Reviews.Title: “Hotel that needs a little repair.”
Reviews.Author: draino3
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Monte Carlo Hotel in January. Our room could have used the following repairs. Shower control worn out and not very controllable, broken dresser drawers, and hair dryer missing. We did not notice the dryer missing until my wife was out of the shower with wet hair. We read on the internet that all rooms are equipped with a hair dryer so she didn't think twice about it not being present. when we called the concierge we were told that we would have to come to their desk and get one. Now I am used to staying at less than 4 star hotels and I have never gotten this kind of treatment at so called budget hotels. The best thing for me at this hotel was that there is a penny slot machine directly in front of the go-go girls stage, and a Starbucks in the food court. Next time we go to Vegas, we will stay the Golden Gate!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: amran k
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the monte carlo. it has a very good spot on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location on the strip, tram direct to Bellagio”
Reviews.Author: lotsofshoes22
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo for a week at the end of March. On arrival the check-in was fast and access to the rooms from reception to the elevators was quick (you dont have to walk through the casino like other hotels.) The room was a good size with a nice big bed and we had a view over the pool on the 29th floor, I think the bathroom was a little dated but clean. The hairdryer is hidden in the wardrobe by the way. There was a coffee machine (no milk) and bottles of water which get refreshed each day. It was an adjoining room, like others have said it can be really noisy which was a shame. The casino was fairly big, lots of slots and tables, maybe a little quieter than others and there is a definite perfume smell to mask the smoke. The "street of dreams" includes a few clothes shops, The Pub (good snack type meals) which has duelling pianos until midnight, a starbucks, yoghurt/crepe place, the cupcakery and the big chill serving slushy type drinks. This conveniently leads you to the Aria Express Tram which takes you directly to the Crystals shopping centre and the Bellagio. This was so handy, think we used it everyday! The hotel is also directly linked to the Aria casino. The food court was really great and so handy for a cheap coffee or a sandwich. They have another Starbucks, Subway, McDonalds, Rubio's, Manchu Wok, Sbarro and it looks like they are about to open a chicken place too. The Dragon Noodle place looked nice but pricey but Diablo's Cantina was cool- the Nacho's for a main meal are huge even if you share! The hotel is right next door to the NYNY hotel and also a CVS pharmacy store which was handy for snacks, beers and souvenirs. We didnt use the pool but it always looked quite busy/people having a good time as there is a lazy river and wave pool for use as well as good music playing. Check-out was slow, and like others have posted the resort fee of $15 a day seems a bit much for what you get back but this shouldnt deter you. Thought the hotel was a great choice for us because of the location, the useful tram and the food court. I would recommend to others and would be happy to return especially for the great price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Casino and average room”
Reviews.Author: Melly44
Reviews.Content: We loved the casino in this hotel - so many games to choose from and really good drink service for a strip hotel. Also the food court had some options available 24 hours a day which was very handy. We stayed in a Spa Suite room, and it was alright. We had some issues getting the room choice we requested, but eventually the hotel accomidated us. The room wasn't that clean, and was a little run down, but the spa tub was worth the extra money.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay again! Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: wickedfan89
Reviews.Content: Before my trip to the Monte Carlo, I was glued to trip advisor reading every review I could find. I flew to Vegas expecting the worse, especially since my last trip was staying at the bellagio. I was pleasantly surprised! The lobby was gorgeous and clean. The rooms were suitable for anybody who just needs a comfy bed and a warm shower, its true that they could use some updating however I was never displeased with my accommodations or the maid service. The restaurants were great including the care and the food court which was perfect for an inexpensive breakfast. The casino was easy to navigate and not smoky like some have posted! Definitely take advantage of The Pubs happy hour! Dollar sliders, wings, and buy one get one drinks! The pool is a fun enviroment with an amazing bar featuring pales full of beers and giant margarita's, pina coladas, etc. Besides a pool there is a lazy river and a wave pool! I cant say enough good things about the Monte Carlo! If you want five star accommodations go to wynn. If you want a great Vegas vacation come here!

Reviews.Title: “Good way to do Vegas on a budget.”
Reviews.Author: argueta_7
Reviews.Content: I had 2 Deluxe, double queen rooms on a pretty busy weekend for about $110 each night. The location is perfect because it's right in the middle of the strip so most places were in walking distance or a $15 cab ride away. The rooms were clean but a bit plain. I was traveling with 7 females so bigger mirrors & more lighting would have been nice. We had issues with the AC in one room so Engineering came to fix it and the problem was resolved in about 90 minutes. Valet was free and room service was quick. They gave us plenty of extra towels & changed our bedding twice without any issues. Overall, I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “totally fantastic would definately go back”
Reviews.Author: jenny g
Reviews.Content: i was a bit scared of going after i read some reviews on here but I loved it the greeting when we arrived at the valet parking was excellent then our bags were put on a trolley, checking was excellent no queue the fridge i requested was deleiverd to the room within half an hour of us arriving. I loved the perfume smell when you entered much better then the smell of smoke in some of the other hotels didnt use the casino but walked through it was impressed as wasnt as dark and claustrophobic as others I have been in. We had breakfast at the buffet and the staff were very friendly Jose our waiter was excellent. The dragon noodle was also excellent friendy staff excellent food the only disappointment was Dvino we went on Sunday were given a table we sat for ten minutes with several members of staff walking past looking at us but no one came to offer us a drink or take our order so we walked out and went next door to the dragon noodle within 10 minutes of arriving there we has food on the table.The Valet parking staff were also excellent and very friendly. The room was lovely and very clean it had everyting we needed the bed was so comfy. Every member of staff we met were very friendly I wouldnt hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Barbaradee1959
Reviews.Content: Large room with a spacious bathroom. We could hear just about everything our next door neighbors were saying at midnight. They were not being loud but apparently the walls are paper thin. Check in is the longest process I have ever been involved in. A good ten minutes per group. The pool looks fantastic but closes at five. The buffet on a week night was marginal at best. The hotel is located in the center of action and the price is reasonable for Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “anniversary ruined”
Reviews.Author: 807mulley
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to book a special two night spa suite for our anniversary this year in february.I had booked this back in December.When we arrived they told us they had overbooked.The desk ladys comment was 'oh they do this all the time.After 45 mins at the front desk they said they would give us an upgrade to a monaco suite and put a rush on it.I gave them my cell and went gambling.Three hours later no call so back to the desk I go pissed.I told him my patients were running out and all he could do was wave the resort fee of 30 dollars for the two nights.Wow,now the room ,yes a little bigger then the spa room but the jacuzzi tub was right next to the toilet,happy anniversary honey and thanks Monte Carlo way to drop the ball.807mulley out.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocrity in La La Land”
Reviews.Author: redkite-traveller
Reviews.Content: This hotel simply astounds you with its mediocrity. The Lobby is bland, check in counters are arranged as if you are entering US customs. The rooms are large and spacious and the top tip is to avoid the "Mountain View" rooms. They are more a view of the very large car parking lots behind the hotel. If at all possible - try and get a room on the higher floors. The lifts feed you music - which really begins to grind one down. Don't eat at the buffet - volumes of tasteless food. We ate there because of a "comp". Having been out all day, we returned to the room to find that it still had not been cleaned. After complaining, we were offered dinner at the Buffet - next to the Casino hall. The hotel is well located, but if you must stay at one of the hotels on the Strip - one of the others with more kitsch character might be more fun. It was reasonably good value for money though. It is unlikely that I would chose it again.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: Cal H
Reviews.Content: Great hotel good bang for your buck! The beds are very comfortable and nice rooms. The hotel is located on the south end of the strip so is quieter but still accessible to the main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo - Sorry we booked it”
Reviews.Author: vg513
Reviews.Content: Was very disappointed in our stay at the Monte Carlo. The ads are very deceiving. The hotel was not the cleanest and offered no amenities. The resort fee is a joke. You pay $20 for two small bottles of water, one regular and one decaf coffee pod and a newspaper that you have to pick up yourself. The fee was supposed to cover internet access but only offered an ethernet plug, no USB so we couldn't plug in our IPad. The place was a ZOO. It was noisy and uncomfortable. The bathtub and toilet leaked. Won't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Viva Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Rosinaandsamtm
Reviews.Content: As first timers to las Vegas, we had no idea really what to expect apart from what's seen in The Hangover....Monte Carlo is a fab place, safe, clean, staff are very friendly. The pool is big, sun beds are available most of the time during the day, shops and restaurants are great, big casino. It seems to be mainly full of senior citizen gamblers by night, but near enough to all the other resorts around the strip to get out and about. Check out the Sex and the City machine, I won big bucks!

Reviews.Title: “Really surprised!”
Reviews.Author: caazgurl
Reviews.Content: I crossed my fingers after booking this room because I had read mixed reviews and some of them were not very good. The front lobby was clean, the staff was very friendly, and my room clean and comfortable! The bathroom was big but I can see where it is starting to show signs of aging, but again, it was clean!The food court offered a variety of choices and the casino was entertaining. The only issue I had was that the hotel doesn't offer wireless wifi in the rooms, not even for purchase. With the resort fee, you can access wired internet but I wasn't able to use it so there resort fee for me was a waste of money.You can get wifi in the food court but that's about it. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “One of our favorites...”
Reviews.Author: goodlifeCalifornia
Reviews.Content: We choose to stay at this hotel because of its location (next to New York New York, across the street from MGM), its access to the free tram/monorail from Viara (next door) which takes you to the Bellagio, and affordability. In the summer months, if you decide to bring your kids to sin city, this hotel's pool area offers a wave pool and a lazy river. Lounge chairs in this area go fast and saving them with a few belongings is not a guarantee that they will be there when you return after breakfast. We actually had our items moved from our lounge chairs on more than one occasion (items were not stolen, just moved) --- it was frustrating. The music is loud, but depending on where you sit -- you can have a conversation. Just inside the entrance from the pool area there is a food court (no food allowed in the pool area) for a quick bite and a break from the sun. (McDonalds, Subway, Rubio's, Starbucks as of last year). The breakfast buffet is pretty good and priced accordingly (you can get more at other hotels, but you will pay more). There is a CVS pharmacy next door on the strip which is convenient (bottled water, snacks, lotions, etc.) and even a Ross Department store across the street in case you forgot to pack your bathing suit and don't want to pay resort prices for another one. There is music and dancing at the Pub (great food and beer), as well as Dueling pianos and/or Nine Fine Irishment next door at New York New York. All in all, it isn't a five star, but it is a nice mid-range resort on the strip with lots of choices.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: SEM88
Reviews.Content: Monte Carlo was much better than I expected. I was a little apprehensive about being that far down the strip; however, the monorail which was right there made everything super easy. The rooms were really night, the pool area was nice and spacious outside in the back. I didn't do most of my gambling at Monte Carlo, but the casino looked pretty good. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best place for the price”
Reviews.Author: Love12Life
Reviews.Content: Our group of 4 mid-lifers had a very good stay here for 4 nights and days. We've stayed 2 x Aria, Mandalay Bay, Paris, and more. I was anticipating a dated place like Flamingo, but was pleasantly surprised. It was at capacity due to final 4 and spring break, but all ran smoothly, parking to check out. I had not been here in about 15 years, and not only updated and clean, but added the Diablo and some new restaurants. We also like the addition of a go-go dancer at the Ingnite bar/ black jack tables. We only ate at restaurants on property, very pleased esp. with Dragon noodle. We ate there 3 times the first 3 days. LOVE the friendly dealers and other staff. I would like to see room hall carpets cleaner and a Wi-fi included in the "resort fee". Very central location in between NYNY and Aria. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great place.”
Reviews.Author: CSTraveler10
Reviews.Content: Lobby: Clean Front Desk: Friendly, fast Room: Average room Location: At start of strip, great location Diablo's Cantina: Margaritas ROCK. Food Court: Great to have

Reviews.Title: “Pool music deafening”
Reviews.Author: bj_in_edgewood_wa
Reviews.Content: I found most of the accommodations at the Monte Carlo in Las Vegas to be very good with the exception of the pool area. They have good selection of pools including wave and stream pools which are great entertainment for kids. Unfortunately the music is so loud it's hard to hold a conversation with the person on the lounge chair next to you. And it is certainly louder than you would want your children's headphones to be. Everything is acceptable until about 11:30 when they crank up the volume. When that happens people scramble for a better location, but they crank up the volume on all the speakers so there are no better locations. Numerous people complained, but the pool attendants shrug it off and apologize, saying they have no control over the volume. Bottom line: If you don't plan to use the pool facilities the Monte is a good place to stay. If you plan to use the pool area then I'd suggest staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good Accommodations at Great Price”
Reviews.Author: DElea60785
Reviews.Content: Monte Carlo Resort & Casino is a pretty standard mid-range Las Vegas casino property, but I found the price to value ratio to be exceptionally good, at least during my recent stay. My room was not business traveler-friendly, lacking much work space and few electric plugs. Also there was not a comfortable chair available. But let's face it, casino resorts don't want you sitting around or working in your room. I can't blame them for encouraging guests to be out of the room dining or gambling. A tram provides convenient transportation as far up the strip as Ballagio. From there Caesars, the Mirage, and other resorts are walkable.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE THIS HOTEL!!”
Reviews.Author: ashleinicole
Reviews.Content: Ive been to Vegas 3 times and all three times I have stayed at Monte Carlo. Its very clean and it feels very homey to me. I love the pool its super fun and nice - try their pink lemonade iced drink! All the places to eat are good. The casino is nice and clean too. The ice bar is really neat - but pretty pricey. Diablos is fun and has great $3 margaritas! All in all this is a great hotel and I would recommend it to anyone! Its in a great location too! The only thing I didn't like is the $15 a day room fee that should be included in your booking.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: texasmama2
Reviews.Content: Whirlwind 2 day/3 night Vegas get-away! Glad we didn't spend more on a fancier resort - only in rm. to shower & sleep. MC is very nice w/an excellent location. Loved easy access to FREE tram to Bellagio & nice little food court for a quick, cheap bite to eat on the go. Got a standard n/s king room on 30th floor w/great view of pools & City Center (Aria, Vdara, Crystals, etc.) Enjoyed ending evenings back in our room out of all the Vegas smoke (!), sitting in 2 comfy chairs @ the window, taking in the view w/a cold beer (picked up in convenience store right off lobby - $2.50 for a cold bottle of beer!) Elevators are fast and divided up by floor groupings (ie. 6 elevators for 22-32nd floors) so you don't stop on 29 floors before getting to yours! Rm was really gd. size. Nice little extra having 2 luggage racks - 1 for each of us. No trouble w/in-room safe - gd. feature. Enjoyed in-room coffee & water, resupplied each day w/extra if requested. Bed/bedding perfectly clean & very comfortable! Pool area looked great but temps. were cool when we were there plus area only open til 5 p.m. so we didn't even use. Would have liked to use the hot tub late at night after a day of walking, walking, walking. Didn't even turn on the TV 'til time to check out - easy check-out over the TV! Love that! A note about housekeeping: I accidentally left my mother's ring in the shower; housekeeping found it & placed it safely on the bathroom counter. Really appreciate the trustworthiness that represents! PROS: location, accessability to free tram & food court for inexpensive options, great service, clean & comfortable, multiple pools & sand volleyball court CONS: pools/hot tub not open at night (closed @ 5 p.m.), no in-room frig (typical Vegas, though), resort fee (also typical Vegas - resorts w/o this fee probably just have higher nightly rate), decor a bit dated (big deal), overall Vegas con - the smoke!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: LandRC
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights at the Monte Carlo - this was our 1st visit to Las Vegas. We were traveling with friends so we asked if we could get rooms close by which was no problem - they gave us side-by-side rooms which was perfect. Since it was my birthday, they upgraded us to a higher floor at no cost which was great. But remember: when getting an upgrade, ask that your room overlooks the strip, and ask what size bed(s) are in the room. We got the higher floor, but we overlooked the back of the hotel (pools), and had two Queen size beds (we like King). But still no big deal. The sunlight over the pools in the morning with the mountains in the background was beautiful. Our rooms were a bit dated but you're only using them for sleep, right? We didn't have a fridge in the room so we went and bought a styrofoam cooler and picked up some milk and cereal for some cheaper breakfast options - CVS isn't far from the hotel. The amenities at the hotel are great - lots of dining options from McDonalds to more upscale sit-down restaurants, lots of shopping options for souvenirs/clothes, etc., and of course the casino. We had great service as well - we left a note for our room attendant (Lisa) and asked if we could have extra coffee for the Kuerig coffee maker. She not only gave us extra coffee, but extra bottles of water as well. And we had no trouble with storing our luggage when we checked out (we had a late flight out of Vegas) so we didn't have to worry about bringing our luggage around with us for the day. There was a notice about water shutoff during our stay but it was from 9pm to 5am, and it didn't affect us at all. The free tram to Monte Carlo's sister hotels was great - it gave us an opportunity to explore the other properties/casinos. We really enjoyed our stay and we're already planning our next trip back to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: Stella154943
Reviews.Content: Stayed at MC first time Mar 19-23. My family had 2 rooms on the 29th floor that were clean and quiet. We requested to move to 2 rooms that had a connecting door and it was provided for us on the second night. We moved to the 28th floor and noticed a few more blemishes but they were overall fine. The pool area was very good for a family with kids. Wave pool and lazy river were fun. Main pool was nice and warm considering outside air temperature was cool. Good beach volleyball area. We didn't eat at the hotel and tried higher rated buffets elsewhere. There is a small food court and it is connected to the Aria and Bellagio by monorail. Good central location with some shopping across the street on LV blvd and in the hotel. We would return here.

Reviews.Title: “STAY ANYWHERE ELSE!”
Reviews.Author: Tinpal
Reviews.Content: With thousands of options of places to stay in Las Vegas, there is no need to put up with the flaws in the Monte Carlo. Very poor repair, poor service, poor staff, unfriendly, the list goes on and on. Here's the kicker: the first night I received a notice that they were TURNING OFF THE WATER FROM 9:00 P.M. TIL 5:00 A.M. and left me with two bottles of water. Seriously????? And I STILL HAD TO PAY FULL PRICE FOR THE ROOM! It was the Monaco Suite. I could not take a shower, flush the toilet, wash my hands, brush my teeth unless I was pouring water from a freakin' water bottle! The tables in the room were is such bad repair that I would not have bought them if they were in a garage sale. The bed and pillows were hard and uncomfortable, the toilet did not flush (even when the water WAS turned on), the towels smelled moldy, the toiletries were watery (The lotion stayed white on my skin like sunblock), don't even get me started on the T.V. channels and the "normal" movies were $12 each! No microwave. I ordered room service for breakfast and actually wished that I'd have found a Jack-in-the-Box to order a breakfast instead. The pot of coffee was so bad that I poured it out! Here's the lowdown: 2 scrambled eggs, a 3x3 in. square of soggy hashbrowns, 3 strips of bacon, 2 slices of cold toast and one pot of coffee = $28.) The final straw was at check-out time when I mentioned the inconvenience of the water being turned off and the girl said she'd waive my resort fee for that night. WHAT???? Honestly, I didn't even care enough to argue. Just get me out of this hell hole and I'll make sure at least one person DOESN'T STAY AT THIS HOTEL!

Reviews.Title: “Fun Place, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Drederick
Reviews.Content: There are some grumpy reviewers on this website. So much, that I was a bit concerned about staying here after I booked our room. (Then I saw what the Negative Nancys felt about Mandalay Bay, an awesome hotel, and was at ease). OK, it this place The Wynn or Caesar's Palace? No. But are you paying $300/nt to stay at the Monte Carlo? No. My wife and I stayed three nights over March Madness & St. Patrick's day. We arrived at 4 a.m. due to weather delays at our airport. The front desk staff were quick and courteous. We were given a room on a high floor, near the end of the hallway, with a view of the beautiful Aria hotel, all without asking for anything. Are the walls thin? A little. But I didn't wake up once due to noise from other rooms, and I am a light sleeper. I did hear a few people in the halls at night, drunk, coming back from clubs...but this is Vegas...I've experienced that at every hotel. The room was fine. No glass-walled shower like at Mandalay Bay or the newer Luxor towers, but if you want that, go pay the money to stay there. The bathroom was fine, the bed was nearly as comfortable as The Hotel at Mandaly Bay (my favorite place I've stayed in Vegas) and the rooms were cleaned every day by nice people. The poker room staff were great, courteous, and nice to my wife - who had never played poker before. Our blackjack dealer, a young man, was funny and courteous. And the craps workers were fun (we won some money there too). The only gambling staff downfall was that the sports book was not properly staffed in the mornings for the busy March Madness weekend...but I still had a great time visiting with the fun guests in the sportsbook. The casino is small enough where you don't lose anyone. The fast food shops are right near the hotel elevators in case you need a late night or early morning snack or a Starbucks. We had late night sushi & noodles at Dragon Noodle and the staff was great. (The sushi chef tipped us off about 1/2-off Sunday sushi too, but we couldn't make it back). Resort Fee: Do I like the resort fee? No. But the hotels that say they don't have a resort fee: like Paris or Caesars cost much more than the Monte Carlo. So avoid the resort fee by overpaying for a room you are hardly in (if you do Vegas right). Location: The location is great. We ate dinner and a champagne brunch at the Aria, which is connected to Monte Carlo. There is a CVS next door for necessities. And the entire Strip is within reach. In short, you can spend more money and stay at the Bellagio, Aria, or The Hotel at Mandalay Bay, and you would probably enjoy the rooms more. Or you can get a good deal, on a good hotel, with great location, with nice employees helping you out - and not whine about being too cheap to stay at one of those hotels - and enjoy your vacation! (I have been to Vegas about 10 times, this hotel is fine)!

Reviews.Title: “Fine place to base at value in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Richphu
Reviews.Content: Paid £570 for flights and 5 nights in Las Vegas. I appreciate its not the Bellagio or the MGM Grand resort but what you get here is a good quality hotel in a central location to enjoy the sights and attractions and then get your head down, your not there to stay in your room are you. The room was airy and clean, a few blemishes in the decor though nothing to put me off, the view though not of the strip included the New York, New York, the Luxor, the Excalibur, the Mandalay Bay and the mountains in the background. This was as a request for high view at a few pounds more. You can ask for a room with a view of the strip at a further minimal additional cost. The bathroom was also clean and the water was hot at all times, the cleaners were in every day and a couple of dollars tip and a little note seemed to do the trick with extra coffees and attention to detail. The bed was huge and very comfortable. Resort itself was very satisfactory with bars and restaurants around the casino, as well as a food court for cheaper options. Sitting at the slot machines we were always attended to for the free drinks by the waitresses which was not always the case in the other hotels. From the hotel here we could walk through to the Aria resort and Casino a huge modern complex with top end restaurants and shops, you can also catch a free tram to the Bellagio from the Monte Carlo, that gives access to Caesers Palace and therefore endless opportunities to see the city within 10 - 15 mins. Going in the other direction on foot to the New York New York is a five minute walk, that then gives you access to the the Excalibur, from there you can catch another free tram to the Luxor and the Mandalay bay. Across the road from there is the MGM Grand. So from the Monte Carlo you could see a lot of the major attractions within a short distance of time. Taxi's are always available out the front and to the top end of the strip ie The Stratosphere/Circus Circus you would be paying £15. Resort fees at the end of the stay is something that you are made aware of when booking so no need to be surprised by them. Though dont forget to add tax. We booked when the fee was $15 dollars a night, they have recently gone up to $20 but when we pointed out the price on our booking they reverted to the original price without a problem. No queues at reception or at concierge when we needed anything and they were always helpful. I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Upgrade to a Monaco Suite”
Reviews.Author: jrm523
Reviews.Content: Once again we stayed at the Monte Carlo for a week for a recent conference/expo. I'm very glad that our company choses the Monte Carlo -- such a wonderful place. Yes, I know, it's not the most glamourous or sexy or newest -- but it offers a supurb value for your $$. Having the food court is a major plus when you simply want a quick/easy/cheaper meal. The Pub and Cafe are excellent places too. I LOVE the new outdoor patio at the Pub, as it overlooks the pools and offer other "scenary" watching too. We upgraded to the Monaco Suite due to the length of our stay. EXCELLENT VALUE! Having a 2nd half bath was wonderful.... and the shower water pressure was the best I've ever had in ANY hotel/resort. Better than ours at home. Check in/out is seamless. Less smokey also vs. other casinos.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Good Location, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Waldolover05
Reviews.Content: This is my third trip to Las Vegas. The room was clean, though a little worn (bubbles in carpet) a cracked title in the shower and some peeling of the edges of the wallpaper but very clean and staff was very helpful. The fitness center was well equipped, had a good variety, and was also clean. Spa seemed good but I didn't take advantage. The casino was always decently busy and had plenty of openings. We ate at the Italian restaurant within- which was good- as well as the buffet. Only hiccup was that the hotel had unforseen plumbing issues and water had to be turned off overnight one night. We had two rooms among our group on differnt floors- one of our rooms got notice of the impending shutoff and a few bottles of water while the other room recieved no warning and no water to supplement. We called to complain and were offered one free buffet ($35 value)- which wasn't very useful for a group of 4- or a refund of our resort fee (a $15/night value)- a much better deal. I would stay at the Monte Carlo again.

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa W
Reviews.Content: Just returned today from my trip to Vegas. I've been to Vegas before and wanted to stay in a different hotel...well my MISTAKE! You cannot breathe in this hotel! Soooooo much smoke and the so called flower smell in the lobby stinks! Of course I know this is a casino and people smoke but after going to other hotels you can really see the difference. To me it is dark and dingy at the Monte Carlo. Also, the water was shut down in all guest rooms from 9pm to 5am...Management typed a letter and housekeeping delivered two bottles of water...wth!!! Resort fees were refunded for my inconvenience. Water pressure was horrible in the shower and the water didn't get hot enough (maybe that is what they were fixing...lol). You can also hear everything from other rooms. They need to do a major renovation on the standard rooms. You can't just throw a flat screen in a room and say "renovated"...the walls, carpet, bathrooms, and linens need help. All I can say is you get what you pay for! On the positive side, staff seemed very helpful and I received nice service from the front desk, housekeeping, and The Buffet. They have to be extra nice in service because this hotel leaves much to be desired. I will not recommend this hotel to anyone and I definitely will not come back. I would prefer to spend a little more to stay somewhere else. Oh and very slow service from cocktail waitresses here...they don't have many

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Anthony F
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooms, large casino gaming floor.. Will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Average stay”
Reviews.Author: Dave B
Reviews.Content: We decided on Monte Carlo for a couple reasons: 1. Room rate was pretty cheap and 2. Location on the strip, pretty close to the middle of the strip. In terms of the room, we went with a strip view and 2 queen beds as opposed to a non-strip view and king bed (had to wait on that to be ready). The overall cleanliness of the room was above average, but nothing special. There was a nice huge TV, wired internet, a Keurig coffee machine, iHome, and two bottles of water per day. Also an in-room safe. The Casino was nice, but nothing special. Table minimums were $10, a wide variety of table games and slots. The cocktail waitresses were a little slow; we even left a slot once because it took so long. There are a few restaurants that are at the hotel. The ones we ate at were Dragon Noodle - excellent sushi and mai tais, Diablos Mexican cantina - awesome happy hour special "wheel of sin" and good food, but not a "nice sit, down meal", more of a crazy fun atmosphere. Ate breakfast at the cafe, which was good. My favorite place was The Pub - great beer selection (over 200 i think?) and ask to sit outside by the pool. Overall, this was a great place to stay, but venture out on the strip and into other hotels/casinos for a great "Vegas" experience. New York New York is right next door, and the Aria,Vdara, and Bellagio are just a free tram ride away.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: sandymumsie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo 6th Feb for 6 nights and had a fantastic time as we went to celebrate my husbands 60th birthday, champagne & cake were delivered to the room soon after we arrived (this had been arranged with family from England) nothing was too much trouble. We had a strip view & the room was lovely & clean. We ate at Brands and the food was excellent. Also the Pub was good. We also arranged a trip to the Sky Walk this is a fantastic days outing. All in all a very good time was had.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel at an affordable price”
Reviews.Author: ryan d
Reviews.Content: Our group of 4 stayed at the Monte Carlo from 3/12-3/16. We are all early 20s and went for spring break. We checked in early at about 11am. We requested a high floor with connecting rooms and we were accommodated with no problems. The front desk check in was very courteous and energetic. One of the rooms was not ready yet, but my room was so we just put our stuff in there and went to check out the hotel and eat while we were waiting for the other room. The rooms were clean and very basic. Nothing special here. You get all the standard stuff, it's just not as ritzy as many other hotels. Walls are very thin so hopefully you get lucky and have good neighbors. We did. Maids cleaned everyday and we always had enough towels. We got a strip view room and the view was pretty good. 29th floor. You can see MGM Grand, MGM Signature, NY NY, and Tropicana. See picture. The casino is small compared to others. It also smells bad. Not overwhelming, but there is definitely a specific smell the Monte Carlo has. When you first walk in from outside it's a mixture of cheap cologne and axe bodyspray. However, it's Vegas and you don't have to gamble at the Monte Carlo at all if you don't want to. There are 100 other casinos to go to and the location is right in the middle. The pool is decent and we didnt have trouble finding chairs. The frozen drinks there were very good. Wave pool is small, but that wasn't a big deal to me. Hot tub and lazy river were up and running. Overall a decent hotel. However, after seeing all of the other amazing different hotels we will definitely be staying somewhere else on our next trip. Probably the Paris or Cosmo.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel, but I am a bit put off by "resort fees".”
Reviews.Author: JJ_Lune
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying on "the Strip" and Monte Carlo seemed like a good choice for the price. It was in a decent location and had a free tram between it and Bellagio. The hotel was nice enough; and the Casino area was smaller then some of the other Hotels, which is something I appreciate because I cannot stand smoke. There are a few restaurants scattered throughout the Hotel ranging in price from $20-$100 per meal. There is also a food court in the building including a McDonalds, Subway, A pizza place and a taco joint. The only complaint I have about the hotel is the MGM "Resort Fees" that seem to have been recently added. This $20 fee is added to your nightly room fee and must be paid separately from any package deals that included the hotel fee. This came as a bit of surprise upon arrival. Additionally when we were there we found out that 1. The Pool was closed for maintenance, and 2. The hot tub and spa were not included in the fee. -- It seems to me that If you are going to charge a resort fee, then there should be some resort amenities included. I expressed this to the front desk and was told that the resort fee covered the free Wired internet in the hotel rooms and the in-room coffee. This seems like a silly excuse to me, as any discount motel will include those things for no extra charge. In all other aspects our stay was fine; but beware of the "resort fee" that doesn't cover anything having to do with the resort.

Reviews.Title: “perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: donnamarie86
Reviews.Content: I left the iMPERIAL PALACE after 3 days of noise& booked myself into the MONTE CARLO HOTEL. What a breath of fresh air! The rooms are ver nice & clean. Service was excellent & They also delivered robes to my room as I requested when I checked in.The pool area was great & so was the service.I appreciate an in-room safe for my passport & belongings.That is a big deal to feel secure.There is a free Tram from the hotel to the Bellagio.I would absolutely stay there again!. The SPA was only $10.00 & it was heaven. The staff all over the hotel were pleasant, courteous & efficient. Great place!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: Robin101canada
Reviews.Content: The monte Carlo is in a great location,the casino is great. The pool and restaurants are great. I have to question how this hotel is rated at 4.5 stars. It really is just a plain hotel room, the bathroom is not any different than a Holiday Inn, one sink small counter top, small basic tub and shower combo. There is not a mini bar in room, but the beds are comfy. If you are looking for a more luxurious room, I think there are better choices, such as the Mirage. Also the resort fee is 20.00 per night. They advertise that they have Internet in the hotel, but it is not wireless. Wireless is available in food court at Mcdonalds. I think it should really be available in room, included in the resort fee.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay but no 4 Diamond”
Reviews.Author: jjaggernauth
Reviews.Content: My cousin and I stayed at the Monte Carlo from Feb. 14-21. We got there at about 11:30 at night and check in was fairly easy. Once we got to our room we found that the room definitely was not cleaned properly. There was a q-tip on the floor, a dirty cloth in the shower and as I was walking over to my bed I stepped on a wrapper from a bandage (ewwww). Since the hotel was quite full, they could not accomodate us in another room until the next day after people had checked out. When we went to front desk the next day they were kind about it and returned 2 days of resort fees. We wanted a mini fridge in our new room so they gave that to us for free for our troubles. We didn't get to use the pool as it was closed for the season which kind of sucked since it was quite warm the week we were there. Once we changed rooms on day two we had a few issues. The heat was very tempremental in the second room. It was either too hot or too cold all the time. We couldn't seem to find a happy medium to keep the room at a neutral temperature, so it was a week of constant changing the thermostate up and down. We did have to ask housekeeping for things such as water, coffee or sugar but they were more than happy to provide it to us and were super friendly. A few days in I noticed some marks on my arm, and on the second last day my cousin also woke up with a few bumps that to us looked like bites. Upon check out they returned the remainder of my resort fees and had an outside company come and inspect the room in case there were bed bug or anything else. They took our number to let us know before we flew out as if there were anything they didn't want us taking them home with us in our luggage. Luckily there was nothing found and they said it may be from the harsh detergents they use to clean the linens. We also found the water to be quite harsh on our skin. We both found our skin completely dried out despite the amount of moisturizer we put on our skin. The location of the hotel was decent but not ideal but you get what you pay for and that was reasonable to us. One very good thing I can say is that the beds are so comfortable!!! There were days where we felt like we didn't want to get out of our beds its was so comfortable. We ate once at the buffet, once at the cafe and a couple of times in the food court. We went to the buffet on the Friday night which was their seafood/international night. It was more expensive that night and definitely not worth the money. We were just too hungry that night to go anywhere else. The food at the Cafe was amazing. We absolutely loved it and the portions were quite large. The food court, well what can you say, its a food court. This hotel was definitely an afordable stay. It could use some major updating and was definitely not a 4 Diamond hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Blackpool_boy66
Reviews.Content: We checked into this hotel at 9.00 pm - a little later than hoped having driven from the Grand Canyon. Check in was still busy though - but the queues went down pretty quick as they had plenty of staff on for the numbers arriving. However, when we got to reception we found they had given our reserved non smoking king standard bedroom away - it's done on a first come first served basis apparently! They didn't tell us though and let us go up into a smoking room!! So down we went and they quickly moved us to a queen room and told us to come back down in the morning and they would move us back. When we did return in the morning we asked to transfer to a suite instead and they gave us $20 per night off the normal deal which was great. We didn't complain or moan - they offered - and that was good service - you can only tell how good an organisation is when things go a little wrong - the test is can they get it back on track - and the staff at the Monte Carlo did well. We sampled the Pub - which was a great sports bar with good snacks. Lots of different beers from around the world served in nice sports bar type surroundings. The rest of the hotel was nice and clean. It is looking dated compared to the new superstars such as the Cosmopolitan etc. I don't mean tired - just a little old fashioned in the hallways, landings and rooms. There are very pale and muted colours throughout. However, don't let this put you off as you won't be spending that much time in the room. The position of the hotel is fantastic on the strip - and is great value given its good standards and overall surroundings. As others have said Diablos is a good place to get a margarita - and get a seat facing the strip to people watch. The tables in the casino were the friendliest I have played in Vegas. Maybe we were lucky with the croupiers - but I liked them. The slots were good value too - and semed to pay out pretty well. Whilst playing at the tables and the slots we were rarely given time to have an empty glass - the waitresses were excellent. Overall - 4 stars - not because it let itself down anywhere - but this is just a true reflection of its overall quality. I would stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Stay”
Reviews.Author: membra
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo was our go-to hotel in Vegas but this stay will unfortunately be our last. We are Vegas regulars, going out at least once a year and we have stayed at 7 other properties. The Monte Carlo has gone down hill!!! Blown light bulb in our room was not changed even after we let a note and the blown bulb for the maid. Constant battle for towels when it was obvious 2 people were occupying the room, maid would leave only 1 washcloth and 1 bath towel. Last two days shower had only lukewarm water, after we called housekeeping again they sounded annoyed and disinterested. Used to love this hotel next time will book at Paris or Aria.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo Was A Good Way to Affordably Do Vegas”
Reviews.Author: HouGirl30
Reviews.Content: I surprised my husband for his 31st birthday by taking him to Las Vegas for a long weekend. I booked the Monte Carlo through expedia for a very good price, including 2 free Cirque tickets (we wound up seeing LOVE and it was amazing!). I chose the Monte Carlo because it was very affordable, it didn't look scary, and it is a decent location on the strip, catty-corner to the MGM Grand. We've been to Vegas a few times before, and sometimes we like to stay at a slightly higher-end hotel; the reason we didn't stay at Paris or the Venetian was because we were travelling as a group and had to be more economical. So Monte Carlo was perfect for our needs. All in all, we were pretty pleased. We met 3 friends there, and they all felt like it was a very nice hotel, and we've all agreed that should we do a Vegas trip again, the Monte Carlo is definitely one of the places we would consider. Our room was clean, well furnished, and decent sized. Only real complaint is we asked for a single bed (a Q or a K, we didn't care) and we got two fulls. We didn't spring for anything fancy, like a suite or anything. Our view was kinda cool, though--we had a nice view of the spectacle that is the new Aria next door, and it looked amazing. We had the breakfast buffet and it was very good (bottomless mimosas, FTW!); we tried to eat at Brand, the nice restaurant, but we left after half an hour, because we hadn't even gotten water yet and it was an empty restaurant. Diablo, the Mexican place, was great though! Good seafood, and a gargantuan margarita that is guaranteed to make Vegas all the more fun. :-D The gambling was fun. We took up a whole blackjack table, and had a very amiable dealer who laughed and joked with us. My husband and I mainly occupied the nickel and penny slots though, and it was rare that we had to go get our own drink. They even take care of the penny players! Sidenote: we took a walk down the strip one night and hung out in the Venetian for a bit. Not only did we never get a drink on the gambling floor, we only saw about 2 or 3 waitresses. Just an observation. My best friend and I enjoyed an afternoon by the pool, and that was a lot of fun. They have PLENTY of lounge chairs, pool waiter service, and 3 different pools. I loved the wave pool, and the lazy river was fun too. There was also a dj playing loud music and it was fun to just drink, hang out in the pool, and act silly. The one drawback to the pool area is it is CROWDED. The lazy river in particular was crowded--there were a few traffic jams. But what do you expect? It's freakin' Vegas, and everyone's supposed to party and have a great time. My final comments on the hotel: check-in/out was easy-peasy, and the hotel was very easy to find your way around. Drink service was great on the gambling floor, but in other areas it wasn't great. The only reason we wouldn't stay here again is only because I like to stay at different hotels in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great location!!”
Reviews.Author: chunk1985
Reviews.Content: I booked this holiday as a surprise for my partners 30th birthday. I had read the reviews and knew about the resort fee but booked it anyway. Once I had told him I did start to panic and think it was going to be a disaster as there were so many bad reviews. Well......we had a great time. Your in Las Vegas so we were hardly in our room anyway but the hotel was great. Its in a great location the rooms were a great size. We got a strip view, the rooms were cleaned everyday. We requested a no smoking room which is what we got. No smell of smoke anywhere. I think I read somewhere the towels smelt a bit funny....ours didn't. We did have some issues with them putting random amounts on our room bill but it was all sorted, the staff were very nice and helpful. The check in/out isn't the fastest but its massive, there are soooo many people checking in and out everyday, its going to be busy but we weren't stood there for ages. We hired a car and all the self parking in all the hotels is a massive bonus. Would definitely recommend hiring a car although I didn't drive ;-) We ate in the buffet one night and the Dragon Noodle Bar I think it was called. Wouldn't bother with the buffet, far too many nicer buffets in other hotels. Dragon Noodle Bar was ok, nothing exciting. Overall I would definitely recommend this hotel. I would stay again if we ever visited Las Vegas again although there are some super amazing hotels they do have super amazing price tags!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Incubuschick
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Monte Carlo for 6 days in October 2011. I found all staff at the Monte Carlo very helpful and polite. The rooms were very clean and comfortable and the location on the strip was excellent and good value for money. They also have excellent Gym facilities and pool area and quite a variety of restaurants. I liked the layout of the hotel and it was easy to navigate through. I found with the other hotels that it was quite easy to get lost when walking around. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot on the strip; smelly however”
Reviews.Author: USA2012_12
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Monte Carlo in a Monaco Suite. The room was huge! Good value for money. Location is great, on the strip close to airport and other hotels/resorts. Another reviewer commented on how good the hotel smelt. I disagree completely. The cheap perfume smell that hits you as soon as you walk in off the street is foul. Especially when combined with the cigarette smoke in the casino. Add in a nasty burning smell from the fast food outlets near the casino entrance and my nose just wanted to jump off my face and take the next plane out of Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay At Monte Carlo.”
Reviews.Author: paga2
Reviews.Content: We just got back home from a weeks stay at the Monte Carlo. Our check-in went very smoothly, the receptionist was very cordial and helpful, contrary to other reviews. We wanted a room away from the elevators and without a connecting door on an upper floor. Room 28-121 (28th floor) was perfect. It was very clean, quiet, with views to the mountains and back of NY NY and the roller coaster, two queen beds, ( they didnt have a king without connecting door available) Our room had a coffee pot, newer bedding, flat screen t.v., but not much pressure in the shower. Housekeeping was great- they would give us extra waters and coffees when requested and kept the room clean. Monte Carlo is a smaller resort, in a good location on the strip. Our one complaint here, would be that the M Life Players Cards dont work most of the time. We arent big gamblers, so didnt expect to get any real comps by using them, but they worked so seldom in the slot machines that we just quit using them at any of the M Resorts. OK, our other complaint would be the resort fees- they pay for nothing! However, they took off $ 5.00 a day because when we reserved, the resort fees were only $15.00. It was nice to have inexpensive fast food restaurants in the hotel, where you could just grab a bite to eat before going to an early morning tour or on the run. We really liked to use the free Tram ( at the back of the hotel) which goes to Aria- Crystals and Bellagio. If we return to Vegas we would stay here again,

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lizzygny
Reviews.Content: My friend and I went to Vegas for my 25th birthday and we had a great time! The buffet was good and we had the best time at Brand Steakhouse/Lounge. There is another hotel right next door where you could walk over to (indoors) and gamble/drink/etc. This hotel is close to the airport and is close to the beginning of the strip. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and well staffed”
Reviews.Author: SocalScott61
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo is a nice hotel with a convienant location. Easy to reach from the airport or if driving it's located closeto an offramp. Check in was prompt and professional. The room wasn't anything to get excited about but was clean, had a good bed and about a 36" flat screen TV. The hotel has a great variety of restaurants from Subway and McDonalds to Brands Steak House and Andea's French Cuisine. The staff was very friendly and seemed to know what they were doing. Only complaint was that the towels on day two smelled like coffee. The towels looked clean but stunk. Any another town I would give this hotel a 4 but in Vegas you expect a little more. I traveled there for a conference and I would stay again under the same circumstances but there are alot of nicer places in Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Staff made the difference but crummy property”
Reviews.Author: Igbygoesup
Reviews.Content: We were grateful to the staff who were friendly, professional, accommodating. The room we had, though, was sub-par--holes in the sheets (hole-s), chips in the vanity laminate, the furnishings haven't been updated in years. Our room was on the 10th floor near the elevator and there isn't much sound-proofing--we were woken up throughout the night (Saturday-Tuesday). When I learned we were paying a higher rate than friends staying at the Bellagio, I went to the front desk and politely re-negotiated our rate. I was amazed they were so nice about it. The lunch special at the Dragon Noodle in the casino was a tasty good deal. All in all, we should have done more research and gone elsewhere. There are better deals to be had.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Good Value”
Reviews.Author: chris w
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Monte Carlo quite a few times and have always found a great value. The rooms have been remodeled over past few years are quit nice. when room rates are over $100 they are stil quite a bit less than neighboring properties. Staff is always friendly and helpful. I rode up the elevator with a manager ( didn't see his name tag, but he looked like the actor stephen root) the other day who took the time to ask how my stay was going - seemed genuinely interested as opposed those required to ask at the front desk. The option of having a $7 meal in the food court is a nice option from their nice full service restaurants and pub. Casino is just as nice as any other. Though I've never hit a "jackpot" or won the car. I understand the trend of charging a resort fee - my rates are still lower than 8 years ago. Though they seem to keep raising the resort fee. first 13, then 16, now $20. Great location - tram to aria and Bellagio. other direction to MGM, NY NY, Luxor and Mandalay Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: tdarrock
Reviews.Content: This place wasn't anything spectacular, but was very nice for the price we paid. The food court was open pretty late, and there is a free tram that connects to Bellagio and Aria which was nice. Beds were comfy, showers were solid, and the room overall was not super snazzy, but well worth giving a shot.

Reviews.Title: “Still Very Good”
Reviews.Author: Romar556
Reviews.Content: Probably the best thing about the Monte Carlo is the layout and location. If you are driving getting to the parking garage is easy and it is in close proximity to check in, you don't have to drag your luggage through the casino as you have to do in other hotels. Rooms were nice size but will need updating in a few years. I do suggest requesting a room that does not have connecting doors as they are not very sound proof and you can hear the people next door as we did at 2 in the morning playing music. The hotel staff responded very quickly and the problem was solved. Tram to the Bellagio is convenient but is a long walk to get to. Tram from Excaliber to Mandlay Bay is close also. The only disappointment was that they did not have the pool available in early March like other motels did.

Reviews.Title: “Not the snazziest Vegas hotel but clean and comfy”
Reviews.Author: Helen A
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed in a double queen room for a week and we enjoyed this hotel immensely. The room was clean and well appointed, the bathroom dated but clean with good water pressure. The beds were comfy and the view from our room was great :) The hotel is on the south side of the Strip, within walking distance to the bigger hotels/casinos. The hotel is dated (for Vegas) but one of the nicest smelling on the strip :) Apparently you can buy the scent but I never found it hehe. There is a small-ish food court and a few other cafes and buffet (which is ok). We availed ourselves of the pools a few times which was a great way to relax, cool off and de- jetlag. There is also free light rail which interconnects Monte Carlo - Bellagio (from memory). Service was good, although there always seemed to be a wait.

Reviews.Title: “The Monte Carlo Does It Right!”
Reviews.Author: sully418
Reviews.Content: This may not be the flashiest, but it is one of the classiest hotels on the Strip and the staff is over the top helpful and professional. The room was clean and the view terrific! We had a package through Southwest Airlines and it was the perfect choice!

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms & Fun Place”
Reviews.Author: Boystowtraveler
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice room, high up and nice view. It wasn't huge but for two people it was perfect as we were out and about most of the time. The air conditioning was excellent and not loud. Speaking of that, the noise level in hallways and other rooms (and there were many on each floor) is very quiet. So, a basic room with comfy beds, nice view and quiet is just what you can use when you retire for the night. The prices on the rooms, at least when we paid, were VERY reasonable. My only word of caution is that you may have gaming amenities when you check in and if you don't ask about it, they aren't going to tell you.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate in Every Way But One”
Reviews.Author: CGOTRVLR
Reviews.Content: Recently spent two nights at the MC for business and a bit of pleasure. Got a great rate - $50.The hotel is fine in every way - I loved the lack of a theme, the professionalism of the staff, and the size of the casino - very manageable, and fun! The location is great for short walks to NYNY, MGM, Aria, Cosmo, and PH. Good food at The Pub and The Cantina, though the latter was a bit pricey for what it offered. Coffee in the room was bad, but Starbucks is right off of the elevator on the Casino level. Having stayed at Mirage, Bellagio, Harrah's and Caesars in the past, Monte Carlo is right in the middle of that group in terms of preference in the future. My only complaint is that the walls were very thin. I could hear conversations of the folks next door, among other things. Could have been unique to my room. Overall, I'd recommend the hotel.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Yorkshire Dales National Park, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “Second Visit - same same”
Reviews.Author: alliealliecat
Reviews.Content: I visited the Monte Carlo Hotel over Christmas/New Year again. Some of the reasons we returned to this hotel over choosing another hotel - location on the strip very good, use of monorail between some hotels. Car park is not a million miles away from your room/reception as it is with some hotels. Access to your room from the car park good, again you do not have to trail through a shopping mall or casino to get to your room. There are lots of hotels to choose from on the strip, and the Monte Carlo is not one of the newest, therefore does not have ultra modern rooms. The rooms however are functional and practical and of a good size. We did pay for a high floor room, and whilst we got the high floor, there was no other benefit, the room was the same as the one we had the previous year on floor 5. There are a few signs of wear and tear, but we were out all day every day that this did not matter to us. The hotel does have seperate lists depending on what floor you are on, and this does help at peak times. You can use the internet at reception to check in, they have now blocked the internet to only show the airline sites, you cannot access the internet from here. This was available the previous year as I was able to print off discount coupons. The hotel has a mexican restaurant which is good, but the service on our last visit was not brilliant, and do note it does close in the run up to Christmas. I had made a reservation on opentable about 4 months before our visit, only to receive a cancellation notice a couple of weeks before our arrival to say the restaurant would not be open. Hiring a car is a must if you want to get out and about and see some of the sites. We got up early when the strip was nice and quiet and went for a walk. Earl of Sandwich at Planet Hollywood is fab, and highly recommended, as is PF Chang's the chinese restaurant. Get to the malls early if you can before they get mega busy especially at holiday times. Food in the Monte Carlo buffet restaurant was OK. Its not expensive as some, and perhaps does not have such a huge selection, but there is plenty to eat, and it does generally offer good value for money. Yes, would return in the future to the hotel, as I know what I am getting, and it offers great value for money. Feel free to contact me if you have any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Not "Luxurious" As Advertised, But Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: KRB222
Reviews.Content: The location was really good - easy to walk along the Strip or catch the monorail to the Bellagio. The room itself was okay but the bathroom was a little dingy -- peeling wallpaper, black grime in corners, and just an overall feeling of deterioration. The bed was comfortable and it was realy nice to have the Keurig. The price was great so I feel fine about the quality of the room. The Monte Carlo itself, in terms of a casino, wasn't that exciting - the casino area felt a little dead sometimes and the restaurant selection wasn't too interesting. I did have a great experience with the Concierge desk, though, who were able to get us tickets to a show for a very discounted price, so that was a great surprise, and every staff member we encountered during our 4 days there was very friendly. I would possibly stay here again, depending on the rate, but would definitely take a look at other options as well.

Reviews.Title: “Depends on the rate.”
Reviews.Author: rythym0729
Reviews.Content: Location of Monte Carlo is nice even though a little further south than I like to stay. Rooms are adequately comfortable. In my particular room the AC unit wasn't cranking like I would have preferred and someone decided to leave us some M&M's on the floor to snack on upon arrival. For me the price needs to be below $75 nightly to book here again based on my previous Las Vegas experiences.

Reviews.Title: “Decent if You Get a Great Rate”
Reviews.Author: Tee1000
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice, mostly because of great rates offered through MLife Players Club. The casino is decent, the rooms adequate albeit in need of bathroom remodeling, and the staff helpful. It is near NYNY on the strip and you can walk to several casinos from this property. Parking is good as is freeway access. We tend to casino hop in Vegas and I wouldn't stay here intending to play here full time at the casino. Nice thing is that it is not overly crowded and might suit an older less rambunctious crowd than the nearby casinos which tend to attract the 21 - 25 crowd on the prowl. If you get a good rate it's a viable option.

Reviews.Title: “Not the resort it used to be....”
Reviews.Author: Robert B
Reviews.Content: I love going to Las Vegas but have not stayed in the Monte Carlo for over a year. The front desk service person who checked us in was awesome (I really wish I could remember her name to thank her!) She gained the resort an extra half star in my opinion. The property is starting to show its age, the rooms were average but they really could use a complete make over. The casino area is also average, on the plus side there were plenty of (obviously) slot machines and video poker/blackjack. Once the show lets out the noise and music really ramps up for about an hour, so be prepared.... The cafeteria was a huge disappointment, we used to love the food there and truly looked forward to it. Last year and this you can tell that there is new management/owners??? Bottom line was that the food was too expensive for what it was, if it did not have a captive audience of hotel guests- it would probably go out of business.

Reviews.Title: “Great value on strip but lacks attention to details”
Reviews.Author: Dewey500
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent a week at the Monte Carlo. Overall our stay was good but we had enough little problems that it became annoying. We originally booked a Monaco Suite and requested a strip view. When we arrived there were no high floor strip view rooms available so they offered a 3rd floor Monaco Suite instead. I was not willing to accept this so they offered a mountain view on the 22nd floor but said they would call the next day when a strip view opened up so we could move. O.K. fine one night I could live with. After a few trips back and forth to the front desk for key cards that would not work we finnaly got settled in. The mountain view was actually a view of the freeway and In N Out Burger! Not what I had in mind for a Vegas view but waited patiently for the call to be moved to a better room. 24 hours later still no call so back to the front desk again to stand in the long lines waiting to see what the deal was. Apparently nothing opened up so they just decided to not even bother calling us. I told them I was not too happy with how things have been going so far and requested an upgrade to a better room. After the front desk talked to manager they offered to put us in a Spa Suite on the 24th floor with a Strip View. Finally we could relax and enjoy our stay!! The Spa Suite we stayed in was incredible and much better than the Monaco Suite we were in the first night. The Spa Suite we were in looked to be recently updated and was in great shape. (I posted photos in the pic section) We loved the view and sitting in the spa overlooking the strip lights was awesome. The shower was tiled, enclosed in glass and very huge. We also had a nice bar area with sink along with a stereo, refrigerator, and coffee maker. Everything we needed except for maybe a microwave. Pros.... Great value for what you get in a room. Location is perfect and in the middle of all of main action on the strip. Beds and pillows are by far the most comfortable I have ever had in a motel room. We didn't gamble much but loved the casino. Not so large like some of the others and not so smoky. Although there is a strong smell of perfume which did not bother me. The place is very clean and organized. Everybody we dealt with that worked there was extremely friendly and helpful. Had free WIFI everywhere on the property. (part of resort fee I assume) There was a wide range of food options on the property. Subway, McDonalds, Sbaro Pizza, Starbucks and a few others if you want cheaper options. We thought the buffet was pretty good for the price, the Cafe was excellent. Heard good things about Diablo's Cantina, Brand Steakhouse and Dragon Noodle Chinese restaurant but didn't get a chance to eat there. Avis car rental desk onsite. Was very easy to rent a car for a day if you choose. Cons... Our 3rd night there after a very late night we were woken up from a dead sleep very early in the morning by what sounded like a hammer pounding on the wall above our bed and shortly after very loud speaking in spanish and very excessive noise from the next room. Contacted front desk and they apologized after telling us workers were replacing carpet in that room. I stressed my displeasure with this and made it very clear I was not happy. They offered to remove my resort fee for 2 nights which I accepted since workers were done that same day anyway. Walls are very thin especially if you have an adjoining door the the next room. The last two nights of our stay a family with at least one very young child moved into that same room. The kid was constantly screaming and the adults had to be the noisiest most inconsiderate people I have ever heard. Absolutely no respect for others. Never could understand why people bring young children to Vegas. Good thing we had a stereo in the room to drown them out. At this point we only had one more night so I didn't bother to complain since they were quiet after 10:00 P.M. Avoid d.vino for Italian food. We ate there our first night there. Spent $60 for two and were not pleased with the quality. Spaghetti was the worst I ever had. Chicken Parmesan was very dry. Other than a few problems we actually really enjoyed our stay. I know that sounded like way too many problems but they were more than willing to work with us to compensate us in some way. These are the details they need to improve on and if they do it will make this a much better place to stay. I thought the price I paid was excellent compared to others nearby considering the location but will more than likely look elswhere in the future unless they offer me a really good deal to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: ChicoGreybeard
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights. Public areas were clean and fairly well maintained. Room was clean. However, several items needed maintenance. Bulb out in the bathroom, bathroom sink drained slowly. Guess housekeeping doesn't talk to maintenance! Beds were fine, Internet was useable, etc. Service at the desk and restaurants were fine. Frankly, not a bad stay. The property is looking a little dated but it was less crowded than some of the larger/newer casinos on the strip. For the price, I thought it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: Samantha B
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at mgm resorts and out of them i have stayed at mgm (ultimate las vegas favorite), monte carlo and bellagio. Also I have stayed at the Paris hotel but it is not part of mgm. This hotel was okay, not that great. Casino was okay, room was not as nice as other hotels, and the overall hotel is just average. I wouldn't plan to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great vegas location”
Reviews.Author: Brandon E
Reviews.Content: Monte Carlo is a good place to stay, especially during the winter and colder months in Vegas. It's nearly the middle of the strip. It connects to city center and bellagio, it's right across from hard rock (the restaurant not the hotel,) and new york new york (espn zone, or whatever it's called now.) It also houses two of my favorite places in Vegas. Diablos cantina is two stories, open to the strip, and has a great casual bar atomsphere. Through the casino, on the way to city center, it also has "The Pub" which is great Irish bar and with dueling pianos. The casino is a little small, and the rooms are standard. There are also a few more places with better pool scenes (Mandalay, MGM, Hard Rock) so I would say it's average there as well. It does have a great gym (and free) if you like to workout.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite four star”
Reviews.Author: Rumalu
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo is a nice hotel. The rooms are pleasant, the property is not gargantuan like it's sister property the MGM Grade nor down on it's heels like some of the older hotels. There are a few niggly things which really knock it down a small notch. I could hear the people in the next room through the adjoining door. They were not noisy, but I could hear them talking or when they turned on the television. Instead of porcelain or china mugs they had Styrofoam. What happened to 'green' choices? Check in took close to an hour. Not a bad hotel but not a great one.

Reviews.Title: “Four nite stay”
Reviews.Author: jeffsoo1
Reviews.Content: Well run and clean with all the amenities you could think of. Centrally located on the strip we had a good stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Creepy, badly managed dive on a grand scale! Poor amenities!!!”
Reviews.Author: sadaniels
Reviews.Content: 1st thing, (very creepy) when we opened the door to our first room (always a good sign when you have to change rooms) we surprisingly were greeted by a bellhop coming out of our room. He said he was just getting it ready for us. In reality he had no idea we were coming. What was he doing in our room? I would like to know that too. Napping, or something worse, is suspect. That room was the worst room I have ever seen, and I've seen my share: torn wallpaper, giant black smudge on wall, no refrigerator or microwave (standard at most hotels), no chairs or table. Just a bed and bath. The pictures they show you online are there "upgraded rooms," which are not much better. So, I was not going to stay in this creepy room with the CSI spot on the wall. So back to the mile-long front desk we went to negotiate a new room. Of course they did not have another room for us. Like in this huge hotel they did not have even one room available. So we ask to talk to the manager. After declaring that we were not staying in that room he "found" another room. It was the last room down an endless hallway. We got quite the workout; sometimes we just stayed in the room because it was too far of a walk to leave. This room was not much better, except that it did have some chairs. They were willing to roll in a frig. More like a low end motel than a big resort. And at check out we were hit with the hidden resort fees. You know the fees that they say pay for things like the pool and free parking. The kind of things that are free at other hotels (not in Vegas). I booked the room online for our anniversary, so we were locked into the room or we would have stayed somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Adequate Room”
Reviews.Author: Vacation-Reviewer14
Reviews.Content: The location of the resort is ideal - right in the middle of the strip. Location makes walking the strip easy. Upon arrival we noticed our room was not quite clean (stained pillowcases and hair on the bed). Contacted the front desk and we were moved to a different wing on the same floor (12th). This second room was clean and had a better view of the strip - looking out at the MGM Grand. The room was a good size and the bathroom was okay also. Bed was comfortable. Generally the rooms need updating. They are getting old. Parking was easy. Although we only ate in the hotel one time during our 4 day stay - breakfast the morning we were leaving - it was good. Lobby was nicely appointed. Casino was fine. Although I did not use the spa I did walk through it and it was nicely equipped with plenty of exercise equipment and separate massage rooms. Resort connects to Aria without going outside. There are better hotels on the strip, but for the price the Monte Carlo is worth the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, would visit again”
Reviews.Author: ChrisNauta
Reviews.Content: We stayed from Feb. 27 to Mar. 1 and enjoyed this hotel. It is located right in the centre of the strip and is near to everything Vegas has to offer. We found it very affordable staying in a king room on the 30th floor facing the strip. We paid only $ 62.00 per night which i believe was great value. The staff were great and courteous to us with each request we had. There is a restaurant called Diablos right up front and i had some of the best Shrimp and rice in my life there. We would definitely come back here again.

Reviews.Title: “In the Middle of the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Carlos A
Reviews.Content: Is conveniently located in the middle of the strip. Friendly staff, clean, several buffets, restaurants in the lobby. Diablo's is a must. It was a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: maassenl
Reviews.Content: Quiet, on 30th floor, friendly staff, connects to Aria, shuttle to airport.

Reviews.Title: “Middle of the Row Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: turner4
Reviews.Content: We stayed from Jan31-2012 till Feb 4 2012- We picked this hotel based on its location and the affordability. We requested a king room but because we wanted to have an adjoining room with the other couple we travelled with, we opted for 2 queens. When we arrived we were early but we checked in and had the staff call us on our cell to tell us when our room would be ready (they said an hour but was less than 20 mins) also used the bell hop services and when delivered our luggage to the room, even had our beer ice cold :) Very great service, loved the late night food court, shops and wifi spots. The only thing we didn't like was no wifi in room, our safe was broke, and tile floor inside door was very slippery. Other than that we had a great experience at the Monte Carlo.

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient Location, Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: zjodie
Reviews.Content: We had a week stay at Monte Carlo and when we booked our room we paid for a strip view. We checked in a little early so the front desk clerk said they would give us an even better room..... We got to the room only to see that the part of the strip we viewed was a sidewalk area. Anyway, I promptly called down to the front desk and explained that we paid for a strip view, the clerk explained we could see the strip at nite. I asked if they had a better view room and they quickly changed our room key and had us go to a better location. That room and view was spectacular. I still have the photos of the day and nite of the strip from our room on my phone, from over a year ago! PS...... Eat at the hotel restaurant..... Diablo's and don't forget to try the nacho's, they were amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Overall great experience”
Reviews.Author: brmen
Reviews.Content: This was my third time staying in Vegas. I've previously stayed at Stratosphere and Bellagio. I expected my experience at Monte Carlo to be somewhere between the two and it was. Monte Carlo is in a good central location on The Strip. The tram between it, Vdara and Bellagio was really useful. The hotel isn't in that bad of condition. It is a 4 star hotel so it isn't going to be overtly luxurious. It was a comfortable, reasonable sized, clean hotel. People smoking in Vegas is inescapable.
