It would be unreasonable to go there expecting any hotel to not be smoky somewhere on the casino floor! The front desk service was friendly and efficient. When I did encounter a problem with my reservation, it was quickly reviewed and corrected. Overall, I would definitely recommend Monte Carlo to anyone looking for a centrally located 4 star experience on The Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo 'RESORT'......”
Reviews.Author: kizna
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Vegas from Feb. 17th-20th, 2012 to get married. We stayed at the Monte Carlo 'Resort'. Pros: Room was clean, maid service very good and they were very nice. Front desk clerks nice. Cons: You pay extra cause it is a 'RESORT'. Oh and to get internet tv costs extra plus so does other tv channels-tv sucks there. We stayed on the 20th floor. Room 329. Room was clean, yes, but no fan in bathroom.. Geez. Also, when you go to flush the toilet, the pressure is so great that you feel like you will go down with it. lol. It is loud and obnoxious. I guess we aren't used to paying taxes and living in Vegas. All food in the hotel is very expensive. A foot long subway costs $10! The most reasonable food place was the cafe in there. Still around $10-20 but you get alot. Be prepared for alot of walking!!! Also another con is that because it was our 1st time in Vegas, we didn't know how to get around. Please rent a car. We took cabs and they ate all our $. We would ask the front clerks how to get around but they wern't helpful in this area. Seems to me that hotels should have more information on how to get around in a city. Oh wait, they want you to just stay there and take all your money. I doubt we will ever go back to Vegas.. Too expensive for us! Oh, I do have to say if you stay here, go see Jabberwalkeez, they were worth every cent and ya didn't even have to go to another hotel to see them. I LOVED them.

Reviews.Title: “Why Don't People have Manners?!?”
Reviews.Author: Pammat
Reviews.Content: First off, Las Vegas was a necessity for a competition. I will NEVER go back. Not only was there cigarette smoke EVERYWHERE, I was completely disgusted by our first next door neighbors. After waking up at 4 a.m. to yelling, door slamming and very obviously low-class drunks who were smoking on a non-smoking floor (doesn't anyone follow rules in Vegas?) I called down to the front desk. They said they would send security. Never heard them come though. Somewhat quieter, but still door slamming and talking VERY loudly. Their guests must have left so our neighbors could have their quickie, as then I heard 'noises' and 'oh babe' clear as a bell. I thought, good maybe they will go to sleep. Nope. The friends came back, they lit up again (the smoke was coming through the vent in the room). At this point I had called the front desk twice and spoke to security once. I called down and they did not answer the phone for likely 20 rings. I am sure deliberately. Finally I asked them to send security to my room to smell the smoke and hear the commotion. Finally they listened to this set of guys (they were huge!), However, I never did get back to sleep. The front desk gal was so not into her job. She could care less. I guess jaded from the constant complaints and noise that very obviously exist in this hotel. She said sorry once (the last call) and never said anything about any compensation. I had to ask to be moved. When I moved the next day, the front desk staff was great - they waived the resort fee for the entire stay. When we were moved to another floor, there were people smoking by the elevators right by the sign that said "Non-Smoking Floor". Rules I guess are just meant to be broken. I think Vegas is for people who want to lose their heads, their money, their self-respect and drink their faces off. It is a city of overindulgence at every corner. On a slightly more positive note, I thought the food in the Cafe was great. That's about it. The room was cleaned somewhat as in fresh towels and the bed made, but the maid kept leaving the two used glasses on the sink. Not sure why. We had room service one night and the person who brought it up was very nice and professional. I cannot paint the entire hotel guests with the same brush, however, from the glazed looking , boozed induced, chain smoking people I saw transfixed at the slots, unfortunately that is my opinion of people who go to Vegas, at least at the Monte Carlo.

Reviews.Title: “Older yes but you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: GandMGlasgow
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo from the 14th to 21st February on our first trip to Vegas. Yes it is an older hotel and resort but it was clean comfortable and the staff couldn't have been more helpful. The housekeeping staff kept the room clean and the room service was prompt and the food plentiful and of good quality. No complaints remember you get what you pay for

Reviews.Title: “Run Down - Run Down - Run Down”
Reviews.Author: sflslong
Reviews.Content: Title says it all. Old and run down. Too bad when you go on-line and look at the rooms and property and you see nothing but beauty. If you do book a room somewhere in Lost Wages, please always ask when the hotel was last renovated..... trust me it's important and will help in your decision process. "Good luck". Did I mention how run down – run down – run down the rooms were at the Monte Carlo???

Reviews.Title: “Sounds like an earthquake through our room”
Reviews.Author: Debra F
Reviews.Content: There are a lot of loud noises that are coming from somewhere that has woken me up two nights in a row and just woke me again from the nap I needed to take from being woken up last night. When I called to complain about it they told me no repairs were being done. My husband who never complains about anything wants to change hotels now with three nights left of our trip. If you are looking for a hotel you can sleep in, I would not pick this one. Debating on our move right now but not sure if they will let us out of our reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: rareta1979
Reviews.Content: From checkin till checkout the people are most helpful and friendly. Clean rooms, great location..all around excellent stay. My second time here and they have redesigned some areas for the better.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a one night stay”
Reviews.Author: annap74
Reviews.Content: I ended up at Monte Carlo by using Priceline. It was a rather quite weekend in Vegas so we were able to check in early and had a remodeled room on the 16th floor with a strip view. The location was perfect, the bed was comfortable, and the room was clean. My only complaint is I could hear everything in surrounding rooms. The room isn't as big as others we have stayed in at other locales, but for 85 dollars for the night, we'd do it again. We were also happy to have a coffee maker in the basic room, not often found in Vegas. While I prefer the MGM, like I said, for the price we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great location, basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: DC_Whaley
Reviews.Content: I was at this hotel for work, attending a conference at the Aria next door. This hotel is close to everything. It's clean and decent. Nothing to write home about, but if you're looking for an inexpensive, comfortable place this one fits the bill. Concierge and front desk folks were very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Quick trip--first timers”
Reviews.Author: Steve651
Reviews.Content: All in all, a very good place and very good location. Bathroom shower fixtures a little rough and old. Less smoky casino than some others. adequate buffet (Sunday also has seafood).

Reviews.Title: “luxury”
Reviews.Author: Rushrushrush
Reviews.Content: luxury hotel, i love the casino and the food from bufet

Reviews.Title: “Good location... thats about it”
Reviews.Author: Marriedin06
Reviews.Content: Stayed 8 nights with my husband while he attended a photo expo. We chose this hotel because it was near MGM and the price was good through Expedia. The location was the best part- everything else was mediocre. To start, we checked in at 2am and we gave a credit card for the resort fee and another $50 to keep open for any other charges. Turns out they charged the resort fee that day for the entire stay and it was $20, not $15 as Expedia said. All that covered was wired internet and use of the gym. We also got 'complimentary' water each day which we had to remind housekeeping about several times. There were no robes or slippers or nice bathroom amenities with the room, like Bellagio or Mandalay Bay, which we have stayed at before. They also did not leave $50 open on the card so we didn't have access to movies or to charge anything to the room. Housekeeping basically remade the bed- they didn't clean much in the bathroom and like I said before we had to remind them for the water. Room was ok- not terrible but did need some upgrading. The toilet was extremely loud when flushed and walls were thin so we could hear the young kids waking up at 6am every morning (by the way- why are people bringing so many kids to Vegas these days???) Got a massage at the spa which was not so great- she was very fast and it wasn't very relaxing. The whirlpool and steam rooms were ok but didn't compare to other spas on the strip. Definitely small and in need of upgrades. Tried to print boarding passes from the computers in the lobby but printer was out of paper and had to wait for someone from the busy front desk to refill. Overall the location was good but I would probably stay off strip and rent a car next time because anything on the strip is overpriced. Management did refund the resort fee after we listed all our complaints

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Like this Hotel! Is this really a 4 Star Hotel??”
Reviews.Author: kotothej
Reviews.Content: No Wi Fi! $20 resort fee but still have to pay to use the computers in the business centers. Rude phone operators and desk clerk. Got food poisoning from eating chicken at The Cafe "restaurant". Was puking and sick the entire trip. Watered down drinks too! Rooms are old and not renovated. Had two queen beds even though I was the only person in the room :-/. Will not stay here again. Reminds me of the Days Inn. Better off staying at the newer hotels.

Reviews.Title: “A decent place to stay in city that can go wild :)”
Reviews.Author: Anuli
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a short visit on our way to LA in 2009. The room was quite nice with a view of the strip and two queen beds. The service was pretty standard. The location is however great as it is almost in the center of the strip close to all the main attractions and casinos. With Bellagio on its left and New York New York on its right, you can't go wrong. It is conveniently located within 2 miles from the airport and has a airport shuttle. We had a rental car so didn't need one. The room was spacious and clean. The night view in Las Vegas is worth a million dollar especially if you are at the right place on the strip. It is conveniently located within a short walking distance from the new (not so new anymore) Aria CityCenter which is a heaven for the shopoholics. They also have a free tram service that connects you to Bellagio and the Citycenter. It has a monorail connection as well. Another useful thing that came in handy on my trip was it's vicinity to a pharmacy (CVS right outside). We needed some bandaids and few other first aid items late in the evening. The restaurants inside are good and as per LV megaresort standard. We only had breakfast at one of them. This is a pretty standard Las Vegas larger than life mega resort and casino. The outside looks like a palace..pure during the day and the inside looks like a LV casino. We had a comfortable stay and may return if we find a good deal again. We booked through expedia and found a great deal at the last minute, and also we like trying new resorts everytime we are in Las Vegas...you never know if it will still be standing when you visit next time. Casinos grow and fall overnight like the foliage in LV. Will recommend it at the right price.Hope you have a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value and nice casino”
Reviews.Author: Livetotravel
Reviews.Content: I try to stay here whenever I travel to Vegas because I think it's a great value for a casino hotel on the strip. It's always in perfect condition, and the casino is nice, but not too large. It's also a great location, being close to New York-New York and MGM. There is also a very good brewery/restaurant in the hotel, and the food is very good. There buffet is also really good. I have never been disappointed with my stay at Monte Carlo.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice resort”
Reviews.Author: rogerythat
Reviews.Content: This was a nice place to stay, and the location was great. The location puts you right in the heart of the MGM, Aria, Mandalay Bay, and Luxor. It was February so I cannot comment on the pool, but the rooms were nice. The rooms are updated and very comfortable. If I have the chance I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mistacraig
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, great casino and restaurants, didn't like room as looked out on roof, not much of a view

Reviews.Title: “Why I still like this hotel. A honest review”
Reviews.Author: nitesky014
Reviews.Content: I am NOT a one time reviewer. I have stayed here on a few occasions. Why? Because of the price and location. When I come to Vegas I usually come solo to visit friends and I enjoy staying on the strip. Listen if I had more money I would try another hotel like the Bellagio or Wynn. But I picked here for the $40 a nt rate (using the Mcard for Feb7-10). Yes like everyone else I hate the resort fee (all the MGM properties charge it). The hotel does have flaws, I too had a room that had both chairs with stains and a stain on the carpet. My in room safe also did not work. I asked to be moved and they moved me. To a higher floor without an extra charge. Would I like them to update the rooms..YES. But lets be realistic that's a lot of rooms and money. CHECK IN could benefit from the one line method.. again that is a MGM standard way. The CASINO is nice. I like the color and while on the smaller side it works for me. slots and tables, just like everyone else. LOCATION is great as far as I am concern. Being right next to the CVS where I went daily for water and any other essentials. I always hunt for a deal and end up back here. Those that say the walls are too thin - you have loud neighbors. Those that smelled smokers - those guest were smoking in a non smoking room. Bad experience are IMO the result of bad service and bad behaving guest. My service this trip was all good. There are so many choices for those wanting more - so spend more and stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: Megan0012
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently over a long weekend with another couple. The location on the strip was great, pretty central to the heart of the strip. The rooms were clean, beds comfy, and what interaction we had with the staff was good. I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Summer Party Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tripesq
Reviews.Content: This is a belated review from Memorial Day Weekend, but we remember it clearly. We are in our 40's but we were looking to party like its college spring break and we, "hit a home run," with the Monte Carlo. It was a great stay! We checked in on Friday night and on Saturday of the weekend, temps were in the high 80's, and by 10 am the DJ was pumping it poolside. Our room faced the pool, we heard the music from bed, and the party started. We headed down to the pool and had one of our best days ever! Get there early to get the lounge chairs. By noon, most are taken. See our photos of the pool scene from our room before it got too crowded down there. The hotel had a crew come in and set up a foam pool on their resort beach and we found our place in the suds...slipping and sliding all over with the mainly 20’s party crowd. Then the wave pool....dancers and DJ...great! We could not believe that people brought children here! Later, we rented tubes and floated the lazy river around and around, music blasting; crowd dancing, bodies rubbing, tons of bikinis, electric atmosphere. This was we wanted to see at a Vegas hotel on Memorial Day Weekend and they did not let us down. By Monday, we did not want to go home, needed more pool time, so we purchased a half-day till 5 PM in the room for a reasonable price. Room Review: It’s rated at 4 stars, but really it’s a 3 star room and 4 stars for the extensive resort facilities. Don't expect anything more than a 3 from the room unless they update it. Towels, soap, etc. all 3 stars. But we weren’t in Vegas to hang in the room--we were out and about. Area: Very convenient to everything. You are next to the Aria, NY NY, MGM, and a tram that takes you to Bellagio. We trammed and walked it wherever we wanted to go. Food: With the exception of Subway in the Hotel, we did not eat there. (BTW: a Subway Sub is 2x normal price=$10.00=Vegas Hotel high prices!) Parking: Free Self-Parking easy as can be. Park in the large covered garage and walk the causeway into the lobby. We did not move the car for 3 days. Gambling: Who knows! We were having so much fun, that we forgot to gamble. Only things we did not like: They would not let us bring food or water to the pool area. We had to sneak it. (Don't tell them! LOL).

Reviews.Title: “Average accommodations”
Reviews.Author: happynwtraveler
Reviews.Content: Cost was too high for the accommodations or service. Pool was closed, still charged a resort fee - rooms just average - staff at front desk not particularly friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it !!!”
Reviews.Author: Ladaka
Reviews.Content: I booked a pent house room.. No iron board or iron .. The spa in tub didn't work .. No snacks or treats in room ...service no good... I also rented 10 other rooms .. No discount...buffet was awful .. Food very dry like it was sitting there long time .. I have stayed in las Vegas in other hotels .., but I would never stay at monte Carlo again ... Limo never picked us up to take to airport .. They had us going from place to place to talk to people .. We just took a taxi and got it over with ... Would not go back there

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: bobindenver1
Reviews.Content: We were in Vegas for business and only paid $69 for a room at the Monte Carlo. The lobby area is nice enough, but the hotel overall is old and dirty. The hallway carpets are stained and the walls are damaged. The room was quite dated and the furniture was shabby. They did not have the king size bed I requested, so I was given a room with two doubles. Also, they apparently don't segregate the smoking rooms from the non smoking rooms. Even though my room was supposed to be non smoking, I could smell smoke coming from another room. The bathroom was fine, but not up to the standards of the better Vegas hotels. I would recomment paying a few extra dollars and upgrade to a newer hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: CTP123
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from the 12th to 18th of Feb. First night there we had our GPS stolen from our rental car. Reported it to security, but they seemed uninterested, and gave the impression that this happens all the time. When I asked about the cameras, I was told that the camera in the location where I was parked was facing the other way. Not impressed by the way it was handled. Will stay elsewhere next time!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed at Holiday Inn Express's that are Nicer than this!”
Reviews.Author: LaurAshley
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business (with a few extra days for fun) and have to assume that the entire bit of the cost premium is purely due to locaiton, not a cent for comfort or quality. Don't get me wrong, the photos don't look bad at all but up close it's not so pretty. The wallpapers peeling in the bathroom, tiles are missing in the bathtub corners, the bathtub it self look like it was made for munchkins, and the bathroom counter was covered in knicks and chips. On top of that when I pluged in my phone and laptop charger behind the knightstand and tv stand I came back with a hand coated in THICK dusk, not a weeks worth for forgetfulness-- were talking the stuff that's you see on your fan blades when you were in college, GROSS! On top of that theres not even a bed spread just a duvet with a sheet tucket over it (the duvet underneath was filthy I might add). Also on the list of annoyances is the lamp that is screwed right into the middle of the desk prohibiting any normal use (maybe not a deal breaker for most traveling there, I'll acknowledge). All of these things I could have lived with if I were not at a 3.5 star hotel on the strip in Las Vegas. I have stayed at worse places than this, but even most Holiday Inn Express's that I've seen were cleaner and nicer than this.

Reviews.Title: “good time at monte carlo”
Reviews.Author: richard_powell1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo for 5 nights from 5th Feb ....we had a strip view on the 16 floor, which meant it was quiet -and not bothered by the noise from the pool. the room was spotlessly clean and comfortably warm....they had a point deducted for a couple of things, the walls are vert thin (do the owners of the hotels read these reviews???? - get some soundproofing folks!!!!!!) and there was no grab rail in the shower or no any slip mat on the tub floor.......................ASlso the food court was low end, but hey there are plenty of places to eat in the town , the Pub was great - good beer choice and the sliders ( Hubby wanted to try them as he didnt know what a slider was!!) we really good... the free tram from the hotel to the Bellagio (via Crystals) was brilliant and saved our poor legs !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Would Not Stay Here Again!”
Reviews.Author: CancunBeacher
Reviews.Content: By far, the Monte Carlo is one of the worst 3-4 start hotels in Vegas. After staying at the Aria for four nights, we decided to stay one additional night before heading home but chose the Monte Carlo (right next to the Aria) since we had a reduced rate offer from MLife. We were first booked into a deluxe room on the 31st floor, with a parking lot view and found out that Playboy or some company like them, were filming a commerical/video directly across the hall in another deluxe room. We immediately asked to be moved and even paid more to upgrade to a suite. The suite was larger, however, the carpets, furniture and bedspread were all stained and disgusting. The room decor, bathroom counters, faucets and tub were ancient and dingy looking. We could hear the neighbors (kids and adults) running and talking for hours late into the night. Since we were only there one night and since we were out of the room most of the night we decided to live through it. The next morning we complained to the front desk only to find out they did not seem to care much and made it sound like this was a normal experience. Never again will we stay here. If you want a great 5 star place to stay.. stay at the Aria.. 5 stars all the way.

Reviews.Title: “great location on the strip”
Reviews.Author: ginabuchanan
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this property several times while in town working a trade show. Room was fairly clean - seemed like it took forever for shower water to get hot and sink didn't drain quickly. But...My bed & pillows did sleep great! They do not have wireless. Internet uses a cable which I wasn't able to get to work. Upon checkout I told them the internet didn't work and they credited a portion of the resort fee. So, if you have any issues - speak up asap so they can either fix or credit your bill. Really wish they could filter out some of the smoke in the lobby/casino area. Ate at The Pub and D'Vino onsite. The Pub has many beers to choose from. The food is just so-so. D'Vino was a nice italian meal. The food court includes Subway, McD's, Starbucks, and a couple other choices. I wanted to see Jabbawoceez show on Tuesday night but they were dark. :( Overall, pretty decent stay at a great rate.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Snob's Favorite Place in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: gjsweets
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Euro-modern property, that is immaculate. It is far enough away from the strip to still get into "trouble". Free shuttle to and from the strip/airport (friendly drivers), service with a smile, and clean (have I said that?). Excellent food venues. Could use a bigger variety of gaming tables, other than that no complaints. Looking forward to going back in June.

Reviews.Title: “Diamond Suite more like Garbage Suite”
Reviews.Author: Kelley W
Reviews.Content: We booked our hotel/air package through Allegiant Air which included deluxe rooms at the Monte Carlo. After emailing the Monte Carlo they offered us an upgrade to there Diamond Suite for $55 a night during the week and $75 a night during the weekend. We felt this was a great deal to get a two room suite with jacuzzi tub. Turns out we got far less from the room we stayed in. The air condition in the room would blow cold air but would not cool the room down below 70F. After several looks by maintenence we were told everything was working fine. The front desk went as far to tell me to change the setting from 60F to 70F because sometimes by setting it warm it will cool the room better. Figure that one out? The room had a wet bar with cabinets that were falling on the hinges and would not close correctly. The carpets in the room were stained very badly, to the point you didnt feel comfortable walking around with out shoes on. After several talks with the front desk we finally decided to stop spending money on upgrade charges and went back to the deluxe room. This process of checking out of my old room to get into a new one took for 25 minutes at the front desk. Everytime you have an issue the person working at the front desk has to make several calls before anything can happen. Sadly these rooms were much cleaner and nicer then our upgraded room. All in all we ended up spending lots of money on resort fees and upgrade fee all to be very dissapointed in our hotel. I would not ever stay again at the Monte Carlo and would urge people to use caustion when staying there. I have stay at older hotels on the strip such as Rivera and had much cleaner and nicer rooms and much better service.

Reviews.Title: “Good value & location on the strip”
Reviews.Author: ColoJess
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I come to Vegas 1-2 times a year and tend to move around, never the same hotel twice. We got a great deal on the Monte Carlo Spa Suite so figured why not? Sure the MC is bit old, but its location next to the City Center is awesome! We arrived a few hours before check-in, but they let us check in at noon. Score! We took a short walk to the elevators and headed up to the 31st floor. The spa suite didn't disappoint! Sure it has a bit of an older style (brass fixtures, carpet and sofa have seen better days), but the view from the jacuzzi is out of this world (strip/mountain view)! It also had a king size bed, sitting area, bar area and decent size bathroom (although no double sinks). And it came with robes and slippers. The room was very clean and the maid service was prompt. When I had to call down for a hair dryer (none in the room), they got it up to me in 10m! Room service was prompt and good also. And all in all it was a good stay. My only complaints are 1) they really need new windows, we could hear the screams from the NYNY roller coaster riders some nights - with the windows and curtains shut! 2) Their resort fee of $20/day is a joke. It gives you bottled water (which we only got 1 day of 3), free phone calls (!? um, who doesn't have a cell) and a paper every day. Oh and WIRED internet access. Here is one place MC needs to get current - wifi please! Other than that, we really like the location and the hotel itself. It was nice to be close to all the newer spots on the strip without paying the big bucks. This place is small, but that is nice sometimes - less walking!

Reviews.Title: “This is the Monte Carlo - Excellent for the Price!”
Reviews.Author: wawazatt
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Monte Carlo for five nights during February 2012. This is not the Aria, the Cosmopolitan, the VDara, the Bellagio, the Venetian, the Palazzo, the Four Seasons, the Wynne, or Encore...this is the Monte Carlo! IF you expect luxury five star amenities, modern decor, wrap around balconies, five star restaurants, or pool beach clubs then pay the price and stay at one of the resorts mentioned above. The Monte Carlo, for the price (I paid $40 per night), is a great place to rest your head with no frills or flash. The rooms are clean, the hotel is smaller than most, and the location is great with a free tram. I experienced great customer service yet I never demand much when I visit Las Vegas three times a year. Resort fees are $16 per day but all the "no resort fee" hotels will charge your credit card $100 per day for incidentals upon arrival so be aware of that fact. On top of the incidental charges, the headache of billing errors, issuing credits back to your card on time etc, etc.The Monte Carlo charged me $0 for incidentals but you do have an option to keep a card on file to charge to your room but no holds are put on your card. I stayed at several Las Vegas hotels and if want a good, clean hotel with a great price.....the Monte Carlo is the safest bet in Vegas! If you don't believe me , stay at the Imperial Palace on the strip for the same price then get back to me..Enjoy your Las Vegas trip!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Pools But Average Rooms”
Reviews.Author: pearlnnj
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Monte Carlo in Vegas during September. The rooms were very average for the price we paid. They were clean, but no frills at all. The walls were so thin that we could hear the people talking to each other thru the wall. The buffet was awful. Don't eat there. The Mirage had a great buffet and very affordable. The best thing about the hotel were the pools. There was a wave pool that was fabulous and a lazy river pool. We are torn between staying there again. Do we give up the luxury room at The Paris for the same price and better location or the fun with the great pools at The Monte Carlo? Decisions, decisions...

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Stay, BUT Resort Fee Unreasonable in Winter”
Reviews.Author: OlanaDL
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo from February 6th through the 13th. Positive aspects of the stay include the proximity of the parking garage to the hotel lobby and registration, the cleanliness of the room, the location of the hotel on the Strip, and the overall helpfulness of the staff in securing a roll-away cot and mini-fridge for the room. Also, the hotel seems to have upgraded its internet service to WiFi. One of the least appealing aspects of our stay was the $15 +tax daily "resort" fee, which appears to include use of the swimming pools, fitness center, and WiFi. As it is winter, none of the hotel's swimming pools were open. $15 +tax is a steep price to pay for daily internet access. Another negative feature is the lack of an organized queue at registration and check-out, resulting in a free-for-all. When questioned about this, the front desk associate said that a roped off queue would make the lobby unattractive. It's hard to imagine that hotel management views chaotic swarms of guests as attractive. I would be inclined to stay elsewhere in the future. The Hampton Inn, for example, while not on the Strip, offers complimentary breakfast, WiFi, a heated pool that is open year-round, and complimentary shuttles to and from the airport and the Strip. There is no resort fee.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to beat for the price!”
Reviews.Author: chipper002
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights at the Monte Carlo in February 2012 and found the room, amenities and location to be excellent. Staff and concierge were courteous and helpful. My wife loved the fact that fresh flowers were everywhere (see pic of flowers near our room). Beds were very comfortable but bathroom could use some upgrading. Minor problem with housekeeping (one day no coffee, next day no glasses, next day no soap) but a call to the desk got a quick response to correct the problems. Nice to have the food court with inexpensive choices for a quick breakfast. Beautiful casino and great location providing easy access to New York New York, Excalibur, MGM, Crystals, Bellagio and other hotels/casinos. If we return to Vegas, we definitely will stay at the Monte Carlo.

Reviews.Title: “AVERAGE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: aldo9292
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel with great location.The rooms were very nice. We booked Non-Smoking room, 31st floor with Strip view. View was stunning, room very clean -but VERY SMOKEY .We kept the window open all the time. Our friends stayed at same time across our room with mountain view , also Non-Smoking room -with nice smell.We tried to call reception at night to order some drinks -they newer answer the phone.When you compare everything= Average Hotel

Reviews.Title: “My Stay at the Monte Carlo in Vegas was Excellent”
Reviews.Author: gnerg
Reviews.Content: Styayed at the Monte Carlo in Las Vegas in February 2012. Rooms were clean, not new, but better than any hotel room back home. Nice food court and the buffet is wonderful. They are redoing the pool area where there is a wave pool, lazzy river, hot tun, and pool. Excellent volley ball area that makes you feel you are at the beach. Service was fine and teh staff was great. What I like is the great location next to the New York NY. Right on the strip. Good check in, and I used the express checkout when we left. When we return we will stay at the Monte Carlo. Many shops in the complex, and a top notch gambling casino. I highly recommend this hotel. The pool will be fun when it opens in the spring.

Reviews.Title: “Best on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: PFD-Canada
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at the LV Hilton when we travel on our own, but when we travel with others, we're at the Monte Carlo. Central on the strip, close to all the sightseeing attractions on the strip, good restaurants, mannerly and efficient staff and so much more, make this our only choice for hotels on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JustGina56287
Reviews.Content: I have been to Vegas multiple times, however this is my first stay at the Monte Carlo. The front desk reception was friendly though a little slow but our room was ready by 10 AM so that was a big plus! The rooms were clean and the beds were really comfy! We had a good view of the pool, plus the location puts you right beside NY NY across the street from MGM Grand and Aria and Cosmopolitan were on the other side! Overall a GREAT stay and would LOVE to stay in this hotel again!!!! Staff was super friendly and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Not a Bad Value All Around”
Reviews.Author: sallywallerman
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 4-day girlfriends reunion in Vegas. Our group included 35 women. Our base group rates were probably not that different from what you can get just booking online; however for a group they did include the expensive daily resort fee and high room taxes so we had substantial savings there. We each shared queen rooms (doubles) and our group leader had a room attached to a hospitality suite which we all used between outings and activities. Our room was was pretty basic with 2 queens on the 18th floor. The beds were comfortable and the housekeeping staff member that serviced our room went above and beyond the call of duty to keep our room clean and well stocked with coffee and toiletries and replacement towels. The check-in and out staff were also helpful and efficient. There are a lot of choices for in-hotel eating. I had Moo Shu Chicken at the Dragon Noodle Restaurant off the Casino and it was quite good. I also tried the Slider Burgers and Onion Rings and an imported pint of beer at The Pub Restaurant and found the food to just be so-so and it took nearly a half hour for them to seat me even though there were plenty of open tables - so I'm not sure they are managed very well. The Slider buns were pretty mealy and overall I wished I had gone some place else. There are several other restaurants including the usual Vegas buffet, but I did not have time to try any of them. I did get a slice of pizza one day at the Sbarro fast food joint in the hotel's "Food Court" and it was okay. Had no luck whatsoever in the Casino and the facility itself was simply a disappointment. The machines seem old, and even me, a smoker, found the ventilation really poor and the air quality stinky. The staff were friendly enough and drinks are complimentary if you are working a slot machine or playing cards. The location of the Monte Carlo is quite good - it is located toward the southern end of the "Strip" north of MGM and just south of New York New York. Hard Rock Hotel and Casino is across and down the street and walking distance and the Crystals shopping mall is just a block or so away. I did not shop there, but one of the gals in our group really enjoyed that mall which includes super high-end stores like Louis Vuitton as well as a Macys. Best of all you have a CVS (with a Chase ATM inside it) immediately to the south on the Strip and you have a Walgreens directly across the street. Both drugstores sell alcohol and wine and all kinds of sandwiches and food products in addition to the usual things you might find in your local chain drugstores. The only serious downside to the Monte Carlo, is that the rooms are not well sound-proofed. You can hear hallway and room next door sounds pretty well. When they refurbish the place in the future I hope they will address this problem. It wasn't so bad that it interfered with my sleep, but it was noticeable on and off during the days and evenings. When you visit Vegas and especially if you do not rent a car (and I'm glad I did not after seeing all of the continuous Strip traffic!) you really need to consider what is within reasonable walking distance to your hotel; otherwise you will be running up a substantial taxi bill. In this regard the Monte Carlo wins extra points for location! *Note: Pool was closed during our stay and during several of the winter months so if this is an amenity that is important to you, check the operating time of the year for the pool as it relates to your trip plan.

Reviews.Title: “Great - right on the strip”
Reviews.Author: JohnJill_15
Reviews.Content: Excellent location meaning walking to most places is easy. A busy reception but efficient. Rooms are spacious as are the bathrooms and both clean. Lifts can be busy, especially at weekends when the hotel is full. "The Pub" is a bar with great atmosphere and an excellent happy hour. Feel this hotel is good value for money. We did have a problem with theft by room service - left a jacket hanging in the closet which the next tenants handed to the housemaid but it was then never handed in to lost property!

Reviews.Title: “monte Carlo - monaco suite”
Reviews.Author: harrisab
Reviews.Content: Very Nice room, didn't have the best view. Got the room comped, however long wait to check in. Nice pool area, a little crowded at times - but easy to find people. Nice small casino didn't get lost like I do in MGM casino. Good drink service most of the time. Great location mid-strip easy to get on the free tram and very quick and easy to walk to Aria.

Reviews.Title: “Fourth Vegas trip, Second stay at Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: LaceyJ59
Reviews.Content: This is the best value hotel in Vegas, in my opinion. It has a center strip location, the pool is awesome, with the lazy river and wave pool. The rooms are very nice. There are plenty of restaurants here, including a food court with cheaper options. We love the Mexican restaurant at the front of the hotel. You can always find cheap rates here. We have stayed at Luxor and Excalibur and this is my favorite of the three.

Reviews.Title: “This is four star?”
Reviews.Author: KristineG28
Reviews.Content: This has got be the worst hotel experience ever! We checked in early and our room wasn't ready which we expected since our friends room wasn't ready at check in time the day before. We were supposed to get a call but didn't. At 5:30 we went back to the front desk and the women who helped us had to speak to a housekeeping supervisor to find out why the system still said our room was dirty when it was accually clean and why we didn't get a call. She has been the only person to give good servicethe whole time. We got to the room there were dirty dishes outside the door and a coffee maker but no coffee or cups in the room. We called to get coffee that was delivered and the next morning we discovered there was only 1 caffinated. We called for a second one, get transferred to a supervisor who tried to argue that we were only entitled to one of each. We said take the decaf in exchange so he agreed. We then discovered we didn't have a bath mat so we had to put a towel on the floor. We have one more night and I expect it to be just as bad. I wish I hadn't paid extra for a suite.

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: remote2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the monte carlo from 23rd Jan to 3rd Feb. We throughly enjoyed our stay.We had a room on the 18th floor ,which allowed to have a smoke ,a nasty habit but Ienjoy a smoke occasionally . T he room was always kept very cleanl The staff in the hotel were friendly and efficient ,helpful in every way. There were many places to eat and drink,to suit most budgets. I had read several reveiws on this hotel some good and some bad,but we could find no fault whatsoever ,and throughly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Family Friendly in Sin City”
Reviews.Author: andynsuzan
Reviews.Content: We went to Vegas for the first time, during Spring Break mind you, because my brother was getting married there and we were NOT going to miss it. Had to take the kids and I researched hotels extensively to make sure we found the most family friendly on the Strip. (We wanted to stay on the Strip because--Hey it's Vegas! :) )We succeeded! I think our hotel, at that time anyway, was the only one which did not have half naked women dancing on casino tables! We had to walk through several other hotels so we know. Kids in Vegas is not the ideal situation, but at least we made it work. Actually traveled in March 2010.

Reviews.Title: “Viva Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: 0mardc
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel @ 11am & was able to check in early (w/o any add'l fees) and was given a strip view room (16-335)!! Only problem I had was, no Wi-Fi available inside the room. You must use their CAT5 jack and connect it to your laptop. So if you don't have that jack on your laptop, tablet, ect. you will have to go to their food court or lobby area to use the Wi-Fi. Internet is FREE, just enter your last name + room number.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the Price”
Reviews.Author: AnanthG
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Monte Carlo for a week in February. The hotel on the whole was ok. The room price was good and the service was above average. Definetly stay at this hotel in future

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Scottwspicer
Reviews.Content: Rooms were ok, poor atmosphere in poker room, slot area was nice, lounges were poor with very poor service. My wife was treated like crap in one of the lounges. Will never stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “My birthday vegas trip”
Reviews.Author: txeinsi
Reviews.Content: I was here to celebrate a few birthdays. I was very impressed with the lobby and staff. They were all smiling and attentive. The rooms were good but nothing amazing. The decor felt a little old for my taste. I am into more modern looking places. However, for the value I paid. I would say It was worth every penny. The location: I love the location of this hotel. It's not too crowded here. The bad: The showers. OH MY GOD. The water pressure is SOOOO strong. I felt like I was being attacked by the shower. Also, the water leaked through because it was so strong. There was water all over the floor everytime I got out of the shower. The lotion. PLEASE BRING YOUR OWN lotion. This has to be thickest lotion in the world i have ever used. It took me appox 3 minutes per arm because the lotion would not set into my skin. I was pure white and had to run extensively. The Dragon Noodle restaurant was just okay. It quality of food did not feel fresh. Would I return? Yes but it certainly would not be my first pick.

Reviews.Title: “Lucky location, indeed.”
Reviews.Author: GumdropGirl
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Monte Carlo twice. Considering I come to Vegas at least 3 times per year, it's not a remarkable property. But I do like it, in a pleased and benignly unexcited way. The Monte Carlo has a few good things going for it, particularly its location, and its pricepoint. Yes, the rooms are clean and comfortable. The decor is typical, unobtrusive hotel decor: off-white wall paper, beige carpet, granite countertops, brass fixtures. This time 'round, we styaed in a spa suite. Bed was comfy. Television was a 42" Samsung flat panel (like I have at home) carrying the usual blend of cable channels. The spa tub was right next to the window with a view of the mountains. The spa warmed quickly, and was large enough for two reasonably-size American adults, or four children, or one obese person under 250kgs. The room was a broad, open space equipped with a wet bar, kitchen sink and a mini-fridge. There was a living room area with sofa and coffee table, the bed, and the spa tub. No partitions in between. Monte Carlo is located next to the new Crystals at City Centre and Aria. There is a tram connecting Monte Carlo to City Centre to Bellagio. The tram is a great convenience because the Monte Carlo itself doesn't have the most exciting amenities. No hot nightclub. No celebrity chef restaurant. Mediocre shopping options. To get the great stuff, you have to step outside. But that's fine because you can pay less for a good room and still reap the rewards of those New Hotness properties. Service at the Monte Carlo is very good. There was a delay in my room check-in, so the front desk compensated me with waived resort fees and complimentary late check-out. So the tl;dr version: Good room for a good price. Nothing exciting to write home about.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad value on the strip”
Reviews.Author: djt68
Reviews.Content: Overall, not a bad value. Good location on the strip. Rooms are adequate size. i had a couple of room complaints. Pillows are WAY too hard. Just not comfortable at all. Also, the towels all smell like burnt toast. it's funny, I was at the front desk asking about something else and someone complained about the same thing. Good array of restaurants. The sports book is ok, a bit small compared to many other Vegas hotels...plus they need more TV's. Overall, Monte Carlo lacks the dazzle of the top tier hotels in Vegas, but you get a good location, pretty good accomodations, etc. for a decent price.

Reviews.Title: “You'll never forget the smell. Don't expect the best of anything.”
Reviews.Author: mkd887
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel by shuttle which lost a piece of our luggage. The hotel lineup was long (30 minutes) with several empty computer stations but only a few staff members. Our room, upon arriving to it after a long walk, was nothing impressive with no microwave, no fridge, and obvious stains on the sheets right on top for all to see. We went to the front desk to complain about the stained sheets and asked for them to be changed. They apologized, assured they'd be changed and removed the daily "resort fee" from our bill. After a long flight and wait to get settled in, we searched for food. After wandering about the strong-smelling hotel which was a combination of 30-year old cigarette smoke and overpowering cheap air freshener, we discovered that all restaurants in the hotel stopped serving food after 9 pm and no one would suggest any places we could eat at. We went to the concierge desk to ask for suggestions, but they too were closed at 9pm. The city that never sleeps my [--]. We wandered the strip to find overpriced food and drinks. Do not get suckered into visiting the hotel's club "Brand" - it is a ripoff. They offered wristbands to the ladies for "free drinks" which turned out not to be free when they finally get you roped into the line checking your id's and they want $20 cover charge. The boys got in for $10 each but they bought their "deal" of bottle service - a tiny bottle of disgusting Skyy vodka, some mix, and a table - all for the cheap price of $140 when the same bottle and mix cost $30 from the hotel lobby store. The very second you finish your bottle, the staff rush to take your mix and cups away regardless of whether you've finished with them or not. We returned to our rooms at 1 am to find our sheets had not been changed as requested. Returned downstairs to talk to front desk again. They apologized again, claiming they only had 1 housekeeper on duty and we need to give her 15 minutes to change the sheets. We walked around some more, gave her a good 1/2 hour before returning to the room, and she was still in our room but just finishing up. So exhausted, we fell into bed and didn't notice until the next morning the "new" sheets also had nasty stains on them. The shower drain wouldn't drain worth sh!t and while showering, the tub would fill up with dirty water. Gross. I called front desk this time to complain about dirty sheets and disfunctional bathtub drain. I waited a half hour and got put on hold, transferred to the manager several times. After repeating my story again and again, we were given a new room and waited another 20 minutes for someone to bring us new key cards. In our new room with a worse view than the first, the safe didn't work, but we'd given up on trying to get decent service. Also, there was someone else's trash in the garbage bin that wasn't changed from the previous visitors. After a few hours in that hotel lobby/casino/restaurant areas, my nose and sinuses felt raw from the stench and accepted a persistent headache. All other hotels we visited did have a slightly noticeable smoke/air freshener smell, but the Monte Carlo was obnoxiously offensive. Our rooms were outdated and worn. Simple amenities and service were hard to come by. Accessibility to places were far away and you had to walk everywhere - not client friendly at all. Drinks at any bar seemed excessively priced, except at the Pub one night where Bud light was on a good deal. The best experience was one late night, I ordered overpriced room service. The sweet man who brought it up must have felt bad knowing they were charging me $15 for Special K cereal and strawberries - and I only ordered for "one" person as they have an extra charge for each individual. Knowing there were 2 people staying in the room, he included 2 milks, 2 servings of cereal and a generous bowl of fresh cut strawberries. We were appreciative. The king sized bed was very comfortable however and there was plenty of space in our room - for some positive points. I would NOT stay in this hotel again. From what I saw, other hotels on the strip of similar, less and more pricey levels all seemed better than the Monte Carlo. For my first trip to Vegas, I was quite disappointed. I don't know if I'd returned. It seems like a rip off for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: veespot
Reviews.Content: The reviews of this hotel were so bad, I honestly had no expectations! I loved it! I will stay there again! My room was nice & clean -- bed comfortable. Front desk helpful and friendly. I had a package that included food -- I ate at the Cafe & Diablo's. The wait at Cafe was a little long, but the food was good (breakfast). Diablo's was AMAZING (get the Fondue with chorrizo)! Very short walk to Aria & tram to Bellagio. At a great location -- easily accessible to all the hot spots! Casino wasn't that smokey, cocktail waitresses very attentive. Jabbawockie Show is in this hotel, they say it books quick. Make sure you sign up for MLife so you got all the freebies -- I got the best cupcakes FREE at cupcakery. 24 hour inexpensive Food court has Subway, Sbarro and McDonald's. I didn't have a great view, but I didn't request one either. Walls are thin and I heard others music & talking, but it didn't matter -- I had a blast!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but not great”
Reviews.Author: Ninabel
Reviews.Content: We made reservations for a king bed room when we checked in at 9:30 after our 9 hours traveling we were informed no more king beds available. We could call in am to be put on list to switch. They did call to get us switched which was good. This hotel has paper thin walls I can hear word for word conversations next door. The room is clean but needs updating towels have holes, stains on sheets, etc. I have stayed in the Venetian, ballys, and excalibur and would prefer them to here.

Reviews.Title: “What happens in Vegas stays on Facebook”
Reviews.Author: nocte_volens
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo is a nice medium priced hotel on the Las Vegas Strip. I like the location in the southern third of the strip. The room was very nice and the bed comfortable. We opted for a high floor room which costs a bit more. We stayed here a couple of years ago in a low floor room, and while our room was fine, one the the couples we went with had a room near the kitchen and there was quite a bit of noise early in the morning. Service was generally good; I have yet to have poor service in Vegas. We went to Vegas during a major trade show, so our hotel was quite expensive (as were all the hotels at the time). The lesson to be learned is to pay more attention to when you go, as the price of our room would have been almost 1/2 had we chosen a different week. We are going back to Vegas in Sept. 2012 and will probably stay at the Monte Carlo again.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo - Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: woodenshoe58
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd time we have stayed there in the last couple years. Hotel is in pretty good location although some of the higher end casinos/hotels are a little further down the strip. There's a Walgreens across the street. MGM (one of our favorite places to stay and play is less then 5 minute walk. There is a mono rail that takes you to the Aria and Belligio. The rooms are clean, waitresses on the floor are friendly and drinks are plentiful. We have eaten at some of the restaurants and they are good. Buffet is good, not great. Actually the Cafe has very good food. Worst part was that the slots and tables ate most of my money

Reviews.Title: “good location and price”
Reviews.Author: Andrew D
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 6 days very helpfull freindly staff. As a lot of reveiws say it is a bit dated but it was clean and located right on the strip. We rented a car from the on site Avis desk and found them very helpful. The concierge was great at printing out tickets for the shows we saw and answering our questions.We would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel choice”
Reviews.Author: garyamc
Reviews.Content: If yo're looking for a good hotel in a great location, Monte Carlo is the place! It is not a party hotel and would be great for families. It has a large casino and several restaurants plus a food court. I had breakfast at "The Cafe. The service and food were excellent and priced reasonably. Las Vegas food prices have escalated. I paid $16.99 for a hot pastrami sandwich at the Carnegie Deli at the Mirage! Room was clean. Get a deluxe strip view room. It's on a higher floor and looks out to the Strip and beyond. If you gamble or play the slots, join the Mlife players club. It's free and can be used at all of MGM Grand Resorts hotels on the Strip. The big negative is the check in process. They have several agents but there is not one line to stand in. You kind of just pick one out and stand in that place.The party in front of me took about 20 minutes to check in. Check out is fine. You can use the TV checkout of the Express Checkout boxes.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Hale_24
Reviews.Content: I have been to Las Vegas a few times. I wouldn't say that I know everything about Vegas, but one thing I do know is that you want to be in a good location on the strip. The Monte Carlo is a great location. Everything is pretty accessible from here. The hotel itself is nice enough. I wouldn't say it is terribly posh, but for it's age, it is pretty good. We spent some time in the pool at this hotel and we found the pool area to be a good time. It was very busy and the weather was hot, so a cold beer by the pool was a good way to spend a couple hours in the afternoon. We ate and drank a bit at the PUB in this hotel, and it was average. We also ate at The Brand in this hotel and it was excellent. Not cheap, but great prime rib. The only real complaint I had about this hotel is that the towels smelled horrible. Not too sure what the deal was there. I am not sure if it was a stale smoke smell, or what, but it was memorable, and not in a good way. I thought that overall the hotel was good. Not excellent, but good. I have also stayed at the Mandalay Bay, which is an excellent in every way, except for it's location. I have also stayed at the Venetian, which is excellent in every way, including it's location. The only trouble there is that it is usually quite expensive. All in all, if you can get a good buy on the Monte Carlo, it will probably do just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families, good location, good value”
Reviews.Author: SLC-Sammy
Reviews.Content: I've been to vegas around 40 times, and I think I've stayed at MC on at least 12 of those trips. If you're there to party, there are better options (the MC has no nightclub and it's a bit "quieter" than some resorts). But if you're traveling with kids, this place is perfect! Their pool is perfect for a family, it has a wave pool and a lazy river that are perfect for the kids to play in while the adults enjoy a cool drink while sunbathing. They always email me deals that I can't pass up ($70 per weeknight during the summer is a common offer) and having a food court downstairs helps keep the kids fed on a budget. If you're not on a budget, their asian and italian restaurants are quite good. The rooms are starting to show their age a bit and they aren't anywhere near as luxurious as many other hotels on the strip. But you can't beat the combination of location, price, and newness (built in 1996). Don't get me wrong, even the party crowd can have a great time here. Just don't expect to be able to make a ton of noise at four in the morning (I've had security put a stop to impromptu parties before). PROS: Great location, affordable, good pool CONS: Lack of nightlife, rooms are showing their age

Reviews.Title: “poor value”
Reviews.Author: floridabill007
Reviews.Content: after staying in many strip hotels, went back to monte after six years . the standards compared to other hotels has fallen even further. the buffet is the worst on the strip and you will pay about $24 for the priviledge. cafe not much better. tightest machines we have encountered. pool is a brick yard.you have to pay extra for a side view of anything, plus daily room charge for a paper! rooms ok nothing speacial. if u like playing poker then you will be in a crypt at the back of casino. dont pay no more than $45 and thats just because its position to better hotels.if first visit go to tropicana mgm mandalay or new york.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are a bit dated, good location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: Mr_R_Baron
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights in January. Rooms are a good size but have a faded beige colour and appear a little tired and jaded. Casino has a nice layout but because of the low ceilings the cigartette smoke doesn't go away very well. After 3 or 4 days hanging around everyone in my group was complaining their eyes were hurting..... On the last day, I would take a long route and avoid walking through the casino.

Reviews.Title: “Good locale, comfy”
Reviews.Author: katiejz
Reviews.Content: Nice staff, comfy feel, great location on the strip, good restaurants/food court.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo GOOD ROOMS for GREAT PRICES”
Reviews.Author: Henrynn1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the pass at the MGM and must say the rooms at the Monte Carlo are beautiful. The hotel has invested not too long ago more into remodeling the rooms. This is a good location next to New York New York and MGM. Must say though this is only a good place if you only want to gamble. There are alot of slot machines and alot of tables....however for entertainment Monte Carlos is not the spot. This hotel is nice and well maintained if you want to relax in Vegas and just gamble. The rooms are spacious and updated. Im glad I came here!

Reviews.Title: “Best $10 you can spend @ Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: g0lfin
Reviews.Content: When I arrived at MC I waited about 5 min to check in at 9:30am. We were upgraded to a city view room. Arrived at the room, nice bed, nice TV, washroom could use a bit of an update. Overall for $100 per night, room was nice. Because I was charged $15 per day resort fee, I used the gym to get my monies worth. You have to walk through the Spa area to get to the gym. Gym was very good, lots of machines, weights and space. I then found out for $10 per day I could use the Spa, so I took advantage of the Spa. The Spa fee is good ALL DAY (untill 7pm) and it has a hot tub, cold tub, steam sauna masage rooms and upgraded showers. Great selection of mens items at sinks to use as well. I used the spa for four days, my skin feels great and my body feels cleaner and smoother from using the spa. I was very happy to spend the money, never busy and overall was a great experience. At the Spa, they have both and Mens and ladies section. If you are planning to stay at MC. Take some time out and take advantage of the Spa and what it has to offer. Well worth the $10 per day and I feel the best deal at the MC! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Older hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Dee Y
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo is definitely one of the older hotels in Las Vegas. The casino is good, rooms are average and the wait for elevators is not very long. The food court inside is actually really good -- subway, starbucks, manchu wok, rubio's and mcdonalds. The best thing about this hotel is its location! Pretty darn close to the middle. I had a couple issues with our room (on the 23rd floor): First, the shower head was really really strong and we couldn't adjust it. Second, I couldn't find the hair dryer until I asked and they said it was in the closet on the top shelf (which I didn't even notice). Third, when people knocked on the doors beside us, we kept thinking that it was our door. The tvs in the rooms are newer flat screens and that's probably the nicest thing in the room. We also had to request a mini fridge, which was wheeled to our room. The casino is pretty good - all the latest slot machines and lots of tables. My only issue was that it was VERY smokey inside. I've never gone during January before, and I think because the heat was on, there was a little less air circulation. I have asthma, so I couldn't stay in the casino for more than an hour without starting to cough a lot. We did go to other hotels and they were a lot less smokey, but you could still smell it. Overall, I would probably stay here again, since it's pretty cheap. Don't expect anything amazing except that you'll have easy access to both sides of the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Decision”
Reviews.Author: Chris W
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo just has a great feel to it. The staff are friendly and helpful, the building and facilities themselves are clean and elegant and the room I stayed in was big enough, serviced daily and was really quite nice. The price was right, too. The Casino itself is less crowded than the bigger casinos which is great because its easier to get around and the staff have time to talk you through how each game works if you've never played before. I guess the bigger casinos provide more atmosphere, but you're never far from them. MC is far enough down the strip that its not absolute chaos as soon as you step outside - but its only a moments walk from the chaos. This meant it was never an effort for us to get in amongst all the excitement that vegas has to offer, but we also had somewhere we could retreat to, where the restaurants and shops weren't overcrowded all the time. While I stayed here with a mate, we had two friends staying at the Bellagio and another staying at Caesar's Palace - and I've got to tell you, MC is a lot less crowded than the more notorious Casino Resorts. This is handy at times - for example when you feel like hitting the pool. The Bellagio was always overflowing with bodies, but the pool at the MC gave us a chance to relax in and by the pool without worrying about jumping into a sea of bodies and having our bannana lounges immediately poached. All in all, its a great hotel at a good price in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “You can find better in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Mar M
Reviews.Content: I was nervous about staying at the Monte Carlo after I read the reviews. Unfortunately, I was already booked through a soccer tournament and couldn't change my reservations. We arrived on Friday night at 11:00 PM and still waited a half hour to check in. The next morning and throughout my 4 day stay there were always ridiculously long lines, (20+ people per line), and many empty check in stations that could have been staffed and helping customers. My room was clean, but as mentioned in the other reviews, looked plain, and did not have a refrigerator or microwave. There were plenty of towels and the room was average in size. I did not have any issues waiting for the elevator. The elevator lobby is right next to the Casino and you will be smelling the smoke. There is a "long" route to the food court, but it is just as easy to cut through the casino and again, you will smell like smoke. The smell in the lobby and throughout the hotel that a few reviewers complained about was obvious. I did not find it unpleasant, but if you are sensitive to smells or have sinus issues then you will be affected and it will probably give you a head ache. The food court was great! They have Chinese, Rubio's, McDonalds, and two other places that are of that caliber. It was open all night and the prices were higher than a regular fast food, but cheaper than room service. The Cafe was awful. It is outdated, smoking is allowed, and the food is terrible. Everything is made with margarine and the toast was so stale that I nearly chipped a tooth. I had egg beaters with cheese and veges. I could only swallow 2 bites. It will cost you about 30 bucks for breakfast for two. We went to McDonalds and bought breakfast sandwiches. The sports pub was good. The drinks were pricey, but the food was reasonable. The Ahi tuna salad was excellent and the hot wings were good as well. The weekend Piano Duel show isn't very good. The pregnant piano lady is a horrible singer and most of our group ignored the show. The casino is a bit pricey and very smokey. For the money I preferred to go to the Aria or other nearby casinos. There is a tram that connects the Monte Carlo, the Aria and Bellagio. This will cut down on walking to each of these casino's, (they are worth the trip), but you will still need to wear sensible shoes as there are a ton of stairs to and from the tram. Our comforters were not changed from the previous guests and there was a strong smell of cologne on both of them. I asked the manager downstairs, (after waiting in a long line), if they could be swapped out. The comforter and sheets were swapped out. I am not sure what was on the sheets, but that night any part of my skin that touched the sheets was broken out in hives. I am not allergic or sensitive to laundry soap, and this was a severe reaction. I had no reaction to the sheets that I had slept on the night before. I showed the manager the reaction and requested a change of sheets again. Housekeeping came upstairs with new sheets but threw them on the bed and left them for me to change. I stripped the bed and slept on the mattress cover and used a blanket I had packed. I didn't have anymore hives, so I am still attributing the severe breakout to something either put on the sheets or what the sheets were washed with. If you have sensitive skin, you will be miserable at this hotel. I didn't understand the resort fee or the spa fee, but after checking in, it was made very apparent. There is an extra 16.95 per day added onto your hotel rate. In addition, if you want to use the gym or spa you must pay 18 dollars a day per person as well. Add 40 dollars a day per person to your room rate when you are booking the hotel. Overall, the hotel is outdated, smoky and not worth the price. If you are looking for a "Vegas" experience this one is about 30 years old.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Place for the Money”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Vixen719
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fairly decent. There's a small food court with McDonalds, Subway and Sabarros, so there are some nice options for late night snacking. The rooms are nice but there were some things missing that I thought were standard in every hotel. There wasn't a microwave or a refrigerator in the room. This is something of a problem if you want to keep anything chilled. Also there were a few tiles missing in our bathroom which made the whole room feel really dated. The walls are also extremely thin. The hotel was clean and the staff is pretty friendly although I did waste something on my comforter the first day and it was never changed the whole time of my stay. That was just a little unnerving, and made me wonder what else they don't change.... The hotel buffet was also pretty decent. They serve brunch almost all day so if you can't get up early for breakfast there's no reason to worry. Location wise, it's kind of towards the end of the strip so if you're ok with walking this shouldn't be a problem. Overall, if you're looking for some place on the strip that is fairly cheap this is a good place to go, just don't expect anything amazing.

Reviews.Title: “service was terrible !”
Reviews.Author: soiman1
Reviews.Content: check in was fine ... the room was terrible ... the furniture was old and marked up... the bathroom had a shower for handicapped people ... no bath tub... called down to get room changed ...the front desk said they would get back to me ... waited 20 minutes called again and was given the run-a-round by some nice sounding lady ... my girlfriend said let's go eat ... went down stairs and ordered the fish and chips ... the waiter was fine ... when the food came it was cold ... told the waiter and he brought me hot fries ... what a f###ing joke ... MONTE CARLO is a TWO STAR HOTEL ... there are so many better places to stay

Reviews.Title: “I'd definitely stay there again”
Reviews.Author: cdm209
Reviews.Content: A buddy's birthday prompted us to celebrate in Vegas and he chose to stay at the Monte Carlo. His girlfriend got us the room for a great deal off one of the travel websites. It was such a quick cab ride from the airport. It probably was faster getting there than waiting in the cab line... Check in was a breeze and we were allowed to check in early. It was a nice, clean room, and that's all you need since you're hardly in the room at all. We went to check out City Center right after since we heard that was the new thing in town and we took the free, quick tram over. We weren't impressed and decided to walk back to the hotel to get started on the gambling. The hotel is close to all of that so it didn't take long. As far as the gambling, there were always open tables and for the most part friendly dealers. The drink service was pretty good at night, but a little relaxed during the day. The biggest disappointment with the hotel was the Cafe/Diner. We went twice...the first time, during happy hour, they only had one server for the whole place and that we'd have to wait 20 minutes. Why have only one server during happy hour? That didn't make sense so we left and went to the "Pub" in the hotel. They served a good burger and good beers so that was nice. We decided to try the Cafe/Diner for breakfast the next day to see if we can get a seat without having to wait. We were seated within minutes, which was good, but the waitress took forever to take our order and after she took it, it took more than 30 minutes to get our food. People that came after us, got their food before we did. And when we got our food, it wasn't as described and the portions were small for the price they charged. We did talk to the manager and he comped us 30% which was nice, but don't bother going here. Besides the lousy Cafe/Diner, this was a great place and I'd definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Showing some "seams" on the Vegas Strip”
Reviews.Author: jrleonardfl
Reviews.Content: I was frankly disappointed with my recent stay at the Monte Carlo Resort on the Vegas Strip. I've stayed at the Mandalay Bay, MGM, Mirage and the Stratosphere during past trips. While my room rate was $80 or so less per night than I've paid at more glamorous Sin City digs, the service and room condition was far less. - My room reservation was to have included a $35 credit that could be applied against a dining experience at the Monte Carlo. SHAME on me for not reading the fine print . . . the wonderful Andre's restaurant that I had so looked forward to visiting was NOT included in this package. My plans were to eat at the highly recommended Andre's and come under the business per diem with the $35 gimmee - Oh Well. - Last Monday night strong storms moved through the Southeast. After taxiing for two full hours around Charlotte waiting for FAA landing clearance, I obviously missed my connecting flight to Vegas and arrived well after midnight instead of the planned 7:15 schedule. I waited for a short time to check-in and receive my key and headed up to the 25th floor for my room. The key didn't work. I returned to the registration desk and received an apology and a key for a different room? Upon entering this room, it was clearly occupied with an unmade bed, toiletries in the bathroom and thankfully guests that were out on the town. Back to the front desk expecting a huge room upgrade and was sent to the 30th floor where I collapsed and quickly fell to sleep. - Room 3 on the 30th floor was certainly nothing special. My pictures will show a mirror in the bathroom that had come loose and was reattached a few inches over leaving holes in the wallpaper and wall. - I frankly thought my window was broken at first and then realized a large swath of the windowfilm tint had torn away from the outside. On a positive note, I asked for my luggage to be stored a few hours after check-out and the Bell Captain was very helpful and courteous. Likewise, the same young man that coordinated the taxi line greeted everyone with a warm good morning and helped me with bags that I was carrying. If you stay at this hotel, you will be impressed with the Brand Steakhouse; I enjoyed a terrific meal and applied the aforementioned $35 coupon which was accurately credited against my room bill. I think this hotel is showing a few seams. (I'd be curious to know whether my Expedia reservation had something to do with the poor room and dismal view?) I'll make my reservations earlier next time and return to the Mandalay, Signature MGM or Mirage.

Reviews.Title: “Family Casino”
Reviews.Author: DIANE C
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo is so easy to get around in. You never feel like you don't know where you are. The bank of elevators is very convenient and fast. The Food Court offers almost eveything you can eat at very reasonable prices. The walk way to the tram is so easy to get to the Bellagio. You can also walk to Aria in about 5 minutes without going outside. The chinese restaurant is the best on the strip. Rooms are very nice for the price.

Reviews.Title: “An improvement over a year ago”
Reviews.Author: Biblit
Reviews.Content: The management has dialed down the perfume coming out of the vents, it is now tolerable. Front desk staff was actually pleasant! Dirty dishes weren't left in the hall for days on end. Kudos for the positive changes! Now if they would consider re-training the floor servers. They remain rude.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Ilovenyc0886
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over nye and were happy with our decision to stay here. It's obviously not the best hotel on the strip but it's also not the most expensive so you get what you paid for. Fair sized room, which were nice and clean. Polite staff and good food options. Lifts were spilt into different levels so you couldn't travel between floors if you had friends on another level, you had to go down to the foyer to go back up- which was annoying but not the end of the world. Good position on the strip to walk around the other casinos. For the price would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: SeaTravelTime
Reviews.Content: Great weekend in January at the Monte Carlo. Comfortable room, good location and excellent service. Requested slippers and they brought them right away at no charge! Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Has everything you need”
Reviews.Author: Francismwoo
Reviews.Content: This place wasn't the most extravagant place in Vegas but the location is great and has everything you need. Price wasn't as bad as it's competitors and it's definitely not the worst place to stay on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money but they should have provided us with the room we had booked”
Reviews.Author: toni526
Reviews.Content: 3 night stay in this wonderfully clean hotel and casino. Some staff were rude at times especially on the roulette tables and the m life players counter which was very disappointing. Warm welcome recieved but We booked 2 joining suits which we didn't get. Location was great. Fantastic value for money. Terrible meal in the 'cafe'. Girls offering drinks on the casino floor were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T EAT THE BUFFET”
Reviews.Author: azn_eagle
Reviews.Content: We stayed jan 16-19, the room was ok, no refrigerator in the room. No sleepers, no toothbrush or other necessities, although room service was happy to provide them when asked. Beware the $25 resort fee on top of the room rate. Really a middle of the road hotel, it wasn't too expensive or cheap, and the location is good. DO NOT EAT THE BUFFET. On our last day, we tried the buffet because it was comped by the hotel, I am still feeling it almost a week later.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: asurly1
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here last year, in a Spa Suite and LOVED it. We elected, this year, among the MANY other choices in town to stay here again IN another Spa Suite. We were, in a word: disappointed. It started at check in. As in all hotels (and we expected the same here…) large lines to check in, but for some reason the person in front of us took an exorbitant amount of time to check in. (In excess of 30 minutes!) Now that may not have been the desk clerk’s fault, but somebody like that needs to be sent somewhere else if they are that obstinate.
