Last year we had a Spa Suite on the 30th floor, it was an AWESOME room. It had a steam shower, and plenty of room. (There was a large gap between the foot of the bed and the sofa) In the room this year, (on the 25th floor) there was NO steam shower, not nearly as much room between the bed and the sofa, etc… The thermostat was not accurate. We had it set in the 60’s (on the AC setting) and the room NEVER got really cool. The lighting in the “stool” section of the bathroom was VERY inadequate. (I think a bic lighter would furnish more light!) The sink in the wet bar was slow and made a lot of noise. There was NO stereo system (like the room on the 30th floor last year. The most aggravating thing about this whole trip was the “Resort fee”…what an [--] joke that is!! $15 a night added on to your bill (NO CHOICE!) for basically NOTHING! You can tell the front desk staff, as well as the concierge staff is well prepared to defend that charge. (Even if they don’t agree with it!) I was told that “part” of that was internet access (wired in the room). They had wireless in the room last year! And use of the computer / printer downstairs to print your boarding passes. Well, low and behold, when I tried to use it (the one downstairs near the front desk) I was asked to pay $5! I thought that was already included!! I complained to the concierge staff and was quickly offered that they would print it up for me. (Again, I’m sure they have to answer this question a LOT!) So basically here’s what’s included in your mandatory “Resort Charge” of $15 a day: a USA Today available on your floor for free. (Not even delivered under your door….you have to go to the areas near the elevators to get it!) Lose the stinking mandatory resort fees, and I’ll pay for my own USA today!! Next time I go….I will stay in one of the Total Rewards Hotels (Paris, Caesars, Planet Hollywood, Rio, Flamingo, etc) that offer NO resort fees! Looking forward to going back next year, but NOT at the Monte Carlo! I loved you Monte Carlo….but now I’m not sure I even like you anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Great casino hotel right on the strip!”
Reviews.Author: abqwolfe
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful - standard double queen room is huge! We stayed two nights during the SEMA show in November, 2011 at a great rate. Check-in and check-out was smooth and the front desk staff both times was professional and helpful. Once in the room it doesn't feel like a "casino" - but if you want to gamble, it's just a short elevator ride to the lobby. One reviewer mentioned no Wi-Fi, but I'm pretty sure we did have free wi-fi in our room. Our room was super clean and the beds VERY comfortable. We enjoyed dinner at the buffet and breakfast at McDonald's was a good way to start the day. There are also some great shops connected to the hotel. Would recommend - especially if the rates are low - the Monte Carlo runs specials all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Danny S
Reviews.Content: Cons: Internet = very slow. Pros: beds= luxurious, bathroom = clean, service = very accomodating, food court = convenient and inexpensive, check in/out = quick and easy. Not exactly sure it warrants 4 stars, however, it is a great hotel for a reasonable rate.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: ler-----12
Reviews.Content: We got a good deal on a one-night stay here and It was worth the money we paid. Location was good- towards the end of the strip. Found the rooms to be very comfortable and nice! Have stayed at better hotels in Vegas but or the price paid, it was a good stay! Vegas is so much fun!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the price”
Reviews.Author: Luvcruisn
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel were wonderful. They went out of their way to be helpful ensuring you were enjoying your stay. Overall the hotel is clean but is getting a little tired and requires some upgrading. I didn't pay big dollars for this hotel ..I went through hotels.ca and got a great price! The casino is ok but doesn't compare to others (like the Belagio) in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay and price is great as well!”
Reviews.Author: santonika
Reviews.Content: The place was tidy and has everything you could need, beds were comfortable but some of the group wasn't too fond of the pillows (on the thicker side). The nightclub wasn't very big compared to other places but was quite elegant. We frequented the Cafe and the staff there are great and so was the food. Saw the Jabbawokeez, which was a fantastic show right in the hotel. We also got tickets at the hotel box office for Celine Dion 2 hours before the show for $60, great last minute price! The pool was closed but I guess this is the case for many of the hotels at this time of year. They say check-in is at 3pm but we were able to when we got there at around 1pm, I would suggest to check in earlier as it looked quite busy that evening. They also have and express checkout, which was great cause the lines were pretty long. This is for those of you that don't charge stuff to the room and have no need to look at the statement. Also there is no wifi in the rooms, just ethernet cable for computers. So phones or tablets cant hook up to the internet.

Reviews.Title: “NOT a great experience!”
Reviews.Author: Stacy T
Reviews.Content: First impression of the lobby, not so bad. First impression of the room, Motel 6. Everything is nailed down, literally. There is no complimentary coffee, water, Wi-Fi, or anything else for that matter. There is no refrigerator or mini bar. There is not even a fan in the bathroom and the sink was clogged. We were in town for a trade show, checked in for a WEEK! The housekeeping took items from our room, even though our bags were still there and we were obviously NOT checked out. To top off the not so wonderful stay, we were treated as idiots and theives by their "security officer" Tom. Shawna at the front desk did her best to apologize for Tom's behavior, but with everything combined, we will not be returning to the Monte Carlo again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Doylel25
Reviews.Content: I found the Monte Carlo staff and hotel overall an amazing experience. I found the shower a bit annoying but loved the place. Great value and great location. I went with my boyfriend for a week and it was a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Location is OK but does not worth $$$...”
Reviews.Author: nbalsari
Reviews.Content: Another Las Vegas hotel. Depends what you are looking for, but I was there only for 1 night and booked it for its location. Does not worth the money you pay (especially the extra fees that they charge for internet that I did not use, fax that I did not receive or newspaper that I did not get...). There are better values in LV, try another place

Reviews.Title: “Old look!”
Reviews.Author: tayshan1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here because we were at a coffee convention. We had stay at the MGM for 3 nights but their rates went up on Sunday night. When we arrived the check in was very slow. We finally got to our room ($79) and I do understand we booked the old room but damn. The pillow case had a hair on it. The sheets has dirt on them and the furniture was so old. We called housekeeping but I guess they were gone for the day, so someone from the front desk helped us. She gave us a new room number and transferred our keys to another room. Both rooms had a great view of the strip. The food court had very reasonable prices compared to the MGM. But the sitting area in the food court looked really old. The staff was very nice and helpful but unless I got a remodeled free room, I won't be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms aren't Great, but still a good value”
Reviews.Author: Barney22222
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a buddy's 40th B-Day. Bathrooms are very dated and rest of the room is very basic. We got a good deal on the room, so can't complain too much. It is in a very good location on the Strip, which is the main reason we used the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What happens there doesn't have to stay there!!! - Hotel reviews that is!!!”
Reviews.Author: DenverDebbie
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Vegas... Most of my trip I can’t share with you and it has to “stay there”, but I can share with you that if you want a clean, nice hotel on the strip... The Monte Carlo is for you. I have stayed at the Monte Carlo at least twice a year for year for the past 5 years and have never been disappointed. I have gone with my son, my girlfriends, and by myself and have always had an enjoyable time. If you book directly from the Hotel's Website you just can't beat the prices, which are always some of the least expensive on the strip. There are a few hotels for less money, but be careful with those, they are usually dirty, un-kept, old and run down. The Mpnte Carol is always clean and well taken care of. The furniture is older, but not outdated or trashed. The linens always look brand spanking new, well pressed and clean and what a great matress... I sleep like a baby. If you are looking for a grandiose hotel with lots of pretense situated on the strip, then the Monte Carlo is NOT for you. At the Monte Carlo, you can actually walk less than 100 steps from the front desk to the guest room elevators, without hiking across a humongous casino or needing a golf cart to keep your feet from hurting. The Casino is large but not expansive where you get lost and the tables are comfortable. All employees seem sincere to have you as a guest. The hotel is situated towards the south end of the strip, but conveniently located walking distance for lots to do. If you want inexpensive transportation you can catch the bus that goes up and down the strip, as it is always handy and you can get a three-day unlimited pass for only $20. If it’s a hot summer month and you don’t want to feel like a sardine in a sauna, I do not recommend the bus – I promise a cab or rental car is better for trips that are not within walking distance. The restaurants are great and reasonably priced for Las Vegas standards. I recommend Brand for a spectacular steak dinner. Ask for Alex, she’s the best waitress. Remember all items are al-a-carte. Diablo's has really good Mexican food and during the summer a great patio. Although the pool was not open during this trip, it is a fun place with the lazy river. Buy large floating enter-tubes at a discount store before leaving home to save money. Pack them and the hotel can fill them for you. I’m always available to answer any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Confortable and clean room in a great location at the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Luc_Rei
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel because of its price and location, during the NYE 2012. The room is spacious, clean, the hotel has some fast food restaurants where you can have a quick breakfast and from there you can take a walk to the other hotels, casinos and shows around. The staff was very polite and helped me to recover cash and documents I forgot in the safe of the room, some days later, when I was in anoter city... They sent the documents to the city I was and the cash to my country, converted in a pay check. It's not a 5 star hotel, like Caesars or Encore or Wyyn, but a good choice for the price. The only complain is that they don't have Wifi, but wired internet, something strange these days...

Reviews.Title: “Casino”
Reviews.Author: Brantrav
Reviews.Content: Very clean and nicely laid out. Not as large as some of the other hotels, but everything was there and lots of choices.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo Hotel Stay”
Reviews.Author: Brantrav
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Monte Carlo in January of 2012. At check-in I asked for a no-smoking room and a view of the strip. I was given a room on the 27th floor with a view of the strip, with the MGM grand Hotel in plain view of my room. The room had 2 queen beds (I asked for 1 king but unavailable), but it was fine. Dining at the hotel was excellent. I had breakfast one day in the cafe and dinner at the buffet. Both venues were clean, well staffed and the food was great. The front desk staff were very courteous and answered all of my questions during my stay. The Casino was well laid out, and very busy, and the casino staff were friendly, and very hospitable. Ladies were around often to serve drinks and the mood was happy and fun. The Monte Carlo Hotel is in a good location on the strip, joined to the Aria Resort via a walkway and shuttle train. A pleasant 4 day stay, my first time there, and eager to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Average Stay, Great View”
Reviews.Author: binowest
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was just average. I did get a pool view room that overlooked all of the lights of City Center at night.. It made for a very beautiful view. The hotel had a nice variety of restaurants, shops and a nice little food court. It was a good location for me while running the Zappos Vegas Half Marathon.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel in prime location”
Reviews.Author: miker5012
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the monte carlo twice over the years. The people are always friendly and it's generally a nice hotel. They pump this aroma into the air system that makes it one of the nicer smelling hotels if that means anything. The rooms were nice, and I cant really think of anything bad to say about the hotel. The only time I got upset was one day I stayed all night and planned on taking a nap the next day. The music coming from the pool area made it impossible to sleep in the room during the day. I guess we could of had our room moved, but we just dealt with it. Nice food court and the Monte is in a decent location on the strip. If your looking for a cheap lunch you can go right across the street to the showcase where they have a decent food court

Reviews.Title: “Great stay during a road trip in NV and AZ”
Reviews.Author: nickss1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Monte Carlo at the start of a road trip in the south west in Oct 2011. A quick $14 cab ride from airport. The check-in was swift and attentive. 'Woody' sorted me out a room on the 31st floor overlooking the Strip; wonderful view!. It was a clean room with two beds, and ready immediately. A nice large flat-screen TV with plenty of channels. It had a large bathroom (although the lights failed, which was dealt with by engineering staff) Spent plenty of time in the large casino, which I found easy to navigate. There's a large pool (several) and plenty of sunbeds. Overall, a great stay and would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, watch for the price to fall.”
Reviews.Author: mattk53
Reviews.Content: We got a great price so we jumped on it. I know there are nicer places, but this was fine for my wife and me. It had everything we needed right there. Good blackjack rules, excellent buffet, great brew pub and a hidden tram that nobody ever used that shot you up the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: kahnrtist
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Monte Carlo Resort for our anniversary and were very happy with our stay. The room was nice, nothing fancy, but the beds were very comfortable. The main attraction for us was the excellent casino. Drink service was always plentiful and the slot variety is excellent. We also dined at the Cafe (ok, nothing special), Diablo's Cantina (delicious), and Andre's (excellent service).

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here unless you are a deep sleeper!”
Reviews.Author: theresaw
Reviews.Content: The walls in this hotel are paper thin! I stayed on the 19th floor and could literally hear every word of the conversation the couple next door to me was having. I was there for work and most people are there to party, so I endured 5 nights of terrible sleep since I was continuously woken up in the middle of the night by drunk boisterous people returning from a long night of drinking/gambling. Why do drunk people talk so loud?? If that wasn't bad enough, the loud talk was most often times followed by loud intimate noises -- gross! Way too much information! Staff was aloof at best. Will NEVER return!

Reviews.Title: “Location and service are above average”
Reviews.Author: soneill2012
Reviews.Content: Overall a pleasant stay. Its in a great location within walking distance of city center and other amenities and restaurants.. the service was very good. My only complaints are somewhat minor but irritating: they pump some sort of frangrance throughout the hotel either for ambience or to mask the smoke from the casino or some other issue. It is very evident when you return to to the hotel from outside and it gave me headaches. The other thing is while noone goes there to watch tv in their room, after a day of fun going back to relax and watch tv is nice..so why do they have nice tvs in the rooms but no high definition programming? Seems cheap for such a nice place

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: CVioletS
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Monte Carlo twice now, in December 2009 and December 2010. I am just writing this review now because I have recently recommended this hotel to my friends and realized I had never reviewed it here on Trip Advisor! This is a great place to stay with a group of friends or if you are traveling for business. It is much smaller than other casino hotels on The Strip (or maybe it just feels that way?) but still provides wonderful amenities and easy access to anywhere you want to go. Check in was smooth and easy both times, and had a much shorter wait than other resorts I have stayed at in Las Vegas before. The Concierge on duty when we checked in helped us decide on another show to see when we arrived, I appreciated her honest opinions and upbeat attitude - especially since my group was being a little difficult and all trying to buy our tickets separately but have seats together. The Lobby is clean and smells awesome. Casino seems smokier than at some other properties, and it is very small. However it is never too crowded and it was a great place to wind down at night/early hours of the morning. They also have several sit-down restaurant options, and although we did not take advantage of them we did think there was a great variety with fairly priced items. Since we were all young girls on a budget, we appreciated the food court in the hotel which had Subway, Sbarro, Starbucks, etc. for those times we did not want to spend the extra money to sit down somewhere a little nicer. The rooms are a bit outdated but were kept very clean, and we had just enough room for the four girls we squeezed in there :) Location is great as well. We walked over to New York New York and Excalibur for restaurants, bars, and casinos. You can hop on the monorail to get from Monte Carlo to City Center and even Bellagio, which then puts you right in the middle of The Strip. It really is a great location! I have also stayed at Treasure Island, Wynn, and The Four Seasons in Las Vegas. I would recommend Monte Carlo for trips when you won't be spending too much time in your room or looking for fine dining or shopping options at your hotel. We will definitely return to Monte Carlo if we go to Vegas again with this group!

Reviews.Title: “clean but shabby room”
Reviews.Author: ASaucy
Reviews.Content: we recently stayed at the monte carlo for the CES convention. the room was clean but shabby - the furniture was very worn, the wall paper was peeling, the lamp shades were tattered. at least it was clean, and that is of the utmost importance. staff was very helpful and nice. they were a great help at the bell desk and one night, an alarm in a neighboring room was going off at midnight...we called to the front desk and they sent someone up right away to turn it off. definitely no complaints about the staff. this hotel is farther down on the strip and is a long ways from a lot of the main hotels. it was a fine stay, but i definitely would not rate it as more than average - especially by las vegas standards! great if you don't mind a "no frills" stay and are looking to be cost effective.

Reviews.Title: “Overall it is fine...worth what you pay but no more”
Reviews.Author: ADKtraveller
Reviews.Content: The check in staff was nice but the process was lousy...there is not a single line for check in so you just pick a line and wait. Meanwhile people are attempting to stand in multiple lines by placing different people in their party in different lines. The room is somewhat clean but not in good shape. There are stains in the fabric on the seats, the furniture is chipped and scratched. The room smells clean and the bathroom is clean and the carpet in the room appears to be decent. There is a small desk for working with an available plug for a computer and other plugs are readily accessible to charge phones/Ipods etc. The price is reasonable and it is worth the price although I do not like the separate resort fee. It is convenient to Aria if you need to be there and do not want to spend $100 more per night merely to be there. I think MC is better than Ballys but not as nice as Paris which has a similar price point.

Reviews.Title: “Updated and Uncrowded”
Reviews.Author: mbmb310
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during CES, while prices were high all around. We were first assigned to a 3rd floor (roof level with view of ac units, vents, and wall) handicapped room, which I recommend refusing unless you need it. The next day, upon requesting an improvement, we got an 8th floor non-smoking room, nicer all around. Our rooms were clean, and the parking, lobby, and food court were convenient and uncrowded. Internet is only wired, no fridge, bathrobes, or TV in bathroom. Pluses are USA Today on each floor, easy access to 2 Starbucks off lobby, and indoor walkway to City Center and Aria.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for a Great Price”
Reviews.Author: Susan and Peter K
Reviews.Content: We upgraded to the Spa Suite and were very pleased! If you are staying for a while, or in our case to get married, the extra space was worth it, not to mention the great spa tub! The only complaint was the $16.80 per day resort fee. During the summer season, I wouldn't have any issue, but when the pool area is closed, the resort fee should either be waved or reduced. Overall, our stay was wonderful and we would definitely stay at the Monte Carlo again.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it at any price.”
Reviews.Author: Martinlois
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Monte Carlo twice and this time was my last. My first stay was ok and at $70 per day. For $70 per day in las vegas I wasn't expecting much. this time the Monte Carlo jacked up the rates for CES. I payed nearly $500 per night for a standard room. The service was terrible and the staff did not seem like they cared about the customers experience. they almost seemed annoyed to help. The room was filthy, food on the ground, very dusty and we even had what looked like blood on the bathroom wall. We figured it was someone who had had enough of the Monte Carlo experience. The entire hotel is worn and dated. The only redeeming factor is that there is a tram to the Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “The Monte Carlo Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: joe g
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed there for 4 days this January. We thought the casino was clean, convenient to the strip, and not over crowded. The casino wasn't brand new but had a nice food court and a few good places to dine and a really easy feeling to it. The casino is right in the middle of the strip which is awesome. The rooms were standard. The hotel service was good. The spa/workout room was very convenient and free with our stay. We used it the entire time. The casino had an older feel to it but we really liked that. We stayed at Mandalay Bay last year and that was incredible. But everything was way over priced in the casino and it was too far from the center of the strip. I would recommend stayting here if you want to hang out in peace. It's not for the high rollers or the people who like the hustle and bustle of a busy and loud casino. I give it an overall 4 stars. I hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: kelly h
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 5 nights at the Monte Carlo. Pretty good location on the strip. The room was a nice size, clean, housekeeping was good. Good A/C. The beds were okay. Good view. No noise problems like others have mentioned. Our entire floor smelled of marajuana, but it's vegas. The lobby was nice, the casino and public areas were on the smaller side, compaired to other casinos. The shopping area that attaches to the tram was nice. The steakhouse restaurant was very good. Steaks were perfect, the potions were huge. The service and food were the best that we had on this trip to vegas. The food court area had good selection, subway cost more than at home, but again the potions were huge. The sports bar also had good food with huge portions. There was a nice cupcake place with very good flavors. The buffet was typical of vegas. They had a very nice cigar bar that my husband really enjoyed. The cigar bar was the best. Drinks were okay, typical. Pool area was very nice, large, and crowded. The music didn't seem excesively loud to me, like others have mentioned. People were enjoying themselves. Some areas of the hotel appeared newer than others. We took a helecopter tour, wax museum, dinner at Paris, pet the MGM lions, Hoover Damn, M&M world, Phantom of the Opera, and many other fun activies. It was a very nice vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Amanda-yijun-g
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is very good! It's in the middle of all the hotels! Everything is great except that no wifi in the room!

Reviews.Title: “3 nights in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: pjh1295
Reviews.Content: We went to Vega for 3 nights for a surprise party! We picked the Monte Carlo for, location and price. In my opinion this hotel is fine, yes it is a little dated and you can see some wear in places, but nothing stays new forever. They have free valet parking, check in was smooth and quick, employees that I had any contact with were all kind and helpful. I would stay again and would recommend anyone give it a try.

Reviews.Title: “Average Stay”
Reviews.Author: Tim Y
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo was very average. The rooms are suitable and the casino was standard. The beds are not very comfortable. The noise the plumbing creates between rooms is obnoxious. The bathrooms are worn out and in severe need of upgrading. I would stay here again but it would not be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Place is below average”
Reviews.Author: snuffycats
Reviews.Content: Arrived Dec 15th after 5 hours on a plane. Check in process was quick but the attendant made a boo boo and wrote and told me the incorrect room number. Of course I find this out after trying to open the incorrect room and not getting in. This was annoying but these things happen (she had transposed the digits). I found a house phone and Security gave me the correct number so I wandered back down the hallway to the correct room. Once inside the room was clean but a little worn out. I tried getting on the internet and it did not work. I called the front desk and they sent someone up who was able to resolve the issue within minutes. The issue was that they had 3 different network cables and the only one that worked was tucked under the tv stand. The tech cut off two of the ethernet cables that were no longer in use. It was unfortunate that I had both these issues because had they not occured I would have given it 3/5 but I stayed later in NY, NY and it was much nicer, newer and costs the same so go there instead.

Reviews.Title: “Try somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: WorstTours
Reviews.Content: Long wait on check in- rooms OK, pools all closed & under construction, completely shocked when a staff member entered our room about 9:30 the night before we were due to check out as there was a phone bill on the account & they chase everything over $50!!! They had left no message on the phone when we were eating downstairs earlier in the evening & when we discussed it with the concierge they were uninterested & disrespectful. They lied about there being any Duty Manager on that night, he finally attended and was only interested in telling us they had a business to run & if everyone shot through without paying they would lose a lot of money. Certainly they made us feel as if they thought we were trying not to pay something when the trip was all pre-paid through a travel agent. Dreadful attitude, scratch the surface & it's very sleazy.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel no Gimmicks”
Reviews.Author: perrygrin
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo is a very good hotel in an ideal position on the strip,it ha sno obvious gimmicks like many of the others but I see this as aplus as it gives good standards of comfort and and facilites "unpretentiuosly luxurious" as it says itself.Drinks appeared to be more expensive than in some other resorts for instance a glass of wine in The Hit bar was 18 dollars! and beers in the pub also seemed more expensive than others but there doesnt seem to be any rule in Las Vegas you have to shop around. Bills Gambling Hall opposite bellagio seemed to be the cheapest with Margharitas at 2dollars small but ok.Whilst there dont miss Big Elvis a free show at 3oclock and 7 oclock most days arrive about 40 mins early to get a seat. Back to Monte Carlo the buffet is pretty good we had breakfast twice at $14.99.Its pleasant as it is away from the hustle and bustle which is difficult to escape in LV.If your on a budget go to the food hall for Macdonalds ,Subway and other outlets an Egg McMuffin meal about 8dollars. I dont gamble but had a great time in Vegas there is so much to see and do and so many restaurants you cant go wrong for eating although watch out for the air conditioning .I was miserable in the Hard Rock cafe opposite even though we swapped tables I was freezing and it spoiled the occassion.Th eplace was abit of a let down too I was expecting it to be top knotch on the LV strip but it wasnt as good as the one in Naarma bay Sharm el Sheikh. My big tip would be to do lots of research and plan ahead.Las Vegas is great and absolutely bonkers at the same time,loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you would want for a great trip!”
Reviews.Author: danielly411
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the monte carlo in a deluxe high floor suite in Dec. 2011. We just booked another vacation and I cannot wait to come back! Our room was clean, minus one small tear in the sheets. I found the staff helpful and polite, and we never had to wait long for anything. The only gripe I would have is that this the hotel is sort of south of alot of things we wanted to do. I didn't know about the monorail, but plan to use that next time. The perfume smell was there, but i didn't mind it as it masked the cigarrette smoke from the casino. The hotel pool was closed while we stayed there in December, but I am excited to use it when we return.

Reviews.Title: “I think I have blisters....”
Reviews.Author: rileymacdonald
Reviews.Content: We arrived here on New Year's day. I was a little worried about this hotel because of all the reviews. Check in was easy, only 2 people in line in front of us. We asked for a room on a low floor so we wouldn't be stuck in the elevators stopping at every floor. We were given room 5112. We noticed that the room was a handicapped room. We had to squat while in the shower to fit under the shower fixture. The shower leaked the entire time - and not just a few drops. We never called it in and I don't think the maids cared all that much since they never addressed the issue either. the hotel does have a smell to it but only in the casino area - and all the hotels have it. It's gross the smell of smoke in the casinos and it seeps into your clothing. The room was clean, the bed was comfy and they had black out curtains. We were barely in the room so it was fine. I spent an afternoon at the spa. Exactly what every girl needs after 5 days in Vegas. I had a great mesage with Andrew and enjoyed the hot tubs and steam rooms afterwards. We ate breakfast twice at the hotel - I forget the name. It was good. We never made it to the food court (don't eat fast food) or the buffet. If I ever go back to Vegas I would probably stay at another hotel just to try something different but there was nothing wrong with this one. Yes it does need to be updated but it's not the end of the world. The hotel has a great location on the strip with monorail access. Also there is a drugstore on the corner that's great for getting water and snacks. The staff were very pleasant and helpfull. Too bad the pools weren't open.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as other reviewers said”
Reviews.Author: mia879
Reviews.Content: I was worried after reading the reviews, but was pleasantly surprised. There was that strong perfume smell, but otherwise everything was great. We had a room on the 29th floor with mountain views. We did have an adjoining room, but there was not a sound from the neighbours. The staff were wonderful, the food really good, and the casino was not bad at all. I know the hotel is older, but did very well hiding it's age. This was one of the more positive places I've been to in my travels.

Reviews.Title: “Not great, but not bad”
Reviews.Author: radley4
Reviews.Content: This was a second stay at the Monte Carlo and it seemed to have slipped a hair. Room felt a bit shabby although the bed and linens were of good quality. Cleanliness was subpar. There was a piece of plastic (one of those things that clothing tags are attached with) on one of the night stands and it stayed there all four days. Spots in the bathroom weren't cleaned and one day there were several bobby pins in the room and we didn't bring them. I still like that you can avoid going through the casino here if you want. However, the Monte Carlo makes sure you have no diversions. Cell phone service in the rooms appears to have some kind of purposeful interference and there is only wireless service in the casino. That was beyond annoying. One of the best values is the free shuttle than runs from the Monte Carlo, Aria and Bellagio. For the price, it was a good value and convenient for our purposes.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: larusaphilp
Reviews.Content: Nice decor and service, the only thing missing is that the rooms don't have refrigerator anymore and the bathrooms don't have fans to clear the air, I guess it is part of cutting down due to the economy. In January the pool is closed but they give you access to Aria Hotel pool which we didn't take advantage, we had a tight schedule. The minus 5 lounge was awesome, a little small for what they charge. Dragon Noodle lounge was great place to eat and a bit less expensive than others. We went to the night club, it was just fine. Buffet was good, great for lunch and dinner, good value. Hotel in a centric location.

Reviews.Title: “For New year 2011”
Reviews.Author: Benito37
Reviews.Content: Was at Monte Carlos for 5 days in december 2010 until january 2011. The room was ok, we have a web acces and a clean room, no view on the strip, you need to pay an extra. Play at casino a little bit, but i'm not a gambler. We try the buffet and it was greath. Good location and for a low budget it's very cool place.

Reviews.Title: “Yuck!!”
Reviews.Author: danielle F
Reviews.Content: I only stayed here because our family picked it. The room was outdated. When we showered the bathtub would fill up, so I call the front desk because that grosses me out!! The maintenance man came up and said there was nothing backing it up, the cause was that the shower head was too strong! Okay Thanks? We went to the pool one day~it was packed!! The lazy pool was very small and crowded. The drinks are expensive and watered down, but I guess that is expected. One night we went to one of the bars in the hotel. They were having Karaoke night, it was a lot of fun!

Reviews.Title: “Good Vegas Strip Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chris Y
Reviews.Content: I was a little concerned about booking the Monte Carlo in Vegas based on prior reviews, but I enjoyed my stay there. I went with a friend for a weekend of fun and we arrived around 1PM and were able to get checked in. The lines weren't too bad at the time, however, I don't know why it takes each person so long to get checked in. If you see a long line there, it's going to be a while. They need to find a way to speed it up. I thought the room was good. I didn't think it was dated. Had all the amenities except they hide the hair dryer in the closet in a bag which I didn't know about until I called the front desk. There is also no fridge in the room to store water but that wasn't a big deal. I had a room with a nice view of the valley facing West. I advise upgrading to a higher floor up in the tower if you want a great view. Elevators were fast and it's easy to get in and out of the Hotel. Lots to see there other than the Casino. We ate at the Steakhouse one night which was great and had drinks at one of the bars. The "Minus 5 Icebar" is also in the Hotel but we never made it in there. There's a fee to get in and it sounded too touristy and lame so we passed on that. Part of the deal included two complimentary meals at the Hotel Buffet. I found out later that I had to mention that to the buffet cashier and this was after standing in a long buffet line. They didn't really explain how to get compensated for the meals at check in. Turns out, you have to charge it to your room, then it gets comped when you check out. Kind of a strange way to do it and confusing. I charged it to my card so I got screwed on that one. The food at the buffet was good but nothing too great. Outside the Icebar is another bar at the end of the Casino with a hot woman dancing on a stage. It was strange as there's not much around her other than gambling tables. Still a nice thing to see when walking by. ;) The Hotel is in a great location, maybe a third of the way up the strip. We walked up to Caesars Palace a few times but having to go up and down all the stairways that go over the streets made it a bit tiring. I recommend cabbing it to the other Hotels. There's also a tram in the back of the Monte Carlo that goes up to the Bellagio so that's another option. Some commented on noise in the Hotel. I didn't hear much of anything, of course I didn't have any loud neighbors. All in all, a decent stay if you're looking to book a nice hotel in a great location. The painfully slow check in lines and reimbursement issues for the buffet are my only complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo offers great value”
Reviews.Author: Vegasman16
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Monte Carlo in Las Vegas from January 4th through January 7th. I booked the reservation in advance through the hotel directly. Having been to to Las Vegas many times and never stayed at the Monte Carlo I was anxious to see what they had to offer. Check in was easy and hassle free. The desk clerk was friendly and informative. Although we were on a discounted room he provided us with a room on one of the upper floors with a great view of City Center. After checking in I watched the Orange Bowl in the sports book. The sports book was a great place to watch a game because it has a bountiful number of televisions and drink service was very efficient. The only meals we ate at Monte Carlo was breakfast and that was in the Cafe. The food was excellent and the prices were reasonable. The casino had a wide variety of table games and slot machines although it wasnt as busy or lively as some of the other casino's on the strip. The rooms were average size but very clean. The housekeeping service was very good and prompt each day. The Monte Carlo is a mid level property in the heart of the Las Vegas strip. The location is an easy walk to most of the casino's on the strip. You can even access Aria via a covered walkway that connects the two resorts. I would definately stay at the Monte Carlo again. In my opinion its one of the best values on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Older but better”
Reviews.Author: nannybrister
Reviews.Content: Our Dec. visit was to celebrate the 11th anniv. of our Vegas wedding! We arrived at the Monte Carlo around 11 a.m. and, to our surprise, were checked right in. The room location, however, was not acceptable. We had a view of a roof. Husband didn't want to bother about it; but I asked for a better room and got it right away! That room had an amazing view of the mountains! The tub collected water from the shower and there was no vent in the bathroom, a couple of the towels each day smelled scorched. Our room was not cleaned one day; but we didn't call. Plenty of towels .I accidently checked out a movie on the TV, called the desk and they removed the charge immediately! We were amazed that the staff believed that it was an error. Checkout through the phone was easy. I love the location of the hotel! In the middle of everything. (The bus system is very good, dependable, and cheap! Also clean!!) We ate at the Food court a few times, Subway, a chinese place, and McD's. Also had a really good dinner at the Chinese restaurant in the Casino. Did not like the buffet, though. Too much $$ for very few choices. Oh, also had a burger at the cafe in the casino. Having not spent enough $$ in the Casino, our comp was $25 worth of products at Starbucks. We enjoyed pastries on the airplane ride home! The only reason that I said "older but better" in my review title is that, after experiencing the hustle and bustle of the newer, trendier hotels it was wonderful to get back to our fairly quiet one. I noticed that not as many young adults stayed there. Also didn't see lots of little kids. (I still say that Vegas isn't the place for babies; but that's another story) The casino was busy in the evenings but not so much that you couldn't get into the action. We do recommend the Monte Carlo.

Reviews.Title: “Location and good value”
Reviews.Author: FrenchBoy
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean. Very comfortable and locatyed in front of smaller rastaurants and a food court locations where you eat for much less than in the main hotel. Walking distance from the main downtown action. Planning to go back in december 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gonzales123
Reviews.Content: Very clean room. Lots of space. Fast check in. check in was very fast had no problems. Great staff. housekeeping was great as well.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Strip Location”
Reviews.Author: RetiredCuero_tx
Reviews.Content: great location on the strip. Service was excellent and room was OK. Price was very good for a Vegas resort.Food court was a nice extra in that the days of cheap food in Vegas are gone. Would stay here again. Did not win in casino.

Reviews.Title: “It's a Las Vegas Hotel - What do you expect?”
Reviews.Author: felikso
Reviews.Content: Whilst it's called a resort, let's get real - it's a Las Vegas Hotel. It's got rooms, bars, buffets, pools and, let's not forget, a casino. It's a place to crash and I will say that it's a fine place to crash except it's all too impersonal. We arrived late and even then it took an hour to check in. From my observation, there was always a line and they didn't appear to match staffing resources to demand. The rooms were clean and generally functional. There was a nifty monorail to the Bellagio that was great to use. It was central to most "attractions".

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't deserve 4-star status”
Reviews.Author: pinkfreud
Reviews.Content: Thin walls. Smokey as all hell (no pun intended). Rooms were very, very average--nowhere near what we'd expect from a 4 star ranking. Toiletries were subpar. We booked for $70/night, so can't really complain. But for a 4 star hotel, it was just very disappointing in how average and forgettable it was. Good water pressure in sink and shower though. The buffet is very, very, very bad. The spa ($10 entry fee for guests) was very small, but had all the usuals: sauna, steam room, private showers, and jacuzzi (that's about it). The steam room and jacuzzi were boiling hot (not in a good way).

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location & great value!”
Reviews.Author: Anna101010
Reviews.Content: We visited Las Vegas December 19 - 24, 2011. This is the best time to visit this city because it was less crowded, until Friday. The hotel rate was very affordable, front desk extremely helpful and friendly, and the location was PERFECT! Although it has been a few years since the rooms were updated, they were clean, plenty of towels and wash cloths. We met up with family that arrived the day after we arrived and the front desk staff put the in a room 3 doors down from us - this was great as we didn't have to go to another tower within the hotel to visit them. We liked the food court (particularly Starbucks and Subway) so we had healthy options For instance Subway offers low fat meal - the egg white omelets are made fresh. Ate at the buffet one night, but since I eat vegetarian it was a wate of money for me. Although the salad bar had a great selection of veggies. We gambled a little and found that the machines by the car were pretty loose - got to play a long time on $5.

Reviews.Title: “WATCH OUT FOR FRAUD”
Reviews.Author: coolio9
Reviews.Content: WATCH OUT FOR FRAUD! Over charged $50. at the front desk for services not rendered. You are asked to sign an agreement allowing them to charge your card at their discretion. I refused to sign it and asked for the manager who agreed to adjust it. When I got my statement, they charged me anyway. The rooms were missing the bed spreads, no coffee in room, no frig., no microwave, window film half torn off, it took 4 times going back to front desk to get room key to work, even the radio did not work. I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A great Hotel well situated”
Reviews.Author: agneslf
Reviews.Content: Spent 8 nights in the Monte Carlo in September Lovely room very clean and comfortable. Helppful staff from check-in to check-out. Well situated on the Strip and a good choice of eating places within the hotel.Will definately be back God willing

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: LozA13
Reviews.Content: This is the place to stay for location on the strip with easy access to all major casinos. Food court is great and actually has better wi fi than the room. Be prepared to wait around 20mins to check in though. Excellent fitness centre if you want to work out.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Whitlam H
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. Location on the strip is great, check in was quick and easy, the room was quiet and very clean, staff were friendly and check out was also quick with free bag storage after check out. Didn't use the buffet and the pool area was closed for rennovation so can't comment on these but as we went for new year then we never had any intention of staying many nights in the hotel itself. We always finished our gambling and drinking though after our nights out. Just one issue I have - the Starbucks closed at around 11pm! This isn't good - I always like to get a coffee after midnight and we had to settle for the Mcdonalds (don't go there, it is chaos and the staff are a bit useless). So apart from that one minor issue I would highly recommend this hotel and we would def def come back. I did worry about some of the reviews about the hotel but please ignore them - you don't have anything to be concerned with AT ALL. By the way, the bed was SOOOOOO comfy!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A very nice comfortable hotel in a good location...”
Reviews.Author: NewlyWed14
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled between 31 December 2011 to 4 January 2012. Our room was located on the 12th floor with views over the pool and the nearby Aria hotel (the pool area was closed). Our room was very big with a really comfortable king sized bed. The decor is quite dated and the hotel does need a bit of an update. Our room was however very clean and comfortable which is what we wanted. As we didn't spend much of our time in the hotel room we didn't mind the dated furniture and decor. It was handy that there was an ipod/iphone dock in the room as well as a wall-mounted safe. As for the hotel itself, the air in the casino seemed to be a lot more fresh than some of the other casinos we visited during our trip. The casino itself also had a nice atmosphere including some nice bars and restaurants. The food court has a McDonalds, Starbucks, Subway and some Chinese and Italian places. Quite a good variety but not as big as some of the other larger hotels. There is a free tram service to the Aria and Bellagio which is handy. The location on the strip is also good as it's next to New York New York and across the road from Planet Hollywood and the MGM. If you want to explore the strip and don't want to walk all the way the tram takes you to the Bellagio after which you can walk to Caesar’s Palace, Mirage, Venetian etc. On New Years Eve we spent the night on the strip watching the fireworks and there was ample entertainment in the hotel itself with various parties/set meals to choose from. Lastly, the hotel staff were really helpful and offered a great service. Check in was quite fast. There are plenty of taxis available outside the hotel. I think this is a good hotel to choose if you want a reasonable price with a good location and great comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LASD
Reviews.Content: We liked the hotel overall and the front desk staff (Sean especially) were very friendly. We liked the food court for breakfast. We didn't try the buffet so not sure if it is good or not. The room was not well soundproofed. The adjoining door does not help and to be fair is only a real problem if you have noisy neighbors. The Monte Carlo is located in a central location on the strip and has a free tram to the Bellagio which cuts down on walking when you want to go along to the Venetian etc. Check out was quick and efficient. One caution... the toilets flush with 'atomic force' so be careful...

Reviews.Title: “Terrific view and Awesome Service!!”
Reviews.Author: Jim C
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled to Las Vegas and the Monte Carlo for our wedding in October 2011. I had been to Vegas before but it had been 15 years,. We carefully picked the MC for its central location and affordability. We arrived mid afternoon, the wait to check in was not bad at all... maybe 10 minutes. We were given exactly the room we had requested, a King non smoking, High floor strip view. The room was just fantastic! We didnt expect a "belligio" room.,.. we got what we paid for, and it was quite nice. We really only slept in the room... the rest of the time we enjoyed the city. The room had an adjoining door, but thankfully it was quiet. We went to the pool every day... loved it! I think it would be nice if the pool was open later into the evening, but we went early in the day, and really enjoyed it. We found everything to be clean and appropriate... We only paid $46 for our room. The view was just spectacular! The casino was our favorite part... we found the Deal or No Deal game and large Wheel of Fortune to be our favorites... we actually won $650! Would be nice if the Blackjack tables had cheaper games than $10 but if you know how to play you sure can win big. Food court was great. We have just booked our next trip for May and we cant wait to "go home!" we plan to even retire in Vegas! Overall an A+ experience. If you want super fancy, go somewhere else. If you want affordable, and just right service, this is the place to be!

Reviews.Title: “Too many pool rules”
Reviews.Author: Kelzoe
Reviews.Content: We go to Vegas every Sept and have for years. In 2011 we chose the Monte Carlo and actually it was a great hotel over all. We had a nice room, I asked for thinner pillows and they were delivered immediately and were perfect for me. The hotel gave good service and we had no complaints until we went to the pool. They have way too many rules at the pool. You can't take the water bottles from the casino into the pool area even if they are still sealed! That's just rediculous! Then they would not let us move our lounge chairs at all - not even a foot! We were trying to get away from the very loud music - I am not a prude but there should be a happy medium for the level of music at the pool. My chair was vibrating from the base in the music!! When we checked out & were asked about our stay we told them it was great except for the pool issues - they were nice enough to comp our pool drinks at least which we did not expect. We would go back to the Monte Carlo in a heartbeat if they easied up on the pool rules. The pool is a big part of our stay in Vegas so it has to be good.

Reviews.Title: “A Bargain!”
Reviews.Author: Del102102
Reviews.Content: Was visiting Vegas for work. The room I stayed in was very spacious and the bathroom was pretty big as well. The bed was comfortable. I did not gambble (not much of one) but did walk through the casino in search of food. They a couple of restaurants with in the hotel to chose from. I only got to try the breakfast buffet place, it was decent. For a hotel of this size I would have expected a much faster check in process but I understand they have to give the customers the 411 on all their services and locations. They have a really nice gym and spa retreat area. Showers/changing rooms are extremely clean and nice. Friendly staff. I would stay here again, especially since they always have a great room price bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok.....”
Reviews.Author: kld94931
Reviews.Content: This was definitely not the best hotel we have stayed in but the price was right at the time. Maid service was not very good.. Requested extra towel and never got it, shower and bathroom were dirty. They put us in a handicapped room as all the king size rooms were gone. I asked the desk clerk what the difference was and she said just some bars in the shower but there was much more to it then that. There was no storage in the bathroom or counter space because of the way the handicap vanity was. The bathtub/shower was so raised up off the floor to accommodate easy in and out that when my husband stood up in it his entire head stuck out above the top of the shower curtain. It was quite funny actually. Anyhow, it's back to the Venetian for us!

Reviews.Title: “You dont need to gamble on this one”
Reviews.Author: rollo2522
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Vegas and was picked up by the hotel courier service, fast tracked through booking and was enjoying my first day in no time at all. Althogh the Hotel ,like all others in Vegas, has gambling facilities on site there is so much else to do in this town that gambling is only part of it. The on site running Buffet was excellent with many different cuisines to chose from but there are also other different restaurants in the hotel ranging from classic pub grub to fine dining. In the Town itself there are many attractions attached to other hotel resort complexes, Ceasars Palace , Paris, MGM Grand, Bellagio to name a few which will keep you occupied but for the sake of a short bus ride it is worth visiting the old part of Vegas at the original Freemont Street where the street entertainers certainly earn their money. Dont miss out on this town ,it has so much to offer but you may well need a holiday when you return home.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great place.”
Reviews.Author: thebanshee
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here over Nov/Dec for my birthday. The hotel rooms are large, lovely comfortable beds and great and we were lucky to have great views of the mountains as opposed to the strip. Beds are huge! the first room we had had a linking door to the next room and we had to change rooms as we could hear the TV next door etc. Too noisy. The next room we were given was a twin room, huge beds again. Nicely furnished, only thing is with the twin rooms there isn't a table and armchairs as there is less space due to the two large beds, in the double room we did have the seating area. No kettle in the room BUT this is normal for the US. We took a travel kettle which i believe is an excellent idea. We were on the 4th floor. The Casino are is quite plush, there is a funny perfume smell as soon as you enter though which i think is to mask the smell of the cigarettes. It's not really that pleasant a smell but hey. There is a food court in the hotel with all kinds of foods, great as some of them are open 24 hours! So a coffee or tea is minutes away any time! The staff are really friendly and efficient, we had no problems at all.. We didn't think much of the shops but there is an ABUNDANCE of shops right on the strip anyway. we didn't use the spa facilities either. On the whole this is a nice hotel. would def stay again. It's a LOT better than some of the other hotels we visited on our trip to Las V.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Trip!”
Reviews.Author: billynbirdy
Reviews.Content: It took a very long time to get checked in. We traveled 12/24/11 - 12/26/11 so it was very busy. The rooms were aged, but not too much that it makes it unpleasant. The bed was very comfortable. There isn't too much going on in that hotel. I felt that the rooms were spacious enough and it was quiet most of the time. The walls are thing though. We could hear our neighbors talk at times. I also left my ID when I checked in. I realized it a few hours later. Although it was difficult to get a hold of someone, they kept my ID with security and I able to retreive it after proving my identity. Overall, I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - dated casino”
Reviews.Author: Tara P
Reviews.Content: Hotel room was really nice, huge room, huge bathroom, nice spa overlooking the strip. Only downsides were the casino was a bit dated, no in room wifi and our security box didn't work. We asked for it to be fixed a few times, they kept telling us someone would come up but they never did. Hotel is good for the money - i would have no problem staying there again. Nicely located on the strip too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip!”
Reviews.Author: charlotte8682
Reviews.Content: Checked on at the Monte Carlo was long and did take some time, the one handy thing was that as we arrived the bell boys took our bags and when we had finally checked in the bags were brought to our room. I had just a deluxe room with a view looking over the front of the hotel, I thought the room was large enough and the bathroom size very good, your not in your room long enough to worry about the size of the bedroom and bathroom so not sure what people expect! The rooms do have thin walls as I found out during my stay first time was a young family with children that seemed to cry at all hours and then when they checked out a group of young americans shouting swearing and running round the hotel in the early hours! But when I called the front desk to complain about the noise they were up straight away to tell them to SHUT UP!!! We eat at the Buffet for Breakfast and Dinner I wasn't impressed with the buffet both times the varieties wasn't great the seating also needs to be updated as a number of seats were very worn and torn! We also eat in the Dragon noodle bar the food is very very good and is worth a visit! When walking around other hotels in las Vegas I was so shocked at how small the Monte Carlo Hotel felt in comparison to these, But I was thankful as I don't think I would like to be in one of the much bigger hotels with hoards and hoards of people walking through! Overall I would recommend the hotel all hotel staff were helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, nice stay on the Vegas Strip”
Reviews.Author: original_ck1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took an early morning flight during our last visit to Las Vegas and got in around 10:00 a.m., so we weren't sure if our room would be ready at the Monte Carlo when we arrived. A room wasn't ready yet in our price range, but rather than making us wait we were upgraded to a higher floor that had a spectacular view of the mountains. Our room was very nice and had all the amenities we needed for our 3-night stay. There was a restaurants, a food court, and several gift shops right on the premises. There was also an excellent Mexican cantina with great drink specials located in front of the hotel. The pool area is awesome, and includes a wave pool and lazy river. The only downfall of this hotel is that it was located a bit too far down the Strip than most of the shows and attractions we ended up visiting. The nearest monorail station is across the street and the very back of the MGM Grand, which is quite a hike. There is a tram that you can board at the Bellagio that has a stop behind the pool area of the Monte Carlo. Again, you have to walk through a good portion of the Bellagio to get to the tram stop. Unless you've rented a car, prepare to do some serious walking or get a cab. Other than that, it was a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “So outdated”
Reviews.Author: MashkaNYC
Reviews.Content: Needed a hotel on the strip for a last minute weekend in December that wasnt too overpriced. My friend booked this one. Lobby is so disgusting, it smells of cigarette smoke like an old outdated Vegas hotel. The check in is so badly run. This was middle of December, Vegas is on the dead side at this time, and there were so many people in line. We had to wait forever just to check in. The room was nice size, great great view. We stayed on 31st floor, which is one below the top floor. The room was SO outdated, there was no minibar in the room and not even a vent in the bathroom! There was mold on the showerhead... Even the elivators interiors were so old and beaten down.. shame. BUT the beds, beds were amazing, def. one of the best beds I've ever slept in in my life. I think the closest to this was a 4 star hotel in Dubai. We could also hear everything going on in the room next door, like people talking. Also, the room temperature was very good, on the colder side a few times, but great ventilation, felt very comfortable. Location is good but you can see that by the map. They 100% need to renovate the rooms or I do not see a bright future for them.

Reviews.Title: “Very good Hotel for Family stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: HappyToTravel06
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this hotel during our trip to LV. this is a perfect hotel for family stay considering the fact that the inhouse the casino is small and McDonalds....It is located at the right oposite to MGM Grand and close to all the big casino hotels...so you will not miss anything...they have a temporary as well as very big free self parking space which also connects to the hotel lobby...we stayed in a double queen bed room. room is nice and clean...wired internet is available included in the resort fee....wireless is additional chargeable....for room service additional $ 2.5 will be charged extra. there are pharmacies right across and right next...really convenient... few things which i do not like is the shower and the cold cream...worst at their best... overall a family hotel with little extra priced

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Service, but shabby condition”
Reviews.Author: Azhkman
Reviews.Content: The service of the hotel was very good. The experience at Check-in was very quick once we reached the desk, but prior to that all lines were long (note: it was the day before NYE 2011) so I don't hold this against them. I did receive a room on the high floor which I requested, and it had a great open view of the other side of Vegas towards the mountains. We were in room 27-318. I was told that the Monte Carlo is under going renovations, if so, then our room was not yet renovated. The furniture showed its age, the wiring reminds me of staying in a classic building, where you can see 'after market' wiring laid around the top of the baseboards and there was no closet but rather just a wardrobe in the room. This is where the hair dryer is kept. The room itself was clean, as was the bathroom, and the toilet had a jet engine like flush. Awesome. The fixtures look like they are just out of the 1970s. I did not care for the shower at all. It looked cool, a square showerhead with four squares shooting out water. But it was quite cold in Vegas, and would have preferred a better more all covering shower, and an ability to change settings. There is a safe in the room, it is wall-mounted by the door, it holds a lot more than it looks like it would. It was able to hold 2 laptops, a camera, a travel wallet, iPad, and two iPods, with a couple of manipulations to get the door to close. We had room service once, and ordered a movie. Room service was right on time, and it was pretty tasty. The movie ordering process was very easy, but I was not able to order a movie the second time, it kept saying not available. This was actually a few hours before midnight on NYE 2011, so I guess too many people were ordering movies then. I had gotten sick from a night out of boozing, and woke up pretty sick. The CVS next to the hotel has a clinic in the back which charges only $89 per visit. Very useful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: RonandLou
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo for a 4 day break. We got great prices as booked online and paid in advance. The location is great, check in/out was super quick, room was clean and spacious. Granted it's not as impressive as some of the other super hotels on the strip, but we didn't go to Vegas to stay in the hotel all day so this suited our needs perfectly. Should I return to Vegas I would probably return to the Monte Carlo.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: thingamabobby
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a family. 2 adults , one 6 year old. We got a delux room with view of strip on special on website. It was nice room, spacious, well equiped although no coffee and tea station. Great view of strip. Quiet room being near the top on 30th floor. We liked the street of dreams for shopping. Prices for Breakfast and Buffet are expensive but no more so than any of the other hotels. We found eating out better and cheaper especially with kids. We found the location to be great for us. We were in middle of all family activity we wanted to see. To the right we headed on mono rail at Excalibur to Mandalay to see the Shark Reef. And to the left we enjoyed Bellagio Fountains, The Venetian and the shopping street inside the Paris hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great week end”
Reviews.Author: GerardvanBalveren
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo was full of 30 plus beautiful people, except for me and my friend. The room was fine no , issues but then you don't spend much time in the room. The pools are fine, with the river being warmer than the wave pool. They need a way to charge drinks to your room without carrying ID, maybe a plastic waterproof swipe card. It wasn't a problem for others but when you both are swimming where do you keep thing to buy drinks? The Casino was fun and friendly. We took the all day buffet pass which was good value but ties you to the buffet. I still prefer the Mirage Buffet as the best on the strip, but there was plenty to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sw02jco
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in a great location. Rooms were clean, we were in 30th floor with an amazing view of strip. Smaller than most Vegas resorts though.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay.”
Reviews.Author: Sparkie2009
Reviews.Content: Had a great time! Went out for Christmas. Nice clean rooms and convenient to all. The staff was very helpfull to all things to and see. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location fab, watch out for resort fee though.”
Reviews.Author: westcott_travellers
Reviews.Content: Really live hotel, such a great location, on the strip with a lot near by. The check in staff were pleaseant enough.. the resort fee is a stinger though $15 a night and they change that when you get there! Room was top though, view of the strip and a hot tub. Would recommend the suites. They have wi fi too even the front desk don't seem to know that! Beware of the yard margerita from el diablo they are lethal!

Reviews.Title: “Like hearing people having sex a 3am?”
Reviews.Author: jay-yo
Reviews.Content: Thin walls, outdated hotel overall, no wifi in rooms but still $17 resort fee, wallpaper cracking, room dated from lates 90s, complained about thin walls and gross clogged tub and front desk said theres nothing they could do to better my stay, Joy, didn't offer an apology nor was sympathetic. Great location, however. Would NOT stay again unless it had same rate as a Motel 6.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: UtahOutdoors
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in a room over looking the strip and I wouldn't stay here again. We walked into our room and the trash cans had not been taken out...there was a pile of towels right in the center of the floor in our entry way all wadded up. We did call the front desk and they were able to get us another room very quick. The showers are small and leaked. I really am not that hard to please when it comes to a hotel but if I had to do it all over again I would spend money and stay at the Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing!!”
Reviews.Author: michellejoe
Reviews.Content: We travel to Vegas for getaways about 3 times/ yr. We had never stayed at the Monte Carlo so we thought that we would give it a try as the price was right. We are very sorry that we did. Check in was painfully slow (and it was 4 pm in the afternoon); the room was disappointing as well- very dated. Small, crammed bathroom and the sink and tub drained very slowly- yuck. We would hear everything from the room beside us. We ate at the buffet one morning for breakfast and it was not impressive either. Normally we stay at the Bellagio or MGM- I would highly recommend both facilities and their resaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Sherry F
Reviews.Content: There are a some great things about this hotel; location: It is in the middle of the strip. There is a FREE tram that will take you to Luxor, Mandalay, and Bellagio. Directly across the street is MGM Grand, and the monorail station that will take you from one end to the other- but it is not free. There are 5 restaurants, and a food court inside the resort. The casino is spacious and the cocktail service is good. The down side: The rooms are old and in need of remodel. We stayed in a spa suite with a strip view. They don't look anything like their web page shows! The furniture was old (and torn in places). The carpet was nasty (stained). The towels were dingy white and cheap. NO COFFEE MAKER (you must either go downstairs (and pay a ridiculous price at Starbucks) or order room service (a 3 cup pot was $8.99!!). They provide cheap little bottles of shampoo and soap (no better than Motel 6) and the toilet paper was HORRIBLE. Luckily, there is a Walgreens across the street and we bought all our toiletries there, as well as snacks and drinks. Our daughter had a regular strip view room at a much cheaper price, but it was a cracker-box size and old as well. I would NOT recommend this "resort" hotel unless you are just looking for a place to flop that is in the middle of the strip. If so, get the lowest price specials they offer and skip the FALSE advertising of the luxury rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a complete renovation”
Reviews.Author: AW R
Reviews.Content: Beds are very comfortable but everything else needs to be renovated: carpet, shower, sink, faucets, ...... No WiFi in the room (had to go to the hotel lobby or food court). Probably will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Still worth the money”
Reviews.Author: phladun
Reviews.Content: This is the second time that I've stayed at the Monte Carlo. I paid a meeting rate of $55 plus $15 resort fee plus taxes for each of the two days that I stayed at the property. Somehow, I got upgraded to a better room which was exciting at first however, since I was alone, I really didn't need a sofa or two bathrooms. Plus, the room was right near the elevators which in Vegas is a big negative because not only are people walking out of the elevators at all hours of the night, they are usually talking loudly as well. I went out to the pool area and the wave pool and lazy river were closed for maintenance however, the main swimming pool was open. I didn't see anyone using the pool (as the outdoor temperature was close to freezing) however, it was steaming so I believe it was well heated. There were people using the hot tub, though. The food court is conveniently located very close to the lobby/elevators so it's easy to grab a quick bit (if you don't mind fare like McDonald's); there was a Starbucks in the food court. I don't gamble so have no personal comments on the casino. It seemed ok as many of the tables were being used. I find this hotel fairly clean, decently priced and conveniently located. It's definitely not a 4 or 5 star resort but gets a 4 star rating from me for meeting my needs for a good price (although the price was actually more than I paid last year).

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable beds, clean rooms, good service”
Reviews.Author: jtoothman
Reviews.Content: Postivies: low noise, nice view, comfortable bed, clean, and great service. Negatives: the restaurant choices could be better, the food in The Cafe could be better (breakfast was good though), the payouts could be better, the bathroom needs a vent, and a vanity outside of the shower area would've been nice (versus having it in the bathroom where all of the steam from the shower was located).

Reviews.Title: “Half Poor, Half Average.”
Reviews.Author: Annie M
Reviews.Content: Hi. I'm Annie, a nine years old. I'm using my dad's account. Monte Carlo's rooms are very dark and boring. I have to admit that my rating was half poor and half average, but I say that it is mostly in the poor. WARNING:Do not waste your money booking the bigger rooms. The only special things about it is an extra bathroom with no shower and a sofa. Not worth it. I never heard of a hotel room with two bathrooms. So don't waste $30 for a bathroom you don't even need, a measly sofa, and mabye 2 square ft space! The hotel looks so old that it's hard not to think that it is at least 70 years old. But it is still cheerful and it acts like a modern hotel. The bathoom ceiling is so low that for those of you that are very tall, you might have to bend down a bit, and I'm sure you wouldn't want to do that. If I were you, I would reccomend renting the smaller rooms, which might have a higher ceiling, or unless you want to waste your money on little space and a sofa.

Reviews.Title: “Not nearly as nice as it used to be”
Reviews.Author: WheelingWVMarty
Reviews.Content: We recently went to Las Vegas in celebration of my son's 21st birthday. Having stayed at the Monte Carlo several times in the past, we knew it was a lovely hotel in a great location. Not anymore. We were early to check-in but we did before walking the city. The desk clerk wouldn't tell us the room numbers, like it was a secret. We left our bags with the bellman and eventually our rooms were ready. They were pretty standard, but o.k. My wife and I had a view of City Center which is horrible, but my son had a strip view and the trip was for him anyway, so we were fine with it. The rooms are really showing a lot of wear. Outside of the room next to ours was a carafe and wine glass which sat there for 3 days. Eventually, someone got it. On the 4th and last day of our trip I noticed an abundance of long hair on the shower wall and neither of us has long hair. I mentioned it to my wife who said it had been there a couple days. I was extremely irritated with her for not leaving a note for housekeeping, but was a little surprised it had been there, although I hadn't noticed it. It was gross!! I honestly cannot recommend this resort anymore and doubt that we will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “BAD SERVICE AND RUDE STAFF”
Reviews.Author: Thundermx
Reviews.Content: Horrible Service!... Do not waste your time and money in this old Hotel. In my situation I made a PREPAY for the 8 night and when I arrive I gave my credit card to pay the service. Until 6 night the Staff Personal knock my door ( around 10 pm Las Vegas Time ) because my credit card doesnt work !!! ( why they are going until 6 day !! ) I talk with my Bank in Mexico and they told me that problem not was report, because my credit card is normal and vigent...so the shame is Montecarlo Hotel...!!!! I go down and talk with spanish girl in Staff Recepcion and she doesnt know what to say and what to do...I paid in cash $680.00 additionaly the rooms are dirty ( carpet and curtins ). Nothing was working in the room (e.g., hair dryer, internet, door lock). The key to the room was set until they got the money and I had to run to the front desk to re-activate it, and of course, I had to stay in line long long time....it's my last time in this old and dirty hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Basic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EFanucci
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights. Room was fairly clean but very basic. Did ask to not have anyone come in and clean but that was ignored. Valet was quick and the check in and out process was very fast. The only complaint was that the rooms have very thin walls. Was wide open after been woken up at 3am. Other than that I asked to have a high floor and it was given to me.

Reviews.Title: “Still a good value”
Reviews.Author: JilWebb
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at several places on the strip and Monte is still a good value. You get a great location, friendly staff, clean rooms and the pool area is nice... even though the sun does not hit pool until 11am (we stayed in Oct). The only con's are the high resort fees and over priced pool drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Big Disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: bill925
Reviews.Content: We decided to take a Christmas Trip to Vegas so my wife booked our stay through American Airlines Vacations. We've stayed at several other properties on the Strip in the past, but the Monte Carlo was by far the worse. The room, and hotel in general was outdated and in dire need of renovation. The only positive was the comfortable bed. The room was not very clean, and housekeeping was TERRIBLE! The pillows were hard, and the bedding was worn. Two days in a row I called for a manager, but they are very well insulated so it is nearly impossible to air a complaint. The sheets had holes in them and grease stains, before I raised a big enough stink to get them changed. They never gave us clean glasses, and the only thing they did was make the bed. The floor was never vacuumed, and the bathroom was not cleaned. The furniture is well worn, and needs to be replaced. I asked for a housekeeping supervisor to come to our room, and after making two calls, the supervisor never showed. The next night I called several times and asked for a manager but got the run around over and over until finally one of the managers called me back. She did comp our breakfast the last day, and they took off the resort fee. That's another complaint. The $15.00 plus tax they charge in addition every day for a so called "resort fee" is the biggest rip off I've ever seen. It supposedly covers in room internet, but there is no wifi in the rooms. The 40" flat screen TV they advertise is a joke as well. There are no movie channels such as HBO, and no HD so the picture you get is terrible. You would think for the $15.00 fee, you would at least get decent TV to watch. This is at best, a budget hotel. We had a room with a strip view, but the windows were so dirty, it wasn't much of a view.
