I'm used to staying at nice hotels, but the Monte Carlo doesn't fit that category In addition, the casino at the Monte Carlo is pretty bad as well. Fortunately, their sister property, the Aria had a nice clean, casino with decent slots. Overall, the Monte Carlo gets a big "thumbs down." Would I recommend this hotel to my friends, no! to my enemies, yes! There are plenty of nice hotels on the strip I would recommend, but not the Monte Carlo.

Reviews.Title: “Waste of Money! It is more of a 2 star than 4 star.”
Reviews.Author: mitra h
Reviews.Content: Horrible place!... Do NOT waste your money. Staff are impolite, disrespectful, and rude. Nothing was working in the room (e.g., hair dryer, internet, door lock). The key to the room was set for one time use ONLY and I had to run to the front desk to re-activate it, and of course, I had to stay in line each time that they were fixing it.

Reviews.Title: “3rd stay”
Reviews.Author: scothishqueen
Reviews.Content: Price is right and the location okay. We stayed in a suite this trip and it was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't consider it a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hong C
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo was just ok. It was more of a 3 star than a 4 star. The hotel needs some reno to make it it more lively. The hall way was dated and so was the room. The bathroom was quite ordinary and the base board was coming off. Not quite up to standard compared to the rest of the 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: scholnicks
Reviews.Content: We usually stay across the strip at the MGM, but for this trip we stayed 6 nights at the Monte Carlo. Other than the hard pillows we really like the Monte Carlo and will stay there again. It is conveniently located near the south end and easy walking distance to the center strip. The free tram takes you up to the Bellagio in no time. The casino is decent sized; however, we mostly played blackjack next door at New York New York.

Reviews.Title: “Serviceable”
Reviews.Author: AnotherVancouverite
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel via WestJet Vacations for a cheap rate, so we weren't expecting much; just a clean, decent place for us to wind down after long days. Well we really didn't get much in return, and here's why: Check-ins and check-outs: no real wait for us but as a few reviewers have mentioned, some stanchions would've helped with lining up the crowd in a more orderly fashion. The hall just off our floor's elevator bay has a very low ceiling...I'm only 5'4" and I felt a bit oppressed by the (lack of) height. What's the deal with that? Worn-looking carpet. Sheets and pillowcases not quite 100% clean looking. While I'm at it, worn caulking and clogged up bathtub drains, too. The shower...I was blasted in the face by it. The pressure is ridiculously high (not adjustable) and hot water didn't come that quickly. Added to the clogged drain mentioned above, the shower experience wasn't all that enjoyable. Resort fees...we knew at the time of booking that we'd get dinged with it. But if all we're getting is a frayed internet cable (no in-room wi-fi) and slow housekeeping service, I'm staying elsewhere next time. There were some things done right though - beds were comfortable. Big flat screen TV with good amount of premium channels. And the room was reasonable quiet at night. All in all not enough to detract from our 4 nights stay in Vegas, and for the money we paid it's quite serviceable. It is fairly centrally located on the strip, after all. Although if you want true Vegas luxury in your hotel, this is definitely not it.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Monte Carlo!”
Reviews.Author: coquicola412
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Monte Carlo last weekend for 3 nights, and we really enjoyed it! Check-in was pretty quick, and the front desk agent (maybe Linda?) was nice and helpful. We had reserved a king, non-smoking room, and of course, I was going to see if we could get somewhat of a view, but she pretty much just said there's only 1 king room available (handicapped) on the 3rd floor, or a double queen. So we chose the king, which is what we booked, but I was slightly disappointed that we were on such a low floor, and in a handicapped room. The room itself was nice. Large bathroom, comfy bed, etc. Everything was clean. No washcloths the first night, but they were there the 2nd and 3rd night? A minor complaint would be that there weren't enough shower curtain rings on the shower curtain. This created gaps in the curtain and made it somewhat drafty while showering. We didn't complain but noticed it was fixed the final night, so we appreciated that. The tub seemed to have some difficulty draining properly. The location was great - very convenient to everything, including the Duece bus line.There is a free tram that can take you to Aria and Bellagio, which we used a few times. It was very handy having the food court right at the bottom of the elevators! The casino was nice - we stopped and gambled a few times throughout the trip. The hotel is beautiful inside and outside. Very nice smell when you walk in. I think all of the hotels are doing this to try to cover up the smell of cigarette smoke, which I personally like. I'd rather smell something slightly overpowering but good than the stench of rank cigarette smoke. Wish all of the casinos would turn non-smoking. We didn't run into many staff, but the front desk agents and bell staff were nice and helpful. We wanted to try the Minus 5 bar because we saw it on TV one time, but at $15/person just for the bare essentials of getting in, we decided to pass. We didn't see Jabbawokeez, but after all of the advertising, I admit, we got a little curious. Perhaps next time? I will echo the complaints of everyone...the resort fee sucks. We didn't get anything from it. I saw stacks of newspapers on our floor, but not in front of doors. Overall, we really enjoyed it, and would certainly consider staying here in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy hotel”
Reviews.Author: S1m0n123
Reviews.Content: Nobody sleeps in Vegas, including us! The rooms have interconnecting doors, which when closed still let all the noise through. All of the doors had huge gaps underneath to let the sound through. We had a rowdy group of guys staying next door who would come in at 2am, talk for an hour then to sleep for a few hours before disturbing us again at 7am. The hotel plumbing was also really noisy, you could hear every flush, and this too went on throughout the night. We also had a loud truck that would park outside our window in the middle of the night(we were on the 20th floor!) rev the engine, then start cleaning the drains. Luckily after 1/2 hour he would stop to let the engine cool down before starting up again Just as things would calm down the maids would start their rounds. Vegas is a great place to party, but don't expect any sleep, so why bother with a hotel?

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay at Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: Bmoresfinest124
Reviews.Content: Visited the Monte Carlo last weekend to celebrate a friend's birthday. This was our first trip to Vegas. I was hesitant to stay here after reading many of the other reviews, but I had a very positive experience. Pros: Room was clean, no bugs, affordable. Close to airport, short walking distance to other hotels, restaurants, malls, shops (CVS, Ross), and free tram to Crystals Center City and Bellagio hotels. Nice food court and restaurants in the hotel. Cons: Not as modern with as many amenities as some of the other hotels visited on The Strip, check-in process was slow. Housekeeping kept forgetting to leave washcloths so I had to call the front desk or catch housekeeping in the hall while making their rounds to as for more.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mica76
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Monte Carlo for 4 nights. Comfortable room and a great buffet breakfast or brunch.Great location for getting out and about on the strip.Close to the airport. Very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Meeting at the Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: TheCTPGroup
Reviews.Content: We just completed a small meeting at the Monte Carlo for one of our clients. Despite some challanges in the planning stages, it was very successful. The front line staff (banquet waiters) were great - very accommodating. The function space is a little strangely laid out but we made it work. Sleeping rooms were perfectly serviceable but overall, the hotel is a bit tired (chipped paint and scrapes abound - especially in the elevators) and could definitely use a facelift.

Reviews.Title: “Just Alright...”
Reviews.Author: ColeyCole37
Reviews.Content: First let me say that I am not one of those people who expect too much for my money as far as hotels go. I am pretty simple. However, this place is just not up to par. The doors close hard, the walls are thin & if there is some in your hall you can hear their entire conversation. Me and a group of 9 other people came here for a 5 day vacation before Christmas and we are currently still here. The light in our bathroom has been broken since Monday and they just sent someone to fix it. Housekeeping threw away some stuff they shouldn't have and they were really unapologetic about it. A decent location and good restaurants in the lobby are the only saving graces. The people gambling in the lobby even look depressed. If you are just looking for a deal this is it. Just don't expect much else. Also, no fridge or microwaves in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Slowly going downhill”
Reviews.Author: jm98md
Reviews.Content: Have been staying here a few years now. For the most part it has been a nice hotel although after staying there last week I have noticed the rooms are definitely in need of remodeling. Mold in the caulk joints around shower. There also is no sort of order in the lobby as far as check in. Most hotels will have a roped area to deal with lines and take people in order. Here you pretty much just stand out in the open and try to catch the attention of the next receptionist to get checked in. One other thing that was a bit disturbing for a 4 star rated hotel was a cart full of dirty dishes from room service sat in the hallway for 2 days. It was still there when we checked out, so don't know how long it actually sat there. Noticed a little more smokiness in the casino than past trips. On the plus side it is a very nice casino and very friendly people working around the hotel and the room rates were reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Well done!”
Reviews.Author: Lologr
Reviews.Content: Just got home from 3 nights at the Monte Carlo. We got a crazy good deal on Hotwire, but we were worried after we read some mixed reviews here. We worried for nothing - we loved the location, it was clean, rooms were ample, bathroom was nice, and employees were kind. The only things I would dick them on would be the thin walls between rooms and the slow wired internet. But we spent so little time in our room, and neither deterred from our experience, so overall, we were extremely pleased.

Reviews.Title: “First Trip to Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: dorfnair
Reviews.Content: First let me point out I traveled as a tourist, not a gambler. I chose Monte Carlo as part of a package deal which best fit my "budget." I found the complex to be quite satisfactory. I had been told by a local resident it was one of the "older" resort/casinos and it appeared to be thus. Older did not necessairily prove to be any drawback. Overall the resort was very pleasant, clean and well staffed. The staff I found to be above average in being courteous, helpful and efficient. There were some language barriers with housekeeping and the buffet staff, but nothing of any significance. The complex is centrally located on the "strip" and convenient for walking to other resorts and sights of the strip. I found it interesting there was no coffee maker or microwave in room, but no doubt this is to generate room service income and tips . . . Would I stay there again or recommend it to a friend, most definitely. If one is a high roller, perhaps another resort would be worth considering.

Reviews.Title: “Would Definitely Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: Linda L
Reviews.Content: I loved the Monte Carlo, the pools, lazy river, had an awesome time twice at Diablos.... great food. I have stayed at several hotels in Vegas and found the Monte Carlo's staff friendly and just an overall great stay...

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: Debra H
Reviews.Content: We stayed during the Nationals Finals Rodeo, the Monte Carlos has been host to the bareback riders for the past several years, my son Ryan Gray bareback rider, won the promo suite this year. What a fun contest for the contestants. We have stayed at the MC several times and you and your staff are awesome to us. Everyone from the bell boys, the waitresses the Pub Staff, check in staff are always so friendly and accommindating to us. They love the cowboys and it shows. The rates were awesome for the families. Thank you for that too. We will be back and thanks for taking good care of our cowboys. Merry Christmas, Deb Humphrey

Reviews.Title: “Seriously, stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: TellMeWhereToGoNext
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference at the University of Nevada, Las Vegas, last week and was supposed to stay at the MGM Grand, but didn't call the hotel in time to make the cut off date. Consequently, the girl on the phone recommended her "sister" hotel, the Monte Carlo. She explained that the rate was the same or very similar to the "conference rate" that the University negotiated for conference attendees. Well, I reluctantly booked it, which I typically do not do unless I search the Internet for deals first. It was only five days before my flight out, so thought better safe than sorry. The next day I had some time on my hands, so I checked out the Monte Carlo website. I noticed that there was deal on the web site where if you book for two nights, you get two free passes to a buffet. I was surprised that the girl I spoke to didn't mention the deal, especially since she also knew how disappointed I was not to get into the MGM Grand. Nevertheless, I thought I would nicely ask for the free buffet passes when I got there. Very long story short, they refused and no matter how many people I spoke with, they explained that it was not possible. Couldn't do it. Sorry. Seriously? This place wasn't cheap either - and they charged a resort fee of around $18 a night on top of their room fee. The lobby is nice, but the rooms are very average, so I was shocked that people rated it a 4 on hotels.com. Also, the walls are paper thin. I could hear full conversations of the people in the next room for two straight nights - sometimes until 3 am in the morning, which is just not good when you are expected to give a presentation in the morning. To top it off, I called their customer service line at 10 am in the morning and it literally rang for 15 minutes straight (I had it on speaker) and no one ever picked up. Unbelieveable. I left after 2 nights and stayed at the Paris Hotel for less money per night. LOVED the customer service there - they were friendly, helpful, amazing. Let me check in at 11:00 am. Room was comfortable and quiet. Bathroom was beautifully decorated. The casino was welcoming; the Mon Ami Gabi restaurant was to die for! So good! A loaf a hot french bread with butter is served when you sit down and all you need is a nice salad and some soup and you'll think you're in Paris! It's the only open air cafe that I noticed while I was there and you could sit outside because they had those heaters. Coffee was located right near the elevators to the rooms - so pretty convenient. Would go back again and again. Don't stay at the unfriendly, over priced, over rated Monte Carlo. I was so sorry I wasted two nights there. The only thing that they had over the Paris Hotel was free WIFI.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated.”
Reviews.Author: Leon043
Reviews.Content: I start with the executive summary: Top location on the strip, and that's just about it. Old, worn, not clean, poor service.... but affordable. What more do you need to know. Sleep here, do the rest somewhere else. I got cigarette smoke from the room next door, there was a old sandwich under my bed, and so on and on. Unpolite staff in the casino, terrible food. Like they say in LV: Good luck!

Reviews.Title: “Afforable with college kids”
Reviews.Author: babyblueyoshi
Reviews.Content: Love staying at the Monte Carlo because it's affordable and there's a food court...yea the Venetian has a food court too but unless I find an amazing deal, it's way out of my price range. Checked in on a Sunday and was told its their busiest day but the lady who helped me out was very nice and cheery, like she actually likes her job! The rooms are adequate, nothing spectacular. But I love the lazy river at the pool and I always seem to find chairs even if it seems crowded. However, you do get what you pay for, the crowd is definitely younger. Lots of 21st birthdays being celebrated. Love the tram that goes to Aria and Bellagio tho, cuts down a bit of the walking!

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo Resort - OK at best”
Reviews.Author: Cindy146
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo Resort for 3 nights. At best I would say the hotel is OK. They have a $15 technology fee which will only get you wired internet in your room. We took an iPad with us for ease of travel and could not use it in our room, no wireless available. We didn't realize that they hotel didn't have wireless. To use the wireless we had to walk all the way through the hotel and through the Street of Dreams to find a bigger Starbucks. We were suppose to get a paper each day and supposedly they had them on every floor, I never saw one paper on the floor we stayed on. They were also suppose to be able to check you in and print you a boarding pass, when I asked for them to do that, they were able to check us in, but they said our boarding passes would not print. So we had to get our boarding passes printed at the airport. The room was old and tired. The bathroom was clean but definitely outdated. The last morning we were there I woke up and went to take my shower, it was then I realized the hotel staff had not left new shampoo, conditioner or bath soap. Luckily we had enough left over from the day before we made it through. Again, there was not ONE big issue, just alot of little issues, that although did not effect our overall great experience in Vegas for the first time, it did make us both realize we will never stay at the Monte Carlo again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: kolonialone
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay through and online bidding process for a very reasonable rate considering the National Rodeo Finals were in town while I was there. The staff were great, especially at check-in. The room was better than average but not as nice as some of the other properties around the strip. The beds were firm, so if you prefer soft, you're out of luck. The pillows were also very firm and I ended up getting a crick in my neck. The food choices were great as there were plenty to choose from both in the food court and standalone restaurants in the hotel. The Titanic exhibit was close by and within walking distance. The only drawback were the resort fees of $16/day that were not part of the final price I paid during my bid. There were other properties close by that do not charge a resort fee, so keep that in mind when booking and/or bidding. One final note, do not let the taxi(if you are taking one) take the freeway, this is a waste of time and money and a way for you to get charged double. If you are staying at this hotel, or any hotel on the south end of the strip, make sure the taxi takes Tropicana to Las Vegas Blvd., it'll be far cheaper....trust me.

Reviews.Title: “Good priced average hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Thekid401
Reviews.Content: The monte Carlo was a great deal but nothing spectacular. The casino was average. The staff was friendly but never went out of their way to impress you. The location was convenient. I would NOT reccommend the buffet, spend an extra $3 and take the free team to the bellagio for an amazing prime rib buffet!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: cherislarry
Reviews.Content: My sife and myself stayed here while I attended a conference at the same hotel. While the room, service, and hospitality were all nice, they didn't wow me. We have stayed at two other hotels in Las Vegas and found both to have better rooms and accomodations. That being said, we also paid considerably more for those other two hotels. If you are looking for a nice, reasonably priced hotel in Vegas, this could be for you. If you are looking for a memorable experience, go more high end.

Reviews.Title: “Only so so”
Reviews.Author: Thang T
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean and overall OK. Location is very good since you can get to all the attractions on the strip easily on foot. However the minus points are: 1) Resort fees which is just a hidden fee to mask the real cost of the hotel stay. I did not get any of the things they say is included in the resort fee like newspaper, 2 bottle of water, internet... Furthermore, the food at the Buffet was an expression of the sad state in which the hotel has declined. Me and my family will look for other places next time.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION...THAT'S ABOUT IT.”
Reviews.Author: thump57
Reviews.Content: Went to Las Vegas for my birthday the 1st weekend of December. It was the Rodeo Nationals that weekend and the place was full of people waiting in line to check in. The wait wasn't to bad but they could have had more help with checking everyone in. The reception area was nice and large but as soon as you walk in you will be over powered by air freshener or something. I noticed it in all the hotel/casinos. They need to tone it down quit a bit. The rooms are nothing fancy and I did notice that the carpet in both the hall and room had big stains on them. They did give you the shampoo and all, which was nice.We had a room that looked out over the strip which was nice to look at in the evening when all the lights were on. The bed and linen was nothing to write home about. Did go to the Pub and have the all you can eat Bar-B- Que, that was good but not fantastic. Did a walk through their buffet and for $20.00, there was not a very big selection to choose from. Nothing like the Paris buffet. It was a nice weekend but I will not go back to the Monte Carlo. Mirage and Paris have this place beat hands down. If you are going to be walking the strip, hitting all the stores, this is a good location to be at.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: cathyostro
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Monte Carlo was decent. Was there for a work function for 4 days. Lots to do in the hotel, and did not seem on the ghetto side, as some others do. Great location. Only issue was with the towels. The towels had this awful "old" smell to them. I could barely even dry myself off with them b/c of the smell. They were like that the entire time, even with new towels every day. Very strange.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a good choice”
Reviews.Author: mike186258
Reviews.Content: Second time at the MC, really can't fault it, location is about as good as it gets. Free monorail to Bellagio's which puts you right across from Paris, Caesar's, Venetian and Planet Hollywood. The rooms clean, well equipped and serviced to a good standard daily. We wouldn't stay anywhere else friends who stayed in other hotels confirmed that the MC will be their choice next time. If you want a good value hotel at the heart of the strip can't go wrong with Monte Carlo. Reception staff absolutely superb.

Reviews.Title: “Viva Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: skibum13
Reviews.Content: Just came back from 4 fabulous days in Vegas with 7 wild women! Took my 21 year old daughters to Vegas. Booked the Monte Carlo as wanted to be on the strip. Hotel was wonderful. So much to offer and see. From the clean rooms to the easy access to everything around the hotel. All restuarants and pubs were great and very accomodating. The food fair was wonderful for a quick bite or a cup of coffee when needed. The casino, very open and friendly. For $10.00 you have use of the spa for 24 hours. AWESOME! It was nice to sit in the hot and cold tub and just relax for a few minutes. The hotel is in a perfect location, across from the hard Rock Cafe, M & M's store, along with drug stores and everything handy. I have been to the MGM Grand and Bally's and i have to say I would definately go back to the Monte Carlo anytime!!

Reviews.Title: “Toxic air fresheners stink”
Reviews.Author: Jack M
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks nice, but the stink from the fragrances being pumped into the hotel is disgusting. It's so strong that it makes you choke and burns your eyes. I hear this is common in Las Vegas and most of the hotels are flooding the air of their hotels with these toxic fragrances. Gag!!!!! Next time, I will make sure to ask if a hotel is using these toxic chemicals before I make a reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Modern Hotel in A Great Location”
Reviews.Author: racheldetroit
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying here. My friend had never been to Vegas so I wanted a place close enough to the main strip that we could walk to the main attractions. This hotel is clean and modern and doesn't smell like cigarette smoke. It is on the tram line so you can easily move to different parts of Vegas. There is also a food court on the first floor with a Subway, McDonalds, Subway, and a few other places for quick cheap eats. I like this place because it is clean, modern, and in the center of it all.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Peta505
Reviews.Content: Overall this is a pretty good hotel for what we paid. The room was nice, the bathroom was good, and we had a view towards the strip (although we were only on the 8th floor and could really only see the lights of our own hotel and those immediately across the road). Unfortunately one of the reasons for us picking this hotel was the pool area, with the Lazy River Rafts a drawcard for the children - however we only discovered this was closed for maintenance on arrival. When we booked this hotel through our travel agent, we were not told this was going to be the situation. We had dinner at the Dragon Noodle & Co restaurant and enjoyed it immensely. Breakfast at The Cafe was also very good. The tram connecting the Monte Carlo to the Bellagio is very handy - we used it constantly. If only there were fridges provided in these hotels - and tea/coffee making facilities - my rating of the hotel would improve greatly. However, from previous experience in other hotels in Las Vegas, this is nothing but the norm. Overall, for the price we paid I'd rate the hotel fairly highly but if my budget was improved I'd go for the Bellagio next door. To compare the Monte Carlo to other hotels I have stayed at in Las Vegas, it is not quite as good as the MGM, but it is leaps and bounds better than Circus Circus. If only there was a non-smoking casino hotel in Las Vegas........

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: DianaK_123
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, clean rooms, great location but no wireless! Don't take your iPad as you won't be able to use it in your room. Some of the areas could use an update.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: AZcartrip
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Monte Carlo several times and have always enjoyed our stay. Except this time. As always the staff was great, but our room was bad. First of all, the bathtub wouldn't drain, at all. Then the wall safe wouldn't work. Finally there wasn't heat coming from the heater/air conditioner. It would blow air, but never enough to heat the room. Besides all that, we paid for a upgraded strip view room, which we got. However, it was dirty. The carpet was a mess. They was mysterious stains on the wall near the bed, and in the bath room. When we complained, they did fix the tub and wall safe. But never fixed the heat. During the week we were there, it was cold. Jody at the front desk was very nice and did try to make amends by waving our "resort" fee. He's the only reason that I've rated this stay "average" instead of "poor". We were so disappointed, we checked out two days early.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Tamara98_99
Reviews.Content: We booked a Monaco Suite and were very happy with our room. It was spacious. It was great having two toilets. There was a nice jet tub and the shower had great water pressure. The bed was very comfortable and the mini-fridge actually kept our food cold! Our smoke-free room truly was smoke-free. There were a few times we could hear the people in the room next door but not enough to be a bother. The location was close to everything we needed. We rode the tram to the City Center and Bellagio. Across the street is Hard Rock Cafe and the M&M Factory. It's a short walk to NY, NY where you can cross to MGM or Excalibur. We aren't gamblers so we didn't use the casino. The food court choices were perfect for us (we used Subway, McDonalds, and Haagen Daaz). It was nice to have the food available so close to the elevators to easily carry it to our room. The only complaint I had was check-in. It was very slow and I don't think it was a busy time of year but for some reason they said they didn't have many room options even though we arrived less than an hour after check-in. We were told we would have a view of the pool but instead we had a view of the mountains.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, good location & a food court, yay!”
Reviews.Author: daisybabe73
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying at the Monte Carlo. I am in Vegas at least once a year, and this is becoming my favorite hotel (in the winter). The beds are super comfy, with down comforters and fluffy pillows. The rooms are fairly spacious, and very clean. The shower head could be higher (I am 5'11"), and the blodryer had a broken switch, but those are my only minor concerns. The food court right by the elevators is awesome! I love how easy it is to eat when I'm hungry - some other Vegas hotels don't make it so simple. I would stay here again in the cooler seasons, but in the summer prefer a hotel with a nicer pool area (eg. MGM, Mandalay or Flamingo).

Reviews.Title: “A Great Fit”
Reviews.Author: farmersfrommn
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 night stay at the Monte Carlo and wanted to say how pleased we were with our experience. We have visited Vegas around 15 times, and have been in this casino, and Diablo's Bar a few times, but have not stayed there until this trip. We chose this property for location, price, free shuttle to the National Finals Rodeo, and close access to the bus for Downtown and Fremont Street. We found the check-in to be a little time consuming, but very friendly and professional service. VERY nice front desk clerk who even asked if we would like to have a room on the same floor as one of our other friends who were checking in at the same time. Our room was on the 25th floor , and even without a "strip view" we had an amazing view of the newer "city center" next door. The rooms were clean and everything was in nice condition and working order. The beds are AWESOME ! The casino is large enough to keep you entertained, but not so large that you cant find your way, or loose your companions or your way to the elevators. I loved the fact that there was a Starbucks and McDonalds right there near the elevator lobby for any FAST needs for coffee or snacks. The only better thing would be if there were a coffee maker in the room. We do notice that most Las Vegas hotels do not offer that, not sure why? We had a very busy schedule and so many places to go, and we loved the close access to the bus, the monorail, and even hired a limo for our group from right there in the taxi / limo lane of the hotel. Some of our party were able to spend time at Diablo's and enjoy drink specials and free shots ! There is a CVS store right next door where you can get bottles of water, soda, liquor and beer if you choose, or snacks and any other necessities. Since our stay was in the colder season we did not get to use any of the pool facility, but it looked like a great place to relax and enjoy during warmer weather. There looked to be some pool renovation going on while we were there. The only part of our stay that we would be dissatisfied with would be the 16.00/day "resort fee", which since it was not pool season, we never really got anything for that fee, that we could identify. Unfortunately , nearly ALL the resorts in LV are charging these "resort fees", for exactly what, I don't know. Over all a great place to stay. We will definitely plan to stay at the Monte Carlo again next visit if they keep their prices as reasonable and competitive as they were at this time. We would love to stay longer the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Cowboy Up and Party Down!”
Reviews.Author: RedneckCowgirl
Reviews.Content: Going to Vegas has become a yearly trip now for us to attend the National Finals Rodeo. We picked the Monte Carlo based on location, price, quality, as well as the fact that they had advertised themselves as a Host Hotel. We had an easy check in and check out. No problems there. This was the nicest room we have stayed in for Vegas.Large, very clean, super quiet and great view of the strip. We stayed on the 9th floor and were quite please with our location. The hotel is a little upscale and very nice. We never had a meal there or cocktails. We tended to do our breakfasts across the strip and a little south at the Salsa Cantina. A great mexican cafe with $2.00 Bloody Marys' and a$ 5.00 breakfast. We actually both ate and had drinks for cheaper than 1 breakfast at the MC...so we continued to head to the cantina several times throughout our trip. We did go to the Pub on Friday night and were very disappointed that at 12:30 the band stopped and they basically "kicked" us out! (really, in Vegas??) They did have a tap beer "special" plus a shot of Jack Daniels for $5.00 or a plastic boot filled with beer for $10.00. My first boot had a leak and made a huge mess all over the table. We had little or no wait service, so I ended up taking it back for a replacement myself! It was great that they had a shuttle to and from the Thomas and Mack arena for the rodeo, but other than that and a few hay bales put in strategic places,,,you would never know this was much of a host hotel. Other things offered was the additional resort fee...from which we got nothin...never saw a paper once in our room or elsewhere in the hotel,too cold to swim, we didn't bring laptops for the wireless interenet...so that was pretty much a wash.We were very disappointed in the "M" player's card. Also, we got nuthin! Usually there is a two for one meal, cocktail discounts ect. We actually had a hard time even finding out about the card, getting one and getting it to work. it was a super hassle and not at all as good as the other places we have stayed. (Hooters, Harrah's, Stardust and the Excalibur) We didn't do too much at the hotel itself, but did try and spend some money in Diablos' in the tex/mex restaraunt bar and grill attached to the MC. For the third time in a row, we were pissed by the time we left this place.My friends had coupons for discount drinks, but the bartender wouldn't honor them. We tried to buy a t-shirt from the bar, but the bartender couldn't work the till (he was messed up!) and then when I asked the host if we could please purchase a shirt he only replied "only the bartenders can sell them!" I give up. On a good note, the music was good and the shot girls were adorable and worked super hard...I just felt bad that they got stuck in this bar and not on the strip elsewhere. Needless to say, we'll never hit Diablo's again. Pretty much every body but the shot girls were rude in there. Hotel staff for housekeeping were great and very efficient. Casino workers and cocktail waitresses were great too. We would definately stay at this place again, I am just sad they don't embrace more of the rodeo spirit for the 10 days. We hopped over to the MGM and that place was rocking...they had a huge live viewing party, gave away prizes, good drink specials, and featured a "Gold Buckle Zone" with two live bands, giveaways and Trevor Brazile's Saddle and Buckle Display. We also got to meet the cowboys after the rodeo, as some came in for meet and greets there.hmmmmm sounds like we MAY be at the MGM next year? :) Either way, the Monte Carlo was very nice and we had a great stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel, Average Location”
Reviews.Author: Shane D
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Monte Carlo in June of 2011. I don't know what it was, but everything about this place just seemed average to me. The price wasn't cheap, but wasn't expensive either. The location is wasn't bad, but there are several hotels on the strip with a much more desirable location for about the same price. The rooms were nice: decent amenities, good sized TV, comfortable bed, good water-pressure, but I have definitely stayed in much nice rooms in my day. The casino floor has a mediocre selection of table games for medium-low stakes, and the sports book is below average in comparison to other books in the area. Getting the picture yet? While the Monte Carlo is far from the worst hotel on the strip, it fails to be anything more than average in most things it has to offer. Besides a good selection of fast-casual dining options, the Monte Carlo will leave you wanting more.

Reviews.Title: “TREATED LIKE CATTLE!!!”
Reviews.Author: ramsayj01
Reviews.Content: Well know I know how cattle feel like when being corralled! Wellcome to the NEW Vegas! Stand in a long line, than be waved forward,respond to the one word question, Name? Then the credit card please. Oh a polite word! There is an $11 resort fee that gets you a paper that is left by the elevators no where near your room. Wait a darn picking minute, I get it droped right infront of my room at other Hotels and I am not paying $11 for it. Forgot if you are lugging your big old lap top with you the resort fee includes internet except every where else it is free wifi, and the cable in the room is missing the end that is plugged into your computer. this type of service and lack of value for your money was prevalent throughout Vegas! Even though I left with more money than I arrived with, I will not return to a tourist site that has such poor services and price gouging gone viral. Not what it use to be in Vegas. What happens in Vegas costs more then what it should. However if you want to know how cattle feel that's the place.

Reviews.Title: “I Love This Place”
Reviews.Author: Willbetrvlng
Reviews.Content: Stay here for 3 nights over Thanksgiving. I love this place for where it is and the atmosphere. I am not into partying too heavy so I don't need a night club. The Casino has good games and the dealers at the tables are usually OK. Drinks are sometimes slow at the slots, but that's OK. The rooms are clean, the beds are soft, the bathroom has the usual stuff. The Hotel provides easy access to City Center, the Bellagio, or the MGM. The restaurants are fine, the food court is good, and it has a decent sports book. Its all I need for a base to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Happycoupleno1
Reviews.Content: We had such a wonderful vacation at the Monte Carlo Casino. Everyone was so nice and are room was so clean and nice.We loved the 21 dealers so helpful and always smiling. Had fun speaking to Frank and Greg at the poolside. Loved the Mexican restaurant in the hotel. Looking forward to returning. I give this hotel thumbs up .Thank you Monte Carlo. Aloha Karine and Jeff

Reviews.Title: “What Happens in Vegas . . . . .”
Reviews.Author: WillPwr
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a 3 day stay at the Monte Carlo Resort & Casino. Before I booked my trip and days leading up to my trip I read the reviews here on Trip Advisor consistently I was a bit nervous before I arrived because 75% of the reviews on here were not pleasant. However, I must say I had a pleasant stay at the Monte Carlo. A few travelers mention the comfortable night sleep they had in the rooms and I completely agree the beds, sheets and pillows are so comfortable it was by far the best night’s sleep I’ve had in months! Check-in for me was a breeze; the front desk attendant accommodated my request with a smile. I spent time lounging by the pool area. The pool is heated for all my winter travelers. This is a huge hotel so be prepared to do a lot of walking to get to and from your room and the strip. The hotel is in a great location on the strip (right next door to a CVS for all your snack, liquor and out-of-town travel needs) No, the hotel is not the newest kid on the block (i.e. Aria) so do not go expecting fresh paint, new carpet, fancy furniture, etc. Who goes to Las Vegas and spends that much time in there hotel room anyway? Enjoy the hotel and enjoy the city. As always remember . . . .what happens in Vegas stays in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: lular
Reviews.Content: Being a frequent traveler who is lucky enough to stay in 5 star deluxe hotels on business, my husband and I booked and paid for this hotel ourselves as it was very reasonable in price ($46 on three of the nights) and were not disappointed at all. It is not in the league of the Bellagio / Encore / Four Seasons (I have stayed at all of them) but it is a small property which is easy to get around and not get lost, plenty of bars and food outlets, and the casino is really great. It is well located on the strip and for $46 per night and the most comfy bed I have slept in - what more can you ask for! The only complaints I had was that the towels smelt of burnt caramel (!) and I had to get them changed and the queue was long to check in - they need to sort out the check in line so that there are not lots of queues for each agent. Throughly recommended - I will stay there again when in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Do you Travel to Vegas for a Hotel Room?”
Reviews.Author: andwen98
Reviews.Content: If so, this may not be the place for you. We used the hotel room to sleep and shower - the room fit our needs. We brought our own soaps/shampoos and did not use the items provided by the resort. We requested/received a strip view on a mid level floor location. Our room was clean and the beds were very comfortable. The location on the strip was nice and the tram is onsite. However, the resort fee ($15.00) is a money grab. This is a trumped up charge with no benefit. If you can book a good/low price to offset the resort fee we would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Some good, some bad, but overall a good time”
Reviews.Author: Wbaylis
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Monte Carlo, and here are just a few things that I wish I had known before I went, hopefully to help others: (1) Check-In is a NIGHTMARE - the lines are interminably slow and the desk staff are far more interested in selling upgrades and restaurant reservations than they are about getting tired travelers to their rooms. The poor lady ahead of me in line actually was at the desk for more than 45 minutes (no exaggeration - I checked on my watch). (2) The food at the Cafe is VERY good (though not cheap). (3) Do NOT go to the buffet unless you have served time and think prison food is the greatest - the food at the Buffet is GHASTLY and a complete ripoff. (4) Diablo's bar is fun and the food is OK - this is a place for twentysomethings who want to get smashed and listen to loud music - the death wings here are REALLY hot - actually will hurt your hands as well as your tongue, but good drinks and a fun upbeat staff. (5) The walgreens right across the street from the main entrance has fresh fruit and snacks at fair prices - great for stocking up the room.

Reviews.Title: “OK stay, solid 4 star, shame about the resort fee”
Reviews.Author: foleyartist
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo is in a very convenient location to the more lively side of the strip. The parking garage is well lit and connected via a walkway on one level. Checkin was pretty smooth, we asked for a strip view room and was told it would be available on the second day of our stay. Room was clean, bathroom nice, soaps etc were average and more of a 3 star quality. We saw room service trays left out for more than 24 hours. The resort fee of $15 per day is just another way of getting money out of guests. what do you actually get? Access to the pool which is closed in winter, a free newspaper because you went to Vegas to put your feet up and read the paper in your room, free printing of boarding passes which you can do from most hotels anyway and free local rate calls... resortfees.com reported that you get 2 free bottles of water a day - this is not true. On the plus side, the hotel itself is convenient in that you can walk right onto the strip opposite M&M world and it is a "short" walk to the New York. Alternatively, a free tram runs from the Monte Carlo to the Bellagio, stopping at Aria on the way. This was quite good. Overall a solid 4 star hotel in a good location on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Uninspiring”
Reviews.Author: DavidZA
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very simple, they feel very old in that their look is dated and they haven't been adequately maintained. Our room had lights that weren't working, the bathroom wasn't particularly clean and the walls were in terrible shape in the corners. Basically the rooms felt very budget and like a cheap motel. Other than the the casino was decent but the staff at the one restaurant on the casino floor were appalling, I forget the name of the restaurant though. The location is good though.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap hotel needs updating”
Reviews.Author: Pinkawesome
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in Nov, it was the cheapest hotel on the strip and in a good location, we booked a king room and were given a double, when we rang reception and asked why they said no kings were left. The rooms were clean but need updating, there was a constant noise in the bathroom behind the wall but keeping the door shut stopped that. We had all our valuables in the safe, but left our loose change on the unit next to the TV, several dollars, on the last day we went out early in the morning to breakfast and the maid cleaned our room, when we arrived back to pack all of our change was gone, we didn't have time to wait to check out and speak to reception as the queues were large so we used express checkout and decided we would email the missing money complaint in, we emailed 3 addresses as we were unsure who would deal with the situation, a week later still no response.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location/Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Nevada1957
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked the Monte Carlo Resort on a close friends recomendation as well as Trip Advisor reviews. We had a wonderful time at Las Vegas, not being big gamblers we more were interested in sightseeing and dinning. The Monte Carlo is connected to the Aria and Bellagio via a free tram located in the back of the resort, this saved a lot of time & walking allowing us to go to various resorts for dinner during our stay. Room was very nice and the staff at the front desk was very helpful. The sports pub at the Monte Carlo is a GREAT place to watch any sporting event.

Reviews.Title: “VERY BASIC - dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: LoniK
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights there just recently in rooms advertized as STRIP VIEW??? Our view consisted of roof tops, parking lot and noisy a/c units. DISSAPOINTING!!!. Hotel didn't offer any coupons, promotions or incentives for local spa or Any Monte Carlo facilities. It would make sense to keep their Guests entertained without leaving Monte Carlo. We were awakened at 8:30 am by knocking housekeeper, rooms are very basic and noisy, very uncomfortable pillows, noisy, acustic bathrooms. When we checked-inn carpet was wet in our room# 27225. We made reseervations 2 weeks ahead with request of 2nd room to be close by, we were put on 2 seperate floors! Inconenient!!! At $80 per night we had much better stay at Excalibur or Luxor.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: violator98765
Reviews.Content: I think the Monte Carlo may be the best value and location on the strip. I stayed here Nov 18-21st and had a great time. I felt the staff was very friendly, the rooms were nice and the tables were reasonable. Plus it is part of the MGM properties so you can use your MLife card. The only bad thing I would say is that their towels stunk.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: oldrocker47
Reviews.Content: Some reviews are neg but enjoyed the stay very nice hotel very good staff

Reviews.Title: “Great room, good value”
Reviews.Author: micklisa
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Monte Carlo November 13-16. The stay was good, and the room was clean, and the beds were very comfortable.I would stay at the MC again.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this dump!”
Reviews.Author: BozoNanno
Reviews.Content: Totally overrated and just a tired old hotel. To make matters worse, they had the gall to charge a "resort fee." Pleez. Avoid and stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Laminated1
Reviews.Content: I arrived early in the morning and was given a room immediately. I was in my room at 9:00 am. My room (18th floor), was clean and comfortable but average. TV was a 42" flat screen. Bathroom was good sized, plenty of hot water and the best water presssure I've ever experienced in Vegas. The view from the room overlooked the pool area, the Aria and the Viva Elvis Theatre. The wave pool and the lazy river pool are under remodel construction and was closed to the public. I only ate in the buffet in this hotel. Food was average but the service was very good. Most of the restaurants have an area that faces out to the casino. During the times that they were open, they all looked quite empty. On the other hand, the Food Court was packed 24/7. The hotel has a monorail that takes you to the Aria, Crystals, Vdara and Bellagio. The slot machines and video poker just "gobbled" up the money as fast as I put it in the machines. I spoke to a few locals who were playing poker at the hotel and they informed me the Monte Carlo is not the place for slotS and VP. The staff at the hotel were all very friendly. They were approachable and very willing to help make the visit an enjoyable one. I would stay again because the staff is so professional and the rooms were comfortable but I won't gamble there.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Rooms, value for money”
Reviews.Author: alplan
Reviews.Content: Large clean rooms, good value for the price, nothing out of the ordinary. Well located on the strip for getting around. I would rather stay at the Paris but we went with a group & the rest had booked at the Monte Carlo so we went with the flow. I had to stand my ground to get the deluxe strip view we had booked & paid for, the couple booking in next to us didn't & got a lower room with no recompense even though they had prepaid. The strip view is limited as the hotel is set back. The room had an adjoining door which made for a noisy stay as there seemed to be a crowd of youngsters next door. Some hotels put in a sound panel, but the Monte Carlo obviously don't! I don't think I would stay here again, but if you got a good deal then go for it!

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: h1stein
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the end of Aug 2011. This was a paid business trio that I extended into an extra 3 days for personal. After reading a few reviews I decided on a Monte Carlo suite because they were bigger and it was for 6 days. I was not expecting a new car smell and fancy fixtures so I was very happy with a clean room with lots of space and a reasonable living area. A few people mentioned how loud the pool was but it is only until 6 while we were there and it wasn't really that loud. I had a great time in the wave pool, lazy river and regular pool so I guess it depends on your expectations. Not a gambler so can't help you there but it did not seem that busy while we were there. I would stay clear of the in house fast food places and just run across the street although the pub had reasonable food and we ate in the breakfast buffet just about every day. Enjoyed the atmosphere at diablo's during the day and also during the evening. Overall I enjoyed this place and especially how central it was to other spots of interest. Viva Las Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Great all-rounder - Spa Suite”
Reviews.Author: mobeverton
Reviews.Content: Not our original selection but the money we saved switching from the Bellagio IMO was well worth it. Great location - connected to City Center and Bellagio with monorail. Not the best equiped hotel but with the new City Center a short walk through the hotel its has it all very close by. We used the monorail quite a few times and it was very easy and ultimately very helpful as we sepent a fair bit of our time in the Bellagio, Cosmo and Aria. I expected the room and casino to be tired and a bit grotty and was soooo wrong. Yes the rooms need a bit of a touch up but they where extremly clean and above all comfortable. The bed was the best of any hotel I had stayed in and the spa tub in the room over looking the strip was a big bonus. Checkin/out where super quick - one major gripe was the $200 deposit we had to pay which I knew nothing about on top of the $15/night resort fee (which I was aware of). The $200 is actually taken from your account and then refunded - which in a sense is sad as we get charged for using our credit card and also get hit by the bank as its a UK card! But the above was a very minor quibble and loved this hotel. Its not themed, or overly plus or high end but very comfortable - thats the best word I can use to describe it. The Casino was good for us first timers, who in all honestly where a little nervous about the gambling and the etiquate that applies. We needant of worried though as the staff were very helpful and friendly and explained all the rules with patient and vigour. The waitress service was also one of the best/quickest we recived - second to the MGM Grand. We only ate at the Pub (seperate review) which was great food and again excellent service. The food court was convienient but avoid the McDonalds as they simply dont have a clue! We never ate in the other restaurants as we didnt like the way they all looked onto the casino which is a little smokey.............I smoke myself but to be honest dont like smoke around my food as I have never smoked in my house and thought the smoking ban was a great idea. We did visit the Brand nighclub in the wee hours which was a blast - only small and about $20 each to get in but girls drink free and the cost for my drinks were not excessive. They were renovating the pool area when we were there (mid Nov) and you could see areas that were to recieve a make over. I can honestly say that this was a good place to stay at and would stay again - if on a budget. The above mentioned link the City Center really done it for us as it was convient. Room service also was decent - again not too pricey for food (drinks a different matter!) and tasty - had the Phili Cheesesteak, was yummy. Great location to visit strip as you have Bellagio, Venetian (our fav), Ceasars TI to the north and NYNY, Luxor and Mandalay Bay to the south. Top tip - if you get a suite with a bar, as we did, there is a CVS, Walgreens and a Liquor store facing/next to hotel. Go there and stock up on ale/wine as its a lot cheaper. There is a fridge in the room, ice machine on the floor by the elevators and also a water/soda dispensor by ice machine. The CVS is to the left as you leave the front of the hotel, the Walgreens and Liour store are on the other side of the road facing the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wow strip view room”
Reviews.Author: krisy82
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel way cheap. I didn't know what to expect but was very impressed. Definitely will stay here again. Our view overlooked the m&m world and coke.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay again”
Reviews.Author: sara09
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a business conference, and did not choose the hotel, but would not pay to stay here. While the staff is pleasant, check in and concierge service is painfully slow. The rooms are decent size, but everything about them screams "cheap" - the horrendous light fixtures, the ever present cheap perfume smell, the low quality linens and the stains on the carpet. Unlike other reviewers, I did not find the beds particularly comfortable, and the pillows even less so. And...the neverending loop of video in the elevator about the current shows drove everyone in our group insane! The location is good though, and the fact that the you don't have to walk through the ENTIRE casino to get to the Starbucks at 6:30 in the morning is better than some other hotels in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Good middle-to-lower tier hotel on the strip”
Reviews.Author: sactokw
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for plush, this is not the place. If you are looking for lower cost, fairly clean, good location on the Strip (fairly central and happening area of the Strip), then this is the place. Check in: very slow and disorganized; should be Wendy-styled check in or have faster staff. Parking: Adequate with short bridge on 2nd level to hotel check in. Hotel: stayed on 31st floor with good Strip view (only has 32 floors). Elevators may take some time, but are pretty fast. Room: Thin walled, so if you are light sleeper, bring ear plugs. Has lockbox in closet (very convenient). Lighting was adequate. TV flat screen (no premium channels). Bed: Comfortable with adequate pillows. Bathroom: Fairly clean. OK toiletries (shampoo/conditioner/soaps/lotion). Toilet: Strong vacuum flush (always good). Shower: Non-adjustable shower head setting, but adequate water pressure with some (mild) temperature variance during the shower. Resort fee: $15/day plus tax; gym, newspaper, "wired" internet, boarding pass printing (not worth it if you ask me, but lower than other MGM properties). Gym: Pretty good size with about 8 treadmills and 8 bikes, some free weight and a lot of machine. Spa use will require extra pay. Pool: One heated pool with hot tub opened in November. Wave pool and lazy river pool closed. Restaurants: Dragon Noodle (Chinese) has $10 lunch special which is not bad. Did not do Buffet or other restaurants. Has good food court with McDonald, Starbucks, Rubios, Sbarro, Subway, Ice cream place, and Chinese fast food. Casino: OK games; lighting is a little dark in Casino. BJ with 2 decks (S17) in High limit room only (minimum is $100, but I also saw minimum at $50 at times); only one 8 deck shoe with S17 in general casino area. Linked by walkway to Aria with tram to Bellagio: Convenient if you like more plush to your casino experience. At Aria, BJ had more variety than Monte Carlo. Entry into casino: Has rose perfume smell (can be overwhelming for sensitive people).

Reviews.Title: “Very good for the price.”
Reviews.Author: keshtrini
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed from the 4th to the 8th of November.Location was excellent for the strip and the room was clean and comfortable.The fast food outlets at the food court was most convenient to us and the food was satisfying.All in all ,we would most certainly stay at the Monte Carlo next time we visit Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “If you have perfume allergies stay clear.”
Reviews.Author: Dawndavid
Reviews.Content: When you walk in the hotel you are hit with an over powering fragrance .it's a deodorizer used to cover up cigarette smoke. It gave me an instant headache and nausea The service was terrible and the food in the buffet absolutely awful. The check in staff were slow slow slow. Check in took 45 minutes and the staff not very knowledgeable . This hotel is no bargain but the rooms were clean and the beds comfortable . I wouldn't stay here again far better choices in Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Needs updating - worth it if it's cheap!”
Reviews.Author: ShananiganZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo from November 13-18th. Pros: Okay location for crossing the street and you don't have to walk through the casino if you are using cabs. It was fairly clean and it was only $60 a night so the price was good. Cons: It is a low standard 4 star in my opinion - there are no robes in the room. There is so fridge or mini bar and the toiletries were poor quality. We got average service and when we had a car rental question we waited over 25 minutes only to give up. At night we were approached coming out of the elevator by people offering us "deals". They only had rooms with 2 queens for my husband and I and the elevators were always full of people stopping at every floor(minor annoyances I know). I was happy enough with our stay since it was cheap but won't be staying again regardless of the price. If you want something cheap with an okay location it's a good choice but if you're looking for luxury or any little extras, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, amazing pools!”
Reviews.Author: Djgoldma
Reviews.Content: Most people stay at the newer hotels or in the middle of the strip. The is no need. Monte Carlo is near the Luxor, but it's a 10-15 minute across the strip, no big deal. The pools thre are amazing. They have a wave pool, and a lazy river, both awesome. MGM grand is right across the street, where you can pick up the train as well. Highly recommended !

Reviews.Title: “Ok..not exceptional”
Reviews.Author: Mstish34
Reviews.Content: My husband and I go to Las Vegas a couple of times a year, stayed at the Monte Carlo this time. Our travel agent rant and raved about how great the Monte Carlo was in comparison to other hotels on the strip. It was ok--mediocre at best but not exceptional by far. Beautiful from the outside and gorgeous casino, the rooms are lacking. Location is ok, not really as close as we normally would have been to the free monorail to get from casino to casino but luckily the weather was nice so the walk was great. We attempted to dine at 2 of the resurants there( the japanese and Italian) and the japanese was closed due to lack of staff to open it , so that was un-nerving. Front desk customer service was slow!!! Room service was good once they came to clean our room which was sometimes as late as 6pm. Otherwise a great trip but the Monte Carlo wont be my first pic to stay at

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: mlong68
Reviews.Content: we stayed at Monte Carlo purely due to the cost per night, why else do you pick a hotel in Las Vegas? check in was quick and easy, our room was ready even though we arrived 3 hours early. i had reserved a high floor room, when she offered a lower floor we took it. i don't go to Las Vegas to have a view out the window, i go to have fun outside of the room. So the lower level room was great as the elevator rides were very short. the room itself was in great condition. clean, good decor, everything in working order... however... NO HAIR DRYER OR COFFEE MAKER. not sure if this is a normal thing for Vegas but my wife was not pleased. she got over it though. the tub/shower combo was disappointing a bit, i was hoping for a walk in shower, but i guess they only offer them with their suites. the casino floor was great. bright enough but not too bright. the gaming tables were fun. i would not recommend their sports book, go next door to Aria to watch football as the book in Monte Carlo is not that comfy. the ignite bar at the front of the hotel has an amazing drink, the cable car. it rocks. their restaurants we visited... brand steak house, the pub, and diablos, all were very good, i'd recommend them all. enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great price and beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Alisha S
Reviews.Content: Honestly, dont listen to some people on here, they will whinge about anything!! My Husband and I stayed at The Monte Carlo in Las Vegas for 11 nights for our honeymoon. Our check in was prompt, our room beautiful and clean and we had an amazing view from the 31st floor! The Hotel is in a prime location, close to everything on the strip as well as public transport if you need to get away from the hustle and bustle. We also liked the Monte Carlo because it didnt have too many extra's like nightclubs and hundred's of shops to pull people in off the streets. This meant that there was minimal traffic in the casino and around the elevators making it easier to reach your room. I would highly recommend this place for couples, families, business, anything that brings you to vegas. Dont listen to the haters!!!

Reviews.Title: “Plenty of other places to stay - avoid this”
Reviews.Author: NJ-KAS252
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at this hotel for 5 nights while attending a business convention at another nearby hotel that was sold out. This hotel was recommended by other coworkers as a "quieter" place to stay on the strip. Room did not seem clean and there were large stains on the rug between the beds. Overall stale odor in the room. The only good thing is the window opened just slightly and I didn't need to use the a/c. Hallsways dark and unclean carpet. (Perhaps it is time to use the win from the casino and upgrade!) Used to staying in higher end hotels for business travel but this is certainly not one of them.

Reviews.Title: “What a trip”
Reviews.Author: llaite
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we were greeted in a professioanl manner. We had booked a king size bed however upon arrival we were placed in a room with two queen beds. this was not noted by the front desk on checkin. We should have been told before we went to the room. The room we were provided was well appointed and clean. The location as it relates to the strip was great. We found it to be in a central location and was within a short walking distance or taxi ride of all attractions and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: Matt G
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not right in the middle of the strip but is close to New York New York, Bellagio and MGM Grand so is OK. The rooms are OK but no fridge or coffee/tea making. Casino and shops food places are OK but not brilliant. The team in hotel runs to and from Bellagio and nearby trams run to/from Mandalay Bay, MGM Grand etc. Walking most aces is OK if weather suits. Checkin was very slow and they were not busy! Also I asked to borrow some scissors for 5 minutes in my room and they refused "for security reasons". I then walked 12 meters to the lobby shop and bought a pair of scissors for $6. That is crazy. The concierge lady was a cow as well. All in all a good stay though for the price. It isn't one of the high-profile hotels but it is great to stay at. Rooms are cheap, clean, safe, quiet and you are pretty central to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Not a four star quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: tsushima
Reviews.Content: I think my expectations were a bit too high for this place. The staff had that "meh" attitude- except for Jerry the bellhop (he was super awesome). And they nickeled and dime the hell out of you, the plaster in our room was cracking, we can listen to our neighbor's TV, and the food was over priced and bland. I will admit that the bed was comfy and the gym was well maintained. All in all, it wasn't worth staying for four nights when you can get a great room with better service down the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad Stay”
Reviews.Author: ShyguyFresno
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 11/3 to 11/6 arrived at 11pm on 11/3 check in was a bit of a mess. We got the old bait and switch from the Monte Carlo. We reserved and paid for a N/S Strip Veiw room and what we got was a Smoking with a few of the 15 freeway. What got me though was when the lady at the check in desk handed us the keys we even asked that it was a N/S Strip View and she said yes it was. Why the heck would you say that when you were fully aware of what type of room you were giving us. I will say second visit to the desk the person corrected and moved us right away. Would I stay here again yeah if the rates are right.

Reviews.Title: “Resort Fees??”
Reviews.Author: Jess7Lbc
Reviews.Content: First the good: I like the hotel, the location is wonderful (tram to Bellagio, Aria, etc.), the pool is pretty nice (cool whirlpool, warm pool, and jacuzzi), and the room rates are reasonable. Now the ugly...We put a Do Not Disturb sign on the door because we like our privacy. We returned to the room at around 11pm and the door was open with a housekeeper cleaning away! The Do Not Disturb sign was on the ground. The housekeeper informed us that her manager advised her to enter the room despite the sign. I spoke to the management who did not have any reasonable explanation. To compensate us they refunded us the resort fees which are insane to begin with. There weren't any resort fees the last time I stayed at the Monte Carlo, but apparently this is a popular thing in Vegas now so that hotels can make their rates look deceptively lower. I felt uncomfortable the rest of my stay because I was worried about someone entering my room again.

Reviews.Title: “Not my #1 Las Vegas Choice, but a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: alicemac41
Reviews.Content: So I have my favorite hotel in Las Vegas (Mirage) but we stayed a Thurs and Fri, and there was an event on in Las Vegas so that hotel's room rates were really high, so we tried somewhere else. I've stayed at worse hotels in Las Vegas, and I was happy at this one. Not excellent, might stay again, might not - it did the trick. It's also a little smaller than some of the other hotels, which does has some advantages. Hotel rooms are a little dated but this is what you get for an average "weekend" rate in Las Vegas. The wait to check in frustrated me. There's no formal queue, you just line up behind whatever party is at the counter (after someone came and told us this) and wait....and wait some more...and wait some more. We arrived, it wasn't busy, and were 2nd at the counter, and waited for around 20 minutes. No wifi in the rooms but that's not completely uncommon. Room was spacious, flat screen tv. no fridge or mini bar, I read on another review you can pay for a fridge, but we didn't know that. Bathroom was good, no fan/ventilation though, but the shower was excellent! Great pressure to help you get over the previous night. Bathroom tap was annoying, turn it on and it's full force and water goes everywhere so be carefuly with this! Rooms were clean overall and we were on a non smoking floor. Elevators quick as well. Breakfast buffet was okay, $20 per person, no toast to be found, but an egg making station, and no lines in the morning (some more popular hotels you can wait a bit for a table). We ate lunch at the cafe next to the buffet which was good. They also have Starbucks and McDonalds, a Cupcake place and some others. Casino, a little stale smelling in the mornings from the smoke, but we enjoyed ourselves in there at night. The waitresses with the drinks were a bit inconsistent. One time we waited around 40 minutes before we saw anyone. Location is okay, better than average but there are more centrally located hotels. Keep in mind, just because the hotel "next door" looks close it can still be a 10-15 minute walk. I think they had a tram and monorail to other hotels, but we didn't actually see them or use them. You can walk through to Aria (and go and watch Cirque Elvis) and Bellgio is next door. CVS and Walgreens on the corners also. Service - lose points for long wait in check in and not seeing drinks people at casino Value - again, this was a busy weekend in Vegas, so can't judge the price based on that. Sleep - a little noisy, air conditioning I think...

Reviews.Title: “Functional Hotel/Great Location”
Reviews.Author: scm1133
Reviews.Content: We had a pleasant stay at the Monte Carlo hotel - it was functional and in a great location. The only minor hiccup was the room that we stayed in for our first night - empty shampoo bottles in the bathroom and dirty towels on the racks (we arrived around midnight and didn't notice until the following morning). We moved rooms and the 2nd room was much better than the original. The hotel seemed indifferent about the inconvenience, but comped 2 nights of the resort fee. Pros: Location - easy access walking/tram to nearby hotels and restaurants. Quiet during the week and late late night. $5.00 tables early in the morning. Across the street from half price tickets center. Cons: Not great restaurants (always relatively empty), unhelpful conceirge, and mediocre rooms. It was a functional room - inexpensive, a place to sleep, and helped us see a lot of different casinos while we were in town. I would stay at the hotel in the future if the rates were low.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo Part Duex, We had a Suite time”
Reviews.Author: Mario2k4
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd time staying here, and because of how we were treated the first time, we decided to stay here a second time this year. Also because it was our anniversary, we decided to upgrade to a suite. We were not disappointed the second time around. We stayed at the Monaco Suite. 700 square feet of comfort and convenience. Staying on the 14th floor was nice cause the elevator only had one floor to stop either way and most of the time it was a direct ride. Also we were steps away once off the elevator a plus because of all the walking you do. The couch, the firm yet comfy bed and the flat screen tv all made this experience very special. But after all this what makes Monte Carlo so special is the staff and management. From the minute we arrived till we left we were treated like royalty. That's why the next time we go back, we'll be staying here again. Our Las Vegas home away from home!

Reviews.Title: “The Monte Carlo, Las Vegas - Great Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: ktloves2travel
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at the Monte Carlo Hotel for 3 nights and had a great time. Centrally located on the strip we were equal walking distance to the rest of the hotels. We were able to check-in to our rooms when we arrived at 11. We requested a deluxe view room and got it. Our room was very clean and all the staff we encountered were friendly. The only snag was when we rented a car from the Avis counter within the hotel. It took an hour because the printer wasn't working but other than that I would highly recommend the Monte Carlo.

Reviews.Title: “What a Difference a Year Makes”
Reviews.Author: VincDon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Monte Carlo during the summer of 2010. While the room was nice, but out dated, the customer service was really lacking. Now coming back and staying here in November of 2011, it has gotten a lot better. First off the room I am in is a Deluxe room. It has a decent view of the pool, the Rio, and Aria. The TV is a flatscreen(last time I stayed in a Spa room and it had a tube TV) looks like a 42", The Bed is extremely comfortable, the room is clean and airy. Honestly, even though its been over a year since I stayed in the Spa room, in my opinion the Deluxe room is nicer, and more bang for your buck. The casino itself seems like it is not as smoky as before, but given it is November the crowd does not seem to be as huge as you would find in the summertime.The customer service has greatly improved since last time. Alot of the buffet workers, and even the Players Club workers would be snippy, and give you the look of death when you asked a simple question. This time around I think I have seen alot more smiles, and more good mornings, how are you, yes sir, no sir etc. Honestly I do have to give kudos to the management team here. When I was here last and my review was posted, one of the assistant managers called me literally an hour after it posted. He apologized, and did confirm that one of the biggest complaints was customer service. Well like I said in the title....What a Difference a Year Makes.

Reviews.Title: “Modest rates, good rooms”
Reviews.Author: Superzu
Reviews.Content: Rooms at the hotel are smaller than your average Vegas room but well appointed. The only in-room drawback is that internet access is not wifi, you actually have to hook up your laptop to a cable. The internet access is included in the mandatory resort fee ($15). There is free wifi in the casino area. Staff is very friendly and helpful. The location is not bad, across the street from the MGM and the monorail. There is a free tram to Aria and the Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “An ok hotel but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: lsm_dk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Monte Carlo for 4 days in October with 2 other couples. We stayed here because we had gotten a good price with a discount code but next time we will probably pay a little more and stay at one of the luxury hotels in Vegas since they do not cost that much more. The rooms were fine and clean but there were no WIFI and the hotel seemed somewhat dated. The check-in took a long time even though there were only 2 people in the que in front of us but it seemed they all had some complaints and soon we also had one. We had all requested non-smoking rooms but were informed that they had none available when 4 of us checked in. However when the last couple in our party checked in at another check-in desk 5 minutes later they could get a non-smoking room. We were offered to be moved next day and they promised to hold 2 non-smoking rooms for us even though we could not be back at the hotel and move our stuff before 5 PM (as is usually the requirement at the hotel) because we were going on a day trip to Grand Canyon. When we got back from our trip to Grand Canyon it turned out that the hotel had only held a room for me and my husband but had released the room that were being held for our friends and they were told that now there were no non-smoking room available for them. Fortunately the person we had checked in with the day before and who had held the room for us was at work and could remember her promise so suddenly there was a non-smoking room available after all.

Reviews.Title: “It's a mid-level hotel with a staff that tries really hard.”
Reviews.Author: KollegeKlubMadison
Reviews.Content: Standard room was average, essentially like an airport Sheraton. Nothing special, but the staff was very friendly. I was at a conference in the hotel, and the business staff helped greatly by making sure the boxes and banners were where they were needed. There is really no "elegance" to this property, but if you go in with basic expectations of a clean room and an older casino, they meet them.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for a mid range casino resort”
Reviews.Author: chiqee
Reviews.Content: I've always thought the Monte Carlo was a pretty decent hotel that is mid strip and affordable to stay in. I haven't been back for a 3 years now and I'm glad to report that they have updated their rooms a bit. I forgot how spacious their bathroom was and my king size room was pretty nice. The bed was comfortable and there was a good amount of space to move about. They removed the huge TV/dresser cabinet and tube TV with a smaller dresser and flat screen TV. I stayed two night from Sunday to Tuesday in the beginning of August 2011. I love its location next to the Aria.
