I enjoyed the restaurants there more but for those looking for cheap eats, they have a food court. The walk through the street of dreams is short and goes right to the Aria Casino. The casino area is a good size but not as big as most casinos. They do have their fair share of the latest slot machines. Their table games area is fairly small but I haven't found an issue with finding a place to play. Some of their dealers be a lot moodier than most that I've been too and that's usually my gripe about MC's gaming staff. You either get the friendly ones or the super crabby dealers. It's pretty smokey though so often I walk over to the Aria to play slots. There cocktail service was decent and was consist. I didn't use the pool area but it does get busy. I would stay again since it's so convenient mid strip. CVS (next door), Walgreens (a block up the street) and the ABC store (across the street from Diablos) is fairly close. I think the resort fees were a bit high for you were getting. There was internet but no WIFI so it wasn't helpful if you just was travelling with your smartphone, only for people with laptops. I would consider returning and plan to in Feb next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice room, great service!”
Reviews.Author: sj7
Reviews.Content: We booked a spa suite for our 7th trip to Vegas, when we got to our room which was awesome, we saw a door by the headboard of the bed, thinking it was a closet, I opened it and realized that it was an adjoining door as the guy next door yelled out at me! That was not going to to work for us! We called down right away and asked for a non-adjoining room which we were informed all the spa suites were adjoining, which if not by the bed we may have been ok with it. We asked about the next level of room which was a diamond suite and they gave it to us for 25.00 per night which we gladly accepted! The front desk was great, there was some minor little problems when we changed rooms so she ended up waiving our resort fees for the 4 days which worked out almost even for us! Yes, the rooms are tired and in need of some updates, our shower had some black marks on the ceiling, no fan in the bathroom that we could find, but the room made up for the worn carpets and not so upscale amenities but the price is right. What bothered me the most is that the room was big and comfortable, yes there were marks on the carpet in some spots but that is from people who have stayed there, I just don't understand how people can be so careless as to ruin such a beautiful room! We loved the room, we had a nice view of NYNY and the mountains. The room was large and the jetted giant bathtub was fantastic! The maid service was great, we would come in after a long day and night and our robes were folded on our bed, the tv was on the channel with the fish tank which I found most relaxing after a long day and night, chocolates on our bed. We asked for a new robe as one of them seemed like it was worn and just hung up and that was easily replaced, we asked for flatter pillows and got those instantly. The employees we had contact with were great, especially Georgina at the front desk, she was supposed to be off work but stayed to finish off our room change as I mentioned above, there was a couple of things that went sideways when we went down to change rooms and she wanted to make sure it all went right for us. It was great having a fridge, saved us from filling the bathroom sink with ice! We loved the casino, it had lots of great games and liked that it was not a long walk to get anywhere once you got off the elevator. The pool was open but we did not bring our bathing suits so that was a dissapointment, I would have went in as the water was warm and the weather was not too bad! I would definitely stay there again. Anyone have any questions please send me a message and I will answer them if I can!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: RayleighTasha_1985
Reviews.Content: Decided to stay here as it was the cheapest strip view room we found of the major strip hotels. Location is good - it's not at the end of the strip, just off centre really. Is a ten minute walk to Bellagio and the hotel runs a free tram to Mandalay bay and Bellagio. No wifi in rooms on wired Internet so bring a laptop! Wifi available in casino though. No fridge in room you can request one for $25 per night. Reason I didnt give 5 stars for location is only because it's not the most central, would probably choose Paris or Caesars or Venetian next time and just pay a bit more! Room was clean but a bit tired in places hence 4 stars for that. Overall though was pleased with room we got for the price, especially as valet parking was free!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place”
Reviews.Author: 1954kaya
Reviews.Content: Apriori Beauty, an awesome skin care company, held their first conference/celebration at this hotel this week (Nov). I am a consultant with this company and all good at the Monte Carlo! The best beds, food and staff with our celebration were awesome. You definitely need to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: GordandPeggy
Reviews.Content: The rooms are somewhat dated, but clean. Staff everywhere in the hotel are very helpful, particularly in housekeeping. Like many Las Vegas hotels, the hotel can be a bit overwhelming until you become accustomed to getting around. As we ate at many restaurants on the strip, we never had the opportunity to eat at the restaruants in the Monte Carlo other than The Pub and Cafe. Both provided very good food and service. Beds were comfortable and windows opened so you could have both fresh and air conditioned air at night. Bathrooms were okay. However, the next time I go to Vegas, I'll be looking for an adult friendly hotel. Parents who bring their infants, toddlers and young children to Vegas astounds me. Vegas is not Disneyland!

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelming”
Reviews.Author: TOgirl47
Reviews.Content: I was generally underwhelmed with my experience at the Monte Carlo. While the rooms are of a decent size and have comfortable beds, everything else falls a bit short. The bathrooms are tired and in desperate need of some updates. A single shallow old style sink doesn't cut it anymore, and the amenities were poor. You only recieve Shampoo and Body Wash, Conditioner was delievered after a call - this should be an automatic part of the amenities to begin with. The housekeeping service was shoddy at best - we stayed for 5 nights and every single day they tried to just drop off towels and leave. A piece of paper from the soap wrapper remained on the floor the entire week - we easily could have thrown it out, but I was interested to see if the floors were cleaned at all, which they clearly weren't. The amenities were not refreshed without a call to the front desk, and we routinely recevied a large pile of towels either left in the middle of the counter or stacked in a chair in the room. I used to be a house keeper at a similarly-classed hotel, and found the service very disappointing. The hotel lobby is nice as is the casino and various restaurants/bars on the property. I thought the pool area was a bit of a let down with old, dirty sun loungers crammed together like sardines. The resort fee is a joke and the message you received when accessing wifi the lobby (since it is unavailable in the rooms) is maddening: "This WIFI service is available complimentary as part of your resort fees". Who would pay $50 for access to 'complimentary' wifi in a static location? What is the resort fee for? Access to the pool area, where you can't so much as walk in with a cup of water. To be honest, stay somewhere else. I had a fabulous time because of the people I was there with - the Monte Carlo was the only downside of the whole trip.

Reviews.Title: “Lively pool area but dated hotel”
Reviews.Author: GibbsintheCity
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Monte Carlo hotel in August 2011 with my two children (7 and 10). I chose the hotel because of the wave pool and lazy river in the pool area - which lived up to expectations. The children loved the pool area although the pool party started at 12pm and some competitions were Club 18-30 style. We did have to pay for the rings for the lazy river and couldn't take our own bottled water to the pool. Our room was dated and quite bare. We tried the buffet breakfast on our first morning and while you could eat as much as you wanted, the food was not good quality. We ate at the McDonalds the next morning. We ate at the Italian restaurant one night which was better and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem!”
Reviews.Author: LumpyMinnesota
Reviews.Content: Carlos at check in was very friendly and helpful. The casino is beautiful and exotic and charming. The buffet was excellent. The room was nice and cute but a little dated, only in that it's not as fancy and hip as the newer mega resorts such as the Venetian, Wynn or Cosmopolitan etc..But the cost is also much cheaper than those places. It seems like the Monte Carlo just sort of gets forgotten in the mix of all the new fancy hotels, especially since it's very near City Center and Bellagio. But their service was as good as any of those fancy 5-star properties. In summary, the Monte Carlo is a great value for the money, has clean rooms, a very nice casino and pool, a great location and very friendly staff. I will stay at the Monte Carlo again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but no more”
Reviews.Author: Pauldolling
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in June 2011, I have to say that I wasn't that impressed. We weren't allowed to take our own bottled water to the pool, we had to buy their water fom around the pool bar at vastly inflated prices. Also they had a Mc Donald's in their food court and the prices were so much higher than normal, I asked the staff in Mc Donald's and they said the pricing was dictated from the resort. Overall I felt that the hotel was ok but I wouldn't return, having stayed at other hotels in Vegas, there are better choices. Rooms were clean.

Reviews.Title: “Decent but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Loveformargaritas
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Vegas and a 3-night stay at the Monte Carlo. The hotel is nice, but the rooms are starting to show wear. There were several stains on the carpet and walls. The bed was comfortable but did not have a comforter on it. This is ok (since they're never cleaned anyway) but it made for a cold night. We had to crank up the heat to sleep comfortably. Compared to other places I've stayed in Vegas, I found the walls to be very thin at the Monte Carlo. Even with the air on, I heard noises all night...alarm clocks going off, shower/toilet sounds, loud neighbors, etc. Some noise is to be expected, but I thought the MC was really noisy. If you're looking for a place to rest your head while you party and see the sights in Vegas, the Monte Carlo will do and can be had at a reasonable price. However, next time we go to Vegas, we'll stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - rooms to be renewed”
Reviews.Author: magstk72
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is quiet good. The Casion in the hotel is nice. Bars and restaurant is also ok. BUT: The rooms must be renewed! Old furniture, old bathroom, old carpets, no space for clothing. Conclusion: good hotel, hotel room are only average. Actually too expensive. Rates must be lower. Actually also the resort fee should not be charged extra. The resort fee can easily be canluated with the total room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Clean neat and tidy with a central strip location”
Reviews.Author: Lisa P
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo is conveniently located near the middle of the strip. We found the staff to be friendly and helpful, the rooms clean and tidy though the furniture is getting a little tired. The eateries within the casino were reasonably priced and as you are centrally located if you could not get what you wanted in the hotel everything is only a short walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Excently located”
Reviews.Author: fussy43
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights and was very pleased with the environment. The beds are the best that I have slept in when staying in a hotel. There are plenty of eatery's within the hotels location. Reception staff and very helpful. My only complaint is that the decor needs updating.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: pamela c
Reviews.Content: We have travelled 3 times to Vegas.This was our second time at the Monte Carlo. Our first visit was to the Mirage, which was very good, but the M.C. is our favourite. The staff, rooms and facilities are all exceptional value for the rates charged. The location of the hotel and size of the casino are both plus points. We are hoping to return again in2012. Only thing we found uncomfortable this year was the strict rule of no drinks from the hotel at the pool side. I understand the Hotel not wanting guest to take crates of beer etc on to the pool side, but surely a Coffee or drink bought from the Hotel isn't a problem. We witnessed several rows between pool staff and guests, which doesn't lend itself to a relaxing pool visit.....perhaps this strict rule could be looked at.

Reviews.Title: “Nice spot in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Chren
Reviews.Content: We found the Monte Carlo hotel very good. Our only disappointment was that there are no tea/coffee making facicities in the rooms with the options being room service or get one in the food court below, This seem to be common with most Vegas hotels. But apart from that everything else was made our stay in Vegas a pleasant one.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value”
Reviews.Author: Quickfoot
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Monte Carlo for 6 nights in Oct 2011 with 5 friends. Out of all the major 4-5 star casino & resorts on the Strip, the MC lacks a bit of luster (City Center, MGM Grand, Bellagio are much more extravagant), but provide excellent value as they offer significantly cheaper prices than the others. The free skytram to Aria/Crystal/Cosmopolitan and Bellagio make travelling to other areas of the Strip easy. Food court was a great, cheap alternative for 4AM munchies but for restaurants, you're better off in the neighboring resorts. Overall a great expereince, and convenient location make it a great value if you don't want to splurge on top end resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas Again!”
Reviews.Author: Karen S
Reviews.Content: This is our second time staying here, and we chose it again, as we liked the proximity to everything, and the price was great too. the only thing we dont' agree with was the "Resort Fee" which was just an added cost for using the pool area, which we didn't use... i feel they should attract that fee from those frequenting it. that will factor in when choosing our next stay in LV !! Across the road, is a pharmacy which has a large variety of everything.Also across the road there is a show ticket office if you need tickets at the last minute. these prices were cheaper, but as with last minute bookings you may miss a show you really would like to see. Apart from that we enjoyed the Monte Carlo, the service is great, we had trouble with opening and using the safe in our room, within 10mins of our call to the front desk, the lady was there opening and show us how to use it, so happy with that.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and good location”
Reviews.Author: sportyroo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo for a long weekend with friends in October 2011. Although we booked 2 rooms in the same booking we were down the opposite ends of the long corridor. Not really an issue but if you are hoping for rooms close together request this when you book. The room was a decent size with 2 queen beds which were very comfy and the bathroom had a nice shower with good pressure. We were surprised at how quiet the room was. No fridge in the room but there is an ice bucket and an ice machine and vending machine by the lifts. There is an iron and lots of coathangers in the room. Also has a safe. The hotel is in a good location, beside the City Centre and there are a nice selection of shops within the Monte Carlo. Service was very good but avoid the concierge in the morning when people are booking tours, the queues are long. CVs is next door and it's 24/7 so you can buy snacks and anything else you fancy. No wi-fi in the room which is a bit annoying but they have it in the foodcourt by Starbucks and McDs. Also we were disappointed to see the $15/night resort fee was charged to our credit card after our stay. I don't recall them mentioning this at check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good location!”
Reviews.Author: Becky2011_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo for 3nights the beginning on Oct 2011. When we arrived we were checked in quickly and our room was spacious clean and had a very large bed! We ate twice within the hotel at the bar and at d vino both good food although d vino a little more expensive. We also ate at the Cafe for breakfast which was very good. Hotel staff very helpful when we had to ring tour companies to confirm pick ups etc.. We would recommend staying at the Monte Carlo.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing 2 Nights in Vagas”
Reviews.Author: Autogenesis
Reviews.Content: Welcome to Monte Carlo world of greeness and fun which contrasts sharply to my first impression and experience when I checked into Hilton at Las Vagas 2 years ago. I checked into this hotel on the 1st November 2011 having just arrived from Nigeria via New York to attend the 2011 AAPEX/SEMA trade fair and right from the beginning I had a feeling that this second visit to Las Vagas will be full with space. Reception was wonderful at the front office and you will feel belonging to this massive place. I entered the Room 9-102 at about 12:25 ET and behold I stood there overwhelmed with space, touch of class and exciting well layout facilities. From the guest toilet through the wide screen TV seating quitely infront of an exquisite sofa to the kingsize bed, a private reading table down to the comfort stations, you will have a feeling that you are been treated like a crown prince. The green policy of this hotel is clearly spelt out in a small label place in the room showing that the hotel in environmentally friendly. Check out this...if you place the linen on the rack after use it means you want to re-use, but if on the floor, that means you want it replaced, that is quite innovative; etc The staff at Monte Carlo hotel, from the front office, to the security; from the house keepers to the shop keepers are warm and friendly and they deserves a great meaure of thanks for their willingness and readiness to be of assistance at all times. Casino and gambling life is very active and lively and it is like a 24-hour fun fair involving a whole lot of people cutting across age and genda, you see all manners of people going about their "business" without any hinderance. If you are on business trip and you are not through yet with your business but must check out of your room, you can safely drop your baggages for safe keeping after checking out and come back for it later.

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: naspadoni
Reviews.Content: My two friends and I stayed at the Monte Carlo Oct 27 to 31st. 2011. We had three rooms and all were excellent, clean, the beds were very comfortable. The check-in was quick and easy. The Monte Carlo being smaller then most on the strip was perfect. The staff are very helpful and friendly. The shuttle to other hotels is right down the hall. I will stay there again when I return to Las Vegas. The pool area was nice, women change room was clean.

Reviews.Title: “6 out of 10 score”
Reviews.Author: LISAMARIE1212
Reviews.Content: The rooms were ok but we know what we were getting considering what we paid for it. The main reason we stayed here was the location! There is a free tram that takes you to the nicer hotels aria and bellagio that is inside monte carlo so you dont have to walk on las vegas blvd as much. We spent majority of our time at aria and bellagio and just slept at monte carlo. When we arrived at the hotel and went to check in the agents were none informative didnt even tell us how to get to the room we had to stand in line and ask concierge since the line was shorter. We stopped by the concierge desk later that day to ask for dinner suggestions and the guy we spoke to (cant remember his name) seemed irritated that we didnt know where we wanted to dine. He made us feel incompitant we just asked for a magazine and decided to figure it out ourself. After that experience we didnt want to go back so we called mirage to buy show tickets. We were not sure where mirage was so I decided to ask concierges on the way out of the hotel since the guy was now gone. The gal we spoke with (sameena) was very nice and pulled out a map for how to get to mirage and asked us what we planned on going to do there I told her to pick up tickets she said she could print them out for me all she needed was my ID she gave us the tickets and even offered resturant suggestions (without us asking and without making us feel stupid!!!) she was just wonderful and full of information. We had dinner at brand the food was pretty good but the service was terribly slow, we had reservations for 530 and got seated right away but it took a long time for a server to come and take our order. We both ordered steak and didnt think it would take that long for it to get made. We waited and waited and waited the server kept disapearing for long periods of time when he finally came back we had to stop him and ask him where the food was and he rushed past and said he will check. 5 minutes later the food arrived it was a little cold but tasted great. We asked for the check right away assuming that would take a long time that came quickly and that was the only time our server took the time to ask us how everything was and hoped we had a great dinner (of course because he wanted a good tip) typical! We had the same exact experience the next day at the their mexican cantina the service was slow the servers were rude and the food was bland. The only good thing was the margaritas. I think this hotel should focus on service at their restaurants we noticed they were always empty and the food court was always full. This hotel has no WiFi in the rooms I found this hard to believe we paid a resort fee including internet but it was for a plug connection?!!! Who doesnt have wireless available? I was told by the bell desk they have wireless at starbucks in the hotel so why am i paying to use internet in the room when its free at starbucks and its wireless???! Makes no sense. overall I would give this hotel 6/10 the only reason why I would stay there is the location save the money the better hotels.

Reviews.Title: “It did the job”
Reviews.Author: Bob-Carol-Hedland
Reviews.Content: We thought it represented good value for “the strip” The rooms were big with 2 queen beds, a more than adequate bathroom; it was quiet and comfortable. As with any hotel that size, you can be lucky on checking in as we were, with nobody else waiting, but we did have to wait a fair time to ask the concierge some questions. The only niggle was a lack of a laundry, unless you wanted to use the bell hop service, but this appears to be common complaint, so unless you have your car, you have to get yourself out to the suburbs somehow.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: Pascal G
Reviews.Content: Lots of positives for the Monte Carlo! First of all, its one of the cheapest Resorts on the actual Las Vegas strip! So top-notch location! ON the strip next to all the other big ones like New-York, City Center, Bellagio, MGM etc.. The resort is really nice, large casino, great nice and clean rooms! The shops and eateries in the shopping street inside the resort was a great added bonus! Oh plus, the ran a free monorail service from Monte Carlo to City Center and to Bellagio which was great! The only downsides I would have to mention is that there is only 2 or 3 main restaurants in the resort and they are all very expensive. Also, there is a hidden "resort" fee that they charge for everyday you stay there. If you dont know about it it can come as a surprise at the end of your visit. And lastly, the pool and whole outdoors was closed when we went. It wasnt THAT warm but compared to Canada I wouldve still taken a swim ;) All and all, a great resort, good staff, nice rooms, clean and perfect location. I would definetly recommend to people.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms need renovating”
Reviews.Author: imacubsfan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Monte Carlo over Halloween weekend (2011). The hotel location is great, the casino and amenities are ok, the rooms are not so good. When we arrived, there were stains all over the beds white comforter. We called and this was taken care of within 15 minutes. The bathrooms were disgusting. The wallpaper was peeling back and there was black mold underneath it & the shower head had mildew built up all over it. I called and asked to switch rooms after this and was told that there were no rooms available. We didn't pay that much for the room, so we just dealt with it. I am just not sure how this place maintains a 4 Diamond rating with AAA?? I would probably not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Three "Aussie" loved stay at Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: robbie308
Reviews.Content: Return visit to L/Vegas and we thought the Monte Carlo was fine, of course for lots more Dollars we could have stayed at a more "up-market" casino / hotel, but M/C was fine. The Monaco Suite room was spacious and we really enjoyed the extra space and comfy beds. The main plus for me was that my room *(Level 3) was very quiet and perfect to escape the las Vegas madness and noise, a real oasis!. The pool area was great and the food court handy for that quick snack. Certainly would NOT recommend anywhere at Monte Carlo for breakfasts thank god for the buffet at Aria ($17.50) possibly the best I have ever experienced anywhere except perhaps in Asia. Monte Carlo is well positioned on the strip and if you can pre-book some time ahead as we did and avoid busy "convention " times, we got a great deal. Robert.

Reviews.Title: “Great time, great service, lose slots”
Reviews.Author: DUPS14
Reviews.Content: We had a great time playing and drinking on the casino floor. There are dancers, the waitress we had was great, and we won a couple jackpots. Not the highest profile place on the strip, but seems to always provide good times. Well worth a stop on the way into Aria.

Reviews.Title: “Great room and chilled out hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Coopergreg
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a spa suite for two nights at the end of our holiday. The room was better than expected - absolutely huge, with a large hot-tub, kitchenette/bar area, sofa, plus the shower room. The view was great from the 31st floor. Check in was quick and efficient, but when I asked about Wi-Fi in the room was told there wasn't any. When we got to the room we found there was! We ate in the Chinese restaurant in the hotel which was fantastic. The second night we walked across the the Aria and had dinner in the buffet - food was brilliant! There are not many 'tourist attractions' in the Monte Carlo, which makes it a chilled out hotel. The only negatives were that we had to call for room service to vacuum the room as soon as we arrived, and the wait for the lifts was really long on many occasions. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but lacking otherwise”
Reviews.Author: ilovemygsd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo in 2007 and were really happy with the room, etc. I don't know if our expectations have gotten higher as we've stayed at other properties in Las Vegas or if it has gone downhill since then. Overall the room was clean. The drains in the tub and the sink backed up. There was peeling wallpaper. There were random holes in the wallpaper that had been sort of covered over. It just looked a little shabby. The pillows were too fluffy - this is just a matter of preference, I know. There was a q tip inside the armoire and it wasn't ours - gross. A glass was outside our door when we checked in and it remained until the next afternoon. Our needs were met, but they definitely weren't exceeded. The location is good, but I don't know that we'll stay here again. One of the perks was The Cupcakery that is inside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Had a good stay with No problems.”
Reviews.Author: NRosenbaum
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the location for a weekend stay in Vegas. Everything was fine. Check in on a Friday night about 7pm could not of been better! Walked right up to the registration/check in with no one in front of us. Great. Our room the Monaco suite, was just fine. Lots of room and very clean. Yes the furniture was chipped and the couch a bit worn and could use an upgrade but we just over looked that. The towels in the bathroom could be softer for sure. The bed was comfortable, the pillows a bit too big for me. All small things, and would not keep us from returning. The bath and a half was great. Bathrooms were very clean in our room. Pretty quiet in our room location. Might of been just lucky there.

Reviews.Title: “Our anniversary stay at the Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: rogersrunners
Reviews.Content: We stayed seven nights at this property and enjoyed every minute of it ...the staff were friendly and pleasant ...the tram for the strip was handy ..........the room was spacious and clean and our view was great ...we had family members stay here as well to help us celebrate our fifty years married and all in all was an absolutely wonderful...and Oh yes thanks for the bottle of wine waiting for us in our room upon arrival Roger & Lorieta from Dieppe New Brunswick

Reviews.Title: “monte carlo las vegas amazing”
Reviews.Author: sheila2341
Reviews.Content: First time in Vegas,was just amazing..Monte Carlo was great, price wise and walking around the sites.We went in almost all the hotels and Monte Carlo was the best designed . Nothing was too far and getting to the rooms was not a maze.There was a walk light not far which is far and few between on the strip. The room, staff and all the facilities were great and so was the price.I would highly recomend this hotel again and will be back. The Aria buffet must be the best kept secret in Vegas..It was amazing for under 40:00 a person with all the wine included...There was lobster,crab legs,shrimp make your own pasta,prime rib,chicken and desserts...wow.Dicks restaurant in the Excalibur is just toooo much..fun.you have to go.Mon Ami Gabi was great and we waited for the patio and got to see the light show at the Bellagio..wow.We renewed our vows (25) years at the Elvis Chapel...They were so accomating and it was so much fun.That Elvis was great and funny well worth the money..We also went to see Pawn Stars.Just like TV show the son and nephew were there and they were taping a show..Went to the Chart House Restaurant in the Golden Nugget just amazing, the aquarime view was just great, and the prices and value were great. We then went to Fremont street to finish the party..Wow amazing light show, drinks were cheap, did'nt win on the slots but had a blast.We have to go back to Vegas because our 6 days there we still did'nt see everything..can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Free tram from bottom of hotel but no WIFI in room”
Reviews.Author: Helenww
Reviews.Content: Good location on the strip as near the middle and there is a free tram which starts from Monte Carlo and stops off at some of the big hotels along the strip and runs until 3am. No WIFI in room which was disappointing as picked this hotel to use the internet. The Internet that was available was through a cable. Starbucks at bottom of hotel did however provide WIFI. Stayed in a standard double room which was of similar quality to the Luxor (slightly cheaper hotel). Wave machine swimming pool was fun and good availability of sunbeds and I even used the volley ball court. Nice variety of food within the hotel and situated next to a pharmacy which was useful to buy extra sun cream. Taxi available from outside the hotel but beware as they took us the long way round to get to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, great location, best happy hours”
Reviews.Author: Tatewick
Reviews.Content: This is the only hotel I stay at in Vegas. It has a great location, close enough to all the action but not right in the thick as to be overwhelmed. Your connected to City Center which is all you need. A tram going from Monte to Ballagio, it's perfect. And the price is always pretty good. Be sure you're signed up with MLife. The rooms aren't really anything to brag about, but you're not going be in them anyway so who cares. They have a luxury you can stay at if that's what you're looking for. Small casino, but lots of eateries and bars with what seems to be infinite happy hours. You can spend for 3pm - 8pm doing happy hours alone here with all the places they have. It's a good launchpad for your Vegas vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is ok, nothing special.”
Reviews.Author: martin4711
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a conference at Monte Carlo Resort, got 50% discount which made the place worth staying. Rooms were fine, half of the pool area was under construction.

Reviews.Title: “Still a great place for your dollar”
Reviews.Author: nvayupak
Reviews.Content: This is the first time we ever stayed at the Monte Carlo Resort and Casino. Usually we never stay anything south of the Las Vegas strip. But due to high price booking for hotel stays north of the strip we decided to look elsewhere. Ergo Monte Carlo Resort and Casino. From our search we were able to acquire this nice room with a strip view for less than half of the price compared to a resort hotel casino north of the strip. We were very pleased with the service upon check-in. Very quick and informative, which we like. As for the room, I have to say it was very nice and especially clean. The beds are very comfortable and come with nice soft pillows. The bathroom is very clean as well, which also comes with your typical cleaning and washing supplies. As for the entertainment units, they are up to date with the latest and greatest LCD TV. If you are looking for something inexpensive with access quick to CVS, Tram connection and walking distance to other major hotel and casino resort. Consider Monte Carlo, because this place is a really save for your hard earn dollar.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: Saskia_8
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in september and were quite pleased with the hotel. It's centrally located on the strip, so it's very easy to check out all the casinos. The hotel room was spacious with 2 queens, allthough the decor was a bit bland. The pool area was not very large, but sunbeds were abundant and I never had a problem finding one. We dined at André's, which was excellent (wine list was overpriced, but I must admit it was the best wine i've tasted on several trips to the US, and well you're in Las Vegas). The foodcourt was not very extensive, but the Mexican was very good. I was not impressed by their concierge service, they are very much interested in selling you show tickets to one of the affiliated casinos, but after waiting in a line for 15 minutes I was advised that the only option to go to North Las Vegas Outlets was by taxi. Since there is a cheap shuttle bus available (that I managed to locate on my own on the strip), i can only conclude they only wish to offer good advise when they can make money on it. That's oke, just don't stand in line for budget friendly advise. All in all; excellent location, nice room, good dining options, nice pool and all for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “The Vegas Casino Time Forgot.”
Reviews.Author: COBBCITY
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a visit that included Monte Carlo. Even more than the last time I was in Vegas… Monte Carlo continues to fade. It needs major remodeling and updating, is set back from the strip, it’s facilities are small compared to it’s neighbors and now it sits in the shadow of CityCenter making it easy to miss with CityCenter’s towers looming over it. MGM also owns Monte Carlo and it’s clear from my experience and others here this place needs dire help as it lacks any buzz and is usually forgotten. It either needs to be closed or totally gutted, remodeled, renamed and made part of CityCenter. Otherwise, it will continue to move onto the Vegas “has been” list. It can’t live much longer dated and floating on it’s own. Why the owners spent billions on a massive new facility next to it and did nothing to improve Monte Carlo escapes me.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel not bad....rooms not good”
Reviews.Author: TravelGirl33
Reviews.Content: We were meeting family from the UK so agreed to meet here to stay the night before going to Zion/Bryce, etc. The Hotel itself isn't so bad. The resturant/cafe where we had breakfast had very good food and very good service. The rooms really need some help. We requested a non-smoking room and were put into a smoking room (strong stale smell of smoke) next to room with a bunch of guys. With the smell of smoke and the paper thin walls we asked for a different room. That was not a problem. The new room was quiet but old. The rugs were tired to say the least but we just needed a place to sleep. The price for the room wasn't horrible but the $15 "resort" fee was a huge rip off. We didn't use any of the amenities. It is just an opportunity to get more money. Won't stay there again, even if it is just a place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Only two complaints”
Reviews.Author: Darryl C
Reviews.Content: We spent our 20th anniversary at the Monte Carlo and my wife liked it alot. Excellent location on the strip. My two complaints are no wireless internet and a $15 resort fee per night. It is 2011. Everyone has free wireless internet except the Monte Carlo. The McDonalds in the Monte Carlo foodcourt has free wireless internet. The only thing we got for the $15 a night resort free was a $1 USA Today paper. A little bit of advise to the Monte Carlo. If you are going to change people a $15 fee you need to give them a product. Get ride of the $15 fee and have a $1 resort fee for the USA Today paper. Just raise the room rates by $14 so people won't feel like they are getting ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “Paper thin walls”
Reviews.Author: Tvdave22
Reviews.Content: Check was slow with no single feeder line. Took us almost a half hour. Resort fee of $15 was a gyp. Our room was clean, but the walls were so thin we could hear converstions clearly in the next room. Hotel was very responsive to our complaint of noise when next door neighbors were playing loud music.

Reviews.Title: “Good price/average accomadations”
Reviews.Author: dthomp1847
Reviews.Content: Arrived @ 5pm and check in was easy/fast. Room was OK-nothing special, a little worn-ie wallpaper slightly peeling, small counter in bathroom. No coffee maker. Even being on high floor elevators were never a problem. Very convenient location. Traveled with elderly parents and was an easy walk to Aria, NYNY, MGM. Excalibur, etc. Plently of options for dining from the food court and cafe to buffet to Pub and Brand Steakhouse.

Reviews.Title: “Angel/Front Desk Rock Star”
Reviews.Author: JudasPriestFan
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with the young woman Angel who checked us in. I am Front Office Manager for a hotel and I can recognize a great agent when I see one. She kept smiling even when the man in front of us was being difficult. Give this girl a raise and a promotion, she's worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Could do with some remodelling otherwise good value”
Reviews.Author: dipex
Reviews.Content: As with all hotels in this town, generally low room rates disguise the fact that your overall charges soar when dining, drinking and enjoying oneself. So in the end, Las Vegas is not necessarily for the budget-minded. Monte Carlo rates are reasonable but extras soon add up as I found. The rooms instilled an atmosphere of early 90s decor. Perhaps it's the beigeness everywhere (which is the colour scheme adopted to evoke Monte Carlo but is now a little tired). The rooms are generously sized and provide all the usual amenities but are definitely dated. To update the rooms would no doubt inflate room rates and the rate I paid was reasonable. Excellent location with a tram service to the new CityCenter (Aria hotel) and the Bellagio. Like many hotels in this town the place resembles an airport terminal and, not being a casino freak, I dislike having to wade through a noisy, smoke-filled casino each time I wish to reach the street. Music is too loud but I guess this is 'Welcome to the world of Las Vegas'. I liked the quality of meals and the ambience of the cafe but found d'Vino (the Italian eatery) expensive and food quality poor (I did try only two dishes however). Drinks were exorbitant; they could provide only a large 1-litre bottle of San Pellegrino at $8 for one person. If one is seeking an enormous, somewhat impersonal hotel but central then this fits the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Rossi54
Reviews.Content: Been to las vegas 25/30 times and have stayed at many different hotels. By far, these hotel rooms were the worst. The rooms were "motel" quality at best. Small rooms that need updating. Small baths, with no counter space or shelving, and mini bathtubs built for 5' people under 140lbs. The bright side of the hotel was the restaurants. Dante's was pricey but worth every penny. The Cafe was also very good. If room quality and size is important, don't stay here. Staff was good.

Reviews.Title: “Good overall rates, good neighbors”
Reviews.Author: Daxious
Reviews.Content: I do not think I would go back to the Monte Carlo unless given a great (comp or close to it) deal, as there are much better locations / rooms / casinos for the same amount of money. We had a spa suite which had seen better days, wall paper peeling, missing light, no not bulb the whole socket above the head of the bed, which means you wake up to a wire staring at you. There was a steam shower that did not work, to be fair we did not ask for anything to be fixed, as we were not in the room long enough to care. Food, below average even the food court was not big enough, lots of people with no where to eat. Location great neighbors and a walkway over to the aria, which is really nice.

Reviews.Title: “Monique at concierge is the person to see about reservations to places in Vegas you want to visit. Super sweet!”
Reviews.Author: Nancy467
Reviews.Content: Monique at the concierge kiosk on the strip was the best! So professional, informative and went the extra mile for us. We scored same day 0 tickets for half of what they were selling them for elsewhere. She made our trip great! Thanks Monique!

Reviews.Title: “Suprising Visit!”
Reviews.Author: jrob86
Reviews.Content: Just back from a suprising stay here, reading the reviews gives the one impression of this place, but staying there was another thing all together. This place IS clean, it is safe and it's about more than just it's location mid-strip. The casino may be smaller than others, but it's always lively and the excitemnet just reminds you what vegas is all about! The rooms may need a little updating, for example the styling is a little old-fashioned, but it does keep with the theme and there's no problems with cleanliness. The pool is well worth a visit, never too busy with good bar service, but one word of warning, early morning and afternonn it does suffer from a lack of direct sunshine. Good location as city centre just next door and the mono-rail links with bellagio, saving a walk through aria and crystals. Would def stay here again and recommend to all, ignore the bad reviews and give it a try!

Reviews.Title: “$75.00 on red!”
Reviews.Author: markdil
Reviews.Content: After reading a few bad reviews of this hotel, I was a little hesitant to stay here! But after evaluating the grammar, double negatives, and spelling, I considered the source and ignored them. Evaluating a hotel in my opinion is based on quite a few factors including and most important THE PRICE YOU PAY TO STAY! If you pay a bundle, you should expect a lot. If you pay a little, you should NOT be upset if it is not The Four Seasons. After a few days at the Monte Carlo, only two items aggravated me. The first being there is no WiFi in the lobby. Yes, you read correctly. Not sure why, but that certainly needs to change seeing we are living in 2011. The second item is they have no feeder line at check in. What's with that? So, your gambling starts early when you check in by picking out WHICH line you wait in. You can take a very good educated guess by sizing up the clientele standing in these lines. If they have more than three pieces of luggage or lack a full set of teeth, definitely move on to a different line. I found the rooms to be just fine. Clean but slightly dated. The maid service was good and they always were willing to bring towels up to the room very quickly. The casino was also adequate. It had a food court inside with McDonald's, Starbucks, Subway and so on. There was never a wait to cash in your winnings at the cashier cage. There were reviews that complained about the pool. The pool was acceptable, although not a tropical oasis. It was clean, not crowded, and they brought you anything you desired while basking in the sun. I found the drinks to be above average. I read reviews of the Monte Carlo not being in a "happening" place or in the center of all the action. Trust me, no matter WHERE you stay, and that includes The Bellagio, Venetian, and Caesars Palace, you are going to have to WALK to get ANYWHERE! And you will walk miles, so if you are not in shape, overweight, or don't like to walk you may want to rethink your travel plans. The streets are PACKED with people. There are a lot of shops and places to go that are within a stone's throw of the Monte Carlo including an AMAZING luxury shopping experience called Crystals at City Center. You have to see it to believe it. Something that caught my attention was a Minus 5 Lounge located inside the Monte Carlo. Everything inside is ice. The bar, tables, glasses, and chairs. And yes, it is COLD in there. Amazingly, the place was packed. Obviously, these people were not from the North. Bid on this hotel through Priceline and try to get a rate of about $75.00 a night. Anything more, you can do better elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bev1110
Reviews.Content: Great view from the 18th floor overlooking the strip. The room was clean, but was well used. The Casino was great, beautiful lobby, but best of all this hotel is right in the middle of all the action. Tram has easy access and is connected to other hotels via corridors, which is great! Overall - good experience, quiet room and no disturbances.

Reviews.Title: “going down hill”
Reviews.Author: W.O.F.
Reviews.Content: I revisited the Monte Carlo Hotel after 10 years and a facelift of the rooms and casino and was not pleased. The rooms were the same, although they had newer beds. The bathrooms were the same, although they put in new granite. The pool was worse than before because the wave pool was closed down and they squished all the deck chairs next to each other so that you would have to climb over your "neighbor" to hoist yourself into the chair. The casino was fine and clean, but no great restaurants/prices to speak of. BUT the very worst part is that they charge a resort fee (like all the other MGM properties) and DON"T HAVE WIFI!!!! Welcome to the 21st century Monte Carlo!!! Have you heard of IPads and tablets that don't have ethernet cables????? Let's do some modernizing of the internet service, or don't charge a resort fee!!! Won't be back until this is fixed!

Reviews.Title: “Lousy treatment in top floor suite”
Reviews.Author: Charlie E
Reviews.Content: We had a Suite on the top floor 32, on OCT 2011. We had just had a wedding, dropped $4000 bucks at Andres's for dinner in the hotel, and the group moved up to the suite for after dinner drinks and partying. The group was only 20 people, family members of the bride and groom. No rock stars or white trash in the group, just normal people. The Hotel Supervisor named "Erick Baum" showed up at the door with about 5 security and told us that everyone had to leave due to the noise. He made everyone leave the suite. We said that if he thought we were making too much noise, move us to another room we will even pay any difference. There was going to be no negotiating on his part. Honest, the noise we were making was rated "lame Las Vegas party level." I expect some high roller whale complained next door, and the hotel supervisor made the decision to take care of him and not us. We offered to shut down the music, but he didn't care. The in room sound system was playing at level 4 or so out of a volume 10. Was at the Mandalay Bay 2 years back for another family wedding and they treated us fabulous. That party was noisey with 75 people in the suite, and the hotel was very accommodating the whole 5 days. If you are having a wedding suite or just want to have some fun, pick a different hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just "ok" for Vegas, could be so much better with a few changes geared towards making guests feel welcome”
Reviews.Author: Bricneach
Reviews.Content: Stayed here to be close to friends. Probably would not stay here again. Check in lines were chaotic and disorganized (when guests start changing lines frequently to check in, there's a problem). The hallways smell, peeling wallpaper everywhere, rooms were not dirty, but not overly clean either. Outside window was dirty. Biggest irritation was the pool policy that you could not bring anything into the pool area that was not purchased in the pool area. Meaning a latte, bought from the Monte Carlo Starbucks, could not enter the pool area. Clearly the hotel is more concerned about making $ than making the guests feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Bait and Switch”
Reviews.Author: JOHN C
Reviews.Content: Very dissappointed in the room I received at on 10/8/2011-10/11/11. I reserved my room through the Monte Carlo website and paid extra for a (high floor strip view) the room I was given was a view that faced the pool. I reqested to be changed to a room that I paid for but was told the hotel was booked up. Very dissappointing! John Clark

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Balloons2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo Resort for 8 nights and found it to be very comfortable, the staff where excellent and very friendly. The hotel is in a great position on the strip with the bus stopping out the front.Will stay again !!

Reviews.Title: “Easy to get around the hotel”
Reviews.Author: mojo1992
Reviews.Content: Smaller hotel so it's very easy to find your way around. Rooms are in need of upgrades as far bathroom, carpet etc. Staff very friendly? Buffet sucked! Nothing really fresh aside from omlette station, mostly greasy foods, very small fruit section. Cafe food better. Casino too smoky compared to others. Pool really nice, but didn't like that you can't bring outside water in. Diablos was good, good service. Tram to bellagio right here & close to a road crosswalk. AC worked awesome. Very quiet too as far as outside noise! Got a great group rate too so inquire for them.

Reviews.Title: “Viva Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: franklin833
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a suite and the bathroom was very nice and spacious.I enjoyed the hotels amenities and it's central location. Was clean and convenient. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: S708
Reviews.Content: Generally speaking we were happy with our stay at the Monte Carlo in Las Vegas. The hotel is located right on the strip and is close to all of the action. The Hotel Lobby is very nice and is what you would expect from a four star hotel with Marble Floors and a very nice check-in and concierge. The common areas were clean and well maintained. When we checked in we were given a room that was a little worse for wear with older furnishings and a comforter that was ripped. We went to the front desk to request a different room and they accomodated our request with a slightly nicer room on a higher floor. The second room was clean and well maintained. The beds were comfortable and there was a flat screen television in the room. The wall safe worked well and the view was nice overlooking the pool and the ARIA hotel next door. The only thing I would suggest they do is consider adding a coffee pot to the room, but other than that I was very pleased. The pool area of the resort was also very nice with a wave pool, lazy river, and a swimming pool. The pool side service was friendly and they had a nice selection of drinks and food. The casino was clean and not as crowded as some of the others on the strip. The location was very convenient with a free Tram running from the Monte Carlo to the the Bellagio, which came in quite handy. Generally speaking the staff was quite friendly and helpful. My one complaint would have to be the $15.00 resort fee that they say covers your use of the pool and the internet. The internet service is not even wireless so it is pretty much a total joke and I was actually insulted to have to pay a $15 fee for an internet connection that wouldn't work with any sort of modern wireless devices.. I think instead of a resort fee they should just fire some people in their marketing department to reduce expenses and get rid of the fee. The marketing department must have come to the conclusion that since they couldn't sell rooms at a higher rate it would be easier to just take advantage of unsuspecting tourists by charging them a hidden $15 per day fee instead of going out at trying to sell rooms at a higher rate. Realistically this is a pretty nice hotel that is centrally located. I wouldn't have a problem staying here again, but would keep in mind that the daily rate you see online is actually $15.00 higher after figuring the resort fee when compared with some other hotels on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate for a Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: HavokandSully
Reviews.Content: My company sent me to Vegas for a conference that was being held at the Monte Carlo. My wife and I decided to stay at the Monte Carlo for the convenience and not the value (conference rate and employer picking up the tab). Convenient is the best thing I can say about this hotel. It’s in a great location near the center of the strip and the rooms were fine. Clean and plenty of room but the beds were horrible. Neither of us could get comfortable (not usually an issue while partying in Vegas but since this was a work function, uncomfortable beds were a real issue). The restaurants were not worth checking out although we did ask one of the doormen for a recommendation for sushi and steak. He clearly stated that we should eat at other casinos this week. His recommendations were fantastic so thank you for your honesty. On a positive note, The Pub at MC was a cool place for a beer although they were out of too many beers and closed at midnight. I don’t gamble but my wife plays poker. She only played for a few hours at the Monte Carlo because the action was very slow. She grabbed a seat in a tournament at Caesar’s that was much better than anything being offered at MC. I saved the best (worst) for last. The show at Monte Carlo was pretty bad. I was surprised that the Jabbawockeez were able to get $90 a ticket for this act. This show is cheaper than others on the strip but is still not worth seeing at any price. Simply not worth the time spent. The show was a disjointed mess of bad skits with decent music. I kept waiting for them to pull it together and pull off something that we would talk about later over dinner but nothing ever happened. All I could think of during the show was that it looked like they were trying out three new guys tonight and I would be angry if I had paid for these tickets. Overall, the Monte Carlo is still far better than the low end hotels like Excalibur and Luxor, if for nothing else but its location and cleanliness. I don’t expect it to compare to the newer hotels but they could at least put together a decent show and one nice restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “it was not the greatest...................”
Reviews.Author: tedWisconsin
Reviews.Content: During check in, found out that we were double billed for 2 rooms and received only one conformation number for one room....had asked for a non smoking king bed when the reservation was made and received a smoking queen....Yah, right......well, got our king non-smoking as was told that we had to pay for a resort fee to use there services....well, we never used there services, pool, internet, etc.....Room was ok, but the walls were paper thin and we could hear everything that was going on next door(nightly entertainment)...Needs upgrade,,,,,,,

Reviews.Title: “Nice sums it up.”
Reviews.Author: DoubleVisionDV
Reviews.Content: Great price up on the 25th floor. Best bed I've slept in, good bathroom and very good size rooms. The hotel is boring as hell but has one of the best lobbies around. having dollar car rentals in the lobby was great also. The mono rail was good so could get around to other more exciting places. Stayed for 5 nights before heading downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Heart of the strip? Well, it's about 2 blocks from the heart.”
Reviews.Author: lastipe
Reviews.Content: This hotel was ok. The room was fine, the bathrooms were clean, but I did have clean white socks on and when I walked around the room, they turned gray from the dirt in the carpet. We stayed with the do not disturb sign on the door because I left for the pool while he was sleeping, and I came back for a nap around 5. The door was opened by a maid while I was resting to ask for service, even though the sign was still on the door. I could have bolted the door, but I would have locked my friend out. I would recommend staying somewhere with wifi. We didn't have any in the room. We also paid a resort fee. For the extra $16, a night, I would stay somewhere closer to the Strip, like the Paris or Cosmopolitan. It would have been the same price had I factored that in. also, it's by a shady CVS. They have about 300 fliers on the street from the people offering girls in 20 minutes. A man outside it everyday said he wanted to "wrestle" with me. Gross. This is an ok hotel, but you're in Vegas, you're not supposed to be in your hotel. But I would stay at the other hotels mentioned.

Reviews.Title: “Disapointed with Hotel customer appreciation.”
Reviews.Author: Albert53
Reviews.Content: The 9 Girl Getaway was a wonderful time because we made it that way. The hotel room was clean and the beds were very comfortable. I like the food court which offered Starbucks and Subway for a quick bite on the run. Also ate at D Vino. Great food, presentation and value. We went to Walgreens across the street and purchased a coffee maker for $12.99 as there was not one available in the room. We had brought our own coffee. The ice bucket served as our fridge to store milk. Coffee was great in the morning to sip with our jammies on. NObody liked the idea of dressing and going down to Starbucks first thing. The pool area was lovely, however despite our group pumping in thousands of dollars into the Monte Carlo, we could not bring even a bottle of water and had our bags searched prior to entering the pool area. The POOL POLICE stated that NO BEVERAGES or FOOD could be brought in due to sanitary reasons??? I don't usually share my H20. I guess $22 for a glass of wine and a mixed drink purchased at the pool was much more sanitary???? Guest Gouging?? I would try another Hotel next time as the Hotel does not encourage/promote return. I love some pool vacation, with drinks etc, however could not justify the pricing at the Monte Carlo pool area.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: sherbySomerset
Reviews.Content: Rooms are as you would expect,clean with comfy beds.good location with a free tram which takes you further down the strip.pool was ok, small but you dont spend a lot of time there.as for not being able to take food and drink outside,its not an issue as there is free ice water to help yourself to.you can tke your own rings into the lazy river to avoid paying the $15 to higher one,if they are having a busy day they will just swop yours for theirs and give yours back when you leave.Dennys opposite great for cheap breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “monte carlo Hotel Vegas”
Reviews.Author: dena-taylor
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Vegas in june this year and stayed at this hotel for 3 nights on our way to palm springs. we visited other hotels in vegas but were extremely happy we stayed here. even though it was big as they all are in vegas it had a little more class the staff were excellent in all areas the rooms were amazing and the facilities great we didnt find it expensive and would highly recommend this hotel if visiting vegas.rooms very clean, beds very comfy,the pool area was great they have a wave pool and a normal pool a manmade beach area and plenty of sunbeds. We had a great time thanks monte Carlo and all its staff we will definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL”
Reviews.Author: Home1Sweden
Reviews.Content: If you can go elsewhere. Crowded, tacky, no customer service, not clean. loud, run down, pool area terrible. So many nice beautiful hotels in Vegas why stay here. BORING, Food is awful, hotel ugly,morn, tired. Must assume most people staying here got a very very cheap rate.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Josbob
Reviews.Content: We were for three days at the Monte Carlo and I chose this hotel because the rate for a stripview room was very good. I didn't expect too much because the reviews are not always great. But everything was really good. Great location between City Centre and NYNY. Nice personnel. Good buffet but expensive. The casino is attractive enough. The room is big with execellent bed. The shower could be updated. It 's not a very special or fancy place but for the money an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Viva Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: dolphinkisser
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo Hotel from Oct 12-16/11 and found it to be very comfortable and clean. The room was very nice and the beds were comfortable. It was not too noisy and we had a partial view of the strip. The staff were all very helpful and the food was good, but a bit pricey. The drinks were also good, but pricey. The food court is more reasonably priced. The Hotel was centrally located and there is a tram to the Bellagio, which is helpful. A short walk the other way, and another tram to Mandalay Bay. Close to all sorts of attractions and shows. Any Cirque du Soleil you can see is great, but Ka was spectacular (at MGM). Also, Phantom of the Opera (Venetian), worth every penny. Tix4tonight across the street are cheaper. Down side was the $15. a day resort fee. For this you get: Local calls, newspaper, print boarding passes. Not worth $15 per day, but that's what it costs.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location, helpful staff, nice pool”
Reviews.Author: BUNSTERBOO
Reviews.Content: Room was well equipped very comfy beds, great view and very helpful staff. We had a pool view room.The room was very clean and had everything you would expect from a vegas room The pool area was very clean and the pools were lovely although the pool area was small. we didnt get our bags checked as advised in other reviews and we took drinks in Plenty of places to eat from McDonalds to buffets and al la carte Check in staff very helpful There is a bus stop outside the hotel which is handy We would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Middle of the road quality rooms, plenty of entertainment, value restaurants”
Reviews.Author: NW-USA-Travelers
Reviews.Content: The rooms were like a typical hotel. No granite counters, carpet was clean, beds are very soft and comfy, although I was short sheeted every night. Restaurants include value in McDonalds and Subway up to classy, with Andre's French cuisine. Entertainment was adequate as well, with the Pub's happy hour, Brand classy night club and all the gambling tables.

Reviews.Title: “The pool, aka food and beverage experience”
Reviews.Author: Margaret D
Reviews.Content: Did you know that Monte Carlo no longer has a "pool"? Now they have a "complete food and beverage experience" with a pool in it( except the wave pool was broken, the rest is very tiny.) This means you cannot bring in food or drink, and the storm trooper at the gate will inspect your bag. Ok, I get it, they want to sell their stuff. BUT, we put up our little flag, and waited over 40 minutes with no server. Got up and complained. Got a server. 45 min after that, we got our sandwich, which was fixed incorrectly, and no drink. Eventually got drink. And, oh, I ordered ice water with my meal, and was told to get it myself--from the "water station" where they had little cone shaped paper cups--not something you could take back to your chair and put down. Cross this place off your list. Also found that staff generally knew nothing--asked hostess at the Pub which beers were included in the advertised special- she did not know, and did not offer to find out. Typical of the lousy service at the whole place.

Reviews.Title: “Well.....”
Reviews.Author: TheodensQueen
Reviews.Content: Good value, inexpensive. Quiet (which is great!). Located next to the New York New York and across the street somewhat from MGM Grand. Also right next to the CVS pharmacy if you forget something in packing. I was traveling in a group of 4 so we had two rooms--we were given them adjoining (we asked when booking for adjoining or rooms that were close by). Housekeeping didn't come to straighten the room the first day until we called around 3pm in the afternoon and the next day didn't knock and walked in the room at 8am (we were up, going to head out the door but the double lock didn't work). We couldn't find the ice machine at first and asked two hotel employees who said they were on the second floor. Maybe there was one there, but we didn't find it. Evidently, they are located on all the floors where rooms are (found this out by reading the binder in the room).

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chrystal74
Reviews.Content: Awesome hotel. My room was clean and beautiful, found happy hour specials in all of the restaurants, and it was close to everything I wanted to do.

Reviews.Title: “watch where you put your cash”
Reviews.Author: Renee R
Reviews.Content: There were 3 of us girls who stayed at the monte carlo for the weekend and we left our cash and wallets in the safe in our hotel room. We hadn't checked the safe in 24 hours and when we went to go pull more cash out of the safe ALL of the cash $1200 was stolen. Once we called security they took a report and kept telling us they would get back to us. 3 weeks after we left we received was a letting apologizing and telling us there was not enough evidence. We received no discount, they never offered to change our room, nor did we get any of our money back. We were assured at the time that they had high security that would help us, but this was not the case. It wrecked our whole trip and we will NEVER stay there again. So if you do decided to stay here you better be careful with all of your belongings..its not worth wrecking your trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, hotel just OK”
Reviews.Author: kitty55
Reviews.Content: Three of us stayed four nights in June. We had a room with 2-Queen beds on the 15th floor facing the strip. As others have said, the view is over the casino below, but really not bad. We didn't spend much time in the room anyway. Although the room size was decent, there wasn't much storage space or even a table. Just a small desk and dresser which held the TV. Not much counter space in the bathroom either. No coffee pot or mini-bar/fridge. The beds were comfortable and the room was clean, but definitely showing wear & tear. We slept in the first morning and never received maid service. Had to phone and request clean towels. The pool area looks really nice but it was a party scene, with blasting techo music on the weekends. We had a late night dinner and a breakfast in the cafe, and the food was pretty good with reasonable prices. Great location next to NYNY, and across from MGM. Free tram to Bellagio/city center mall and Walgreens was right next door. I got a really cheap rate so it was pretty much worth that price, but would probably choose another hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Bolas77
Reviews.Content: Overall we loved our stay. The positives were the location, friendly staff, great pool area and cocktails. The downside was that the rooms are a little old and tired, although we werent expecting new for the price and based on other reviews.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hotel With Understated European Elegance”
Reviews.Author: seasonedtraveler1851
Reviews.Content: From the rooms to the pool and spa areas, the decor is beautiful and the hotel is laid out well to minimize the walking required for the pool, casino, registration, parking and rooms. There are a variety of good restaurant options along with a sports pub and a food court for breakfast, lunch or a late night snack. Monte Carlo is in a great location and even has a monorail to take you to Bellagio and City Center. Rooms are reasonably priced based upon the quality of the hotel and furnishings, but weekend rates are high as are all other hotels. I don't consider myself to be a big player, but feel like I'm coming home each time I visit the Monte Carlo because of the friendly treatment I receive from my host and the VIP staff.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations.”
Reviews.Author: Margate-sunseekers
Reviews.Content: All over Vegas "you get what you pay for", but as far as the Monte Carlo is concerned I feel we got more than we paid for. Check in was very smooth (Patricia was very efficient, and accomodated our only small request with no problem), and the hotel itself if superbly located on the strip with the tram link to the Bellagio a big bonus to break down the slightly longer walks down the strip to the likes of Caesars palace and beyond. The pool area is great, and the bars and restaurants on offer give you plenty of options, especially with the various happy hours! The ticket office/concierge next to the theatre also did a very good deal on some show tickets (with the M Life card the hotel gives you), which was much cheaper than the lauded "tixfortonight" booths on the strip. The rooms are perfectly clean and fine for what you need, good shower, hairdryer, room safe, big tv with lots of channels, and a very comfy bed and pillows. If you want to go around the hotel with your clipboard looking for flaws, then sure your'll find some things that could do with updating or replacing, as you could in most places including our own homes. My spouse and I saw six shows, and went to the Grand Canyon by helicopter, which we couldn't have done had we stayed at a so called higher grade hotel. I honestly think that the Monte Carlo is a great option for a stay in Las Vegas that won't eat up too much of your gambling/entertainment budget.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: Moonray_red
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at the Monte Carlo for 6 nights and I was not impressed at all and will not return. Top ten issues: 1) Wanted a king room - got a double queen room 2) The first room we were in had a hand blood stain on the sheer curtains (19th floor facing the lazy river) 3) Went back to get another room and complain about the blood stain. No apology and rude desk receptionist and still gave us a double queen room. 4) Standing in 2- 3 inches of water with each shower 5) The rooms have no ambiance, plain 6) Our room did not have any sitting areas. 7) Restaurants too expensive 8) Food Court - well just gross 9) Rude waitress - even though I tipped her with every beverage 10) Service Staff never picked up the dirty trays/dishes in the hallways, so you are always walking by thrown out food and that is gross.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Otherwise problems.”
Reviews.Author: jnu172
Reviews.Content: Well let's see...first they checked us into a (very) dirty room. My wife was particularly upset my the used condoms on the floor. Changed rooms ok. Hotel charges a resort fee that covers Internet, paper etc. Problem is, there is no wireless in the rooms so your iPad is useless. Our second room had a peersistant odor that resembled cat urine. We reported that and were offered one day resort fee refund to compensate. They did not take this off the bill, however and the checkout line was way too long to mess with it. The location is great and the pool area is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Melster
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Monte Carlo last week I can say that it was OK for Vegas. The location was close to the centre and it if you prefer to taxi to one of the further ends of the strip and walk it is a fairly cheap ride (ask to go the back way and NOT down the strip). As other reviews have mentioned the hotel is showing its age but the room was nice and was clean and the bed was excellent so as far as I am concerned all was good!! I am a little paranoid about dirty hotel rooms and after reading LOTS of reviews of other Vegas hotels I felt hesitant about this trip but after a close inspection of the room when we arrived I was happy and had no problems sleeping on the very comfy bed. We also ate at the Mexican restaurant (I think is was called Diablos) and the Chinese Noodle restaurant at the hotel and both meals were very good. The Noodle restaurant was one of our best meals in Veags and I would highly recommend it - there were six of us and we each ordered something different and then shared it and all the dishes had their own unique flavour and were wonderful! I also liked that there was a Starbucks and McDonalds downstair and in the morning there were short lines and hot coffee only a minute away!! I can say that I am not a big gambler so I wasn't expecting much when I decided to try the slot machines at the Monte Carlo but for the first time ever in Vegas I actually won money every time I played at our hotel !!! I have to admit I had fun playing them!! I do agree with other reviews that it is an average hotel for Vegas but for what we paid I have no complaints and if I did I would totally be telling you here as I value Trip Advisor and the honest opinions that people post. Thanks Monte Carol for a very nice Vegas vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: COLO_USA
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in s great location. Good beds and bedding. The only thing we didn't like was the daily "resort fee" added to your bill. What a bogus way to add $18 a day to the price if the room. Probably will never stat again because of this fee.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel & Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: cat105
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo Hotel from 10/3/11 thru 10/9/11. After reading the reviews, we were hesitant - however, I am certainly glad that we picked this one! This hotel is in a great central location on the strip & downstairs right around the corner from the elevators is a Starbucks (great for coffee in the morning), McDonald's, Subway, etc. The food at "The Cafe" is extremely good - we ate there for breakfast each morning. Beds are so comfortable you don't want to get out of them in the morning. Yes - the hotel could use a little updating but if you want extreme luxury, then stay at a 5 star & not a 4 star. The hotel was extremely clean! One thing this hotel had that we noticed many others didn't was padded benches in the lobby. This may sound silly to some of you; however, when you are traveling with an 85 year old woman, these benches came in handy while the rest of us were in line checking in. The other hotels had zilch in their lobbies to sit down & rest if you chose to. We had nothing but extremely friendly waitstaff, clerks, housekeeping, etc. The "stains" in the hallway on the carpet were minimal & something we barely noticed (someone must have spilled their coffee or something). And the previous reviews we read about the shower heads - I LOVED that shower! It comes out quite hard & feels great on your sore back or feet. Just a note --- I didn't think our room had a hair dryer because I didn't see one in the bathroom - it is located on the shelf in the closet. In-room safe worked great! We had a view of the strip on the 21st floor - beautiful!! My mom needed an extra blanket & it was brought to our room right away. Our lightbulb in the foyer burned out & that was replaced pronto. We had no complaints about this hotel & would definitely stay there again - especially for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tigerlily32
Reviews.Content: We have been to Vegas several times now but this is our first stay at the Monte Carlo. We were very happy with the hotel. The rooms were very clean, buffet was fabulous and customer service everywhere in the hotel was exceptional. Our wedding was scheduled for the afternoon we arrived in Vegas and we were concerned that the hotel would not let us check-in early (as they would not confirm this on the phone) which would have really thrown a wrench into things (bridal party hair/makeup etc) but we had no problems, just real friendly and accommodating desk staff. Pool and lazy river were great but lawn chairs were hard to come by unless you got there early. Definitely will stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Decent but nothing crazy”
Reviews.Author: Trifish
Reviews.Content: With all the new fancy hotels in Vegas the Monte Carlo could use an update. The rooms are mediocre. We had a view of the pool, which was decent. The showerhead is way too low for the average person and the tub never drained. Ick. Although we weren't for work we thought the hotel had WIFI but instead you had to plug in. We could not get online b/c we brought our iPad. We had to go to the downstairs Starbucks to get wireless access. Apprently they're updating their wireless but I'm not sure when. As for location, the MC was great and the monorail up to the Bellagio was ideal. We had also reserved a King room connecting to another King room. Upon checkin we were placed in a room with two queens and no adjoining room. This was disappointing. They told us they didn't have adjoining rooms but they clearly did. We were moved the next morning to a King room on the same floor. With a little updating the hotel could be improved but all in all we enjoyed the trip and the friendly MC staff.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel on the strip”
Reviews.Author: sugarcrisis
Reviews.Content: We planned our first Vegas trip last minute and decided we would rather have an okay hotel and use most of our money for gambling and shows and whatnot. It's an okay place to stay on the strip. It's gorgeous on the outside but the inside is showing its age. The casino is great and had a good payout. Smells of old cigar/cigarette smoke. Take advantage of the tram between Monte Carlo and other hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Good experience for my first time trip to vegas”
Reviews.Author: dayla89
