Reviews.Content: I stayed here last month for my first trip to Vegas, and had absolutely no problems with it. It's not the most grand of hotels, but it works!! The room was cheap-$59 USD a night, and it had a good casino and food court and such. The buffet seemed good too, lots of choices. The location is the best part, it's right in the middle of things and isn't a far cab ride to many of the touristy spots. It was great for our group but we really just needed a place to pass out in at the end of the day, so for anyone who is looking for a more upscale stay I would suggest somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “SWEEEEEET!”
Reviews.Author: TripSkipper1
Reviews.Content: Went here for a bachelor party - best idea ever! Great location centrally located on the Vegas Strip. The rooms are clean and very inexpensive with expedia or other holiday booking websites. The best part of the hotel: Great outdoor swimming/drinking area! The "lazy river" where you can float, walk, or swim along as the current takes you around in a circular route so that you can drink and mingle with all the great people enjoying the sun. What a blast! Been to "Treasure Island" and "New York, New York" which didn't hold a candle to the Monte Carlo. Just be sure to have great friends along and you're guaranteed a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “There are better but you pay much more!”
Reviews.Author: emalou2
Reviews.Content: Our first time in Vegas. Really pleased with hotel. Clean, nice big room and great shower. Good location. Music is off at 12 midnight too so doesn't keep you up all night. Lobby is large and busy. Parking is free, no wi fi but they do offer Internet service via a keyboard in bedroom which didnt work? There was a plastic sheet in the bed too for all those who wet the bed! We didn't fortunately so ask for our room! We had a strip view, which overlooked part of the roof but could see plenty at night. That didn't make us wet the bed either... Used the buffet in restaurant, that was 24 $ each, food was very good but seating wasn't great. Casino was clean and didn't smell. I'd stay here again and will still be able to refrain from peeing the bed :-)

Reviews.Title: “Good but with one problem”
Reviews.Author: MarylandKid_At_Heart
Reviews.Content: Had a three night stay last week in September. Room was adequate but could use some updating. Major problem was we had a room with a door to adjoining suite. You could hear any voices or noises through the door. It seems person was sitting on their bed, talking on the phone, and sounded like a loudspeaker through the door. Maybe thicker doors or some kind of sound deadening material needs to be placed between the doors. Overall, stay was enjoyable, check-in and out went smoothly, and food was good

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service at the Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: MarleneComox
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay at he Monte Carlo. Very friendly and helpful staff, comfortable and spotless room and a variety of eating options. Very good location on the Strip and enjoyed the convenience of the mono rail from the Monte Carlo to the Bellagio. Would stay at the Monte Carlo again. Although the wave pool was not open certainly enjoyed the rest of the pool area. Pleasant and comfortable and nice river/lagoon.

Reviews.Title: “Needs some tlc”
Reviews.Author: BassRockBoy
Reviews.Content: This is the 4th time we have stayed in this hotel. We have always found it serviceable, friendly staff and a great place to stay. Having just returned we won't stay again. The hotel definitely needs upgrading, there was blood on the door handles, light switches and mirrors. As the hotel was full we couldn't get a move. We cleaned the room ourselves as it was an easier option! Checking in and out was a farce, it seemed they tried to double charge for everything and when explaining to us that it was a genuine error and rarely happened, both couples either side of us burst out laughing as it was happening to them too! There must be better places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice & Affordable”
Reviews.Author: ma0106
Reviews.Content: We stood at the MonteCarlo for my friends wedding and it was really nice. The pool area is amazing lots of fun!! Not sure why some people are giving it a bad review it's actually a really nice and affordable hotel. Staff was very nice & the rooms were nice and clean. I would recommend it especially if you are going in a large group. Totally worth it! Don't forget to see Cirque Soleil Zumanity at the New York New York!! Amazing!!

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: Joan Smithers
Reviews.Content: Had the pleasure of staying at the MC for the first week of October. Could not understand any of the complaints I had read about before I came here - we did not find any fault anywhere except perhaps the horrid music around the pool. The MC has a good location and we were very happy with our strip view (room 30-212). Possibly the only complaint would be the lack of a tea/coffee maker in the room but would have had trouble faulting the room otherwise (did suffer noisy neighbours). Reception were a little slow on arrival but nothing other than helpful at other times. Would definately recommend this hotel to anybody who mentions coming to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “If you only read 1 review - read this one !”
Reviews.Author: PapaPierce
Reviews.Content: My wife and I & our 2 friends have literally just returned from a weeks holiday at the Monte Carlo. Quite frankly, I dont understand why so many people are giving this such a bad review. Perhaps they are too fussy are perhaps my standards are too low - but I'm certain it's not the latter !!! The staff were excellent throughout the entire duration of our stay, our bed was the most comfortable I've ever slept in, our room was cleaned everyday - along with clean towels changed daily, the range of food offered in the various cafes was really good, the pool was lovely and the casino was great - I really can't see what anyone has to moan about ! Yes a couple of pieces of furniture in our room were scratched, perhaps the bathroom was a little outdated and maybe the music round the pool was a bit too loud ( weekends only ) but this is quite simply one of the nicest hotels I've stayed in - simple ! Tips - make use of the $44.99 buffet of buffet pass, really good value for money - we had dinner at the Rio, breakfast at the Paris ( fab ) , lunch at the Imperial Palace ( :-( ) and dinner at the Spice Market buffet in Planet Hollywood. 4 meals each within 24 hours - would thoroughly recommend it. Diablos was fantastic & you really must see the Lion King, dont bother with Tix4tonight, just book directly at the Mandalay Bay - we paid $133 for 2 tickets and had a perfect view. If you are going on a Virgin package holiday, on arrival at the airport, dont use the coach provided - you'll be on the coach for a good hour or more, far better to just jump in a cab, pay @$13 and be at your hotel within 10 miutes !

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Debbsi1
Reviews.Content: Monday to Friday stay, rooms at the cheapest Holiday Inn are better. To say the hotel is tired is saying a lot, it is past time to spend a little cash and hire new staff and also upgrade. had a spill in The Cafe, when we asked for help they literally threw a few napkins at us and left, I went up to ask if we could have help as it was on the plates and a mess, was told move your table sit somewhere else. I will sit somewhere else I will sit at another resturant in another hotel. I complained about the room they offered a lower floor over a garage, wow. I called after they said they are aware the hotel is tired. Well Monte Carlo you may be tired but you lost a customer!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel on the strip”
Reviews.Author: mcampbell67
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo is one of uptown Vegas' older hotels, but don't let that put you off. Sure it doesn't have the 'wow' factor of others hotels such as the Luxor, Venetian or Bellagio, but for me it is all the better for it. There isn't a constant stream of people snapping away, and the bars restaurants and casino are perhaps a little quieter as a result. Our room was good, we paid a little extra for a Strip view and we felt it was worth it. The scene looking out at night is pretty cool. The hotel has a great location in the middle of the Strip, really close to the Bellagio and other hotels. It's pretty well priced as well. Overall I'd recommend this hotel if you are looking for an inexpensive base to experience Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel in a very busy city.”
Reviews.Author: LeslieBeld
Reviews.Content: We had a business conference at the Monte Carlo. The hotel did a very good job with the business meeting set-up and meals. The location of the hotel worked well for our activities as well. The downside was the smokiness of the casino, which had to be walked through whenever getting from one place to another, and the smokiness of the room (which was a non-smoking room).

Reviews.Title: “A bit outdated, but OK nonetheless...”
Reviews.Author: Bloomsthree
Reviews.Content: Initially requested a strip view room and received, but on entry requested an alternate room as window seal was broken and wind made a constant irritating whistle, also window film in room was torn and unsightly. We were promptly given another room, "not strip view", but liked the view of the back side of NY NY better than prior view. Beds are very comfortable, but walls are very very thin. We had neighbors next door talking very loudly and TV on, called down to front desk and security came up about 15 minutes later asking them to quiet down, which they thankfully did. My Mom (78) felt very comfortable there and did some exploring of the casino when I attended conference there. (Conference food left a bit to be desired, but facility standard). I would stay there again if the price was right, but it would have to be a very good price....

Reviews.Title: “Honest Review of the Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: Jaggermagoo
Reviews.Content: First impression when walking in to the Monte Carlo is the lobby is beautiful and well maintained. I arrived in the morning so there were was no queue of people waiting to be tended to. I checked in right away and was promptly given a room. The smell that is pumped into the lobby/casino hits you right away as you walk thru the front door...I can see how some people may have been offended by its strength. I had to wash all my clothes that I didn't wear to get the smell out. I ate at Diablo's one day...I had the steak tacos that were great! I also had a margartia that was just ok... Personally I don't like any margaritas that come out of a machine. I also at at the Cafe once for an early dinner, and once for breakfast. The bacon cheeseburger was delicious...as were the pancakes... The room was clean, and the bed was comfortable. The pillows were stiff and almost too fluffy. I should have called for feather pillows, but did not. If you do stay here make it worth your while and call for a feather pillow. It is blatantly obvious that this hotel is trying to cater to college kids (or the like). The BRAND steakhouse doubles as a nightclub in the evening. The music PUMPS, PUMPS, and PUMPS some more. I couldn't even talk to the dealer at my blackjack table because the music was so loud. I had a room facing the strip so the music from the pool did not bother me. The casino is a little bit dingy looking, and dark. The poker room is a joke. However, the people running the poker room are very nice and professional. It's just hard to get a game going and stay going. The hotel has easy access to ARIA via walkway or tram. It was only a few minute ride to Bellagio via tram, this is a great feature. If you are an older person please consider staying elsewhere and save yourself the trouble. It is an ok place to visit during the daytime. All I have to say is that you get what you pay for in Vegas. I didn't pay a whole lot for this (work trip) but I do believe I got what my work paid for. Next time I will stay at Mirage or Bellagio...at least if I can help it. As my rating suggests, this is a very average hotel. One thing I do recommend is seeing Carrot Top....he was hilarious!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: Oldbikers
Reviews.Content: We arrived shortly after noon and requested a room close to the elevator. Given one on the 30th floor which uses the express elevator which is a BIG plus. Noise free at night! Valet and maid service is excellent. Casino small, but very nice. Location as good as it gets on the strip! Can walk to several other casinos/hotels. Food court a plus and always clean. We have stayed at the Monte Carlo several times over the past years as well as other hotels. But we will continue to check out the Monte Carlo's room rates and comps when planning future trips. We try to go to Vegas twice a year. Next year we will celebrate our 57th anniversary and hope to stay there again. The business office staff was very helpful in getting our boarding passes the day before we left. Nice people, nice clean place, good rates/comps and an excellent location make for a GREAT time.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel on the Stripe”
Reviews.Author: wayne900
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights at Monte Carlo and I love this hotel very much. Great location, great room and i love the casino here. Price is also great even thou there is resort fees. Check in was fast as i was usher into the VIP lounge. Maybe just plain lucky when someone call us to go in there to check in. Fast and quiet. I was given the room on the 31st floor and i have a great view. Even thou i'm at the last room along the corridor, there is still WIFI in my room. I love the bed too. The only downside i can find is there is no fridge in the room. Among the casino i visit, i prefer the casino here. very nice design. The buffet here is also great and one of the better i tried around. There is a ABC market across to get anything that you forget to bring. Check out is fast too. Only problem now is i paid cash for my room and they actually charge my credit card and return it again but the exchange rate is different. I lose about USD$20 from there and after sending 2 emails to them, there is no reply at all. I love this hotel and i hope they will give me a reply soon. If not, i will consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Its a mainstay”
Reviews.Author: tobyt13
Reviews.Content: When one thinks of Vegas and all the grand hotels, the Monte Carlo is certainly not one that comes to many peoples minds but for me it has a lot to offer. Mom and I have been going to Vegas at least once a year for the past 10 years. By returning to the same hotel Mom has grown accustom to the surroundings so I experience less anxiety when she takes off by herself. The casino offers a vast array of slots in varying amounts and there are plenty of table games (though I don't partake). We especially like the fast food court if we want just a quick bite and there is a good assortment of other food venues that won't break the bank. The hotel is large enough to not be claustrophobic but not so large as to limit Moms ability to get around including access to the pool and such. Rooms are clean and beds comfortable so what more can we ask

Reviews.Title: “Average, not great”
Reviews.Author: MissTraveler_55
Reviews.Content: Price was really reasonable, but you get what you pay for. Pretty old and run down interior. For the same money I would stay somewhere else ('GO' room at the Flamingo for example) and have a much better strip location.The pool was nice, but not as fabulous as the Mandalay, but very nice for an 'okay' hotel. The restaurant had yummy breakfast, we did eat there each morning. It's okay, we will most likely not be staying there again though.

Reviews.Title: “Great locaton and reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: bruce440
Reviews.Content: You must be on the Strip in Las Vegas and this is nice hotel and reasonable price. Nice to have free tram car to Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pool Action”
Reviews.Author: socjoc12
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel several times on my many trips to Vegas and always have a great time. The hotel itself is average in terms of rooms and casino. However, the pool is wonderful if you're looking to meet people and have a great time. They have a wave pool, and a lazy river which is great to float around in and meet people. They also have a DJ playing music. So if you're looking for some "spring break" type action at an affordabe hotel, centrally located on the strip this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: igl_07
Reviews.Content: we had a great stay at the Monte Carlo, our room was really big and on the 27th floor, it was very quiet at night despite being right on the strip so you could get a good nights sleep. The hotel has everything you could possibly want in terms of places to get food and drinks, the pool is great, there's shops, a salon, spa etc and the location is right on the strip and it's connected via an air conditioned tram to the Bellagio. Great Value as I think we paid a lot less than for some of the others on the strip. I would definitely recommend this to anyone who is going to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome well priced hotel/casino right in the heart of Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: Lansom
Reviews.Content: Spent 10 days in Vegas and stayed at 4 different hotels. Started at MGM Grand, very flash and a bit pricey but the room was tiny and had no windows? Next stop was the Hilton which is really nice but a little far away from the action (but only a $10 taxi away), 3rd up was the Monte Carlo. Our favorite of the 4. Decent prices, awesome party atmosphere, right in the heart of the action. Diablos mexican restaurant was right outside and has the best fish tacos plus the cabanas are reasonably priced by the pool. After that we stayed at Imperial Palace which I don't receomend to anyone although the casino's down that end have far more character than the others. Flamingo's looked pretty nice which is right next door. Monte Carlo really made our trip, although after getting a pedicure which I was too drunk to remember I can no longer show my face in the beauty salon.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst Hotel I've ever been”
Reviews.Author: pampuch
Reviews.Content: Last time I was in Vegas I booked the Stratosphere. It was nothing special, but is was cheap. This time we decided to spend more for a good hotel. Unfortunately we stayed in the Monte Carlo. Time in line until check-in: 20min. The furniture in the rooms is very old (30yrs?). Only two new things: Flat Screen TV and iPod dockingstation (cheap no name version, price in retail about 30$). No WiFi, no fridge. Carpets on the floors are not dirty, but spots are everywhere. Food Court in the hotel with McDonald's, Sturbucks, Subway, etc. Not what we expected from a 4* Hotel with rooms for 150$. Better go to the Stratosphere for 50$ or spend more for a really good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great time - will definately stay here again.Sept 24th thru Oct 1st, 2011”
Reviews.Author: ToledoChevelle
Reviews.Content: Our first time to stay at Monte Carlo, but definately not our last. The staff was extreamly helpful, from our check in - we had the pleasure of meeting John who checked us in early, and then called us when our room was ready, no line waiting how great is that. We had a suite for the week on the 13th floor. Two bath rooms, frig in the room, safe, and very large room. Very comfortable bed and very clean. Valet service was best we have ever had, extreamly friendly and went out of there way to make you feel welcome, (Especially Tony). We ate in the PUB - WOW the burger was great -the service by Tim, was entertaining and great. The only negative thing I can think of was no coffee pot in the room. We did not use the pool area so I can not comment on that.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Shannon_Robinson_88
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the end of August - had a great time! The pools were amazing, the lazy river was a nice touch. We found it quiet and nice. It was very close to other casinos/hotels and easy to walk to along the strip. We had a standard room that was wheelchair acessible, so it had a walk-in (roll-in) shower that was a good size. Our room didn't have the best view (overlooked the pool vs the strip), but we weren't in the room much anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Ideally located on the strip”
Reviews.Author: Paulinbexley
Reviews.Content: Smart hotel on the strip. Has a free and very frequent air cond tram service to city shopping and bellagio's to save you stepping out. Book tickets to shows via the hotel and save - we wanted to go to the tournament of kings, direct it was $79 Inc tax, hotel price $52 also checkout hotel guide, some free show tickets, some two for one. Would suggest you book in advance for shows that may sell out, otherwise you will probably save money locally. Good hotel in good location. Lots of free parking in multi storey car park behind. When booking be aware there is a $15 per day resort charge (+tax) that is not usually quoted in the room price- classed as surcharge.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, Great value”
Reviews.Author: khill603
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Monte Carlo in August 2011. The casino was big, clean and modern. There were quite a few choices for restaurants and lounges. The room was good size. It was modern with a flat screen tv. I judge hotel rooms by the tv, if they have a tube tv then the room hasn't been updated in quite some time. The only thing wrong with the room were 2 minor things. In the bathroom a piece of wallpaper was curling up. This obviously had been there for quite awhile. Perhaps someone could run down to Walgreens and buy some Elmers glue. Also the tinting on the window, a large piece was torn off. This make the room look a little like a Days Inn, instead of a 4 star hotel. The pool area wasn't very big, but I managed to find a chair when I went down there. One of the days I was there it was 109 degrees f outside. The wave pool was positively cold. Very nice. This hotel charges $6 for a bottle of beer. To add insult to injury, MGM Resorts has managed to find another way to nickel and dime you. When you get the beer it is now $6.49, tax is added. This must be the only place in the US where the tax is not included. It's a good thing MGM doesnt own gas stations. Overall I like this hotel, other than the $20/night resort fee which basically amounts to a free newspaper. I would stay here again but buyer beware.

Reviews.Title: “Good except for Resort Fees”
Reviews.Author: renesio
Reviews.Content: We booked a Deluxe high Floor as recommended in the many reviews. Indeed the view from the 31st floor was fantastic. The room was large but lacks amenities such as percolators or coffee makers. The room was not as well cleaned as one would expect from such a highly rated hotel. Dust was evident around the lamp shades. The Resort Fee of $15/day and the Room Tax of $ 11.62/ day added considerably to the room rate of $96.80 /day. Plus tax on the Resort Fee of $ 1.80 / day. When booking, ask about these other charges. Due to forward flight schedules, we extended one day and the charge was much lower at $ 70/day plus Resort fee of $ 15 plus tax of $8.40 plus tax of $1.80.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, decent price”
Reviews.Author: Mbutler913
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for first trip to Las Vegas. Everyone was very friendly and it was easy to get around. Rooms were average at best. DO NOT GET A SMOKING ROOM. Even if you are a smoker. STINKS. It is just as easy to go down to the lobby or the casino anyhow. But everything else was very good. Might stay there again just based on location

Reviews.Title: “rooms look tired. Nice pools”
Reviews.Author: glennBrisbane
Reviews.Content: The lobby appears very glamorous. The rooms appear a little tired and felt a little let down when arriving in our room after coming through the flashy lobby. Our room however was clean and the bed was comfortable. Our room was on the 5th floor. We had a view of the top of an airconditioning power plant, which obscured our view of the pool. The pool area is nice with a smallish wavepool and a lazy river. You can rent a tube for the day or alternatively buy them beside the pool. They sell the metal bottles of beer to drink in the pool for $6. They have Heineken and Corona and a selection of domestic beers. A lot of young singles playing about in the pool with a pool DJ playing music. Good atmosphere for singles. Almost makes you want to be young again. There is a second nearby pool if you want to get away from that environment. There is no wifi in the rooms here. You need an ethernet cable to use it. You pay a resort fee of $16 per day which they say in their promotional material is for in room internet (no good if you cant use it) and for daily newspaper you have to collect yourself near the lift on your floor, for free local phone calls (which seems standard in most US hotels), free copying and faxing (when I asked about this I was told it for printing of boarding passes by the counter staff and that if it was anything else I would need to use the pay per use PCs located around the lobby). In short I think the resort fee is a scam and just a defacto way of increasing the room rate. Some of the casinos in Vegas are no longer charging this fee. There is a McDonalds, Subway, and Haagen Dasz in the food court located on the ground floor. McDonalds has their free wifi there. The Monte Carlo is located at the better end of the strip where the newer hotels are. MGM grand, Aria, Mandalay Bay, New York, New York are all in this segment of the strip. The front desk staff are more than helpful. I had dinner at one of the restaurants. The food was good, although I thought the service was slow considering the restaurant would not have been half full. Overall I would not stay here again unless I had a good price or a special deal.

Reviews.Title: “I love this place!”
Reviews.Author: CM2228
Reviews.Content: This is the second time my partner and I have stayed here. We recently stayed here for 7 nights in Sep 2011. We actually got married in Vegas so this was an important part of our USA trip. We booked a Monaco Suite, which we also stayed in last year. We choose these suites because they are located right near the lifts and allow for easy access to the strip. having said this, we hardly ever hear "lift noise" from the room. The suites are big and clean and I love that they include 2 toilets and a lounge area for watching TV. I love the pool area of the Monte Carlo because it has a wave pool, a flowing river style pool and a large hot spa. The pool area has always seemed to have plenty of "normal people" and I have not seen that many overly pretentious types, which I find to be a plus. Parking is easy at this hotel. The buffet was pretty good and I also like the food court for times when you just feel like something cheap and easy to eat. Diablos is a fun place to go for drinks on a Fri or sat night....their frozen margaritas are fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “nice place, great buffet!”
Reviews.Author: eandy33
Reviews.Content: Me and my fiancee stayed here in September for a weekend away. We ate at the buffet for breakfast and it was EXCELLENT! Good variety reasonably priced (we ate on a thursday) and very clean. When we checked in we had a very friendly guy help us. We were really impressed with how pleasant he was. I was not impressed with the pool though. The building itself blocked the sun on half the area so all the people were on one side of the pool area. The pool just happened to be in the shaded side, boo. I wouldn't stay here again just because the pool was disappointing. Another thing that was a bummer was the diablo cafe. We went to eat there and there was wait of 20 minutes, we decided to put our names down and saw that the menu was a little expensive (like $15-$20 a plate) and it had poor reviews on yelp. Oh well! Oh and one more thing that I was really mad about was, on our way to the airport we noticed that in the lobby you can print your air line tickets out...but of course they charge you for that. Ridiculous!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: jckelly09
Reviews.Content: Nice clean rooms, beautiful reception and good conections between hotels. We would recommend but be aware that hotel is slightly off strip so strip views are negligible but are far reaching.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff and clean room”
Reviews.Author: KSJE
Reviews.Content: The MC has a great location, it's clean and the staff are very friendly and accommodating. We stayed for 4 nights while the Barrett-Jackson car auction was in town. The front desk staff were friendly and the concierge helped us get tickets to shows and make reservations at a few restaurants. My only complaint was not having a fridge in the room, When I asked if they had fridges available, I was told it would be a $25/night fee, which I found unreasonable. We stayed on the 14th flr facing the pool, which was great b/c the music did not get going until 9am and by that time, we were already up and getting our day started. The fitness centre is very clean and has a lot of modern equipment and the pool area is quite large with 4 pools to choose from. While at the hotel, we took a crash course on how to play Craps, which was very helpful. The quick casual food options at the food court were somewhat limited. If you aren't into McDonald's and Subway, take a 5 mins walk next door to the New York New York and you will find whatever you are looking for. I would recommend staying at the MC. It is not as flashy as some of the other hotels on the Strip but you aren't going to pay the flashy price either. Over all, the MC worked out just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay There!”
Reviews.Author: morkula
Reviews.Content: After receiving several promotions from this casino resort, I resolved to take them up on an offer stating 3 nights free accommodations, 75 dollars in free play, and 2-for-1 show tickets. Upon arriving at the casino, I was told I didn't qualify for the free play. No where in the offer sent me via email was there a qualifying specification, it stated clearly "here is your offer." Not only that, but I was also denied the 2-for-1 show tickets. No satisfaction was gained by complaining to the management or the player's club there. I decided to use the spa facility, where I discovered that half of the amenities were closed for rennovation. This information was not passed on in their emails or place don their website. They insisted on charging me full resort fee to use 1/2 of a spa! I finally got a discount on that, but when I checked out of the resort, they tried to charge me full price for my "complimentary 3-night stay!" It didn't matter that I had a printout of the email offer, it didn't matter that my stay was not satisfactory in any way, shape, or form. To me, it seemed as if it were a scam! I did finally get the complimentary stay. Thank goodness, as my room was substandard, to say the least, with broken drawers and doors. I will never stay with them again, as I have never been so misled and treated so badly by a service organizations such as that of the Monte Carlo.

Reviews.Title: “average but good”
Reviews.Author: bubby79
Reviews.Content: I visited vegas in late july and stayed at the monte carlo, not a 4 star property but definitely adequate for the money. there are 2 or 3 very nice restaurants, the rooms are more then sufficient and the wave pool is fun. plus, the hotel tram is right at the resort and the location is bad at all...i would definitely stay there again...

Reviews.Title: “Better than ok and on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: ScrumpApple
Reviews.Content: This hotel is pretty reasonably priced for being on the Strip. Our room on the 27th floor was spacious and clean with a flat screen tv, but would have been good to have a fridge in there. If given the option between a high level room and one that has view of the Strip I wouldn't bother paying extra for the Strip view as any high room will have a pretty good view of something (desert/mountains) and at check in they will probably just allocate you whatever room is ready. We didn't eat at the hotel as we were out each night, but there is a Denny's right across the street for a cheaper breakfast than the one offered ay the Casino's buffet. Be prepared for a 15 min wait, but they do have free WiFi, which is lacking at the Monte Carlo. The pool and lazy river at the hotel looked good, but didn't use them so can't comment. Overall, if you want something that is midrange and on the Strip the Monte Carlo ticks the right boxes.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid rooms with connecting doors”
Reviews.Author: utahania
Reviews.Content: My 2 night stay at the Monte Carlo is pretty much summed up by two unrelated events. First, the front desk is near perfect. Effortlessly handled my reservation mistake. Second, as I clearly heard my neighbors say around 9 am "M O L D !" Yes, I could plainly hear everything said next door and yes the bathroom smelled moldy in my room too. Probably just an issue of not getting a room with a connecting door. And keep the bathroom door shut.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price! Great Bedding! Very nice room...”
Reviews.Author: rmcnallen1
Reviews.Content: Hey...just got back from a couple nights in Vegas at the Monte Carlo...this was my first stay there, been to vegas a bunch. I was leary of the Monte Carlo because of some of the reviews, but let me put your mind at ease....Great Price! Great Bedding! & Very nice room... the bedding, and let's be honest, isn't it all about the sleep? room was fine (bathroom was not "lifestyles of the rich & famous", but ok)....nice tv, very nice location on the strip....but the bed & bedding was off the charts! my buddy was saying the same thing....the bed was probably the best sleep i have ever had....great, great, great mattress....and 5 star bed linens & duvet...and 3 pillows per bed (different levels of padding so you can choose your level of softness...who does that? most you are lucky to get 2 crappy pillows...AND a tube/roll pillow as well...so 4 per bed???) after a long hard day, it was a true joy to get in that bed.... the hotel also has a food court next to casino for starbucks, and other stuff....pretty funny, 2 starbucks in the hotel, probably not 50 yards from each other.... anyway, think about it for your next trip....if you value your sleep, this is the place.... OH, the price...we paid $80/night midweek ($100 with resort fees/tax), but we also got 2 free buffets per day (1 each person per day) that we can use at Monte Carlo, MGM or Aria....$40 value....so great deal....lastly, on the location....not bad, but they now have a free tram that runs from monte carlo to bellagio (no walking to main strip corner of bellagio/caesar)...very nice & very convenient.... thx....

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: richard t
Reviews.Content: For the money, it is hard to beat staying anywhere other than the Monte Carlo Resort in Las Vegas. The rooms are spacious and clean. The pool area is like being in a water park. And the location, next to City Center, ny ny, and having the tram to take you to the Belagio, not having to drive or park.....well, you can't beat it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us - great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Manchester_LV
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo for 4 nights in September this year. This was our 2nd visit to Las Vegas. The hotel is in a good location on the strip and is great value for money. We stayed in Las Vegas for 9 nights, 4 nights at the Monte Carlo, 3 nights off the strip and the last 2 nights in the Aria. The Monte Carlo is very clean, large rooms and the beds were very comfortable. The staff were great, efficient and rooms cleaned to a high standard. We spent a few days round the pool, the lazy river and wave pool were great. The only downside was that the sunbeds were abit squashed together and there is not much room around the pools. Overall, we were very impressed with the hotel and would stay here again if we go back to Las Vegas as the hotel has a relaxed atmosphere. You can access the Aria next door via a walkway, which in our opinion is one of the best and newest hotels on the strip, it is expensive, but well worth the money (we got a special offer Monday, Tuesday night and got it for a very good price). There is a free monorail which runs from the Monte Carlo up to the Bellagio and stops at the Aria and City Centre, which we used this a few times. We have now visited the majority of hotels on the strip and we consider the Monte Carlo and Aria 2 of the best hotels. The pool areas do get very busy with party people at the weekends, this might not be for everyone, but during the week was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Generally good with some let downs”
Reviews.Author: ATL-travel71
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this property in the past and I recently stayed for five days in September. Location is great on the south side of "The Strip". It has easy access to a free tram running to the Belagio. It is close proximity to lots of restaurants & shopping. It has some quick eats on the property like Starbucks, McDonalds, etc... The casino is not as large as others, but it's not too small either. The pool area is very nice with a lazy river and wave pool. However, the wave pool was closed our entire stay and they did not let us know even at check-in. The hotel and rooms were clean. The rooms were not new, but didn't feel dated and we liked the bed. Inside the room, it can be noisy from above, music from the pool and through the door. It is Las Vegas, so I guess you have to expect that a bit. MGM properties do charge resort fees plus tax which is kind of like forcing people to pay for daily internet connection. That is definitely not consumer friendly and many other resorts do not charge it, so be sure to add that into any comparisons. We also needed a late check-out of one hour which they could not accomodate which was disappointing. Overall, the Monte Carlo is a good value and I would stay there again. I'd ask about anything you plan to use ahead of time before booking just in case.

Reviews.Title: “Best choice at the strip for the price”
Reviews.Author: Trvlbug1974
Reviews.Content: Pros: Located at the strip (somewhere in the middle closer to the end), clean, smells great although some people might find it a bit overpowering, you do not need to walk through the casinos and walk in a big circle to get to your room which is the layout of most other hotels on the strip. Foodcourt in the hotel - for cheap and quick bites. CVS (american drugstore chain) is just next to the hotel, they stock touristy souvenirs, good variety of snacks & drinks and of course OTC drugs and stuff like hairdryers, travel socks etc if you forget to pack them, this store is a lifesaver. Vegas hotels on the strip do not provide complimentary coffee & tea making facilities in the rooms so the onsite food court & CVS comes in handy. Expect long lines during check ins, express self check out is available. Cons: New resort fee policy USD15 (ridiculous). Booked through expedia, I got quite good rates. After some research and being in Vegas a few times (I don't like Vegas but am there for conference), I find Monte Carlo the best choice for me, this feels the most decent for the rates.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect - only real negative is the resort fee”
Reviews.Author: Copey302
Reviews.Content: We were a little concerned after reading the bad reviews on this hotel so did not expect too much, however all concerns disapeared as soon as we arrived. The staff on the front desk were extremely helpful and friendly. They helped us pick a room with a good view and took time to make sure we got the one we wanted. Check in time was quick (we arrived on a Sunday which I believe is generally a quieter time). Our room was lovely and the beds were extremely comfortable. It was also very clean and quite spacious. I can understand to a point what some are saying about marks on furniture as we did have one on the wall and a couple on the chair but this did not bother us in the slightest becuase apart form that the room was lovely. I dont think it needed updating at all. Bathroom was a good size and clean. Shower was very powerful and plenty of nice fluffy towels. The pool area had a great atmosphere and the lazy river was fab. There was load music by the pool but it wasnt too loud and i think it added to the atmosphere. The music they were playing was great so I would not complain! It was a bit of a pain that we could not take our own drinks into the pool area. I thought this was a little out of order as they were very strict with it although we did see a couple of people sneak things in. I really liked the casino in this hotel as it was a little less manic and just a nice size where we could all do our own thing without completely losing each other. I liked the casino in this hotel better than all others we visited. Location was perfect - pretty much right in the middle and great being so close to City Centre and MGM and M&M World etc.Tram to City Centre and Bellagio was great - saved on some walking and there was never a queue whilst we were there. The ONLY real dissapointment for us was the resort fee at the end. $16 a day seemed quite excessive for wired internet, a paper and use of the gym - none of which we used other than one paper. Luckily we read about this before we went but if we had not I think it would have been quite a shock. Hopefully they will scrap it eventually... Overall we loved this hotel and would stay there again without a doubt. The decor felt really glamourous downstairs and we could not believe what good value it was. I think it would be hard to find another hotel so nice for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated and staff very unhelpful”
Reviews.Author: Neil R
Reviews.Content: Our stay in Las Vegas came at the end of a fortnight’s holiday in the USA, and as such it was cost & location that were the most important aspects in our booking of this hotel. On both these aspects, there really isn’t anything for us to complain about. Some of the additional positives included the Pub which did great beer and great food for reasonable prices and the swimming pool area which was very lively and the hostesses very quick and helpful. Additionally, the new free Tram link to the Bellagio was very convenient and allowed us to get further down the strip very quickly and in air conditioned coolness. One massive negative we had in the hotel was that it is one of the older hotels on the strip and the Air Conditioning and Elevator/Lift systems appear in need of an overhaul. On the first night the air conditioning unit made an awful racket, keeping both my girlfriend and I awake most of the night. We told reception who mentioned they would get someone to look into it. However, on the second night there was still noise and there was no message to confirm if an engineer had been or not. We asked about it at reception and there was no evidence on file to state if anyone had been or any work completed. The third night remained very noisy, whilst on the last night, the A/C was noisy then abruptly at 11pm packed up and was not working at all, which as it was a particularly warm night wasn’t that pleasant. To rub salt in the wounds, when we checked out, we were asked about our stay, so we complained about this again. The receptionist then was angry we didn’t respond with the traditional ‘it was great’ and told her of our upset. Her lack of sympathy was rather grating. Additionally, I can’t tell you how long we must have waited for the lifts/elevators to get us to and from the 23rd floor. Finally, the Wave pool was closed throughout our stay and we were given no explanation as to why this was, nor any apology. This was disappointing to say the least and led to the other pools being very over crowded. We’ll probably come back to Vegas, but definitely won’t be coming back to the Monte Carlo!

Reviews.Title: “Cheapish hotel on the strip, OK if you can get a deal.....”
Reviews.Author: BIG_BOZ_Leeds
Reviews.Content: Not the best hotel i have ever stayed in but far from the worst. The foyer and enterance is Great and the Valet parking is both Free and very good, as is the check in experience, however the rooms are VERY average and really do not live up to the impression you will have recieved on the way in. I would stuggle to recommend this hotel, but if you are planning on spending most of your time out of the room exploring the city its OK, that said if you are not bothered about having a casino in your hotel, i would stay slightly off strip and save a packet if you are looking for cheaper accomodation in Vegas. Hotel facilities are reasonably good with a food court and a few restaurants, "The Cafe" was quite nice, the Pub was decent enough and had cheap draght beer and the buffet was.......Typical for a Vegas Buffet! Also the Monorail is usefull for getting across to the Belagio and the strip. The pool looked nice, but had some pretty poor euro dance rubbish being belted out of the PA all day and so did not make for a pleasent place to sit. Overall OK but i wouldnt go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy”
Reviews.Author: rachsuch
Reviews.Content: Location: Towards the end of the strip, but has free mono rail to the Bellagio, every 5 mins. also, across the street is MGM and you could catch a train from there too ($7 all day pass). Service: Excellent, our check in time was 3 pm, but we landed at 9 am, they immediately gave us a room, we were all set to leave our luggage behind and roam the streets. We even got a got view from the 10 th floor (had to wait for an hour if we wanted the rooms on the higher floors) Room: Really good, no complaints. Except that it dint have wireless. But theres a starbucks at the hotel too. Pool: was very nice, the wave pool and the lazy pool... not too loud or filled with too many kids. we went on labor day weekend!

Reviews.Title: “So pleased with our choice”
Reviews.Author: Ky83
Reviews.Content: What a great place, our room was beautiful- loved the view from the 31st floor, made our Honeymoon really special. Check in was seemless, people were lovely and really really helpful. Coming from New Zealand we could learn alot from your customer service, alot of these reviews seem very very picky. We got room service and the food was spectacular, we also really enjoyed dinner in one of your restaurants D'vinos (superb again) and watched Jabbawockeez (they were also great). Won't hesitate to recommend to any of our friends and family heading your way.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: OTravelBug
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 26th floor - strip view - which was awsome at night ... Room was big and clean ... located centrally - close to everything - Staff were helpful and nice ... I would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: Claire H
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as part of our honeymoon trip in America . Even though the hotel was extremely busy when we arrived we were checked in and in our room within 10mins! The room was a little outdated but there was plenty of room, the bathroom was quite tatty but again there was plenty of space to make up for that and it was clean. The bathroom was also styled with marble which was a nice touch. Our room had a fantastic view overlooking the strip and the top of the casino. Considering the hotel was so busy it was very quiet at night. We never had a chance to use the pool facilities as there is so much more to do in Las Vegas. We used the casino which in my opinion was one of the better ones to play at along the strip. It was also good to have several fast food restaurants within the complex aswel as a pub/nightclub type venue. There is also a bar type thing that serves frozen alcoholic drinks...definitely recommend getting one (or two!) of these!! The hotel is in a good location, it's about a 10min taxi ride from the airport which cost us less than $15. It is also only a short walk to the MGM casino, New York New York casino and Excalibur casino. I have already recommended this hotel to several of my friends who have recently made plans to go to Las Vegas. When I go back in a few years time I will definitely consider staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great places”
Reviews.Author: PATRICK H
Reviews.Content: Clean, prices are good, near everything on the strip, close to airport. Staff all very plesent.

Reviews.Title: “LAS VEGAS AGAIN.”
Reviews.Author: CALIF09
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for just over a week in Sept. 2011.The Monte Carlo is in a good position next door to the new part of town the Aria and Vdara being the new hotels in town.Check in was easy and quick and we had a nice room on the 28th floor,but maybe a bit to far from the lift.Room was clean and with two queen beds and a big enough bathroom.Plenty of places to eat and drink in the hotel the Pub being the best.This was our second visit to Vegas and the only downside were people walking around with their drinks but all in all a good holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Will come back”
Reviews.Author: jayisgerman
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Monte Carlo in Las Vegas. We like the location - central strip with easy access to the MGM, Excalibur (from there free tram to Luxor or Mandalay) or the other side with free tram to Bellagio. We got a very good price for the room (Sunday through Wednesday) and even though the resort fee is steep ($16.80/night) - it is declared up front and you just have to fold it into your total cost. Parking is a breeze and nice quick walk to reception. Wish they had a better system for the front desk. You basically pick a desk and then hope it will not take that long. Well.... just like in the supermarket - you always end up picking the wrong line! :-) They should just have one common line and then guide people to the next available counter. No biggie though. First room we got was on the 17th floor and was a handicapped access room. No problem with that, however, when we entered the room you could hear the pounding of the DJ playing the hip-hop music at the pool. It was a little much for our taste, especially since we like to rest in the afternoon and that would be impossible with that music. Called front desk and were switched to a room on the other side of hotel on the 25th floor. Did not even have to go back down, keys were re-coded over the phone. No hassle at all. Our room was very spacious and relatively updated. Furniture showed some wear, but nothing to be upset about. Bed was clean and comfortable. We requested softer pillows (the ones there were really firm and uncomfortable) and this was done no problem. Bathroom was OK, too. Shower was the only downside. Nozzle was very low and sprayed all the water directly in your face at a very strong pressure. Not very relaxing. Had some drainage issues, which were fixed no problem when we called service. Unfortunately, we ended up having some very rude and loud neighbors, but that's not the hotel's fault. These 2 women got "home" at 6:00 AM and were exchanging their anecdotes at a noiselevel as though they were at a racetrack or something. They kept screaming and hootin' and hollerin, like it was nobody's business. By 7:00 AM, I finally had enough and went knocking on their door. I asked the woman who answered to please keep it down a little, and I was really nice about it - even called her Ma'am. She looked me up and down and then shouted at me: "we paid for this room" and slammed the door in my face. I ended up telling her through the door that we will call Security and that simmered her down to a noiselevel of "can deal with it as long as you have earplugs". Again, not the hotel's fault - but a bit of a downer. Just rude! We had room service twice and it was a bit hit and miss, but overall no complaints. Once the fees and taxes and tip for room service is added, it does get a bit pricey though. We ate at the cafe twice and again, no complaints. Friendly wait staff and decent food overall. Dealers at the casino were friendly and drink service was always going around and very friendly, too. Final verdict: we will stay here again. We like the location. The rooms are nice and as updated as possible for an older locale. Elevators are slow and could use some renovating, but that's not a big deal. Staff very friendly. Good Value for strip location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: Aprilp2412
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights in September 2011. Easy check in with a very helpfull valet staff. Room was nice and very clean. Had no issues during our stay. We enjoyed the hotel, casino and bars.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST LOCATION AND VALUE FOR MONEY ON THE STRIP”
Reviews.Author: ginger_in_spain
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Monte Carlo twice in the last 7 months and think it's great value for money. Diablo's Cantina next door is great for fajitas and ritas ( and rock music)............especially if you get the discount vouchors from the staff outside ( margarita or beer only 3 dollars with vouchor!!). The only negative I can say about this hotel is the food court which is crowded and noisy but you can get your Starbucks, omelettes, Mc D's here if that's what you like. There is also a second Starbucks ( which is quieter) at the back of the hotel on your way to the free tram to the Bellagio via the Aria Hotel ( we saw the Cirque du Soleil Viva Elvis here and it was brill !). We booked through booking.com and I have no complaints about the price................some companies may or may not include resort fees .There is no fridge or mini bar in the room, but the ABC store opposite sells everything including soft drinks, food, booze, fruit etc. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “SUPER GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: sashokchat
Reviews.Content: The hotel is awesome and it is one of the best in Vegas and in the world. The casino has one of the biggest jackpots you can get in the world. The view is great, the attractions are great.

Reviews.Title: “amazing stay”
Reviews.Author: l3mgk
Reviews.Content: First trip to las vegas and stayed at the monte carlo hotel , I thought it was a really good choice for where it was on the strip, pretty central and I loved the size as it had everything that we needed but was not to big that you got lost in it.We ate in the hotel a few times, went to the cafe for breakfast, had a snack at manchu wok , the pub and diablos which we all enjoyed, good food and great service. We went to Dragon noodle one night for a meal and would not rate it at all but that was the only disappointment of the whole week. Loved the casino, was not there to win my fortune just had a wee gamble for fun and had a great time. The pool area was great but people could possibly find the music a bit loud. A good tram service at the back of the street of dreams taking you down to the bellagio hotel which I must add was beautiful but a bit on the big side for me. We asked for a smoking room and obviously smelt strongly of smoke when we entered but an air freshener in the room did the trick, very comfy bed, plenty room and good hairdryer and ironing facilities. It had all the requirements that we needed a very good stay after a 10 hr flight and would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Nicest Staff, Nastiest Smell”
Reviews.Author: hamletjay
Reviews.Content: Went to a Medical/Legal conference for three nights and days. The conference facility was more than adequate; despite an occasional video or audio blip, the main room was very comfortable, clean and the room temperature was fine. I would attend another conference there. However, the hotel itself is seriously in need of a total rehab. The beds and bedding are great, but there are small rooms with tiny bathrooms and everything smells like a smokestack. Although they had record of my request for a king sized bed, there were not any available (even tho colleagues without requests, who registered and checked in simultaneously, got them). We had to hold our breaths to walk thru the casino, it smells so awful. There is a $12.00 a day "resort fee". Supposedly this includes free parking (no car), free Wi-fi (only if you have an Ethernet-based laptop, not an iPad or Phone) free newspaper (on a rack, right in front of the broken elevator), and free boarding pass printing ( unnecessary if you have a cell phone & go green!) There was always a broken elevator, and the carpeting throughout the whole hotel is too filthy for a decent pair of shoes to walk upon.

Reviews.Title: “Decent but beware 'resort fee'”
Reviews.Author: NorthYorksBeerlover
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently for one night before flying out of McCarran. The accommodation was perfectly fine, the room clean and comfortable and thankfully the centralised air conditioning was quiet! However the whole stay was spoilt by the sneaky mandatory 'resort fee' of $15 they tried to charge us at check in. This supposedly covered local phone calls and internet usage and other trivial matters. We told them we would not pay it and eventually they agreed to waive it, but next time we stayed there we would be charged it (per night as well). We told them we wont be bothering them again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: NathaliaSoto
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel if you are on budget we were two young couples in our late 20's and early 30's & stayed from the Sep 17-19 for Mexican independence celebration sep 16 which is a big celeb in Las Vegas, hotel has a great location next to city center where nice hotels are like cosmopolitan aria etc are, lots of restaurants and nightlife in the area, right on the strip, hotel is nice has been renovated. Rooms are clean regular sized ok beds, not noisy and service is good and friendly. Casino is good with low cost starting bets, it caters to people all ages specially older crowds, I totally recommend this hotel if you are in a budget and want to be well located. Great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in the Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: kerplooey
Reviews.Content: We weren't expecting luxury but did expect things to work and be clean. Check in went fairly smoothly, but that was about the best part. The elevators were always very packed, I'm assuming they weren't all working because only two ever opened. We generally would stop on every floor and as silly as it seems it was hard to push the button since it's only on one side. We had a Monaco Suite and it was disappointing, the door and walls had a lot of dents and chipped paint. The couch looked like it was from 1970, even though the hotel was built in the 90's. Most of that can be overlooked, however the floor had 2 huge wet spots on it. The master bathroom also had no power at all, nothing worked. We got that fixed, but I wanted a new room because the wet spots didn't dry, well they didn't give us one. The towels had holes and rips in them which is pretty bad for a AAA four diamond hotel. The casino and pool cater to the hip wanna be 20-30's something crowd. I'm 31 but found the music very overpowering at the pool. The hallway near our room always had people screaming and being very loud at all hours. The casino wasn't a lot better, more people loitering and acting loud than actually playing. Not a very enjoyable gaming experience, so I generally went to the Aria or Bellagio to play. They have a 15+ dollar resort fee, which I knew but I found it odd I had to pay it with a comped stay, I did not have to pay it at TI or Bellagio. Overall I can't recommend this hotel, I wanted to like it but too many problems. If you can get TI or another mid tier hotel I would book them over the MC.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at the Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: AliceHastings
Reviews.Content: We recently spent four nights at the Monte Carlo. I was a little apprehensive before arriving following reviews I had seen. The check in was quick and we got upgraded as we were on honeymoon. Our room was a little dated but had a big bed, big tv, big bathroom and a fantastic view. Some previous reviews said there was an artificial smell in the rooms, but we did not experience this. All the staff we met at the hotel were friendly and helpful. The hotel was well placed on the strip and there was a free monorail running from the hotel to the Bellagio which was great. While we were there we saw two shows Penn & Teller at the Rio and Beatles Love at the Mirrage, which were fantastic and recommend seeing. This hotel is good value for money but next time if we had a bit extra to spend we would stay at The Wynn or the Venitian.

Reviews.Title: “Right priced, great location”
Reviews.Author: Dakminman
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this property maybe 15 times in the past but haven't wrote a review for them until now. I lucked out and got a great price, just under $ 100 with resort fees, so stayed for two days. This property is between City Center and NY NY. Great room at a great price. I had previously signed up for their awards card that you insert in slots when you play which is free of charge ( the card not the slots unfortunately). This card allowed me to get a break on LOVE tickets even though I don't gamble.

Reviews.Title: “good, clean, but old”
Reviews.Author: CLMG
Reviews.Content: Property needs to be updated. Yet the service was good; front desk staff were very helpful. Casino is ok for inexpensive gambling especially slots. Time for remodeling

Reviews.Title: “surprisingly great hotel - don't worry about the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: jo3019
Reviews.Content: After reading the mixed reviews I was apprehensive about our choice to stay at MC. I chose MC because it is one of the more affordable hotels on the strip without being tacky like Circus Circus or Excalibur. Well we were pleasantly surprised when we arrived - no bad smells (like some reviewers report), very clean, elegant, friendly helpful staff, our room was plenty big and luxurious enough (we stayed in a normal basic room) and much better than the one we stayed in at New York New York on our last visit to LV. The choice of restaurants isn't huge but there are enough and the food court has a good range for quick bites. Jabawokeez wasn't brilliant but its a fairly cheap show compared with the Cirque shows and the bad bits are pretty funny so you still end up enjoying it. Room service was fast and very tasty. The free shuttle to Bellagio is a definate benefit,cutting down on some of the strip walking when you feel the need to. We didn't sit round the pool but it looked great. After visiting all the main players on the strip for a look around, I would say if we go back to Vegas a third time, I wouldn't hesitate to choose MC again as it is classy, clean and affordable.

Reviews.Title: “You wont be sorry you've stayed here.”
Reviews.Author: greengem8
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd visit to this hotel. its clean, comfortable, friendly, has a fantastic location and amazing staff. I got upgraded to a strip view! Just for being polite to the check in girl! Yes its not state of the art, the furniture has a few knocks and the carpets look worn. But none of this takes away from the amazing experience. All the staff are so polite and friendly. The casino is the easiest to navigate and has a good range of slots and tables. The food court is very convenient, Mcdonalds, subway, Starbucks, Haagen Daz ice cream. The Cafe is great for everything!! The staff are great and the food is wonderful. The swimming pool area is good, there are 3 pools, plenty of loungers (very tightly packed) a choice of shade or sun, a bar, a poolside shop and a towel service. The check in girl advised me to buy a phone card as its cheaper than using the phone in my room, which to me goes to show they arent out to get every penny from you. I really appreciated this. Check in was quick (4pm) took about ten minutes. Check out was even quicker! But i did check out early (8am) to avoid the crowds. The bell desk will hold luggage and are extremely friendly. Give this place a chance, its a good price, great location, great service.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo was okay but not fantastic”
Reviews.Author: lrichards51064
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo for my daughters wedding in Feb. 2010 . My daughter really wanted to stay there and it was not a huge disappointment but not fantastic either. The rooms were basic so didn't except too much and they delivered. The casino was moderately equipped with a variety of machines. They had video blackjack which is hard to find! The food court is just okay, nit much to brag about. The location is pretty good unless you plan to spend your time by the Bellagio or Ceasars which is quite the walk. Overall, it's not bad but it wasn't great either. Of course you also get hit with the resort fees which add up real quick. since this stay I have only stayed at a Harrah's property as they don't charge resort fees.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and affordable”
Reviews.Author: Travelers_163
Reviews.Content: We stayed many times at the Monte Carlo while visiting Las Vegas. We always enjoyed our experience. The rooms are very nice although the bathrooms could use an update. Each time we stayed there, the room was very quiet. The hotel is affordable and conveniently located on the strip. The pools are great but can be quite crowded on week-ends. We will be going back and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Let the review speak for itself..”
Reviews.Author: Geoff G
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to bring our grown kids and spouses to Vegas. If it were just the two of us, we may not have stayed here but keeping the cost of three couples in mind, it was the value we were after. Down: We had three separate rooms. We requested and prepaid for non smoking rooms with king sized beds. We got there and got smoking rooms with two queen beds. Up: called the front desk and they agreed to move all three the next morning without hesitation. Down: no wifi in rooms except in suites. Up: hard wire is available so don't bother with iPad, bring laptop....the cable laying across the floor is the Internet cable. Down: new room Internet not working. Up: called front desk, they sent up a tech who spent the next hour with me. Nice guy....of course, he was not a cable guy so he offered to move me but after having moved once, i said no, I'll take the refund on the mandatory fee for Internet. That said, half an hour later he returned with a can actual cable guy and i spent the next hour with both of them. Nice guys....turns out it was a cable.....about 39 seconds of of actual work. Booked through expedia. Happy with price....asked for late check out. Upon checking in, asked again for late check out (had a late flight). Told by desk clerk that no problem, check out is 1100, courtesy hour is 12 and anything later than that is subject to a fee. 12 worked so I happily went to spend my money. Down: check out....advised that late check out is not available. First told that it is offered but only if available....then told that it is not even offered at all (the courtesy hour) for the last six months. When asked, why four days earlier it was...he got a supervisor. Up: she approved 12 check out. Down: buffet ridiculously expensive. Don't waste your time...selection not worth it. Up: lots of regular, reasonably priced places near by. Denny,s immediately across street, Overall, i was happy. I would probably stay a little further up in the future, but that's merely for convenience. Down: house keeping comes a knocking at 0900....they don't clean....they tidy. But they do a really good job of making the bed. Up: they knock gently at 0900 Like most hotels I image that everything is designed to get you downstairs.....no coffee machine etc. Vending machine is a pop machine. The bathrooms were clean and well kept. No bathroom fan for some unknown reason.... The hallways are showing some wear, but you're only in the hall for 10 seconds a day....no big deal. Overall though, I don't imagine these complaints are much different than other hotels so I'd have to say that with that in mind, its a good value for the location and although I had minor complaints, they were friendly, courteous and quick to resolve.

Reviews.Title: “I'm ready to go back”
Reviews.Author: jrod1611
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked we felt like we were welcomed and a valued guest. The front desk staff was unbelievably accomodating ando friendly and even upgraded our room to a high floor with a strip view. The room was clean and spacious. The pool area was better than expected as both of us spent several days there. After the first day the staff knew our names and treated us like family. I also tweeted about the hotel and staff on several occasions and without fail everytime I was either retweeted with a comment or resolution to the my question. I have never encountered this amount of socialan networking from any hotel within Las Vegas. We will be back as we were very impressed with all facets of the property and service levels.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: CaptainClaud
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nice and quiet, a good place to get away from all the young people and fast pace of the strip. I was only here for a couple of nights. The lobby/check in area is very elegant, lots of fresh flowers on the counters but the smell of the flowers can be over powering at times. Check in was quick, we arrived very early in the morning at 8 am, so we were able to check in, and check our bags with the concierge. However, our room was not available until 5 pm, which a big inconvenience because by 2pm, we were ready to take a shower and relax for a bit before getting ready for a night out on the town. The hotel room was modern with a very comfortable bed, and we had a great view of the strip. We had brunch at the buffet twice it was wonderful lots of food and the brunch came with your choice of champagne or mimosas. The hotel also has a food court with subway, mcdonlads, they even have their 1$ menu which gets packed after a night out on the town. We did have a good time at the bar/restaurant Diablo’s Cantina. The dj played some great hip-hop music. The location of the Monte Carlo hotel is great, we walked over to New York New York and there was a great nightclub there, also they have Coyote Ugly, which is a lot of fun, expect lots of younger people and very loud casino at that hotel. Overall, the Monte Carlo hotel is a great value for the price

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: NaddieNewfoundland
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to Vegas for my husband and I, so we took along our two grown daughters and my mother-in-law. The Monte Carlo hotel was not a disappointment. I chose it because the rate was great, the rooms looked good online and the location was ideal. Having stayed the previous year at the Luxor and being very disappointed, I was a little more careful when booking this time around. I was very pleasantly surprised that The Monte Carlo was even better than expected. The rooms were clean,good sized, but not great views of the strip as it is set back a bit. Howver the views of the mountains from the rear of the hotel are fabulous. The beautiful scent of roses hits you everytime you enter the huge marble lobby making this hotel very nice to come back to after a long vegas night. The only downfall of our stay and the reason I booked the Flamingo for this years trip was because after making reservations at the steakhouse, we were left standing for about 1/2 hour while the female maitre d' accepted bribes from people without reservations. Now I know this goes on everywhere, and had she let one or two in ahead of us i would have had no problem. But eleven people without reservations skipped ahead of us while she filled her pockets. So no going back for us.

Reviews.Title: “Good value on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: vski16
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Monte Carlo several times, each for multiple nights. We feel it's one of the best values for a "nicer" property on the Strip. The service is efficient and friendly and rooms are clean and well-appointed. Like most hotels on the Strip, the standard rooms do not have refrigerators or coffee makers. Internet and gym are included with the mandatory room fee of $15/night. There is a nice food court, the buffet is decent, and easy access to the City Center and the other Strip hotels. The only annoyance is that there is an afternoon pool party (Thurs through Sunday) where DJ music is blasted at the pool. If you have a room on the pool side of the building, you will be treated to a pounding beat all afternoon (but who stays in their room in Vegas?). If you want a quieter experience, request a room away from the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Just what I wanted from a Vegas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HuskerFan2009
Reviews.Content: I went to Vegas for the first time this back in June. I had seen the movies with the fancy suites, but I basically wanted a nice bed to sleep in and a bathroom. The only times I was in the room was to sleep and recover. **the hotel lobby was really neat. Had shops, restaurants, a little convience store, and really open so a lot of people could roam free in there. The Casino was a casino. So nothing to fancy there. **i really enjoyed the Foodcourt in the hotel as it gave me a cheaper option to eat something quick. **My favorite part of this hotel was the pool scene. They had a pool where you could just relax, a wave pool, and a lazy river. The service for booze was great, it was hard to have an empty drink in your hand. **The only knock is that it is kindof of at the end of the strip. So its a good walk to the bellagio, Ceasars, etc - but still, I would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as in the past”
Reviews.Author: BikeHawk
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Monte Carlo several times, but this was probably our last visit. Room was fine except for the bedding (large heavy comforter). We called housekeeping and requested a traditional blanket and were told it would be delivered to our room - never came. We always liked the fact that one can get to the pool without traversing thru a casino or shopping area like so many vegas hotels and that their was a nice food court right by the door to the pool. In the past we could bring snacks and drinks from the food court to the pool, but now they have what we heard several guests refer to as the 'purse police' at the pool entrance. They would not even allow guests to bring in a coffee they had just purchased from the hotel's own food court and the attitude was far from friendly - must be a training ground for future TSA agents! The prices at the pool, of course were outlandish. We also hated the non-stop loud hip hop music at the pool which was definitely not in line with the demographics of most of the guests during the weekdays - (thank God for I-pods). The final straw was the unadvertised $ 15.00 per day 'Resort Fee' - keep that in mind when comparing price of rooms with the Harrah's affiliated hotels which don't charge a resort fee.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: Kohmann
Reviews.Content: Upgrade to the spa suite!! It's still the same or less per night as a regular room anywhere else and it's awesome!! This hotel is gorgeous, quiet but right on the strip, the rail behind the hotel takes you straight to the Bellagio with stops along the way. Check in is a breeze, booking tours and shows is easy peasy at the concierge. We love Vegas but we really love the Monte Carlo!! We're going again in April and wouldn't stay anywhere else!!

Reviews.Title: “April @ Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: DENEISE72
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at the Monte Carlo and I have to say that I am just as happy with it the second time as I was the first. We checked in late and threw out things in the room and then went to The Pub for a late dinner. They have the most awesome burgers there. Monte Carlo is pretty centrally located on the strip that it is easy access to amost everywhere. I also enjoy Monte Carlo because of its size. It isn't one of those hotels that it takes you 15 minutes to walk threw the casino before you even get to the elevators to get to your room. Would definately say that I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Siko
Reviews.Content: This trip (August 21 to 26, 2011) was for my wife's 40th birthday. Neither of us had ever been to Las Vegas before, so we were pretty excited to see the sights. Not knowing a lot about where everything is located, but knowing that we wanted to stay on the strip, I did a little research and based on the great price, I booked us in at the Monte Carlo. We checked in late (1:30 AM), so they did not have the king bed room with a strip view that we booked....completely understandable....they said they would get us the room we booked the next day. And they did. The front desk staff were nice and they were helpful. The pool area was nice, lots of room and it never seemed that busy even though there were a lot of people. I know a lot of people on other reviews complained that you can't bring beverages into the pool area and have to buy there....well, that's just the way it is. You're on vacation. If you're going to get upset about having to pay a few extra bucks for a drink, stay home. The food court area was nice and handy for breakfasts (McDonald's, Subway, Starbucks). There is no big "attraction" at this hotel, which makes it nice.....it is a plain, quieter hotel, which was fine by us. If we decide to go back some day, I will probably book a different hotel just for variety. We had no issues with the Monte Carlo at all!

Reviews.Title: “Could be cleaner...”
Reviews.Author: kentexuk75
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last January & last week, the Hall carpets are filthy as ever, the windows are disgustingly dirty so view or not no pix taken this trip, overall housekeeping needs to be stepped up. The loud music from the pools bounced off the walls and gave me a headache, so if you want to gamble till the wee hours and expect to get some sleep during the morning forget it!! The room service Eggs Benedict was undercooked and stone cold, the coffee was bland. I could say more but the bottom line is we will stay elsewhere next time, the Mirage and MGM are better hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay heart of the strip”
Reviews.Author: BrooklyniteLA
Reviews.Content: Overall: Nice hotel, 3.5~4 star IMO, great location, good food at restaurants, very nice & helpful staff at check in (Gina helped me with check in and Mary at check out and they were both courteous and helpful, I didnt get any free upgrades but both felt me feel very welcome at the hotel). Hotel: The front has a magnificent water fountain and beautiful status but the entrance lacks lights and colors to attract and invite by passers inside the hotel. It feels abandoned. The hideous Mexican/vampire restaurant in the front has covered some part of the architecture and it feels like an added sore thumb to the architecture of the building, I have a feeling this was not part of the original hotel design. They should change that to give it a Monte Carlo feel and look (Monte Carlo is in FRANCE no Mexico, also it should remind people of luxury and elegance not vampires and good times with lots of comfort food.
