Don't take me wrong I am a big fan of Mexican food just the restaurant doesn't fit in this hotel). Great parking we were able to park within 100ft of the elevator every time for some reason. And they don't make you walk miles inside from parking to elevator, very quick walk from escalator passing check in and elevators. Pools: The best part of the hotel IMO second to location are the 3 pools and spa. A lazy river and a wave pool that goes on once every like 15 minutes or so. I added a video here. Lots of security and life guards and it feels safe for families and kids unlike the stupid video that comes up on YouTube when you lookup Monte Carlo there. Thats why I added the video. There was a drunk middle age lady in the lazy river there who was immediately ejected from the pool area along with her husband, I think she was just having fun but someone complained I guess. Restaurants: We had food at the buffet, the Cafe and the food court. The buffet was ok, not sure if it was worth $19.99 maybe on the weekends when its $25~$26 is better, nothing fancy. The Cafe was really good, we loved eating there breakfast every day. The staff were nice and helpful. Our room key gave us buy one get one free appetizers. The PUB near the pool (cant take their food to the pool chairs) has amazing sliders for $1 from 3-6pm. The only place without happy hour is the pool area restaurant where they bring you food and drinks to your chair so they get you there with $13 drinks and $55~$70 pitchers! No discounts or coupons anywhere. There is free ice at the food court from the machines, which is very helpful. McDonalds and Starbucks right down the elevator? Cant beat that (warning: Starbucks costs almost about twice, Grande Coffee is $3.50 as opposed to $1.95 in LA). Rooms: Well they are dated probably from their original 4.5 status, we have stayed here twice once in 2009 and again in 2011 and its just getting more dated and may fall into 3Star soon if the owners dont start spending some money in the rooms. They still look great and comfortable though but dont give you the sense of luxury or the sense of crisp cleanness you get at like Holiday Inn Express in Henderson. Location: Once you park here you can walk to most parts of the strip (well walking to Venetian and Rio may be a bit far) its right next door to City Center and Luxor on both sides and they both have trams to talk to to a couple more casinos if you dont want to walk too much (well finding the tram is a walk by itself).

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Rosalind0
Reviews.Content: The first time I stayed at the Monte Carlo Hotel in Las Vegas was great. However, the 2nd time, we were put in a room at the very end of the hall with no view (same price as the previous time), it was quite noisy as the outside deliveries started at about 4:00am. The room was nothing special. It really needed to be renovated. Also, I love the pool area as it has the wave pool, warm pool and lazy river. However, if you sit in that area, around noon the music gets very loud. They cater more to the young crowd and don't seem to care that it is a mixed crowd and that everyone does not want the music to be "pounding in your ears".

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: Reen_11
Reviews.Content: Although I have stayed at Mirage and Planet Hollywood Towers and I loved PH towers... Monte Carlo was a good hotel for the price I paid. I found the deal on twitter and it was a 48 hour sale deal. I loved how my girls and I got there at 9am and were able to check in right away. There's also WiFi at the hotel. We got the 19th floor and the view was amazing! The hotel was central and easy to get on the strip. There's a CVS right beside the hotel so that was super convenient. If you are a fast food lover, you will like the food court. The hotel does not have a lot of shopping, but Planet Hollywood was across the street so it was easy access to a shopping mall. Nightlife was alright. They have a new spot called Brand Lounge. It is small but very good music if you don't like house music. They played good hip hop, r&b mix. They were doing a promo if the girls paid $20 you get to drink for free all night. The only complain about this hotel is that there's a distinct smell throughout the hotel. Our hotel floor stunk and we got towels that smelt burnt. It was strange. Room service was quick. The breakfast I ordered was good, but the pasta for dinner was average. The price for hotel was affordable and would stay here again if I find a good deal

Reviews.Title: “Chips...and not the good kind”
Reviews.Author: Grungie
Reviews.Content: Our overall stay was pleasant but we noticed a nacho cheese Dorito chip on the floor of our room when we checked in. We left it on the floor to see how long it would take to get cleaned and it was still in the same place when we checked out. It definitely did not speak well for the cleanliness of the room! The people at the concierge desk were exceptionally friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good”
Reviews.Author: Riemanniscing
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Monte Carlo because of a special and were quite surprised. I was expecting old and tacky but got reasonable and fun. No it's not luxe, but it is nice and well placed on the strip. Easy access to other properties.

Reviews.Title: “Very average”
Reviews.Author: FoodSnob1
Reviews.Content: Monte Carlo is very average considering the great location. It is in desperate need of a reno. It often has good rates, so I guess you get what you pay for. Although the pool area has a lazy river and wave pool, it attracts a younger crowd that can't seem to keep their inappropriate behaviour in check. Not the best if you have children with you. I will only go there if I absolutely have to.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value on The Strip”
Reviews.Author: mhn14
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 weeks ago and got a Sun/Mon for $116.00 through Expedia. The hotel in general is very clean and well kept up. We had a room facing the pool and even though we were on the 31st floor the music from the pool was still loud. My biggest complaint with all MGM properties is the resort fee which covers Internet,free local phone calls, a newspaper and the ability to print airline boarding passes. I wouldn't complain about the fee if you actually got something of value in return, I was paying $15 a day for the USA Today. Otherwise you can't beat the location and the pool area while loud is not over crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Standards slipping”
Reviews.Author: sammy1222
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here probably 10 times over last 10-15 years and although you can still get some pretty good rates the buffet and cafe have slipped significantly . The cafe told us there was a15 minute delay while when there was hardly anybody thereat noon and I asked to see someone to complain. While waiting for a supervisor a party of six left stating they had waited for 20 minutes after being seated and nobody came to take there order. The supervisor came and seated us immediately and a waiter came right away. The buffet kept the entries from noon through close to six PM and many of the items were dried out under the lights. The casino itself was never very busy in comparison to surrounding hotels and it seems people just want the rates but leave for other destinations as the hotel seems to have lost its way . The only area that people seemed to enjoy was the pub where the Dueling piano fellows from New York New York played

Reviews.Title: “An ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: perkypatsy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and "adequate" . The towels are thin and there are not too many amenities in the room anymore other than basic soap and shampoo and conditioner. My biggest beef is the incredibly loud "techno music" that is constantly filling the casino and, worse, drowning out all conversation around the pool. It is impossible to just sit and relax by the pool with that music constantly pounding at highest volume. Maybe if you are 25 ......

Reviews.Title: “Needs renovating”
Reviews.Author: jch218
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo in Veas needs renovating. It has no safe's in the room and everything is pretty worn. Plus, their internet is ethernet only, no wifi. Apple MacBook Air could not hook up and they weren't willing to find a solution for us. Water in bathtub ran very slowly out and finally just clogged up. Seems the maids would have noticed this.

Reviews.Title: “Good room and service, not great”
Reviews.Author: b3b
Reviews.Content: We stayed 8 days in the Monte Carlo Resort, in Las Vegas. It was good, but could have been better. Hotel check-in was quick but not friendly. Room was neat, but not clean. There was gum in the carpet that we asked to have removed. Floors needed a good cleaning. We did receive a lot of comps due to our complaints though. We had a refrigerator brought to our room (usual cost $25/day) - comped. Our room deal included two buffet breakfast or lunch, and we were three people - third price was comped. We actually could have had more comped, but we had paid for tickets and other meals with visa, rather than charging it to our room. The location of this hotel is ideal and fairly quiet. We used the fitness centre and although busy, it is a fair size and there are plenty of options for working out. This was probably the best part of this hotel! My Top 10 Tips - 1) if you rent a car, use valet parking, it was free! 2) If you plan to shop at the outlet mall, sign up on their website for a free coupon book. They had plenty of good deals. 3) If you plan to do shows within your hotel's affiliated hotels e.g. Monte Carlo is affiliated with MGM, Aria, Ex Calibur and Mandalay Bay, charge them to your room. 4) If you "like" a hotel resort on facebook, prior to going, you may be eligible for some extra deals. 5) Sign up for groupon, or dealfinder, to see if they have discounted excursions in the Las Vegas area. 6) At the Monte Carlo pool, there is a lazy river. To rent an inner tube for the day, it was $9.00. To buy an intertube that says Monte Carlo, it was $11 or $12 dollars. However, you can also bring your own. 7) If you have a car, and want to visit old vegas, you can park in the parking tower and get your parking comped, if you eat at one of the older casinos. We ate at Fitgerald's. Food was great. 8) If you want to see the G&S Pawn Shop from the Pawn Stars TV show, get there early, i.e. 10am or earlier. 9) There is a Disney store outlet at the Premium Outlet Mall North, or a Disney Characters outlet at Premium Outlet Mall South. The North store had the better deals. 10) Drink plenty of water. We bought a case of water at the drugstore, and refilled our bottles as needed. There are plenty of vendors selling water for $1.00 a bottle on the strip. Check the convenience stores though, you can often get a bottle for $0.69. Loved Vegas. We're going back when Shania Twain comes to town.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us!”
Reviews.Author: OACS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel from August 14 - August 19, 2011. We paid a little extra to have a high room overlooking the strip and asked for a king bed. When we got there we had a friendly and quick check in. When we got to our room there were two double beds and the room was NOT overlooking the strip. It was frustrating because the person who checked us in could have warned us that we were NOT getting what we paid for. Anywho, we got a new room, but the new room was not cleaned. The bed was unmade and the toilet was dirty. I called down again (this time furious) and they gave us a room with strip view and two double beds, with the option to switch when a room with a king bed and strip view became available the next day. They were very apologetic and made the stay super affordable, but it did make our trip get off to a bad start. The bed and pillows were clean, and the TV was a large LCD with internet I believe because there was a key board. The hotel has WiFi which i was able to log into but not my husband and one day I couldn't log in at all. They also have Ethernet connection in the room. The room was just good enough and it a good size too. We only slept there. The Casino was nice. And there is a food court with McD's and other fast food restaurants. There is also a mall which connects to the hotel. The pool area was really nice with an over abundance of sun loungers. It was too bad we didn't have time to laze around the pool, I think I would have loved it! The location of the hotel was perfect for us. It is just beside the City Centre mall. There is a CVS pharmacy right beside and a Walgreens across the street. There is a tram in the hotel which can take you to the Bellagio which is what we did one day to cut the walking in half when we went to a show. All in all a positive experience. I might stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “THIS IS A 4-STAR ???”
Reviews.Author: druhbarnes
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed with this hotel/casino . I had a printed out confirmation for a HIGH FLOOR Delux room, when I checked in, the hotel just listed Delux room, not High Floor. The man on the desk told me that I could come back @ 3:oopm the next day and get a high floor for an extra charge. Our room on the 6th floor was ok but the furnishings were getting rather SHABBY, the hallway carpet was stained and dirty, a light was flickering on and off the whole stay. This is NOT what I expect from a property listed as a 4 Star.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and have been back”
Reviews.Author: Joe S
Reviews.Content: Great time at the Monte Carlo. Employees are very friendly, restaurants are great as is the food court.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: carter2010
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Monte Carlo Hotel and Casino, Las Vegas, July 18-22, 2011. I enjoyed the spacious, clean, quiet room overlooking the Strip. I was surprised how spacious the rooms were and the quality furnishings, comfortable beds, etc. This hotel has a dignified modern atmosphere that is perfect for me! I have stayed at this hotel twice before (2001, 2008) and I would gladly return for another vacation. Best of all, the rates are very economical if rooms are reserved early!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel on the Las Vegas strip”
Reviews.Author: JCinSpain
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo is a great value destination in a good location on the Las Vegas Strip. The rooms were big and comfortable and had every amenity you would generally require. The reception staff were always very helpful. This is a great value option because it is generally so much cheaper than many other strip hotels. I would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “EHHHHH.....no different than Motel 6...except for the casino, of course”
Reviews.Author: seepack
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not bad. It just wasn't great. For the price, I guess, it was awesome. However, this was my first time in Vegas and I had this image in my mind that all the hotels in Vegas (especially on the strip) would be GLORIOUS (even for the average room). The hotel room itself was, literally, no different that your average hotel/motel in your home-town. I was disappointed. Food was good at the buffet--did not try any other restaurant. Casino was average. DO NOT and I mean DO NOT waste your time/money/energy at the bars/nightclubs at this hotel. They have a ton of promoters trying to get people into the lounge, and they say you pay $20 for a cup, then you can refill it as much as you like. The problem is, there are only 5 drinks to choose from, and they are not very good. The pool was ok. We almost could not find a chair, but when we did, the waitress was prompt to come take our order. Water was cold, but it was so hot outside it was refreshing. They did not allow any outside drinks/food to be brought into the pool area, and the drinks were expensive. Man, the more I write this, the more I find myself complaining! eeek! Anyway, for the money we spent ( a package deal for flight and hotel for 4 days for $350) it was about what you would expect. But there is nothing special about the Monte Carlo and I will, for sure, not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: dusty008
Reviews.Content: Spent March break in Vegas for the second time, with spouse and friends - even though we are all way past college age. Had a great time. The Monte Carlo Hotel is deluxe without being over the top. The location is great. The rooms are more than adequate. I like the elevators for designated floors so you don't have to stop 20 times or wait forever. The front desk staff were all very efficient, polite and friendly. The pool area is terrific - especially like the Lazy River now that they don't let it be filled with people just standing around drinking beer. And Vegas itself is always a fun few days.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: 686lauran
Reviews.Content: Not a lot to say really! Was nice enough, I would stay here again but nothing special! The room was really big and clean, the bathroom was clean! The only thing I didn’t like is that the music from the pool is really loud! When you are outside you have to shout at each other and our room was facing the pool so when we went up in the afternoon you could just here the bass from the tunes!! I’m young but it gave me a bad head!!

Reviews.Title: “Ok Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mack184
Reviews.Content: Staff very friendly. Rooms are a good size. The rooms smell of smoke. The bath towels smelled of smoke. This was supposed to be a non smoking room

Reviews.Title: “OK, but would probably stay elsewhere if there's a next time”
Reviews.Author: NorfolkCommonMan
Reviews.Content: Impressive atrium and entrance. Long wait for check-in. Not given a room on an upper floor as requested with the booking. Room safe failed first day - security very helpful, but unable to resolve - had to use lobby deposit box. I had to wait 20 minutes to speak to a receptionist in the lobby - there was another who seemed free, but refused to deal with me "because it wouldn't be fair" to the others in the queue, even though I was not trying to check ot or in, and I was late for a tour. The safe was fixed later that day by a maintenance engineer - very helpful and efficient. Apart from the pool, there's really nothing else here to excite - just a casino, really. Contrast with many of the other 'resorts' on the Strip, which are almost theme parks. In summary, reception unhelpful and rather unfriendly, other staff fine. No 'added value' if you're looking for more than a casino.

Reviews.Title: “In need of revamp”
Reviews.Author: DJH1973
Reviews.Content: This hotel is part of the MGM hotel chain and in comparison to a couple of their other properties is in need of updating, just the general decor is old, carpets wall paper light fittings etc all old and dated, some guests complaining of no mini bar/fridges in room. If you don"t venture in to the other hotels you would be very happy with the Monte Carlo and in all we were, the staff were friendly, it is in the centre of the strip has a variety of restaurants (Dragon noodle fantastic) and bars, has a decent gym (only visited once.) decent sized casino with good music whilst you play. Great wave pool and atmosphere at pool area, but bit annoying you pay $22 for a cocktail but cant take it back in to the hotel??? this was our second visit to Vegas and previously stayed in The Mirage we will definately return to Vegas again, but untill some work is done on the hotel would possibly look at others......

Reviews.Title: “value for money, good location”
Reviews.Author: TeessideChestnut
Reviews.Content: stayed at Monte Carlo at end of August and thought it offered good value for money compared with other hotels. It is in a good location on the strip with connecting free mono-rail to city centre and Ballagio hotel. No problems checking in - everyone friendly and helpful. Large room, clean with everything you need. Only downside was the pool area. It is not very large and half is in the shade - but with temperatures over 100, this was not a bad thing. Your bags are searched on entering the pool area and drinks and food taken off you. Once in the pool area there is a water fountain, so you do not have to purchase water (they are near the toilets) There were pool parties with DJ's on a Friday, Saturday and Sunday and these were EXTREMELY loud. The buffet at Monte Carlo was $17 rising to $20 on a weekend and more for evening time. We found that it is quite expensive now in Las Vegas for food and drink. Would recomment the Mon Ami Gabi restaurant at front of Paris hotel. good food, amazing view from patio area of Ballagio fountains. Don,t bother buying tickets for the mono-rail that runs from the MGM down to Harrahs hotel. by the time you have walked through the hotels to and from the mono-rail, you could be at the other end of the strip. save your money and walk.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, Average, Tired, Getting Old....”
Reviews.Author: LaoBlue
Reviews.Content: Come on, this hotel/casino is getting old. Rooms are so basic, thin walls, dirty carpets, old pumbing, loose wallpaper, slippery bathtubs! Gosh, if you pay more than 50 USD/night, you'd be better off spending more for a much nicer hotel on the strip! The only thing "good" about this hotel is that you can stay cheap and play elsewhere, even eat at another hotel, like the Aria (very nice and very new!). I would recommend staying next door at the Aria for a modern touch, or up the street in a more newerly hotel like the Bellagio (especially if it's your first time and you want some place very special - don't stay at the MC). Doors are thin, rooms are dark, and the "strip-view" is basically a look at the top of the casino roof! Our room included breakfast or lunch, and we ate at the Aria buffet - so nice and new, but a bit simple. The casino is old and smoke, but if you like those older and cheap machines to kill time, then MC is the place. Unfortunately, the MC and the MGM are old dinosaurs waiting for the wrecking ball. Even New York next door is showing it's age, but still has that charm just like NYC. The pools are squeezed between buildings and are showing age too, and nothing fancy. 15 dollar "resort" fee gets you free internet....and that's about it. MC is no resort by any means!

Reviews.Title: “Not outstanding but better than others!”
Reviews.Author: travel_bugz02
Reviews.Content: I found the rooms very comfortable and large compared to where I stayed previously. The rooms were clean and the bathroom was moderate. I would not say the rooms in this hotel are fabulously luxurious but for the price this is what is expected. I was happy to know it wasn’t a very long walk from the lobby to the room and I did not have to wait long for elevators nor were they always crowded. The hotel has all the amenities I required and was not too far located from much of the things I wanted to see and do. The casino of this hotel is ok nothing great, however the hotel lobby / shops area was clean better than many others. I wasn’t very impressed by the pool of this hotel and found it very small, compared to what’s out there. Overall a decent hotel for the price paid.

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL EXPERIENCE I HAVE EVER HAD”
Reviews.Author: emula79
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed here over Labor Day Weekend. The first night after we got back to the hotel, we realized our hotel room had been robbed. Over $500 worth of property was stolen from our room. We had closed and locked the door when we left earlier in the night. We called a security officer to our room, and he appeared to be intoxicated. He was very unhelpful and unprofessional the entire conversation. The next morning, we went down to the front desk and spoke to the hotel operations manager as well as the security office manager, both whom were also not helpful whatsoever and treated us as if we were not adults. The only thing they offered us was a food voucher at one of the hotel's restaurant. They did not seem to see our robbery as serious and treated us with disrespect. We did not receive any other relief other than the food voucher. On top of all of this, a pool employee that day told us to stay at a motel 6 when we asked if we could bring a bottle full of water into the pool area. I will never stay at this hotel again, and I will never recommend staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Well Located but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: BucksTraveller2010
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to Las Vegas, staying 2 nights just to get an initial experience of LV and the Strip. The hotel is well located with a tram service connecting to the adjacent hotels. The hotel is much more understated than the other hotels we visited, with a low-key theme compared to New York New York, Bellagio etc. Our2 rooms were opposite each other with 1 overlooking the pools and the other overlooking the Strip. Both were clean and comfortable. The breakfast buffet was good quality, short queues and reasonably priced. The pools were crowded with very loud music. Check-in queues were long when we arrived in late afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “Decent value but I won't be back”
Reviews.Author: Swooks
Reviews.Content: Room on the 22nd floor was clean and decor was upgraded. Fine for the price. No problem with check in and service was good. My only complaint, and it's a big one, was the ear-splittingly loud music at the pool! It was actually painful! I will probably not stay there again which is unfortunate. We've stayed at the Monte Carlo many times so I'm sad to write a negative review. I understand that the Monte is trying to market to a young, partying demographic, but it was ridiculous. Forget trying to relax. . My advice if you do stay there: head for the smaller pool just inside the gate to the left. It was a bit quieter away from the speakers.

Reviews.Title: “Too good to pass up”
Reviews.Author: kairosntx
Reviews.Content: I subscribe to several travel email deals and check specials to Las Vegas because the prices can be too good to pass up. We were amazed we could fly and get two nights at the Monte Carlo for a little over $200, taxes and fees included. We had never stayednat the Monte Carlo and were very impressed. The check-in was very smooth; they were staffed well and the front desk manager was making sure it was going as quickly as possible. Te room was spacious, clean and well appointed. The Monte Carlo is the best value of the four star star resorts on the strip!

Reviews.Title: “bed bugs spoiled the trip”
Reviews.Author: TamsinDeirdre
Reviews.Content: no hotel can beat monte carlo's strategic location on the strip. but our whole vegas trip was spoiled by bed bugs. we only found out i got bit countless of times a few days after we got home. the welts are actually still visible and the emotional stress and paranoia is still there. we had to fumigate the entire house and wash everything we have in high heat just to have peace of mind. the room we stayed in for a week was 344 ... if any monte carlo reps are reading this, please act on this immediately. i now am so afraid to travel after this whole ordeal

Reviews.Title: “very noisy”
Reviews.Author: Maureen264
Reviews.Content: great looking, clean hotel but very noisy. Understand this is Vegas but party in next room all night long and concierage wasn't too concerned when we reported this. pool also closes at 7 p.m. in summer! maybe 9 or 10 would have been better to cool down. no facilities in the rooms had to go to Starbucks for morning coffee. no laundry facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: magnoliad
Reviews.Content: MC was just OK . The big lobby has no real theme and the concierge ranged from great to frustrating in their responses. Family of 4 adults with the youngest 21 and the oldest hitting senior status. They could not provide 2 rooms on same floor with request for a king and 2 doubles . The boys liked their room even though it overlooked a parking lot. So far, so good. Our room had a moldy smell so we asked for a new room. They did accommodate, but to a room with 2 Queens and I expected they would find another room like the one we had booked. Not feeling quite as good. Beds were comfy and room was good size. It was little things like all the dust hanging off the lamps and the vents, the tattered wallpaper, a tap that ran all night . No horrible complaint just think we would have done better (first trip to Vegas) to try other hotels. We visited many casino's and enjoyed cobbled streets , light shows and more glitter than we had ever seen and coming back to MC was always OK but wanted to try rooms at other casinos .

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare hotel! Stay away!”
Reviews.Author: persianprnces
Reviews.Content: This was the worse hotel in vegas ever! Horrible maid service dirty floors chipped broken furniture. No sun at pool! Ridiculously loud music and dj at pool! Rude staff everywhere. Did not feel welcomed not for one second! If u decide to stay here u may save time and just flush ur money down toilet. Can't say enough what a disappointment this place was. Never again!

Reviews.Title: “Di Vino Restaurant Monte Carlo --great Italian food & good value”
Reviews.Author: sheilaDallas
Reviews.Content: We visited the :"newish" Di Vino Restaurant --only the restaurant this trip. The food was good, very reasonably priced and the portions HUGE. We had their Sunday red sauce special--lasagna for me--ravioli for my honey. Both were great. Service was good and it was gratifying to see the manager checking on customers and showing a lot of interest in customers' opinions. It has a pleasant atmosphere off the casino floor, and is a great place for an informal dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Oldtimer037
Reviews.Content: We were celebrating an anniversary having a two night stay. Arrived at the hotel at 1pm and was allowed to check in. We found the hotel to have extremely good customer service. Our room was on the 29th floor which is a non smoking floor. The room was large and roomy and was just OK. The AC seemed a little overloaded with 111 degree outdoor temp. One of the express elevators was out of service and the wait occasionally was slow but not inconvenient. Pool area is great.

Reviews.Title: “Fair accomodations for a fair price.....”
Reviews.Author: powell'sparty
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three days at end of August to relax and visit with my family that met us there. Rooms were nice, a bit tattered but clean, pool was a nice break from the heat, but music was a bit loud to actually stay too long.Nice to have rooms accessible to pool with out a long walk through casino, and options for a lower cost snack or meal at the food court. Had a great lunch at Diablos on front of property. Still miss not having a coffee pot in the room but I guess all of Vegas doesn't want you to linger to long in your room in the mornings, but I fixed that problem...i bring my own!! If you are doing alot of walking on the strip, I would suggest staying in a property closer to the middle of all the action, was alot of walking.....but tram through city center is convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale and classy, clean, and inexpensive, good deal for the price and location.”
Reviews.Author: blazerbryant
Reviews.Content: Pros: Large, clean, modern room. Flat panel TV (but no HD channels). Classy un-creepy casino floor. Good pool for tanning and splashing around. Good location with indoor corridor to Aria and tram to Crystals and Bellagio. VERY comfortable beds. Cons: Weird showerhead like standing under a high-pressure firehose spray. "Resort fee" of sixteen bucks a day added on at checkin even if you pre-pay (priceline, etc). Buffet was just OK for twenty bucks for mid-week dinner.  We used priceline to bid for a four star hotel on the strip and ended up at Monte Carlo. Pleasantly surprised. Having previously stayed at Circus Circus and Riviera, which seemed old and scuzzy, this place seemed simple and rather theme-less by Vegas standards, but the room was large, very clean, and had a flat panel TV. I could tell it was a few years older, but still appeared in fairly new condition. Plus there was a few perks like an ihome style iPhone charger stereo and alarm clock. Free newspapers in the hallway. The hotel is one of few where you can check in and go to your room without walking through a casino floor (although getting to the strip outside requires a casino walkthrough). Others have complained about the perfume smell throughout, but I actually enjoyed it and found it much more refreshing than the universally smoky smell everywhere else in Vegas. Pool was nice, the main pool is however usually in the shade, with the wave pool and lazy river in the sun. Chairs were pretty crowded together but we were there on Tuesday so it wasn't crowded with people. NO WIFI, paid or otherwise in the room. I would stay here again and recommend it, but don't overpay. It doesn't really have a theme or attractions so you'll spend more time exploring elsewhere if you're not gambling. Try pricelining four-star around 40-50 a night (weekday) or just look for similar price deals on their website.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the price”
Reviews.Author: Olivia E
Reviews.Content: I’ve stayed at the Monte Carlo 3 times now, the most recent being just a few days ago. I keep going back for various reasons, number one being the price for the location. I just stayed on a Sunday and Monday and booked using a promotional code I found online and the rates were only $48 a night plus I received 2 Jabbawockeez tickets for the price of 1. We got the 5th row from the stage, and because of the deal only paid $90 total for the show. I also noticed some changes in the Monte Carlo from a year ago when I stayed. They have added new Samsung flat screens and new bedding and pillows to the rooms. My number 1 complaint after staying there a year ago was that they needed to update their rooms a bit, and they have definitely done that. Check in and check out was less than 5 minutes, and all the staff I enountered were very nice. It’s also great because the hotel is directly connected to Aria, and has a free tram going to Vdara, Aria and the Bellagio, it is highly convenient and allows you to skip the taxis. There is a resort fee, but over half all the hotels on the strip have an unavoidable resort fee, at least it includes free internet. Also make sure you stop by the pool, the lazy river is my personal favorite, the wave pool is nice too. There is loud music at the pool, yes, but hello?? This is Vegas not a monastary retreat. I would definitely recommend this hotel if you want a great value for your money. If you want high-end you will need to pay A LOT more and look into the newer hotels. Just make sure you thoroughly shop all the promotional codes for the best values, also of course, Vegas is always cheaper if you don’t go on the weekends. I would also recommend the Blue Man Group and the Jabbawockeez shows. Both are great.

Reviews.Title: “Could have stayed elsewhere for half the price....”
Reviews.Author: Love4Daksap
Reviews.Content: The rooms were nice and the bed very comfortable but not worth double the price of another hotel just as comfy and nice. Yeah it has nice pools, but I just wasn't impressed with the overall value considering the price. The casino wasn't a good payout, so we went elsewhere. We asked for more towels and we got them, but the guest service for other things were not as efficient.

Reviews.Title: “THE KIDS LOVED IT...SO WE LOVED IT TOO!!”
Reviews.Author: ved_11
Reviews.Content: IT SPELL BINDS YOU with its myriad facets....fast..efficient..comfy beds...a good wavepool..and you dont have to cross the casino to reach the elevators. mc donalds,subway ,sbarro all there so the kids had their choice. lazy river was a focal point for the kids and the queen size beds a comforter for us with the kidsThe hotel could do with a little bit of renovation but still it is good . THE hotel is not grand but comfy ALL IN ALL... good location ,good food ,good beds...all in a good value....so go try it.

Reviews.Title: “Not Horrible”
Reviews.Author: Alice512
Reviews.Content: This is a typical 3 star hotel. Needs updating, pool is noisy, young crowd. Slots are a mixture of old and new. Bathroom has one sink, two would make it much nicer. Bedroom is large, nice TV Food is just ok, but you do have a Starbucks, McDonalds, Subway, etc on the premises which helps keep the cost of food down. Not bad, but was a $12 cab ride from the Wynn and other upscale resorts. Hair salon was excellent and affordable.

Reviews.Title: “good location but old and shabby”
Reviews.Author: judy d
Reviews.Content: smallish rooms , old decor, sunked bed matres . the casino looks fine and the main floor but the rooms seam old and overused. the carpet in the coridor was dusty and steined. will not return nor advise others to go.

Reviews.Title: “OK room, Great location”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Path
Reviews.Content: This one is getting age but it's still nice and perfectly located at the best spot in Vegas. It's also one of the lowest rate on the strip. The free skytrain to the Aria and the Bellagio is very convenient. I recommend it for a low cost trip. If your focus is on comfort and luxury, this aint the place. I rate it 3.5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but it was just... eh.”
Reviews.Author: tanIamTexas
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a bachelorette party in Vegas and we stayed at the Monte Carlo for its location and price. I loved our view of New York, New York and it was really quiet on our floor (for the few hours we actually spent sleeping.) The Monte Carlo is home to Minus 5 Ice Bar, the Jabbowakeez show and Brand Ultra Lounge, and it has several places to eat, including a food court for those late night hunger rages. We accepted the $20 offer to go to the Brand one night with free unlimited drinks upon entry, but if we had known how tiny the club was and how awful their drinks were, we wouldn't have gone there. The music was great, but there was no room to move. The casino is large, but lifeless. Yes, there are plenty of people there gambling, but it is dark and dull. No bling, no dancers, nobody seemed to be having fun in there. It was like a cave for gambling addicts who aren't there for fun. Just my opinion. We ended up taking a limo downtown and hitting up the casinos on Fremont Street and they were WAY more fun. Plus they had cheaper tables for us lightweights. The rooms were nothing to write home about. We had adjoining rooms on the 17th floor and the view was nice, but the rooms left much to be desired. We had certain "stains" on our bedding, which was gross and there was a hair on the bathtub. The other room had a bathroom that smelled repulsive the entire trip. The beds were comfortable though, not that that would matter much after an exhausting night on the town. The pool area is nice, but crowded. I liked that it had a regular pool, a wave pool, and a lazy river. You had to pay for the tube rentals though, which was kind of lame. One thing that the resorts I've stayed at in Mexico and Jamaica can learn from this place though, is how to fit enough lounge chairs to accommodate the guests! Kudos to the Monte Carlo for having ample chairs. The music was loud, but it was good! And this is Vegas! The shops were just okay, but there are plenty of other hotels nearby with great shops, so that didn't matter. You're right between New York and the Bellagio and a short walk from Paris, too. There are plenty of great places to go that are super close. Oh, we LOVED Fat Burger, which is directly across the street. Great burgers on the cheap!!! Just a little bonus for you! After we all partied on Fremont Street one night, we decided we liked "Old Vegas" better than the strip for nightlife. They had some great free performances and everything seemed more affordable there. Make sure you squeeze in a ride downtown if you do stay on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Not opulent but still very nice”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Mimi12
Reviews.Content: This was the first time that I had stayed in the Monte Carlo and I had booked a last minute deal on the internet. There is no one particular draw to the hotel which means there are less gaping tourists to navigate around. The room was quite nice - not luxurious but still nice. We were not particularly drawn to any of the restaurants and there was no coffee besides Starbucks. However, the greatest draw for us about the Monte Carlo is the free tram which connects it with CityCenter and Bellagio. We spent a nice morning in the pool area before spending the day hanging out on other parts of the Strip. I would definitely stay here again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price!”
Reviews.Author: jandm7
Reviews.Content: After reading so many reviews and got to experience it myself, I say some people on here really exagerate. Yes the hotel is old but you already new that when you booked your stay, it will have stains on the carpet and holes in the wall. That goes with any old hotel. No one is perfect. We were allowed to check in early. The gal jennifer at the counter was really sweet. I dont know why people complained about staff, they were all very helpful, friendly, and approachable. The pool was fun. I love the volleyball court. The sand is nice and cool. My only complaint about the hotel would be the advertisement in the elevator, annoying!!! I would stay here again for the price. In general for vegas.. I dont like the fact that mostly all the restaraunts close at 11 or 12.. who goes to bed early when they are there. You dont have much to choose from after 12am. :( Ride the deuce! $20 for 3 days or $7 for 24 hrs. Taxis are expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value. Great Location. Weird smell.”
Reviews.Author: smamimam
Reviews.Content: Location: - Perfect location for "new" Vegas. Right in the center of everything - bars, hotels, casino's, shopping. It is an $18.00 cab ride to "old" Vegas which you HAVE to see. Freemont Street is a must. Rooms: We stayed in a standard room, pool view. It was a typical hotel room. Very Clean. Bed and pillows were great. Very comfortable. Staff: Over-the-top friendly, helpful and courteous. There is not a bad thing we can say about anyone we met in Vegas from the hotel staff, to the restaurant staff, bar and even cab drivers. Complaint: There is a very strange "perfume" smell in the Monte Carlo. It must be coming out of the vents or something. We visited a lot of hotels and the Monte Carlo was the only hotel that had this very distinct unpleasant perfume smell. If you are sensitive to smells this may really bother you. It's not really noticeable in the rooms, but it is like a punch in the face as soon as you get into the lobby and it is in the casino as well. I'm not sure what odor they are trying to cover up with this perfume that is constantly wafting in the air, but they need to figure something else out. You can't get away from it unless you leave the hotel. They can also do without the "resort fee". There are many hotels waiving the resort fee. You really don't get anything from paying for it. Use of pool, towels, internet connection in your room.

Reviews.Title: “The casino is nice but the rooms are outdated and not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: djrealone
Reviews.Content: We paid for a strip view and one king bed. We get to our room and have two twin beds and no strip view. The lady at the counter said its considered a strip view but the end of the strip. Eventually after arguing we got another room with strip view and one bed. But this room had a shower head from the 1970s with water pressure that hurt when you shower. Also there was no refrigerator no ice bucket and the room just felt old. I was very dissapointed as it was our first time in Vegas. The pool facilities and casino were very nice though.

Reviews.Title: “Worn and dated but expected for the price.”
Reviews.Author: Moxsd
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo is a fine hotel, especially for the prices you pay. The room itself is older, carpet shows it age and the bathroom is small. I did not mind this as it was 1/4 the price of higher end hotels. The amenities of the room are very very few. The grounds are MUCH nicer than the rooms, lobby, pub, Diablos are all really fun and nice. The Pub had a great happy hour as did Diablos. I found the staff to be super nice and happy to assist. I also enjoyed that you got comped drinks at the bar slots, Wynn does not offer this. The only issue we had was on our first night. There was a violent fight on our floor which took security about 15 minutes to contain. It was an apparent domestic violence fight and the women was obviously the aggressor and extremely intoxicated. I understand protocols of giving warnings etc, but after 10 minutes of screams, "f bombs" and finally a physical attack on security it seemed the situation should have been handled faster. The couple was eventually handcuffed, arrested, and thrown our of the hotel. I understand this CAN HAPPEN at any hotel, it just seemed MORE THAN LIKELY to happen at the Monte Carlo. If you get a super price its fine, don't expect 4 star. If you can get a room for 40 bucks more at Vdara or a nicer spot, do it. Clean, Fun, Safe and if affordable it can be a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Great areas in some cases but needs a update badly”
Reviews.Author: vgasdude
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Monte Carlo for two nights Aug 23rd through the 25th in a Monaco Suite. First lets start with the good. The hotel lobby and downstairs area including the casino are clean , bright, etc with a good selection of machines for the most part including new machines like American Idol, Wheel of Fortune, Sex and the City etc. The employees are very helpful and courteous. They have a tram that goes to Bellagio and the Aria so I was able to visit other casinos while I was there. My check in took about 10 min which is not bad but there is no organization in the lobby area so sometimes when I walked past there were a lot of people checking in and it seemed very disorganized but as I said I arrived later at night so had no problem. The pool area was very nice and includes a wave pool and lazy river. . Unfortunately they had a fire at this hotel a couple of years ago and completely renovated the top floor into very nice rooms. I wish they had spent the money redoing the entire hotel. My room was clean and was kept clean by the staff who were very courteous as I have mentioned however for a suite it was very disappointing. I have stayed at the Signature at MGM, The Palazzo, The Venetian, Encore and The Wynn which all have suites the same size. My furniture was banged up, there was no safe for valuables , and the carpet was old as was the rest of the furniture in the room. Do not get me wrong the room as I said was clean but for a suite I expected more of a wow factor. The rooms need an update asap. The only problem I had at the pool was that I was there for an hour and not one time did anyone stop by to ask about drinks etc. I had to go and get my own which I have noticed is becoming a problem with all the hotels I have stayed at on the strip lately as far as the pool area goes. Also a word about resort fees. If someone quotes you a price on the phone get a name. I have a slot card and turned down three comped nights at the MGM in a regular room because the price I was quoted for a suite at the Monte Carlo was so good and was told it included the resort fee which it did not. Once I got home I called the hotel and was not going to get into a massive argument over a 30.00 difference however there was no way to prove someone in casino services gave me that quote or not so I was stuck with the bill. So in closing the Monte Carlo is a nice place to gamble, the pool area other than the service was great however the rooms need an upgrade so make your determination on how attached you are to having a nice room as opposed to an ok one for whatever price you are given. I myself would prefer a regular room at the MGM next time since it has been redone as opposed to the suite I had at the Monte Carlo. It unfortunately is not someplace I would stay again at least until an upgrade is done.

Reviews.Title: “Checked in and then back out”
Reviews.Author: Hk0620
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in March when we went down for a friend's wedding as the price was right. Upon check in, we went into the room to find it extremely in need of a reno. It smelled old and dirty and when we pulled the bed cover back, found hairs in the bed. I went into the bathroom, and was also met with hair. We switched rooms, and found the second room to be without the bed hair, however the wall paper was peeling off the wall and the same smell was there. We called around for another hotel room, but we unable to get one until the next day, so we had to stay a night. The bed was terrible and the pillows were hard. No matter the price, I would never stay here again. But what I can't fathom, is how people think this is a nice place. If it is, I would hate to see their housekeeping skills.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal for A quick One Night Stay”
Reviews.Author: TikiTravels
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night as we had a late night flight in. The check in was easy and the front desk was well staffed which was a plus coming in after midnight. The value for what we paid made this a great deal. We had a non smoking room with 2 queen beds. The room was clean and looked a little weathered but stocked with towels etc. I took my son the to the wave pool and lazy river the next day. The Wave pool was a hit and we rented inner tubes for the lazy river. My only complaint was that the music was very loud at the pool and I generally enjoy pool side music. The buffet was a great deal and the food was very good with alot of selectiion for all. Also, make sure to sign up for the hotels M Life card. If you are doing any gambling on slots etc it lets you accure points that you can use for comped food at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for cheap.”
Reviews.Author: Teejer
Reviews.Content: Our stay was for 3 nights. The price was crazy cheap and our room was huge! 1.5 baths plus a sitting area with a couch, tables, and chairs. Overall we had a great stay. The casino wasn't that great though.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: clark957
Reviews.Content: This hotel sits in the center of the attractions with a bus service right outside the doors. The M&M and Coke stores are right across the sreet (easy access). The room was large and the stafff freindly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room”
Reviews.Author: TravelerViajante
Reviews.Content: This hotel has great, clean and big sized rooms! My husband and I stayed there for 3 nights. The pool is big and there are a lot of loungers to sit sun/shade. The only thing I dind't enjoy very much was the super loud music they play all day long, I couldn't hear my very own music! The spa has great facilities that guests can use whitout paying for spa services and the gym is very good too with all new equipment. The only negative side of this hotel is the concierge, they weren't helpfull at all to some questions we had! The neighboring hotel concierge was much more helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: MamaBear63
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to go big and celebrate our anniversary at the Monte Carlo. The front desk was amazingly helpful and kind. The rooms were nice and confortable. They have a wonderful Spa and ftiness center to relax and be pampered. We spent an entire day in the Lazy River pool area. It was wonderful, exept for the fact you have to rent or buy your own floating tube at $10 dollars a pop! That didn't seem reasonable to us so we just floated around the river with each other! There was plenty of places to eat and a free tram to the four surrounding casinos to visit. The downside is that when we booked the hotel it was at a great weekday price, but once you get there you are hit with a $15 dollar a day resort tax! I guess I didn't read the fine print. This should be something that just include in the price so there aren't any surprises when you arrive. All in all it was a well kept hotel with courteous staff.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed :(”
Reviews.Author: Sweetdaima
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo because the price was right and they were offering a free show. In order to receive your free show tickets, you have to call a 1-800 number within a certian time period or you forfeit your tickets. This number was busy for 2 days straight and I had to call the concierge at the Monte Carlo to have the tickets arranged. The room itself was poor. The bathroom was set up for seniors, with a raised toilet and a walk in, cracked, seated shower. I am average height for a woman and I felt like a little kid on the toilet. They charge a resort fee but you don't get anything for that. Not even water in your room. YES there are places in the hotel where it smells like smoke. We have stayed at NY NY, the Signature and Bally's (which was 6 yrs ago and better than this place) I thought we would overlook the bad reviews and try it out. Lesson Learned

Reviews.Title: “Mediochre Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CanAmTravelers
Reviews.Content: For a hotel that was renovated in 2010 you would never know it. The lobby is nice, casino is on the smaller side and the rooms reminded me of a motel 6. I stayed at the Venetian a month ago and there is no comparison. We will not be staying here again.,

Reviews.Title: “Awesome for the price!”
Reviews.Author: mergarcia
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal for three nights at the Monte Carlo. The rooms were clean and the beds were really comfy. The bathroom is nothing exciting, but that is okay becasue its not like I go to Vegas for the top notch free lotion, shampoo and conditioner in the hotel. The pools were amazing, Regular, Wave and Lazy!!! The prices in the pool to buy drinks and food was a bit crazy, so we didnt buy anything. Get to the pool early though because it doesnt take long for the chairs to fill up. I thought the food options at the Monte Carlo were great. We ate at the Pub for the happy hour and were really pleased. They mesquite fries were awesome and the sliders were really good too. The food court was good because it had a little of everything. The cupcake place was yummy with so many choices to choose from. Dragon Noodles was pretty good too, the lunch special gives you so much food! They also have a fine dining place next to the casino. I thought the tables were reasonably priced, although you just cant find the cheaper tables like you used to. My friend and I played the slots a lot and had a great time. What I liked as well is how close everything is to the Monte Carlo. Tons of great places to eat, shop and entertainment is within walking distance. I would absolutly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Overall nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Sarious
Reviews.Content: We ended up getting a great deal in the mail for one of the M resorts. We chose Monte Carlo out of all of them because they upgraded us to a suite. Room was spacious and had 2 bathrooms. Room was clean ans bed was comfy...however the room needs some renovation.Couch was damaged,air conditioner sounded like a plane taking off. I was surprised that there wasnt a mini bar in the room or coffee maker either. The casino was well ventelated, no lines at the front desk and they were very helpful.Nice pool. Crowd was a mix of everyone from 2 months old to 90 years old. Great location on the strip!

Reviews.Title: “Bang in the middle of the strip”
Reviews.Author: paulindia
Reviews.Content: When I went to vegas last year, I was looking for a place where I could experience the las vegas strip. I considered the stratosphere for the view but wanted to be close to the bellagio to watch the musical fountains. Monte Carlo is right in the middle of the striip and walakable to ceasars palace and the bellagio, so its perfect. While your here dont miss the O show at the bellagio, you can book tickets from the friedly staff of the Monte Carlo. There is a huge pool , usually crowded, but is pretty clean and fun. In the lobby area they also have a food court with McDonalds, Subway Starbucks and more to grab a quick bite. Also, Try to get rooms facing the strip for an awesome view and plan your trip on a weekday if your on a tight budget.

Reviews.Title: “family reunion but not really for families”
Reviews.Author: spontane0us_famly
Reviews.Content: i haven't been to vegas in over 10 years. what a change - with so much more squeezed into every inch of the strip! in the words of a toddler..."too crowded" the check in process is a total zoo at the monte carlo - there isn't one line feeding all the stations, it's a total free for all. it took over an hour to check in! and then we had to wait for our rooms - 3 of them, which was OK since we arrived early but still - having to wait an hour to get checked in was not appreciated. of the 3 rooms, 2 were OK, but the 3rd had some sort of blood stains on the mattress. yes, we check the beds.... so we had to switch rooms, actually 3 times as they gave us a King room at first when we had asked for 2 beds. we chose the monte carlo for the pool, it's a very nice pool with a lazy river of sorts (small) and a wave pool but it's not meant for families. it was crowded and loud and not much shade - they had a DJ playing music all day and the kiddie pool was really tiny. we were very disappointed with the pool. but we enjoyed the tram that takes you from the Monte Carlo to Aria/city center and onto the Bellagio. We took it every day to visit and eat at the Bellagio. That's a very very nice hotel - with a very nice pool scene and some shade. we'll stay at the Bellagio next time, if ever there's a next time. as you can tell, we're not into gambling or the vegas scene, but thought vegas was a family friendly place, at least that's what they're touting nowadays. oh - and the food - it's decent and buffets are fun but the quality of the meat isn't what it used to be either. alrighty!

Reviews.Title: “Overall fine but nothing special about it”
Reviews.Author: AshVee
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fine. Great if you get a good rate but if you are after something special, stay elsewhere. I wouldn’t stay here again when there are so many other fantastic hotels to choose from on the Strip. I was travelling for work and inspected several hotels i.e. Monte Carlo, New York, New York, MGM Grand, Mandalay Bay, Bellagio, Circus Circus, Excalibur, Luxor, Aria, Vdara, & the Mirage. Compared to the newer hotels (Aria & Vdara) and hotels that are being refurbished (Bellagio & MGM Grand) the Monte Carlo appears a bit old, tired and bland. Obviously they refurbish the hotels where they get a better return on investment & can charge higher room rates like the gorgeous Bellagio. So the Monte….. Long waits for service at check in counters and this was during the week - much worse on the weekend. Lots of counters but not many staff? Bit of a long walk through the casino to get to the hotel elevators but at least the Monte doesn't have the revolting cigarette cloud that hits you as soon as you open the door (just visit Circus, Circus, Luxor or the Excalibur if you want that experience). Location was convenient and easy to get around. The hotel pool was pretty ordinary compared to many others I saw in Vegas - you wouldn’t stay here for the pool scene. Limited opening hours (9am – 7pm) mean there's not much time to have a quick dip and relax by the pool if you are out and about all day. On the weekend it was over crowded and there wasn't even room to swim. Seems you just go to the pool to drink beer and listen to techno not swim. Surely this must annoy a lot of the hotel guests? My room was smoke free, beds clean and comfortable. The bathrooms are tired & old but thankfully clean. No luxurious tubs here. Not having a mini fridge was pretty disappointing but they had an ice bucket. As others have mentioned the walls are way too thin and you can pretty much here every toilet flush around you (not a quiet place to recover from your jetlag!). I also had the misfortune to be located next to a couple arguing at 2am before one of them decided to go out in the hallway to scream on her cell phone! Called Security and was pretty happy with the response - 5 security guards outside my door within 10 minutes! They clearly take it seriously here and I even heard them ask the guy next door to see his girlfriend – the room had become suspiciously quiet and I guess they thought they better avoid a CSI scenario. Peace & quiet after that so mission accomplished. So fine overall. New York, New York is pretty much in the same location and has nicer rooms, a better vibe and good restaurants. I’d pick that over the Monte Carlo.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: Pks1000
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at the Monte Carlo on two prior visit to Las Vegas, liking the resort we choose it for our daughters wedding and for the guests to stay at while visiting Las Vegas. Lets say the resort has gone downhill since then. Our problems began upon check-in, I had called twice the first time two weeks prior and as requested by the staff two days prior to check-in to inform/request of the front desk staff that six rooms (the seventh had paid for a higher floor room) be assigned next to each other or at the very least very close to each other. This was essential for my 87 year old mother-in-law whom required my assistance. This seemed impossible to accomplish on check-in, at first we were all on different floors then after 1 1/2 hours of waiting and talking to the desk clerk and an area manager we finally got most of the rooms on the same floor, at the time the rooms were not ready although it was well after the stated check in time the clerk told me they would call my cell phone when the room was ready - I'm still waiting for the call. After finally getting my room we received the one thing that I told the clerk was unacceptable, a room with an adjoining door. Although resolved it was one more inconvenience. When I booked the trip I called the resort to ask if there was internet access at the resort as I needed to be in touch with my office on my iPad. The reservationist told me there was. As I found what was provided for the resort fee was an out of date phone modem. I called the front desk to ask if there was a wireless connection, the desk clerk told me no but I could go across the street to McDonalds. Good idea send guest across the street. I did a search on my iPad and found a cox cable wireless connection which worked. I just assumed that the clerk did not know about the service and called the front desk back to tell him about it. I got another clerk and told her, "her response was how did you get into that, we don't tell guests that we have it"! What? Also the uninformed clerks don't know that the McDonalds in the resort food court also has free Internet access. As for the resort fee. I do not mind paying my fee as I do use the Internet and resort facility's but is it fair to charge it to an 87 year old woman? When my mother in law asked to speak to a manager about fee the area manager said under no circumstances could the fee be waved. My mother in law began to write a note of complaint about the fee on the bottom of the check-in sheet that she was signing, the manager grabbed it out of her hand and said you can not write a note on that! My husband said what is wrong with that, will you get in trouble? He got no response. It was very upsetting and disrespectful. My mother in laws door was not closing properly during the entire visit, the staff was aware of the problem when they needed to get the door open the night before. We also asked it to be look at earlier that day because we had to pull it closed. On Thursday however we could not open the door due to the fact that the door was coming off of the hinges, when we called the front desk and they stated that they don't deal with that and transferred him to the maintenance number where no one answered the phone. Although resolved by the night manager we had to call him ourselves. We also called twice to get the clock in my mother in laws suite fixed or replaced. Three days and two clocks later it was finally replaced. The night manager was the only employee we encountered that was helpful and not rude. A member of our party did not get his room cleaned for 2 days and the ice machine on our floor did nor have ice in it for the 5 days of our stay. The vending machine was also not refilled.

Reviews.Title: “For the price, this is difficult to beat”
Reviews.Author: JoshuaMConnecticut
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a rather long seven nights last week. The weekday rate was only $45 but then they add the $16 fee for the exercise room and the high speed internet. Add in the taxes and the other yada yada stuff, the weekday rate came out to be about $69 per day. Well worth it in my opinion. Last year, I stayed at Bally's and the internet was around $15 per day as an add on, and the exercise room was in the $25 dollar range as I recall. So for this kind of money we got a hotel with a fantastic pool area, easy access via the tram to Aria and Bellagio. Our room had a view of the pool, which was kind of nice, but the windows were very dirty form the Las Vegas duststorms, which was unfortunate. The music was loud at the pool, but it was about the same as our stay at Bally's last year. But the other reviewer who said get a room away from the pool was correct. The music is loud starting at around noon, but ends at 7 pm., which was no big deal for me. Rooms with views, upper floors, etc., all cost more, so be warned before you do something you'll regret. Our room was "standard" which consisted of two queen beds, a table, and a straight back chair. There was a 42" flat tv sitting on top of a ridiculously small three-drawer dresser. The full cable tv channel selection was available, plus the usual hotel offerings of movies and adult fare. The bathroom had a hair dryer, iron, every lotion and soap imaginable, two drinking glasses and an ice bucket. The cleaning staff took care of us very nicely. There was also a safe that was about 4" deep for jewelry, but not big enough for a laptop. Mattresses were firm and comfortable, pillow top type. The pool was truly wonderful. There is a "regular" pool of good size, and in the shade most of the day; then there is a "lazy river", and finally there is a wave pool. There is a small fourth pool for private parties, and there is a hot tub, which we didn't use. They wouldn't let us bring our own drinks into the pool area, which stunk frankly. Drink prices were probably in line with the competition, but were basically a ripoff. $3 for a coffee, $6 for beers, and then $12 to $18 for the fruity booze. They at least provided free ice cold water the entire day. There is plenty of room to walk around and it was crowded, but not so much so that it was impossible to enjoy. We ended going to the pool every morning, or until the music was unbearable. The buffet was inexpensive and mediocre, and we were more content to spend a few dollars more and go to either the Aria or Bellagio buffet. We like good quality meats at the carving station, an assortments of seafood, crab, and sushi, and well-made desserts. Monte Carlo was lacking in quality in all categories. If you like a good buffet, spend $10 more per person, and visit Aria, Bellagio, or Venetian. The check in was rather quick, the concierge was very helpful for the three times we bothered them, and the bell captain was nice enough to hold our luggage for a few hours. No problems there. The best part of Monte Carlo was that you can at least cruise around the public places without being mobbed with gawkers that clog the touristy casinos such as Bellagio, Venetian, Mirage, MGM, Mandalay Bay, and Flamingo. There were never any crowds in the bars or on the casino floor. Some of the hotspots were uncomfortably empty even. Obviously the hipsters go somewhere else than Monte Carlo on weekends. Having said that, there always was a pretty good party atmosphere in Diablo's Cantina which is on the street and attached to the hotel. We went there three times for a nightcap before turning in. On a dollar/value scale, it was pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “will not come back”
Reviews.Author: gideon m
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a stay at the monte carlo ending august 20, 2011. I will never stay there again, for three primary reasons. First, I had a room on the pool side of the hotel, and on the days which featured a pool DJ, the music was insanely loud and you basically did not want to be in your room much. This is particulalry bad if you are jetlagged and want an afternoon nap, forget about it! Second, the hotel lobby and some other areas have a disgusting odor, which seems to be from a mixture of some sort of perfume masking an underlying smoke odor. it is pretty gross. Not one other vegas hotel smells nearly as bad. Finally, the rooms are not as nice as it seemed from the website photos. In particular, the bathroom is very old looking. On the plus side, the location was nice and the food and bars on the first floor are good, but you can always visit those without staying at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “So glad we stayed here.”
Reviews.Author: Kathy J
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo Resort and Casino mostly for the large pool area, as we had teenagers with us. We are so glad we did, the staff and security were friendly and courteous, not only to us but to our kids. It is a family friendly hotel and casino, with out losing the Las Vegas character and bling factor.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, fair, okay location”
Reviews.Author: EVANNY
Reviews.Content: (The hotel):I stayed at monte carlo aug 14 to Aug 18. We arrived at the hotel close to midnight and check in was VERY slow..waited nearly 15 min, were already so exhausted..we had requested 1king bed but did not get that.. Room was clean, big bathroom. Pools are good, casino is busy, all casinos reek of smoke. Takes about 15 min to walk to Bellagio TIP: buy a bus pass for 7$, fOr 24 hrs, cheaper than taxis and gets u closer than the shuttle BUT very slow as ppl pay as they get on/off, sometimes walking is faster..other times bus was helpful to go to end of strip or old vegaS strip The area warning: many ppl on the street offer u freebies to go to some grandview /RCI tour which can take 2 to 4 hrs..u don't need to sign anything, if you're willing to spend half ur day watching or being talked too about residences you prolly won't buy into, its worth it to sit and nod and then say no repeatedly for free gifts (like shows/dinners,etc)..if u have limited time in vegas don't go

Reviews.Title: “loved the location on the strip”
Reviews.Author: winterblues012
Reviews.Content: Wow has Vegas ever grown since my last trip there. I was very pleased with the hotel. It was spectacular on the outside but only average on the inside. Rooms were certainly clean and spacious. But really just a room. One you could find anywhere in any city. It was nice though as we were given a room facing the strip(MGM). On arrival we waited in line for over 45 minutes and when we went up to our room the housekeeping staff were still cleaning it. So down we went and stood again in line for another 35 minutes or so. That's when we got the room with a view. Staff are far to busy and really didn't find to many friendly people. I really did like the location though. Right across from an ABC store, Walgreens and next to a CVS . Outback Steakhouse and Denny's are a minutes walk away. I always love Vegas through and through. This is my 9th time here and first at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but expected more”
Reviews.Author: RF81
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo at the beginning of August after spending 10 days in San Francisco. Maybe it was the amazing staff at the hotel there that made the staff here seem so unhelpful or maybe they really were just that miserable. On arrival we checked in, this was fine but there was no smile or welcome, we were handed a couple of key cards and signed to say I knew about the resort fee (rip off fee) then we went to the room. The room was nice, quite big but nothing special and the bathroom could have done with a big of decorating. It was really hot (obviously) and we thought we'd ring down to ask for a fridge so we could have some cold water. Not at $25 a night we wouldn't!!! We bought a mini one at home for the price of one nights rental!!! The location was good for the Bellagio and there's a free tram that takes you to Aria and the Bellagio which was great. It was nice having the food court and the shops but we didn't use them much, especially as there are places over the road to buy things much cheaper. We didn't bother with the pool because it was like a disco whenever we walked past with music blaring and it wasn't exactly a place you could go and chill out with a book. Not sure if they'd be able to cram any more loungers in there either but I'm sure if they could charge for them they would. With regards to housekeeping, our room was always left clean but we found it to be very late in the day. Returning to the room at 3pm and it still wasn't clean? Not ideal. All in all, the hotel was ok. We found the resort fee to be an absolute joke. We basically paid $16 something for a copy of USA Today for 4 days. If we go to Vegas again we'd definitely be staying elsewhere. Someone further down had put the coconut smell as a positive. Hmmm, you know you're scraping the barrel when the smell is a plus point!

Reviews.Title: “Good But With Odd Minor Issues”
Reviews.Author: cow_manx
Reviews.Content: The pool is fantastic, the pool was the biggest factor in choosing this hotel and it did not disappoint. On the whole the hotel was good but there were some unusual minor issues. When we first checked in they got our reservation wrong and gave us a room with only one bed when we had requested two – the person who checked us in didn’t even know how many beds were in the first room. For another example this hotel does not seem to believe in Do Not Disturb signs – every night we were there we had to hand-write our own and when we requested one from housekeeping they gave it to us and took it away the very next turn down service! The rooms are in pretty good condition, only some slight staining on the carpet and the odd 1-inch rip in the linen. Speaking of linen, we only had facecloths slightly more than half of our week-long stay. The public spaces were nice and clean however the elevators frequently had garbage in them, were under repair, and not air conditioned. Their website says you have to pay for Wi-Fi but its actually free for hotel guests as it is included in the resort fee. I enjoyed my stay here and would definitely visit this hotel on subsequent visits to Vegas but I think I may stay somewhere else that can get the little things right. If every Motel 6 I’ve ever stayed at could know how many beds are in each room and provide Do Not Disturb signs but this hotel cannot tells me this is a great entertainment destination but perhaps not the best source of accommodations. The primary assets of this property are the pool and its other attractions such as the Minus 5 Ice Bar and Jabbawockeez. I do like their social media interactivity though, more so than the front desk staff they were very responsive to my questions and concerns – if the Monte Carlo provided the same level of service at their front desk as they do on Twitter that would go a long way to improving things.

Reviews.Title: “Maid Service leaves much to be desired”
Reviews.Author: sbkane
Reviews.Content: Stayed two days. Used the drinking glasses on the first day and after maid service, they were not replaced...just moved. NICE! (NOT). The SPA fee is a sham!. You book your reservation and then on top of it...they add a FEE! Give me a break!. Never staying there again, too many places without the fee and good maid service.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: welltraveled5253
Reviews.Content: Monte Carlo Hotel and Casino is in a great location. It is right on the Strip next to New York New York and is close to other casinos. The rooms are really nice . The staff acts like they appreciate you being there. The buffet is good. The casino is clean and has a good variety of slots. It has a good pool with plenty of chairs. I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “It had up's and downs”
Reviews.Author: Grace A
Reviews.Content: A positive of the Monte Carlo was that it had a nice pool, it had a nice coconut scent inside (except from the smoke casino) and also a complimentary buffet card, which allowed a free buffet for 2 people at lunch (certain hotels). Not dinner, though. It's location was OK, but a little bit away from the hotels i prefered, like Caesar's or Paris. The negatives: The walls were too thin. I could hear things next door, even some things no one should EVER hear, let me put it at that! Also, the pool closed at 7 PM, while opening at 9 in the morning. I wish it would be open later on; it wouldn't be as crowded as at night. Last.... our final hotel bill was a lot of money because of service fees, like paying 25 dollars for a newspaper that we didn't even use.

Reviews.Title: “Average, Bang For Your Buck = Get What You Pay For, No Glitz Or Glamour”
Reviews.Author: ORMooseTraveler
Reviews.Content: We rented a regular room and a Spa Suite - Regular room was $60.00/night and was doable for just sleeping. Spa Suite was $120.00/night and was big, roomy, nice tube, walk in shower, seperate toilet from shower area, old Bose stereo surround system, but had nice bar area with refridgerator. This hotel is no Bellagio, Venitian or Palazzo as far as the "Glitz and Glamour" but it was clean and if all your going to do is sleep and would rather spend your money on the fun stuff....it works.

Reviews.Title: “A Monty Python nightmare”
Reviews.Author: Aleta B
Reviews.Content: When we arrived to check in, we counted 26 check-in computer terminals, of which only a dozen were staffed, leaving lines of people 10 deep in front of each one. We waited 40 minutes to be processed before we could get to our room. It was late at night and we wanted only to fall into bed. The bathroom sink wouldn't drain, and brushing our teeth and washing our faces was gross and off putting as the sink filled with nasty water. The following morning, housekeeping rattled the door and woke us at 10:00; there was no do-not-disturb sign available to hang outside. However, at 3:00 in the afternoon when we returned to our room from shopping, the maid was in it making the beds. We came home late from a show, carrying only one key card between the two of us and it wouldn't open our door. We faced another 40-minute wait downstairs at the desks to get help. After our demanding a manager over the wait because of what we deemed an emergency--although they did not see it as any kind of a rush problem, it turned out that they wouldn't help us because that card was not connected to the name on the room reservation, and that necessary ID was locked in the room, which the key card wouldn't open. Get the picture? We were furious, and they were absolutely unhelpful. Finally, a member of the security staff met us at our room door after we had been sitting on the hallway floor for twenty minutes, we in evening dresses and high heels, he watching us struggle to our feet with no offer to help us.
