He opened the door for us, checked the ID, and went away again. The other key card remained unfixed--we were too whipped after our frustrating hour to deal with it any further that night. We were changing our clothes for bed at 11:30 when a knock came at the door--it was the plumber! He was there to fix the bathroom sink while we were half-naked, dead tired, and frazzled from fighting with the hotel staff. The next night, we were awakened at 2:00 by someone trying our door, inserting a key card, and jiggling the door handle. I suppose if our own key wouldn't open it, theirs wouldn't either! We had just gotten back to sleep when a baby down the hall began crying and kept it up for an entire hour! I know this because I kept looking at the clock. On the night before we left, we called the staff to ask about late check out. We were told we could indeed check out late and we needed to call in the morning to confirm. We called in the morning to confirm and were told that we could NOT check out late. I understand that the hotel staff cannot help such things as other guests trying to get into the wrong room and crying babies in the middle of the night, but the most serious of our annoyances during our stay had to do with very unhelpful hotel staff who were clearly uninterested in our welfare. It seemed that once they got our money and had us in their building, they lost interest in making our stay a comfortable one and in some instances, even went out of their way to make us miserable. We will NEVER NEVER NEVER return there! :( :( :(

Reviews.Title: “The Monte Carlo very nice.... But the wait to get the room”
Reviews.Author: Joe915
Reviews.Content: First if you get early to the hotel you need to wait until 3 pm to check in. When we got to the room very nice and clean , nice bathroom with marble floor We got the strip view room at night the view is nice . one thing that I notice that the room was very clean but not the windows they were very dirty from the inside and out side all the days that stayed at the hote i think that was the only problome i found l. The monte carlo has very good service don't get me wrong .Other thing I would not recommend the buffet at the Monte Carlo one of the worst service ever did not like food for the same price I would recommend the Rio buffet.

Reviews.Title: “It's a mediocre place”
Reviews.Author: marine2531
Reviews.Content: I have been to Vegas many times and stayed at a lot of different hotels. This is by far the lowest quality. Fortunately it was a business trip and my company put me up there. It's a good thing I got to experience it on someone else's dime. It really just is mediocre. Seems very dreary. You don't see a lot of people having a great time. I suppose they just stay there because it's cheap and go off to the Wynn or Hard Rock for their fun. I ordered room service. It arrived in a timely manner. Chicken fingers were nothing special. Then again, i don't ever really expect a lot from chicken fingers so don't hold me to the fire for that one. Overall, I would stay again if someone else was paying. That's about it.

Reviews.Title: “Probably won't return”
Reviews.Author: KimJonesOhio
Reviews.Content: I went out to Vegas for a girls weekend. There were 4 of us, all early 40's. We booked our trip through a travel agent and didnt do much research on our own, BIG MISTAKE. The hotel was 'dead'. There was no vibe or excitement at all. The staff was rude and acted bothered. The rooms were clean, we requested strip view and received such. The concierge, most of the time, acted as if we were bothering him/her. We got more information on where to go, what to do and how to do it from a cab driver who hooked us up!!! The seafood buffet on the weekend was a good deal...for $2 more u can have unlimited champagne! The pool area was nice and clean, however the loud, LOUD, obnoxious rap music was just too much. I just felt that this hotel really missed the mark. I can only assume others thought the same thing....the gaming floor was dead!

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled by the hotel's website, choose another hotel!”
Reviews.Author: knowhome
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took a quick trip to Vegas to celebrate our anniversary. I got a last minute deal to stay at the Monte Carlo for 4 nights. I checked the hotel's website and it looked reasonably classy, modern & relaxing. When we arrived we were told that the room with a king bed that I had booked was not available, and then the key to the room they gave us with 2 queen's did not work (twice), so they gave us a different room with a king bed? which they obviously had the whole time. The room was clean and overlooked the pool area, which was fine except from about 11am-7pm all you could hear was dance music booming from the DJ below (we were 20 floors up), so forget staying in the room during the day. The faucet in the shower constantly ran and despite calling the front desk they never did anything about it. Oh, and the bed sheets were about a foot too short, which was a nice touch. The walls are thin, and you can hear everyone around you. Including people partying well past 3am, and the service was lackluster at best. The concierge desk was frequently vacant, and there were long lines at the front desk. In all, I am sure you can do better with another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Monte Carlo is a good value and in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: SandAndSunLover1
Reviews.Content: We just got back home from our stay at the Monte Carlo. Check-in was a breeze, no lines, no waiting. We arrived at 8am and were able to check in to our room which was located on the 6th floor with a view of the Aria and the hotel's air conditioning units. The view was a let down but not a huge issue since we were lucky enough to check-in so early. The room was clean and had plenty of coat hangars. The hair dryer is located in the armoire along with the iron. The safe is small but it held all we needed to put in it. We ate at the Pub, the service was great and the food was good. We also ate at the food court, the Fish Tacos at Rubios were tasty and McDonalds breakfast was as expected. It's nice to have a few reasonably priced places to grab a quick bite. The hotel staff were friendly. The cocktail waitresses were scarce and slow but friendly. Overall this is a nice place to stay and the location can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best on the strip”
Reviews.Author: Jazzboxer
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to Vegas in 6 months and loved the monte Carlo, the rooms were of a high standard of cleanliness and the staff are very polite and courteous, our aircon would not work on the first night which was rectified within 2 hours of reporting it at the desk in the morning, great location on the strip and even has it's own ice bar inside which was great, the only thing we were not keen on was the small food court and a Chinese restaurant in which the food was not great (can't remember the name) apart from that the buffet was great! We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great view!Large room!Enjoyed stay-nothing great”
Reviews.Author: brookebethune
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this Hotel for 2 nights in July. It is pretty much at the beginning of the strip so it was great in location-however its VEGAS! EVERYTHING IS GREAT LOCATION! We had a room on the 23rd floor facing the mountains-it was a pretty great view! The hotel it self is big- nothing to special. Drinks in the pool area are very pricy. the pool is ok- i like that they had a lazy river and a wave pool but the wave pool was closed They have an ICE bar-5 degrees its called- We never went in but its pretty cool- its a room you go into with winter gear on and you can drink and take a picture. For the price we paid theres nothing to much to complain about However there was no mini bar and no blowdryers- We would have loved to stay at Cesars Palace or The Venetian or Wynn however we enjoyed our stay

Reviews.Title: “I would never recommend this hotel to anyone!!!”
Reviews.Author: Taye D
Reviews.Content: The staff was very rude and unprofessional. Security needs to take customer service training and learn how to talk to guests in a professional manner. In the casino, the waitress just kept walking by without offering a drink while I was playing the slot machines. This was my first time ever visiting Las Vegas, and I was very unpleased with the service and being approached by security with lies told by another guest in the room next door to my room. Security automatically accused my family member and I of the lies that they received from the guest next door to our room. Security harrassed me and my family member. The Monte Carlo is not a good hotel to stay at ; the hallways were very smelly, an older man was punched in the face on the elevator by a young drunk man that he didn't even know. This was the worse hotel I ever stayed in and I would never recommend this hotel to anyone. The Monte Carol Resort and Casino gets a thumb down!!!! :(

Reviews.Title: “OK for the money!”
Reviews.Author: judytomita
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself wasn't too bad, but is in need of updating. We were given a "smoking room" and were not asked whether we wanted a smoking room so the room smelled very much of smoke. The Casino doesn't have as much variety of buffets and restaurants as some of the other hotels. The corridors of the hotel on the different floors need renovating as the carpets are stained and walls marked up. The safes in the room are the smallest that I have ever seen, smaller than a shoe box. The casino was very nice and I did like the size of it as it wasn't so huge and overwhelming as places like the MGM where you could get lost. The stay overall was nice, but I would try another hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service”
Reviews.Author: aremu
Reviews.Content: I was in Vegas with friends last May. We stayed at Monte Carlo. The room was very clean and the services was great except for the per day resort fee .

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Room I've Stayed At!”
Reviews.Author: FreetoTravel49
Reviews.Content: Hi there, This was my 11th time to Vegas over a 20 year period and love Vegas and have stayed at many of the popular hotels. Never have I been more disappointed in a hotel room than at the Monte Carlo. Sure the front exterior looks great. One thinks of the real Monte Carlo and thinks, "well, this should live up to it's name somewhat at least". Let me say the lobby was at best, mediocre, simple little flowers at the check in stations, compared to say The Aria, or The Cosmopolitan. The staff however was efficient and courteous at check-in. We were able to check into our room right away at 1:30pm instead of 3pm. Exiting the elevator on the 9th floor, the carpets already gave indication of neglect. Large stains, in several of the areas right from the elevator and down to the room at 9211. Going inside, the room was again mediocre. Not even a mini fridge, NO COFFEE MAKER!, LADIES BE WARNED IF YOU LOVE YOUR COFFEE WHILE GETTING READY! Even the cheapest hotels have a coffee maker! Come on management! The bathroom again was mediocre...but a clincher was...wanting a shower...get refreshed before heading down stairs to have fun...and explore...the tub filled with about 3-4 inches of water. Standing in this the whole time, while washing it did not drain. It was a full 10 minutes, maybe more for it to drain once the tap was off. So, lets just say the next person in line to freshen up...has to stand in 3 inches of water! Yuck for them! We phone down and expressed our concerns. The on duty manager was polite and apologetic. Oh, we'll send someone up with a mini fridge and get the engineer to repair the tub drainage. Well the fridge came soon enough...10 minutes. I was happy as insulin diabetic need to store all meds in a cold fridge otherwise it becomes ineffective after 24 hours. So put the meds in, have our lovely bath...I mean shower (water pressure was great though) and go out for the evening. We thought the engineer would be back as the manager said he's be there in 20 minutes, while we were out. No one ever came to fix this drainage issue. The fridge was not working. We had to put the meds on plastic in the ice bucket then....next morning we complained and they brought another one...that worked. In short, you can find other excellent hotel rooms for the same price or less or even a few dollars more...ie. Aria would have been 100.00 more as would the Cosmopolitan. I have to say though in their favour the Brand Steakhouse at Monte Carlo was a 10+! We shared a steak dinner...20 ounces and the fixings and the hugest cheescake slice I have ever seen! Plus the service was impeccable. I would go back to this hotel but only for the restaurant and gambling as I won 100.00 :) next time I go in November this year. Hope this helps you all with your decisions...I have never written a review on any other hotel in Vegas because it's always been great...but this one I figured I should warn my fellow travellers. Happy Travelling!!

Reviews.Title: “This could be the hotel for you!”
Reviews.Author: beachtravel
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because I was traveling alone with three kids and wanted a good walking location to the strip... with a pool, lazy river and wave pool that wasn't too out of control with the "see and be seen" crowd. We liked it because you do not have to walk through the casino to get to the elevators, does not smell of smoke, does not have an overwhelming "perfume" in the air as some Vegas hotels do... and the beds were SUPER comfortable. Wonderful.... cant say enough about the comfy beds. That being said, this hotel will not give you the "wow" effect like some of the other hotes, they arent trying to outglitz anyone and arent trying to make you feel super welcome or luxurious. This hotel is serviceable... and a good deal for $60 a night. Clean, comfortable, good location.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it was amazing!”
Reviews.Author: ljgarcia1
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights here while in Vegas, we had the spa suite and it was absolutely amazing! Had a bar area, living area, huge jaccuzi bathtub in the living area/bedroom that was by the window looking out onto the strip. The bathroom had a shower and sink area with a separate door to the toilet. We were on the 27th floor and had a great view of the strip. It was a great location with everything in walking distance. The pool was also amazing! Had a lazy river, poolside bar, small wave pool, average size swimming pool, and hot tub. This place was perfect and had many restaurants and shops inside. Will definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are nice. Not impressed with the rest.”
Reviews.Author: Sondeash
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo to see the Jabbawokeez show. Check-in was a bit chaotic. Lots of folks checking in at front desk. The hotel has a lot of checkin desks but leaves it up to the guest to form lines. The room was nicely appointed and comfortable. We ate dinner at the Buffet. Price was $21. Food was mediocre. Service was bad. I would not recommend this restaurant. Also, you have to walk through the casino to get to any restaurant and the theater. The casino had a strong smoke smell. Overall I was disappointed with my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it the first time, hated it the second time!!”
Reviews.Author: mariaami
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got married at the Monte Carlo and just spent our 13th Anniversary at the hotel. The public areas of the hotel are nice, but the rooms are way below par. As soon as we turned down the hall that our room was located on, the hall smelled of marijuana. I requested a smoking room, which lacks ventelation. This actually wouldn't have bothered me if the people in the adjoining room to ours weren't smoking pot and the smell wasn't going into our room. Neither of us use drugs, so yes, it really bothered me. Every night the "DO NOT DISTURB" sign was removed from our door and we had to ask for 1 on 2 seperate occassions. PRO's -I requested a high floor with a strip view; which was beautiful. -The water pressure in the shower was very good. -Gambling was good. -The employees in the restaurants and the bar are very nice. -If you want a contact high stay on a smoking floor. -The location of the hotel is good. -Decent parking. CON's -At check-in we received free admission to a night club, however, it was not to a club inside the hotel. -I requested a room with a king bed and got 2 queens. -Every night, the "DO NOT DISTURB" sign was removed. -The "Seafood Brunch" on Sunday doesn't really have a lot of seafood. -The room looks like it has the same fixtures and carpet it had 13 years ago. -Everything that was going on in the adjoining room and hall could be heard. -The ironing board was broken. -Express check out is only available from 6 AM to 11 AM - this doesn't help anyone if you have an early flight. -If you want to buy incidentals such as water, cigerettes, liquor, etc...go off the strip, or buy somewhere other than a casino. Cigerettes were $10.00 a pack and water was $4.00.

Reviews.Title: “Overall pretty good”
Reviews.Author: the_explorer7
Reviews.Content: Our neighbors were a bit noisy, but the room was pretty nice. The lobby was very attractive and the room was very clean. Nothing blew us out of the water, but our stay was pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “"exceeds all expectations"”
Reviews.Author: dayanaval29
Reviews.Content: i loved this hotel. we booked it online through "expedia" for 52 usd per night; it was for christmas weekend. it was cheap to say the least. when we drove to the hotel my husband did not believe that this is the hotel we booked so cheap. it was gorgious, right in the middle of the strip. perfect location. the lobby was pretty full of christmas trees, the chek in people were very nice and effective. the room was huge. the beds were very very comfy, it was the best sleep, the bath room was very very clean. the brakfast buffet was rich and full of choices and worth every penny. there is not even one bad thing i can say about the hotel. loved it! and will deffinnitly go back there again and recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy bed, basic rooms, loud pool area, good location on The Strip...”
Reviews.Author: hezaa69
Reviews.Content: We were on the 29th floor, overlooking the pool area. The music from the pool DJ, all day long, echoed through the canyon of buildings and pounded in our room. Once we realized it would be like that every day, we worked around it. Oh, and on our first morning, we awoke to housekeeping just walking into our room at 6:26am. We didn't know it was housekeeping, we just woke up to our door opening. Scared us! Not the best way to wake up on vacation. Security came and gave us a lecture about the door. what about housekeeping apologizing for having the wrong room? (NOT 4-star behavior.) The room was basic and comfortable. In fact, the beds were very comfy and that rocked! The Monte Carlo is in a great stop on the strip: not too far from the airport, walking distance to so many of the great ones: Bellagio, Cosmopolitan, Aria... The Monte Carlo is not over the top. It is comfortable, low-key, friendly. We tried D.Vino (Italian restaurant) and The Pub and both were good. The lazy river and entire pool area were fun. We hated that we couldn't even bring bottles of water in (No outside food or beverage). -And charging for the use of the tubes for the lazy river was a bit much, but it was a family-friendly area and there were people of all ages, young and old, enjoying the pools. Oh, and check out "Minus 5", the ice bar in the Monte Carlo. It's just a cool experience! :-) One of the highlights of the Monte Carlo. Oh, and don't miss Jabbawockeez! Very talented performers, very moving performance. Thanks guys!!!

Reviews.Title: “There were Ups and Downs.....”
Reviews.Author: alcavallo22
Reviews.Content: I took my boyfriend here on a surprise birthday trip. I chose the Monte Carlo because of it great location and reasonable rates. The location did not disappoint, I feel like it was a perfect spot pretty much in the middle of the strip. The first problem which occurred almost instantly was upon checking in the employee at the desk stated that they did not have any high floor rooms available for a while, which we booked. We stated we would take a lower floor if it was ready. I asked for a refund on the difference and she stated there was not a price difference, I knew for a fact there was, but I kept quiet for the time being. My boyfriend asked how much a refrigerator rental was and she stated I believe something like $30 a day, we declined. We went up to the room which was average, but there was a lot of dust. I brought up to my boyfriend again that I knew the price was different. My boyfriend made a phone call and requested to speak to a manager. The manager was very apologetic and immediately put us in a high floor room which was clean and gave us the refrigerator for free for the duration of our stay(mind you the price was much cheaper then the original employee stated). Now after stating all of that, the rest of our stay was great. We actually gambled in the Monte Carlo casino for the most part. We ate at the P.U.B. which was great. And as I said early the location and price you cannot beat. If returning, I would definitely stay at the Monte Carlo again!

Reviews.Title: “Oh My Gosh - Great Hotel all Around! Not So Busy as the Rest on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: YonatiaEdmonton
Reviews.Content: This is our fourth trip to Vegas in 4 years. We went to escape the rain of Edmonton! We have stayed at the Imperial Palace, Luxor, MGM Grand and this hotel surpasses all. Great location to walk the strip, not so busy as the other hotels because there are only two links to the Aria and the Ex Calibur; where the MGM Grand was so busy to just walk through the hotel to the elevators. The pool was fantastic; lazy river, wave pool and regular pool (heated). There are a bit strick about bringing anything into the pool (no water even but they provide water) but this also stops the crazy drunks from being irritating. Great hotel for families and couples. The buffet is not so good compared to Planet Hollywood (#1 buffet), and we went to the Aria this time and it was a close second. The Rio is not great anymore for the seafood buffet (don't bother with the Monte Carlo Friday/Saturday brunch seafood buffet - a few cold small shrimps and crab legs (that's it for the seafood). Our room was clean, the beds were really nice, the staff helpful and excellent ventilation for the smoke in the casino. We would stay here again no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it if you want to hang out at the pool”
Reviews.Author: cookiecutie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort in June. We were really interested in the pool area, since it had a lazy river. The pool area itself is wonderful. I do not like that they charge $15/room for "resort fee"... As well there seems to be a discrepancy on whether or not they would allow us to take our own tube into the pool area. One day we had no problem the next we weren't allowed. All in all it is not as big of a resort as I had anticipated. The access to the free tram was nice to get further up the strip, but there wasn't anything else all that special about the hotel. I would recommend if you would like to hang out at the pool every day of your trip then this is the hotel to stay at, however if you do not intend to use it - it is not worth the $15 extra a night, especially since the hotel is not as centrally located on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: xd3vili5hx
Reviews.Content: Brilliant clean n massive hotel!! Had a really nice italian restaurant n is 1 of the best hotels in Vegas! Has a mini store jz a few yards away incase u want any snacks etc.. Other hotels I'd recommend are MGM and caesars palace! Monte Carlo was showing jabb awok jeez - amazing show! Must see!!

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: loriwa
Reviews.Content: Great place, great location and. Best of all it is not smoky.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Service”
Reviews.Author: Carinosa410
Reviews.Content: I was not staying in the Monte Carlo but from my experience with the rude staff I wld never stay there and will advise my friends and family not 2 stay there or visit. I went 2 gamble and check out the establishment and me and my party where treated rudely by a cocktail waitress and a dealer who did not even know how to explain a game of craps and suggested tht since we came from the streets we already knew as u can guess we are ethnic and I found that unacceptable for this hotel that u hear so much about to have such rude and nasty employees. As far as the cocktail waitress she was either having a bad day or she was just rude. She had the worst attitude. She took our order like we were wasting her time or interrupting her day. I called the hotel and the guy I talked 2 acted like it was nothing I thought customer satisfaction was top priority I guess not

Reviews.Title: “No words to describe! Horrible - Don't get their "secret" deal”
Reviews.Author: Aglodesigns
Reviews.Content: Where can I start? We got their "secret "deal from Travelocity - first mistake. We got there late around midnight so luckily no lines or waiting. Got a room, when we walked in it was like walking back into 1980s. Old old old dingy room. Our window panel was broken so the wind was very "musical". No mini fridge, no coffee maker, only two towels and no toiletries. We were too tired to switch rooms that night so we did in the morning - second mistake. Our new room had a joining room with the door locked but it did not make a difference. All night long we could hear people in there loud! You can hear someone even if they were just breathing. Customer service is so poor that I think you can get better service at Motel 6! Oh, and the $15 a day hotel service fee??? We were supposed to get 2 bottles of water per day and a newspaper - where did that go? DO NOT STAY HERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: jujubeans33
Reviews.Content: I wasn't exactly thrilled with this hotel. There are other hotels in Vegas for a comparable price that are a lot nicer. My first complaint would be the water noise. Everytime someone above us ( we were on the 8th floor) flushed the toliet or took a shower, we heard it. My second complaint is with the pool. They actually check your bag to make sure you don't bring your own bottle of water to the pool. No...you have to buy their $5 bottle of water when its a 110 outside and you are thirsty. It was very annoying to say the least. Their pools were a bit dirty. The nice things were the food court that had a few cheap fast food places...chinese, pizza, subway, Haagen Daaz, and a couple others. The steakhouse there was good but very pricey. Won $1200 on their wheel of fourtune Penny slots which were pretty cool. The Cupcakery inside the building is awesome. The tram was convient to Bellagio or Aria.

Reviews.Title: “"Ok, but will try another hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Parispaigepayton
Reviews.Content: It is on the strip, room had a great view. beds were comforable but floor 16 had an odor of smoke. bathroom not very clean. outdated decor in rooms. Lobby very elegant,breakfast brunch was good.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: frangel
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nites at the Monte Carlo hotel after our tour of Arizona. Loved the hotel. Even if this place is 'huge' our room was very quiet and comfortable. Staff was most helpful and friendly. Casino was also lots of fun. Would definitely go back there.

Reviews.Title: “ehh, could always be better....”
Reviews.Author: leebrian527
Reviews.Content: There's nothing wrong with the hotel, but for the price you pay, you could stay at a much more nicer hotel with more amenities. Pros: The food court is very convenient, I think the most convenient of all the hotels in Las Vegas, and the monorail connecting aria/monte carlo to bellagio makes your walk to the center of las vegas blvd very convenient. nothing wrong with the room or bathroom, but the shower head is the most ugliest thing I've used. cons: the odor in this hotel is awful, especially that walk up to the monorail from the hotel. it literally smells like the sewage pipe or sewage storage is right around you. the other thing that most are not aware the resort fee is ridiculous, you practically throw away 20 bucks a day + taxes on a fee which you probably will not even use in the hotel. there is NOTHING in this hotel other than a few restaurants, a pool, the food court, a gym/spa, and the internet isn't even free. its ridiculous to just throw money away like that, especially caesars resorts that dont charge you a "resort fee." I am a "mlife" players card member, and let me tell you they #$#*%#%@%@ it all up for all of us regular people who cant bet 100 a hand to get comps.... but thats the least of my issue. --ive stayed here 3 times, and on a highly positive note, if you can afford it... hotel32 is worth it. for the price you pay, you have your personal check in host and concierge, no need to speak with anyone else. but as I said, to all of us regular folks who dont want to pay, or cant afford the high life.... they lied to you when they said its a "4 star diamond"

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Service”
Reviews.Author: ristrar1171
Reviews.Content: I would like to have seen better service at your casino I had horrible service from your cocktail waitress and your craps dealer. The dealer could not even explain the game to us and isinuated that b/c we came from the streets that we should already know how to play I thought that was extremly racist. It took forever ...for us to get a cocktail waitress to serve us and when we did we get one she was the rudest one ever. She also said because one of wasn't gambling she couldn't serve them but all of us had been gambling for hours with no service so is it our fault that no one came by to ask us if we wanted anything. I was very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice and the staff was wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Lve2travel_9
Reviews.Content: First, I have to say I was very nervous staying here after what I had read. I couldn't change our reservation because we paid for it with a vacation package. So all the worrying I did was for nothing. The room was very clean and always cleaned by 12pm. They even brought up extra towels and toiletries (per the previous suggestion bring your own soap they are small). Cleaning staff was great. The room furniture was fine no negative comments, and the bed was comfortable with lots of pillows! We also asked for a room away from the pool and they gave us a mountain view (no problems). The pool, yes the music was loud around 12pm (they could tone it down). To get a chair you need to be down there from 9-10:30am or comeback around 1pm (when AM people are leaving). They do check your bags and water is available for free, the drinks are expensive (to be expected). Plenty of sun in July! The buffet was paid for with our vacation package we were too lazy to go try another place so we stayed at Monte Carlo and it was good, they do need to change it up! The front desk staff, very nice yes we did wait 40 min for our room but the manager automatically waived our fees! We didn't even ask! Very clean entrance, bell staff wonderful. We don't have a negative thing to stay about the hotel. I really feel no matter where you go the chances of your hotel stay being perfect is unlikely...go with a positve and fun attitude and dont let the little things ruin your vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty towels?! Really?!”
Reviews.Author: cogrl
Reviews.Content: The location, entrance, and casino at the Monte Carlo were great. As this was our engagement weekend, we upgraded our room to a suite - it was not exactly what we thought it would be. It was spacious, and the jacuzzi tub was really nice, but otherwise, the room was very dated - clear signs of wear on the furniture, and the towels in our bathroom were dirty - as in had been used and just put back up on the rack dirty!!! When we told them about the dirty towels, the response was rude - they asked what we thought they were going to do for us! It took them all afternoon to get clean towels to us. The ipod alarm was also broken, when they brought us a replacement it was an 80's style radio alarm. The room did have a nice view of the pool area, and we were high enough up that we couldn't hear the noise from the pool. The pool area was another disappointment. Though it is a nice area - with a lazy river and a wave pool, there is simply not enough room!! Chairs are way to close, and it was impossible to actually get a chair if you weren't there pretty much when the pool opened. We were there on Memorial Day weekend, so perhaps it is not as bad on slower weekends, but it was really frustrating. Also - you cannot take ANY food or drinks into the pool area. We thought Starbucks was ok based on previous reviews, and had just bought our drinks before going to the pool, and we had to drink them before entering. Just really annoying. The location of this resort is really great - easy to get to several other resorts. We also got a free buffet for each day we were there, and could have gone to a few other resorts to use it if we had wanted to. The breakfast buffet was pretty standard, and we didn't have to wait in lines too much. The casino area was a good time - had a great time at the Craps tables, and the people working the tables were all really nice. We only ate at 1 restaurant in the hotel - Dragon Noodle. We went for a happy hour they had on the sushi, and we really liked it! They don't have a huge selection of sushi, but what we had was really tasty - and spicy! Overall, we still had a great time in Las Vegas, but with as many offerings that Vegas has, Monte Carlo really needs to step it up in some ways. It is definitely becoming a "budget" hotel, and its age is starting to show.

Reviews.Title: “Good memories at Mone Carlo Resort”
Reviews.Author: LILODEAR
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived in Monte Carlo Resort & Casino on Black Friday 2011 and we stayed there for 5 nights, if I'm not mistaken. Our room was overlooking the Strip... Ross and M&M's World are directly fronting our bay windows! ;-) nothing fancy about the room but we certainly didn't mind. We're in Vegas afterall and we didn't have much time to stay in the room anyway. ;-). Initially, we had some problems with our toilet tank and they moved us to another room on the same floor, still overlooking the Strip. They gave us complimentary meals for our inconvenience and we availed it for breakfast on our second day. Nothing spectacular on he spread..... It was the usual hotel flare but we certainly have had much better spreads in our other hotel stays... Front desk service was quite impressive.... Fast, courteous and efficient just the way it should be.... The location is just perfect... Monte Carlo is just a short walk towards the tram at the City Center.... It's also almost across the bus stop for the bus that would take you to whichever point you like from their specified route for $7 for the 24-hour duration... plus of course, it's smacked right at The Strip so you can do a lot of things from there. Needless to say, we won't mind going back to this hotel in our future visit to Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Elaewhere If You Can”
Reviews.Author: MMMH
Reviews.Content: Just back from 4 nights in Vegas staying at the Monte Carlo. While our room was spotlessly clean this hotel really lacks the wow-factor that you expect in a city like this. The whole place is jaded, with a feeling that it was lovely once, a long time ago. The minute you walk in the door you are greeted with the most awful smell of air-freshener which is piped out through the AC, it is truly nauseating, and actually forced us out of the hotel on more than one occasion. Thankfully this smell was not in our bedroom, which as I've said already could not be faulted. However, in Vegas you spend your days in hotels so it would be nice to want to linger around your own!! Over the course of our stay we visited most of the hotels on the strip and felt we really had made a bad choice. So, unless you get an amazing deal, shop around, do your homework and see if you can get a different hotel for similar money, or else spend a bit more, you'll be glad you did.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, cleanliness not so great”
Reviews.Author: YVR-AKI
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a smoking room on the 26th floor with a strip view. Price was pretty good but as we were checking in early (noon) there were no non-smoking rooms available. We could have waited for a non-smoking room but decided to give it a try. Very pleasantly surprised with the smell of the room... no hint of smoke at all and it actually smelt great. The hallways did smell but not too bad. The condition of the room was quite disappointing though... debris on the floor (was it cleaned?), bathroom also appeared not to have been cleaned well with hairs on the floor / sink. Found old cereal in the bedside table drawer and other junk by the beds under the skirts. Staff was very friendly / cheeful though. The guys at the Taxi stand were always cheerful and talkative as were everyone we dealt with at the front desk for checkin / checkout. Views of the strip were pretty good and the nephew loved the pools.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful on the outside, not so much on the inside”
Reviews.Author: ajotter
Reviews.Content: Perhaps if it wasn't billed as a 4 star resort, I wouldn't even have taken the time to write a review, but I wanted to share my experience. We had choices when we booked, and we chose this one partly based on its rating so I felt people should know exactly what they are getting. The exterior of the hotel and the lobby were beautiful but that is where it stops. This was my very first trip to Las Vegas, so I was excited to stay in a "4 star" hotel. I have stayed in 4 stars before, so I was really expecting something nice. What we got was a room in which the air conditioner never got the temp below 78 (at best), an awful "skunk" odor that would come and go out in the hallway and into our room, the filthiest carpets I have EVER seen (this is no exaggeration...you can not walk 12 inches in this hotel without running into a new stain), and just an overall worn out appearance of everything here. The walls are beaten up and have scuffs and scratches all over them. We stayed on 2 different floors during our visit (21st and 8th) and the experience was the same on both although the air worked a little better on the 21st floor room. We had to move b/c we wanted a king room and they didn't have any for the first night we were there so they offered to move us the next day. The service was good overall. We had to wait a pretty long time to check in as there were only 2 desk clerks working (there is room for 20) and the lines were quite long to get checked in, but the staff was very friendly and polite. But the facility itself is just worn out. It appears that no one in management ever ventures past the lobby/casino area, or they would be horrified at how filthy everything looks. An occasional carpet cleaning would do wonders. And sadly I lost my cell phone while there, or I would have posted some pictures. But I think you get the idea. Bottom line, if cleanliness (or at the least the appearance of it) is important to you, I wouldn't choose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price, nothing special though”
Reviews.Author: FuManStu42
Reviews.Content: On every Vegas trip I visit the Monte Carlo and have always liked the casino and bars. When looking for a decent sized room to spend 10 days in with my other half on her first Vegas trip, this seemed the logical choice as the suites were a lot cheaper than the MGM and are apparently virtually the same. The suite itself was a fair size and had all the bits you expect but it was all a bit tired and the TV and internet connection didn't work. They were fixed within a couple of hours but it never really seemed above average. The staff were all very polite (except for the one racist spin the wheel guy!) and the few bits of service we used were quite good but the concierge was terrible. After wasting nearly 2 hours getting them to find a high-end restaurant with good vegetarian options for a special meal, we gave up and solved it ourselves in 10 minutes using our laptop :-0. All in all I have no reservations about going there again if the price is right but they must be doing something very wrong there as the casino was always empty. We would go along every other casino on the strip and they would be very busy and then return to the MC and find it empty with little in the way of atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump.”
Reviews.Author: chelseadawn713
Reviews.Content: Came here for my birthday with my boyfriend. Having worked in hotels for 3 years, I definitely know what service is. The monte carlo has none. They checked us into a smoking room without even bothering to let us know, we found out when we were in the room. I have asthma and they couldnt have cared less. They moved us to a second "less smoky" smoking room and the bedding had cigarette burns, there was soap still in the shower that had body hair on it, it was disgusting. Finally on the second day, they moved us to a non smoking room where someone had left a bag of their clothes in plain view in the room. Obviously housekeeping isnt what it should be and again I say, THE SERVICE IS NONEXISTANT. the general manager should be ashamed of himself.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to stay without all of the frills!”
Reviews.Author: rcruz79
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a low key place without all of the bells and whistles then this is it! The Monte Carlo is a very nice and well kept hotel but does not really have any major attractions linked to it. The rooms were nice and we had a good view of the New york New York hotel next door and their "skyline". The pool area was ok and had a lot of families and children. The wave pool was a nice feature and so was their small lazy river. The location is great and you are in walking distance of many major attractions. For the price you can't go wrong. Very nice restaurants with a nice ambiance.

Reviews.Title: “Great for corporate events”
Reviews.Author: jmk171
Reviews.Content: Our company of 17 stayed at the Monte Carlo just a few days ago for a corporate retreat. We had a great experience with Alexis and Tiffany in Guest Relations and with Susan in the Poker room. They far exceeded our expectations regarding meeting space and accommodations during our stay. There is a good chance we'll choose the Monte Carlo again on our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: 100oneida
Reviews.Content: We took a family vacation to Vegas and had a package deal with Southwest. Good prices for hotel and airfare. We found the Monte Carlo to be a good place. We had all age ranges ( 20's to 70's ) including my 78 year old mother with us. Not noisey. Exciting enough and in a good location on the strip for the 20 somethings. We felt safe there. It was a 3 night stay. We were able to upgrade to a higher level floor and it was very quiet. There is a Starbucks downstairs if you need that and Mcdonalds coffee on the less expensive end. We ate breakfast at the cafe downstairs and ate dinner in other exciting Hotels. Discovered you can take the free transit to several other places after we had walked a lot. Just ask someone at the Hotel about it. Would go back for the package deal. We did have a later night flight arriving so becareful when you book if you're taking an am or pm flight. Over all great place for a variety of ages.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed it and will go back”
Reviews.Author: JLS1007
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Monte Carlo Las Vegas in July. Had a great time. When we first checked in and got to our room the safe would not open. Called down to the desk and someone was up in about 5 minutes to unlock it. The second day the light over the shower area went out and in a matter of minutes someone came up and replaced the blub. That was the only problems that we encountered and they were minor ones. Beds were very comfortable and everyone slept good. Nosie problems from the hallway was a little bad sometimes very late at night. The casino was great and always had someone asking if you needed a drink. Only ate at the food court and that was for breakfast. Never ate at the resturants in the hotel, seemed to be a little over priced. The hotel and casino was very clean. We enjoyed our stay and would go back to the Monte Carlo again.

Reviews.Title: “Fun and modern!!!”
Reviews.Author: reviewmaster777
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 days and it was good. Pool atmosphere great but music volume loud! Good room and view. Food court decent. Basic shops. Nice lobby but slow. Stamp machine broke. Enjoyable but can be improved alot!!! Nice place!!

Reviews.Title: “Showing it's age...”
Reviews.Author: divecozumel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here July 28-30th with friends. This is my second stay here and the rooms are beginning to wear. Although the television was upgraded, and the towels were nice, the rest of the furniture including the mattress left alot to be desired. Maid service was slow/non-existent. She finally showed at 4:30pm yesterday and was surprised we weren't interested in her cleaning the room. We had left by 7 am and spent the day out and about. Music by the pool was unbearably loud and DJ sucked. Now they have a rule that NO food or outside drinks can be brought in...13 bucks for a dixie cup drink? Seems like the Monte Carlo has starting skimping on staff, not what I go to Vegas for. Food at Diablos was nasty. Best margs over at New York, New York. Plenty of new options with the Aria and Cosmopolitan just opening. Won't be returning.

Reviews.Title: “"Did not like it and will not be coming back "”
Reviews.Author: LibertySummers
Reviews.Content: Hotel did not provide complimentary coffee or breakfast . I booked from my understanding that I would have free complimentary breakfast everyday . Seems the bigger the company "IS" The customer service "SUCKS". I guess I was spoiled from the smaller casino and hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant & Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: KenoshaKen
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Monte carlo for 3 nights from July 25 - 28 (Monday - Thursday). We received a Mlife players card offer for 2 complimentary nights and the 3rd night at a $59.00 rate. Also included was $25.00 in free slot play and 2 for 1 tickets to any shows at MGM properties. We purchased 2 tickets to see the "Beatles Love" cirque du soleil show at the Mirage. A fantastic high energy show that is a must see! The music, costumes, special effects are awsome, as you are entertained through the beatles career. Getting back to the Monte Carlo, we arrived from the airport around 6:00 pm, check in was easy (10 minutes). We were put in a room on the 19th floor, room 114. This floor is non smoking. we were a bit surprised to find out on entry that our room was a handicapped one. No big deal for us as you got more space. The room was nice and clean, but did have a few scuff marks on the walls. It had a new large flat screen TV and a nice comfortable king size bed. The furniture did look new also. The maid service was very good, left extra towels and plenty of bathroom amenities. We would come back around 12 noon each day to change into our swim wear and head down to the pool. Our room by that time was always cleaned up. The pool area was nice. It had a couple of regular pools, a lazy river and a wave pool. Plenty of chairs available! Towels were issued as you entered. They also had plastic cups, ice water available. (No carry in drinks were allowed, including bottle water). The ice water was great with Nevada's heat & sun. Poolside drinks are expensive for my taste, so we had the water. We liked playing slots at the Monte Carlo, we both actually won a little. Seemed like a lot of people in the casino having a good time. We ate at the Monte Carlo buffet for breakfast ($16.95 per person). It was very good, many food choices. We loved the omelet station. Also ate dinner at the Pub. They have a tasty pub burger with fries ($13.00) that we really enjoyed. They also have a happy hour from 4 to 7 pm I believe. ( 2 for 1 draft beer specials, etc.). Also check out the Cup Cakery down the hall from the pub. Great yummy cupcakes! Check out was a breeze, checked out on Thursday morning around 9:30. We earned a few comps which lowered our bill a bit. (Do make it a point to sign up for a players club card). We enjoyed our stay at the Monte Carlo, everyone was very helpful and friend- ly. Cocktail waitresses were timely as we played the slots. They work hard so we always tip. The only negatives I can think of is dirty carpets in the elevators and floor halls. There is a $15.00 daily resort fee, but you get some services from it like in room wired internet, fitness center access, daily newspaper (USA), airline boarding pass printing, etc. We enjoy going to Vegas about 4 times a year. Have stayed at many different hotels there. I rank the Monte Carlo a 4 star hotel. Rates are more reasonable and the hotel is in a good location being in the center of the strip. Plus you can use the free tram to the Aria and Bellagio Hotels. I'm sure I'll be back in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Slow check-in process”
Reviews.Author: ccmbgrl
Reviews.Content: They need to rethink their check-in system. Maybe one line that feeds into the next available front desk staff rather than lines behind each person. I waited 40 minutes for 3 people ahead of me to check in, while the lines on each side of me kept moving. I would have moved, but the other lines were growing longer and I kept thinking my line would move faster. Very annoying. It only took me 3 minutes to check in, so I don't know what the problem was with everyone else. The basic rooms are nothing fancy. No mini-bar (and all I wanted was water!). The casino is nice though, good cafe and a short walk to CityCenter.

Reviews.Title: “awsome time”
Reviews.Author: nmfallguy
Reviews.Content: Once again The Monte Carlo lived up to everything it advertises.The rooms are very spacious,the buffet is more than you can imagine.The VIP area is warm and inviting,The staff are more than helpful they bend over backwards to make your stay one you wont forget soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for an IDEAL location on the strip with one of the best pools!”
Reviews.Author: ebalestro
Reviews.Content: I've traveled to Vegas for so many conventions and meetings, and Monte Carlo is still consistently one of the strip's best offerings for value, location and amenities. Rooms are decorated very nicely, with upscale furnishings and bathrooms. The location is superior....you're right in the middle of everything, with close proximity to the strip's best of the best...Bellagio, Paris, Venetian...and the attractions of New York, New York. Andre's restaurant is really wonderful, we had a private room for our group and the service and food was impeccable. Great wine list. I found the lobby, shops and restaurants to be upscale as well. The pool is so awesome, the lounges and cabanas are great, but the Lazy River is perfect for the Vegas heat. You can stay somewhere else that has a fancy name and a price tag, but I think Monte Carlo is a hidden gem.

Reviews.Title: “Nice - but can you take the crowds and rules”
Reviews.Author: DR_DAN2010
Reviews.Content: At a couple hundred a night, I expect to be treated quite like a king - I am cheap by nature. Would not put this experience in the treated like a king category. Rooms were adequate, clean and comfortable. Missing some of the nice little things like a frig and coffer maker. But who is expected to stay in their rooms anyway? The check in staff was not rude, but rather matter of fact- no, we can't, no we don't, no we won't. no you can't, and you are paying more. That is sort of how it went. If you stay here and perhaps all of the major hotels in LV, you are part of a horde of people from all over the world - and the only way to deal with this volume and variety is ... have a rule for everything. I would say the service was obligatory, and mostly they said, no. The rules made me feel like I was at a Homeland Security facility - but I think this may just be Vegas in 2011. The internet fees and the mandatory resort fees, offset any good deal that we may have received as part of the "hotel package". This will be my last trip of choice to Vegas, the Blue Man group was fantastic, the Zip Line Downtown was fun, and the people watching - I am sure the feeling was mutual - but wow are there some strange people in the world. I am going to try Reno next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location; would go back...”
Reviews.Author: avapopelectric
Reviews.Content: just got back from a trip to LV and booked the Monte Carlo because my father recommended it and the price was really low and wasn't disappointed! I was looking for a fairly calm hotel, with a great location and clean room and it is exactly what I got. The hotel and rooms were perfectly fine, check-in and check-out were a breeze and the pool was great. The only thing is that the pool gets REALLY crowded especially in the afternoon and while there are plenty of loungers available, there isn't a lot of shade if you want some (I didn't, but my mother did!). The music was fine with me, not too loud and would range from Green Day to Rhianna, which was great. I also wished more restaurants would be available in the hotel, just because sometimes it's more convenient to eat at the hotel than to go out. I would go back to this hotel, mostly because it's well located (free tram to Crystals and Bellagio is a plus, as well as another connecting Excal to Luxor and Mandalay Bay that isn't far) and because it's usually cheaper than other hotels of the same quality. It was very calm (except on one night where there was VERY loud music and annoying people in the next room); this is not a party hotel, and I appreciated that also.

Reviews.Title: “Ehhhh It was Ooookaaay”
Reviews.Author: kellyarix
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just ok. if you can get it for about $115 on a weekend then do it. If not move on The pros: I didn't have to wait until 2 or 3 to check in like I do in the bigger hotels. The service was great. They have low min. buy ins on the tables. If you're a gambler that's nice. The food in the cafe was good and decently priced The cons: TOO MANY KIDS AT THE POOL. It still amazes me that people bring their kids to Vegas and I don't want to see them on my sin city trip (sorry parents, try Disney next time). Here's a bonus tip for your trip advisor readers. Planet Hollywood is also crawling with kids The rooms were sort of lame. Nothing has been updated and the fun part of Vegas is the glitz and glamour. If you don't care about that stuff this hotel is just fine. There's nothing horrible about the hotel but there's nothing great about it either.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and convenient access to the rest of Vegas”
Reviews.Author: schoolgirl77
Reviews.Content: I go to Vegas multiple times a year but this was my first stay at the Monte Carlo. I go to the NYNY and MGM Grand a lot, as well as shopping off the strip. I found it super convenient that the parking garage feeds you right into the lobby which is right next to the main bank of elevators for the rooms. I was happy to not have to walk through the entire casino with my luggage. Also close to the lobby was a sundry shop and food court open 24 hours that includes Rubio's, Subway, Sbarro, and Starbucks. A convenient coffee fix and you don't have to hunt for somewhere to get a snack at 3am. :) Rooms were also very comfortable, not as nice as Palazzo and the like, but better than Excalibur, Tropicana.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: travelqueen10151
Reviews.Content: Our second time to stay at the Monte Carlo. The room was clean and quiet, with a nice variety in the pool area with a lazy river, wave pool, jacuzzi, and regular pool. The casino isn't very loose with the slots but none of them are so you might as well get over it. The pub restaurant and cafe offered nice food with big portions (so split). Lots of fast food options made it reasonable to eat. This was a family trip with a disabled person and we had access to a wheel chair and a motorized cart. The only complaint was the long lines at check in. Loved the in -room speedy check out where the entire bill shows on the TV screen.

Reviews.Title: “family vaction”
Reviews.Author: scottc39
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo services were top notch, the Casino very big and always hopping day and nite, the food was top notch as well , great buffet with great choices for breakfast, lunch and dinner. there was a great chinese noodle place in the Casino as well. Star bucks coffer shop, just plenty of places to eat at. The room we were in was on the 12th floor over looking the pool , very nive veiw, My folks were on the 16th floor with a great veiw of the pool and other hotels. We stayed right on the strip so casino hopping was very easy, the weather was just great not to hot, lots of places to eat at and do shopping. Just be on vaction was a blast, there was a lot of walking and the was the worst thing.

Reviews.Title: “clean and quiet!”
Reviews.Author: cultural_addict
Reviews.Content: We started out in a room with 2 queen beds the first night and then were moved to a room way up on the 16th floor, with a king bed the next night. Both rooms were pleasant, clean, and quiet. The fellow that helped us with tickets and reservations at the concierge desk was absolutely awesome! Most of the staff was reasonably helpful at the front desk, although the "lines" are quite confusing. The buffet was also actually really good, which was a nice surprise. All in all this was a great hotel to stay at, and it's in a great location right on the strip :)

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with Mediocre”
Reviews.Author: travel201008
Reviews.Content: We got there 30 minutes before check-in time (and we had reservations) and had to wait 2 1/2 hours for a room to be ready. The rooms (we had two), and especially the bathrooms were dated and worn, but very clean. We were accommodated with strip view rooms, which we requested. We waited in line both checking in and checking out for a good 20-30 minutes. Room Service was prompt and the food was good. As a whole, it just didn't live up to the reputation and was worth a little less than the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Whoadie
Reviews.Content: Really had a good time there, the pool was great and the famous Gorda drink pool side is awesome, $50 was the price but it ws great, Overall had a great experience, had a spa suite and love the spa tub, the shower, the bed and even the ipod hookup to the stereo. I would recommend this hotel to anybody who wants a good deal and right on the strip. with denny's across the street and the Bellagio water show to the left!! I love it, looking forward to going back again!! Jey New Orleans

Reviews.Title: “An aging, croweded hotel, but good for the $”
Reviews.Author: Bronzediva
Reviews.Content: I had gone to the Monte Carlo's website before booking and it appeared as if it had been renovated within the past ten or so years. They claimed they had unassuming elegance. I would not go that far. My first impression was the fingerprints on the glass doors. Many prints. It seems easy to me to have a staff member regularly take some windex and a paper towel to the glass doors. But once inside I understood why so many prints. The lobby was a madhouse of guests checking in and buzzing around. But my hubby and I were patient was waited in line for our turn. We had booked on another site and got a really good deal--comparable to a Super 8 price. So many others probably got that same deal! The carpets were dingy and didn't look updated. The ads blasting on the TV screen in the elevator was advertizing their in house show--Jabberwakees. The ad itself was loud and obnoxious. But we could tolerate it if only for a minute travel time. We requested a high floor and got 22nd (yes a high enough floor) although our view of the pool was obscured by dusty windows (from the outside). The pool was bumpin' loud music during the day, but thankfully it was off when we finally got in the bed to sleep. The decor was nothing fancy and the bathroom not really luxurious--just an average motel bathroom with nicer toiletries. Looks like the little things were updated to make it seem renovated, but things such as carpeting and wallpaper were older. But yet, for the cheap price, it was comfy and clean enough. We did have some young neighbors wake us up at 4 am coming in for the night/morning obviously intoxicated and loud. But they must have zonked out soon afterward.

Reviews.Title: “Average (Great Strip View)”
Reviews.Author: sheilametoo
Reviews.Content: We use the Monte Carlo for a 3 day Birthday getaway during weekday. We felt like unwelcome guess. We spent our money in the casino bought great food. It was kind of boring. We received wonderful welcomes at the Wynn and Cosmo. Acknowledging staff happy to be working.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and of couse we'll be back again”
Reviews.Author: apimukp
Reviews.Content: It was our first time at Monte Caro Hotel. We stayed sixe nights forour business trip. The rooms and casino were not noisy. The location is good. The hotel is not far from the airport. They have free shuttle bus bring us to the exhibition show.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time in Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: cindilouredhat
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from spending three nights at the Monte Carlo Hotel and Casino in Las Vegas, and we had a great time! I think what made the difference for me was not that there were no problems, but how well problems were handled. The hotel was beautiful and easy to get to from the airport since the van waiting to take us to our hotel was part of our package deal! Very nice surprise! Our room turned out to be on a smoker's floor, so we called and they changed us out the next day after sincerely trying to minimize the smell in the room. The city was experiencing 100 degree weather, but the hotels, stores, restaurants and public transportation was all beautifully air conditioned so the discomfort was minimized. There were a wide varitety of restaurants right there in the hotel where we enjoyed discounts brought to our attention as soon as we checked in. In fact, every time we asked for help from the front desk, whatever the problem was, it was quickly remedied. They held on to our luggage after checkout so that we could continue to enjoy the city without having to tote that around. They were able to print up our boarding passes early, and our transportation to take us back to the airport was waiting when we returned. In the hotel itself, there were a lot of little shops including some that were great fun just to browse in, and others where we were able to buy bargain tee shirts to bring home for our kids. For little things you may have brought to bring, of course the usual sundries are in the hotel room, but there was another store in the lobby with more, but there are great little stores very close by for anything else you might need. The room itself was wonderful, the bed very comfortable and clean, as was the lovely bathroom. There was a noisy family with young children next door, but that was not the hotel's fault, and the good news was they went to bed really early! The pool area was great fun. From our hotel room, it looked like it would be too hot to be out there, but we found that early in the morning, as soon as they opened, there was a great deal of shade and no crowds! One of the best things about this hotel was that it is extremely close to a lot of other really cool hotels, and they even have free air conditioned trams that take you there! Don't miss the Bellagio. In the other direction, walk across the street to New York and the hotels in that direction are connected also, so you spend the least amount of time in the heat. This is our fourth trip to Las Vegas where we have also stayed at the Paris Hotel, Planet Hollywood and long ago we stayed at Circus Circus when our kids were very small. To me, this hotel holds it own among the best of them, leaving me feeling pampered and rested, at what was a very reasonable price. We will undoubtedly be back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, fun pool, crappy resort fees”
Reviews.Author: zippshi
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I came to Vegas to celebrate my friend's bachelorette party. Needless to say, we just wanted a hotel on the strip, close to things with a good pool. We did get all those things at Monte Carlo. It has great placement on the strip with a free tram to the new City Center and then Bellagio. It is also next to NYNY and MGM which is fun. The pool is great with one big main pool, a wave pool (whose waves run a little too frequent for my taste) and a lazy river. We shared a $55 pitcher of mojitos which actually went a long way. The only thing I would change about that would be that we weren't allowed to bring in bottled water to the pool area. It's 100 degrees outside and we can't bring in water. Go figure. The casino is smaller than some of the other hotels on the strip so we were done playing there after the first day and a half. We didn't check out their ice bar thing because it was hard to see what the deal was with it. Our main problem with the hotel was that when we checked in, we were informed of the new "resort fees" that some hotels in Las Vegas started. For 3 nights, it was an extra $50 per room. They said it was so we could have internet (connected with a cable) and some other stuff. We never used anything that would even come close to covering the amount for the fee. We didn't even turn our tv on until we tried to check out. In fact, when we went to mail a postcard, they charged us $0.50 to mail it because there was a convenience fee on top of what the stamp cost. So let me get this straight, you charge me an extra $50 for the room and then can't cover a $0.20 stamp? Come on... Bottom line: Great pool and location, but find another hotel without the resort fees. They start out your trip with a slightly sour taste in the mouth.

Reviews.Title: “Better than most”
Reviews.Author: Immebsmom
Reviews.Content: We checked in mid-week which helped with the chaos. There check in area needs to be redone as it is a free for all. Most of the other big hotels have a queue and you go to the next available window. Not here. It is like a crazy grocery store line where everyone splits up their party into different check in/out lines to see who gets there first. Rooms - The rooms were lovely and clean. We had two double rooms. One with a view and one without. No problems with noise, but we did have one guy who tried to follow us into our room (VERY DRUNK) and we got rid of him and notified security. I have to say that the rooms were clean, we really did not hear alot of noise. Food - There are multiple restaurants and fast food outlets. The fast food outlets are at least double the price of your average free standing location at home. I think a foot long at subway was $10 for the $5 and then $12 for the 'premium'. The Dragon Noodle restaurant has really good dimsum for lunch and they participate in the buy a coupon to get $xx off your total purchase of $xx or more. We did the costs and on lunch for 4, we easily save $40 off the total by buying the $5 discount. Tix4tonight sells them and they are just about across the street at the Coke bottle. Valet parking - was close conveinent at quick. Never really had a long wait. Pool - very small for the property and got very crowded very quickly. Also, like all properties on the strip, the pool closes at 6 or 7pm. In the middle of summer? Seriously? It isn't even like the sun has gone down and it is dark. Biggest irritation about this property and all MGM properties is the daily resort fee. It was $20 a day here (it is more or less depending on the property you stay at) Casino was eh....never really won anything and they did not have the most current and/or popular slots. Not as smokey as some I have been in, but I am not sure if that is because they have a good ventalation system or less smokers.

Reviews.Title: “I hated it and will never stay there again”
Reviews.Author: valgerdur13
Reviews.Content: I was overcharged, but not untill I got home and they put it on my AX Card. Made reservation for 2 queen beds, they gave us 1 king, the room was lousy. We were supposed to get, buy 1, get 1 free on the buff, they would not give it to us. Supposed to get newspaper, couldn't get one, I could go on and on.

Reviews.Title: “Our Stay at Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: Gizmo311
Reviews.Content: I can summarize our stay at Monte Carlo in one word.....ADEQUATE. We got a very good price for the nights we stayed, and the hotel quality was consistent with that price. Our room had some stains in the carpet (we think it was vomit), the A/C was not very cool, and the shower head was very low (luckily both of us are short...I would feel sorry for any tall person trying to take a shower). There were a lot of families with children staying there during our stay, and they were pretty much everywhere...walking through casinos, in the restaurants and in the pool. Having said all of that, the staff was very friendly and were quick to fix any issues (when housekeeping forgot to leave glasses, towels, etc...). The majority of the dealers in the casino were friendly, and the cocktail waitresses were very good at providing drinks while you were gambling (not true for all Vegas casinos). Again, an adequate hotel, and a pretty good value for the buck. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “counter staff who didnt care”
Reviews.Author: dealfinderblue
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Las Vegas at 12:00 noon. We went to the desk and things started off ok, i handed in my expedia extra gift which was free buffet for breakfast or lunch for each day you stay. Then things fell apart, they said they could not put 2 promo codes into the computer software to allow us to take advantage of the expedia offer. Then they blamed expedia and told me to go call them. It took me 75 minutes to check in that day and the hotel ended up not honouring the expedia free meals offer. When asked they wouldnt even comp me a free meal to make up for the 75 minute wait in the lobby. Because they refused to honour our promo it cost me an extra $ 240 for meals that would have been covered on the promo.

Reviews.Title: “Under impressive”
Reviews.Author: VinoGal
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels but I felt compelled to write about the Monte Carlo. Overall it is a dated hotel, loud and crowded hotel. Since I was here on more business I had some extra time to enjoy Las Vegas. The hotel rooms are not as clean and are outdated. If I had known there is not a coffee machine in the room I would not have booked a room here at the Monte Carlo. There is a Starbucks in the lobby but that did open up until 6am. You can hear every door in the hallway closing. Even though the lobby is large it is still very crowded and the entire hotel is loud. Even the advertising you get bombarded with in the elevator is loud. There really is not a single area of the hotel that is remotely quiet, except the room which has no refrigerator or coffee machine. The pool area is small, crowded and loud. The buffet was OK at best, at bit overpriced for the quality of the food being served. Considering the competition in walking distance, The Cosmopolitan, Aria, Vdara and Bellagio you would think the Monte Carlo would step up their game. I won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: JKZander
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed three nights at the Monte Carlo in June. We didnt have a reservation on arrival but easily acquired a room, a pool view one at that! The rooms were dated but spacious, and quiet. The King-sized bed was really comfortable too! We found the location of the hotel central and were able to walk to most of the main casinos, restaurants and bars. The hotel is beside the spectacular new Cosmopolitan hotel, which is definitely worth a visit! Free parking was available, although I'm not really sure whether or not this is standard for most Vegas hotels. There is no access to free wifi, which was a major negative for us.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: sj57
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to Las Vegas, after visiting many other hotels and casinos we quickly found the Monte Carlo was average and lacking greatly in comparison. The casino and restaurants were barely occupied. However, the pool area/experience was great! And The Pub restaurant had a nice outdoor patio overlooking the pool and great, affordable food. The location is a bit far but better than other hotels that required taxi cab rides.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but shame about the pool.”
Reviews.Author: Amanda26_uk
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very impressive and the reception area is huge. We paid a bit extra for a higher floor which was worth it for the views of Vegas. The casino was nice enough and the in house show called Jabawockeez was brilliant! We also went to see Cirque du Soleil which I have to say wasn't as good but much more expensive. The buffet was excellent and you get a two for one offer on your room key which you can use once a day. The buffet is $20 each and you can help yourself to everything. The room was big and comfortable with all the modern gadgets to enjoy a few days in Vegas. The staff were very friendly and couldn't do enough to help which was great. The only down side was the pool. They played VERY loud music all day and there were ashtrays, food and drinks all over the floor surrounding the pool. It isn't really big enough for the hotel so it was severley over crowded. We only went once for aroung 20 minutes and hated every inute of it.

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Steven4209
Reviews.Content: after reading many reviews, many not so good we were pleasantly surprised with this hotel. Room was surprisingly large, and well appointed. If you looking for a base point. its strip based, didn't have the usual old smoke smell about it. note: as with most LV hotels....WIFI is not available for the Ipad users. there is a starbucks and Mcdonalds down stairs

Reviews.Title: “vegas is amazing.”
Reviews.Author: dymondoo
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Vegas and it was the best time. Stopped at the Monte Carlo resort for 11 nights and loved every one. The hotel is right on the strip but is not to big and brash so serves as a great base. Hotel is not as big as many on the strip but has everything and more you need for a great time. Room was large and clean with comfy beds. Pool area was about the best i came across in vegas. Good party atmosphere but if you got down after about 11 finding a sunbed was not easy. All the bars have offers at different times for drinks so read up and save $$$. We liked to have coctails in the "Brand" and "Hit" bars before seven :-) Find a voucher for buy one get one free and go to the Minus 5 bar, everything in there is made of ice its amazing. Hotel has a free monrail to the Bellagio hotel so this can save you lots of walking when getting around. Another good way to get around id the busses. $7 for a 24 hour pass that allows you to travel from the very south of the strip right upto Freemont street at the very north, two different busses one stops at every hotel and one stops about every 4 so if your going a long way try and hop on the one with least stops. Go and see the Blue Man group at the Venetian I have never laughed so hard!! also go and see "Ka" at the MGM grand as although i'm not into dance/circus it was the most amazing thing I have ever seen!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! We did the grand canyon helicopter trip and it was stunning. We used the following website and booked it in the UK before we went out with no issues. http://www.allgrandcanyontours.com/Grand-Canyon-Tours/Helicopter-Tours/sbc-2849?pref=02&gclid=CLy-7OWplKoCFUK_zAod4RTpyg&aid=ltg1328 heliport only 20 Mins from hotel but free limo pick up so cheers easy. Get to Vegas people its just a scream.

Reviews.Title: “Quite good bar a couple of minor things”
Reviews.Author: Sebs312
Reviews.Content: Don't get me wrong. As far as hotels go, this resort is one of the best I've stayed in. However my expectations of the room itself were unmatched. I found it to be quite outdated. This may be the style they are looking for, but I did expect a more modern feel from the hotel. That was why a star was deducted. However, being in Las Vegas, the room quality should not matter as much as the entertainment. The casino is well equipped with all games, if a bit smaller compared to some other casinos. It is perfectly located around the middle of the strip making traveling perfect. The staff are all very helpful and friendly, providing an excellent service overall. The bars and restaurants are great, having both upmarket and fast food establishments. The jabbawokeez show that they have on is superb and is definitely recommended for all visitors to vegas. Would I stay here again? I would not have any reservations about the hotel, but being in vegas, you want to try them all. But brilliant all the same.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience will not stay again...”
Reviews.Author: cjaeris
Reviews.Content: We are on a family of 5 and came to Vegas for vacation. We have stayed at other MGM properties but this is the first time we stayed at Monte Carlo. We got a pretty good rate but it wasn't even worht us paying that! I would have gladly paid more at another property for a better experience. Service was AWFUL..managers response to negative experience awful. (continued lack of response to requests (we had to call at least 2 - 3 times, wrong rate information, and something was forgotten for our room every day...compensation? $75 food credit and no resort fees...they should have given our stay for free it was pretty stressful AND we stayed in the Diamond Suite!) The manager didn't even know who I can write to for my experience...I had to wait for the "survey" that comes out after our stay. As I write this we're actually still here and would leave if we weren't watching their show tonight. I was able to find out the customer service e-mail and still have not received any response from my experience (over 24 hours). This is the FIRST review on any of these sites that I have ever written on my experiences at any hotels because it was THAT bad....I would not recommend this hotel....

Reviews.Title: “Hotel and Casino were good, pool was not”
Reviews.Author: Audrey460
Reviews.Content: We did have to change rooms because someone had smoked in our first room. We were happy with the second room and the casino. The buffet was expensive, but had pretty good food. The steakhouse was VERY expensive, but we split a steak and it was pretty good. The concierge sold us inexpensive tickets to Zumanity, which was AWESOME! The pool was less than wonderful. They wouldn't let us in with drinks that we had purchased IN THE HOTEL! Then when we bought drinks in the pool, the "lifeguards" blew whistles at everyone in the pool with a drink.
