It was 102 degrees outside and they didn't want us to stand in the pool with a drink. Totally ridiculous. The fitness center and spa was well worth the $10 to use the lockers, steam room, suana, and hot tub. Generally the hotel staff walking around the hotel and in the food court were very unhelpful and almost rude. The exceptions were the concierge and the spa, where they were at least helpful. Not spectacular, but we only paid $79/night.

Reviews.Title: “Within easy walking distance to both ends of the strip”
Reviews.Author: vlp50
Reviews.Content: We had a comfortable stay at the Monte Carlo, no complaints really, other than the wafer thin walls, listening to the party next door until 4am was a little much, but you are in Vegas so we slept on the plane coming home.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for families”
Reviews.Author: hawinhb
Reviews.Content: Traveled with 2 10-year-old boys. Kids enjoyed small wave pool, lazy river and swimming pool. Sand volleyball area behind lazy river. Saw Jabbawockeez in hotel theatre (a great show for children and adults). Booked thru Expedia and received 2/day complimentary buffet tickets for breakfast or lunch. Buffet had large variety with short lines. Bed was comfortable. Hotel located near freeway. Hotel has RESORT FEE of $15/day. No wireless but was able to connect to internet. BEWARE: when accepting Terms and Conditions for internet service, you are authorizing hotel to sell your info to 3rd parties (read #8 before accepting). Connects to Aria Hotel and tram station to certain hotels. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “First visit.Happy with choice,BUT.....”
Reviews.Author: lefatman
Reviews.Content: Took a long weekend trip for my wives birthday and booked through a travel agent. Found the hotel to be very convenient to the airport.Check in was very easy and painless.Room was as advertised and plenty big for us.We ate at the buffet twice (vouchers were included in our deal) and found food to be very good and the selection was great. Only other meals were in food court,which has a good variety and a dinner in d'vinci which was the highlight of our stay. We would have been completely satisfied if we had not visited other hotels. Bellagio is amazing ! New York New York has great atmosphere and is a trip in itself just to see the interior. Went to Luxor for the Titanic display and again atmosphere was unbelievable. Titanic display itself was very interesting,but probably a bit overpriced. Riu was a trip in itself,WSOP underway and the place was hopping. I'm an old fart,so to say I enjoyed the Coasters,Platters, Marvelettes show would be an understatement. I would recommend that any first time visitors,like ourselves, start their stay with a round trip ticket on the deuce bus.That gave us a good idea where everything is.Overall a very satisfying vacation,but as a non casino gambler I'm not in any real hurry to go back. If we do return,pricing will be the major consideration,as you can go anywhere no matter where you stay. The biggest problem we had was with the in room internet as it never worked for us and I had to use my Verizon Sky Card.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay for a relaxing get away”
Reviews.Author: DebVancouver
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Monte Carlo in June 2011 for a get away to see Garth Brooks. It is a nice hotel and the staff were very friendly. The room was nice, clean like a regular hotel room. LOCATION: It is located quite south on the strip so you will have to do a bit of walking to see the other resorts. I would recommend using the free tram which has two stops: the Aria and Bellagio area casinos. The monorail system which you have to pay for from the MGM across the street is not that useful if you are staying here. The amount you have to walk just to get to it, is not worth it. Using the free one from the Monte Carlo and then walking up to the Wynn area is free and the walking will be about the same. There is a CVS (I think that is what the letters were - sorry not from US) and pharmacy across the street so you can pick up any forgotten necessities. MEALS: There is a McDonalds, Starbucks, Subway and a couple of other fast food type places located in the hotel. We did eat at the steakhouse in the hotel "BRAND" which was really good, my husband did the "Wine around the World" with dinner and it was presented very well and the staff and service was excellent! The hickory smoked mashed potaotes were REALLY GOOD! If you have dined at Gothams in Vancouver it is very similar both in price and meal style. We also ate at the Bellagio Buffet for breakfast (on a Monday - which is different than the weekend buffets). It was good and the service was very good as well. PRICE: The Monte Carlo was a nice clean place - nothing fancy and on par with the other hotels of the same level as far as price goes. The water in the pool was $8.25 a bottle which is CRAZY and you can't take anything in so beware of that. There is also a mandatory resort fee which wasn't much but really???? Just incorporate into your rates so your customers don't feel like they are paying for something that they are not using. Also no coffe makers so you will want to visit Starbucks in the morning. I would stay here again and take advantage of the tram to get me up the strip to the other casinos or else stay in that area if the price was similar.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad.. Great Pool!”
Reviews.Author: Friskie_11
Reviews.Content: This was just OK. Im glad I spent the little extra for the Monacco suite as the extra space was nice. Originally arrived at 3am due to a delayed flight so checking was no problem.. got to our room only to find a pair of old gross underwear in the drawer!!lol.. not a big deal, the front desk got us a new room right away and a couple of buffett comps. They were super friendly about it too. The lazy river at the pool was awesome, but BEWARE the gigantic mohito's will hit ya hard floating in the sun all day...lesson learned :) over all not bad, the steakhouse was great but the Casino had a strong smell to it that gave us a headache so we played elsewhere. I would recomend only if the price is right,.. for what I paid on this trip Ive been to better, cheeper.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Time,..We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: oldtimer630_0
Reviews.Content: Check-in was accomplished without fuss, total time about 15 minutes. Staff was friendly and well informed, answering all our questions. The room was very clean and spacious enough for our needs. The kingsize bed was extremely comfortable and the room was quiet at night. We were slightly disappointed with the Dragon Noodle Restaurant, expecting the food to be better than it was, nothing exceptional. The Cafe food was tasty, ample portions and certainly moderate in price. Casino attendants were polite and prompt in offering refreshments. All in all, we enjoyed our stay of 6 nights, and will certainly stay again. We highly recommend the Monte Carlo for it's friendly atmosphere, central location and value .

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay there again”
Reviews.Author: anchancubtl
Reviews.Content: Expectations were higher for the Monte Carlo but when we arrived our party didn't get rooms cles to each other. The bathroom was dirty and the towels smelled of urine. Had to call housekeeping twice. They need to update the carpets and rooms. We got a deal on the hotel rate thank goodness because normally they run $350-$400 a room which I would never pay. Very dissappointed. Loud music palying until 10pm at the pool. Not a hotel for kids. Won't stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “We were very impressed and will be looking to go back soon”
Reviews.Author: EdandAnn29
Reviews.Content: Make sure that you join the resort card scheme, these often come with great money off, 2 for 1 deals and more. Always check on line before your trip for other offers too i.e extra discount on hotel bookings etc. We travelled in December as the heat of the summer is way to much for us we were wearing T shirts during the day and only jackets in evening. Must see is the Grand Canyon we went Christmas Day it was fantastic they did say that there was 11ft of snow the year before but not when we went it was fantastic needed big coat still had a chill in the air. Hotel was very helpfull we had a package delivered and they notified us immediately it arrived. Nothing was too much trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding everytime we go!”
Reviews.Author: MaureenMatt
Reviews.Content: The biggest draw to this hotel is the pool. Don't plan on going to the pool to sit quietly and relax. This pool is a party. The doors open at 900 and the music and alcohol start flowing immediately. Makes for great people watching. Get there early to find good seats in the shade because it does get hot. The rooms, service and casino are good for the money. We love this place and stay here about twice a year. Starbucks is easy to find on the casino floor. There is a second Starbucks down the hall past the brew pub. Small store next door for essentials; water, sunscreen, etc. No complaints about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Stay for the Price..Not the Pool!”
Reviews.Author: Davyboy75
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights and really liked this place. It has everything a resort hotel can offer in a very good location on Las Vegas Blvd. Nice lobby. Clean room. Lots of choices for food. We got the room for about $60.00 per night. We had a room on the 20th floor with a strip view. Nice! The bad part is the pool. Too many people for the area. Lounge chairs are packed together like sardines. The pool was dirty. The pool area had garbage throughout the grounds. We asked for towels, and were told they ran out. We did see lots of dirty towels draped over various chairs. Our dream of relaxing by the pool was shattered!! I think staff could have did a better job. We will probably stay here again, but we won't count on spending time at the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Eh' Not So Hot...”
Reviews.Author: Kpost1
Reviews.Content: So, I stayed here in May with a huge group for my wedding. We had about 20 people booking rooms for my wedding that was being held outside of the city. I had worked with a guy in the group booking department named Dan and I cannot express how rude this man was. He was not helpful and had a terrible attitude the entire time I worked with him. The only reason I stayed with the Monte Carlo was because it was a decent group price and it wasn’t a young hip casino where the older guests wouldn’t feel comfortable. The day my family and I checked in they were changing computer systems and the line to check in was incredibly long. By the time we got up there and checked into one of the rooms, they claimed they didn’t have the second room booked under my father’s name. Since he made both of the reservations the at the same time, I hardly think it was an issue on our part. So, after an HOUR! the woman checking us in had to go and get her manager who basically made us beg and thank him for “allowing” us to still use the group booking price for the room reservation that they lost. The pool was fun because it had a lazy river and wave pool but the music was disgustingly loud, and I'm still in my 20's and thought that!! The positives were that the rooms were clean and comfy and I spoke with a woman in the concierge department who helped me look for limo services to and from the wedding. I ended up finding a cheaper price through a different service, but I couldn’t have been happier with how helpful and nice she was. The bellhops and valet guys were super friendly as well. After the check-in fiasco I was so turned off by the casino that I’m not sure I’d end up staying here again, but for it being in a great central location on the strip, having nice clean rooms at a good price, it’s certainly a decent option.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location on the Las Vegas strip”
Reviews.Author: TStewart30
Reviews.Content: On a February 2011 trip to Las Vegas we chose the Monte Carlo because of its location and the price deal we got. Many of the hotels in the city offer similar price values, but this location "is right in the middle of things" and in a central strip location. You can walk anywhere and this hotel is right next door to the new City Center (shopping and restaurants). There are certainly newer hotels, but the Monte Carlo has a good reputation as being one of the fixtures on the strip so we knew we'd have a good experience there. They have a huge and well run (efficient) check in lobby area. The lobby also had computers and printers available at no cost so you could get your boarding passes ( a little thing, I know, but we didn't have a computer in our group). Our rooms were large and clean and we had a mini-fridge(possibly there by accident as we did not order this and only one of our rooms had one). It was also nice that just downstairs from the elevators (and a short stroll thru the casino of course) was a great food court. Sometimes you get tired of eating in expensive hotel restaurants or buffets and just want to grab a Starbucks or a Subway sandwich and take it to your room, so this option is also available. Like many of the hotels, the Monte Carlo also has free covered parking just off the lobby. All in all, a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but Lots of Noise”
Reviews.Author: Marinda0
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful and comfortable. It has several restaurants and a 24 hour food court. It also has shops, Cupcakery, Starbucks, theater for shows and casino. It is located on the strip, and it has a tram to Aria/City Center (next door) and Bellagio. The only complain I have is the noises. I can hear the water running from an adjacent room; people talking outside my room; alarm clock going off next door; and the screaming riders of the New York New York rollercoaster to midnight. Since I wasn't there to stay up all night, I noticed the noises since I was in my room by 11 p.m. It is a nice hotel, and I would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good news and bad”
Reviews.Author: rickandlouise
Reviews.Content: The good news is that the hotel is centrally located, and the rooms are nice. The bad news is with the staff, the 2 for one deal and the noise! 1) We got some bum directions to the hotels north of the Monte Carlo from the Concierge who didn't even mention the tram that leaves their hotel and goes north - making the trip much faster, easier, and it's free. 2) We got some attitude from the girl in the pool store when she misunderstood my request. 3) The 2 for 1 was fine for the buffet, but the 2 for 1 rafts felt like a total rip off. They were out of rental rafts (?) and we had to purchase a raft ($13 or $16) and then they would "loan" us the second, and then they charged us $3 for the "loaner". 4) We had a room on the 30th floor facing the pool. Very nice, except for the pool music, which we could hear clearly all day. It made it difficult to sleep during the day, preparing for our big night out! We ate dinner at their steak house and the food was excellent. I'll give a high score for service factoring in the excellent service from the housekeeping staff and a television repairman.

Reviews.Title: “NIce Size Hotel, Great Location, Very friendly”
Reviews.Author: nwarkansasgal
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from July 1 thru July 5th. Loved the size of the hotel and for the money it was great. Did not need GPS to find things. Tram to Bellagio area. Very close to City Center and within walking distance to so many places and other casinos. Yes, other casinos are newer, however the prices are much more expensive too and so big that it is hard to find your way around. Walk way to the Aria casino too.

Reviews.Title: “Well used very clean room on 27th floor overlooking pool spoilt by very loud music from pool area.”
Reviews.Author: Stragglers
Reviews.Content: Biggest complaint is the noise from the pool area. Continual head banging music which is very unpleasant when down there and can still be heard up on the 27th floor! This music is loud enough to damage hearing.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but Hotel looks and feels tired”
Reviews.Author: Kristoph01
Reviews.Content: Overall not bad. Casino definitely not the best in town. Every time you walked into the casino you are overwhelmed by a flowery smell that is supposed to cover up the smell of the cigarettes, but fails to do so. Restaurants are just ok. Service was good. Pool was nice and had a DJ every day. Hotel room was nice and clean, but nothing special. Be prepared to pay an additional $15/day for a resort fee that gives you internet in your room, free local and 1-800 calls, and access to the fitness center. When we were walking through all the other hotels we wish we had stayed somewhere else. It does have a great location, but with all the choices of hotel on the strip, I would NOT stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Priced Right, we'll stay again”
Reviews.Author: opallets
Reviews.Content: I don't get why all the negative reviews, its on the strip!! Do I need say more. What can one expect for $60.00/night weekdays, yes this is a older hotel, has lost its glamor. The valet is located next to check in, which is close to the elevators that take you to your room. Which was great for us and our 2 yr old. VALET- GREAT, less than 2 min on a Sunday. CHECK -IN - AWFUL- waited almost 40 min. ROOMS- Decent size room, very clean, comfortable beds and great AC. The furniture does seem to need an upgrade, but not terribly bad. POOLS- This is the reason I stayed here, the pools are awesome as always, great for families and young crowd. . They have a lazy river, wave pool, and a decent sized reg. pool and hot tub. We didn't have a problem getting chairs or service. FOOD- the cafe was alright, a little pricy for the quality you get. Buffet- We went to both the RIO and PARIS, so obviously Monte cant compare with that. We did enjoy the pasta and Mongolian station, they make your dish in front of you just the way you want it. They also have a convenient tram that takes you to the new city center and one for the Bellagio . Overall: Like I said its on the strip, if your looking for luxury or a 4 + resort forget about. Its a decent hotel,standard rooms, great value and awesome pools.

Reviews.Title: “Good price but probably won't be back”
Reviews.Author: PRVistor
Reviews.Content: We went for a fun getaway with friends. I have a fun policy to not stay at the same place twice in Vegas each time I go and our friends picked Monte Carlo. We did want to upgrade to a the Monaco Suite as it was only $78 on Thursday night of our stay. The room was spacious and clean. I was impressed. The half bath off the entry way was a nice addition to when we had our friends in our room for pre-dinner drinks. The casino was a good size for the hotel and had everything we were looking for. The food court was nice to have breakfast at each morning. We did have the Seafood buffett one day for lunch but I would have to say there was not much Seafood to be had. The only options were crab legs and shrimp. Spa: I scheduled a 90 min massage. I have had a few massages in Vegas and they usually are a TRUE luxury. At the Monte Carlo, they aren't. The Spa is nothing more than a hot tub, suana and steam room. There is no luxury about it. The Bellagio and Encore Spas are a retreat where you could spend all day as a queen. Here, I lasted 10 minutes. What a disappointment. As for my massage, it was awful. Not sure how that is possible. Each move was deliberate. Each section was the same movement over and over and over for 90 MINUTES. To top it of, the 18% gratuity is a MUST not a option. Pool - we spent an entire day there and had wonderful chairs, though we did get there at open. We stayed near the entrance and away from the wave pool and lazy river where the loud music was. It did however take a while to catch the attention of the wait staff. Once we placed our first order they kept coming back. Ask the Security Guards (Eric or Donovan) they have great tips on the best chairs. Overall, the hotel is tired but clean. It is priced well and would be great for a fun, cost effective weekend. For extra, Vegas amenties, this is NOT the place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay and price was reasonable.”
Reviews.Author: lumberchick1
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our vacation in Las Vegas and had stayed at the Monte Carlo Casino and Resort. The room was fine but the internet via the TV in the room was not working the whole time we were there. Just a thought but it would be a good idea to bring your own laptop or cell phone which can access your e-mail as the fees in the lobby for accessing the internet were atrocious -$1.00 per minute. Food at the buffet was good but not consistent. Try other hotels for variety. Tried to go swimming but the pool area was overcrowded and was playing very loud annoying music. We also didn't like the idea of being herded into the casinos of every hotel in order to get anywhere. Smelling the smoke in them was not pleasant either. I would say that the Monte Carlo was nice overall experience in spite of these few things.

Reviews.Title: “Best Time”
Reviews.Author: Lizajane_11
Reviews.Content: I loved the hotel. It was big but small enough so I didnt get lost. The rooms were clean and looked new. There was a food court downstairs with a 24 hour Mcdonalds. Therefore I didn't have to eat at an expensive restaurant somewhere on the strip. Also I nice hot tub and wave pool. Had the best time...

Reviews.Title: “Very Fun!!”
Reviews.Author: chia00
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for something inexpensive on the strip this is a great place to stay, with a great pool!! Small poker room, but always action, good pool area and great restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time at the Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: YLO38
Reviews.Content: My husband, our 2 sons, and brother and family have always planned to go to Vegas to celebrate the 21st birthday of my nephew and youngest son. We booked the Monte Carlo in May. Our trip started with flight issues and we didn't get to our hotel until 4:30 AM. We were all able to get checked into our rooms by 5:00 AM and the rooms were fine. We enjoyed the rest of our weekend. I was a little worried after reading the reviews, but we had no issues. The pool was great and not too loud, the buffet food was wonderful and plenty to choose from for college-aged kids. We didn't have a whole lot of luck in the casino but the service was great and everyone at the hotel was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay and not too pricey.”
Reviews.Author: samami
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in Jan. 2011 and thought this was a very comfortable hotel on the strip. The rooms are a bit older and do not have a lot of extra's that some of the newer hotels on the strip offer -- like the flat screen TV's and big bathrooms. That being said they are still very clean and affordably priced. The hotel is right next door to the Diablo's Cantina and across the street from the M&M shop. There is a safe in the room and the bed is very welcoming. The casino floor is one of my favorites and great for a beginner because it isn't extremely loud. They also have a pretty decent food court, that is accessible to both the Aria and the New York. I had a Swedish Massage at the spa and that was also great! This is a great hotel for coming to on a Vegas budget! You still get the strip location and you pay a bit less for it. They also have a an awesome looking pool - with a lazy river BUT since it was January I didn't get to use it :( The one thing I disliked was the resort fee, but most hotels on the strip owned by MGM have this daily fee (about 20 per day.)

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations and would book again”
Reviews.Author: wind_horse66
Reviews.Content: After much consideration and not wanting to pay the resort fees (which this hotel has) we decided to book her rather than other similarily priced, centrally located hotels. The overall quality of the hotel and rooms were above what I expected. We found no fault with the hotel staff and services. The lobby and attached food and retail services were convenient and impressive as was the outdoor pool areas. Other reviewers may not have been as favorable but the outdoor areas were definitely varied enough to spend hours of relaxation and fun with friends and family. Unfortunately, november had limted outdoor pool weather hours! This would be a good family hotel and resort and situated perfectly for short walks out to the newest retail shopping on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Monaco Suite nice but need to be renovated”
Reviews.Author: MarkDC-Travel
Reviews.Content: Please forgive any typos! The Monte Carlo is one of my favorite hotels on the south end of the strip. I’ve stayed here three times before. This time, I stayed in a Monaco Suite, room 22-101 on June 22, 23 and 24. The direct flight from my home airport arrives at 10:30 AM so I arrived at the hotel at about 11:15. Went to the front desk and within 5 minutes was being serviced. I began with an apology for being so early and was told that it was not a problem and they plan for early arrivals and, within 10 minutes more and a nice $20 tip for the clerk for being so helpful, I was in my room. Upon entering the room to the right of the door is a closet with iron and ironing board as well as slippers, but no robe. You will find 2 folding suitcase stands and plenty of hangers. Next to the closet is a half bath with a sink and a toilet for guests. To the left is a nice piece of furniture that holds glasses and an ice bucket. This is a good place to leave non-perishables upon entering. Further into the room is a nice flat panel TV and a couch, which is NOT a hide-a-bed, and coffee table. Beyond that, by the window is a small table and two chairs where you can sit and eat take out food or room service. Turning right, you see a desk and chair as well as the king size bed and two night stands. The bed is very comfortable and should give anyone a good night’s sleep. Heading over to the bathroom, you will also find a small reading table and chair. The bathroom has one sink. The shower is in a jetted bathtub and the toilet is behind its own door for privacy which, when shut, reveals a wall safe. The jetted tub worked great and I was able to enjoy it one evening. All in all, the room is a nice size, very functional, and the windows were clean! There was a wire for the internet which I plugged into my laptop, but the connection did not work. They’ve been making improvements but did not tell me. Turns out that when I turned on my wireless signal, this room now has a wireless connection and a wired connection is no longer necessary. This was great news and my ipod had no problem going out and getting the connection as well. If I was staying in a Caesars property, I would have been charged over $28/night for this amenity. The cost is included with the $16.80 resort fee, an $11 savings over Caesars. Yea! Now for what was bad about the room. The Monaco suites do need a total makeover. Are they horrible? Not by any means. However, ALL of the furniture in this room has been patched with putty, and painted, and sometimes patched and not painted so many times that it appears they finally gave up and you can now see the scratches and missing pieces of wood in the furniture and gashes in the walls and the door. I don’t understand how slats of wood can be missing from under the glass top of the nightstand. The knob of a door on the credenza was missing and just the screw is left pointing out from the door as if in wait to tear through someone’s flesh when they unknowingly walked by. The fabric on the couch cushions has been stretched beyond belief. See photos for the above. If you pay $100 a night for a room, you should expect to feel like I were the first person in the room, not the 1000th. Customers expect more from a suite. A few more things about the hotel: The public areas were cleaner than my past visits. Either they are doing a better job or there were less crazy people at the hotel this time. I believe the former since the hotel was packed with folks in town for some Electric Daisy Carnival rave party. I’ve heard there are noise issues at the Monte Carlo. My room did not face the pool so I can not say anything about noise from there, but the sound of the ads in the elevator does not need to be as loud as it is currently set. It is not enough for people to go running into the streets as some might make you think, but it is a bit annoying being effectively yelled at every time you’re in the elevator. Also, while playing Black Jack in the Casino, the booming from the base from the entertainment at Brand (around 11 PM) was way out of line to the point where I really could not concentrate on my play and had to stop. I liked the new store “Lick” and of course who doesn’t like “The Cupcakery”. The Pool area is really good since they have three pools to choose from, a regular pool, a wave pool and a lazy river. On top of that, they have a small pool that you can rent for a small party. I did become sick during my stay, but not from anything at the Monte Carlo. (Don’t buy salads from the ABC store!) However, I’ve never had a “bad” stay at the Monte Carlo and this stay was no different. Even though I was out of commission for two days and a night, I still managed to have a good time there. All staff members were great, from check-in to M-life desk to Business center that helped me print out my boarding pass. I’m happy to still be able to recommend Monte Carlo as a nice place to stay in Las Vegas, but the Monaco suites do need to be renovated if they are going to continue to charge $90 - $100 and up. Don't mean to be overly harsh, but the beat up furniture takes away from the "WOW" factor that could be had in this room.

Reviews.Title: “Average Vegas Hotel with Good Facilities”
Reviews.Author: PoodleRank
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a couple with a child. We chose the Monte Carlo primarily because we wanted a nice pool, while trying to avoid the pool party scene at some of the newer mega-hotels. We read online that it probably had one of the better kiddie pools. It helped that the Monte Carlo was also cheaper compared to many of the other MGM Resorts hotels. We were in a standard room on the back side of the hotel. Frankly, it was really nothing special. The hotel's slogan is "Unpretentiously Luxurious". Unpretentious, yes. Luxurious, no. The bed was nice enough but the bathroom was definitely dark and tired. It had the classic signs of a worn room -- water drained poorly, rust stains under the sink, just adequate showerhead. The room size is also average at best, and compares very unfavorably to places llke the Venetian. It was not a bad room ... just not a great one. The room was clean, so that's not a concern. About that pool. It is definitely a really nice pool. There's a wave pool (just like Mandalay Bay), as well as a "lazy river" (just like the MGM Grand) that you can float down on a inner tube. However, I think that the kiddie pool is actually gone. Some old reviews speak of five pools, including the separate kiddie pool. But the hotel now appears to have just *four* pools. It was also louder and party-like than I had hoped for. I still had a good time at the pool, and spent many hours there. It just wasn't exactly what I had expected. The other common facilities exceeded my expectations. Check-in and check-out were much faster than I had experienced previously at other Vegas hotels, and the self-parking lot is relatively nearby -- across a bridge and down a set of escalators puts you right in the lobby. The breakfast buffet is pretty good, and the fine dining restaurant (Andre's) was excellent with great service. You can also take a tram to Aria/City Center and Bellagio so you don't have to get into the car as much.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money for what you get”
Reviews.Author: lorrainedave489
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights in June 2011. For what you pay you get good value for money at The Monte Carlo. We had a room on the 31st floor. High as you get, not including 'Hotel 32' on the 32nd floor, so we were away from the noise and the crowds of the strip yet only an elevator ride away from it all. The room was OK. Maybe a little dated in the bathroom compared to one of the new hotels but it was clean with no complaints. The bed was comfortable and we had a good nights sleep. You have many options in Las vegas with budgets and tastes to suit all. The Monte Carlo is a good choice if you do not want to spend money on booking a room, but still want something decent. If you want to spend on a stylish room for the Las Vegas experience then some of the other strip hotels could be a better option.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: 3longhorns
Reviews.Content: We checked in late to a dirty room with beatup furniture and lamps that were broken. Hair all over restroom. Stains on our carpet and throughout hotel. Very sad because last year had blast here. When we went to checkout and find a different hotel, Jody at the front desk was great on helping us and put us in hotel 32. The new room is very nice updated and clean. If you cannot get hotel 32 then stay somewhere else. Everything worn looking. We were told they are hoping to renovate soon. Would have switched hotels if upgrade not available. Other room very bad condition.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo- very average”
Reviews.Author: Caspur1
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip back in May and were very excited to go to the Monte Carlo (first time in Vegas). But after reading the reviews on here, we were a little concerned about the quality of service we'd receive. We arrived late on a Saturday (10pm) and check in was very quick. We got the high level floor we had booked and 2 queens (booked a king- but that was ok). Concierge was very friendly, and room seemed clean on first appearances. Despite being fairly happy with the room, we found the casino extremely smokey and the roulette staff very unfriendly. We are roulette rookies and when we asked for some explanation, we kind of got ridiculed. There was one woman there who blatantly  couldn't count and everyone sat around her table was getting very frustrated. When a few of us explained that she'd given out the wrong number of chips, her and the boss guy started shouting at us even though they then realized they were wrong...kind of put a dampener on the rest of our evening!  The pool was nice, but always busy, and it was a struggle to find empty chairs. One day we were queuing for 45 mins at the bar to get a drink, even though there were only 5 people in front of us. On the last night, I went to sleep on the 2nd queen, only to pull the covers back to find make-up and glitter all over the sheets! Seeing as it was our first time in Vegas, we weren't too bothered about things as we spent most of our time going to see other places. We would give the Monte Carlo 2.5 out of 5. Next time we will try either Caesar's or Planet Hollywood. If you can afford to spend a bit more, do not go to Monte Carlo.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: travelrockstexas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo for 4th of July with another couple. Nice hotel and great location. Rooms are very comfortable and bathrooms clean and well-appointed. Only negatives on the room were the thin walls - could hear neighbors next door and kids running down the hallway - and lack of coffeemaker in the room. Elevators are quick and always available - which says a lot in a large hotel on a holiday weekend. Front desk and concierge helpful and competent. Check-out and bag check were quick despite a huge crowd. The food court downstairs is convenient (Subway, Starbucks, McDonald's). We had a 2-for-1 deal and had the brunch buffet - good selection and a good value. Neither are fancy or "foodie" options but good to fill in other meals when you're looking for something affordable and/or quick. The buffet line can get very long, but we avoided this by going at 9:30. Casino is fun and lively without being too crowded. We found it to be the least smoky of the casinos we walked through. Pool area fun and lively - energetic DJ and good music. Still family-friendly. My sister and I reserved a basic pedicure and were surprised when we were told during the pedicure that the $50 charge did not include buffing the soles, etc! So be aware! We found that to be a bit tricky - an extra $20 to do what is normally part of a pedicure. Would have been better if they charged $70 upfront. Spa and fitness area very nice. We had access to the spa for the day and enjoyed the steam room, sauna etc. Location is fantastic. Easy walk to Aria and Crystals/City Center. Free tram takes you to Bellagio. For locations on the north part of the strip would recommend cab, but there's plenty to do right around the Monte Carlo.

Reviews.Title: “Needs an update, badly”
Reviews.Author: Shrubbo
Reviews.Content: I make it a policy to stay in a different hotel each time I go to Las Vegas (there are so many options, so why not?). Since my budget was very tight this trip, and they offered a good rate, I went to the Monte Carlo. Location is good and parking is ample. No complaints there. The check-in process took forever. Instead of one large line they let people just stand around. Meaning if you happen to be behind someone taking forever to check in, then you'll take forever too. The room would be nice if everything in it wasn't so old. The comforter was worn down and had holes, the carpets were patchy, even the lampshade was filthy. Everything is just showing signs of age and high volume wear and tear. The decor is nice and everything, but it needs a remodel as soon as possible. Until then, it's not worth staying in. Our rate came with a room credit, which we used at the buffet. I love a Las Vegas buffet, but this was nothing special. Not really worth the price, even with the discount. An, to top it off, they called my room to tell me my credit card had been declined and I had one hour to come rectify it or they would remove us. Odd, I thought, as the room had been pre-paid. Turns out they had tried to charge my card for the stay a second time. There was a lot of confusion at the front desk as to how that could happen, but it did. It was rectified with apology, but it was annoying. And what if we had not been in the room to answer the phone? Would they have removed our stuff? With the plethora of other great Vegas hotel options, I would avoid the Monte Carlo until they remodel their rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay again”
Reviews.Author: mrsprince79
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Monte Carlo for our anniversary. The first thing I noticed was how pleasantly the hotel smelled. Check in was a breeze and our room was very comfy. The only cons were all the extra fees. I mean 10 bucks to rent a tube for the lazy river..come on! Also it took a long time for the hot water to come on in the shower and whirlpool tub.Food court was good and less expensive than I expected. Overall and excellent stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good, not great”
Reviews.Author: catnthehat
Reviews.Content: If you like loud booming dance track background beat noise to every song at the pool, this place is for you. Pool, murky, dingy every day. Needed chlorine and cleaning. Pool drinks are typically priced. $11 for well drinks. Mojito $13. Monaco suite was fine. Shower heads are restricted. Plan on a long shower because the bar of soap is as big as mini match box. It is a joke how small it is. Do yourself a favor and buy one at CVS or bring one with you. Casino dealers for the most part are very friendly. Find Carole Ann. She is a hoot. Food abundant. Dragon Noodle, excellent sushi choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel... for the price”
Reviews.Author: Amber_Lee17
Reviews.Content: Rooms were very basic, similar to a Holiday Inn type room. The lobby, casino, food court, shops and restaurants were fantastic. Location was awesome! Very central. The pool area was overflowing with lounger chairs which was very different from the pictures on the website. I also noticed alot of kids at this hotel compared to the other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: LiverpoolLou_10
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay, hotel very clean and comfortable with excellent views of the strip at night from my room. Staff all very friendly and nothing was too much trouble for them. My only negative was being hit with an unexpected eighty dollar fee upon arrival, but I assume this would apply to all hotels in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: dag2546
Reviews.Content: We did read Trip Advisor before we booked this hotel and the Hotel ived up to the reviews. We have to visit las vegas for business at the same time each year and we usually stay where we are going to be relatively close to where the convention is held. We changed hotels this year as previously other hotels have been noisy and very busy. We found this hotel to be quieter and most accomodating. It is not the flashest hotel on the Strip but it has everything you need, clean and comfortable. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: emmypants
Reviews.Content: This is a hard review to write. We stayed there last year, and it was impeccable. I guess I had higher explications or something. We arrived on a Sunday around 1:00 pm. Check-in isn't until 3 pm, but the valet said that we might be able to check it, it would just depend. The valet was friendly and so were the people who took our luggage. There were lines a mile long. On every open station, which was about five. My husband and I got in seperate lines to see if one would move faster than another. Not really. I understood that it was a Las Vegas hotel and it's busy, so I let the people behind me do all of the griping, and believe me, there was a lot. We finally made it to the check-in and I had my online confirmation. It was for a "Strip View, at least on the 24th floor." Well, we got issued a room on the 30th floor, which I thought was great. We stood in line for 45 minutes and all I wanted to do was sit. We got to our room and it was not a strip view. It was a pool view. I called down to the front desk and they apologized and said to come get a new room. We didn't touch anything, left it clean and left. We had to stand in line for another 45 minutes. By now, it's around 3:30 pm, the normal check in time. I was informed that we could either wait for another hour and a half, or stay in the pool room. We decided to wait and go eat, since we paid for a strip view. We finally get into our room around 5:00 and I tested the safe. It locked, but it didn't open. We called the bell desk and they sent security. It took almost a half hour to get it fixed. And it still only worked half the time after that. Fortunately he showed us some tricks to open it if need-be, just push on the door and enter the code. That made me feel real safe.. not. The room we ended up in was an adjoined room. The people next to us had children that screamed and played loudly, well into the morning, around 2 am. I know hindsight is 20/20, but had we known this, we would have stayed in the pool view. That room had clean windows, our windows were filthy which makes for an interesting "Strip View." The breakfast buffet was good. We didn't get a chance to make it to the Ice Bar and if I had to hear the elevator advertising Jabbawockeez one more time, I might have screamed. If we make it back to Vegas, I don't think we will stay here again. It's a perfect location, but this time just left a bad taste in my mouth.

Reviews.Title: “monte carlo report”
Reviews.Author: michelledoe1
Reviews.Content: just back from 8 days at the MC and we loved it. the room was clean, big enough, good view from window over the pool towards rio & the palms etc, flat screen tv, daily maid service and a lift that went straight to floor 23 + above. waitress service when playing the machines was quite quick and they kept comming back. the casino wasn't as large as some we went to but it was always nice to get back to ours for that bit of space and relaxed feel. the buffet + cafe + food court was good but the brand steakhouse and a few of the better restraunts were a bit pricey (for us) although service was excellent at all of them. the pool was a bit crowded and some sunbeds were in the shade first thing and late on but overall it was nice the shop was a bit pricey but there is a walgreens and an abc store right over the street and next door the MC is perfect for visiting the other hotels and has a deuce bus stop outside, we'd definately stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good value”
Reviews.Author: Osdanuwati
Reviews.Content: With the plethora of other options available, this nice hotel, which is centrally located on the Strip and next door to the new City Center, is a solid value. I used to warn against it while the construction of City Center (noisy!) was ongoing, but now, its just cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BodyWrapGal
Reviews.Content: I love the Monte Carlo. It's situated in walking distance to many other Hotels and attractions. Right next door to the City Center. You can walk through the Monte Carlo to get to Aria. No need to walk outside. After you check in, the elevators are close by so that you don't feel like you're walking 5 miles to get to your room and you don't have to walk through the Casino. Service was great and the rooms are spacious and clean. The food court is convenient and a great selection. Loved the Pub Restaurant. Great food and loved the Happy Hour Specials. The pool area is cool. Lots to do. Even has a wave pool. Love the upbeat music. I would definitely stay at Monte Carlo again.

Reviews.Title: “The Monte Carlo appears tired out”
Reviews.Author: Traveler16340
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo for three days in June. Having stayed at many strip casinos over the years, this one was the biggest disappointment. If it would have been billed as a 2 ½ or 3 star hotel, my opinion would have been better, but it was billed at 3 ½ to 4 stars. The lobby is very spacey and pleasant. The check in process could use some improvement as there is no organized line to wait in for the next available agent to check you in so it turns into a free for all rush to the counter. Our first room was in need of repair, air conditioner not working, flush handle on the toilet broken and a desk drawer that wanted to remain opened in the walking path of the room. After another 40 minute wait in the now larger free for all check in line, I was assigned a new room which turned out to be fully operational. The Monte Carlo is in need of updating as it is appearing a bit tired. The buffet was quite good as was the adjacent restaurant. There isn’t much more to say other than there were stained carpeting and worn-out sheets. One other thing I did encounter for the first time was the inability to redeem a cash voucher from a slot machine. I was fortune enough to have cashed out of the slot machine before the system crashed as there were many angry patrons standing by their slot machines unable to get their money out. I won’t be returning to the Monte Carlo soon, I only hope your experience will be better than mine.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and Attractive”
Reviews.Author: yeemun
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a few days/nights to visit the Grand Canyon and to see KA cirque du soleil show at MGM grand which was good hotel was not that great, no coffee/tea makers in room or even bottled water and the place could do with a update. Not bad but not good either. The concierge was excellent however very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “just average for a 4 star resort”
Reviews.Author: deecan23
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Las Vegas - a stop over on a cross country trip. We did not get the handicap accessible room we were promised at the time of our reservations. The front desk clerk did not seem to understand the word wheelchair or that a king bed would not accommodate 4 people. After much fuss and getting the manager invovled we finally got a suitable room that was clean and quiet. The customer service was awful. Every time we called housekeeping for towels or the front desk we were put on hold for 10-15 minutes. We had a horrible time getting the internet to work - it turned out the modem in our room needed replaced. The pool was quite crowded and very noisy and seemed to cater to the heavy drinking young crowd. Not at all relaxing! The casino was fine - not as smokey as most. I just got the feeling this resort was so big they really didn't strive to please the customers.

Reviews.Title: “Oh Monte Carlo, how we LOVED you! Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: InAnotherLife
Reviews.Content: -We stayed at the Monte Carlo June 19-23, 2011...and we LOVED it! Two married couples, (ages 28-33) two rooms, two reservations on a very limited budget. Our plane arrived at 11am so we were well before check in time of 3pm. However we thought we'd give it a shot and get in line once we arrived to the hotel. There was no real designated check in/check out lines but we didn't mind as the lines moved quick! The gal that checked us in was super friendly and told us she was sorry but being that we were early our rooms weren't ready yet (2 king non-smoking rooms) we could come back later or she could get us into 2 double non-smoking rooms. We asked if they were adjoining (we didn't request this, but thought we'd give it a go and ask!), they were not, but she did have two rooms on the 12th floor that were side by side. We said that sounded great and took them! We didn't plan on being in our room much anyways. We also asked if they were running any promotions that we could get in on and we got BOGO buffets, BOGO tube rentals, BOGO roller coaster passes at the NYNY, and some more. We didn't need or use all of them, but hey, anything extra at no additional cost is wonderful! -Resort fee. Lets get it out of the way. Yes its silly and annoying. Why they just don't add it into the room total from the getgo is beyond me...but we knew about it in advance so we just factored it in and didn't allow it to ruin our experience. Our room with the resort fee was still cheaper than any downtown hotel in Chicago. -Our rooms faced the mountains/pool area and yes its true... Thursday thru Sunday they have a DJ at the pool and you can hear it in your room. But who cares! We weren't going to hang out in our room during the day anyways. Monday-Wednesday you don't hear the regular non-dj music from the pool in your room. I don’t know why all the complaints about the towels/showers/etc. in the room. We had absolutely no qualms. They have a sign that they are trying to go green and a towel left on the floor will be replaced and a towel on the rack will be left to be reused. I think that’s a great idea! Our shower worked fine and it felt great after a long day out and away from the room. -The pools themselves were great, and that lazy river was more fun without the tube than with it! Oh and it’s true. If you carry a bag in they will inspect it to make sure you aren’t carrying in any food/drinks. We just chugged some beer in our room then headed down to the pool. The only thing we found a bit silly was all the VIP chairs and cabanas that were never used. Yes I'm sure they wanted them available for those willing to pay for them, but they sort of look stupid just wasting space when people aren't paying for them. It’s kind of like saying “Hey! We’re overpriced and no one ever uses us!” A touch wasteful in my humble opinion. -The casino was not what I expected. The reviews I read said the casino at the Monte Carlo was a dead zone and the machines/tables didn’t pay out well at all. I beg to differ. My husband and I played Game King machines for hours on end. He came out ahead on his money and I lost ten dollars total in 5 days. Not to shabby for non-gamblers. The waitresses came around very often and we tipped $1 a drink and it was well worth it. Those gals work fast and were very very kind. If you aren’t a member, go to the M Life desk and sign up for their card. You earn points and those points help you get free/comped things. We used our card at the Monte, MGM, NYNY, Bellagio, and Excalibur. -There is a free tram thru the shopping area that will get you all the way down the strip to the Bellagio. We used this when our feet were tired, which was quite often. You can also walk to the Excalibur and take a similar free tram all the way down to the Mandalay Bay which was equally nice and so convenient! -The hotel is in such a great location. Walk next door to the NYNY and take the bridge over to the MGM or Excalibur and from either of those places you can get to the Tropicana. There is a CVS in front of the hotel and an ABC store directly across the street. Both stores have most anything you need that you might have left at home. Los Salsa Cantina also across the street had a $3.95 morning breakfast with $.99 bloody mary drinks. It was a great inexpensive meal and we went there 3 of our 5 mornings. We had Catalina as a server...fabulous lady! Way better than hitting fast food for breakfast. But if you want fast food there is a Del Taco, Sbarro, DQ, Panda Express up an escalator right near Los Salsa Cantina. Also across the street near the M&M’s world is a store called the Grand Canyon Experience (G.C.E.); this place rocks! They had 2/$2 16oz cold beers. A little hint if you’re a drinker, buy their $4.95 cold bag and they’ll fill it with ice for free and then you can take those beers back to your room and reuse the bag with the ice vending machine on your floor. Also at the G.C.E. with every purchase if you mention their sign that says a free 16.9oz water you’ll get it for that…free! Yes the store is mostly touristy for sale items, but we didn’t mind. We were just on the lookout for deals! It was so nice to have those kinds of prices in such close walking proximity when on a strict budget. -Check out was really painless. The offered us to do express checkout, but I wanted a copy of our room bill (which by the way you can verify on your tv in your room to keep an eye on things). Once again there was no direction for check in/check out, but the line moved quickly once again and we were settled up and headed over to the concierge to leave our bags. The gentleman that checked us out was as equally polite as the gal that checked us in. Way to go Monte Carlo on getting such wonderful staff! Our flight wasn’t to leave until later that night so we needed to check our bags for awhile. We tipped the bell man $1/bag (we had 12 altogether) and by george they were super fast to get our bags back out to us when the shuttle arrived! These are some of the most polite workers in a hotel we’ve ever experienced and we’ve travelled quite a bit domestically and internationally (and all on a budget I might add!). -With all this said, YES! Absolutely! We will stay at the Monte Carlo Again…. The sooner we get back to Las Vegas and the Monte Carlo the better. I guess our Midwestern manners go a long way... We were laid back and polite and we got back the same if not better from the Monte Carlo staff. Thanks so much!

Reviews.Title: “fabulous hotel and fabulous location!”
Reviews.Author: Gem94
Reviews.Content: Quick and easy check in/out. Rooms bigger than expected and cleaned everyday. Staff very friendly. Lovely pool and jacuzzi, and music to keep you entertained. Good choice of food within the hotel. Fabulous location, central on the strip. Good variety of shops, restaurants and entertainment within walking distance of the hotel. Free tram available to take you to the other end of the strip. Went with a large group of friends who stayed at various other hotels, several wished they had stayed at the Monte Carlo. It was our first time in Vegas, but would definitely stay at the Monte Carlo again.....Would definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Not the best for LV”
Reviews.Author: tennis4ever
Reviews.Content: Hotel was a stop for one night on a bus trip. We got there around 1:30 and of course our rooms were not ready. We were told to come back at 3:00, which we did, but the rooms were still not ready. I was expecting a lot more since I had stayed at the hotel about 20 years ago. This time the hotel seemed very worn. There was absolutely nothing in the room: no coffee maker, no refrigerator, no microwave, no paper; we had to go out for any thing we wanted. Our bus left at 6:30 in the a.m. and the only breakfast option was the Mc Donalds since the Starbucks wasn't even open. Room itself was adequate, just not what I expected for Las Vegas. Fitness center closed at 7:00! (isn't LV a 24 hour-type place?)

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was just "okay"”
Reviews.Author: kakiLouisiana
Reviews.Content: Pros: good location on the strip; staff was friendly, GREAT hamburger in the cafe. Cons: carpets and upholstery stained; had to beg to get more than one washcloth in our room everyday; food was not that great and very pricey; walls in the rooms were so thin we could hear everything the people in the room next door said-even a sneeze! The safe in the room was so small you could hardly fit anything in it. There is an irritating commercial playing in the elevators over and over and over again. We did not choose this hotel-it was a company trip-but if we return to Vegas, it will not be at the Monte Carlo....I was expecting more from a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Better then I expected”
Reviews.Author: Gemini0Star
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to vegas. Wasn't sure how much I would spend in my room, so I picked a hotel the I thought was average in price. It was actually a very nice stay. The pool was a lot of fun and clean. The rooms were tidy and the beds were comfy. The only negative is that they could upgrade their carpets which were filthy...but not the end of the world. Location was good, right on the strip. The buffet was also just ok...the food wasnt spectacular but it wasn't the worst. Had some nice shops and I liked how it was connected to the Aria.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED THE MONTE CARLO”
Reviews.Author: luckylady2011
Reviews.Content: Vacations are indeed important and we wait patiently and expect the most for our dollar. Well people that is true, but honestly some of you are just simply rude. Treat others as you would like to be treated. You are on a holiday but for heaven sake use discretion. That being said, I will be honest and say the Monte Carlo is a FANTASTIC HOTEL with staff that are both friendly and very patient. From the minute my aunt and I checked in, until the time we left the hotel, we were treated exceptionally well. Melina, who worked at the front desk was ever so helpful and knowledgeable on shows, shopping and where to eat. She was a breath of fresh air. She made our holiday. Thank you. Our room was much larger than I expected and ever so clean and fresh. The young ladies kept our room clean and there were plenty of fresh towels, sheets and extra shampoo at our discretion. The staff were very cheery and always busy cleaning. Service was excellent in the restaurants and the young troopers working in the food court had more patience than people deserved. Very professional indeed. I would recommend and have recommended the Monte Carlo to others.

Reviews.Title: “Good not great, just as expected”
Reviews.Author: Teeter22
Reviews.Content: Someone needs to drown the pool DJs! Not only does their music selection suck, but it is played at a volume where you cannot talk to someone sitting next to you. Loud music that sucks it a double whammy! Pool management is clueless. Minus 5 bar is fun for a drink or two. Gets a little cold after 30 minutes or so.

Reviews.Title: “Not so sure about the Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: travelwis
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked 4 nights at the Monte Carlo. This was our first time staying at the Monte Carlo. We arrived around 9pm and checking in took about 20 minutes. We had requested a King bed room, but were given a double bed room that overlooked the pool. Which was ok. We dropped our bags in the room and went to meet friends for the evening. We got back to the room and pulled down the covers of the first bed and found a fake eyelash on the sheet. We called the front desk and they said they will send up housekeeping to replace the bedding. We pulled the covers down on the second bed and found the sheet covered in pen ink. It didn't look like the bed sheets were replaced before we got the room. Housekeeping came and replaced the bedding. Not a great introduction to the Monte Carlo. The casino in the hotel is a little on the smaller side.(MGM and New York New York which are the closest hotels have much larger casinos.) The pool area is ok. There is a regular pool, a wave pool and a lazy river. The chairs nearest the pool entrance are in the shade until noon. There is a food court in the Monte Carlo which has McDonald's, Sbarro, Subway and a taco place. There is also a buffet restaurant and a regular reataurant called the "Cafe". We ate lunch at the "Cafe" one day. The price for a burger and fries way $12.99. On our next trip to Vegas we will choose a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed.”
Reviews.Author: AdrianneS
Reviews.Content: I've been to Vegas a few times, and I know the Monte Carlo is one of the mid range hotels/casinos, but I was not impressed with the amenities of the room. The pool was nice enough, as was the casino and food options...but the shower, towels and bedding were nothing special. It feels odd to complain about something so minuscule...but the shower had no direct line of water, it just kind of sprayed at you. And the towels were overdried, so they were smelly and crunchy (painful on a little sun). The pool is gimicky with a wave pool and lazy river. Here's a hint: If there are more people standing and drinking in the lazy river than there are tubes and floaters, SHUT THE RIVER OFF! And what kind of party pool has a serious wave pool going all the time? Do you want people to drown?!?!? Overall we had a good time, we weren't in the room too often and got to check out some other pools during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal! Excellent hotel for an affordable price”
Reviews.Author: tvsoliveira
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks like new! Very cleanliness, good pace, big swimming pool and a sand volleyball court. It was great! The price is quite better than other hotels in the nearby. Very well located! The restaurants are a little bit more expensives, but there is a food court with different kind of fast food restaurants, and with better prices too. This a good place to be if you are looking for fun and good deals.

Reviews.Title: “Worst customer service on the strip”
Reviews.Author: lheck102
Reviews.Content: I understand that this is a very busy hotel, but they provided some of the worst customer service I have ever experienced. We arrived early for check-in (around 1pm) and were told that our room was guaranteed between 3-5pm. No problem, we went to The Pub (which was the only part of the resort where the staff was friendly!) to have a drink and wait it out. Around 3:30 we called the number provided to check the status and were told it was not ready yet....this continued until 5:30pm when they said our room was ready. At 5:30 we went up to our room to find that housekeeping had not even touched it yet! There was trash, the bed was unmade, and there was a water bottle full of toenails in the bathroom...disgusting! We called the front desk who said that they would send housekeeping up within the next 15 minutes, and promised us $50 credit at The Pub. So we left and came back to the room 45 minutes later and our keys didn't work. We went back down to the front desk, where we were told that our room had been switched....what?? We booked a $500 spa suite and had been switched to a tiny room with two double beds. When we explained to the front desk agent that it was not what we had booked, she finally switched us to another spa suite room. The next day we had lunch at The Pub, and asked the waiter to bill our room since we had been told that we would receive a $50 credit. When he called the front desk they told him that we 'were not set-up for room charges and would have to pay out of pocket'. After explaining our situation yet again, they finally honored the credit we had been promised. When we used the pool one day, we asked the gate attendant if we could leave our souvenir cups with her since we were not allowed to bring in outside drinks. She said that was fine and we saw her put them into a podium next to the gate. When we left the pool and stopped by to pick up our $20 cups, they weren't there and her only response was, 'They must have gotten lost'. Ridiculous. Our room was very nice, once we actually got to use it, but because of the overall experience we will not be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Great first time at Vegas hotel”
Reviews.Author: md589
Reviews.Content: I think this place well worth it. The outside looks nice, not to impresive though. Like the fact that it's located near CVS, Walgreens, Denny's, and other places which def made my trip smoother. The front desk is pretty elegant, strong flower smell. The clerks are friendly, they took for ever to give me a room but they offer me $50 credit for food expenses or some type of room service. The room we stayed in was the deluxe; I mean it had everything you need for a 21 year old who only plans to sleep and shower there. The room was always clean. Theres a spacious closet, a safe for your valuables, drawers, desk. I liked it very much. The bed was extremely comforting I loved it. The shower room is great, its a bit small but like I said if your only planning to sleep and shower in your hotel then its geat. As for the casino, its not always filled with a "younger" crowd. Usually its not super packed.If your looking to have fun at the casino, this one is not the one unless your 35+. Buffet was horrible!!! do not waste your moneY! front desk, room service, everyone was friendly. i loved the fact that you can get on the train there, which is free by the way, that gets you to bellagio, arias, cesaers, and I forgot what other.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and Location for Monte Carlo, do NOT use Fox rental car company!”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugg81
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Monte Carlo for 4 nights, comfortable beds, room a little dated but package deal was $200 less than any other hotel in the same area. Great pool parties during the day, casino was a little dead at night. Buffet was excellent at hotel and food court open 24 hrs for those midnight cravings. Overall happy with this hotel and would stay again. Rented convertible from Fox as it was also $200 less than other rental companies, now i see why. First we had to wait 1 hr and 45 mins in hot stuffy trailer, with no a\c to pick up car, while the agents were busy chit chatting and upselling left right and center instead of getting the job done swiftly and efficiently.. It is not located at the rental car center as their website would have you believe, you have to take the schuttle to the rental center and then another schuttle from there to Foxes lot. Kind of a pain to be honest. Drove the vehicle off the lot across to the gas station to set up the GPS. Car died and would not restart.. thank god we werent at the grand canyon or something, what a fiasco!!! byt the time we actually got outta there with a car that actually ran, we had wasted 3 hours of the afternoon. BRUTAL!! next time i will pay extra and go with Budget or Enterprise.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed at all.”
Reviews.Author: Blue693
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Monte Carlo and all though I thought the beds were very comfortable, I would not return to this hotel. I thought people were very unfriendly. They only had two elevators working. This on a weekend with very high traffic. Since I do not visit Vegas often I guess I did not realize that you do not even have a coffee pot in your room. Seems a little funny to me that you can stay at Motel 6 and you have coffee your room. If you want it in Vegas you have to pay for it and you pay more than it is worth that is for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Easy to navigate this casino and hotel.”
Reviews.Author: happy_trails_2_you99
Reviews.Content: This is a very late review. We actually flew in on Jan 1st, which gave us great deals on the flight and hotel stay. I believe we paid $49. a night. The stay was very enjoyable. What I like most about this hotel is that it is not so huge that you can get lost in it like some of the other mega casinos. The layout is logical and easy to navigate. The rooms were very clean, but a little dated (for Las Vegas strip standards.) For the price we paid, it was an incredible deal. The only complaint I have is there are no coffee makers in the room. Room service coffee is approximately $13. plus tip for a pot.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay @ Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: MNMEL
Reviews.Content: I will start off by saying that we stayed at MC the 2nd half of our trip (June 16-18th). The first half was at a much newer hotel/casino. With that being said, I still enjoyed my stay at MC. Yes the rooms are nothing super special. I just needed a bed to sleep on. We literally were in our rooms for sleep and showering only. Yes, one day the towels did smell a little burnt. It reminded me of burnt carmel corn. I guess if they are drying the towels in super high heat, I would rather smell that and know they are clean. I love the layout of the hotel and casino. So easy to navigate around. We encountered very nice people while there for the most part. We ate at The Pub, and really liked it. Our waiter, Conn, was very nice! We had some really nice dealers ( Ron, Anna, Violeta, and Victoria) with nice personalities as well. The cocktail waitresses were just ok. We tipped very well and everytime. I just think some are annoyed with their job. I could never do it. I did see many people not tip while at the slots. I also noticed you couldn't ever find a CW at the slots. Table games, well, they were abundant there. We saw Jabbawockeez and it was a great show. It is loud , for those that complain of noise. (PS, I am 33 with a toddler at home). There is your heads up. I enjoyed the music during the show. Also, I loved the music on the casino floor! We didn't get a chance to go by the pool at MC. To those that mention many kids, it seems as if the hotels with fun pools will attract families with kids. Also, we were there in June. School is out, families go on vacation. It's a more pocket book friendly hotel, so yes, you will see kids. It didn't bother me at all. All in all....I would stay again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Good in parts, bad in others”
Reviews.Author: solo-vegas
Reviews.Content: Been aprehensive ever since being booked in to the MC with out checking it first. Read the reviews on here and started to fear the worse. Firstly , the resort fee. Many of you will have read my thoughts on this extra in other posts. Speaking as a British holiday maker, this fee offers NOTHING of use to a holiday maker but makes good sense to some one attending Las Vegas for a working break, i.e conference. I can't see many British holiday makers wanting to ring local and toll free numbers. Nor can I see them wanting photocopying done or faxes sending. Internet that is supplied to the room via a cable is of no use as the majority of holiday makers don't travel with a lap top computer. They do , however use mobile phones with wifi, an extra charge. Check in was pretty quick and pleasent at around 9.15pm on Weds 15th June. Room was Strip facing, had two queen beds, a nice flat screen Tv, a clean bathroom and a comfy bed. However, I only made use of the room for one night as a couple with FOUR kids, all under the age of 10 ( I'm guessing here ) took the suite next door and the racket coming thru the dividing door was completely unacceptable. TAKE YOUR KIDS TO DISNEYWORLD, don't inflict them on other Adults who have come to a place that is meant for ADULTS. Front counter staff didn't bat an eyelid when I asked to change rooms and I was impressed by their willingness to sort out my problem. Higher floor, better strip view and one Kingsize. Stayed at the Bellagio many times as well as the Flamingo , Imperial, Mandalay Bay, Tropicana and Rio but certainly feel the staff were more helpful at the M.C. Wanted to use the pool but the sheer volume of noise being created by the poolside disco coupled with how cram packed it was, put me off. Pity as I do like to sit by the pool, have a read, listen to my iPod. The Buffet was not as good as I remember it from around 4 years ago when I last used it. The signs of cutbacks are all to clear with very limited choices now and breakfast rolled in to lunch , leaving just two meals a day. I"m a slot player and I found plenty of different machines to occupy me in the M.C's casino. I would, however, point out that in 4 days and nights there, I was only offered a drink on one occassion. There just didn't seem to be any cocktail waitress's around. I was all so left speech less on Sat night. I like to have a flutter on the Wheel of fortune ( lazy betting, I know ) but at 9pm it was closed. There was a lady with it who told me it would be opening any minute but after 10 minutes, I got up and walked away. An hour later I was walking back past it so stopped to have a go. This time they were changing spinners and would I wait a while whilst they sorted out the chips and changed over. No wonder they need Resort fees when you can't give your money away in the casino !! Overall, M.C is not a dump by any means. It's not lacking in facilities. It's nice and central on the strip. Warning for British pint drinkers though... The Pub had a good selection of English beers but at $10 for a pint !!! That was around £6.00 at my exchange rate. Blimey, it makes London pub prices look like good. The Hotel staff are helpful and friendly. There is a nice food court all though the Starbuk's closes at 11pm leaving you to drink the dish water serves McDonalds up. To sum up, value for money is a very personal factor as we all want something different for our Buck. With out the useless resort fee, I would rate the M.C as value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “ok hotel with oodles of kids but does not accomodate people with disabilities”
Reviews.Author: vickietoria
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean but there were holes all over our bedspread. The music was so loud everywhere we went that it was difficult to hear each other talk. Loud as heck by the pool, in the eleavators, and in the buffet dining room. And it was not pleasant dinner music or even enjoyable rock music. There were so many kids there that you felt as if it was a daycare center. We entered the buffet to eat breakfast and the cost was ridiculous. $43 for 2 of us. We are not big eaters but we paid the price and ate. Food was very good. Hostess brought us to our seat and there were 2 speakers over our table with that loud music blaring. I asked if we could choose another seat and she abruptly said, "no" then walked away. Couldn't get our money back so we sat down. We had to practically beg for coffee and the waiter never came back to refill our cup. Don't recommended eating here. You can also smell smoke from the casino everywhere in the hotel. The pool was so full by 11 AM that we didn't want to use it. The lazy river looked like cattle being herded. Every pool side lounge recliner was taken by 10 AM. We asked the girl in charge of the pool area if there were chairs to sit in by the pool and she said no. I explained that my spouse cannot lie on a lounge chair due to back injury. She just said no we don't have them. Most hotels have some chairs to sit in. We checked the pool area several times during the day and people just placed a towel on chairs and took off for the entire day. Pool closes at 8 PM. Would not return here due to overcrowding, smoke smell, number off kids, rude staff in the buffet area. There are beautiful hotels everywhere in Vegas that value their patrons. This is not one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty,busy and noisy”
Reviews.Author: conjuror88
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 days for a medical conference. Check in was quick but had to wait 2 hours to get the room. The main floor has the casino and the ubiquitous food court with the usual Starbucks, Hagen daas, McD, Subway and the like. We asked the concierge where the meetings were being held and they had no idea, even the supervisor had to be called still no idea. Usually hotels have the meetings/conferences listed on the main floor--guess where it was, on the second floor !! Had we not seen other colleagues we would not have known since we were all looking for some sort of sign for directions. Very poorly set up especially for such a large group checking in. Stressed already and we still had not started the meetings. Upon entering the room we noticed the ice bucket still with water, no liner, glasses on the washroom dirty and no towels. Immediately complained, we were changed to another room, another 1 hour wait, same room, another floor, accetable but not great. The hotel is dated and in dire need of repaint, replacing some furniture. Also no fridge. They also charged the resort fee irrespective of whether you used the facilities or not. Did not try any of the restaurants. The conference meals were also sub par even with the menu having steak, chicken, salads, pasta, just all tasteless. WHen I asked for some more coffee they said they ran out ? Also asked how our friends liked their room, they all had minor, irritating complaints from cleanliness, missing toiletries, leftover items, grout in the shower, stained chairs. Would not stay here again. Glad we booked the balance of the trip at another fantastic hotel on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel for value, location & comfort”
Reviews.Author: coffeebean818
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here many times. This hotel is the best if you're looking for a place that provides nice, clean rooms, a great location & awesome rates - all in one. Obviously it isn't the "best" hotel in Vegas, but it is the best in terms of the overall price package. I have also stayed at "value" hotels on the strip - i.e. Tropicana, Excalibur, etc, and I'm sorry, but there is not even a comparison. I was actually really uncomfortable in those hotels - they were gross and just not nice. One of them even had a mirror on the ceiling above the bed and the other did not have one of those locks you can put on your door from the inside. Ew. If you're looking for a nice place to stay in a great location, but you want to save some of your $$$ for other activities (i.e. nice dinners, gambling, etc), definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Good value during the week.”
Reviews.Author: Hoosier_Packer
Reviews.Content: Family of four stayed during the week and were happy with the room cleanliness, convenient location, free parking, and pool area. We were not so impressed by the restaurant choices and customer service. They weren't bad, we've just had better. We found a room deal for $80/night. Same room jumps to $170/night on Saturday. Overpriced at that rate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel,clean and cozy.”
Reviews.Author: frr2408
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at the Monte Carlo in my last trips to Las Vegas , this is a nice place to stay,clean rooms and very nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great pool”
Reviews.Author: MindyinLasVegas
