Reviews.Content: As a local, this is one of my favorite hotels to staycation. The parking is great- easy in and out. The location is great- good proximity to everything. I like that there is a mall type food court for when you want to grab something fast and the buffet is quite good. Check out the new ice bar restaurant where everything is made of ice- very cool!! I will say that the new rool on pool floats (you can only use theirs now and they are miserable to sit in) sucks. Not sure why they changed that pool rule, but I liked it way better last summer when we could bring our own comfortable ones. Overall, great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: gouacats
Reviews.Content: We got a great rate and decided to stay despite some of the reviews we read and we are so glad we did!!! We are all very picky travelers and We loved it! The room was spacious enough for the 3 of us. It was clean, the beds were comfy. Nothing fancy about the bathroom, but it was clean. The food court was convenient, the buffet was yummy (we got a discount through the discount tix place across the street). Loved the tram to the Bellagio. The pool area was nice, but loud. Our only negative comment would be that if you like to sleep past 9am or take naps, definitely request a non-pool view room. We were on the 19th floor and it was soooooo loud!! And, we won in the casino on the slots and video poker! The only casino that we won at!! We will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: cherie_t021
Reviews.Content: Had been here before. Location is great. Room comfortable and staff all nice. Great value for the price. Only negatives - had trouble getting towels and the resort fee. Otherwise, would love to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Vegas, will be back but probably to a different hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gingerbint
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Vegas, two friends travelling out for a special occasion as our friend's were getting married & it was also my 40th birthday. Having seen many programmes on Vegas we were expecting glitz & glamour from the start. The hotel lobby was large & airy & check in was quick with the reception staff being friendly. We paid extra for a Deluxe room on a high floor & were given a double room on the 23rd floor overlooking the pool. Note to readers - if you find you have a room overlooking the pool change it immediately!! Don't even try it for one night! More later on why. The room itself was not we had in our minds from the internet pictures of the hotel. It did the job for somewhere to stay but not the luxury we had imagined. Having later seen our friends rooms I definatly think we had a bum deal. The beds was comfortable but mine was saggy in the middle on one side. The decor was contemporary but looking tired in places and there was a rust stain on the floor in the bathroom under the sink. The shower was powerful but, when on, the bath tap also sprayed out water so the mixer switch did not work well. The plug sockets wobbled when you plugged things in, they looked quite unsafe! Beds were made daily, bins were emptied and towels were changed. The ipod dock mentioned only fitted one of our 4 ipod/iphones the slim line 8G, none of the others fitted nor did my iphone. The in room safe was hilarious! Imagine a size just wider than an A4 box file and then stand it up. This was the safe!! You had to balance everything on its sides & place around the edges & quickly shut the door. Then it would not close as the safe door was quite deep taking up precious space in the safe itself. We only had a small jewellery box, travel wallet, purses, passports & ipods and could not get much more in. If you had a laptop or notebook you would get nothing else in, if you could even get them in! The hotel facilities were very good, several bars, shops, restaurants and food outlets plus an array of machines & tables in the Casino. We ate at Andre's restaurant for the night of our friend's wedding. We had a private dining room for our party & the service & food were outstanding. Everyone enjoyed their meal & the staff were friendly but not intrusive. Some of the party during the stay also ate in the 'Cafe' & the buffet restaurants & all mentioned the food was good there too. We also ate at Diablo's out the front of the hotel, the Nachos were massive & very tasty! They have a drinks offer that changes every 30mins or so. On a weekend evenings it changes to a bar/club & costs $10 to get in. The pool choices were good, a lazy river, wave pool, spa pool & standard pool. For the lazy river you had to buy or hire a ring to ride on. I think it was $12 to hire for the day or $16 to buy one to keep. You could go round without a ring if you wanted. They played music in the pool area which was ok earlier on in the day but by lunchtime/afternoon it was far too loud, drowned out everything! This is the reason why if you have a room overlooking the pool I would highly recommend getting it changed! When we arrived, the first 3 days we were out the room from 9/930am & not back till 7/8/9pm so were unaware of the noise from the pool. However on our 4th/5th days we spent these at the hotel & found the music to be so loud even on the 23rd floor it was clearly heard & louder than the TV & made it impossible to relax in the room. I did go down & complain to the Concierge who in my opinion was a complete waste of space. He just shrugged his shoulders, agreed it was rather loud & that's how it was! Other persons in our group changed their rooms after one night due to this but as we only has two nights left we didn't bother, not that we were given the option had we wanted to! I could understand if it was spring break or similar but there was no one 'partying' down by the pool area, everyone was chilling, reading & relaxing including the teenagers/college aged kids. I've lived in Magaluf & not experienced it on that scale! It was a shame that there was no fridge facility in the room, this would have been a great addition. There was ice facility near the lifts but trudging up & down the corridors to get it was a pain especially as we were at the far end. The air conditioning in the room worked well & was adjustable to suit. There are computers at the far left of the lobby area where you can check in & print your boarding passes for free. It comes up as a charge when you press print but there is no fee. I believe there was in room WiFi but this was not used as we had nothing to access it with us. All in all we enjoyed our trip to Las Vegas & I will defiantly be coming back but having seen many of the other hotels & what they have to offer I think I will choose one of them for my next visit over the Monte Carlo.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good casino, awesome experience”
Reviews.Author: mkoiki
Reviews.Content: Well known resort, not much new to post here.. Good rooms, nice pool (looked nice, but not my thing), decent gym, well-balanced casino... Only con I want to mention is the over-repetitive Jabbawockeez Dance Crew elevator ad... but please don't get me wrong.. the show looks great but I had nightmares with that song on my head :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: mavium
Reviews.Content: Great central location to the strip and the room was great. Had a upper 28th floor room with 2 beds (asked for one but received two) with a view of the mountains. Room was part of the summer special rate that included 2 for 1 buffet. Room was modern with flat panel TV, apple i charger, and spacious bathroom. Will be back next time in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for the price”
Reviews.Author: pacacc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a 4 night stay in the Monaco Suite. The experience was overall a positive one. I was apprehensive about staying here as a result of some of the reviews. I think that when staying here you just need to have realistic expectations. Its not a 5 star property more like 3 so you have to keep that in mind. Some random thoughts: The resort fee is annoying. Some of the furniture was beat up, however the room had a flat screen and the room was clean. I did not notice any stains on the carpet or anywhere else in the room. My wife was not impressed at all with the spa. The bed was clean and extremely comfortable as far as hotel beds go. We have stayed at other mid level hotels on the strip and this one was at the top of that list.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable holiday”
Reviews.Author: cdnmallshopper
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean, location was good. Staff was very friendly and helpful. There was a wave pool and lazy river that was okay, not as big as I thought. The food mall in the hotel was very conveniant for a quick breakfest or late night snack. Next time we go, we may try the Mandalay Bay but the Monte Carlo was good for us.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough hotel, but no coffee in room, no fridge, etc. Beds were comfortable, pillows were okay.”
Reviews.Author: lynneborle
Reviews.Content: It's a little dated, the bathroom really shows it. Small tub, cracks in tiles, etc. But clean. Not quite as centrally located as it advertises, it's a VERY long walk to the other end of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite place to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Venturatravelers
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been staying at the Monte Carlo for years now. It's not big like all the new hotels but it's in a good location. We both like to walk so it's within walking distance to most of the hotels and attractions. It's also easy to get to the freeway and from the freeway back to the hotel. My wife loves to shop in Vegas so we spend quite a bit of time off of the strip shopping and visiting the outlaying hotels and casinos. We also get pretty good rates and discounts there. We never go in the summer because of the heat but 4 or 5 times in the off season. You can go when you want when your retired! We like it, you might too?

Reviews.Title: “Not our first choice but OK stay.”
Reviews.Author: PSBTEXAS
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a family trip for 4 nights in the beginning of May. It was not my first choice (we had stayed here before) but we got a good rate from their website in addition to the AAA discount. The other reason for choosing it was its location on the strip for the first time Vegas visitor we were travelling with. We arrived/checked in at 8:30 in the morning and were told we wouldn't be able to get the key to our room until between 3:00 and 5:00 p.m. The hotel did keep our luggage and we spend the day walking the strip. I think we eventually got in after 5:00 but that was partly due to wanting to wait for the room we requested (floor 31 overlooking the pool) and because the previous guests left without checking out. The view from the room (31112) was well worth the wait. We looked out to the Aria and Cosmopolitan and had a strip view in the distance. The night time views were great for photos. The room itself was just basic but clean. I never did find a hairdryer. We used the pool once. The lazy river and the wave pool are a nice feature of this hotel considering the price. The only other hotel with a wave pool is the Mandalay Bay which is generally much more expensive. There is also a sand volleyball court which seemed popular. The downside at the pool is you have to rent the rubber rings at $10 a day or $25 a week. We didn't bother. We had drinks and appetizers in the Pub. They were both good. We just couldn't believe they closed at 11:00 on week nights. We had coffee in the nicer of the two Starbucks in the hotel which is at the base of the tram stairway. They don't take the pre-loaded Starbucks cards which I didn't discover until it came to paying. We didn't go back. For breakfast we ate at McDonald's in the food court. It was more expensive than at home but was fast and the same quality of food as you would get at any McDonalds. They did charge extra for coffee when you order breakfast platters which are included at our locations here but that is Vegas! The hotel frontage is pretty and the pool areas are nice but the casino is dark and was very quiet compared to all the others we visited. I think the lack of a theme makes it less interesting for visitors than many other hotels on the strip. When booking our stay I found 2 out of 3 reservations people I dealt with were very unhelpful (one lady made me find the discount code I was quoting as she said the deal had ended. It had not. On the other hand the one person asked if we had a AAA card and got us the extra discount.) When calling the front desk if you mentioned the word ‘reservation’ they transferred you without letting you ask a question. Overall I would say when the price is right I would recommend it as we felt we got value for money. If they are charging average strip prices I would recommend staying somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Lame”
Reviews.Author: mandakcali
Reviews.Content: I think my expectations were just too high. We spent a lot more money than people in our group for a suite, thinking it would be you know, a suite? Basically we got a couch and a half bath. And the room was DIRTY. The bed was comfy, but the room was like the Bermuda Triangle of hotel rooms. I have never had so many stupid issues in a hotel room. Remote didn't work very well, the bathroom lights would not come on one morning; we didn't have drinking glasses or a "Do Not Disturb" sign. It was just plain goofy. To their credit I did complain and they were kind enough to offer a nice F&B comp we used at the pool but overall it was just one thing after another. I think what bothered me the most is it just wasn't as together as I am used to for Vegas hotels. When we booked, if I had seen one or two stars I wouldn't have cared so much. We had friends stay here a couple of years ago and it was much nicer. They've really slipped, and had we spent $80.00 more total over the three nights we could have stayed at MGM or The Hotel. The pool was fun though, and the cafe was really good.

Reviews.Title: “Average experience, but good value for money :)”
Reviews.Author: Grimace87
Reviews.Content: Pros: 1. Food court in hotel 2. Great service, very friendly staff! 3. Really nice bed, which was large and had really comfy white sheets 4. Great location, near lots of the nice hotels on the strip and has a free tram to Bellagio 5. Really cheap for the location, and even cheaper on weekdays Cons: 1. Pool closed at 5pm so I never got to use it 2. Showers were fiddly, we could never get the setting right 3. The walls aren't very sound proof, can get noisy at night 4. Hotel doesn't have as much of a 'theme' as other hotels

Reviews.Title: “Fun lazy river and wave pool!”
Reviews.Author: travelator17
Reviews.Content: The basic hotel rooms are normal but well kept. Big bathrooms :) The lobby is nicely decorated and welcoming and there is a food court near the lobby which is very convenient. The best part is the pool! The lazy river was so much fun but buy your innertube at a nearby drugstore or the ABC store across the street and you'll save about 10 dollars. Only problem is that a lot of kids are in there unattended and swimming around splashing and kicking instead of floating on tubes. They need a life guard in the area to calm the children down. The other pools are nice and some parts are shaded by palms which is great when it gets a bit too hot.

Reviews.Title: “A very good R&C”
Reviews.Author: pjthedj
Reviews.Content: This 14 year old facility still offers quality and value and will reurn there again. It even has 2 Starbucks. We rented a car four our 4 day trip and found out on the second day that you can Valet your car at any of the resorts on the strip free of charge anytime, which we did. Tipping is very welcomed That is one of the offers that come with the resort fee we all pay. Very usefull if you visit other resorts that are a long way from your resort as we had someone with our party that was being challenged by the long walks.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo is Outstanding!!!”
Reviews.Author: Huggo69
Reviews.Content: The staff is incredibly friendly, the rooms are just fone (who wants to stay in the room in vegas anyway), the bars and restaurants in the hotel were GREAT and the best part of the place is the lazy river a great scene by the pool!!!! GREAT location as well!!!

Reviews.Title: “First experience in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Scami
Reviews.Content: Pretty good hotel if you stay one night. Good location and nice bars inside the hotel. The carpet on the hallways are old, and this make the impresion that the hotel is around 3 1/2 stars.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Lacking”
Reviews.Author: PatinMaryland
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took advantage of a Spring Break special to go to Las Vegas. Monte Carlo was the most cost effective option so we expected some amenities to be lacking. The seating in the buffet and breakfast cafe was worn and shabby looking. The buffet was severely lacking. I would have to classify it mediocre at best. The Spring Break special included (or so we thought) Happy Hour pricing in the bar all day but it turned out it was only during the regular HH times in the evening. We felt the advertising was a bit misleading. As I mentioned, since it was "cost effective", we didn't expect a lot and that's what we got.

Reviews.Title: “The Monte Carlo is nice but bland, a nice little haven in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: paclarks
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I were in town for a wedding and spent 3 nights at the Monte Carlo. Check in was no problem - we got a room with a king bed that overlooked the pool area and the new City Center/Aria on the 30th floor. The room was very pedestrian - done in neutral colors with bed, desk with chair and then a sitting chair and ottoman. The bathroom was also pretty boring, one sink a shower and the usual toiletries. We didn't eat here, other than Starbucks for breakfast. The gambling was ok, not very busy and the slots seemed to hit. It did take a long time to get a drink though. The pool area is really nice, there is a lazy river, wave pool, regular pool and hot tub. Also, the Jabbawockeez music in the elevator is still haunting my brain...... On a side note, my parents got a suite and it seemed much nicer than a regular room.

Reviews.Title: “Not the newest strip hotel, but still costs like it is”
Reviews.Author: COArmstrong
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Monte Carlo a couple times in the last decade, and it is always a high quality, luxury hotel. However, being that it is one of the older premium resorts on the strip (i.e. not one of the ancient resorts, like Flamingo, but one of the older modern resorts), you'd think you could get some great deals here. Not necessarily. They'll still add on mandatory facility fees (gym, morning paper, etc.), and have some other annoying profit oriented policies: you can't bring any outside food / beverages to their pool, not even water! What next, you won't be able to bring your own sun-block in?! End result, a very nice, luxury hotel, but you feel like you're being nit-picked or nickel and dimed at times during your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: mondaygirl
Reviews.Content: Nice room, nice pool, great location next to City Center.

Reviews.Title: “Would have been mad if I had paid...”
Reviews.Author: CAB062709
Reviews.Content: I went for a business trip so I did not have to pay for my room but if I had I would have been very disappointed. Seriously, this place is not worth the money. My room at the Monte Carlo was right on par with rooms in other casinos that I have stayed at in Vegas that are half the cost. Cons: The furniture was very beat up and stained, thank goodness I had two beds because I pulled back the covers of the first one and the sheets were dirty...ewww, there were shoe scuff marks on my ceiling...I know this is Vegas but come on, there was trash on my floor left from the previous occupants, the concierge desk was on the whole unhelpful, the toliet was the loudest flushing toliet I have ever heard in my entire life and I nearly had a heart attack the first time I had to flush which resulted in having to use my fingers to cover my ears and flushing with my foot the rest of the trip in order to avoid the sound. Pros: It is really in a great location on the strip, there is a free tram that connects the hotel to Aria and the Bellagio, the pool area was very nice and really fun, the restaurants in the hotel were great, and the conference rooms were nice however these pros were not enough to overshadow the dirtiness and general shabbiness of the room. If the rooms were half the cost I would be leaving a great review but they aren't. Either spend more money to go somewhere nicer or spend less to get the same quality elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced and ideally situated hotel/casino in centre of Vegas”
Reviews.Author: marypuss
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in a central situation for the sites of Las Vegas. Comfortable and not so expensive as the most famous hotels but still very comfortable and had all necessary facilities. Was disappointed with the pub in the hotel, very pricey and drinks not what we expeced - a brandy and coke which is all brandy and no coke for a huge price is not how I expect it. Bar staff should ask or explain drinks to customers possibly? Nice range of shops in casino and several eating places to suit most tastes

Reviews.Title: “Ok. Priced low. Its vegas noisy young adults? Pool nice for families teens but not to relax”
Reviews.Author: retirebioteacher
Reviews.Content: Rooms ok not luxurous not up to date decore. Not a 4 star more a 21/2. Worn wallcoveringl Shower hot but dripped and didn't turn off fully. Beds are very comfortable. Staff honored our requesst for quiet room end of hallway. We are in our 60's and the only qiiet place was in our room. Price very reasonable. We booked a name your own price on Priceline. Many young loud twenty years olds run around drunk. Vegas is Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: Ajay1979
Reviews.Content: It was our second anniversary this past weekend, We stayed from June 5th 2011 to June 8th 2011 in this RUN DOWN hotel. How can such a hotel be so cheap! IF YOU ARE READING THIS REVIEW:PLEASE LISTEN! HOTEL LINEN STILL SMELLS LIKE SMOKE! I know they had an accident two years ago! Seriously TWO YEAR AGO! When we let the front desk know about the smell, Receptionist LISA gave us the million dollar surprise like we are from Mars and she has no clue what we were talking about! PLEASE STAY AWAY FROM MONTECARLO!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap does not equal good. Sad.”
Reviews.Author: Colorado_Rick
Reviews.Content: While our stay at the MC was more-or-less OK, we would definitely not stay there again. The MC is looking well-worn and the lack of maintenance & upkeep is obvious. Carpets are worn, plumbing is a mix of old & new, & our room just seemed dingy and dark. While the housekeeping staff did good work, the room was in dire need of a serious scrubbing, not just a daily once-over. There was crusty stuff in the corners--YUCK! The pool was very over-crowded & extremely noisy, with a DJ playing tunes at max volume. Not a pleasant experience. At least the pools seemed clean. Not a scene for older folks like us. Food at the buffet & Diablo's was good but not exceptional. We would rate the MC on a par with the Rio. Relatively inexpensive, but there's a good reason it's cheaper than other resorts on the strip. Good location though.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in so many ways”
Reviews.Author: BEF45
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at the MGM Grand but decided I wanted to try a different hotel this time. I chose the Monte Carlo because it belongs to the same group as the MGM, therefore, I was expecting a similar experience in a different package. Was I wrong! The first hint that things would be different came at check-in when I requested a mini-fridge for our room - only to be told the fridge was an addition $15 USD PER NIGHT over and above the $15 per night resort fee. Seeing the room for the first time was more disappointment. The carpet was soiled and stained to the point I didn't want to walk in the room in bare feet; I found a used kleenex behing the curtain which remained there for the duration of our 3-day stay; the toilet flush mechanism was broken; there were water/dirt stains along the baseboards of the bathroom; there was a visible buildup of dust / grit in the bathroom vent above the toilet and around the fire sprinkler in the ceiling; and finally, there were what looked like food stains and a shoe print in the ceiling of our room. To their credit though, I was relieved to find the bedding to be clean. The towels and face cloths however, had an unpleasant industrial odor when wet. As we were only in Las Vegas for 3 days and the bed was clean enough to sleep in, we opted to overlook the overall shabbiness of the room. The final straw though was when I was denied entrance to the pool area because I had 3 unopened bottles of water in my bag. I can understand not bringing in alcohol but they were turning away paying guests who had water or coffee in their hands! Apparently the Monte Carlo is hurting for money so badly they demand you pay their over-inflated prices for bottled water poolside! Again, I had never experienced this at the MGM Grand so was deeply offended and shocked that the Monte Carlo would treat their customers in this manner. Needless to say, I will NEVER return to the Monte Carlo and would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Too Good To Be True”
Reviews.Author: akcountess
Reviews.Content: We go to Las Vegas several times a year, but have never stayed here before. Even though we are long time members of the slot club, they had a 10 year old email address so we had never gotten any promo emails. We saw an offer on their website in April, but couldn't access it with our players club cards so we called. After hearing the story, they set up our reservation, sent the confirmation email to the new email address, and told us to go to the players club for new cards when we arrived. All set - or so we thought. When we arrived, we got none of the promos that were promised (except for the room rate) - not the 2 for 1 buffet, appetizer or bottle of champagn that were all promised. They said we didn't book the reservation on the website using the special offer code. Of course not - we used the phone because we couldn't access the special on the web!! There are lots of places in Las Vegas to stay - both on and off the strip - that will promise AND DELIVER great deals. Next time, we'll stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and affordable”
Reviews.Author: mchenryed
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great location, easy access to the strip, City Center and Bellagio. Rooms were clean. Super fast check-in and friendly / helpful staff Reasonable price Bed was very comfortable. Free USA Today newspaper. Quiet -- never really heard our neighbors or people wandering the halls. Cons: No king-sized bed available at check-in. We had two doubles (it was a busy week there) The club music starting in the morning around the pool was annoying. I am fairly tolerant of club music but whoever was the DJ for this was horrible and it started way too early (I believe around 8:30 - 9AM). We could hear it from our room on the 14th floor. Room was clean but was starting to show a little wear and tear. Nothing major but it had taken some beatings. Resort fee I could get a clear voice connection on my cell phone (Verizon) but the internet connection was pretty much dead. The wireless connection (that I paid for in my resort fee) was pretty much non-existent in our room. I would stay here again and recommend others looking for a nice hotel, at a reasonable price in the midst of the strip action.

Reviews.Title: “Faded but not jaded”
Reviews.Author: brulynn
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo has seen better days but still provides good service and a certain ambience missing from other Strip hotels. We tried the Buffet for breakfast and dinner and was presented with a good choice of dishes and while you may get better elsewhere this was good value. Visiting the oter hotels on the Strip we concluded that the Monte Carlo clientele is Mr and Mrs Middle America, suited us British visitors anyway!! Yes, you can get better but you will have to pay more for it. All the staff tried very hard and succeeded in making our stay a pleasant one. If the owners re-decorate it could again be one of the best on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid Monte Carlo at all cost”
Reviews.Author: cruisinwithted
Reviews.Content: I have been in the travel industry for 4 years assisting over 5000 travel arrangements. This hotel was a major turnoff to the Las Vegas strip in general and particularly this type of hotel. We are treated very rudely from the getgo and the porter accosted us with instant demands to move our car when one of the passengers had an emergency at arrival. The head of the dept offered a credit which we later found to be grossly misrepresented. Overall you can do a lot better staying at Arizona Charlies in Boulder avoiding all the hassle of a big hotel with indifferent staff. also although they charge a resort fee of $15 a day they close access the pool area after 7 pm. Also I was told that the wifi I was paying for through the resort fee I was paying for required a hard cable and could not be accessed through wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice, as always!”
Reviews.Author: PollyannaDreamgirl
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Monte Carlo the past several times we have been to Las Vegas, and it remains our favorite. The staff is very nice and helpful, the rooms are clean and comfortable, and the casino itself is layed out nicely and not overwhelming. We enjoyed the choice of restaurants within the property, as well as the close proximity to the other resorts on the strip. The free parking was a plus as well.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel strongly recommended”
Reviews.Author: lovettecorrea
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel . Staff helpful. Very nice food court. Located next to city center. has a free monorail connection to city center and the Bellagio. Plenty to see and do around the hotel. For kids the M&M store is just opposite the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location on The Strip, good value during high season”
Reviews.Author: JY_Globetrotter
Reviews.Content: I visit Las Vegas from time to time and always make a habit of choosing a hotel I haven't stayed at before. Monte Carlo had been on my list for a long time and I decided to finally give it a shot. I checked in on a Monday night and left on a Wednesday. Since I'm not here on a weekend, the check-in/check-out process was sweet and efficient. I cannot guarantee that you would escape the hotel lobby chaos if you came on a Friday evening. The staff were very courteous and accommodating. Because it is an older hotel, do not expect new and contemporary furnishings. Our room on the 11th floor was simple and very clean although it did show a sign of its age compared to those built in the last few years. All was quiet and noise was not an issue. The visit to the pool was also very pleasant. Small lazy pool but a nice fun wave pool that kids and adults would enjoy with lots of available chairs. The resort fee included both internet and the use of the health club. Noticed that the gym is on the smaller side and by 7am, most of the cardio machines were occupied. The location of the hotel is also excellent being quite close to City Centre and Miracle Mile. The only restaurant I tried in the hotel was Diablo's serving Mexican cuisine and I liked the fact that it was quick service with a patio bordering The Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel fab shame about other guests!!”
Reviews.Author: CarlyandSam
Reviews.Content: This was the second stop for us on our Honeymoon and I cannot tell you how much we were looking forward to seeing Las Vegas. Everything about our room was great, clean and nicely decorated with a great view from our window. The one thing we could have done with was more coat hangers but if that is all we have to complain about in the hotel we were very lucky. Unbeknown to us it was Memorial day weekend in America when we went which made for a fun atmosphere but it also caused us a couple of problems. Everywhere was so busy it was hard to view the sights properly and we had to wait for long periods of time to get into anywhere to eat. The other problem which to be honest was much worse was our neighbours in the room next door. I understand that people want to go out and have fun in Vegas don't we all? But coming back at 5am and having a screaming match was not neighbour friendly especially as we had an ajoining door with that room so we had no sound proofing at all. All in all a great destination and a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We Love Monte Carlo!”
Reviews.Author: 2HappyWorldTravelers
Reviews.Content: Hotel has lovely clean smell that is very tipical for Monte Carlo. Can't wait to go back. We've seen Monte Carlo while it was being build and fell in love with it immediately. We stayed there every year for many years, recently end of May 2011. Hotel is getting little tired, but it is still the place to stay. Room was very nice, excellent view of the strip, beds were very comfy, everything in working order. Great location, in the middle of it all. Very speedy check in as well as check out and pleasant front desk staff. We tried d'vino italian ristorante, but it was just ok, nothing special. We liked the food court, bought breakfast there every morning and took it in our room. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great service!”
Reviews.Author: sharvey872
Reviews.Content: When I booked our rooms at the Monte Carlo, I had no idea what to expect from the reviews. I had never stayed on the strip and we certainly didn't have a Bellagio budget so it's safe to say that it was a very blind decision on my part. When we arrived, the check-in desk was very nice and helpful. The carpets in the hallways could stand to be cleaned but once we got to our room, it was fine. Nothing grand, but it was exactly what we asked for and right in budget. One bad thing was that the toilet wasn't working but we understand that things happen and they were nice about it. It took maintenance until 11:30pm to come fix the problem which was a bit annoying but there was a restroom downstairs and we wanted to peruse the casino anyway. We went to sleep early, exhausted after a long day of traveling, and woke up at 4am to a violent, physical fight from the couple next door (enough to wake 4 people up from a dead sleep). We called the front desk and from there I'm not sure what happened, but the fighting stopped. The only gripe I have was the pool. The drinks were unbelievably expensive and you couldn't even take water in. The guards at the front touched everything in my bag, opened up my towel, etc. to make sure that no food was in there. Hello, this isn't a matter of national security and I felt very uncomfortable having someone going through everything in my pool bag (there was a towel, a Kindle, my cell phone, room key, and ID....why did it take several minutes?). Not cool and left a very bad taste in my mouth. Other than that, I love that there was a Starbucks downstairs, the DJ at the pool was so fun, Donovan (the security officer) was wonderful and even gave us hugs on our way out and I can honestly say that we would come back because of him. We never ate at the restaurants but we did see the Jabbawockeez show. Because a Cirque show wasn't in the budget, I felt a bit like I was "settling" just because it was cheaper but once the show was over, my jaw was still hanging open. It was THAT good! I would recommend it to anyone and I'm so glad that we saw it. Worth every penny! So overall, I would definitely recommend the Monte Carlo and will most likely be back. And a big thank you to Donovan!! :)

Reviews.Title: “REALLY EXCITING PLACE”
Reviews.Author: monicaparmar
Reviews.Content: It is vibrant exciting and full of life , the crowd is very happening. The food court has a very good variety of food. the check in and check out is really fast....I stayed twice and found it very happy experience.. the business centre is also very responsive

Reviews.Title: “Best for younger people”
Reviews.Author: artanis65
Reviews.Content: The facilities are quite nice. The room was spacious and clean. The tub stopped up, but I called housekeeping and they fixed it within 30 minutes. The pool area is lovely, with a lazy river and a wave pool. I was there on a weekend and into the weekdays, and the pool area was crowded at all times but not unreasonably so. The casino is large, but it's not as overwhelming as some of its neighbors. The dealers are friendly. The location in the middle of the strip is perfect. However, be aware of the noise. The official policy of the Monte Carlo seems to be to pump up the dance music as loudly as they possibly can, in both the pool area and the casino. There's no area in the pool complex in which you can avoid the music. It was already too loud, but then at noon on both Saturday and Sunday, a DJ came out and cranked the volume of the bass heavy music up to 11. I beat a hasty retreat to my room, but even on the 7th floor, the sound permeated the walls of the room. If you're looking for a little peace and quiet gambling, I wouldn't recommend the Monte Carlo. Nor would I recommend it for families. If you're in the magic age between 21-35 and you like really loud dance music, go for it. This casino is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Stop worrying If you have booked The Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: Southcoastmag
Reviews.Content: My recent stays in hotels have included Claridges (London) and The Peninsular(Hong Kong) both 5* hotels so I have some experience of quality. Now I'm not going to pretend for one minute the Monte Carlo is in their class but some of the rubbish being written on here is totally annoying. Like others I was concerned having read some of the reviews particularly as I had my two daughters with me (28 and 23). I needn't have worried. From the moment we checked in everything was perfect. It's Las Vegas people it's meant to be loud and brash. Room was fine, beds were superb, bathroom was clean. Tunes round the pool were banging, and their food and drink were cheap and good so stop complaining you can't bring your own. I repeat it's Las Vegas go self catering in a caravan if that's what you want. Casino may be smaller than others but as we are novice gamblers it suited. dealers were friendly and good crowd at the tables kept everything lighthearted with no serious winners or losers. Restaurants may be few but Diablo excellent value and great atmosphere while the Italian was superb(wine a bit pricey). If you want more go out, doors aren't locked and Fatburger over the road has to be experienced. Saw Jabawockeez which has to be one of best shows in town. Yes there are things that could be better but so minor I won't even list them. Look at what you have paid and just enjoy a great experience in the world's greatest city. And no I don't work for the hotel just hate people who want to worry people for no reason. Gary

Reviews.Title: “Surpassed Our Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Blake99
Reviews.Content: Thank you to all of you who write reviews as it really helps us decide whether or not to stay at a place, Monte Carlo included. We have stayed at MGM, New York New York, Mirage and Treasure Island previously and have enjoyed them. We stay at different places just for the variety and to check them out. When we got a great room rate offer e-mailed to us from Monte Carlo, first thing I did was read reviews. It has been around for awhile, but is still well kept and modern. It does not wreak of smoke and the casino is spacious and uncrowded. The rooms are a little larger than your average hotel room and very clean and fresh. The beds were very soft and comfortable. We found the showers to be just fine, not "blasting" like mentioned in other reviews. We found it to be very quiet at night while sleeping; no sounds of outside traffic or bumping/talking coming from other rooms. (just the occasional drunk rowdy coming down the hallway) Pool was fantastic! Not crowded and well spread out. Lazy river and wave pool are a big hit, as well as the white sand beach volleyball court they have set up. The sun exposure throughout the day at the pool is very good - no shady areas due to a high building next door. Drinks are super expensive at the pool however!!! There is also a Food Court by the lobby that came in real handy. (plus the prices were reasonable) The tram is just a little further back from there that takes you to Aria and Bellagio. (Saved a whole bunch of walking) The girl at the front desk during check-in was very friendly and accommodating. It was no problem to get 2 adjoining rooms as our 3 kids were staying in it. We needed extra towels one day and they were brought up to us within 5 minutes. When we were leaving, we need a taxi for 5 people and the doorman went out of his way to get us one promptly. Out of all the hotels we have stayed at, the rooms are all very similar. And since we don't spend a lot of time in them, that's just fine; as long as the bed is comfortable. We would go back to Monte Carlo again because of the location on the Strip, value for the money, pool, open casino and great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, lovely hotel, great holiday”
Reviews.Author: Stubok
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Monte Carlo for our 1st anniversary. As always, I'll give a totally honest review of everything I think is relevant. 1. The Hotel Although this is one of the older hotels, everything was really clean. Unlike some of the others, we didnt need a sat nav to find our room from reception. The room was a good size, really clean with a really big and comfortable bed. Big wide screen TV with good channel choice.The safe was free to use and a good enough size to keep things like valuables and wallets in it. The bathroom was clean and the shower was pretty good. Again, it was all very clean and the room will be cleaned every day (unless you're in it when they turn up obviously). 2. The Casino Really nice casino. Not sprawling and all over the place like some of the other hotels (planet hollywood etc). Waitresses were really friendly and always kept coming back with more drinks. Plenty of tables/machines to keep you entertained. 3. The pool This is the only slight criticism. The pool area is not very big compared to some others and there is always a queue at 9am when they open up. Most of those people would just go in at 9 and leave their towels on the loungers and then disappear off for breakfast or whatever else. It took a couple of days to find the best sun loungers where you were guaranteed to get a decent amount of sun. Lots of palm trees around the whole pool area means that you need to be very careful about being blocked out. I can see it being more of an issue in the off season when the sun is lower. It was really busy over the weekend and there were lots of people without loungers who just had to hang around on the edge of the pool. Quite a lot of loud music but it was good music so didn't bother us at all. 4. Facilities Check in was pretty quick and friendly. The food court was handy for lunchtimes or a cheap evening dinner. "The Pub" does excellent food and it's quite reasonable. The burgers are highly recommended. There are 2 Starbucks (as the rooms don't have coffee making facilities), and both were quite busy in the mornings. The concierge was really helpful and helped us to find places we were looking for by printing off maps, directions and bus timetable for the Duece Bus. There is a tram connecting the Monte Carlo with the new city centre hotels and the Bellagio which is really handy. It's also free. 5. Overall experience. As always, you get what you pay for. We got 9 nights (including flight) for £1600. I really couldn't complain about anything to be honest, we really enjoyed our time there. Yes it may be a bit more dated than some of the other hotels on the strip, but only by Vegas standards. The staff were friendly, all the facilities (including the room) were really clean and it had everything you need. The ONLY annoying thing (and this is nothing to do with the hotel) is there there isn't a single book store on the strip. The 2 that are in the brochures have both closed down (mandalay bay and Fashion Show mall). We managed to find a Borders in the new Town Square development south of the strip (about 10 minutes on the Duece Bus). Otherwise bring plenty of books with you if you plan to read by the pool during the day. PS, we requested a high floor room with a strip view before we travelled and thats exactly what we got.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: TarbyEssex
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a week at the Monte Carlo. The overall experience was excellent. It is relatively inexpensive and in a superb central Strip location. The rooms are fine and kept very clean. My only real gripe is about the lack of fridge, coffee maker or even glasses to use when having a drink Definitely a hotel I would recommend

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room and a wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: HeathSchneider
Reviews.Content: Let's start from the beginning...no one in Vegas does valet parking as well as The Monte Carlo. Their valet service is terrific and if you've ever been to the Flamingo, Harrah's, The Venetian, Caesar's, etc, you know how bad it can get. Their valet service set the tone for the entire visit -- professional, quick service with a smile. We had the spa suite with a request for a Strip view and the highest floor available. Cha-ching...Strip view and the 23th floor. Perfect. The hotel room was everything we hoped for and so much more. The spa was enormous -- nothing like those "built for two" but no room to move spas in other hotels. Throw in the steam shower and it was perfect. The spa sat directly beneath the large bay window so you had a view of the Strip while you relaxed. Terrific. The rest of the room was just as good -- bar, sitting area and king-sized bed all set up nicely to entertain and relax. The folks at the Monte Carlo don't get the props they deserve for their friendly service. Everytime we met with people from the hotel, it was always professional and courteous. The pool (especially the lazy river) was very crowded, but the July heat pushes people to the water. They do charge to rent innertubes but they allow you to bring in your own (some hotels do not allow that). Twice they ran out of towels at the pool while we were there. Within an hour the fresh towels were delivered. We stayed for 5 nights and enjoyed the entire trip.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo- Worst Service Worst Sleep Loud”
Reviews.Author: bias4798
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over memorial weekend and this is one of the worst hotels iv'e ever stayed at in Vegas... They said they upgraded but def down graded in service. We had to wait for hours at 2Pm as they said rooms were dirty and they were short handed on cleaners(dumb since it was a busy weekend) took 3 hours before we got a room and as we arrived lady still cleaning..We ordered room service and it took hour and a half to call and recieve then our cart of dirty food sat in front of our room for 2 days. Everytime you ride in the elevator you will hear the same advertisments over & over(annoying) The beds are hard as a rock, linens are nice and flat screen nice but small... They copy everybody else at the pool- played such loud music you had to scream to talk, so the pool is very loud, not relaxing what so ever. They need to upgrade there speakers outside cause it kept cutting out every couple min(left the pool cause they ruined my relaxing time) Also stayed here for floating river, it's a lie- they have one and it's extremely small not even worth going into.. D.vino is a good italian place with good service...Don't plan on getting a drink while gambling here also, couldn't find anybody and if you did they were so rude..

Reviews.Title: “Vegas is like Marmite you either love it or hate it!”
Reviews.Author: ashleyB_187
Reviews.Content: Myself and my friend went to Vegas for a girlie week in Feb, the weather was 23ish degrees which was good for us. It was sunny enough to enjoy it but not hot enough that we didnt do anything. The Monte Carlo hotel was fabulous, it didnt have free wifi but luckily the macdonalds inhouse did. The service was excellent and the food superb. We went and had a drink at the Eiffel Tower Restuarant overlooking the Bellagio fountains which were fantastic. We went to Maddam Tussards which we thoroughly enjoyed. We took a gondola ride in the Veneitian. We did the open top bus tour which gave us a great sense of direction and where everything was. We and saw Holly Maddison in the peep Show at Planet Hollywood, gambled in the Bellagio. Saw the lions in MGM, went to Sharks reef in Mandalay Bay. We did so much in a week in Vegas we needed another holiday to get over it!!

Reviews.Title: “It was just fine!”
Reviews.Author: Platinouno
Reviews.Content: We used to stay at the Sahara before she closed, so had to find somewhere else to stay and chose the Monte Carlo. Upon check in the girl at the front desk never smiled, not once, and seemed a little put off when we asked questions. We got our room and headed up. Just as booked, we got a strip view. With some many other hotels being closer to the strip, and the Monte Carlo being placed further back, you did get to see some of the strip, but not as much as I had hoped. But that's ok, at least I didn't have to look at a parking lot. The location on the strip is good, as you can get anywhere you want from there walking or on the trams that run between the like owned hotels. The room was basic, clean with enough room for the two of us not to trip on on another. My one beef about the room is the bathroom. Over the sink is well lit, but the shower is another thing. First off, the shower head is quite low so I had to put it up as far as it would go and duck to get my head wet. Secondly, the shower is so poorly lit that I had to figure out how to shave my legs without it looking like a murder scene, but this too was overcome with a little creativity. Our room was made up every day with new lotion, shampoo etc. The housekeeping staff was very friendly. Our TV did not work upon arriving, and it took the fellow just a few minutes to come up and repair it which was fine because we were waiting for our luggage. The safe would not open for me, and again it took but a few minutes for them to come up and repair it. The casino is large and easy to get turned around in, but we had fun there. The 24 hour food court is a bonus! You can eat after a long night with no waiting. I you go, you must go to the Japanese Noodle house!! The portions are huge, and the calamari is devine. All and all, I would stay there again. The prices are fair, the service is better than good and of course location was great!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not amazing”
Reviews.Author: Moqui_Girl
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to Vegas in recent years and we chose the Monte Carlo as we were staying with friends and it suited everyone's budget. We paid slightly more to upgrade to a Monaco Suite and we were very happy with the room overall. The rooms are HUGE and are located just by the elevators so are very convenient. There were a couple of scratches on the furniture which showed its age a little but this did not really bother us. The decor was pleasant and the bed was large and very comfortable. We also suffered with burnt smelling towels but it was a minor issue for us. We were placed on the 4th floor which i was initially very disappointed by and they had no other rooms available to be able to move us. However, we had a view over towards NYNY so it wasn't so bad and we had the added bonus of being able to get wifi! The Monte Carlo doesn't advertise the availability of wifi but I know some other people have been able to get it. Therefore if wifi is important to you, try asking for a low floor as our friends on the 22nd floor could not get it. The location of the hotel is good and as such we spend very little time there. We only ate once, at Starbucks, for breakfast and we didn't gamble there at all. We used the pool twice and had not problems getting loungers as long as we wanted to sit in the shade, which we did. We used the self park garage as its is very convenient and just a short walk across a walkway on the second floor to get to the hotel lobby. I had no really issues with the hotel but if we came to Vegas again we would probably stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite place to stay and inexpensive”
Reviews.Author: Shelley07
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at this resort and we will be returning annually. Love this place!!! Rooms clean, cheap and great location. Free tram from hotel goes to aria, crystals, and bellagio. Great for people who want to save themselves from blisters. Food court is decent. We didnt eat at any of the sit down restaurants because we usually left the hotel and went out at night. Pool is great, with wave pool and lazy river and a couple smaller pools and hot tub. Im sure there are more luxiourious hotels on the strip, but for the price, and if you arent extremely fussy, this s a GREAT PLACE!!!!!!! Join their email club and you'll get a promo code to book your next trip. Was about 350 after all resort fees and taxes for FIVE nights. Cant beat it for location.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay, when you know what to expect!”
Reviews.Author: siloet19
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Monte Carlo and thoroughly enjoyed myself. I had been there before and would go back in a second. The rooms were clean for the most part. They have the new duvet covers, which are cleaned daily as opposed to the old style of comforter and blanket that get washed once every so often. New flat screen tv's and wired high speed interned made the room comfortable along with climate controlled a/c. Bathroom was a modern style and the room had a very nice feel to it. The only issue I encountered was loud music on my 4th night there. It turned out that they play music at the pool from Noon-5pm on Thursday through Sunday, so if you like to sleep during that time make sure you get a room not facing the pool. I had to switch rooms, but they were accommodating and while it was a little annoying it is important not to let things like that bother you. There were a few hairs in the bathroom, but as any real traveler or anyone in the hotel business will tell you, it is next to impossible to avoid. Really the key is knowing what to expect and for the location and room, I could not complain.

Reviews.Title: “Nice price, nice location on strip”
Reviews.Author: thomasons
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for 2 reasons. Location and price. We weren't disappointed in either one. Monte Carlo is located in a good position on the strip where you can walk to numerous other hotels, which is what we wanted to do. The rooms are nice, clean, comfortable. The pool was not as impressive. It was not big, and it was hard to find a chair to sit in. It was a nice area, just not big enough. The food court was pretty decent, you had 4 or 5 choices of fast food, and then, the nicer resturants. The Jaberwakees video in the elevator will drive you insane! The casinos at Monte Carlo are nice and the dealers are better than the others at other casinos we encountered! When I thought I had left an item behind at the hotel, the staff was very helpful in checking with the currents guests to see if they had found my item. (or at least they returned my phone call and acted like it!). Would stay there again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “They're a step above most strip hotels”
Reviews.Author: Jang-Hale
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 10th floor for two nights. The walls are thin so noise (water running, TV and talking etc.) from the neighbours are quite noticeable. The gaming area is spacious, good variety of slots and tables to choose from. I like the dancers above the blackjack tables. The dining decor at the restaurants doesn't seem as inviting as the Venetian's or Bellegio's so we ate elsewhere. There's a pool for a refreshing dip on those +30C. days. The bar/pub by the hotel mall is nice and there's two Starbucks outlets for a decent cup of java (the wi-fi is awful though). They do provide a free USA Today to keep you up-to-date and all of the staff seem friendly but some of the desk staff doesn't seem very knowledgeable with the strip. I would come back but this hotel might not be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good service and great pools!”
Reviews.Author: murphygreen
Reviews.Content: I go to Vegas and have stayed in lots of hotels on the strip. This was my first time at the Monte Carlo and I was wondering by some of the reviews it might be a mistake. But as usual we always get good rooms and good service. Lucky I guess. The checkin was fast, we arrived early but still got a room with a view of the strip. Yes the rooms are dated but unless you want to stay at one of the newer hotels alot of the rooms in Vegas are dated. The room was clean and beds comfortable. We did not get the towels that smelled like smoke! The pool areas was great with a good pool, lazy river, and a wave pool. We ate at the Pub at happy hour and had the sliders for $1.00 each. They we great! We also ate at the Mexican, Noodle House and they were both good and so was the service. The casino is smaller than some other hotels but it was nice. The cocktail waitresses we alway around to serve you a beverage and the service was good there too. So other than some dated furniture we had a great stay and would reccommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but loud”
Reviews.Author: Patm123
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times since it first opened, but not in the last 6 years so decided to try it again. It's always had a great location and with the new improvements and reopened tram, figured it would be a good time. It's still a nice place but I must now rank it as the loudest of any hotel I've stayed due to the music they have going at various locations. My room was on the 23rd floor overlooking the pool so every morning at 10:00AM they would turn on music in the pool area which would stay on until about 4;00PM. Even on the 23rd floor, it was so loud thru closed windows, you would have to raise the volume of the radio or TV set in your room if on. However where this really bothered me was the fitness center. The music there was so overwhelming, I could not listen to my own Ipod. I went to the desk to ask the attendant to turn it down and had to raise my voice to actually get his attention. He advised that they have no control over the volume, it's a management decision.. Several other people I met in the gym also complained. It was absurdly loud for what is a relatively small room. Since going to the gym daily is something I enjoy, this issue really put a damper on my stay and my opinion of the hotel. Too bad, because otherwise it's very nice. Had a great massage in their salon, their buffet is much improved and I really liked the new sushi bar. The staff is professional and friendly, rooms comfortable and clean, and I had great luck in the casino. It's obvious the hotel is trying to attract a younger demographic but if you are over the age of 30, you may find areas of the Monte Carlo uncomfortable. I like loud music too, but confine it to my car or Ipod.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: fave5
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel to Vegas three times a year and we have stayed at most of the hotels on the strip. The Monte Carlo has very average rooms. They have upgraded the bedding which was a nice change from previous trips. The reason we stay here when we do is because of the location. Very close to many hotels and has a great tram that will take you to the City Center and Bellagio. It's also the only hotel where the elevator, registration desk, pool and the food court are all right by each other and you don't have to walk a mile all over the casino going from one place to the other. That alone is worth a lot in my opinion!! The food is HORRIBLE at the cafe. We really like Diablo's. So if you want some close, cheap food options and an average room close to other hotels, this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are just okay, but service was excellent”
Reviews.Author: VancouverHamish
Reviews.Content: I won this trip and didn't have a choice of hotels, but after staying at the Cosmopolitan last month, it was hard to be happy with such a mediocre, nothing special room. It was free though, so I really can't complain. At least the rooms were clean and the location was very central. The Monte Carlo lobby and hotel itself was quite nice though. The one thing I can say is that their check-in and check-out was extremely efficient and that the service in all areas of the hotel was excellent. We were greeted in a friendly manner by every single hotel employee. You can't say that about the awful service at the Cosmopolitan.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: laney2010
Reviews.Content: Very basic average hotel has all the facilities you need nothing special but it's not terrible

Reviews.Title: “Love noise and smoke - then this is great!”
Reviews.Author: imabcqt
Reviews.Content: Disappointing stay at the Monte Carlo although I've stayed there before several years ago. Basic Room, a bit tired but no major complaints in this department, the bed was comfortable. My biggest complaint is that compared to other casinos i found the air circulation terrible and had difficulty breathing there unless I was at another casino or on the strip. Also was going for a quiet getaway and asked specifically about the pool parties, hoping to avoid one. Well on Thursday on the 17th floor overlooking the pool you could feel the windows shake in our room and I could hear the lyrics perfectly to the terrible house/dance music being blasted at the pool down below. I can only imagine how loud it would have been @ the pool with only 1 guy I could see raving in the pool having the time of his life. If you want to smoke, get drunk and don't care about your room - this is the place for you. If you want a high quality, quiet but fun atmosphere - look elsewhere. Also be aware, $15/day resort fees do apply to their rooms with very little benefits.

Reviews.Title: “not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Dallas77_11
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a 4 star rating. The exterior and lobby of the hotel are very nice. The rooms are in need of updates. The furniture is traditional and it was chipping. The only updates, there are flat screen televisions in the room. When we arrived at 9pm the bathroom was not cleaned, there was hair on the sink and on the toilet. There was also something on the bedding and needed to be changed. The carpet in the halls also needed to be cleaned. The hotel did send someone up asap. These things should have been done prior to arrival. When I visit Vegas again, I will stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome ! Good service and excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: MarijkeGeoffrey
Reviews.Content: We booked the monte carlo for 3 nights. We were making a worldtrip that ended in USA. The last few days were spenden on the west coast and offcourse we had to stay in las vegas. We choose the monte carlo based on internet ratings and rates. We had a deluxe strip vieuw room. Amazing ! Good beds, large tv, free internet and a nice shower and bath. The casino is good, tables are not to expensive and everything you need is there, restaurants, mc donalds, swimming pool, shops, it's never ending ! Location is excellent on the strip and next to the other big casino's as MGM, New York New York etc. We will definately return some day !

Reviews.Title: “Great value, clean rooms, friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Lada70
Reviews.Content: We spend two nights in this hotel and all I can say that it was beyond our expectations. Rooms were nice and clean, excellent service. You dont have to spend a fortune to feel comfortable and cozy. We booked the rooms in advance and it was worth every penny. If you are looking for great value do not go any further. This hotel is on the Strip...there is MGM and Hard Rock Cafe and Ross also conveniently located just across the street. The Buffet in the hotel is average but for that price you can find a good selection of food from seafood to salads.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't go back”
Reviews.Author: SJJ21
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights mid-week in May. Room ok if a little tired looking. No tea/coffee making facilities in room. Towels stank like stale cooking oil which followed you everywhere if you used them. Music in the pool area is very loud and annoying if you want to chill out. Hotel was otherwise reasonably quiet, although we were on 20th floor! Public areas were fine.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific”
Reviews.Author: pudypo
Reviews.Content: Our Family had 4 different rooms at the hotel and I read reviews and was almost afraid of staying here, but to my surprise I thought it was great especially when traveling with children. Yes, the music from the pool was loud, but ask for a room not facing the pool and it was fine. Food court especially great for kids food. Ammenites are close not a far walk to pool , food, front desk or casino ( some hotels you walk forever ) Pool was crowded but what do you expect for a Vegas week-end. A middle age to young crowd. No, not the Bellagio but affordable and clean. Linens were great ,towels did not smell and we saw a king deluxe a double bed standard , Diamond Suite and Monaco Suite none of our family had any complaints. I have stayed at most all the MGM properties and the rooms at Monte Carlo are comparable to the MGM if not better.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: glinda1
Reviews.Content: It's on the south end of the Strip, between Aria and New York New York. We had a 25th floor, Strip view room on a non-smoking floor. By booking early, we got room rates of $53 - $98, depending on day. The rooms are standard, but adequate. Beds are very comfy. There was no grab bar in the shower, however. The hotel is set back from the Strip, so we also had a view of the roof and its equipment. I wish the room offered a coffeemaker. Check in was efficient and staff was friendly. We used valet, doorman, and bellboy service. The casino is smallish, but that's not a problem. Slots were tight, but they were the same everywhere on the Strip and on Fremont Street. Pool was fine, but I dislike the extra loud music that blares incessantly. We really had no problems, however. It's well within our budget and we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Overpromise under-deliver”
Reviews.Author: Camommee
Reviews.Content: We were in Vegas for a wedding and brought our 2 year old. According to website and in room material they have 4 pools: wave pool, lazy river, kids pool and pool. Unfortunately they changed the kids pool to a VIP area where you need to pay to enjoy the 2 foot deep pool and share it with drinking, smoking and partying adults. I am sorry if you advertise a kids pool you dam well better have one. Also we paid extra for a room with a view of the strip. Our window on the 27 floor was so dirty it was very difficult to see through it let alone enjoy a view of the strip! We will definitely not be staying there again! Very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - new, clean and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: mariya0504
Reviews.Content: Great value for what you get. The hotel is much newer compared to half of the hotels on the Strip. No old carpets in the lobby and the casino which makes a big difference. Not as expensive as Bellagio, MGM, Paris but the service you get is as good. The lobby area is close to the elevators and you don't need to walk miles to get to your room. The pool area is nice (including wave pool) and sand volleyball playground. The buffet is average but good value - $16 per person that's cheaper than many others. The hotel does not have a great night club or anything like that but all the cool bars and clubs are within walking distance so that's not a big deal.

Reviews.Title: “lively and ideal location”
Reviews.Author: yoz80
Reviews.Content: Was pleasantly surprised with the monte carlo after reading a few reviews on here,the location is excellent opposite the MGM and next to the city center which is also accessible as is the bellagio by the free monorail from the monte carlo.The pool was large and at the weekend was bouncing with dj's, drink offers and the weekend vegas party crowd.Having been to Wet Republic parties at the MGM on a previous visit the monte carlo's pool party atmosphere could definetely hold it's own! The rooms were large and clean,the only negative was the smell near the front of the hotel near diablo's which I heard from a barmaid was from the drains and was due to be rectified at considerable expense.This was a minor issue as we spent most of our time hitting the strip.The smell was confined mainly to the front of the hotel and reading a few reviews on here people are definetely over reacting! The pro's far outweighed any cons,we didn't try any of the restaurants so couldnt comment on those although the food court was quite pricey! In summary the hotel was clean, the staff were friendly and it wasa great place to chill/party by the pool and crash after hitting the vegas nightlife for a great price!

Reviews.Title: “Lost its class!!”
Reviews.Author: awaydaysNorthWest
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and another couple in our 60's stayed 4 nights. My husband and I recommended this hotel to our first time in Vegas friends as we had stayed there twice before. I was embarassed that I had raved about this beautiful classy hotel!!!! Not what it was. Totally let down. Grubby and noisy compared to all the new hotels around it it has lost its touch. Pool area plays the loudest heavy rock music at the week-ends so careful which room you get. If you want an hour by the pool to just rest a while. Forget it! We all love to party but this was deafening!! Buffet great but will not return to the Monte Carlo when visiting Vegas again.

Reviews.Title: “Had a WONDERFUl time!”
Reviews.Author: WINyes
Reviews.Content: Was a little nervous about staying here after reading some of the reviews. It's amazing on how different the same stay can be. We had a great time and thought the room was beautiful! We got exactly what we asked for - king bed, non-smoking, strip view room. While there was nothing fancy about the room, it was clean, spacious and very modern nice. The hotel staff was very nice overall. Check-in was a breeze at 9:30am and the guy nice. Check-out was a little confusing, they could have more/better signs on what to do and where to go. Check-out girl was ok. Asked how our stay was but didn't seem to give a hoot what I said. She was the "fake-nice" which is the type of person that drives me crazy. Overall, the location, the room, hotel maids, service was great. If there weren't other places that I want to try we would definitly stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and less pricey alternative to nearby 5 star hotels.”
Reviews.Author: digitalsabre
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed here. The first time I stayed here was 6 years ago and remember it being somewhat average then, not much has changed at the Monte Carlo in that time. This year we stayed in room 14-122. It has a view of the new City Center and the Monte Carlo pool area. This hotel has obviously aimed itself at being an alternative to the nearby higher end hotels. Average isn't necessarily bad, it's just not as impressive as the newer properties. The location is good though, and is connected to City Center (Aria, etc) and Bellagio via a tram. Here are some of the things that make this an average hotel... There were some issues with the drains in the sink and tub draining slow and the button in the bathroom was missing. Although I felt the room was relatively clean, there were a few things that I have to mention. The comforters were white, and they had a suspicious stain on one of them. Also, there was what appeared to be cleaning solution on the bathroom door that wasn't totally wiped up. The casino is a nice size, but not extravagant. Kind of like a miniature version of MGM Grand's casino, much more manageable as far as walking. The smoke was a little think at times during the busier evenings but not bad in the mornings and afternoons. The dealers I spoke to were all very nice. The pool area was at one time one of the best in Vegas, but over time other resorts have surpassed it. There is a wave pool, a lazy river, a hot tub, and a beach area for playing volleyball, which is more than a lot of resorts. It is just not as tropical as some resort pools, it's would be really open feeling, except for the fact the facade of the hotel is looming over you the whole time. I didn't eat at any of the full service restaurants at the hotel, except for the store that sells cupcakes and a few places in the food court. I did hear that Brand Steakhouse was really good though. Even with all of it's 'Averageness' it is still a good value for those who don't want to spend more for a higher end resort.

Reviews.Title: “It was fine, comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: noreply110
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed our stay here. Didn't really like the location, but that has nothing to do with the hotel itself. The beds were nice, the rooms were clean, the maid service was great. Seriously make sure to visit the spa on the second floor. There is a sperate men's and women's hot tub and steamroom. Very nice. Nothing negative to say.

Reviews.Title: “All i'd hoped for and more”
Reviews.Author: colliewobbles50
Reviews.Content: Having read a number of reviews some good some not so good wasnt sure what to expect. We stayed in the monoco suites and they were fabulous. Yes there were a few stains on the carpet but no more than you would expect from a quick turn over hotel but otherwise the room and indeed the hotel was spotless. We had a strip view which was breathtaking and Its central location is brill to get to everywhere. Staff were always courteous and polite and very helpful. Cant wait to go back !!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with great casino”
Reviews.Author: maryc82
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night to celebrate husbands birthday. Originally booked a spa suite but the wonderful check in person upgraded us to a Diamond Spa Suite in the Hotel 32 section of Monte Carlo. Beautiful clean corridor leading to the room, which had a marble entrance, living room, wet bar, double doors to a beautiful large bedroom leadin to the bathroom with the biggest spa bath I have ever seen, 6 people could have fit in comfortably. Enjoyed the casino, lively and good fun. We had a nice meal in the Cafe with very pleasant service. The assistant manager of the Cafe came and apologised for the delay in our order and chatted with us in a very pleasant manner. He later came back to our table to check on our meal and to enquire if it was satisfactory. Nice.

Reviews.Title: “New Years”
Reviews.Author: 4EvaCanadian
Reviews.Content: This was my wife and I's first time in Vegas so we decided to go for New Years with other couples all staying at the Monte Carlo because of the better prices. The first thing I would like to say is that it is an older hotel on the strip so it is pretty plain jane compared to other hotels on the strip. Our experiece with checking in and checking out was fabulous and when ever we needed help with anything the hotel staff was very good in helping us, I really have No complaints about this hotel except for the fact that is was a bit older. The BEST part of the hotel is the location, it is dead center on the strip and right next to City Center which is beautiful in every way, there is also a mono rail that runs all the way to the Bellagio which was great. Staying in Vegas we did notice that you only spend about 6-8 hours in your room only to sleep so we came to the conclusion that staying at Monte Carlo was perfect for the price,if you plan on staying longer in your room or your just a baller then it would be better to get a nicer hotel like the Cosmopolitan at City Center which was awesome. All in all a great hotel for the money... And spending New Years in Vegas with friends is too much Fun. Can't wait to go back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Should have picked a different hotel....”
Reviews.Author: tottyteacher
Reviews.Content: Let me preface this review by saying I have never been to Vegas before. I stayed with 3 girlfriends at the MonteCarlo..we had three double rooms on the 13 th floor. I thought the room was clean ( even the bathroom) and the beds were comfortable but .the carpet was dirty looking and it was rather gross to walk around in barefeet. We were in a room that faced the pool and everyday at precisely 9:00 am they began playing loud club music which just increased in volume as the day wore on. If you are a light sleeper and don't feel like getting up at 9am request a room that does not face the pool. The pool was packed on the weekend and very hard to get a seat together with my friends, because the majority of the seats had been "reserved" by towels and left to sit for the rest of the day. The music is so loud you might as well forget about having a conversation with anyone even the person in the next seat. You cannot bring any food or drink into the pool...well most people can't...some people got in with their Starbucks others had to drink it outside the pool area. Don't even think about bringing in your own bottle of water...they won't let you because they want you to pay the $5 to buy it. The slushy drinks are expensive....$11 if you get a small glass...I think the "boot" was much cheaper at $16.....but wow...sometimes you just don't feel like drinking that much ..just be prepared to pay for the privilege of getting a small drink. After walking through the other hotels I got the distinct feeling I was staying at the poor cousins place. There isn't much in the way of interesting things to look at, very few shops just very unspectacular...no big grand Vegas feel to it. Also, you'd think you could get some food somewhere after 10pm....no. Just in the Caffe. They stop serving food at 10 in all the other places. The Pub was good...lots of nice beers and great $1 sliders for happy hour and Diablo's make a great Margarita. ( $39/jug) The casino?? Well I don't know...I have never gambled before....but the other hotels just felt nicer and less dingy. I know that this was a cheaper option and if it all you can afford then you will probably enjoy yourself, but if you can splurge even a bit more...go somewhere you'll remember. Not the Monte Carlo.

Reviews.Title: “Lost its luster”
Reviews.Author: mark110
Reviews.Content: Made our second trip to the MC May 12-15 with another couple. Last trip was 3 years ago. First the good: The Pub, the casino, the public areas, the tram access to City Center and Bellagio, the walkway to Aria; all good. The casino, the lobby, and the public areas seem to sparkle. And the location is still hard to beat. The Pub, no longer brewing beer, now has a tremendous menu of beers from around the world with many on tap.
