But the bad...Unfortunately, the Monte Carlo is starting to show it age in several places, specifically the rooms. We stayed in a deluxe guest room (7th floor), and our friends were in a Monaco Suite also on the 7th floor. The Monaco Suite had been remodeled but the remodel was poor; cheap furnishing. The deluxe room was so beat up I don't know where to start. The windows were so filthy we could not see out of them. The noise from the street (we were on the 7th floor and it still penetrated the room) and through the paper-thin walls required us to purchase earplugs to sleep. We also had a terrible sewage smell that crept into the bathroom each day in the morning, then again in the afternoon. It never stayed, however. It was more annoying than intrusive. The just OK....The pool. Lots of people, mainly 20-30 year olds who enjoy the loud DJ-fueled music and frozen drinks by the yard. Pool area was clean, and pretty well-kept all day long.

Reviews.Title: “OK Room, Front Desk Slow, Resort Fees Stink and Terrible Pillows”
Reviews.Author: TheDitz
Reviews.Content: Our first time to Vegas but not our first stay in a nice hotel. Stayed Tuesday thru Saturday May 10-14 in room 7-227. My wife reserved two rooms for us and our travel companions. Requested adjoining King bed rooms but upon check-in our friends had to settle for two queens on the same floor. When they went to their room, other guests were already in the room! So after much ado, our friends were re-assigned a new room on a new floor. This entire process took about 45 minutes. The front desk staff, though courteous, said that they had a "new software". If so, it stunk and there were new trainees all over the front desk that knew nothing so the process took FOREVER. Several times electronic room keys did not work. The room was actually OK but upon arrival, we had to call for new bed linens as there seemed to be a large brown stain (blood?) on our top sheet. Housekeeping was there in a flash. The room walls are VERY thin. My wife heard one couple apparently enjoying themselves very much and another night I was awakened several times by guys partying and yelling in a room nearby. I was so tired I didn't even care. The bed was very comfortable but the pillows are like HUGE bricks. Did not eat the buffet so can't comment there but the $1 happy hour burger sliders and wings at the PUB were good as was our dinner at the Cafe (comped by the front desk for all the foul-ups on check-in). Positives? The Tram to Bellagio can get you down the strip quickly. Go past the pub and upstairs to get it. Go out the front of the hotel (through the casino) and a 24 hour CVS is right there. You can actually buy water, food and tobacco for regular prices. Prices at all the strip hotel gift shops are like the airport and cinemas. I refuse to pay $4 for a bottle of H2O. The Monte Carlo is actually located in a good spot on the strip so the positives outweigh the negatives for this review. It could have been better but then again, it's what you are willing to do to get what you want. The only thing that really stuck in my craw was the $17 PER DAY "resort fee". What a bunch of crap. Just charge me for the room and be done with it. Hard wired ethernet cable to boot! No free wireless in today's day is against the rules! Once again, checkout took 40 minutes because my wife spotted that we had been overcharged by almost $50. I think they have to do a lot of what they do because their casino is not actually all that large compared to some of the others I saw. Anything below $10 blackjack is mostly unavailable on the strip hotels. If you find one here or there, they are always full. Go downtown to the Freemont Experience and gamble there. $5 blackjack if you get there before 3 or 4 p.m. After that, they raise the minimums as well but if you are lucky enough to be on the table, they grandfather you in at $5.

Reviews.Title: “NICE HOTEL, but...”
Reviews.Author: Judepude
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at Monte Carlo. I had found it had gone downhill a bit in the last couple of years but still very nice. The beds were really comfortable. The pool was nice but good luck getting your legs in between the seats - crammed in there like sardines. My biggest criticism would be that you can only take Starbuck's products out to the pool. Even though they have other eateries in the food fair in the Hotel, Starbuck's is the only eatery that you're allowed to take to the pool. Maybe a few signs posted would be helpful. Bought coffee at McDonalds (in the same food fair as Starbuck's) and wasn't allowed to take it to the pool (same as bottled water). A few too many rules for my liking.

Reviews.Title: “great location on strip”
Reviews.Author: zobo1
Reviews.Content: recently stayed at the monte carlo resort and casino for one week with my boyfriend for my 21st birthday! stayed in room 24-105 booked a standard room which had two double beds much bigger than what i expected and has huge plasma screen in room. The monte carlo hotel has a good casino and food court with subway mcdonalds handy for breakfast or snacks also has buffet and few restaurants. There is a tram which is free from the hotel and stops at crystals shopping and vdara and the bellagio. the hotel also has a great pool area with lazy river, wave pool, hot tub and regular pool although no drinks are allowed to be brought out in to this area. the only down side was the spa area on the second floor is separate for men and women which meant me and my boyfriend couldnt go together and therefore didnt use the spa area. the hotel is right next to new york hotel and opposite mgm great location. Overall would def stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “The room was alright until I went into the bathroom”
Reviews.Author: lovelylanna
Reviews.Content: I stayed in room 7-218 for 4 nights. The room was ok. Relatively clean room but the bathroom was outdated and the water in the bathtub ran constantly (as if a wrench was needed to turn it completely off) and the sink drained slowly. I considered changing rooms after the first night of hearing water all night, but after talking with my travel companions, I learned two had requested room changes. One room was sold as a on smoking room but smelled of cigarette smoke. The other had a very dirty bathroom. Neither thought the new room was that much better. The walls in this hotel are very thin. Arriving on Tuesday has its perks. No long lines any where....not at the tables in the casino, food court or restaurants. On Thursday night, the crowds arrived. Room service orders were served within 40 minutes and the staff was very pleasant. Friday and Saturday the front desk and room service telephone lines had you on hold for long periods of time. When I left the hotel on Saturday afternoon the large lobby was packed. I did not check out when I left on Saturday (via television in room nor front desk) rather I called on my way to the airport. I was placed on hold two different times. The first time for 15 minutes. The second time for 24 minutes. My suggestion is to check out using the television in your room. Would I stay at the Monte Carlo again? Not on my dime. There are other hotels within the same price range with more modern ammenities.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: TootingLondon
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly impressed by the Monte Carlo. It wasn't a hotel I had heard about before and, whilst it didn't have quite the glitz or glamour of the more famous Vegas hotels like the MGM or Bellagio it was exactly what I was after. Most importantly, it is right on the strip in a good location, and connected to the Bellagio by a free monorail, so you can see all the Vegas sights easily. My room was very nice, and the entire hotel was very clean. Food was fine, with a number of options for dining and drinking in the hotel, but I generally preferred to eat out depending on where the shows I wanted to see that night were (though I did stop at the Cupcakery cupcake cafe and the frozen cocktail bar a fair few times!). The casino floor perhaps wasn't as glitzy as those in some of the other hotels, but I'm not much of a gambler so that didn't bother me. Also the fitness center was fine, but not mind-blowing - a few treadmills and bikes, plus some weights machines. Sadly because I was there in December the outdoor pool was closed.

Reviews.Title: “Good location on the strip”
Reviews.Author: Margaret_lishmund
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location on the strip next to New New York hotel. We stayed here for 2 nights in a deluxe room. The room was big and a very good standard. It is a big hotel but is easier to navigate your way round compared to the very large hotels such as the Luxor. The staff are friendly but the check in was quite rushed, and we were not given resort information ,or told that we get 25% discount off show tickets at the hotel. We had to get a map of the area in a free leaflet in the street. There is a wide range of food outlets in the hotel. Expect drinks to be expensive as you would in London, but there are bars which do Happy Hour Deals.

Reviews.Title: “don't be worried by the negative reviews”
Reviews.Author: hayley211498
Reviews.Content: we were worried about staying at this hotel due to all the negative reviews but they were banished as soon as were arrived at the hotel.We stayed on the 8th floor and had a great view of the pool and some of the strip.Pool area can get a bit crowded but aim for end seats and you don't feel people get on top of you.Rooms were very clean and service within hotel was excellent.Location could not be bettered and recommend you aim for the market place for breakfast and a good night out away from the casino's.Only downside is the strange and sometimes overpowering smell within the casino

Reviews.Title: “Great for the money”
Reviews.Author: JuliaT31
Reviews.Content: Ideal spot for seeing all of the hotels as its almost at the start of the strip. Great pool but can get a little crowded. Was a bit worried by other reviews on here but the room was very clean and not dated like other reviews have said. We stayed on the 22nd floor and did not have a great view but it was ideal for what we needed it for. It was large and comfortable. The hotel shop is very expensive for essential items but next door is a pharmacy that sells everything at half of the price. Try not to use the ATM machines as they charge a small fortune to take money out, the shop next door does cashback at a fraction of the hotel price.

Reviews.Title: “There are better options in Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: fossilgirl
Reviews.Content: I've been to Vegas several times but this was my first time staying at the Monte Carlo. Decent location and fine rooms but not the place to go if you want to feel like you're at a "resort". The pool is now my least favorite of all the pools I've seen in Vegas. The chairs are practically stacked on top of each other; there is literally no space between them and no space to move them around. They also don't allow outside food and drink. One day we brought our bottled water in with no problems and the next we were not allowed to carry them in. They also charge a $15 "resort fee" that allows you to use the gym, but if you want to use the hot tubs in the locker room you have to pay an additional $10. Overall I'd say if you just want a room to sleep in the Monte Carlo is fine but if you want to lounge by the pool and enjoy the sunshine this is not the place.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: movingon50
Reviews.Content: I felt I owed the hotel a review. I stayed at the Monte Carlo on April 12, 2011 to April 18, 2011. I will definatly return on my next trip to Vegas. The room was clean, the bed was very comfortable. my maid was excellent. The Cafe restaraunt in the hotel had fabulous food. The convenience to the other hotels with the escalators and monorail was a great feature. The pools were great, a lazy river, wave pool and pool with hot tub was very nice. The only thing I complained about was the teenagers working the pool area. One oyoung employee asked to check my pocketbook for alcahol. I hit the roof. She stated the pool area has a bar and restaraunt and doesn't allow outside drinks brought in? I informed this young lady that I was 50 years old and certainly didn't have intentions on sneaking in nips in my purse. I was appauled. I was nicely dressed and wanted to check out the pool area. I didn't have intentions on hanging out there. I voiced my complaint to the manager and he compensated me for being treated like a second class citizen. I will not allow that to sour my stay at the Monte Carlo. Loved it.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: too far from the wild west!
Reviews.Title: “average rooms, fabulous location, great lazy river”
Reviews.Author: Rocker_rep
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights here for a dose of commercialism on a 3 week national parks road trip. It was hotttttt so we got a great rate of $55. Still, we expected more..... The title says it all. The rooms were totally average. Think holiday inn, best western or hampton inn. On previous trips we've stayed at The Mirage, Flamingo, MGM and Harrahs and even harrahs room was better! (it had 2 TVs and was a renovated room) The room only had one tv - even Harrahs had two (a small one in the bathroom). The monte carlo's bathroom was very small. Again, think holiday inn or best western. We weren't there to hang in the room but were surprised how VERY basic it was. It overlooked the pool complex so the view was nice. I peeked into several the next day too, and they were all the same. The location however, is great, as is the pool area. Several pools and a really nice lazy river, the largest we've experienced. We all had a blast! The pool management. was very inconsistent. One day we were allowed to bring in two bottles of water, and two cans of soda. They said we were allowed to bring in "one beveridge per person." The next day my bag was searched and we were told NO beveridges at all. Huh?? We did enjoy dinner in the pub, where i had amazing 'fajita-nachos,' likely the best i've had anywhere. The others all had burgers and enjoyed them. If the price is right, stay here. But i think you can do much better.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay, clean, friendly!”
Reviews.Author: out4thehunt
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Monte Carlo for our 25th anniversary and couldn't have picked a more perfect hotel to stay in. We checked out many hotels while there and for the price it couldn't be beat. The food at the cafe was terrific for breakfast and dinner! They had a McDonald's inside the hotel and Starbucks for coffee. No coffee pots in the rooms. The room we stayed on was strip view and just the perfect size. Your not in your room much anyways. The pools were awesome! The gambling was great as well. I hit it big on one of the slot machines and the dealers were friendly on the black jack tables. Totally recommend Monte Carlo!

Reviews.Title: “Please Knock!”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveler93536
Reviews.Content: I rented two rooms on 5/7/11: 22-113 and 22-115. First I must say that there is an aweful wind noise to the point I thought it was an airport behind us.Granted the Hotel can't control the wind. However, can the maid please knock when entering...around 10:05 am both of our rooms were opened by the maids...without knocking...To bad the man was on his way to the bathroom butt naked! Our door was opened first then the ajoining room door was opened in the same manner....This required me to address the maids. I asked the maids 'isn't check out time at 11:00am?" they replied 'yes'. I then asked what time is it...I got a blank stare. Never in my life have I been in a hotel that opened doors prior to knocking especailly when it's not even check out time. Needless to say...there was no morning Cookie. I kept hearing doors open and was neverous the entire time. Moving on...The pool hostess had me pour out my coffee as there is a no outside food or drink policy...which is understood. What I don't understand is how come after I poured out my coffee and I entered the pool area people were walking around with coffee cups? No worries...so I go to the bar by the lazy river and order coffee...They don't serve coffe! Now I'm perplexed. So I go back to the pool gate hostess and ask her why she made me pour out my coffee when there are plenty of people drinking coffee? Her response...you can only have coffee in the pool area if it Starbucks...That's great...drum roll please....so I held up my starbucks plastic cup and her repsonse was it has to paper starbucks cup! That is absurd! Nice pool atmosphere but not worth the extra attitude and unwritten pool policy. Room service didn't answer the phone...can you say Lost Revenue?!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Johnlcruise
Reviews.Content: I arrived at 4PM and there was no wait to check-in. Was given a room on the 14th floor no smoking and it was great. Room was very clean and the beds where great. My only complant would be the $15.00 extra charge per day. Feel it's a touch too high. sould be more around $10.00. I understand they need to do this for the extras like towles at the pool but come on $15.00 it a touch too much. I spent 3 days at the pool and loved it. All thought the drink prices are a little high and the service slow. I found that most places i went to charge alot for a drink. (Not like home) But Vegas has to make up for this with the lower room prices.. All in all it was a great 3day get away to relax by the pool and enjoy myself. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo not what it used to be!”
Reviews.Author: NJLT
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been travelling from the UK to Las Vegas for the last eight years on our annual holiday. We choose Las Vegas for the wonderful climate, fabulous hotels, excellent shopping and varied nightlife. We usually divide out stay into two hotels, one towards the South of the strip (have stayed in Luxor, MGM, Bellagio and Monte Carlo) and one towards the North end (have stayed in the Palazzo and the Venetian). This was our fourth visit to the Monte Carlo but our first return for some four years. The Monte Carlo used to be one of our first choice hotels, but after this visit, I feel you can now do much better at this end of the strip. I will start with the positives: -Obviously the location has not changed and the hotel is in a good central position. Introduction of the free monorail gives easy access to City Centre and the Bellagio. -This resort doesn’t have the theming or appeal of neighboring resorts and hence doesn’t seem to get the same levels of foot traffic as say the Bellagio. This makes it appear relatively quiet and relaxed inside. -Even though they charge the ridiculous resort fee of $15+tax per night (to get a copy of USA Today, use the gym and print out your boarding cards when you leave), we still managed to get a decent rate. We paid around $120 a night for a Monaco suite, although we did book about 6 months in advance. Now onto the negatives: -Although we got a decent rate, the rooms and furniture are starting to look very tired. Some investment badly needed. -As you can read in many previous reviews, the room towels can badly smell of smoke. Come on Monte Carlo, if so many people are complaining do something about it !!!!! -With the City Centre development now complete, the pool area is now completely surrounded by buildings. Combine this with the way they arrange the sun beds and its like sitting in a car park. At this time of year the surrounding buildings also create a lot of shade, especially for the main pool. It’s a shame because we used to really like this pool area. -New pool rules have been introduced since our last visit, which seem to lack any kind of logic. You now cannot sit by the edge of the pool; you are either in or out. Apparently this is for safety reasons but come on guys, apply some common sense. When we first got moved on, the pool was empty so what emergency access were we blocking? The lifeguards applied this rule ruthlessly throughout our stay, the only exception being to large groups of young males chugging beer…..scared maybe? -Another new rule is you cannot bring any outside food or drink into the pool area, unless it was bought from Starbucks. We were told it was because they owned the onsite Starbucks but none of the others. I can understand this with alcohol and picnics but you couldn’t even take your own bottled water. Surely this is a health risk given the Vegas climate. This rule is again ruthlessly enforced with bag searches. We even witnessed a stroppy attendant telling a lady with medical issues that it was like turning up at a bar with her own beer. -The music played by the pool is loud. In addition, there is a DJ on Thurs-Sun who is even louder, although this was not an issue for us, but could be with some other visitors. Its almost like they’ve changed their target audience for the pool from couples/families to the weekend party crowd. We did visit some of their on site restaurants (The Pub, Diablo’s and D.Vino). The Pub and Diablo’s are pretty much what you’d expect from the price however D.Vino was disappointing. There was a limited menu choice, the staff all dressed in denim (for a slightly upmarket Italian restaurant???), the room was too bright and had no atmosphere. It was kind of like sitting in someones Dining Room! For a similar menu and price, we’d recommend the Wolfgang Puck Brasserie in Crystals. Far superior on all accounts! In summary, if you are after an average hotel with a good location, don’t mind sunbathing in a car park, and are happy to smell a bit singed when you’ve dried yourself with the towels provided, this is a good option. We, however, will not be returning and will be looking for a higher standard of accommodation and facilities in a similar location on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Vihoney27
Reviews.Content: Where should I start....we asked for a non-smoking room and as we walked to our floor, the first thing we smelled was weed and cigarettes. The walls are so thin that every word is heard from the hallway as well as your neighbors as well as the smell of cigarettes seeping through the cheaply made room. There was no welcome menu to look at nor any in-dining service menu. The room did not even have a refrigerator for us to store some water bottles. I took a shower when we first got there assuming that they have a blow dryer, but there was none. I had to leave the room with wet hair! Our view was the roof top. Oh forgot to mention the pool area. Worst set up ive ever seen. There were chairs facing the parking structure and the music was in appropriate for the average guest of all ages. They blasted loud hip hop music that sounded like all horrible base. There were older people who had to wear ear plugs just to relax at the pool. If I wanted to go to a pool and party and look and act like an idiot, I would pay to go to those typ of places, but not for just a regular hotel. We stayed at Aria two nights prior because of the ood rates and had excellent time there. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. Overall I had a horrible experience. If you think about it MGM owns half of the strip so don't mind to pay a little more for a better stay in vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation”
Reviews.Author: vacationfanatic101
Reviews.Content: A lot of these reviews bother me. mainly because if you are very well-off and high maintenence stay at the bellagio or caesers palace. The monte carlo was great. Only complaint isthe walls were alittle thin, but why would you go to vegas for a quiet vacation? My husband and I were able to check in to our room at 11 AM with no problems. Even if you have to wait, their policy is that check-in isn't until 3 PM so you should go in there expecting that. They can watch your bags if you can't check in and you should go explore. Our room was up to date just fine, had a flat screen, comfortable bed, and a nice view of the pool. The dragon noodle CO had really great food and the food court is just convenient. If you like slots, maybe venture to another casino and play their slots, I felt like nobody was really winning in the monte carlo. But thats the beauty of vegas is everything is so close and you can go in to other hotels and use their amenities! Take advice from me, if you are expecting amazing and luxorious hotel... stay at the bellagio, but i had an awesome time at the monte carlo and would stay there again! pool isgreat. TIP THE COCKTAILERS in the casino. it's free drinks and if you expect them to come back dont be cheap, tip;)

Reviews.Title: “No real complaints”
Reviews.Author: MNLowroller
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying that after 4 trips to Las Vegas I have officially soured of it. My first trip was 5 years ago and every trip since the costs have gone up and the service has gone down. Now for the review. Location: Monte Carlo is in a pretty good location, with easy access to City center, and Bellagio via a free, quick, tram. It is also a short walk to New York New York. My only complaint about location is that it is almost impossible to cross the street in front of the hotel. It would be a long walk to things that are right across the street. Room: It was alright, nothing amazing, but no complaints either. Nice tv with few real channels, good view of the pool and city center. Food: They have a LOT of food options from cheap to expensive, from late night snack to full buffet. We ate at the Cafe a couple times for breakfast, food was ok, prices were about on par, the wait was unacceptably long considering there were at least 5 empty tables (still empty after we ate) also ate and drank at The Pub, food was good, drinks were good, prices were about new Vegas standard ($8 beer, $17 burger) Pool The website is a little misleading, the main pool is always in the shade, and much smaller in person, there's also a hot tub, wave pool (which was pretty cool) and a lazy river. The pool does not allow outside food or beverage, no not even a bottle of water. All in all the pool was pretty nice, it would have been a little nicer had the weather cooperated. Gaming Didn't play much, got too thirsty and moved to another casino (very limited cocktail service, but about on par with everywhere we went, see also: bad) Other things you should know $15 per day resort fee covers a daily newspaper, access to the gym, wifi, free local phone calls, and fax and copy service. Overall: I doubt I'll return to Las Vegas anytime soon. If I do it would probably be a different hotel by no fault of the Monte Carlo, there are just so many options that I doubt I'd ever hit the same place twice.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: mike186258
Reviews.Content: Couldn't have made a better choice. if you you go out through the entrance by Diablo's you are right in the middle of the strip !! We arrived at about 9am and was in our room within 20 mins, the room was comfortable,clean and had everything we needed, housekeeping did the room every day. Facilities at the hotel are excellent and the Lazy River pool is real good fun. Other hotels on the strip have "attractions" which are great to go and see but it was nice to come back to the relative sanity of the Monte Carlo. For the price of a stay here compared to other hotels we believe we made an excellent choice and would recommend this hotel to anyone, check out was flawless and we were at the airport within 50 mins of leaving our room !! The staff were exceptionally polite and helpful, the desk booked us a helicopter tour over the canyon which was fabulous, good reputable company (Maverick), with no unexpected problems. I personally would rate this hotel very highly. Our stay at LV was everything we would have wished and the MC was a major contribution to our enjoyment, can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home In The Middle Of The Strip”
Reviews.Author: funsville
Reviews.Content: Here's what you get from Monte Carlo. A decent room, excellent service, a fantastic location, a great buffet, a nice casino, a cool pool area and a comfortable, casual atmosphere at as good a price as you'll get anywhere. I was alone (female) and was completely comfortable. Some things deserve special mention. They let me check in SUPER early. Like 10:30 a.m. When I was leaving but needed to store my bags, the dude from the bell desk came to meet me as soon as he saw I was headed toward him (pretty far away) and took over from there. The slot club folks will do everything they can to help you maximize your benefits, even if you are a small time gambler like me. I have ZERO complaints about my stay. It was absolutely wonderful. But I have my standard complaint about any MGM resort which is that hideous resort fee. $15 extra bucks plus tax every night for some minor "benefits" that cost virtually nothing on their part to "offer." The fee is mandatory whether you use the benefits or not. Hateful. Otherwise, MGM resorts are where it's at!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Kim2902
Reviews.Content: For a stay in vegas who really cares about the room you stay in? but if you do then for the price paid the Monte Carlo is a good place to stay. the hotel was clean and tidy. Some people have moaned about the smell of air freshner but for me it was a plesant smell and certainly not over powering. it made a change to some of the hotels when you walk in and get attacked by the fag smell!! the reception staff were ok, didn't do anything wrong but weren't the best i have seen. they had a job to do, they done it but didn't go above and beyond in my books. the conciege again were ok but didn't go out of their way to help. as long as you know what it is you want your be fine but otherwise could be an issue. The room itself was large and clean although the standard of cleaning during our stay wasn't up to my standard. the towels were folded; the bed made in a kind of fashion( duvet thrown back together pillows un-plumped, didn't look like a frshly made bed) but nothing seemed to be cleaned ie sink, and bathroom work top had toothpaste marks through out the duration of our stay. minor things but things that add up. If your looking for a hotel with a view of the strip this isn't the hotel for you, as the ehotel is set back the only view you have of of the casion roofing with all the air conditionings units on top. But you don't go to vegas to stay in the room!! Overall a good hotel but minor things could make it a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Spa Suite--Nice and the price was right”
Reviews.Author: festermatt
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4/25-4/30 in a spa suite at the Monte Carlo. Got a great rate(121/night). We knew they charged the absurd resort fee, but the room still was well priced when adding that in. We stayed on the 25th floor; all the suites were right off the elevator, which is not my preference...I like being down the hall away from the noise. Pros: location is great...can get to most of the strip pretty easily, Room was very nice..jacuzzi tub, marble shower, sauna, separate toilet, king bed that did not kill my back, wet bar, flat screen, bose soundsystem, dvd player and stereo, casino easy to navigate, clean, well staffed(contrary to what I heard of short staffing) Cons: Window opened completely...freaked me out, suites too close to elevators and combined with thin walls means I hear every passing conversation with great clarity, elevator slow, mostly because 2 of the 6 elevators in our bank are exclusively for Hotel 32, which leaves 4 for 9 floors of rooms, because the suites are in the core of the building, the views are not great...we saw not much but the Aria, casino was pretty dead and slots did not feel updated to me.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay again...”
Reviews.Author: amcozy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Monte Carlo at the very end of April / early May 2011 and I thought that the hotel was pretty good, especially considering that, after the service fee, we paid about $78/night. The location is fantastic, making it extremely easy to get around the Strip to see shows, other hotels, etc. The pool area was our favorite part of the hotel and why I think the stay was worth the price we paid - we stayed on weekdays, so it wasn't extremely busy. They have a great wave pool and "lazy river" that we really enjoyed. The hot tub was pretty small, and the regular pool was in the shade so, so the water was too cold for us to swim in, but there was plenty of places to lay out to get a tan and enjoy the great weather. There are volleyball courts too, apparantly, but we didn't use them. However, after everything was said and done, besides alcoholic beverages a few slot machines, we did not eat or gamble at the Monte Carlo. They have very limited dining selections, and the ones they have aren't very good. The hotel isn't as big as some of it's neighbors, so it just can't accommodate much in the way of entertainment like Caesers Palace or the Venetian. The City Center next door has amazing dining spots, so I would recommend going there or further down the Strip to eat. The biggest problem that my husband and I had during our stay was a mix up in our rooms - and by rooms, I mean three different ones over a two-night stay. When we first arrived, we were put in a double-queen room that didn't have a view of the strip, even though we paid extra for a Strip view and we requested a king bed. We were immediately moved to a room on a higher floor with a view of the Strip, but they said that no King beds were available until the following night. The second room had four of the largest moths that I have EVER seen. My husband spent about 10 minutes hitting the gigantic bugs with a magazine before the poor things were all dead. Our TV also had issues, but the maintainence person was at our door within minutes to fix it. The next day, we were moved two rooms down the hall to a room with a king bed, an even better view of the Strip and, thankfully, no moths. The problem here was that our neighbors weren't having a good time, apparantly, and were SCREAMING at the top of the lungs at each other for hours and hours. We called security, who came up within minutes, but we had to call three more times and security didn't really do anything to resolve the problem except ask them to quiet down... which they didn't. We requested a late check-out on our last day and got 4 extra hours for $20. The bell desk held our bags (free) while we went to dinner and walked around the Strip. The valet was free was well, and they had our car to us in less than 5 mins when we were ready to leave.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable but nothing to rave about”
Reviews.Author: ctandsn
Reviews.Content: stayed here for three nights for a conference. got a good deal on priceline. but had to pay the 16.80 resort fee (this includes tax) per night--like most, we didn't use the spa or pool, but did use the wired internet in the room. no fridge our coffee maker but starbucks is right downstairs. room clean but towels stink and some still stained. they do have a blow dryer and safe in the closet. could hear everyone passing by in the hallway but it was sleep depriving. checkin can be long depending on what line you choose. check out in the room was a breeze. overall not a bad stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Strip Location”
Reviews.Author: NicWoosh
Reviews.Content: Check in was painless - although there was a Resort charge of $16.80 or similar for stuff you probably don't want or need. We had 2 Queen beds as sharing a room. In hindsight a suite would have been better and more spacious. This is not the swankest hotel on the strip but the rates are good - especially if you can go mid week, shockingly cheap. Nice pool, its got a few actually and a tide pool. One point - don't take any drinks to the pool as they don't let them in - pain for those going with yard glasses of alcohol. Can only assume its some sort of concession thing. Pool also has cabans - we were going to hire one as a special treat except they quoted us $800 so we went shopping instead. For the energetic there's a Volley ball area too - nice to watch. Didn't use most facilities but did go to Brand restaurant - thumbs up. Cafe always seemed to have a queue so we went to Buffet. Not my thing however if you want vast amounts of food after a heavy night for a fixed price go for it. This place also has an Ice Bar which didn't quite go for but interesting. Great feature is the City Train or Tram - free train that goes from Monte Carlo up to Bellagio. Which is very handy when you've done enough walking up and down the strip. There is a Metro on opposite side of strip but this costs $5 one way.

Reviews.Title: “rooms are disappointing”
Reviews.Author: shiverwinnipeg
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to Vegas. The Hotel is nice, service was great but the room was UGLY. I do not travel to vegas to hang out in the hotel room, however a hotel room is still my home away from home for our time away. Our standard room was akin to a Super 8 motel. It was outdated, clean but I expect more from Vegas. My partner says I am spoiled from my stay at the Wynn. But this could have been a lot nicer!

Reviews.Title: “Good location on The Strip”
Reviews.Author: RedShoesNottingham
Reviews.Content: All that you'd expect from a Las Vegas hotel. Don't get me wrong, I've stayed in better hotels on The Strip, but this was good value for money. In fact, if you weren't in Las Vegas it would easily rate as a five-star but has to compete with the likes of Ceasar's Palace and The Venetian. Pool area was great with a small lazy river to float around. The hotel is in a great location in the centre of The Strip. All I would say, as for probably any hotel room in Las Vegas, on a party weekend like Easter during Spring Break, the walls are a little thin!!! Enjoy your time in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Needs a facelift”
Reviews.Author: abbyfay
Reviews.Content: Rooms were O.K. Could use a facelift. Location was Good, but I think I would prefer to stay by the Mirage. More going on. We ate at the buffet in the Monte Carlo when we arrived and were very disappointed. The next day we took the meal plan at the Excalibur. Breakfast was good, but the other meals were not. We got sick! We don't know if it was food poisoning or a stomach virus. We lost a whole day in bed. I'm glad we got sick at the same time. The Shark reef at Mandalay Bay was great, The flower conservatory in Bellagios is beautiful and the gondola ride at the Venetian was fun. Thankfully there was a great food court in our hotel, because our appetites were not that good. The pool area was nice at the hotel and the employees were friendly. We went to see Frank Caliendo at the hotel and he was really funny. Also saw Anthony Cool at Paris. Also a great show. If I had to do it all over again,I would not have stayed at the Monte Carlo.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL IN GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: NorfolkDebbie34
Reviews.Content: I was a bit anxious about the monte carlo hotel reviews at first as good and bad written on here but I was presently suprised. This is a mid range hotel with good amenties and in a great location for the strip. The rooms were slightly outdated and could do with updating but they were comfortable especially the beds and very clean. We got a view of the pool which was ok but can get noisy at weekends with the music around the pool so no chance of a nap in the afternoon!! I didnt sit round the pool much as the sunbeds were very close together and busy and the music was very loud. Ok for young people though!! The hotel staff were helpful and friendly. The casino was much smaller than the other hotels but this was fine. It is in a great location with lots of bars, resturants nearby. The free monrail was great to get to the other hotels as lots of walking. My advice would be to take very comfortable shoes with you and maybe take a hoodie/cardigan for the evenings as can get a bit cool. If you get a good price for the monte carlo hotel give it a try!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Arseniclad
Reviews.Content: this hotel included 3 nights as part of a deal which made it an extraordinarily economical stay, the hotel is in convenient safe location near south end of strip, about a $15 cab ride from airport which is quicker and less expensive than a airport transfer. service was excellent, front desk and concierge were helpful and enthusiastic. pool staff was friendly, room was clean, with a comfortable bed, with a nice view of the pool area and the new buildings in the new city center development, nice pool and beach volleyball area, lots of families with kids, up to date fitness room and gym. casino more or less the same as any other strip hotel there is a free rail shuttle to Bellagio however it is probably quicker to walk. only downside are the lineups for a coffee or a burger in the food court areas

Reviews.Title: “Great place and good times.”
Reviews.Author: attomicdawg
Reviews.Content: Went to Vegas for a relaxing break and had a great time. Check in was quick and easy, and was given a good run down on things to do while in town. The sports bar was amazing at happy hour with cheap sliders and drinks. we even ordered room service twice and was pleased with what they offered.We will be returning again soon.

Reviews.Title: “WORST Hotel Ever! Made our trip a nightmare! Definitely don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Lucky_Girl37
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I planned a wonderful trip to Vegas to relax and kick back for a few days but the service at this hotel made our trip a nightmare. We reserved the Monaco suite with a roll in shower because I'm paralyzed and thus require a shower chair. We made the reservations online but called not once, but twice to make sure the suite would have a roll in shower... we showed up and after waiting forever to check in we went up to the room and found out that it had no barrier free shower. So we figured it was just a mix up and went back down and waited some more to talk to someone, turns out they have limited Monacco suites (1) with a roll in shower and they gave it to someone else for the week.... we were obviously upset but we got put in a standard room for two of the days then we were promised the diamond suite for the last two days to make up for the inconvenience, so we stayed in a standard room with a "roll in shower" and the shower was so small no kind of shower chair would ever fit in that thing. This hotel has to be breaking ADA guidelines.... The standard room was dingy, dark and small. The best part is when we went up to the "diamond suite" and looked in the bathroom and OH BIG SURPRISE! there is NO roll in shower! At this point we were both pretty outraged. They basically comped us a couple hundred dollars worth of food and drinks at their lousy restaurants which, by the way, we both got sick from eating the food brought up from room service. You're better off eating at the McDonald's! The "diamond suite" was more like a cubic zirconia... the furniture was beat up like someone got drunk and started hitting the coffee table. The blow dryer literally smelled like someone had taken a pee in it when you turned it on, it was absolutely disgusting! Their handicap accessible room had lights by the phone and the doorbell for hearing impaired visitors and a roll under sink in the kitchen entry room and no accessible shower. I guess the room was designed for a deaf person in a wheelchair who can use a regular bath tub. Our floor smelled like weed the last night we were there and in the early morning another person on the floor was blowing an air horn repeatedly....This place was a complete joke! Find a different hotel to go to. You couldn't pay me to ever stay at this place again! There are a ton of hotels in Vegas, don't give this one your business!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for Vegas”
Reviews.Author: craigers13
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd time staying at the Monte Carlo. We got a great deal over the easter weekend by signing up for their guestbook (25% off). The lobby area is nice, the casino is quite clean and not as smoky as some other places. The girl who checked us in was very friendly and welcoming. We had a room on the 16th floor facing the Excalibur/NYNY which was quite large by Vegas standards. There is a great pool area that didn't feel overly crowded considering the hotel must have been near full. The maid service was always quick and did a good job. The beds are comfy but the pillows could use an update. My only complaint is the noise in the room can be a bit excessive. Windows could use a refurbihing to block out street/wind noise and the walls are a little thin so if you have nosiy neighbors it may be a problem, but hey, who comes to vegas to relax? We would definitely stay here again,

Reviews.Title: “Money stolen from suitcase”
Reviews.Author: taurus202
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel since location was quite convenient. Services were OK, nothing exceptional either way. Since we had to check out at 11 and our flight was not until 7 pm, luggage was checked into the bellhop luggage storage area. I had about $400 CAD and $2000 Mexican pesos in an outside compartment of my suitcase along with my passport and some other material. When I picked up my suitcase, I retreived my passport and flight info and put it in my pocket, not realizing that anything was missing. When I got to Calgary, I realized that all the money was gone, although some coins were still there. I called the hotel today to report this incident, got shuffled from person to person until the 5th person actually said he was with security. He said an officer would get back to me ASAP......................Still waiting for that to happen.

Reviews.Title: “MONACO SUITE NOT WORTH THE PRICE”
Reviews.Author: tactjv2
Reviews.Content: Booked a Monaco Suite with the view of the strip. Check in took forever. Our suite (3-301) was on the third floor. The strip view was not. Open the curtains to the view of the roof and all the HVAC systems. The wallpaper on the outside was coming off and held up with bluetape. The carpet had foot print stains going into the bathroom. The furniture was all nicked up and worn. Went down to complain and was given a room on the 17th floor but it was not available until the next day. The view still I feel is not what we paid for. The other couple we were with stayed at the Aria. Wish we did. I would say the only bonus is it had a foodcourt that had Subway, McDonalds and Starbucks.

Reviews.Title: “Go Somewhere Else”
Reviews.Author: easyrider11
Reviews.Content: We reserved a Monaco Suite and was told that it would be on a higher floor with a view. When we checked in we recieved room 4301 with a view of the casino roof and parking structure. We asked for a different room and the only way out was to reserved a Diamond Suite. The Diamond Suite did have a nice view but for $300.00 a night it should. The Diamond Suite had a slow drain and dirty carpets. In the fridge was some ones left over Chinese food with fork still attached. The Suites were both near elavators and were very loud when people entered the atrium or went to get ice. The swiming pool is great but for some reason people are bringing children to the resort. There is no escaping the 10 and under crowd here. The pool waitress puts the wait in waitress. It can take 45 minutes to get a beer. Do yourself a favor and get it yourself. Water is $6.00 at the pool. Every one wants a tip for crappy service. The food is really lame at the pool The food court is really dirty near the casino. The Monte Carlo has seen its glory days and should be considered the same as a fancy buget hotel. Stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “You will leave the Monte Carlo disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: oceancruiser1
Reviews.Content: You are guaranteed to leave the Monte Carlo disappointed from the condition of the rooms, to the bad service and food. The Bad: The Monte Carlo does not guarantee that you will get a king bed room upon check in...so they tried to stick us with twin beds first telling us there was no availability for king size beds. So after speaking with a supervisor they sent us to another room...with a king that was horrible...smelled, wallpaper torn, cracked marble in the bathroom...so back to the supervisor. Then they sent us to another room on the 25th floor which was not great but better...the problem was it had not been cleaned...at 8:00pm at night...so again back to the supervisor...who promised it would be cleaned by the time we were back from dinner. Two hour delay getting all this worked out. Our friends also found their rooms to be bad. The rooms have old broken furniture, old beds, really beat up bathrooms. The hotel and casino real look rundown. Upon checkout I called the front desk and was confronted with one of the most disrespectful clerks I have ever spoke to, and they wanted to charge me $20 more dollars for one additional hour. I (again) asked for the supervisor and she gave me 3 additional hours no charge (like she does this often) They charge a $16 per day resort fee on top of your room rate and you receive nothing extra for this charge...even WiFi is not included. Went to the Italian restaurant and the meal was very poor. Pasta was just OK and the gourmet pizza was not cooked all the way and needed to be sent back. What is surprising is the the Monte Carlo also has Andre's Restaurant which is one of the best in Vegas. The Good: The location is one of the best in vegas but there are many other hotels that are MUCH BETTER within two blocks. The pool area was fun with a great DJ and the pool staff were great! Casino staff was very friendly. Conclusion: This hotel advertises that it is a luxury hotel which it is not. Stay away if you are looking for something special.

Reviews.Title: “WARNING: Never forget anything before you check out of this crap hotel! If you do, don’t bother trying to get them back!”
Reviews.Author: Traveller-2811
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel from 11 April 2011 to 13 April 2011, room 17-208. We had forgotten to pack our camera charger and battery when we checked out. We had been charging the battery overnight and left it in on the wall socket, below the desk in the room. We had left the hotel around 9 am and realised we had forgotten the charger and battery when we were about to board the plane at 11am. We immediately called the hotel. We were put to lost and found, but no one picked up. We called several times and left several messages for the lost and found department. Yet, by the afternoon no one had returned our call. The only assurance was that the Reservations person who picked up my call told me that no one will be checking into our room for the day – to our relief as we thought this meant we would get our charger and battery back. When we finally managed to talk to someone from lost and found at 4pm (I had to keep calling; no one called back), I was told to call back again after 6pm when housekeeping had cleaned the rooms. So at 7pm I called the hotel again and was told to call back again in an hour’s time so that the housekeeping could check the room again as no one had turned in anything. So once again I had to call back and LO AND BEHOLD! THEY HAD NOT FOUND MY ITEM! I was then told by the manager that they would do a second check in case the missing item was not logged onto the lost and found sheet. He assured me he would call me back in 5 or 10 minutes. After an hour, I heard nothing from the hotel! Again I had to call back! Again the manager told me that they have nothing but he had sent someone to re-check the lost and found box in case, and that he would call me back very shortly. LIES!!! BLOODY LIES!! Neither the manager nor anyone from the hotel called back!! By then I was in Canada and was unfortunately only halfway through my 3 weeks US / Canada trip with my husband. We desperately needed the charger and battery back, in order to work our camera for the remaining trip. We were even willing to pay for DHL to courier it to us in Canada if it was found. Imagine our desperation. HEED MY WARNING: This is by far the worst service ever. It is obvious that housekeeping or someone from the hotel had STOLEN MY CHARGER AND BATTERY, since the hotel had assured us that no one checked into our room for the day. NO ONE IN THE HOTEL WANTS TO BE RESPONSIBLE!! I had even told the hotel EXACTLY where the items were plugged into! No one even bothers to return a phone call!! I had left several messages, to both the voicemail AND live persons, INCLUDING THE HOTEL MANAGER!! For their convenience I left both a US number and an international number. NEVER STAY AT MONTE CARLO, WHERE SERVICE IS NON EXISTENT AND WHERE YOUR VALUABLES ARE FOREVER GONE!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, good location, smaller than others which is nice”
Reviews.Author: jackiepaddy
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd visit to the MC (last was in 2003). 11 people in our party. Two of our rooms were adjoining which was an unexpected bonus. Rooms 20-113 & 115. View of NY, NY and Excalibur. Nice view, especially at night. Could watch the NY, NY roller coaster. Paid $57/night plus daily resort fee. The lobby area is very nice. The room probably hasn't been updated since our last visit except for the nice flat screen (for some reason, the channels would change by themselves; must have been another room's remote control, happened to the other guests, too). Beds are soft but comfortable. Bathroom is large but in need of updates. Mirror was chipped, sink handle fell off, bath faucet wouldn't turn off. Housekeeping never left enough towels; had to call for more daily. Service was prompt. Rooms are not equipped for today's traveler. Few electric outlets for charging. Had to climb under the desk to find one. Few dresser drawers. Just not meant for 4 people staying 5 nights. As another reviewer noted, the towels often smelled burned and no fridge or microwave was a bummer. Our room had a hairdryer in the closet. I did not hear any noise from adjoining room, even the one we were connected to. No hallway noise at all. Nor were we bothered by the airplanes which were constantly overhead. Buffet dinner was average at best for $19.99. I guess that's pretty cheap. Nothing to write home about. Several booths had torn and frayed fabric. Definitely in need of a makeover. Had breakfast at The Cafe several times which was good but expensive. $75 for 4 on average for us. We ate and drank at The Pub several times. $7 for Corona. Or 5 for $25 at the pool (cans). Service at The Pub was spotty. One night no one came near us after we were given menus. We went to the bar for our drinks. Didn't seem to bother anyone nor did they seem to notice. Drinks at Brand steakhouse were very expensive but they were handing out BOGO coupons in the casino. Food court is a hit with the teens. Pools are nice but with the building of Aria and the giant gray monstrosity next to it, the sun is practically blocked out. Very crowded and difficult to get a chair if you arrive after 10am. Attendants said they walk around and remove towels off chairs if the guest didn;t leave any other personal belongings to mark their chair. We rented a cabana for a $400 commitment to food and drink. Best deal of the trip. Cabana is free as long as you spend $400 between 9am and 6pm. We spent $500 for 12 of us so it was worth it. $400 is the lowest price; charge more if its busy and more crowded. We rented it at noon. There's a private pool and cabana available for rent too which was interesting. We were told $500 rental fee plus $100/person in food and drink commitment. Its very nice. Neverending Frank Caliendo and Jabawockeez ads in the elevator were enough to send us over the edge.

Reviews.Title: “Careful with the rate!!”
Reviews.Author: MynameBuenosAires
Reviews.Content: We had gotten a good rate through Priceline, but were very surprised when we had to pay an extra U$S 16 plus tax PER PERSON / PER NIGHT to use the spa which we were not going to use anyway! I felt cheated.... Plus, they charge U$S 30 per night for a baby crib!!! We had to make a phone call and were charged U$S 14 to pick up the phone, plus the communication fee!! Outrageous!! If you are going on a tight budget, this is NOT your hotel!! I´m surprised they don´t charge for extra pillows!!! Also, there´s no coffee maker, or refrigirator.

Reviews.Title: “It worked for our purposes.”
Reviews.Author: pwhite92
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent four nights in Vegas. Our purpose was to sight see and do some gambling. We didn't want to spend too much time in our room, so there room served it's purpose. No refrigerator, microwave, hair dryer, or coffee machine, so that was a little bit of a downer. The bed was comfortable and the views were amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time at MC”
Reviews.Author: glasgowcelticgirl
Reviews.Content: I booked a great package deal on Expedia for this hotel. I was really nervous about staying here after reading so many negative reviews. Well it wasn't that bad. It wasn't the Ritz but we had a clean spacious room that overlooked the pool and City Center. I booked a regular room but was given a room on the 19th floor and it had newer flat screen TV so not sure if this is considered upgrade or what. Location was central to everything, right in the middle of the strip. The fast food court was handy in the morning for bringing coffee and stuff back up to room, Pool area was pretty crowded and water was freezing, they couldn't have had the heat on. We were there a total of 3 nights and our room had always been cleaned when we returned in the afternoon. We were giving a early check in at 11:30am but had to pay a extra 20.00 to extend our check out time to 3pm from the standard 11am. I would stay here again if the rate was right.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: Time2CheckIn
Reviews.Content: We booked the Monte Carlo mainly because we got an excellent rate through their MLife loyalty program and the fact that we hadn't stayed there before. The location was convenient and the hotel was nice. The rooms were a little dated, but they were clean as were the common areas. There is a resort fee but it included access to the fitness center and internet, so it was worth it to us. We had been hiking in Zion National Park for several days and had a rental car, so we were happily surprised to find that they had a FREE self-parking lot. We would stay there again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed My Visit”
Reviews.Author: onajetplaneDenton
Reviews.Content: I quickly checked in at noon and was able to switch from a queen to a king room with no problems. Housekeeping did a great job however the towels did have a slightly burnt smell on day two of my stay. The pool area was busy but we had no problem finding a couple of chairs together for our group. We had the buffet for breakfast .I thought it was a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Total rip-off, stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: legiswriter
Reviews.Content: I ended up booking the Monte Carlo through Priceline's "name your own price" function and was very disappointed. My husband and I had stayed there in 2006 and were completely unimpressed, so I had a bad feeling about this trip as well. Priceline has nerve considering it a "4 star hotel" when every other source I've seen gives it 3 - 3 1/2 stars. If you are stuck with it like I was, it's not terrible, so don't freak out, but if you have the option to stay elsewhere in that price range do NOT book here to save a couple bucks. First, I'll start with the few good things, and there were a few, then discuss the negatives, and finally outline a few good things about the hotel that you can take advantage of without staying there. The Good: -the pool area is pretty decent. With a wave pool, a lazy river and a regular pool you have a lot of nice options. Also, the music & dj in the afternoon are fun (if you're into that type of thing, if you like a serene, quiet pool experience, this is NOT the place for you.) As with most hotels, the pool is crowded and people are jerks and lay claim to chairs they have no intention of using til later. Only thing you can do is be a jerk as well, go lay out some towels and come back when you're ready. - the staff we dealt with were all pleasant enough - the food court has decent options for a quick bite The Bad - the rooms are clean enough, but so unbelievably dated and worn, they appear dingy and depressing. - the beds dont have fitted sheets and the bottom sheet comes untucked and is all over the bed, pretty much as soon as you get in it. I don't really care to lay directly ON a hotel mattress (shudder) so this skeeved me out. -the mattresses are absolutely beat and not very comfortable - the bed linens are old, worn and kind of cheap. They do NOT match the stock photos from the hotel website. - the pool side rooms get POUNDED with music during the day and are unbearable if you're trying to take a nap or just relax in the afternoon. We had to switch to a strip view room after the first day to escape this. - the casino is fine, but kind of sterile and has nothing of interest. It's not a happening spot, at all. - free internet, but no Wi Fi which is crazy in 2011! Stop by here to check out: - The Pub has an enormously satisfying beer collection on tap. I can't rave enough about that. If you're a beer lover, definitely have a meal or two there and enjoy the amazing assortment of brews. - the tram station giving you access to the CityCenter & Bellagio is convenient if you're staying on the south end of the strip. -the food at the Brand steakhouse was spot on. It's a bit cheaper than some more well known establishments (Craftsteak), but the quality of meat and preparation of the 40 oz porterhouse we shared was fantastic. Don't expect some amazing twists and turns in the menu, it's typical a la carte steakhouse fare, but it is of excellent quality. I would go back in a heart beat. Just don't let them seat you at the tables that are really close to the casino floor as you'll like you're in a food court. We had to move to be comfortable. Overall, I was disappointed to stay here and was offended by the room quality. But they were clean enough so I wasn't so skeeved that I felt the need to go elsewhere. If you can avoid this place - do so. The NY NY & MGM Grand are in the same area of the strip, cost around the same, offer quite a bit more, and don't have rooms from 1996.

Reviews.Title: “Viva Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Marasmom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently visited Vegas to celebrate my 40th birthday and our wedding anniversary. We stayed at the Monte Carlo and loved it! It is not at the center of the strip but across the street from MGM and next to NY NY, both of which we also enjoyed. The rooms are plenty big and the food court offers a good variety. We did not eat at the resturants at the hotel but did enjoy the dueling pianos and beer variety at The Pub. The shopping at MGM and Planet Hollywood is fantastic. We really enjoyed the PBR Rock Bar at Planet Hollywood and the Sporting House at NY NY. The best thing was Blue Man Group, though!

Reviews.Title: “You Can`t judge a book by its cover!”
Reviews.Author: bevsdogs
Reviews.Content: From the outside and the lobby this appears to be a nice hotel but the rooms are in need of a makeover. The furniture was missing handles and the shower head in both of our rooms (we changed after the 1st night) need replacing. It was not easy to get hot water out of the shower.

Reviews.Title: “Be prepared to pay extra for everything”
Reviews.Author: MrJonty
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well placed on the Strip and like most of the other hotels well equipped with a huge casino, shopping mall, spa and restaurants. The spa treatments were prohibitively expensive. The pool area is far too small for the number of guests and if you want to use a lounger you will lie cheek by jowl with other guests. They even charge you $10 for the tubes for the lazy river. What a rip-off! The hotel's own restaurants are very pricey and service is incredibly slow, especially at reception and concierge where guests regularly waited for 30 minutes to be served. This hotel tries but it must try harder.

Reviews.Title: “monte carlo is amazing”
Reviews.Author: beaut044
Reviews.Content: glad did not listen to some of the comments before we left it was amaaazing clean,friendly and to have a McDonald in the lobby was great the concierge was very helpful to help us with the sale of tickets concerts overall we will definitely go back to Monte Carlo

Reviews.Title: “Good deal for the price”
Reviews.Author: Walter53
Reviews.Content: Monte Carlo continues to be a good moderate priced strip hotel. Noise from room to room is an issue, but otherwise rooms are clean and neat. Casino is relatively less smoky than many others.

Reviews.Title: “You can't go wrong staying here, unless you're a Princess!”
Reviews.Author: Sunforus
Reviews.Content: Stayed from the 9th-13th Apr. The trip didn't start out to well, as we had to switch planes. We made it out to the holding area, when a light appeared(hydraulics). So we had to turn around and disembarked, then waited for a new plane to be taxied over. The airline (WestJet) handled things really well. The end resulted was just over a 2 hr delay(scheduled to leave TO @ 8:50). So by time we arrived at reception there was no one else checking in. Check in went smooth, given a room on the 27th floor with a southwest view (the back of NYNY & side of Excalibur. The window did open, maybe 2 inches. They state up front that there is a $15.00 service charge, and you are required to initial on the reservation . I asked if a late check out was available, and what the cost would be. They checked and said I could get the late checkout. So I was able to get the room until 3pm for $20.00, normal checkout is 11am. The room was very clean. We had 2 queen size beds which were very comfortable. Each bed had 3 pillows each. There was also a 32" flat screen TV. In the closet was the safe(easy to operate), iron & ironing board, the hair dryer was also in there in a bag. Plus it also had 2 folding luggage benches. The bathroom was very clean, with plenty of towels. Previous reviews stated they had a burnt smell to them. We found that was the case on some of the towels but not all of them. We put it down to the cleaning chemicals and the dryer. If this will ruin your vacation, I suggest you head elsewhere. We never found the walls to be thin, we were down near the end of the hall and never heard much from the hallways. The only problem we had was that 2 nights in a row we came back to the room with the alarm clock going of next door. Called down both nights, were transferred to security, and stated the problem. It was taken care of within 5 min. each night. The pool area was very nice, it was never too crowded while we were there. There was plenty of sun all day over by the wave pool and the lazy river. The main pool near the hot tub didn't start to get any sun until 3pm. They do check your bag going in, more of a glance then anything else. You also need to show your room key. You can pick up towels down there as well. Many were using more than one, but then again it wasn't to crowded. They do frown on you when you try to move the loungers in a different direction. Inner tubes can be rented for $10.00 a day. We passed ours on to some kids when we left for the day, which made both the parents & kids happy. (Never made it in the wave pool but the lazy river is heated.) We ate at the Pub twice, the food was good. The Flatbreads (pizza) are very good. If a game(hockey for us) is on the tube they will have Happy Hour. 2 for 1 beers, plus wings & sliders. We also tried the buffet, which wasn't bad. There is a food court, which we used for quick stops in the mornings. We enjoyed the casino, never seemed to smell any smoke unless beside a smoker. Cocktail waitresses were always around. Tip them and they will be back. Location is great. Drug store right next door, ABC store across the street . Also another drug store(Walgreen's), Denny's, Outback, Hard Rock, etc.... With the late check out we had no wait at reception when checking out. Took our bags to the bell hop desk and they held them for a couple of more hours for us. We found all the staff to be very nice. Take the time to say hi to them and they will say the same to you, plus it comes with a smile. They have a Dollar car rental at the Bell Hop desk. We rented a car for 1 day. If you walk up to the desk it will cost you at least $30.00 more for the same car than if you reserved it on line. We reserved next day with a lap top from the room. You need a land line, no wireless. Also if you need to to pre book your seats for the plane, there are 3 computers on the far left hand side of reception. Just follow directions and you won't have any problems. It will show prices for printing, but it is FREE!! This is probably the only perk for your resort fees.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: FWDaisy
Reviews.Content: Yes! The towels do smell burnt! Interesting that in a 2 queen room you only get three bath towels. The shower is apparently aerated to seem like it's high pressure, but it was hard to rinse my legs with the fine mist spraying everywhere. The pool area closed at 6 while we were there. Not a big deal since it was breezy out and the tall surrounding buildings block out the sun most of the day anyway. The lazy river was fun, bring your own floaties - they're expensive to rent or buy by the pool. I liked the smell of the lobby - it reminded me of Hawaii and was better than the cigarette smell you normally associate with a casino. We had a room with 2 very comfortable queen beds and had a rollaway brought in for our son. The dresser only had 3 small drawers and had taken a beating, making it look shabby, but we managed to cram most of our clothes in it. 3 of the restaurants in the food court offer breakfast, so it's a cheaper alternative to a sit down place. Neither Starbucks takes their own gift cards.

Reviews.Title: “Great price and location!”
Reviews.Author: ploffyj
Reviews.Content: This was my boyfriend and I's first trip to Vegas together. A friend of ours recommended the Monte Carlo because of the price and location. We arrived at 10:30am and were able to get checked in. The front desk agent, Layla, even upgraded our room to a King Size Bed, upon my request, with a great view of the strip. The lobby is really nice and the rooms are clean and pretty standard. Because we were on a budget it was great to have many food options. We ordered room service, ate at pricier restaurants some days, but in the hotel we had a Subway, McDonald's, Starbucks, Sbarro, Chinese, Mexican, Haagen dazs, and my favorite The Cupcakery (had specialty cupcakes). By the way, room service came fast and the server was extremely friendly and we even had a 1 minute conversation on his favorite show on TV. (Server on night of 4/10/11 Rm 11-311) The pool area is great. There is a hot tub, lazy river, wave pool, beach volleyball court, and of course a regular pool Most importantly...the location, The Monte Carlo is in the perfect location. Next door to The New York, New York Hotel, across the street from MGM, and the hotel also has a Tram to connect to the Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and smelly rooms.”
Reviews.Author: ncep17
Reviews.Content: 4 off us stayed at the Monte Carlo from April 3 for a week. We found the rooms to be very tired. Barthrooms had a unique smell about them which was not nice. Carpet in the rooms and hall way were very old and stained. Would have been nice to have a room window open with a bit of fresh air, the smoke smell you get from just walking through the casino part is terrible. You did not seem to smell the smoke in other casino's. We all found the smoke and the air conditioning extremely harsh on our eyes even in our room. We must have been last in line for room cleaning because our room was not cleaned until about 3 in the afternoon. Front counter staff were good but would have been nice if they told us all the charges exept just there base rate. They did not tell us we had to pay more because we were high up and looking over the strip. Just goota watch these things. Wifi did not work in our room and the front staff would not give us the access code for some reason, ended up using Starbucks in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again in a heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: chamkreb
Reviews.Content: Travelled with my husband and 9 other friends. Right from the time we checked in to the time we left we never had any problems. Got a king bed like we asked for overlooking the pool, after reading some of the reviews I was a little worried, but check in was smooth, the desk staff was very friendly, the rooms were clean, (no blood on the sheets as mentioned in earlier reviews), the beds were very comfortable, the hotel staff were all very friendly and helpful. The hotel is a little older than some on the strip but for the price we paid this was absolutely a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Standard rooms getting tired.”
Reviews.Author: Fritz487
Reviews.Content: Good location .. like the casino , not too hectic, just right. Standard rooms getting tired. Wall paper peeling, shower gets water all over the floor no matter how you arrange the curtain. TV channel selection pretty restrictive. Would go back as beefs not too daunting.

Reviews.Title: “Imagine if a Grayhound Station became a Las Vegas hotel”
Reviews.Author: therlp
Reviews.Content: I travel for business a lot. An awful lot. I had a conference in Las Vegas at the Monte Carlo, and my hotel room was comped by the conference. I debated paying to stay somewhere else. I'm not sure where even to begin. My main concerns in no particular order: 1. The hotel does not have wireless internet. I get that you want people on the Casino floor, and I most certainly do not want to do work while in Las Vegas, but I have clients and a team back at the office who count on me to at least check in. There is no wireless Internet at the Monte Carlo. Actually, there is. In the conference rooms. You need a password to get onto that Internet network, which the Monte Carlo will not give out to anyone. Even if you offer to pay for it. The hotel does have Internet cables but, news flash, computers made in the past two years no longer have ethernet ports. The person at the business center actually told me, "wireless networks are very expenses, that's why most hotels don't have them." Um, of the 100 or so hotels I have stayed at in the past six months, ALL of them, save the Monte Carlo have wireless. And, again, ethernet cables don't work on newer computers. It's one thing to not have updated your hotel at all in the past ten years. It is quite another to make material misrepresentations to guests about the state of affairs in the rest of the world. 2. This hotel is short staffed. Which they like to point out to you at all times. Of the six light bulbs in my room, three were burnt out when I checked in. Another two burnt out during my first night, leaving me with one light in the bathroom. When I called down to the desk - at noon - I was on hold for thirty minutes. Thirty minutes. Thirty minutes. Because they were short-staffed. When I went to check in, it took me twenty minutes to get to an attendant (and there were two other people waiting in line, total). Because they were short staffed. When I ordered breakfast to my room, the wait time for delivery was an hour. An hour. Because they were short-staffed. 3. My conference comped my room. Easy enough detail, right? They had pre-paid for it. That little detail required no less than three people to check me in. And guess what? When I went to check out, it took no less than four people and thirty-minutes to complete the transaction. Because nobody could figure out how to use their computer system. 4. The wall-paper in the bathroom was peeling and the ceiling was crusting away, such that every time you closed the bathroom door a fine dust rained down. 5. There was no mini-bar in the rooms - not even an $8 bottle of water that hotels in all price classes seem to love - and the rooms had tube TVs from the mid-1990s. 6. There are a lot of off color Yankees hats (like, you know, bright green Yankees hats), professional wrestling T-shirts, children on leashes and yard glasses filled with frozen margaritas milling about on the Casino floor. Not to come off as elitist, but the hotel has all the feel and character of a Greyhound station. I get that the Monte Carlo is not the Cosmopolitan. However, it was quite startling to realize it is not even close in quality to Treasure Island or a Marriott in Topeka, Kansas.

Reviews.Title: “Questions to ask BEFORE you stay at Monte Carlo, Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: nonight
Reviews.Content: Will the rooms be checked for broken furniture, including mattress frames? Will housekeeping respect your willing participation in 'green' living (re-use towels and sheets)? Will anyone answer the front desk phone when you call from the room? AND THE WORST: Are the disgusting odors from the bathrooms (no doors, just openings) at the food court and casino still not vented away? You get the odors from the food court, the 'Street of Dreams', the Casino, and the elevator lobby. It does not matter how cheap the rooms may be... this is just not acceptible.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Can't Wait To Go Back”
Reviews.Author: Jesm23
Reviews.Content: The room was nice and the staff was wonderful I can't think of anything to complain about. They upgraded us to a suite after one night of playing.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Results... Nice hotel and casino... Customer service lacks.”
Reviews.Author: CamanoHal
Reviews.Content: The good... It is a clean, well maintained hotel and casino. Does not have that ash tray odor when you enter the building like many do. A nice food court with variety, and a great pool area with lazy river. They actually would have gotten five stars if this was the entire story of our experience. The bad.... Online they offer "Strip Views" for an additional fee per night. We were booking two rooms for us and our friends, and were supposed to be next to each other. When we arrived they said they could not put us together, but offered to at least get us on the same floor. Ok... no big deal. So we get to our room it has a great strip view across Las Vegas boulvevard to the MGM and other casinos. At night you see all the lights on the strip... and that was great.. But our friends, who were also supposed to get a strip view were put in a room facing Interstate 15, and looking at the back of the new developments to the north, and the Aria hotel. Add in the air conditioners and it is a pretty boring view. Not facing the strip what so ever. Ok so is that all that bad? Well it depends on how the front desk staff respond when this concern was brought to their attention. Instead of admitting that yes this in not the "strip view" you upgraded to, they claimed that the Aria is considered a strip view because it's address is on Las Vegas Blvd. Anyone who has seen the Aria knows that it is way off of Las Vegas Blvd behind a huge mall, and most of the other Strip properties. Ok.. So when we got a supervisor involved... they still did not want to budge from calling this a Strip View room.
