But we negotiated down the "resort fees" of $15 per day for both of our rooms, to compensate our friends for the extra amount they were paying $30 per day for the alleged strip view room. Manager Celeste agreed to it, and said she put it on our account. Of course by the next morning when she was off shift and we were checking out, a different front desk employee had a different story. He said only one of the rooms had been waived for the resort fee. Another debate with the front desk personnel and the supervisor ensued. Although this time, no one was arguing that it was a strip view anymore. It was like they assumed we were lying, and the supervisor simply said I am going to waive the fee on the second room also, just because their is a line forming behind you. We are still waiting for the credit card charge to see what they really did.. but for now we are assuming they did. Bottom line... If you get the strip view then great... you should have no problems. If you have paid for the strip view and get to look at the plain silver Aria hotel..Good luck

Reviews.Title: “April 5th thru 8th 2011”
Reviews.Author: mtnbiker4300
Reviews.Content: I've found a new home on the strip thanks to a great Host and Manager, Jacob Ellis. Jacob took the time to set up the reservation with a great rate. I was on the 31st floor with a great view of the strip. Room was clean and comfortable. Also very quiet. I tipped the maid service and found everything in proper order with any extras I needed. High winds moved in with gusts of 57 mph on the strip, and the staff and security were on hand to handle any problems should arise. nice to see them about in such bad weather. Again, It was nice meeting Mr.Ellis and his staff. Will be in contact soon to set up the next trip to Vegas. Thanks MC for a great week of food and fun !

Reviews.Title: “Not what it used to be...”
Reviews.Author: skljajic
Reviews.Content: "Monte Carlo" still looks great from the outside but it is now a bit rundown. Staff also are not the friendliest on the Strip. Nothing special...

Reviews.Title: “Good for Kids”
Reviews.Author: korfitness
Reviews.Content: After a miserable stay at Ravella in Lake Las Vegas, we ended up here because the pool was heated. The kids loved the wave pool, and lazy river. The water could've been warmer, but was hot compared to Ravella. Overall, we had a good time at Monte Carlo.

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: footballmomVista_CA
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 night stay at the Monte Carlo. We took our teenage children for this trip. We have stayed at most hotels on the strip and a few off. This is one of the worst stays we have had. We belong to the Mlife program through MGM promotions and wanted to use out comps and discounts to stay this time. We have stayed at Mirage and Mandalay Bay in this group. By far both others are nicer. To start, I chose Monte Carlo for the location and the fact that the reservation rep told me that they had an arcade. We were looking at New York New York because I knew they had a good kid arcade but they didn't have an attractive pool area. The Monte Carlo pool area is ok. Nothing like Mandalay Bay, but it has a lazy river and a small wave pool. (Lazy River was closed for the first hour we were out there 11:00ish). There is NO arcade at Monte Carlo. I tend to choose hotels by size of room and bathroom. The bathroom was nothing to write home about...room not so hot either. There were stains on the carpet, walls, drapes, SHEETS and the shower curtain. The towels in the bathroom smelt like they were burnt...not nice when drying off your face! The hall carpet was stained also in many areas. We were anticipating the hotel fee so that wasn't an issue, but the internet cable was missing in one room and we had to search for it in our other room. We did call for help and we found the 1 cable about 45 minutes before the attendant came. Traveling with teenagers eager to get out and look around, we didn't have time to call for service for the other room. The lobby/check-in desk area is lovely and smells great. The service there was nice and the concierge as well. While we didn't pay much for the room, we would have rather paid more for a nicer more comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo has gone down, down, down”
Reviews.Author: AGentlRose
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Monte Carlo in 1998. At that time it was a lovely stay. I couldn't believe that not a thing has been refurbished in their guest rooms, except maybe the TV sets, since 1998. As far as guest service, the only friendly service we received was from the parking valets. The front desk clerk was a snooty guy named Thomas, who acted like he was doing us a favor, giving us and I quote "a beautiful room on a higher floor (19th so not really) with a Strip view because we were booked for 5 nights.. Well, the view of the Strip was minimal, it was more like a view of the Monte Carlo's casino roof top. The bathroom floor looked filthy, as if someone had grease on their shoes and housekeeping couldn't clean it. The wallpaper was coming off the wall in the bathroom and the wallpaper that was on the wall also has greasy fingerprints on it. The shower pressure was horrible and I like a stronger water flow, but this was like nothing I've ever seen before. I couldn't connect with the internet because there was nothing to connect to. I called the front desk and naturally get snooty Thomas who acted like I was stupid and didn't know how to connect. An engineer was sent to our room and he said "unforunately when the internet connection jack breaks, they have nothing to replace it with", so he went to another room to get one. Talk about stealing from Peter to pay Paul. Bedding was uncomfortable because it seemed like the mattress was worn out, again like I said befoe, it probably wasn't changed since I was there in 1998. I was so disgusted I checked out the next morning. I called to make sure I wouldn't be charged any penalties for leaving early and was assured that I wouldn't. I called The Rio and got a good deal with them (and a nicer room with a friendlier staff). Price-wise the Monte Carlo was cheap, and that is exactly what you get ---- cheap. My suggestion is to sign up for all the hotel-casinos newsletters and you can find a better deal.

Reviews.Title: “Superb value for money paid”
Reviews.Author: Chrispythegull
Reviews.Content: Being in our mid 20s, my friends and I wanted to get away to Vegas at an affordable price. After days of painstakingly combing many different travel sites, including the websites of each of the individual resorts that are located on the strip, I came across the Monte Carlo. I discovered they they offered prices that were especially reasonable in comparison to the others. I signed up to their mailing list and noticed that by doing so I was given a further 20% off their already discounted room rates. Our stay was over 4 nights from March 31st-April 4th, which fell during the tail end of spring break. I was able to secure rates through the Monte Carlo website at $44.85, $108.85, $120.05, and $44.85. (Thu, Fri, Sat, Sun) for each of the two rooms. We arrived at the hotel precisely at 3PM, which is check-in time, and entered the hotel to a rather chaotic lobby scene- which to be fair is par for the course for any Vegas resort at check in time. The lobby was elegantly appointed and there was a very pungent smell of women's purfume which seemed to be constantly pumped into the concourse. I enjoyed, though others may feel it rather overwhelming. After a very brief wait (ten minutes, maximum) we made it to the front desk itself. The woman at the reception was nice and personable. She assigned us rooms which matched our requests (near each other, high floor, non smoking, etc). We entered the room and discovered them to be adequately spacious but rather drab and colorless. The walls are painted with a plain vanilla color with little to nothing adorning them. The TV was large and HI def capable, however none of the channels were actually offered in HI-definition, meaning that all of the channels appeared horizontally distorted and took some getting used to. The desk and chair were very simple and rather antiquated, though again, adequate. The nightstand matched the desk in both appearance and age, though it did come equipped with an ipod clock/docking station, which was a nice touch. By contrast, however, it must be noted that the beds were FANTASTIC. They were exceptionally comfortable in every way, from the pillows to the sheets to the blankets. Sometimes hotels guests are forced to call in for more blankets due to inadequate bedding, but in our room even with the thermostat set at a constant 60 degrees throughout our stay, we never had to ask for more accoutrements. The blackout curtains were 100% effective in blocking out the brilliant desert sun even when it was 90+ outside and the sun shining directly into our bedroom window (We got a parking lot + New York New York Resort view on the 15th level). The bathroom was sufficiently large and well stocked with everything we could need, whether it be lotion or conditioner, plenty of towels, or even an extra roll of toilet paper should we ever need it. The water pressure was not lacking and the water temperature always quick to warm/cool as desired. The internet was adequately speedy, though the fact that there was no wireless internet capability meant you had to connect via hard wire, which was rather disappointing as I desperately wanted to utilize my comfy bed! We found the different pools and lazy river to be exceptionally fun and lively, though we were very disappointed that it all closed by 5PM! The sun was still up two hours after pool closure and the temperature had reached the 90s on Friday and Saturday . What's the point of even having a pool if it's not going to be offered in such ideal conditions? We felt that the casino was very generously spacious with many different fun options in terms of gaming. The dealers all seemed friendly as were the cocktail waitresses. We picked out three specific keno machines and gravitated towards them every time we went down to the casino floor. We got to know our local cocktail waitress Gemma who was exceptionally personable and really, REALLY made us feel at home. She really went out of her way to ALWAYS make sure we had drinks in our hands at all times, and not just the small freebie ones either. I drank exclusively pina coladas, and my drinks were always brought with cherry garnishes and copious amounts of whipped cream, just the way I like them. For reference, we sat very near the cafe and Brand Steakhouse, which were also near the fancy shmancy "rapid roulette" tables. It's often times the small things like this that leave lasting impressions, and in that regard Gemma definitely stood out. As a poker aficionado, I made it a priority to visit the poker room and play there a couple of times. On the whole I was VERY disappointed with the poker room and the EXTRAORDINARILY unfriendly service given to us by the hostesses at the front and the dealers as well. My friends and I had been interested in playing in some of the tournaments and when I phoned ahead to inquire as to how many folks had signed up, I was told not to worry about how many people had signed up and just come down and sign up. I insisted on knowing how many had signed up since the tournaments are 60 dollars to enter, and I was very audibly sighed at by the receptionist and told "Let me go find out" in a very overtly rude way. The poker tables themselves had an odd flat depression towards the armrests on the sides, so it felt like you were playing poker on a hill rather than a table. You couldn't "slide" your chips towards the betting circle as you might do on any other poker playing surface, here you had to lift up your whole stack and hope you didn't hit your stack on the lip of the felt and thus drop your stack. You'd also be admonished if you placed your chips on the actual 'hill' because your chips would be too near the betting circle and would thus be in an unsuitably precarious position. I'll decline to name the individuals I encountered, but several of the poker dealers who cycled into my particular game were humorless, dry, and extremely short with us. We were a lively table and we were very much enjoying ourselves, but one dealer in particular had an especially dour demeanor and passive aggressively let us know whenever he could that we were a major inconvenience to him. I've played poker in many different venues across the world and while I found the poker room itself to be rather comfortable and fun, the only thing I'll remember it for is the poor service and strangely designed poker tables. We wanted to try happy hour at The Pub and were disappointed at the limited choices offered for beer and appetizers. We were also not sure how one dollar for ONE wing qualifies as 'happy hour'... but that being said we were impressed with the quality and freshness of the wings and sliders that were offered. The sliders in particular were very tasty and we ordered probably 15-20 of them between the 3 of us. I hadn't been in the drinking mood so I ordered a root beer. While it cost a ridiculous 4 dollars, it was unlike any other root beer I had had before. It seemed to have been pulled from a keg and possibly fresh brewed. It had a nice, stout head on it as if it were genuine beer. I didn't inquire as to the specifics, but it was a very tasty and fresh root beer. My friend happened to order a chicken caesar salar and was aghast that during happy hour it was still a whopping 19 DOLLARS. Probably the most expensive caesar salad I have ever come across. Of course, this was the name of the game at every restaurant in the Monte Carlo, including at the food court. At any typical Subway location around the USA, for instance, you'll find that there is a selection of five dollar subs. Those same subs at the Monte Carlo will cost you upwards of 7 dollars for a 40%+ markup. McDonalds was a similarly awful choice in that regard, in that you'd find a standard big mac meal for over 7 dollars at this food court, way above what you'd normally find at a typical mcDonalds restaurant away from the strip. We dined at the Cafe on one occasion and found the food there to be good but the service a bit sparse and slow for a Sunday at 2pm. While prices were similarly high I found the food quality to be good. We ordered chicken tenders as an appetizer and they were very fresh and large, and my hamburger was tasty. I couldn't eat the whole thing. It must be said that my friend, who ordered the shrimp scampi, said that his sauce was VERY creamy, much more so than you would expect from a typical scampi. I agree, although I did enjoy the actual taste of it. One final annoyance that we encountered during our stay was the um, let's say punctuality of the housekeeping staff. I have no idea why, but almost immediately after checking in we got a typical "coin bang" on our front door with someone screaming 'housekeeping', We were surprised when even though she was hardly through with the first knock she immediately entered the room before I could even get up off the bed! She saw us and left. I went to the door and asked her if something was wrong, and she said she said in rather broken English 'room check'. I had no idea what that meant but just assumed it was a misunderstanding... The next morning at about 8:30- 9:00AM we got another coin bang on the front door with another woman shrieking "housekeeping. " She also scarcely waited more than a split second after knocking once before entering the room. Again, the woman saw us and said 'I come back later'. Having already been awakened, I went out and asked if they could just come back later at 2PM, and she said just put out the "Do not disturb sign". In fairness this is exactly what I should have done from the start (and it's exactly what I did every morning thereafter) but It was still an inconvenience to be woken up so early like that... In summary: Pros: Very comfy beds, affordable room rates, pool quality, quality and speed of cocktail service (especially Gemma), size of casino, large choice of games, kind dealers. Cons: Rude poker room attendants, high price of food and entertainment on site, pool hours, housekeeping 'punctuality', "Happy Hour" at the pub, lack of Hi Def channel selections to match HI Def TVs. Overall we were very pleased with the value we received for what we paid. We understand that 'your mileage will vary' with respect to the shortcomings in service and the other disappointments we encountered. None of the problems that we ran into seemed to be systemic administrative flaws, just individual lapses here and there. We would give the hotel a solid 4 rating out of 5 because it generally met and exceeded our expectations. Thank you for reading and I hope this review will be helpful in determining where you stay in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “You aren't the only hotel!”
Reviews.Author: WeddingGuest4211
Reviews.Content: The front desk clerks need to take some lessons for the proper manner in which to treat customers who have paid to stay here! Not only were members of our wedding party treated rudely and abruptly I saw many others treated the same way. Guess what, Monte Carlo, you are not the only game in town! The wedding coordinator could stand to take a few classes in proper manners also. I would never stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms Not Maintained”
Reviews.Author: SeaBreeze77
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo still has positives: good pool area, location, low rates, and a nice lobby, but it has huge negatives as well---lacking maintenance, dated finishes, worn furniture, dirty windows. Just be aware of what you're getting----something akin to an old, worn, Holiday Inn---and it can make sense for some people that don't demand luxury finishes or service. We, however, will not be back. There are too many great options in Vegas to return to Monte Carlo.

Reviews.Title: “Issues with room cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: Teespoon44
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving at the Monte Carlo to check in, the air deodorizer they use was quite strong but not uncomfortable. The check-in was quick and straight forward. We went up to our room and found the drawers pulled open, the adjoining door to the next room open, trash on the floor, and trash still in the garbage cans. It was obvious that the cleaning staff had not completed this room (beds were made and bathroom was clean). We went back down to the lobby and advised of our room's state. The clerk appoligized and immediately gave us another room on the same floor. When we entered the room it was in better condition, but the floors were not vacuumed as there was a large amount black lint on the carpet and hair on the bathroom floor. We didn't feel like going back down to the lobby so we called house keeping to advise them and asked that they do a vacuum while we were gone. When we came back, there was still hair on the bathroom floor and the carpet was better but still had lint in places. So if room cleanliness is an issue for you, you will not enjoy this hotel. The bed was very comfortful and we never had any trouble sleeping. The hotel amenities were very good. There are two Starbucks located on the resort. We mostly ate all of our meals at other venues on the strip. Cabo Wabo (Planet Hollywood) has a nice patio and delicious mexican food. Dinner at Pampas (Miracle Mile Mall, Planet Hollywood) was fantastic! I totally recommend going there. The Premium Outlet (North) is an outdoor mall that has many fantastic stores to shop at. I definately recommend getting the shopping passport; we saved a lot of money using it. We walked from the Monte Carlo to the New York, New York hotel and took the bus (WAX NB/WB) on Tropicana. It is only an 8 to 10 minute ride. Very convenient. Overall, I would visit this resort/casino again but would not stay here. I believe this resort is shown as a 4 or 4.5 star hotel (we normally stay in 4.5 to 5 star hotels). I would say it is more like 3 or 3.5.

Reviews.Title: “Find somewhere else to stay”
Reviews.Author: Hammer5457
Reviews.Content: Sure wish we would have. We booked this hotel 3 months in advance as the reviews I had read at the time were decent enough. We are in our 50's. Our biggest complaint was the NOISE! Our room faced the pool and the music played for the sunbathers was SO LOUD it reverberated in our room to the point that it was impossible to relax in the afternoon. We were on the 16th floor. Relatives of ours were on the 22nd floor and had the same problem. We had the same problem with the towels as a previous reviewer. Towels that had a burnt smell. Beds were too soft and were in need of replacing. Floors were dirty with sticky spots. The casino was good. The restaurants were nice, but pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SRPManitoba
Reviews.Content: I have no idea why there is even a single bad review for this hotel. We cheecked in early and they gave us a very spacious beautiful room. The beds were so soft, with memory foam toppers. We had a large screen tv and a clean and spacious bathroom. The location was wonderful in the middle of everything, but when you returned to the casino it was quieter than some which for us was nice. The food court was great with a huge variety and the restaurants were good as well. The pool was great it had a lazy river and a wave pool. We had a fabulous time and we were so close to everything. There is a tram to the Bellagio and the MGM across the street had a monorail stop so transportation was not an issue. Don't believe the bad reviews Monte Corlo is a great and affordable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “More than we expected!”
Reviews.Author: straubella
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay. Centrally located on the strip with plenty to do near this casino/hotel/resort. Pools were a lot of fun and plenty of places to sit in the sun. Casino was fun and not too smoky for us being non smokers. We enjoyed an upper level room that faced the strip at a reasonable price. The hotel was quiet despite the number of people there. I would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “She's a tired ole girl .....”
Reviews.Author: ZeldaGatsby
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 days Wednesday and Thursday because of a good rate of $42 a night and an upgrade to a sreip view special they were running. Well, except for location and the price, I got what I paid for, As everyone else has said....the towels do smell like burnt peanuts and not very soft. I imagine that there dryers are so hot as to actually burn the fabric time after time. Also the pool Nazi's as I called them (sorry about the choice of words) but no food or beverages into the pool area and they actually pay someone to stand there and police everyone as they enter, Secondly rationing the towels as if they were precious comodities 1 per person. And lastly the tower configuration only gives you about an hour and a half of sun until you have to move to another seat, good luck with that. My room 2199 was at the end of the hallway and yes, paper thin walls, as you could hear your neighbor come and go at all hours. Too many other Hotel options out there instead of wasting your hard earned dollar here again. My ONLY compliment was the valet, Derick who helped me find my car after misplacing my ticket and even remembering my name each time I drove up! A+ to Derick and a C- to the rest of the Monte Carlo. Also no wi-fi but an ethernet cable that you had to sit at the desk and not browse in bed as I emjoy to do. This is 2011 people wake-up! I will not return.

Reviews.Title: “wont be back”
Reviews.Author: tttoojftrndmd
Reviews.Content: we travel to vegas at least 6 times a year and stay at different hotel ,this was are first time here and we are not very fussy and have enjoyed most of the hotels but this one had a few things that really did bug us ,first the towels really do smell like they have been burnt and when you dry yourself with them you smell like you have been sitting by a fire ,we could not get into are room till 5 pm which was the latest we have ever had yet on are last day housekeeping was knocking on the door at 8am ,we mainly went for the pool as we were with are to young children first they search you like you are at the airport before letting you in and they made us throw are coffee away which we had just brought at the hotel away they would not let us move the chairs 1 nich apart as they said they had to stay together ,they just had way to many rulls for are likeing we on on vacation to have fun not to be told what to do......

Reviews.Title: “THE MONTE CARLO IS TERRIBLE!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kimma626
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews surrounding the Monte Carlo hotel, I thought we would have a great time, I WAS WRONG! Upon arriving from a long flight to the hotel at 11:45 pm, I was sent to a DIRTY ROOM. After lugging all my luggage BACK down to the lobby I was then given another room on a much lower floor. I went to the room and the carpet was filthy. It had toenails in it as well as food etc. AS I am calling housekeeping to come and vacuum, my husband went to lay down an d the sheet over the duvet there was BLOOD on it! I was furious! No one ever came to adress our concerns I pitched the duvet and slept with a sheet all night! I was so disgusted! DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not What it Used to Be”
Reviews.Author: rowan23037
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo for the first time 9 years ago and it was fantastic, so after trying a few other hotels on the strip over the past few years, we decided to stay there again but were really disappointed. The rooms were clean, but have not been updated since our first visit. When we booked, we booked a promotion that led us to believe we would be getting a pair of tickets to the show "Jabbawockeez" but when I called prior to arriving to ask what day the show tickets would be good for, I was told I had misunderstood the ad and tickets were not included, since the promotion had since been removed from their website, I couldn't argue it. The hotel was clean, but for the four days we were there, we had warm (not hot) water in the room only once regardless of what time of day we showered. They had an ice machine, but no ice buckets. The cleaning staff seemed to make a point of ramming their vacuum into the door to wake us up and get us out of room in the morning because they did it around 9-10am repeatedly every day of our stay. Finally, we found it a little unsettling that while our valuables were locked up in the in room safe, a small amount of change disappeared from the dresser in our room...makes one question what items need to be locked in the safe when leaving the room if 16 cents is not even safe!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay, With Serious Exceptions...”
Reviews.Author: Sophiemichaels
Reviews.Content: This place has so much potential, that if they'd quit trying to nickel and dime you in stupid ways, they'd deserve more stars. First of all, the resort fee is just silly. It's 15 dollars. Allegedly, this covers the 50 cent daily newspaper, fitness center (used by MAYBE 10 percent of guests), free copying and faxing (really? In Vegas? How many people use that?) Free boarding pass printing (whoah - pinch me...) and free local and toll free calls (for the two people left on the planet with no cell phone). I thought the room was decently priced for it's quality and location on the strip. The room is definitely no frills - no fridge, microwave, coffeemaker. It has a nifty ipod alarm clock - that was cool. The beds are comfortable and the pillows are puffy and plentiful. The room is big too. I had a crappy view of traffic and parking lot, but wasn't expecting much better as I didn't pay for strip view. Weird experience with room service: Went to order it, and had no menu. called down for a menu. Half an hour later, still no menu and two people come to my door to perform a "security check." No idea what that is, and they didn't explain - but they looked, saw that I'm a middle-aged chick travelling with a 4 and 6 year old, so wasn't much of a threat. So I call down again and say - thanks for the security check, now can I have a menu? Once I finally ordered, the room service took an hour and fifteen minutes to get to me! One thing about the hotel windows - they're old, and they aren't very thick and don't seem all that secure. Someone else here complained that the window opens only two inches... Well, I'm on the tenth floor of a high-rise - I don't WANT to "air out" the room by opening a window. Frankly, you don't want windows that open in a building where someone may have just lost their life savings gambling. Also with little kids, I wished I had more faith in the security bar that keeps that window from opening. So, back to the nickel and diming: They have a food court with mcdonalds, some Italian place, starbucks, subway and an Asian place... nice selection. So we get subway sandwiches and a bottle of water and make our way out to the pool. They search our bags and tell us we can't take "outside" food into the pool area. They employ a staff member who's only job is to go through your stuff and make sure you don't bring food or drink in . I said "Outside food? I bought this fifty feet from here INSIDE your hotel!" It's just such a thinly veiled way to force you to buy their pool food and drink, and you gotta love the sign that says it's for the guests "safety." I don't mind buying their expensive drinks and nachos (in fact I did later!) It's just such an insult to common sense and the guests' intelligence to frisk us for food for our safety. OK, on to more favorable stuff. The staff I encountered were ALL very nice, friendly and professional. The valet guys especially - enthusiastic and fast in their work. There is the cutest little cupcake shop on the property, as well as a music memorabilia store and fun clothing store with cute if overpriced women's stuff. The lobby's big and smells of roses. They have a HUGE restaurant called The Pub with nice beer choices, and you HAVE to try their sliders if you're into that... they are some of the best little burgers I've ever had. Lots of flatscreens and an overall yummy menu and different cool seating arrangements. Best reason to stay here with kids: The pool area. My kids absolutely loved it, and so did I. I would come back to this hotel just for the good time we had there. It's this cool oasis surrounded by highrises. The wave pool is fun and bright and clean, and the lazy river is big enough to be a blast for the kids, but small enough that you can see 'em as they go all the way around. Average hot tub, nice pool, but a little on the small side (the pool area wasn't crowded though, so it didn't matter much). The servers in the pool area were fast and freindly, and there always seemed to be someone there if you wanted something (again, they really push the food and drink there!) The drinks we had were delicious. My daughter cut her foot, and there was a first-aid guy there one minute after she started crying. Lots of lifeguards (maybe to enforce stupid rules like "You can't sit on the side of the wave pool." Probably for my own safety - that five inches of water in the shallow end could cause problems...) Anyway - the pool area really is awesome. Here are the things to look out for: At least this time of year, The hotel blocks the sun from most of the pool area for a good chunk of the afternoon. And the pools close at FIVE O'CLOCK! I guess the sun sets early and they don't have lights out there, which I think is also a trademark of Vegas - I was told they all close early. Bet it's so you'll get your butt out of the pool and go gamble. Also, the music was LOUD. Almost UNCOMFORTABLE LOUD. You get used to it after awhile, and the music was a fun party selection, but even slightly quiter would have made a big difference. NOTE: If you're travelling with a bunch of people and want to really treat yourself, there's a great VIP cabana aarea vailable for rent... it's 500 dollars, and your drinks (and maybe food) count toward that cost. It's fenced in and has it's own little pool, flat screens, really nice lounging areas and cabana cover. It's just awesome for a bachelor party or something. And trust me - you and a handful of people don't have to be professionals to drink 500 bucks worth in about three hours at this place!:) So there you go - despite the weird irritations, I'd stay here again. But what I'd probably do first is look for a comparable pool situation. My other reviews prove me to be a pretty laid-back traveller, but these guys pushed the irritation level a little too high for me to automatically give them repeat business.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Stay with friendly staff and a great location!”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTraveller13
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo is well positioned on the strip. Near bus stops, MGM, Planet Hollywood and drug store. Rooms are comfortable, nothing too fancy, clean with decent view of the strip. I found the 28th floor to be pretty quite. We checked in aroun 630pm had about a 15 min wait. not to bad. Hotel has a distinctive scent..soapy perfume-like smell. All the staff were most helpful and pleasant. Casino is small compaired to others however it has a great feel to it! Be mindful of the resort fee. The couple in front of us at the check-in were unaware of it! Internet in the room was part of the resort fee.Lot's of water pressure, shower was ok. The Ice Bar in the casino was interesting...be careful of the added $$$ once inside.

Reviews.Title: “Triple-negative experience: unsafe parking garage + overbilled me by 1 night + resort??”
Reviews.Author: MBatz
Reviews.Content: My car was broken into in their well-lit parking garage: rear door window broken, my product samples travel bag stolen out of closed trunk. Hotel 'risk management dept.' did not care: did not return multiple voice mails left. Eventually through my complaints at front desk, I was connected and begged them to look on their security cameras as supporting evidence for the police report. From the woman's attitude response, I knew right then nothing would become of it. She promised a return call which I got 4 days later when I was already back home: their security cameras recorded nothing and they are not liable. After all the frustrations of the lost value and having to fix car window, I left a day earlier than originally booked. A week after my return, I noticed the last night retroactively charged to my credit card, even though I had checked out early enough and had double-/triple-checked with front desk that I would not be charged for the final night. I had to call, hold, explain, complain, wait, wait, then was promised my money back within 3 - 5 work days. Anyways: why to they charge a hefty daily resort fee? For free local calls (who needs those in today's world?), a free newspaper (that you do not get at your hotel door but have to pick up near the elevator) and for their great swimming pools (which were closed in February!). They will NOT see me again!! I recommend: stay away!!

Reviews.Title: “At the Heart of the Strip!”
Reviews.Author: priteshUk
Reviews.Content: Great location as its bang in the middle of the strip. View from window was of the strip overlooking the MGM and Planet Hollywood. Other hotels will have more swagger and class (Venetion, MGM, Bellagio) but this one is very good too. Facilities and service are as you would expect from Vegas. The buzz at night probably won't be ideal for sleeping but definately recommended.

Reviews.Title: “5 STAR SERVICE AND ACCOMMODATIONS”
Reviews.Author: LINDBY1
Reviews.Content: We originally had booked a Spa Suite for 4 nights, but when we arrived, we asked for, and received, an upgrade to a Loft in the Monte Carlo's Hotel 32 for a very reasonable price. Our experience was nothing short of exceptional. From our first interaction with the front desk staff to the ease of check-in and check-out, we were amazed at the level of service we received at every turn. The entire staff of Hotel 32 was attentive, but never, overbearing, and always respectful of our privacy. For a few more dollars per night, we were treated to luxury view accommodations, a private lounge serving a continental breakfast, fruit and soft drinks during the day, light appetizers in the evening and coffee 24/7. Our stay was extremely comfortable and pleasant. We vacation in Las Vegas twice a year and would most definitely recommend Monte Carlo's Hotel 32! We look forward to staying there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Wow what a Value”
Reviews.Author: Sara_and_Daniel
Reviews.Content: I'm a value shopper that usually tries to find the best deal I can for my travel dollar. The Monte Carlo didn't not disappoint. Booked online with them for $39 per night and wasn't expecting much for my money. What we got was a great experience! Was it the Wynn or Bellagio of course not but for the difference I saved I was able spend the money on great show tickets!! If you are looking for a clean, nice, friendly hotel in Vegas then book the Monte Carlo. Viva Las Vegas!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Vegas Experience!!”
Reviews.Author: MudOnTheTires
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo offers a great location, tons of food options, and a great casino. The reason my sleep quality is rated low is because it always looks like daylight in Vegas, not because the bed was not comfortable. Who goes to Vegas for sleep anyways?

Reviews.Title: “Horrendous Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: kcollins11
Reviews.Content: I was there with 15 friends this weekend, and the customer service was horrendous. They didn't book our rooms together (as they had promised) and offered no apology. We were there at 9am but unable to check in until 5pm, and again, no apologies. Just bad attitude from the people working at the front desk and the managers. Every employee we spoke with was condescending and rude. Also, they charge a resort fee of $15 per night. For what? You still have to pay $10 to have access to the spa area. The pool was closed the whole weekend, and the staff there were rude and unapologetic as well. Sad that we gave them so much business and got terrible service and attitudes in return. I won't there again.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: rottimom1
Reviews.Content: nice hotel for the money. very clean, comfortable beds, nice shower. bathroom was a good size. pool area was nice and opened although it was too cold out for us to want to swim. casino smelled nice not smokey.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly, noisey and drab.”
Reviews.Author: tlhinx
Reviews.Content: If you want a lot of room space for a great price this is good. However, we did not like much else. The #1 trun off for us is that the bed smelled...really, really bad. The window won't open more that 1/2 an inch so don't think you are going to air out the room and the hotel is noisey, playing non-stop loud music and ads. But, maybe that's just me and my distaste for Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Dkelley78
Reviews.Content: Had an excellent time here. Perfect location on the strip seeing as it is right in the middle of everything. Staff was excellent all the way from the front desk who allowed my wife and me to switch from a room with two beds on the 7th floor to a king room on the 11th floor to the kind engineer who help us get to lock off of my wife's suitcase after we accidentally locked our keys in it. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice but lots of things need attention in their rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Stephano617
Reviews.Content: The first few nights we had a room on the 28th floor overlooking the pool area (Aria side), during the day the poolside music was so loud we couldn't take a nap. Also, the speaker system wasn't hooked up. The last night we had a suite W/hot tub, it was very nice but the sound system in this room was also no hooked up! For the price I think I'd go somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad nor Fussy”
Reviews.Author: allyk19
Reviews.Content: After carefully reading the reviews of this property and much research, we booked this hotel on word of mouth and location, when we arrived there was no reservation for us after a 10 hour flight! we where givin a room with a strip view but i felt there was to much drama made about our reservation not been found, we had booked through a large tour operator so i wasnt worried because we pre paid so i found there was no need for the dramatics! we where told to come back before 11 next morning and it would be all sorted out, it wasnt, then we where told to come back an hour later and it was sorted, the hotel itself i found was lovely no frills no fuss it didnt have amenities as other strip hotels but i wasnt looking for that it had a food hall which consisted of mcdonalds, starbucks and Subway which was good, the casino was huge and a good choice and plenty of tables, the locaten is probably the best on the strip i found, the pub which is located in the hotel have happy hour every day between 3 & 7 only on domestic beers though as we get caught out $20 for 2 pints of Heineken!! the best way to acess the strip is perhaps cut through the Aria across the crystals shopping centre and onto the cosmo hotel it saves crossing roads and up and down stairs and elevators. the rooms are clean and beds are comfy try to get located in hotel 23 they seamed to be the best rooms from what i heard thats where we where. if i was returning to vegas i would prob book into the cosmopoltian as its the newest on the strip and very nice indeed!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, but avoid the Strip- stay downtown”
Reviews.Author: Cyclonefamily5
Reviews.Content: Monte Carlo rooms very nice and big- clean- staff was great, especially the valet staff. They do an excellent and fast job. Rented a car cheap to get around. But we fell in love with the downtown area- it was busy and fun. The Carlo's casino was dead by comparison. The nitelife downtown cannot be beat. On the strip, it's just a bunch of younguns strolling around trying to avoid the weirdos, the hustlers, the sex sellers. Prices high for everything. The downtown area was somewhat older and definitely more mature, not nearly as seedy. Prices were much better. $16 lunch vs the $48 lunch on the strip. Checkout the Golden Nugget, we will stay there next time we go, and we will take our teenage kids. Gamble there and at the Golden Gate and the Fremont and Binions.

Reviews.Title: “Spa Suite - spacious and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: musiqueetcirque
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a weekend in Las Vegas. I searched around to find a suite with a nice jacuzzi tub and found the spa suites at Monte Carlo. When we arrived, I was a bit overwhelmed at the odour of the deodorant spray they spray in the casino level and lobby of the hotel. For someone who is sensitive to odours, it is overwhelming... but luckily didn't permeate into the rooms. Our room was on the 24th floor, and at first I was worried that it was near the elevator, but it ended up being very quiet. Only noise I could hear was our neighbours. Their TV and talking in the morning. But that was minimal. The room was huge, a bit dated, the carpet was a bit stained but the bed was VERY comfortable , unusual for a hotel. I'd say their bed was as nice as the Westin beds. I love it when hotels don't use comforters/bed covers but rather cover the duvet with a clean bedsheet. At least you can sit on the bed and not worry. A part from the stained carpet the room was very clean. It was nice to have a couch, and a bar with a fridge in the room and the spaciousness of it was really nice. It was great to relax in the huge hottub bath which was in the middle of the suite and looked outside over the pool. The shower also had a steam shower in it, which was really nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but not a great hotel...”
Reviews.Author: hawkeyegirl2002
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel online at expedia. Got it for a great price considering we went right before Thanksgiving. Booked a suite to just get some more space. Room size was nice, bathroom was nice, but view of parking lot not so nice. Also, they don't have bottom sheets on the bed, only a flat that doesn't stay put at all and doesn't seem to fit the bed! They did accommodate our son with a fold-away bed, but the sheets smelled. Overall, the hotel feels rundown and in need of sprucing up. We didn't gamble there so no opinion. We did eat at the mexican restaurant up front and it was not good at all; food cold, service crappy, etc. do not suggest going there!

Reviews.Title: “If you can get a great rate - stay here!”
Reviews.Author: BVGinPSC
Reviews.Content: After two back breaking nights on the hard beds at the Flamingo, I was actually grateful for their having messed up my reservations causing me to need to look elsewhere for a final night in Vegas. Calling through my mLife promotions for the best rate, I landed at the Monte Carlo and got a great room for $39/night. (Plus their $15 resort fee, but I'd been paying that much for internet each day at the Flamingo.. soooo.. it kind of evened out.) Check-in was a breeze, although I could see it being a totally different experience if it were crowded. There were no formal lines or queue. You just sort of found your way to a desk agent and were helped. Mine was extra friendly and fast (what is it about Vegas hotels and airport gate agents that require 15 minutes of typing to process anything?!) I was given a room on the 19th floor on the east spoke (MC is in the traditional 3-spoke ground plan that Mirage and TI are also in.) I had an awesome view of the mountains and the backsides of NYNY, Excalibur, Luxor and Mandalay Bay. Now, it may have been in comparison to the torture device that I'd spent the last two nights in, but the bed here was so much nicer! Nicer linens and a big comforter! Room was spot on in size (though, no huge.) I imagine if it had been a 2 queen room it might have felt cramped. The bathroom was spacious and didn't feel like I was crammed into it. My only complaint was the shower. Several other people have noted this and I have to agree --- the water pressure on the shower feels like you're getting sandblasted! OUCH! I enjoy the Monte Carlo's gaming floor and have always done well. Their choice of dining options is enough to satisfy most appetites, but if you can't find what you're looking for here, the MC is connected via free tram to Aria/CityCenter/Bellagio/Cosmo, and NYNY is a 3 minute walk. All-in-all, a great hotel with a just-short-of-awesome location.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: ziggy409
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in Vegas and I booked everything through Expedia. I originally wanted to stay at the Planet Hollywood or NYNY but the Monte Carlo was the cheapest so I booked it. I read all the reviews online and heard about "the blood on the sheets", "thin walls", it being outdated, etc. Don't believe the reviews! I loved the hotel, it's super nice inside, it had a new television, a big bathroom, and I didn't see any blood on the sheets. The beds were super comfy to sleep on and it also had an ipod dock if you wanted to play some tunes. The only thing I would complain about would be that one morning the alarm in the room beside us which was vacant was going off. I called security and told them and literally five minutes later they were there fixing the problem. As for location, it is right beside the NYNY, across from the Coke, M&Ms store, and MGM Grand. There is also a convenient tram that takes you from the Monte Carlo to CityCentre and then on to the Bellagio (we took that quite often). We didn't use the pool as it was chilly for Vegas standards (I'm from Canada so i thought it was hot), but it looked really nice. The one thing that was annoying was the the entrance to the hotel is at the side, but if you want to get to the strip quick there is an entrance in front. The staff were okay. When I checked in I thought I would try the "$20 trick" which she quickly shot down saying that they don't accept tips, however, she did offer me a strip room which i believe is more money. Also, we booked a king size online but we got two queens instead, she said something along the lines of "just because you book it online doesn't mean you are going to get it.." it wasn't a big deal in the end though. Also, one morning we wanted to go to the nearest IHOP, the concierge printed us off directions, which we followed but we knew something was up when we weren't seeing the sign or anything. It was then I noticed that on the paper she printed it said "Closed 2008", so that was annoying and a waste of time. Other things I didn't like was the lack of wifi in the hotel, internet was included in the resort fee, however, it was plug in internet and I brought my iPad so I couldn't use it. Overall though, I would say that it's a great hotel and great price! I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Sadly and with regrets...”
Reviews.Author: SoFlaK
Reviews.Content: I will this sadly and with regrets. I have only stayed at one Vegas hotel but it was way too far away from the action. Originally, we planned on staying at the Cosmopolitan but had to downplay our trip. We still decided to go because we believed that Vegas can be done cheaper -- maybe we were wrong. The front desk staff was MISERABLE! They screwed up my reservation and then proceeded to not fix it but tell me they were giving me a strip view. I am so upset and feel RIPPED OFF. Do not stay here - the casino is bland, the pool is awful, and the hotel overall is just below middle of the road hotels for Vegas. The room is run down and the bathroom fixtures are old (or just need to be replaced). NEVER AGAIN.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Time_Traveler016
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews, and yes the water pressure is high, but after a long day, that is a great. And yes I found something not working, but one call and 20 min later it was fixed. I cannot think of anything I can say bad about the place. It was clean, quiet and private. Had all the amenities we wanted and would and will stay there again. As many times as we have been to Vegas it was the most bang for the buck we have ever received. You ask and they gave it to you. And when we checked out the young lady asked about our stay and she lit up when we said it was awesome, I think she was as thrilled as we were.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, decent room size, ok casino.”
Reviews.Author: gary25
Reviews.Content: I like the location of monte Carlo, it's almost in the middle of Vegas which is very convenient ESP if you are going for just 1 night. Rooms were big and bathroom was pretty ok as well. I liked the fact the have a food court right next to the casino which really helps.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed at 8 Vegas hotels. Easily most disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: Antony T
Reviews.Content: The service is what really lets this hotel down. It is poor. Everything else like the bars, pool, casino and food are average at best. So many better options out there, many of them cheaper. A hotel drastically lacking atmosphere in such a vibrant city. Plus point is it is on the Strip and not much else. In summary: Bland.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: thinkn333
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Monte Carlo on the front end of a business trip. Since I was traveling alone at that point I was very concerned about being out at night alone. I felt very safe and had a great time. Using the tram was very convenient. The room was well maintained. The shower head was some kind of square aerator. By the time the hot water hit the body, it was cold. Not my greatest experience. My husband checked into another room later in the week and also had a good experience. Great trip, good location and the staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Average room Free Nights”
Reviews.Author: Colo01
Reviews.Content: Before I start. Let me say my rooms were "free" . Parking was good and just across from check-in. Check in went smooth. The room was just a average room with nothing that stood out. The bathroom was not up to par. It was dark and shower head was like being in a power washer. ( No Adjustment to be found ). Towels smelled like they were burnt. These rooms could use some upgrading. Casino was clean and service was OK. Buffett was 3 stars out of 5 stars Overall I still loss money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BlueCrocus
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Monte Carlo for 4 nights and can't really fault our stay. The service we received was great both from the check in desk and the concierge. We had a twin room with a king sized bed each which was very comfortable, the sheets and towels were changed daily. Our room had a good view of the strip but it was very quiet. The buffet is really good value for money, we ate at another hotel on the first morning but found the Monte Carlo had much more choice and was cheaper so we ate there every day after that. The service was excellent too, especially Ben. The only downside was The Cafe, the service wasn't as good as it had been elsewhere but thats a minor fault. Be warned though - the portions there are massive! We had a sandwich and it was big enough for 3 people to share! All in all we had a great stay and the hotel is in a good location. I can't understand the comments on the decor as compared to some of the hotels on the strip which aren't great to say the least, the Monte Carlo is miles ahead.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: govanboy47
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the monte calro , for first time , we were upgraded to a spa suiet, and it was fantastic , the bar,jacuzzi and steam box , were excellant, the hotel is in a great location , and although a little older than some of the hotels , it still has a bit of class to it , would def recommend staying here .

Reviews.Title: “location!”
Reviews.Author: tillypoppy
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from this hotel, and unfortunatly a lot of the reviews that I have previously read are correct. After a good 10hr flight our room was not ready and we were told to keep calling a number as it maybe ready between 3-5pm. Not good enough when all you have done is travel and they know you are arriving- also I made some requests to the hotel( I am fully aware these are not guarrented) but none were given to us. The room although it was not what I asked for, was actually a good clean size. Nice flat screen tv and ipod/iphone docking station is a great extra touch. The walls are extremely thin!! You can hear everything and I mean everything. Bathroom large and clean good shower, but the towels did smell like they had been burnt, we had brought our own towels so used them. Tried reception again to find out about making a phone call, so unhelpful I couldnt believe it and told us to call another state in America it would cost roughly $90 so I then asked about internet and was told oh just use your laptop. Not the repsonse I expected especially as I didnt have a laptop, However we met another couple who showed us where and how to use the internet Location was excellent and the monorail was a great extra bonus cant fault this, also can not fault the pub. Head there for happy hour and the mini burgers are great. For the location and vaule for money would prob stay again and just hope we get a different member of staff at check in.

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay at or recommend this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: JMTM6059
Reviews.Content: We arrived at noon and check-in wasn't until 3:00. We received a number to call and when we did, we were told the room was not guaranteed until 5:00. The woman at the desk was extremely rude. She obviously hated her job. I bit my tongue because it was our first trip to Vegas and we weren't going to let one person ruin our stay. The room was just a typical room we would have gotten at a Holiday Inn. The bed was hard as a rock and the pillows harder. You can hear people in the rooms next to yours and anyone walking down the hallway. The bathroom was old and looked dirty. The make-up mirror actually fell off the wall when we tried to close it. The tub was stained. the floor was stained. The towels smelled as if they had been burnt. We were charged $15.00 a day for the fitness room and newspaper which we never used and never received. We were not told about this charge until we were checking out. The pool was never opened. While we played in the casino, the waitress only came one time to ask if we wanted anything to drink and that was because another player complained loudly. Then, the waitress came back with a drink for the complainer and no-one else. The dealers were rude. We did most of our gambling at Planet Hollywood. What a difference in atmoshpere. The waitress was constantly at our table and the dealers were extremely nice. Diablo's at Monte Carlo was good. That's about it. I would never stay at the Monte Carlo again and I will not recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value for money!”
Reviews.Author: beachlove111
Reviews.Content: Loved this place! Right on the strip within walking distance to everything! We got amazing winter rates and honestly couldnt have asked for more. Rooms were fine, maybe the bathroom could do with an update, oh and the shower was kind of terrible, but your in vegas, all u need is a comfy bed and it definitely had that, and curtains that blocked out any hint of sunlight so u could sleep in alllll day if u wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo- wonderful surprise”
Reviews.Author: LAKWethersfield_Ct
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo is not one of the Big Mega Hotels in Las Vegas. But if you want a great hotel at a terrific location and at a reasonable price, the Monte Carlo is your place to stay in Las Vegas. It is right next to the NEW City Center and ARIA RESORT. You can walk to ARIA without going outside. There is a FREE tram that goes from Monte Carlo to City Center and then to BELLAGRIO. Food is very reasonable. There is a food court which has five or six reasonable priced fast food type food venues including MacDonalds. The Buffet is excellent and very reasonable. Breakfast Buffett will cost you about $15.00 which includes an omelet station. There is a pub which has many TV sets showing Sporting Events. Good barfood but it is noisy. Rooms are good size and clean,. Elevators go very fast. You don't wait long to get an elevator to your floor Valet parking is Free like most Vegas hotels,but you don't have to wait too long to get your car. On my floor ( the 26th), you get free USA Today. I don't know if this is true on other floors There seems to be less noise and less crowded in this hotel I got a great view of the Las Vegas Strip from my room. Ask for a room with a view of the Strip You can walk to the MGM Hotel which is across the street. JUST A TERRIFIC LOCATION.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: jdog16
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Monte Carlo for 3 nights. The room was clean and spacious. The only issue I had with the room was that the water pressure in the shower too strong and hard. Very painful! Staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel is in a good location, you can catch the tram to Aria and Bellagio (free) or it's about a 20 minute walk down the strip to other places. This hotel is not as fancy or modern or large as other hotel/casinos however it is more affordable. 'Diablos Mexican Cantina' and 'The Pub' are both great dining options in the Monte Carlo Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelming”
Reviews.Author: cheddarhead
Reviews.Content: The wave pool and lazy river were out of commision. It was too cold to use them anyway, but would have been upset had it been warm enough. There was a sickly-sweet floral aroma being pumped through the air to offset the smoke odor. I would have preferred the smoke smell. (and I hate cigarette smoke) Our room was fair. Comfy bed. Had to call the desk for a hair dryer. It came promptly. Good but pricey food at the Pub, but the dueling pianos was annoying. Diablo's restaurant...don't bother. The worst margaritas I have ever had in my life. Didn't have a strip view, but that was okay because I got to watch the sunsets. I've spent a lot less for hotels and got a lot more for my money.Check in and check out went fine. Not a bad stay, not a great one either. Will go somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value & A Great Bed”
Reviews.Author: Mexicodreaming1
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at the Monte Carlo many times in the past but not for a few years so was concerned about some of the previous reviews. We did get a wonderful deal at $42 a night for a regular room and like that end of the strip. We went for a 50th birthday event and stayed 6 nights. The room was clean and the bed is wonderful. The towels were clean and new and the maids were very attentive to any requests for extra towels. Our room had a large new flat screen television which we never did watch. Everyone we dealt with at the hotel was very friendly. Yes the casino/hotel does have a strange perfume smell that some of the older casinos have but we did not spend much time in the casino since the City Center is just a tram ride away. The cafe for breakfast was just so-so but many wonderful restaurants close by. For the price this hotel cannot be beat.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: ntxhais
Reviews.Content: went here a year or two earlier than said on the *date of stay* found a great rate online for this hotel- $50/ night! enjoyed the stay--only for sleep ;) good location low hotel staff interaction, but helpful when interacting hint: you can always get help from any of the other concierge services (taxi drivers, too) for help with night life, sight seeing, culture, etc. plus before you go, you can always google to find more things; loved to see what you can do for free on the internet (some of the freebies expired because of the change in times (ie) free cards from all casinos thru a casino supervisor, but most of the free stuff you can get is still in effect I bought the power pass, you can totally get free tix from all the said places EVERYDAY your pass is valid, so your friends can go in your stead if you don't want to, etc. you'll never make a full trek across the strip if you are going to play tourist through it all so bide your time gamble and get your free drinks there plus power pass gives you a free $10 without purchasing anything in the venue, so you can grab a cocktail or a snack at the same location you get your powerpass in caesars palace some of us spent a lot of money while a couple of the girls didn't (free riders!), but i had my fun! I rented a car but didn't use it much, taxis & walking is the way to go; I played the tourist and had the safe fun. be careful, good luck and have fun!

Reviews.Title: “I would definately stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Sooner_fan_12
Reviews.Content: The VIP staff (Lisa) was amazing and very helpful. She made us feel like we were special. This is a wonderful hotel. We had a clogged sink when we first checke in but they had it repaired within 30minutes. Good courtesy maintenance staff, very professional.

Reviews.Title: “why do I have to pay for hot tub and sauna”
Reviews.Author: valleyview10
Reviews.Content: After a day of shopping and gambling, went to use the hot tub in the hotel and was told I'd have to pay $15.00. Also the hotel has no where to eat breakfast except Subway and McDonalds. Took my business elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: ceiberman
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week early Feb 2011, incorporating Superbowl weekend. Check-in was quick and painless. Which was a relief after a 10 hr flight. The staff were welcoming and friendly. The room itself was clean and as well equipped as we needed for our stay. The strip view from the 31st floor was as a good as we could have wanted. As an unexpected bonus the room came with 'complimentary' wi-fi as part of the resort fee. I understand this is not yet available in all rooms but is being rolled out throughout the hotel. The location was ok (its towards the edge of the major strip Casinos) and is well connected - there's a free tram that links the Monte Carlo to the Aria and Bellagio. At the end of the day you're not going to find Bellagio or Aria type quality at the Monte Carlo. The flipside is you're not going to be hit by the sort of prices you'd find at those hotels. The Monte Carlo provided fine features and comfort levels for what is essentially a hotel from the top of the budget range / bottom of the mid price level. Would definitely stay there again if I was in town.

Reviews.Title: “good value but in need of some updates...”
Reviews.Author: ginabuchanan
Reviews.Content: This made the 3rd time I stayed at Monte Carlo in a year. I travel on business and my colleagues like the convenience of this hotel. Upon checking in on Sunday, 2/13, my room (King non-smoking) was not ready. They offered me 2 queens non-smoking but then advised this room was not ready either. Note it was 4pm. It was either wait 30min for 2queens or 1hr for the King I had reserved. I chose to wait for the King. Once I got into my room is was fairly clean, not spotless but I've seen dirtier. The room did have a faint smell of cigarette smoke though. The bed did sleep great. The internet was wired. No wireless. I was not able to connect to the wired internet and did not have time to wait for someone to troubleshoot. This was annoying since you do pay a $15/day resort fee whichs includes internet, USA Today, and gym usage. Get a M Players Club Card and they will send you special offers. I actually got this room for $39/night and my colleagues paid $56-$70/night. It was during Chinese New Year and Valentines Day, along with numerous business trade shows all going on at the same time. So I felt the rate was great. I ate in the food court - they have Subway, Starbucks, McDonalds, Sbarro, and some other choices. Ate dinner 1 night at The Pub - great Pub food. Also ate dinner 1 night at the Buffet - $19.95 and some good choices. Had breakfast 1 morn at the Cafe - delicious french toast. CVS pharmacy is right next door - worth the walk over to pick up snacks, sodas, toiletries, etc. vs. buying at the shop inside the Monte Carlo. I've never used the spa services and the pool was closed. Free parking within the parking garage. Convenient walkway over to the Aria Center City (don't even have to go outside). Overall, a good hotel for the $, good location on the strip (right beside the new Aria City Center), and good options within for food & entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “Annoying aspects, but overall....nice”
Reviews.Author: asurly1
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a Tuesday afternoon on a pleasure trip where we met some family for a fun time in Las Vegas. Made it to the hotel and stood in a long line to check in. (which is normal, and I understand) Was told by the desk clerk that our Spa Suite was not quite ready, as most of the Spa Suites were full last night. (It was the Tuesday after Valentine’s day) It was probably 2:30 – 3:00 local time. Don’t they make you leave the room by 11 AM?? (I was thinking...) Oh well, it’s a pleasure trip....I can stand to go “Chill out” in the Pub and have a couple of beers. I was given a set of keys, but no room number assigned, and was told to check back in about 45 minutes. We went and had a couple of beers in the bar. (Which was really nice but kind of expensive....but...again...had to remind myself: ON vacation.) Called the number they gave me...was told: 45 minutes...I slightly protested saying I was told that about an hour ago, they responded with: “The room is not guaranteed until 5 PM” .....I really need to get my stuff in the room, as we are supposed to be meeting the rest of my party and going out in a little bit and it would REALLY be nice if I was situated in the room, with access to my stuff and it NOT stuck in some Bellman’s warehouse. But, ok....met the rest of our party whose fight had come in from Denver. They had their room already. Went back and forth with this about 3 times...was given the same “45 minutes / 5 PM guarantee thingy” song and dance number. Again.....I realize it’s a HUGE hotel, and this IS Vegas...but it’s kind of hard for me to realize it taking 6 hours to clean a room. Ok...after we finally got in the room....VERY nice! Comfortable looking room, inviting bed, wonderful looking Spa tub. VERY pleased for the price we paid. The room had the steam shower option which was VERY nice for my girlfriend’s cold / sinus condition. Believe it or not....the shower head also ACTUALLY had some water pressure. I was amazed! It had a little “wet bar” with a small refrigerator which was also nice. As for the casino. We are not smokers, I don’t like it, but my girlfriend has a VERY LOW tolerance for cigarette smoke and it is one of her “triggers” for migraine headaches. Just walking thru the casino it had a pretty heavy smell of cigarettes. I personally think that they could have ventilated the casino a little bit better. I know that it will never be smoke free, but a little more ventilated would be a LOT better. We ate at the breakfast at The cafe because it was handy. I must admit, it kind of bothers me paying $14 + for breakfast, but again....I’m on vacation....happy thoughts. However...it was pretty good! We had a few issues with the climate control system, but the maintenance man showed up and very courteously explained the situation and we were mostly good the rest of the trip. The Bell staff was very good and courteous.. This place is considered a “mid-range” hotel.. We stayed here because of the Spa Suite. We have stayed at the Luxor’s Spa Suite, (and liked it) but this place is even better. It has a nice location on the strip. There is both a CVS and a Walgreens nearby. There were some “annoying” things, but more than likely we will stay here again. We can’t wait to go back! February 2011

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hospitality/Customer Service Ive Ever Experienced”
Reviews.Author: KMcquade6053
Reviews.Content: After traveling since 4am - I arrived in Las Vegas around 12pm - called the hotel - was told my room wasnt ready but should be by the time i got there - I arrived and was told it wouldnt be ready til about 130pm and to call a phone number they provided to check the status then - I was surprised there were no clean rooms since it was such a large hotel - but i waited - I called at 130 pm to hear it wont be ready til 530pm! Unles, if course, I pay them an extra $30 - then i could have a room right then! So they had clean and vacant rooms sitting empty while i had to wait! RIDICULOUS! Then there was a $15 daily resort fee for in room internet that didnt work, a fitness center but you couldnt use the locker room w/o paying extra, a newspaper i never received- We went to the concierge to find out about hiking and the hoover dam trips - whether we should rent a car or take a tour - We were completely blown off by the girl claiming she "knew nothing about the trips or what we should do so we should go look it up online" - I manage a resort in key west and I would have happily fired our concierge if s/he EVER talked to a guest like that!!! The rooms were clean - pretty noisy but it is Vegas after all - the front desk was always rude - the bell staff was Wonderful and so was the operator - they were the only hospitable ones there

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: ryanosorensen
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nothing to write home about. That being said we did not spend much time at our hotel. We spent most of our time doing activities elsewhere. It does seem dated compared to other hotels. This old look is especially apparent in the rooms with their brass colored finishings along with the heavy wood feel. The carpets also seemed a bit dated. The service was great with a request to switch rooms being accomodated with little hassle. The maintenance man was also quick to change one burnt out light bulb and put a new one where one was absent (Perhaps the maintenance man would not have been needed if the lights were actually checked before?) It was nice that the hotel had easy access to a monorail which takes you to the Bellagio (which is a great place to spend some time). We got a good rate so I would say I got what I paid for. I would be a bit upset had I paid more though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Quality and Equally Great Value”
Reviews.Author: BruceofWorcesterMA
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrrived, the hotel appeared and smelled clean, even in the casino which can tend to be overrun with cigarette smoke. The room was clean and well maintained. Hotel staff were friendly and smiled. We made use of the fitness center and spa. Both were nicely equipped. The only drawback was the whirlpools seemed to be down frequently. Convenient location to other hotels and attractions. Pool was closed due to weather, so cannot provide comments on this aspect of resort.

Reviews.Title: “For the money, it can't be beat”
Reviews.Author: amdstrots
Reviews.Content: This hotel is no venetian or Bellagio, but it is a nice place to stay. It is not so huge that you get lost just trying to get to the strip. It is starting to show its age and can use some updating, but nothing like excalibur or some of the older hotels. The rooms were small but clean and the bed was very comfortable. The service was excellent. The casino was a good time. The food court definitely saved time and money. If you are looking for a good hotel and a cheaper stay in vegas this is it!!

Reviews.Title: “Needs some updating but no real problems”
Reviews.Author: LetsGetGone
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in Jan/11 - great location on the Strip. Had a Monaco suite and it was very clean. Bed was comfortable but the pillows were too big. Room was noisy due to location - right near the central area near the elevators, plus we could hear every word of the conversations taking place in the room next door. Internet is through cable connection only - no wireless. Ate at both the buffet and the Cafe in the hotel - both were very good. Free parking is a bonus. All our dealings with hotel staff were pleasant. Just needs some updating with amenities found in other hotels, such as a small fridge, wine glasses in room, wireless.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointed .... don't let the pics fool you !!!”
Reviews.Author: angbocook
Reviews.Content: our room was very dirty.... the bathroom has mismatched faucet in the tub along with stains in the bottom of the tub.... this is supposed to be a 4 star resort, not sure who rates this resort but could not have saw our room. first when we checked in we walk into a room with someone getting dressed !! (Had just check in and received the key to that room that someone else was already in). waited in iine again to get another room that was a queen room (had reserved a king...) waited again and lucky us we finally got a room. this stay is a nightmare, will never stay here again.... booked thru tripres.com, they would do nothing to assist in this matter. i have pics of this hotel if anyone would like to see email me @ angbocook@yahoo.com.

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: 186337Peter
Reviews.Content: Went to the monte carlo in nov 08 ,staff very helpful,room was nice, everythink you need.The casino is not the biggest, but you only need to play on the slots,to have a free drink, just give a $1 tip. The breakfast in the monte carlo is the best,its just past the brandsteakhouse,bacon,eggs,hashbrowns,toast,fresh juice,if you finish your pot of coffe,they give you another one. the pub is great ,mouth watering steak,and very big,great attmos. The food court is also good,the best pizza.When i went the andres restaurant was closed,it was being done up,realy wanted to eat there,but there is lots of other places to eat in the monte carlo hotel. Iam hopping to come back if i can save the money

Reviews.Title: “Good, solid hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Lisa60713
Reviews.Content: We're surprised by the negative reviews. We visit every year for family and we have always had a really good stay. The rooms are spacious and clean. It's centrally located and the service is excellent. Requests are handled quickly and very efficiently. They have an excellent staff.

Reviews.Title: “Best Trip Ever”
Reviews.Author: cherry4249
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Monte Carlo over the Halloween Period. The Rooms are very spacious with two double beds in, their is a desk and cabinet with tv. The bathroom includes a bath, and has toilettres placed in every morning when they are cleaning the room. This hotel is very clean, has a number of shops within the hotel. Food court that includs mexican,2 x starbucks, macdonalds and many more, plus dinner area's, Ice Bar There is also a bar in the hotel. The staff where always friendly. Not to sure about the gambling as didnt go to vegas for that. The hotel does have pools only open from like 0930-1730, never used them so couldnt comment. The location of the hotel is opposite the hardrock cafe, and i would say its in a great part of the strip. All in all i would reccommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good price, good location, nice bed, no hot water”
Reviews.Author: valentinevacation
Reviews.Content: Overall we thought we got a good value here. Nice surroundings, comfortable large room with comfy king bed. Water in shower never got hot in 3 days. No coffeemaker in the room. Good location to get around strip. friendly but nothing above and beyond. We paid $67.00 for king room Mon-Wed. stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price and will stay there again!! Way better than Mirage.”
Reviews.Author: KCCho
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Vegas. First trip we stayed at Encore (which is amazing if you have the extra bucks or a friend with comps) and Mirage (overkill on the air freshener and not very clean). Monte Carlo was a gamble after reading the reviews on here. Pros- good price, good location, fun casino but not so big you get lost in it, tables with bets low enough my hubs felt comfortable playing on them, clean, food court for cheaper and quick food, close to CVS for snacks/water and other random things, pretty good cocktail service, fun atmosphere Cons- thin walls, BAD buffet (spend the extra $15 and eat at the Bellagio buffet), resort fee, pool never seemed to get much light

Reviews.Title: “better places to stay”
Reviews.Author: rsandy43
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks amazing both inside and out and the good value buffet for breakfast, lunch and dinner, that is where it stops. We stayed on the 7th floor with the ceiling fans of a building next to them being able to be heard all night. The toilet flush was extremely noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Go for it if you don't mind slightly aged rooms”
Reviews.Author: DanielDP
Reviews.Content: For less than $100, the hotel stay is good. The rooms are probably still in the early '80s, but other than that, the bed is comfortable, the service is good, the facilities are good. Now the negative sides: no wireless: if you are at the Monte Carlo for business and not for the casino, you may not like that. As my first time in Las Vegas, I wasn't aware casinos are not obliged to be non-smoking... Well, if you need to go to a restaurant, guess what? you have to go through the casino.
