I don't care for gambling, but I really dislike smoke, so a no-no there. Avoid the Chinese restaurant in there like the pest: worst Chinese I have ever had? probably not, but surely close to that. The rooms are slightly noisier, but all in all acceptable. Super basic toiletries and "sandpaper" towels don't make for your ideal bathroom experience.. You are better off renting your own car than taking a taxi: much cheaper and more flexibility.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Start to a vacation because of Monte Carlo....NYNY saves the day!!”
Reviews.Author: brousmith
Reviews.Content: Please review my NYNY rating they really saved our trip because of this............... I always look at the reviews before book a property. I would have to agree with the bad review of this hotel. I understand we did get to Las Vegas early and check in is at three. But after 5 trips to Las Vegas, we have never be treated like we did at the MC. We had to wait for 3 hours for customer service to get a Manager to complain about the gentleman at the desk that was very rude to my wife. He was not a people person....look people in the eye and be nice. If you don't like your job find something else. After a very long wait, we finally got a supervisor and was put in a Non smoking room(booked a smoking). Plus, we had to put a extra 400 dollars for a deposit(which we not told about at booking). I feel MGM really needs to look at this property and worry about losing the 4 diamond award. After all this, I called the player club and decided to cancel this booking....to many bad things for us to enjoy this property. To be fair...I was not able to rate sleep and rooms because we canceled this booking.

Reviews.Title: “Aged hotel, closed pool”
Reviews.Author: kexbox
Reviews.Content: Ok, I was travelling in february but why closing down all the pools when neighbouring hotels don't? No Flat-TV on the rooms, that is so "un-Las Vegas". Furthermore our windows were extremely dirty so you could almost not look out of your window, the front desk got us another room that was cleaner. Location is ok for trips on the strip. Our night was cheap and so everyone has to decide what he wants to get. I would stay there again if cheap but hotels in Vegas aren't really expensive at all.

Reviews.Title: “Had an excellent time at Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: funinthesun44
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Monaco Suite, Feb 6 - 9 for my husbands 40th birthday I was skeptical that the rooms were going to be noisy.. did not hear a thing! we were on the 13th floor, right next to the elevator.. complete quiet! Loved the extra room and the 2 bathrooms! The jacuzzi tub was awesome! Big pillows, down comfortable. Only thing I could say if I had to, is the flat screen tv was a bit far away from the bed for watching at night. Had a mini fridge in the room which also came in handy! Loved the fact that you did not have to walk a mile to the lobby, or to the elevator.. everything was close and very very easy to navigate (unlike the larger hotels) We got the all you can eat buffet for $30 a day per person at the hotel.. very good food This was the first visit back to Vegas in over 10 years.. I am so happy we made the right choice in staying at Monte Carlo. I honestly do not know why people complain about this hotel. I think you get what you pay for. My suggestion is to pay a few dollars more and get the larger Monaco Suite. You will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Hddd
Reviews.Content: We were really excited as we have never been to Vegas before the first question everyone asks you "what hotel are u staying at" well everyone had told us the Monte Carlo was really nice so I was so excited!!! We arrived in the morning and our room wasn't ready after calling and requested an early checkin so we went for lunch. Once our room was ready I was diapointed as it was still nice but not what I was expecting we had a great view though. Horrible shower head so much pressure that. I felt sand was blasting on my body. Call the engineering and it was fixed on day 3. Then had something wrong with our heater and at 3am is started making huge noises every 5 minutes. Would never stay again a this hotel as we had alot of problems with our room pillows were so hard and the worst was you could hear everything even the people sneezing in the next room, I'm surprised we couldn't here them taking a crap!! Would like to stay more in the middle of the strip cause after the third day I dreaded walking bAck to hotel. Also found it strange that our towels would stink of smoke so bad couldn't even dryoff properly.

Reviews.Title: “Underrated hotel.”
Reviews.Author: JaviSRK
Reviews.Content: My first time staying here, but not first time being in the casino. They've darkened up the casino a bit, but it works to their advantage. We checked in on Dec 30, and a room was ready at 10:30AM. The standard room is nice. Sheets were clean, and the room was in good shape. Still had a Tube TV, but I hear they are changing that to flat screens. We had an issue with the shower water pressure being much too high, and a doorstop falling off. A quick call to maintenance and 30 minutes later, the problem was fixed. The Cafe's service has a lot to be desired, but OK food. Dragon Noodle Co. is your standard asian fare, but they make their dim sum in-house. The cupcakery is sweet goodness, and the Pub has great burgers and onion rings to match. Also a great place to watch football, especially when the sportsbook needs updating. IMO, Monte Carlo is well on it's way to becoming a hidden gem, and its value is nice (minus resort fees of course) due to its easy access to Aria, Bellagio and Cosmopolitan. 3 stars for service is due to excellent service by hotel staff, but below average service by The Cafe and Dragon Noodle Co.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location Nice Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: chabibialways
Reviews.Content: So we came here Christmas weekend. The rates were great and the location is very good and convenient. I made fun of everybody at first for talking about the food court, but its awesome and also convenient. We stayed in the Monaco Suite and it was a spectacular room. Only con is the sheets were dirt and room service had to go through her whole cart before finally finding clean sheets :( yuck. But the bed is very comfortable and the room was a great value. I would stay again. By the way the Cafe people are not friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: MJUtah
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo with 2 other couples we were traveling with. They chose it over other hotels as it had a 4/5 star rating on the booking site. It was OK, but definitely not 4 stars! Good points: The king size bed was comfortable, pretty clean, good location, friendly staff, good water pressure in shower, food court attached to hotel, access to tram from inside hotel, free parking. Drawbacks: Very basic, room rather small, no wireless internet (wired internet was available), small, boxy TV, funny smell of some kind of cleaner throughout hotel, could hear everything going on in hallway outside room, the buffet was pricey for average food. The price was reasonable but I could have found a nicer hotel for the same price if we hadn't wanted to stay with our friends. I am told that all of the Las Vegas hotels tack on a resort fee, but I thought it was an absolute ripoff. $16 per day (on top of the room rate) for basic amenities that are standard for most lodging ie a newspaper, internet. printing your boarding pass.

Reviews.Title: “Good Price and Value”
Reviews.Author: Goodscout
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean. A little noisey, could hear other rooms. Pillows too big and hard. Shower head was a little strong on flow.

Reviews.Title: “How soon can I come back?!?!”
Reviews.Author: EllieMaeofMontpelier
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo is the best value on the strip. It is upscale enough that you don't feel like you're getting cheated but not over priced like some of the bigger name hotels. The foyer is elegant and the staff at check-in are top knotch. Some of the dealers in the casino are nice enough to teach you the games if you're unfamiliar, rather than just take your money while you struggle to get the hang of it. It says something when a dealer can make you feel good about losing your money. My only complaint is that when you order room service, the dishes/tables are not picked up from the hallway in a timely fashion. They just linger out in the open for serveral days. That's kind of gross. We wouldn't stay anywhere else in Vegas. We've done the research and visited almost every resort there. This is the best deal.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but location a let down”
Reviews.Author: happychick28
Reviews.Content: Don't get me wrong, this hotel is great value for money. The pool area is fantastic, and you can actually find your way out of the casino without getting lost! There are some great shops, and a free tram which will take you to the Aria, Crystals and Bellagio. We had an issue with our neigbours one night because they decided to party till 3am one night - not a problem if the walls were sound proof! We didn't need to call security, as someone else had, but it took 3 visits for them to get the message (in my opinion, security were a little 'soft'). If we were to visit Vegas again, we will probably pay more money and stay in a different hotel more central to the strip as the Monte Carlo was further out than we thought - we never did make it to see some of the other hotels (but a good reason to go back) - Viva Las Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, burning nostrils!”
Reviews.Author: Stodrod
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, unfortunately the hotel and casino is dated inside. The hotel uses some sort of detergent or fragrance to mask the smell of cigarette smoke. This made all persons in the group suffer with burning, bleeding nostrils. I would not enter this hotel ever again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Impressive, Impeccable, Irresistible ; Monte Carlo Las Vegas, Thank You!”
Reviews.Author: Mario2k4
Reviews.Content: Me and my Wife went on an extended weekend to Las Vegas, and we decided to stay here. We came with her extended family to celebrate her uncle's 40th Birthday. There were 8 of us who booked our rooms here. None of us have stayed here, but all of us have been to Vegas before, us being the most experienced, this would make our 6th trip in 2 years. I made the recommendation to stay here based on the location and it's 4 star AAA rating, and the rate's were very attractive as well. We booked in November, and were able to save over $150 compared to the standard rates, a suggestion I would have to others, if you can, book 2-3 months in advance and get a good rate locked on, and if possible book directly with the Hotel, I found this get's you the best deals. We arrived early at 9am and tried to check in, found out that our room would not be ready till 3pm or maybe later. We were OK with that, but we had a bigger issue at hand. Of the 4 rooms we booked, one reservation could not be found. They had rooms available, but of course would be at a much higher rate, loosing the $150 savings. I had a contact from an email I had sent to the hotel, and I gave her a call. She was there, and was very friendly and polite. She told me to wait and she would get someone to give me a call back. 15 minutes later the Supervisor of the front desk called my cell. I told her what had happened. She took my information, promptly took care of the issue. The missing reservation was corrected, and they honored the price we had been quoted earlier. We also got our rooms cleaned and ready early, 12:30 pm, without even asking for it. WOW, now that's GREAT service! Everywhere we went on the property, from the Valet, to the Bell Service, to the Front Desk, the Housekeeping staff, casino personal, were all very friendly, and greeted us whenever possible with a very pleasant smile and words of welcome. I was very happy to hear the Valet staff especially say every time we returned, Welcome back! Simple but heartwarming. Our room was a strip view on the 21st floor, as everyone's in our party, another surprise that was arranged by the front desk without even requesting. Very convenient when we had to meet up to go out to eat dinner or go out on the town. Rooms were very spacious and VERY CLEAN, beds were comfy, lots of pillows (4) and lots of drawers and closet space and hangers. The bathroom had plenty of marble, big mirror, a low entry tub/ shower combo, and this AWESOME shower head that really refreshed you when taking that shower. I need to find out where they got it, I'll have to get one for myself! I could go on and on about how much we like Monte Carlo Hotel and Casino, but I'll stop here. I would stay here again, and recommend others visit this very wonderful Hotel Resort. Oh .. wait, I almost forgot to mention the great staff at the Spa and Fitness center, I only went 1 day, but the service and facility was top notch, walk in and you get to use the shower, sauna, and even arrange for a massage, (for a nominal fee) all this without leaving the fitness Center. Very nice touch. On behalf of me, my wife and my extended family, we'd like to thank the Management and Staff of the Monte Carlo Hotel and Casino Las Vegas. You guys ROCK!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room, great location”
Reviews.Author: Ozi1_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice - not luxury but comfortable and clean - and located in a great spot on the strip - in between Ceasar's Palace and New York New York. Our room was just a normal twin room with two double beds - not large but comfortable. The TV was not flat screened but it worked. There was free internet provided as part of the resort fee which was about $16 per night. The staff was nice and helpful and we had no problems with either check-in (which was really quick) or check-out (did it over the hotel phone). There was free parking right outside the door. The only negative was the price. I booked this at the last minute through a las vegas website and it cost me $1200 for two nights. Yes, you read right. Usually this room would be around $80 per night. However, silly me did not pre-book our accommodation (the only one we did not book in a month long holiday!!) and turned up in Vegas thinking we would just find a nice hotel to stay in - after all there are so many. WRONG! There was a convention on - the world's largest electronic convention - with 250,000 delegates attending who obviously were smart enough to pre-booked their accommodation!!! Anyway, we are from Australia and I was not going home without staying on the strip - so I paid the price. My tip - book your accommodation before you leave home.

Reviews.Title: “Value for the money, but...”
Reviews.Author: buzzcat5
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at MC in January. Check-in was delayed, but that is not unusual for Vegas. Yes you can walk to In-n-Out, which I did, but ask the concierge for directions as one side of the street does not have a sidewalk. I would not try it after dark. And yes, it was worth the walk! (about 20 minutes, max). MC is a great location with easy access to Aria and others. Its rooms are in need of upgrades, i.e., towels, TVs. Water pressure in shower is really good. On a scale of 1 to 10 I give it a 6, but I feel with just a minimal amount of attention it could be a 7 or 8. And somehow, they have got to reduce the smoke smell, especially in the casino. I was looking for value and for the most part received some, but I would definitely have to have a nicer room in order to stay there again. The help there -- at the hotel and in the casino -- were very nice, with the exception of one female attendant at the craps table. She seemed aggravated that I was not a veteran craps player and had to be told of the rules. But that was an exception as I played 3 nights and had some fun. The sports book is pretty good, but again, with some minimal attention, could really be nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, rooms could do with updating”
Reviews.Author: CocoSianElle
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in December as part of my husbands 30th Birthday. The only complaint is the rooms are quite dated and for the rating of this hotel I expected more. The front desk were really helpful, they let us check in at 9:30am which they didn't have to. The hotel itself is quite big inside and has some nice places to go, food court is great for grabbing a quick bite. If you get the chance, you must eat at 'The Pub' this place was awesome! Would stay here again...as we were leaving it looking like they were updating some of the rooms with new lamps - they really need new tv's!

Reviews.Title: “Via Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Vegas32655
Reviews.Content: Great Service. Checked us in early which we appreciated after a 14 hour flght and no sleep. had a couple of hours sleep and then we asked if there was an interconnecting room available which indeed there was after a couple of hours so we changed to a better floor and view. Nothing to complain about. No room smells, Lifts were fine. Bathroom was fine. Rooms were a good size. Casino wasnt too busy. Centrally located on strip. Would definately recommend and stay again. No groups of 'people' handing out business cards for girls out the front of hotel which was a definate plus as you get sick of seeing and hearing them flick the cards in your husbands, teenage boys and girl faces!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location/Casino/Restaurants, adequate room.”
Reviews.Author: fdl1
Reviews.Content: The public areas are lavish, the lobby is grand, and the casino is fun. It's location on the strip makes it easy to get to MGM Grand, New York, New York, and the Aria and Cosmopolitan. The room meets standards- has a comfortable bed, and clean washroom. However, there's no added amenities, like WiFi (not even pay per use), and the TV is older; somewhat surprising given the rest of the property, but I guess in Vegas they don't really want you to spend too much time in your hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Yes, the rates are cheap but go elsewhere with your money...”
Reviews.Author: gretchenvan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo for 2 nights.I wasn't expecting much but there wasn't much to even meet my small expectations. I was not at all impressed. First off, we checked in and were told our room wouldn't be ready until 5pm. We opted to stay in a 2 queen bed room so we could have a room as soon as we checked in. The resort fee is a joke, $12.95 a day for nothing-- no pool in January. The room was very old and outdated and the bathroom was just gross. Everything was old, including the shower head. The shower was similar to the shower from hell, the water felt like nails as it sprayed out on you all while flooding the bathroom as you showered. The rooms have no perks-- no cups, no ice bucket, no coffee pot. Basic rooms usually have these. The walls are VERY THIN, I repeat VERY THIN. You can hear other room's when they shower, flush their toliet and even cough. If the air or fan made a little noise it might drown out the sound but they don't. The beds were average, the pillows were about a foot thick with no give. And at 9:00 on Sunday morning, we were awakened by housekeeping banging on other people's doors shouting "Housekeeping." Fun way to wake up after a night out. You would think if they start cleaning the rooms that early that they would have them done by the time people began to check in. BOTTOM LINE: There are tons of deals in Vegas-- go find one somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Has only got worse”
Reviews.Author: itravel088
Reviews.Content: I had previously stayed at the Monte Carlo over 10 years ago. I enjoyed my stay at that time as the hotel was relatively new. It appears that the hotel has not invested any money since that time. The mattress on the bed was lumpy and even the sheet was torn. Imagine my surprise when after showering the bath towel had an obvious blood stain on it and other dirty marks. Watch out for the shower. The water came out with such force that the shower curtain would fly open from the breeze and leave water on the floor. The casino floor was not set up in any logical manner. Perhaps this was planned so as to avoid providing free drinks. It sure was hard to find a cocktail waitress. If you play the slots you might as well just add the cost to you room bill. The slots paid worse than any other casino that I been in. All in all, I am never going back

Reviews.Title: “Showers are hazardous to your health”
Reviews.Author: LLreed
Reviews.Content: The hard spray from square shower heads in the bathrooms was painful! The pressure was not adjustable and sprayed the bathroom floor as well. The towels were stained and smelled. The sheets smelled. No coffeemaker in any rooms. The room was old, bathroom had stains. yuk Pool was closed because it did not reach 65 degrees outside. If the spa was closed, you could not get to the gym, even though it was a part of the fees you paid. what a ripoff!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Value, Mid level hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: CoachJSin
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Monte Carlo for first time. Hotel was nice and clean. Like other reviews, i did notice a strong perfume smell but it didn't bother me and would not be a deal breaker. I absolutely love the fact that it is connected to the Aria Casino, very convenient. Went to see the Jabbawockeez show, they are talented performers and really enjoyed it. For anyone who has seen Stomp or equivalent, this show is so much better with an emphasis on Music. Room was very basic, nothing special but it was priced perfectly for a solid strip hotel. Location was great. I had a rental car and found the hotel very easy to get to and from. Valet was very fast. Had to pay a resort fee of $16, but I used internet in the room and the Spa (only $5 w/resort fee), so it was a good value for me. I will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value on the strip”
Reviews.Author: Phillieboy
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo exceeded expectations. It is not the newest/trendiest/fanciest place on the strip, however it has a helpful staff, central location and clean rooms/facilities. I would definately stay at the Monte Carlo again. It is a good place to conserve the vegas budget without slumming it!!!

Reviews.Title: “This in Vegas.. You've got to be kidding me!”
Reviews.Author: lalwilliams202
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night, and one night was about all I could've taken. I was there for a group convention and to say I was shocked at how low budget this hotel was is an understatement. Of all places, you can't have a shabby hotel in Vegas. There's just too many options out there. And a run down hotel is not how you stay competitive in a hospitality market such as Vegas. Let's start with the overall stinch when you walk in the place. It literally smells like your grandmother's house. You know the one that she's had since the 60's. The lobby was eh, not impressive, but the worst part is when you get to the rooms. They don't have wifi at all! That's a big no no for a business traveler. More importantly the wired internet service that's included in this miscellaneous resort fee (which I argue that this is no where close to a resort) didn't even work! Then there's a huge bulky TV. Who on earth still has this an option. NO HD Tvs in Vegas, you've got to be kidding me?!?! Everything about the rooms made my skin crawl. Antiquated tiling and bathroom amenities. Shower shoes were a must. Yucky carpet, stained furniture. Even my lysol didn't bring me comfort in this place. The bathroom fixtures had the yuckiest soap film on them. It was just terrible. I couldn't get any sleep. All night I tossed and turned, as nothing would prevent me from believing this place didn't have bed bugs. I would NEVER stay here again. You're better off staying at Courtyard Marriott than this place. I don't think it helped that I stayed at the Aria the week before. To say this place paled in comparison is putting it lightly. They'd literally have to tear this building down and begin again to be competitive. YEAH, I repeat, I'd NEVER stay here again! PS: For anyone even remotely considering bringing their significant other.. abort, abort, abort. Avoid the dog house. There are better options out there at the same price point.

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: jnelson5
Reviews.Content: This was my 10th stay. They are spraying something into the air to cover some smell. It caused my eyes to burn. Resort Fee is a joke. $15 for nothing we used. No wireless service. I can't use the gym due to bad back. (Can't use the pool in January). They won't waive the fee and if you don't accept, no room and they keep your deposit. Two beers for $16. Come on. Room was clean and nice. Furniture is very old. Sorry Monte Carlo, you've lost a long term customer. Buffet was overpriced. Only went because we had 2 for 1 coupons.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel stench is overpowering and staff is rude.”
Reviews.Author: Biblit
Reviews.Content: The overpowering perfume stench that greets you at the door never eases. After 3 days of a 5 day stay, I had to seek medical attention for inflamed sinuses! The public restrooms are disgusting, and complaints to staff fell on deaf ears. Ironically, the nicest employee on the premises checked us out.

Reviews.Title: “No wifi and 3G reception spotty”
Reviews.Author: JoettaK
Reviews.Content: Monte Carlo has perfect location, is clean and nice enough but no coffee machine in room, no wifi and the hotel gets horrible 3G on ATT. If you can live without those it is great place for price and free tram to new city center and Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “Why would anyone stay here with all the options in Vegas?”
Reviews.Author: rdkell
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Monte Carlo twice. The first time was in 2002, and the second was this week. And not one thing in the rooms has changed, except that the severely dated furniture, television, etc. have been worn down and now are dirtier and more banged up than I remember. My company booked this hotel for a trade show or I wouldn't have gone back. The lobby is alright, though by Vegas standards pretty unimpressive. There are no good restaurants in the hotel, we ate at the pub and it was pretty awful. A mall-style food court with McDonalds, Subway, etc. in located prominently in the middle of the casino. The room was terrible, with possibly the least comfortable bed I've slept in since college. It was lumpy and awful. The pillows were easily 8 inches thick with no give. I ended up folding a towel in half and putting it in a pillow case. The television was a very old tube TV, and half the buttons on the remote did not work (picture included). My sink was broken, I called and they were going to send maintenance that never came in my 3 day stay (picture included). Also, my room stunk like industrial cleaning product mixed with cinnamon. I had to crack the window and turn on max air and it didn't really help. And perhaps the strangest element to my room: a show print on the ceiling (only Vegas right?), I included a picture. There was also a whole drilled in the wall, which brought to mind that Erin Andrews video thing, luckily I don't think there would be a market for a similar video of myself. I go to Vegas a lot, the town is hit with the recession and there are great deals to be found. On Hotwire I can usually get a 4.5 or 5 star for $100-$120 a night. Saving the extra $20 for a dump like this is not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Experience !!!”
Reviews.Author: Somerwyne
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo wasn't one of the hotels on our list but we were very impressed ! We got a great deal on a " Monaco Suite" and were very pleased with our choice. The suite was" fantastic"-had a sofa,super comfortable bed & Jacuzzi tub in a huge bathroom.The hotel has been recently renovated and is wonderful - although I don't think our suite was one of them ,it was clean & more than adequate.There was a Mc Donalds down stairs where we got breakfast every morning before heading out. Very convenient ! It wasn't as crowded as the bigger ones-Loved this hotel !!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING HOTEL - GREAT LOCATION - AWESOME RESTAURANTS”
Reviews.Author: boisverf
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th time visiting Vegas and our first time staying at the Monte Carlo. I have to say it was at par with some other resorts that we have stayed before. Comparing this resort with the Mirage or the TI which we have stayed before, I have to honestly say that the Monte Carlo is nothing short of these two. It is also much cheaper price wise and the location is as much centralized. The pool was closed due to bad weather so we can't give you any help with that part of the hotel. The room was very clean, decoration was awesome, the parking garage is close to the hotel and there was always plenty of parking spots available. The staff was courteous everytime we had to talk to an employee, we had the greatest service. The restaurants in the hotel were very good, the Diablo's Cantina is nothing short of awesom for food and service. We had the greatest burger of our lives over there. The Pub was also a great place for a great time, they had dueling pianos and the musicians were great at entertaining the crowd which was a little small but we never felt it. I would defnitively recommend this hotel. As far as the other reviews about the room having a smaller tv no flat panel, maybe you should realize you're in Vegas, go out and see the city instead of watching tv. The Monte Carlo resort is also a little quieter than other resorts, much more peaceful than the TI, which is a great thing. If you are looking for a great party place, maybe look at another resort but if you're looking for a great place to stay and be able to walk around, this is your spot. Their slogan "Unpretentious Luxury" is right on and we will definitely be going back to the Monte Carlo.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price, location and winnings!”
Reviews.Author: crehman
Reviews.Content: We were traveling with 4 young 20's, 2 mid 50's and an 80 year old - all within a budget. I was very pleased with the Monte Carlo. While it was not the most happening place for the young it IS a great place to go to gamble and close enough to everything on the strip without paying the higher prices! We loved the ice bar and the pub for their great burgers. The rooms were very nice and clean. The beds were very comfortable! We especially loved the fact that we were able to get a table rather easily to play blackjack and the slots seemed to be throwing better here than any other hotel. It was nice to come back to our casino after being out in the noisy, crazy, crowded ones on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: DonnaLD
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, nice and clean hotel. Hotel Staff were very friendly. We loved using the lazy river to float on with a drink at the pool area. The hotel is on the strip walking distance to everything. If you love tex-mex food the Diablo's Cantina restaurant is amazing! This restaurant is located infront of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Third stay at Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: ne1travel
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at the Monte Carlo and for the price point it has always been a good value ($29/night + resort fees) Normally we stay Sun - Fri but this time we added a friday night stay. We are now 52 and enjoy a place in Vegas with a pool and Monte Carlo offers a nice pool and sitting area although it has bee enclosed by the ARIA. All in all it is a nice stay but beware that once the clock strikes noon on friday the music at the pool changes to a younger crowd music and is very loud and becomes a spring break atmosphere. Even in the casino area the music changes and some of the craps table workers were complaining. During the week it is no problem. The rooms have been redone since our second stay and the hotel itself has been renovated but still is not mor than a 3 1/2 star. Not sure if we would go back or not because of the younger crowds. But I still think it is a great deal for a nice looking Vegas place to hang your hat for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Not one that you really remember but central and a great value”
Reviews.Author: bryan_m11
Reviews.Content: When booking the Monte Carlo I couldn't really remember where that hotel was located but it's in a great location, super close to the airport and right in the middle of the strip. The hotel it's self is set back a little but not off the main area and has a little shuttle that goes for free over to the Belagio. From this hotel you can pretty much walk to anywhere else. The rooms were nice and clean though not as modern as most of the other places. For some reason there was no internet in our room but other people on other floors had it. I usually would have changed rooms for this but I was there only for a few days and it wasn't so important. The price for the Monte Carlo was great, I don't think I have ever paid so little for such a nice room but I guess it is Vegas. The Hotel casino is OK, not as big as some but it doesn't really matter as long as you can get on a table or in a game. The Kobe beef burgers in the in hotel restaurant were great, and i'll review it separately.

Reviews.Title: “Great location on the strip, not fancy”
Reviews.Author: doyledOttawa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at MC for 3 nights in Dec 2010 and had a great time. The hotel is closer to the south end of the strip, right beside NY/NY. It is a bit dated and could use some reno's but all in all it was a fantastic stay. The casino is not small, but it's not massive or overwhelming either. There is a food court near the elevators to go up to the rooms and we quite enjoyed the convenience of grabbing breakfast before we began our day. The prices at the food court are very reasonable, unlike some of the fancier casinos. Check-in took a bit of time, but the line up went quickly. The rooms are certainly dated, but you don't spend much time in your room in Vegas anyways :) I would stay at the MC again - the staff was friendly, the rooms were fine, and the location is fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location, fantastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: samnuz
Reviews.Content: Having (unfortunately) just returned from Las Vegas I have to say I couldn't have been more happy with my stay at the Monte Carlo. I was slightly concerned going out there having read some negative reviews but the hotel exceeded my expectations and I was very happy. The rooms were clean, light and spacious and although the tv wasn't plasma (not really a big deal) there were lots of channels to choose from. The hotel staff were very helpful in letting us switch to a strip view room at no extra cost and the concierge were extremely helpful. In terms of location I can't think of a better place to be. A free shuttle service that runs approx every 3 mins straight to the Bellagio means you are at the centre of the strip within minutes. In addition, the bus stop outside which allows you to go up and down the strip for $7 a day means you can see everything there is to see in Vegas. The 'Street of dreams' in the hotel isn't really dreamy - a pub, Harley Davidson shop and some others but with Caesers and the Planet Hollywood mile of shops just down the road there's plenty of choice elsewhere. My only gripe would be the fact there were no mini-fridges but other than that I loved the hotel and would not hesitate to go back and win some back of the money I lost! I 100% recommend to all!

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointed”
Reviews.Author: daymeeyan
Reviews.Content: We have spent lots of time on the strip at various hotels, but this was the first time staying at Monte Carlo. Prices were expensive due to the fact we were staying over New Years Eve, but we wanted to be in the middle of the party. We booked 2 rooms and both were essentially the same. Our room faced the pool and Aria. Unfortunately the pool was closed because it was below freezing, but somehow we still had to pay a $13/night "resort fee". Just another way for them to sneak in a hidden fee I guess cause we couldn't use anything resort worthy. The room itself was well worn and in need of everything new. Just extremely dated from the beds to the bathroom. I found that the foam pillows were too high for me and actually hurt my neck and back. I stay in lots of hotels as I travel a lot for work and this was probably the most uncomfortable I've been.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: holidayfor4not2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Monte Carlo from January7 -10. We were on the 29th floor. and had a great view. We usually stay at Paris, or Treasure Island but got a good price as we( my husband) were here for the CES show. I was very worried after reading the negative reviews but no worries. Firstly, the parkade is a very short distance to the lobby, unlike most Las Vegas hotels. The lobby is beautiful, fresh flowers, very clean! Check in took no time at all, personal were very friendly. Our room had a king size bed, very clean, lots of room for the desk and chair and side table. The bathroom is a bit plain, but was clean. Towels were plentiful and white and fluffy ( previous reviews said the towels were stained). All staff were very friendly! Casino is a lot smaller than most which we thought was a good thing. Getting around inside the hotel is quick and easy. Food court was convienent, buffet was very good. The is a drugstore right beside the hotel to buy water, snacks, they even sell sandwich meat. We have stayed in numerous hotels in Canada, USA and South America and are quite picky regarding cleanliness and atmophere. We enjoyed our stay at the Monte Carlo and would stay again. It would be nice to return when the weather is warmer as the pool area looked very nice.

Reviews.Title: “A great base for a trip to Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Lu_and_Pete
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo for New Years 2010/11 in a Strip view room on the 28th floor. The view was great and we enjoyed the NYE fireworks from the MGM Grand from the comfort and privacy of our room. Our room was clean, spacious and elegant with a very comfortable bed. It was surprisingly quiet and dark, and we slept very well here. The Monte Carlo seems to have less attractions then some of the other hotels/casinos which we found a bonus, as it wasn't overly crowded with tourists. It's location approximately midway on the Strip is great, and makes it easy to explore all of the main attractions. We didn't eat at the hotel, but the restaurants looked nice, and we loved the Cupcakery! Staff were helpful, but perhaps somewhat clinical. I would highly recommend the Monte Carlo and hope to return some day.

Reviews.Title: “Old and worn but might be cheap”
Reviews.Author: CCR032
Reviews.Content: I was traveling on business and did not pay for the room. I understand rooms may be very cheap ($40-60) so if cheap and on the strip are your top priorities this hotel may still be for you. Otherwise, there are much nicer places. Everything about it is old, worn, and cheap. The carpets are filthy, the hallway walls have empty hooks (where some docoration once hung), some of the room number plaques are missing and the number has been written in marker on the wall, the ugly desk lamp is bolted to the desk (so you can't move it to have space to work), the TV's are old, the desk chair (and only chair in the room) is uncomfortable, the rooms smell musty... There are no nice touches such as a coffee pot in the room. The fitness center is only open 6 am-7pm. There is a crowd on weekdays at 6 am with all cardio machines taken by 6:15 (better on Saturday). The equipment is cheap and several treadmills were out of order. The casino is small (and smokey) and the dealers were expressionless and make no eye contact. They looked terribly unhappy to be there. The steakhouse is nice. Diablo's is just a sports bar serving overpriced Tex Mex.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but a bit dated”
Reviews.Author: Laineonthemove
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located down one end of the strip next to the new york new york hotel and opposite the hard rock cafe and m&m world.. It is set back a bit and has some sort of roman theme. When we entered the main reception it looked quite nice but it is not on the same scale as the aria next door or the mgm grand. The couple who we had arrived with had requested a room on the smoking floor and my partner had asked for a room near them on the 25th floor. When we arrived on the floor you could smell smoke (obviously) I do not smoke so was already a bit miffed that my partner had requested we be on this floor. We had been booked into a deluxe strip view room which is the standard room but on a higher floor with a view over the strip, the rooms come with either a king size bed or two queens. When we entered the room we had been given two queens (which we had not been asked which we would prefer) The view out of the window was amazing but the windows looked a bit dirty. The rooms are pretty dated with brown patterned carpet and an old style tv inside a big cabinet a desk lamp and chair. The bathrooms are fine with a decent shower inside a bath and a large counter with sink and mirror. There are no tea making facilities and no mini bar in the room which is a bit dissapointing. I was not happy because the room smelled of smoke and I wanted a king size bed I decided I wanted another room on a non smoking floor (Im not usually one of those complainers but on this occasion after an 11 hour flight from the uk I wanted something a bit better) So back we went to reception and I explained the situation and apologised for being such a pain. The lady was very nice and gave us a room with a king size bed on the non smoking 28th floor. We had to wait for it to be ready but that was fine. We went and wondered down 'The street of dreams' where the shops are the Harley Davidson shop is cool. So on our way to the room we noticed the hallways do have a strong smell of flowery carpet freshener (as mentioned in other reviews) its not that bad once you get used to it but it is a bit sickly. Our room was much the same but with a king size bed and a bit brighter. The view over the strip is really cool and I think having that made the room seem a lot better. The casino is smaller than some other hotels but its not bad the food court is good and has mcdonalds subway chinease and mexican. The resteraunts are located off the casino floor. The first night we had dinner in Brands and I have to say it was absoloutley delicious the tomato soup was divine and the steak perfect. The beds are absoloutly the most comfortable beds ever which is a big thing when you are staying for a while (we were staying 11 days) the walls are a bit thin but I always take ear plugs so coupled with the comfy bed sleep was no problem and well enjoyed. I ordered room service on a couple of occasions and the food was always nice we either went down to Mcdonalds for breakfast or into 'The Cafe' they do really nice eggs benedict in their but it does get busy. We didn't bother going to see Jabba Wokeez or Frank Caliendo because they looked a bit rubbish and by the end of the holiday I was sick of seeing them cos they were adverstised on the small screens in the lift constantly. When you go around the other hotels you realise why the Monte Carlo is quite a bit cheaper it is just not as fancy and has not been updated. I didn't use the pool as it was december and cold so cannot comment on that. The Pub was ok but it was all people watching sport so not really for me we had some nachos in their and they were really very nice and you get loads. The house keeping staff were excellent and our room was always tidied every day and was always left spotless. Basically this is a no frills hotel, it is located on the strip so thats good, the staff are nice and helpfull, the food is nice, and the prices are good, It IS dated and the rooms although clean are looking a bit worn and tired. I would not stay here again because if I were to come back I would like to stay in a really nice hotel like The Bellagio. That said my stay was pleasent and I had no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Won't return, too many other motels that looked better on the Strip.”
Reviews.Author: 45JAG
Reviews.Content: Everything was pretty average. However, I was very disappointed that the fitness center was only open 6 am to 7 pm. Since I am an early exerciser, this was an inconvenience. There was a large group of people waiting at 6 am, then a mad scramble to obtain a machine before they were all taken. The room itself had very poor lighting. The hairdryer started smoking and quit working. There was no coffee pot in the room, so to use my own tea I brought along, it would cost $4 for room service hot water.

Reviews.Title: “Time for some renos”
Reviews.Author: VancouverCraig
Reviews.Content: I know that the economy is down but it is still time to renovate. The Casino is very smoky compared to the other 1/2 dozen we were in. You can smell the smoke soon as you get to the elevator after leaving your room. They still have tubed tvs., bathrooms are standard looking, (no fancy lighting) The breakfast food was good and average price ($12.00 for eggs benny.) Overall the hotel is average, the staff were nice and they did have two free terminals for printing your boarding passes. The $16.00 resort fee per night on top of the room bill does include wired internet... again time for wireless.

Reviews.Title: “not a good stay”
Reviews.Author: juvecare
Reviews.Content: First they gave us a room where someone else was staying only to return to the girl who could care less, they then booked us till Thurs telling us that Thurs rate would be $400 plus tax causing us to have to move out a day earlier, due to the rediculous price mentioned. THey gave us a room with a tub that had draining problems, a room where you could hear your neighbor and a lock off door in the room. The people at the front desk.. a female could care less we told her it was our 25th wedding Anniv. but she ignored us. The housekeeping was great forget the rest as far as rooms, there is plenty of other nice places to stay and they welcome you better then that. I should have listened to the reviews I read that said alot of this about the tubs etc! oh and 15.00 for innernet hook up

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Casino, Don't mark this one off your list!”
Reviews.Author: traveling722
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Las Vegas with extended family for a reunion. Have never stayed at this end of the strip before, usually stay mid-strip. But other family members already booked rooms at the Monte Carlo, so we stayed there, too. It was a great choice. We had a room overlooking the strip. Wonderful view. Rooms were very elegant and updated. Nice and clean. Everything was top-notch!

Reviews.Title: “Better than I ever imagined!”
Reviews.Author: BLeege
Reviews.Content: My husband and I accompanied many friends to Las Vegas for one of the couples to marry there. We all stayed at the Monte Carlo. I upgraded our room to a suite and would definately do so again. Although the room's last renovation was obviously quite some time ago, it was spacious and the extra half bathroom was was appreciated. The pool area was quite a draw for us when booking, but quite honestly, we didn't spend any considerable amount of time there. We always felt comfortable and spent the vast majority of our time at the Monte Carlo, so I think it's a winner. We LOVED the location of the hotel, so many great sites that we could easily walk to around town. Additionally, Walgreens was practically right across the street so we loaded up on bottled water and other essentials cheap there for the stay. We splurged several times and had amazing meals. The steak house at the Monte Carlo had crazy yummy food. It was not cheap, but we certainly would have the same if given the chance. Husband had the prime rib, yum and I'm not a prime rib gal. I had the sea bass and the mushroom risotto, wowwee! That said, it is nice that the hotel has a food court offering some cheap meal alternatives to keep costs down. There was a restaurant across the street with a great breakfast special and $1 and $2 Bloody Marys. Tex Mex atmosphere and great service there as well. As it was our first time to Vegas, we had no idea the value of the bussing system. Given a second chance, we would have tapped into that great deal right away. Callaway golf center and custom fitting :). Great experience! I did not think that Las Vegas was somewhere that I would totally enjoy... surprise! I've already been looking for sales to return, what fun!

Reviews.Title: “Almost with the "big boys"”
Reviews.Author: eliza39
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 night stay at the Las Vegas Monte Carlo. The Hotel is very nice, with a few more changes I think it could be considered a luxury hotel. Pros: room was very large. we had a king bed and plenty of space for our luggage. extra luggage rack. Location is excellent, right in the middle of the strip and next to citycenter. a "too-die for" high end mall. Excellent restaurants. We ate at the pub and the Cafe, both served great food. Lobby and rooms are nicely decorated, very elegant. Casino is very nice but smaller than the other casinos on the strip (I liked the smaller size) Cons: little things that make a hotel luxurious. Towels: the towels here were hard and scratchy. TV's. I don't watch much tv on vacation but come 'on Monte Carlo, how old are those sets? time to upgrade. price of flat screens have dropped tremendously and for a 14 dollar a day resort charge, you could throw in a free movie channel instead of 7 channels dedicated to the hotel. All in all these things were minor and I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing room amazing view”
Reviews.Author: xdanixo
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 114 on the 28th floor which was a handicapped room. Amazing view and service awesome location. Only thing was looked like they were renovating on that floor looked kinda dumpy

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay here again”
Reviews.Author: lobster68w
Reviews.Content: Went for a couple day trip to LV. Found a room here for a decent price and the reviews were good so I went for it. We only used it as a base to explore the city, and it worked well. Parking was easy to find and spots were plentiful. We never used valet, only self park. Check-in took about 5 minutes waiting in line, not a big deal. Got room keys and found the elevator to our floor. The room was nice, clean, and had no smoke smell. We had a view on the pool and parking garage. One thing noticeable is that there was no WIFI, only an ethernet cable to use. That was annoying. The only other complaint I have is the shower leaked all over the floor. No matter how you did the shower curtain, it still soaked the floor. Beds were comfy with a nice duvet. The hotel was also quiet. Walking through the casino, there are a few nice places to eat, as well as a food court that's open 24/7. The hotel is right across the street, and maybe a 10 minute walk from the Monorail station at MGM. One thing to be aware of is the outside pool and hot tub close in the winter. I was surprised it wasn't open and heated. Also, though it's not the hotels fault, AT&T seemed to be in a virtual dead zone around this hotel. Full bars and no connection. It wasn't isolated to one phone either.

Reviews.Title: “false advertising”
Reviews.Author: Tom654
Reviews.Content: The room we got looked nothing like what is shown on their website. Old room with renovated bathroom. Our non-smoking room had an after-smell of smoke. Heater was not working. Water pressure in the bathroom was good.

Reviews.Title: “It Was Better Experience This Time Around”
Reviews.Author: peterlc63
Reviews.Content: Stayed here once before but, wasn't too impressed. They had a great deal though so we decided to give it try. Just stayed one night after staying in Sedona for two nights and we were pretty tried by the time we got to Vegas. Much to our delight, they automatically upgraded us to a suite! Not sure why but, it was a nice surprise. It was very roomy, had two toilets, had a comfortable bed and was very clean. I also liked that the lobby if the first place you come to when coming from the parking lot which reduce a lot of wondering around looking to check in. The parking lot is also well-lit compared to the lots at Paris and MGM. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap stay on the strip”
Reviews.Author: chateaubordeaux
Reviews.Content: We got a great package deal that included 4 nights at the Monte Carlo, so that influenced our decision to stay here. First off, the location is great - mid-strip and connected to other hotels by tram and the deuce bus. Service was also very good and everyone at the desk was extremely professional. Unfortunately, like other reviewers have found, we noticed hair in the bathroom that wasn't cleaned prior to our arrival. There were even long strands of black hair stuck to the bath towels. It made us think whether there were other hygiene issues that we couldn't see. Beds were comfortable, but the walls seemed thin. We heard toilets flushing, showers running and taps flowing from other rooms all night long. If you're a light sleeper, this is not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Hotel BUT LAZY Housekeepers”
Reviews.Author: lovebudgettravel
Reviews.Content: We got a $40/night deal on Priceline and stayed at Monte Carlo Dec 22 and 23. We were certainly expecting MORE from Monte Carlo as it should be pretty fancy and somewhat newer hotels than Flamingo and Bally's. The goods: Location... right across the street from NY NY and it's connected to Aria. When we were there the casino was actually pretty quiet, not as smokey..easy to find a table to play. The bads: Lazy housekeepers failed to impress!!! Upon entering our room we saw some hair on one of the beds (linens were white, so easily spotted), towels in the bathroom were sloppily folded and hung. Housekeeping didn't replace shampoo for the next day, boo!! No coffee maker and no refrigerator in the room.. boo!! Cheap hairdryer, took a long long long time to dry my hair!!! No wireless internet.. seriously?!!!! We would only stay here again if the price is right.. other than that.. Monte Carlo failed to impress as one of the nice place to stay on the strip...

Reviews.Title: “At $120 per night, better else where.”
Reviews.Author: JCfromLA
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 rooms via AmEx travel for one night on 12/25 at $120 per night per room. When we arrived at roughly 2:00 pm, we were told at the front desk that the rooms were being clean at the time and that they will put a rush on it where the rooms will be ready at 3 pm. We dropped off our luggages at the bell desk and walked around a little bit, then we picked up the luggages roughly a hr later and went to our rooms. The rooms were not ready and we told that it will be another 30 min or so for one of the rooms to be cleaned while the other room wasn't even started yet. We decided not to drop off the luggages at the bell desk since it was only 30 min and end up waiting at the hallway for another 30 min to have one of the rooms clean. The other room took longer but we didn't wait for it since we just wanted a room to drop off our stuff. When we came back and checked the other room later that night, the room wasn't completely clean as we notice some candy (M&Ms) on the carpet by the window and next to the desk. The shower drain for both rooms have drainage issue. By the time we realized it, it was too late in the day so we didn't call the front desk to relocate our rooms or have a plumber come up. I informed the front desk manager these issues during the check out and she indicated that since I booked the hotel via AmEx travel, there is nothing she can do about providing me a discount or credit. She did offer to not charging me the $30 resort fee ($15 per night per room). If we have only any one of these issues, it wouldn't be that big of a deal. But to have all these issues with a one night stay speaks pretty clearly / loudly to me what kind of hotel this is. Overall, very disappointing especially when this is supposedly a AAA rated 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but starting to show its age”
Reviews.Author: Sparky1983a
Reviews.Content: Had a fantastic holiday the main tips I would like to add was dont let the taxi drivers from the airport rip you off ask to go via Tropicana or otherwise they will go on a wild goose tour of all the motorways and instead of a a $14 taxi trip it was $27! We were lucky enough to get away with paying no resort fees I think because it was Winter and all the main facilities were closed as the lady on the desk could see I wasnt happy about this charge! All in all the hotel is clean and tidy and I would say the only thing that let the room down was the huge old fashioned TV. Free wired ethernet connection is available in the hotel rooms. Also worth booking the Grand Canyon Bus Boat and Helicopter excursion to the grand canyon we used viator.com and really memorable day for £135 each!

Reviews.Title: “Great Strip Location and an Even Better Value”
Reviews.Author: TiresWinRaces
Reviews.Content: Stayed here April 17-20 with buddies on a Vegas party weekend. We had previously stopped at the Von's on Tropicana Ave. not far from the airport for liquor and snacks (which is highly recommended for two reasons - can have a few drinks while getting settled in and cleaned up, and beats paying strip prices). Went to the valet and the bellhops took our luggage and grocery bags quickly and courteously, which where brought up shortly after we reached our rooms by calling the bell desk and asking for them. Check in was pretty quick with no line on a Saturday! Got a high floor room facing toward Mandalay Bay so the view was ok. Stayed in a standard 2 queen room. Was impressed with relatively large room size. Bathroom isn't very big but perfectly fine for a standard type room. Room was quiet at night and bed seemed comfortable enough. Our group was mostly interested in gambling and partying and the Monte Carlo didn't disappoint. Saturday night was hopping when we finally got down to the casino. They have a party pit with several $5 and $10 6:5 blackjack tables surrounding a stage with a few girls dancing. This is only running on weekend nights. The rest of the casino has good blackjack that offers surrender for as little as $10. Drink service was fine a on par with other strip casinos. This casino is pretty easy to navigate compared to others on the strip; from the elevators it is a little bit of a walk out to the strip but nothing like MGM Grand. There is also a walkway to get to the new Aria casino without having to go out to the strip which was cool because Aria has a nice sports book for watching tv. MC's book is just ok with older chairs. Waked by the pool but didn't use it; there were plenty of people enjoying it, though. It's bad that to get to the pool you have to walk through the lobby, though. Newer hotels like the Wynn have a separate spa/pool floor from the elevators. Stopped by the brew pub one night which no longer brews their own beer. They had a band and it seemed like a good type of place to go if you get there early, but it just seemed set up weird for a late night band act. To sum it up, this a nice hotel that definitely caters to middle of the road gamblers and a middle age crowd. The rooms and entire resort are clean, moderately fancy but certainly not over the top. I would stay here again if I wanted to be on the strip for under $80/night.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Sangria888
Reviews.Content: Location is gd as there is a free team shuttle to aria hotel next door n ESP helpful to the bellagio. Godsend esp if u think of the constant traffic gridlock. Gd size hotel not too big some of them are too huge to walk fr pt A to pt B quickly. Comfy beds which were great! Overall a great deal!

Reviews.Title: “Rude Staff, terrible rooms”
Reviews.Author: ilovevegas6
Reviews.Content: We booked 4 rooms for an entire week. Not only were our rooms straight out of the 90's and not refurbished at ALL, but when we requested to move to updated rooms they couldn't even come up with one. One of the rooms smelled like a nasty old bowling alley. I personally had 4 encounters with pit bosses/dealers that were EXTREMELY rude and unfavorable, to the point where it just made me leave the table and take my money elsewhere. Our group finally got fed up with the entire hotel 3 days in and moved to another hotel for the remainder of our week stay in vegas. Very unhappy with the Monte Carlo.

Reviews.Title: “The fragrance in the common areas is an assault to the senses.”
Reviews.Author: dstone0417
Reviews.Content: Beside this objectionable odor, I was told via the reservation agent that we could have a handicapp accessable unit. I also confirmed that there would be 2 queen beds in the room.. When we arrived, there was only a king in that bedroom and a Mother and daughter had to sleep together. When I first arrived at the room and called to see whether another handicapp room with double beds was available, they simply tolld me that that is the only type of room they had. So I take issue with the lack of knowledge that the booking agent had. Also they are using a very inferior type of toilet paper.

Reviews.Title: “Rapunzel! You forgot your hair”
Reviews.Author: salesmaven
Reviews.Content: We booked adjoining deluxe rooms for 3 nights. The $12.50 resort fee was just a way to get more money. Newspapers stands were always empty and we had no need for the free wifi, fitness center or printing of boarding passes. Upon arrival, we unpacked our bags and headed down to dinner and the casino. Much later, we returned to turn in for the evening. And that is when we noticed that the floor in both the bathrooms had an unbelievable amount of hair on it. I mean more than 10 loose, long dark hair strands. In both rooms! Yuck! I tried to call housekeeping but it was late and no one answered. While waiting for someone to answer I noticed a hair on the phone. yuck! The next day we called housekeeping and told them about the hair and how dirty the room was. They promised to clean it. We got back in late again and about half the hair had been cleaned up. We used the bath towels as rugs to avoid walking on the floor. After seeing the hair, I noticed that the room had not been really cleaned in a long time, just given a quick change of sheets and towels and a wipe down of the sink basin. There was a penny embedded in the carpet. Several Bobbie pins were scattered around on the carpet. Dust was built up all around the edge of the floors. Overall, these rooms were just plain dirty and tired. We will not return. This is a real shame because this has always been a favorite Vegas hotel for my family. We only paid $32.00 a night, but I'm sure the rooms at the La Quinta or Super 8 are cleaner. The beds are lumpy and uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: Garcas
Reviews.Content: Great location in the middle of the Las Vegas strip. We had a good deal for 2 nights.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL FOR THE PRICE - GOOD LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: betti14
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel - we came from Boston last minute for a fun trip to Vegas during the Thanksgiving Week (needed to get away from New England I guess). The hotel was well located, as we went to 2 shows at the MGM across the street (Cirque de Soleil KA and Crazy Horse - both excellent). MC is right on the tram which takes you to the ARIA and Bellagio which offer even more shopping, shows and nightlife. We checked in immediately, got the room we asked for, and they upgraded to high-floor strip view for free. Excellent Service. The pool was too cold (November) but looked decent and private. THE SPA WAS THE BEST. Men and Women have separate spas so you can really relax - use the hot tub, steamroom, sauna, ice-facecloths and other amenities in total relaxation. There's even snacks and water on-hand included. Free hair and body products, use of their robes, towels and slippers. Yes you have to pay a $15 resort fee per day, then $5 each time you use the gym or spa, but if you don't plan to use it, you can ask for that fee to be waived. Honestly, we got the hotel for close to $50 a night, so to pay extra for the spa was not a big deal. The Spa was really worth it. Gym is decent and is co-ed. The food in this hotel was pretty good. BRAND has a great deal for happy hour - 2-for-1 which is great. The mini-burgers are the best. The buffet is ok, breakfast is best, but I wouldn't do it everyday if you can help it. Lots of food to snack on in the food court. I didn't make it to the other restaurants, but the ICE Bar looked really cool - you literally sit on Ice seats and tables. Very Norwegian. Jabberwockies is one of the current shows - looked good but we were too busy to get to that one. If you want an adventure go to the GUN STORE - a $15 cab ride where you can learn to handle all types of firearms, and shoot off some steam. Other things to do, Nascar experience, Grand Canyon and more. Trip advisor lists them all with ratings. I would stay again - though at some point I want to stay further down near the Venetian.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place. You can't go wrong.”
Reviews.Author: kingair11
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo is a pleasant relaxing place to be. It is elegant, clean and the staff are nice. We have not checked out of our hotel yet, but everything has been great so far ! TIP ** For the easiest way to make it around the strip, go to the bus stops which are every quarter mile. For $ 7.00 each, you can right the Double Decker bus any where from the most southern casino on the vegas strip, to downtown Vegas up North. It sure beats paying a taxi !

Reviews.Title: “Great Value/Quality On-the-Strip Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JNDTraveler
Reviews.Content: The purpose of my our trip was to visit Las Vegas for a few days and see several shows and concerts. This is my 9th trip to Vegas and we wanted to book something very affordable on the strip, near the center, that had clean fresh rooms awaiting us after a full day/night of entertainment. This was actually my 2nd time staying at this hotel. Now its even better because it connects to Aria (City Center) which is the most Awesome hotel on the strip right now. At The Monte Carlo, the hotel always smells fresh. I hate the penetrating smell of cigarette smoke at some hotels that have poor air/ventilation filters. The room was always very clean. Our towels were fresh and did not look dingy or worn out. For the price that we paid per night, the room was great. The casino area was great, spacious, and I like that the hotel also has a Food Court just in case you want to grab something quick to eat. We were very pleased with "The Buffet" with their 'All-Day" pass on our last day of our trip since we planned just to relax at pool/casino at Monte Carlo. The pool is great, I have liked this one a lot. Another great restaurant that is a must to try is "Dragon Noodle." The food was great....way better than PF Changs!! Diablo's Cantina is a must stop if you are staying here and order a Margarita. Since the Monte Carlo is in a great location, we would get on the Aria/Monte Carlo Tram to go to other hotels on the strip which cut down on the walking and we avoided paying for taxis!!! We also got several Monte Carlo Resort credits and coupons upon check in that made our hotel stay even better. You have to ask for them at "Check-In" otherwise you might not get them. Overall, our stay was great and the room savings was HUGE!!! We fulfilled the purpose of our trip, since this was our 9th time in Las Vegas, without sacrificing quality and strip location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value Right on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Flydog66
Reviews.Content: No, it is not one of the newer more lavish hotels but our family stayed here for a wedding. We booked the rooms 2 months in advance and got an amazing deal on a suite. The room was huge (2 bathrooms!) with a very comfortable bed and large flat screen tv. The pool area was nice (especially the lazy river) although the water was a bit cold and later in the day got so crowded with partiers you could not get around. They should enfoce the no drinking in the pools more. The 2 restuarants we tried were not bad either. Nice, quiet spa area. An excllent value.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal on a Monaco Suite”
Reviews.Author: tap6699
Reviews.Content: We booked about 6 months ago and got a great deal on a Monaco Suite for 6 nights which we then improved as we got a further online discount for registering with their guestbook. Check in was quick and we were initially allocated a room on a lower floor with a view of the monorail station and pool. The room itself was fine but we were on a smoking floor and in the early hours of the morning we could smell the cigarette smoke which came from the adjoining room though the interconnecting door. We asked for a move the next day to a non smoking floor which had a strip view. This was dealt with efficiently and the bell desk were excellent in moving all our stuff. Because of the move we saw two different Monaco Suites and apart from the first having a LCD TV and the second a standard TV they were just like the pictures on the website. Huge room with sofa and King Bed, one main bathroom with a bathtub and shower over the tub, separate toilet which was where the room safe was located. The room also had a second bathroom with toilet and sink. You can tell the Monte Carlo is a bit older because of the fixtures but everything worked fine. Good sony clock radio with aux cable for ipod, fast internet included in resort fee. We also used the gym which was well equipped and also a good place to get free bottled water and juice. I stayed in a normal room at this hotel about 7 or 8 years ago and this stay was much better. Room safe was one of those thin flat ones which make it difficult to store things like laptops but only a minor issue and big enough to store passports cash etc. Overall would recommend this hotel as it is convenient for Citycenter which is right next door and there is also a monorail which takes you to Crystals and Bellagio. Great happy hour deals at the bar at Brand Steakhouse, half price drinks and appetisers between 5 and 7pm, excellent food and service. Food court with Starbucks, McDonalds, Haagen Dazs, McDonalds, Pizza place, Mexican and Chinese. Most of theses places were open by 6am so great for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but won't 'wow' you”
Reviews.Author: Rob2082
Reviews.Content: First time staying at the Monte Carlo. I stayed through Players Club (I highly recommend you signup immediately when you get to any MGM casino as the rates are great after the first time you play). In my opinion Monte Carlo is nicer than Luxor, but not as nice as MGM Grand. You can get to the other casinos on the South End, but it's not as convenient as being at NY NY, MGM Grand, Excalibur, Luxor, or Mandalay (i.e. no tram and no convenient walkways through the casino). Other than you get your standard experience (Starbucks, decent restaurants, mini food court, and etc). The resort fee is $12, which is better than Mirage. This casino also was not as good as MGM with their free drink service for people playing at the slots and table games. The pool area also looked average, but not as nice as some of the other hotels. If the cost difference is less than $10-$15/night at one of the nicer MGM properties I would stay at one of those places...otherwise this is a fine place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: PghScottygirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were fortunate to get a great deal from the Monte Carlo and decided to take it. It was first stay and it won't be our last. The MC is more intimate and user friendly than some of the other strip hotels. It is big enough that you know you are in Vegas, but small enough that it doesn't take half a day to find what you are looking for! Having the food court downstairs is a bonus for me -- I need my coffee asap in the mornings! The rooms were roomy, clean and comfortable. NO SIGN OF THE NASTY BEDBUGS!! The staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “birthday holiday”
Reviews.Author: sticky74
Reviews.Content: everything was great , the only thing we had was rooms could do with a up date , we a hole behind doors, i think this was as stopper that stopped door handle going on wall but this was inbedded in it , towels could be larger in bathroom as im 12/14 english size and they just fitted me and had small holes in , and a child must have had a pen and drawn on wall , but appart from that hotel is very nice only small faults

Reviews.Title: “Great value ... great location ... great sleep!”
Reviews.Author: GammaGammaHey
Reviews.Content: Traveled with my mother. Got a room deal with 2 show tickets. Saw Love @ The Mirage. Loved it! Great show for the Beatle fan ... or not. I'd say it's a must see. I wasn't too thrilled at the prospect at staying at the Monte Carlo initially. I had stayed there for a business trip in 2008 and I was really not impressed. Rooms were a bit dirty and the casino was blah and empty. This trip, I'm not sure if my perspective changed because it was a leisure trip or if the hotel/casino made changes. The August 2010 trip was a complete 180! The rooms were cleaned up (tho same old dated decor - not my thing), the mattresses were classed up (my mom could've spent the entire vacation sleeping ... the beds are to die for!!), the bathroom is roomy .. my complaint about the room (which I've seen others complain about) is the bathroom has no fan or ventilation. The casino, this trip, was hopping every night (we were there a total of 3 nights). Cocktail drink service was great. We didn't win but we had fun. The casino didn't take our money the first night .. always a good thing. The location of the hotel is fantastic. You have City center, New York New York, Planet Hollywood, and the MGM all within a short walking distance or tram ride. You don't feel stuck at your hotel. With temps in August over 110 degrees, the convenience of having places to go to within a short distance is perfect. One recommendation is don't think you can walk to the Mirage and back without killing your feet. We did it and regretted it. One other note about the Monte Carlo is the food choices. I was traveling with a non-foodie and it was nice to have fast food within the property. McDonalds, Rubio's, Sbarro, and even 2 Starbucks (yes ... TWO!!!) This is definately something to consider if you're traveling with someone who doesn't want to experiment with the great restaurants LV has to offer. Some of the BIG hotels (Bellagio and the Wynn in particular) do not offer any fast food. Also, be sure to sign up for the MGM/Mirage club card when staying here. You can use the card at any of the MGM/Mirage properties to earn points/comps. While staying this trip, I signed up and was offered free/discounted rooms for a future stay (see my next review). I would (did) stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate, but not fancy”
Reviews.Author: ablyons
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from staying a week at the Monte Carlo in Las Vegas. No particular reason for picking this hotel except maybe price and location. The rooms are not fancy, but then who stays in the room all the time? The bed was one of the best I have ever slept in....would have liked to take it home!!! The casino was small and cozy and not like other hotels where you need a map to get out. The food was good but I thought pricey........$65.00 for a turkey dinner on Thanksgiving?...hmmm..you be the judge. It seemed more like a senior citizen hotel with outdated swirly carpet and such. The Players Club offers nothing in return for gambling, not even a free breakfast!!! Disappointing, but nothing is free anymore. It was okay and I probably would stay there again. If you want something hip, eclectic, exciting, new, and 21st. century stay at the Aria next door. Quite a place but you will pay for the opulence.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful way to celebrate my 30th bday at MC!”
Reviews.Author: petra4
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely time at the Monte Carlo. Though not fancy, the rooms are clean and the bed duvet was one that I wanted to steal to take home with me! Leila the cocktail waitress in the casino was fantastic! Anticipating my requests before I even had to ask! Of all the hotels I've stayed at in Vegas, MC has had the most friendly staff. The only complaint I had was that the tub drained extremely slowly. I was standing in water up past my ankles. I understand that in large hotels, drainage can be an issue, however, I stayed at another Vegas hotel in May and did not have this issue. Other than that... my friends and I had a wonderful time and I would definately recommend the MC to anyone solely based on the location, the comfort of the beds and the friendliness of its staff! Keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to expectations and more”
Reviews.Author: Bookworm1971
Reviews.Content: We booked the MC because the price was fantastic and we liked the location on the Strip. The layout of the property itself is another plus. Never a marathon walk to get anywhere, even though we were at the very end of one of the room corridors. The resort fee is a joke IMO but I made a point of grabbing a newspaper everyday from the stand in the elevator area just because we had paid for it. We arrived early in the day and were able to check in right away. Although the king room we requested wasn't ready they still assigned us our room and we were able to check our bags at the bell desk and get on with our day. We could have taken 2 queens right away but opted to wait. The customer service far exceeded my expectations right from check-in. They even took care of my request to have our friends, who were checking in later that day, close to our room. There was no run around with rooms as we had dealt with on our last visit at another Strip hotel. Only issue with the room was that the previous occupants had left the safe locked. Our first call about it was forgotten/ignored but when I spoke to someone in Security directly the next morning 2 security staff were at the room within 5-10 minutes to fix the problem. The room was neat and clean with a very comfortable bed. I did notice a slightly smoky smell in the room which I attributed to being on the 9th floor not far above the casino ventilation and we had the AC on constantly. It may not be a problem on the higher floors if you happen to be on that side of the hotel. It was only a slight smell but may bother people who are sensitive to it. We were on a non-smoking floor. The layout of the property was great. The food court area and entrance to the Street of Dreams (shopping and access to the tram to City Center and Bellagio) was very close to the elevators as was the Lobby. The casino never felt crowded and it was a quick walk through to get to the Strip. It's a short walk to City Center and the overhead walkway to Planet Hollywood. Because the Cosmopolitan is still under construction we weren't able to walk past City Center without crossing the street first. Hopping the tram to Bellagio solved that problem.
