The Duece southbound stops right outside the hotel and there are 2 stops for northbound within a short walk across the street. At $7 for 24 hours it's well worth it for getting up and down the Strip or to Fremont without breaking the bank on cab fare. We would definitely stay at the Monte Carlo again and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the value!”
Reviews.Author: BettyBetBet
Reviews.Content: We stayed in early November. Our room was not renovated - looked like it had been last renovated in the early 2000's or thereabouts. No matter - it was clean! We ended up in Vegas because my husband had a business conference - it is not either of our favorite places to visit but this hotel was great for a few reasons. 1. it has a tram connected to Aria and Bellagio. This is great if you want to get around the strip but don't want to pay for cabs/busses and/or go outside! 2. FANTASTIC food - GO TO D.VINO!!! It is so yummy - best meal we've had in a while! 3. It was chilly when we were there but the pool was awesome - had it been nicer outside when we were there we'd have camped out by the pool the entire time. Overall, we really liked this hotel. To be honest, I hope I never go to Vegas again (I don't gamble...) but if we do, I want to stay here! Definitely go - it is worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Good again, could have been a little better?”
Reviews.Author: 96LT4
Reviews.Content: We decided after our trip in March to have our wedding at Monte Carlo. We liked the wedding chapel, location, easy layout of property, restaurants and rooms well enough to choose Monte Carlo over some others. This trip included several family and friends who had not been to Las Vegas or not been recently. We were a bit surprised to find limited room choices when checking in on a Monday evening? We had to "take what was available" on a couple of the rooms. The rooms were OK, many have commented they need updating/remodeling and we would agree, but some are better than others? The service was good all around, not great, but really no complaints. Bell service was above average, we had a bunch of luggage and the one guy did a great job when we arrived. The wedding went very well and the staff was accomodating. The "wedding chapel" had been remodeled since our last visit and even though it needed an update, we liked the old decor better? Also, the wedding chapel signage has been removed from the 2nd floor completely? The room is still there, but it's not "called" the wedding chapel any longer??? Very silly and potentially very confusing for some. Certainly it's not important to many who visit, but the parking gargage at MC is simply one of the best on the strip. It was a huge plus on this trip with a big group to haul around. We played the slots a good bit and found them to be very tight. If slot play is the primary focus of your trip, take your business off the strip, you might not hit it big, but your $$ will last longer. Tables were OK, hard to find multiple seats at BJ tables under $15 though. We tried the Cafe for breakfast and found it to be good, maybe a little above average. The buffet was OK but really just barely average for LV. Monte Carlo does have a better than average food court with good variety and comfortable seating. Also visited the new -5 Ice bar at MC, had a good time, but kind of pricey. In summary, another good visit to Monte Carlo as it continues to be a good choice for it's location and value. I would recommend Monte Carlo to those who have never been or maybe don't visit as often? "Vegas veterans" might look elsewhere?

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: Nonna Sicilia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Monte Carlo for 3 nights and had a great time. We ate at 2 of their restaurants and could only recommend the Dragon Noodle. Food was very good and served hot. Also ate at The Cafe. Steak was not what we are use to getting. The New York Strip was very thin and well done, even though I ordered it Medium. Service was slow and several waiters asked if we had been waited on yet. The hotel itself was a wonderful experience. Check-in and check-out were very quick and desk clerks were very helpful and courteous. The room was clean and big. No complaints on maid service or hospitality services. Would recommend and would go back. So much to do and see,need more than 3 nights there

Reviews.Title: “Everything was better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: holidaytimeusa
Reviews.Content: Having checked Tripadvisor everyday since I booked my holiday back in July, I was a little nervous about what the hotel was going to be like having seen some of the reviews. But I could find very little about the hotel that I didn't like. The location was great, the size was good and the free tram linking the property to Bellagio saved us so much time and walking. When we checked in and the lady on the front desk removed the resort fee without us even asking. The room, was not the most modern in the world, but was perfect for what we were looking for and for the price exceeded my expectations. We heard no noise from any other rooms and the cleaners always did a very good job. I will be recommending this hotel to friend and family and would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Spa Suite Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: towerxvi
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo Hotel & Casino was an outstanding hotel for the price. We stayed there 11/13/10 thru 11/16/10 in a Spa Suite that over looked The Vegas Strip with views of MGM Grand & NYNY Hotel. The price we paid was the same that we would have paid had we booked a spa suite at Excalibur or Imperial Palace. When we arrived the front desk agent was very friendly, as was all the staff we met during our stay. We didn't have to wait more than 1 minute in the check in line. The only glitch we had was on arrival, they didn't have our suite ready, and were told we would have to wait one hour so they could clean it, and to then check with the desk...meaning we didn't get our room till 6pm, however this was made up for via a resort credit, and the room had a great view from the 28th floor. The room was cleaned daily, and fresh towels and linens were provided daily. We were also happy to find an MP3 hookup to the stereo system. The spa tub is big and is made for 2 people. It's right up against the window for a great vegas view. This room also has a wet bar and fridge that we loved, and a sauna that we didn't use. We loved the layout of this hotel, because the elevators are just off the lobby, along with the food court, and shops. The Casino is big but not unmanageable like some of its neighbors. The hotel doesn't smell like smoke, because they pump a fragrance smell of flowers, but I liked that better than smelling the heavy cigarettes/cigar smoke. The food court has a 24hr McDonald's that came in handy one night. They also have 2 Starbucks on the property. A huge highlight was the Free Tram that runs from Monte Carlo to Bellagio this saved us time, and walking city center is confusing at best, due to all the ongoing construction. We also really liked having the CVS right next door between MC and City Center. Its funny that before this trip we never really considered staying at Monte Carlo, as we had never even set foot on the property, because there isn't much to draw big crowds however this was a great property for us as we go to see shows, gamble, shop, and eat. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Worse experience ever”
Reviews.Author: CraigB1970
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had been planning this trip since February 2010, and were both really looking forward to our time in the US, especially in Vegas. I had read all the reviews on TripAdvisor, read the hotel websites, plus much more, and Monte Carlo Vegas seemed like a nice enough hotel to stay in - great location on the Strip, reasonably priced, nice enough rooms. So it seemed. From the moment we arrived in our room after check in, our experience at the Monte Carlo Resort was bad. The room, for starters, didn't look anything like the pictures on their website - instead of a modern, fresh room, we got an old looking room, and to make it worse, hairs in the shower, cracked toilet, and broken air vents. We complained to the front desk, and they moved us to another room. Different room, same experience. Hair in the shower, broken facilities, old room. Moved again for a second time, same experience. Moved again, same thing. Fourth time they moved us to a spa suite at no extra expense. While the room was bigger, the was disgusting thing was that the picture they showed me at the front desk looked nothing like what we got - pictures show a modern room, with modern furniture, the room is old, badly in need of renovation, with old furniture, and an old beat-up TV. When I spoke to the front desk about this, they apologised and said that management made them show the pictures, even though the pictures are of a future renovation, not the current standard!! Instead of staying 5 nights, we left early, and took off as quickly as we could. To make matters worse the staff at the concierge desk (outside of Lucia, who was awesome) were really bad - showed no compassion or interest when my wife was ill and needed a doctor, and sent us on a wild goose chase to The Forum for a cell phone, when the store had closed 5 years ago!!! I'm normally able to handle bad experiences, and have been lucky to have stayed at MGM Grand last time, and had an awesome time. This time, however, Vegas was ruined by Monte Carlo Resort's poor standards and rude staff. I would advise that people seriously think twice before staying here, and be warned that the pictures on their website are false. Can't believe companies can get away with that in the US.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, good food court, weird smell!”
Reviews.Author: GeraldoR
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our very first trip to Las Vegas. We enjoyed the Monte Carlo for several reasons including the great location, it was a quick walk to the strip and it was close to everything. The bus was easy to get to and we took the deuce which dropped us off right in front of the hotel. We found it really quiet at night. We really appreciated the food court downstairs and had our morning coffee there each day. Our only complaint would have to be the weird pumped in air freshener that smelled like roses. It was nauseating! Other than that, it was good value for the money!

Reviews.Title: “less than expected”
Reviews.Author: bigCS
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Monte Carlo for the first time. Usually go to Vegas up to 4 times a year staying at MGM.Mirage, or Flamingo/Bally's. I got the feeling that the MC is the b--tard child that has been forgotten and ignored by its parent. The first floor lobby and casino were very nice with very friendly and helpful employees. Our room was on the 29th floor. The hallway carpeting was very stained. The room carpet was pulling up. TV would not swival and could not be seen while sitting at the desk. No pen, paper, and only 1 glass. Non smoking room at times smelled of smoke and at other times of skunk. Towels had a burnt smell instead of smelling fresh, We were given a 2 for 1 coupon for the buffet and ate there the first night. OMG!! 6:30 PM on a Saturday night and only 6 tables occupied. The light bulb should have gone off. Oh well. The food on the buffet including the deserts were marginal at best. Ribs were dry and very tough. No cold shrimp. Tried many of the dishes almost all ended up being taken away. The roast beef that was being carved appeared to be very low quality and although I love beef I was afraid to try it. The highlight was the made to order pasta. Chicken alfredo was good except the chicken tasted kind of funny. Atfer this dining experience we were afraid to try the steak house or the Italian restaurant. Ended up eating elsewhere. Room prices were reasonable but I think the Flamingo is in better shape for a similar price. Took the tram to Aria. Walked around for awhile. We didn't see anything special about it. Cosmopolitan, a new hotel and casino, is being built in front of Aria/City Center. When completed it may offer serious competition to the City Center. Overall the MC has potential but until the MGM pays some attention to this hotel I think there better places to stay at a similar price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel,Great Location”
Reviews.Author: dazjob
Reviews.Content: Went to Vegas to get married and stayed in the Monaco Suite - it was wonderful! Big spacious airy room, deep jetted bath, with a great view of the mountains. The location was perfect - great position on the strip, within easy walking distance of the centre strip. The hotel isn't one of the biggest, but I found this to be a good thing. Everything inside was easily accessible and you knew where you were at all times. It's easy to get lost in some of the bigger hotels, or at least walk round and round in circles just to get to the elevator! The pools were great fun. We being English found the pools lovely and warm at 10.00 in the morning and it was good for a quiet swim. Got busier when the sun came out but still enjoyable. Our bed was big, soft and luxurious with 5 huge fluffy pillows - you may not want to sleep much in Vegas, but when you do, this is the bed you want to be in! Unfortunately there is a resort fee of $14.50 a night, but this is clearly stated on all literature when you book with them. The deal we got was still cheaper with the resort fee than some of the other hotels in the same vicinity were without! Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “There are better themed hotels in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: ExplorerX9
Reviews.Content: Good family hotel and good for senior citizens. Hotel had everything in the room except for coffee/tea making appliances. comfortable bed,good water pressure in the shower. Comfortable stay but a little less exciting for Vegas. Has food court near the lobby with Mcdonalds,Subway, Sbbaro,Starbucks. Swimming pool is tiny.Not worth paying a resort fee in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay somewhere else!!”
Reviews.Author: Jan36461
Reviews.Content: Booked a king . . got there and only had a queen . . . ugh!! Moved to King the next day . . . then internet in the king room didn't work - - it become OUR problem to get the right IP address . . . we wasted time changing rooms, getting internet up and running and the place doesn't smell like rose, it just stinks!! It's an OK hotel at best. Would switch hotels, but stay at this end of the strip. Do NOT waste your time on the Frank Caliendo show . . . wow. One hour and 15 minutes of wasted time I will never get back. He spends 20 minutes on his back holding up his hand singing like Kermit the Frog!! In his words ala Charles Barkley . . he's a terrible knucklehead.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good price. mostly fine but room for some improvements”
Reviews.Author: Annie1111
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Monte Carlo with my husband and a friend for two nights. We got a good price and knew that the location was great so overall our impressions are broadly positive. The check-in process was pretty quick - we were quite early, only one of our two rooms were ready but the check-in agent gave us both keys and told us the other room would be available mid-afternoon (which it was). . He offered us the choice of two non-adjoining rooms either which were available immediately, good to have had the choice. The rooms were fine, ever so slightly dated as other reviewers have pointed out, but bright, clean and spacious. I would have preferred a more modern shower but for the low price we paid, it was fine. We ate in the buffet one day and were very pleasantly surprised with the quality and choice of the food, this was definitely a good choice and the all-day option was very good value. We had dinner another evening in Diablos, one of the meals (a salmon dish) was great but two of us didn't particularly enjoy ours, probably wouldn't recommend it and it was quite expensive. The casino was fun and the staff friendly - we're not huge gamblers at all so it was more the cheap machines and a few goes on the tables. We enjoyed the free craps lesson too! We loved the pool area but were very disappointed that the hours were so limited - it closed at five which seemed unreasonably early for a heated pool, on the first day we were there we'd planned an early evening swim before dinner but and were very surprised to find it was all closed up. The main negative I have was the sickly-sweet smell of air freshener throughout the public areas. I definitely don't like the smell of smoke but the fake freshener stench wasn't much better. We did get used to it later in our stay but it was not pleasant. An upgraded ventilation system would be the answer. Finally the resort fee was completely ridiculous and pointless, it seemed to be entirely a rip off with no benefit. It was so small that surely it can't be of any real use to the hotel coffers but it left us all with a bad taste in our mouths, feeling a bit ripped off. So overall, I'd recommend this if you can get a good price, but better pool hours, better ventilation and abolish the resort fee please!

Reviews.Title: “First Time Trip To Vegas”
Reviews.Author: djkginger
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 nights at the Monte Carlo Hotel. This was our first trip to Las Vegas. The hotel was clean, affordable, and centrally located. A lobby food court was available for snacks or a light meal. The hotel restaurants were also noted to be good. The staff was knowledgable and eager to provide any service required. Even though the casino was a bit smokey, we found that this was typical within each casino we visited. We would recommend this hotel to any Vegas traveller. Ask for a high floor room. The views of the mountains are beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - lovely time for the first time in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: OAPontour
Reviews.Content: This was a surprise 65th birthday for my husband. We were not disappointed. We had a standard room overlooking the swimming pool, big and clean. I must thank the business centre for helping on receiving an urgent e mail, they were very helpful. We had a bad experience in the Cafe, and due to that we did not eat in the hotel again. If we were to go back, this is where we would go on our budget. Shame they do not have a coffee or tea maker in the room, would be a nice touch. We had 3 days there and as one was taken up going to the Grand Canyon, we did not manage to see all vegas, which was a shame.Saw CHER at Caesars, fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “I liked it, would go back again”
Reviews.Author: MBanzai
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, nothing spectacular but good. Big confortable room. very good beds, bathroom maybe a bit old, very good buffet nice pool. Good service. Free parking , no free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, classy, and reasonable rates!”
Reviews.Author: theshaffer4
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo is a fun and classy hotel. It has much to offer and is in a prime location. The food court had a wide variety of good restaurants to choose from and the pool area was wonderful for lounging or partying with friends! We stayed in the Monaco Suite which was really spacious and nice. Our room had a nice view of the pool area. I would recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nadia0185
Reviews.Content: Location is good, nice hotel, quiet, clean, service is very good and staff very polite, asked for a small refrigerator in the room, got it right away. There is a food court, restaurants. The casino of the hotel is dull comparing to other hotels casinos like Caesers, Aria, Paris, If I go back to Vegas, I'll choose another hotel to have another experience.

Reviews.Title: “Will be staying here again”
Reviews.Author: DandKtravel
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at the Monte Carlo. We chose this hotel again because we had such a great time while we were there in 2007, Upon our arrival we received a complimentary upgrade to a city view room, which was nice seems we already paid an amazing price from booking on Vegas.com. One of the main reasons we liked this hotel was the pool, I am a huge fan of the jetted lazy river, the only down side of the jetted lazy river is the people that stand along the sides and do not move, slightly annoying, but besides that a great time. Our room was clean and house keeping was very friendly and always checked if we needed anything. The rooms do need a bit of updating but they are clean and and still in good condition, but really I did not come to Vegas to stay in my hotel room For eating in the hotel we usually just grabbed breakfast from Starbucks, there is now 2 Starbucks the other one is closer to the monorail and usually less busy, I have tried the buffet before and not such a huge fan, but there is still many fast food options Since our last visit, there is now a monorail connecting the Monte Carlo to the Bellagio which runs every 3-5 mins, it also stops at Aria & Vdara. This makes using public transportation much easier as once you are at the bellagio you can walk across the street to the Paris Hotel to catch the gold line for the Premium Outlets We had a great time and can't wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “faboulus”
Reviews.Author: vanelsacker
Reviews.Content: Great staying super service everyone was very helpfull going in 2011 for the third time Everything is in the walking distance great with the 2 trainstations closeby. If you say vegas you say Monte Carlo

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS”
Reviews.Author: BunnySedaliaCO
Reviews.Content: All the girls in the VIP Services go beyond their jobs. They are the best.....Lisa, Christine, Deborah and Anna. Each and everyone of them are a credit to the Monte Carlo. Always smiling, always accomodating. Love the Food Court...........but the service at The Cafe needs a whole lot of help....extremely slow. The least best thing is the stained towels.

Reviews.Title: “Not real fancy, but just right for me!!”
Reviews.Author: uhohfiveoh
Reviews.Content: Stayed Sun and Mon nights. Check in took 20 minutes. Clerk was polite and helpful! Rooms were average, but clean and comfortable - no complaints here! Casino small, but clean and a little quieter. Location - toward the south end of the strip, which is fine with me! Overall - Good experience and will recommend and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Poor sound insulation on 28th floor”
Reviews.Author: vegasharleygirl
Reviews.Content: we stayed in room 219 on 28th floor. There was a blocked door to an adjoining room which was poorly insulated and meant that we could hear our neighbours and their drunken revelries/ crying baby. We were disappointed that the pool closes at 5pm- it was too cold after that anyway, and the gym also closed at 6pm. This meant that for teenagers ( not allowed to linger in casino area) there were limited opportunites- which was not clear form their website. The restaurant buffet was very good value- the food was very good quality- especially steak/gammon) especially if you had an all day ticket , which was very good for hungry teenage boys ( and entertainment value for watching the clinically obese stuff themselves beyond belief). Agree about the overwhelming odour of carpet freshner. If going to las vegas again we would go elsewhere. Good thing was the free large car park and easy free monorail to the Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “Classy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mike-chambers
Reviews.Content: Stayed Saturday to Friday last week. Arrived 9pm and was checked in within 5 minutes. The staff are helpful and the room is very clean. The views are amazing from the 22nd floor. Lots of places to eat and drink. One of the few hotels which feel more like a hotel than a casino. Great based to explore the strip s its right in the centre. Well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “A Fair Hotel for the Money”
Reviews.Author: Buzbyago
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews i was a little apprehensive about staying at the MC, however here are my findings. Yes the rooms are a little dated and could do with a refurb, however we had clean sheets and towels daily and generally the room was of a respectable standard. The food court in the hotel was very handy and again quite good. Reception staff were helpful and efficient, no long queues for booking in or checking out. The pool area was very noisy on the weekend and it was hard to get a sunbed, but less so during the week, towels were always readily available. This was my third trip to Vegas and the other 2 times I stayed up the other end by the Fashion Mall. I opted to stay down the MC end to explore that area better, however personally I prefer the other end so will venture back there on my next visit, but not because I wouldn't stay at the MC again as I consider this a fair priced hotel with good amenities and worth the price I paid.

Reviews.Title: “nice resort an casino”
Reviews.Author: skcmret
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Monte Carlo and I must say that it was an excellent experience. Check in was easy and smooth. The room (very clean) was on the 19th floor with an excellent view of the pool and the Rio casino. However, we were charged $14.50 per day for a "resort fee". I have no idea what the fee covered. I hope it was not for computer access, cause I don't own a laptop. If it was for access to the spa, at my age, sliced cucumber on my eyes don't appeal to me. I suggest that they put a card in the keycard envelope, explaining why they are stealing a "resort fee" from me. I tried to locate an e mail address on the resort's website to complain about the fee, but its inpossible to track one down. All in all I have no complaints about the resort other then the extra fee.

Reviews.Title: “Nauseating perfume smell in entire hotel to block out stale smoke”
Reviews.Author: iwannatravel4ever
Reviews.Content: We were disappointed in the quality of the "standard" room we had. The window was filthy and the bathroom was old and shabby looking. No bar fridge in the room, or even a coffee maker so you had to get dressed and go down to Starbucks for coffee in the morning if you didn't want to order room service. The staff had no personality, and the wait staff in the bar was rude. We had to leave the hotel to find a quiet bar so we could actually talk to each other. The beds, however, were excellent and the housekeeping staff did a good job.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in the centre of the Las Vegas Strip”
Reviews.Author: BearsRus
Reviews.Content: This is our fifth trip to Las vegas, each time we choose a new hotel. this time we chosse the Monte Carlo, being a reasonable priced hotel, we chose a spa suite, 800sq feet of space with a double spa overlooking the strip. At the end of the day there is nothing better than relaxing in a bubbling spa, sipping a cocktail or drink of your choice, seeing the lights of the strip, before getting changed for dinner or going to one of the many shows on the Strip. We were very happy with the location of the Monte Carlo, being adjacent to the new hotels on the strip, there is a tram connecting the Monte carlo to the new Aria Hotel, which is currently showing the new Elvis Circus Du Soleil, having seen several of their shows, we felt this was'nt upto the same standard as say the Beatles "Love" at the Mirage. The Casino is well set up, it has a number of easily accessable and reasonably priced restaurants as well as a good selection of shops, across the road is a Walmart to purchase anything you have forgotten or decided you need. A nice touch was a fridge for your exclusive use, in other hotels on the strip, the fridge is only for the use and sale of their goods at very high prices, we received several notices at the Mirage for putting our own drinks in the fridge as this was frowned upon. There is a bus stop right outside the hotel when returning from further up the strip and Fremont Street, very convenient. The check in and check out was quite fast, staff were very friendly. We hope you enjoy your stay at the Monte carlo as much as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money customer service non exi”
Reviews.Author: queenc268
Reviews.Content: We arrived to the hotel a day early the reception area is quite large with a number of registers there is no queuing system and such its pot luck weather you there for two minutes or ten as the staff have no clue who is next. After ten minutes or so we were seen and unfortunately could not get into the suite we had booked so we asked for a strip view for the next day, getting into our room we were greeted with a mountain view ! so I asked at reception no strip view we should have asked when we checked in ! What. The room was nice enough except the windows were filthy and any view was obscured, the safe was locked in the open position (well checked I think not!) and the sauna in the shower didn't work. All these things were reported to reception only the safe got fixed. Finally getting out of our booked room we decided to go gamble after all its Vegas.. the staff at the Monte carlo are the most miserable useless dealers I have ever met I only ever saw one of them smile. getting a drink wasn't fun there was never a waitress around whilst you were gambling and if you went and found one they would snap at you because you couldn't have a drink unless you were gambling...the dealer on one of our tables took off our winning bet and we had to get into a twenty minute discussion just to get them to check a camera not at all professional The pool area seemed nice except most of the day it was in the shade so completely useless. the hotel it self had a really nice bar but the main night-life was much further down the strip We were checking out early in the morning so I went the night before to settle my bill and raise the issues we had, to be treated like a moron because it was apparently way to hard to print a bill before you had checked out( even though it only took him about 20 seconds eventually) as for the rest of the issues it was some feeble excuse about them not being logged properly he didn't even say sorry! My advice spend your money elsewhere the only good thing about this hotel was the mail who kept our room spotless and the beds with were really comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “They Ruined My Wedding Plans”
Reviews.Author: Slace
Reviews.Content: I had sceduled a wedding several months back for October of 2010. I was sent pictures of the chapel and signed a contract. Thirty to forty days before my wedding I was informed in an e-mail that the coordinator was changed. I received no call. I called and was informed by the wedding chapel manager that the coordinator was being changed along with other staff members and that the chapel was now going to be under renovation. I was concerned, but was informed If it was not complete that they would find me another venue and bring in things from the outside to decorate. This is not what I contracted for... I was upset and concerned. Another venue? Under Renovation? This was my wedding. I asked the wedding chapel manager why did they not tell me about the renovations and she said the decision came from corporate...At this point she could refund my deposit or I could talk to corporate..... I took one of the options and called corporate and was told by the secretary of the President that they would call back..No one called until I called and a catering manager called back and tried to cover the mistake by saying it would still be lovely....it will be beautiful...if the renovations are not complete we will put you in another venue...a conference room or outside a resaurant....I was even more upset... It was just my fiance and myself getting married. I did not want a conference room or another venue. I wanted the chapel. After speaking to the President, the Presidents secretary, the Board of Directors assistant, the Board of Directors Secretary..we were just jerked around, lies kept escalating and bottom line is no one cared. After all of it, they decided to comp a 400.00 wedding package, but we were reserved but gave it another chance. We changed all our hotel reservations and the final straw was the double charge and treatment given when we explained the overcharge and were told we were no shows..Hard to be a no show when our bank statement showed the original refund...In our opinion this hotel had o concerns for our wedding. The were rude, lied many times and I would not recommend this to anyone unless you want to be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Cant Wait Ti Go Back”
Reviews.Author: Ilovedianna
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip through AAA and on the advice of our travel agent, she recommended The Monte Carlo. Best recommendation we could have had! We went to Vegas to get married and had 6 other couples flying in who also stayed at the Monte Carlo and one at Hotel 32. The service from begining to end (we stayed 5 nights) was perfection! If we needed it, it was there in moments. Housekeeping was fabulous, great beds made every morning like a drill sargent would be in to inspect them. Clean, clean,clean! Everything from our room, hallways, casino was sparkling. Hotel 32 (aunt and uncle stayed there) was amazing and the service.....WOW....cant wait to go back and that includes everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value and location”
Reviews.Author: srndlvr
Reviews.Content: I stayed in one of the King Spa rooms on the 20th floor. This was my second visit to the Monte Carlo for a business conference. The first time I stayed in a standard room. This time I found the rate at the Monte Carlos website and a great value. The room was huge and very comfortable. The room included a small dining area and fridge,small sofa and sitting area, a massive jacuzzi tub, and the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in. The large window above the tub provided a lovely view of the city although it didn't overlook the strip. My only complaint is that the towels smelled a bit like smoke even after I got replacements. The toiletries provided were good quality Altough not as upscale as some of the other more well known Vegas hotels the Monte Carlo provides adaquate amenities, very good value and the service was excellent. I would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Questionable Customer Relations”
Reviews.Author: VegasVisitor89052
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Monte Carlo three times in 2010. Great prices and a perfect location on the Strip. However, I just booked our convention (120 guests) somewhere else because of a run-in I had with the staff at the Monte Carlo. I wanted to stay an extra night of my last 7 night stay and although they had no trouble letting me keep my room and they clearly saw I had been there three times already this year, they charged my the high end rate for a Saturday night only stay. I told them that would mean no more bookings from me or my group but they would not budge.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, large rooms, good central location, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: karen_kir
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the "spa suite" and although the carpet is a bit worn, and it's time for a TV upgrade, the room is very comfortable and has everything we need (and doesn't smell like smoke - yay!). I love that the window opens a bit so you can get fresh air if you like and see how hot/cold it is outside! There is an awesome large shower and we loved the bed - very comfortable! The location worked for us as we are in vegas to sight-see and go to some shows/shopping (we aren't gamblers) and so although you're in the middle of everything, it doesn't feel as crowded on the street as it is near the Bellagio. We never see queues at the check-in, where as walking through other hotels, the line-ups have been huuuuuge (esp. flamingo hotel). McDonalds is ownstairs if you want a cheap breakfeast, otherwise room service is very tasty - a bit expensive, but thats usual for hotels I guess. Another plus is that this is one of the easiest hotels to get in and out of without having to walk through the whole casino. Great when you are tired from walking all day and don't want to battle with the crowded casino floor to get to your room. All-in-all, I would stay again and would recommend to others!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and fantastic value!!”
Reviews.Author: graham1007
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights and enjoyed every minute. Great location at the south of the strip next to and near other great hotels and casinos! Room was spacious clean and pleasant to stay in. Only minor critiscm is that in this day an age a flat screen tv always looks better than than old bulky ones!! The pool was fab, loads of sun loungers an the wave pool and lazy river made a lovely cool down form the Vegas heat! We ate 'The Pub' and was impressed with the food and friendly service. Would stay here again as it felt quite intimate compared to the size of other hotels but still had the buzz that we hoped for!

Reviews.Title: “Just the right size!”
Reviews.Author: MrsFEngland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Montecarlo for 4 nights. Check in was easy at the huge reception desk in the huge foyer! Our room overlooked the pool area. Very comfortable room. My sister and her husband also stayed here and got a room with a view over the strip which they requested. They too found there room very comfortable. If there was a resort fee it must have been included in our total price as we were not required to pay extra when we checked out. Montecarlo is at one end of the strip (luxor end). Dont think we ever made it all the way to the other end of the strip. Everything is so huge and has so much to see! There is a free monorail to the Aria and Bellagio. Think there is another monorail from the other side of the strip that goes further. The pool are is lovely. Loads of sun beds. There is a small wave pool and a lazy river. We only spent one afternoon at the pool to get over the jet lag! The casino is a nice size. Smaller than some of the others but still huge! There is a small shopping area with a pub that sells pretty much any lager/beer you could imagine. They have a happy hour between 7 and 9 I think where women drink for free and men get buy BOGOF on certain drinks! I would definately stay there again :)

Reviews.Title: “Stayed before and will stay again”
Reviews.Author: PamTorrox
Reviews.Content: Staff friendly and very helpful after a long trans Atlantic flight. Casino host was great and made us feel very welcome. I know it is not the "poshest" hotel on the strip but we like it and are going back in 3 weeks. Have stayed at a few of the other hotels and we think the Monte Carlo gives off a friendly, family atmosphere. Could do with a hot drink making facility in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Big rooms and big value at the Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: ASonginmyHeart
Reviews.Content: You walk into the lobby and are greeted with the scent of roses- it's almost impossible to detect any smoke in this hotel which is a HUGE plus! The staff was incredibly friendly and the rooms were better than adequate. The bathrooms were large as was the 2-queen room we stayed in. We had 5 girls in one room with plenty of room for a roll-away bed and all our luggage! The beds were super-comfortable and we didn't have any problems with noise on the 26th floor. The casino was clean and offered good variety as did the restaurants, pool, and shops. The free tram from Monte Carlo to Bellagio was a GREAT way to get around. The location of this hotel is nearly perfect on the strip. Overall, it's the best strip hotel value I've found- our rooms were just over $100/night and we had nothing to complain about!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value”
Reviews.Author: cjvdjv
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Las Vegas Oct. 7-12 for a girlfriends getaway. Altogether, there were nine of us staying at the Monte Carlo and we had a wonderful time. The Monte Carol is a very nice hotel and an excellent value. The location is great, right on the strip, convenient to the bus and tram. The rooms were clean and comfortable and the maid service was wonderful. Additional pillows and towels were provided immediately upon request. The hotel must be in the process of replaceming their mattresses because , while the rooom adjoining ours had a new mattress, ours did not. However, when I complained that our mattress was uncomfortable, a new one was in place when we returned. In fact, all of the staff were more then accomodating. While the buffet is a wonderful value at $24.99 a DAY on weekdays and $34.99 a day on Fridays (seafood), Saturdays, and Sundays (champaign brunch), I also appreciated that fact that they had a food court where we could grab an inexpensive breakfact of lunch before heading out for the day. The only drawback is the $12.50 a day resort fee. Even though most all of the big hotel on the strip charge this fee and I knew about it before-hand, I still think it just a sneaky way to get increased revenue. They say it's for the use of the pool, fitness center and wi-fi. Well we used none of those. I would be better if they charged an individual fee for each of these services. None the less, while it may not be as dazzleing as some of the newer hotels, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, perfect location on strip.”
Reviews.Author: Bigboy7Devon
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself and facilities are fairly good. Good pool area with its own lazy river and wave pool, free towels supplied for pool area. The food court (Mcdonalds, Chinese, Italian, Subway) inside the hotel is great for quickness or if you want to keep your budget down. The casino is a little smokey but aren't they all. The bedrooms are average and a bit dated but wouldn't stop me from staying here again. The location is the best feature, all the best hotels and attractions are within walking distance. Buy your show tickets from the kiosks on the strip they are half price in a lot of cases.

Reviews.Title: “A GREAT LARGE SIZED ROOM IN A GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: THETRUEMEZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotle for a week and booked through Hotels.com after first having checked out the Hotel through Trip Advisor The price we paid was very cheap and we were delighted with the 400 sq feet en suite room we had. We did try the old '...$20...am I entitled to any free room upgrades...' but weddings on 10.101.10 had all the best rooms booked. I t makes me wonder about the better rooms because ours was great anyway We had a King bed and it is superwide -you definately do not disturb each others sleep in those beds and the had a Seally Topper that was sooo comfortable -we slept like babies. They have an in room safe -brilliant and room service is fantastic. No fridge or tea and coffee amking facilities which was a pain but free ice and an ice bucket solved the former. We took our own travel keetle and cups -simple We did not like the Buffet at this Hotel-we thught it poor BUT if you want a great breakfast or Dinner go to the 'Cafe' in the Hotel where it is most excellenty food and NOT expensive. For convenience there is fast food places in the food court and very inexpensive All in all we would recommend this hotel to friends and the only reason we would not stay again is simply that we'd stay at the Venetian next time, then the Palazzo then the Mirage then the Wynn and so on................

Reviews.Title: “Great If You Just Want To Relax”
Reviews.Author: spunkygonecountry
Reviews.Content: Fast check-in which is always a plus in Vegas. Fairly modern rooms - we were on the 28th floor which had a view of the strip. Housekeeping was prompt everyday - didn't have to wait long for our room to be made up. Great pool area - plenty of seating with lagoon and wave pool. Great stay if you don't mind being down the south end of the strip. We didn't go to sightsee just relax so this place was perfect for us. If you want to be in all the action I'd recommend staying at the Venetian or Casears. If you do stay here you probably should look at getting a Monorail pass. Only complaint would be the walls were pretty thin we could hear people in the next room talking. Plumbing was also really loud. TIP: Dine @ Belliago Buffet for dinner - we like it the best.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Pett_World
Reviews.Content: The service at the Monte Carlo is the best. The people took real good care of me and my guest (especially LISA in VIP) She is the best and very Classy

Reviews.Title: “A Relaxing Honeymoon Retreat”
Reviews.Author: cpz95m
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from our 5 night honeymoon at the Monte Carlo and it was wonderful. This was our first trip to Las Vegas and we were very impressed on how nice the room was. The room was a spa suite with an incredible view on the 25th floor. The bed was very comfortable and the toilet had a seperate room from the shower. Although there is a casino and some restaurants on the main floor, it was not as busy or as noisy as the other hotels. This made for a relaxing retreat after walking around on the strip. If you have never been to Las Vegas, there is a monorail that can take you around the strip. The nearest station is at the MGM Grand and its pretty close to the Monte Carlo. Not a bad walk at all. I also liked that the hotel was right next to the drug store. The breakfast buffet was awesome, however, we never ate dinner there. I also used the salon to get my hair and makeup done for my wedding. They did an exceptional job. We never experienced any negative issues with our room. We loved it there and would go back again on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money”
Reviews.Author: pwrm21
Reviews.Content: After staying at a high end hotel for a convention, we moved to Monte Carlo for 2 days of vacation (our expense). We were very happy there. One negative...the pillows were too big and hard...I had trouble sleeping. The rooms and hotel were clean, and the food was a LOT more reasonable than Caesars (convention site). The public bathrooms could have been cleaner. Loved the river ride and wave pool. Would definately stay there again, and would refer others. If going in near future, don't miss Frank Caliendo's show...he's great. Skip the -5 degree ice lounge...nothing there but ice. Cher was part of the convention entertainment. Certainly glad we didn't pay for those tickets...would have been a waste of money. Love her, but the show was a big disappointment. Show started 30 minutes late, with no entertainment to occupy the audience. Cher sang only portions of her older songs, and spent most of her time behind the scenes changing clothes. Went to both "Body Works" and "Titanic" at the Luxor. Liked them both. The Bellagio has a nice "Conservatory" thats worth seeing. They decorate it for the holidays...currently fall. Their public bathrooms were a disappointmentas well, not clean.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better”
Reviews.Author: ChelseaBelleNewYork
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Monte Carlo for the first time and was disappointed in the hotel overall. I thought that it would have nicer than it was. The room was clean but just average in decor. The buffet restaurant is in serious need of an overhaul. The carpet has a black walkway leading out of the service area on the carpet leading out into the diniing area and the there are several other spots where the carpet is black from spills, etc. The seats have frayed stitching and tears in the fabric and the food is really just average. The food court is also not great. It is disorganized and messy. The pool area consists of a jacuzzi, pool, lazy river and a wave pool, with private cabanas for rent. There is a bar and a small shop to buy snacks and suntan lotion and to rent tubes to use in the lazy river. We had a great time on two days during our stay; hanging out by the pool and just floating along the lazy river. That was alot of fun and highly recommended when you just want to chill for a day but the hotel should really clean the chairs. I had to cover mine with 2 towels in order to feel comfortable laying on them because they are all so dirty. Just a little more attention to some of these negatives would really make the Monte Carlo nicer. It seems to be so nice and yet there is a lack of attention to some of high traffic areas in the hotel. The Aria, which is next door; is much nicer and cleaner and the buffet restaurant there is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lms3504
Reviews.Content: This was my 20-something trip to Vegas from the UK. I stayed at MC for the first time in May 2010 on my own and this time I brought my Mother, Sister and her Husband. Previously I have stayed at IP,TI, Flamingo and Ballys in Standard / Deluxe rooms. I agree with all the positive reviews and do not let a few minor faults colour my whole review. The room I had this time was similar to the first visit but without the scratched chair arm where it had hit the underside of the table, the louved door of the closet door had fewer knocks and the suitcase stand had fewer chips. The bathroom, beds and linen were clean as always. The resort fee was still in effect although instead of having two 500ml bottles of water in our room we had a 10dollar beverage coupon to get them from one of the bars. The coupon could be used for "non-alcoholic beverages or well drinks". A rum and coke counts as a well drink as the dispense them from those 'guns', so I got that instead and sat and watched the baseball play-offs in the Sports book rather than the Pub. The sports book has cocktail waitress service but as I did not have a sports bet on it would have been a bit cheeky to order a free drink as I do when playing the slots (and I had already been 'told off' by a waitress at the Mirage for requesting a drink without having a bet on!). I rum and coke at the bar is 8dollars! I would have thought it would be a double for that, the free ones while you play are usually singles. We enjoyed the Buffet breakfasts (15dollars+tax) - they had an omlette station and what we had would have cost a lot more in the Cafe. We sometimes had breakfast the foodcourt with the Italian eatery having the nearest to the 'All-American Breakfasts' I enjoy while holidaying in the US (9dollars). We enjoyed an evening meal in the Cafe, especially their ice-cream tower dessert. The previous January, when I was resting in the Mandalay Bay Sports book I was showered by soda! The sports book Director was doing an early morning walk-thru before the main events got going, when he saw someone had left a drinks container in the sports bar sometime in the night. He had dropped it in a bin but it hit the side, the lid came off and I got that shower of soda. Mike apologised and got a towel for me. Thankfully I was able to clean up so that I did not have to go back to my hotel to change - I was staying at the IP that trip. Mike asked me where I was staying and whether I came to Vegas often. I said I sometime came with my family. He said he wanted to do something for me so he gave me his business card and on the back he signed for a free night at the hotel or dinner for four. So this trip we each had a free evening Buffet which we all enjoyed and will visit again, although we will have to pay! This was true old-Vegas hospitality. The catering dept charged the sports book 112dollars for this comp so Mike was not giving away a cheap comp. I will be back in Vegas in January on my own. I do not like the resort fee so I am undecided as to whether I will return then. As a family we will probably be back. I do like the location, choice of slots, food court, sports bar, buffet, openness and decor though!!!

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo, Las Vegas vacation”
Reviews.Author: spammy0124
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel in Vegas that fits most peoples needs. The hotel isn't too large, but large enough to offer multiple restaurants, a great casino and very professional staff. Located on the strip near the Aria, Bellagio and New York New York hotel/casinos. I would recommend this to almost every vegas traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo delivered!”
Reviews.Author: Justsaygo13
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo for three nights, the end of September, including the weekend. You can’t beat the price, because the hotel rates go up so high for the weekend. We tried to check in around noon; they assigned us a room but said it wasn’t ready. Around 2:00 pm we went back to see if our room was ready and he assigned us to another one that was ready. I had booked a high floor deluxe and we got one on the 31st floor. (Almost made it to Hotel 32.) I told him I wanted a room that had been renovated and he said ours was a partial renovation. It was fine. The rooms are small and the windows are not full length, but otherwise we were very satisfied with the room. The TV is not flat screen, but heck, we didn’t watch much TV. The room was very clean, again, bathroom was small, but marble with tile and clean. The king bed was very comfortable and looked just like the picture on the new website. My husband noted several times how clean it was for an older hotel. The lobby is beautiful. We booked a package and received 2 for 1 buffet. We had the dinner buffet and it was better than I had expected. Surprisingly good selection, nothing to rave about, but good items, some very good. The casino was fun, not too crazy on a Saturday night. I thought their selection of slots was the best and we visited about 5 others on the strip. Location is wonderful, we walked to the Aria, and it was quicker than the tram. One big plus is the food court; I got soft drinks for $1@McDonalds. That’s hard to beat on the strip! From reading reviews prior to going to Vegas, I was very concerned about what our experience would be like at the MC. There must be a lot of rooms that are not renovated yet, because ours was great. We stayed @ the Wynn the next 2 nights, and yes, that is an exceptional hotel. We had the fantastic Wynn buffet but still felt we had a favorable experience at MC. For value and convenience the Monte Carlo delivered.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Valet your car”
Reviews.Author: adidasgirla
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Monte Carlo every time I went to Vegas (last 8 times), but this last trip was the last for me. It wasn't the hotel that was the problem, yes the hotel is getting old and the drains don't drain that fast but the real issue for me was the valet parking. I was there for 5 nights and had my car valet there from day one to 3 took it out on the 3rd and valet it back till the end of the trip. When I took my car the 3rd day of the trip the very nice valet guys opened the doors for me and I sat in my car and drove away. My first stop was the gas station and what did I find? That the side of my car by the gas tank was scratched (but it was perfectly normal when I came to Vegas). I noticed it and drove right back to Monte Carlo, the manager of the valet took pictures, called security, and made a report and told me I should hear back from them in 3 days. Guess what? I heard back from them in a month and what was said to me was even worse. They were not going to pay for the damage because I left their property (even though they had cameras to prove). Now, I am stuck with $1300 in damages. I guess this has taught me a lesson, look at your car each time you valet it.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: mst2432
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three night stay at Monte Carlo. Don't believe the bad reviews. The hotel is smaller compared to the newer giants, but you cannot beat the location and layout of the property. Enjoyed the wave pool, only complaint is that they place the chairs "very close" to each other. The rooms were nice, with great pillows and beds. The food court is great - able to get something to eat very late at night for a reasonable price. The walkway to the new City Center is also a nice touch. Watched the games on Sunday at the Pub, good food but a little pricey for bar food. Gambling was OK, they do offer $5 blackjack during the daytime. Would not hesitate to go back. Headed over to New York, New York to gamble and hit $800 on a Wheel of Fortune machine. Also played blackjack, and the dealer was very nice and patient with some players that were beginners.

Reviews.Title: “Diamond Suite, very nice”
Reviews.Author: MarkDC-Travel
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at the Monte Carlo. My first two stays were in the Monaco and Spa suites. This time I stayed in room 23001, a Diamond Suite. The Diamond Suite is two separate rooms, the living room and the bedroom. The living area has a long counter for the wet bar and refrigerator. The is a lot of empty space in this pseudo galley kitchen area that does NOT have a microwave. I got a deal of 30% off on Saturday, Sunday, and Monday (Oct 2, 3 & 4) so the suite cost me inclusive of resort fees and taxes $218.34 for Saturday, and $132.10 for Sunday and also for Monday for a total of $482.55 for the three nights. This averaged to $161/night. For a two room suite, this is a good price for Vegas. The living area is a good sized room with a fold out sofa bed and an eating table. The room also had an old Phillips 34" HDTV tube television set. There was also a toilet by the entrance. The bedroom was also good sized. In the closet were the usual amenities, safe, iron and ironing board, as well as many wooden hangers. There were also two robes and two pairs of slippers. The bathroom was galley-like and small, but contained the huge Jacuzzi you find in the spa suite and a separate shower. The bed was very comfortable. The was another old Phillips 34" HDTV tube television set in the bedroom. These old TVs are probably good for renting a movie, but they have very limited TV channels. Yes, I like TV while in bed even in Las Vegas and there is little to offer from the cable they have in the room. They do have the latest movies for rent though. The rooms are a bit warn and in need of a makeover. The windows were filthy. Surprise, you can open the widows a crack. This is a nice feature I like when I can find it in these highrise resorts. This trip, I was in desperate need of a haircut and scheduled a haircut at the salon. A person by the name of Rindy cut my hair. She worked there for the last 12 years. She did a fine job, but she was able to draw me out and converse with me a lot. I'm usually very quiet so she demonstrated exceptional people skills. The front desk check in was very smooth and checking in at 11AM was not a problem. There were times when the hotel was very noisy with young people (in their 20s) who never learned manners. These are the people that scream down the hall to their friends and basically act as if the word revolves around them with no consideration for others. I guess each hotel has their fair share, and the Monte Carlo is no exception. The location of the Monte Carlo is excellent. It is easy to get to all the hotels to the south and across the strip, and with the tram to Bellagio, all hotels mid strip are also within easy walking distance. The hotels on the north end are a bit further, but the walk is not really that bad. Eats are fin in this hotel, with a discount fast food in the food court, to upscale restaurants that will cost you $120+ per person and everything in between. But all eateries Vegas are within walking distance from the Monte Carlo. The Monte Carlo is IMO the best value and location on the strip, even if it is in need of a makeover. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service”
Reviews.Author: Vegasbabysept10
Reviews.Content: For anyone travelling to Las Vegas, do yourself a favor and stay at the Monte Carlo. The hotel is well located, the rooms are clean and spacious and most of all, the staff if exceptionally helpful and friendly. In particular, Angela Pezzeli and Lisa Massaro went out of their way to make sure that our stay in vegas was unforgettable. Angela & Lisa, we can't thank you enough. We will definitely be back!!

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: dswslc
Reviews.Content: Just back from the Monte Carlo and after reading the comments I'm not sure I stayed at the same hotel as a lot of the other posters. I found the Monte Carlo to be very clean,very professional, very friendly, the right size and in a perfect location. I walked all over the strip and visited many other properties and I bet I could find fault with any them if I tried hard enough. The floor I was on was completely no smoking, very quiet, exceptionally clean with no stains in the hall ways, no dirty sheets, no slow running drains, comfortable bed and the room seemed huge. I had a fabulous view of the new city center, there was food for all budgets and I loved the classy way the casino looked . When the hotel says check-in is at 3pm why do you show up at 11am and expect a room to be ready? The negative would be the resort fee, but I knew they had it when I booked the hotel. Would I stay there again.........absolutely.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury for Regular Folks”
Reviews.Author: onesmartcookie1
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights while in Las Vegas and managed to get this for $50/ per night. The day we arrived it was 11 Am in the morning and the room was just being made up as we arrived so we had to wait about 15 mins. which was no problem because it wasn't even check in time. They were very accomodating. The maid service was very efficient and when we told them it was our first stay at this hotel they welcomes us with a big smile and "Welcome to the best!". It was obvious they took great pride in their jobs and appreciate our business. That was refreshing because I can tell you that we have stayed in other places in Las Vegas and not recieved such stellar service. The room had a kingsize bed with nice bedding, pillows and was incredibly comfy! We had two nights of wonderful sleep and with no noise. The room's furnishings are a bit dated but I like the fact it was not too modern/cold otherwise it would have lost some of its charm to me. Everything was well looked after and apparent that the maid service looks after all details. It was perfect, clean and well maintained. I was happy to have a tub in the room because we have stayed at two other hotels in Vegas and both did not have a tub. It was great to have a soak after a long day of gambling, walking and having fun! There was an ice machine down the hall, newspapers provided each day and we had a view of some of the strip. The temperature in the room was perfect. We never had time to take advantage of the pool but from what we saw it was quite nice and maintained. The only thing I didn't care for was the tv. It wasn't a modern flat screen. I had to use their tv internet which was quite cumbersome. We took advantage of the free shuttle from Monte Carlo to Bellagio which happens to go through the new City Center. The Street of Dreams is a nice shopping area in the hotel and we also thought it was nice to have a small food court area nearby in case we wanted to grab something to eat instead of dining out. As well, there are other options in the hotel if you want to dine out. The Conceirge was very helpful as was the bell desk. We took advantage of the Bell Desk when we were checking out and kept our luggage there before we flew out later that day. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Huge Hotel”
Reviews.Author: subchat
Reviews.Content: This is a really huge hotel with about 15 check in counters and a really massive lobby. Rooms are fairly well appointed but aircon is weak and especially in the summer heat of Las Vegas this could be devasting. We had problem with the Aircon and after complaining, Housekeeping did send across a mechanic. The mechanic told us that the aircon was based on water based cooling and hence not much could be done, something which we could not understand. The job of an airconditioner is to cool irrespective of the mode of cooling. However, he cleaned the vents and changed the filters and there was some improvement but not adequate. This was the one negative,the other one being there was no tea or coffee maker in the room. I was told that this is the case in all Las Vegas hotels, which is surprising since all the Hotels we stayed during our 35 days tour of USA and Canada had this facility. However, Ihaving said that I would like to list the pros as under: 1. Casino on site(I suppose this is true of majority of hotels in Las Vegas) 2. Food Court at the Lobby level with a wide choice of cuisines at fairly reasonale prices so food is never an issue. Some of the stalls are open almost all night. 3. Free train shuttle service between the hotel and the Bellagio Palace Hotel from wher you can witness the awesome fireworks display in the night. Also take in the other sights and hotels like MGM. Paris Hotel with the replica of the Eifel Tower and the Statue of Liberty. 4. Housekeeping service and Room Service were quite attentive 5. You can spend hours in the Lobby either People Watching or shopping at the various shops which had fairly good stuff at sale prices . 6. Breakfast arranged by our Tour Operator in one of the restaurants at the food court was awesome

Reviews.Title: “Angela Pezzella and Lisa Massaro”
Reviews.Author: PaolaMontreal
Reviews.Content: In September 2010, I visited Vegas for the first time and stayed at the Monte Carlo. Although the hotel was very well located, the rooms were clean and the service in general was very good, the best features of this hotel, by far, were Angela Pezzella (concierge) and Lisa Massaro (VIP Services). Both employees went above and beyond to ensure that our stay in Vegas was spectacular. Their focus on customer service is unparalleled and they have set the standards for other employees beyond reach. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone planning a Vegas trip. Angela and Lisa make all of the difference.

Reviews.Title: “Gross!!!!”
Reviews.Author: macarn
Reviews.Content: One of the most disgusting places I've ever stayed. I post pictures of the bathroom which had feces everywhere. The general manager left me a message after I got home and complained....tried to complain there but was greeted with nothing but rudeness. His message was basically "got your pictures, forwarded to housekeeping, don't call me, I'll call you." I also filed a report with the Board of Health. I am a nurse and this place is dangerous!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: MGMSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Monte Carlo for two nights back in July. It was one of the cheapest places on the strip, but the room was clean and not too outdated/shabby as some cheaper places on the strip can be. Generally the staff was nice and attentive and the pool area was really nice, especially the lazy river! Another big plus is that it is in a great location to get to the new City Center and is more or less in the middle of the strip, but it's not a terribly long drive to get to the airport. My one complaint is the resort fee that is tacked onto your reservation, which I think was an additional $20/night for services that we never really used.

Reviews.Title: “A fine time”
Reviews.Author: geoboy89
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights at the Monte Carlo at the end of September. The positives... Check in and check out were smooth and problem free. The room was perfectly fine. Comfortable. Spacious. Clean. A bit of a view of the strip. Pool area was very nice. Great buffet. We got the full day buffet package on day one for around $30 per person Secure in room safe to store all of your winnings The negatives... Prepare to pay the resort fee of roughly $13 per night. No mini fridge in the room. The gym (if you care to use it) is tiny Overall, a positive stay. This hotel does not have all of the glitz of other properties further up the strip but was a good home base during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in heart of the strip”
Reviews.Author: Minor_16
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Monte Carlo for 7 days and can't imagine a better value in the heart of the strip. This being my 6th trip to Vegas, but first time staying in this area, I didn't know how convenient it would be. Great staff, rooms were clean, and casino was what you would expect. Only complaint is you can hear everything going on from outside your room. Whether it was somebody running water, or a party going on downstairs, you could hear it.....It wasn't enough to keep us awake, but if you're a light sleeper, it could be an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel rooms bad, everything else good”
Reviews.Author: RBG81601
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights here in October 2010 on the 20th floor. Checkin was easy and fast and the hotel is well organized and you don't have to trek through the casino to the elevators. The room was old, dirty and tired. The windows were filthy and broken. The bathroom fixtures were broken. The air vents were full of dirt and junk. The carpets were filthy and torn. The furniture was beat up. The tub didn't drain. And you can hear everything through the walls. The only good thing about the room was the comfortable bed. The resort itself is great, the restaurants and pool and casino were wonderful, but the horrible rooms will keep us from ever staying here again unless we hear the rooms have all been totally updated and remodeled.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal stay for the price!”
Reviews.Author: BCmo
Reviews.Content: I've read on and off reviews for the Monte Carlo. This was my 4th time in Vegas but 1st time at the Monte Carlo. I personally thought is was fantastic! Service was good. Our room was a standard double, but had everything we needed. It was clean, spacious and looked out onto the strip which was a bonus. The hotel has 2 Starbucks on the main floor (YAY! Love my Starbucks!). The Tram goes from Monte Carlo to Bellagio which is perfect because I prefer to gamble at the Flamingo and Harrahs...cuts down on blisters that's for sure! The pools are awesome! Busy but not impossible to find a chair. LOVE the wave pool. Diablos is a great place for good mexican food....margaritas are AWESOME! One very cool added 'extra' I found out about by fluke was that you have complimentary access to using 1 of 2 computers at the front desk to print your flight boarding passes. Very handy! Would stay here again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location but rooms need updated”
Reviews.Author: walshy1984
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights at end of september. The hotel in general is very nice. The staff were very friendly and helpful. When we arrived were put in a smoking room by accident but when we went to reception they moved us to a non smoking room which was bigger and better. I felt the rooms were very old fashioned and could all do will a revamp although they were clean. Everything was getting a bit shabby and old but considering you don't spend much time in your room except for sleeping I didn't mind to much. The facilities in hotel are brilliant, There is a nice pool, a good casino, several restaurants and lots of fast food outlets inc. macdonalds, subways, starbucks, pizza, chinese and mexican. There is also a tram which takes you to the bellagio for free!! Location is brillaint. Next to New York, New York and opposite MGM Grand. Right on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “I was In Las Vegas during Thursday/Oct: 7, 2010 to Sunday/Oct: 10, 2010”
Reviews.Author: 129HO
Reviews.Content: Comfortable Room. Warm And Helpfully Staff. 24 Hour Service. Free Valet Parking For All Guest. Fitness Center, Salon, And Spa. Concierge Service. Free Local Phone Calls. If You Enjoy Golf. The Concierge Will Set You Up. 1. Bali Hai Golf Club; 5160 Las Vegas Blvd. South; Las Vegas, Or The Desert Pines Golf Club. Food Court and Restaurants. A Small Note: On Thursday Night / October 7, 2010 I Went To The Mirage To See Mr. Terry Fator. ( Excellent Show ) He Won America's Got Talent In 2007. Places To Help You Save Money. 1. Las Vegas Outlet Center Mall; 7400 Las Vegas Blvd South; Las Vegas, NV 89123. 2. Outback Steakhouse. 3. Denny's, 4. ABC Stores, 5. Walgreens, 6. CVS Pharmacy, 7. Mc Donalds, 8. Taco Bell, And 9. Jack N The Box.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay @ the Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: Okanaganamiga
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Monte Carlo September 12 -18th, 2010. Chick trip. What a great hotel! Start from the beginning; learned from last year DO NOT TAKE THE SHUTTLE from the airport unless you have a good three hours to kill after your flight! TAKE A CAB!!!!! Cheap and quick! The Monte Carlo has a great layout, the lobby and elevators are beside eachother so you do not have to drag your luggage through the casino which is a big plus!!! We were on the 27th floor in tower #2 (?), the room was nice and clean, big bathroom and overlooked the pool area and the new Aria hotel. I must say, they had the MOST comfortable beds and pillows I have ever experienced, very nice! The connecting trams were convenient and useful. The "food fair" area is just off the casino and on your way into the mall area. One piece of advise....DO NOT EAT AT THE CHINESE FOOD KIOSK @ MONTE CARLO....unless you want to be sick for your vacation. Pay the extra and go to the Dragon Noodle Co.....very well worth it! The staff were very helpful and polite. And about the "resort tax"....it was 14.00 a day for each day stayed, the tax is for phone calls, faxes, and a few other offers which we did not have use for any. The interesting thing is, at the end of our stay the balance was zero, did not get charged the fee. Last year at the Excalibur the same thing happened....but we got a few comps in the process....no comps @ the Monte...which was ok but questionable. The Monte Carlo is at a great location on the strip as well, a little more central. Close to shops and a drug store if need be. Note Canadians: Canadian quarters do not fit in the pop machine...Heheh. All in all, I will definately stay at the Monte Carlo in the future, great price, great rooms, great service. The only drawback for me personally was thesmell of mold on our elevator lobbly area on 27th floor (allergic to mold), and I understand as there was a fire years ago. Not too much of a biggie as you don't spend much time there. Casino was fun, clean and busy, drink service prompt when they did find you. So enjoy, was worth the stay! PS the pub thats across from the Harley shop in Mote Carlo is great, awesome food and atmosphere, but VERY loud, intolerable actually, not a place for anyone but drunk football fans which is not a bad thing but expect to leave with ringing ears and a headache if you pop in for lunch or dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Average Stay on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: mtnbiker4300
Reviews.Content: My partner has stayed here several times, to where this was my first stay. After first joining their mailing list, we looked for a great special to be emailed and we took advantage of it. This is a nice clean average resort. our room was on the 23rd floor overlooking the strip. The staff gave us this room at our request. maid service was great and friendly. They gave us anything extra we might have needed. Beds were really soft and soft comforters. Queen beds had 3 big soft pillows each. Hair dryer died so a call to housekeeping took about 30 to 45 mins to replace it. Really no complaints there. Food court was great and convenient. The bar next to the Steakhouse was quite loud at night next to the casino. Would have been hard to play and and listen to a few drunks during kareoke night. Ouch ! Newest attraction looks like its the Minus -5 Bar. Put on a cold suit, go into a ice room and have cold drinks. Didnt do it, but looked fun. The buffet was nothing to write home about. Got in there late and they had no seafood. Looks like Friday and Saturdays for that one only. Waitress wouldnt revisit you hardly at all. Got a comp'ed meal at Dragon Noodle Co. and it was great ! Great Sushi ! Wonton soup was different and great also. Dont miss the Lettuce wraps. Looks like the strip is looking tired on the north end. The south end looks fresh and updated. A step up in resorts would put you at NY-NY or MGM. Heard complaints Luxor especially the Criss Angel show. Worst one on the strip was the word on the street. We did Blue Man and KA. Everyone was talking about Jersey Boys and Le Reve, both being fantastic. All in all, for the price, I will be at the Monte Carlo again. BTW, they have added a tram that runs to Aria and Bellagio. Walk down past NY NY and catch a tram that runs from Excalibur, Luxor and Mandalay Bay. Walk thru MGM to the back and you can catch the Monorail all the way down to walking distance of the Stratosphere.

Reviews.Title: “We love this place!”
Reviews.Author: Lilosa
Reviews.Content: This is the second year we've stayed at the Monte Carlo, and we plan to go back next year. The location is great, right in the middle of everything we like. It's not super-big, but that's perfect for us since my husband has trouble walking. The lobby is a manageable size and the elevators are close by. Every hotel staff member we dealt with was friendly and helpful, including front desk clerks, bell clerks, concierges, housekeepers and valets. They gave us a room close by the elevators, as requested, and a free wheelchair to use for the duration of our stay. When we experienced problems accessing the Internet, a tech representative was there within 10 minutes--and the problem turned out to be within our computer, not their system. Housekeeping respected our Do Not Disturb sign, no matter how late we slept in, and the room was always clean when we returned. The 20-somethings in our party spent a lot of time at the Lazy River and had a ball. We ate at 3 of their restaurants--Diablo's, the Buffet, and The Pub--and enjoyed all our meals. (If you go to the Pub, be sure to order the organic meatball flatbread--everyone in the family loved it!) Our only complaint was the casino itself. We like to play blackjack, and some of the dealers were great but there were several who weren't especially friendly. We had a lot more fun gambling on Fremont St.

Reviews.Title: “Just Not Good Anymore”
Reviews.Author: travellingmom011
Reviews.Content: We've been coming here for many years, but the hotel/casino needs a major up-date. Front Desk: Always courteous. Grand, lobby. You get the impression that the rooms will also be grand. Rooms: Old bedspreads have been removed and replaced with thin, white covers. The beds are pretty comfortable. Carpets have cigarette burns (even in non-smoking rooms). Bathrooms are "okay" - but the cleaning needs to be happening. I wiped some water off the floors after my son's shower, and the towel turned black. The furniture is dated, so is the T.V. The upside is that you can get a room pretty cheaply. But beware of the mandatory $15.00/night resort fee. It comes with some "coupons" that are useless (good luck trying to turn one in for a free drink at the bar- a real joke), but it does include two bottles of water! (6 oz. each), so the room cost does add up. Casino: I'm a member of their "Player's Club" - anyone can join. You put the card they issue into any machine you play (also works at the tables) and it keeps track of your playing. At some point enough "points" are earned for freebies. I played and spent a lot of money for three days, and didn't earn anything. I checked at the info. desk on my last day, and the attendant gave me a strange, pinched look and said "maybe you can get a free coffee". I told her "no thanks".
