While playing the slots, I was offered free drinks numerous times, so that's a plus. Buffet: It's just okay - typical - but I didn't see any seafood items offered the 3 days we were there. For $30.00/person, you can eat at the buffet all day long. You also get to wear a red wristband that tells everyone that you're a glutton. The breakfast seems to be the best bet. Food Court: Your typical food court with more options if you don't want to eat in any of the restaurants (Subway, McDonald's, pizza, etc. Pools: The lazy river used to be the main draw for my family. Now the pool area has turned into a party zone. Lots of drinking, and locals can use the pool all day for a few bucks. Good luck in finding a single lounge chair for a family of 4. If you drink, there looks like a lot of nice, really tall colorful drinks available. Things for kids to do: Nothing but eat and try to squeeze into the lazy river and avoid looking at what they shouldn't be looking at. Monte Carlo used to have an arcade, but it's now part of the shopping area. This hotel really isn't someplace I would ever bring my family to again.

Reviews.Title: “Wash your windows, okay?!”
Reviews.Author: silver33
Reviews.Content: For a resort with the kind of ratings you have, I am amazed that the window are so dirty. Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “A nice "3" star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: OcalaGator
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at MC in the past so knew what to expect. Got a great rate ($45.00) on the internet so the flaws didnt bother me much. The good: Great location on the strip with a tram that runs to City Center and Bellagio.( Dont bother with City Center yet. Miracle Mile Shops in Planet Hollywood are much better !) Nice casino and not very smokey. Service at Valet and check in was excellent. The bad: Carpet in rooms and halls needs to be replaced. Windows are filthy so dont bother getting a "strip view". Mountain view is much quieter and you dont have the morning sun. No flat screen TV's in rooms. Very few cocktail waiters in casino.

Reviews.Title: “It's getting old, and a "Resort" fee when this is far from it”
Reviews.Author: Jason_chi
Reviews.Content: This is my third trip to Vegas. Last trip was to the Palms, and I'm still trying to see which one I like better. Palms is newer, but off the strip. Monte Carlo is really starting to show its age. Old CRT TVs, elevators are in BAD shape (you don't even know what floor you are on because the screens are dead), and the lighting is very cheap in the hallways. The casino is fine, and the main floor has been renovated, so that part is nice. But despite this, the location is pretty good. So, if you don't care about a really nice room, this would work for you. If you are looking for something luxurious, look elsewhere. The one thing that really bugs me is there is now a $14 "Resort fee" PER DAY that you have to pay. It covers internet and local phone calls. Neither of which I need, but are forced to pay for. There are still many casino hotels that don't charge this fee, and I will be booking at one of those for my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “okay, but there is better”
Reviews.Author: SASSYBEAN
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Monte Carlo and I have to say, the hotel could do better. The rate we got was very decent, but they do charge you a $12 "resort fee" which is supposedly for a newspaper every day, access to the gym and free faxing and copies. Doesn't seem right to pay $12/night for a paper and access to a gym but whatever. I called housekeeping to ask for towels, was told they would be delivered immediately, but they never arrived. the room was comfortable, but is just the room. Carpets in the hallway and room were badly stained, there was no refridgerator or microwave, the shower did not drain well and the in-room safe was so small the only thing that could fit in it was a wallet and a phone. Laptop wouldhave never fit in there. Finally, there is free internet service, but you have to have ethernet cable with you, there is no free WiFi. Another couple with us stayed at the Rio for approximately the same rate per night, with no resort fee. They had a couch in their room, with a fridge, free WiFi and beautiful clean room. Although the Rio is not on the strip, for the price and accomodations, seems to be worth the cost of a cab or bus ride to the strip, or just renting a car to get around in. We won;t stay at the Monte Carlo again simply because there are other casino/resorts that offer more for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding at Monte Carlo!!”
Reviews.Author: love2relax
Reviews.Content: We just had our wedding at the monte carlo hotel and it was perfect. The wedding coordinator Heather always returned emails or phone calls promptly. She had lots of great information about where to go and how to get my dress steamed etc.....even when we couldn't get a cabana at the pool the next day she pulled strings and reserved one for us. The flowers were beautiful! The salon was not the greatest I have to admit. My hair and makeup turned out fine but I felt it was very overpriced and the prices on their website are not totally accurate. They also have very poor customer service over the phone. However I had a massage there and it was amazing and totally worth the money. The hotel is close to everything and the buffet was excellent. The rooms are nice but their suites are even better! We stayed in a spa suite and it was amazing, loved it! The pool is more tame then I think most of the other big hotels but they have a wave pool and a great lazy river that our whole group used for hours and hours. Drinking at the pool is pricy but thats Vegas for ya. Other then that we had a wonderful time. I would do it again at the Monte Carlo!

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo, Las Vegas - good for the money”
Reviews.Author: goSFO
Reviews.Content: Monte Carlo Resort and Casino has great location and really nice resort area. Swimming pools are includes lazy river and ocean beach with waves. I would recommend it for travelers with limited budged. Look for deals. Sign for emails destribution. But remember, they have $12.50 mandatory resort fee per night!

Reviews.Title: “Great Shower, Hard pillows and more Cons”
Reviews.Author: youngrose39
Reviews.Content: We were there for our anniversary and got the suite 10th floor, ok rooms and it was clean, we asked for a strip view and got a view of the roof and 2 inches worth of the strip between 2 buildings. The wave pool was freezing and the towels had holes in it, the lounge chair are so hard, plus you have to pay extra to use a tube to float down the lazy river $9.00 the pool and jaquzzi closes at 6:00 PM and they say there is a spa in doors that you can use but it is an extra cost of $5.00 and it closes at 8 PM. The housekeepers woke us up every morning they dont even wait for you to open the door they knock and just walk in. Pillows are hard as rock and you get 5 small hard pillows with a king bed, why not 2 king size since its a king bed. wont stay there again. you cant check in till 3 to 5 PM

Reviews.Title: “Love the pool area!”
Reviews.Author: CDSinMN
Reviews.Content: Room was pretty basic but decent enough. Pool area was good. A bit crowded on a Saturday afternoon but not too bad. Wave pool was a lot of fun but water was cold. Lazy river was nice but a bit crowded with people standing thoughout by the edge drinking. Casino wasn't very busy. Ate at the Cafe, it was OK but not too big of a menu. Did like having a Food Court available. Diablo's has good food and great drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience! Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: SowherewasI
Reviews.Content: Got a great rate via text "Summer Offer". Got the Monaco Suite for $250 for a Sat/Sun night stay. GREAT SUITE! Wonderful bed, sitting area w/couch, eating space, desk, 1 1/2 baths all marble, flat screen tv. Was worried about being so close to the elevator, but heard NOTHING our entire stay. Check in was quick, check out was quick, staff was very friendly and we had a buy one get one free buffet, but they ran out of certificates so just comped us both a buffet. Casino dealers were fun. Great location-jumped on tram to Aria and Bellagio all the time. Great property and will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel not bad, but some of the staff let them down”
Reviews.Author: gfrenc8106
Reviews.Content: On arrival at around 6 pm we were checked in by Woody, friendly and bubbly, and we hauled our tired bodies to the 13th floor. Disaster - our room had not been cleaned at all since the previous occupant had left that morning. I rang down to reception to complain and was given a muted apology by a young lady who sounded as if this sort of thing happened all the time. We were allocated another room on the same floor - unfortunately this room did not overlook the main Las Vegas strip like the original, so I rejected it. We ended up with a view of the strip but two floors down from our friends, and right at the end of a very long (and very noisy) corridor. But, give them their due, they did sort the problem quickly. The room had no directory of services, so we couldn't tell whether they offered room service or how many restaurants there were on site, so we didn't eat there. The hotel was, for us, just too big, and the noise in the casino was deafening, although you couldn't hear it from other parts of the hotel. English newspapers were on sale in the lobby, the ONLY hotel we stayed in that acknowledged newspapers were printed in any other country other than the USA. But if you like big, noisy, brash American hotels with a casino and pole dancers, this is the one for you!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Features and Value”
Reviews.Author: Salaman
Reviews.Content: With its easy walking access to many of the South Strip hotels and the free monorail on the west side of the Strip connecting the Bellagio, this is an excellent location while in Vegas. The buses which run south along the Strip, stop at the MGM Grand across the street, while the northbound buses can be accessed in front of the Bellagio ( use the monorail to get there). Excellent resort atmosphere on-site with wave pool, river pool etc. Small gym is well maintained with helpful staff. Bottles of ice-cold water. The resort fee of $14 is a pretty good deal. Foodcourt includes McD's, Sub and Sbarro. We went on a Grand Canyon tour early AM on Saturday Oct. 2 and it was great to have good cheap breakfast fare available by Subway and McD's.at 5AM. We stayed in room 12-124. You can hear some of the plumbing from adjoining room(s) and our tub did not drain as quickly as I would have liked. Excellent air conditioning unit. Bolt feature on the door lock gives you a good sense of security. In-room safe was available but I didn't feel that there was a need for us to use it. It was quiet on our floor both nights that we stayed there. Check-out time was 11 but we payed the extra fee to stay until 6PM as our flight to Toronto was later in the evening. Money well spent .Friendly helpful staff everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “No frills”
Reviews.Author: kaj0
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Monte Carlo for a few nights. The front desk service was excellent and the staff were very friendly. Our only complaint was the over powering smell of flowers (roses) when we walked into the lobby. Not sure what that was about but it was ghastly. Maybe trying to cover up the over powering stink of cigarette smoke! The rooms although clean, were very basic. The hotel location was good and it was handy having the tram which takes you right into the middle of the action. We didn't try any of the restaurants in the hotel as there were so many places to go. I did like having Starbucks in the food court for morning coffee. We did spend a few hours in the casino and had great service - unlike what we experienced in some of the "fancier" hotels. It didn't seem overly busy but it may have just been the time we were there. The pool was ok but I don't know why they had to close so early. It would have been nice to get an extra hour poolside. This is a good value hotel and would recommend it for those looking for a no frills stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place & price”
Reviews.Author: ROBBJOHN
Reviews.Content: Beautiful property, clean and quiet rooms. We chose a luxury king room which was above the 16th floor and had a strip view. Front desk staff were very cordial as well as all other staff. Housekeeping staff were great. I would recommend this propert for couples or families. They have a wonderful pool, wave pool and lazy river pool. You did have to pay for the floats in the river but you could just lay back and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value and Service, and Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: AlphaTravelling
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the feeling of a very plus, upmarket place, and yet the rates reflect a very reasonably priced hotel. It is right on the strip and close enough to walk everywhere. The amenities are easy to get to, and there is a selection of eating on-site, so it caters for everything you could need. There is even a monorail that takes you straight to the Bellagio, so if you don't feel like walking, you don't have to! The staff were very helpful and friendly - especially the business centre staff, who helped us mail a package home (back to Australia). We received it in the time they said it would take (only 10 days!). If you're wanting to swim, you can only use the pool during daylight hours, so there's no swimming after 6pm. The rooms are comfortable and well serviced. We had one incident of being woken up early in the morning which turned out to be 2 security guards knocking on the door of our neighbour - this was an isolated incident though. Otherwise, it was relatively quiet. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable quiet hotel in good location, good value”
Reviews.Author: Nigel_P_London
Reviews.Content: I booked the Monte Carlo after reading many reviews of Las Vegas hotels on this website. I'm glad I did so, because my experience was very good. Everything worked, the staff were polite and the hotel was cool about keeping my suitcase for 48 hours while I went off to the Grand Canyon. If I had to go to Las Vegas again to visit the Canyon, I'd certainly go back to the Monte Carlo, though I'd eat at the Bellagio if I wanted a buffet as the Bellagio's buffet is way better and slightly cheaper. To eat at the Monte Carlo I'd recommend Rubio's a no-nonense taqueria is the food court. Back in the room, the beds were clean, comfortable and the room for pretty spacious -- an excellent deal all round, considering I paid I think arount £45. My only gripe is that the swimming pool looked pretty small, no good if you want to swim laps.

Reviews.Title: “Rude”
Reviews.Author: sharicbrb
Reviews.Content: The first time I went to Vegas we stayed at the Monte Carlo and it was Great, things have changed big time. When we gamble we like to have a drink and have a nice relaxing time, we are on vacation so we do like good customer service. The waitress was so rude! We asked for a drink and she was not smiling and said "are you staying here to play or ? " Do not recommend. We always eat at the buffet and it was good!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travellerwith4
Reviews.Content: stayed for 4 nights .....very clean and friendly, check in took about 2 minutes the lobby smelt fantastic with all the fresh flowers ....the pool was very busy but to be excepted with the hot weather The valet people were very knowledgeable for directions we would stay there again and would recommend it to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Great location, poor sleep quality....”
Reviews.Author: Michie_B
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally located, with being able to easily walk the strip. The casino is nice. The pool was closed when we were there at Christmas. The room we stayed seemed very outdated for this supposed 4 star hotel, and the walls were quite thin, as we were able to hear our neighbor cough repeatedly throughout the nights, and everytime he entered and left his room. The bathroom reminded us of staying in a cheap motel, as it was extremely basic and very outdated. If we stayed here again, I would probably ask for a different floor of the hotel, or even a different room. Overall, everything seemed clean enough though, and it was nice to be in a non-smoking room. Not sure that I would rate this hotel a 4 star...

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo - all you need!”
Reviews.Author: GingerFanny
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd time my husband and i have stayed at the Monte Carlo Hotel in LV and we continue to stay there becasue of its ideal location and reasonable rates. This is a great hotel without costing the earth to stay! The Monte Carlo has a nice, well lit casino (unlike many of the other dimly lit casinos on the strip) and doesn't smell of smoke. They have some great restaurants...the Cafe serves great food (at good prices) 24/7 and the Brand Steakhouse is superb! The best meal i have ever had in Vegas was at the Brand Steakhouse. The Pub is also great if you like sports and want some fun....super atmosphere especially when the football is on. The Monte Carlo rooms and spacious, clean and comfortable. The pools are lovely and staff friendly. There is a now a free tram that runs from the MC, via City Centre to the Bellagio now, which is great!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VALUE AND GOOD LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Asa17
Reviews.Content: I would recommend the Monte Carlo Hotel. I stayed in one of the Diamond Suites. It was clean and very spacious. Unfortunately, they did not have two queen beds so I had to share a King size bed with my sister. They did have a sofabed so another family member slept on that which they said it was comfortable. Four years ago I also stayed at the Monte Carlo and you can see the wear and tear but overall I like the Monte Carlo because it is not too big that you can get lost. Caesars Palace, MGM, and the Venetian seemed a little too big. The lazy river is great and the food court is also a great value. Also there is a CVS and Walgreens not too far away and it is near to other sites and hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic in everyway”
Reviews.Author: Lily1230
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location right where its all happening and connected to other Hotels by monorail, and good plus in the extreme heat! Service was friendly and very efficient, free parking also.Pools are brill, casino bit quieter than others but still really good fun, wide variety of food outlets and restaurants all within the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Base to explore LA”
Reviews.Author: Macc72
Reviews.Content: My Sister and I spent only 2 nights in Vegas in the middle of a driving tour of LA/Nevada. As with all Vegas Hotels, this one is very big!! Plenty of parking available and check in was simple enough. The rooms are very nicely decorated though not as big as I was expecting (good sized bathroom though). Staying in Vegas involves an awful lot more walking than you think....things may look only a five minute walk away but I assure you they are not. Our hotel then was pretty centrally located. It is definately worth taking advantage of the "free" drinks in the casino as long as you are playing the machines. On the Casino floor are also plenty of places to eat including the mandatory MacDonalds. I found the food in the hotel to be slightly expensive but I guess you pay for it on the "strip". We didn't take advantage of the outdoor pool area because it was simply too hot. It did however look a little cramped considering the size of the hotel. Overall, this hotel suited our needs and it was a very comfortable stay. Top tip: take comfy shoes!!

Reviews.Title: “Simple but lucrative”
Reviews.Author: CanadaLoveparis
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Monte Carlo many times...we find the hotel needs an upgrade but all the restaurants inside the hotel are top notch and the winnings in this hotel are good..Our best winnings have always come from the Monte Carlo...Room was clean and adequate..food excellent..No doubt it is good value for the price...

Reviews.Title: “Expected more”
Reviews.Author: DSWeimar
Reviews.Content: The casino was nice, the restaurants were fine, but the rooms were average to poor. We switched rooms and both were nothing nice. Lame TV's, sheets were scratchy, the tub and sink would not drain. The towels smelled horrible and gross.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the location”
Reviews.Author: wootentmw
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo is located on the south "strip" and provides easy access to the new City Center properties and the Bellagio via the free tram. We chose for its combination of value, location and access. When we reserved we requested two queen beds in a non-smoking room and we got what we asked for, no hassles. Our room and the wing we were in appeared to have been renovated within the last year. The hall and room carpets were clean. The beds were very comfortable. Everything smelled clean. Wireless Internet is included in the daily resort fee and works very well. There is a low level of foot traffic through the property and it was consequently quiet and not at all crowded feeling. Some of the properties along the strip funnel street traffic from overhead walk walkways etc. and consequently are loud and crowded, not so with the Monte Carlo. The casino was just average and could use some updating. You probably will want to get out and explore other properties bar and restaurant offering. The pool area was fine but a little congested feeling. They charge for the "lazy river" tubes which I thought was a little cheap on management's part. The hotel and parking valet staff were very courteous which gave the property a "glad you are here" feel. Overall I would choose the Monte Carlo again against comparable priced south strip alternatives, especially for its clean rooms, quiet atmosphere, and the food court which is very handy for morning coffee and inexpensive fast food. If you are renting a car the access to Las Vegas Blvd. is easy and the Valet parking staff is first rate.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service Sucks”
Reviews.Author: MoBanuelos
Reviews.Content: Customer Service sucks...shower drain didnt work, they never came to fix it for the 4 days we were there... They promised us if we came back they would upgrade us to a suite but did not deliver that promise when we came back & management had a I dont care about my customers attitude.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: spurs1960
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights, what a great time we had. we had strip view rooms they were brilliant, clean & very comfortable, also you can valet park for free

Reviews.Title: “Amazing! Booking for next year!”
Reviews.Author: itamkin
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the reviews on trip advisor i was hesitant about our stay at Monte Carlo. We had previously stayed at the Venetian so had high standards with which to compare the MC. The location, the lobby, the staff, the ease of check in and the rooms were fantastic. We particularly enjoyed "The Pub" and the buffet was great. The pool area was the best we have seen anywhere on the strip, including Mandalay Bay and the Bellagio. Every weekend there is a pool party which is fun and noisy! Of course you can find a quiet area if you choose, but hey its Vegas! You don't go for a quiet holiday do you? Whilst playing at one of the video roulette tables the power went down, we were asked to return to claim back credit on the machines. When we returned (several hours after we were supposed to) the casino manager 'Donna' came to greet us with our credit and sincere apologies. She led us to the bar and bought us 2 cocktails each of our choosing! Fantastic! She could not have been more helpful. Some of the bigger hotels were full of non residents exploring the hotel, wheras the MC felt more like home. It was easy to navigate and never too busy. The value of this hotel was unbelievable! We booked through an agent and were concerned after reading reviews about the resort fee that we would be confronted with but fortunately there was no problem at all, it was all taken care of in our booking. As for the long line at Starbucks, there are 2! Go to the other one near the tram! The Cupcakery makes the best cupcakes ever! Get the lemon, or Julius...amazing! I was pleasently surprised that the minature toiletries (which were fab) were replenished everyday! The beds were extremely comfortable and the cleaning service was really good too. If you are looking for a great hotel to stay in the heart of the action, this is it! We went to every hotel on the strip and would choose this again over any other! Overall, a great hotel, great value, a great stay, a great holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Slightly Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Mark87008
Reviews.Content: Having stopped in Vegas before decided to try another hotel was slightly disappointed with my stay in the Monte Carlo. Room was pretty basic for what i'd expect in Vegas and was pretty dated. No free Wi-Fi but free cable provided. Service very good though with both reception and cleaners. Not a place i'd stop again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location on the strip. Well priced, nice room. Great service and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: jmacphee
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 week stay in Las Vegas at the Monte Carlo, and I can't really praise this place enough. From what I read on here beforehand I was worried that we should have paid more to stay at a 'posher' strip hotel. That would have been a big mistake. I travelled with my girlfriend and my family, we also had family staying at the Bellagio. From the moment we arrived at the impressive lobby area to check-in, we were treated to excellent customer service from friendly and approachable staff. We asked for two rooms nearby one another, these were quickly allocated to us on the 12th floor. Our room had a view of MGM and the strip area opposite the MC. The room itself was very clean with comfortable beds and a basic but nice enough bathroom. It was not the biggest or best hotel room I have ever stayed in, but for the price it is superb value. Yes, the TV not a flatscreen, and yes, the water drains away from the bath tub a little slowly. But so what?! If these things could ruin your holiday in Vegas, you should be going somewhere else! We never heard any noise from our neighbors or from the corridors during our stay (which is something other reviews often tend to moan about). In my opinion two of the best things about the MC are the pool area and The Pub. The pools are great fun, there is a lazy river, wave pool and a heated pool (which tended to be in the shade) as well as a large jucuzzi. There was always sunbeds available for the 4 of us, I usually chose to relax in the shade with a cold beer but sun-soaked beds were also in good supply. The pool-side music only got loud on Fridays and Saturdays between 12:00-17:00 and even then there were areas where you could lie down and barely hear any music if you prefered to. They really do try to cater for everybody at MC. The Pub is just brilliant, again the staff are all friendly, they serve tasty burgers/flatbreads for a chilled out meal. Best of all though are the happy hour deals which mean you can head out onto the strip having had a good drink with very lttle expense. (Buy one get one free drinks 16:00-19:00 and 21:00-23:00 / also ladies drink free 18:00-19:00 and 21:00-22:00) Excellent! The location of the MC is second to none, with handy transport links such as the tram to City Centre/Bellagio on site, a bus stop outside and the monorail just over the road at MGM. To be honest though, you can walk to just about anywhere from here as long as it's not too hot outside! I would definitely recommend this hotel to a friend, and look forward to visiting it myself in the future.

Reviews.Title: “How much did we pay???”
Reviews.Author: DavidFancher
Reviews.Content: I would say if you can get a room for $30-$50 less than MGM or New York you may want to consider it. I recomend this hotel for its location and only if you can get it cheap! The rooms are clean and small. The beds are uncomfortable. If you are getting a room in order to have a place to sleep it off, its great for that. Otherwise consider Planet Hollywood or Bally's (only for comperable reasons). The food selection was poor, The Pool was shaded most of the day and the construction of the City Center was annoying. You will find yourself wanting to go elswhere after spending any time on this property. Romance: Not here Night Life: Not here Comfort: Not here Value: Not if you paid more that $50 a night!!! Location: Great but not worth paying for. The Staff: Friendly and Helpful

Reviews.Title: “nice but could be better in some areas”
Reviews.Author: BIA47
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited this resort for three day. On the first afternoon we went down to check out the pool. It would be nice to have the hours of operation later, that way we as well as others could enjoy the pool.. The resturants are a little pricey. Plus the day before we were to leave, we left the room early and returned about 9:30 p. m. our room had not been cleaned. the next morning when we checked out and informed the clerk, all that was said was "sorry". I was expecting them to state that it would be checked into.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Times, Great Trip”
Reviews.Author: LaBeaches
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd trip to Vegas. I traveled with a group of 10. Monte Carlo is centrally located on the strip. We had no problems with checking in or out. There was no long waits or attitudes from staff. I was a tad concerned about the hotel based on some other reviews that I've seen, but I have to admit, I didn't have one problem with my stay. The room was clean upon arrival & cleaned daily by staff. The beds were comfy & I never missed a good nights/early mornings rest. Since we were such a large group, we were split into several rooms, however the hotel was very accomodating with ensuring that we were all on the same floor. The pool area is smaller then what I expected, but it was still nice. You have to be up early in order to reserve a lounge chair. On Saturday's there is a DJ & poolside entertainment. The wave pool is NOT a place for small children as most of the entertainment takes place there. Actually VEGAS isn't a place for small children but that's just my opinion. We ordered poolside food/drinks...expect a wait. Poolside staff is friendly & helpful, but very busy. Outside of laying poolside & sleeping at the Monte Carlo, my group & I spent time partying it up in Vegas. We checked out the Ice Bar inside the hotel, which is literally ice & definitely a different experience. The Monte Carlo has a great location which leads to great times & a great trip.

Reviews.Title: “good value, good pool, comfy beds!”
Reviews.Author: picklingjimandjobey
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a girls holiday to Vegas. We booked to stay in the Monte Carlo because they offered us a great deal on the rooms. I have stayed in Vegas twice before, once at the Excalibur and once at the Falmingo, so I already new the location of the hotel and was pretty happy to book there. I was however a bit worried after reading some very negative reviews on here. All my fears went away when we entered the lobby. After a very long flight I was delighted to see no queues for check in! A quick service meant we were in our rooms within 10 minutes. The rooms were fine, basic but clean and tidy with two really comfy beds! Seriously most comfortable bed ever! We never heard a noise during the night, like some reviews have suggested but we were at the side facing new york new york , not an amazing view but hey, you only sleep in your room! The hotel is in a good location with a free tram running to the Bellagio and city centre development which is right next door. The tram is great - especially seeing as its free - and adds some value to the hotel, no need to walk in the heat! The pool is lovely although got very busy at the weekend. Couldnt find a free sun lounger so had to just find a spot near the edge of the pool. There were three pools and a hot tub. There was always an area of the pool area in shadow too which can be a good thing to escape the 100 degree heat! The cabanas were also good value, I think somewhere around $200 on week days which between four of you is pretty good value. There was a minus 5 ice bar in the hotel which is well worth a visit plus a really good steak restaurant (and some other places we didnt try) Right outside is a deuce bus stop which is very convenient too. I wouldnt say this is the best hotel I've ever stayed in but certainly nowhere near the worst, for value for money I couldnt fault it. In Vegas, I personally prefered the Flamingo 'Go Rooms' but who can resist neon pink glowing bathrooms!! :) I would recommend this hotel to friends as its centrally located with good rooms and good amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Check the small print regarding resort fee”
Reviews.Author: Lancastrian66
Reviews.Content: We were travelling route 66 and diverted to Las Vegas seeking a hotel for a couple of nights, seeing the Monte Carlo we decided to price it up & the figure seemed reasonable for the position although on the top end we were prepared to pay. You cannot book at the reception desks and had to telephone their office from the foyer which took an eternity eventually being connected to an operator who then put me through to the office. We booked in and went back to reception who finished the booking. I duly signed the booking clearly stating the amount we had agreed and initialled the paperwork lower down which because of all the booking delays and the miniscual print i had not read. on checking out the "resort fee" of 12.40 plus tax is added when i challenged them and asked what this included it was stated, free internet providing you have brought your own laptop (we were elderly people on holiday so no laptop), free newspapers which we never saw, free use of pool & gym we had not bargained on a pool/gym and had not packed swim/sportswear, free phone calls are also mentioned providing it is to someone in america the only item on the paperwork we could have used was water which i suggested taking with us had been withdrawn. providing you are an active american with a laptop for business or otherwise then i feel the resort fee is a complete rip off. this is not the only hotel that charge the fee. so buyer beware

Reviews.Title: “Beware: If It Sounds Too Good, It Probably Is”
Reviews.Author: Hawaiiantaco
Reviews.Content: We recently joined several friends and stayed at the Monte Carlo. The special price was quite good, and we booked early in order to get the lower prices and the specials that were included in the package. The hotel readily honored the price, but the perks were a different story. One extra was simply that 2 bottles of water be provided in the room each day for no cost. Yikes! You would have thought we were asking for the moon when we requested them to honor that one. After much ado, they did finally bring up the water, all at once and against their desire. They said they had discontinued that policy. What? We booked under that agreement and by golly they had to honor it. Our friends had exactly the same reaction from the hotel management. The other things, free drinks mostly, were restricted some, but were easy enough. We had asked for a room with a view of the strip. What we got was a room with a television that did not work, over an extensive roof top. Beyond the roof top we could see the strip, but only the tops of buildings. We changed rooms because they could not fix the television, and the view was then of the pool complex, which was better than an ugly rooftop. The rooms were clean enough, but the furnishings were austere at best. Our friends' rooms all had small things that did not work, like the sink. The staff was efficient and friendly. The lobby and desk were just fine. The casino felt dirty and was less crowded than the other, more upscale hotels, so that was really a relief once the weekend crowds arrived. Some of the machines did not work, though, and the staff in the casino were really of little assistance. We did find a restaurant, The Cafe, that was inexpensive, polite, and served very good food. The Mexican restaruant, El Diablo, was also quite nice; Okay service, but good food. Of course, the location of this hotel is good, central to the Vegas strip and other quality hotels and activities. We will not be staying at the Monte Carlo again. The other hotels in the area offer good deals and feel more upscale. It just is not agreeable to be on vacation and have to fight for what you paid for. I prefer to be where I get what is agreed upon without negotiation or the hassle of having to change rooms. I also prefer to have more well appointed rooms. I must say, though, that the rooms we had were large. Staff was good. Noise level on the floors, appointment of rooms, upkeep of common areas and rooms, honoring of agreement were all an irritant. All in all, the Monte Carlo is an average hotel with both good and bad points. Whether or not one chooses to stay there might depend on the quality of your experience, and what qualities you are seeking. When a place like Vegas offers so many choices, why not go for the gold!

Reviews.Title: “Better than what i expected”
Reviews.Author: Yenism
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed staying at the Monte Carlo, we're not sure why its not got better reviews but in terms of the cost, location etc we thought it was very good value for money. I definitely enjoyed there more than Mandalay bay, the pool was really nice and chilled and basically it was a smaller version of Mandalay. But nicer because you can relax more without trying to share the same pool with screaming kids and thousands of people. Although the Mandalay Room was smarter... Monte Carlo does the job... plus its next door to the most fabulous new hotel called Aria... which is something else!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fine, and a STEAL for $35”
Reviews.Author: MBrack
Reviews.Content: Check in on Sunday night was quick and easy. They gave us a double room when we're reserved a king, but switched us as soon as we phoned. The next room was right in the middle of a HUGE foreign tour group and these folks stayed up talking loudly until 3:00 am, then ALL of their room phones started ringing non-stop at 5:00 am. No sleep for us that night. The MC staff was very apologetic and switched us to another room which was completely quiet all day and night. All the staff we dealt with her friendly and helpful. The rooms are just fine - standard gold-brocade hotel decor - nothing fancy. Comfortable beds, plumbing worked, room was clean. We ate in the cafe twice and the food was good both times and the service friendly. The pool area was ok, but felt very enclosed to me because of the City Center buildings all around it. Plenty of chairs available and good cocktail service (but yes - those drinks are pricey). The location is great, of course. I'd say that especially if you can get a cheap rate staying at the Monte Carlo is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: Deceangi
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Monte Carlo for a week with a friend for her birthday. We were somewhat concerned after reading previous reviews. Found the staff to be very friendly, helpful and efficient. Our room was up-graded on request, when we checked-in. We had a room with a view and it was spotlessly clean. It was obvious that the room had been thoroughly cleaned beforehand. The beds were very comfy, and the room was a good size. Regardless of the time, there was always someone cleaning in the hotel. We felt sorry for the bloke cleaning the stone work outside, he must have been sweating cobs in those temperatures. As the hotel is not huge the casino is a nice size, with slots for most people's pockets. The pool area was good, even when it was very busy you always managed to find a sun-bed. I mislaid my purse at the pool., luckily it was handed in. Security could not have been more helpful. Maintenance came within minutes to repair a problem with our safety deposit box, again not only efficient but friendly too. We only ate three times in the hotel, the café, buffet and the Brand Steakhouse. The buffet and café are fine, but the Brand Steakhouse is overpriced and has an odd definition of a cocktail. As Monte Carlo is in such a good location we generally went to different hotels to eat out. The rooms do need to be up-dated though. Ultimately if you want luxury you have to pay for it. We found the Monte Carlo to be good value, it is an excellent base for experiencing Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent pricing, starting to show it's age.”
Reviews.Author: Earthbound-Traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice in two weeks, different trips. Check-in is a cluster, they really need to do a better/quicker job. It is a sales pitch. I was not happy with the "resort fee" for $12.95 plus tax = $14.50. For that you get free internet, 2 bottles of water per day and a newspaper. The water, you need a coupon for and need to go to a bar to get it. Paying for internet does not make it free. The paper was available at the elevator. Like everything else in 'Vegas you will pay for it. Ate at Diablo's in the hotel great service, good food. Also ate at the cafe in the casino for breakfast, good food and service. The room was clean, the bed comfortable. You can hear hallway noise and that may wake you, it did me. It was an OK stay but I feel you could do better on the 'strip.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the bait and switch for bed choice!”
Reviews.Author: claydawg21396
Reviews.Content: We arrived late with a guaranteed check-in. We were pre-paid through a travel website. We selected (and paid for) a room with a King Size bed. The first night we were assigned two doubles as they were "out" of King Bed rooms. The room had scotch tape still stuck on the ceiling, the carpets were stained and filthy, and the tub tile area had mold/fungus growing in the corners. We were moved to a King room the next night for the remainder of the stay. I left a ball cap in the first room and called three straight days down to lost and found and never got anyone on the phone and I left 3 messages. I'm still waiting on that phone call. In the King bed room, the "free after you pay us $12 a night for a resort fee" internet lan line did not work and did not work for the entire stay. There is no free wi-fi in this hotel. Also, the bed was worn out and it had the worst pillows I have ever had in a hotel, and I travel often for business purposes. On the plus side, the location is great. It's an easy walk to most areas of action on the strip. The casino itself was nice, but the sports book leaved a little to be desired. The dealers were nice as well. Overall, I would relate the quality of the hotel to something similar to a Comfort Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location!”
Reviews.Author: Wescallahan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Monte Carlo from September 9-12, 2010. We traveld with another couple for a long kids-free weekend. The Monte Carlo was a great hotel/casino for the price. We arrived at around 11:45am and the check-in line was not bad at all. We walked right up to the front desk and politely asked for the 2 rooms we reserved and requested for them to be adjoining with a strip view. He looked at several options and offered us rooms on the 19th floor, which were not ready yet, or the 11th floor, which would be ready in 30 minutes. We took the rooms on the 11th floor, with a strip view. He was very helpful, the entire check-in took 10 minutes at most. We went and ate at the Pub there in the hotel, since we had to wait a few minutes for our rooms to be ready. The food there is really good and the drinks were as well. They also have live music at night, but we didn't check that out on the trip. Our rooms were ready at around 1pm, and they were about what we expected. Nothing very fancy, but very clean (we tipped the maid $3 per day and they kept our rooms very nice. The TV is older, like other people on here mentioned. Who cares though??? I didn't go to Vegas to watch TV! The beds were some of the most comfortable I have ever slept on in a hotel. The bathrooms were spacious... and the adjoining rooms were perfect for us and our friends. The rooms could certaintly use some updating, but for the money, you really do get what you pay for. The pool area is very nice. However, they do charge $8 for a beer... which is overpriced, even for Vegas. The key is to get at the pool early in the morning, or later in the afternoon to get a good spot in the sun... these chairs fill up fast! The Casino atmosphere was very fun as well... nice dealers, good payouts. Go to the Minus 5 bar if you get a chance! There is one in the Monte Carlo, and one in Mandalay Bay. This is a bar that is negative 5 degrees and they give you Eskimo gear to wear while you are in there. For $25 bucks you get admission and 1 cocktail, along with the gear you need to be comfortable. Very fun place, and you can't do that anywhere else but Vegas! Overall, great time at the Monte Carlo. Only negative is the resort fee... you really don't get anything out of it!! Other than that, you can enjoy Vegas without paying the high dollar price that other Hotels charge.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value!”
Reviews.Author: Diane040
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at the Monte Carlo several years ago and LOVED it - now it is starting to show some age... Checked in lated the first night and there were some problems with the rooms I had requested. I had made reservations directly with hotel. Because it was so late decided to just take the rooms offered. I called down in the morning and was assigned new rooms and they were much better. The hotel added in a free buffet for all guests - that was very nice. I still really like this hotel - however the rooms could be cleaner and updated. For the price - I was more than happy!!

Reviews.Title: “Still good”
Reviews.Author: nitesky014
Reviews.Content: I know some people like to complain about the little things...yes my room had a dent in the wall. I could see streaks in the mirror. Some of the furniture was knicked. But at $48/nt on the 31st floor with a few! did that ruin my trip --HECK NO!. The check in is always disorganizred (so is the Bellagio). They had someone helping organize the lines. the pool was nice. just need to chase the sun with the buildings. I like the hotel/casino being right next to the CVS -for cheap water/snacks.The location works for me. And I always like the size of the casino. The bed was comfortable. My few cons: the Diablo really took away from the front appearance. I used the spa this time. It was smaller - and I felt the shower area could have been cleaner; the jacuzzi area could use more privacy. But for $5...it was worth the visit before boarding my flight. My biggest con is with the MGM properties in general - thy need to ditch that resort fee, Harrah properties do not carry that at all.

Reviews.Title: “Wow an amazing place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: greengem8
Reviews.Content: I was extremely pleased with this hotel. All the staff I encountered were so friendly. The hotel was clean, as was my room. I had no maintenance issues, everything worked as it should. The bed was amazingly comfortable!! Its a wonderful size hotel, not too big and not too posh. Its got just the right feeling to it. The location was fantastic, with a bus stop right outside!! And the free tram to the Bellagio was great. Lots of choice when it came to dining. The casino was well laid out, not over crowded and easy to find your way out!! Im a non smoker so that bothered me a bit, as it got quite smokey in the evenings. Overall a Fantastic place to stay. I loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “Better than Most think”
Reviews.Author: Macman211
Reviews.Content: Stayed a long weekend to attend a wedding at the "World Famous Chapel of the Bells". I found the Monte Carlo to be better than average with clean rooms, friendly service, and lots to do during the evening dancing to a live band at "The Pub" and partying for free with a DJ playing great music at the bar adjacent to the casino. The pool area was large and fine with lots to do for everyone. I'm not about to tell you the Monte Carlo is on the same level as the brand new Aria next door or the Bellagio, Wynn, etc; but you can save a buck here and spend it on the clubs and casinos. Added bonus; we were able to check in at 10 am with no problem, and had a very good room on the 20th floor with no issues. Oh yeah, I also won a couple hundred at the $10 blackjack table where the atmosphere was fun and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the $$$$, could use some updating and pizzazz!”
Reviews.Author: fourseastravelcom
Reviews.Content: My husband just returned from a stay in Las Vegas that included two nights at Monte Carlo over Labor Day weekend. The Monte Carlo is a nice place, not fantastic or upscale, but nice. The rooms were typical, and we did have a nice partial strip view. Furnishings are a little "tired" and the bathroom could use some updates. The casino has a nice atmosphere and we won quite a bit of money on the slots and video roulette, so we spent a lot of time there. The restaurants and buffet were quite nice. The food court was a big help if you just wanted a snack or beverage. Staff were helpful, check in and out were quick and easy. The pool area, while quite nice, was a bit crowded and cramped, but it was Labor Day weekend. There were many families there with young children. The stores available on property were quite expansive, and not really overpriced. There is a tram that connects Monte Carlo to Aria and Ballagio, which we used quite often. There is a walkway between the hotels, so you never really have to go outside. We stayed at the Aria for the other nights we were in Vega, but kept coming back to Monte Carlo to gamble and for the buffet, as it was a good value. Overall, I would go back to the Monte Carlo, but perhaps try for an updated room.

Reviews.Title: “hi”
Reviews.Author: TitoP2
Reviews.Content: it was great, i recommend to everybody, nice rooms, free air, pools great

Reviews.Title: “Beware...cockroaches and bad service!”
Reviews.Author: dpearce03
Reviews.Content: Check in was quick (although we were late in arriving so not many people checking in at 11 pm.). The room was bare to say the least! The tv was ridiculously small but so what since we aren't spending time in the room anyway right? The bathroom sink faucet broke off when we tried to turn the water on but so what since we aren't spending time in the room anyway right? The carpet had a couple of burn marks but so what....you get the point. Each bed had only 2 very flat pillows (so much for luxury while on vacation). Ok, so all of that said we were ready to just suck it up to a crappy room when we noticed the first cockroach. OMG, I was freaked out. I am not the kind of person who deals well with bugs but paying money to sleep in a room with bugs is more then I can handle. I'll bet you are wondering how the front desk handled this information? "Well we can switch you rooms but to be honest there are roaches everywhere so there really isn't any point". If you are like us you are interested in staying here because of the beautiful pool area. The wave pool and lazy river are wonderful or it could be wonderful IF someone would clean up this property. While floating in the lazy river be ready to watch garbage pass over and under you. Yeah, signs everywhere stating no drinking in the pool and yet there are cups, straws, and garbage EVERYWHERE. Disgusting. The general manager of this property should be ashamed. In a nutshell...if you don't mind rude service, cockroaches, and garbage then this is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “In one sentence - this stay was about a B minus.”
Reviews.Author: atlandyamanda
Reviews.Content: Allow me to preface this by writing that I have enjoyed staying at the MC several times over the years. It seems, however, that the rooms need a refresh. My husband and I checked in on a Friday and were thrilled to have been given a room on the 31st floor that overlooked the pool. Until, that is, we HEARD the pool music, bass, announcements, vibrations, etc. Would this go on all day?? No, it would stop at 6pm, and it did, on the dot. There is one more floor on top of the 31st floor, and it's called "Hiotel 32". It's the same hotel with a swanky name. Apparently, the rooms must have hard woods in them because all of a sudden at 4:30am, a herd of horses made their way into my ceiling and clomped their way around their room on those hardwoods and woke me up. Wait - what was that noise? Men laughing? Girls screaming? Oh, bad dream. It wasn't horses after all. It was the loud, obnoxious guests in the room above me coming in from their night on the town, clomping through, heels and all, on that hardwood floor that REVERBERATED my room, shook my ceiling and me up until they simmered down at around 5:45. That was a big mistake in the design of the rooms above. My advice - stay lower than 31 so the people above you have CARPET! The room itself was old. The tv was old and the picture quality was fading. The armoire wouldn't close all the way and was completely scratched up. The room was dusty and I kept sneezing. The bathroom was extremely clean, however the towels smelled like they had been by a camp fire or something because they had an awful smoky smell which in turn, permeated my hair since I used it and then smelled it. The toiletries are ok and basic. Compared to what I saw at the Bellagio, another MGM property, these were low grade. The pool looked inviting and was kept clean. It was busy and LOUD. I was really glad that the noise stopped at 6. The folks that worked there were spot on GOOD. Every person I came in contact with totally rocked it and was professional. The weekend we were there, all the MGM properties system went down and no one could use their slot card to play, earn points, nothing. They were also having to do hand pay outs for any transaction, regardless of the amount. I sat waiting on a $1 payout for 15 mins and DH made me walk away. And it wasn't just the MC - it was ALL MGM properties. The restaurants were good. We ate breakfast at the cafe and it was over priced but tasty. Also used the food court a lot too - McDonalds, Subway and Manchu Wok. All hot, quick and tasty. The free tram to Aria and Bellagio was nice, too. Will save you some $ by not using cabs. The walk was not bad at all. The Inferno Lounge added towards the back by Diablos was a nice addtion. Now get the rest of the hotel done. I would recommend this to anyone who is on a budget that needs a clean place to stay with no frills, where its easy to get to your room. The rooms are really in need of an update and refresh. The makeup mirror in my bathroom didn't illuminate or stay in the correct position, as it was broken. Nice cool room though (temperature wise.) WIll post some pics.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: sheebad
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in a Monaco suite.We have stayed in various hotels in Vegas but this was our first time in the monte carlo. Check in was very quick (like they were on commission for how many guests they can check in on their shift) We were told they had 2 suites left ,one on 4th floor with a strip view and one on 8th floor without. On his recommendation we chose the 4th floor - strip view ???? We had a view of a roof and could see a couple of lights from the strip. Thankfully the room was really nice very spacious , 2 bathrooms, a couch and a fridge. The bed was huge and very very comfortable. The hotel was great and really cant fault much . There wasnt much difference in price for the monaco suite and in my opinion was worth it - look for one on a high floor if getting a strip view ! Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo experience”
Reviews.Author: BobP1
Reviews.Content: We arrived on 01 Sep. After reading all of the negative reviews I was very skeptical. The check-in process was painless, received no coupons for anything, which I expected, but as I figured out later, doesn't happen anywhere in Vegas anymore. Our room was spotless, and huge, we requested a suite with a room attached for our teenage children which the hotel obliged. We did have a few issues which the front desk could not/did not help us with. I contacted their management and was taken care of....first night of hotel stay free, 4 free buffet coupons. If you want to stay in a 5 star hotel stay in a 5 star hotel! The Monte Carlo is reasonably priced and is located right in the middle of the strip, within walking distance of just about everything. The Waterpark was great.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Get Married Here!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Wattspl
Reviews.Content: We had a wedding planned for October 5, 2010 at the chapel in Monte Carlo. We signed a contract; paid the depost; and paid for airline ticktes. Thirty days prior to our wedding, we received an email that our wedding coordinator was changed and that the hotel's catering manager would be in charge. When we telephoned the Monte Carlo, we were also told that the chapel was undergong renovation and that it should be completed by the day of our wedding. We were assured that if it wasn't completed, we could be married in one of ther conference rooms or a venue outside a restaurant. This was completely unacceptable to us! This was not what we were sold and did not meet our expectations. We complained to the President of the Monte Carlo and his staff. Their response was that we should be happy that the chapel's 12 year old carpet was being replaced and we should be happy. Of course, we weren't expecting worn out carpeting in the first place. We then called public relations and they couldn't understand why we didn't want to get into a limo to travel to a different venue for a wedding. This might be acceptable to others, but if that is what we wanted we would have booked that for our wedding. After all, Vegas has dozens of "other" wedding venues. I have been a frequent guest at other MGM Resort hotells and casinos over the years, but am so disappointed with their corporate response that I don't plan on another stay. They've ruined our wedding and we are now left ith making new plans just 30 days prior to our wedding. It is a real shame that Steve Wynne is not still the owner of the Mirage!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service”
Reviews.Author: lal100
Reviews.Content: Beware of the glamourous facade as this hotel does not live up to expectations. The service was non-existant, the staff were miserable and only interested in doing everything fast.Forget eye contact and a smile. We spoke to other people who stayed there and they agreed with us and explained its like most of MGM mid-range hotels.Hotels seem to spend a fortune on facilities and neglect customer service.

Reviews.Title: “not as bad as reviews I read”
Reviews.Author: frequentflyer2010
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Monte Carlo for 3 nights August 25 to the 28th. Upon check in, the lobby was nice and clean. Check in was easy and fast. Our room was small in size and my husband referred to it as a "Best Western". I'm a more pickier person and I thought the room was great. It was a bit small but the bed and the linens were wonderful. The view was perfect of the pool and Aria Hotel. The bathroom was clean and stocked well with towels. The tub was small but it did the trick. I read in a review how the carpets were dirty. Well the hall carpet was stained, probably from the sloppy people who like to leave messes for others to clean up. Our room carpet was clean. Our room was cleaned daily without delay. I did hate the resort fee which i think is a rip off. The casino was a nice size, did not win a cent there. The food court was nice. We ate at an Italian place in the hotel that was pricey but the food was good. The pool was decent. There was also a few cool bars in the hotel as well. I liked the Monte Carlo.

Reviews.Title: “Another Fun Time in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Oscar827
Reviews.Content: We were in Vegas from August 23th to the 27th. It just happened to be our 36th anniversary. We arrive at the Monte Carlo in the morning and we were able to check-in right away. We were in our room within a half hour. We were in a standard room on the 15th floor looking out to pool area. It was not fancy, but very clean. It was a typical Vegas standard room. We have been going to Vegas for 20 years 2-4 times a year and the rooms are not that much different. We have stayed at he Monte Carlo a few times in the past and each time have had good time. We stayed this time because it was good price for airfare and room booked through Expedia. The pool area was nice with a wave pool and a lazy river like many have said. There were many famlies there, but it was not a problem for us. We had a good time at the pool area. Yes the chairs were close together, but so are many other places. It was not a concern, No problem finding a place to sit. We always do go during the week and I would suppose it is busier on the weekend. We found all the employees we had contact with friendly and helpful if needed. We had no concerns with the room. I like the casino because it is easy to get around and you will not get lost. If you enjoy drinks while you play, the beverage servers were always coming around. We played in many places in the area and they were the best at the Monte Carlo. We ate at the Pub it was expensive. 2 hamburgers and fries and 2 malts cost $55. thought it was high. They do have good happy hours in places. Ladies drink free for an hour at one of the bars there for an hour. We did buy the all day buffet one day $30. We ate all three meals and a couple more extra times for just a snack. It was fine. Breakfeast was the best. My wife liked all the desserts. We ate a couple more times there also because we got some free buffets. There resort fee was $12.95 plus tax. I did use the fitness area. I hate the resort fee but it is stated on Expedia if you book through them. TI has the highest I no of $22 a night. Most table games during the week are from $5 any up. Slots of Fun I know have cheaper table games. I like the Monte Carlo because it is a good location to other casinos also without walking a great distance. New York New York is close and so is Excaliber and then you can take a tram to Mandayla Bay and Luxor. There is also a tram from the Monte Carlo to Aria and Belligo. We spent a day downtown and had a fun time. The casinos are close together and the food is alot cheaper. We had a nice prime rib at the Four Queens Rest. for under $20 with a player's card. We got a lot of free play by using are card at the Monte Carlo and at TI. We are not big buck players. We had good time like always and the Monte Carlo was fun and would stay there again, but we always look for a good deal. I am going to look for a place without a resort fee next time. Some places do not have a resort fee any more. We will going back in a few months. Maybe downtown this time. I like the Golden Nugget. If your are going in the future have a good time. The slots are the same at every place you can win some and lose some.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Robfur
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo is a very good hotel to stay at. It's in a great location, access to tram and many other attractions. I didn't realize the hotel opened in 1996. It looks new from the outside but the inside (rooms/carpet) is showing its age. Rooms are basic with old furniture. Overall my experience was excellent. Casino/food options are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Room was extremely dirty and they...”
Reviews.Author: beach049
Reviews.Content: Room was extremely dirty and they switched us to another room that was equally dirty. The buffet and casino were average

Reviews.Title: “Great location and loved the pools! Rooms could have had some improvements.”
Reviews.Author: gabeboyd
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in several different hotels and I really enjoyed staying at the Monte Carlo. Our room was pretty simple - two queen beds, TV (not flat screen), desk and chair, and a bathroom with a bath, toilet and one sink. The bed and pillow were AMAZING! So comfortable, I got a great nights sleep every night. These were my main gripes with the room: - Our keys were temperamental, sometimes we had to insert them about 20 times - The lighting wasn't that good, with all the lights on the room wasn't very will lit - Housekeeping weren't that good either, one day they didn't take our trash and another they didn't leave us a bathmat What the room lacked though the hotel made up for. And to be honest we weren't in the room much so it didn't really bother us. The pool scene was so much fun, they had a DJ and host when we were there and there were lots of fun games and awesome music. It was really easy to get a spot by the pool and my friends and I loved the wave pool and easy river. It's not as big as the Mandalay Bay pool area, but was convenient to access from our room and not as busy. Everything in the hotel was also laid out conveniently, it was simple to get from our room to the casino, the pool and the taxi area. I've stayed at some hotels where you have to walk for a long time to get everywhere. It's also right in the middle of the strip so walking distance to most casinos. Would recommend!

Reviews.Title: “It was okay”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel23Wa
Reviews.Content: It seemed like the most plain hotel out of all the other places in Vegas...

Reviews.Title: “Good service, but terrible room.”
Reviews.Author: Holli999
Reviews.Content: First off, the service from the hotel staff was very good. We arrived around 9am on Friday and asked for an early check in and they were able to quickly accommodate us. We picked Monte Carlo because of the low weekend rate and it's proximity to Aria, Bellagio, and the MGM Grand. We ate at The Pub and it was very good. I go to Vegas several times a year and enjoy staying at different places. We were not expecting MC to be as nice as Aria, Wynn, or Bellagio, but we figured it would be close to MGM Grand as far as room quality. We were wrong. The room had some sort of musky funk odor.. difficult to place it exactly. The bed is low to the ground and the linens are not very soft and cheap looking. The furniture in the room seems like it's all undersized for the space. TV is old and small. We took the tram to Bellagio for breakfast at Cafe Bellagio (always great). Afterwards we went to MC's spa so my wife could check it out to see if she wanted to have her spa service there. She found it to be lacking is several areas. At this point I was sensing that our weekend getaway was in danger of being ruined by the disappointing property so I called the manager and explained that the room was not the caliber we were expecting and that we would like to book a different hotel. The manager refunded our full amount and connected me to Aria where we were able to book a room. Excellent service again from the MC staff. We ended up paying double the price to stay at Aria ($139/night weekend poker player rate) but it was well worth it. This may be a good low cost option for a family with kids because of the pools(we saw plenty of kiddos running around).

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: beachmusicBeachmusic
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night on our way to Los Angeles. Have stayed in Las Vegas many times, and like it less and less with each visit. Stayed at the Monte Carlo because of the rate. Average across the board. Wouldn't stay again, as there are lots of hotels with decent rates in a town with thousands of hotel rooms to fill, and will likely try another.

Reviews.Title: “Meh”
Reviews.Author: cmb2011
Reviews.Content: I heard this hotel was pretty good. So I was pretty excited. The check in was good enough, clean lobby and nice staff. Then we got up to our room. It was pretty plain, but I was expecting that. We were on the 5th floor overlooking the pool. It was so loud during the day you couldn't sleep past 10 or have a nap and the base felt like it was coming through the room. So I couldn't sleep in or nap and I was up all night because I was freezing. When we first arrived it didn't look like the bed was made it had a tiny thin blanket with a sheet on top. So I called down and they said this was there new bedding. Well it was so thin both me and my gielfriend were up all night shivering in MAY! I have stayed at MGM and many other places that had a thin duvet which was perfect but nothing like this! The rest of the hotel was ok. The pool was fun but really really small and crowded. I was not impressed at all and will not stay here agian.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK hotel in Vegas...”
Reviews.Author: TMAC20
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo was clean and employees were friendly however... it was dissapointing to find that the room had no coffee maker ($16 for carafe thru room service & 45 minute delivery time); no refrigerator; no menu/hotel services book in the room... plus (and this sounds fussy) the bedding was "2nd rate" (no fitted sheet - just a flat sheet that ended up twisted around you by mid sleep). We had stayed at the Paris just the week before and everything was AMAZING - coffee in room, $10 for a carafe to your room in under 20 min, etc etc). Each time we go to Vegas we try a different hotel - if we ever start to return to hotels, the MC will NOT be on our list of hotels to return to.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: aardie21
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Vegas and was part of a general route 66 tour from Chicago to LA. Given that we had stayed in several motels along the way, we were excited to see what this hotel had to offer. We felt slightly overwhelmed when we first arrived as the lobby was massive and very loud and crowded. It felt like the interior of a major railway station. There were long lines to check in and the downside was definitely queuing for the elevators, which were very slow to arrive and invariably too crowded to accommodate everyone. We thought our room itself was clean and spacious and as we were located on the 26th floor, we had a fantastic view of the strip. The bathroom too, was of a very high standard. We were disappointed with a few things however. Even some of the more basic hotels we had stayed in had free wi-fi, flat screen tv and refrigerator facilities. We had expected these features and were disappointed not to have them. Also, I was unwell during the day, and despite having a "do not disturb" sign on the door and my husband explaining the situation, the housekeeper kept trying to get in which was every annoying. We were very impressed with how central the hotel was, the eating and shopping facilities and the pool area. Yes, the pool area was very crowded but then you would expect that in August with temperatures of over 100 outside. I would also mention that we were very impressed with the free car parking valet service - very much appreciated by us after a long drive. There is nothing worse than having loads of luggage and trying to find somewhere to park your car. We certainly hadn't expected this service to be free. I couldn't really comment on the value for money aspect of this hotel as it was booked for us as part of a tour and we do not know of the deal that was secured on our behalf. I woudl say that it was far better than a lot of the other places we stayed at en route and I would definitely have no hesitation in staying here if we returned in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the price”
Reviews.Author: shellyk244
Reviews.Content: Arrived on Sat. night and had no trouble with checkin. Room was clean and cool. The TV was flaky and has very few channels. Kids loved the wave pool and lazy river. We went to the pools very early because of the heat and had no problems with chairs. The food court is very convenient. Really liked the location of the hotel however they were replacing carpeting all over and the chemical smell was horrible. The maid didn't clean the room one day so we called for clean towels. The are trying to be "green" so the linens are not replaced during the stay. Overall a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has seen better days”
Reviews.Author: Cindyelle
Reviews.Content: Upon check in, the tub was clogged with filthy water). Had to call maintenance to come up an clean the hair out, which took 30 minutes,, and we were left with a filthy tub, so had to change rooms. The new room was right next door and had no ice bucket, and dirty windows. We will NEVER stay here again, even with a discount as the staff was not helpful or apologetic at all

Reviews.Title: “Not Clean, Over Priced, Hidden Fee”
Reviews.Author: IS2010
Reviews.Content: BADLY MAINTAINED-- broken sink, stained bedsheet, and smelly towels. OVER PRICED--We thought we got a good deal when we booked and paid for our rooms through the Monte Carlo website for about $49 per night. HIDDEN FEE--upon check-in, the front desk told us that there's a "complimentary MANDATORY RESORT FEE" for internet service and gym use. We only used internet service in one of the rooms, yet they charged us an additional $29 for both rooms anyway. DON'T GO there, you're better off going to a hotel like South Point- the rooms are bigger, newer and there is FREE INTERNET Service, at least that was the case when we were there last summer.

Reviews.Title: “great location, big hotel”
Reviews.Author: enjoyslife3
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the Monte Carlo. It is a big hotel. Did not like out view for our room, called down, they changed it right over the phone and redid our keys so that we went right to a different room. Very nice. Bustling hotel. Food court worked out well. Pools are nice, chairs fill up fast. At 9 in the morning, they ran out of towels - they opened up at 8. It took a 1/2 hour before they got more. Really??? Monorail to/from Bellagio is great. Felt a little overwhelmed with thing in Las Vegas. wish they had a weekly activity list of things going on. They charge a resort fee. Wi -fi should be included with this.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip, but average hotel.”
Reviews.Author: TxNurse
Reviews.Content: This is my first stay at the Monte Carlo and picked it for its location and price on US airways vacations. Arrived on Sat afternoon with no line for check-in. They informed us of the $13/night "resort fee" which originally included 2 bottles of water. Now you don't get water but a coupon for $10.00 off a drink purchase in one of their bars. Our room was a king room on the 14th floor overlooking the pool area. The room was very basic, nothing fancy. I was surprised, as I really expected a more elegant room. The bed was comfortable and there were ample pillows. The bathroom was just that, plain and simple. The tub was slow to drain, as I've seen this complaint on here more than once. Housekeeping did a great job on the rooms and they were always done in a timely fashion. The only thing is they never replaced our drinking glasses during the 3 days...not a big deal though, but I just thought it was odd. If you are there on a weekend and want to nap during the day, avoid rooms that face the pool. The music is VERY loud from around 11am-7pm. It is nearly impossible to drown out the music/bass with your tv. It did get very irritating after awhile. The pool area is great. There is 1 wave pool, 1 lazy river, and 1 regular pool. Sat and Sun were pretty crowded, but did find a lounger. By Monday, the crowds were gone. You can not bring in any outside food/drinks. They do search your bags. So plan on spending $6.00 for a bottle of "Monte Carlo" water. The mixed frozen drinks were $10 and up. The pool hours are 8am-7pm. The breakfast buffet there was HORRIBLE! The price was $15/person and sooooo NOT worth it. There was a very limited selection of food. The eggs were watery and the bisquits hard as a rock. There is a food court with McDonalds, Subway, Starbucks, and some other food options. Not so sure I would stay here again, especially if the "Resort Fees" are still in place. The location and the pools are great, but thats about all it has going for it. There is just too much competition out there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but not the best quality”
Reviews.Author: antiem80
Reviews.Content: I've been to Vegas 3 times and have stayed in a different hotel each time. The first time was the Luxor. Not a bad place and reasonable but the location is far from the life of the Strip since it's all the way at the South end. Next I stayed at the MGM Grand and most recently at the Monte Carlo. Both I chose because as an MGM Player I received excellent deals. While the Monte Carlo is a *great* location and was very pretty in the common areas (lobby, casino), the rooms were shabbier than I expected. My first room was a smoking one when I requested nonsmoking, had holes in the sheets, drainage problems in the bathroom and stained carpets in the hallway. While I was immediately and efficiently switched to a new room when I spoke to the front desk, the new room was ok but still not as nice as rooms at the MGM Grand. The Grand's rooms were much nicer for the money. I'll probably try a few more places before I really decide that the MGM Grand is my favorite. But so far it's in the running and the Monte Carlo I would only recommend for price and location.

Reviews.Title: “Girlfriend Getaways - Not at the Monte Carlo!”
Reviews.Author: momsgonewild
Reviews.Content: I recently booked the 4th annual girlfriend getaways trip for myself and 4 of my friends. We chose the Monte Carlo based on price through Southwest Vacations and from reviews of the property. We were seeking a hotel on the strip that has a fantastic pool and was geared towards adults. After all, the majority of us were getting away from husbands and children for the weekend before school started. The hotel did accomodate us by finding adjoining rooms for us so that was a plus in the beginning. Our disappointment started when we arrived up in our room. During our 4 day stay at the hotel, the air conditioner was not working properly. The thermometer said 68 degrees, but it was more like 78 degrees! Sleeping at night was extremly uncomfortable due to no air. The wallpaper was peeling off of the wall near the window sill. The bathroom shower had tarnished brass fixtures. The room had not been renovated in some time. The pool facilities were very nice, but no where in all the reviews I read did it say this was a "family friendly" hotel. There were families and KIDS everywhere! Instead of being at an adult venue, we felt like were staying at a Disney World property. The pool / acquatic center closed at 7:00 PM EACH day. The pub did provide ladies complimentary beer during happy hour. We found some of the servers / bartenders to be on the rude side and not geared towards accomodating their guests. Beverages at the Pub were also watered down and definitely not a good value for our money. We attempted another happy hour in the lounge called "Brand". The atmosphere was nice and food was quite tastey, but our waitress was not on her game. We found that our food items had been lost or forgotten about and one of our items never made it to the table.
