When we asked the waitress and the manager about it, they simply said "we ran out". It would have been nice to tell us that when we placed our order so we could have opted for something else. Overall, if you are looking for a budget friendly hotel - The Monte Carlo is definitely for you. If you are seeking the "WOW" factor, please go on down the road to Mandalay Bay. I wish we would have paid the extra $35 per person for superior accomodations and more of an adult hotel. Live and learn.

Reviews.Title: “Go Elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: famteen
Reviews.Content: The rooms were unbelievably hot and stuffy. They also had a very bad smell. The pools were nice but way too crowded to enjoy. Not worth even the low price we paid. Long line to check in.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, great value.”
Reviews.Author: 1SLOCALOCAL
Reviews.Content: I called the casino host for reservations since I have a players card. Always sign up for these because you don't have to play hardly at all to get the perks of a discounted room and comps/discounts. They offered me a $35 rate for a regular room, but we were bringing four teenagers. We booked the Presidential Suite for us at $169. It is 875 square feet, large living room with sofa bed and chair, dining table and huge wet bar with a powder room. In the bedroom we had a king size bed, and in the bathroom, a jacuzzi tub, seperate shower and double sink vanity. We then booked a regular room for the kids with two beds . The regular rate was $99. We all hung out in our suite during the day where we could spread out and had privacy to relax by ourselves later. This property has three pools. Besides the regular one, there is a wave pool and a lazy river pool. They offer a food court as well as fine dining. There are shops and a free tram to the neighboring Aria and Belagio hotels. It is right next to NYNY where there are arcades and rides for the kids. We all had a great time and I came home with money I had won!

Reviews.Title: “dirty rooms and unsanitary conditions”
Reviews.Author: joules100
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for being in the middle of the strip, great convenience to have a tram from montecarlo to belaggio. Food was great and there were options to choose from. Sad we checked in early but our room was not ready by 5pm (their deadline). they said they showed our original room was showing dirty in their system. We were moved to another room, where we found dirty bandages on the floor next to the chair. that was just disgusting, they took about half an hour to 45 minutes and 4 calls to get someone to come and clean it. We stayed there after this horrible first impression just because we flew for more than 10 hours. No room change for this terrible inconvenience, just a unsincere apology. When we return to Vegas, we will not stay at Montecarlo, we will take our business elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent middle of the road resort”
Reviews.Author: SouthMartin
Reviews.Content: This makes my 3rd time I stayed there. The Monte is nice, but somewhat basic. Not too flashy. I picked it as I feel it has the best swimming pool complex on the strip (had 2 kids with us). 3 main pools plus a kiddie pool. Get tired of one pool, hop in another. Pools were pretty crowded, but I attribute that to the weather (very hot). Pool area had a strange smell that for 3 days I couldn't identify. The last time I was there the pool music was at a background level. Very relaxing. This time it was much louder (I suppose to appeal to the younger crowd). Louder music means louder conversations, hence overall louder experience. I paid extra for a high floor room. In retrospect, didn't need it as we were only in the room to change and sleep. Never even turned on the TV. Could have save a few $$$ and picked a lower room. I like the (free) boarding pass printing set-up they have in the lobby (though technically I paid for it via the resort fee). Reserved a Queen double room on-line, was assigned a King single. Fortunately, that got fixed at check-in. Only problem was with the maid. Did a real lousy job one day and we called to complain (which is out of character for us as we tend to take things on the chin). Next day the room was perfect. I like that the elevators are (relatively) close to the parking garage - unlike other resorts. The pool is close to the elevators too. Whoever designed it made it easy to navigate. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: World_Travelor_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo as a family of 4 a few years ago. Just writing now, because I'm a new Trip Advisor user. Found the hotel to be very family friendly. There is a food court downstairs, which definately helps with the cost of food. McDonalds, Starbucks, Pizza, etc. The pub is kid friendly. It's a pub during the day and a night club during the night. They also have half priced appy's, with great nachos :) We had a strip view room, which was amazing! The rooms are very nice, the beds are comfortable and all around, a great place to stay. The hotel had four pools. One wave pool, one lazy river pool and two other normal pools. It does get over crowded as it was also a public pool at the time we were there. Not sure if it still is.... The hotel has a tram that links to Aria and the Bellagio. The hotel is a little further down the strip, beside New York New York, but it's still not in a bad location. I would stay here again :)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Good Food, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: tblakl
Reviews.Content: We took our daughter to Vegas to celebrate her 21st birthday - stayed for 3 nights. We arrived on a Tuesday evening and had no trouble checking in - only took about 10 minutes. We were able to get 2 rooms on the same floor, one with a king, the other with 2 queens, both had a pool view. We had stayed in this hotel when it first opened and again about 10 years ago. The rooms are not the fanciest, but the beds were very comfortable and linens were great. We didn't care that the TV was not a flat screen - didn't watch it much. Room was clean, AC worked well. We could hear noise from the hall, water running in the pipes, but it was not obnoxious. Since this hotel is now linked to Aria and Bellagio with a free tram, it makes getting around a breeze. We ate breakfast and dinner at the buffet, and both were good. Breakfast had lots of variety and everything tasted good. Dinner entrees had great flavor, but the desserts were lacking and staff was slow to replenish them. Food court was great for a quick drink or snack - thrilled with the dollar menu! Our daughter ate at D.Vino and had the $1.99 breakfast in the Cafe, and dinner at the Pub and said all were really good. We had no trouble finding lounge chairs at the pool, and no big complaints about the pool area. It does seem more closed in than it used to pre-City Center, when it still had tennis courts. There is a sand volleyball court, though. We knew about the resort fee up-front - does seem like a rip-off, and hopefully a trend that will go away soon. Fitness center was good - crowded in late morning, but still able to find things to do. We were disappointed that Diablos took away one of the fountains outside and changed the appearance - not as elegant as it used to be. You just can't beat the location for the price - CVS is right outside, Aria is next door, NY NY is close, which leads to the south end of the strip. We are thrifty travellers and I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone that likes good value and is not snooty about their accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo offers affordable luxury”
Reviews.Author: flyawaycafe
Reviews.Content: I recently had the opportunity to stay at the Monte Carlo and was curious to see how it had fared since my last stay some 10+ years ago. It was a mixed bag, like any hotel stay, so I'll break it down into easy to understand categories. The Good: Great location at the southern end of the LV Strip offers easy access to everything that's going on in the area Beautiful exterior facade, even more so when lit up at night Affordable prices with lots of package deals currently being offered that can bring the price of a room to under $60 with lots of extras thrown in Pool area offers several pools and a lazy river Spa - I had a pedicure and was very pleased with the service Friendly and helpful staff Refrigerator in room - very nice for cold water in the blistering heat Frank Caliendo show was great , he's a remarkable impersonator Good restaurant choices Very close to the new CityCenter for some great shopping, restaurants, and public art Needing Improvement: Long (and I mean taking up the whole lobby and can't walk through it long) lines for check in and check out Rooms are a little tired, although recent upgrades helped, and bathrooms, while clean, feel dated and old Windows desperately needed washing Attention to little details seem to have slipped through the crack (no glasses in room and it took an hour to get them) Pool is jam packed, making it nearly impossible to float the lazy river or to even dangle your feet in the water Resort fee Rooms facing the pool can be very noisy Opinion: For the room rate, this is an amazing hotel, perhaps that's why they've chosen the phrase "affordable luxury" to describe it. While I'd be hard pressed to put this in a true luxury category, you get a lot of bang for your buck, making the resort a good value. Well located so that you can get around if you like, but with enough restaurants and amenities that you don't have to leave, this is a great Las Vegas value.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Location! Great Linens!! Very Suprised That I Liked This Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Angiet2
Reviews.Content: I received two free nights from some comps and was NOT expecting this to be more than a place to sleep, while I was in Vegas for a Real Estate training seminar/conference. Well, when I crawled into bed and felt the high thread count, freshly starched linens, I was in Heaven!! We were in a standard, two bed room (tried hard to get upgraded, but even with a nice tip to the front desk staff member, it was a no-go!) with a 'Strip View' (more like a view of the roof top!). Yes, the bathroom needs some updating (water leaks from the tub all over the floor and you have to keep towels handy to mop up the spillage!), but the staff is VERY friendly, the food court is uber convenient (and cheap!) and you can get from your room to your car in under 5 mins flat (try doing that at any of the mega resorts on the strip!). We were at The Paris Hotel, LV for our convention, and they offered absolutely NO cheap, fast food. I don't mind spending money on a nice meal, but when they charge me $10 for a lousy bagle sandwich, that's when I get ticked! I was so pleased to be able to go to the food court and get a Rubio's burritto, or a Subway breakfast omelette (and fresh baked cookies!). I truly had LOW expectations of my stay here... I figured that since it was comp'd, with the exception of my resort fee ($29 for two days), what the heck?! Well, the Monte Carlo turned out to be a lovely experience and I would absolutely stay here again, with no hesitation. I would still beg, plead and give puppy dog eyes to get upgraded to Hotel 32, though!! I can only imagine how sweet that must be!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap room rates, but will not recommend and will not stay again.”
Reviews.Author: blitz_ac
Reviews.Content: Got a deal on this hotel since we were traveling Sunday through midweek. Aparrently, so did the whole town since there was quite a wait during check in due to a high number of folks arriving for their stay. Positives: Location! But that was about it. Negatives: Mainly service throughout the hotel. It was mostly horrible to non-existent. We used the fitness center (included in the mandatory resort fee), but had to go through a very rude and unnecessarily confrontational entrance attendant. We also tried the buffet for breakfast---no good. Very limited food selection and the servers are not very proactive about refills. The rooms were average in size. We booked standard rooms with double beds which we found with stained sheets and covers. We stripped these down and requested all our linens changed. Very gross. Again, service was slow when requesting additional towels, pillows...etc. In one occassion, they never delivered on a request, we had to flag the housekeeping cart down to get what we needed. Internet comes with the resort fee but its through a cable in your room. No WiFi. Pool area is not great either. Its understandably crowded because of the heat, but if lucky enough to find a lounge chair, it's likely broken. The pools are tiny. The wave pool was never in operation during the times we ventured out to it. You get what you pay for. Lesson learned. Will never book again.

Reviews.Title: “I am undecided”
Reviews.Author: Jeffbuc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Monte July 26 to the 29th. I have stayed at the Monte numerous times over the last ten years and always find myself wanting to stay there over anywhere else because of the location and value. However, this stay may help to change my mind. We stayed in a suite on floor 21 and the room was good. There are no complaints. And I would venture to say that the hotel is an okay place for the money. What I destest about a location is getting nickel and dimed, especially in Vegas. When I reserved, my "resort fee" (added for my convenience, isn't that nice of them?) included waters, newspaper, and all the other amenities. I decided not to vehemently complain about them deciding to convenience me with the fee because it included waters and I was thinking about using the gym. So on the second day of having no water in my room I called the front desk to complain about my lack of water. The lady informed me that the resort fee no longer includes water (it must have been too costly, what with the $12.95 for two 8oz bottles of water), but since my reservations were made before the change, I would get a coupon to redeem for water. Not 1 coupon per day, 1 coupon total. So I go take the $10 coupon to the bar and I got exactly two 8 oz bottles of water. Personally, I think giving someone a $10 coupon to get 16oz of water is a slap in the face. I would say I will never stay at the Monte again, but I may in the future given its price and location. However, given the slap in the face that occured, I will first look to a non-MGM Mirage property (which unfortunately is most of the strip.)

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: mgreg85
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews once we made our reservations, I was really leery about staying at the Monte Carlo. We stayed here years ago when it first opened and loved it. This trip we found the staff to be ver friendly and helpful. The room was clean and the bed was very comfortable. The pool was very crowded, but it was 112 outside, so that was to be expected. The only flaw I can agree with per some of the previous reviews is that the TV channel selection was poor--very few channels. Other than that, it was a very pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: acourt
Reviews.Content: This is our 3rd time staying at the Monte Carlo & it gets better all the time. Nothing is to much of a problem & the staff are very Professional. We would recommend this hotel to anyone & is very affordable

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: angelaernie
Reviews.Content: Stayed July 17-21. Got upgraded at front desk with tip to the 31st floor, King bed. Friends we were travelling with could not get a king bed that day, they had 2 doubles. Room was very clean, cleaning staff was always prompt. Hotel is nicely laid out. No problems finding way around. Great Location!

Reviews.Title: “P-E-R-F-E-C-T weekend -”
Reviews.Author: JJDARNELL
Reviews.Content: I've never been someone to share my experience on a web page, but after a planned 21st birthday celebration weekend for my daughter I felt the need to write a review about the Monte Carlo in Las Vegas. The Monte Carlo's location was perfect for us. Everything was close. Easy to find from the airport, and easy to get in and out. There's CVS drugstore next door for forgotten items and cheaper bottled drinks like Gatorade. The rooms were fine for the 4 of us. The early morning beer bottle drop was loud, and the late night argument next door was noisy, but not a huge ordeal. Check in & out: Both times were flawless - the staff was friendly and helpful. We arrived on a Thursday afternoon, so there wasn't much of a crowd. Friday was alot busier, so I'd suggest a Thursday check in if possible. They even had a couple of people to help with their computers to get boarding passed (um....yeah - I needed help) Valet - I NEVER had to wait more than 5 minutes to get my car back, even on the crazy Saturday night (can't say that about the Treasure Island or Rio) Very friendly and fun people.. Pool - Again, arrived on Thursday so getting a spot of Friday wasn't a problem. Arrived at the pool early on Saturday, and it filled up quick. 3 pools in this area. The lazy lagoon got a bit crowded, but it was 114 degrees, so it was expected. Friendly waitresses (not bad to look at either) - Decent price on buckets of beer on ice! Ate lunch at THE PUB's outside patio one afternoon. THE BEST cheeseburger I have ever eaten. We ALL had great food - again, very friendly waiter and server. Casino - Easy to navigate from one end to the other. Didn't play any tables, but watched a while. Dealers seemed to be pretty involved and friendly. Especially EARLY in the mornings after the sun had come up and some of the young women were walking back through to get to their rooms (walk of shame?) Very funny and friendly!! There was a food court there with some chain restaurants for a cheap, quick, late night meal or snacks. I'm from Dayton, OH and I'm not associated with this hotel at all. I just wanted to share all the positive things about the Monte Carlo. We made a last minute hotel change due to bad reviews at another nearby location (not New York - New York) so I wanted to share the positive and good things here. I will be returning to Las Vegas for a convention in February and I suggested to my boss that we stay here for the week. I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel to anybody!!!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, smelly, no view and just needs some updating”
Reviews.Author: NovemberBoys
Reviews.Content: got there late on a wednesday night, nonsmoking room was like entering the marlboro mans room when opened. moved to a different room, not exactly smoke free but better and the view was strip view, which means back of nyny...not worth it! the hallways smell, are dirty and dishes everywhere that looked to have been there some time. loud as expected in vegas but @ 4am wow! next day we moved to a room that had more of a front view of the hotel, no strip view exactly but cleaner and smelled better. the pool closes at 7pm! why?!?!?!? the only thing that stood out in our stay was the breakfast buffet, awesome variety, tasted great and we all enjoyed it each morning (2 x's) of our stay. otherwise, pay a bit more for a cleaner/nicer hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than I expected!!”
Reviews.Author: MrKilowatt
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo unexepectedly after deciding to stay two extra nights. We had already stayed at the Golden Nugget and Planet Hollywood for two nights each. The best deal I could find with short notice was the Monte Carlo. I had an offer of $29 for one night and $67 for the next night (Friday). Anyway, we checked in early on Thursday morning. Our rooms weren't ready, but that was to be expected. We got our room about 2pm and had a pool view room on the 17th floor. The room was very clean and although nothing special it was actually a lot nicer than I expected. I would give the room a B. I have played at the casino before in passing but had not spent much time there. I quickly found that I really liked the setup, the lighting, and the total design of the casino. I would give the casino an A-. The pool area is very nice, with a lazy river, wave pool and another pool. There is also another small pool that can be rented for private parties. I am not a pool person, but we did go there for a couple hours. I would give the area an A-. There are several resturaunts and we did try the micro brewery. Overall I would give the Monte Carlo a B+. We will definetely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great retail experience”
Reviews.Author: jaspberblubber
Reviews.Content: was at the monte carlo during the soccer frenzy recenty and had some of the best service from the their retail stores there, one of their bars (the pub) had all the tee shirts and jerseys from all the countries participating in the world cup and i purchased a few formy friends from california. on my last day i realized that i should be buying for myself, after some calls, annette from retail was able to go to the bar and retreive some real nice tees for me, she held them for me until i was ready to leave and i brought home some good looking items which i will wear in the future, great service here, will definately come back

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable, clean, and friendly”
Reviews.Author: ALANSC7
Reviews.Content: The drive to the Monte Carlo, which is on the south end of the strip, is about 10 minutes from the airport car rental center. If your taking a shuttle or a cab add a little time to that . Our check in was fast and courteous. Yes, they currently (7/12/2010) have the "Resort Fee" but have added a few freebies to compensate. No big deal in my opinion. Our room was comfortable and clean although a little worn. The bathroom was large and clean with a great shower. Our room had a nice view of the pool and the Aria at City Center. If you're here to watch TV then beware you're limited to 13 channels. But then, if you come to Vegas to watch TV maybe you should reconsider your plans. The elevators to your room are right at the edge of the casino so getting back for a nap is a snap! (I'm over 50, I need a nap!) They were featuring an all-day buffet pass for $30.00 per person which in my opinion is a great bargain . You can come and go from 7 am to 10pm and have all you want. The buffet is one of the better ones on the strip, especially for the price. It has a great variety of cuisines and custom cooking stations. It's roomy, airy, and has a simple elegance. There is also a very nice food court in the casino that is open 22 hours a day. (Closed from 3 am to 5 am) It's great for a quick bite or that first cup of coffee in the morning. You can take a short 10 minute walk from the Monte Carlo through a typical shopping mall to the Aria, the fantastic new casino at City Center. At the end of the same corridor is a tram to the Bellagio and Excaliber. This is really convenient because the walks to the other casinos on the strip can be deceptive. They're right next door to each other, but due to their massive grounds the walks can be daunting. From the Monte Carlo, the walk to NY-NY and MGM is quick. But for others it's taxi time. You can also catch the Deuce bus which goes up and down the strip, but my experience is it's faster to walk. The buses stop too often and are often full. The Monte Carlo Casino is very open and the staff is friendly and helpful. During our trip the slots at both the Monte Carlo and the Aria were loose and generous. After a couple of days at the Monte Carlo we drove downtown (20 minutes away) and checked into the Golden Nugget.

Reviews.Title: “This was my Wedding Trip - Just plain”
Reviews.Author: VegasLover0000
Reviews.Content: I got married on September 2/10 in Las Vegas. I chose Monte Carlo because it looked very elegant and romantic in the photos online and I wanted a trip to remember. The entire hotel and casino were very beautiful. Everywhere was clean and comfortable. There didn't seem to really be any sort of a theme, just elegant styled but not as nice as places like the Bellagio or Venitian. I don't think any hotel in Vegas can be compared to each other though. They are all so different. Our room was quite spacious as are all Vegas hotels. It was clean and comfortable. The bathroom was bright and the marble looked great. The bed was just as you expect from a hotel bed. We shared our room with our 2 boys and there was more than enough space for everyone to move about fine. The room was quite high and faced the strip so the view was absolutely AMAZING especially at night. The only restaurant I ate at was the buffett. It was good with alot of selection and the waiting staff were friendly. I spent a little time in the casino in the evening and thought it was fine. Nothing great, just a casino. The waitresses had good service as well. I don't remember there being much to do or see in this hotel but it was fine for the price. I think the price paid was great for the elegance and comfort. I have stayed in other hotels that offered coupons and offers at check in or went out of their way to make us feel special but this one was more of just a beautiful place to rest our head at night. My wedding experience wasn't the best I have had in Vegas but it I still loved it. I would stay in this hotel again because it was beautiful, comfortable, friendly and a good price.

Reviews.Title: “don't pay extra”
Reviews.Author: humboldtraveler
Reviews.Content: Booked a strip view room. The view was of the back of New York, New York. So I would not pay extra. Also the resort fee says it includes water, news paper, free internet. I never received any of thes services. Infact in the room signs regarding the internet charges.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel on the strip”
Reviews.Author: diana48
Reviews.Content: just got back last night . we got to the monte carlo about 11 am and they offered us a room with a mountain view or we could wait and get a pool view so we waited and got in to our room about 2 and wow what a view we had. Hotel room was very big with a king size bed and a table and 2 chairs and another chair. i will admit the hotel should be updated but to be honest how long are you actually in your room. the tv was an older one but we only watched tv when getting ready to go out in the morning or the evening and i only watched it to get weather update. the bed was so nice and comfy and we slept like logs. I dont think the ac was working like it should have in our rooms and we probably should have called maintence and had them come look at it but i kept saying well it was 115 degrees each day we was there so im sure the ac was working overtime. the casino was nice and big and even though i didnt win much we still had a lot of fun. there is a food court which has a mcdonalds, subway, starbucks, sbarro and an ice cream place. pretty reasonable priced. you could go to mcdonalds and get a large soda or ice tea for $1.00 which was much better than spending $4.00 at the bar . The location for the monte carlo is great go right out the front and nyny is right next door . We didnt eat at any of the restaurants there so cant comment on them except for the mcdonalds and the fast food places which were the usual for mcdonalds lol The pools are the best thing about the whole hotel. they have a wave pool and a lazy river and another pool and a hot tub which was empty the whole time we were there. who wants to go sit in a hottub when its 115 outside. overall its a great hotel and in a great location. you can take a tram to belagio and aria and to crystals all for free and the deuce and ace bus stop is right outside the front door so its all pretty convenient and well located. the rooms were nice and clean and the hotel itself was clean . I would stay here again a heartbeat. I just wish they had a refrigerator in the room to keep your drinks cold The only thing i didnt like was when u went to go flush the toilet it made such a loud noise it made me jump every time lol overall was a great hotel and i hope you have as much fun at the monte carlo as my husband and i did .

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the price”
Reviews.Author: coloradogirl8
Reviews.Content: People told us the hotel was fine. We found it to be a little better than that. We got to the hotel at 8:00 am and they let us and our friends check in early right then and put us on the same floor. The rooms are okay, nothing fancy and they need updating. But we were only in the rooms to shower and sleep, so it didn't matter. The casino was good to us and the buffet was decent. We definitely took advantage of the McDondald's and Starbucks. The pool was not as great as what we had heard. Even though it was 115 degrees, the water was freezing. And the whole area just felt crowded. The location of the hotel is perfect! We were in the middle of everything. Overall, the rooms do need updating, but we paid a great price and were pleased with what we got.

Reviews.Title: “renovations needed... and not just the rooms”
Reviews.Author: AK_foodie2010
Reviews.Content: Over the past year, I stayed at the Monte Carlo 3 times. After the last visit, I doubt I will return. The rooms are worn and do not offer the frills that an average 4 star hotel should. While the resort fee is supposed to cover internet, as of May, they still attempted to charge me. The front desk staff have steadily been getting more rude and less helpful. On a positive note, the hotel has three really nice pools and fabulous eateries including Brand Steakhouse and The Pub. If you book, check the hotel website for deals, you can usually get extra perks that way.

Reviews.Title: “Decent value - excellent location”
Reviews.Author: TTnC4Me
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 nights, the 2nd week of July, in a 2 double bed "deluxe" room (which is what they call their regular rooms, 11th floor. We got the south side of the hotel, with a partial obstructed view of the strip but was decent. The beds were comfortable, the pillows were great, the room size was average. The bathroom was clean and is one big room, so toilet/shower/sink are all in one space. However, it was the loudest, most abrupt flushing toilet I've ever heard and scared the breath out of everyone each time it was flushed! The TV channels were few and internet was expensive - $5/ 5 min. The hotel is VERY convenient to most things on the strip. We enjoyed walking out and having access to NY NY, MGM, and Excalibur. The free shuttle connecting to the hotel to take us to Bellagio for the fountains show, Caesar's Palace, etc... is extremely efficient and a *great* way to travel behind the strip! The pool area was spacious and although we were there on a weekend, we were able to find seats fairly easily late afternoon. The music was fun and our kids (12,10,7) enjoyed the lazy river, and wave pool. There were many other families at this hotel and that was a selling point to us, but after extensive forum reading, may be discouraging to others. That's not to say that there wasn't plenty of beer being spilled and drunk, obnoxious folks in the nearby cabanas - it is Vegas after all. However, the staff was great in taking initiaive to addressing loud mouthed and clearly drunk individuals and excorting them out of the pool area, for their safety & others'. The food court in the hotel was great for less expensive eating; offering Subway, McDonalds, Sabarro, Manchu Wok, Starbucks, etc... The Casino was average and most of the same games as seen in most other hotels. Self Parking was wonderful. Located adjacent to the hotel, it was easy to navigate and super convenient to the hotel. Overall, we had a great experience and would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for what we paid”
Reviews.Author: Tracy B
Reviews.Content: Beautiful facade and very playful bell hops.Check in was very smooth and as requested ourselves and two other couples were roomed kitty corner to each other on the same floor. Never really heard any obtrusive noise that we couldn't sleep,best bed I have ever had in a hotel.We booked the Monaco suites and that may have had something to do with the lack of disappointment I have read about on here.They were huge,two bathrooms and definitely not dated. The buffet has something for everyone but a bit pricey so go hungry,very good food. Didn't bother with the higher end restaurants as we wanted to spend our money on more" important" things.If you just want a cheap reasonable snack there is the food court which again something for everyone. The casino is smaller than most but still a lot of fun.It was easy to find your friends if you separated for a while to do your own thing.They have a small poker room which I liked,wasn't intimidating and quite a few players from the higher end hotels who preferred this room for its intimacy and friendliness. Swimming area,oh yeah that was intimidating,too many young hot bods lol, felt like a big ol' fish out of water. No really the pool area was very nice and lots of chairs depending on the time of day. Location is incredibly convenient and one can always take the monorail between hotels if it's too hot to walk and it was. I found the staff very friendly but I also know they serve thousands of people in a day and I never really needed to get their attention for anything major so no complaints. All in all we were all very satisfied and would stay here again:)

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Hawkshoe
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Monte Carlo on the recomendation of a friend. We were very pleased with the facility. The room was nice and clean. The people at the check-in desk were very friendly and helpful. The pool area was great. Both my 16 year old and my 8 year old loved it, especially the lazy river. We enjoyed a nice dinner at the pub while watching the game. The location was great being right on the strip. This is not your superfancy, all the bells and whistles type hotel on the strip but it is very nice and has enough going on to enjoy. If you want more excitement you can visit other hotels on the stip. For the price, this place is a bargain. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting and amusing”
Reviews.Author: LasVegasMexicoCity
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Monte Carlo Resort & Casino from July 8th until July 11th, invited by MGM-Mirage for a Fam Trip, as I belong to one of the top wholesaler travel agency in Mexico City. The clerk that made our check-in was very kind and corteous, but when she asked for a credit card, my colleague and I handed her our debit cards. She took them and said nothing about the charge of USD 480 that they were going to make for incidentals. Two days later, when we checked our balance at the ATM, we realized that a big amount of money was missing from our accounts. I had to call my bank in Mexico to find out what kind of charge was made which I was not aware of. They told me that Hotel Monte Carlo has charged USD 480 in my card. Of course immediately I contacted the supervisor in charge at the hotel, Mr. Lionel Cavazos, who explained us the situation and commited to call our banks in order to reinburse the amount. Even though the reinbursment process was not immediate and it was until today, July 14th, when my account received the money from Monte Carlo, Mr. Cavazos was really helpful and concerned about our situation. He even spoke to the manager, to be able to give us 50% of the charge in cash, so we could have at least this amount of money available. He really got involved in our problem and gave the extra mile to paliate the situation. Besides, he offered us a courtesy buffet for Sunday bruch, when he asked us if we already have had breakfast. I want to express my sincere gratitude to Lionel, as he really helped us and always in an excelent mood and service attitude. Lionel: THANKS A LOT for turning a bad situation in a pleasant one!!!

Reviews.Title: “Takes a long time to get a Response”
Reviews.Author: COBB64
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Monte Carlo for my birthday. The hotel is in horrible condition. We were extremely disappointed in the way the staff cleaned and maintained the property. We booked massages in the Spa after working out in the fitness center. That is the one bright spot in the property, the fitness center is great. However, the spa is another issue. The women working on the the female side of the spa ignore clients and they do not stock the items there for their customers. My wife waited in the area for her massage after soaking in the whirlpool, and all of the towels were gone. No one bothered to come restock. Cold compresses were supposed to be available for the two stage steam room, but again the staff was busy gossiping. There was not water or fruit as there was on the men's side. The men's staff was great. When I addressed the issues at check out, the desk manager was accomodating and he truly seemed embarrassed by the property. He gave us 40% off our second night stay. I was satisfied with that. The spa director has yet to contact me... She has told the property management that she tried to call me and e-mail me. She is either lying or trying someone else. The manager has been able to reach me.... There has been significant lapses in communication though. It was 2 months before the first contact by the manager. The spa manager attempted to give us 10% off of spa services at checkout, but I wasn't satisfied. I was willing to pay full price for mine. I wanted my wife's spa fees completely refunded. Not only were the issues above bad, but her massage therapist was late and rushed. This was a bust for her. The manager has offered a 40% off my next stay, but I have declined that and told her that the gesture needs to come from the spa.

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay here again”
Reviews.Author: bdr402
Reviews.Content: My wife took her daughter to Las Vegas for her 21st birthday. She called various hotels 3 months prior to find the best rate and deals, as 3 other adult family members were also going. She found the best deal at the Monte Carlo. She inquired when she made the reservation about getting a pool cabana on Sunday afternoon. They told her they would put her name on the list and it would be $275. On Sunday, after being there 3 days, she checked on the cabana. They told her she got one, but it would be $350, the weekend rate. She said they told her $275 when she made the reservation and the person didn't care. She spoke to the manager, who told her the pool manager would call her back. The pool manager called her and was very uncaring and would not honor their earlier quote. She did tell her they would waive the $16 resort fee during her 4 day stay. When she checked out, the fee had not been waived. And, the cabana sat empty all Sunday afternoon. So they have lost us as customers, (we usually stay there), over a measly $75.

Reviews.Title: “Won't Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: Zingo14
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Vegas the middle of July and stayed 4 days at Bellagio. On the Friday we were supposed to drive back home, we were still tired and since Bellagio was booked, we called Monte Carlo. We had seen a show at that hotel, and I heard it had nice rooms. When we arrived, staff was friendly and the room was average. I admitted at the time after Bellagio, nothing seems that gorgeous in comparison. But I had no real complaints until we decided to take an afternoon nap. I was surprised how many people were out and about in the middle of 110 degree weather; we are from AZ and used to it, but are for sure night people and were staying up really late on vacation. Our room was on the 10th floor above the pool, which apparently has blasting music with ridiculous bass from 10:00am to 7:00pm. It's not unreasonable for them to play music for the people at the pool, but do I have to hear it and feel its vibrations ten stories up? I'm cranky when I'm tired so I was pretty bothered by this. We just left the room without a nap and walked around some other casino. Additionally, the pool music woke me up the next morning. The walls are paper thin and we both woke up throughout the night multiple times to people in other rooms flushing their toilets and other plumbing noises. The sheets in our room had a couple holes on the fitted one, and there was popcorn on our floor. From the time we checked in, room service dishes were stacked outside other rooms lining our hallway, and stayed there until the time we checked out. We did see two shows at the Monte Carlo Theater during the week, and when we said we stayed at Bellagio they automatically offered 50% discount for the show. When we returned to see another show, I asked if they offered any deals since we were staying at this hotel, and they informed me that only because I asked, they would give me 25 percent off. We did not initially expect any discount prior, but when you tell people you're staying at Bellagio, you do get a better response, usually including, "Oooooh!" Finally, as if I wasn't cranky enough from poor sleep, Monte Carlo has some other sewage issues going on between the theater and their bar Diablo. You can smell this stench from the outside on the strip all the way into the hotel near the bar/theater entrance. I don't know how people can eat or drink outside while surrounded by this smell. Apparently during this trip, I became a Bellagio snob and will book there for future trips. One last point: although we booked last minute at Monte Carlo, it was more expensive than any of the days at Bellagio since I booked in advance. It is well worth it to book a couple months prior. Monte Carlo probably was nice in its day, but it seems old and smelly now.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but off the strip”
Reviews.Author: rollachick
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Monte Carlo many times in the last few years (I travel to Vegas 3-4 times a year for business). I've stayed at other hotels on the stirp before (Excalibur, Westin, Caesar's Palace, etc). The value for the hotel is great (usually can find a room for around $40-50/night). They've included a 'resort fee' now of $12.95 a day which includes wired internet (no wifi) and 2 bottles of water a day. I think all hotels now charge a 'resort fee' which includes the internet service (wired or wireless). I've always gotten the internet fees as I need to be able to work through VPN so the 'added' bonus of 2 bottles of water is nice. It is an older hotel and does not have a wet bar or fridge. The rooms are average and the pool is ok. They do have a 'wave' river where you can float around all day but there's nothing spectacular about the pool. The hotel is located a little south on the strip and isn't near the Tram. You can walk a block or two to MGM Grand and catch a tram from there to get to the Convention Center or the other hotels. Diablo is a bar that is connected to the hotel and faces the strip. It gets a little wild around Cinco De Mayo (which is when I was last there). Overall, good value if you aren't planning to spend a lot of time in your room although if I were coming for personal travel; I would opt to stay at Caesar's or at the Wynn.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool, nice room, so-so service”
Reviews.Author: jabmoore
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Monte Carlo a few years back for business (2004) and was looking forward to a return with my family because of the great service and property. The good news, the property is still fairly nice with the pool being the biggest plus. Whether you are there with kids or just hanging with friends, I found it to have plenty of space, great pool choices and ample seating. Our rooms were very nice, especially for the great room rate we got and I did not feel cheated even when paying the additional (unadvertised) resort fee. My only real complaint is that the service at the hotel has gone WAY DOWN. Although the staff are nice enough, there is very little attentiveness to customer needs and no sense of responsibility. For example, we called maintenance to have our shower head fixed (it was not flowing) and were told someone would be by in 10 minutes. An HOUR LATER after three calls downstairs, we finally gave up and took baths instead. They never did come to fix it.

Reviews.Title: “Second visit - would make a third”
Reviews.Author: ZZsMomLongIsland
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed here before and remembered enjoying it so much that we did a repeat. We are not Las Vegas novices. We travel to Las Vegas from New York at least four times a year - if we can we try for five. We have stayed at other hotels that were considered upscale and some that people would call "yuch." But this hotel can please everyone. The rooms are clean - the people who service them friendly. There is a fantastic food court that opens early and stays open late. You can always grab something to snack on or get a quick meal. There are restaurants that offer great variet - Italian, Chinese, Continental. The pool area is cleverly designed with a regular pool, a heated hot tub, a lazy river that you can either buy a tube to go around in or rent, and a wave pool that upon a buzzer sounding sends out wave after wave for a fun time. The lobby is tastefully done. The casino is well lit with a variety of slot machines in all denominations and tons of table games. We saw Lance Burton, a magician, who was funny and entertaining. We also saw Frank Caliendo who is an impersonator who we thought was quite frankly lousy. He deals strictly in political humor and if you do not have a current political background the jokes fall on deaf ears. We found the location ideal with other hotels on either side of us quite accessible. All in all we would stay a third time. Probably will.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: Joanne8290
Reviews.Content: I really do love staying at the Monte Carlo, first off is the locaton. You can easily walk to major hotels without sweltering in the heat. Second, the pool area is great. We fell in love a few years ago with the wave pool and river. We also rented the cabanas for a few days, great service. The casino is your basic machines. I like the fact my players card works at all the MGM-Mirage casinos. Only negative is how the check you in, You just pick a line and hope that it moves. We picked bad lines every time and end up 30-45 minutes waiting to check in, while others move right along. Would rather see one line for everyone. Not a major player but get many comps also.

Reviews.Title: “Ok room, very nice pool”
Reviews.Author: phladun
Reviews.Content: We (a couple with a one year old child) stayed here 4 nights as I was attending a conference at the hotel. The first night (Saturday) we paid a total of $127 which included the room rate of $101, the resort fee of $12.95 plus taxes. The next 3 nights, we paid the conference rate total of $59 including the room rate of $40 plus the resort fee and taxes. The room was very average with 2 queen beds, a desk and a TV cabinet. The bathroom was clean; it was not updated but not run down either. There was a bit of noise one night as a few drunk guys decided it would be fun to wake up the floor however, they seemed to disappear fairly quickly. In all honesty, we were probably the noisy ones as our child would cry occasionally at night and in the very early morning (time change effect) when she woke up for the day. The pool area was very busy on the weekend however, during the week, we really enjoyed it. The main pool was fairly deep so difficult for kids to swim in however, the wave pool was shallow so the smaller kids hung out there. The waves were not constantly on either, so during off times, the wave pool could be used as a paddling pool. There was also a lazy river and a hot tub. We ate at Brand, the hotel steak house, and had a fabulous dinner. So average room, excellent rate, very good pool area and excellent steak house adds up to a 4 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “4 Star Not, 2 1/2 maybe”
Reviews.Author: chenique1
Reviews.Content: We we're soooooo disappointed in the Monte Carlo! This probably was a 4 star years ago, but not today. The hotel casino had a very aweful stench. The rooms did not have bedspreads or comforts, just two sheets and a blanket. Call the front desk, thinking maybe housekeeping forgot to put it on, their response was "we got rid on them months ago". You go figure that out! Also , they only had about 8 cable channels this included local channels. Went to the pool area, ask for a tube for the lazy river, was told their is a $12.95 fee to rent daily. Are you kidding me! What a rip off! We paid $12.95 daily resort fee, for water I had to call downstair daily for. I will never stay or visit this hotel AGAIN! My room view of the strip was the only thing that was spectular.

Reviews.Title: “Thin walls, but great pool. Remember to budget for the resort fee!”
Reviews.Author: AZTXgrl
Reviews.Content: We stayed over 4th of July weekend. The hotel sent us a great player's club rate so we took it. I don't like that all the MGM properties are charging a $15 - 20/night "resort fee". The are giving you wired internet in the room as part of that, but it is a desparate attempt to keep from going bankrupt. The Monte Carlo is about the best location and room for the money on that part of the Strip. We really enjoy the pool at this hotel. If you're clever, you can BYOB into the pool area, just don't be a drunk idiot about it. Pool area is great if you get there by 10am on weekends. They have a wave pool and lazy river and keep things clean and tidy. Rooms are good, we booked a non-smoking room but were obviously just above a smoking room. I woke up with a sore throat the next morning and could smell smoke all night the first night, didn't smell any the rest of the stay. Monte Carol is well known for having very thin walls. I ALWAYS bring earplugs to sleep in when we stay here. I'm a light sleeper and the drunk idiots in the hallway and next door at 3am can always be heard. Just bring the earplugs and thank me later.

Reviews.Title: “Not what it used to be”
Reviews.Author: oopzydaze
Reviews.Content: I was so disappointed with my last stay at Monte Carlo. What happened to the customer service?? Don't bother calling front desk because no one seems to answer the phone. This was so annoying when you're trying to request a late check out and you're on the 31st floor. We were promised 2 bottled waters a day and I had to track down maid service to get them because they weren't in our room and again, no one answers the front desk phone. Also had to track down the maid to get a Do Not Disturb sign because it wasn't in the room. We were promised drink credits and I just noticed that neither the restaurant nor the hotel honored that credit when they gave us our bill at check out. I used to stay here on business trips and never had a problem but this last stay convinced me that it's time to try other hotels in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel for a good price”
Reviews.Author: Luvs2Travel2CU
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo on the LV strip is very nice. Check in at midnight took 5 minutes. The first room we were given had a stain on the sheet, so they immediatly gave us to another room over the phone. Sink and tub were sluggish, but a call for a plumber took care of it within an 1/2 hour. Very comfy beds. Pool water was refreshing and cold, even though outside air temperture that day was 102. Shops were nice, picked up a few gifts at the $10 store. The bellhop stored our luggage for 10 hours since we had a late flight home. There are lots of choices for hotel rooms, but this one was fine for the money. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel For The Money”
Reviews.Author: pookiegRidgecrest
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice. The staff was friendly. The pools were amazing, not too crowded for a holiday weekend. The resort fee is a major drawback, not worth it. The casino smelled very strange like there may have been a sewage problem, has anyone else noticed this? Other than that it was a nice place to stay and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Warning - Hidden Charges”
Reviews.Author: Bruce35dc
Reviews.Content: DO NOT TRUST any price for this hotel. YOU MUST ADD $14.50 per night to the quote, for charges you will BE FORCED to accept. My flight-hotel package was advertised as all-inclusive. But when I checked in at the Hotel I was FORCED to agree to pay for a $14.50 per night charge for newspapers, 2 bottles of water, and high speed internet. I was told I COULD NOT DECLINE these charges, even if I didn't use the water or internet. Now the Casinos RIP YOU OFF even before you get to the tables.

Reviews.Title: “Ideally located if you like the razmatazz of Vegas”
Reviews.Author: EnglandTanky
Reviews.Content: Right on the main strip - very clean and comfortable with very good helpful staff and good cafes, restaurants etc.

Reviews.Title: “good value and location”
Reviews.Author: travelswithjh
Reviews.Content: if you are looking for value and less noise this is a good location. It met all of our objectives. Room was a little tired. House keeping did an excellent job. service was excellent in all aspects.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive Lobby, Outdated rooms, Rude staff”
Reviews.Author: Dawn2565
Reviews.Content: After having spent a week in Vegas in June, we decided to come back to finish our trip around california, and booked the Monte Carlo. We stayed at New York New York last time and enjoyed it, and was told that their sister hotel; Monte Carlo was supposed to be the better of the two. First off the lobby is very nice, and it is very nice that you don't have to go through the casino to get to the lobby from car park. Getting from the car park to the lobby was a long walk either. Check-in seemed to be fine considering Independence day was around the corner. When we got to the hotel we saw food, and trash had been left all along the corridor which was a bad impression. On entering the room there a musty smell, and we could see the rooms looking very tired, and screaming to be renovated. The room was nothing like the photos off the internet, these must've been taken when the room was brand new. We asked to change rooms, and got a higher floor, but smelt heavily of air freshener. The staff was not very friendly or helpful, so we checked out to and went back to New York New York. Pool and Lobby are very nice, and location is pretty good. But stay at the New York New York where your custom is valued.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, would highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: tweetyMichigan
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family 6/26 - 6/29 for vacation in Vegas and the Grand canyon. The hotel was VERY clean, all the staff were friendly, our roon was large although just average room. It had a wave pool and lazy river which we all enjoyed alot as the temps were 110 degrees. The cost of the tubes to rent were pricey $14/day I would recommend taking your own if you can which they do let you use. The hotel is right in the middle of things on the strip. I will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Gentleman's Vegas Golf Trip”
Reviews.Author: JD-Maggie
Reviews.Content: This is just Jim and not Maggie and the four of us guys stayed in two rooms on the 19th floor and had a very enjoyable stay at the Monte Carlo. Hotel: We usually stay in moderately priced hotels like the NYNY or Flamingo and booked the Monte Carlo so that we could cool off in the pools after our rounds of golf. The hotel is not a four star hotel but it was perfectly fine and met our expectations. No wait for Thursday afternoon check in nor Sunday morning departure. Had non-smoking, 2- Queen beds available as I requested. Very good/nice employees throughout the weekend. Very nice clean room. One thing the rooms need is to replace the older television sets but even that didn't matter to us as we don't spend very much time in the rooms anyway. Food: We miss the brew pub but enjoyed the beer pub. They have replaced the excellent oven baked pizzas with flatbread ones. They had a very good acoustic guitarist playing to an indifferent crowd on Thursday evening. She was very good. $145 for three people, Overpriced for what it was. We just had 2-3 beers each. There is a very crowded Starbucks in the food court. If you walk 2 minutes down past the Pub and retail on the way to Aria you will find a larger, less crowded one. Pool: The pool was relaxing on Friday afternoon. I wish they played a little more pop music and a little less rap music. Both the pool and lazy river were good and crowded. The water was noticably less clean on Saturday. Easy to get a chair both afternoons. The resort is aiming for a younger, stupider crowd. There is entire "party" pit on the weekends for bad 6:5 BJ tables with a Go-Go dancer. Overall, the MC is not looking for discerning clientele. This is not negative, just an observation. We enjoyed ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful First Trip to Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: ChemEngGirl
Reviews.Content: This was my very first trip to Las Vegas, and I went with my husband and a bunch of friends for a wedding. There was a large group of us that wanted to get rooms near each other, but we didn't request this before we arrived. The people at the front desk were very nice and very accomodating, and were able to get us all rooms near each other. The rooms were older but decent, didn't spend a whole lot of time there anyways. Never had to wait for an elevator, there always seemed to be one ready. I thought the location of the Monte Carlo was very good, within walking distance to several shops and other hotels, and it even had a free tram that went to the Bellagio. All the hotels are so big, make sure you wear comfortable walking shoes! The first night we were there we took a taxi everywhere which got expensive. I recommend taking the bus - only $7 for a 24 hour unlimited pass. There were also quite a few things to do within the hotel. I was really glad that the Monte Carlo had a food court with places like McDonalds and Subway, Vegas gets really expensive so it was nice to have a cheaper option for lunch or late night snacks. The Pub was also a pretty cool place to hang out as well. I think Monte Carlo had one of the better casinos, lots of slot machines and card tables, and never too crowded. The pool area was really fun, especially if you like to party! There were music and games, and they also had really good drinks (get the peach bellini!!). All the shows and attractions in Vegas are pretty expensive, but there are some free things to do: see the fountains at the Bellagio, the volcano at the Mirage, the lions at the MGM Grand, the pirate show at Treasure Island, and you definitely need to go downtown to Fremont Street (one of my favs!). We arrived on a Wednesday night, which turned out to be a really good idea. We were able to do most of the sightseeing Wednesday and Thursday. By Friday, everywhere was considerably more crowded. Also, I would not recommend bringing young kids. There is drinking, gambling, and 'adult entertainment' everywhere you look. One last thing - you should visit Toby Keith's Bar and Grill in Harrah's. The bartenders were amazing and they had a live band and dance floor with lots of two-stepping! If I went to Vegas again, I would probably stay at the Monte Carlo again. It is less expensive than some of the others, in a good location, and has fun things to do.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Penney728
Reviews.Content: One thing that I really liked about this hotel is that you can drive around the back and have the valet take your car and walk right into the Hotel registration and not have to walk through the whole casino with your luggage and everything. They have complimentary water bottles in your room, the pool was really nice, the people at the registration desk were very friendly - and for the location on the strip it was a good value

Reviews.Title: “Worth the Money”
Reviews.Author: golfman69
Reviews.Content: From the time we deiced to stay here to the end, my family was treated with special care. Having a family reunion can be trickey, trying to satisfy everyone, but the Monte Carlo meet everyones needs and did it with class. Katy, at the front desk was able to get all 11 rooms on the same floor and the rooms were nice....you must remember what you are paying....we paid less that $250 for friday,sat,and sun. in Vegas.....the pool area was perfect for all ages, with drink specials till noon.... plus not overly crazy....just fun....spent 2 days soaking up the sun and trust me if you want sun it can be found....but get there around 8 for the best seats.. Location was great...right on the srtip, the food court was VERY handy and the casino was comfortable...not overwhelming...like some. Yes the rooms aren't the fanciest....but they sure are nice and comfortable.....my wifes only complaint is the maidservice....they weren't able to our rooms in a timely fashion, but they did.....Everyone said that the MC be there first choice again given the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “OK Stay except for beds”
Reviews.Author: pletzkeb
Reviews.Content: The hotel, casino and restaurant staff are very friendly and helpful. Check in was quick and easy. Our room on the 19th floor had a view of the pool area. Don't get a room with a view of the pool if you want to sleep during the day as it is very noisy. The hotel lobby, casino, restaurants, and guest hallways are kept up very well. Our room, a 2 queen was large. The bath room was a nice size. The shower head was horrible and it was impossible to turn off the tub facet after using. The linens and toiletries were cheap. The sheets would not stay on the bed which made sleeping very uncomfortable. When I checked with housekeeping about getting sheets that fit the bed, I was told they had no fitted sheets, but they would put king size sheets on the bed. They didn't. Room service was very good, both food and delivery. We would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for price”
Reviews.Author: oban34
Reviews.Content: . I've read a lot of reviews regarding the Monte Carlo and to me it comes down to your expectations. If you are looking for the Wynn or Bellagio for Monte Carlo prices this is not your place. For me I love this place because its very clean, nice pools, great location, good food choices and nice rooms. The beds were comfortable and the rooms clean. I would think that this would be a good hotel for family's due to a more mature clientele. As well the staff and casino has always been very friendly and helpful when needed

Reviews.Title: “Memorial Day and Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: Mamatravel1
Reviews.Content: We stayed the weekend of Memorial Day at the Monte Carlo for our Anniversary trip. We had booked a vacation package through Southwest Airlines. After reading some reviews I was worried about the hotel. We’ve stayed at eight different Las Vegas hotels during business and fun trips. We had a great stay, but I’d only stay again if we got a great rate. There’s nothing super special about the hotel (except for the pool). Good Everything is close and convenient in the hotel. It’s a short walk to elevators, pool, casino, and the rooms. The parking garage is the closest one of any of the casinos. Great location on the strip. You can walk to New York, New York and MGM. There is a great monorail to Aria and Bellagio. Food court with McDonald’s , Starbucks, and Rubio’s. Pool area rocked and is why we picked the hotel. It was mellow in the morning and a crowded party scene in the afternoon. My husband enjoyed a nice spot in the shade. The room was clean and we didn’t have any problems with water pressure. Bad Our flight got in at 8:30am. We tried to check-in and were assigned a strip-view king that wasn’t ready. We had a number to call after 3pm to see if it was clean. The room wasn’t ready until almost 5pm. Two of the six elevators to our floor (14th) broke. We ended up riding up, and then down to get one. There were long lines for the elevators. Pool opened one day without lifeguards on duty and without pool towels. Towels arrived an hour after opening and they quickly ran out again. Long lines at the front desk. I agree with other reviewers that they have cut staff because of economic times. The front desk had long lines and that’s why the cleaning of rooms took forever. The walls are thin and my husband was kept up by loud noisy neighbors. We bought earplugs at CVS and he slept great the next night.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Wolvesfan62
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Monte Carlo for my second time in Vegas. (First time was at Imperial Palace...). Checked in at 2 pm, no line up, got upgraded to a high floor room with a good view. Good customer service at the desk and housekeeping was good, not entering the room when the do not disturb sign was on the door). Casino was good to us on the last day, didn't eat at any of the restaurants there so cannot comment. Like the pharmacy next door (good after a hard days night....) All in all a nice hotel for the price. I am returning next month, but have upgraded to a Spa Suite for just a little more money...WOO HOO

Reviews.Title: “Been there done that”
Reviews.Author: rmb0707
Reviews.Content: The wife allowed me time in Vegas for a few days by myself but I had to limit my expenses. Monte Carlo was not my first choice but it was the least expensive. I was comped for the three nights and I got a casino and hotel credit. I have stayed here before in my prior visits to Vegas but the last time was over ten years ago. I didn't remember much about my stay so it was like the first time again. I use to go to Vegas two or three times a year before I got married now it's once every one or two years. I had the low end room and it was still very nice. I don't have any complaints. I had a view of the strip mainly MGM and it was very nice to look out the window. I come to Vegas to let loose and to have a good time. I just gamble and drink beer all day long. Not much else. Monte Carlo is a resort and has everything you want and you really don't ever have to leave. I wouldn't advise that. They have a food court there with four or five fast food restaurants and they have a dinner along with several fancy restaurants. There is to be a time when you could get good food at reasonable prices. Those days are gone. All MGM properties now have a nightly resort fee, which I think is a BIG rippoff. You do get two bottles of water (first night only), a free daily newspaper (ruppee!) and access to the fitness center. If you want to use the sauna etc... it is an additional $5 charge. My problem with the resort fee is that you are being charge for something you didn't want in the first place. The pool area is nice. It has a lazy river that kids to adults will enjoy. I gamble a lot there and I didn't see or hear many winners. I didn't win at all. Nothing. I think I will stay somewhere else on my next visit next year.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: sarafras
Reviews.Content: rooms were clean, no problems with noise from other rooms, great location, ate buffet in the hotel - lots of variety in the food. service was good - no complaints. checked in on Sat. around 7p, no lines.........only thing that went wrong was our hotel bill had a charge of $12 for a 30 second long distance call that we did not make - they took charges off without a hassle. tube tv in room, but no big deal....had view of the pools and city center. staff were all very friendly (in all parts of the hotel)

Reviews.Title: “remember the resort fee”
Reviews.Author: hawa38
Reviews.Content: $13 a day mandatory resort fee will give you access to the gym and wireless internet. if you stay more than a night like we did you might want to think about it again. gym has updated workout equipment, free bottled water, not sure if the spa services are included, didn't have time for that. standard room is spacious, flat screen tv, just be prepared to walk down a very long hallway because it is a very big hotel. pool opens at 9 am instead of 7 am at the other nearby hotels. check in/out is fast and hassle free. plenty of free parking spaces at the garage next to the hotel so don't worry, valet also available just need to tip. the hotel also has free tram that will take you to Aria and Bellagio. overall a no frill experience, for $80 a night i am not sure i will come back, if you can get a deal for less than $50 i think it is ok.

Reviews.Title: “Can't complain”
Reviews.Author: IndyMegan
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as part of a package through Expedia. Decent value. The reviews indicated that it had deteriorated since I last stayed here, four years ago, but I didn't notice. We wanted a nice hotel with a clean, quiet room, good pool and casual dining options. It was fine for our purposes. Breakdown: Location - Okay. Tram to City Center and Bellagio was convenient. Bus stop across the street (which is at least a block and a half, as all distances in Vegas are exaggerated). Check-in/out - fast, friendly. Surprised by a mandatory $15 per room/night "resort charge," which includes pool use, unlimited long distance, business center, and a bunch of other stuff that I assumed was included in the room rate. Oh well. We were charged $20 for a call from the room, which should have been included. It was removed. Room - clean, spacious, no bed bugs, no problem. Oddly, the maid put a bag of tobacco on our bathroom counter. She said she found it in the wastebasket. EIther it was hers, or our basket wasn't emptied before we left. But why would someone leave a full bag of tobacco and rolling papers? We didn't smell smoke in the room. I could hear the TV in the next room, faintly, and in the hallways you can hear people talking inside the room. But this wasn't a disturbance, and I'm easily disturbed. Pool - crowded, a bit of a party scene. There's a small freeform pool, a lazy river, a large wave pool, and a hot tub. There were leaves and straws in the freeform pool, but it didn't stop me from enjoying myself. The chairs are smooshed together (touching, so you can't step between them unless you space them out) and stacked three or four rows deep. Some people line up at 7:30 to get their choice of chair when the pool opens at 8. If you really want a great spot, the best shady spot, or need a lot of chairs together, this is a good idea. You can put towels on chairs and save them. There were still plenty of chairs available by noon. Plentiful towels. Rental innertubes for the lazy river. Very stiff pool drinks. Not my favorite pool in the world. but not bad. Restaurants: ate at the food court and the breakfast buffet. Both were as expected. Casino - sleepy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Comp'ed Room.”
Reviews.Author: egiblock
Reviews.Content: Since this hotel is part of the MGM hotels (Bellagio, MGM, Mandalay Bay, The Mirage, NY NY, Luxor, Excalibur, Circus Circus) we were able to start our vacation with a free night here. This place is a great place to stay. The room we got was a 700 square-foot Monaco Suite. It had a great view of the new City Center, as well as the Monte Carlo swimming pools. It had 1 1 /2 baths, with a jacuzzi bath tub. Everything was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort for the money”
Reviews.Author: HotShotPenny
Reviews.Content: Arrived sun. June 13th in the morning- check in went very smooth, staff was very helpful and friendly. room was very basic, nothing fancy, but clean. Had a great view of the strip. We ate at the buffet (had a 2 for 1 deal) for breakfast, the food was very good. We also ate at the Cafe, service was awful...waited 45 min. for our order, food was good. We checked out thurs. no problems. Overall we had a great stay and would stay at the MonteCarlo again.

Reviews.Title: “A good, low-cost, basic casino room”
Reviews.Author: Carrie P
Reviews.Content: We visit Vegas a few times a year and have stayed at several casino hotels on the Strip. Our room at the Monte Carlo struck me as a lower-quality version of the MGM Grand (with correspondingly lower prices). It was a good choice and we'd stay there again. Very clean room on arrival and it was perfectly cleaned and made up both days. The pool area is great and was not a full-on party zone - lots of people in the pools but I would not say it had a spring break atmosphere at the time we were there. There are sexier pools in Vegas which attract that crowd - this was just your average hotel guest assortment. There are a bazillion deckchairs so it didn't seem like the crowd was a problem. Be sensible though; my friend had her bag and wallet stolen off a deckchair when she left it unattended. The lifeguards aren't there to remember several hundred people and who owns which bag. The casino area is one of the least smokey I've found. People were definitely smoking in there, but it was barely noticeable unless you were actually right next to a smoker. Compared to most casinos where the stench is appalling to a non-smoker, this alone makes the Monte Carlo worth my money. As some other reviews mentioned, the walls are paper thin and you WILL hear everything from the next room. Ear plugs are a good idea if you're a light sleeper. We were next to what sounded like a freakin' daycare center. Come on people, don't bring your dozens of screaming toddlers to Vegas and then leave them in the room all day, okay? Go to Disneyland instead and we'll all be much happier. The bathroom was okay. Nothing fancy, but clean and with all the usual amenities (soap, lotion, shampoo, conditioner, hairdryer, magnifying shaving/makeup mirror), good towels, good water pressure in the shower. The tub was slow draining and once you pull the shower curtain closed it is very dimly lit in there - not too bad, just a minor annoyance. Air conditioning in the room was good, with digital thermostat controls. The bed was comfortable, with a sheet, thin cover thingy (you really don't need a comforter in Las Vegas so I don't know why some people mention the lack of huge thick blankets as a drawback) and a big pile of about six pillows. I used the spa (had a Swedish massage and also checked out the sauna, steam room etc) and it was excellent. Small, but peaceful and nicely designed. The massage was one of the best I've had anywhere. My masseur was a guy called Jose and he was fantastic. We ate elsewhere for most meals but did go to The Cafe restaurant for brunch. The food was great but our group of five waited forever for service and some mistakes were made when the food finally turned up. To their credit, the wait staff were very apologetic and comped us some of the dishes without even being asked. The relatively small size of the Monte Carlo means you're not wasting half of each day just walking through the hotel/casino. Unlike most Vegas casino resorts, you don't feel like you need a GPS and a team of Sherpas to find your way from one end of it to the other. I usually like a bit more luxury than the Monte Carlo, but it is by no means down at Motel 6 level, it's just a nice standard room at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Tons of Fun on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: physiogal
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at the Monte Carlo for a stagette and had a great time. Although nearer to one end of the strip, the Monte Carlo is in a great location - only 20 minute walk to the Bellagio water fountains and across the street from the rollercoaster of New York, New York. I signed up with the Guestbook on the Monte Carlo website and got $40 nights! A great deal... The only down side is there isn't a dance club - but the Pub and Diablo have great food, drinks and music. The pool was pretty good - lazy river and wave pool - and a lot of chairs to relax on. Overall a good experience!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Spa Tub!”
Reviews.Author: Sheba611
Reviews.Content: I got a good rate on a Spa Suite for Memorial Day weekend. The hotel check in was quick and the staff were polite. The room had a mini fridge but no coffee maker. As part of the daily fees, you get 2 small bottles of water and wi-fi. The spa tub is nice and large and located in the bedroom next to the window. I was told I had a pool view, but I could not see any pool looking out my window. Got a view of the city tram and Aria. Although the Monte Carlo is in a good location on the Strip and City Center, I will not be going back. I like to play Slots and found the slots at Monte Carlo and Aria to be stingy. Does not make for a fun trip when you only lose. A couple of bright spots were the shows. I saw Lance Burton at Monte Carlo and O at Bellagio. If you are in LV in the near future go see Lance Burton. He is leaving Monte Carlo (rumor is he is retiring). He is a great magician and entertainer.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at the Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: sizergh
Reviews.Content: There were several things I enjoyed about the Monte Carlo. First, it's centrally-located on the Strip, so getting around is usually an easy walk either direction. Close to the Bellagio, City Center and about a 10 minute walk down to the Luxor/Mandalay Bay area. About 10 minute walk to Caesars Palace. Self parking is very easy.....not confusing. Our check in on a Friday morning took about 5 minutes. Lots of desk clerks working. Very professional and helpful. From the elevators, everything is close. The pool, casino and food court (McDonalds/Subway/Sbarra, etc.) are all located together just off the elevators. The pool was usually busy with music playing. Lots of lounge chairs. There is a sand volleyball court at one end and a large hot tub that holds about 15 people. The room (12-222) was clean. Good A/C. The television was a little out-dated (not a flat screen), but it worked just fine. We got extra towels from the housekeeper. She gave them to us off her cart. The only time I saw any housekeeping issues was early Sunday morning in the elevators....some trash on the elevator floor from the busy Saturday night. Shortly thereafter, the housekeeping staff was in cleaning them out. We used the concierge to print out our airline boarding tickets in advance. Very pleasant and helpful. All said, good location, helpful staff and a pretty good deal compared to the other hotels on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for a 2 1/2 Star hotel”
Reviews.Author: TexasZuggie
Reviews.Content: Our problem with the Monte Carlo was that it was not rated as promised. Not by a longshot. Monte Carlo is definitely not a 4 star hotel. Not even a 3 1/2 or a 3. Give it a solid 2 1/2! The room was clean and spacious. Great location. The bed was comfy and the AC worked well. Staff was courteous and helpful. No bugs, no slow draining drains, no noise, and no coffee maker, as reported in previous posts. It's just that for Las Vegas, we expected more. Our room looked like it had not been updated in 15 or 20 years. Quite ragged around the edges. Old style smaller tube TV. The entire hotel looked that way. We saw Lance Burton at the Monte Carlo - he's been playing there for 14 years - and even the show and theatre looked old and dated. But it was a good show - you can get discount tickets at the ticket office in the big Coke Bottle across the street. We also saw Love at the Mirage - great show. Best seats are the cheap ones, high and in the back. We did lunch buffets at Wynn's and Paris. Wonderful! And tried the breakfast buffet at the Monte Carlo. Not so good and very overpriced at $14.95 pp. Of course that $12.95 resort fee doesn't seems justified. But the good news about that is that it includes ifree in-room internet (not wi-fi, but the kind where you plug in the cable).
