Bottom line - the Monte Carlo is fine if you're happy with a 2 1/2 star hotel and can get it cheap. Just don't book with any higher expectations. Next time we'll stay elsewhere. There's just too many much nicer places in Vegas for not too much more money.

Reviews.Title: “Decent but definitely not my first choice”
Reviews.Author: BeckyBloomwood
Reviews.Content: My husband was attending a course in Las Vegas for work and I tagged along with him. The course was located at the Monte Carlo and he did not have a choice of hotels. If we were the ones paying for the room, we would not have chosen Monte Carlo, but it was decent enough for our 3 night stay. Check-in We arrived at 11 am and were told our room would be ready in about 30 minutes. We were pleasantly surprised that it would be ready so quickly. They went ahead and assigned our room to us and gave us our key, which was nice that we did not have to return to check-in. The service at the front desk was polite, but definitely not friendly. We decided to grab lunch and return later in the afternoon. Room We were given a room on the fourth floor with a slight view of MGM. I was a little disappointed in the view, but we had not asked for a room with a nice view at check-in, so I did not have any reason to complain. I hated that the room was so dark and dimly lit, though! It made it difficult when getting ready in the evening. The safe was also really narrow and small. However, the bed was comfortable and we did sleep well at night. Of course, our exhaustion in the evenings may have also contributed to our deep sleep. I would compare the room to that of a Hampton Inn. There was never a long wait for the elevators, which was nice. Location I did not really care for the location of the hotel. It seems there are more families with kids in this area of the strip, with NYNY and MGM so close. We also like to gamble and dine near Caesars/Bellagio, so the location was not convenient for our evening activities. We prefer to stay mid-strip for this reason alone. Pool I did not care for the pool area. The lounge chairs were dirty and packed together. There were dirty cups left all over and never picked up by staff. Cocktail service was pretty non-existent. It was easier to just walk over to the bar than wait for a server. The drinks were also not good. The cannot make a margarita to save their lives. There are 3 separate pools: a regular pool, a lazy river pool, and a wave pool. I liked the regular pool the best. It was small, but pretty calm compared to the lazy river and wave pool. Plus, the small size meant the sun warmed the water very easily and it felt quite nice. Overall I did not really care for the hotel, but it was a decent place to sleep at night on the strip. I did not like the location. If we were paying ourselves, we would not choose this hotel. If I had to pick a hotel on the strip on a budget, I would check rates at Flamingo. While the casino and lobby of the Monte Carlo are much nicer, the rooms are just as nice at Flamingo and the location is much better. Mirage would also be a better choice in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Tooo Hot”
Reviews.Author: SwetaJain
Reviews.Content: May it be weather or crowd its toooo hot at Las Vegas, its a night city, full of night life and hot crowd. Gambling is the major attraction of this city. People majorly come here to play in casinos. Hotel Monte carlo also had a huge good casino.

Reviews.Title: “With all the hotels on the strip - stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: Julie_Z16
Reviews.Content: I was quite disappointed with this hotel. We had a room on the third floor with a view of a roof. There were no coffee/tea making facilities in the room and when I called to enquire was simply told 'sorry we don't do that'. The staff were not particularly pleasant, although they did answer my queries. My main bug bear was the lifts. We were on the third floor so could quite easily have walked up the stairs but there were no stairs for public use. This would be fine except there were only 3 lifts working, meaning a wait of up to ten minutes to get up and down to our room! I found this astonishing. There are pleanty of other hotels on the strip and I would only return here if pushed.

Reviews.Title: “Pool alone is worth the stay.....”
Reviews.Author: Schwally
Reviews.Content: Stayed at MC with family, including 3 year old child - before flames about children in Vegas, this was the best location for family coming from 3 states. We stayed during the week, which I'm sure is a much different scene than on the weekend. Check In - painless, accurate, & friendly. Rooms were adjoining with the beds & non-smoking as requested. Room Quality - this is the only thing about MC that can use an upgrade in my opinion. Room was clean, but seemed worn. Mattress seemed to be worn on the side by the nightstand. Weird thing was there were no comforters on any of the 4 beds in our rooms. When we asked, we were told that the hotel is looking for a more modern look and is doing away with them. Another family member's king room did have one however. It was just weird - maybe they're doing away with all of the stained/burned ones? I'd rather have none than one with cig holes, though. Bathroom was fine, nothing fancy, but clean as well. Overall, we didn't go to Vegas to sit in the room, so a little dated was fine by us. Pool - this is why we booked, and glad that we did. Excellent options for a small child, but not too overwhelming either. There were plenty of chairs, and shade or sun was available all day. Good mix of young singles & families. Neither one was obnoxious. Other reviews mention the music being too loud - did not find that at all. It was a good volume. Pool bar was quick & friendly & drinks were not short on the spirits! Hotel Layout - this was the best surprise for us. MC is not a HUGE hotel/resort that requires tons of confusing walking through the casino. From the main elevator banks, you're within sight of the pool entrance, food court, lobby, and shopping. So if you're at the pool and want to run up to your room or to the food court, it's not a major trek. Restaurants - food court is convenient & has a lot of choices: Subway, McDonalds, Sbarro, Mexican place, Chinese place, Haagen Daz, and Starbucks. Expect to pay 30% more than at home. Nice to have other quick options while on vacation. Ate at Diablo's Cantina - food was a little above average, but overpriced - but while on vacation, it's to be expected. Margarita pitcher for $30 seemed to be virgin - would not recommend. The Pub was very good with a lot more dining options than I thought. The buffet was a typical Vegas buffet. Ate twice there and was pretty much the same both evenings. Breakfast buffet offered the typical fare as well. Service - overall very friendly & good at check in, restaurants, bell desk, pool bar, dealers & drink service while gambling. Have no complaints whatsoever. Misc - enjoyed having the tram to City Center and Bellagio, was very convenient to get around. Shops were fine, but nothing over the top or lacking. Very middle class, which is fine by me!!!! MC seems to have a new tagline of 'unpretentiously luxurious.' I would agree 100%. If you're used to someone waiting on you hand and foot, this may not be for you. But if you're looking for a nice place to stay without going broke, I'd recommend the MC.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: SoloGirlTravels
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately I made the mistake of assuming that if a hotel was on the strip it would be "safe," boy was I wrong. I booked this hotel before searching Trip Advisor, which was a mistake, because after I did, I saw more than one person complained of the same things and of bed bugs! Well, I was unable to canel my reservation, so I went and kept my fingers crossed. First of all, don't let the lobby fool you, while it looks nice, that is just a front for what is to come. The staff wasn't very friendly and the room wasnt ready even though we arrived an hour after check-in. We were told to try the room after 30 minutes and given our room key. When we mozied up to the room, the maid wasn't even finished and when we asked if she needed more time, she told us "No, its finished" with a surly look on her face. The rooms definitely need refurbishment. The comforters had stains on them and cigarette burns, the sheets were dirty as well. I immediately checked the sheets for bed bugs and didnt see any so I gave that a rest for the day. The bathrrom was dirty too. There was hair on the floor, the shower wouldn't drain and the fixture came off when you pulled up on the knob to turn on the water. The windows were dirty as well. I doubt they had been cleaned on the outside for a long time, if at all. The pool area was packed and not for anyone but the rowdy college crowd. I'm in that age group, but frankly some of their antics were just plain annoying. The beach chairs were dirty and there were drinks left everywhere. The second day we were there my friend and I lay down for a nap when I noticed what looked like a dead bed bug on the sheet. I immediated called the manager and they sent someone up. He was understanding and explained their procedure for checking the room for bugs. He comped us for a meal and 4-5 hours later we were informed the exterminator was there to check the room. He thorougly checked everything, stripping all the items during his inspection. Luckily, there were no bugs in the room. We were told by the manager, who was very professional and friendly that he would send room service up to gve us clean sheets and new bedding. When my friend and I returned to the room later we were pleasantly surprised. Not only did we have clean bedding, but clean robes, slippers, and chocolates laid out on our beds! It was a nice touch after so much drama, but the clean sheets should have been present from the beginning. I would not recommend this hotel because it was dirty and needs major refurbishment, but I will say in our time of crisis, the staff did there best to accomodate us and worked with us to resolve the problem which was a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for the price!”
Reviews.Author: TrueTravel19
Reviews.Content: Lobby was well very nice and clean. Lighting was great with no smell of smoke. Customer services was good with fast check in. Room: 22th floor with a wonder view. Large room with nice bathroom. Little outdated but okay for the price and location. Bed was comfortable with clean sheets and soft pillows. No noise from hallway or neighbors. Safe in room. Felt very safe in the hotel and room. Eats: Cafe has excellent food at a decent price. Buffet was good (breakfast only). Pool: Very clean and large. Very relaxing even with kids around. Spa: Very nice spa and massage. Worth the money Location: Across from the MGM Grand where you can catch the monorail to the north end of the strip. Overall I would recommend and stay her again. No frills or thrills.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: CheerfulChickie
Reviews.Content: I just got back from spending Memorial Weekend in Vegas. I've stayed at the Monte Carlo many many times. This past weekend was one of the best deals I've gotten there for a holiday weekend. My friends and I got plane tickets from LA to Vegas and 3days/2 nights at the Monte Carlo for $302 (per person, each separate room). We took a 7am flight and the hotel let us check in early. They now charge a "resort fee" on top of what travelocity charges (~$15/day I think), which they didn't do before. My room was quiet, but one of my friends did complain about drunk people outside her door. I think there's a possibility of that no matter where you stay in Vegas. Recommend you ask for a room on the higher floors as sometimes noise or smoke from the casino will creep to the lower floors. I've never noticed but my friends have. The Aria Hotel and Casino next door is also now open, which is also very nice. You can get to the Aria from the Monte Carlo via a walkway (took us the 2nd day to figure that out). There are much nicer hotel/casinos in Vegas, but you will pay alot more. There are also cheaper hotels, but you'll get dingy rooms and an old casino. What brings me back to the Monte Carlo is that you get an above average hotel for a great deal. The major casinos that are a must-see, Bellagio, MGM, Ceasar's Place, etc are all about 10mins walking distance. Off course you can still take the tram to all the other casinos as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value/Location”
Reviews.Author: arober
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a friend's 30th B-day/Memorial Day weekend and I thought it was nice. The room was comfortable, but not luxurious. We were on the 7th floor and had friends on the 10th. We went to the pool on Monday and it was uncrowded and pleasant, the lazy river and wave pool were fun, we stayed over by the wave pool and a volleyball court no one probably ever sees, it was quiet. We went to Diablos, where the service was lacking, seemed like they were understaffed. The chips and salsa were good, so were the nachos and fajitas. They have a happy hour where we got $3 XX and a wheel and they spin it every hour for specials-$5 patron shots while we were there. We went to the buffet there one night, which was $20 for dinner and nothing special, but everything I tried I liked (still, they were supposed to have "creat your own" hibachi and pasta stations and no one seemed very interested in cooking at those for us), we ate at Dragon Noodle which was a giant portion (split with my spouse and still didn't finish) again, it wasn't anything special but it was good, expensive ($18 for a plate of noodles with chicken, 2 shrimp, beef) but that's Vegas. I liked the tram to Bellagio, we saw O, and to City Center (walked through but nothing even remotely inviting, just a lot of high-end designer stores, I like Planet Hollywood shops better where they have a mix of retailers). I have stayed a lot of places on the strip. This isn't as nice as Mandalay, or MGM, but it's nicer than Ex Calibur and the location is really great. We walked everywhere and rarely took cabs. I didn't eat at the food court, but it's convenient to have McDonalds, Rubios, Subway, Machu Wok, so you don't have to spend $20 on every meal. The $15/night "resort fee" is outrageous though, and I would consider that in the room price in the future. The resort fee includes the gym and interneet, which I didn't use, and the bottles of water are the tiniest bottles I have ever seen! Housekeeping does come late in the day for stay-over rooms. Oh, and I should mention a nice thing, my spouse left an ipod in the safe and when he called they send someone up to get it and will fedex it back to us, which is nice and makes me feel better about having stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Memorial Day and My daughter's 21st Birthday was Wonderful here”
Reviews.Author: HavingFun33
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Monte Carlo previous times with friends, dates, and now my daughter's 21st Birthday. My sister joined us and the Queen beds were comfortable. No longer have those bulky comforters I couldn't stand and felt were never cleaned?? Not all the rooms are upgraded/remodeled. We still had the bulky TV not the flat screen room. Guess this is what you get from their emailed promo rates. The location is right on the strip, I don't mind driving, cabs cost over $15 one way plus adding tip. So the freeway is right behind the hotel to get on and off. We drove to Statrosphere, Circus Circus, Paris & Venetian all conveniently located to the Monte Carlo. Service was great, we needed a wheelchair for my daughter, had a sprained ankle, and got a complimentary wheelchair to use at the hotel. Housekeeping was nice to keep our room clean the whole weekend stay as busy as it was on Memorial Day. We even got a view when we told them at the front desk it was my daughter's 21st birthday which was really considerate of them. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I have never been so disapointed on a vacation in my life!”
Reviews.Author: browneyedgurl2082
Reviews.Content: It was a horrible experience from the second we got to our room, there was blood all over our comforter and the cleaning lady had just left the room we watched her walk out and made her come back with a new one. Two days later we come back to our room to get ready for a show that we were going to and someones clothes were laying on our bed when we entered the room (they claim the cards showed no one had been in the room but offered us suites). And finally we had paid for everything flights,rooms,shows,limo rides before we ever went out to Vegas months in advance we go to check out and they want to charge a "resort fee" of 60.00 per room for stuff that was never used... Don't you think people should know about this before they check in. We travel a lot and love Vegas but will stay far far away from this place.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to avoid the MTV-like crowd, stay somewhere else.”
Reviews.Author: ArtimusPrime
Reviews.Content: We were traveling to a family birthday party, so we had to bring our 7 year old son. Knowing that Vegas isn't exactly kid-friendly, we looked up "family friendly" hotels, and the Monte Carlo showed up on several lists. We figured that with the wave pool and lazy river, we'd be good. We arrived on a Saturday, and after lunch, went to the pools. Whoa. The pool area was packed with 20-somethings in tattoos and skimpy outfits jiggling to the hard-driving thumping music, drinking everywhere, including in the pools (the pool rules specifically prohibit this, but no one stopped it). We had to stay for a little while because the kid was desperate for the pool, and we eventually managed to find seats that weren't right in front of the DJ. But the lazy river was pointless because it was filled edge to edge with the party crowd. The room was OK. A bit drab, not exactly deluxe, even though it was a Monaco Suite. The location was near the elevators, and those pool people like to party late. Every time some of them came home, they'd wake us up, sometimes with choice language. Others in our group were lucky enough to have an all night party next to them. The next morning, we took advantage of hangover time to join other weary families and get the kids some pool time. It was much quieter, but we couldn't help but be a little creeped out by what may be floating around us. The hotel had quite a few visible areas that needed additional post-party cleaning. This was Memorial Day weekend, and we weren't looking forward to another party-filled Sunday evening, so we decided to see what the hotel could do. We talked with the Assistant Manager for the Monte Carlo Hotel. We calmly explained our dissatisfaction. She was very professional and polite. She explained how the hotel had recently changed marketing campaigns that is now attracting more of the "night club scene." I asked if we could change rooms, but she said all of the suites were in the same general location, so that probably wouldn't help. She offered us a free meal. We asked about changing hotels and she said that if we could confirm a reservation at another hotel, she would be happy to work with us to get us out of our reservation. We confirmed a suite with Vdara, called the Asst Mgr back, and she did what she promised. We'll never be back to the Monte Carlo, but at least the staff was very professional. The Vdara was a huge upgrade, and since there's no casino there, it's probably more suited to families - at least as much as Vegas can be.

Reviews.Title: “No coffee pot in the room!”
Reviews.Author: Idaho_Travel_Bug
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of the pricing and pools. The outside of the hotel is beautiful. The check-in area is also beautiful. They have elevators that go to certain floors which is really nice. We were on the 21st floor, so we got on the elevator that went from floor 13 to floor 23. This way the elevators don't take so long and there are not so many people in each elevator. There were 6 elevators for our floors. You never had to wait long for one. When we got to our floor, it opened up into a huge area and there are 3 different hallways. We found our room easy enough. We had a room with two queen beds. The rooms were very spacious. There was a huge window that we got to see the beautiful view, unfortunately it was out the back of the hotel and not the strip view, but it was still nice. I was very surprised that the rooms did not have flat screen tv's. My friend had stayed at Harrah's which is an older hotel, and they even had a flat screen tv in the bathroom. Monte Carlo certainly didn't have that which is unfortunate. The thing I didn't like at all was that there was no coffee pot with coffee in the room. Why would they not have that? I didn't like that at all. You could order coffee which was $5.95 for 3 cups and $8.95 for 6 cups. I didn't do that because my friend doesn't drink coffee and I don't think I could have drank 3 cups by myself. You could also go downstairs to Starbucks or McDonalds to get coffee which is what I ended up doing, but by the time it was 11 am and I really like my coffee right when I get up. Monte Carlo really needs to change that. I also am shocked that they had a cable for internet service. Yes it is free, but to have to hook up to a cable is ridiculous. All the big hotels in Las Vegas should have fre wi-fi. I could not get on the internet if my friend was on the internet. Very frustrating. The beds were very comfortable and I slept well. However, there was no comforter on the bed! Each bed had a sheet, a light blanket and the another sheet; that's it! We had to turn the heat on to keep warm. The bathroom has the sink in the bathroom and I've never liked that, but you deal with it. Our tub/shower did not drain well at all. There was always about an inch or two of water in the bottom of the shower. I hate that. They have nice quality amenities in the bathroom. The rooms seem to be quiet. I didn't hear anything from the rooms next to us and above us. We didn't eat at any of the restaurants in the hotel. I did like having the little food court downstairs. I got my coffee from McDonalds in the morning and then one day I ate at the Mexican fast food place called Rubio's. It was very good. The have an area to eat. I would loved to have tried some of the restaurants, but we weren't there long enough. There is a tram that goes from Monte Carlo to the Bellagio which is great. It makes it a lot easier getting down the strip without having to walk so much. The tram comes every two minutes, so you don't have to wait long. Look at the sign when you walk up to the tram to know which side of the tracks you need to be on to get the next tram. One day I laid out by the pools. This is probably the best thing about Monte Carlo. There are four pools. One is a regular pool, one looks like it might be a kiddie pool, one is a wave pool and one is a lazy river. It was kept very clean and I loved the whole area. There was music playing in the background. It wasn't overwhelming loud, but it was pop music. I would suggest sitting close to the pool bar, so you don't have to walk so far to get a drink. You can't get into the pool area unless you show your room card which is nice. I don't think I would stay at this hotel again unless I was coming down with kids so they could play in the pools. I will probably look elsewhere just because of the coffee not in the rooms and the fact that shower didn't drain. I feel like I could have got just as good of a deal ($50/night) going else where.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous time”
Reviews.Author: sunnyincolorado
Reviews.Content: I as well as other people was a little nervous because of some other reviews of the Monte Carlo. We got a suite room and it was wonderful. it has two bathrooms and the bed was also very comfortable. We were with a group of about 12 people. The other people who were staying with us at the hotel did have some issues with the shower pressure but other than that the rooms were fine. They also used the spa which was 5 bucks a day and had everything you could ever need in there and they took showers down there after sweating out all of our "toxins" from partying it up. The pools were great. it was not crowded while we were there during the week. The lazy river was really fun. the pool bar was of course expensive but we got refillable cup for $16 and then could get refills for $11. The bar inside towards the street of dreams does have refills for $1 cheaper but the drinks didnt seems as strong and were a lot sweeter. I highly reccomend the peach bellini at the outside pool bar. The buffet was not overly impressively but good enough. I did not give this review 5 stars or whatever just because of the showers in the other rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dinny80
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a wonderful trip at the Monte Carlo Resort & Casino. The service was exceptional, the room was nice and clean. I utilized the fitness center and it offered a wide range of equipments. It was also very clean. The Monte Carlo Resort is in a great location on the strip, very close to the MGM, New York New York and the new hotel ARIA. The best thing about this resort is that the casino is small and not overwhelming. I would highly recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Reviews should be much better...”
Reviews.Author: Debers17
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Monte Carlo 5/23 - 5/26 and very much enjoyed our stay. I'm beginning to think people expect WAY too much in this day and age and I'm only 32!!! From all the reviews I was a bit nervous to stay at this hotel, but as it was comped (our first for Vegas!) I didn't want to lose the opportunity to stay in a property we've never even stepped foot in. This hotel has become my new favorite place to stay. Even if I never receive another comp offer again, I would still pay to stay at the MC. From reading a few trip advisor trip reports on the message boards, I was left with the impression that the walking/travel time between City Center and MC was a bit of a treck. To my surprise, the walk to the tram, which took us to Bellagio, was not even a 5 min walk. And the walk from MC to Aria was even less. It was literally a hop, skip and a jump away from the end of the Street of Dreams. Once inside the Aria, you could simply cross straight over to the lobby area and enter the Crystals mall. We were given a deluxe room on the 26th floor, room 324. I honestly believe I had a better "strip" view than the strip views would give. We could see the "backside" of the NYNY and the coaster (which never could be heard), the Excalibur, the Luxor, the Mandalay Bay and The Hotel. At night, we had a lit up "strip" view to the left with a gorgeous city and mtn view in from of us. Our room overlooked the main entrance to the MC hotel. The only complaint I would have was that the bathtub was clogged with a slow drain, however having been involved in a large festival just before arriving, my husband had been on his feet for most of the day and welcomed the soaking of his feet as he showered, so it wasn't an issue that bothered us enough to even call maintainence. The beds were comfy, the food court had a good selection of eatery's and the buffet was delicious. Being on a budget this trip, we chose not to eat at any of the more expensive restaurants, though the menus seemed to offer a large variety of dishes at decent prices. The pool area during the week was not crowded in the least. At noon we decided to head down to the lazy river and had no issues finding a seat. In fact there were a 3 chairs available right next to the women's restroom right in front of the lazy river and no one wanted them because they were shaded. By the time we had made several trip around the lazy river, the sun was shining bright on them and I was able to sunbathe and get dried off before heading back up to our room. My husband and I are not big gamblers in the least. Though we didn't hit any jackpots, we were able to put our money in the slots (all we played this trip) and it would last enough to keep us entertained for hours. I found it funny that during the day the slots seemed "looser" than in the evenings when there seemed to be more people in the casinos. Even the Aria paid us pretty good that we came back to the MC with more $ the we went in with, but then was quickly put right back. I don't go to Vegas with the expectations of winning big, just enough to keep me entertained, which was the case for us! All in all we had a wonderful relaxing time (which is all we expected out of our trip). I honestly believe that some people's expectations are so high that once they arrive to a hotel and their expectations are not met they immediately give the hotel a bad review. We really enjoyed the MC and plan to return again at the end of the year even if I have to pay for my room :oD

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel value”
Reviews.Author: Dexter_J
Reviews.Content: Nice room, good restaurants, great location on the strip, friendly & helpful staff, nice pool area. The only drawback was the thin walls that made it hard to sleep from noise. If you need your beauty rest, bring earplugs. Overall a very god experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: MalekV
Reviews.Content: It's a strip hotel closer to the middle than some others; cheaper than Caesar's or the Venetian. We did the internet special type room ~$200 a night for the weekend with the "strip view". The room was adequate, the beds were fine, there were no amenities. The furniture was boring and the television was your typical Motel 6 RCA, the carpet was there and had the look of well-worn high-traffic commercial carpet. I'll usually stay at a Hampton Inn for business trips and their rooms are better appointed than the Monte Carlo. The "Strip View" is a joke. While you do have a strip view, our wing was set back behind the casino. Other than the big HRC guitar, and a sign that says "ROSS - Coming Soon" there was nothing to view on the strip. Obviously the windows don't open and that's a shame because we couldn't clean a spot in or to actually see out - they were filthy. The room itself was clean except for the moths - one dead, one alive. The rest of the hotel was fine. We arrived early (about 6 hours before normal checkin) and were still taken care of right away. There was no line at that time and the front desk staff was quick and courteous. One thing I really like is that the front desk area is not buried inside the casino. From the taxi dropoff to checkin to the elevators we never had to wheel our luggage through the casino. The elevators themselves are somewhat slow and lines had a habit of forming at the elevator banks but that can be expected on a weekend. Overall a good experience but there are better hotels on the strip for about the same money. Never did find the City Center tram. I would recommend, but only if you were going to be on the South end of the strip for an event.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay on the strip. Loved the lazy river and pools!”
Reviews.Author: riversnorthwest
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo feels like new. It's not as huge as some of the other hotels which we liked. More reasonable to stay here then many of the others but it's just as nice or nicer. The new Aria is next door - very easy to get to, also MGM, and New York New York. Will definitely stay there again! If you have a rental car be sure to see Valley of Fire. Just a one hour drive - spectacular scenery, even saw a big horn sheep!

Reviews.Title: “Solid choice and value on Strip”
Reviews.Author: ShowMeVegas
Reviews.Content: Let me state at the beginning that I stayed here on a complimentary promotion however I would have booked here even had I not received the offer due to the location, ambiance and value of the property. The check-in process was quick, courteous and seamless. I was very pleased with access to the property from the Strip, to my room from the lobby and casino, to City Center via monoral and walking, and to the pool area. Though not opulent, the hotel decor is attractive and upscale for a value property. The elevator configuration makes room access a breeze. The room was adequate for our needs. While the decor was bland, the bedding and temperature was comfortable. The bathroom was of decent size and in good repair. The floor (21st) was quiet and very accommodating for sleep and rest. It was a solid, basic room. The casino appeals to those like myself who enjoy a comfortable, relaxed place to play with decent cocktail service on the floor. The drinks were weak but the waitresses were attentive. The sports book is intimate with enough ammenities to watch a game or a few races but I wouldn't stay beyond this. The seating was adequate but not plush. The pool area was good with excellent access and a lazy river feature. Arrive early if you want a selection of loungers. The only negatives I experienced was a small bit of trash in the room when I arrived but was attributed to someone who left a take-out lunch in their room after express checkout. There was a moth infestation in the room the three days we were there which was annoying. The television was an old, small tube instead of the updated flat screens popular in other properties. I usually don't watch TV in my room but did so for an NBA game one evening and would have enjoyed a better viewing experience. Since we did not have a laptop with us we asked that the resort fee for internet access be removed and were told this would be addressed at checkout by casino marketing. At checkout, our request was denied. The $14.50 for internet, a newspaper kiosk in the public area, ftiness center, and two tiny bottles of water per day was ridiculous. If you detest resort fees as a gouging tactic or on principle, stay elsewhere. I dont mind paying fees for services used but not a non-selective, blanket assessment of arbitrary fees. If you are looking for a property at a good value, with adequate ammenities, a decent room and a location with good access to other properties, then the Monte Carlo is a very safe choice as a base to take advantage of what Las Vegas offers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: btravel_10
Reviews.Content: Spent 4days, 3 nights at Monte Carlo. Had a great non smoking room on the 31st floor. Got a room right away, arrived around 8pm. Gave us 1 bed instead of 2 beds. Straighten out right awayand apologetic. The food is left to be desired. Suggest you eat elsewhere. Location was great. The casino is small compared to the larger hotels on the strip. Although walked a lot, also took their bus service to get around. Overall, had a great Vacation. Yes, would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to complain about”
Reviews.Author: brandi0825
Reviews.Content: Arriving to the Monte Carlo i was a little nervous after all of the reviews i had read here, BUT i was totally happy with everything from the ease of the parking to check in and our room. The room was a basic room, clean with a very comfortable bed. The only complaint that i have with the room was it was at the end of the very long hallway. I have to remember next time to request a room closer to the elevators and ice machine. I really feel that most people that are reviewing on here are serioulsy way too picky. the restaurants were really good and well priced. the noodle company we did feel for the quantity of food it was a little over priced. We have stayed many places on the strip (mgm, tropicana, excalibur, TI,) and this would be ranked #2 out of the ones we stayed at, MGM being #1. we would totally stay here again and again and again! only regret is we didnt try the Diablos!!

Reviews.Title: “Fine for the guys”
Reviews.Author: RamblinHoosier
Reviews.Content: This is a lower cost strip hotel for a reason. The common areas are nice but the rooms are tired and the mattresses old. If you're looking for a glitzy room pay up and go somewhere nicer but if you just use the room to shower, change and crash in like we do this place has a good location, a food court and nice dealers with lower strip table limits. The pool area is small and they go for an MTV spring break vibe but it worked ok. As with all MGM properties getting rated takes work. Unless you note with the boss when you start and stop they give much lower playing time. The resort fee is an annoying fact of life in Vegas since the town went on life support.

Reviews.Title: “The reviews were miss leading. Kim Bel Air MD”
Reviews.Author: 1972Kim
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 days the was room we were in was clean and not all beat up. The fact that there is a tram car that s right inside the hotel was great. I did buy a cupcake from the cupcake stand for $ 4.00 that was not fresh so i was disappointed with that but that was about it .The staff was friendly . And I did here my neighbor flush the toilet one night but it did not bother me . There was nothing exciting about the place but it was alright .They could stand to upgrade TV.The resort fee at the end is a bit much we paid a 101.50 at the check will definitely checking and trying not to stay at places that charge a resort fee again it a rip off.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: cathy818
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not a total bust, it just didn't live up to the reviews I saw ahead of time or their "four diamond" AAA rating. The towels were thin, the bed was on the uncomfortable side, there was a hair or two in the bathtub, a rip in the wallpaper and broken (but poorly repaired) picture frame. The fixtures in this place are some cheap gold finish and the bathtub spout was turning silver. The look of the room was quite nice, but perhaps not maintained as well as you would hope.

Reviews.Title: “Four Stars Does Not mean a 4 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: joyinlagunahills
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to say, this is not a 4 star hotel, in the AAA sense. For some reason, the ratings of all of the big Las Vegas hotels always seems inflated.The rooms at the Monte Carlo are certainly ok. Clean and comfortable, but hardly plush or luxurious. This is a nice decent hotel. I liked the buffet. Not overblown but good quality well prepared food. I liked the casino (reasonably good paying slots etc. but of course they can and do change the odds in a heartbeat, depends on the day of the week, time of the year, time of day, etc. I haven't quite figured out the pattern, but I can tell when the odds are different). As for location, it is excellent, but remember, the distances even to a next door hotel are enormous. To reach the Bellagio is at least a 20 minute walk. But this is nevertheless a good strip location in a nice area. There is a Walgreen's as "next door" as anything in Las Vegas can actually be. The pool and exercise room are very nice. The resort fee is an additional $12.95 per day and if you are on a budget be sure and ask about whether the fee is mandatory (sometimes they offer a package deal, sometimes not.) For a nice reasonably priced visit to Las Vegas the Monte Carlo is a good choice. It is about twice as nice as the real budget places (the Imperial Palace for example which for some reason manages to get 3 stars (or circles) on TripAdvisor).

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed The Monte Carlo!”
Reviews.Author: chollinger
Reviews.Content: We went to the Monte Carlo for 3 nights in May. We arrived at the hotel around 11:30 a.m. and checked right in; there was no waiting. Our room was on the 10th floor, overlooking the pool area and City Center. As a flight attendant, I'm used to hotel rooms and this one was very average--basic beds, TV, desk and cleaning amenities. The location is ideal, although personally I find City Center to be an eyesore. The hotel is in the heart of everything, and within walking distance to a lot of what The Strip has to offer. There are a lot of restaurants and other great hotels (MGM Grand, NY NY) in close proximity. Several chain restaurants (Hard Rock Cafe, Denny's, McDonald's) are nearby as well, in addition to excellent specialty restaurants. The pool area is beautiful, although they play extremely loud music throughout the day, so if you enjoy napping, request a room that is not poolside. The lazy river was very crowded, as were the private cabana areas. There were always plenty of seats near each of the pools. The staff that we encountered was very helpful and friendly. The casino was fun, and seemed to have more penny slots than most of the other casinos on the Strip. We didn't win much of anything, but the video machines with the bonus games seemed to hit quite a bit and make what little we were spending last quite some time. I've stayed at the Sahara in the past, and as a budget traveler, the Monte Carlo is far superior. I would not hesitate to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “After reading reviews, I was concerned, yet NICE over all stay!!”
Reviews.Author: KTWalters
Reviews.Content: Lobby was lovely. Pool was nice, loud at times, but we stayed by the more quiet side. Drinks were expensive (recommend going inside to get the slushy drinks and bring back to pool with you - much better quality and much cheaper!) Room was clean, bed was comfy. Only bad thing to say, the water in the sink drained very slowly...but who cares. All in all, excellent location and fun Pub bar/restaurant with excellent food and 2 Starbucks in the shoppes! Can't beat that. For more details, check my blog www.Katie-Walters.com

Reviews.Title: “Okay Hotel For Its Location”
Reviews.Author: LuverOfTraveling
Reviews.Content: I've been to Las Vegas many times (living in southern CA makes it an easy drive to get there), and I'm the type of traveler who prefers to stay in a hotel on 'The Strip', in the middle of the action. I had always seen the Monte Carlo as I walked by, and others I know have stayed there and liked it, so I decided to give it a try. I had checked other hotels in the area, comparing their prices, and the rate I found for the Monte Carlo was pretty reasonable. I checked their website, and realized they charge a $12.95 plus tax mandatory Resort Fee (daily), but we went ahead and booked a room. This Resort Fee covers the cost of two 12-oz bottles of water (our first night we only had one on the desk), a newspaper, use of their fitness center and the business center that we weren't interested in using. Even though we stayed there for Saturday and Sunday nights, the price was still good for where we were located on 'The Strip'. To start, I had read the reviews on this site, and especially paid attention to the negative reviews. I took my chances, and this is what we experienced there: Upon entering the main lobby, we noticed there was no line, so we were checked in quickly. After getting to the room, and opening the door, we noticed trash strewn all over the room; a sheet pulled off of one of the beds; bath water still in the tub, with the shower curtain inside of the tub and more trash on the bathroom floor. I immediately became upset, and my boyfriend got on the phone to report what we found. He was put on hold; he waited for approximately 3 minutes, then hung up and we went back downstairs to tell them what we found and asked for another room. The girl behind the counter apologized and assigned us to a room on a higher floor with a nice view of the City Center buildings and the pools. I also asked her to make sure to report this to whomever she needed, so that we're not charged for the damages. The room is decorated okay and was very clean. Since we're experienced travelers, we were shocked to find out that the hotel charges $100 per day for the incidental fee; since we were there for two nights, they had to hold $200.... which we expect to get back within a few days. On our 2nd night there, around 3pm, after returning to the room after being out for 6 hours, the room had not been cleaned. I began assuming the hotel may have cutbacks on staff, so they don't get to many rooms until the afternoon hours. The housekeeper eventually showed up, and my boyfriend told her we needed clean towels, but he didn't say anything to her about taking out the trash and dirty towels. As for the furniture, it does look a little outdated, but it was decorated enough to not look too boring. The bed was okay, but the pillows were awful. I don't know if this is something that occurs daily, but the pool area closed between 5-6pm, which is strange, since this is Nevada and why close so early.... they should remain open until at least 9pm, in my opinion. The pools aren't too big, but they have a 'lazy river' and a wave pool for everyone to enjoy. I was able to sit in the pool area with a laptop and still received wireless internet access. Would I stay here again? Yes I would, if the price is right and due to its location, but I will for sure look for better places next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great pool”
Reviews.Author: BGK190479
Reviews.Content: Great hotel at the Strip in Las Vegas.It is easy to get a cheap room if booking i advance. The hotel is not the most spectacular, but the hotel pools are regarded as some of the best in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RosamondRosamondguy
Reviews.Content: My recent stay at Monte Carlo was what I expected. The Monte Carlo is a classy-looking hotel with white marble floors and gleaming chandeliers. Check-in and check-out were both quick and easy. The lobby is right there as soon as you get off the parking garage, which is a big PLUS. My room was spacious and comfortable, although it was not super luxurious. It was still really nice. In addition, Monte Carlo has a health spa and a very nice pool area. There are ten fabulous restaurants. I particularly liked Diablo's Cantina. It is an open-air Mexican restaurant in front of the hotel. They have great food and lively music. It is a fun place to eat. Also, the food and service in the 24-hour Cafe are excellent. Monte Carlo has impressionist Frank Caliendo highlighting in the Lance Burton Theater. He is very entertaining (without being vulgar). Imagine that! Monte Carlo is in a great location, right next door to New York New York and across the street from the MGM Grand. It is also connected with the new City Center complex and the new Aria Hotel. Monte Carlo has reasonable rates compared to other hotels on the strip. The top floor (the 32nd) is called Hotel 32 and features super luxurious rooms and luxury amenities for those who are willing to pay a little more. I enjoyed my stay at Monte Carlo and would recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed, after waiting years to stay here.”
Reviews.Author: nevdestine
Reviews.Content: All day to get my room, 5 hours. Not until I threatened to leave did they all of sudden find a clean room. I think they wanted to keep me gambling. No coffee in the room. Only one Starbucks was open. First morning 27 people in line at Starbucks, 24 people in line at McDonalds. I had to hike(yes hike) over to New York to get coffee every monrning for 4 mornings. Excercise was good but you had to plan everything. Pizza place was good and convenient. THE ROOM WAS VERY, VERY CLEAN. They have a great cleaning crew. I notice these things. I asked for a room near the elavator and was stuck at the end of what seemed like a 2 day walk to get to the room. I asked for a bottom floor, and they stuck me on the next to top floor. The elevators kept breaking down. At one point only 1 of 6 elevators worked. We were packed on like rats. That is why I ask for a low floor. Heater and air did not work right. I had to leave the window open and then a wind tunnel happen when ever the elevator open. Gambling was tight, slots were tight. They kept openning and shutting tables. To get my free cash offer was like a gauntet, nobody understood how to get $20 in free offer. There were several language issues with players club and with the cashiers. After 4 days and nights of gambling on the tables and slots, they said I had a negative balance in comps. That I was in the hole. Zero comps after 5 days because they said they comped my hotel. They sent me the 4 nights free to get me there, I did not ask for it. Would I go back, NEVER. Why? Can't accumulate comps.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location, Very Nice Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: spidora2002
Reviews.Content: We are a 41 year old couple who travels frequently to Vegas; this is my 14th time and I try to stay some place different each time. After researching the Monte Carlo I thought it would be an excellent place to stay. I looked on line and saw a beautiful lobby, beautiful pool area and thought it would be perfect. I booked my trip and then started reading the reviews I have to say I was a little nervous and even contemplated upgrading to a more expensive hotel; let me tell you this hotel is perfectly fine to stay at. The hotel is in a perfect location across from MGM and New York New York, the pool area is berautiful with a swimming pool, wave pool, lazy river, food and beverage service outside is offered. The casino is not huge but by no means is it small it is a nice size casino; there are plenty of slots and tables available. They have a 24 hour cafe which is reasonably priced and the food (breakfast lunch dinner served at anytime) it is very good and you get nice size portions. Burger and Fries figure about $12.00. They have a 24 hour food court with McDonalds, Subway, Baskin Robbins, Sbarro and a Mexican fast food options as well. The rooms were just fine; nothing formal but not a Motel 6/Circus Circus either. Housekeeping was in everyday with clean towels and bottled water (which keep in mind all the hotels now charge $12.00 a day surcharge in addition to your room rate). This hotel by no means is the Bellagio or Venetian or Wynn, but you are also paying half the price. This is NOT a seedy, dirty hotel it was clean and offered not only the food court and cafe but also a buffet restaurant and an upscale French restaurant and Steak Restaurant and Diablos restaurant which is a fun indoor/outdoor Mexican/American restaurant. I would definitely stay here again; I would have no reason not to, there is food, nightlife gambling and pool. I am convinced that people can have a bad experience in any hotel, you could stay at the best hotel in the world and you would still find people who will complain; look at the complaints posted: the WIFI was not working the rooms were loud, for gosh sakes your on vacation, put the computer away and have fun. If you have been to Vegas then you know how much there is to do at night - by the time we went to bed we were so exhausted we never heard a peep, the hallways were quite. The chances of you being in your room the exact same time the people next to you are is slim; it's Vegas everyone is on a different schedule. The night life was lively, the food was good, the rooms were clean, the locations is PERFECT and the price is reasonable. Do not be afraid to stay at this hotel I would certainly recommend it. I have had numerous people also recommend this hotel to me and I am glad I stayed here. The only negative thing I have to say is if you use a players card at the tables (Black Jack, Let it Ride, Poker) you must bet at least $10.00 for points to register; big deal - players cards work in all the slots and you can still use your card at all the other qualifying hotels if you want to find a $5.00 table - Big deal right!!! Take it from a person who travels frequently and has been to Vegas numerous times. I have stayed at many different Vegas Hotels and I would say that if you are on a budget but want a great location and nice hotel; certainly do not be afraid to stay here I really do not believe you will be dissappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Don't look for service!”
Reviews.Author: gapiwei2006
Reviews.Content: We new this property is in the middle of the price range, however decided to choose it over the Flamingo(we have stayed there 3 times and love it) However, wanted to try the South end of the strip and Monte Carlo. We didn't expect rooms comparable to the Venetian, but we did expect basic comfort, and service. Did we get comfort and service? Arrival, the lobby, casino, food court are nice. However, the rooms: Black mold in shower, broken faucet, bed was broken, angled so badly you could see it. We asked to fix the sink, remove mold, and rectify the bed. We could not switch rooms, as they had none available at that time, however maybe later on possibly?? Well they came to fix the issues, however bed was still an issue (slept with head at the feet instead) sink broke within 3rd time of using again, and mold was not gone. We called again to front desk, when we asked for compensation, they gave us $50 credit for the buffet/cafe. They did not offer anything, or an apology. Bye this time it was the 2nd night, and said forget it, not worth to move all our stuff. If we had been staying longer than 3 nights, we would have moved hotels. The pool does have partial sun through out the day, but you can find areas with plenty of sunlight. The chairs are comfortable, and good amenities. However, pool management is confused, they have packed the chairs 1 next to the other, you are not enable you move or walk beside your chair. We were told this was because they needed space to get out in case of fire, however 2 of the days we were there, the room between the chairs was so narrow you could walk in many areas. They were more concerned how the chairs looked, and they had laid flat, then the customers. They would move a chair over if you had got up to get lunch, or swim, even with your items on it! I spoke to 2 supervisor/managers, and they said it was direction from there Managers. No one took responsibility for the fact that they were banging, and moving chairs 4 times in 1 afternoon while you are trying to enjoy the sun. Not so relaxing. We have travelled to over 30 resorts and never!! ever had this type of situation occur at a pool. However, come Friday at lunch time, they turned up the music, brought out the party girls and staff were every where....even some said hello. Where we were the during the week? I would never travel to this property again. There rooms need a total overhaul!

Reviews.Title: “A nice suprise!”
Reviews.Author: Travlerfl1
Reviews.Content: Paid for Delux Queen room with a high view. Perfectly placed on the 29th floor, spacious and the first traveling room we have ever had that had NO oder, none! The 29th is also a designated non-smoking floor. This room had a view of the distant mountains and the new City Center. Convenient location to both the center and south strip. Across the street is a new Denny's with clean friendly prices. The monorail is not such a good choice, the taxis are expensive, but at times necessary. Take good walking shoes. Airport to hotel was $15, hotel to Imperial palace $10 and to Fremont Street (we didn"t go) $25 each way. Monte Carlo is linked to the City Center project and Ballegio via a free elevated tram and some walking. See shows: Terry Vader at Mirage (under a 100 million $ contract for 10 years & Human Nature at Imperial Palace (MoTown from ausse) that have just been voted best singers in LV, you will be thanking yourself for years for both! Monte Carlo Casino is as others have said more quiet than some other casinos. I complement MC on the organized layout and it seems fewer smokers frequent the casino...nice for those of us that have a sense of health. Great elevator speed and a direct, thru the casino walk to the strip. Walking is easier on the east (other) side of the street due to continued construction on parts of City Center and some awkward strip crossovers. Many crossovers are available but we choose to use the ped . x way at the traffic light right outside the hotel. Walgreens and CVS are just a few steps away on the strip. ABC store is across the street and is more of a sundry store than the typical ABC. They have a suitable, but limited, choice of spirits. Hope this will add to your trip. We are a active couple in our 60's who are well travelled.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, good location.”
Reviews.Author: nick1534
Reviews.Content: Check in took about 20 minutes, apparently the 1 group ahead of us had an issue and it took a few minutes longer than normal. Once we got up to the desk, we were there less than 5 minutes. Our room was on the 21st floor with a view of the mountains, the Orleans, and a side view of the NY NY and roller coaster. We saw a couple of beautiful sunsets. The room was very clean, housekeeping was right on top of everything. Yes, the room looked a little dated. They are due for a perk-up soon. But the fact that it was clean was the deciding factor. The hallways were kept clear of room service items. Housekeeping also seemed very unobtrusive. If you had the Do Not Disturb sign out, they did not disturb. We were able to hear some noises from other rooms, but not enough to ruin our stay. At the end of a day in Vegas, we were tired! I like the fact that you do not have to walk through the casino to get to the pool. The food court was adequate. Our group ate at several places during our stay and everything was fine. The casino gave us some play for our money. When you put $ in a slot machine, you got some bonus rounds and it kept you there for a while, it didn't just suck up all your money. I understand the odds of playing slots, but I just want a little entertainment. The weather was not cooperative to get to the pool until the weekend and of course it was very busy. Hard to find 2 chairs together after mid morning. The music is played loudly as reported here before, but at least it was something you could tolerate. Overall everyone seemed to have a good time in the pool areas. I would return to this hotel again, but probably after checking out other properties. Simply put, there is just so much to see and so many hotels to try out. The location of this hotel is good for going north or south on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: scubabug
Reviews.Content: Clean and comfortable but nothing special. The dinner buffet was not good, the other hotels were much better. Carpet in the room was stained. Watch out for the resort fees which is an additional charge being added by all the hotels in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “I will never go back They ruined my 30th birthday.”
Reviews.Author: Tclingenpeel
Reviews.Content: I went to Vegas for my 30th birthday. I was excited to find a table that was completly opened. All my friends sat down to play black Jack. Mechelle was our dealer if you see here stay clear. I tried to talk to her and ask a question about a hand. She was silent and didn't even acknowledge me. My husband asked if it was company policy that they can't talk and she lost it. She yelled are you talking to me and made a huge scene. Then she told my friend that her us passport looked like it could be bought at a swap meet. Never ever go there. I work for a company that has great customer service and now I know what horrable service is.

Reviews.Title: “relaxing location for south strip fun”
Reviews.Author: NY2LA2London2Sydney
Reviews.Content: Went for a birthday getaway with a friend. I have stayed at Mirage and MGM in the past, and what I really like about the Monte Carlo is that it's not massive; you're not walking for miles and miles to navigate the place. The pool was bustling but we were always able to find 2 chairs for sunbathing (and unlike another reviewer, I didn't think the towels were dirty at all!). We had tix for shows at MGM and Excalibur (I ALWAYS see Thunder from Down Under when i'm in Vegas), and this place was an oasis in the middle of the busy, cheesy-themed resorts of the South Strip. We didn't eat at the restaurants but enjoyed the food court for quick, cheap bites. Went elsewhere for fancier meals since I'm a foodie. My friend and I enjoy the club scene on the north end of the strip, and for girls in high heels, we had to cab it, unfortunately. That's the only negative I can think of. Resort fee: duh. Who doesn't charge one these days? This hotel is very nice and a great deal. It wasn't noisy, but it wasn't dead and filled with senior citizens and children either. Not a lot of smoking either, unlike some other nearby hotels (yuck). I would recommend this hotel if you want to stay on the South Strip, for sure. Free and ample parking is a huge plus.

Reviews.Title: “Good value right on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: jerseyshoredeb
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo wasn't my first choice to stay in Vegas, but the price was right for a weekend getaway. The hotel and casino is pretty much thin and long to walk from the back out to the Strip. The rooms are decent and clean but nothing overly wowing. There is a Food Court with a McDonald's, Starbucks, Panda Express. Longest lines I've ever seen at a Starbucks except for LAX in the morning. The pool is just OK. There was a DJ but the way the area is situated that a lot of the chairs do not get sun until the afternoon since it's blocked by other buildings. There is a lazy river which is nothing compared to the one at the MGM. There is also wave pool which was nice. The pool bar is ridiculously priced, even more so than expected in Vegas ($75 for 2 salads, a turkey wrap, and 2 alcoholic drinks). Bottles of water are $5, they will not give you tap water, but they will give you a cup with ice and then you need to fill it up at the water fountain near the bathrooms. Check-in/out was relatively simple and easy. Not long of a wait for someone to help you. The parking deck for self-parking is large and it's free. It's in the way back of the hotel but it's really not too long of a walk to the elevators to the rooms. Clientele ranged the gamut to bachelorette parties, families, young groups of guys, older couples and retirees. Plenty of tables ranging from $5 to $100+ minimum. Lots of slots, many only 1, 2 or 5 cents. Diablo's Cantina right out front was the happening place - still going strong at 3 am when we walked by.

Reviews.Title: “Going to cost you more than you think!”
Reviews.Author: CJ4UNME
Reviews.Content: Wife and I planned and paid for our airfare/hotel up front, thinking we got a great deal. Upon check in found out about the additional "Resort Fee" that no one told us about. $12.95 plus tax per day. One other thing that we were not pleased about, was the paper thin walls. Were woke up early every morning by noise from housekeeping, loud couples, etc. Other than that, Monte Carlo is still a very nice place to stay and we did enjoy Frank Caliendo, the casino, pool, and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Morrcoop
Reviews.Content: I come to Vegas every April for a large broadcasting convention and have stayed in many different resorts up and down the strip. The Monte Carlo is my new favorite place to stay on the strip. You can't beat the location, and unlike many of the larger resorts, the hotel is fairly compact and convenient to your room and to the parking lot. When you step off the elevator it's a short walk in any direction to reach the lobby, the food court (including Starbuck's), the escalator to the self parking garage, and the pool. You don't have to trek all the way through the casino to get to any of these -- a plus in my book. It's also a quick walk, or tram ride, to the new Aria complex (in City Center) that is absolutely gorgeous. A must do for a stroll after dinner one night. I know that other reviewers have been upset with the daily resort fee but I'm not one of them. All the resorts are now charging a mandatory fee and Monte Carlo's includes use of the gym, a daily newspaper, bottles of water and Internet connection. These are all things I need and want when traveling so I'm not bothered by the fee, but if you don't want any of these you will, no doubt, be annoyed by having to pay for it. Also, virtually no Vegas resort has a coffee maker in the room so there's no use complaining about it -- they want to get you out of your room and into the restaurants and food court. After your workout treat yourself to the stream room, jacuzzi and sauna, which are guaranteed to leave you relaxed and ready to got on with your day. Our room overlooked the pool and City Center complex so it was quiet at night and with a beautiful view. The room was newly remodeled, very clean and nicely appointed. Not luxurious, but definitely nicer than other resorts in the same price range that I've stayed in. For this long-time Vegas visitor Monte Carlo is an excellent choice for mid-priced strip resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Not as nice as I was expecting”
Reviews.Author: RamblingRed
Reviews.Content: I've mostly stayed at the more budget hotels when visiting Vegas, so I was happy to get a chance to stay at the Monte Carlo, a hotel that always looked nice to me. Honestly, it just didn't meet my expectations. The lobby and the service was very good, but the rooms and the smokiness let me down. I booked a nonsmoking room but was given a smoking room, which was smelly and still had the previous occupant's trash on the desk. I went back down and asked for a nonsmoking and was told that the only nonsmoking would be their extra $10/night "premium" rooms (the only premium was that they were higher up. Woo hoo, a better view of the parking garage.) The room was fine - clean, but worn, and they fixed it up nicely each day. The bed was pretty hard and scratchy, though. It was a good deal during the week, but the weekend price just wasn't worth it (especially without including breakfast or wireless, but then that's the truth for most strip hotels). By the way, make sure to wave the "resort fee" if you don't want to pay the $14/day for wireless and a free bottle of water.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the price”
Reviews.Author: kmc2010
Reviews.Content: Vegas has some very good deals out there now! We booked this trip through US Airways Vacations and chose the Monte Carlo because of its price. The added perks were the excellent health club, the location on the Strip, and the rooms were a decent size and still in good shape. The hotel does charge a resort fee of $12.95 a day. This does include access to the fitness center, internet access, newspaper, complimentary faxing and printing from business center and 2 free waters daily. Lunch at the Dragon Noodle was great for the price. d Vino was a solid dinner place. Excellent meat and cheese platters and wine value. Service was wanting though.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, not luxurious”
Reviews.Author: annc123
Reviews.Content: I had high hopes for this hotel, but it was just OK. We reserved a King non-smoking strip view, and they could not honor our reservation (which I find very annoying... what's the point of a reservation?) We were sent up to the 26th floor, only to find that our Queen room was still being cleaned. Had to call down to the front desk, and they got us a king non-smoking but no strip view (which I didn't care about.... wish they had asked if we would take a non-view room over the 2 queen room that wasn't even cleaned!) The room was pretty dated but it was clean. We ate at the Pub, and the food was good but it took over 20 minutes just to get a beer. The place wasn't crowded.... just bad service. The pool area is nice but cramped. Casino was on the small side, but that was OK with us. If you can get a good rate, this hotel is a decent choice because of the location. Don't forget to add the $14.50 (tax included) resort fee to any price you find.

Reviews.Title: “Stay for the location, not the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: TravelingElTimo
Reviews.Content: Everything was strikingly average. From the rooms to the food to the gaming. The pool area (wave pool, lazy river, hot-tub, pool) was nice, but gets crowded quickly and doesn't offer a lot of privacy. Location is nearly as close to ideal as one can get. From here it is easy to get to nearly all the south-strip hotels. All-in-all, nothing stands out as particularly great or terrible... just an average hotel with average amenities at an average price.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, bad room condition”
Reviews.Author: hguo0806
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a very good location, next to the new city center, and New York New York hotel. Can take TRAM to city center and Bellagio. Outdoor pool is very cool, kids will love it. Room is kind of old and out of dated. It is older than the Motel 6 room I stayed this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Some good, some bad”
Reviews.Author: nmbjs
Reviews.Content: Checked in at 10am with no wait during spring break. Room was clean with minor wear on furniture. Given the age of the place it is well kept. The reports of thin walls and hallway noise are dead on but things quieted down enough at night for me to sleep. At 5am there is lots of plumbing noise and it woke me up every morning. Service was great from the front desk to the restaurants to housekeeping. The only place I didn't care for the service was at The Pub. The Pub was not that busy with 4 bartenders working and long waits to get served. The buffet was mediocre. For a couple more dollars you can get a fantastic buffet at Bellagio. I never thought much for the Monte Carlos location but the new tram to Bellagio changes things a lot. It's so much easier to access the center strip now. The casino is small but they had a good variety of games and it was always easy to find a seat. Overall I liked the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice casino , average rooms”
Reviews.Author: McTraveler74
Reviews.Content: My wife, siblings and I stayed at the Monte Carlo this past weekend and would have to say most of the reviews found here are correct. The beds were pretty uncomfortable and the bathroom was dark and plain. Very average room. For people in their 20's on a tight budget who do not plan on spending much time in the room, this hotel is fine. Others like myself who value a comfortable bed and good night's sleep should look into another resort. I have stayed at The Venetian and Caesar's Palace before, and there is no comparison. On the positive side, The Monte Carlo's casino is pretty nice and the location is superb - right next door to CVS, right across the street from a couple of liquor stores if you like to drink relatively cheap , and right next door to New York New York. There's nothing really "wrong" with the Monte Carlo, but if you're going to party in Las Vegas why not spend the extra few hundred dollars on one of the 4 star resorts. They're just noticibly nicer. Side note: one of the previous reviews complained about the pornography on the streets (i.e., business card sized ads for strip clubs and adult chat phone numbers that are passed out everywhere) and that he was disturbed his 6 yr old was exposed to nude images. I cannot stress this enough - THE LAS VEGAS STRIP IS NOT A PLACE FOR CHILDREN. There is absolutely no reason anyone under the age of 18 should be vacationing there. Personally I believe anyone who brings their kids to Vegas should be investigated by child protective services, but that's just me.

Reviews.Title: “Do as I say, not as I do...spend a little extra and stay someplace else without so many kids!”
Reviews.Author: NatalieKansasCity
Reviews.Content: The rooms were dirty (found condoms on the floor under the bed, and hair and ??? all over the bathroom floor) Towels had not been replaced, linens were not fresh, toiletries were partially used. Requested a clean room and were told none were available, but they would send someone to clean...that happened the next day. The pool was like Romper Room...isn't Vegas an adult destination? I love my kiddos, but came to Vegas for a weekend getaway. Dozens of kids screaming, splashing, crying, napping on the lounge chairs. Service was HORRIBLE! Gambling staff was rude, restaurant staff was terrible, food was bad, can I really say more? Check the pricing at some of the "NICER" hotels in town, you will be glad you spent the extra $25 a night!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend it”
Reviews.Author: terece
Reviews.Content: Hi We were at the Hotel for 5 days. We checked in at 1am and had to check out at 11pm. I was worried we would have to check out at 11am the day we left but was pleasantly surprised to find out we had the room until 11am the following day so we had the room right until check out. This hotel is so easy to get around, there are 3 elevators designated to a set of floors, we were on the 29th floor and our elevator only stopped on floors 24-31. The food court, hotel lobby, pool and mall are all accessable right from the elevators. The casino was one of the most fun and clean and we checked out alot of them. I didn't notice until I read another review but unless someone is sitting right near you smoking there is no haze hanging through the air. We never heard people or tv's in other rooms, I slept in one day and hear usual hallway noise but it was 9am. The pool area has sun all throughout the day, the pool itself got shaded in the afternoon but there were plenty of chairs in the sun. The cafe in the casino has breakfast, lunch and dinnner items 24 hours a day, I highly recommend the mandarin crepes, yummy. There is also a dollar rent a car right in the hotel, a little hard to find online, prebooked a car for a day and had no troubles. If you are looking for a foofoo hotel, pay a little extra and stay at a newer hotel, there was nothing I could complain about staying at the Monte Carlo.

Reviews.Title: “Far better than expected.”
Reviews.Author: webgemcanada
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Las Vegas and we were a little worried about how worn and used the accomodation would be at the Monte Carlo Hotel. There was no need to worry. The room was very clean and well maintained. On entering the lobby to register we were quite surprised at the luxury ot the marble and chandeliers. Registration was fast and courteous. Our room on the 25th floor was gilt and cherry wood. Clean and smell free. Dining at the many restaurants was a pleasure and the portions were good. This is the only hotel we found that didn't make you walk through the casino each time you came into the hotel. The general luxury of the public areas of the hotel are a reminder of who makes all the money in Vegas. I don't know about "What stays in Vegas" but the main thing to stay in Vegas is your money. The payouts are pretty good as we could play in the casino for some time before losing our daily allowance. The staff were extremely courteous and friendly especially in the evenings at the buffet. All told. we had a good stay and would not criticize anything about this hotel apart from the daytime noise from the swimming pool. We were on the 25th floor and couldn't doze during the day at all. Get a room that doesn't overlook the pool. That will be our only reason for not returning to the Monte Carlo.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: cshager
Reviews.Content: Everthing was good at the MC except it advertised wi fi and being part of the package an included in the resort fee. I guess they meant access. The room was fine but starting to show a little wear as many of the older hotels in vegas. The pool area was cramped with the chairs lined up right next to one another. The lazy river look like fun for kids. We didn't use it because there were so many kids. The hot tub was nasty, and the next day it was drained and closed. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: NormanAtlas
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a business conference. I work for a "cheap" company and was very concerned given the per night rate ($50.00) and based on many negative reviews. To my surprise, hotel was more than acceptable. Room was clean and quiet and plenty spacious. Hotel staff friendly and accommodating. Plenty of decent restaurants and the location extremely convenient. Definitely not in the same league as the elegant and other theme hotels on the strip, but quite acceptable for the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Sports Bar”
Reviews.Author: kev22o8
Reviews.Content: Went to the sports bar one night. Had to put up with the usual wait at the entrance to be seated . Told 20 min wait so we chose to wait at the bar. BIG MISTAKE. Between 7-9 pm drinks are double the price. 32 DOLLARS for 4 Bud Lights! When we got a table the food was awful. Everything fried and greasey. Never again. Total Rip Off.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel at OK prices for the strip.”
Reviews.Author: robmnj
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo is located in a prime location of the strip. The rooms were average, but the prices were a little high, even by comparison of other hotels in the area. Big bonus was there was free internet. It was not wireless, but free internet in a trip hotel is hard to come by.

Reviews.Title: “Good value if you get a discount and upgrade”
Reviews.Author: kquintas
Reviews.Content: We got a suite for $89 per night mid-week. It was a good value because my husband and I went with a group of friends and we used our suite for gatherings, drinks and snacks. The rooms are a bit dark and need some updating but the beds were comfortable, the room clean and the towels were good. We had a small refrig and bar in the room. I expected more things in a suite like a cork screw and some silverware. Very barron of the basic necessities. The pool was okay for kids but not great for adults. Jacuzzi was small and filled with kids and, therefore, not good for adults. But you could not beat the deal we got. If we paid full price we would have found somewhere else to stay. I will say that they had good ventilation in the casino. Can't stand cigarette smoke and most casinos are filled with smoke. They seemed to have a system that kept the air relatively clear compared to the other casinos.

Reviews.Title: “Will this be the next hotel to bite the dust on the Strip?”
Reviews.Author: Shar_Melbourne
Reviews.Content: This place is definately looking old. No frills in the rooms here, we even had to pay if we wanted wine glasses (hey we had just been to the Napa Valley!!) If any of the rooms in the vicinity used their showers we heard it loud and clear. OK I admit it was Spring Break time when we were there (we weren't aware till we arrived) but this place was like a budget motel to the college kids. If you need somewhere to stay which is quite reasonable priced then this is for you. The location is fairly good but you could hear a whole lot of noice from NYNY next door as well. But then again... who goes to Vegas to sleep??

Reviews.Title: “Don't book through Southwest Airlines”
Reviews.Author: Chitown55
Reviews.Content: The check in process was terrible. Once they saw it was a package from Southwest Airlines Travel we thought we were the ugly step child. Didn't ask smoking or non, king or double beds and couldn't charge anything to my room. Then the room was a view of the valet area on a low floor at the far end of the hall. They didn't welcome us or thank us for staying there. They only have 2 bars outside of the restaurants and only 1 open at a time during the day. And what hotel doesn't have a coffee maker in the room now a days. I think MGM/Mirage is more interested in high rollers than the normal person. Even the dealers were rude. They couldn't get rid of us fast enough, they didn't even give a receipt. I would have expected a lot more of everything from a hotel named Monte Carlo.

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for at the Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: nymetsfanz
Reviews.Content: The place was clean but you can tell it is the lower expenses of the Las Vegas Hotels. Check in was quick and easy and they allowed us to come a little early.
