Parking is free and was quite easy. By 4:00 the pool was packed with really not a lot of places to sit. I think this must be a place where many of the locals come to hang out. The only water warm enough to put the kids in were the lazy river and the hot tub. Our toilet was clogged upon arrival but the staff was fabulous to come fix it within minutes of us calling the front desk. I would have to say one of the positives of this stay was the friendly and professional staff. I slept horribly, my wife slept wonderfully. To me the walls are way too thin and I could hear drunk people up and down the hallway at night and the toilets and showers to the side and above me turn on/off. I could still hear the ambulances down below although I was on the 20th floor and at 5:50 am the engineers accidentally set off the hotel alarm and a loud voice came into our room "May I have your attention, please" and then it shut off. I had to inquire at the front desk upon check-out about that. I asked if there were any quieter places in the hotel for future stays and I was told, "No, all the rooms are the same". We tried to grab a quick bite at McDonalds in the hotel before we hit the road again. Apparently 80 other people had the same idea as us. I waited in line for about 20 minutes with 2 hungary young children. Once I ordered and had the food there I was told their computers were down and it was cash only- for of course which I had none and couldn't use my debit card. We had to leave and find another restaurant outside of the hotel. All in all it is what I paid for. It is not the most expensive hotel on the strip for a reason and I will probably look into other hotels in the future and pay a little more money. One thing that was disturbing that can't really be changed is all the pornography handouts by the street vendors. I have a 6 yr old son who I was constantly trying to shield from all the naked pictures that were on the little cards the street vendors hand out and people throw them on the ground. They were everywhere with just a tiny "star" covering up a nipple or crotch shot. It was disturbing to have my son see those images.

Reviews.Title: “good value & super location”
Reviews.Author: wickedatbest
Reviews.Content: stayed here for three nights at the end of march..although the hotel is one of the older on the strip it still retains a certain amount of charm..the room and bathroom were a decent size and clean..the bed was comfortable and very little noise at night..food at the hotel is reasonably priced and of decent quality..staff are helpfull and seem to enjoy their work..best by far is the price when you consider the location..if you want luxury there are other options nearby at much bigger rates, but this hotel is good value for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: missbedora
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on this hotel, and I had pretty low expectations. I was pleasantly surprised. The room was clean and modern, although the bathroom was a little worn. Fully operational and clean though. The service was great. We called ahead and asked for a fridge, and it was delivered to our room when we got there, no charge. The hotel itself had a great location as well. The $12 and change per day resort fee (not optional) was irritating but my fiance used the gym and we both used the internet each day, so I guess we actually got our money's worth. The 2 small bottles of water each day also got used of course. The casino itself is smaller than most, and not busy. Maybe a plus to some, but we're young and wanted to be somewhere a bit more lively. But it's the Vegas strip - there was action a stone's throw in every direction. The pool was also a bit small, and super crowded (almost impossible to find a single chair at 1 pm, let alone a pair together) when we were there (at the end of American college spring break) and with loud music and lots of things like cheesy dance competitions and "find the cherry in the bowl of whipped cream" contest. If I was young and single, it would have been paradise. As it was, it was a bit annoying, but I think the hotel was running some kind of "spring break party" promotion, so I should have expected it. We didn't eat at any of the restaurants in the hotel, except room service twice (good), so can't comment on those.

Reviews.Title: “Very Poor Property”
Reviews.Author: GrahamTrucks
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Monte Carlo for business, not a place I would typically go but since all the meetings were there.....The property, facility, and rooms were about what you would expect for a property in this price...acceptable. The staff, however, must be the dredges of Vegas. Staff had very bad attitudes, from doormen to casino dealers. Upon entering my room, the room had been cleaned but for some strange reason cloths were in the closet and trash was around the room. Asked them to have someone clean it up, but no one showed up. Then the next day they cleaned the room.....and left all that trash in there again! Amazing. Biggest disappoint was the poker room, the staff had major attitudes that ruined the whole experience. There are much better places in Vegas for the same or slghtly more money.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: otbrli
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights at the Monte Carlo, Checked in on Feb 27th only to find that when we reached our room we were greeted with a smoke filled room, pillow proped up on the bed as if someone had just left, went directly back to the front desk passing by empty bar glasses and stained carpeting on out way to find out if our room was right, told the desk about the issue and she gave us another key to another room reaking of cigarettes and mentioned that this is part of the decor (rooms that smell like a bar room). Pillows that were like sacs of potato's and did I mention that he shower was only luke warm. Hidden fees were the icing on the cake. We spent 8 days traveling and ending in Nappa and this was the worst place by far.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo is back, not a bad choice at all”
Reviews.Author: 96LT4
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at Monte Carlo and am glad to report a very good experience. We stayed there 4-5 times in the 2002-06 time frame and always enjoyed it, but when City Center came along, I felt the enormity of project next door was a big,big negative to MC. The good news is City Center is mostly finished, Monte Carlo has been lightly remodeled and maybe best of all, the parking garage is back! A quick comment about Aria @ City Center, we were not impressed. To me it felt like a gigantic version of Red Rock or GVR? Not a bad thing, but not on par with Bellagio, Wynn, etc... Room - We stayed in a Monaco Suite. Good size,space and layout. The walls are thin but it never was a problem. Most newer properties have separate tub and shower, not here, jucuzzi tub/shower combined, there was a separate 1/2 bath. The room was available when we arrived (12:15) and was clean. Gaming - Played the slots, not much success, not the worst either. Blackjack was a pleasant suprise, 3/2 without continuous shuffle, $10 tables, even a few $5's. Craps was active, up to 5X and had a few good rolls myself. Dining - The cafe was very good. We had lunch and thought the food was well above average and service good as well. We tried dinner at Brand steakhouse and were impressed. We thought the menu had good variety and we liked the "open to the casino" aspect of the place. The food again was very,very good and service solid, but not great. I would return, but will probably will spend this $ at Lawry's next time. In summary, the Monte Carlo is again a good choice on the strip for it's location, easy to use property layout and value. If you are going to Vegas for the "Club scene", this may not be the place for you? If not, it does about everything else pretty well.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nep1984
Reviews.Content: Overall, this is a good hotel that is reasonably priced in a central location on the strip. Overall, it is probably a 3.5/4 star property. The rooms are ok (could use some updating), but overall they are comfortable. The hotel public spaces are nice. If the price is right, I would stay here again. They have a resort fee now which bundles internet, gym access, etc. Before this you had to pay to go to the gym and pay for the internet. So the resort fee makes it all much cheaper. Staff were also very friendly and helpful. A word of caution, the pool plays very loud music during the day so if you have a room facing the pool, you will definitely hear the music.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Update”
Reviews.Author: tutroy
Reviews.Content: I'm sure this was once a jewel (my Dad, who used to stay there regularly in the late '90's-early 2000's says so) but it is now on the point of genteel decay, as they say. Old televisions, no minibar, dated decor, inadequate electronic outlets, badly-furnished rooms. A lot of wasted space in ours, yet it added nothing in the way of function or ambience. No Wi-Fi, except in spots. One of our rooms could get it, not ours. You pay a $14.95 resort fee that includes a spool-out network cable (worked just fine). The last in-room innovation this hotel has seen is the tv in an armoire. Should tell you something. since when does a class place need an armoire for the tv? Pro: the bartender in The Pub on the morning-lunch shift, the tram (monorail) from MC through City Center to Bellagio; Diablo's and, I think, the fact that it is not right on The Strip (although one of our cabbies told us that was its "death knell").

Reviews.Title: “Needs some serious cleaning and updating!”
Reviews.Author: irisrose
Reviews.Content: My boys and I accompanied my husband who was attending a conference at the Monte Carlo. He had booked a deluxe room but paid extra for a high floor with a strip view. Check in was fairly quick and easy. Went up to check out the room and of course we didn't get the upgrade we paid for. We did get a high room but over looking the parking lot and parking garage. We almost overlooked that to stay in the room but upon further inspection, the room was a dump! Torn and frayed carpet where the carpet met the tile, beds that looked very well worn to the point you could see a visible cave in the middle of the mattress. The icing on the cake was the cigarette burn hole in one bed spread and some red stain (blood? Red lipstick?) on the other bedspread. My husband went back down and refused the room and asked for an upgrade (but paid out of our pocket for that because he didn't say anything about the stains) We were hoping to get a room that was less used and abused. We ended up with a huge suite which was much better but still quite worn out. Carpet was worn and stained in spots, ink doodling on the upholstered wing chair, mildew in the shower caulking. But our housekeeping crew did a very nice job of cleaning each day! The Monte Carlo staff was very nice and professional. We did swim one day when it was warm. The lazy river is nice but can get crowded. Maybe because the wave pool wasn't open yet so everyone was in the river pool. Another pool was open but in the shade so it was a little cold. But the area seemed clean and well kept. Food court was good but over priced as typical for Vegas. But it was well staffed and busy times moved quickly. Oh and the Pub had really, really good burgers!! So I would say that if you are going to Vegas to be OUT of your room most of the time and don't really care what it looks like, the standard deluxe room at the Monte Carlo should be fine for that. But if you don't like unidentifiable stains on your bedding and carpet, go for an upgrade or another hotel. The commons areas are well kept, clean and attractive - too bad they can't extend that care to the rooms people sleep in.

Reviews.Title: “Good Room with roof top view!”
Reviews.Author: Exploretheworldnow
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel our room wasn’t quite ready so we had a half hour to go and get a Starbuck’s coffee. When we were able to get into our room it was quite large and clean. The view from the window was the top of the lower part of the hotel and all the air conditioning equipment. But, it was surprisingly quiet in the room. Beware of the ‘resort fee’ as they changed it from the time that we booked to the time that we checked out. Make sure that they don’t overcharge you! We used the Business office to print out our boarding pass, something that the resort offers for ‘free’ but beware the price for using the internet for 15minutes is $8. There was no fridge or coffee maker in the room, and only a very small bottle of water every day – so you are certain to spend your money in their hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel...great staff!”
Reviews.Author: KVasboe
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Las Vegas for a wedding that was held, in part, at the Monte Carlo. In planning the wedding, we looked at a variety of hotels and found that the Monte Carlo was not only willing to work with the bride on every aspect of her reception, we were also able to negotiate group rates for all the wedding guests who stayed at the hotel. I shared a room with another friend who was traveling solo. The room was fairly basic; two beds, a tv, a desk, a bathroom... the view was great though. We were high up in one of the towers, strip side, so the view was difficult to beat. The fact that the room was basic wasn't an issue; we weren't in Vegas to stay in the room all day. Since we were in town during the middle of March, there was an inevitable "spring break" feel, most noticeably at the pool. However, it was far less than some of the other places we visited (Planet Hollywood, Tropicana, Excalibur, to name a few). The staff worked hard to make sure the place felt clean, despite so many people. There was a great variety of food in the hotel, including a food court, a buffet, and several restaurants of varying food and price. I went to the buffet for breakfast one day; the price for breakfast was around $20 and there was a large amount of food to choose from. Everything I had was pretty good (though I'm told that the breakfast buffet food was much better than the dinner buffet), and it was not difficult to find enough to eat. The other restaurant I tried was Diablo's Cantina at the front of the hotel. The atmosphere was fun, but the food was barely passable. I actually preferred the food at Rubio's in the food court to the food at Diablo's. The location of the hotel is great. It is within walking distance of a good deal of the south part of the strip, including New York New York, the MGM Grand, Tropicana, Excalibur and the Luxor. To the north, there is a free tram that runs from the Monte Carlo to the Bellagio, with a stop in between. And, in case of emergencies, there is a CVS Pharmacy about 100 feet from the front entrance. The staff at the Monte Carlo was great; the event staff in particular was fantastic. As previously mentioned, they worked tirelessly with the bride, the hotel coordinator and myself to take care of every detail we could think of. The day-of staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The bartender, Doug, was extremely engaging and had some great stories. And when we realized that the cake topper was too heavy for the cake, had fallen over and cracked the cake, the baker/decorator rushed in and managed a beautiful repair job, all before most of the guests had arrived! In addition to the great service, the food was excellent. Overall, it was a great trip. The guests that I talked to all had very favorable things to say about the hotel and the service. I would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Not going back!!!”
Reviews.Author: Adalida
Reviews.Content: This was my husband and my first alone trip since having 2 kids. I was so stoked. I had always seen this hotel on previous visits and wanted to stay here. We checked in and it started off wrong. I had called and spoken to a rep on the phone who said I could upgrade to a spa suite and it would be reserved; I just has to pay for it when I checked in. No problem!!! We arrived at the hotel on a Sunday night, after the NASCAR event was all said and done. The lobby was beautiful. I got up to the counter and the check in clerk had no notes and no upgraded room in my reservation. To top it off, I would not be able to get the spa suite until Tuesday night, our last night there. I decided at that point not to upgrade. I did not want to have to change rooms and be on someone else's time schedule. No apology or anything. Supposedly, the only smoking room left was a handicap room. Fine. I was already ticked I did not have my upgrade. We get up to the room, walk in, and the room had not been even made up!!! Bedding tossed on a chair, pillows on the floor, and the bathroom was a mess! My hubby called the front desk and asked for a manager - he was immediately transferred to housekeeping. (He is much more patient and nicer than me) They would be up immediately to fix it. Ok. We sit at the desk for a half hour waiting; finally about 8 pm my husband called again and spoke to Jake, a manager. Jake moved us immediately to a room down the way (smoking even, funny!?!) and noticed we were there for three nights. He said that as a courtesy, he would comp us 50.00 in room service each night for the problem. We get to the new room and it was all setup for an arrival. Great! We ordered room service the following am after exploring the strip a bit, and no issues. The next day, I call again for some breakfast. I then get a call from in-room dining, that the credit was a one time deal and the needed to know how I would be paying for the items. I was again, not happy. I informed the agent that Jake was the one who set this up. She said she would contact the management and speak to him to get the ok. Another call back to my room and I was told the credit was a one time deal, and since Jake was off, they would not be able to honor the credit. I was done arguing. That was the last strike. We completed our stay and now know we should have gone with another property. My husband agreed. I can say based on the room pictures we both have and the telling of the story, the Monte Carlo has lost out on some business. I expected more, or at least to have a clean room and no lies.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - avoid if you want privacy”
Reviews.Author: sdavis144
Reviews.Content: I took off for a few days of R and R - totally on my own. I left my family behind and wanted to relax and think of ME. There are way TOO many times that I feel overworked. Well, I head off for Las Vegas on my quest and opted for the Monte Carlo because it seemed nice enough for the money. The service of the staff was good, considering. But some things were just glaring in error. First of all, when I checked in, there were burned out bulbs in the bathroom. Why? I had to wait an extra hour to check in because they were cleaning my room and no one noticed that the bulbs were out?? Surely not. And then, the walls were SO thin that I could hear conversations, word for word, and my neighbor got mad at me - profanity issuing mad - because I had the television on, normal volume at 10:00 in the morning. So, I wouldn't recommend it. Go spend a little more and stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Monte Crapo - The hotel that time forgot”
Reviews.Author: drog1998
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks amazing from the outside but once in the room i'm suddenly transported back to 1979. This place is the pits! No mini bar, a TV that even my granma would laugh at, dilapidated beds and ancient shower fittings that are covered in limescale. All that aside the staff were very friendly and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “It was great!”
Reviews.Author: blueyes890
Reviews.Content: Monte Carlo is a solid 3 or 3.5 star. We did not go to stay in our rooms; we went to Viva Las Vegas. We found the dealers all very helpful and very funny. Made it less intimidating to approach a game you aren't so familiar with. Was decently located as well. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel, which mainly gets missed by most visitors, but in a superb location”
Reviews.Author: the_cadmans
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo, for my 50th birthday in Sept 2007 and so have some fond memories and it was also our first time in Las Vegas. The Hotel room was very nice, had a decent view of the MGM opposite and part of the strip on the northern side. However the best bits about the Monte Carlo are that because it has no major attraction or walk through visitors, it tends to be quieter than most strip hotels, yet is still in a really great location and now the city centre is finished, there will be no effect from the building works. If it's a 4 star hotel your after, you could do much worse than this !! The pool area is also very quiet and relaxing and easy to spend some time in.

Reviews.Title: “Would recomend the hotel to friends.”
Reviews.Author: newtravelerVT
Reviews.Content: Front desk check-in was quick and efficient. Room clean and comfortable. Had a problem with the in room safe and someone was dispatched immediately to repair it. Food Court convenient. Casino was pleasant and not smoke filled. Location on the strip is excellent. Bus stop going south in front of hotel, going north just across the street. Everyone who worked at the hotel which we had contact with was helpful and polite. We are planning a return visit in 2010 and would not hesitate to stay at the Monte Carlo.

Reviews.Title: “Second time around!”
Reviews.Author: MelissaS2
Reviews.Content: Second trip to Vegas and we decided to stay at a "less expensive" hotel. This one was worth the money. A little noisy at times but otherwise not bad. Served its purpose!

Reviews.Title: “a great place”
Reviews.Author: JackT2
Reviews.Content: the monte carlo was a great stay they were helpful on top of everything got a great mexican joint called diablo's next to all the major attractions u cant go wrong with this choice!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Las Vegas trip”
Reviews.Author: jjcopeland
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Las Vegas for a quick trip. We wanted to stay on the South side of the strip and that is one of the reasons we chose the Monte Carlo. The price of the hotel is a fantastic deal in comparison to the location and what the hotel offers. It is a quick 5 min walk to New York New York. From there you can easily get to Excalaber, Luxor, and Mandalay Bay. Right across the street is MGM Grand and that is also and awesome hotel just with 10 mins walking. Frank Caliendo is now at the Monte Carlo and he is a great show! I would recommend the Monte Carlo to any of my friends who want to get their money worth on a trip to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value - nice stay”
Reviews.Author: leochristy
Reviews.Content: I’d definitely stay here again. I got a nice 3 for 2 package deal through bookit.com. Middle of the strip, close to everything. Hotel is a little dated compared to others high end strip places, but very clean. Room was good, but nothing fancy. (no fridge, no coffee maker) 12 foot ceilings added a European flavor. Bed was very comfortable with nice pillow top mattress. Check-in good with reception separate from Casino (a plus) . Even with 8-10 people working check in, I saw the line get long when big groups checked in. Stayed on 31st floor and had to wait for elevator often (seemed like not all were running) I upgraded to "strip view" but new city park high rise and NYC Casino limits view to roof tops staight out window -- not sure its worth it, but didn't see the "non strip view" so hard to compare. Food court near foot of elevator made running down for a cup of starbucks before a morning bath a habit. Concierge was very helpful finding me a golf course for $70 in Boulder Cty (30 miles from Hotel, but good). Didn't have time for fitness center so I can't comment. Pooll was closed for winter, but could use Bellagio's 1/2 milie away -- too cold to sun anyway. Casino was good and not too crowded - broke even, yeh!.

Reviews.Title: “Good Enough”
Reviews.Author: jainsterk
Reviews.Content: When it comes to Vegas, for me, the rooms don't really matter. How much time do you actually spend it them? This place was totally average. Nothing really stood out. We took a smoking room instead of one on the construction side of the hotel. Im not sure the construction would have been worse. The room was really stinky.

Reviews.Title: “never ever again”
Reviews.Author: danicafan
Reviews.Content: overpriced for what you get -- I have stayed in nicer $20 no tell motels -- charged $10.94 so called resort fee each night for 2 tiny bottles of water and a paper Would not reccomend this place to anyone -- anyplace within the confines of this place extremely high priced -- don't drink in the pub unless you have won a huge jackpot cost us $32 for 3 - 16 oz glasses of warm keg beer and a coke

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas Review”
Reviews.Author: MarcR4
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in a great part of the Las Vegas strip.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: jordan447
Reviews.Content: Extremely clean rooms. Nice pool. Awesome casino. Very good buffet! Just wish it had been connected to the monorail when we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Another Awesome Stay”
Reviews.Author: wish2trvlmor
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Monte Carlo February 19 to 22, 2010 on a wonderful VIP offer. My husband has not been to Vegas for 20 years so did not know what to expect. My descriptions of my "on my own trips" did not give him a adequate visual of the monte carlo or the trip itself. Well needless to say he was impressed, from the check in process to the first glimpse of our spa suite, he was in awe. The spa suite was beautiful, a romantic room to reconnect with your special person. A wet bar with a fridge, a steam shower, a surround sound, and the beautiful spa tub with a gorgeous view of the mountains. The King size bed was sooo comfortable with deluxe linens. Oh what luxury!! The housekeeping staff was beyond compare with one night turn down service and chocolates on our pillow. Water bottles daily. They just anticipated our every need. We ate at the buffet every day for supper and breakfast. The food was fantastic, fresh and the made to order stations (omelates, pasta, stirfrys) were my husbands favorites, cracked crab, shrimp and other seafood, prime rib, chicken ham, mexican, chinese and desserts to die for. Champagne brunch on Saturdays and Sundays. With all of the selections you would think that they would slip somewhere, but the attention to detail was visisble, with trays refilled, items not being allowed to dry out, very impressive.The cafe was so nice for a late night snack with the sandwhiches so big you couldn't wrap your hands around them. We did not try Brands as we did not want to make a reservation because we did not want to be tied to a time, but it was busy and people looked like they were enjoying themselves. Might try it on a later trip. The new Aria is connected via an indoor walkthrough where you don't even realize that you have left the Monte Carlo property. The Aria casino was quite pricey with high denomination machines. Was hard to find something affordable to play there. The Monte Carlo casino has alot of machines, too many penny machines though and the tables start at a minimum $10 a hand. I think that they could lower this for the day time crowd. But we did have some luck at the Monte Carlo, didn't lose our shirts there like we did at the Aria. MGM casino was very lucky, as was some of the properties on Freemont street. There is a free tram that now runs to the Bellagio which saved some wear and tear on my walking shoes. Its location is great because you can access other properties and site seeing venues, plus the shops. We took the duece bus to freemont and it stops right in front of the hotel. Saw Zumantiy, shopped till I dropped and ate like kings. The only real drawback was the pool was closed for the season, can understand that though because the temps were never above 60. The Monte Carlos service, hospitality and suites are terrific, I would not hesitate to refer friends or family. Our Casino Host, Chaz is beyond compare. He is knowledgeable, helpful and so patient with questions and offers suggestions that he would anticipate we would like. We are a modest couple but were treated like "high rollers". We felt valued, appreciated and special. In a nutshell, the Monte Carlo will meet your needs but exceed your expectations. Was another awewsome stay and we wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “5 star”
Reviews.Author: MichelleVCachola
Reviews.Content: The rooms are clean and the rooms are nice. It was really enjoyable staying there.

Reviews.Title: “A disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: k2inaz
Reviews.Content: I had previously stayed at this hotel & was satisfied. However, this stay was very disappointing. The shower didn't work, the tv died, and the furniture badly needed repair. Housekeeping did not do a very good job cleaning each day (glass table tops always had fingerprints on them - never cleaned). The casino itself was fine & so were the restaurants, but the rooms were unsatisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas”
Reviews.Author: ChrisH8
Reviews.Content: My wife and I Traveled to Vegas with a friend last winter.The Monte Carlo is right on the strip,so you could walk to just about everything.I had never been and had no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet, and great food!”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoMac12
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean, the food at the buffets are a great value and very good. The staff was responsive and the casino was bright, spacious and relatively smoke free. The fitness center was very nice. I would highly recommend this as a great "under $100 value"!

Reviews.Title: “Friends Wedding”
Reviews.Author: Mandalitta
Reviews.Content: I had such an awesome trip and stay at this hotel. The only thing I didn't like was the fact that my friend was supposed to get married in the chapel and the minister forgot so we had to change the venue. Instead his wedding was done at a wedding chapel that didn't fit half the people with us. Other than that it was beautiful and the accommodations were great.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: TamCNRN
Reviews.Content: A very good place to stay for the money. Not as fancy as some hotels in the area, but it is very clean. Service was great. If you want a clean comfortable but not fancy room then this is it. It was reccomended to me by several people and I was very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: rhdiva
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean hotel with great central location on the strip. Be aware though, that although they do have four swimming pools none, NONE of them are indoor pools and all of them close for the winter. Room was nice, location was perfect, restaurants in the hotel were great. Smoking is allowed in the casino which was a little disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “So-so - lacking in several areas”
Reviews.Author: dheg
Reviews.Content: Have stayed many places in Vegas, on and off strip - the Monte Carlo is lacking in a few areas so be aware of these before you book a standard room: 1. Hidden "Resort Fees" you will be charged upon checkout (very shady) 2. No coffee makers in rooms 3. No fridge in rooms

Reviews.Title: “Nice place!”
Reviews.Author: gemlee
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel with wonderful view outside. The service is quite good. However, the magic show isn't really interesting.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: clgag
Reviews.Content: We stayed from Feb 6-9, 2009. I was worried about the Monte Carlo, everytime I read a review it was bad! Things from dirty rooms to bed bugs!! We had EXCELLENT service!! When we got there we wanted to upgrade to the Monaco room but they were all taken due to the Superbowl weekend, but they gave us a stripview room for free and gave us a two hour extended late check out at on our final day there at no charge as well!! Our rooms were clean and very nice! I love the fact that they have a food court if you don't want to eat at a buffet, its alot cheaper! Excellent hotel and great service! The only thing is (I wish someone told me this!) do not take a cab ride everywhere, there is a double decker bus called The Deuce and its $3.00 per ride or $7.00 for the whole day or $30.00 for three days and it drops you off at all the hotels or within very close walking distance....could have saved ourselves $200.00 in cab rides!!! But Las Vegas is NOT a place to bring children to, its an adult city! Disneyland is a place for children! I could not believe all the small children and babies that parents brought with them, poor little guys were up very late in their strollers! I am a parent and would never bring my children to Las Vegas....now when they turn 21...that's a different story!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay Here”
Reviews.Author: HarryFrmNC
Reviews.Content: When we got to the Monte Carlo at 11pm our room was absolutely NASTY! The bed was unmade, TV was on, the bathroom was trashed and as we were on our way to the front desk a housekeeper said to give her 5 minutes and it would be cleaned. We got to the front desk and was told it was a miscommunication between the desk and housekeeping then we were eventually offered a different room - only to find hair all over the towels and shower. To beat all, the next morning when we went to the buffet there was food scraps all over the table, seat and on the very top "CLEAN" plate. The beds are hard as plywood and very uncomfortable. If you stay here, which I do NOT recommend, and go to the buffet ask to sit in Marco's area. He is the most competent person in the place. The staff on the casino floor was SLOW! We would be seated at a machine for 45 minutes to an hour before anyone would come by to say "Hello" Let me say this - as a worldwide traveler this is the WORST place I have paid to stay.

Reviews.Title: “The One to Choose!”
Reviews.Author: LeKeithaC
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo is a fabulous hotel. It reminds you of James Bond movies. The reception staff was very friendly and helpful. Our room was clean and very nicely furnished.

Reviews.Title: “Worries unfounded”
Reviews.Author: WanderingstarBelfast
Reviews.Content: Returned yesterday from Las Vegas, having stayed a week in the Monte Carlo hotel. After I had made my booking, I came across 2 reviews that were not particularly good about my choice of hotel and must admit I was quite concerned. Both reviews highlighted that the hotel was unclean, and one review mentioned bed bugs. However my experience with this hotel was actually the opposite - our bedroom was cleaned thoroughly each day, lobby areas and food court areas were immaculate so I was delighted, and also the staff were friendly. The free tram between the Monte Carlo /City Centre & Bellagio was a great bonus.

Reviews.Title: “What happened?”
Reviews.Author: AZDesertBlossom
Reviews.Content: When we stayed at Monte Carlo prior to the fire, it was clean and service was excellent. Perhaps the remodeled higher floors are nice, however they have allowed the regular rooms to get shabby. Broken shower head, mold in the toilet, towels with holes and sheets with stains. I realize that this is suppose to be more of a budget hotel, but the savings aren't what they need to be for the quality of the room. With the variety of options on The Strip, The Monte Carlo better get it in gear. Oh, and don't plan on using the pool. It is still under construction.

Reviews.Title: “Great Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CamilleM2
Reviews.Content: Great Beautiful Hotel Property. Nice rooms, beautiful resort property fun atmosphere, center of strip with access to other properties close by. Had a great time!!!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: nichols96
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo offers travelers an average hotel room. The carpet and bathroom was clean. There are no special ammenities. They dont offer a coffee pot because they want you to buy a 3$ coffee downstairs. They do not offer free or paid shuttle service to/from the airport. It was in a good location, next to a crosswalk so that you can get to the busier side of Las Vegas Blvd. The walls are thin, I could hear the neighboring rooms hair dryer and alarm clock every day. They offer non smoking floors, not just non smoking rooms, which is very nice for those sensitive to cig. smoke.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful pre-Christmas stress relief”
Reviews.Author: Lane22
Reviews.Content: Loved the spa amenities- great way to relax before the hectic Christmas week.

Reviews.Title: “Very, very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: LeighOhio
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights at MC. Room was spacious & very clean. As noted before dimly lit tho. Room was ready for check in before noon on arrival day. We rec'd email for 3 nights comp, $125. food & drink comp as well as $50. freeplay. It was called A-Fishin-AH-DOUGH offer, I have the toll free number if anyone is interested. good till 2-28. We had not been there for a couple of years. We are visiting daughter in LV so decided to give it a try. Why not?? The only negative I have is about a restaurant d vino. waitrness didn't appear to care if she were there or not. Chatted with other staff, didn't ask if we wanted more beverages, etc

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place for a stag”
Reviews.Author: funtravel88
Reviews.Content: Found the booking for packages very good and the experience from the June stag I attended was terrific. We are booking another on May.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay”
Reviews.Author: Opinionku
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo hotel from Jan 30 - Feb 2 for 4 nights. Even though we had the 3 nights for 1 night free deal, with the mandatory RESORT FEE of $9.50 per night, it is not really cheap at all. The resort fee is a scam, the pool is closed during the winter, and we told the front desk we were not going to use the gym, but he said it is a mandatory fee. So for $9.50 per day, we got 2 small bottles of water, a paper and use of local calls. Internet is NOT included. Pretty expensive bottles of water, I would say. Room is clean, bed is comfortable, but there is no coffee facilities, no hot water facilities in the room. So everytime you want coffee, you have to go down to the food court in the lobby to buy it. I would say check out similar hotel, they may cost the same but most have coffee in the room, and some may offer internet service with the resort fee charges.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: MidwestLovestotravel
Reviews.Content: Had a nice stay at the Monte Carlo. It is on the south end of the strip......wish it was more centrally located, but a nice hotel for the money. The rooms are nice and comfortable. Check in was somewhat slow....but okay. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Just so so”
Reviews.Author: KerryLK
Reviews.Content: It was just average, but being centrally located made it easy to walk around town.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: familygalNZ
Reviews.Content: we stayed here 2 nights with 2 adults and 2 kids. the beds were big and comfortable, rooms were a bit dimly lit (could've been brighter) but overall clean and welcoming. So central to everything. the pools were closed in winter though so that was a bummer!

Reviews.Title: “Ok place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Barb50
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the MC from Jan. 17-21, 2010. The check in was quick, no lineups. The cost of the taxi from the airport was around $20. The room was ok, nothing special, but we were not in the room long enough we were always out walking and taking in the free sights that the other hotels have to offer. Treasure Island pirate show was under renovation at the time we were there. But lots to do for free, Lion Habitat @ the MGM; Volcano show outside at the Mirage; Freemont Street light show (downtown) starts at dark, was 6PM when we were there; Atlantis show at Caesars, just ask anyone on staff and they will point you in the right direction. If you don't want to walk there is the Deuce bus that travels from downtown old Las Vegas out the outlet mall at the other end of the Strip past Mandalay Bay. There are some ticket dispensers on the Strip, but not many. You can purchase a 3 day pass for $15 or a 24 hr pass for $7. You can also purchase from the bus driver but you need the exact money. For the kids there is lots of arcades and rides at some of the resorts, they would not be bored. They say that it is expensive in LV, but at the Monte Carlo they have a few fast food outlets; Subway, Starbucks, McDonalds, etc. where you eat cheaply. If you like Chinese food we suggest Panda Express. There is one located across from the Monte Carlo close to the Coke Cola store. Just go up the escalator and there are a few more fast food places.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but property is deteriorating!”
Reviews.Author: Coldcdn
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been to Las Vegas many times over the last fifteen years, and have stayed here quite a few times. We always love the location and value for the dollar. Most recently we stayed in a strip-view deluxe room on the 31st floor from January 25 - 29. Our room had been recently renovated, with new wall paper, headboard, carpet etc. However, our friends on the same floor had a tired room that was not renovated. Overall we were concerned about the cleanliness and maintenance of the property. It just seems that given the recession and the age of the property, MGM Mirage is putting emphasis on other properties (especially City Centre next door), and cutting corners and costs at its older properties. May be time to consider other strip hotels, such as Treasure Island, which is usually priced in the same range as the Monte Carlo.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for resort fees and no place to go outside at resort.”
Reviews.Author: wyomingfrog
Reviews.Content: DO NOT give them your credit card when checking in unless you want to pay the resort fee and 12% taxes on that fee. We had a paid receipt that stated all fees and taxes were included in our prepayment (no asterik by that statement). When we checked in, the desk person asked for our credit card for "incidentals". We said we didn't plan on charging anything and refused to give the card. She kept pushing for our card and we kept denying them. Finally, she stated she needed it for the resort fees. It was obvious that she was trained not to disclose this fee. When we showed our receipt stating that all taxes and fees were already paid, she still wanted us to pay the resort fee. Finally, she got a supervisor and the fee was waived. He showed us how if we clicked like 5 buttons on the hotel website there was an asterik on the bottom of page 5 stating there could be resort fees added. Trickery and deception!!! Stand firm- refuse to pay this extortion fee!! Also, there is not one spot to go outside and enjoy the sun or a book. Not only is the pool closed and under repair, there is not one spot to get some fresh air unless you head to the strip and sit on a bench there. I would never stay here if you like privacy and sun while swimming. When the pool does open, it is over shadowed by the City Center. Looming over the pool area is the tram to the City Center, so be prepared to have the public watch you. You will also have a view of the massive building all around you. It is a shame how the Monte Carlo is ruined by the city center. The view is ruined from the rooms by the behemoth City Center. If you just want a good location without wanting to be outside or being overshadowed by the City Center doesn't bother you- this could be a place for you. The Cafe was delicious and accomodating. The room was nice and clean- great shower. Ask for a fridge for your room, we got it free of charge. No fan in bathroom- so plan to have a steamy mirror. Good luck trying to get service at the mail counter, as everytime we went there, they used that space to check people into the hotel. I don't recommend this hotel because I like sunshine, fresh air, and REFUSE TO PAY RESORT FEES WHICH THEY TAX. They charge 12% tax on the resort fee- bringing an added charge of 10.50$ per day!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel With Great Location Reasonably Priced”
Reviews.Author: ArchAngel521
Reviews.Content: We visited in December (2009) between Christmas and New Year's. Vegas is a ZOO on New Year's Eve, I cannot recommend that to any one (unless you are a glutton for punishment, or just want to be squeezed in with 2 million of your closest friends ~ seriously...). That being said, the week is on of Vegas' busiest of the year. While Monte Carlo was full, they handled the crowds efficiently. Have stayed with Monte Carlo three times in the last year, and will consider it as first choice in future. Rooms were comfortable, we had two regular rooms (double queen beds) and one "Monaco" Junior Suite. The regular rooms are comfortable, well appointed, but a little too dark for my liking. Would it be too much to ask for more lights? For a few dollars more, the Monaco suite is well worth the price: Marble entries and marble baths (yes, two bathrooms), sitting area, refrigerator, double sinks in the master, over 700sq ft. Twice we've stayed in a Monaco, and each time it was LESS THAN $100 per night! Check in was not bad, it varies by time of day. Once I arrived before noon, and the room was not ready (check-in is 3:00, after all, but Vegas is a 24-hour city, and other places I've stayed could accommodate early arrival). Arriving mid-afternoon will find longer lines, but they move quickly and the staff anticipates the crowd. In December we arrived around Midnight and the check-in was fast, courteous, and amazingly alert given the time of day. It galls me to pay $15 / night for Internet, but what are you going to do? That is pretty standard on the Strip right now. Monte Carlo offers BOTH wireless and wired (your choice) in the room, fee is charged to your bill only if you accept and sign up each day. One time, higher floor, wireless was intermittent and not satisfactory so we opted for wired.This time, wireless was strong (lower floor) and quite convenient. Check before you sign up, but you can change back and forth each day. Since the summer (of 2009) they have added a $9.95 daily "resort fee," which ostensibly is to pay for two bottles of water (wow! that's pricey water!), a daily newspaper (which was free before they charged daily) and full access to the fitness club. That is worth it if you are going to work out, as they used to charge more than $10 per day to use the fitness facilities. In reality, it is simply a way of charging another $10 while making it APPEAR as though the daily rate is lower. This seems to be pretty consistent for ALL of the MGM/Mirage properties now, and has been copied by other brands, as well. Food is surprisingly good. The "Cafe" looks at first like a simple restaurant, but the menu is EXTENSIVE and the pricing reasonable. Some of their salads became my wife's favorite, and she regularly wanted to eat there. The buffet is about like any of the buffets on the Strip, except on Sunday Morning they have a champagne brunch which is definitely a step up. "Brand" steakhouse is fine, but undistinguished from other steakhouses in Vegas. Brand often runs specials, like the pre-show prime rib, which is very nice. Only Diablo's Mexican Cantina came as a real disappointment ~ nothing special, prices high, and indigestion to follow. As others have mentioned, there is a full food court, too, with quick grab McDonald's, Haagen Dasz, Subway, pizza, and others. A second, larger/nicer Starbuck's has opened in the passageway to City center (just past the Pub), as well as a cupcake-ery. In December, Monte Carlo opened an interior connector to City Center. You can now walk from Monte to Aria without setting foot outside (though I felt, with all of the halls and escalators, a little like a gerbil in a Habitrail!). You can also access indoors a tram that goes to Crystal's shopping and all the way to Bellagio all for FREE which makes the location extremely convenient to the west side of the Strip. Of course, across the street (small access road, not the Strip) is NewYork-NewYork and its attractions, and accross the Strip (cross with the lights!) is shopping, OutBack steaks, and more. There are CVS and Wallgreens right by MonteCarlo, as well. Right in the hotel is the Lance Burton theater. Since Burton and Monte Carlo re-signed last Fall, that provides a good in-house show most nights. Equally imprtant, six nights each week Frank Caliendo appears in the same theater. He also stays around for you to meet, greet, and have your picture taken. A riot and well worth seeing. Since City Center opened they have re-opened the public self-park garage which is free and convenient. However, there is also free parking out front and across the access drive which we used often and found even more convenient. Valet parking is fast, courteous, and free (tip, as always in Vegas!) All in all, the service is great, and the hotel is nice. It is getting better each trip.

Reviews.Title: “thin walls & dirty linens”
Reviews.Author: pdx2vegas
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in seven different hotels on the strip and Monte Carlo is the only one that I will not stay at again. Although everyone we spoke to was very friendly and helpful, the dirty pillowcase, 3 dirty towels and stained bed cover made the weekend stay unpleasant. Also, Monte Carlo has the thinnest walls of all the hotels I've stayed at. At other hotels, I've heard muffled noises from the room next door, but it's never been so loud that I could hear the conversations clearly. Part of the $9.50 per night resort fee covers printing of your boarding pass at the business center. When I tried to log on to print our boarding passes, it took so long to log on that I finally gave up. The staff was very friendly and the location of the hotel is great. It was very convenient to go check out the City Center next door, but there are so many nicer hotels in the same price range that I will not be returning to Monte Carlo.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Value for money hotel”
Reviews.Author: Guest_BLR_01
Reviews.Content: While in Vegas one is always tempted to stay on the strip and Monte Carlo provides a decent stay experience which comes with a price tag that shldn't pinch your pocket. Given that most of the time in the day (and night) you will be out of your room, the experience in MC is adequate. It doesn't have any theme to baost of like that in Paris or Venetian or Caesers palace but the amenities and the luxury is enough. We were greeted by a very helpful front desk and the room was clean and spacious. We also got one overlooking the strip. Like all other hotels it has a food court and a theme alley that was yet to be open when we visited. The casino was plush but lacked the charm/ambeince of the other more famous ones. Oveall it was nice and pleasant given that we found it to be the least expensive of the other hotels on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort”
Reviews.Author: AZretiree
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo for a few days. Although we signed up (& purchased) for a small suite, when we arrived there we were told none were available due to (blah, blah, etc). We did get a room.However the next morning we went to the VIP services and spoke to John at Marketing. We were able to get a spa suite at the same price we would have for the smaller suite. However, if we did not complain, nothing would have transpired.

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: diane5101
Reviews.Content: The only bad thing in Vegas in Jan was the WEATHER, rain for 4 days we were there, just like rivers on all the streets. I like Vegas much more in July! Had a great time, just I felt that 3 nights is not enough time, a 5 night trip might be the best! Monte Carlo was great and the room service was THE BEST. All in all great trip and look forward to another one.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas... that's all I need to say”
Reviews.Author: diane5101
Reviews.Content: Went to Vegas with husband, daughter and son in law and a good friend. Stayed @ the Monte Carlo. This was a great place.. Pretty central, the weather was the pits, it rained the 3 days we were there and was quite cold. All in All Vegas is exciting, went to the Zumanity show @ the New York New York, a must see show! Once again Thank you Vegas for the wonderful time and hope to visit again soon. Players Club.. give us some more free accomodations, longer next time though.!! Room Service @ this hotel is AWESOME!! GREAT SERVICE!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price, if you are going to be out of your room a lot”
Reviews.Author: klmmicro
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I stayed at the Monte Carlos a few days before Christmas. Las Vegas was busy and having not been there in years it seemed like a fun place. We arrived in the evening and checked at the front desk. The lobby of this hotel is spacious and inviting. The desk staff was quick to serve us and the whole process took about 15 minutes. We had our room key cards and up we went. My wife had reserved a room a few weeks prior, but it was when we arrived that they assigned us our actual room. It was on the 23rd floor, which suited me fine. We were told it was a "strip view" when initially booking. When we got to the room, it was not what we had thought at all. The strip view was of the backside of New York, New York with the suburbs in background. My wife, being assertive called down and told the desk that we did not consider the view to be what we were paying for. They quickly booked us a new room, though we were not able to check in to that room until the following night. The next night we stayed in a room on the 32nd floor and faced the strip, but the view is now blocked by the new “City Center” complex. To stay ON the strip and not spend a fortune, the Monte Carlos is one of the best deals in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: NakibK
Reviews.Content: With our vacation package deal we booked a deluxe room. Once we arrived at check-in we asked what a deluxe room looks like. The lady at the check-in show us the pictures of the various rooms. My wife really like the Monaco Suite so we upgrade our room for $30 extra per night. The Monaco Suite was spacious, clean and had an excellent view of the new Aria hotel. Everything in the room was great except there was no hot water. I called the receptionist who quickly send an engineer. The engineer was extremely friendly and told us it better to change to another room so they can fix the hot water issue, we agreed. She showed us two other Monaco Suite rooms however the view wasn't as good (That's what the engineer told us) She called down to management and asked for a Spa Suite for us. Thanks to the engineer we got upgraded to a Spa Suite. We didn't even ask for an upgraded. The Engineer was a lady in her mid-40s. I forgot her name. Wow what service. The engineer took us to the Spa Suite on the 29th floor with a view of the Strip. The room was very nice with jacuzzi next to the window. The Engineer even helped us with our luggage. I tried to give her a $20 tip for her assistance she didn't take it and smiled and said "I hope you have a wonderful time at the Monte Carlo". AGAIN WOW that was an Excellent service. We stayed four nights at the Monte Carlo and it was great. The King size bed was extremely comfortable. We tried the lunch buffet which is inside the Casino. For $14 the buffet was bad at all. The $14 also includes your non-alcoholic drinks. There is a Tram that goes from Monte Carlo to City Center to Belliago. It is free. My wife and I are both in our 20s. This was the first time for both of us in Vegas. We were glad we both at the Monte Carlo. We will definitely come back to Vegas again. But next time we will try to win...

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good hotel.. Nothing spectacular”
Reviews.Author: Bestbeancounter
Reviews.Content: This was the first time staying at the Monte Carlo, and my experience was pretty positive. We got a regular room with a King Sized bed and it was pretty decent. The hotel was clean, the room was clean and their concierge and front desk were very helpful. The first day we got there we used the front desk a lot to inquire about shows and directions and they were very helpful. The hotel was nothing spectacular. There weren't very many stores, and we didn't gamble very much. But the atmosphere was good and like some of the reviewers here mentioned, it's certainly an older crowd. But it was cheaper than all the other hotels we were looking at so I was happy about that. The parking was good as we were able to park right in front of the bridge that connects the parking lot to the hotel every night! It's a step up from Imperial Palace (where I stayed back in 2006), but really nothing spectacular! It's affordable and it's comfortable. Good enough for me!

Reviews.Title: “Always a great place for the price.”
Reviews.Author: SOLANGE03
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Monte Carlo for three nights in December. As always, we had a great time. We ate at the Dragon Noodle, which was great. Also ate at the pub, and had the best hamburger ever. The only downside of our trip is when we went to Terribles Hotel and Casino for dinner. The restaurant was too busy, so we tried the buffet. They were showing an extensive menu of Italian food. There was none. The food station(there was only one) was dirty as were the tables. What food they did have lived up to the name of the place....terrible. Just picture the buffet in Las Vegas Vacation with Chevy Chase.

Reviews.Title: “Looks can be deceiving at the Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: Klas_MI
Reviews.Content: The casino and restaurant areas were very nice. I highly recommend eating at the Dragon Noodle Co. The food and atmosphere were great even though the attitude of the server was not. The hotel buffet was ordinary. I had the 'special' seafood buffet, which was really nothing special and definitely over priced. The buffet at the Red Rock Casino was far superior. One of the big disappointments was the rooms. They were very plain and dated. They lacked any of the grandeur of the first floor. The bedspreads were quite disgusting. One of ours had a blood stain on it--classy! The hotel parking was very convenient and the location was excellent. The crowds in the hotel tended to be older and more low key than most of the other hotels on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Can do better at other hotels”
Reviews.Author: auggiemctavish
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Monte Carlo, maybe the fourth or fifth time here. The room was adequate. The old televison was tired, but with a dearth of channels to choose from it really didn't matter. Watch out for the "resort" tax or should I say fee. Why is this a resort? The pool was not open, I didn't get my 2 "free" bottles of waters in the room when I checked in, I didn't need to call anyone local, didn't have time to use the gym and they could have saved the paper for someone else. With all the competition in Las Vegas, this tired looking property is getting to be the "Sears" of Las Vegas hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good service but nothing really special”
Reviews.Author: ShelmarinSask
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from our first trip to Vegas. Made our reservation based on reviews and were overall happy with our choice. After touring and walking through the many other hotels on the strip (I do mean WALKING!!), our opinion of the Monte Carlo was that it was really nothing special compared to others. Our room should have been cleaner as therer was lots of broken glass throughout, but after calling housekeeping they immediately came and vacuumed the room thoroughly. Check in/out was swift and accurate.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Location, Excellent Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Kerkaz
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo is very well positioned on the strip and the rooms are spacious and comfortable. No free internet access, or coffee and tea making facilities in the rooms. The Resort fee charge of $9.50 per day is ridiculous and we have no idea what it was for. The pool was closed as it was winter, and we didn't use any other facilities. The Buffet is good value and highly recommended. The food court is excellent for a quick breakfast with all of the usual's - McDonalds. Starbucks, Subway, etc. Travel up and down the strip is easy on the 'Deuce' - a large double decker bus. $3:00 for a one way ride, or $7:00 for 24 hours. Make sure you check out the 'Fremont Experience' in the old part of Vegas - amazing screen the length of a road. Went on a helicopter trip to a Ranch - $284:00 for 2 hours of actual helicopter ride (1 hour) and 1 hour on the ranch. Breakfast was good, with a singing cowboy to entertain.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here non-negotiable $9.50 per nite resort fee. Rip-off!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Packerfan1999
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews about this hotel and thought we'd give it a shot. Well that was my first mistake. I read that there was a resort fee to use the pool(which was closed when we were there because it was too cold), 2 bottles of water per day,(that we only got 2 out of the 4 days we were there), free local calls(who are we going to call locally?), get a paper daily(again, we got that only 2 out of the 4 days) and use of the gym. That was $9.50 PER NITE!!!!! Only recently did I hear an informational program that said to avoid places w/RESORT FEES. I figured we would get there and say, we aren't going to call anyone, use the gym, drink the bottled water and we COULDN'T use the pool, so they would take the fee off. NOPE, didn't happen. So we get into our room, which had a wonderful view of the BACK of the hotel, when we asked for a view of the strip, that's what we got. Then, as I was standing by the window, looking at our wonderful view of ...traffic, I was stepping on something. Here, there were a bunch of crushed crackers that hadn't been vacuumed up! GROSS!!! And, as I looked around the room, our ironing board was missing. I made sure to report both right away, cuz I didn't feel like paying $400 for an ironing board, which I'm sure I would have been held responsible for. There was a burn mark in the bathroom floor from a cigarette or something. And the comforter on the bed was disgusting. Very old and 'pilly.' The whole room could have used a makeover, very musty. Almost every hotel we've ever stayed at on vacation, even the inexpensive ones, have refrigerators and microwaves in the rooms. Not here. And don't even THINK about staying in the room to relax and watch tv. There are about 15 channels, maybe, and 3 of them are informational channels about the hotel. And everytime we would turn the tv on, the volume was soo loud. So I had to turn the tv on and quick mute it so I could turn the volume down. I liked the food court, but that too needed a desperate make-over. There were chips out of the walls where the tables hit the wall. And the tables were worn down a couple of layers in spots. So PLEASE, PLEASE, reconsider, no matter how cheap the rates are for this hotel, do NOT stay here. As they say, 'You get what you pay for.'

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for the money...but be prepared to walk!”
Reviews.Author: firefly1680
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to vegas with my boyfriend whose been there several times. Overall, the hotel was nice, clean, and small....easy to navigate. The casino was small but good. Lots of $5 tables during the week. Brand is a cool lounge to hang at night....great music. The only downside to this hotel was that there isn't much to do at the hotel itself so you have to leave the hotel to get to anything. Not great when you're going out in stilettos! All in all, a great hotel for a leisure weekend, but wouldn't recommend if you're in vegas for the nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Howard Johnson of the Vegas Strip”
Reviews.Author: MichelleJ2
Reviews.Content: Hotel was ok, it was a room. The casino was great, pools were nice, but I am sure there are nicer ones.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but could be better”
Reviews.Author: BELLE7512
Reviews.Content: Compared to other hotels in Vegas, I would not have chosen to stay at the Monte Carlo. The casino was smaller and there really wasn't a big selection of places to eat or drink. The hotel was a good price... biggest reason why we chose to stay there. Rooms do not have microwaves (making it hard to eat some left overs) nor do they have fridges. This is annoying as one gets a little tired of eating out all the time. Gotta say, the DJ by the pool was good, and there was lots of pool space for everyone. It was not worth paying $12.00 to rent a tube to use in the river pool. So many people use that pool that the tubes can't get by. The best (and best price) restaurant was the one outside by the pool!!! Oh, and the hotel entertainer that was supposed to be there, was not there one night during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for hidden extra fees!!”
Reviews.Author: SilviaDW
Reviews.Content: In overall the hotel facilities are decent, though a bit old and the shopping area is quite small compared to other hotels in Vegas. What I really didn`t like was: 1 - There`s no fridge in the room. 2 - Internet access costs additional US$ 14.95 per day. 3 - They charge an extra US$ 9.50 "Resort Fee" per night. I only found out about it when i saw it charged in our bill, they don`t tell you about it when you check in, but they put in tiny little letters in a paper you have to sign to check in. They say the fee is for the 2 bottles of water they leave in the room everyday, for the newspaper stand they provide in each floor and access to the gym. As I didn`t read any newspaper and also wasn`t in Vegas to workout, those were the most expensive bottles of water of the trip. I EXPECT TRANSPARENCY FROM ANY ETHICAL BUSINESS. People don`t want to analyze every piece of paper as a contract through a lawyer`s perspective while in vacation. This is why I`m not coming back to Monte Carlo.

Reviews.Title: “Good for 3 nights”
Reviews.Author: muffalina
Reviews.Content: Stayed at MC booked a last minute package through American Airlines, Deal was too good to pass up. For what we paid, I was pleasantly surprised. The only complaint, actually 2, that I have is that there is little to NO SUN in the pool area. It is a beautiful pool with several sections, most of which were in shade. Also, the casino was rather smoky even though it wasn't crowded. We were placed on a higher level floor, but at the very end of the hallway, which was good and bad, Good cuz it was quiet at our end, bad cuz it meant a long walk. Still, compared to other hotels in Vegas, it was a relatively quick one.

Reviews.Title: “An older place but the bed was amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Chuck27
Reviews.Content: I've been to Vegas a handful of times and this was the first time staying at the Monte Carlo. Rooms are an ok size and older compared to other resorts on the strip but the location was great. Pros: - Thomas checked us in quickly and was very friendly - The casino cafe had great service and food - Bed and pillow was surprisingly comfortable (would highly consider staying here again for that reason alone) - Middle of the strip Cons: - Very thin walls in the room (could hear next door talking on the phone) - Too bad there was no free/lower cost internet or wifi - Cleaning staff was good but did see room service carts left outside in the hallway for extended periods of time

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is close to convention center”
Reviews.Author: girltravelme
Reviews.Content: Hotel has decent rooms, but who spends a lot of time in their room its more about a good value, but its a good location for people going to the convention center. The hotel also has a subway, mcdonalds, and a couple other places to eat at. If you have kids this is perfect for you, as you wont have to walk in the hot heat. The pool is pretty small, but they have a seperate one for adults on the back.

Reviews.Title: “Buffett Concert trip”
Reviews.Author: DC73
Reviews.Content: Another short trip to vegas, another fun trip. Monte Carlo was pretty good, convenience was decent with nice rooms. We were mostly there to hit the concert though.

Reviews.Title: “This resort was a poor value.”
Reviews.Author: poppop9
Reviews.Content: I would give this resort a "C-" overall. Have stayed in six other Strip resorts previously. The room was clean but noisy. Could hear water running from other rooms and easily heard the couple in the next room having sex at 5:00am! The quality of the buffet was definitely overpriced. The food was inferior in,display, preparation, and flavor when compared with other resorts on the Strip. I did not gamble. The fitness room/gym was very nice with high quality equipment and atmosphere. Personnel were friendly, location good. Nice tram to Bellagio. I would not return there, mainly based upon the poor food quality and noisy room. I feel I can get a nicer experience elsewhere for the same cost.

Reviews.Title: “Good times!”
Reviews.Author: tbrackett
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, clean rooms, friendly staff. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: wpgDude
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the MGM Signature suites last year, and while the room was smaller and not as well appointed the experience was top notch. We arrived in the morning and there was zero wait to check in. Our room was changed upon request immediately from 2 queens on the lower floors to a king room on the upper floors that were renovated recently. Compared to the MGM this hotel is smaller, which makes it much easier to leave and get to the strip. There is also a Tram that brings you to the Bellagio and City Centre, super convenient. The workout facilities are included in a $9.50 per night resort fee, and they are great. The only thing not included in this fee is wireless internet access, a $14.95 per day extra. Don't get it. I purchased it for one day, and the signal is incredibly weak. I called the front desk 20 minutes later and had them refund my purchase. We ate at the Buffet one supper and while it is not the best buffet on the strip, the food is good, the price is right, and you don't have to wait in line for more than a few minutes, versus the buffet at Paris. Overall my wife and I were very happy with our stay and next time we return just the two of us we would happily stay at the Monte Carlo again. For a larger group the Signature suites at MGM are the better option.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, but City Center has ruined the view”
Reviews.Author: SixtySpeedTwin
Reviews.Content: After a dodgy start when we turned up and they didnt have a room despite having one booked for six months and ending up in a smoking room (we dont so it was foul). We got our high level (31st) strip view room, only the view was of walgreens an angled view of MGM and a wall of glass that's City Center. We paid extra for this and my advice is dont bother if your in the southern wing, the north wing may be better looking at mgm and NY NY. With the gripe about the room's view over my review gets better, the room was cleaned really well fairly basic but OK, the bed was comfy and the staff were super helpful. The hotels location is pretty good and has more than enough to do, the tram link is handy too. All in all i think its great value with clean rooms and helpful staff in a fairly good position (CC is tedious to get by on foot), so I'd recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “My Second Choice To Mirage Among Mid-Priced Properties”
Reviews.Author: Jtorsney
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Monte Carlo twice. Registration was quite easy on both occassions and the guest elevators are nearby, so you don't have to walk through the casino. Guest rooms are nicely furnished without being flashy. Like Mirage, I find the guest bathrooms small which is a minor annoyance. This might be the easiest hotel to navigate in the city. Service is generally good overall. The only really good restaurant is Andres, but it is actually spectacular. The others are pretty good without being exceptional. The pool area includes a lazy river and wave pool, which are both nice but not as cool as Mandalay Bay. Lance Burton's show here is flat-out excellent. Monte Carlo ranks as a great value in my book. I would stay here again as long as I got a decent rate.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay - Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: MFPorter
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful and the staff was very nice! It is so nice to see a staff that smiles and looks like they enjoy what they are doing. We were on the 25th floor and the view was beautiful. The rooms were spacious and the beds were very comfortable. The only complaints on the rooms were the bed spreads both had stains on them. The shampoos/lotions and soaps provided should be upgraded. Took a long time to get a cocktail waitress when playing the slots and the sports book needs to be updated with more comfy chairs. The area by Cantina Diablo had a strong rotten egg smell which was then masked by air freshner - not pleasant. Breakfast was very good, our waitress was great and had good sense of humor. The area above our booth was very dusty. Overall great value and we had a very enjoyable stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “New Year in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Joseph-Glasgow
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo, very clean with good service. We found it to be a great Hotel & location. Walking distance to most other Hotel's, Casino's and venues.

Reviews.Title: “third tier at best”
Reviews.Author: mixmax74
Reviews.Content: No character hotel. No luxury. Very uncomfortable beds / pillows. Couldn't sleep there. No room amenities, not even a mini-bar. Was cheap but you get what you pay for . . .

Reviews.Title: “good”
Reviews.Author: AnupamaVenkitesh
Reviews.Content: good stay, nice place ..access to pool and casinos and strip..the only prob was with regard to the view of the room..i got a seventeenth floor..still was not able to get a good view :( so u should specify tht when u check in

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for a wedding!”
Reviews.Author: giggle18
Reviews.Content: Had a beautiful suite and enjoyed every minute! Hotel was in the perfect spot for everything. Close to shows, other hotels and dining. Hotel was very clean and bright, and full of life! Atteded a wedding and that was done very nice as well. Simple, but nice. Rooms neat and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Suite Wonderful - Casino Marginal”
Reviews.Author: MonicaP9
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a very nice suite - lots of room, great furniture & decor. Casino downstairs was marginal. Parking was a nightmare getting in and out.

Reviews.Title: “Entrance Fee for Gym??”
Reviews.Author: soap6irl
Reviews.Content: I did not appreciate that, since I'd already paid to stay there. There was even a per person usage fee for the jacuzzi. NOT COOL!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: jmurph8081
Reviews.Content: Quiet compared to other casinos on the strip. Nicely decorated, clean, great service!

Reviews.Title: “excellent value”
Reviews.Author: irishroverottawa
Reviews.Content: have stayed at the monte carlo many times, very good value, good bars and restaurants on site, easy access to I-15, would recommend and will stay. again

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: DaniellaM1
Reviews.Content: My friend Devyn and I stayed here after leaving the dreadddedddd imperial palace. They had the most relaxing lounge area with a WAVE pool.. so cool. Rooms were clean, place was beautiful, I felt like i was royalty and I only payed $59.00 a night. PLUS, we were right next to NY NY and got 2 ride the roller coaster. Monte Carlo had every possible amenity, amazing staff, and amazing views from the rooms (not like the brick wall we had at 'imperial palace', seriously no joke, perfect place for a murder mystery). Anyway, back to Monte Carlo...I would stay there every time if i could.

Reviews.Title: “Great value on the strip!”
Reviews.Author: PJGC
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Monte Carlo in August of 2009 with my best friend. First time to Vegas! We booked with Tripcentral.ca and flew out of Toronto via Sunwing. Included in our package were free tickets to KA. The Monte Carlo may not be as big as the other strip hotels, but upon first glance you can appreciate the understated elegance. The lobby is lovely with fresh flower arrangements. Check in was a relatively painless procedure. The room was clean and quiet. Two double beds and a decent bathroom. To cut down on the "getting ready" time I used the shower at the gym/spa so my friend could have the bathroom to herself. What a deal!!! I paid $39 for a 3-day pass that included use of the gym, sauna, whirlpool & cool plunge, a sitting room with complimentary juice/bottled water/fruit, etc. I used their shampoo, conditioner, soap, shaving gel, razors, hair dryer, curling iron, hairspray, etc. It was like this private little peace of heaven in the middle of Vegas. Very relaxing. The gym had a good selection of cardio equipment and weights and it was not busy. It was a really great way to start each crazy Vegas day! The pool area was nice. The usual towel/reservation thing happens. I didn't gamble much, but the casino was fun. No problems getting drinks the first night, but after that I gave up. The lack of waitresses on the floor was one of my only complaints. I felt bad for them because they were really trying to keep up with the demand. The buffet was good. We had the breakfast buffet twice and at $18/person we made the most of it!!! I tried grits for the first time! All in all, I don't think you can beat the value of the Monte Carlo. The location is great and the facilities are very nice. There is a Duece stop right outside the Monte Carlo which makes getting around the strip a lot easier on your poor tired feet (abandon your vanity and wear comfortable shoes!!!!).

Reviews.Title: “Good quality hotel with "off the strip" prices!”
Reviews.Author: LorettaG87
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at this hotel and would stay here again. Its next door to Hotel New York New York and across the road from the Coca Cola bottle (20feet high) were the Tix4today office is for half price show tickets. Tix4today is THE place to buy all show tickets except Caesars Palace. The Monorail is a bit of a walk through the MGM Grand Hotel but it is much quicker especially if you use it to go to Fremont Experience (NOT to be missed!). The Deuce bus, outside the Cola Cola bottle is $7 for the day but does take 45 mins to get to Fremont Experience although you see lots more from the bus. Trolley bus no longer operates! The food at the cafe restaurant at the Hotel Monte Carlo was excellent and at reasonable prices for the standard. (we had no time to try their buffet) Some of the better known larger hotels were a disappointment for food and overpriced. Best buffet is at the Bellagio Hotel but note that dinner prices start at 3pm! Don't get caught out with the Gelato at $16 at Caesars Palace! Each hotel offers from $5 upwards to join their Players Clubs for their casinos. its free to join , You get a card with the money on and as you play points are added to your card for prizes even room rate specials, IF you spend alot. Las Vegas has something for everyone, each hotel is a mini "Disneyworld" so allow plenty of time and a good pair of comfortable shoes!

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: CaronD
