Reviews.Content: We got a suite, which was MUCH better than the standard rooms and included a fridge. Still no kettle though, as is common in Las Vegas, but we bought our own from a pharmacy across the road for less than $10. In-room internet service was terrible and the business centre is closed on weekends. The hotel has a great location though and the $18 (plus tax) dinner buffet is absolutely fantastic. Tariff during the week was almost half that of the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “11/13/09 bed bugs....should have read the reviews”
Reviews.Author: maxdCA
Reviews.Content: First of all, I was upset when I realized in the middle of the night that I was sleeping on the mattress instead of on a sheet. Turns out, at least in our room, there was not a bottom sheet - the kind with elastic to hold the sheet in place. Instead, they were using two top sheets so the sheet was just laid out on the mattress. Sunday while checking out, I saw 6 bites. Didnt think much of it - in a rush to get home. Then that night and the next few days, more bites. Weird that they appeared in two different places - Vegas and home (so Cal). Itch like crazy and in "clusters" on different parts of my body look more like welts. Researched after becoming suspicious and found out they can appear up to 9 days after getting bit and they look more like welts and they bite in clusters (ussually 3) which is what I have. Total of 21 bites. Disgusting.

Reviews.Title: “just average but always consistent”
Reviews.Author: Ms_Independent08
Reviews.Content: Went here in April with a friend. (This is a late submission). I've stayed here before, and the construction was still going on, but it was expected, so again, not too much of an issue. The room was good, the value was good. What I haven't done in Vegas before was chill by the pool. ( When hubby and I go to Vegas, we're usually tied up with shopping and sightseeing) We spent our days by the pool, and our nights partying at the clubs. What a great vacation. The sun sits right in the middle of the sky and when you get too warm the lazy river cools you off just right. Let me just say the DJ and his/her mash-ups were either awesome or horrible. But the thumping of the music and crowd of people to watch... it was perfect. I didn't notice before, but there is an awfully strong floral smell emitted into the hotel that I found this time to be nauseating. In fact, my leather jacket (which stayed in my suitcase for the duration of the trip) reeked of it for weeks after. As always, the service is fine (not outstanding but not bad), the decor and cleanliness are fine. We had a poolside room which I guess if you are spending the days in your room might be an issue- the music carried up to the 27th floor and rocked our walls- but we were cool with it. (After laying by the pool all day we had to have a nap to make sure we were in shape for the night's festivities! It's a tough life!) Tip- try Jimmy Buffet's Margaritaville for an inexpensive, entertaining dinner. Or another favorite? Gonzales Y Gonzales in New York New York! That place never fails to satisfy a craving for southwestern cusine- and, you can get the mile high margaritas there too!! Another great place for dinner- The Voodoo Restaurant. Expensive and classy with awesome service and cool decor. Afterwards, head up to the VooDoo Lounge for some drinks and enjoy the view on the rooftop patio. Be advised, after 10 pm, tables are reserved for bottle service only, but with the DJ and crowd out on the patio, who wants to be sitting at a table? It's one of my favorite nightspots! The Monte Carlo isn't the Wynn, or Caesars. It's average accomodation with a great location on the strip. It's nothing extremely fancy, and is not at all a dive-joint. The pool is fantastic, the location is great, (also there's a CVS right next door and a Walgreens across the street in case you need sunblock, toiletries, etc)

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money at Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: Catee1
Reviews.Content: We were booked to stay at the hotel for 2 nights on Nov. 6 and 7th. However, we arrived one night early and booked a room on Wednesday, Nov. 5th. Our rooms were okay, however, they never came to clean our rooms and the room rugs and hall rugs were stained and dirty. We stayed on the 18th floor, it looked like they emptied the hallways, nothing was there, no chairs etc. I would never recommend this hotel for the price they charged. We did book the rooms for Nov. 6 at a price of $130.00 and on Nov. 7 the price was $165.00, we could not believe they on a wednesday they charged us $175.00 plus taxes.

Reviews.Title: “The Monte Carlo is a breath of fresh air!”
Reviews.Author: betty3315
Reviews.Content: At the end of the day after touring the streets and hotels on the strip, it was always nice to come back to the Monte Carlo. It is elegant. The lobbies, hallways smell like fresh flowers and CLEAN (not smoky). Coming back always felt like a reprieve from the craziness of the strip! Our room was 'fine'. Stayed for 3 nights and the housekeeping service wasn't spectacular, we found surfaces and floors were not clean upon return each day. The room attendants also make a lot of noise in the mornings vacuuming the halls and knocking on doors. Finally, the walls are thin, and we had to listen to the neighbors partying in bed! The pool area is lovely, but keep in mind it closes at 5pm SHARP. (Music off, bar closed and we were literally thrown out of the hottub by the lifeguard staff). We were hoping to enjoy the hottub in the early evening under the stars, but it seems all pools and hottubs in Vegas close early, for safety reasons we guess. The Monte Carlo is central to everything, and we would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed every minute of our stay”
Reviews.Author: Lilosa
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Monte Carlo and enjoyed every minute. Check-in was quick, and the desk clerk was friendly and helpful. We arrived at 11 a.m. and were in our room 20 minutes later. He gave us a room near the elevators, as requested, because my husband has trouble walking. We like to sleep in on vacation and one day didn't leave the room until 1 p.m., but the housekeepers respected the Do Not Disturb sign and somehow managed to clean the room as soon as we were gone. They did a great job--our room was sparkling clean every day. 8 of us met for the Sunday brunch buffet and spent a few hours there visiting, but the wait staff never seemed impatient and the food was great! The fitness room was well-equipped, and I appreciated the free water and juice. Only one small complaint--the daily resort fee covers just 1 trip to the fitness room per day. If I wanted to use the weights in the morning and go back later for the treadmill, it was an extra $5. That seems ridiculous to me, but it's a pretty small thing compared to all the other great things about this hotel. We'll definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Week”
Reviews.Author: MrsTowers
Reviews.Content: We had been to Las Vegas twice before staying at the Excalibur and the Luxor. After spending a week travelling to Arizona and Utah we were spending our last week in Vegas to celebrate a friends wedding. Members of the party were staying at the Bellagio, Wynne, New York New York and Luxor, but we were looking for the best deal in a reasonable hotel and the Monte Carlo seemed the best option. Initially we had booked for 8 nights but arrived in Vegas a night earlier and the service desk were very helpful in accommodating us. Our room was a bit dated but clean. The Monte Carlo looks very impressive from the outside and is spacy inside it is also ideally situated on the strip. There are cheap eating and drinking options which the upmarket hotels do not have. We tried the buffet at lunch and it was very good. There was building work going on between the hotel and the Bellagio which we didnt here but it was a pain having to walk through it. Our friends and the bride and groom were staying at the Bellagio so we did spend a lot of time at that hotel which is very luxurious but also expensive for drinks etc. so they were joining us at the Monte Carlo in the evening. We would return to the Monte Carlo as we found it hard to fault, perhaps new decor!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for Vegas getaway”
Reviews.Author: cdngirl83
Reviews.Content: You don't go to Vegas to hang out in your room and for that reason the Monte Carlo is PERFECT! Not that the rooms are bad, they are just average. Spacious, with comfortable beds and clean and nice washroom. But the best part is this hotel is a great price, is amazing location and has a lovely pool area. Would definitely recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “Halloween for Adults”
Reviews.Author: TXStoney
Reviews.Content: Staff friendly at check in, Pub bar and at the Buffet. Paid extra for a high floor with a view, but disappointed because city center blocked more than half of the strip view. Room was clean, but worn out sheets and bed covers were pilled. In room movies were not up to date, I guess 6 months or a year old. Internet was 14.99 for 24hrs. Wireless was very low and wired did not work. My room needed serious updating. I liked the in room safe. Bell service was quick and friendly. I missed the microbrewery. The in room phone was so old that none of their services were listed. You had to dial the operator to get the right extension. Housekeeping was professional and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “TAKE A CHANCE ON THE MONTE CARLO”
Reviews.Author: stevieboyse9
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed between the 25th October and the 30th October, and had a great time. I have previously stayed at the Venetian, obviously the Monte Carlo is nowhere near the Venetian in luxury. However it is over half the price. Our rooms on the 25th Floor overlooked the pool, and the soon to be open City Centre Site. We had no problems with construction noise as the project is almost complete. However the new buildings cast a shadow over the pool area for a large part of the day, so if lazing by the pool is your thing you may want to go elsewhere. I had a problem with the safe in my room. This was quicky fixed by the friendly security staff. The rooms do need some modernisation but are clean and have everything you need. The hotel is not themed so it does not attract large amounts of gawping tourists, just guests and gamblers. The buffet is ok, but the close by MGM Grand is better. The hotel also includes a food court, with Starbucks, Macdonalds, Subway and a few others. The hotel is in a good position on the strip. Don't buy food or drink from the hotel shop, pop outside to the CVS Pharmacy or Walgreens and you will save loads. The MGM Grand across the road will give you access to the Monorail, but if there are a few of you, it may be cheaper and quicker to get a taxi. To sum up, The Monte Carlo is not the best hotel on the strip but very good value for money. Our room cost $340 for 5 nights, which at this time is £207. This is excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “We used to love the Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: pnutsdad
Reviews.Content: My family came to Vegas to celebrate my mom-in-law’s 80th birthday. We usually stay at the Monte Carlo due to the service, rooms and location. Within a few steps, you have several casinos to visit and the Rosewood Grille is right across the street. We normally have had great luck with the Monte Carlo, but this trip might be our last stay. It all started at check in. The still have people getting into a variety of lines to get to the front desk. Instead of one line and you get the next available person, you get into a line and hope you pick the right one. I, of course, did not. I watched as people who came in after me go to the front desk staff while I stood and stood. I only had 3 single people in front of me, but of course, as they got the desk, 2 – 4 others joined them. So after a 20 minute wait, I was finally at the front desk. I booked this trip over 6 months ago asking for connecting rooms, one with a king, one with two queens. Of course, they could not do this. I had options of a king in a handicap room on a different floor from the 2nd room or two rooms that were both queens in various sections of the same floor. After some work, they were finally able to get us two rooms, both queens, close to one another. You would think with today’s technology, the planning for rooms would not be this difficult. So after 30 minutes, we were finally up to our room. The rooms were okay. I remember the Monte Carlo having nicer rooms, but I guess they are just getting old. What was really disappointed is the condition of the room from the cleaning staff. All the beds looked like, after they were made, someone laid in the middle of the beds. The comforters were wrinkled and in one case, the pillows were on the bed, not under the comforter. So we spent the first part of our visit looking the room over to ensure it had actually been cleaned. The first evening and day was nice. The casino was clean, getting around was easy and the staff at the hotel were courteous. They cleaned our rooms as expected and the room seemed to be in good shape, until we went to bed. In one of the room, the sheets did not fit either queen bed. It was like some camping trip where you got your bed short sheeted. We tried to strip and remake the beds, but it did not matter. The sheets were not the right size. So we slept on part sheet, part mattress. The final insult were the surveys I was asked to fill out. I was offered surveys two time from the Monte Carlo and the survey links never work. I guess now that most of the hotels in Vegas are owned by one major company, the term service is not longer practiced.

Reviews.Title: “I'm changing brands”
Reviews.Author: HarrahsSevenStar
Reviews.Content: Been a seven star with Harrah's for years and I've never received this kind of treatment. Limo driver waited an hour because of late flight, host met us at the door, signed in VIP lounge, escorted to room, etc. Good food, very nice room, even hit some payables. Better than any annual trip Harrah's gives. I hardley ever played at MGM properties before, but I sure will from now on. If you want to be treated cheap then stay at Harrah's. Well done, Monte Carlo!

Reviews.Title: “Great locatio, great stay”
Reviews.Author: biggirl69
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights between 7-11 Oct for my 40th birthday after visit to New York, taxi ride from airport less than 10 mins we paid $20 including tip. Arrived about 4pmish & check in was empty, we were given choice of rooms, some were ready & some not. We choose 13th floor with king size bed pool view but had to wait 30mins to be ready so checked luggage in & went to pub for beer. Friendly barman each time we visited. Room was good size & clean, tv,safe,iron & ironing board. Clean bathroom, we did notice water was slow to drain when showering but nothing major. View of pool, noticed building around but never heard any noise. Never used pool area but had a look around, needed to show room key to enter & looked in my bag, looked good & popular. Because built up area we did notice pool didn't get a lot of sun. Food hall was really handy. We ate at the chinese restaurant (not the food hall chinese) & The Brand both meals were good, look out for the girls giving out the 241 cocktails vouchers for The Brand cocktails. Casino was large & easy to navigate, cocktails waitresses were around but not as often as I liked!!! Location of hotel was great. We walked everywhere but you have options to use monorail & buses. Only downside we found was showing ID, in hotels & restuants never asked, but when viisting bar,club or paying by VISA we were asked nearly every time, As we come from the UK we did find it a little frustating, I don't drive so only had passport which I was not keen to carry with me everywhere, managed to blagg it in few places 'sorry we're from England & don't need to carry ID' no problem but one bar would not serve us & we are 40 & 46!!!!!! other than that we has a great time & would stay here again & hope to visit in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property but Disappointing Room”
Reviews.Author: suzdavid
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo is a gorgeous hotel with great restaurant choices and a nice pool area. We splurged and booked a spa room with a hot tub overlooking the city. When we arrived, we were immediately disappointed with the cleanliness of the room. Though it was on a non-smoking floor, the room reeked of cigarette smoke. The jacuzzi tub was dirty, and there were rings on the coffee table and near the jacuzzi where drinks had been set by previous guests. The first time we used the bathroom, we found a "surprise" floating in the toilet! For the money we paid, we expected a fresher, cleaner room. Though food and drinks at the cafe and pub were excellent, service at the cafe was slow. We also waitied in line for half an hour to be seated, even though half the seats were empty inside. Maybe they were short-staffed, but why did that become our problem? Overall, our stay at the Monte Carlo was disappointing and I wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo Resort is the Place to spend your vacation!”
Reviews.Author: BRANDMTNView
Reviews.Content: We have spent the last five years of our vacation at Monte Carlo Hotel Las Vegas. the service is excellent and we are very pleased. The restaurants are nice although I miss the Blackstone Restaurant with the delicious Prime Rib, Brand is okay. Monte Carlo is the place for us! We will stay over and over again! Art

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for our vacation!”
Reviews.Author: travelpete2009
Reviews.Content: Myself, my father and brother stayed at the Monte Carlo for 4 nights October 19-23 and couldn't have asked for a better hotel. The hotel is located between the city center (which is currently under construction) and New York, New York. There are many restaurants, nightclubs and shopping within walking distance. Our room was on the 18th floor and had an awesome view of the pool and new City Center. The room was well kept, clean and had everything we needed (there is hair dryer and iron/board in room). All that really matters is that you have a bed - you are in vegas!! if you want a nice quiet place - stay home!! The staff at the Monte Carlo are awesome! Anything you need (extra towels, water, matches... etc.) they have it to you in no time and with a smile. They even took 2 long distance phone calls off our bill because I didn't get through ($15 per call - buy a phone card!!) check - in and check out was a breeze. The only thing i didn't like was the $9.50 per day resort fee. It included bottles of water in the room daily and printing of boarding passes. I have been to vegas a few times before, but my father and brother never have, so we rented a car and I took them to the Hoover Dam. We stopped at a few of the older historic casinos and hotels on the way. Make sure you eat or pack a lunch before you get to the Hoover Dam. We paid $45.00 for 3 burgers & fries there!! The casino at the monte wasnt too crowded most of the time, which is nice not to have to wait for a table or machine. We did win a little ( enough to pay for 3 tickets for 2 shows, and most of our meals) which was a bonus. Jubilee (at Bally's)- seen it 3 times now. Fantastic cabaret style show. Definately worth it. Ask cab drivers for coupon books - we got the $92.50 seats for $35.00!! We wanted tickets for the Beatles Love but it was sold out, so we saw Human Nature by Smokey Robinson at the Imperial Palace. Great show, very lively. Anyhow, I've stayed at many of the big properties in vegas, like the MGM Grand, Paris, etc., and the Monte Carlo is definately a great place to stay, we will go back for sure. One tip I can leave for people is: have a good time in vegas dont get wrapped up by the reviews and whatnot. you vacation is what you make it. If you get upset at every little thing - just stay home!!!

Reviews.Title: “good”
Reviews.Author: SethH
Reviews.Content: great room zervice,.. clean towels, clean bathrooms, great food, fine stallions....

Reviews.Title: “A great time”
Reviews.Author: SunTan12
Reviews.Content: Stayed with some friends this past week and we had a great time. We were expecting a long wait at check in but we only had to wait 10minutes and were able to check in to our hotel at 9am. The information and conceirge were extremely helpful and when one of our party realised they had left their key to their suitcase in the previous hotel, engineering was prompt in coming up and removing the lock. The hotel was clean and the food court was good except it is not open 24hours. Also vistied the Chinese/Japanese restaurant and the cocktails and food were both great. The casino is so/so but there are so many others to discover on the strip. The Monte Carlo is in a great location and we didn't hear the construction from our room. I would definately stay here again and with the current prices of around $59 a night during the week how could you not.

Reviews.Title: “Go -- if only for the pools!”
Reviews.Author: mcbrie
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights at the Monte Carlo in late June. One of the hottest weekends hitting around 106. In JUNE! The hotel was nice, clean and what you could expect. The location was ok, but with the sprawling properties combined with the construction on the strip, we pretty much stayed put. The only issues we had with the hotel was the temperature of the rooms. We could not seem to get the a/c cool enough at night and had trouble sleeping. Also, we thought we were hearing hallway, or neighboring room conversations, but realized that the maid had left the radio on the lowest volume. A little irritating, but easy fix once we turned off the radio. THE BEST PART IS THE POOLS! Although there was a good crowd and trouble finding a seat if you were outside any later than 9am, there was plenty of water to play in and around. The lazy river was a blast! Buy an intertube at Rite Aid or the ABC Store instead of renting at the hotel. Also, bring your own beverages into the pool to save cash. The wave pool was a serious party with DJ, though the playlist could use some better rotation. I think they only played about 15 songs on a continuous loop. Another cool thing, which I suspect all hotels are going to be picking up on...you can sign up for hotel deals and discount through text messaging. We were getting offers for BOGO dinners and drinks for all the hotels in the company (includes NYNY and Caesars). We would definitely come back to the Monte.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, room and pool!”
Reviews.Author: couloir17
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel. Been to vegas probably about 6 times in the past 3-4 years so ive been to a few places. the room was huge, and smelled pretty clean. didnt have the best view but then again who cares about the view in vegas we were hardly in there anyways... bed was super comfy too. Pool does have the loud pumping music id read about but it wasn't that annoying at all. drinks at the pool were a bit pricey but what do u expect? the drink girls at the pool are smoking hot and i liked the lazy river though it wasnt exactly moving at lazy speed. sure the casino is a bit dated but we didnt play much there anyhow, the food court was handy for a quick bite and you can't beat the location for the price. mostly ive stayed at budget places like Imperial Palace and Excalibur so this was definitely a step up. check in was easy and painless as well.

Reviews.Title: “Simply an amazing experience.”
Reviews.Author: goodstuffisgoodstuff
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Monte Carlo around 10:30PM and it took about 10 minutes to check in with no problems, oh and I love hearing "You already paid for the room, we don't need to have your card on file, unless you want movies or something." We get up to the room and its HUGE! (2 Queen beds a non-smoking). The bathroom is big as well, nice tile floor and marble counter, shower head could have been updated but still very nice waterfall style. We had a great view of the New York New York and the Excalibur. We went to the pool the next day, the lazy river is pretty cool, although $12.95 for a inner-tube is kind of steep, but you can just go in without one. The other pool is nice as well, as is the jacuzzi. The service is what made this place amazing, I had a shirt on bed that I left there, I left the room to get a bite to eat, I come back and guess what the SHIRT IS FOLDED on the bed, I've never had a maid do that before. The food-court is open 24 hours but kind of pricey, for instance a foot long turkey sandwich and Subway was $9.00. If you ask the front desk for coupons upon check-in however, you can get a free soda or something with purchase. The one complaint I had was that the air conditioning unit in the room was in-wall and controlled by a thermostat in the room, you can set it to 60 and fan Hi, and it takes a while to get cold but its not loud so I guess that's good. Could use some more TV channels and also about the noise from the pool DJ, I had a room on the other side and didn't hear it. I do admit the walls are kind of thin, you can hear people talking and doors shutting but its ok, it won't keep you up because the beds are amazing. Overall, this is one of the best hotels I've stayed in, I've stayed in luxury hotels in New York and San Francisco among other places and so far only few have compared to this one.

Reviews.Title: “Third time lucky but then you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Nixxrite
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo is a good on strip hotel, not fantastic, not awful, but good. On checkin we were given a smoking room with two Queen size beds and neither myself or my partner smoke, the room was tainted by the smell of cigarettes and wasn't ideal. I called the front desk and they moved us to a non smoking floor immediately. Our second room albeit slightly better had two Queen size beds again which to be frank is useless to a couple and takes up a lot of the floor space. I called the front desk and asked to be moved again to a room with a single King size bed. The front desk told me they couldn't do this for the first evening but were able to the next day. Finally, the next day we got a room that was ideal, a king size bed, and plenty of floor space for luggage, shopping etc. Throughout the experience I do have to say the front desk were accommodating and helpful at every turn. As for the remainder, the Pub has had a makeover and the Beer Towers have gone which is a bit of a bind as they made the old micro brewery worth a visit. I didn't use the pools but did go out there a couple of times, unfortunately you don't get much sun late on in the afternoon as the new building adjacent do their best to block out the sunlight. The Casino itself was ok, free craps lessons every day at 11. Occasional $5 blackjack tables for those gambling on a budget but I have to give special mention to Gail, one of the blackjack dealers. Her friendly demeanor really made playing at the table a pleasure, she introduced us to several people from all over the world and the table had a great atmosphere. There's also a Starbucks at the back of the Casino for those in need of a morning coffee, one thing I would say is the queues here get pretty big and you may have a wait so if you need a fix it might be quicker to go to NYNY next door. All in all, the location is on strip and pretty good but not central, the cleanliness and service are as you would expect from any hotel. My only gripe would be the rooms as they could probably do with being touched up but overall, we booked 90 days in advance and so got a good discount and on the strength of that it was a great value for money location and I wouldn't have any qualms staying in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Would Never Return or Recommend to Anyone”
Reviews.Author: princessmc
Reviews.Content: We Arrived At About 2PM, Check In Was At 3PM We Didn’t Get A Room Till 4PM We Still Needed To Get Ready For A Wedding, The Water From The Shower Had Horrible Water Pressure And Below Where The Comes From Was Loose And The Water Was Hot Below But not one you Pulled It Up for a Shower, it Was horrible. I Booked My Room Weeks Ahead Of Time they charged my card for one night right away And They Still Didn’t Have A Room Ready, I Went on A Thursday And Didn’t Seem To Busy There. It Was My First Time There, And There a RE Way Better And Nicer Hotels on The Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, bad nightly experience”
Reviews.Author: stevekhart
Reviews.Content: While the rooms were nice, we had young adults partying in the rooms on each side of us until 2am. Called front desk twice with no remedy. Room 31-116 Moved the next day to room 24-317, nice view of the strip. room was great and much quietier neighbors. Unfortunately the "Club Diablo" (part of M.C.) thumped out techno bass beats until 2am. Boom, boom, boom, boom.... The staff was apologetic, but offered discount or upgrade for our troubles. The pool was in the shade until 2pm, then sunny until 6-ish. 1 Beer and 1 maragrita - $23 including tip by the pool. Good room price, good quality. Not for someone looking to relax and call it an early night at 11pm.

Reviews.Title: “If you desire an ecomonic room to simply sleep in while in Vegas, this is may be a good hotel for you!”
Reviews.Author: DrTurtle
Reviews.Content: In Vegas, I've been at the Wyndham, the Bellagio, theHOTEL (Mandalay Bay), Planet Hollywood, the Signature (MGM), Cesaer's Palace, and Monte Carlo. Monte Carlo = not impressed. Almost appalled. The casino and bar area was nice. However, the rooms and hallways were plain and eerie. There was little design and no suggestions of luxury. The room was surprisinlgy, worst than Holiday Inns that I've stayed at previously. Maybe I got a bad room. Staff was nice. Curtains were stained, room was empty... but that equates to alot of floor space for luggage! Bathroom was large but again, plain. When you go to Vegas, you don't expect rooms to be subpar. I have not stayed at Circus Circus, Imperial Something or Flamingo (which have less expensive rates), but if Monte Carlo is supposed to be a notch above those... consider me worried. Anyhow, I didn't spend much time in the room at all, which was a great thing. So, if you're tight on cash and just need a place to crash, consider Monte Carlo.

Reviews.Title: “dont bother”
Reviews.Author: terryukSouthport
Reviews.Content: poor attitude by staff along with poor but expensive facilities.dont try and get a sunbed after 11am as the60 or so that arent in the shade will already be taken.if you are lucky and do manage to get one it will either be dirty or broken.dont sign for anything at the bar etc as we found a 30dollar tip had been added to our bill at andre's even though we left a 15 dollar tip.we were then told by staff that it was a slip of the pen on our behalf.its 19 dollars to use the gym plus 5dollars for the changing rooms.dont bother with the reopened pub two lots of fish and chips with a couple of beersis over 60dollars with tax.the rooms are large but very basic with thin walls leading to you listening to next doors noise. terry .uk

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special ... would not pay for rooms here.”
Reviews.Author: jtram98
Reviews.Content: We had two nights comped here so decided to take them. Check-in was very quick (Oct 10, Saturday morning). Our first room on the 31st floor had adjoining rooms on both sides and we could clearly hear the TV in the next room. We decided to change rooms and called the front desk. The same person who checked us in answered the phone and immediately changed our rooms. When we went to the front desk, the clerk had our rooms keys ready. Our new room was on the 21st floor with a view of the pool. We tried the pool. The lazy river was fun, however there was little sun. The pool area is right next to the new City Center and many of the buildings seem to block a lot of the sun. The room was fine, but the bathtub did drain very slowly - other reviews mentioned the same thing. There is nothing particularly bad with this hotel - its just not that special. As I mentioned, our rooms were comped, so I'm not really complaining. However, I don't think I would pay for a room at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, great rooms. Very friendly and efficent staff”
Reviews.Author: bornagainboozer
Reviews.Content: Go see for yorself the Monte Carlo is a great hotel, the rooms are very clean and comfortable, the catering within the hotel is great, service second to none. Staff very helpful and friendly. Dont know whny people moan about the music at the pool, perhaps they should stay in a convent instead, its Vegas. Come on what do you expect

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, Old and run down!”
Reviews.Author: UtahSlc123
Reviews.Content: We try to sneek away to Vegas once or twice a year ( It's only about a 50min flight ) and we have never stayed at the Monte Carlo before so we decided to give it a try. the hotel is in a good location but the rooms are old and run down and not very clean ( okay I know it's a hotel so it wont be as clean as my house, but it was pretty dirty) we did not enjoy this hotel at all. spend a little more money and stay somewhere nicer with alot more to do. we will not return.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Jason H
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo was definitely someplace that I would go back to. The rooms were spacious and clean, the staff was attentive and helpful and the location was perfect. Located next to the New York, New York Hotel and across the street from the MGM Grand and Planet Hollywood, the entire strip was at our doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “Plenty of elbow room”
Reviews.Author: shrewdgrud
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 days and 4 nights. The location on the strip is great..not too overly busy, like places right in the middle of the strip but also not far away either to all the interesting places to visit.This hotel has plenty of staff for checking in and out so theres not alot of waiting around. We had an 8th floor room,.. not much for a view on the backside but you can get a partial glimpse of the pool(s) below. Very spacious room, low lighting and thick heavy covers on the bed. good sized bathroom with plenty of towels and toiletries. One drawback is that they want to charge for WiFi service, which we believe is just ridiculous because there are much cheaper hotels across the country and places that give you this service for free anymore. They also need to install stationary or ceiling fans in the rooms as the window can only be opened a couple of inches and the room was stuffy in the morning. good bathroom with plenty of towels and guest toiletries. Housekeeping was very good, even in the latter part of the day, as you can find someone in the hallway if you need anything. The Casino itself was very nice and is wide open with alot of games. we found, compared to many other casinos on the Strip, that this one was much more open for foot traffic and had plenty of elbow room without feeling overly crowded, which was nice. We found the waitresses were very slow in bringing drinks unless you tipped heavy and heard that complaint from other people as well during our stay but outside of that, the casino itself is very well layed out. Their is a McDonalds, a Subway and another fastfood business in the hotel adjacent to the casino for quick bites. The breakfast buffet is actually pretty good for the price and the main selling point here, is the made to order omelettes...they also have a great variety of fruits and fresh baked goods to go along with a typical breakfast buffet tho we didnt see any toast but they had biscuits. I wouldnt recommend the lunch or dinner buffets here for the price, as there are so many buffets along the strip that offer more variety at the same price range but thats my personal observation. We did experience Diablos Cantina, which is a pub belonging to the hotel and casino..here you can sit outside on a patio setting and enjoy a cocktail, listen to music and people watch right on the corner of Las Vegas Blvd and Monte Carlo. The chicken nachos are fantastic and a house favorite but be prepared to be full.. our waitress gave us a good tip and recommended getting only one order because the serving size is so large, it will feed four easily.. we tried our best and maybe finished a third of it and they are sooo good. The pool(s) area is quite popular and the Lazy River located here is just what it sounds like.. you can rent a floaty, grab a cocktail from the poolside bar and float around on the slow moving river all day if you want. its depth is only three feet or so but it will move you. some may want to come early to sunbathe as the lounge chairs fill up pretty fast after high noon when the sun comes around the building to shine on the pool area. Overall this hotel and casino has good points and bad too but it ranks up there with many of the leading places in Las Vegas and the architecture is amazing in itself for picture taking. There are good pictures of this property online.The staff, both in the hotel and casino are very helpful and super courteous to everyone, answering questions or giving advise to those that need it, whether a guest or just visiting. Be prepared to spend alot more for small items you might need from vendors inside as they are quite pricey unless you hit the jackpot or just have money to burn. we found for simple items that wont break your budget, you can walk a couple hundred yards nearby the property to a local CVS or Walgreens store and use the savings in the casino or for whatever.

Reviews.Title: “About the worst experience I ever had”
Reviews.Author: FloridaGemini20
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this hotel was the quiet room. Once I left (and this is my fourth stay at the Monte Carlo) the noise was unbearable. The sound level and boom boom boom beat of the music was so high I could never relax. It was hard to be in the casino (where it would be expected to have some loud music) but also the pool area sound level and the restaurants were the same. This was never that way before. My husband and I will never return.

Reviews.Title: “VEGAS”
Reviews.Author: MalorieL
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo was alright for the price. The rooms were nice and the casino was okay, but there are much nicer hotels in Las Vegas though.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo Delivers”
Reviews.Author: BCISR
Reviews.Content: I stayed @ the Monte Carlo with four buddies last week. Rooms were so cheap, we each had a king room. Check-in was a breeze. Staff was pleasant and attentive. The breakfast buffet was very good. The king room was clean, bedding looked a little worn, old TV's. But who comes to Vegas to watch TV. Very confortable bed. Maid service did a good job, very appreciative when tipped. Diablo's was excellent, food and service. "Mohawk" waiter did an excellent job. Casino was very good to me. "Rick" (H/D owner) dealer was excellent !!! Great place to stay for a guy's only trip. Stay @ Polazzo when traveling with my wife. Would recommend for mid-level stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families except for the smoking in the pool area”
Reviews.Author: AAA-member
Reviews.Content: They have the lazy river and the wave pool that is an attraction in itself for our 6 year old and our 16 year old. The only thing is I wish they would have a small non-smoking area near these pools for families with children or for adults with medical conditions that would prefer a non-smoking area. The hotel is across the street from the M&M store, the arcade, and the roller coaster in the New York New York, which was perfect for our kids. If you try this hotel and agree with the non-smoking area please let them know so that maybe this will change soon. After a relaxing day at the pool it was great to enjoy the Buffet with a Pasta Station and Asian Food Station, especially at 2 for 1.

Reviews.Title: “BEST BANG FOR THE BUCK”
Reviews.Author: BOJOWILLIAM
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I spent 4 nights at the Monte Carlo and still can not believe that this hotel has been getting bad reviews on trip advisor.Upon our arrival we were concerned about the construction noise that everyone was complaining about on this site.We were given a beautiful room on the 24th floor overlooking the pool area and did not hear a sound.The next morning the bathroom blow dryer conked out and was replaced in 10 minutes by the hotel staff.The rest of the week was perfect and the staff was very pleasant and cheerful, and always available when you need them.The entire hotel was spotless and the buffet was as good as it can get for the price that they charge people.If you go there and just want a quick bite to eat, try some fast food (Sbarros,Subway etc) located in the casino near the pool entrance.The pool area is nice and if you are traveling with children just check out the Lazy River.If you do not want to rent any inner tubes just go next door to the CVS and purchase them for $5.99 each, because the rentals can run you about $14 a day.We highly recomment the Monte Carlo and its a great place to stay....Period!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “very nice, not really family friendly”
Reviews.Author: martin918
Reviews.Content: My wife and three young kids stayed for three nites. Very nice and clean. We all loved the lazy river, wavepool was disappointing. On our last day (friday) the pool turned into spring break. Great if we didn't have kids and were 15 years younger. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Sammydan
Reviews.Content: We decided to take a quick trip to Vegas and got a great deal at the Monte Carlo. I have never been to Vegas and although my boyfriend had been he stayed all the way at the other end of the strip. We both thought the location was perfect! Right next to New York, New York and across from M&M world, and MGM grand but not too far at the end like Mandalay Bay and the Luxor. There is alot of construction going on for the Mandarin Oriental opening in December but besides that it was great! The room is your typical hotel room, it was comfortable and the staff was very nice. I did hear the cleaning staff knocking on doors around 8:30/9:00 so if you plan to sleep later maybe put the do not disturb sign on your door. We had a slight problem with our bed the first 2 hours we were there and without hesitation management moved our room and comped us a free dining at the buffet. We didn't go to the pool but we could see it from our room. There is a lazy river, wave pool, and two other pools that looked clean and nice from what we saw. If and when we go back Monte Carlo would def be where we would stay.

Reviews.Title: “Central and easy to navigate”
Reviews.Author: Ezza25
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Monte Carlo for 4 nights during a 2 week trip around the US. First impressions is the hotel is very nice and everything is on your doorstep, either within the hotel or just outside. Check in staff were incrediably slow, but conceirge on future visits about missing rooms items was very helpful and prompt. Rooms were spacious but dark and bathrooms were fine. We found the lack of coffee makers and bar fridges a sign that we were being forced to stay out of the rooms to spend money. There is a $4.99 fee on the atms downstairs which was a shock, but I think within the casino region that is probably the norm. Cleaning left a bit to be desired, for example when the cleaner couldn't reach a corner of the bed to put the duvet flat it was left. This may be due to the huge volume of rooms they have to clean and there isn't the time to make the finishing touches. The room service trays were left for well over 24hours on our floor, which we thought was unacceptable particularly as the guests had left half eaten food uncovered. Buffet in the hotel was lovely with very friendly staff and was great value. Casino staff were fantastic and had endless patience. The bar had the opposite and we weren't treated as if they wanted us there (once they decided to serve us). Be careful with the baggage storage as bags are not kept together and we had to go back to the hotel from the airport when we realised they had not put all the luggage into the taxi.

Reviews.Title: “good location and stay”
Reviews.Author: katiek3
Reviews.Content: the monte carlo is in a good location on the strip. it's easy to get to all the locations on the strip. there's not a lot of nightlife in the monte carlo, but the casino aspect was good. there's an open air restaurant/bar in front of the hotel. the pool was nice and not as rowdy as some other hotel pools

Reviews.Title: “Will Not Go Back”
Reviews.Author: cindy74
Reviews.Content: I did not like this Hotel at all. Maid service is very slow and takes forever to fix problems. I had a disgusting stain on a Sham on the bed. They did not change it when asked. It took theme three days to do it. Room was not that clean.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: JMatsuhiro
Reviews.Content: I expected a little better from a big name hotel. The fire alarm going off at 1:00 am didn't help.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: margstew
Reviews.Content: Was surprised to find the hotel better than expected. I had been a little anxious after reading some of the reviews, but we were very pleased with the room and the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay again....”
Reviews.Author: smh2200
Reviews.Content: While I had heard great things about the Monte Carlo, the experience feel short in many areas. The overall hotel cassino stunk, and not just like smoke but like they had plumbing problems. We could not stay in the hotel to gamble, and thus went to other cassinos. The hotel room was average room, kind of felt more like a holiday inn then the famous Monte Carlo. The bed was not comfortable and the sheets need replacing. The water pressure was good but the temp was really sad. Talk about four days of cold showers. We did mention the noice level of the constuction around the hotel but they had no room on the other side of the hotel, thus we heard construction from 7 am to midnight. I'd reconsider staying at this hotel. They present themself as this high class/high end hotel but you will be disappointed by the average motel you will actually get for your money.

Reviews.Title: “I loved the Monte Carlo, everyone was very helpful, the hotel was very clean and the decor was beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Cathleen9
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo was a beautiful hotel and very clean. The decor was updated and chic. Because we in mid-week and the hotel was not extremely busy, we were upgraded to a suite without even asking. I will definitely make the Monte Carlo my home-base for future business trips to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great stay”
Reviews.Author: scott2080
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel primarily because of good room rate and location. Turned out to be really good. Pretty much in the center, rooms were great, service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and service right on the strip”
Reviews.Author: moxiejacks
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo for a mini-vacation. We absolutely loved the hotel. The one thing that I noticed was that there was no smokey smell that is very apparent in other hotels around the strip. This is an excellent value for a nice hotel right in the middle of the strip. We really like the location - you can walk right out of the hotel and be right on the strip. It isn't an over-the-top hotel like most of the ones that you find on the strip on Vegas. The hotel room are very clean - and smell clean too! No smells of cigarettes that you get at other hotels. I would definitely stay here again. Their players club program is great too - you can accumulate points at the Monte Carlo, MGM, Bellagio and a bunch of other affiliated hotels on the strip. If you're looking for an over-the-top hotel experience like Bellagio or Venetian, then the Monte Carlo probably isn't for you. If you're looking for a nicely appointed, clean smelling, fairly reasonable hotel right on the strip then the Monte Carlo is where you want to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Property”
Reviews.Author: erick1997
Reviews.Content: Front Desk service was exceptional except they may want to add ropes for a single line. You have people standing at various places and there is no single line. Rooms were pretty basic but clean. I guess you get what you pay for because we did a special rate but was upgraded to a view on the strip which was extremely nice. Front desk staff was exceptional and didn't experience anyone being rude.

Reviews.Title: “Love it, Love it, Love it”
Reviews.Author: TallT50
Reviews.Content: We love staying at the Monte Carlo whenever we go to Vegas. The pool is a great place to relax for the day before heading out for the night. You don't have to go through the entire Casino in your swimwear to get to it. Food is near by, they can either bring you food poolside our right in the door is a nice selection at the food court.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: livbello
Reviews.Content: enjoyed the spa and restaurants at the hotel we tried a saki bomb at the noodle house

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice for the Price”
Reviews.Author: AnnMarie_Charlotte
Reviews.Content: Check in was alittle confusing because you had to pick a line... I think it would be smoother if they used ropes. Erica checked me in and was very nice. I asked about the construction and the noisy pool and was told the construction was almost done and shouldnt bother me, and she felt my room was high enough that I wouldnt hear the pool music. She was correct. My room was nice, the bed was very comfortable. The casino was just average, but it was nice to have the food court so close by. The pool didnt have enough sun, and the chairs were so close together you needed to almost step on someone to lay down. Overall it was a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “It's a beige sort of place.....but thats not always bad!”
Reviews.Author: marcnshirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at MC from the 1stOctober checking out on the 4th. I'd read a few bad reports of this hotel, so I was a little aprehensive about my stay, however, given it was a comp deal, I went ahead with my stay....and I'm glad I did....The Monte Carlo Hotel is a pretty nice hotel and not deserving of some of the bad reviews I have seen posted. As a solo female traveller I can say I felt totally safe and comfortable at the MC. Check in was swift and friendly. I was given room 20318 which faced the mountains....with the Orleans seen in the distance straight ahead and the NYNY to my left. The room....as with the hallways was decorated in beige. The carpets could do with a freshen up but the bed was very comfortable, the linens were crisp and not at all scratchy, the towels in the bathroom were brand new and fluffy white. The room is furnished with "cherry wood"...it is looking a tad outdated for my taste, however, the desk wardrobe and amoir were all in excellent condition. The room was very clean and comfortable over all. The 1st night I heard no noise at all...and I wondered where the reviews of paper thin walls come from. I found out on the second day when I had 2 ladies move into the room next door who were LOUD....very loud...I could hear every word of their conversation! I had a room with an interconnecting door though....so that might be to be avoided. The casino downstairs has a wonderfully staffed, friendly poker room. The slot machines varied from pennies up and the cocktail service was super speedy sometimes and deathly slow at others, depending on which section you sit in. There is a food court with a starbucks and subway, maccas, sbaro, ice creams and some chinese food and mexican food. The location of MC is slap bang next to NYNY on one side and the city center project on the other. I did not hear any construction noise at all. The pool area has 2 pools and a lazy river. Well staffed and very clean. Room service is amongst the worst I have eaten anywhere....this is to be avoided....I ordered twice just to make sure I didnt just cop a bad night....and the 2nd time was equally as bad as the 1st.....give room service a miss. Over all though....I consider the Monte Carlo a pretty good 3 star hotel. It may not have the glitz and glamour of other big players in the Vegas Hotel game, but it also doesnt have the high rates. It's a solid mid teir property with friendly staff, good location and pretty good bang for your buck. Would I stay there again? Yes. Would I suggest friends stay there? Yes....for a rate of under $100 a night....it's a pretty good deal.....anything over $100, there are better deals to be had in Vegas. Oh...ps...They have introduced a "resort fee", which I think is rubbish....it's $9.50 a night (I think)...I wrote "declined" under where it says resort fee on my check in slip. It was not charged to by bill upon check out. shirl'

Reviews.Title: “Watch the "Resort Fee"”
Reviews.Author: Edfooyung
Reviews.Content: Like a lot of hotels this one charges a $10/day "Resort Fee" for the health club, bottled water in the room , etc. I did not use any of these services. I love ala carte fees that are shoved down our throat involuntarily. Also some of the staff seemed a tad bit surly. Very average place.

Reviews.Title: “It was okay except for the pool area and weird garage”
Reviews.Author: coolcaesar
Reviews.Content: I recently visited the Monte Carlo for the first time and stayed through the weekend. I got a good deal on Hotwire. Although built in 1993, the Monte Carlo has been well-maintained over the years and was in good shape. Hallways, lobby, elevators, and room all have a consistent design scheme and look good. The room was well-designed, attractive, and in good condition, with no funny smells or damage, except for a small tan stain on one of the comforters. The room was quiet and I got a good night's sleep. Room A/C was quiet and maintained temperature well. Parking is free, there is a lot of it, and the garage is relatively new and looks a lot nicer than some of the garages attached to older hotels on the Strip. Landscaping is not as elaborate as the Bellagio but is decent and reasonably attractive. Plus they have "free" newspapers (well, considering how much this place costs, they should be handing out newspapers). And of course, it's on the Strip and conveniently located next to a CVS/pharmacy open 24/7. There are some downsides, though, which is why I can't give it a rating of five. As a lot of people have noted, there's no fridge in the rooms. The room lighting was kind of dim and inadequate (only two lamps). There's an annoying $9 daily resort fee (which with taxes comes to $10.50 a day). The Monte Carlo uses the same gigantic garage for valet parking, self parking, and employee parking for both itself and the adjacent CityCenter complex, so the garage has a very confusing design intended to keep all four user populations separate, and the signage is not clear, which means it's easy to end up going the wrong way. The pool area is too small and in the shade of the Monte Carlo building itself for much of the day, which means the pools are rather cold and the surrounding chairs are overcrowded. The music in the pool area was not as loud as I expected but I agree that it is annoying. In the end, I appreciated the convenience of staying in a pleasant, clean, comfortable, quiet hotel room on the Strip with a good view of the city. But if you also like to go swimming during a Vegas vacation, the Monte Carlo is not a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Going downhill”
Reviews.Author: KansasReviewer
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights at the Monte Carlo, what a disappointment. From check-in, waiting in unorganized lines, was given a different room than what was reserved and paid for. Did not know until arrived in room and then immediately went back to stand in line again. Was told rooms are first come first serve. After complaining that I wanted what I paid for, a room magically opened up. Room was filthy. Not vacuumed once during stay. You can hear every noise from adjacent rooms. The restaurants were way overpriced and the food was bland. Had better food in the food court. From the entrance on Las Vegas Blvd. you would think the casino is closed, not much glitz going on. I was verrry disappointed and do not plan on returning to Monte Carlo. I would not recommend staying there at all.

Reviews.Title: “great trip, ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: Calgarygrl11
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Monte Carlo for 5 days, 4 night with 5 other girls. It wasn't my first time in Vegas, but my first time stayng at the Monte Carlo. Arrived at the hotel around 1:00 p.m. and only one room was ready (2 girls / room) he said the other room would be ready before 5 p.m. We dealt with John at the front desk; he is SO slow and it took us about 45 mins. just to check in. Something to keep in mind - there is a $9.50 / day charge if you want to use the gym. You do enough walking in Vegas so you probably don't need to bother with the gym! Our check-in took so long that we were given comps to the buffet which could be used at any time during our stay. The buffet was great - lots of selection and friendly staff. The pool was ok. It had an awful sewage smell the entire trip and the "lazy river" wasn't as fantastic as described. If you want to rent an inner tube for the lazy river for $12, you are better off going next door to the CVS pharmacy and buying a tube for $4. The room was decent enough but there is NO COFFEE MAKER (which was a must-have for me). There is a food court in the hotel which had a pretty decent selection. Another tip - if you don't want to be woken up by housekeeping at 9 a.m., remember to put your "do not disturb" sign on your door. We ate at Diablo's (hotel restaurant) one night. The food and drinks were great but I got a weird rash on my leg from sitting on the chair cover (which really freaked me out). I just removed the cover and I was fine. The location was great and I think we got a good deal for the price. There are a lot of hotel options though!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Place.........”
Reviews.Author: UpNorthMona
Reviews.Content: We just spent 4 nights and loved it... But if we could say one thing bad........it would be....nice to have a small refrig......as it get's hot there and it would be nice to have a place to put some cold bottles of water.........ect........Realize it's about wanting to get everyone out spending the $$$.........But..........again, it would be nice to come back and relax with a cold drink........and then all refreshed and ready for the next round....... We loved the Strip and can't wait to return.....It would also be nice........if the Hotel would inform all of there clients........of what they have........such as ..Shop's ect.........and what floor each one is on..........give out some info..............

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location for a fab holiday”
Reviews.Author: pixie1Scotland
Reviews.Content: Found a great mix of ages whilst we were there. was one of the quieter casinos in town. The room we had on the 31st floor was spacious and clean. Our room attendants were very hard working and courteous at all times. Had the champagne buffet brunch and what great value for money. Had 2 glasses of champagne and could have had more if we had wanted to. The casino was a bit mixed. The drink attendants were very unattentive at times and one was especially rude. The pool was good although very shaded at times and could be on the cold side. Pity it didnt open until 0900am. Would come back to this hotel. great hotel for price, location and comfy beds dont expect the nightlife to be great. Go elsewhere but nice to come back to a quiet spot after a hectic day/night out.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location, at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: Aussietravellers72
Reviews.Content: We arrived in LV at 1.30am, and having seen a promotional price for this well-located hotel, managed to get a comfortable room for 3 nights for $55 - $69 per night. Whilst the room was by no means new, the service was very good, valet parking very convenient, and the spa (with separate mens and womens sections) was a real respite from the casino's bells and whistles, and was exceptionally clean (access cost a few dollars more per day). The pool area was lovely, and the margaritas excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for money Good location & Service”
Reviews.Author: OxfordVegasregular
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to stay on the strip but do not want to spend a fortune the Monte Carlo Hotel is the place to stay . Well located & within walking distance of some of the top hotels you will find this hotel reasonably priced with a good level of service & friendly staff. After visting several of the other more popular hotels with attractions it was nice to come back to not such a busy hotel at the end of the night . better still the bus stops right outside the front door on the way home !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cruze-lover
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ok, but wish I had checked out other hotels as there seems to be much better options out there. I booked the room though Delta Vacations and also since I am not a "high roller", was given a room on the 5th floor with a view of the A/C units and slight view of the pool. Pros 1. Great location - middle of the strip 2. Pool was great (however the staff could do a better job picking up towels off the chairs, hard to tell if the chairs were still occupied) Cons Room was so-so (maybe due to low floor). Bed were average, pillow were not great (order extra from room service) 1. Thin walls 2. $9.50/day resort fee included "printing your boarding passes" BEWARE - When we asked the Concierge about this, he said no problem he would do it for us. Then he asked for our sky miles number and PIN. When we declined to give him that personal information (you can book tickets/access credit card info with those numbers), he said the business center was closed and we could only print though him. We said "no thanks" and printed them at the airport. 3. Lots of construction around the hotel. 4. Large buildings around the pool block the sun (but that was ok since it was 100+) All and all, not a bad stay for the price - but there is a lot of options.

Reviews.Title: “Overall - Pretty Good!”
Reviews.Author: suedieter
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three night stay at this hotel/Casino. While not one of the more well known on the "Strip", it was a very nice, centrally located Hotel. Very nice room on the 27th Floor with a view of the Strip and all the hotels. It is a bit noisy at night if your room faces the street but it's not bad. Room could have been cleaner. Had some mystery stains on the bedspread but they came up and changed it out as soon as we called. The Pool is great! Three different areas to swim and lots of lounge chairs for relaxation. There is a regular food court inside the hotel with Subway, MacDonalds, Sbarro, Starbucks, Rubios Mexican, Haagen Das Ice Cream etc. There are various other restaurants too. We did not try the sushi bar but did eat in the "Pub" and the "Cafe". Both were excellent and considering it was Las Vegas, not too expensive. Entrees at both were around $10. Went to see Mirage at the Bellagio - wow highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Boring, Boring... and more boring.”
Reviews.Author: PetShopLady
Reviews.Content: It was clean, the rooms were fine, bathrooms a little small and outdated, but whatever. I really thought the hotel was a snooze-fest - especially after seeing all the other fabulous ones I should have stayed at. Rio & Luxor were both cheaper, and we would have enjoyed them more. The pool was terribly crowded and small, and the pool bar was expensive and awkward to get to. Also, didn't help that our flight arrived at 8am and we weren't given a room until 5pm. that was awful. The service desk was rude. Room Service was yummy though and better than many other vegas restaurants. I want to return to vegas, but I certainly won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel with Thin Walls”
Reviews.Author: Love2Travel1974
Reviews.Content: I just recently returned from a four (4) night stay at the Monte Carlo. The room was clean and decent. My only complaint was the thin walls. Upon arrival I was placed in a room next to some extreme partiers, however management and security quickly handled the matter and I had no further issues. The second morning my husband and I were awakened by what I can only describe as “Screams of Passion”. We soon discovered that the couple on the other side was celebrating their anniversary. We were celebrating a birthday and an anniversary so I could definitely understand, but was wondering if anyone heard my celebratory noises as well. Nevertheless the room and hotel staff were great and the customer service was awesome! The rate that I received on the hotel room was great, but I would not stay here again regardless of the rate because of the thin walls. Believe it or not the construction noise was minimum compared to my neighbors. The buffet at the hotel was also good.

Reviews.Title: “monte carlo las vegas great experience”
Reviews.Author: jimboconk
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the monte carlo las vegas between 12th-18th september.i stayed there for two reasons,one was the price and the other was the reviews.the reviews were mixed but on the whole tripadvisor seemed to give a balance in favour of this hotel.the hotel is elegant it feels like a more upmarket hotel than the price would indicate.the rooms were good,spacious and clean and quiet.the housekeeping was excellent.as i arrived very late and left very early i cannot really comment on the checking desk but i did find the staff friendly and helpful.the casino area is much quieter than other casinos but after visiting some other hotels this turned out to be a blessing.the only complaint is the buffet the food is bland the choice is not very good(looked forward to a nice roast beef dinner the beef was so rare that i felt as if i had a blood transfusion and who wants loaded roast potatoes covered in CHEESE)go elsewhere to eat or try the dragon noodle in this hotel .the location though is brilliant and the deuce stops are right outside the hotel but it can be difficult to get on at certain times of the day.i would return to this hotel and would recommend it especially to slightly more mature people who are looking for a hotel that is not too busy and who are offered plenty of free drinks and offers value for money.the players card is good as it can be used in lots of other hotels but dont use your comps in the buffet--jim conquer

Reviews.Title: “Excellent positionally”
Reviews.Author: UkRon50
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent position on the strip in las vegas. The rooms are of an excellent standard with a good housekeeping service. The staff are welcoming and extremely friendly. It offers great plenty to do with quite a few amenities and choice is plentyful. The value for money is extremely fair and the food is to a good standard. The poker room is probably one of the most well organised and managed rooms in vegas not to mention very welcoming by the staff. Would advise anyone looking for a nice alround hotel to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Simple hotel off the strip”
Reviews.Author: goatluv
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked this as something different form the normal hotels that we stay at. The front desk was very helpful in getting us to our room... 25th floor strip view. .. the strip view really isn't of the strip, the way the hotel is set up it is hard to get a great view. As for the hotel it is very simple, nothing fancy or overwhelming. The casino is not as busy as some of the others on the strips so that made this a nice place to play on the tables. If you are looking for a simple place to stay with nice rooms this is it, if it is your first time to Vegas and you are looking for a bit more of a thrill you may want to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: christiantodd
Reviews.Content: I would HIGHLY recommend staying at the Monte Carlo! GREAT location that is close to everything, GREAT price, and the rooms are above average and VERY clean! I don't have any complaints, and would definetely stay there again. Nice pool - not to busy, very clean and not too loud like we were expecting. Clean and comfortable, quiet, close to Walgreens/QVC, walking distance to everything from the Bellagio/Paris/Venetian down to MGM/Excalibur/NYNY/Luxor, and of course the CityCenter. Unless you are want to spend 3X the money to stay in a 5-star resort, I would HIGHLY recommend the Monte Carlo! Very sold 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: kepLiverpool
Reviews.Content: Not sure i'd have booked this hotel if i'd have read the reviews first. Glad I didn't read the reviews. We arrived at the monte carlo at 9pm saturday 5th september which is the busiest night of the year (so i was told), no waiting a check in, very pleasant and helpful receptionist gave us rooms next door to each other on floor 26 with great views. Rooms a good size well equipped, little tired but hotel is one of the older ones on the strip. No problem getting 4 sun beds sunday morning, pool area was busy but as it was bank holiday i supposed you would expect that, the music is louder than normal but adds to atmosphere, wave pool fun and lazy river well lazy. Had a great time at the monte carlo and would have no problem staying there again. Hired a car and drove to death valley,hoover dam and lake mead to feed the ever growing fish!!!! Recommend cirque du soleil love the beatles show at the mirage.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Habscouple
Reviews.Content: Visited Las Vegas and stayed at the Monte Carlo. Great location, right on the strip close (as close as you can be) to shopping and other casinos. For those who haven't visited Vegas before, things are a lot further than they appear on the map so be prepared. After waiting for over an hour for a shuttle (take a taxi, with two people or more it was cheaper than a shuttle and takes a lot less time) we arrived at the Monte Carlo. Check in was smooth but upon arrival in our room my wife had an allergic reaction to some cleaning product that left a very strong smell. We went back to the front desk and asked to switch rooms. They were more than accomodating and quickly got us another room. >Rooms were large and clean. Beds were comfortable and bathroom was very nice. They were doing some construction nearby, but noise wasn't too big of a factor. Had some neighbors that kept us up late one night, but it is Vegas so I imagine that happens all the time. Elevators were quick and we never had to wait. >Casino was large and had table games, slots, sports betting, ect. Waitresses provided drinks regularly. Nice atmosphere all around. >Pool, lazy river, wave pool were AWESOME. Great way to cool off on a hot, hot Nevada day. Drinks by the pool are expensive. >Restaurants in the hotel are good, nothing too spectacular. Lots to choose from though from buffet to steak house to fast food and everything in between. >Shops were okay in the hotel, we didn't browse in them too much. All in all, a very good stay. Friendly staff, great casino and beautiful pool. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Casino/Hotel, but the rooms are far from what you would expect”
Reviews.Author: Upgrading
Reviews.Content: First of all, I must say that I read the casino reviews for the Monte Carlo before making reservations. Some reviews were bad and some were complimentary. However, after our stay, I can definitely confirm that all of the negative reviews that I read were absolutely correct (So be sure to read them). We booked our reservations online for a premium, non-smoking room. Upon our arrival at 11pm, we were told that our room was not ready..can you believe this? So, we had to wait while the room was cleaned, (keep in mind that hotel check-in time is at 3pm). Anyway, we finally got to go to our room and discovered that someone else was already in our assigned room # (pathetic). We had to return to the front desk again and get another room # since we obviously were assigned the wrong room #. TOTAL INCOMPETENCE should be the name of the front desk employees. It gets WORSE..When we got inside our room we noticed the following: 2 queen beds instead of a king bed as reserved, a large pubic hair (thats right) in the bathroom sink, absolutely filthy bed comforters with cigarette burns on one and a blood-stain on the other comforter...DISGUSTING. I have never really been one to complain, but this is ridiculous for a casino/hotel that advertises such great rooms and service. We actually took pictures of the pubic hair and the cigarette burns/blood stains on the comforters. We intend to forward these to Monte Carlo Management. I would not even walk inside the room without shoes on.. For the same money I paid, I could have stayed at a better quality-controlled casino/hotel. I was satisfied with the other aspects of this hotel, with exception to the hotel rooms which need a major overhaul with new linens, carpet, etc. I definitely will not be staying at the Monte Carlo again..I expect much more for the money. Needless to say, our expectations were initially high, but every time we entered our room they hit rock bottom. PLEASE DO YOURSELF A favor and keep walking down the strip to the Bellagio or across the street to NY NY.

Reviews.Title: “Lazy River was a Blast!”
Reviews.Author: rockbaby
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at the Monte Carlo. The rooms were fine. The beds were clean and the linens were good. The very favorite part of the trip was the Lazy River. We floated for a couple of hours. You have the option to rent tubes or whatever but I just floated on my own. Get to the pool early as it closes at 7 p.m. and the chairs were full most of the day. The casino is fine. The chandeliers are beautiful. Nice views for that part of the strip. Easy access parking.

Reviews.Title: “no lights in bathroom Filthy room broken furniture”
Reviews.Author: stunnedArizona
Reviews.Content: after leaving early from our trip to the monte carlo because of a room with NO LIGHTS , FILTHY curtins, bedspreads and windows. Broken furniture . Wrote a letter to the general managers secretary , also filled out review on there web. site. NO REPLY !!!!!!!!! What a bad way to do business. We travel to Vegas 5 to 6 times a year and never have we came across these problems !!!!!!!!!!!! Players card didnt work half the time either. Best part in the ice machine room a couple was having sex , While we were going to elevators for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: robinski_00
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo was not awful, but our room smelled like industrial cleaner and the sheets did not fit the bed. The pool, which is advertised as being huge, was a serious disappointment--it is tiny compared to others in the area. Plus, the water was disgustingly dirty and a DJ was blaring tunes all day long. It was not a relaxing scene, more of a Spring Break feel. There is only one main pool and it was so crowded that we could not even find a chair--we would have had to sit on the cement. The pool guy recommended we walk two hotels down to Excalibur and use their pool, which we did. Their pool was fantastic-had an adults only section, 3-4 pools and tons of chairs. What was I paying Monte Carlo for if I had to walk 25 minutes down the Strip to use someone else’s pool? The worst aspect of the hotel is the food. The restaurants are TERRIBLE!!! We spent our last evening at the hotel's steak restaurant, Brand, which is pretty pricey. Our entire meal tasted as if it was smoked, even the asparagus. All dishes, including salads, are made for two. What in the world does that accomplish? My husband and I wanted to order different sides and I wanted a salad as a first course. It was a huge waste of money. The hotel's only redeeming quality is that it is close to the main sidewalk as opposed to being set back like Caesar's. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “been in better and have been in worse”
Reviews.Author: sunchiller
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay in Vegas, stayed the first time at MGM, this trip was a gift to our children for graduating university. I have nothing I can really say was bad about the Monte Carlo. No its not the MGM but its higher standards than some of the other resorts on the trip. I would compare rooms to the Best Westerns in Canada. Our rooms were on the 15th floor not facing the strip or the pool. The rooms were quiet, clean and plenty of space for the amount of time you are there. Check in was a breeze arrived at hotel at 1230, lunch time, and our rooms were ready, which was fantastic because check in time isn't until 3. Also check out time is at 11 am and our flight home didn't leave until 1130 pm, so they offered us our room at 1/2 of the days rate, so we could keep our room until 8pm. We had great service from the front desk, conceirge desk, (who helped us book a few day trips and also to let us know how to get cheaper tickets to some of the shows). I can't say we had any trouble or rudeness from one person who worked at the hotel. We did eat at the buffet for the champagne brunch, and it was worth every penny, we had our fair share of champagne to celebrate. We also ate at the buffet at the Mirage and I found we all enjoyed the buffet at the monte carlo the most, and the mirage was more expensive. One thing we did really like about this hotel is that it is smaller than some so it made it much easier to get around. We did two shows Lion King and Love would recommend both shows but are two totally different types of shows we also went to the gun shop on tropicanna ave and there you can do target practice a few other place we visit and would reccomend are shark reef, minus 5 bar, roller coaster at new york, rides at stratosphere also go to freemont st. at night places to eat roxy's, harley davidison cafe, italian place at new york.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay - will definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: JudyJackpot
Reviews.Content: I don’t know why some Las Vegas hotels avoid using any kind of organized line management system for the check in process, and the Monte Carlo is one of them. It seems that you have to jockey for a position in front of the check in desk, and pray that the clerks are efficient or that the people ahead of you don’t have credit card issues. I hate that they don’t use the “next in line” approach by setting up the customary velvet ropes to guide guests through the line in an orderly manner. That said however, our stay at the Monte Carlo was GREAT once we got to our room. The rooms are nicely updated, clean and comfortable, the bathroom is super-clean with great amenities, and the hotel atmosphere is very nice. Housekeeping was excellent and the hotel towels were plush. The only downside to the room was the thin walls but this is common in most hotels and would have gone unnoticed except that the couple in the room next to us was rowdy and obnoxious - the lady had a loud, irritating laugh - but I chalk that up to inconsiderate human behavior and poor manners, and nothing against the hotel itself. Laughter is good, but not a 3:00 AM when some people are trying to sleep! Lucky for us they were gone the last two nights.
