As most room serivce (anywhere) is expensive I would try to avoid that if you're trying to watch the spending. I only went down to the pool area once and for a short time, but the girls I travelled with were able to spend a day at the pool and said that finding an open chair wasn't too difficult (as I've stayed at other hotels in Vegas which sometimes are near impossible to find an open beach chair) and they LOVED the lazy river. It's nice to be able to float around lazily in an innertube and stay cool while soaking up some sun. There were enough palm trees around to offer some shade if you wanted it as well. For a 3-star hotel and the price that comes with it, Monte Carlo felt like a 4 star hotel with great value. Out of the other hotels in it's 3-star class, I would definitely choose Monte Carlo again over any of them.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort”
Reviews.Author: Lucky032
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in the middle of July, 2009, and we had a great experience. The front desk staff was very accomadating and provided us with a terrific room, a Monaco suite. The room was spacious and well designed. We had no problems finding a machine to play on or a table to play at during the entire week. The pool area was very nice and the lazy river, although crowded, was relaxing. The new parking garage is a recent addition and very convenient. It is well lit and there was a security person at all times. We will be looking forward to our next trip to Vegas and plan to stay at the Monte Carlo.

Reviews.Title: “food police”
Reviews.Author: naz123Liverpool
Reviews.Content: Had to change rooms twice, each time waited 20 mins in line. Waited ten mins for a drink at the brew pub while staff chats to one and only customer about how good they look for their age ( happened at least two other bars in hotel) Pool bar charges $10 for two bottles of water. They check your room key at the pool gate which is good but they also check your bag . I thought this was also for security but found out they are looking for food , after buying two ice creams FROM THE HOTEL and taking them to the pool I was stopped and told I could not eat them by the pool. I stood there in 40 degree heat with ice cream running down my arms unable to reach my sister to tell her to come out to eat and unable to go in. I argued there are no signs anywere about this rule and. I then asked for the reasons, because it was not for hygiene because people are drinking creamy cocktails and rainbow ice drinks in the pool spilling them and leaving a nice foamy scum around the edge of the water for you to swim in, could the reason be they want you to buy the very expensive food and drink from the pool bar. Pool area was filthy ,put my bag on the floor and was covered in stains, clothes dirty from the beds ,swam twice in seven days because pool packed out with lots of people just standing in the pool waving drinks about, sun beds all reserved at 9am but no one around until lunch time . Sat and watched as people forced to eat quickly standing up or throw food away, even families with small children had to throw away snax bought from the hotel shop, one woman was turned away bacause she had an apple. The loud rock music started at 9AM and got louder through the day, The rooms and the hotel was shabby and scruffy and house keeping done as little as possible. Lots of what look like drunk teenagers running around screaming and shouting. Most of the staff were rude apart from the buffet staff. Paid alot of money for what is supposed to be an ok hotel , feel cheated and ruined my birthday trip

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean, and a bargain”
Reviews.Author: minipenne
Reviews.Content: Despite the construction going on in and around the hotel, we really enjoyed our stay. It's not the swankiest of rooms (mainly the bed linens are okay, but not great), but when you're spending so little, what do you expect? It was very clean, and the casino is one of the less frenetic ones on the strip. There's plenty of space and light, and the dealers are nice. The casino also does not have a strong odor (neither of smoke nor cloying air fresheners). We were in Vegas to meet up with family. We checked in first. We were on a different floor from my parents and, after spending a night in our original room, we asked if we could move to their floor, which promptly happened. I would be happy to stay here on a return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Wanted to love it... but they didn't want my love!”
Reviews.Author: Orion_240
Reviews.Content: Okay, I wanted to try staying at the Monte Carlo because it seemed to be a little more upscale than the NYNY next door, where I've stayed twice. I was hit with disappointment the second I arrived. The entire MC parking structure was CLOSED to guests! They were using it for construction workers for City Center! I had to park out on the hot sun and walk about 200 yards with my heavy bags, through lots of traffic on the side alley. Valet was very packed the whole time I was there, and I hate leaving my nice car with valets. Also, like the Mirage, they have this strange check-in area, where there is no single line, and you just stand in front of each desk clerk. I had several other people walk up and get their rooms while I waited. The elevator banks are close by though, and I had one that serviced just the upper rooms. The hallway to the room was very sparse, with no decoration or feel that you are at the Monte Carlo. The room was the same and it made the NYNY look like The Palms! Nothing special about the room at all. It had most of the normal amenities, but these days hotels in Vegas should be offering something beyond "normal", especially for the higher rates I paid. Most of this average quality was to be found in other areas too. The pool area was packed every day of my 4 night stay, and I got the last chair each time I went. It would have been a nice pool area were it not for the loud music which made talking to your waitress almost impossible. The river they have is nice, but you need to get rid of half the people in order to have a nice swim not getting bumped into. I heard they are letting people from the NYNY use the MC's pool. Gambling, the buffet and coffee shop were also nothing special, though the service was above average. Diablo's, right out front, had great fajitas and a great view of the Strip. We ate at Andre's and had a 4 Star meal. Had the sea bass and it was worth every penny! But they would not let me open a bottle of expensive wine I'd brought. They didn't have corkage at all. The front desk clerk had given us a $25 off card to use, so once again, the service is great but some policies need to change. We ended up buying a pair of cheap wine glasses and drinking out on the steps right on the Strip! I also tried Brand, which is their steak place, but it is right off the side of the casino and open to it. Smelled lots of cigarette smoke throughout dinner. The burgers were good, but the servers are a little young for such high prices. The overall crowd at the MC was younger than I had expected and it proved that Vegas has lots of visitors. If I ran the Monte Carlo I would demand shuttles, buses or carpools for the construction workers, thus giving MC guests back their parking structure. I would also create a single check-in line, add special amenities to the rooms, lower the music at the pools, or have a separate area for adults who want more peace and quiet. Until then I'm not really able to recommend the MC.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice room at a very good price.”
Reviews.Author: sroberson
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent, location great, and check in was a breeze.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: Tina200902
Reviews.Content: I had hear pretty good things about this hotel but, that was not the case at all. I don't find myself to be a picky traveler. The customer service was horrible. The front desk was not knowledgeable. They were rude and not helpful. I felt like they were doing me the favour by allowing me to stay there. I have been to Vegas many times and never had an experience quite like this one. This will be the last time that I stay at an MGM property.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed our time at Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: NoleGallagher
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a great stay at Monte Carlo. We try to get out to vegas once a year and was a little nervous after reading reviews. Previous trips we've stayed at Venetian, MGM, and Caesars. Monte Carlo sent us a deal that was too good to pass up and we really enjoyed our stay. We'd definitely stay here again. We loved the layout of the MC. It was very easy to get around. When you come down from the room, you have the main lobby, pool, casino, and food court all right there. The other hotels you have to walk a mile to get around. The room was average but we didn't care at all. We generally left the room at 9am and didn't go to bed until after 1am. We slept, showered, and changed at the room. I've seen some bad reviews on beds but ours was fine and comfortable. Our room was the last one on the 27th floor so noisy neighbors and construction wasn't an issue. Another good piece of advice we took from previous reviews was bringing tubes for the lazy river with us. I think my wife bought some for under $5 compared to renting or buying at the pool. only negative I had was you couldn't sit on the edge of the pool with a drink. This is the only hotel I've been too where i couldn't drink a beer sitting on side of pool. So instead of running up a $75 bar tab per day at the pool, i bought one beer in four days b/c I didn't want to drink it sitting in my chair. As I said, we'd definitely stay here again. It's not as nice as the other hotels we've stayed, but for the price it was great. We averaged $50/night (Wed-Sat night) and would stay at the MC all the time for that rate.

Reviews.Title: “hotel staff not friendly”
Reviews.Author: cjshue
Reviews.Content: Hotel is mediocre. Room is dark and not well ventilated. Mattress is way too soft. The hotel staff is not friendly at all. Called and asked for direction to the gym, got rude answer and hung up. Will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service for a Strip Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vegasfun1
Reviews.Content: First review for us and it must be said that this service in the Casino is the worst I have ever seen in Las Vegas. We will not spend our money at this Casino tommorrow. The staff is rude and their is no atmosphere that makes playing fun. Spent nearly 30 minutes before we got service at the craps table for drinks. Video poker was even worse, the bartender spent his time NOT delivering drinks. The place is just dead and absolutely no fun! Isn't Vegas about fun? Do not stay or play here!!! Oh, the Diablo Cantina is a great place to eat and hang...that is it!!

Reviews.Title: “good location & nice room”
Reviews.Author: Whitegirl1966
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a good location of the Strip. The room was a tad dated but very clean & comfortable. The maid service was adequate also. The pool was overcrowded (being summer & all, no surprise) but we managed to have a good time relaxing there & ordering some decent poolside cocktails & food. The beds were real comfortable..after an evening of walking the Strip, you want a comfy bed to go to.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay- Pool makes it all worth it!”
Reviews.Author: Nhern
Reviews.Content: We were hesitant to book this hotel for a 3 night stay over the 4th of July weekend. I feel that this review is needed to balance the bad reviews. Our experience was great. Overall, the staff was very helpful and friendly, the hotel room (while fairly basic and small) was clean and had a nice view of the srip. We stayed in a deluxe high floor strip view room and it was quiet and the beds were fine. The pool was the best part! You do have to get there early to get a chair- if you do, you should have no problems finding chairs together. Pro's - Wave pool- while kind of small, it is lots of fun - The lazy river is swift and fun - You can bring your own raft to the pool. You can also rent one of their rafts, but it's cheaper to buy one at walgreens which is nearby. The pool attendants are also happy to blow it up for you- again, very good service - Pool drink service was fast and someone always came by. The food by the pool was also good. - There's a regular pool as well- mainly adults in this pool. We had a 6 year old with us, so we used the wave pool and lazy river mainly. - Pool area can get croweded, but don't let that deter you- it's fine - Pool hours are the same in most of the big hotels- this one closes at 7. Some others close at 6 (it's vegas, go figure) - Live DJ at the pool. The music is loud, but not terrible. Even with a hangover you should be ok. - There's a store in the lobby- has all your essentials you could need - Food court in the hotel (McDonalds, Starbucks, Rubios, etc)- great for a quick bite - Fast elevators - easy check-in and check-out - fast valet service - pretty good location on the strip- especially if traveling with kids- it's close to excalibur and M&M world, etc Con's: - Room pretty small, but adequate - Halls could use some touching up - Room service trays left out for a few days - Food and service at their cafe was just ok- and prices pretty high - Casino was ok- I've been to better and worse All in all, I would say that this was a very kid-friendly and nice hotel. I would definitely recommend it to anyone who is looking for a hotel with a great pool and a clean room with a nice view. Don't worry about the bad reviews- I couldn't find anything really bad with this hotel- and I am a tough critic.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to write home about, but does the job”
Reviews.Author: Nyahz
Reviews.Content: Really decent price for a hotel that is relatively close to some of the better casinos. Accommodations are pretty standard but much better than I expected for $40 a night! Bed was comfortable and room was clean, water pressure good. I didn't spend much time there anyway =)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Ok Casino - Staff "ok"”
Reviews.Author: bmoore09
Reviews.Content: So my girlfriend and I stayed at the Monte Carlo in late June. We booked a Tues-Sat for $42 a night. Couldnt really beat it. My other family were staying at the Mandalay Bay and the Hard Rock. So we were in close proxemity to them all. So we arrived and checked it. We were glad to see the casino was easy to navigate. It's kinda just like a straight line, not crazy halls and turns everywhere. This was probably my fave part of the palce. Didnt have to look hard to find my family. We didnt really eat there, so i cant comment on the food. The rooms were pretty blah. Nothing special, but nothing wrong either. It wokred out. I dont know how I'd feel about paying more/night. But for what we paid we were very happy. Great location, ok service, and ok rooms.

Reviews.Title: “No Thanks!”
Reviews.Author: jpr78
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great for most activities in Las Vegas. The hotel itself is however not good at all. Its old and worn. Cleaning was ok, as long as you dont look under the bed. ( I did..) If you like really bad tvreception, doorkeys that work perhaps every third time and plumbing that wakes up the whole floor then this is the perfect hotel for You. As an added bonus You get a boring casino and a not working players club. And ofcourse they lost my membership information for the players club and almost accused me of stealing a card. Internet access at $14.99 per 24h period is an insult even though it seemed quite fast. The only really good thing was the staff for check in/out and the poolarea.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo - Good Enough”
Reviews.Author: funnybone
Reviews.Content: This review is long overdue. We had a wonderful family reunion which included family members from Montreal, Toronto, LA and Santa Barbara. All fifteen of us stayed at the Monte Carlo. What got the ball rolling was the fact that my brother-in-law won a free five day trip to LV through work for his family, so we decided to join. Managed to get a fabulous rate of $59 for the first 3 nights, then $129 on the week-end. Having stayed at the Venetian two years aga ( first time in Vegas) , I was leary about such a stepdown. Here are my impressions: Firstly, the size of the hotel was a huge plus. It was wonderfully manageable. No walking for fifteen minutes just to reach the front desk. No big hustle and bustle in the lobby and common areas. This made sense since there is no big attraction here drawing the crowds. No theme. Just a nice marble lobby. Check in was a bit dicey upon arrival. My sister requested that we all be on the same floor. Instead, we ended up on different floors. Staff response was rather icey and not apologetic in the least. We decided not to move in the end. Too much hastle. Room: Clean. Decent enough furnishings. Came nowhere close to our suite at the Venezia Tower. Bathroom was fine. One big problem - the beds were awful (we had two Queens). I told everyone it felt like we were sleeping on water beds - filled halfway! Lumpy, soupy, lightweight. The blankets and sheets were no better. Thin linens; ugly brown woven blanket. No fluffy duvet nestled between two layers of crips sheets in this room. Honestly, I suffered with a lower backache for two months after those sleeps. Other than that, the room was adequate. We were on the fourth floor looking out at the NYNY rollercoaster. Screams and wheel grinding got going on the early side (it's a wonder why anyone would ride a rollercoaster at that hour). Oh yes, we also heard that beeping sound from garbage or construction trucks. Thank goodness for earplugs. I don't gamble, but the casino seemed decent enough. Food: Fast food choices fine for breakfast. Discovered hot oatmeal with a variety of fixings at Starbucks - yummy. Eggs were rather greasy at the breakfast stop. We had coupons for the buffet, so decided on breakfast one morning. Good selection. No complaints. Ate at one of the restaurants one night. Sorry, I've forgotten the name, but it's the casual diner type one. Overall, food was very fair and we definitely wouldn't go back. What really made us squirm was witnessing a crew (including some kind of security person or manager) totally disinfecting the table behind us, all in blue rubber gloves. They even threw out all cutlery and dishes on the table. We didn't go to the trouble of asking why all this was going on for fear of the answer. A plus for us was the location. We liked the fact that the hotel wasn't dead set in the middle of all the strip action, but rather closer to the south end where the scene wasn't so hectic. Also, made getting out of Vegas much easier, both navigation and timewise. Bottom line - would I stay at the MC again? Probably not unless we were guaranteed brand new pillow top beds and top quality duvets and linens. Did I mention that the bottom sheets weren't fitted causing them to slide off at somepoint during the night. It was totally gross waking up on the matress cover. What can I say? The Venezia spoiled us silly!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the hotel, pool was disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Stacylee617
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nites and were happy overall with the hotel. I really liked the layout - you did not have to walk for miles through the casino to get to your room. The elevators were right off the lobby as well as the 'fast food' type restaurants. The beds were very comfortable - which is a plus after long days walking the strip. We booked a special summer package which included several 2 for 1 coupons. When we got to the room, we realized they 'forgot' the coupons - however the front desk corrected the mistake later. The biggest disappointment was the pool area. We were only able to go to the pool one late afternoon. We found 4 chairs together (a plus), but I thought the pool water was very dirty. It was cloudy and had pieces of paper floating in it - probably because of all the people drinking and smoking IN the pool. The wave pool was not working this day, but the water here was much cleaner and no one was in the pool. Of course I expected the loud music but it was definitely LOUD - forget relaxing by the pool when the music was on. I might stay here again based on location of the hotel - and only in the colder weather - not when we wanted pool time.

Reviews.Title: “JUST SAY "NO"”
Reviews.Author: nadey2009
Reviews.Content: The only thing good about the hotel was the fact that it does not smell like smoke like other hotels. The room was outdated, the tub was not working, we had to stop in the middle of the shower to let the water go down so we can continue and it would not overflow, we called and they never showed up to fix it, and when we told them at checkout they said there was no mention of it at all, and we had to ask for a new hair dryer, since ours was throwing sparks out and we got one that was nasty dirty and it did the same thing the next day, and finally we called them again and they brought us a new one at 4:30am, when we asked for it at 2:30am.....

Reviews.Title: “Skip the Monte Carlo!”
Reviews.Author: Kartgv
Reviews.Content: The best thing about our recent stay at the Monte Carlo Hotel & Casino was that it was only 1 night. The room itself and the buffet were adequate but nothing special. The first problem was check-in, when the agent handling our check-in answered a phone call and kept us waiting close to 10 minutes while he handled a complaint from another guest wanting to change his room. When we got to our room, a quick check out the window revealed the ugliest view we've ever had - nothing but construction everywhere. However, we hadn't come for the view and figured that the construction wouldn't be a problem at night. Wrong! All night long, equipment delivered supplies, with crashing metal and equipment backup beeping dominating the night noise. We then understood why the guest had been trying to change his room when we checked in. The next problem was heading for breakfast. We heard the 1st emergency alarm while boarding the elevator. Alarms kept going off peridically for over half an hour and it wasn't until the 4th or 5th alarm that they bothered to announce that the alarms were only a test. Three days later we again passed through Las Vegas and spent 2 nights at Treasure Island in a great room for about the same price (around $75 night). What a difference!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a keeper”
Reviews.Author: huskerfan007
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo is definitely on my list of favorites for Las Vegas. We arrived early (noon) and were able to check in right away. Check in was quick and easy. Our room (16th floor) was spacious and clean. Beds were very comfortable. The bathroom was all marble and very clean. The shower was great. We were not bothered by the construction at all. We did not use the pool but did walk out there and I agree that the music is very loud (as it is everywhere in Vegas) and it was very crowded. The food at the Cafe was excellent and reasonably priced by Vegas standards. The casino was large but easy to navigate. Don't plan on winning in Vegas right now. Things are wound up tighter than a drum. Do your gambling downtown at the Four Queens and be sure to stay for the laser light show.

Reviews.Title: “Twelve Years staying at the Monte Carlo - Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: Eddexx
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Monte after an 11-hour flight only to be told that our room wouldn't be ready till 5 pm. When we got there our expected Strip View was entirely blocked by a towering huge grey wall which turned out to be part of the new City Centre project. The beds were Ok but why don't they supply decent plump pillows instead of the dolls house variety? My wife and I have been staying at (and recommending) the Monte Carlo since it opened in 1996 and have seen a steady decline in just about every aspect of the Hotel. On our last visit 18 months ago we saw the start of the City Centre construction right next to the hotel -and the noise and dust that accompanied it. The once-fabulous pool area has been greatly reduced (the Lazy River wasn't working the day we arrived) and the whole environment is overshadowed by what appears to be the Backside of Benidorm. - and a huge grey warehouse-style abomination that completely ruins the view. Even the cooling waterfalls have gone. On arrival at the pool at 9am everyone had their bags searched (no, not for bombs) but - "due to a change of policy we don't allow any food in the pool area" we were told by an officious Border Guard and my wife had her bag of crisps promptly confiscated - as did a kid behind with a half-eaten bag of popcorn. When I asked why people were being allowed in with their coffee I was told: "Coffee is OK but no food." "So not even a Danish bought in the Hotel to accompany my Starubucks?" I queried - only to be told that pastries were on the forbidden list! Safely past the sentries I went for some towels: "Only two per guest"! the girl barked when I took four. "But I need 2 for my wife as well" I protested and was sulkily supplied with another pair. But before we had time to settle on our longers the most ear-splitting noise (it could not be described as music) blasted our eardrums. Don't get me wrong I like music (Will Smith's my hero) but this was not the usual Monte soft rock -it was Gangsta Rap at full blast and went on mercilessly all morning. People were complaining all around the pool and one couple went into Reception to lodge their objections, then more people joined the queue. All to no avail. On the second morning (after our food search) "Yo Momma! Yo momma!" was belting out again -it was relentless - and more people complained but we were told that "The music is streamed down from a satellite so we can't change it." (Yes you heard that correctly). I don't know if the Manager is a friend of Snoop Doggy Dog but despite the daily protests of his paying guests he refused to either play something which might be appreciated by the majority of his paying guests - or lower the volume. When I complained at Reception I was advised "When you get home fill in a form on the Website." Brilliant. Instead I wrote a very a strong letter on Monte notepaper and handed it in - as we checked out in disgust! What contempt for their guests - no wonder the place is in terminal decline. Even Lance Burton went AWOL - his Theatre closed until further notice -he was apparently 'off sick' (why am I not surprised). Shopping in The Street of Dreams consisted of one lonely shop (the others were closed) and the hotel Hypermarket had disappeared to make space for the new Mexican-themed Diablo Cantina which was lively, fun, busy and totally out of character with the Hotel's 'classy' French Rivera theme. When we ventured outside the Hotel we constantly had pimps thrusting 'girls for hire' cards at us. I later counted thirteen (yes thirteen) pimps in a line so that holidaymakers had to run a gamut of sleaze before escaping to yet another line of pushers a few yards up the Strip. I cannot stress enough our disgust with the management of the Monte Carlo (and I repeat we've been regular guests for nearly thirteen years) and we certainly will neither be returning, nor recommending this pit to any more friends. We checked out and went to the Treasure Island Hotel after spotting a great offer on the Expedia website (one free night in five). See report on Treasure Island which we would highly recommend to those who don't want to spend their vacation with bleeding eardrums and pastry-less coffee.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: barney825
Reviews.Content: Based on some of the reviews of this hotel, I was not looking forward to my say here but the building work round the pool was finished and it is a nice pleasent hotel. Room a bit disapointing and smelled of smoke and bath did not drain very well. If you want to laze by the pool get there early. I was vey shocked at how many people go to the pool at 9 am then leave their towels until much later in the day. This made getting a space very difficult and reminded me of Spain (also not a good place to be with a hangver as very load music played from opening to closing). Found staff to be helpful and friendly. The Brand steak house was amazing, if a bit pricey. Diablos was great, drinks, cocktails and food with brillant open view of strip. For the amount of money we paid for this trip it was great and whilst I would prefer to stay at another hotel on my next visit, I would not rule out staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Completely average and don't expect to grab a spot by the pool”
Reviews.Author: hwood05
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel and this destination overrated and found it all average at best. The big drawback to me was the pool area of this hotel. You cannot possible relax when you are situation by the tram passing overhead which is where you will be unless you get to the pool early in the morning. The hotel in general was overcrowded. Liked the brewery though.

Reviews.Title: “A great Vegas experience”
Reviews.Author: vballguy63
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here before during the early construction of City Center and now that the pounding is done, this is a great place again. It is nice with children that you can check in, go to your room and all of that without stepping into the casino. Not many places there can boast that, but it is appreciated. The hotel is a higher end casino and the rooms are appropriate. They are a standard room, in this case with two beds, but have are nicely decorated and appointed. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was also adequate. For the price I paid it was truly an exceptional deal. The wave pool and lazy river kept the kids busy while I was able to get some work done. We did not eat at the hotel, so cannot comment on the food, but it was a place I would not hesitate to stay in again. The only negative is the parking. With the main parking garage being taken with construction workers, it was challenging finding adequate parking.

Reviews.Title: “False Advertising”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravelerArizona
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo is offering a Summer Vegas promotion that includes 2 for 1 Lance Burton tickets. The problem - the show has been canceled through July 7th, yet they are still selling the promotion for the cancelled dates and not offering any type of compensation to those already booked on the promotion. I think ,at the very least, a rain check on the two for one tickets should be offered. A reservations clerk tells me not and points out that we also have the option of 2 for 1 Zumanity tickets. We don't want Zumanity tickets and would not have booked the promotion if not for Lance Burton. I am very disappointed with the hotel's lack of customer service ethic.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money, but some shortcomings”
Reviews.Author: Whistlertraveller69
Reviews.Content: The location is pretty good, but the pool was noisy and crowded, the casino was smoky, and the windows really filthy. The guy at the front desk told me that there were problems with the window washing equipment since last year's fire. Guess they thought no one would care about the thick layer of dirt caked on the windows. Very expensive poolside drinks too.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: thumperparis
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night but we intend returning and staying longer. The room was spacious, very clean and everything worked. The check in was quick and easy and the staff very helpful. We did the 2 for 1 Martini's and let the bartender whip up his own favorites. The Hotel is well placed in the Strip with lots of great places to visit closeby. Parking is a problem as there are only a limited number of spaces, in the end we twigged that Valet was the answer as it's free apart from the gratuities.

Reviews.Title: “Stolen by housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: maceiogirl
Reviews.Content: I spent a week in Monte Carlo Hotel. When I went to the airport I forgot a bag in my room. I came back 40 minutes later and the housekping went inside my room, took away my value things and left the bag only with some magazines. The room was already dirty, she went there just to look for "forgetable things" and she found. The security found my nike sunglass in her car, but not the rest of things. The Monte Carlo is not a safety ple to stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Conference Facilities”
Reviews.Author: billpayer62
Reviews.Content: I have attended a business conference at the Monte Carlo for the past four years. My wife comes along and we always stay at the hotel. She and I were both pleased with the Monaco Suite and the service we received as hotel guests. Equally impressive was the conference facilities and business center. All my business needs were met while attending the three day conference. The hotel was well prepared and nothing was overlooked for the convenience of the conference attendees. The Monte Carlo facilities continue to be the most impressive I have ever encountered.

Reviews.Title: “Loud rock music everywhere & construction noise at 6 AM”
Reviews.Author: Avondaletraveler
Reviews.Content: We were awakened at 6 AM with construction noise. I realized that City Center was being built next door and asked for a higher floor room - we got the 29th Floor - great? No! They are renovating the 30th floor - lots of hammering. Ask for 23rd or 24th Floor to be away from most of the noise - we moved to 24th Fl. The casino played very loud hard rock music. We couldn't stay at the pool - the music was unbearable. We're both in our early 60's.We got great show tickets next door by MGM Grand "Tix 4 tonight". The Jersey Boys was fabulous and we also enjoyed Louie Anderson. We drove to Mt. Charleston for breakfast at Mt. Charlestown Resort - beautiful ski area only 30 min from Las Vegas. We mistakingly ate at Andres at Mote Carlo Hotel. $45-$63 entrees. Dinner cost over $200 for both of us and the food was just okay. Had a great five days in Vegas but would not stay again at Monte Carlo because of the loud music. Also unexpected $20/per day charge for use of their Fitness Ctr.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: lmg0906
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just came back from our 5 night stay at the Monte Carlo (6/5-6/10/09). We almost didn't book this hotel because I was a bit concerned after reading some of the reviews about the noise level from the construction going on next door and the loud music at the pool. We were on the 12th floor, south side, and we had a view of the strip and although we could see the construction we couldn't hear it at all. As far as the pool was concerned, it was loud (on a Monday afternoon no less) but we didn't spend much time there. It was great being so close to ny, ny & mgm and having the cvs next door for essentials. One of the big complaints that we had was the buffet- the food was good but we found that it really wasn't hot even after they had just put it out. We ended up eating food from the pasta station for dinner and omelette station for breakfast to get hot food. The room was a standard room with a king bed and the sheets and bedding was all clean although a bit ratty and really needs replacement soon. Also, please be aware that 2 of the restaurants in the hotel are closed for renovation right now and Lance Burton is not doing shows "until further notice" so we ended up leaving the hotel for our food/entertainment. Fortunately, we got a great deal on the hotel but I wouldn't spend more and may stay somewhere else next time for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience & Beautiful Suite!”
Reviews.Author: mamahoney4
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked five days in a spa suite at the Monte Carlo in May of 2009 for my 30th birthday. The lobby was breathtaking and smelled of roses, and check in was very quick! Our suite was on the 28th, floor, and was beyond anything we had imagined! The floor was quiet, and the room far exceeded our expectations! The bed was VERY comfortable, the spa tube was HUGE, the bathroom was very nice, and the room itself was VERY large. The suite was also very clean, and we had a nightly turn-down service that left chocolates on the bed. We had a FANTASTIC stay in this room, and, as far as we're concerned, the value just cannot be beaten! The hotel has a good location...right across the street from the NYNY (which is our favorite casino) and the MGM grand. I would stay in this hotel again in a HEARTBEAT...and have already recommended it to all of our friends!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are great”
Reviews.Author: LiveToTravelPune
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Monte Carlo for 2 nights. The room was wonderful and confortable. Best part is that the casino is in the same hotel so we dont have go out of the hotel for gambing. Only problem was that there were hardly any options in food for vegetarians. I would recommend anyone visiting Las Vegas to stay at Monte Carlo.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and casino”
Reviews.Author: wildbill14
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights, hotel is in a great location across from mgm grand, good service and friendly casino and poker room. Only drawback is the construction next door that has almost wiped-out the pool area. My room was high enough that I was not bothered by the construction but the person I was traveling with was in a lower floor and was awaken early every morning buy the noise.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back...”
Reviews.Author: Maypo26
Reviews.Content: We just spent 3 comped nights at Monte Carlo. We tend to stay at whichever hotel offers us the most and this time it was Treasure Island (2 free nights) and Monte Carlo. We've always enjoyed eating at the MC buffet and gambling in their casino, so wanted to try their rooms. Initially, after spending 2 nights at TI, the room at MC was a little bit of a letdown. TI has fluffy beds and a flat screen TV. The room at MC felt like I was staying in my grandma's guest room - a little dated and overly ornate. However, after spending some time in there, I also realized that the room was very clean, the bathroom very nice and it really was just a matter of a difference in taste. A plus with this casino is that the elevators are speedy (elevators are segregated by floors, so our bank of 6 elevators only serviced floors 23-32). Another plus is the food court for a quick snack. And the Starbucks is the most efficiently run Starbucks I've ever been to! The line might look intimidating, but the speed at which they get you through is amazing! I had asked for a room with a view and the front desk person accommodated - but I realized that due to City Center and the configuration of the hotel, that there really ISN'T a room with a view anymore. We had a room that faced the strip - but was angled so that mostly we saw the roof of one of the City Center buildings, complete with Porta Potties for the workers. However, we don't go to Vegas to look out our room window, so it wasn't an issue. Overall, we enjoyed our stay at MC. Their buffet is always one of our favorites because the food is good and the seating is comfortable and cozy. And we brought home some of the money we took, so the casino was friendly to us!

Reviews.Title: “Overall, an average hotel.”
Reviews.Author: thefayray
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo recently because of a free room offer. I was pleasantly surprised to see that it was pretty nice for an older casino on the strip. We had a spa suite and. although everything was a bit old and dated, it was clean with a nice whirlpool tub. The hotel pool was very nice, better than the larger casinos that we usually visit. We had a cabana, which was luxurious and relaxing. The spa was nothing special, however, so I went to Mandalay Bay for my usual spa day. I wasn't overly impressed with the restaurant staff, they were not attentive at all. The hotel staff was great, on the other hand. My only real complaint was that it was extremely noisy early in the morning due to construction on some new condos next door.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo Hotel”
Reviews.Author: retiredspeechdrama
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo is a good hotel value. The adjoining property construction was not a problem if you are staying on the southern end of the property. All the staff were helpful and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Less Than Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fluffystella2004
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the Monte Carlo for four nights. I had read the reviews and they all seemed to have given the hotel an average review. I rate it average also, I suppose. The one thing that bothered me the most about this hotel was our room. It looked as if it hadn't been updated since it'd been built. It was not clean. There was hair all over the carpet. I don't think it had been vacuumed for a long time. The towels pilled pretty badly. I had to pick the individual pills off after I dried myself. The bed linens were in pretty bad shape. My blanket had cigarette burns on it. I hate to think what else was on the sheets. Yuck! The mattress was the worst I have ever slept on. My back was killing me the whole time I was there. I've slept in sleeping bags on a cot that were more comfortable. I had read the reviews about the pool area...about the loud music. It was very annoying. I could not understand the reasoning behind it. There were no college kids bumping and grinding to the music. Especially since the pool closed in the early evening. I had to turn my iPod on high to drown out the annoying pop/hip hop crap. However, the pool itself was nice. I really enjoyed the lazy river pool. There wasn't an excess amount of chlorine in the pools so my skin and eyes did not suffer. We tried the morning buffet. The food was average but it was the process of getting the table that was a pain. We were the only two people waiting to be seated at the time but it was this huge ordeal. The hostesses had walkie talkies, we could see the food/kitchen just a short ways down a hall but we could only walk a few paces where we were stopped then ushered a few paces further, then stopped and finally shown to our seats. We were the only ones in line! It was ridiculous! On other thing is the coffee. I don't think I've been to a place that doesn't have actual half and half cream for coffee. They had this imitation stuff. When I asked for the real thing they gave me a glass of milk. Weird! We found a nice place across the street with better food and prices and avoided the buffet after that experience. I know it seems like I'm giving the Monte Carlo a bad rap but it was only a place to lay our heads. I'm not a gambler so I don't know how the gambling is there. But the employees were very helpful. The lobby is very beautiful. I think they spent most of the maintenance money on the outward appearance of the hotel and the lobby, completely ignoring the rooms. The location is great. Right on the strip so we were able to walk to other hotels and sites. There is a bus also that goes up and down the strip that stops almost in front of the hotel. Would I go to the Monte Carlo again? Nope.

Reviews.Title: “Your possessions will not be returned”
Reviews.Author: milkcow
Reviews.Content: May 2009. If you decide to stay at Monte Carlo please, please, please make sure you do not leave anything in your room. I am 53 years old; I work for the court system and I value myself as an honest person. I have no intention of ripping-off this establishment for a measly $100.00 worth of possessions. I contacted the Monte Carlo the day after I checked out to request the return of a bathing suit (hanging on a towel rack in the bathroom) and sweatshirt (hanging in the closet). After several days of leaving messages and speaking with their Security Department, I received a letter from Denise Chilipka-Oltay, Claim Rep for Monte Carlo who stated the Monte Carlo is “not responsible for reported missing items, are unable to compensate the loss, and hope this incident will not deter my visiting Monte Carlo again.” I again say please……if this hotel does not hire honest maids, how safe is your property in your room? I will NEVER stay there again and I will tell EVERYONE else the same thing.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: David299
Reviews.Content: A good hotel centrally located on the strip. All the facilities you would want in a good location withing walking distance of most other hotels and shows .

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience”
Reviews.Author: Varma72
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to the USA. We were spellbound with our experience. Las Vegas was great. Monte Carlo is a huge resort with a great casino. The rooms were very clean and hygienic. The casino was huge. We were given a lot of freebies on check in. Overall a great experience

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay and good price”
Reviews.Author: goodlawgirl
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the Monte Carlo with 3 girlfriends for a long weekend in Las Vegas. It was a really nice hotel. The staff was great. The Cafe restaurant is open 24 hours a day and the food was good(slightly overpriced as is everything in Las Vegas). The buffet was really good and it was relatively cheap. The Brew Pub also served the best buffalo wings. The casino wasn't overcrowed and the shopps were good. The pool while crowded was really clean and nice. The worst part was that our floor had several young drunk boys and loud girls, so I would probably move to a hotel that would be more out of their reach monetarily! Like the Bellagio or the Venetian. I think they had 6 to 8 people in each of their rooms. It was loud. ( I never called security because they were awful just annoying). I also had a spa treatment (Swedish Massage by Jose) and it was awesome. He was really great. Overall the hotel is clean, the staff is friendly and the surroundings were very good and I would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo is a great hotel for your money!”
Reviews.Author: MJP2617
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at Monte Carlo. The rooms were clean, the staff was friendly, the buffet was surprisingly good. The only negative thing was we ended up with the suite next to the elevator, but didnt make too much noise. Bring your own pillows, the pillows the hotel provide were very uncomfortable for us. Hopefully whatever other hotel we stay next time in las vegas is as great as monte carlo was.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: ShawneeK1
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at the Monte Carlo over Memorial Day weekend and had a great time! They allowed us to check in early (around 11am) and even gave us a strip view room because it was my mother's 60th birthday. The room was quite nice and clean. I wouldn't rate the room above average (maybe on par w/ a Hilton Garden Inn), but it was fine. The location of the hotel was perfect. Situated in between the Bellagio and the New York, New York and across from the MGM- it's perfect. As has been mentioned before, there is a whole bunch of construction going on, but it didn't bother us much at all. The pool area was very crowded (could be beacause it was Memorial Day Weekend) and the chairs are REALLY close together (ie: touching), but the lazy river and wave pool were awesome. I read in an earlier review to bring your own inner tube for the lazy river, so I did, and instead of each spending $12/day or whatever to rent them, I spent $3.99 each @ KMart before I left and just tossed them when we were done. Totally the way to go! We ate at the Cafe (great service, decent food), the buffet (decent) and the Brew Pub (Great service, great food). In short, a great value!

Reviews.Title: “On the strip without the pompous attitude.”
Reviews.Author: travelwisco
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a quick getaway over the memorial day weekend, and took a chance on the monte carlo. Very excited we did, a relaxing place. Clean rooms ( Allowed to check in at 9am), casino floor was easy 2 navigate, earned 3 free buffets which were above average. lIked the pool atmosphere( no drinking water, was a little loud but didnt ruin it 4 me.) Overall the best value we have found on the strip, Classy but not over the top.

Reviews.Title: “Best deal in town for the money”
Reviews.Author: RSAHershey_Pa
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Monte Carlo while we were in Vegas for my son's college graduation. We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and it was $55 for Tuesday, $49 for Wednesday and $55 for Thursday. In additon, we received a "summer party" pack of coupons that were good for 2 for 1 at the buffet, spa, New York roller caoster, plus several other discounts. Great spa with wonderful equipment. While we were standing in line to check in ( at 10:30am) several groups jumped ahead of us to the open window and the manager came over to apologize and gave us a $50 comp meal in the cafe. The lower floor room that we had booked was not available at that time and so we were also upgraded to a higher floor room that was ready. Great customer service!! The meal was very good. The rooms were clean although a bit worn (peeling wall paper and a stain on the ceiling). We had stayed the previous 2 nights in a fountain view room at the Bellagio so it was hard to compare the quality of the room. Pool was very crowded but still very nice. Overall, this was a great deal--nice hotel and great location!

Reviews.Title: “We stay there every year, great location but pool is overcrowded,”
Reviews.Author: mzapple
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at Monte Carlo for the last 5-6 years, primarily for its price and location. It's usually one of the least expensive choices when we buy in a package deal (airfare from NYC + hotel). We like the location because there is a drugstore (I think CVS or Walgreens) right next door. We don't rent a car so it's very convenient for us to get snacks or bottled waters at the drugstore. At the hotel, they usually double or triple the price so it does save us money overall. You can walk to other hotels or take the bus. The hotel rooms are standard size and pretty nice and clean. The AC can be easily controlled. The bathroom is standard Vegas style - nice, clean, modern. There is cleaning service everyday like all other Vegas hotels. Most of the time we stayed there, the staff was accommodating and very nice. For instance, our power went out due to construction going on in the section of the hotel we were staying at for a few hours. My husband's medication (which has to be refrigerated) was affected. The staff was really nice and comped us. However, there have been a couple incidences where the staff was not accommodating and gave us grief but after talking to the managers, everything was smoothed out. The casino is pretty standard - slots and tables, as well as sports center where you can bet and watch your teams! Our fave game is blackjack and we have experienced good luck overall at this hotel. Another big plus is that they have one of the best fitness centers/gym in Vegas. Yes, we are "those" people who actually work out during our vacation!!! If you are too, this is your place! There is a charge - but I think you can get a 3-day deal for about $45. It's big and they have everything from cardio equipment to weight machines to free weights (heavy weights). One year, we were staying there during a Vegas event for body builders. We met a few contestants in the Monte Carlo gym. The only reason they were staying there was because Monte Carlo gym is known to have the best gym equipment. There are a few restaurants at this hotel but I don't think any of them are too memorable. They were overall pretty average (not horrible at all, just nothing special). Their buffet is standard and very average. I prefer the buffet at the Bellagio or Rio's Seafood Buffet. They do have a Starbucks at least! My husband and I usually love relaxing by the pool or going swimming... their pool area is very sunny...however, the Monte Carlo pool is overcrowded. They have three pools but they are all super crowded. The river pool is very shallow and not wide enough. If there are slow people in front of you, it's hard to pass them. You can sit in the other pools but you can't really go swimming because there are too many people. Every year, it seemed like it was getting more and more crowded. (However, I'm not sure if it'll still be crowded this year in 2009 since the economy is down). To summarize, here are the pros and cons: Pros: - Great location, next to drugstore - Starbucks - Best gym on the strip - Hotel rooms are nice and clean - Staff is usually accommodating Cons: - Pool is overcrowded - Nothing special about the restaurants

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, good location, loud pool”
Reviews.Author: MrsOtter
Reviews.Content: The pool area is nice with just enough shade, but as other reviewers have mentioned, the music is SO loud! It would be great is they saved that party atmosphere for the Fri/Sat/Sun crowd. Great casino floor, great location and GREAT smell when you walk int the door!

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo proved really good value”
Reviews.Author: cocktail_girl
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I had been to Vegas less than 9 months before our recent visit and we didn't remember even seeing the Monte Carlo - despite the fact we previously stayed in the MGM Grand practically opposite! We went back to Vegas for a wedding and, because we'd been before, we knew most of the hotels on the Strip are much of a muchness. We ended up picking the Monte Carlo because we found a great offer whereby we got about 20% off the room for booking a few months in advance. We spent about £200 in total for 5 nights and, once in the rooms, they were very similar to the MGM, not surprising as it's owned by the same group. As such, if the same deal ever came up again I'd jump at it. The casino is pretty big, and usually quite quiet, the buffet was good and the room was clean, spacious and comfortable. The only issue is that there's building works very close to the building (true of lots of hotels on the Strip at the moment). After the first night we requested to change rooms which was done within 5 minutes, no hassles and really, really pleasant staff. It's not the most obvious choice on the Strip but the Monte Carlo really did deliver for us, and at such a competitive rate I would go back again

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel pool has very very noisy music”
Reviews.Author: londonboyy
Reviews.Content: The hotel was good enough & the food was great value as we were given 2 for 1 buffet meal tickets, the pool area was nice BUT VERY VERY NOISY RAP MUSIC which was not there when we stayed 2 years ago & it plays from 9 to 6. I complained at reception they don't like it either as they can hear it to & they said the management are catering for the younger generation at the pool---great pity as w will not stay there again because of this.

Reviews.Title: “LOUD, OBNOXIOUS DJ MUSIC 6 HOURS A DAY - TAKE YOUR EARPLUGS!!”
Reviews.Author: travelbugBC_Canada
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean and classy on the inside but the pool area is another story. Once you step outside to the pool your ears are assaulted with the loud, pounding, beat of DJ music reverberating off the cement surfaces in every direction. There is no way to escape the noise and just relax by the pool. If you are between the ages of 16 (I swear many of the partiers were this age) and 29 and are looking for a drunk, pickup party....this is the place for you. If you are anybody else - forget it! There is no quiet area and the so-called music (which starts at noon) doesn't stop until the pool closes at 6:00 on the dot every day. We were told that the DJ is only there on Friday and Saturday which is a lie because we arrived on Thursday and the party was going strong!! It is too bad that this lovely hotel has decided to go this route. Yes, Vegas is Sin City, and yes, people go here to have a good time but not everyone is looking for Animal House. Many other hotels have "adult" pools separate from the regular pool so guests have a choice of where they want to be. At the Monte Carlo, there is no choice! The staff could have cared less about our complaints athough they did admit that lots of guests had complained about the noise. Hmmm, makes you wonder what the Monte Carlo marketing team is thinking. I will never return to this hotel and would tell anyone thinking of going to Vegas to avoid it. Definitely don't take kids anywhere near this place!!

Reviews.Title: “Not memorable”
Reviews.Author: MillsMC
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at 18 hotels in Las Vegas, and this one did not stand out in my mind at all. The room was just okay, the pool looked like a lot of concrete, the chandeliers in the casino were nice, the parking garage was being worked on, so parking was a major pain. Bottom line, there's nothing wrong with this place, but there's no reason to stay here, either.

Reviews.Title: “Just as we remembered!!”
Reviews.Author: Kaydee66
Reviews.Content: Stayed here about 10 years ago and the atmosphere hasn't changed. Friendly staff, great service, comfy beds, good selection of food choices, and an awesome pool area! This hotel is on one of the busiest corners on the Strip but not overcrowded like some others. A relaxing "home" to come back to after a long day in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Staff was wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Retired46
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo the last week of April. The hotel staff couldn't have been nicer and we had a few perks while staying there including some free casino play, buy one get one free meal, etc. The rooms were okay ...nothing special but clean. We would have liked to have a refrigerator and a coffee maker but they were not in the room. All things considered, the location was great and we really enjoyed ourselves!

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: IllinoisBlowhole
Reviews.Content: There are too many better hotels and better deals than the Monte Carlo this year. We go to Las Vegas for a week once a year and try 2-3 nights at different hotels each trip. This time, May 10-16, we stayed at Paris, M.C. and Sam's Town. The Monte Carlo room was on the worst I have ever been seen or stayed in. It was a like cheap budget hotel room that needed updating. It was small, noisy and filthy. Someone had put gum on the night stand by the lamp. I moved the lamp and left a tip, so housekeeping would see the gum. They took the money but left the gum. The only thing worst than the room was the buffet. We could not finish one item on the breakfast buffet, not even the orange (?) juice. The buffet was comped with the room, otherwise I would have ask for my money back. In fairness, they do have a nice (but crowded) pool area and it is easy to find your way around the hotel/casino. Bottom Line - MGM should cut their losses on the City Center and spend the money upgrading their properties.

Reviews.Title: “Why can't drunks stay home”
Reviews.Author: LeeRenee
Reviews.Content: This was the 2nd time I stayed at Monte Carlo. Very nice hotel, however, my party and I were on the 13th floor and unfortunately next to several rooms of partiers that shouted obscenities all night - drank, talked very loud - slammed doors and pretty much were very wild. I believe it was a fraternity or sorority group. I called to complain after 1 pm one night as I feel you can have a good time without waking up other guests, without shouting obscenities, etc. Our final night was awful as the same loud group came upstairs around 3am swearing and making loud noises. When we left our rooms around 4 am to catch our plane, we noticed the wall hangings on the walls were ripped down and broken on the ground. Maybe Monte Carlo needs to have better security to silence these folks that think Vegas is only about drinking and being rude. As for the rest - the buffet was very good - the Brand Steak house was good - but pricey. Nice DJ pool party - only the pool closed at 6pm - what's up with that?

Reviews.Title: “The pool is AWESOME!”
Reviews.Author: heather11_13
Reviews.Content: We didn't stay here but we did enjoy the pool! Great scene! I will stay here the next time we are in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: meret44
Reviews.Content: I just returned from the Monte Carlo and I had a wonderful time. The room was immaculate and the staff exceptional. I had a problem with the air conditioning and they corrected it within 20 minutes. This included putting a new motor in the unit! The elevators never had you waiting for more than five minutes maximum. The beds were comfortable and the linen clean and pressed. I never heard any of the construction. If you want another room, ask to be moved away from it. I made this request before I arrived and it was honored. Take advantage of the summer special and you cannot go wrong. It allows you to use both properties and the pass to the club Rok is worth it. We had a blast there. My daughter rode the roller coaster at NY NY twice. The restaurant two for one in NY NY was wonderful but bear in mind that juice was $5 and coffee $4 so you will still pay about $20 for breakfast. The two for one buffet dinner was reasonable and there was a great selection. The midnight to 6 am steak dinner was delicious. I do not know what other people are complaining about because I think this is the bargain of Las Vegas in terms of price, location, and comfort. Planning to go back again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Disapointing”
Reviews.Author: tiredtoo
Reviews.Content: Pretty from the outside but old and outdated rooms. Bedding, towels and bathroom in desperate need of refreshing. Early morning noise from "City Center" construction next door.

Reviews.Title: “I am the biggest neat freak and extremely particular -LOVE it here!!!”
Reviews.Author: neatfreak38
Reviews.Content: This has been my third visit to the Monte Carlo in the last 2 years. I cannot say enough about this place...the rooms are immaculate and are very nicely decorated. The facility has everything you need and the pool is fabulous. (We visited from May 9 - May 11). I am beyond a neat freak (scared of staying in hotels for fear of bugs), but feel completely at home here. For business I always have to stay at the Venetian (which is lovely), but honestly, the Monte Carlo has the right combination of everything that I need on vacation -and the quality of the facility is great -even to satisfy a very picky person like me. We can afford to stay at a higher placed hotel, but choose to come here time after time. You'd be crazy not to check this out. The cleaning staff is outstanding -and trust worthy. I accidentally left my wedding ring and money in the hotel and it was there when I came back -it was out in the open and I am writing the hotel to compliment them on this.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo - TERRIFIC !!”
Reviews.Author: sbakeman
Reviews.Content: Travelled with a group of 20+ for my husbands 40th birthday - and we had a fabulous time ! Hotel was great, this dictated by the fact that at the end of every "outing" we all migrated back to OUR casino at the Monte Carlo - it was home ! Enjoyed an amazing birthday celebration dinner at the BRAND restaurant as well - pricey but wonderful. Our room was great - experienced no construction noise at all. The pool was crazy crowded - and for us one of the best days was a reserved cabana around the pool - do it, it was fantastic ! At check in time we had some confusion on the exact room we booked, but once we got our strip view room on the 23rd floor it was amazing. Vegas was great - 100+ temperatures so be prepared, and don't expect to come home winning your fortune, but it's VEGAS !!!

Reviews.Title: “Liked it very much...”
Reviews.Author: keystonedreamer
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights in a Monaco Suite with view of pool and City Center. A beautiful, clean, spacious, comfortable room, at a very attractive price. Great service from all the staff. Valet parking was very quick. Terrific room service. NOISE FROM CONSTRUCTION AND OTHER ROOMS WAS NOT A PROBLEM FOR US WHATSOEVER. The place was busy and seemed to be thriving. The Casino was fun and the Hotel may not like knowing we won a bit more than we put in. The location was terrific for access to the things we wanted to see in Vegas. The view of City Center was interesting, and as they finish it up, it will be an amazing view. We intend to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel...LOUD Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TravelGirlSL
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel. However, we were not told about the MAJOR construction going on just outside of our window at all hours of the night...during the day, there was no less noise with the DJ blasting BOOM BOOM BOOM music by the pool. When we spoke to the front desk, they couldn't have cared less. They even said they get complaints about it all of the time. Also, I would like to add, that if you haven't been to Las Vegas in a few years, and you have any level of morality...don't bother. We were disgusted by the soft core porn that was EVERYWHERE! If you must go, for heaven's sake...DON'T BRING THE KIDS!!!

Reviews.Title: “Mostly good - inspect your room first”
Reviews.Author: no_deadbeats
Reviews.Content: Negatives: When we first arrived, our room still had some trash in it that housekeeping missed. Worst of all, a wet, dirty washcloth was left in the tub. We promptly changed rooms. They supposedly "upgraded" us by putting us in a "high floor" room, but the view wasn't as good of the strip. However, the view to the mountains was great, so we stayed. The room had a very strong and distinct marijuana smoke smell when we first walked in. But we just dealt with it because we were ready to hit the casino. By the next day it was gone. We later discovered that the walls are PAPER thin and we not only heard the neighbors next to us very clearly, but during the day, since our room overlooked the pool, the pool music was very loud and crystal clear coming into the room. We felt the consierges could have been more knowledgable (eg: WE knew that Wynn golf was now open to the public, and they didn't) as well. The beds were a tad too firm and the bathroom is extremely small. Positives: Location, location, location - excellent location! All of the staff were very nice and did try hard to accomdate our needs and answer our questions. The rates were fantastic compared to other hotels on the strip and it's still a nice enough place where we didn't feel that we were settling (too much). Once we were moved, the room seemed very clean (except the smell, and I think the carpets could use a good shampooing). The breakfast buffet was AWESOME and totally worth the money. We didn't try lunch or dinner. The fast food court came in handy for quick cheap meals on the run. The water pressure in the shower ROCKED! All in all, we would stay there again and we had a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Excellent, Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Varner
Reviews.Content: After reading all the bad reviews I am telling you this I am a very picky person but the Monte Carlo is Excellent in every way. There were no surprizes for us. We had seven rooms booked for a trip to the Grand Canyon, a family of nineteen and we had teen agers a one year old and a three year old. You do not have to walk through the caniso to get to your rooms. and the pool area is great, they honored all of our request for seven non smoking rooms away from the construction sight., The linens were clean and the towels and wash cloths are of top quality. we travel a lot and I would say this is one of the best we have stayed at. Do not believe all the bad reviews. I am christian and I would not miss lead you. The Monte Carlo is a excellent choice. We were there from May 2 to May 5 and check in and out was fast. Great Hotel, give it a try and you will be on here writing a good review also. 10 stars for the Monte Carlo and the construction is almost done and the lobby was spotless we had the breakfast buffet and it is right up there with the one in Hawaii. Great choices and the food is terrific. and it was only 12.88 a person and with a lot of choices a nd we loved It. you can eat there cheaper than the mcdonalds and it is better for you health wise

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: jem52
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights April 26 - 29 and were pleasantly surprised. The check in and out was a breeze as we were able to use the "invited guest check in" due to a comp for our room. We were in a deluxe room which room was clean, somewhat updated and had a very comfortable bed (I was surprised). The first night we stayed in a room with 2 queens, although we requested a king. However they indicated we could move to a king room the next day. The only problem with this was trying to occupy our room which finally happened around 4:00 p.m. and after my husband stood in the invited guest line for at least 45 minutes. The line only had a couple people, however they kept calling people over from the other lines. Needless to say, my husband was very frustrated! I guess we shouldn't complain as we were getting the room for free. so to speak. The bathroom was bigger than, say, New York, New York, but not as big as TI and Mandalay Bay. We loved the food court, my husband had a large breakfast at Sbarro every morning, brought my coffee and hash browns up to the room for me, and enjoyed the guacamole and chips at Rubios. Even though we don't like buffets in general, we had the lunch buffet on our last day and the price was around $30 (?) total. I enjoyed a "made to order" Philly Cheese Steak and thought it was something different than the usual made to order pasta etc. The casino is a bit dated (we stayed there shortly after it opened), but easy to navigate and had large aisles. We went out to the pool one day and the only complaint I have is that none of the beverage servers made it over to our area. I went to the pool bar and bought a double rum & coke and Malibu & diet for $33. The cups were probably 12 oz. Weather was high 70's, lower 80's. The crowds weren't bad, a sign of the times. I must say that the staff was friendly and nice compared to the staff at New York, New York when we were there in Oct 2008. We didn't eat at any of the other hotel restaurants, so I cannot comment there.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty darn good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: gyw820
Reviews.Content: First time at this hotel, apprehensive considering the many poor reviews. The good: fast checkin and out, friendly staff, no construction noise, clean large room and bath, good convenient location, fast valet service, good food at the cafe, lively casino area. The bad?: tired room decor, some noise from neighboring rooms, slow shower drain, awful buffet, ridiculous internet access fees and poor tv station options. Overall for the price and location, a very good value (except for Sat nite stay which was over priced due to the Championship fight in town). The worst buffet prime rib ever. Nearly the worst bbq ribs, inedible. No wonder no lines on a friday nite. Should've gone to Brand the streakhouse. Overall, definitely will consider for our next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money or time”
Reviews.Author: mozley411
Reviews.Content: With all the hype about Las Vegas - we thought we were in for a great little 4 day get away! Boy, were we disappointed! I don't think we will ever plan another trip there and if we do, we sure won't stay at the Monte Carlo. We spent a lot of money there and the comps are terrible. We ended up getting 2 buffets a piece and we ate at the dinner buffet once while we were there and it was comparable to a Luby's, but twice the price. Taking advantage of our comped buffets when we checked out almost took an act of congress. The people at the players club are very inexperienced and every time you want to know about your comps they have to get on the phone to some secretive "marketing" person. The front desk is just as bad - they can't tell you anything about your comps. Therefore everyone is sending you running around from desk to desk. The rooms are okay, but don't expect fresh towels daily and don't expect coffee in the morning when you wake up. Unless you pay the outrageous price for room service coffee or go downstairs and purchase coffee from McDonald's or Starbucks. Another thing - bring your own sodas or water with you to the room because there are no complimentary bottles of water left in your room and the soda machine on at least 2 floors that we checked was taped up and out of order! After going to two floors looking for a soda machine that worked, we just gave up and went back to our room. They did not have wifi internet access. You had to plug into an ethernet port and then that did not even work. You could access the internet by PAYING a $5 minimum at a little public kiosk in their lobby. If you want to print your boarding passes from there they charge you another $1 per page!!!! The slots were so tight that we did not see anyone winning anything. We spent a lot of money and playtime in their casino and it was crap. My advice: don't go. If you want to go to an excellent hotel/casino that knows how to treat their patrons and don't want to travel to Las Vegas, try L'auberge du lac in Lake Charles, LA. It is a gorgeous hotel and casino, great staff, friendly people, wonderful food, and complimentary beverage bars in the casino for sodas, water, and coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Not Great”
Reviews.Author: foodwinechickie
Reviews.Content: First, I'm a huge fan of MGM Mirage properties. Having said that... Room needs a major update and a good cleaning. Bedding is at Holiday Inn-levels, which is surprising. Bathroom is pretty bad. Not clean, amenities are not what they should be, towels are worn out and bath is unappetizing. The shower lever barely works. Pool is crammed with lounge chairs because of the construction right next to it, so probably not the best experience. PROS: Not a huge hotel to walk through and elevators are right off the lobby. Lobby area looks nice. Great mid-Strip location.

Reviews.Title: “Fine, but for the pool.”
Reviews.Author: luepie
Reviews.Content: While I acknowledge that enjoying a quiet moment reading by the pool isn't the first thing most people look forward to when planning a trip to Vegas, it can provide a welcome respite from clanging slot machines. Just not at the Monte Carlo. There is not a single square yard of the sizable pool area that is not assaulted by loudspeakers pumping in hip hop music at a high volume. Reading or relaxing poolside is utterly impossible as MC tries to create some sort of "party atmosphere" at all hours--even before noon. I've got no problem with hip hop nor with nurturing a "pool party" atmosphere for the guests who love that stuff, but surely MC could set aside a section of its pool area for guests who value a little peace and quiet for a while and who do not address one another as "dude".

Reviews.Title: “Best deal on the strip”
Reviews.Author: AzJules
Reviews.Content: Room was very nice and comfortable. Bathroom was large and accommodating. Very clean. Staff was courteous and helpful. Pool was fun even for adults, we loved the lazy river with its self propelling current. It was almost as good as being at the beach. We enjoyed the poolside bar and drinks were allowed in the lazy river. We got awesome pictures to take home with us. We left our personal belongings at our lounge chairs without any problems. Thanks you Monte Carlo for a "Girls Weekend" we will never forget. Love your deals for rooms on a budget while still getting all the value of a full-priced stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - great base for stay in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: MC51
Reviews.Content: I'm a little surprised by some of the reviews for the Monte Carlo having just stayed there. Having said that we did not go to Vegas to sit by a pool all day - it was our first visit and we're out and about each day. If you are going to relax then yes it's probably not ideal - from the little I saw of the pool area it did seem cramped and there is a buidling site looming over. However it was purely a base for us. We had a great view of the strip. Our room was very clean and comfortable with two big beds and a great shower. The rest of the hotel was very clean with the usual casino, food court, restaurant and buffet places. We liked the fact that although it had all this - as it was not particularly a themed hotel it was better and a bit more of an escape from the others. The staff were very helpful and very well organised - especially in the buffet section - almost military! We only ate in the buffet for breakfast and once for dinner and it was excellent food and value. The building site next door did take the wow factor off the strip a bit and it would be unfortunate if you were looking out onto it. We thought the hotel was good value, comfortable and good location as it sits pretty much in the middle of the main hotels. Las Vegas itself is amazing although very tiring and if you are going to site see rather than relax - although the hotels are themed differently they are all pretty much the same format. If you like loads of gambling and shopping then Vegas is for you!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: kiku621
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Vegas frm 4/27-4/30 & got a great rate of $47.06/night!! How can you pass that up in this economic time! First time at this location & thought it was very nice. The room is clean, the bed comfortable. It's shows a little wear but that's fine. Update w/flat screens, and a plug for cellphone by the desk would help but there is a laptop wire/jack available. Check in/desk service was pleasant & courteous, housekeeping was very good. Food court w/Starbucks, Sbarro, some chinese place is there and the Cafe is open 24hrs, is very good. (Food court at the Venetian is better.) Did not eat at Diablos or the French restaurant or swim in the pool. The gambling tables were fine, there's a lot of penny & nickel slots which was fun. I recommend getting the bus passto get around town on the "Deuce". The 24 hr pass is $7 or a 3 day pass @ $15 & can be purchased right on the bus. Unlimited rides during the time frame!! Well worth the price since one bus ride is $3. And since the buses on "the Strip" are double decker, go up the stairs to get a view of the night life. The bus stops right in front of the hotel when coming fromthe Fremont (north) direction but to head back that way, you have to get to the front of the MGM to catch the bus. They say Vegas is not doing so well since conventions/conventioneers are down & the economy is bad, but there sure seemed to be a lot of people!! It felt like the same Vegas to me! Also, allow extra time for your shuttle pick up to the airport. Allowed an extra 1/2 hour but since there were so many hotel stops, it got late. What ever they tell you when you place your call for pickup, add 30 mins. Overall, this is a 3.5 rating.

Reviews.Title: “A good time despite construction work”
Reviews.Author: bute95
Reviews.Content: I agree with previous comments regarding construction work which very much impacted on an otherwise good hotel. The pool area is indeed 'packed like sardines' and the level of music noise is at times disturbing to say the least., particularly if you want a rest after a night gambling and drinking which is a part of a vegas holiday for us.
