Also because of building work there is a limit to the sunshine at the pool which is again very nice but people are therefore struggling to find sunbeds and it felt more like being in the med with attempts to reserve beds in the better areas. The dust from the construction site was indeed a pest and overall we were disappointed with the sunshine element of this holiday. The hotel areas - rooms, buffet and casino are nice; very clean, with excellent service but could perhaps do with a lick of paint and updating. All this said we did have a good holiday. However I would be cautious for the future regarding the pool and limits to the sun.

Reviews.Title: “A Poem on the Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: hailes
Reviews.Content: My review of this hotel was that it was just so so But it's not necessarily a bad place to go. What was nice was that there wasn't a casino that you need to walk through, but instead is a simple lobby and a few stores too. It's just a basic hotel if you need a place to crash, and you don't have to worry about spending a lot of cash. The pool was big and there was this lazy river to ride, but it was filled with people's suntan lotion as you rode the tide. The location was fine and not really out of the way, and it's a basic place-what more can I say.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it... words can't describe how they've ruined a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: IanW2007
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth stay at the Monte Carlo over the past five years or so and I was really looking forward to it. It's always been good value, it's a great location and while it can't offer good bars and restaurants like other strip hotels it has a solid quality to it that has always appealed. And my wife and I loved relaxing out by the excellent pool..... until now. As we neared the colossal building site loomed into view, engulfing the hotel on three sides in noise, dust and site traffic. But not to worry, that's not really the hotel's fault. Our room was decent enough and we were checked in early. The windows were caked in dust from the site, rendering the extra paid for a view a little wasteful, but you don't go to Vegas to sit in your room, do you. We still weren't going to let such things bother us. But the gross mismanagement of this hotel became clear when we decided to hit the pool, which is an essential part of a Vegas stay. Much of the pool side terraces have been sold off to the building project and the remaining area sees sunbathers packed in like sardines between the various pools. But fortunately the management at the Monte Carlo have found a way to limit the number of people competing for space in the sun. The music around the pool is so loud and so awful that it destroys any notion of a relaxing lie out by the pool, reading or drinking. It is so loud it will literally make you feel sick. I wish I was joking. I'm no stranger to outdoor music festivals and rock concerts but have never heard a noise like it. I imagine they are trying to drown out the noise of the building site, but even still, it makes the pool totally off-limits. My wife and I like to gamble and have a fair few drinks of an evening and then crash out by the pool to recover. it's the only way to be in Vegas. But not so at the Monte Carlo, not any more it would seem. Worse still, not to sound too geriatric about this, but the music sounds like the creation of the manager's son who has begged his dad to let him play some of his mixes by the pool. It's truly appalling. The sort of thing you'd expect to hear if you bought a tone deaf nephew a set of decks for Christmas, played at a volume rivaled only by a Boeing 747 taking off. However... and this is a nice touch. If you looked to escape into to the Brew Pub for a bite of lunch, not only does it look like a canteen for the monstrous building site, covered in dust and littered with hard hats and high-visibility jackets, they also had a fire alarm which went off every 15 minutes for the duration of our stay. This was explained away as "it's nothing to worry about"... well, it is pretty annoying. Much like the way the Monte Carlo is now run. The accommodation and staff were pleasant and despite the MASSIVE building site, the location of the Monte Carlo remains outstanding. However, some basic but important failings mean this is a hotel I could never return to, even in a couple of years when the building work may finally be complete. We went on to the Luxor instead. Not ideal but in comparison it is sooo much better. However, if it wasn't for conferences filling many of the better hotels we would have gone for Caesars Palace which now is uncontested as my favourite Vegas hotel, where previously the Monte Carlo was snapping at its heels.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait until the surrounding construction is over...”
Reviews.Author: FCTraveler044
Reviews.Content: I like the Monte Carlo quite a bit. They've comped me rooms several times. Some of the downsides at the moment is all the City Center construction going on. Plus Internet access is $14.99/day! That's pretty pricey. It's not even WiFi. They WiFi in your room is hit and miss (mostly miss) but it DOES work out by the pool area if you stay close to the building. They got rid of all the Wheel of Fortune slots that I liked so I'm going to have to look elsewhere. I do like the Brew Pub and it was great to see all the different playoff games going on while you ate.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC VALUE”
Reviews.Author: normavivalasvegas
Reviews.Content: Have stayed @ both Monte & MGM --- prefer Monte. MGM entails TONS of walking (we stayed in a regular double the 1st year & JUST to go down & pickup your morning coffee; was a 'trek'!) Monte has had better rates, too (3 years in a row)....and, after Monte's Concierge Floor has it 'hands down' over MGM's "Signature" (food-wise AND service-wise) Great location - you're right there @ NY NY, Excaliabur, & Trop., M&M World & the 1/2-price Tix Booth are right across the street, you have a CVS & a Walgreen just STEPS away...to pick up incidentals, Luxor & Mandalay are a short tram-ride, & you have MGM and the Monorail - to go down to the other end of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yanivek
Reviews.Content: The hotel in the south of the strip near the City Center area. The room was OK and very clean and the service I received was very good, The Buffat was very good with the best dessrts. Very important to mentione that they have parking area with no charge but there is limites space and it is not easy to find a spot.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but not the best I've had at the MC”
Reviews.Author: NDBeachbum
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the MC many times. This time we stayed in the Spa suite, because it was an excellent price. The room itself was decent and large. It was very clean, except for the stained carpets. The spot lights over the bed and the jacuzzi didn't work. The curtain by the jacuzzi only came up half way. So, for what we paid it was fine, but if I would have to pay what they normally ask, it would not be worth it. Our room faced the construction, but I didn't feel the noise was that bad at all. It's actually improved since some of our prior stays. (They are working more inside the buildings now).You could occassionally hear the beeping of the trucks when they were backing up. The bathroom was large. It was nice to have a fridge in the room also. The check in/out went quickly. The valet staff was AWESOME!! You never had to wait for your car long and they were friendly and asked if you needed directions. If you are looking for a quick bite to eat they have a food court with many options. We didn't use the food court, but ate at Brand, which was good and in the Pub. We didn't spend a day at the pool, because it was shaded over, by the CC. The MC sent us an e-mail to sign up for text messaging to hear about the specials and activities that would be going on while you were staying with them. Don't even bother trying to sign up. tried it before we left and while we were down there. We never received one message from them. We didn't have a terrible stay, but with each stay I feel the MC is getting a little out dated. I would stay at the MC again, but I am thinking about staying somewhereelse next time. We usually stay in the Monaco Suite & this time the Spa Suite. To upgrade to those categories or room, I could be staying at the Bellagio, Palazzo or Wynn in a regular room that is just as nice for the same price. (IMO) If you want something that's clean and nothing too exciting it is worth a stay. If you something a little more, I wouldn't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service - Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: euscarol
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel. I've stayed in many in Vegas and this is now my favorite. Best value for the price in Vegas. Very high end and high quality. Staff is the best around Vegas. Hotel and casino are great. Very comfortable hotel to stay. Suitable for couples or families. I travelled with my teen daughter at spring break. We shopped and relaxed at the pools. The pool area is great for families. They have lazy river, wave pools, jacuzzi and regular pool. Very relaxing and good music playing at pool area. Located in great area and you can walk around the strip easily from this hotel. They have a foodcourt with lots of good places like Starbucks, Sbarro Italian, Hagan Daz ice cream, Mcdonalds. The market cafe restaurant we ate in served excellent meals and lots of choices for everyone. We went to the Lance Burton magic show which was also excellent. It's for families and suitable for children, teens and adults. Every person we encountered who worked at this hotel provided excellent service. The room was very nice and quiet. We slept well in this hotel. We moved from the Flamingo (which was horrible) and the front desk let us check in early. The gift shop has nice things for souvenirs. The casino is comfortable and fun to play in. The fitness room is great. Valet parking the best in Vegas with short waits to get your car. I highly recommend this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “great guys on concerige desk very helpfull”
Reviews.Author: wardireland
Reviews.Content: rooms clean and comfortable very friendly staff see jay or mike at concerige desk for the best help and advice on things to see and do

Reviews.Title: “Poor, Average, Mediocre.................”
Reviews.Author: kjsLondon
Reviews.Content: Checked in 29th March for 2 weeks. Check in fine. Asked for room high up away from construction. Had to pay extra $10 per night for room on 25th floor. Room looked over strip but was in very poor condition. Furniture chipped marks on carpets, sheets and blankets very tired. Bed spread very worn!! Bathroom ok though shower head was too low and I'm onlt 5'9"!!! So if you are taller bend for the shower. Bed side light flickered every time you went near the cabinet. The last time we stayed at the Stratosphere but this time we thought we were paying more cash for a better Hotel. How wrong we were. This hotel needs a complete makeover the only thing I can say was the beds were very comfortable although the pillows were so thin even laying on 3 of them you hit the matress. Had room service and at $77 you would have expected it to be hot!! like everything else average.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel, OK if you get a good deal.”
Reviews.Author: BcDarren
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in 8 different hotels over 6 visits to Vegas. Monte Carlo is average at best. If I had payed full price I would have been very disappointed. If you can get a great deal, and are looking for an average room, consider the Monte Carlo. The building looks very dated inside. The staff has a neutral attitude; not rude but not enthusiastic either. The casino was quiet as was the pool; some people bay find that appealing. The pool area is nice except that the City Center construction looms over it. Our package included a bunch of "extras" that were pretty much useless. The free slots $$ offered is what anyone gets if they join the players club. The food court coupons were a bunch of buy item one get item 2 half off coupons. The 2 free buffets were good and the free spa passes would have been OK if we had used them. The "2 drinks at Diablo's" coupon was useless because Diablo's is a joke. No staff, terrible service and a hostess that is perpetually talking on her cell phone. We did not have a room on the City Center construction side, so I cannot comment on the construction noise. The location is OK but the hotels on the other side of the strip are more convenient because that is the side the monorail is on. We ate at the Dragon Noodle restaurant and enjoyed it very much. Good food, friendly staff, reasonable prices and good selection. I would recommend it. Overall, Monte Carlo was kind of a let down but for the price we paid, it was OK. For a few $$ more, say $40.00 - $60.00 / night you can stay at much better hotels like MGM. If you are looking for a quiet, average hotel on the strip, you can stay at Monte Carlo for around $45.00 / night right now.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place, location for the value, nothing too fancy.”
Reviews.Author: MrandMrsTucker
Reviews.Content: We stayed April 9-11 and we thought overall the hotel was decent. We had the basic delux room. I thought the room was just fine, again nothing fancy, but it was clean and comfortable which is all I wanted. The furnishings were updated nicely. The only complaint we had was the water pressure in the shower wasn't great, and the faucet was dripping. We called the next morning to tell them about it and a guy came up to fix it and walked right in when we were still in bed partially naked. :O( But it wasn't traumatic! He was nice and apologized and came back later to fix everything to normal. They gave us 2 free buffet comps though which was nice to have for dinner. They are also building the new City Center next door, and I was woken up around 6am to beeping noises from trucks reversing and other construction noises. My husband slept through it though. I brought ear plugs from reading the other reviews and those helped ALOT! We stayed in room 236 on the 11th floor and it was the nearest to the construction. Overall it was tolerable for two people living in the Oregon country. I think their amenities are ok. Compared to hotels like Planet Hollywood, MGM, Paris, etc... I think it is on the lower end. Their pool is a pool, but the others outdo it. We did like their Brand lounge, which they offered 2 for 1 drink deals. The buffet wasn't that great. The food was ok selection wise, and the flavors were ok. I am glad we didn't pay $18 pp for it. I think the hotel is fine for the location and deals you can get there. I would have rathered stay at a hotel like PH, or Paris because of the location and amenities. It's nice to have shops closer.

Reviews.Title: “Nickled and Dimed”
Reviews.Author: nosinabook
Reviews.Content: Another MGM property where they try to soak you for every penny they can. Extra costs: internet $14.99 per computer; no coffee or tea in room; $2.00 per page to print boarding passes.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK.”
Reviews.Author: TennesseeFoodie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Monte Carlo for 3 days recently with my mother and 2 adolescent daughters. The lobby of the hotel is relatively impressive, and check-in was fairly painless. The room was not all that impressive. It was kind of small and a little dingy, though the bathroom was really nice. The beds were comfortable, except for the non-fitted sheets which did not want to stay on the mattress. I asked for a room away from the construction noise, and did not hear any of the construction noise while in my room, or elsewhere on the premises. I did hear noise from the adjoining rooms, and was awakened once around 4:00 a.m. by a couple of lovebirds in the room next door. The pool area is nice, though it was a bit too chilly for us to swim while there. I didn't spend a lot of time in the casino, so can't really comment on it. The food court was very handy considering we had kids with us. We had the buffet once, and it was very good, especially the desserts. Much better than the Excalibur's, which is the only other Vegas buffet I've tried. The biggest gripe I had is with the internet service. They advertise high speed internet for $14.99 a night. What I didn't learn until I got there was that that price is PER laptop (we had 3) and you can only use 1 laptop at a time, because it is not wireless. I ended up going with a service called Traveler's Wi-Fi, which was much cheaper, but I had a crappy connection the entire time I was there. There were probably better alternatives, but of course, I couldn't research them without an internet connection to begin with. I guess you don't go to Vegas to stay on the internet, but if that's something that's important to you, you might want to research it before you go. Overall, it wasn't a bad experience, but definitely nothing to write home about.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected.......”
Reviews.Author: chubs255
Reviews.Content: My husband and I plus four other couples recently stayed (March 28th through April 1st) at the Monte Carlo. I was really worried when I read some of the reviews because I had done the booking for our whole group. All 10 of us agreed that we would stay there on our next visit to Las Vegas. Our room was on the 27th floor and facing away from the construction. It was quiet, comfortable and clean. We upgraded so we could have a king-sized bed because there weren't any left at our price level. We paid $10 extra a night; however, it was comped when we checked out. I thought that it would be worth asking for. The casino host not only comped the room but also the meals that were charged to our room. Every service person we had contact with was helpful and courteous. We especially enjoyed the staff (Karen specifically) in the coffee shop. The casino was quieter and smaller than a lot of the other casinos. It was easy to find our way around. We also liked having the food court close to the elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we had stayed at Ceasars Palace”
Reviews.Author: uklady
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 7 years ago and, apart from the lobby, the rooms have got very tired looking. We, like others on here asked for a room away from the construction but with a view of the strip. Well, the first room was on the 9th floor (?) and had a view over the roof of the multi-story car park and about an inch view of the MGM opposite! The next day we were moved to the 21st floor and although a better view it was still a very tired looking room and very dark. Do not order food in Sbarros on the casino floor as it was stone cold, over cooked and rubbery. Nothing good or spectacular stood out for us in this hotel and woud therefore never go back there. The next time we go we will stay at Ceasars Palace for its location, shopping and friendlier atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Good value 3.5 star Strip hotel, if you stay on the quiet side”
Reviews.Author: Rollin5911
Reviews.Content: We booked a block of rooms at Monte Carlo for a trade show. My third business stay at MC...Rooms are clean, spacious and well furnished, if starting to show some wear. I would give MC a 3.5 star, solid 4 star if rooms were refurbished. Unbelievably low weekday rate $49 per night (during a trade show!) Ripoff internet at $14.99/day and SLOOOOOOOOOW. Great Strip location near New York and MGM Grand. Close to airport, not walkable to LVCC (Taxi is best option). Nicely decorated and several good restaurants and food court. Friendly and efficient staff. "Cafe" is very good and a decent value for breakfast (starting $9.99). Casino is relatively small but I was not there to gamble. Pool looks nice but I did not swim either. As others have noted, stay on the "non construction" side on upper floor away from City Center construction, due for completion December 2009 if they don't run out of money. Most CC heavy construction (demolition, pile driving etc.) is winding down, but is still noisy on City Center side of Monte Carlo. Avoid frontage road behind CC, construction access. Parking could be an issue but new garage looks due to open soon.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bug Infestation!”
Reviews.Author: MegUtah
Reviews.Content: To add to the noise in the hallways, my significant other woke up complaining that something was biting him. We found bugs in the bed. We reported this to the hotel staff and they did confirm there was a bed bug infestation in our room. We were told to go to the doctor and have our luggage deconaminated. They would consider reimbursing us. The person we dealt with never once volunteered to comp our stay which was only $59.95 per night, so I asked. She said she'd have to think about it. We will not stay at the Monte Carlo again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in the strip”
Reviews.Author: Dania15
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Monte Carlo for two nights in March 2009. We booked a pkg in their website, with a very good price and some extras, like two buffets, two drinks, etc. First time in Vegas for both of us, and we stayed in three hotels, and I have to say the Monte Carlo is as good as the others. I was a little afraid because some of the reviews here weren´t great, but our experience was good. Check in took five minutes in total, and while we were in line the bell approach us, and took care of our luggage in a second in a great mood. I asked for a room away from the construction work, and it was honored without a problem, and even they gave me alternatives to choose from. The room was big, maybe the only problem was that it was a little dark, but it had to be because the orientation. However, any of the other hotels had a main light in the ceiling anyway... The bathroom had enough room, wasn´t huge, but bigger than the average house bathroom. I understand when people say that the furniture is a little old, because it is true, but nothing extreme, it is not run down. We went to the pool, and tried the lazy river, and it was extremely fun! The pool area is close to the construction site, but I didn´t notice at all. We tried the buffet and the casino, and loved both of them. When we went for our complimentary drinks at Diablo´s, the girl said to us to don´t even bother to charge them to the room, that we were fine, so it was a very nice gesture from her, because in other places made us to show all kind of proof to redeem them. We had foos in the food court late at night once, and it was great to have some cheap, late night option just there. The location was good for me, everything in Vegas is so huge that you have to walk anyway! In addition, the casino and public areas are not very crowded, like in other popular hotels. I think this is a perfect option for good location, good quality and an affordable price in the strip.

Reviews.Title: “awsome”
Reviews.Author: monca15
Reviews.Content: We went to Vegas in February, The location of the hotel is very good. The rooms were clean and ready at 10 AM. Which was very good because we got there in the morning at 9 am. The stuff was friendly. I recomend to buy the double decker pass its 15$ for 3 days, and you can get on and off everytime you want it goes every 15 minuts. The Strip is long. The hotels are beutifull but they are owned byt 2 owners so its not worth to spend hundreds of dollars on the hotel rooms, the rooms are the same only diffrence is the Lobby Then Venetian lobby is very beautiful but the rooms are the same what we had in Monte Carlo. and anyways you dont go to vegas to hang around in the room =)=) The all you can Eat buffe is 20$ for 1 and its very good, but next door at Excalibur have 2 for 1 so you pay 20$ for 2. from 2to6 pm. Overall we loved our trip and the hotel and the fly. We flew with sunwing so we had a complimentary dinner drink and massage hehehe :D

Reviews.Title: “OK, but not exactly what expected”
Reviews.Author: HawaiiTraveler86
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, great location on the strip if you want to see other casinos/hotels. Major construction makes parking more than a nightmare. Hotel not crowded, yet they still didn't have the room we reserved and wanted us to pay for the upgrade to get what we reserved. Queen sized beds are more like doubles.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good prices”
Reviews.Author: fergus354
Reviews.Content: We stayed March 16-19th at the Monte Carlo. Asked for and were given a room with a view at no extra charge. Room had a great view of the MGM Grand and the Polo Towers. Construction noise was minimal. The room walls seemed thin, with pipe noise and toilet flushing next door very loud. Showers were the best I have experienced in a hotel. My only issue was that the room had no fan in the bathroom, and no fan came on in the room when you adjusted the temperature, so you had no way to drown out any outside noises when trying to sleep. I could hear the music coming from Diablo's bar out by the street unitl all hours. Comps seemed generous, with $50 food credit in the cafe for us, even though we wouldn't consider ourselves big gamblers. Would stay again. One thing though, the brew pub doesn't do any brewing since the change of ownership.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good for the price but I wish some things were different.”
Reviews.Author: mbright08
Reviews.Content: The room wasn't horrible. BUT the walls were thin every time the person next to us flushed their toilet we could hear it. There are no rules about people in the halls being loud...I was woken up at 530 by drunk people taking a picture outside my door. The construction next door as beautiful as it will be is a 24/7 project so the noise is always there. (btw when they are done...not too much sun will be on the pool....its already being blocked out and its not even finished). Staff was pretty nice to us. The buffet I thought was over priced even for Vegas and it wasnt that good to begin with, THANK GOODNESS FOR ROOM COMPS! WARNING: if you have sensitive skin, request hypoallergenic sheets and towels....i broke out in hives due to the sheets and towels (which are very rough).

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for your money.”
Reviews.Author: Billzilla66
Reviews.Content: I just spent five days at Monte Carlo, and it was a great stay. When I booked my vacation I requested a regular non-smoking room but since it was on a first come, first serve basis they ran of rooms before at 9:00 pm. How-ever they gave me a free upgrade to the 28th floor. It was a nice room, aside from a lamp that flickered everytime I touched the desk. The room faced the pool and construction site, but as I was awake before 6:00 am it never really bothered me. If the noise bothers you, they have a CVS pharmacy open 24 hrs and you can buy ear plugs. The bed was very comfortable, and the room was more spacious than what I thought it was going to be (I'm from NY so I am used to cramped rooms). The casino floor was well lit and easy to find what you are looking for be it a resturant or your favorite slot machine. The food was fantastic, I love thier breakfast buffet, and the graveyard special on steak and eggs is a great value. The casino and hotel is located on the strip next to some of the other more well-known casinos like New York New York, and MGM Grand. But what made my stay there the best was the staff. Very friendly, helpful, and courtious, I will deffinately go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “noisy pool, noisy construction, otherwise OK”
Reviews.Author: alvBirmingham_UK
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on 17-20th March. The rooms are fine and the location, in the middle of the south end of the strip, is good. Also the whole place isn't large by Vegas standards, so its not too far to walk to anywhere and is not too disorientating for a first-time traveller to Vegas. However right now the new CityCenter project is being constructed right next door and the construction goes on all night. It is extremely noisy and we were woken repeatedly. I would not recommend staying here until the CityCenter project is complete, unless you are deaf. The other problem was the pool - all Vega hotel pools pump music through speakers into their pool areas (without leaving even one little quiet corner) but the music at the Monte Carlo was blaring. It was more like a club. No way we could read a book or listen to an MP3 player while lying by the pool - we just gave up after about an hour. On the up side, we only ate once at the buffet (for breakfast) but would definitely recommend the breakfast buffet - it's in a nice room, well managed, with tasty and quality food, a bargain for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Beep, beep, beep, beep...”
Reviews.Author: naramata
Reviews.Content: We were awoken at 7:00 am on Saturday morning to the sounds of construction vehicles backing up(beep, beep) saws and hammering etc. The City Centre Complex is being built right next to the MC. We were able to change rooms and it was somewhat quieter on Sunday morning. However, by Monday construction was back in full swing and though it was somewhat quieter, we were still awoken early by the sounds of construction. Bring earplugs or stay a hotel away from City Centre.

Reviews.Title: “pretty upscale for an inexpensive hotel off the strip”
Reviews.Author: wam3k
Reviews.Content: Room clean. Liked having a food court. Free parking for guests. Not too far off the strip and much nicer than I expeced for the money.

Reviews.Title: “not bad, not great”
Reviews.Author: neicie
Reviews.Content: We stayed march 15-18th. The best part of the hotel is the casino and location. it was clean, not crowded and not too big. However, we play $15-$20 blackjack hands and they didn't even want your card unless you play at least $25 each hand. Other properties happily took our cards. the drink service was top notch 3 of the 4 days we were there and the dealers were all nice. the food court in the casino was also a plus. the weather was great which meant you had to be out early to get a chair. the pool area is TINY and there are not enough chairs and a lot of the area is shaded. the drink service at the pool was good. check in and out was very speedy. we asked to be away from the construction and that was honored. the room is just ok. we don't spend a lot of time there so that usually isn't an issue. the pillows they provide are the worst ones i have ever slept on by far. if they would provide better pillows, i would stay again if the price was really good.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: jamann
Reviews.Content: Overall this is a great place to stay. Check in was a breeze. We arrived at noon and they had several rooms available immediately. We had a choice of pool view, strip view or mountain view. We opted for the pool view, but once we got into the room you could hear the noise of construction so we changed to a much quieter mountain view. You should ask about construction noise when checking in. Rooms were very clean and comfortable. I was nervious after reading a review aobut bed bugs. After careful inspection and 3 nights later, there were no signs of any bed bugs or any other bugs. We booked a stay and play package, good value but probably would have been better off taking the AAA rate. They offered $20.00 in food court coupons. Keep in mind these are not vouchers. You order something and you get a free pop or free tortia chips. Not much of a savings and you won't use all the coupons. It also came with 2 buffet vouchers. This is worth between $20 & $40 depending on the meal. The buffet was okay but you felt obligated to use them when there are so many other choices in Vegas. The food court was nice & reasonable. McDonalds, Pizza, Mexican, Chinese, Starbucks and Hagendaz. There is also a reasonably priced Pub and mexican restaurant Diablo's. Diablo's was always busy with $3.00 drink specials from 3-7p.m. Temperatures didn't allow us to enjoy the pool. We did take a walk to the pool. It is a very nice area with one main pool, a lazy river and a wave pool. We did enjoy the casino's. We don't spend a lot of money gambeling but we did enjoy the monopoly game. This casino seemed to have the best payouts. We couldn't win anything any where else. The main pool water was very chilly....not heated. Location was good. Walking distance to many of the main hotels, casino's and shows. Across the street was a 1/2 off ticket booth for shows. This had the shortest lines of the 3 boots. Don't go to the one next to the M&M store or Bills. Those lines were very long. I did learn that you don't get your "real" tickets here. Once you pay for your show you are directed to the venue where the show is to pick up your "real" tickets with seat assignment. This hotel isn't as plush as the Bellagio and the rooms aren't as big, but it is a very good value. If you are looking for the basic ammenities and not the most expensive restaurants and shops this is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo does not disappoint”
Reviews.Author: Kevbo222
Reviews.Content: My brother and I just got back from a quick weekend in Las Vegas. We have stayed at the Monte Carlo before and decided to stay there again. I have stayed at several properties in Las Vegas and I continue to like the Monte Carlo. The resort is very clean and comfortable. It may not be a pristine as it once was, but it is definitely not run down in any way. The rooms are large and comfortable. The staff is friendly and helpful. All in all, it is a very nice property. I tried to take a shower one day at around 4pm and the shower was not working. I called maintenance and they said that they had a pipe burst and it would be fixed in 15 minutes. In 15 minutes it was in perfect working order. My only complaint would be that I decided to print up our boarding passes and used their business center. They charged me $4 for the 2 minutes on their computer. I felt like that was a little bit of a "nickel and dime" thing, but other then that I cannot say enough good things about this resort overall. It may not be the most "upscale" property on the strip, but I would not hesitate to stay here. I'm not sure I would select it as a place to take my significant other if I was really trying to impress her, but other then that caveat, I would be back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: JefferAlbuquerqueNM
Reviews.Content: The staff was generally okay. A few gems, and no one was outwardly rude. Rooms were less than average, and even though we asked to be placed away from the City Center construction, we had a front row seat. The noise wasn't as bad as we had heard, but the walls were way too thin. Every time someone in the hall opened or closed a door we jumped. The standard rooms were getting a little old and tired. The beds, pillows and bed coverings were not up to standard. Furnishings were worn. The bathroom was nothing special, but adequate. I would normally say the location was good, you had to navigate City Center construction. When it's over, I'm sure it will be fine. One item that bothered us was the how early the restaurants closed. At a quarter of ten, all were closed with the exception of the Cafe (which offered a VERY limited menu) and the food court. Only one restuarant even acknowledged us. The one restaurant we visited, Dragon Noodle, was very poor. That is another review, but trust me, stay away from it. The casino was well laid out. The games were a bit dated, but they had a good variety. Overall, I think you can do much better, expecially in this economy. And until the City Center project if completed, I would stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Darn good value”
Reviews.Author: SissyGirl
Reviews.Content: Two couples (over 50, but hip) spent a week in Vegas in February. We have stayed at the Monte Carlo before and were confident in doing so again. We were not disappointed since it proved to be the same value as in years past. The rooms were clean and while not the Ritz Carlton, they were just fine. The lobby is very pretty and we got some great deals on stuff at the gift shop. Look for the 50% off shelves. Our only gripe was the construction noise. There is a HUGE project going on at the rear of the hotel and those guys start really early. On check-in, be sure to ask for a room on the east side of the hotel. Be specific about wanting to be away from the noise. We felt that odd numbered rooms on any floor would not be directly adjacent to the racket. All in all, we had a great time and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time at the Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: Ldawn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo for four nights and enjoyed every minute of it! From the roomss to the staff everything was great. We did not encounter one person during our stay that was not friendly and helpful. We had a room on the 18th floor facing the strip and the construction from the City Center did not bother us at all. We did have the buffet for dinner one night and it was very nice, we also ate at Cafe and at the Brew Pub and did not have one bad meal. We will stay at this hotel again without a doubt,

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect, but great value”
Reviews.Author: mdanderson
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked a trip to vegas from columbus ohio for 3 nights at the monte carlo. The price was incredible compared to other hotels in the same location, we got air and 3 nights for less than $700. I read the reviews and knew what to expect-construction next door, thin walls etc. We actually loved it and thought above all the place was CLEAN. don't listen to what you hear about people saying it is not kept up well, just not true. For this price, you have to be willing to put up with the imperfections and enjoy yourself. We didn't do any expensive meals, but the fee buffet was fine and the cafe was really very good for the money any time of day.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: VTer24
Reviews.Content: Took advantage of the email rate and we were comped 3 of the 4 nights we stayed. Room was large with large bathroom. Very clean with good maid service. Check-in was quick and the lady checking us in was extremely helpful. Despite comments to the contrary, we found this place quiet (much more so than the Mirage). Machines were tight, but the casino is large and easy to get around. Will not eat at the Cafe again. We went for a late lunch and I ordered a simple salad and my wife ordered a sandwich. It took nearly 45 minutes, despite the fact few people were there. No apology even after asking the waitress where our food was. Food was no better than a salad at McDonalds. We needed a cab to get our rental car. bellhop said that this was a new cabbie, but he told him to just drive down Las Vegas Blvd. the the Fox car rental. When he turned right onto Tropicana Blvd, I asked why. he said that the freeway was quicker. Since it was 9 a.m. and the was no traffic, and only 3 traffic lights to go through, I questioned why. Well after getting off the freeway, he drove right past the rental place and then wanted to drive even further to turn around. He then drove us up to the entrance and expected us to get out and walk across the parking lot to the office. His credentials were not displayed on the dash as required. We were WAY overcharged. This was the trip from hell! The Monte Carlo should not be dealing with thiefs like this. I would absolutely stay at the Monte Carlo again, but would refuse to take another cabbie who is new. Incidentally, this was the only Mid-eastern cabbie we met out of about 6 cab rides.

Reviews.Title: “What a waste of money”
Reviews.Author: tiggerx40
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed with the Monte Carlo. We were told it was a four star...far from it. The reason we chose it was because of the pool, but the pool was closed and they didn't tell you unless you asked. They informed us we could use the Bellagio (which they made seem like it's right next door) but it's over half a mile away. The walls were sooo shallow, we heard people's TV's above us, below us, and next to us plus everyone in the halls. The beds were uncomfortable, shower head very low, and the handle to the sink came off when I put it on!

Reviews.Title: “Fun Hotel with One Exception”
Reviews.Author: MNBigRedFan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Monte Carlo Hotel and Casino on March 2, 2009, with my wife, my brother and his wife. We were in town to see The Beatles Love at the Mirage. Overall I would give the Monte Carlo very positive reviews. I like the Monte Carlo because the casino is fairly small by strip standards and not so hard to find people or lengthy walks to get places. The casino was very nice, clean and very good drink service. The rooms were nice and clean. Diablos Cantina was a lot of fun during Happy Hour with crazy drink specials with the female bartender pouring wild shots while standing on the bar. My only complaint involved an incident at the Cafe and involves something that would have never happened in Vegas 15 years ago before the whole town went corporate. After we returned from the show at the Mirage we went for a quick bite to eat the Cafe before going to bed. While we were in the process of being seated the hostess had a fight with three servers right in front of our table over who was going to be our server. We waited for about 10 minutes and no one even brought water to our table or took our drink orders. If the cafe had been busy I would have understood, but it was close to 90% empty. I called over the hostess to ask if there was a problem and she said someone would be with us shortly. We waited a few more minutes and still no one came to our table to even bring us water, let along take our food order. I then complained rather sternly to the manager about what the problem was with the service. She informed me that if I did not calm down she was going to call security and have me removed. This despite the fact that we had been waiting for 15 minutes with no assurance we would get water let alone dinner. I told her this level of service was not acceptable and she told me that she would not speak to me until I calmed down. I saved her the trouble and our party just left the cafe. 15 years ago that would never have happened in Vegas and is now one of the reasons I go to Laughlin now rather than Vegas. 15 years ago that manager would have go to the kitchen themselves to get the water and probably comped our meals. But in these modern times where these corporate casinos have to squeeze every dime out of every possible source of cash in the hotels customer service has to take a hit. So instead of taking care of us, the manager was complete rude and disrepectful to me and probably cost her resturant $100 that night. In the grand scheme of things that doesn't matter to the Monte Carlo, but it demonstrates how much Las Vegas has changed and not for the better.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but could be noisy”
Reviews.Author: Brighty1861
Reviews.Content: 3 Night stay at a great price.Asked for a room away from construction which they obliged by putting us away from the major City Centre construction.However we still heard construction early from building works near New York New York so ask for a high room.Room was fine,beds comfortable but the walls are very thin and if you have a neighbour with a noisy child like us and you have jet lag it can be a problem. Loved the Brew Pub downstairs- nice atmosphere and good cheap specials.Casino had a nice atmosphere.Diablo restaurant out front was a little like a conveyor belt with the staff constantly rushing you through to serve the next eaters.The construction work next door also hinders walking up and down the strip as the sidewalk was closed at times causing much crossing over the busy road and extra steps.Also what is it with the people giving out the porn cards on the street .All in I would stay again but would probably wait a while until the construction is finished.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, low-key hotel in middle of action”
Reviews.Author: CmonLetsGo
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo is a great value in a great location. It is safe and clean with nice amenities. It is not as "over-the-top" decor-wise as other Vegas properties. The pool is lovely and suitable for both adults and children. The restaurants provide quality foods appealing to a variety of tastes. The casino is bright and cheerful with a nice range of slots and tables.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Going Down Hill”
Reviews.Author: sunfire007
Reviews.Content: Third visit to Monte Carlo in 3 years. 25th Floor view of Strip. (Non smoking room) 'BLOOM' promo purchased. Pros: + Front desk staff friendly and helpful + Clean and tidy room, good water flow in shower/bath, soft towels + Safe, iron and board, hair dryer complimentary + Spa/gym facilities good + Outdoor pool closed, under repair. Patriots were asked to use Bellagio's poolside - nice! Cons: + Paper thin walls offering loud, various sounds from neighboring rooms and noisy water pipes. + Dried blood stain on linen + Smell of cigarette smoke in room was strong. It only subsided when air conditioning was put on. It's Feb! + Amenity mini soap & shampoo was not replenished in our 3-day stay. + Requested extension to check-out time, as we didn't fly until evening. A half an hour was granted, with reason that hotel was full (not true) and cleaning staff was limited (yes).

Reviews.Title: “Spa Suite Worth the Upgrade”
Reviews.Author: mwasson
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Vegas recently for a few days away. Upon our arrival we were booked in a standard room. We had requested a King but none were available so we ended up with two double beds. At that time we also upgraded to a Spa Suite for the next two nights. The upgrade was given at a very reasonable price. It was well worth it. The suite was located on the 21st floor. It had a two person jackuzi in the room that was right by the window and overlooking the strip. The bathroom was very large as well. The only negative was we requested a late check-out and was not granted this request although we were told it wouldn't be a problem at check-in. The location of the Monte Carlo is good. It was a little farther down that we would have liked, but still within walking distant to almost everything.

Reviews.Title: “Eh - average”
Reviews.Author: tamlym
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the MC because rooms were comped. I would not stay otherwise. The bedding was flimsy (no comforter, just a thin scratchy blanket with some sheets (like a motel). This is my main gripe. I really like their casino (not too big, not too small), but their rooms are really not up to par with other places. I'll probably stay at other hotels in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, but north end of strip is much nicer”
Reviews.Author: 5intheOC
Reviews.Content: We hadn't been to Vegas in 5 years. Went to see what was new & exciting. Truth is - not much. Chose the Monte Carlo because they were offering a good Winter Special - decent weekend room rate and a few perks - free buffet, drinks at el Diablo and some other incentives. The hotel was fine - nothing special - but the construction going on around it (the Aria) was ridiculous. Trucks and banging starting at 4 a.m. Noisy!! No TV remote in our room and ill-fitting sheets, hard pillows, soft mattresses. Decent food court with a Starbucks, but the smell of smoke makes it impossible to sit and eat. We enjoyed the breakfast buffet - great selection. Worst part - their location at the south end of the strip is a dump. Vendors on every street corner and people handing out what literally is porn - cards with naked women advertising strip clubs all over the city. Glad we left the kids at home! If you're going to Vegas, stay at the Bellagio or anywhere north of it. The Wynn looked lovely.

Reviews.Title: “marvellous hotel”
Reviews.Author: sophieSWales
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the revues on this hotel,we were a bit concerned. But on arrival the staff were marvellous, the reception was really nice.The check in was very quick, before we knew it we were on our way to our rooms. We were on the 24th floor with views over the Strip.The rooms were quite big and nice and clean.The hotel was very central, plenty of places to eat.Lovely casino and shops. Couldn't ask for anything else.The only downfall was the building work going on next door,it didn't bother us but we found the hotel staff worked really hard to keep the place clean.Would definately stay at this hotel again.The only thing is the City Centre that they are building next door hides a lot of the view of the Strip, it is a shame really as it is a lovely hotel,but how long do you stay in your rooms in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great time!”
Reviews.Author: amalitta
Reviews.Content: Went for a long weekend and had a wonderful time. Great rates and location. Right next to New York New York, so was able to go to the Irish pub and have a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Getaway”
Reviews.Author: parma87
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the MC for the long weekend and we enjoyed it. Check in was a breeze and they gave us a room on a high floor. Not too many people checking in earlier in the afternoon was nice. The room was nice, it was a room with a connecting door but we hardly noticed. Only on one of the three nights we were there did we hear neighbors. View out the windows wasn't the greatest- it was on the construction, but we saw gorgeous sunsets all three nights. No fitted sheets on the beds, but I think that is common in most hotels on the strip. Location was perfect, we walked everywhere we went, never even thought to use the car. Casino didn't have as much traffic as the others so that was nice. Buffet brunch in the morning was great, had a lot of food and great selections. Free margaritas at Diablo's were welcomed and tasty, but when we wanted to eat at 10:30pm on a Sunday night, there kitchen was already closed so we had to go next door to the NYNY. No complaints about the room or anything like that, it was a great location, price, and room for the romantic getaway we were looking for!

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo Just Fine (if you aren't picky and expecting the Wynn or Bellagio)”
Reviews.Author: LoveToTravel5303
Reviews.Content: We (boyfriend & I) stayed at the Monte Carlo Feb 12-15th for a Valentine's getaway. Check-in was quick, we asked to be located away from the construction going on next door and they happily obliged. The room was standard and fine for us - clean and nice enough. Noise - We did hear construction the first night (a few bangs like they were moving steel) at about 4 am so it probably was very loud if you were on the construction side of the hotel but that was all we heard in 3 nights. We heard our neighbors once but then they were either quiet or never in their room...if you had noisy ones I suppose that could have been a problem but we were lucky. Casino - The casino is a little smokier than others but also a little quieter which was okay with me (we just went to the other hotels... we don't gamble much, maybe 2 hours total the whole trip). Food - We ate at the food court for breakfast the first morning and it was standard Starbucks (yes the prices are a little higher but what do you expect, if you want the cheaper prices you have to leave the hotel and go across the street to that food court - we were willing to pay a couple bucks more for the convenience). The second morning we went to the cafe...the "Ultimate Oatmeal" is good and huge enough for 2 people to easily share (maybe even 3 people) so we both ate for under $12. We had a free buffet and used it for dinner...not impressed with that. The food wasn't BAD but it also wasn't great or exciting (kind of like a college cafeteria level of food instead of a resort buffet level). If you had to pay for it, it wouldn't be worth it...go elsewhere. The pool was closed until March but they told us we can go next door to the Bellagio and use their pool/hot tub (for free). Check out was easy. Housekeeping was nice and I thought they did a fine job. Location is excellent (I was bummed that the tram to the Bellagio is gone because now you have to walk past all the construction to get there but it's still a good location) . Don't expect the Mirage, Bellagio or Wynn - type luxury here, I certainly wouldn't call it Motel 6...it's more a Holiday Inn/Doubletree level hotel. We thought it was a reasonable price, in a good location and a decent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This place is a dump!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ScottinParkCity
Reviews.Content: Sink clogged, wallpaper falling off, bathroom filthy, floors dirty, Sheets dirty. What more can I say. This place sucks now. I stayed here a few years ago and it was ok. Now its way worse that a $39 old town hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Room”
Reviews.Author: Sterling3806
Reviews.Content: First day at the hotel - had to asked for the sheets to be change - sheets was dirty. The wornout mattress - was very uncomfortable to sleep on. Had to asked for the floors to be clean. Deluxe Double Rooms & bath is a standard Motel 6 decor. I felt the rooms was overpriced because no extravagant decors - standard 2 star hotel decor.

Reviews.Title: “It was fine for the very discounted rate”
Reviews.Author: UglyCook
Reviews.Content: We got a "Monaco Suite" package for only $89 per night and we got our money's worth, but I wouldn't pay over $100.00 for the suite. Check-in was rather slow. I counted 15 people in line and only 2 stations open. No indication of where to line up, everyone just sort of bunches up and tries to figure it out. The room was HUGE, and had 2 bathrooms. The very small closet was as far from the main bathroom as it could be. There was a jetted tub that had a shower head above it, but not so much as a single grab bar to hold as I crawled in and out over the high sides of the tub. And I am not short. Huge toilet closet which was a waste of space and easily could have accomodated a shower. Soap dish was not cleaned out while we were there. The first day our towels smelled very scorched, but the 2nd day were replaced with better smelling ones. Toiletries were simple and nice. Old bananas in the refrigerator and a call to housekeeping resulted in only an empty promise to remove them. We tossed them out into the hallway 7 hours after calling (didn't want to stink up our room) when we wanted to use the fridge and someone did manage to pick them up by morning. The bed was comfortable and the construction noise did not bother us at all, but we are very sound sleepers. We did hear the phone ringing next door a few times. Internet service is wired only and costs $15 per day. Very strange, but the connection is by the television and quite far away from the desk. No informational magazines anywhere to be found in the room. That was a first for Vegas. The casino was nice, the dealers were great, but we could not get water from the waitresses. Food at the buffet was very good. Diablos was a fun place and the food above average. The free margarita was "ok" but hey, it was free. I'd stay there again if it was cheap. Location is good, it was easy to walk everywhere we wanted to go and CVS pharmacy is right outside for anything forgotten.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Time at the Monte Carlo!”
Reviews.Author: KKat49
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Monte Carlo from Feb 6 to Feb 10, 2009. Nothing but praise for the hotel staff who seem to go out of there way to greet you and make sure everything is okay. Before we left home we asked our rep at WestJet vacations to put a note on our file requesting an upper level room away from the construction next door and we got just that - room 30310 with a lovely view of mountains. Make sure you are not on the construction side of the hotel or you WILL be disturbed by the noise. Our room was a nice size, clean and the maid accomodating - asked for a feather pillow and got it right away - our towels were fluffy and clean and plentiful - the bathroom spotless. Tried the buffet for breakfast and dinner - really good quality food - execellent service - chefs and wait staff very friendly. Casino area smells nice and they try to eliminate the smoke - better than a lot of the other casinos. The music was loud at times in some areas. Waitresses always nearby and happy to serve you. Had some good luck on the Monopoly game and then some bad luck....<smile>. The food court offers some of your favourites, Subway, Starbucks, McDonalds, Sbarro, etc. but for value - you can't beat the buffet. Yes, the Monte Carlo is dated, and there is noisy construction zone next door, but for sheer value you can't beat it. So don't be afraid to give the old girl a try. (Be advised that the Lance Burton Magic show and the Micro Brewery Pub are both closed on Sundays and Mondays.)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: luvs2travel2009
Reviews.Content: I took my husband to Las Vegas for his 40th Birthday. Since it was his first time to Vegas (my 3rd visit to Vegas, but never stayed at the Monte Carlo) I wanted everything to be perfect. I was very worried after reading the reviews and I had already booked and payed for our stay (with not enough time to change our accommodations). We stayed at the Monte Carlo Feb. 5th-9th 2009 in room 9103 and everything was wonderful! We did ask for a room away from the construction going on next to the MC. The rooms are simple and very clean. No coffee in the room, but there is a Starbucks in the MC. The food court in the MC is very convenient for breakfast, lunch on the go, or late night snack . Checking in and out was fast. The location is great. All of the staff were very nice and never rude. We enjoyed our stay so much at the MC, we will be returning this summer.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ptisme
Reviews.Content: I am staying at the monte carlo as we speak and I am quite pleased. My only advise would be to ask for a room on the south side to avoid the construction noise. There is a large hotel going up right next door. There was still some residual noise and the only way to avoid it would be to stay at the luxor or Mandalay Bay which are much further south. Nice clean hotel though, no complaints...

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe all you read, Loved the Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: emmieloumn
Reviews.Content: I just want to say don't believe all the bad reviews regarding the Monte Carlo. I got married in Vegas September 2008 and there was a group of 10 of us that stayed at the Monte Carlo. Upon arriving at the Monte Carlo us and all of our guest recieved the best treatment and the staff was excellent. Upon reading other reviews I was afraid after we booked our stay that it was going to be a bad experience, but it was not. When checking in we told the front desk that we would like rooms away from the construction with a strip view and all of us in our group got just that. None of us had a problem with thin walls or being unable to sleep due to the construction. The cleaning crew was great we would leave for the day and come back to a immaculately cleaned room. The only drawback from the construction is you want to go to the pool by midmorning/early afternoon, as the CityCenter building casts a shadow over the area in the afternoon so there is no sun directly shining down. For the reviewers that say there is no action at this casino, I am not sure what these people saw and how hard these people are to entertain. Besides our group there were alot of other people having a great time at the casino, especially around the group slots like the Wheel of Fortune and Ebay machines we met alot of fun people there and the waitresses are always coming by with cocktails. The food court is great to grab a quick Starbucks in the morning or a quick nosh after a night on the town. The spa employess are also great and do wonderful manicures and pedicures. Fear not and book a room at the Monte Carlo and go into it open minded. The rooms are alot cheaper than some of the other Resort Casinos and the service is great at the Monte Carlo

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo Review”
Reviews.Author: kcashmore
Reviews.Content: I receive offers from Monte Carlo often. I like the location and the rooms are nice. Good for the price as well if they are not sending you freebies. Nice pool and lazy river. Wave pool is nice as well.. Since City Center construction began its a little annoying with all the noise. I still like staying there however.. Smells good and looks food.. Check inn is good when slow. Not over crowded and not ghetto like some other hotels have become.. Good video poker bar right outside sports book. comfy beds and awsome views of strip. Diablos cantina rocks as well !

Reviews.Title: “Old and Stinky.”
Reviews.Author: sjalex20
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo for 2 nights. Luckily my husband was comped (because of his MGM players card) for this trip as I would NEVER pay to stay here - it is in some major need of remodeling to say the least. We were supposed to stay for 4 nights but switched to the Mandalay Bay for the last 2 (thank goodness!!!) The Good: The staff was wonderful and treated us like royalty. It was comped. The room was generally clean. The breakfast we had for room service was good and had huge portions. The not so good: -This hotel is right next to the City Center project and construction here is loud! We have stayed at the Bellagio many times and have NEVER heard construction noises there while in our room - so the walls/windows here must be thin. -Speaking of which we could hear our neighbors holding normal volume conversations as well as if we were sitting in the room with them, this included the poor baby next to us that cried almost all night. -The beds are TERRIBLE, and by that I mean small, hard and the sheets are awful. - The buffet is tiny and doesn’t cost much less then heading over to the Bellagio or Planet Hollywood (which have great food and tons of options). The food was ok but I would definitely go else where. - Parking is ridiculous… the garage is closed and if you want to self park good luck finding a spot in the teeny tiny lot across the street from the lobby. We Valet parked which was fine but I felt like I had to plan my trips away from the strip (since we were also visiting family that lives in Vegas) so that I would not have to pay a tip 50 million times. - The Casino was dull, as in small and no people and their ventilation system must be old school. I swear walking from the LV Boulevard entrance through the casino to my room I literally smelled like an ash tray. They also do pipe in an old lady perfume smell like one other reviewer commented - and they were right, it is probably to cover up the strong smoke smell. Bad, just bad.

Reviews.Title: “Do you like to SLEEP ?”
Reviews.Author: tonyfromcanada
Reviews.Content: check-in was quick but had to beg for a king size bed that we reserved on line, were told that there were none available (3002) Rooms? after some begging one became available out of thin air.The rooms are perfectly fine not as bad as some reviews would suggest. The walls really are paper thin so expect to hear your neighbors showering and sneezing etc. The towels in the bathroom are very rough on your skin and in some cases stained with rust marks? The hotel itself seems clean and the staff very nice,especially the valet attendants.Loved the buffet servers,quick and have a sense of humor. The casino was a little slower then i expected but very loud with music. I think they are trying to atract the younger hip-hop crowd. The cocktail waitresses are always very attentive and never far away, Probably because the casino was not as busy. We ate at the buffet twice and enjoyed it each time $11.95 Breakfast,$18.95 dinner was worth the price. The caffe' was found to be very expensive for breakfast but after midnight they have great deals on food ie; steak and eggs $4.95. The construction going on next door can be loud at times and it definitely blocks the view of the strip and we were on the 23 rd floor. Las Vegas is definitely going through a recession because now you find deals like the old days, ie; 2 for 1 at the steakhouse (Brand), 2 for 1 at the Cantina mexican restaurant etc. The slot machines were very tight no matter what you play and we played alot of them but could'nt come ahead.The only show we went to see was the Phantom of the Opera and it was worth every penny. I can't begin to tell you how elborate the production is so do yourself a favor and go see it. Across the street from the Monte Carlo is a ticket office that provides half price tickets to most shows. If you get there at 9:30 am you get the best deals. Also on our trip we visited the Las Vegas Outlet mall and found really great deals on alot of different items. all in all we would probably not return to the MC mainly because of the location and view (city center office tower) blocks everything includind the sunlight.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if you can...”
Reviews.Author: ScrappyGal
Reviews.Content: I had pretty low expectations arriving at the Monte Carlo, but my stay ended up even worst than expected. 1 - Though I specifically asked for a non-smoking room, I was assigned to a smoking floor. When asked to switch rooms, the associate at the front desk acted as if she was doing us a favor by giving us an "upgraded" room because of the "pool view", which ended up with a view of the marvelous construction happening next door. 2 - Guests behind us walked into a room with ABSOLUTELY NO FURNITURE. 3 - There were clumps of hair in the shower. 4 - The sheets were amazingly worn out and musty. 5 - Walls are VERY thin. Could hear your neighbors showering/talking/etc. Definitely try to avoid this if you can...

Reviews.Title: “Value Stay at the Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: Jimmy_F_in_Michigan
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my recent stay (1-20/1-22) at the Monte Carlo. Room was clean, albeit a bit outdated. Asked for and received room away from construction (NYNY view). Enjoyed 2 nights for price of 3. The price I paid ($80.00 (price when I booked room in December) ) was actually higher than the current online prices. Casino had $5.00 blackjack, three card and Let-It-Ride. Valet service was excellent and received prompt response when my in-room safe would not shut. Overall, a considerable bargain. I would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: johnthetraveler019
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Monte Carlo. The room was nice and so was the pool. I'd say the only problem was that it was on the far end of the strip - a more centralized location would have been nice. But I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lost its Luster”
Reviews.Author: Btraveller47
Reviews.Content: It's been several years since we've stayed at the Monte Carlo, but we remembered it as a decent hotel for the price with nice pools and easy to navigate (i.e. not too big). However, the hotel has not kept up with the rest of the hotels along the strip - it is looking worn down and outdated. We booked a package that included two free buffets, a $30 spa credit, and margaritas at Diablos. We used the buffet credits for dinner one night and the food at the buffet was frightful - thank goodness it was free. I would definitely skip this and pay for some decent food, as there are many other far superior choices at nearby hotels. We also went to Diablo's and got our free margaritas (champagne glass sized for $9 each) the food was decent and the service was good, but the atmosphere was, like most of Vegas these days, geared towards drunken vulgar partiers, with alot of screaming "Woooo's" throughout dinner which becomes annoying after about 2nd time. After these two experiences, we decided to skip the spa credit and consider ourselves ahead. As for the casino, it was pretty empty most of the time we were there. But the worst part was that the casino has a particularly vile pungent odor of musty smoke mixed with years of spilled alcohol, etc. that is reminiscient of a has-been Vegas casino. Thankfully you can bypass the casino for the most part by walking down the side street and going in a side entrance. You just have to avoid the annoying and persistent sidewalk smut peddlers that crowd stretches of sidewalks along the strip, but particularly the short street between the NYNY and MC. A HUGE disappointment was that the pools were closed (although no one tells you this ahead of time) as the weather was quite nice the entire weekend - this IS the desert for goodness sakes! I heard that they were open until mid-December when it snowed and they wouldn't open again until sometime in March possibly. When I asked the concierge if there were any other pools open at the other hotels, he gave a terse "No" and turned away - not exactly the customer service you'd expect. Anyways, check-in and check-out was relatively quick and the clerks were friendly and helpful. And I was happy to see that all the freebies were taken off our bill as promised (you have to charge the package freebies to your room and then they remove them from your bill). The lobby is still in good shape and kept nice with fresh flowers. Our standard room overlooked the strip along with the vast rooftop of the casino strewn with mechanical units, and was on the side of the hotel close to the City Center project (which looks like a stark steel and glass urban landscape - yuck!) we only heard minimal construction noise on one day and it wasn't until 10am - no one appeared to be working over the weekend and most construction in Las Vegas has slowed considerably due to the economic downturn. The room was somewhat worn, but decent enough - it is showing its age with it's old bedspreads, old TV armoire with old tube-TV, tarnished plumbing fixtures, cracked marble tiles in bathroom, slow draining bathtub, etc.. Based on a previous post regarding bed bugs, I thoroughly inspected every inch of our bed, and thankfully found nothing (except to confirm that they indeed do not use fitted sheets which is annoying since the flat sheets they use just barely tuck under the sides and pull out and tangle up around you as you sleep - I guess this must somehow save them money?!?). On the positive side, they do have a surface level parking lot across from the lobby entrance that guests could use free, or you could have your car valet parked for free (except for the valet's tip). We parked our car ourselves in the lot and found this easy, safe and convenient, as we were always able to easily find parking and they have 24 hr security guards on bicycles in the lot. However, given all the newer hotel options, it is not likely that I would stay here again without a complete overhaul.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Service & LOUD!”
Reviews.Author: Canadian2009
Reviews.Content: This was our third time staying at Monte Carlo. It was also our last stay there. The hotel staff were very rude and not accomodating. We had 5 rooms. All of them were directly facing the construction site. We were awoken at 4:00 or 5:00 a.m. every morning with the sounds of drilling and loud beeping. When we spoke to the lady at the front desk, she said: "There's nothing I can do about it. There are no other rooms available." When we asked for a manager, we were told that there was none available. We will never stay there again. It is also quite out dated now and there are many other (and better) places to stay. If you want friendly services, clean rooms, and to sleep in (past 5:00 a.m.), DO NOT stay at the Monte Carlo. They just lost 15 regular customers!

Reviews.Title: “Hated the ticket promoters”
Reviews.Author: tsvfamilytrips
Reviews.Content: An Aussie family that just flew in from Vancouver after a 7 night stay at First Tracks Whistler and the best snow for ages. Booked three rooms, one with a king bed for wifie and myself, and a connecting room for our 14yr son and 11yr daughter, that was actually a few doors down from ours. NO GOOD! So, 20 minutes later after having to explain WHY we needed connecting rooms, we were given connecting rooms on the forth floor. King bed then turned into 2 x queens..OK. Now the third room was for dear sister in law, who was flying down from Rapid City to join us for a couple of days. Maybe her room was on the same floor, but would not commit. Free buffets were good, saved us a few dollars there. the $10 free spend at the casino, you have to join the members club to use it. That didn't happen and the free Maragritas at Diablo's? Well I suppose we would have used them if the place wasn't drowning in ticket promoting people offering prostitution or whatever to my son daughter and wife and myself. Remember the ages of our children? Unbelievable..can't this be cleaned up? Anyway,same old clich'e, you get what you pay for, next time we will stay in Canada where this would not be tolerated.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo Needs A Makeover”
Reviews.Author: AdventureLass
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, the Monte Carlo is beginning to appear outdated compared to many of the other hotels/casinos on The Strip. I experienced no issues with any staff members or my reservation. Check-in & Check-out was efficient, restaurant staff hospitable and welcoming, and all the doormen were helpful and friendly. I appreciate NOT having to walk through the casino to get to the elevator banks to the rooms. Room: Choose a room as far away from the construction of City Center as possible. Construction began promptly at 4:15am every morning. My room was average and clean, rather "worn" in appearance overall. The bedspread was kind of gross. The internet connection ($13.95 for a 24hr period) worked just fine. Food: I dined at the buffet for breakfast: $12.88 incl tax and so not worth the money. A huge variety to choose from, but way overpriced. I also dined at the Dragon Noodle Asian restaurant. The sushi was almost tasteless and all the maki rolls and sashimi fell completely apart when lifting them off the plate. The food court was incredibly overpriced, as was the "convenience" store carrying the usual ammenities. Go next door to the CVS pharmacy and get your snacks, postcards and souvenirs! Casino: I'm not a gambler, so I can't speak to the tables and slots areas. They seemed low key and a much quieter environment in comparison to other casinos.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty average. OK but too far from mid-strip.”
Reviews.Author: beav16
Reviews.Content: This was only my second time staying on the strip. The first time was at the Tropicana years ago. When I booked this, I wanted to stay more in the middle of the strip, but the prices were a lot higher there so I chose the MC. Both registration and check out were easy and quick. We had arrived early in the day so checked our bags with the bellman and walked the strip. Everything we wanted to do - shows, food, the mall - were really far away. Our feet were begging for rest when we returned at 3:40 pm to get into our room. (we were told check in time was 3 pm). We put the key in the door and it opened to find that it hadn't been cleaned yet. Spoke to the housekeepers and had it cleaned next. Took another half hour. The room itself was very comfortable. It suited our purposes just fine. Always had clean towels and bathroom amenities. There was a constant dripping from the bathtub faucet which we called about but did not get fixed. Breakfast buffet was huge with lots of variety and at $12.88 was cheaper than a lot of other ones on the strip. I thought when I booked this hotel that it was of a high enough standard that it would not attract loud and raucous partiers on our non-smoking floor, (I appreciated this after walking through smoky casinos) but unfortunately, the last night of our 3-night stay, we were kept awake and then woken up again by people next door and across the hall. They were loud, running around, and we could hear someone throwing up in the bathroom, another asking, "what were you thinking?" etc. We called security. When we left the next morning, we noticed a stone art piece that had been hanging on the wall was now on the floor of the hallway, there was either wine or blood on the hall carpet, and the door to our neighbor's room was plastered with those business card size ads for calling nude women that are handed out up and down the strip in the afternoons (unfortunate that this happens with children around). We did inform the hotel of this when we checked out. Now that I am more familiar with the locations of things on the strip, it is worth the extra money to stay in a more central location at a nicer hotel. They did have a winter package with room credits for food, the spa (getting off on the spa floor there was an odor which smelled so bad I could not bring myself to use the spa there) and coupons for their food court, but as most of the hotels there are hurting right now, I am sure others had similar offers as well.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated”
Reviews.Author: GBPackers-Lover
Reviews.Content: After our stay at Monte Carlo, I felt as if the property was owned by Harrah's, not MGM Mirage. Normally, the majority of MGM Mirage hotels (Bellagio, MGM Grand, Mirage, Mandalay Bay, etc.) are either new, or have recently renovated their rooms to look new; however, this hotel is definately an exception. We stayed in a spa suite overlooking the strip. The room was about 700 sq. ft. and the spa sat beside the window that overlooked the strip. There were many positives. First, the price. We booked a package for three nights that included four free buffets (the buffet is $20 per person at night), 2 large margaritas, food court coupons, and a spa suite for $79 dollars per night. Not a bad deal. Second, there is a food court in the hotel. This comes in handy when you want to eat lunch for a reasonable price at Subway, McDonalds, etc. Third, the hotel has a nice pool complex. Although it was closed during our stay we did manage to see it. There were various pools, lazy river, etc. There were also many negatives. First, the casino. I love to play cards, and a big reason for that is the atmosphere in the casinos. When I play at MGM Grand or Planet Hollywood it is fun because the casino itself is hip and exciting. However, when I walk through the casino at Monte Carlo, I don’t know what other word to use but “blah.” The casino is small and boring. Second, Even if you get a “strip view room," like the one we had, the view will still suck. The reason is the hotel is boxed in between two tall structures on both sides. Basically, the only thing that you will see with a “strip view room” is the MGM Grand that basically sits across the street. Instead of calling it a “strip view” Monte Carlo should call it an “MGM Grand view.” Third, and like I briefly mentioned earlier, the Monte Carlo is simply outdated. I was shocked to find out it was built in 1996. It looks as if it was built in the 70’s. The tv’s are small, carpet’s dirty, etc. Overall, we will probably not stay at the Monte Carlo again. The hotels on the strip offer promo codes that make it possible to stay at places like MGM Grand and Treasure Island for about the same price. I would say that at least 90% of the hotels on the strip are larger, newer-looking, and more exciting. Monte Carlo may be good for couples in their 50’s and 60’s, but for couples like us in our 20’s, we will probably not return to Monte Carlo.

Reviews.Title: “Not all it's cracked up to be”
Reviews.Author: ShoverBot
Reviews.Content: I'm pretty sure this hotel simply doesn't have a good view of the strip. This trip we got a view of the pool. Translation: A view of the construction and the freeway.
