On a previous visit we got a supposed Strip view room. Due to how the hotel is oriented the best you can hope for is a view of the MGM Grand, but mostly you just see the Monte Carlo's casino roof. If you're hoping for spectacular night-time views like you see in Vegas ads, this is not the place for you. The room itself apears to be the typical standard fare Vegas room until you spend some time in it. The sheets on the bed aren't fitted and pull out easily, and the walls are apparently paper thin. We could clearly hear the guests in the neighboring room and construction noise even from the 29th floor was enough to wake me early in the morning, and I'm not a light sleeper. Any bathroom use in adjoining rooms sounds like it's in your room's bathroom. The thud of footsteps up and down the hall is barely muffled. The vent in the bathroom on this non-smoking floor constantly piped in a steady stream of air that reeked of cigarette smoke. After the disaster our last visit was (power failure which led to no water for hours in the morning and no apologies from staff) I should have known better than to book here again. Lesson learned.

Reviews.Title: “OLD, DIRTY AND LAME.”
Reviews.Author: abc123123
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights - check in was fast but after we had requested a room that's not facing the construction, we were told we will be given a room facing pool side (which was code for "I don't give a f what you want, you are getting a room facing the heart of the construction"). One look at the room instantly reminded me of a holiday inn express or a perhaps a days inns. The bed covers are those that you know have not been washed in years and have been advised by many not to make direct contact with. The bed sheets are not fitted and not tucked properly and would slip loose just by sleeping on them causing you to wake up and notice part of your body is on that nasty exposed mattress. All in all, the room can be summed up by saying it was dated, dirty, nasty, rough, etc. The atmosphere within the hotel/casino can be described as similar to being in a casino located next to a retirement home where the locals often take advantage of the early bird specials. I don't believe I saw one day where the casino was even semi full, it seemed like there were more people in the food court than in the casino or bars. The decor in the lobby, casino and bar is blan, and hard to get excited about. I would say that this hotel does not provide customers with the experience or the atmosphere of being in vegas. It actually seems to suck the experience out of you once you step inside from all that's going on outside on the strip. I don't think I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Under construction”
Reviews.Author: The_Original_Bobo
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights at the Monte Carlo this was our first stop as well as our first time driving in the US. This wasn't made easy by the car parking arrangements at the MC as you are guided into the Valet parking whether you like it or not, this can get expensive if you are using your car alot, as you are expected to tip the valet guys when dropping off and picking up your car. There is a lot of construction work going on all around the MC, hence the parking issue. Our first room view was of the building site, we where moved on the second day (to the size room we had actually booked) our view from here although on the 24th floor was of the pool. Don't know the trick of getting any sort of views of the strip? The MC is situated on the strip next to New York New York, so is in a good spot although it's still a long walk to get anywhere decent. The lazy river is fun and great to relax around whilst catching a few rays although as there are so many highrise buildings around the hotel you have to follow the sun around at swap sunbeds every 1-2 hours or so. Our room was clean and like many other people have mentioned the bedding and furniture is dated, but we found this in most of the hotels we stopped at on our 3 week break which included stopping at 8 hotels. If we where to return to Vegas then we wouldn't stop more than 4 nights and we wouldn't return to the Monte Carlo as there are so many other places to stay you have to explore others.

Reviews.Title: “The city may never sleep, but you might want to...”
Reviews.Author: Tellmehowtosayit
Reviews.Content: I had looked forward to this visit. I had never stayed at the Monte Carlo before and it was a good location on the strip. From the pictures online, I could tell they had the 1980s quilted bedspread, but I looked past it. When we arrived, they put us in a non-smoking room with two queen beds. We thought, as long as it is non-smoking, it is fine with us. We have a queen bed at home, so we didn't see a problem. The carpet seemed newer, a big plus. There were no immediately visible gross elements to the room. When it was time to go to bed, however, it was a whole different story- The most awful offense, in my opinion, was that the sheets on the matress were not fitted. So, when you un-made the bed and pulled the top sheet back, you un-did the bottom sheet as well. Any movement in the bed pulled up the sheet covering the matress and bunched up the thin (the size of a full matress blanket) matress pad underneath the unfitted bottom sheet. The matress was uncomfortable and we tossed and turned all night. I woke up at one point and the sheet had shifted so much, half of my body was on exposed matress. I was seriously grossed out. We called the next day to ask for fitted sheets and they said they did not have any in the hotel. They answered as if it was not the first time they had heard this request. I do not believe those matresses were standard queen matresses. We did not have the same room we normally do at home. Noise seemed to carry especially well in this hotel. We were on the 21st floor, but could hear people revving their engines in the parking garage. Every noise the neighbors made came clearly through the wall, as I am sure our noise did as well. When the water was turned on in our bathroom, it sounded like a dental drill. When the water was turned on in a neighboring bathroom, it sounded like it was in our bathroom. Finally, the towels were stained and tired. It was clear they had been bleached and were clean, but many were discolored and all semblance of softness was lost. The positives- other than the sleeping arangements, the room was livable. It was decent sized. The closet had many hangers. The toiletries provided were actually quite nice. The service was friendly, though they didn't seem to go out of their way to be accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Faithfully as expected”
Reviews.Author: JuneauAlaskaJoAnn
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Monte Carlo many times. I like the fact that I can get in and out without any problems. I know where everything is at and what to expect. The place is low key and mellow, it is showing it's age but who isn't? The rooms are modest, but adequate. You can get some really great rates, for the location - you can't really beat it. I like vegas when its warm. Otherwise if it's cold and rainy it can pretty miz. There is construction on almost all sides of the MC. One morning I woke up to hear drilling, and it was on the floor above me. I was kinda pist, but so was everyone else. I called the front counter and I could hear a lot of complaints. I thought they should of done it from around 12 noon - 5 pm or so. Morning? IN VEGAS?! . The lady at the counter seemed like she was under some stress and was a bit off. All in all, if you want a place for the location - the MC is the place. If you want lux - then this is not the place. But is comfortable and decent. I didn't win much at the slots. I always get the chicken won-ton with noodles at Dragon Noodle. I also don't ever recall being mistaken for a working girl at the MC. which is nice when I'm just trying to relax, have a smoke and a drink or two. Play a few bucks worth of slots - so what if its 3 am. Also I did make everyone check the bed for any bugs, because of a previous warning -- we found none in any of our 3 rooms. My mom liked her room service food, I didn't like mine - and it took a while, but it was Thanksgiving. Room services is a pretty good deal actually - when you compare prices and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Aging and Construction”
Reviews.Author: Indytraveler83
Reviews.Content: I just recently came back from my first trip to Vegas. I wouldn’t consider my trip the typical “Vegas Trip” seeing that I was there for work related purposes. I stayed at the Monte Carlo and I would recommend this hotel to others in the near future if they don’t mind looking past a few things. First of all, the construction is rather bad right now. The City Center going up next to the MC is a huge undertaking and the construction crews are working almost around the clock. I like to think I am a rather deep sleeper but even I couldn’t sleep through their construction noise. Every morning at 6:00 AM the construction crews start and you will probably hear every rivet being put into place. If I was coming back to my room at 5:00 AM and I tried to go to sleep with the sound of jackhammers outside my window I would be less that happy to say the least. Something else about the MC that I couldn’t help but notice was the ‘aging’ it seemed to have. The casino seems to be a little outdated and was almost never busy like some of the others. I also thought the casino had a strange ‘old lady’ smell going on. Laugh all you want but if you have been there you might know what I’m talking about. Their air system at the MC probably cannot hold up to the amount of smoke being taken in so they resort to a brain-numbing scent to try and cover up the smell of Misty cigarettes. The food court in the hotel is pricy and dated. A colleague of mine said he paid $7 for ice cream cone and I spent $12 for some bad Chinese food all within the food court. Unless you are there to pick up a coffee at Starbucks or an Egg McMuffin from McD’s, go out for food. One major plus to the hotel was the location. For the price (broke down to $65 a night) you cannot beat the location. You are on the strip and within walking distance to all of the major hotels/casinos and right next to a CVS if you need to pick up anything you forgot. One last suggestion is to visit Freemont Street during your trip. The Golden Nugget has an amazing pool that words cannot describe (think Shark Tank and Water Slide).

Reviews.Title: “Tired and Worn Out Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kellkae
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Monte Carlo (Dec 1st - Dec 5th). Arrived about 9:30 pm. Staff very friendly, no complaints there. I asked for a room away from the construction side and was sent to a room on the 17th floor. Upon arrival in room found beds that were rumpled, water bottle by bed, went into bathroom to find used soap and hand towels. Called front desk they told me they would "upgrade" us to a Strip view room. Our new room was identical in size and layout to our first room just on the 28th floor with a view of the Strip. First comment --- the room is just plain "tired and worn." The bedding is scuzzy with piling on the polyester bedspreads. The desk and tv cabinet are old and chipped and the lighting is horrible!!! I felt like a troll in a dungeon! The bathroom is decent size but the the whole room made me feel as though I was in a Motel 6. The walls are paper thin and we could hear everything in the room next to us. Thankfully there wasn't much late night noise. It was almost frightening to look out the window on the 28th floor and see how "thin" the walls actually are. The windows are pretty cheap as well. The casino is okay. The food in the restaurants was above average and reasonably priced and all the employees were very friendly which was a nice bonus. I would definitely say for the money the South Point is a much much nicer property and would stay there again but prefer accommodations more along the lines of Mandalay Bay, etc. I would avoid this hotel until they renovate it.

Reviews.Title: “Swimming at the Carlo”
Reviews.Author: war_eagle2005
Reviews.Content: We choose the Monte Carlo solely for the pool for our children. We had a great time. The kiddie pool was nice plus it was fenced in. We booked the room knowing that there was construction going on next door and it turned out to be an advantage because our son loves to watch construction equipment in motion. We had a standard room and every thing was fine. It was great for our family.

Reviews.Title: “Theft from Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: Tikiwiki
Reviews.Content: I arrived on a Thursday (late afternoon) and left Saturday morning. When I arrived, I had a bag with ONLY my camera, phone, IPOD and eyeglasses that I had on the plane with me, so that I would not lose these valuables. When I arrived, I placed the IPOD in my suitcase (a zippered portion, with my headphones) and the camera inside the suitcase, next to clothes. The phone, I placed in my purse and the eyeglasses in the nightstand. On Thursday and Friday nights we gambled...therefore, I did not/could not use my camera (in Casinos). On Saturday morning when I was getting ready to check out, I could not locate my bag nor my camera!!! I am 100% sure that I did NOT LOSE my camera because I NEVER took it back out of the suitcase nor attempted to use it, until I planned to place it (along with my IPOD, phone and eyeglasses) back into the bag so that I could carry it along on the plane. The ONLY day cleaning crew should have gone in my room was on Friday...what a shame that in one short day, the camera was stolen. Customer Service was very insensitive, unconcerned and downright unprofessional about the entire event. After weeks of attempting to get any anwers from them....they ignored phone call after phone call...they FINALLY just sent a letter indicating that they are not responsible for "LOST" items!!!! BEWARE!!!! Lock up your valuables because Monte Carlo personnel will not sympathize with your matter of "LOST or STOLEN" items.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: shiroubi
Reviews.Content: My friends and I booked two rooms for $85/night and we stayed for three nights. I was a bit apprehensive about the hotel from the negative reviews I've read, but I found our stay was absolutely pleasant and well worth the money. Check-in went smoothly and took about fifteen minutes. My room was of average size, which I didn't care for. The bed was so soft! Our bathroom had a shower/tub and was decently sized. There was construction occurring outside in the mornings (now the Palazzo hotel) when we were there Dec. of 2007, but I did not find the noise disturbing. I had read that the walls of the rooms were thin, but I didn't think they were. You'd have to be talking pretty loudly to be heard by people in the next room. Overall, the hotel offers great rates for beautifully decorated rooms with soft beds. This resort would be ideal for travelers looking for a hotel with a bit of class but with nightly rates that are suited for the budget-minded. I would definitely stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Smurfff
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Monte Carlo for 2 nights. The check-in process was fast and the room was clean. The staff are friendly as well. I can't find anything negative to say about my stay. It has been a very good experience. We went to the Buffet restaurant too. It has less variety compared to MGM Grand buffet. However, it's cheaper and so, it depends on individual traveller's preference.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: yoshigal
Reviews.Content: My friend from work and I stayed at the Monte Carlo for the week of Nov 9th through the 16th/08 and we both enjoyed this hotel very much. I had been reading the reviews before we left and I was nervous about our choice..but I am so glad that I didn't change our reservations. Check in was very fast, the staff all very helpful and courteous. The lobby is beautiful as is the casino. Very elegant. We asked for, and were given ,a room facing the strip. We did have to wait a few hours for it but since our arrival time was 0930, this wasn't a surprise. The room was large and very clean. There were no bugs....believe me I checked! I have to agree with the person who said they didn't like the soap but it is easy enough to pick up anything you might want at the CVS next door. The rooms are what I would call moderate. Nothing elaborate, the TV has basic channels, the rug is a little worn, the walls are a little thin but for the money, it is an excellent value and the location is very good. It is extremely handy to have the food court in the hotel. I would much rather run down to the Starbucks and grab coffee and a danish to eat in the room while getting ready for the day than to have to get ready and then go and find a restaurant. We checked out the pool and lazy river but didn't go in. The pools looked inviting and there was lots of seating. But I have to say that the construction site next door has pretty much obliterated any sun over the pool area. I have read others calling the construction an eyesore..but that doesn't begin to describe it. It is an enormous venture with 6 large skyscrapers being built at the same time. It is huge....takes up about one New York City block..and they work on it 24 hours a day. I never heard any noise while in the hotel though so don't let noise concern you. There is always going to be construction in Vegas! The casino in the Monte Carlo is quite large and not as busy as other casinos. I like that..I am in my early 50s and not interested in the mid 20s crowd of drinking and partying (why do young men all have to yell? ) If you want that experience just cross the street and go to the MGM any Friday or Saturday night. We went into pretty much all of the casinos and did not hear anyone hitting the jackpot...ever. I guess the economy has effected Vegas too. On that note, I also noticed several beggars...even inside of the casinos..something I have never seen before in Vegas. Very sad. The card flickers are out in full force too...but at least they have jobs! If you decide to go shopping at the premium Outlet Mall near Fremont street, it is well worth the trip. Great bargains and lots of stores to choose from. The best way to go is to take the monorail to the Sahara and then take a cab from there. The cost will be about $15. We mistakenly took the deuce bus from the Sahara and ended up at the bus terminal near Fremont to switch buses. This is an experience the average person could do without. Unless you have a desire to see dozens of homeless people or have gang members sucking their teeth at you....I would avoid it like the plague. And this was at 1 oclock in the afternoon! I can't imagine what being there after dark would be like. Oh wait, I can imagine it...and no thanks. We took the bus to Laughlin for the day. I like the trip through the desert but the town itself is nothing much. There are about 8 casinos along the river...they are not as nice as the ones in Vegas of course..but they are not bad. There is a very nice boardwalk along the river which leads to a small public beach. We went in the water just to say that we had been in the Colorado River. It was so clean and fresh...lovely! There is also a small outlet mall across the road from where the bus drops you off. The bus driver won't tell you about it..they are trying to get you into the casinos! The trip costs $5 and they throw in a free buffet lunch which was quite good. If you are only in Vegas for a few days, I wouldn't bother..but if you are there for a week and would like a break from the crowds, then I would recommend this trip. You leave about 8 in the morning and get back around 6. I enjoyed it but I don't think it is the kind of thing you would do twice. Kinda like the Hoover Dam..I enjoyed it the first time, but really its just water..and a dam. How many times can you see it? I realize I am writing a book here...so that's about it. I would stay at the Monte Carlo again. The location is very good...the monorail is at the MGM across the street..or you can walk next door to NY NY, then walk over to Excalibur and take their tram to Luxor or Mandalay Bay. It is a bit of a hike to the other end of the strip and you do have to walk by the construction site..but its Vegas, lighten up....have a drink...forget about everything and just HAVE FUN!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: odette1558
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Monte Carlo for 4 nights this past week and have no complaints other than the walls are thin. It is an older hotel and I guess the insulation is not what it is today. Although construction is going on around it didn't bother is at all. We were on the strip side. The hotal staff were friendly and accomodating. I would stay there again even though it's not the Luxor or Winn.

Reviews.Title: “Only a 3* Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EddieSanMateo
Reviews.Content: After seeing a very good promotional price for the Monte Carlo, we booked our trip there because they advertise as a 4-Star hotel. While the property is very nice, the room itself is by no means 4-Star quality. The room is small and modestly decorated with older bedding. Just beware...there is lots of construction surrounding the Monte Carlo and it is noisy because construction goes on 24/7. A new hotel & timeshare development is being constructed next door.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a fan!”
Reviews.Author: S-Dubb
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I booked 2 rooms at the Monte Carlo via Priceline for my bachlorette party in April, 2008. I am shocked that anyone has anything negative to say about this place. It is fabulous - has an awesome food court, is completely updated, and has an AWESOME pool. There was some construction going on, but after 3 beers, no one really cares anymore! The palm trees and lazy river really distract you! Our rooms were clean, the bathrooms were updated, and the location was PRIME. I was nervous when we scored the hotel on priceline, but I was pleasantly surprised and enjoyed the hotel as much as if not more than my stays at Paris and Caesars! I hope my trip out to the Luxor next month (another priceline deal) will be as pleasant of a surprise as Monte Carlo!

Reviews.Title: “Stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: radiacabeza
Reviews.Content: Take your money and stay elsewhere! The MC is in a desperate need of a facelift. -The walls are paper thin - we could hear every word the guy next to us was saying and he wasn't even talking that loudly! -There is one outdoor parking lot for guests. It is nowhere near big enough for a hotel the size of MC. When I asked the security guard in the lot where hotel guests should park I was told to valet it or park in the NYNY structure. It took me over 30 minutes to park the car and walk back to the casino. -The beds and linens are in need of replacement. The sheets were completely coming off of our double bed and my bf found a bloodstained pillowcase on the other double bed! Gross! It's a shame that this property has gone downhill so much. It used to be so nice. We will not be staying at MC ever again.

Reviews.Title: “VERY GOOD HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: jcas5599
Reviews.Content: I have been to Vegas before - stayed at the Flamingo and the Luxor. Wanted to try something different. This hotel has a very nice lobby. I was checked in very quickly even though the reservation was in my mom's name, but she couldn't go at the last minute due to the fact that she was in the hospital and we couldn't get back the money. Hence, I went. I was checked in as I said with very nice people. I went into the jacuzzi and that was fantastic. I also went into the Lazy River Pool and that was great! The room was good, clean with a view of some roof top. I have read earlier reviews about all the buildings being built and the noise - Whether I was at the pool or in the room, I never heard anything!!! So, don't believe everything you read!!!!!!! The bathroom was very nice, can't complain. They replenished the supplies fast. The only thing (and this is serious nitpicking) is that I didn't like the soap - but who cares, cause I brought my own anyway. There is a CVS right next door and a Walgreens across the street- so if you forget anything, you can get it there. I also suggest that before you start buying tourist gifts, go to both of those stores and save yourself a fortune. A shirt is a shirt, you know what I mean? I did use their concierge and they were amazing! I don't remember his name, but he has red hair, and I put that poor man through the ringer trying to find me a good trip to the Grand Canyon. He told me that if I didn't like the trip after I did it, the hotel would reimburse me the money. I thought to myself, how could I possibly go wrong? I booked it right there and then, and it was an amazing trip!!!!! The tour driver took us to the Grand Canyon and we had unscheduled stops on Rte 66 and we stopped at an Indian Trading Post and were able to stretch our legs quite a bit. We also stopped for pictures of wild animals, and he actually let me off the bus so that I could go chase down some Elk and take pictures.... Nice guy!!!!!! Hint: Don't forget to tip the drivers- they don't get paid a lot of money to do these 10 hour trips believe it or not - and the tips really do help. We gave him $20.00 ("we" being my boyfriend and myself) Of course, when we got back, we stopped at the Concierge and had to tell him what an amazing time we had!!!!! The casino: Well, it wasn't built on winners.... I don't do a lot of tables, so I won't comment on those, but the slots? Well, I didn't see anyone win. I play them A LOT and I can tell you that the only time I won was playing a penny slot and I had like .50 left, and I hit the bonus! Figures, right????? The very last night I was there, I stayed on the slot machine, I Dream Of Genie for like 5 hours. It was ridiculous!!!! so, that was good. If your going to play that -it's in the back near the elevators.... there are four back to back. Play the ones facing the front of the casino so that you have your back to the elevators... those paid out more... Trust me!!!! Food: They have a Mcdonalds, a Sbarro's, Starbucks and some other type of fast food restaurants - so you can get a cheap breakfast or a quick snack at lunch. Save yourself some money- instead of eating at fancy restaurants for $40.00 + pp, eat a breakfast there. They do have the fancy smancy restaurants too - don't get me wrong, but I didn't pack fancy clothes, and I know better than to try and get in wearing jeans.... Dinner: Across the street is Outbacks Steakhouse and there was no wait, great food, decent pricing. I work next door to one and I love these restaurants!!! By the by- they do accept jeans... LOL Paris has a nice buffet for dinner too, that is decently priced. Flamingo has a nice buffet as well- if your into Seafood - Holy cow !!! The King Crab legs... ( I don't eat seafood, but watching the others eat, they got their money worth and then some!) I did the Eiffel Tower, that was cool, but we were just at Paris in Sept. - so if you haven't done the actual Eiffel Tower (in Paris) you will love this!!!!! But If you have done the real Eiffel Tower (in Paris), the elevator ride on this is a piece of cake!!!! Still nice views of the strip and the Bellagio waters....Bring your camera. Worth the money. Overall, the hotel is very nice. if you are on a budget and want something nice, book this hotel. But do beware that 8 - yes, 8 buildings are going up around Monte Carlo- so the pool doesn't have a lot of direct sunlight, so sunbathing may be an issue as these buildings are going up..... Also, the monorail stops at MGM so you have to hoof it across the street over to NY and past that, so if your really tired of walking and your feet are killing you it seems like a very long walk! I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable priced hotel on the strip”
Reviews.Author: gr1069
Reviews.Content: Reasonable pricing, nice rooms. Mid sized hotel casino. I have been there a couple times and love the location. Pricing is probably lower than normal since there is a huge construction project going 24/7 next door. Bring earplugs along and/ or make sure your room faces the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay - MC doing their best”
Reviews.Author: VegasSusie
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo has been getting a bad rap for quite some time due to the enormous construction project right next door. This is our second stay; we stayed exactly one year ago. Both visits were very nice, no complaints in particular. We stayed in a Monaco suite for the first two nights (comped) on the 30th floor. It was quite nice, 700 sf, but not worth the regular price of over $300 they state on their website. There was no jetted tub as listed on the site, instead a shower only with a seat. There was no ledge on the shower floor to speak of, so it was virtually impossible not to leak water out onto the marble floor. There was also a smaller washroom in the suite with a loo and sink. The larger bathroom was so spacious, we felt it was a suite designed for wheelchair access. What a great idea. Also had a 42" plasma TV and couch to sit on. Lovely comfortable bed with duvet. We then transferred to a deluxe room on the 10th floor for four nights. We got a special MGM/Mirage players' club rate of $49 per night weeknights and $99 for the Friday. It was a very nice room as well, same as last year so we knew what to expect. No view to speak of - it is difficult to get a really nice view room at the Monte Carlo, unless you like cranes and such. We did not hear any noise from the construction at all, except for a very faint beeping of trucks backing up. No big deal. The housekeeping service was excellent as usual. We requested extra bars of the wonderful shower soap on a note and received lots (we usually leave $4-5 dollars per day for housekeeping if the service is good, and it was). The staff was very friendly at MC. We ate only one meal, a late nighter at The Cafe. Our server, Sharon, was a very nice gal, and the food was quite good. We also had desserts from Starbucks which were very nice. The slots were really tight in Vegas this time around. Last year we managed to win on several machines at MC, but not this time. We saw "Ka" at MGM Grand, which was very good. $150 total for two people, about 2/3 the way back from the stage. Cirque de Soleil shows in general are always a good bet for entertainment; some are quite pricey, however. "Ka" and "Mystere" are quite reasonable. We saw Carrot Top at the Luxor. Very funny guy, kept us laughing. Not for kids under 14, though. $90 total for two. We ate at Joe's Stone Crab Restaurant at Caesar's Palace. Quite pricey, good service; very good filet mignon. The stone crabs take a bit of work to get the meat out of the shell, served cold with a creamy mustard dipping sauce. Sides are big enough for two, so share. New York New York has a nice restaurant, America, with a map on the ceiling that should be seen. It is very well done and fun to look at. The Italian restaurant, Il Fornaio, was quite good. The Tuscany Cafe in Tropicana was much better; it has a dinner special, two lobster tails for $19.95 which is excellent. The Cheesecake Factory at the very far end of the Forum Shops at Caesars is always great - good food, good service and desserts to die for. We tried to get into Bobby Flay's Mesa Grill at Caesar's three times, but no luck. Bette Midler is there until mid December, so it is very difficult to get a reservation at Bobby's. Hope you have better luck than we did. All in all, a great trip; the gambling was brutal, but otherwise Vegas is always fun. Be prepared to walk a lot. Bus pass for 24 hours is $5.00 per person, including transfers. Well worth it, but be prepared for slow going from, say, 3 pm to 7 pm on the Strip. Allow extra time, an extra half hour at least to get to shows and whatnot, otherwise you might be late. The Monorail is much faster, but is $12.00 for 24 hours and stops at the rear of select hotels on the West side of the Strip, then you have to walk through to the street. Monorail runs from the back of MGM Grand at the South end to Sahara on the North - 14 minutes total. If you want to go to Palace Station on Sahara, take the 204 bus. Above all, have fun in Vegas; get used to the construction, it will be there for quite a while. We got used to it pretty quick. Also, check out The Conservatory at the Bellagio if you're going to Vegas soon - it is beautiful with a fall theme of pumpkins, gourds, elves, "man-eating" plants, gorgeous flowers and such. Take your camera and extra batteries for it! Thanks for reading, folks!

Reviews.Title: “Great and quiet for Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Magills070706
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights while visiting Las Vegas for the first time. We liked the central location of the hotel and the quietness of the lobby, etc. There is a lot of construction around the property but we were never bothered by noise or anything while staying here. The rooms could be a little bigger but overall it was a great experience. The food court and the shops were very convenient and the restaurants were amazing!! I would definately reccomend Diabolos!!! It was one of the best meals we had in vegas!!!

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo -Typical Vegas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bettylopez10
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in APril 2008 together with my 2 best friends and our check in and check out is quite fast. However during our visit there was a lot of construction going on around this hotel and there is a very noisy club at the corner of the hotel. Its a typical Vegas hotel, with shops inside the hotel, big restaurant for breakfast,usual casino floor. The room is average, the beds are quite spacious enough for two adults to sleep in comfortably. The downside is that there are a lot of construction around the hotel when we visited it on April 2008.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Matza3
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Monte Carlo Resort. We stayed from the 9-13th of November. Check in was very quick and they gave us our room immediatley even though we arrived at 11:00 a.m. The hotel has a very nice decor, room was clean. We were lucky to have the room with a view of the strip. We were away from the construction, so there was no noise level issues. The pool was closed, then again the weather would have kept you away. On the last day it was open and warm outside, so we did a little tour. Pool is very nice, and the lounge chairs are comfy. We ate at the hotel, the breakfast buffet was more than I expected, worth a try. The cafe had a great menu and reasonable. Food court was convenient, especially Starbucks. Make sure you get a players card, got comped for buffets and coffees at the Starbucks. Staff is friendly. However; some could be more patient. Casino is not as busy as the other casinos on the strip. First day I won over $100 so that was a good start. I won again on the day I left as well, which was a great ending of my stay. I would return to Monte Carlo in the near future.Just one advise, please ensure you purchase a calling card, my friend called home and left a message which cost her $22.00.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: DeeMacL
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Monte Carlo on October 30th for a 4 night stay. Check in was a little longer than expected considering we arrived later on in the evening - about 10 p.m. However, the delay was due more the the guests who were at the counter ahead of us than the staff. They were considering upgrading their room and were asking about 200 questions about their various choices. There weren't a lot of other staff members on at that time of night, hence the delay. Once it was our turn, the front desk clerk was courteous and prompt. Our room was fine. Comfy beds and a decent size, and certainly nice enough for the outstanding rate we were paying. Housekeeping service was reliable and thorough. My two favourite things about this hotel is its location and size. I have stayed at the Luxor and been happy with it, but it is such a looooong walk from the casino to the elevators to your room (if you are in the towers) that you really dread ever having to go back to your room to drop off a shopping bag, or a jacket that you've decided you don't need. Also, the Luxor's casino floor is quite large and sometimes it can be hard to navigate. The Monte Carlo's size and layout is great. You walk out of the casino into the lobby and the elevators are right there, and we never had to wait longer than about 30 seconds for one. I kid you not. It was really nice. The casino is a little smaller than many of the others, and is quite open and well laid out. It is therefore easy to navigate, and if you are looking for someone from your party, it is quite easy to find them. The location of this hotel (right between NYNY and the new City Centre complex that is being built) is a little further removed from the south end of the strip, and for anyone who's been to the strip before, you know that moving 3 or 4 hotels down makes a big difference in walking distance to anywhere else you may want to go. Every property takes up so much real estate, walking the distance of 3 or 4 properties can take you a good half hour, depending on the crowds. We quite enjoyed the Monte Carlo's location, and as to any noise from the construction next door, we did not hear anything. We ate breakfast every day in the Cafe, and every meal was good, and served quickly, by friendly staff. There was only one day we had to wait to be seated, and that was only about a 10 minute wait. All in all, the hotel is a repeat visit in our opinion. Excellent value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was OK! service was good!!”
Reviews.Author: Pedroseal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte carlo for four nights at the start of November. After a long delayed flight the check in process was quick...We asked for an upgraded room which they sorted and it was OK...we looked out on the new complex being built next door....The bar needs to be upgraded (very dark).....on the 2nd night we ate at the brand steakhouse in the hotel which was nice but very filling.....(can't complain)....Overall a good stay but would maybe pay a little extra and stay in the Bellagio or Venetion next time....

Reviews.Title: “Beware of hotels failure to honor prepaid promotions”
Reviews.Author: aliveinsf
Reviews.Content: BEWARE: I prepaid for a package MC 3rd Night Free" plus other "freebies" that most casinos throw in. Under this package, I paid for 2 nights and was to get a 3rd night free. When i went to check in I was told that this package was not available and they tried to charge me rates higher than rates advertised on the webiste, without a free night and theytwere not going to give me the freebies that come with the package. I requested to speak with the front desk manager and was told that she was at lunch (3 pm lunch????). I then asked to speak with the general manager and was told the GM was not available. Apprarently no one in authority was working at the hotel on this day. I requested that they check me into the room and then I would work out the situation with the manager; I also told them I could go to my computer and provide them with confirmations and copies of the advertisement for the package that I prepaid. They refused and demanded that I agree to pay rates higher than the rates currently being advertised on their own webiste, They wouldn't honor the prepaid package and then they tried to gouge me for rates in excess of what was being advertised at that very moment on their webiste. I refused to be bullied into paying higher rates and when it became clear that the staff was not going to provide any customer service, let alone honor their committment, I simply went to another hotel and disputed the payment with my credit card company.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: detome
Reviews.Content: I was driving to California and stayed in Las Vegas one night. The Mote Carlo had a great price and it's location was the prime factor in making my decision. The hotel is decent, all the decor is really nice, the room was very clean and comfortable, the bathroom fixtures were old and needed replacing but this did not hamper my stay in the least. The best part about the hotel is the pool area, they have great music playing, several pools, it's a great place to relax when you're not walking the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, needs some updates”
Reviews.Author: Mtn_Traveler4
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four night stay at the MC. Check-in was a breeze. I requested a room away from the construction and was placed on the 21st floor in the wing opposite the construction. I never heard any construction noise. It looks as though most of the work on the building nearest the MC is nearly complete. We were given a strip view room but due to the dust on the windows from the nearby construction, we could barely see out them. I realize this is not the MC's fault. Our room was an average hotel room, well worn from years of use. I had stayed here about 12 years ago and it honestly doesn't look as though the rooms have been updated since then. Dings in the walls, some minor mildew in the bathroom, and old beds tell the story. Be forewarned - they don't change your sheets while there unless you make a special request. Our sheets were just worn out with holes in some places, as were the blankets. I noticed a gap between the matress and headboard and found a pair of lavender ladies panties. Yuk! How could they put sheets on the bed and not have found those? Our housekeeper took our used soap after the first day and forgot to leave us more. I requested some from housekeeping and while we were gone they delivered a package of extra towels, soap, shampoo, and lotion. The TV is an old picture tube type. We had no problems with noise from neighbors. I do know that both rooms next to ours was occupied. Overall the MC is a great value for the money, plus it is in a primo spot on the Las Vegas strip. With a little effort from MGM, it could be renovated back to its former glory.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again- Sarah from Baltimore had it right!”
Reviews.Author: Smurfette40
Reviews.Content: Sarah from Baltimore had it right. The first room we were put in was dirty with clumps of hair on the shower walls. We were moved to different room that evening and it was like the carpet was never vacummed for months. Scared to even put my luggage on the floor. We complained that night and told we would be given room change in morning. But after the front dest clerk in the morning offered us an upgrade for free to stay the manager came out and declined it. You could n't even see out the windows of the room they were so dirty as well. I offered to take the manager up the room to see how bad it was. She wasn't willing to offer us even a free buffet let alone an upgrade. We went to the Flamingo and had great time there. If your into dirty rooms be my guest at the Monte Carlo, but I would never let my dog stay there let alone my worst enemy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Strip Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ebazinam
Reviews.Content: Booked this Hotel through (MLT-worry free vacations) as a short getaway. Check-in: Very long wait at check in, but not a whole lot different that the other big Las Vegas Strip hotels. The room was exactly as expected. Staff was very friendly and helpful Parking: USE THE FREE VALET PARKING on the south side of the hotel. The self serve lot is small, outdoors, and a good distance from the hotel entrance. Room: Exceptional room, close to the elevator. The beds were very comfortable. Housekeeping was exceptional and speedy. Our view was obstructed by the construction being completed on the west side of the hotel, not that we were there for the view anyway. Television was basic to say the least (it's a casino, they don't what you watching TV in your room anyway). Restaurants: Great food and atmosphere. Buffet was average, there are better buffets within walking distance. Gambling: All of the tables are about the same as everywhere else, drink service was SLOWWWWWW even though we were tipping well (off-season maybe?) Pool: If you are coming to Vegas for the pool scene, this could be the worst pool scene in the entire city. Small pools, with massive building construction and dust surrounding the pool area. Overall: Excellent value for the price paid, I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Greatest!”
Reviews.Author: SarahBaltimore_MD
Reviews.Content: Arrived to noisy construction everywhere. The front desk did not mention the construction noise when I booked the room. Our room was dirty. The windows were filthy. It also needed updating and renovation. When we requested another room, staff was not helpful. In frustration, we stayed in our dirty room for 3 nights. The pool area had little sun and much construction noise. The $30 credit to the spa could only be used for services of $100 or more. I was not told this in advance. Final bill was incorrect, had to wait in line to have the cost of the two buffets removed from my bill. Hotel is more like a 1-2 star hotel. It is expensive for a Saturday night stay. I would not stay there again. I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Peace and quiet”
Reviews.Author: snozz1
Reviews.Content: Family consisting of 2 adults and 2 children, aged 14 & 9, stayed at the Monte Carlo for 3 nights from 20th Sep-23rd Sep 2008. We arrived early for check in but were immediately given the keys for a room. We stayed on the 29th floor and the room was comfortable. The beds were nice but could do with a refridgerator in the room. We did not hear any of the construction work at all from our room but did hear toilets flushing at a bit of laughing next door. The Hotel allowed the kids to walk through the casino as long as we didnt stop. It was a little smokey but nowhere near as bad as other hotels we went in. The pool was great for the kids although the seating was a little congested. The hotel is well located on the strip and the kids found an M & M store across the road which had 4 levels. They were in heaven. Would stay again if we had the opportunity

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: EclecticNature
Reviews.Content: This was the first time I had tried using Priceline and I booked the room for a decent rate. I think this means that you are destined to be directly above the noisy construction. All in all, the room was comfortable and spacious. The parking was a breeze. The staff was friendly enough. The bathroom floor did slant and soak my things when I took my shower. The construction noise didn't bother us because we only stayed one night and had to get up early to catch a flight. Had we booked an extended stay I would have been annoyed by it. Overall I had no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Just an average room”
Reviews.Author: ALloyd
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Monte Carlo Oct 10th-14th. Don't think I would stay there again when I return back to Las Vegas. The room was just average. No frills or thrills. Internet access cost an additional $13 per day. Refrigerators cost an additional $15 per day. There is still alot of construction going on in the area. I would highly recommend dinely at Diablo's. It's a sports bar with a fun atmosphere and great food. If you are on a budget for meals, this casino has a food court which consists of McDonalds, Subway, etc. One positive aspect about the Monte Carlo is the location. It's very convenient to many other popular casinos. As other reviews stated, there is a CVS next door and a Walgreens across the street. All in all, my room was clean but probably won't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: Unkey
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel thru Priceline.com and named my price. It was $50.00 per night which was a very good rate. Cheaper than the hotel's promos (which were very good since they included extras). The hotel is attractive and has a very traditional look to it. Not a lot of glitter or glitz. The hotel is next to the City Center construction. There is also construction on the other side of the hotel (facing the main entrance). I called ahead and requested a quiet room, which was pretty quiet (I had ear plugs jus in case) and also close to the elevator. The room was clean. Nothing special (sort of like a Holiday Inn) but very comfortable. I stayed last time at Harrah's and this is on par. There's an iron, ironing board and room safe. No coffee maker. The bathroom was in marble and came with only 1 soap at the sink (I had to call for 1 for the tub/shower), shampoo, conditioner and lotion. For some reason they ran out of hand towels. But there were plenty of other size. The tv has basic cable only (not even Lifetime or A&E). A good feature was check-out on the tv. Since I had no extra charges and the room was pre-paid (oddly enough I did not have to give a credit card at check-in for additional charges) I used this and was able to stay in the room until I needed to leave. Since check-out is at 11:00 am it was a big plus. The casino is large and the rock music blares which I find annoying, especially when playing a thinking game, like 21 or video poker. So I did my gaming at other casinos. The hotel lobby is actually a hike to The Strip through the casino. I didn't use any of the hotel restaurants except for some fast food Chinese. There is a McDonald's, Subway, Sbarro's and other fast food facilities in the hotel. The buffet doesn't get high marks, so I went to the ones that do (Paris, Bellagio, Planet Hollywood) which are all about a 10-15 minute walk. Right next door is a 24 hour CVS and across the Strip is a 24 hr Walgreens. Also, across the strip at the Coca-Cola Bottle, is the Tix 4 Tonight 1/2 price booth. Use this one as it's indoors and there's a/c. I got a 1/2 price ticket for Folies Bergere at the Tropicana (about a 10-15 minute walk from the hotel). In fact, I walked the entire time I was in Las Vegas. The monorail is just too far away to use (and expensive). The Deuce (Strip bus) is always crowded and you wait forever for everyone to board. I took a shuttle for $6.00 from the airport. We only made to stops before (MGM and New York, New York). To the airport I chose a taxi which ran about $15.00 with tip. To tell the truth, I don't think I'll ever be back to Vegas. The payouts are lousy, the buffets have lost their appeal, the entertainment doesn't seem as plentiful. To come to Vegas just to walk through casino hotels and their malls isn't worth a trip. So I'm glad my stay here was good value and the location was pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Good resort for the value”
Reviews.Author: CFNOBIS
Reviews.Content: Just returned from two nights stay at Monte Carlo. The check in was fast and we were given a decent room with the AAA discount price of $69.95 a night. The room was typical for a basic room on the strip with a better than expected price. I selected this resort as I have stayed here once before and were looking for something within walking distance of the Luxor where we had show tickets for Believe. We were surprised that the casino was not as smoke filled as many others on the strip. In fact it smelled like they were spraying it with air freshener. The casino was easy to walk around and the fast food places were great for a snack including a Starbucks. We were surprised to see all of the penny slot machines they had. My mom really enjoyed playing them. We didn't eat at the hotel, so I can't comment on that. We had breakfast at the Planet Hollywood buffet, my favorite. We ate dinner at Gallagher's Steak house at New York New York one night. The best steak ever! We also ate at Tivoli at Caesers Palace and and Batista's Hole In The Wall across from Bally's. Both serve excellent meals. Overall our stay at the hotel was great for what we wanted. My only complaint was that there was a room service tray in the hall when we checked in and it was still there when we left. Inexcusable! I would highly recommend this resort for its location on the strip, pools and overall enjoyable atmosphere. Like I said the room was average but no one goes to Vegas to say in the room. Do they?

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs found on 10/2008!!”
Reviews.Author: Jessica67
Reviews.Content: Please do not ever stay at the Monte Carlo if you ever go to Las Vegas. My girlfriends and I just went this past weekend for a bachelorette party and found our mattresses were infested with bed bugs. One of the girls got it worse than the rest of us. Below is a link to see the pictures of the bed bugs on the mattresses. This is not some picture we found on the internet. I actually lied down on these mattresses, as did 7 other people in our party. We filed a formal complaint with the hotel and I also reported this to the Clark County Health Department as soon as I got into work this morning. We also contacted a lawyer to take legal action against the hotel to make sure the next time this happens they take it seriously. When we were checking out and asked for our rooms to be comped, the hotel manager said it was not in her power to authorize such a request and it was in the hands of their Risk Management Department and their lawyers. Well now it's in the hands of our lawyers. I hope that you will take this email very seriously and the next time you stay at a hotel check for bed bugs! Please pass this on to everyone you know. Because the hotel did not take our complaint seriously, now we have to get our houses fumigated to ensure the bed bugs or their eggs were not transferred to our houses in our luggage. The hotel is now offering to pay for the cost of the exterminator but it's too little too late to offer anything at this point. We will make them pay!

Reviews.Title: “Room Location the Key to a Good Visit”
Reviews.Author: Beachlovers68
Reviews.Content: Clearly from reading past reviews the location of the room you receive makes all the difference between a noisy, unpleasant experience and a good visit. We had read the posts and were forewarned. When we checked in we requested a room away from the construction (which is a challenge, there's eight towers going up all around the hotel). At first we were told there were none available, but after a bit of insistence, we were given a room (19323) away from the brunt of the construction. We didn't hear a sound, so we were relieved. As far as the room, it was basic at best - no fridge or mini-bar, but clean and quiet. How much are you really in your room in Vegas anyways? And the hotel location was great, we could walk to the Bellagio, Cesars, the MGM, etc., so that made the rather ordinary room worth it. Plus we got a great rate. It's unfortunate that they don't tell you that there's major construction going on around the hotel, but overall our stay was pleasant. Very friendly staff and decent food. We really had no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “An actual honest review. What a novel concept!”
Reviews.Author: JodinB
Reviews.Content: Alright, you're reading this, meaning you actually care enough about your vacation to do the smallest bit of research. Kudos. I stayed at the Monte Carlo from Sep. 29- Oct. 1st. It was amazing. Here's a run-down of myself and the person I went with: 21 year old males, there to have a good time for their first legal trip to Vegas. The Monte Carlo, though not intentionally, is PERFECT for that. Here are my reasons: 1) Affordability. I paid $60 a night for 2 beds in the lower-middle section of the strip. 2) Faux-luxury. We were very impressed with the decor and quality of the hotel itself. It might not impress a 40 year old who has been to most of Europe. But it certainly made us feel like we were staying someplace luxurious. And that's a great feeling. I want to address some of the most pressing issues that you've been reading about in some of these reviews: noise, quality, value, etc. First off, most of these reviews are really lame. Sorry, just being honest. But why would you complain about the temperature of a desert city, in a review for a hotel?? Of course it's hot in July. Go back to Des Moines, loser. Some of these don't even give an explanation of their bad reviews (read the one a few down that says its "run like detroit in the 70's" or something that also makes no sense). This hotel was great. Quick check-in. We asked for a room with a good view and got it without a problem. the pool was fantastic, everything was just great. Some people just have to knock down establishments to make themselves feel better. Weird. Room was good, nothing fancy, though better than most hotels I've stayed in. ONE THING: housekeeping never came. although that was our fault. My friend yelled some things I can't repeat here at them when they knocked on the door at 8 am. whoops. but still. Bathrooms were nice, umm, what else? You're really not in the room that much. You're in Vegas. If you're having a good vacation, that means you are drinking, and not gambling away your child's college tuition. To anyone who complained about the lack of flat screen tv's in the rooms, I hate you. You didnt go on a vacation to watch local news, which is pretty much all you're gonna get on a hotel tv anyway. Go outside fatty. The location: wonderful. close to everything worth seeing. Not a bad walk to The Mirage. Google maps made everything look MUCH more spread out. when you're there, you're probably plastered and you dont even realize you've walked a mile until you're in some hotel wayyy up the strip. I mean that in a fun way. One thing I should mention before I forget, is the noise issue. EVERYONE on here keeps talking about the city center thing. Yes, there is construction. No, you can't hear it. You're drunk anyway. seriously. I guarantee that you'll be drunk if you're in vegas at night. The people that wrote anything saying the noise is unbearable, are the kind of people that just don't want to enjoy anything. Complaining about noise in Las Vegas is like complaining about snow in January. In Canada. ( you know. where it snows. a lot.) Oh, I'm sorry, were you looking for a nice quiet vacation? Go to Palm Springs and have fun doing absolutely nothing. Stop wasting everyone's time by saying it'll ruin your trip. Because you're an idiot. Now, onto another thing that people said wasn't worth it: The Buffet. It owns. Seriously. Admittedly, I was drunk. However, most people in Las Vegas are drinking when they go to eat. It's just part of the strip. It's a big party. The buffet had a mongolian bbq that would cook whatever you fit in a big bowl. Really, that was the selling point for us. We ate mongolian bbq, tacos, sushi, catfish, salmon (maybe? hard to remember), chicken, and a bunch of other stuff. It's small. but everything there was delicious. Go to it. $20, cheaper than most, and worth every penny. We both loved it. When you lose all your money, there is a food court with a McDonald's in it. Dinner for under $5 is pretty sweet. Sooo....I'm getting tired of writing. Feel free to write to me if you have any questions, I'll answer them. The hotel was awesome. Bottom line, stay here if you have a good rate on it. Between the location and the quality of service overall, you won't reget it. You will have a blast, as long as you're not someone who has to complain all the time. In that case, just go kill yourself. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo - Great Price, Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: MavOhio
Reviews.Content: Sorry for the delay on my review. My husband and I stayed at MC for 6 days, 5 nights during the week of Fourth of July. We had a fabulous time. Check-in was a breeze...we had to only wait for 15 minutes for our room to be ready and the room was clean. We asked to be away from the contruction due to the reviews I read before leaving. That was not a problem and we did not hear anything from the contruction. The cleaning ladies on the other hand were something else...they felt the need to scream to each other at all hours of the day. The pool are was okay...the construction was really not a bother to us at the pool. Yeah, it is massive, but there was no dust to bother us. The dealers were wonderful to play with. The drinks came around regularly at the slots and tables. I would go back to the MC again (this is my second stay with this hotel). Sure, it is not as glamorous as the more upscale hotels, but I do not wish to pay double the price to just sleep somewhere.

Reviews.Title: “an average hotel”
Reviews.Author: moodycow
Reviews.Content: the good thing about this hotel is that it does not have a gimic. most of the other hotels in las vegas all have one. there was alot of road works and building works going on around the hotel which made it confusing. the location is fine as you can get around the strip by using the monorail from the mgm across the road . the rooms were average, but clean and tidy. there seemed to be not much on offer for breakfast and long queues at the buffet and cafe when we looked. there was a sports bar which was open for dinner one night but closed another night which i found strange.the staff were helpful enough and the valet parking was very good.

Reviews.Title: “I'll bet it will be the newest hotel to be imploded.”
Reviews.Author: pete_ryan_slo
Reviews.Content: Built in 1994, run like a Detroit Auto company in the 70's. I can't think of a reason to return. What wasn't bad was mediocre. The only plus, when it was time to leave, valet had the car ready really fast. The should have let it burn in January.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo - thumbs up!!”
Reviews.Author: MelissaPgh_Pa
Reviews.Content: After much research and consideration, we booked the MC for our first trip to Las Vegas. I was moderately concerned about the construction I read about in many of the reviews. We decided to go ahead and stay at the MC due to the great deal and location. The Monte Carlo main lobby is beautiful, the casino is low key, the buffet was better than others we tried. We loved the food court for the convenience. Our king room was quite large and clean. The bathroom was also surprisingly large. Our room did face the massive construction zone, but on the 30th floor, we only heard minimal noise, in fact, we found it very interesting to watch the construction in progress of such a large scale project. After visiting the other "upscale" casinos on the Strip, we actually found the MC much more to our liking - nice, clean and low key. Every single employee we encountered was polite and helpful, answering our questions with a smile! We did not drive or rent a car, and due to the construction, I would not recommend it, as it appears it would be problematic at best. The only slightly negative things I would say are there is no exhaust fan in the bathroom, and the elevators are hot and stuffy. Otherwise, we would definitely recommend the MC, and we will probably book here again.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: BeijingAussieinchina
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while my husband attended a business convention. Compared to some of the other hotels/resorts, the Monte Carlo is quite basic. It is an enormous hotel but doesn't have many in-room facilities, including no fridge and no tea or coffee making facilities. During the time that we stayed there a significant number of construction projects were happening along the strip, and in particulare next door to the Monte Carlo. Our room was very noisy the whole time as the construction was happening 24 hours per day, and included reversing beepers on trucks in the early hours of the morning. There was no consideration for hotel guests. For a cheaper option in Las Vegas, this hotel may be OK but it certainly doesn't have many facilities compared with some of the other hotels and resorts on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Plain Hotel for the Strip, but good value”
Reviews.Author: shaggyman
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo looks great on the outside, but the rooms are pretty plain--especially for the Strip. The bathroom in the room was larger than expected, but everything else about the room wasn't very exciting. It wasn't bad, but nothing to get excited about. The food court there was nice if you are looking for "normal" fast food and not wanting to spend a ton of money on expensive restaurants. The location is pretty good being on the south side of the strip near NY, NY, Excalibur and the rest. If you are looking for a no frills, decent hotel on the Strip, Monte Carlo might be it!

Reviews.Title: “Bed 10, Hotel 1”
Reviews.Author: minniemoomoo
Reviews.Content: We always try to stay at a different hotel each time we go to Vegas. Why not? There's so many choices. This time we decided to stay at the Monte Carlo.It had been closed from the fire and now reopened, we got a great deal, so why not? We checked in and asked if there were any upgrades and were told they were booked. But in the same breath, he announced that he was giving us a good room with a view. We went up to the room only to find on the non smoking floor, a room saturated with cigarette smell. Housekeeping should have informed the front desk. Anyway, back downstairs to the front desk. Given another room. When we arrived at the door, the electronic key wouldn't work. Back down to the front desk. By this time, I was already unhappy. The desk reissued the keys and we finally entered our room,not a great view, but no cigarette smell. Tired, we decided to order room service. No room service menu. The front desk was adamant that a menu had to be in the room. There was none, finally a menu arrived. We had no numbers on the phone, just holes where the plate should have been, so we didn't even know what number to call for room service, we had to call the front desk and ask for the number to room service. The toilet lid wouldn't stay up for the hubby, therefore he had to stand to the side, hold up the lid. The door on the TV stand wouldn't stay open, so we had to prop it open with a towel. The tub took forever to drain, and their was mold growing in the shower. Mold in the desert, that's a new one to me. The restaurants in the hotel was another hot topic. It took forever to be waited on in the cafe. On one occasion, we actually waited 15 minutes for someone to take our order, we finally just got up to leave and the desk insisted we pay for our coffee and tea, even though we explained that we had waited 15 minutes for someone to take our order, and we were leaving upset. Unbelievablely, they still insisted on payment. When no ticket could be located for the drink order, they finally said, forget it. We already had! There is no signs for the high roller line. After standing in a line for 10 minutes waiting to be seated, we were told that we were in the wrong line, when I asked how was I to know that, she explained there was no sign, I should have asked. I said we had been there on 2 other occasions, and never given this information. She said, "oh well". Customer service is not their strong suit, matter of fact, it is no where to be found on this property. The bed was the only thing great in this hotel. We had been given a room that had newer bedding, and it was great. Thank goodness for a good night's sleep, otherwise, we wouldn't have made it. Monte Carlo is defintely off our list of do overs.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo - One of my favorite casinos”
Reviews.Author: Terri_1230
Reviews.Content: I go to Vegas 2-3 times per year and have always enjoyed my stays at the Monte Carlo. I have stayed at several different casinos on the strip, but always find myself back at the Monte Carlo. I have had a couple different hosts through the years - but they all take very good care of me whenever I am there - all I have to do is call or e-mail my schedule and everything is taken care of from the minute I arrive at the airport until the day I leave! I also appreciate that even though I am only there 2-3 times a year, many of the bartenders, cocktail waitresses and restaurant servers remember me, some by name. It's nice to have that sort of personal connection!! I highly recommend the Monte Carlo.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TikiTorcher
Reviews.Content: Maybe I'm a little more laid back than some of the other reviewers but I loved this place. We booked a four night stay on the Monte Carlo website and got a great deal. All employees we spoke with were friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. I had read alot about the construction and was a little apprehensive about staying there. My honey was going to a convention so I had planned to spend alot of time at the hotel enjoying the pool, guest room, spa & gym. When we booked we had asked for a King bed, smoking, hopefully not facing construction. As we were late arrivals the first night was spent in a two Queen, non-smoking looking at construction. We were promptly moved the next day to the perfect room. I had a view of the NewYork hotel, the Luxor pyramid behind that, and the gold windows of the Mandalay Bay as well as all the lights of suburban Las Vegas and the mountians beyond. This view at night was fantastic! I actually liked the fact that the pool wasn't all sun all day; it's Vegas, I'm sure we'll appreciate some shade here & there. Melanoma and heatstroke are not part of my vacation plans! I was able to find sun or shade at any time at the pool and the music (I thought) was just loud enough. It could get a little crowded but not too bad. The Spa was great. Well worth the 3-day spa/gym pass which gets you acess to the fitness center, steam room, sauna and locker room facilities. Clean, well stocked and tended to with great equipment. The gym is a little small but almost no one in there any time I went. The bufett was sort of subpar for $20 per person, but it's a bufett, what are you expecting!?!? All in all this was a great stay and I throughly enjoyed myself. I would book here again in a heartbeat. Money well spent!

Reviews.Title: “Construction Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: nicemann
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Monte Carlo before that is what made me go back to the hotel. I had no idea about all the construction that is currently being done around the hotel. First issue they did not have a parking garage. You have to either Valet Park your car, use a tiny surface parking lot (if you can find a space), or park at the MGM Grand and get shuttled back to the Monte Carlo. Just this by itself was a major nightmare. I stayed for a total of two nights. Both of the nights I could not get much sleep due to the sounds of the 24 hour construction going on behind the hotel. I had a "pool view" room and was told this was the loudest part of the hotel. Even though I was on the eighth floor I could still hear the metal pounding and trucks and sirens going off. I could not change my room because they were totally booked. Trying to get in and out of the casino was also a head ache. Roads were blocked off. Semis and dump trucks were always coming and going. I had to take different ways in and out of the entrances depending on the current events. The staff was very nice. I like the location and the casino. I will be back but not till at least January of 2010 when the construction is complete. Till then I will stay at another hotel on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of a Construction Zone.”
Reviews.Author: Spa8110
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, but right now in the middle of a construction Zone. I mean High rise condo's are being built all around the pool area and the side zones. Your views are horrible, and if you like to swim, forget it. They are playing music so loud, I had to wear my noise reductions just to read a magazine. They have a lazy river, but still charge you $12.00 for an innertube. The pool was crowded, even on a Thursday. The rooms are small, and not unlike a Holiday Inn, No real luxury here, and if you are low in the building or not near an elevator, you either have a noisy night, a bad view, or litterly a hike to get to your room. The elevators are set up ok, but whoever designed the building, wasn't thinking about the customers. Not a lot of parking during construction, so valet is pretty much your only choice. The restaurants are overpriced, and the buffet ought to be shutdown. It was the worst meal I have ever had in Vegas. I'm not really sure what the theme of the hotel has to do with your overall experience, it sure didn't feel like we were staying in Monte Carlo, more like Grand Rapids, Michigan. The desk clerk was rude to one of our party at Checkout, so they comped us a lunch, which was overcooked. The good, the location on the strip, and a low key and quiet poker room (nearly the only place to actually relax in the hotel, unless you pay for the overpriced spa treatments). I'm still mad at my wife for picking this loser. Beware if you pick this hotel to save money. Better off staying off the strip and commuting.

Reviews.Title: “Shame about the pool area”
Reviews.Author: britsbest
Reviews.Content: I loved the hotel but wouldn't stay there again due to the location of the pool area. It was our intention to stay by the pool all day and sleep off the previous nights excesses, however there is a major problem- in fact 2 major problems. 1) The pool is surrounded bt 30 odd storey buildings so the sun failed to shine at all (in September) on 50% of the area and for the remainder from 1115 till 1600 was the only sun worshipping time!!! 2) The area is surrounded on 3 sides by the construction of the new city centre development. The noise is constant (didn't invade our room tho). To combat this the music from the PA system is exceptionally loud and makes it impossible to doze! Even then occasionally the noise from the construction drowns out the music !!! However.......the hotel management are 1st class and arranged for me to use the pool at the MGM across the road but this was such a long walk that we put up with the inconveniances at the MC. The lazy river and wave pool make for great cool off areas as it was 100+. The rooms are typical hotel tooms although there was no power shower. We had to call out maintenance on 2 occasions, one the hair dryer "blew" and second the drain in the sink blocked and both were deallt with exceptionally quickly. The bed was very confortable.....too soft for some I'd guess but the pillows were not to our liking. Doubtless they would have changed them but we didn't want to cause a fuss. In sumary the hotel is fine but as there are many to choose from I'd not stay there again. The pool area at the Luxor is better.

Reviews.Title: “Seriously Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: ericb67
Reviews.Content: When I was planning a business trip to Las Vegas I was quite surprised to find a prominant hotel on the Strip for less than $100 a night, given the fact that most are close to twice that much. I paid $89.95 per night, which I thought was very reasonable at the time. I stayed at the Monte Carlo many years ago and it was a very nice place, back then. I don't think the place has been updated since then. It was very disappointing. There were a lot of repairs needed, including one of the elevators not working. They didn't have the King Bed room that I had reserved unless I wanted to wait until 6-7pm to check in. I took the room with two beds they had ready (it was after the 3.00 check in time) and the beds were awful. They used to have an excellent French restaurant that is "closed for renovations". They have a couple of other nice places to eat but the main draw seemed to be the mall style food court. If you want to connect your laptop to the internet in your room, it costs $14 per day. The business center charges $8 for 15 minutes of computer use plus $2 per page to print. A large bottle of water is $4 in the gift shop. In the end, the only thing I can say that is positive is that it was comparatively cheap. The conference I attended was at the Paris hotel, and my room at the Monte Carlo was half the price of rooms at the Paris. If you know in advance that the rooms are a step above Motel 6 but a step below a Holiday Inn, you may not be as disappointed as I was. One other good thing... right next door is a CVS pharmacy. A big bottle of water there is a lot less than it is in the Monte Carlo!

Reviews.Title: “Very surprised. Loved it”
Reviews.Author: lovely622
Reviews.Content: We have not been to Vegas in a couple years. This was like a mini 2nd honeymoon for hubby and myself. Of course, I did my research in where to stay. My choices were: Planet Hollywood, Luxor, New York New York, and Monte Carlo. I finally chose Monte Carlo because of the price and location. I read some of the reviews and became worried because of the bad reviews it had received. Checkin was fast and easy. We probably waited for 5 minutes which isnt bad. The staff was friendly and helpful. We didnt use the pool but it looked like a pretty good size and I liked the lazy river. Probably next time we will use it especially with my 3 year old son. The casino was not bad at all. It was pretty quiet compared to PH and Paris which I did not mind at all. Cocktail waitresses were coming by every so often compared to PH where we waited for 30 minutes for one to come by. We were on the 6th floor and the view was the roof facing the strip. We had no problem with noise from the construction. My only complaint is with the toilet. Every time we flushed the toilet, it seemed like it was going to suck us up as well. It was very strong. The room was pretty clean. We didnt eat at the MC but we did order Starbucks. The food court had many choices such as subway, mcdonalds, rubios, chinese wok, starbucks, etc. Next time, I would certainly eat there. The location of the hotel was great.. CVS is right outside the door. Walgreens is across the street. I think the hotel is in the middle of everything. Ceasars is 10-15 minute walk. Luxor is only 10 minutes away walking. PH and Paris and MGM Grand is a 5 minute walk. New York New York is close was well. LOved it that CVS and Walgreens was so close. We bought water, soda, snacks, and souvenirs from here which saved us some money. We would definetly stay here again. We were very happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Room Okay, Staff very unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: LanaG
Reviews.Content: The check in was okay. Room was average, no perks. The windows are very dirty which makes taking pictures from your room awful and splotchy. The construction was all around us, but we were on the 24th floor so it didn't wake us up or anything. My major complaint was the unfriendliness of the staff and dealers. NO HUMOR WHATSOEVER. We did have two dealers at the Texas Hold em table that were nice... Dallas and Joe. Other than that, they had the humor of a box of rocks. We live in Houston and could not get a flight out due to Hurricane Ike. The Hotel was less than accomodating for a late check out, or a good rate for the extra nights. We will stay elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: tcapBraintree
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the Monte Carlo we were through check in in a matter of minutes. We went to our room on the 17th floor and it wasn't made up as a matter of fact, it was so disgusting that we didn't even go in the door. We went back to reception and the night manager gave us another room, a premium on the 27 floor with a view of the strip,instead of the standard deluxe, and a $50 hotel credit.
