The hotel is not a hopping place like so many of the center strip hotels but, it was clean, a good location, the pool area was great, no construction noise at all while we were there and the buffet breakfast was pretty good. We spent every afternoon and night exploring and gambling at other hotels. When we returned to the Monte Carlo at night, we didn't have much fun in this hotel, it was very quiet and the machines and tables were nothing special. The only 2 deck blackjack was in the high limit section and that was ok except on Friday the table limits were bumped to all 100's and 1 50 so to play $25 hands, you had to play single deck or the 6 deck shoe. There were no kids at the pool and the water temp was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo, Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: SCoombe
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews of the Monte Carlo on Trip Advisor prior to our visit and were a little anxious. However on arriving at the hotel our room was on the 8th floor - overlooking the pool but facing a building site. Was ok for first night, but then the workers started at 8am - noise was just enough to be annoying for our week's stay. We asked at reception to be moved which was done without any problems to a new room on 22nd floor and offered a free breakfast for our inconvenience. New room was on the other side of the hotel, but facing a much smaller building site slightly further away - plus side - slightly better views too. Should be known that Las Vegas is currently undergoing major construction in all areas, if noise is a problem Vegas is not the place to be!!! Loved hotel - staff & information desk & concierge helpful. Casino & staff were great fun too - if you're new to Craps & Poker - go to the free lessons. Also sign up for MGM Players Club - a free membership card - we got $20 FREE DOLLARS $$s to use in their casino - great ! Vegas was surprisingly easy to get around - buy a 24 hour Duece bus ticket as its really good value. Bus stops right outside Monte Carlo.

Reviews.Title: “flamingo way better”
Reviews.Author: bellaitalia910
Reviews.Content: This was a beautiful hotel but not a good place to stay. When we first arrived our room was not ready. So they gave us a food and beverage credit of $20 so we went and had a beer. Later we found out when we checked out that it did not include alcohol. How does a food and beverage credit not include alcohol? Ur in Vegas...duh...anyways then the pool has no sun. You have to keep moving around to stay in the sun. There are not enough chairs in the sun and the pools are never in the sun. The pools were freezing. The location is ok just alot of construction so its hard to cross the street. The steak house call Brand in the hotel is GREAT! we loved it....out of all the hotels we still love the flamingo...not the fanciest but location, service, and the pool are the best.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at Monte Carlo!”
Reviews.Author: aakansascity
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at the Monte Carlo in Las Vegas from Sept 6 - 9. I was a little hesitant to book a room after some of the reviews I had read but the price was so great we decided to give it a try. I was pleasantly surprised from the moment we arrived. Check-in was unbelievably fast at noon on a Saturday and they were very friendly as well. I requested a room on an upper floor away from the construction and that is exactly what we got. The room was really nice, clean and spacious. The bathroom was nice as well. My only complaint is that the walls are thin and you can hear the ridiculously loud toilet and anything else going on in the bathroom. That was a very minor complaint though. Everything else was great. The casino was spacious and not smoky, which we enjoyed. They even had $5 tables on the weekends. We watched football at the brewery and ate at Diablo's Sunday evening. Both were really good with good food and good service. We went to the pool Monday afternoon. There is a small pool that is mostly in the shade, a lazy river and wave pool that have plenty of sun. It wasn't too crowded and we did not hear any of the construction going on at the City Center. We really enjoyed the relaxing atmosphere. They do play music which is really nice. We had a great time in Vegas and certainly enjoyed our stay. We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “this is my last visit to Monte Carlo do to promotion problems”
Reviews.Author: dmartoakville_Canada
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Monte Carlo a few times and had a good host. THis last trip over Labour Day was different. On all previouse trips I have been offered $300.00 in free play but this summer they were not offering free play but instead 3X play. I had a few discussions with my host via e-mail and advised her there sister property were offering me not only a comp suite but free play and 2x play. She told me there was nothing she could do because that was managements decision. However she said I would make more in free play from the 3x play. When we arrived I checked with the players advantage to see how to initiate the 3X play and they said just come and see them when ever I wanted to use it. We were there for three days and the second day I used what I had earned to that point and said I would take the rest at the end of the trip. The night before we were to leave I went to players advantage to get the last of my 3x play and was told it no longer was available as it had stopped at midnight the night before (aug.31). I asked to see the manager as my host was on vacaton, but the manager was also on vacation so another host told me there was nothing he could do. He had the copies of the e-mails in their computer which clearly showed I was to get the 3x play and it did not show any cut off date. He said he did not even know about the cut off date but it would have been set up in the computer so there was no way to fix it. Along with the construction around the pool, the fact no club floor has been open since the fire and the decline of the food in the pub this 3x play has become the icing on the cake and we will not go back there. I liked the casino and the hosts and staff but it is a matter of principal. We ususaly spend 3 days at MC and 3 at Palazzo but have decided to stick with the Palazzo. Both have compd out rooms but the Palazzo is a better location do to construction at MC plus it is a much nicer hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Losing Proposition!!!”
Reviews.Author: vacouple222
Reviews.Content: My last stay at the Monte Carlo was the 3rd time I visited their casino this year. Let me say that both of my previous stays at the Monte Carlo was exceptional, but this time my experience was quite different. At the end of my previous stay I was approached by one of the Casino Hosts and told that they would like to extend 2-3 nights complementary based on my level of gaming, this offer was good for my next visit to their Resort and Casino. At the end of August we received a promotional offer from the Monte Carlo by e-mail and decided to take them up on the offer and went ahead and booked the trip. The second day during our trip we decided to go and talk to the Casino Host that offered to comp us 2-3 nights for our next visit and was pleased that she not only remembered me by face but also had remembered the offer she had extended, when I told her that I would like to take her up on the offer she pulled up my information on her computer and advised me that she could not honor her offer since we were visiting under a promotion. This seemed kind of strange to me since she specifically stated on my prior trip that her “offer” was based on the level of gaming we had played during that visit. I express that I was disappointed as I was hoping that any comps for the current visit could be used towards taking my wife to some of their dinning establishments. She looked into the level of gaming that we had already played for the 2 days prior to talking with her and she proceeded to comped us 2 nights stay off our bill based on those 2 days. She asked if I planned to maintain the current level of play for the remainder of our trip, I let her know that we have a set daily amount which we spend collectively so the level of gaming would stay very consistent, she replied that any other incidentals such as dinning etc… would certainly be covered by the Casino and to please see her again before we checkout in order to have those charges taken off our bill, of course this “comp” would be in relation to our level of gaming. My wife and I enjoyed the rest of our vacation; im big fan of the Blackjack tables but im no high roller in any sense of the word, im not going to get to far into dropping numbers, amounts, wins losses etc…etc… but I will say that on average I spend about 5 hours per day on Blackjack and my average bet is about $60.00 (any mid range gambler knows how many hands of Blackjack you can go thorough in an hour with a fast dealer). Anyhow, prior to check out I stopped back by the Casino Hosts office and to see what they could do with what was left on my tab and what future comps may have compiled for future visits since I was unable to take advantage of her original offer. She pulled up my information advised me that I had spend $224.00 on miscellaneous incidentals, she then went back to examining my gaming activity, to my surprise she advised me that she had “OVER COMPED ME” when she had taken off 2 nights from my bill earlier on the trip. I know how the comps work and the amount of the 2 nights she comped was less then 10% of what I had spent in the Casino at that point in the vacation, coupled with the fact that $224.00 would be small fraction of comp value even for just one day of gaming between my wife and me. I asked her why she had told me to came back to receive the rest of my “comp value” prior to check out, she replied that it was her oversight but offered no remedy. Anyone that has visited Las Vegas any number of times will recognize that the Monte Carlo took advantage of my loyalty to their establishment. They are losing a very loyal customer over $224.00, on Blackjack I would lose $224.00 in 4 losing hands within a matter of minutes. Its not the amount of money spend –vs- what should have been comped, it’s a matter of principles, its obvious that the Monte Carlo does not value me as a customer. Based on this experience I would not recommend anyone to this establishment that plans to spend any time in their Casino.

Reviews.Title: “less than average stay”
Reviews.Author: trip46
Reviews.Content: The lobby is beautiful! The rooms not so much.... kinda dirty, really scratchy sheets, and a lumpy mattress with a very thin pad. Had to corral housekeeping, apparently since we did not notify them that we WANTED our room done. they skipped us ( that is the actual story I got from housekeeping) I am not a princess but we needed towels! Also you can hear every pipe squeak when someone in a room near yours runs the water. Bring foamies or other earplugs!! We ate at the buffet, it was alright. Overall, I was unimpressed. Will try another place next time I return to Las Vegas. ( My adult daughters said the pool was very nice, but very cold)

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: dpnewman
Reviews.Content: We got a flyer in the mail for 2 free nights at the Monte Carlo. We had never stayed there before and thought we would give it try. After I booked it I read several reviews and was a little nervous. The nerves were all for nothing. The hotel itself was great! Very nice room and no problems at all. We were a little diapointed in the Casino. They had mosly older games. But overall I would recommed this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A hotwire price for a great first night in Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: mtsublueraider
Reviews.Content: It was my first night in Vegas and it will hopefully not be my last. My brother and I were taking our first trip across the country and stayed a night in Vegas. I know it wasn't REALLY seeing Vegas if you just stay for a night, but this is just the review of the hotel...right? Parking is a nightmare in Vegas if you don't know what your'e doing. The Monte Carlo has a parking lot for guests to check-in. But, as you'll soon find out... that lot is currently FULL of cars who don't intend on moving anytime soon. Don't forget, vallet parking is free and recomended. We asked for the best view of the strip they could give us. We can't complain because we booked on hotwire, but the nice lady said we could have a good view of the strip but it was a smoking room. She did offer to change us if we wanted to. yes, the room smelled like smoke, but we were just there for one night so we dealt with it. VERY NICE! Any resort on the strip is a good choice. Some people complain about the nearby construction but we never found that to be a problem. We did find that the cafes stopped serving foot a tad early in the Monte Carlo. We had to settle for pizza when we really wanted steak. As far as the room goes. The beds were "alright" and the rooms really weren't laid out any different than a standard hotel room. However, the bathrooms were beautiful and the shower pressure was amazing. Great choice for cheap!

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as some reviews suggest”
Reviews.Author: mhay5109
Reviews.Content: This Hotel has been suffering because of the building work going on beside it. We have just returned after 2 weeks there and I can honestly say that the building works do not cause any problems. The pool area is now smaller but you are still able to get a bed at any time. The Hotel itself is quite quiet and I think this is because it does not have a defined 'theme' The rooms are very clean and the beds are very comfortable. As always, we have stayed there before, the Staff are lovely and genuinely very pleasant and helpful. All requests that I asked for prior to arrival were met, and this was most impressive. U.K. hotels take note!!! All in all a very pleasant stay although the slots could have been looser

Reviews.Title: “Liked the Monte Carlo very much”
Reviews.Author: plumbingGibsonia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo Aug 25-29 and booked 3 rooms. I was a little worried about all the bad reviews but I must say that the rooms were very nice. We were on the 4th floor facing the construction. I heard a little noice but not much. The rooms were a little outdated but still nice. Our maid service was excellent. Had music playing when we entered our room. The elevators were close to the pool and food court. We stayed there because of the lazy river and wave pool. It was nice We went to the pool around 3:00 and was able to get 3 chairs. The casino was nice and not overly huge. The location was good. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: girlyname
Reviews.Content: What a great honeymoon! Our only snafu was we booked a suite online, and the desk told us we really only booked a regular room. Once I showed him our email saying otherwise, he certainly apologized over and over, and upgraded us to the largest suite for a week and a half stay for $40 more per night!! Our only complaint, really, was the housekeeping. They did come every day, however, they didn't do the same things every day. They would put different shampoo's different days, they would put different numbers of towels each day, etc. Also, be careful stepping out of the shower if you have the glassed in showers.... they aren't sealed, and it dumps water ALL over the marble floor! Accident waiting to happen if you aren't careful. Overall, we were VERY pleased, and are looking forward to going back to Vegas... we'll certainly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal with Low Expectations”
Reviews.Author: CarnerosGrape
Reviews.Content: We recently had our bachelor/bachelorette party in Las Vegas. So there were 20 of us staying at the MC. We picked Monte Carlo for it's pool, location and price. It was all "okay". I am a Marriott employee, so I have stayed in some amazing hotels. This is not one of them. However, it is clean. Most of the rooms have views of construction. The pool's are nice and busy at all hours of the day. There is a new building being built right next to the MC. It is a huge eyesore. In the rooms, there is no ventilation in the bathrooms and the drains seem a bit clogged. The lack of fitted sheets bugged me. The last thing I want to do is wake up touching that nasty mattress. I will never return to MC.

Reviews.Title: “Skip this! Go to Caesars Qua!”
Reviews.Author: carzoli
Reviews.Content: Wow. The day before I went to this spa I went to the Qua Spa at Caesars...which made this spa doubly disappointing! Everything at the Qua Spa was top-notch. The Spa at Monte Carlo had tattered robes...and every room in the place was FREEZING. That's just absurd for a spa. The staff seemed annoyed that you were there. I had scheduled a deep-tissue massage - probably a mistake because I had never had one before. When I asked my therapist to back off on the pressure, he did, but when I also informed him that I had a neck injury from a car accident, I don't feel like he took that information into consideration when he manipulated my neck area. I'm sure that the therapists are not at fault and that the spa's treat them like chattel...so I would suggest selecting a place with a GREAT facility, ignore the ignorant attitude of the front desk staff, and SPEAK UP when it comes to your treatment. I would not recommend this spa to anyone unless you like to freeze.

Reviews.Title: “the breakfast buffet is a must!”
Reviews.Author: vegasmvp
Reviews.Content: i have stayed here 3 times and its great. best organized clean casion in vegas. you have to go for breakfast at the buffet, its the best in vegas and only 12 bucks.

Reviews.Title: “if you like holidaying on a construction site then this is the place for you !!!”
Reviews.Author: ace19
Reviews.Content: After many months of planning and forethought we decided on booking our five night stay at the Monte Carlo. We had previously stayed at the Luxor in 2005 but decided on a more up to date and modern hotel. First impressions were good , the lobby was beautiful the rooms were nice and the staff seemed very polite and curtious, but then we took a look around the pool area, what a shock, it was a construction site with 180 degree views of tall unfinished tower blocks and cranes everywhere, with building work going on 24hrs a day ! The sunlight was also obscured and there was very little pool space area (ie. places to lie) If you have a room without a strip view all you will have will have is a very unpleasant view, not to mention the noise. We complained to the manager on the desk but all he could offer was a refund of the deposit, which we accepted and booked ourselves back into the Luxor which has a fantastic pool area with much space and big pools.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo is just average”
Reviews.Author: midlandtraveler1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are from Midland, Texas and we wanted a nice 48hour Vegas Vacation. August 21-23 We had never stayed at the Monte Carlo before so I was anxious about how it would be. Check in was okay they wanted to give me a handi-cap room but I decided to wait because we really wanted a king. Around 5pm they finally had my room ready. The room was okay. Very outdated but clean. The walls are very very thin if you know what I mean. For the same price I could have stayed at the Luxor Hotel that has been updated. I have stayed at the Luxor Hotel before the remodel and loved it but I thought that I would try something new. The pool was nice but really crowded with lots of kids. I think that the Hotel will be better once it gets updated it is just not where I would stay again until it does.

Reviews.Title: “What happend to the parking?”
Reviews.Author: fosterlbue
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the 19th floor Aug 17 though 20th. First thing that didn't work for me is no on-site parking. You have to park by New York New York hotel and walk across the side street which can be very busy during the day due to construction vehicles. Woken up early (4:30am) one morning due to construction noise to City Center. Do not drive down Frank Sinatra drive as the roads are all torn up and the sign holders at each intersection have been standing in the sun too long as they have no idea what's going on. I found it interesting that the pool area no longer has sun at around 4:00pm as one of the new City Center's buildings blocks it... I'm beginning to think that Monte Carlo is now the stepchild in the MGM Mirage collection. Given all of this the hotel is still in pretty good shape. The room was clean and maid service was prompt. This hotel is still the best laid out hotel because as you get off the elevator, you turn one way to the pool/food court, another way to the casino and the way to the front desk/taxi/valet. No long walks to get to one or the other areas. I've stayed here many times over the years, but I may start looking around at other properties due to some of the shortcomings.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, wouldnt mind staying there again”
Reviews.Author: carlass
Reviews.Content: i was skeptical about staying at this hotel before arriving because many reviews bad mouthed it; saying it was a bad hotel and saying so many bad things about it. when i arrived, we had to park in a horrible tiny parking lot (parking structure coming in 2009), maybe big enough for 500 cars or less; not a good sign! once i entered the hotel, it looked really nice; not the nicest, but nice, nonetheless. but i was still worried about how bad the rooms would be, again, i let the reviews get to me! the room was nice, well kept, and clean. the room and restroom were really nice in comparison to other hotels ive stayed at (i.e., sahara, stardust, and flamingo). the toilet was pretty loud, but bearable. the walls were a little thin, but not too bad (unfortunately we got a free audio show of our neighbors at 4am- thank God there were no children in our hotel; definitely not pg 13). but we couldnt hear any construction AT ALL, and we were facing the construction. if you want an above-average hotel for about average price, this hotel is definitely for you! it was nicer than the flamingo, which was more expensive. its not a crappy hotel, but it is definitely not the wynn, bellagio, or caesars palace; its probably not even in the same league as the treasure island or paris but it is still a lot nicer than other hotels; its probably right in the middle. i would stay there again, no doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad Hotel”
Reviews.Author: delipa
Reviews.Content: I must say, like a lot of other travellers, I was concerned that I had made a BIG mistake after reading some of the reviews here ... I worried all for nothing. We stayed at the Monte Carlo from Aug 2-5th. We had two rooms on the 10th floor facing the pool .... and although the sight of the new construction was not as pretty as the mountains, we didn't really hear any noise. We arrived around noon and were given rooms right away... the counter staff & concierge were all very helpful & friendly during our entire stay. The cafe was very nice - good food at affordable prices. The casino was not as busy as most of the other hotels, but it sure was nice to come back to after being out and about. Treasure Island and NYNY, especially, were so crowded you could barely get through all the people. A live band would have been nice, but the music pumping through at night keep us tapping our toes while gambling away ..... it was fun!! I would recommend the Monte Carlo to anyone wanting a nice place to stay without having to dish out a lot of money and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: bopqueen
Reviews.Content: We booked a deal with the Monte Carlo for our stay and then I read reviews. To be honest, I was a little concerned that I would have a bad time. However, my husband and I had a great stay at the Monte Carlo! The Monte Carlo has a great location, right next to New York New York. It is next to the big City Scape project, but that will only make its location even more valuable. The service we had at the front desk was great. The lady who checked us in gave us a room away from the construction (as we requested). The rooms are nice. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was large. The hotel itself is smaller than other Vegas resorts, but that is something my husband and I liked. We have been lost in Caesars and MGM before, so we liked being able to navigate easily. There is a small food court with different types of food that we used quite a bit for some breakfast. The casino is small, but we played table games (craps and Pai Gow) for $5, which is unheard of on the strip. The pool area was nice. Kind of small and crowded, but it does have a lazy river, wave pool, and big pool. I would recommend the Monte Carlo to people who are going to Vegas for Vegas, not the room. If you want to stay on the strip without have to pay $100s of dollars, the Monte Carlo is a good hotel. If you want a fancy hotel, stay at the Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay at the MC again”
Reviews.Author: texastlj
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Monte Carlo from 07/29 - 08/01 to celebrate his birthday. Check in was quick and friendly. I told the woman who checked us in that I was concerned due to some of the reviews I'd seen on Trip Advisor but that I was pleasantly surprised. She said she couldn't offer a free upgrade but could have a refrigerator sent to our room. By the time we got up to our room the fridge was there as was a woman doing what appeared to be a check of the room. Everywhere we went the people were friendly. Most people went out of their way to be helpful. Our room was average. No complaints with housekeeping. We weren't bothered by the noise of the construction next door. I was somewhat disappointed with the view - our room overlooked the roof of the casino. It didn't matter much because we weren't in our room much. We were going to eat at Diablos one night but the music was very loud and I had a headache so we left. The breakfast buffet was very good. Check-out was very fast. I would stay at the Monte Carlo again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay for Value & Location ....”
Reviews.Author: chaosbp
Reviews.Content: 4Night - 5Day Las Vegas Extravaganza! Stayed Monday thru Friday. Check in was quick, maybe 10 minutes. Lobby, pool & exterior was beautiful. Rooms were clean and maintained, not immaculate, but very much what you'd expect for a 12 year old hotel. Windows could use a washing. Could hear plumbing from others rooms occasionally. Could hear the construction next door, but never loud enough to impair my sleep. Great value and location to all other hotels/casinos around. Nice having CVS right next store for drinks, snacks & supplies. Casino was nice, no luck with the slots, but Poker room was fun and a friendly environment. Buffet food was ok, didn't break the bank. Brew Pub food was good, nice "bar" atmosphere. Pool was nice early, crowded with families and kids as mid afternoon came. Overall a good place to stay if your on a budget or dont care about being pampered and over the top ritz. No complaints about anything. Would happily stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: MDaniel73
Reviews.Content: This was our second time at the Monte Carlo and this time was a huge let down. They are building a MASSIVE City Center right next to the Monte Carlo so there is construction noise abound. We booked our room a month out and where placed in the 'parking lot view room' with all the dump trucks even though a nicer room was requested. We were nicely moved the next afternoon when I requested, but even moving from the back to the strip side, and from the 16 to the 21st floor the noise could be heard, starting at 4:30 a.m. to boot. And let me just say that the class of persons are not the same as they used to be. Due to the cheaper costs the more rift raft is allowed in. And the amount of teens and young kids is ridiculous. Well the other thing that was bad is the buffet and the cost. It is now no better than a Luby's or Golden Corral. The cost has increased to $12pp for breakfast (which is the only meal I would recommend eating there), $17pp for lunch, and a obsured $20 pp for dinner. The food is not good. The only meal that was any good was the breakfast and that is because we got our omelets made fresh. The dinner was pathetic. The food was cold, or dried out from sitting there to long, and the staff are not very friendly at all. Heavens forbid you expect them to explain how the system works. We knew, but there were a lot of foreigners that had no clue how or what to do and the staff could care less. Very rude women in the Buffet area. And back to the food, they even used instant mashed potatoes that were not seasoned in the least. So disgusting. We use to LOVE this hotel and all the ammenities, but we will not be returning there as guests again. And by the way, their hotel view of the strip is almost completely blocked by the new buildings going up. And for now there is no parking garage, you have to share a parking lot that holds probably 300 cars at the most with New York , New York customers and staff from the hotels and the other 800 hotel guests. We luckily found a spot but then you have to walk far now and in the heat, no cover anywhere and if the lot is full which it is 100% of the time you then have to park at NY, NY parking garage and walk all the way over. Talk about a pain and turnoff. Not for the money they are still charging for a room. Not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty room and thin walls but overall a decent place for the money”
Reviews.Author: saraalison
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a Friday - Monday stay and booked through Allegiant because they had a BOGO deal on airfare if you also book the hotel through their website. I had heard good things in the past about MC so I decided to stay there. Check in was very fast and easy. The lobby and casino areas are very clean and not smoky at all. However, our room was clearly not vacuumed, there was debris on the desk, one of the bed ruffles was halfway torn off, the windows were filthy and there were sticky pop can rings on the night stand. Oh and the tub drain was clogged. We had to be somewhere right away so didn't have time to notify the front desk. We did the next day and they took care of it. When we finally got to bed at about 4am we could hear the people in the room next to us talking. I could make out every word they said. And then there was the construction noise. They must not work on Sundays because we didn't hear anything that morning. And all the construction around the MC made it very unsightly. We ate at the cafe and buffet. Both were a little pricey but very good. There was a wheel you could spin outside the front of the MC where you could win prizes like $10 free play, 2 free drinks, BOGO to the buffet, etc. So that helped a little. We've stayed at the MGM and Golden Nugget during past excursions. I'd have to say the GN was a better experience. But we were attending a wedding that was held at Mandalay Bay and wanted to be on the strip. Next time we go we'll probably choose New York New York. It's closer to both the tram and monorail.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy Room, but still lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: DebIrish
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo is a lovely hotel, was there on a Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday, but not again until the surrounding construction is complete: garage & City Center. The construction begins at 5:00 a.m. and if you stay in one of the rooms as next to the New York New York Casino you can literally hear the people scream riding the rollercoaster atop it. The best investment this hotel could possibly do for itself is replace those cheap single paned windows with thick double paned glassed windows. What a difference it would make with outside noise. Also, the walls are fairly thin apparently because you can hear quite a bit from the next room over. BUT it is a very nice and lovely hotel and the price isn't bad. The rooms were clean and the staff was pleasant. The Valet Parking was well organized and fully manned. The casino was okay, smoky but okay and the shops and restaurants were nice, as well. It warrants a return visit to eat and play, but until they upgrade the windows and/or the construction is complete, staying overnight again will not even be considered.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyable - no complaints”
Reviews.Author: horsetrader64
Reviews.Content: my wife and I stayed at MC 8-4 thru 8-9...when we arrived we were given double beds and a view of the construction site. thats not terrible as we were on the 23rd floor and above most of the noise, etc. we did want a king bed and a view of the strip so we asked for a change. the lady (Veronica) at the front desk was very helpful...she told us that if we would stay in the first room on Monday evening she would move us to a more pleasing room the next day. the next morning her promise came through and we were assigned a nice room with a king bed and a very nice view of the strip. we really appreciated her help and have no complaints of the Monte Carlo..the maid service was very good and we did not encounter any unfriendly staff at the MC...did not walk away a rich gambler but did not expect to do so...we just had a great time at the MC and LV in general.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms Need Updating”
Reviews.Author: BigAlFromDaBronx
Reviews.Content: We were there 5 nights, checking out on July 4. Stayed there numerous times before. Was a little disappointed this time around. The lobby, casino, food court and cafe were great (although cost wise the cafe is probably 20% more than it should be). Location was great, especially since it averaged 110 degrees each day, and outdoor activity for any extended period of time was not advisable. The main entrance which is across the lobby from the Hotel's check-in area, is on the side and in the back of the building, so one does not have to breathe the smoke in the Casino, although it is not as bad as in other casinos. The only real problem was the furnishings in the room. The carpet was old looking, although not worn. The furniture was vintage circa 1968 Holiday Inn, as were the bathroom facilities. The view, which used to be of the Strip, is now of the construction site next door. At least the jack hammering and pile driving we encountered in October 2006 is finished.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BlondeMomma
Reviews.Content: After staying 2 nights at the very luxurious Palazzo it is hard to compare the Monte Carlo hotel..but I must say, for the price we got we were given more than our money's worth. If you call the property directly you can get a rate between$59-$70 for two adults with two queen beds. AAA club discount gets you $10 off as well. The room was clean, nothing fancy but nice. the pool area has a wave pool and a lazy river, which unfortunately we figured out after we checked out..next time though. Anyways, looking for a good rate and good location, stay here...no complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the money”
Reviews.Author: TXN_TRAVELER
Reviews.Content: We just got home from our four night stay at the Monte Carlo. This was the second time I have stayed there, however the first time was only a brief one-nighter. Check in was a breeze, I tipped the agent and told her that I would be proposing to my girlfriend during our stay and asked if any comp upgrades were available - they were not, but she did offer me a suite upgrade for $50 per night. I accepted and we went up to out mid-level suite on the third floor. The room was nice enough, fairly large with a medium sized flat screen tv, sofa, and a tub with jets in the bathroom. We did notice that the lights in the bathroom were not very bright and the tub took about 20 minutes to drain. We spent the first night in this room and were woken up four separate times by people in the hallway. The walls are very thin. When we returned from breakfast, we barely noticed that housekeeping had been there. They did not even make the bed up!!! We called the front desk to complain about the noise, the tub and housekeeping and they moved us to an identical room on the 12th floor. the tub drain was fine and the lights in the bathroom were very bright. Housekeeping was much better after the first night. The walls of this room were just as thin as the first, but there was not much hallway noise - we could hear just about everything happening in the room next to us. There had to be about 6 21 year old girls staying in there, however it was pretty entertaining listening to them get ready and gripe at eachother ; ) We chose the Monte Carlo primarily for the pool. It was good and we never had a problem finding chairs. Expect lots of kiddos. It was hard to enjoy the lazy river for all of the kids splashing and kicking. Also the tubes are ridiculous - they wanted $12 to rent one. The little store by the pool sells smaller ones for $10. The river is so small and short that you con not really enjoy a tube in it, and people who do get the tubes are constantly bumping into you. The water is really cold - about 65 degrees, but it feels great once you get all the way in! There is also a wave pool that is nice, but usually filled to capacity with kids. The adult pool near the entrance is good enough. If you are looking for a great pool on a budget, I recommend the Flamingo over this place hands down. The Casino was nice. Very loud 90's music plays constantly, but it has a good flow and you won't get lost or turned around. We mainly play blackjack - the limits were $5 until about 5:00PM and after that you won't find a table under $10. The food was good. We really only did breakfast here. The buffet is good. Had a great omelet in the cafe one morning and the service at both was the best in the resort. There is also a food court with Sbarro's, Subway, Mickey D's and Starbucks. I've seen lots of posts commenting on the construction, but it was never an issue for us. Our room did not face it and we never heard any noise. The only time we saw any of it was at the pool. That place is going to be amazing when it is completed.

Reviews.Title: “Had a nice time!”
Reviews.Author: cincin1
Reviews.Content: ON short notice we booked a Monaco Suite(loved it) along with an adjoining deluxe room for the kids. Both were reasonably priced on weds/thurs but not on tues/friday. But, if you check prices at other hotels not bad. I heard mixed reviews about this hotel but my main consideration for booking was nice rooms and a wonderful pool. I think I got both here. The pool was very, very small-the pictures make it seem larger. But, the kids loved it, with the lazy river and the wave pool. We literally spent all day there; disappointed that they close as 7 pm, but that is pretty standard for vegas I hear. Gets alittle rowdy in the afternoon with 20-somethings which may be just what a lot of people are looking for! You have to get to pool promptly at 9 am even on the weekdays if you want a decent chair(s). Also, if construction bothers you, you may want to stear clear; although it totally didnt bother us. Excellent staff service. The Cafe rest. was very good; buffet so-so(about $20 bucks a pop). Excellent walking location for MGM, New York, Excalibur, Coke bottle across the street for Tix-and Lance Burton show was expensive, but again the kids liked it. Spend a couple of extra bucks on Monaco room, it has a lovely flat screen TV, velvet couch, refrig, jacuzzi tub, two baths, and is really cute. Try to get a room facing the strip or you might hear construction noise early. Also, look for deals on Travelzoo cuz you will get good food/spa/gaming credits. I'd go here again for a budget vacation but next time I think I will go all out and stay at Mandalay bay(I wish!)

Reviews.Title: “Great PLace”
Reviews.Author: Runnerjumper23
Reviews.Content: After reading several bad reviews the past month I was weary about staying at the Monte Carlo. Me and my girlfriend arrived at 11:30 and I asked for a room far away from the construction which they gave us on the 29th floor. We also were able to check into the room right away, which was nice. The room was nice for this type of range in hotel...linens were good and the bed was comfortable. The only problem, as other reviewers mentioned was the water backing up in the shower, but it's no big deal. I gambled only here and came out ahead, as did my girlfriend. The food court is close by and a good selection. The buffet was good for the price and we ate at the Brew Pub, which was ok for the price, not too great, but the beer was good and the music was great for dancing. We never made it to the pool but it looked crowded all the time. We also had a few beers at Diablos which is a cool place but the food is overpriced. The Monte Carlo was a great place for the money compared to other places I've stayed (Luxor, Excalibur, Imperial Palace) and will stay ther again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, Don't be scared away !”
Reviews.Author: UAtraveller
Reviews.Content: We were a little nervous with before we arrived because of the reviews. Yes they are building the 7 billion dollar City center complex next door but it didn't effect our vacation. We enjoyed the pool, Found service to be excellent and the rooms clean. They initially had us in a twin room but were able to switch to a king on the 28th floor right next to the construction. We heard little. The buffet was great. The location good. The staff friendly and the piped in oxygen was very theraputic and helped with the hangover. Mai Tai footballs at the pool !!!

Reviews.Title: “All that glitters..is NOT gold”
Reviews.Author: TBegay
Reviews.Content: Booked 5 rooms at Monte Carlo 5 months in advance thru their website for a great deal of about 80$/night. Got to hotel around 11am and walked right up to check-in without any line and was checked in quickly to all 5 rooms....ALL ON DIFFERENT FLOORS. One would think that if you had a "group" reservation some people would be near each other. It didn't bother any of us it was just odd. I had request we all be on the side away from construction so we all faced NY NY and didn't hear any noise. I agree the windows outside were filthy but I didn't go to Vegas to look our a hotel window. The rooms were average like a Best Western ..roomy but ugly gold colors and small worn down furniture. the pillows were horrible they were made of foam all of them were lumpy and past their prime and the toilets were air pressurized water savers and down right loud when flushed. My complaint about the hotel would be noise...very thin walls. You hear everyone's toiltes,doors and conversation around you. . Even with a do not disturb sign on the doors maid service came in and cleaned and then came back later that day while I was reading and let themsefl in my room..I startled them and they said they were just checking that everything was ok! I wasn't having a problem and still am puzzled why they did that...my sister said they came in their room also whlie she was dressing. The pool area was nice you. We ddn't find it too crowded and there were plenty of chairs with your pick of shade or sun. I did however think the water was cloudy/didrty. Would I stay here again....I'm going to be honest and say DOUBTFUL. The location is good but the overall experience was just blah. Even if I could get 80$ rooms agian I think I'd rather stay somewhere a little better maintained and updated...and I'm not a very picky person as long as it is clean and relatively quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1harleyrider
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weeks stay at the Monte Carlo. After reading several bad reviews of this Hotel, I was not looking forward to my arrival. We arrived at the Monte Carlo around 8:00 Am. Hoping to have our room shortly after check in. After checking back several times and nine ours later we were able to check into our room. People working at the front desk are rude and not very helpful. This was really the only bad part of my stay at the Monte Carlo. The pool area is nice, but a little crowded. People start lining up at 8:30 am to get into the pool area that opens at 9:00. If you get there any later in the morning you will have a hard time getting a place to sit. The construction next door is not very nice to look at but it did not ruin my time at the pool. As far as the noise it was not a bother either. Music played at the pool area keeps you from hearing any construction noise. Our room faced the construction and was not an issue. Did very well in the Casino. Did not bother gambling anywhere else. Dollar slots were HOT! For the money this is a good hotel to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “It was fine and I get crabby easily”
Reviews.Author: bella0566
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel to join friends for a birthday party. The price was right and the pool looked inviting. I arrived around 7:00 PM on a Wednesday and check in was quick and easy. I asked for and received a room away from the construction. It had a nice view of the mountains. The room was clean. Extra towels and glasses were provided on request. The front desk person, Joy, was nice at check in. Ed was very helpful at the taxi stand. I didn't hear the construction which is really amazing considering how gigantic the undertaking is. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe I'm just too easy going? The Monte Carlo is A-OK by me.”
Reviews.Author: Gemelli
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I arrived at the Monte Carlo on Thursday July 3rd. Check in was quick and the gentleman who checked us in was very nice and extremely accommodating. We were early but he found a room for us that was ready. We asked for a room facing the strip and we got it. He also arranged for late check out on Sunday the 6th the day of our departure. At arrival we asked for a room with one king bed but one was not available. He told us if we wanted to check back later or the next day they would be happy to check again. It was no big deal so we kept the room with the Queen beds. We had a standard Deluxe room. The room was very nice and clean. And yes, I could see construction from my window but for some reason it did not ruin my stay???? As I have stated before, I have stayed everywhere from Red Roofs, and Holiday Inn’s to Hyatt’s and The Venezia Tower at the Venetian. Minor disruptions such as a speck of mold or a view of construction from the pool or my room won’t ruin things. A lot about how a trip goes is in the travelers attitude. I won’t tolerate filth or horrible service but minor disruptions go with the territory and if you want to enjoy life you just have to learn to roll with the punches sometimes. Lighten up and enjoy life people. We only get once chance. The Monte Carlo is a very nice first class hotel and I would not hesitate to stay there again. P.S.-Our trip was booked as a package through Southwest Airlines

Reviews.Title: “Fun Times at Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: davisan8
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Monte Carlo for 3 days (sat - mon) and while we had a view of the construction, we never heard it until Monday morning. The lazy pool is a lot of fun even though the pool area was exteremely crowded. I enjoyed this hotel a lot more than others since the casino was off the lobby and not IN the lobby. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I won't go back”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel1024
Reviews.Content: the hotel was clean and that was the only plus.they are next to construction that blocks most of the view of the strip. The construction is non stop except for Sundays and we could here it in the room, it started at 5am. They closed part to the lazy river, due to construction. We had 3 different rooms. The second room had plumbing problems, when we made that move i forgot my bathing suit and I had to file a report and it was returned 2 days later. I wish i could have changed hotels, but orbitz didn't offer any help in doing so. I wont go back there. i expected better.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great girls getaway!!”
Reviews.Author: Scarlett61384
Reviews.Content: My three girlfriends and I departed for Vegas last Tuesday. We arrived at the hotel around 10 am and went to check in. We were disappointed when the check in girl told us that there were no adjoining rooms available. We had specifically requested two adjoining rooms with two queen beds in each. I even called to confirm. We opted for two rooms next to each other and headed towards the pool (more about that later). We were unable to check in until 3pm so I returned later to see if our rooms were ready. This time I had a man and he was happy to double check to see if there were adjoining rooms available. He found two and we were very happy. That rooms were ready so we went right on up. The room was nice and clean. I even pulled the nightstand away from the wall and everything looked spotless, except for the windows. The outside windows were very dirty but we could see out of them. Also, we were overlooking the pool and on the construction side but it did not bother us one bit. We couldn't hear any noise. Housekeeping did a great job every morning. I think we spent most of our time at the pool. We loved the football drinks that the bar served ($16.95 for a 64 oz) and kept the bottles so we could get refills (which we only $12.00). And the pools were great. We were there Tuesday through Friday and it wasn't crowded at all until Friday. I think the lazy river was our favorite. But the wave pool is also great. Actually all the pools were wonderful. And the cocktail waitresses circulated frequently so we never waited long for a drink. We tried both the breakfast and dinner buffets that the hotel offered. Both were great. If you have a more sophisticated pallet, I would recommend the Bellagio's, but the Monte Carlo's had so much to choose from. One of my few complaints was about the food court. I think that $10 for a six inch sub, chips, and a drink from Subway is ridiculous! That's about it. This was our first trip to Vegas and we are dying to go back! There is so much to do that we could not fit in all into four days. Next time we want to go for at least six days and stay during the weekend to see what that is like. Happy Traveling!

Reviews.Title: “I had a great time”
Reviews.Author: travel_safely
Reviews.Content: This was my third trip to Las Vegas and I took my mother. It was a nice place and a nice price. The casino left a little to be desired, but the rooms were nice and clean. They gave us each free buffets and free drinks, so that was nice. The buffet was good, and the staff was pleasant. Good value as well. I was pleased.

Reviews.Title: “A great place for families!”
Reviews.Author: Military_Traveler11
Reviews.Content: There are lots of bad reviews of the Monte Carlo, but after staying for 3 nights, it can't be beat in Vegas if you travel with family. The room was excellent and large, the pool is very kid-friendly, and the place is not overrun with drunks or partiers. We were very happy and intend to stay there again. It's also very close to many good attractions in Vegas. Complaints about construction are unfounded - the music played by the pool drowned out all the noise. Excellent tunes from the 80s and 90s, btw...

Reviews.Title: “You Certainly Won't Hate It”
Reviews.Author: enchantingeyes
Reviews.Content: I know the Monte Carlo is currently getting a bad rap, particularly regarding the construction issues and what some believe to be deteriorating lodging. But to be frank, it's not so bad. While the rooms aren't in new condition they are certainly satisfactory. The casino is small and easy to navigate. Just ask for a room that doesn't face construction. We were there during a busy convention weekend and we found the Monte Carlo to be easily accessible, but still far enough from the noise and crowds on the "busier" side of the strip. If this is your first time in Vegas, or you're going to celebrate something special, you may want to look somewhere else. But if you're an old veteran, the Monte Carlo will suit you fine; I don't you'll find anything to be particularly offensive. And on a side note, the spa is fairly nice as well. Ask for Chelle if you're going in for a nail service. Also, Walgreens and CVS are very conveniently located, which is attractive for visitors who are staying a while. I wish the site would allow us to give half stars, because in all honestly the Monte Carlo was a 3.5 for us. But I'm going to give them the benefit of the doubt with a full 4.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location on the strip”
Reviews.Author: JanetteMarkSheffield
Reviews.Content: We would recommend this hotel if you want to stay on the Las Vegas Strip. It's well positioned, has great facilities and the room was very comfortable, spacious and well equipped. The only thing missing from the room was tea/coffee making facilities (however, there was a good Starbucks downstairs in the food court).

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Relaxed Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dj_rell5
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I stayed at the Monte Carlo (MC) and it wasn't bad. I went with a friend of mine for the 4th of July weekend and she chose the MC because she wanted to relax. The MC is definitely a nice hotel if you want to relax because there are not many "young singles" running around the hotel. There are no clubs/lounges in this hotel so if you are a "young single" and you’re looking for the nightlife, you will definitely have to leave the hotel and go somewhere else. At check in, the hotel staff was polite and “there for you.” I arrived before my friend and she called the hotel to allow me to check in. When I went to check in there were no issues, which was great because sometimes it becomes an issue when you don’t make the original reservations. Once I arrived at the room everything thing seem to be in order. The bathroom was a nice size (big enough for me and her to get ready at the same time). The only issue I really had with the hotel was that the hotel windows were filthy. And the view was nice, you could see the MGM Grand among other things; but the windows were dirty. That would be the most negative thing I have to say. We laid by the pool a good bit and there were two separate pools. The far side pool was a “lazy river” and that allowed you to rent tubes and let the water push you around the course. I would suggest to get to the pool early in order to get pool side seating otherwise you will be SOL; luckily my friend was up early to reserve seats. The hotel does have a food court that allowed you to eat “cheaper” than the average restaurant in Vegas. They have a Subway, McDonalds, Sbarro, Manchu Wok and I think a few others. **NOTE**: I DID SAY “CHEAPER” BUT THE PRICES ARE INFLATED A BIT (IN CASE YOU DON’T KNOW HOW VEGAS WORKS). All in all the experience was average, I am going again next month and will be trying out the MGM Grand. But you want a nice hotel without all the noise of night life then the MC would be a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaGirl22
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location of the Strip. The Casino itself is average. The buffet (I forget the name) Restaurant is decent priced and has a nice variety of tasty food. The Spa is not the nicest I have been in, but is average I would say. The procedures I had done were above my expectations and the prices for them were very nicely priced. I did not go in the pool but I did look outside and it seemed like it would be an enjoyable time to relax out there. One of my friends rented a movie through the TV in our room and was very dissapointed. He chose one of the movies that had just come out in theatres so he was expecting it to be between 10 and 20 dollars. However, it never said the price until after he ordered it and it was 40 dollars!!! Ridiculous! He called the front desk and said he didn't want it anymore and for them to take off the charge (it was only 2 min. into the movie) but they said they can't do that. Needless to say, he will never get a movie from there again! The room decor is nothing fabulous but it's a place to sleep and it was clean. I prefer other hotels on the Strip to this one, but if you don't like the typical Vegas themed hotels then this facility would be a good option for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Families”
Reviews.Author: hmnichols
Reviews.Content: We came out to Vegas for a family wedding & stayed at the Monte Carlo Hotel & Casino. As Vegas has been shifting dramatically away from a family atmosphere over the last five years, it was refreshing to find the kid-friendly amenities hidden in the Monte Carlo. The wave pool & lazy river were a popular hit with my 8 year old son. Just a tip- the tubes are $14 to rent or $10 to buy, so bring one from home to save $. It did get a bit crowded, but everyone was friendly. There is a McDonalds and arcade on the lower level as well. A great place for families. I would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Okay but not Four Star”
Reviews.Author: roy54
Reviews.Content: We got a smoking room though we had requested a non-smoking. Couldn't sleep at all. They changed the room on the next day. the conversation from the next room was audible. Breakfast Buffet was good.

Reviews.Title: “nice casino -good service- good location -decent room with great view”
Reviews.Author: RobertBabb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo from June 29th -July 2nd. The Casino was nice ,easy to navigate and lots of fun( the music tends to be a little loud for my taste.) I had a good time in the comfortable sports book. This is an easy walk to the New York-New York casino next door( N.Y-N.Y. is conected to the MGM by an over the street walkway so the three casinos can be done together in one day) The service at Monte Carlo was good. My brother had a suite on the 18th floor and they gave me a regular room on that floor (the 18th floor is a Smoking Floor) Both rooms had terrific views of the Stip (in the front of the hotel. My only complaint with the regular room was a little damage to the bathroom( the bathroom door-stop had been pushed into the wall and there was a cracked tile in the bathroom floor) also the Bath tub was very ordinary - other than that the Room itself was comfortable and the staff was very nice with us. The Lance Burton magic show is really worth seeing and the theatre is one of the best in Vegas. We also saw Jersey Boys at The Palazzo (by far the best hotel in Vegas -it puts the Bellagio the Venitian and the Wynns to shame) Jersey Boys is a must see! and Bette Midler at Ceasars and You really can't go wrong with this show -Bette is great and the show girls are the best in town (all 30 of them) Over all the Monte Carlo was a good stay in a good location and the Cafe was a very nice place to eat. If you can afford it stay at the Palazzo. But for a very nice mid-price hotel the Monte Carlo might just be your vacation hotel

Reviews.Title: “O.K., Just O.K.”
Reviews.Author: MRP01
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo is well located towards the south end of the Las Vegas strip, so it is convenient to many Vegas attractions by either foot or short bus ride. Though the rooms are nice enough, I don't feel that the Monte Carlo represents a very good value in this price range. The room had a tv, but it was an old style tube type. The air conditioning was barely adequate with only one poorly placed vent into the room. One nice feature is the pool area. There are 4 pools including a wave pool and a "flowing river" free form type. Beware though because the Monte Carlo is in theheart of the new City Center construction project and there are working crane booms hanging over the pool area. The view from any room facing the strip will be of construction sites, and the wndows are quite dirty as a result. The Paris is comparably priced and overall a much better value.

Reviews.Title: “left after one night”
Reviews.Author: tmurph
Reviews.Content: one word: brutal. parking was horrendous. non-existent self-park (lot across the street at NY/NY was packed). after checking in, sent us to a room that was not ready. pool was minuscule and so jam-packed at (5 p.m.) with people that this family of four could find no spots to lay out towels or climb into the pool. our room was non-refundable, yet we decided after one night to get a room at mandalay bay (what a great stay we had there!)...we did not officially check out of the monte carlo until our last day in town so the hotel couldn't rent out our room. we were so looking forward to staying at the monte carlo and we even requested ahead of time for a room opposite the construction (we got that room), but we were sadly disappointed with the issues this hotel has...

Reviews.Title: “Don't see how you couldn't love this place”
Reviews.Author: despicable865
Reviews.Content: I was a bit skeptical after reading some of the reviews on this website but I took a chance because I got a really good deal on the room. My conclusion after my stay was that some people are just hard to please. The Monte Carlo was great the beds were comfy nice food court plenty on great places to eat. Anything you have an appetite for can be found at the Monte Carlo. Steakhouse, Italian, Mexican, Asian, even a Mc Donalds and a Subway were on sight if you didn't want a big expensive meal. The bathrooms were nice and the casino staff were friendly. The only thing you could complain about is that there weren't that many shops to go to like it bigger casinos but who goes to a hotel to go shopping anyway. There is construction going on next door to the Monte Carlo but I think it would be a shame to blame them for what someone else is building around them. I also forgot to mention check in time is 3pm but i arrived at Noon and I thought it would have been a problem but no way they had a room already ready for us. Thanks Monte Carlo

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place for Families”
Reviews.Author: Thunder70306
Reviews.Content: Hi All, I just returned from another fabulous week in Las Vegas:) Well, this time I stayed at the Monte Carlo, next to the New York New York across from MGM Grand. I first have to say that this is a great place to stay if you are going on a budget. Through the help of my research and plane travel of my agent we arrived in Vegas about 4pm local time. After picking up the rental car from Hertz (buy sattelite radio if going to Grand Canyon, possible free upgrade from them, I got it!), we arrived at the hotel and valet parked the car, highly recommended at any property (its free, when you pick up the car give a couple of dollars for tip). By car, the entrance to the property is not directly on the strip, you enter the property from the side before you see the hotel. Once I checked in we received a nice room on the 24th floor with a view of the pool area and construction nearby, a bit more about this later. The room itself was typical for a hotel room and not what I thought a Vegas guestroom would be like. Mind you my last stay was at the Paris which is quoted as a luxury property. It was typical because it had the standard double beds and a regular TV in an armoire versus a flat screen plasma. What I did get to see was a brief view of the suites that were on my floor. This room in particular looked very nice, very much like the photos they use on the website, would like to stay in one of those rooms if I stay again. The pool at the hotel was very nice. It has a regular type pool, wave pool which was a hit with the kids and a lazy river, which will cost you $14 to get a tube to use the lazy river properly. One other thing I found was odd, but again comparing it to the Paris pool, this pool was heated?! which when its 105 degrees I found it not very refreshing. One warning for future travellers to the Monte Carlo. Next door they are building this giant hotel/residences that is owned by MGM and might be casting a shadow over the pool area when the project is completed in 2010, also heard construction noises, but not really annoying. Overall, I would stay there again if I was on a tight budget and could not stay at a property closer to the other hotels action. I found that the Themed properties ie: Paris, Bellagio or Venetian, were more attractive to me for all the glitz and glamour. Prices at the food courts and buffet were really fair priced and well worth it. Avoid the Mexican restaurant in the food court for breakfast, total rip off, would have spent less at Starbucks or McDonalds.Thats all for now and hope this helps anyone :) Have a nice trip

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great Time”
Reviews.Author: BWT02
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a weekend blow out at the Monte Carlo. We had a great time. Our room was an online special discount room, so it was really nothing amazing. It was however clean and comfortable. The blackjack tables were a lot of fun and the drink service was prompt. The best part of this hotel was the pool. It was packed! The lazy river was full as was the wave pool. It made for great people watching and socializing. We met several fun people. Others complained about the large construction project nearby but I hardly noticed it. All in all the Monte Carlo is a little older resort but if you find a good deal dont hesitate to stay here. I visit vegas at least 4 times per year on average and usually stay at mandalay or NY NY but I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Quiet, Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Jbollig
Reviews.Content: We recently had a two night stay at the Monte Carlo and was pleased with our room, and the service. After reading a few reviews (after I made the reservation) we were a little concerned. However, prior to arriving I contacted management regarding our concerns. I was surprised that they wrote back, and they gave me a contact if there were any issues with our stay. That wasn't needed though, because our room was very clean and in good condition. We had absolutely no noise issues, and the service at the front desk and the valet was excellent. We ate at the hotel only once, (Cafe) and the service and food were both good. We got a good rate, so I feel that we received a good value for our money. I can understand some less than glowing reviews because they do need to do some updating, and we did notice that the bedding and linens seemed to have seen better days. Still, this was a good stay, and a great value. I tend to hold "Above Average" and "Excellent" ratings for those that seem to really be better than the next place, so neutral, average is best I can do.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: billiebob55
Reviews.Content: How can I put this, other than say that the Monte Carlo in Vegas failed in every aspect. We have stayed there a couple of times previously and had an enjoyable experience but not this time. They are building a new complex behind the hotel using the old parking area so there isn’t any parking other than valet and they didn’t have enough of that to accommodate the customers. Our room wasn’t what we requested, we were with others and they couldn’t place us anywhere near each other, the first room we entered was polluted with sewer problems and we had to be relocated again. The air conditioner barely performed and with high temperatures outside, the room stayed warm. The brew pub was closed on Monday and Tuesday which happened to be the days we were there, my son had been looking forward to it for months. I’m thinking that with the new construction, they will tear down the old Monte Carlo and convert it into parking and it will be for the better.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo Las Vegas is always reliable”
Reviews.Author: POOK26
Reviews.Content: If the five star hotels are out of your budget, try The Monte Carlo. It's clean, centrally located and the price is always right. They also have a great diner like restaurant on the premises for cheap, good food. I eat there for breakfast every time I visit.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: Irishmomma
Reviews.Content: Had booked our nonsmoking king size bed about 3 months before our arrival. When we arrived, we were given a room on the 12th floor facing the strip. We were awoken at 6 a.m. (!!!!) by LOUD construction after going to bed about 4 hours before (arrived the day before). The new City Center is absolutely the most massive construction project I have ever seen--even by Las Vegas standards. I learned that they work 24 hours around the clock to expedite a project meant to take years, but will be done in another year and a half. I went into this hotel open-minded, having had two glorious stays at Treasure Island in the past. However, the din from construction forced us to pack up and move to another room the next day. We were moved to a much higher floor, facing the mountains--much quieter. The lazy river at the pool was closed most every morning due to the nearby welding from the construction. Every day, there was debris blowing off the construction site (which you could physically reach out and touch, it's that close) that got in our eyes, in the pool (closing down the wave pool) in our drinks, and in our hair. The pool was nice enough though. The rooms were smaller and less 'appointed' than the ones at TI. Our tub (like another client mentioned) never drained when we were showering. I would be standing in about a foot of water (ikkk) by the time I was done showering. The rooms were always very clean and well-kept. The food in the Cafe was always very good, but night after night when we went in to have a sandwich, there would be ONE waiter working many many tables, running ragged. The manager sat one table after another before they would finally have another waiter come on duty. The breakfast buffet was LAME and could not compare to TI's. One thing I will give you is that MC is conveniently located to all the fantastic restaurants in the New York NY mall adjacent to MC. The casino was rather dead every night, even on a busy night. The casino dealers were never chatty or engaging in conversation. Overall, I DID like Monte Carlo for the most part--and there were many many loyal MC repeat guests that we met during our stay. So that is commendable to MC I guess. I think there are much better places to stay, but it is probably an 8 on a 1-10 scale of places available in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “"I want to go back...."”
Reviews.Author: timbovt
Reviews.Content: I had a great time, I want to go back............My partner had a conference in Las Vegas, we had booked just after the fire. I was a little nervous if it would be together when we got there. No worries it's Vegas things happen over night...... The Monte Carlo was terrific. From the lobby, and speedy check in. Wish I could remember the lady who waited on us. We were concerned about construction noise. Asked for a high floor, were put on 28. Even checked us in early. Had a great meal at the Brew Pub, yummy local beers. I was too busy to get in the pool, the Lazy River looked like fun. The food court was handy for grabbing something to eat as I was running out the door to catch a tour bus. AC was cold, 62 in no time. Bath rooms were clean and bright. Good firm beds, no sags. Clean, Clean, Clean, Clean I have been reading the reviews here, most of the bad that has been said has nothing to do with this hotel. So I feel as though I need to address some of those complaints: Construction: is happening all over the city. Card Slappers on the street: how is that the hotel problem? Heat: hello your in the desert..... Wind: Vegas is a windy place. Smoking: Vegas is smoking.(in more ways than one) Casinos: they are all a rat maze, nothing to do with the hotel. (I was stuck in the Luxor for an hour before I found the exit ) Kids: Hello again, not a kid friendly city, there's gambling, smoking, drinking and [----], so......... The MC is not a theme hotel like some of the others. (NY NY, Luxor, Excalibur, ) If that's what your looking for stay some place else. It is a really nice hotel that is VERY economical for a "Strip" hotel, clean, conveniently located. My only complaint, you have to pay for Internet access. Even the business center charged. So if you did not like the MC stay some place else, so they will have a room for me!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: chrisvnardmore
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Monte Carlo for three nights arriving on the 15th at 9 a.m. There was a film shooting on the strip so the trip from the airport took an hour. Once we got to the hotel we were checked in within 10 minutes. Our desk clerk Veronica was great. Travelocity was offering a promotion which was not valid on our stay so she tried to help us. The elevators are quite fast as they only service certain floors. We stayed on the 17th floor facing the building construction. Make sure you shut your curtains before you leave your room in the afternoon as it will be 100 degrees when you return. We went to the pool once about 4 p.m. and it wasn't crowded but the surrounding construction does make the pool pretty shady. The pool was pretty clean and there were plenty of chairs. We ate at Diablos once and we had a $25 credit or otherwise we probably wouldn't have. My beer was $8 and the margarita was $11. The food was pretty good but not great! We would definitely stay here again, the beds were soft and the housekeepers were great. It is a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Vegas stay”
Reviews.Author: Kaz_from_Manc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the less exciting places to stay in Vegas. The casino area is very bland and smokey compared to newer hotels. It is ok if you can get a good rate. The pool is very nice, but there is a lot of construction work going on at the moment, so I wouldn't recommend this hotel for your once in a lifetime trip to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Not the worst, but not the best”
Reviews.Author: BurbzGuy
Reviews.Content: In spite of the mixed reviews on here regarding the Monte Carlo, I chose to stay here because this is my "lucky" hotel. I have previously stayed at the Luxor and Venetian Hotels, but had most of my success @ the Monte Carlo's casino. The room was a disappointment. Although I requested a non-smoking room, the room we were given reeked of cigarettes. I opened the window and made the best of things. The bedding was outdated and the mattress and pillows seemed uncomfortable. Since I didn't go to Vegas to stay in the room, I didn't mind too much. Also, the bathroom was nice, with the exception of the tub. The drain had a problem and would often drain very slowly. Otherwise, the rest of the hotel, such as the lobby and casino were very nice. The buffet was ok. Sadly, the casino seemed to run out of luck for me on this trip. I don't plan on returning. The Luxor was much better and much cheaper. I won't even compare this place to the Venetian.

Reviews.Title: “Stunningly Mediocre”
Reviews.Author: atlantafromatlanta
Reviews.Content: Well, let's see.... if you think getting a smoking room with 2 full beds, instead of a king or queen, ON YOUR ANNIVERSARY is acceptable then you'll probably like the Monte Carlo. Though we called a week in advance to make sure everything was set for our 8 year wedding anniversary, we actually arrived to find ourselves in a smoky room with 2 beds. After we reminded them it was our anniversary, they "graciously" agreed to put us in a non-smoking room but oh well, it still had 2 full beds! Wow! That's classy! I'm pretty sure a Holiday Inn Express could be more accomodating than that. Secondly, the pool is REALLY SAD. I am not exaggerating. The lazy river doesn't even move and the pool looks like your typical neighborhood pool --- but even more crowded. They are also building a multi-million dollar complex right next to the pool so construction and noise occurs all day. If you're in your twenties and just want to get wasted and try to hook up and you don't care about your surroundings, than you'll love this place. If you're over the age of 21 and don't want to stand in a lukewarm, overcrowded pool, you'll probably want to stay somewhere else. Fortunately, we had some friends staying at the Mirage so we joined them there the next day. Going from the Monte Carlo pool to the Mirage pool was like going from the Hampton Inn pool to the Ritz Carlton pool. They're not even close. By the way, if you read any reviews about this hotel that say it is great, check the date. Apparently, the hotel has new ownership and it has gone downhill since. Unfortunately, we found this out after we got there. Also, the website is deceptive. The rooms are very plain and neutral. The lobby is really beautiful, I'll give them that but that's about it. Bottom line: If you're young and on a budget and you just want to stay on the strip this hotel is perfect. If not, you should really consider the other hotels. We thought the Mirage and MGM were great and of course the Wynn is amazing (their restaurants and employees are incredible) but that's in a completely different price category.

Reviews.Title: “Eh”
Reviews.Author: mlsf
Reviews.Content: Stay was alright. Our bathroom smelled like a sewer and when we told them they said someone would be coming up to our room to check it out. We waited for an hour, no one, we called the front desk. They then said we didn't have to be there. Got home later and it still smelled. Really disappointing that they didn't leave a vm or a note or anything. I wouldn't recommend this hotel. I got it on priceline so I didn't choose it. Beware.

Reviews.Title: “exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: Mreks
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just back from a two night get away in Vegas and had a super stay at Monte Carlo. I read all the reviews first which was a big help. We got a Monaco suite and requested to be far away from the city center construction. They gave us the best room as far away from noise as possible. We have two small children at home so we were looking forward to sleeping in without anyone screaming or crying. The room was very nice, It had a soft comfortable bed, which you do not usally get, and TWO bathrooms. Many review I read talked about unclean rooms and loud nights. Our room was worth the upgrade. It was only $180 total more for the two nights than a standard room and well worth it. We had no problem checking in and even had time to use the jacuzzi in the room. We used room service twice and both times they were great! We were nervous about using the pool because all the reviews complained about the construction next door. We got a Cabana right in the middle and it was perfect. They treated us like kings and was never bothered by construction. It is also well worth the money. $230 for all day in the cabana, which is ten minutes in the casino, so I recommend getting one. Our cabana host even got us a reservation at a great restaurant for that night on a Friday. The pool area was swarming with beautiful people, which was also a suprise. I thought of MC as a budget inn for vegas and it was much nicer than I remember. I am more a Wynn type person but don't have Wynn type money so this stay definatly exceeded our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “So-So Hotel - Look Elsewhere If You Are Picky”
Reviews.Author: RonSonomaCounty
Reviews.Content: The rooms in this hotel were tolerable, but there were definitely some significant drawbacks. The drain in the bathroom sink did not have a functioning stopper, and the drain for the shower was very, very slow to drain. When I took my shower I was standing in a few inches of dirty water after a minute. Their brunch buffet was pretty bad by my standards.
