If you do a buffet in Las Vegas, go elsewhere, like the Bellagio. For breakfast the second morning I ordered a belgian waffle at the Monte Carlo cafe. I asked the waitress if it really came with "real maple syrup" as stated on the menu. I hate the fake stuff, so really wanted the maple syrup. The waitress assured me (no less than three times) that in fact the syrup was the real thing. Unfortunately when she brought out the syrup it was the typical corn syrup with at most 2% maple syrup. It was horrid. I complained, but the waitress didn't do anything. Why would a restaurant say they have "real maple syrup" when they don't? The next day I went to the Bellagio for breakfast, ordered their belgian waffle. Again I asked if they had the "real maple" syrup, and the waitress said that they in fact did serve it. Sure enough, they had it -- and I was very pleased. Finally, I was able to get a decent breakfast in Las Vegas! For a good breakfast go somewhere other than Monte Carlo. Also, I am not certain if all the hotels in Las Vegas allow smoking, but be forewarned that you cannot escape indoor cigarette smoke in this hotel/casino. Apparently, Nevada has no regulations on smoking, unfortunately.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: BobbieB251
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our stay at Monte Carlo. We were concerned since there were some bad reviews. The only problem we had was at check in. Our reservations were for a king room and a double room. When we arrived we had 2 double rooms. We were told it was first come first serve and our room was given to someone else. We were to get incentives and they told us they did not have any for us. We were given a phone number to call the next day. We called and Southwest called the Monte Carlo and they gave us the incentives. The manager gave us a king and double room. The pools were wonderful. The food was great at the cafe and buffet. The rooms were wonderful for the price. We would stay at the Monte Carlo in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: psmom3
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our stay at Monte Carlo, the hotel has very easy check in, and the rooms are easy to get to, elevators are quick, easy to get around this hotel. Valet parking and the attendents are GREAT. Not a lot to do at this hotel but the location is a plus. You do see the construction site from the pool area, but this was not a problem for us. There is alot of construction going on along the strip, you take the good with the bad

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing in some ways”
Reviews.Author: Wilburforce
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Monte Carlo in June 2008 for our 10 year wedding anniversary, and second honeymoon. We had stayed there on our honeymoon so wanted to stay again. We were very disappointed when we reached our room. It looked quite tired and the windows were really dirty from the construction site next door. The glasses in the bathroom were both dirty too. We were willing to overlook these things because we had got a good deal on price. At 5.30am on our first morning, also our wedding anniversary, we were woken up by air horns and loud construction noise. This was really disappointing because we had expressly asked at check in for a quieter room - something the check in girl failed to understand or listen to. At 6am we went to reception to ask for a room change. The check in staff were apologetic and moved us to the 29th floor. The new room was as far from the construction as we could get so was alot quieter. The floor had also been refurbished, possibly after the recent fire, and the room was clean and new. Alot nicer. We did have about 3 of our towels that smelt like a BBQ, possibly also following the recent fire but we stayed for 7 nights so the majority were ok. We were disappointed by the pool area. The wave pool was dirty with crisp packets and a fag end floating along with general grit etc from the building site that surrounds it. Our first day by the pool was a Saturday when the construction is suspended. We visited the pool again on a Monday when approx a third of the pool area was closed until 10.00am because of the construction. We only syated for 1.5 hours because the noise was too loud and we could not relax. I think the Monte Carlo is an ok hotel if you can get a refurbished room but would not recommend it if you plan to use the pool facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time at the Monte Carlo.”
Reviews.Author: moesk
Reviews.Content: My husband and I really enjoyed our stay at the Monte Carlo. The food court came in handy and we loved the buffet. The check in and check out was effortless and the staff was very friendly. We were not bothered by the construction at all. I like the location of the hotel on the strip especially with a CVS next door and a Walgreens across the street. We only spent one day at the pool and here was the only time I was a little disappointed. The pool is shaded by the hotel so you get very little sun. It was nice to sit and read my book and not be baked alive by the 105 degrees outside. But, I expected the pool to be like bath water which is what I like. We both found the pool to be a litte cold and with all the huge buildings going up around the pool area, it was pretty windy. It was still a nice afternoon but if you are going strictly to relax at the pool, I might choose another hotel. But, if you are looking for a nice hotel with a great price, location, food, and customer service, you'll love the Monte Carlo.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't stay here - but will next time!”
Reviews.Author: Amber12478
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel to Las Vegas regularly, but had never ventured into Monte Carlo, having viewed it as a place for the older crowd. During this visit, we decided to give the casino a try and were thrilled with our experience. We happened to sit a table where a man named Cliff was our dealer. We had a FANTASTIC time. Not only was he a great dealer with a sense of humor, he was a wealth of Las Vegas knowledge. The casino itself was well lit and was full of mature individuals of all ages just looking to have a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: lasvegas-marmalade
Reviews.Content: Somewhat disappointed by this hotel. It is adjacent to a very large builing site and the workmen are on site 24 hours a day. It also meant that the pool area is being overlooked by large cranes, with debris and rubbish blowing in at the doors. The hotel was quiet noisy, with little noise proofing between rooms! The restaurants are however quite good and it has all the amenities needed. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone until the building work has been completed, expected to continue until 2010!!

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: SheffieldBlonde
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in great location, centre of strip, rooms very clean although delux/standard room a bit dated, hotel is great value.Visit the ' Brand 'restaurant in the hotel.Food,presentation and service are excellent, steaks and fish melt in the mouth!Only drawback, back of hotel behind the great pool area is a gigantic building site which overlooks everything.Massive apartment, hotel , shop and restaurant complex called City Centre being built.This stretches as far up the strip to the Bellaggio Hotel.Our room faced the strip so no noise, but if facing the site then building work starts at 5.30am.Would not expect this to be finished until next year. JA Sheffield, UK.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: jeanbeanie
Reviews.Content: We were concerned after seeing all the bad reviews but we ended up having nothing but a great experience. Our room was comfortable and clean and was well kept by housekeeping during our stay. We had a room that overlooked the pool as well as the construction on the 8th floor and not once did the construction noise bother us. We also used the pool area which we thought was great and again none of the construction noise and smell that I had heard about was a problem. We enjoyed the casino and again i did not notice an overwhelming smell of smoke. We ate at the Brand steak house and had the Kobe short ribs. It was the best meal. The concierge was also a great help. I believed that we used Mike and he helped to set us up with a table at Moon 2 hours before we were supposed to leave for the club. He gave us great tips and we ended up having the best time. The only bad experience was at Diablos. Our waitress disappeared after our food was brought and we recieved no drink refills or service and she only came back after it was time to pay. When we arrived home we found out she had charged our card twice!!! The Monte Carlo is not the Bellagio by any means but for what we paid i thought we recieved a beautiful, clean hotel with great amenities. Most of the bad reviews are just over critical and silly.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: gloria001
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Monte Carlo and I was a bit apprehensive after reading some of the reviews. However, I believe some people cannot be satisfied! The Monte Carlo was great. I was worried about construction but it did not affect our stay at all. We spent part of every day at the pool which was wonderful. The staff was excellent in every part of the hotel but especially at the pool. The room was fine - not luxury but we weren't paying luxury prices so did not expect it. I thought the buffet was better than average - plenty there at all times. The food court was very convenient for just getting coffee or a snack. Again, the construction was not an inconvenience, absolutely does not run 24/7 as has been stated here and was barely even noticeable - in fact, it was an interesting diversion to sit by the pool and watch this massive building go up! Location is great, casino is OK but you may want to check out a bigger hotel for gambling, staff is wonderful, food is very good. I would stay here again and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as I expected.”
Reviews.Author: burghputz
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo was not as bad as I have seen written in these reviews. I arrived at 10:30 AM and was able to check in for that day. I was actually surprised that they would let me do that! THe room was comfortable and nice. Bathroom was also nice. It was a nice clean room. But I was out and about and did not spend lots of my time in the room. The one thing that I will say was that during my stay, there was no construction going on next door. I would imagine that if ther were it would have been a little more noisy than it was. I was there only 1 day and that was a Monday so the casino was not very busy. I was not impressed with the casino as I thought that the dealers and bosses were not very frendly at all. I actually got up and cashed in and went to the NY NY and MGM to have fun. I only ate one time in the hotel - breakfast at the buffet. I got it for free so I can't complain, but I would not spend $12 on what you got. The highlight of the buffet (if you can call it one) was that they had Krispy Kream donuts on the buffet and that the frozen custard machine was working. Thas was about it. I ate the rest of my meals at NY NY - they have a great steakhouse! So, it was not as horrible as some others have you believe, but it wasn't anything over the top special. I would say that on a scale of 1 to 10 I would give it a 4.5.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: riogrl1
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo Hotel in Vegas is a great hotel right on the strip near MGM Grand and New York, New York. It's a very classy place with nice hotel rooms (the bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was huge!) - the view wasn't the greatest. Had a room overlooking the pool area and could see all the construction behind it for the new CityCenter. But we couldn't hear any of the construction noise in our room on the 16th floor! The check-in service was fast and smooth, booked with Southwest Vacations online and received a $25 credit for food at the Cafe or Buffet and $5 Starbucks credit. The casino area was nicely laid out and had plenty of open space to walk around and not too noisy or crowded. I will definitely be coming back to stay at the Monte Carlo Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A "4-star" out of 100 maybe”
Reviews.Author: mustbcrazy
Reviews.Content: I took my daughter to Vegas for her 18th birthday and decided to get a room at the Monte Carlo,as they were having a great special and were rated at 4 stars. Well it must have been 4 out of 100 because this hotel is no 4-star hotel. Out of all of the hotels we went to in Vegas, it was the only one that smelled of cigarette smoke. The decor was outdated and crummy and the pool area is surrounded by construction of the new City Center. We did not have a lot of construction noise on our side of the hotel, but were very disappointed in the hotel's quality. Do yourself a favor and go to the Mirage, TI or the Bellagio if you can afford it. You will be glad!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!!”
Reviews.Author: thebigmccracken
Reviews.Content: Wow, everyone here seems really whiny and hard to please. Typical. Anyways, we LOVED the Monte Carlo. The location cannot be beat, the rooms were much classier and larger than any of the other rooms I've stayed in on the strip. We were automatically given a $25 food credit due to the amount we spent booking, the Pub is lots of fun, and the pool is awesome. They upgraded us for next to nothing to a gorgeous spa suite on the 26th floor, just because we asked. Everyone was incredibly helpful and kind, from the maids to the front desk. Yes, there was some construction, but we could barely hear it from our suite and not at all from our original basic room. The only thing I would recommend is valet is a bargain here, due to the fact that they use New York New York's parking garage and it can be a bit confusing to navigate. The Monte Carlo is fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Worth what I paid”
Reviews.Author: javisq
Reviews.Content: I was in Vegas for a conference and got a good deal rate from an e-mail that was sent out. I arrived at the hotel around 1:00 and they were able to check me in. The room I got had two double beds and was fine. They still have the scratchy old blankets and the pillows were too full to make it comfortable. I had to set the a/c down to about 63 degrees just to make sure it was not 80. The shower had a ton of pressure, but the drain could not keep up with all of the water that came through. The clock radio was not plugged in and I could not find a place to do that near the bed, so I had to use my cell phone. However, the room was pretty quiet and the staff was nice. While this review sounds negative, I would still think about staying here again, especially if the rate were really good.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place, but the Construction...”
Reviews.Author: Chrismigs65
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Monte Carlo. Overall, it was a good experience for what we paid. We arrived early and expected to have to wait until 3:00 to check in, so we took a walk around the grounds. When checking out the pool, we saw (and heard) the construction going on next door. There's a $7 Billion dollar project going on right next door. Right now the Iron girders and facade are going up and if you're looking to relax quietly by the pool, forget about it . At noon we tried to check in, luckily, the front desk was able to accommodate us when we asked for a high floor, away from the construction. We had to get 2 queen beds instead of a king, but well worth it considering the alternative. So, I give the check in staff a 5 for service. We ate at the Cafe inside the hotel as well as a few of the fast food places and the brew pub....all good. As for the pool...as mentioned, it abuts construction. Yet, there is waitress service, the pool is clean, and plenty of towels. We got out there at 2pm one day and although very crowded, we were able to find a couple of chaises...might have been the last 2. Gambling area was a bit smokey for our liking, but always plenty of tables open and low minimums for betting. We found cigarette smoke a problem in a lot of casino's...seems like the ones with high ceilings don't have as big a problem...wonder why they all don't have high ceilings? Diablo Cantina is right out front as is the overpass to MGM Grand and NYNY...Monte Carlo is in a great location. So, I would return to the Monte Carlo...in 2 years, once the construction next door is completed.

Reviews.Title: “Not what you expect”
Reviews.Author: hotelsnob2
Reviews.Content: Buyers beware, the rooms at this hotel were very dirty and small for Las Vegas standards while still paying Las Vegas prices. When we complained about the room being dirty (something disgusting on the comforter and threw up on the bathroom walls)the maid came with a new comforter and threw it in our room. We had to make up our own bed. The faucet was leaking in the shower, however maintenance did come right up and fix that. It was never disclosed to us that they are working 24/7 on the City Center next door. So expect to be awake all night to the sounds of jack hammers etc. Yes that is right I said 24/7. I would not have minded if it was during the day but every night I would wake up to the sounds of major construction. In the end we were given a $50 credit to our bill WOW! Needless to say we won't be going back to the Monte Carlo. I expect at least a clean room when paying $300/night.

Reviews.Title: “Below Average, Would Never Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: Sunshine_2323
Reviews.Content: I was charged a few extra items that just appeared on my credit card bill for no reason. In addition, we were given a package which actually had strings attached and weren't able to utilize any of the package details. The players club card was inactive and after numerous attempts the problem was never rectified. The bathroom was dirty upon our checkin and the house cleaning came to "clean" it again but left it dirty. It was disgusting because it was someone's leftover #2 over the seats (sorry for the graphs but it was extremely unexceptable). They did a poor job of cleaning the room overall and if we had to go there again we would definentely opt out. It was our first trip to Vegas and not nearly as enjoyable as it would have been if we stayed at another hotel. There was a mistake made the first time, but believe me, we will never make this mistake again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: gordonsg5
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a great stay at the Monte. The hotel itself is really nice. The front outside facing the strip is awesome. Check in was no problem (but what problems can you have at 1 am?.) The rooms did the trick for serving their purpose for having never been inside the rooms; showering and sleeping basically. The pool area was surprisingly nice. Didnt know what to expect with all the construction going on, but you could barely hear anything going on in the City Center over the music being played at the pool. So i'm not sure what to make of people claiming the construction was way too loud... But overall it was an awesome stay. Would def stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: MTTT
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo because I've always wanted to try the lazy river. They don't advertise it and it's small, but fun. We were impressed with the peaceful atmosphere at this casino compared with others on the strip. It was nice to come back to after touring the other hotels along the strip. Our only disappointment was that they've taken out the tram that used to connect the Monte Carlo with Bellagio, so we had to walk, but it wasn't a bad walk and there's always something or someone interesting to see along the way.

Reviews.Title: “Was expecting better”
Reviews.Author: starbelrus
Reviews.Content: have to say I was pretty disappointed with this place. First of all, there is a HUGE construction project going on right next to the Monte Carlo and they start work there early!!!! By early, I mean at 5am they are already out there. The second problem I had with this hotel are the pillows and the bed, just not comfortable at all!!! I called to ask if they had different pillows but they said that they did not. My third problem was the fact that one of the beds in our room had a bedspreads with LARGE and OBVIOUS stain right across the front of the cover. I am not sure why they would even continue to use that bedspread. Seeing that I just felt unclean!!!! Another concern is the location on the strip. Its located way at the end of the strip so you had to walk a bit to be at the center of all the action. I had originally booked Planet Hollywood but at the last minute change my mind due to better ratings for the Monte Carlo on trip advisor and I def. regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: shelma
Reviews.Content: We also stayed here over Memorial Day weekend (Sat-Mon) and agree that this hotel is just ok. The rooms DEFINITELY need some updating. They were very bland and boring. They only provide two flimsy pillows on each bed and the bedding wasn't really that comfortable. The bathrooms are large but the shower heads were not designed for tall people. They're very close to the wall and low so I felt like I was standing against the wall in the shower. We were never bothered by any construction noise however the very loud pipes would wake me up each morning. When the water to a shower would be turned on in other rooms or other floors, not sure which, it would sound like a seal whaling and then you would hear the water running through the pipes the length of time that person was showering. The hotel is definitely beginning to show its age. The staff is all very friendly and the casino is nice. Room service was pretty slow, took 50 minutes for an order of grilled cheese and jalapeno poppers. We had gotten some comps for the Cafe restaurant and the food and service was good there. We also did eat and hang out at the Diablo restaurant which I enjoyed. There I enjoyed that every 30 minutes they spin a wheel and have a different $3 drink special depending on what the wheel lands on. $3 is a very good deal for drinks at a bar on the strip. With our hotel rate we received a $25 dining credit and $5 Starbucks credit which when we checked out had still not been taken off our bill. When I called the front desk to inquire about it I had to be transferred 5 different times to get someone to fix the bill to reflect the credit. I would probably only stay at this hotel again if I got a really great rate or if they updated their rooms. Otherwise there are much nicer hotels for comparable rates on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Not Kid Friendly - next door construction site”
Reviews.Author: tradeshowtraveler
Reviews.Content: Our room was clean and nice bathroom but the sink was broken so it emptied onto the floor. There is a huge construction site just to the north of the hotel near the pool which makes it really ugly and (noisy weekdays). The pool area also smells like septic. There were smokers in our non-smoking room area. It could have been the housekeepers. We were allowed to check in really early, which was nice but our room faced the back. We paid a pretty high price for the room so that was dissapointing. We were allowed to stay at the pool after checking out which was also a bonus and the pool area is really fun with a flowing river pool, a wave pool (cold), a toddlers area and a large hot tub and bars where they sell cocktails. We had a bad experience with the kids. They wanted McDonalds for breakfast and we wanted the buffet, so we sat them at McDonalds to eat while we went to the buffet. Three security guards later escorted them to the buffet because under 16's can't be unsupervised anywhere in the casino area. But when they sat down at the table next to us in an almost empty restaurant, the waitress told us she needed that table and the kids had to stand up while we ate our breakfast. I said to the waitress that I could see 50 empty tables, but she flatly ignored me. There was also an older couple sitting in the enclosed toddler pool smoking without kids. No one stopped them, but if my kids went near the hot tub without me, they were told to get out.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat disappointed”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinRidgewalker
Reviews.Content: Although I am a frequent vacation traveler, this was my first visit to Vegas. The other couple my wife and I went with had stayed at the Monte Carlo before, and they made the arrangements. Over all, it was okay. We were prepared for the construction and luckly our room did not over-look it. However, we were placed on the third floor with a view of the exhaust vents over the casino and restaurants. There was constant blower noise and we didn't dare open the window due to the fumes. Since we didn't plan on being in our room much we didn't ask for a different one. Overall the room was quiet, but we were there Tuesday-Friday, so the hotel was not full. The Monte Carlo had a roof fire earlier this year and both my wife and I were sure the towels smelled smoky, and they were dingy. The carpet was stained. There was no fan in the bathroom. Also no coffee, microwave or fridge, of course. They want you ouf of your room spending money. Compared to many of the other casino/hotels we visited the Monte Carlo seemed out of date and a little run down. My wife suggested that after the huge City Center complex next door is finished they would or should probably tear down the Monte Carlo. The casino area was okay. I mainly play the slots and there was enought variety for me. The wait to check in was long, but the staff was courteous. Checkout was painless. Restaurants were below average. Go next door to New York, New York for lunch. Compared to non-Vegas two and three star accomodations I'd say that except for the fact that it is located on the Strip it would be rated as two-star. I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good price but rooms looking a bit tired”
Reviews.Author: johnnyjumpstart
Reviews.Content: I stayed thursday- friday nights of Memorial Day weekend paying $89 thru Priceline.com which made the stay enjoyable. It would have been too much to pay the hotel's going rate which was considerable higher. This is my second stay at Monte Carlo and several annoying things caught my eye. A new Diablo bar has been built curbside and attached to Monte Carlo to appeal to a younger crowd but the bar which blasts loud music out onto the street not only is annoying, but it obscures the view of Monte Carlo while approaching from the south strip. The hotel is being overshadowed by the construction of the new City Center Complex and construction noise was evident late at night while I tried to sleep. A cement mixing operation has been set up in the parking lot between Monte Carlo & NY NY and is serviced by about 20 cement mixers all day long. It appears the parking garage was also inundated by some construction expansion. The hotel shows no evidence of the fire early this year and was spotless in the lobby, casino & bedroom. The bedrooms are begining to show age as the comforters looked worn and the redwood furniture was showing chips and scratches. Monte Carlo has a 4 star lobby with 2.5 star rooms. If you are looking for a spotless, value hotel in a great location on the strip then this is the place for you provided you can get a room for less than $100/night. Monte Carlo basically provides Holiday Inn quality rooms surrounded by a moderate sized casino that is quiet & laid back.

Reviews.Title: “Bland”
Reviews.Author: Penguin07
Reviews.Content: Like some of the other reviewers here, I was a little underwhelmed by the Monte Carlo. The staff I dealt with ranged from polite enough to totally indifferent. My room (just a standard room) was fine, though I was put off by having no ventilation in the bathroom (hello, mildew) and the cookie and other food detritus that was behind my nightstand (which remained there throughout my 4-day stay). The beds and pillows were pretty comfortable, though. The pool itself was nice enough, but you are surrounded by the construction next door. Not exactly relaxing. Oh, and they keep hitting sewer lines. I think you can imagine the smell. The brew pub closed by 11 every night, which seemed odd for a bar/Vegas. We tried to go a couple of times, and were once ignored and then treated rudely by the staff. The decor is fine, but I didn't find anything overly European about it. It was pretty standard "hotel style." I've stayed in Hampton Inns that were more luxe than this place. For a place touting itself as a luxurious, European-style resort, the Monte Carlo has some work to do!

Reviews.Title: “4th Time & Going Back!”
Reviews.Author: BLONDIE73
Reviews.Content: My husband & I have been out to Las Vegas once a year for the last 7 years. We've stayed at (once each) MGM & Paris, but we keep going back to the Monte Carlo. It has a great location, not too big & easy to get right on the strip. The mattresses are the most comfortable we have ever slept on (our friends agree). We love the Steakhouse (the food melts) and the food court is easy for that quick meal. When the tram(shuttle) was open between MC & Belaggio - definetly saved on walking (I think when the new hotel next door is complete it will be open again). We've stayed there with the construction (twice now) and have not heard any noise or been offended by any smells (at least until you get outside and past the hotel). By the way - Diablos is awesome. We will keep going back.

Reviews.Title: “It was Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: byln
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of monte carlo's spa suites on May 11-14, and we had a pretty enjoyable time. I think it was a novelty for us that there was a giant jacuzzi almost smack in the middle of the room (it was towards the side of the room next to a big window), and the tub was huge. it could fit way more than two people in my opinion. I was a little disappointed that it wasnt a flat screen tv, given that in the room grade below the website said that all tvs were flat screen, and i kinda remember something about an ipod dock (which our spa suite did not have). The Spa suite did have an okay sound system (speakers on the ceiling throughout) but if youre in the bathroom you cant hear very much. the bed was okay, a little too soft - which possibly means the mattress is worn down, but the pillows were flat and not firm. Not the most comfortable sleep ive had, but it was okay. thought the turn down service was unnecessary, but the godiva milk chocolates they left were really good. Location wise monte carlo is pretty far north, but walking is good for you. or you can get on the deuce which serves the entire strip and downtown hotels (i think) which is USD $5 a day. Construction does take place 24 hours, but if youre not too picky, its okay. our view was partly of a construction site and th strip, but not that we minded. casino wise we did like how monte carlo felt, but we didnt play as much as we did in others. smoky, but its big so its not that bad. We ate at diablos and we enjoyed it. We paid around 135, 165 and 165 per night for our Sunday-Wednesday stay. I hope we didnt get ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “Meh”
Reviews.Author: SDblondie
Reviews.Content: I thought that for the price an location that this hotel would be nicer, but it wasn't. The lobby and pool and very nice, but our room was run-down. It was small and old looking. Bad pillows and a view of the massive new construction project on the strip. (construction runs 24 hours a day by the way). Staff was nice enough. Location was great, but I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Who knew there was construction?”
Reviews.Author: allaboutthepool
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at Monte Carlo. On the good side - the food court is great - you can grab breakfast, lunch for a very reasonable price (Starbucks, McDonalds, Subway, Pizza, Chinese, Mexican and ice-Cream). Room was a good size and I like the lay-out of the hotel - nothing was too far of a walk from anything else (which can be a problem at some Vegas hotels). The guests staying at the hotel were super-friendly and very down to earth. The rates were reasonable and I liked the wave pool, the lazy river pool and the outdoor space (though I would say it is not my favorite). On the negative side: CONSTRUCTION - there is a huge amount of construction going on around the hotel (not in the hotel, but on the strip) but as a result, from the pool area you can see all the construction and hear the banging, drilling etc. (also sometimes a bad smell from the welding I think). Also, part of the pool deck are and the lazy river pool was closed till noon on the 1st day because of the construction - which meant about 50 pool side chairs were out of commission. Like most Vegas hotels if you get to the pool after 10am it is almost impossible to get a good pool-side seat, and the towels seemed really cheap. Very poor service on the casino floor - we played several times for 20-30 mins at a time, and never had a waitress come by to offer us cocktails. Overall it was OK - I have stayed at Flamingo and the Mirage....and I would say the pool at those 2 places was much better..but this hotel is a little easier to navigate. You can actually run to your room from the pool and not feel like you just walked 2 miles - lol

Reviews.Title: “Best Value on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: ump2please
Reviews.Content: After reading all the negative reviews on the Monte Carlo, I was apprehensive about taking my wife there for our anniversary. However our stay there turned out just fine. Since I had read that you should ask for a room on the quiet side of the hotel, I mentioned that to the clerk at check in. He was more than accomidating, upgrading us to a room overlooking the strip. Now - here are the facts: 1. Yes - there is construction taking place on virtually ALL sides of the hotel. But I never found this to be intrusive or overly noisy. I did hear the occassional warning horn blow, but this was no more frequent than hearing the siren of an emergency vehicle going down the strip. 2. Construction around the pool area is a bit of an eyesore - but not intrusive. This is rated one of the nicest pool areas on the strip. It has a normal tropical type pool, with adjoining large hot tub. A kiddie pool. A lazy river (which does move fast). And also a wave pool that I could tell the kids were having a blast in. (Recommend you buy your own tube for the lazy river. They rent for $15 a day.) Drinks at the pool are a bit expensive, but hey, I can blow $20 in the casino in 2 minutes. 3. We had a Deluxe room (normal room) - which was adequate for two people, not real large - and a little short on drawer space. But for us, the room is a place to sleep, shower and -- well, you know the rest. I read reviews about the walls being thin. We did not notice this. Never heard a word from our neighbors, other than the college guys walking through the hall - not a big deal. 4. Great food court with McDonalds, Starbucks, Sabarro Pizza, Haigan-Daiz, ManchuWoc - (excuse the spelling) so good variety. Buffet was better than average, not great - but priced appropriately. Plenty of other restaurants, but we did not try because I was looking for a good steak place. They are opening one soon. Diablos is the newest Mexican margarita bar / restaurant on the premises, and was always crowded. 5. Casino was fine. Not the glitzy glamorous atmosphere that some other people desire - but my wife did like the fact that the slots were spread out more, so people were not on top of each other, like in some other casinos. We walked north on the strip to Caesar's (to see Cher). Because of the construction, I would suggest crossing the street to walk up the strip, otherwise you have a long block of a scaffolded protective tunnel to walk through. Caesar's was a 15 minute walk. All in all - a great place, especially for the money. If you are expecting the glamour of the Wynn or the Venetian / Palacio, then go down the street and pay the $250 to $400 for an equivelent room. I am in Vegas 6 to 8 times a year for conventions - and have stayed in most every hotel on the strip. The Monte Carlo was better than expected. I saw a lot of families with kids, probably because of the great pool facility. Lots of college age and middle age individuals - even some honeymooners. I would recommend for most anyone, unless you are the "hard to please" type.

Reviews.Title: “We LOVED our stay at the Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: cjzap
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a first time 5-night stay at the MC and we really enjoyed it. We chose the Monte Carlo because we rec'd a great deal from casino marketing - $49 a night room, free play, $25 food credit, and two comped tickets to Lance Burton (great show). After reading some of the other reviews, I was a little worried - but we were pleasantly surprised. Although the rooms are smaller than some of the other ones we have stayed in (MGM, Planet Hollywood) the one we had was in good shape and housekeeping kept it exceptionally clean. Bed was comfortable, bathroom OK. TV was a trifle small and channel selection was awful, but we really didn't watch that much. We were on the 6th floor in Tower 3. While it faced the big construction project, we only heard noise if I had the window open. Not much of a view, but unfortunately, that City Center has taken away most of the views from the rooms. All-in-all tho, it was a decent enough room, especially for the price we paid. We ate at the buffet and at the Brew Pub. Buffet was not the greatest and a little over priced. (Spice Market at PH is our personal favorite). The Brew Pub was nice with a decent menu, but again a little pricey for what we had (but, hey, it's Vegas). We did not try any of the other restaurants. I have only nice things to say about the staff. We had an "invited guest" check-in and the clerk was very pleasant. The housekeeping staff were very nice, as were the employees in the Buffett and Brew Pub. We did not encounter a single rude, unhappy employee at this hotel, as noted by other reviewers. I was especially impressed by the staff at the Players Club. I experienced a problem with accessing my point play on my players card (highly recommend always signing up for cards). I had to deal with 3 different shift supervisors who were pleasant, accommodating, and just plain nice. They worked with their Tech support people, and the problem was eventually fixed. Those people couldn't have been more pleasant. My problem was minor and they could have blown me off, but they didn't. We really liked the casino. Mostly we play slots. The Monte Carlo has a very good selection for slot players - and we did fairly well in there. The casino is bright, airy and laid out well. It's smaller than most, so you aren't apt to loose your way when walking around. This goes for the resort as a whole. It's a very easy place to navigate, and I especially like the fact you don't have to drag your luggage thru the entire casino just to get to your room. All-in-all we really like this property. You can get some good deals here. We also like the location. We are partial to the casinos at the south end of the strip and the location of the Monte Carlo makes it easy to get to them. The Duece Bus also stops right in front of the hotel so that's nice. We would not hesitate to stay at the MC again and I would recommend this property to anyone wanting a decent place to stay for a decent price. Hey, it's not the Wynn or Bellagio, but then they don't charge those kinds of prices either. Don't overlook this property when planning a trip to Vegas - we had a great time there.

Reviews.Title: “So-So”
Reviews.Author: Candit
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed at the Monte Carlo from April 20-24. We had a so-so room with two queen beds and a pretty good view of the NY NY roller coaster. We had some issues with the air conditioning unit in the room so we were moved to a suite on the 5th floor. It was a really nice room with 1 and a half baths which is nice for two women. On our third night staying there my mom got food poisoning really bad and discovered it was from a restaurant at the Monte Carlo. I went down to the restaurant at 2:30 am to let them know that she was sick. I wasn't looking for anything I just thought they should know about it. We had to report it to security and fill out reports. They called her the next morning to find out how she was feeling and asked a lot of questions. I finally had to take her to the doctor on Wednesday night because we were flying home on Thursday and she couldn't fly in the shape she was in. The hotel never contacted us again. I was a little disapointed to find out that they never even called her to make sure everything was all right. However the stay overall was nice and I would probably go back.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints”
Reviews.Author: cdth
Reviews.Content: Got a good deal (less than $100/night, $25 food voucher, $5 Starbucks, $10 free play) and enjoyed the stay. The Monte Carlo is not remarkable in any way, but is well-located, has a nice pool, and has nice rooms. The bed was comfortable. If you sleep really lightly, you should search for a hotel not near the construction. You can find one, but it can take a bit of looking. I stayed Sat. and Sunday night, and no construction then, but could hear it by Monday morning. It did not wake me, but I could hear it. A lounge/bar other than the sports book would be a good addition to the Monte Carlo...you'll have to go elsewhere for that. In the realm of firsts: On the second day, the inside door handle popped off when I pulled on it. I popped it back on, and could use it, but it had not been fixed by the time I left. The hotel is only 12 years old, and doesn't seem OLD, but will benefit from the updating they are doing.

Reviews.Title: “Refreshing Monte Carlo Resort”
Reviews.Author: dtgrne
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a May 2008 trip to Las Vegas, NV from VA and we were both thoroughly pleased with the Monte Carlo Resort Hotel & Casino. We are not gamblers but we did insert a dollar in the $0.25 slot machine to say we did partake in the livelihood of the city. The Monte Carlo casino area is crisp and clean but smoking is allowed in that area. The hotel's buffet was great especially considering the 2-for-1 coupons given to us by those who had visited a promotion earlier in the day. The only thing about Vegas as a whole is that all the casinos seem to have you wait unecessarily in line for buffet seating to be arranged. Plenty of seating would be available and the line could move faster but some are deterred from the eating establishment initially by the lines hanging out pass the doorway. We had a non-smoking king room with effective thermostat controls so that we could enjoy a cool room after a day of walking. The remarks about the bedding was correct - the mattress was absolutely devine. The room was superb for Vegas especially for the less than $100 price per night we obtained via Expedia. All the room lacked from the most expensive hotels in the country was a small refrigerator, exhaust fan in bathroom or heating lamp and a movie channel. We all know the intent is to not keep us in the rooms but in the casino but the room was definitely satisfactory. I found the Monte Carlo to be easily navigable and the food court had adequate vendors. Please know that if you receive a dining credit from the hotel to understand the few eating establishments that honors the credit and that you must utilize the voucher prior to check out because the charge must be applied to your room and then the hotel reimburses the cost at checkout. There is a spa and chapel on premise that we did not visit and the pool was busy and enjoyed during operating hours where the lifeguard was on duty till 6 p.m. I personally would have liked the pool to be open till dark. The view out the room window was facing the strip. A Deuce strip bus stop is in front of the Monte Carlo and access to the Monorail was through the back of the MGM Grand across the street with a asfe cat walk on the corner for pedestrian crossing. This was a return trip for my husband and I to Vegas. We are pleasantly and positively assured that we made a perfect selection with the Monte Carlo. As both frugal and quality seekers, we look forward to your opinions on the Trip Advisor.

Reviews.Title: “UNDER expectation”
Reviews.Author: Happyhare06
Reviews.Content: I got the one night stay on Priceline. The check was Ok. I requested the clerk one king size bed but was rejected because the rooms are not ready. They will be after 17:00. So I got a double bed room which was fine. At first I got a third floor room. I didn't dare to take that since constructions are underway. 24 floor wasn't so bad but still could hear the construction noise. Bathroom was awful. Could flush the toilet normally and bathtub water outlet was letting the water out fast enough. On this same trip I stay at a Holiday Inn which was better than this. The thing that bothered me the most was the knocking on the door since 09:30. Seems like they want guests to check out early and check in late for some reason. Anyways, I wouldn't stay again in Monte Carlo and don't recommend it to anyone. Those of you who already have plans just check in LATE to get a better room and check out EARLY to avoid the bothering.

Reviews.Title: “Really LIked the Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: timpramas
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Monte Carlo for two nights in early May. I was there for business and spent an extra night for fun. I reserved a non-smoking standard deluxe room and only had to spend a few minutes in line waiting to check-in. Service was consistently friendly. The room was nice. Although facing the City Center construction I did not notice any noise (I was on the 11th floor). The beds and pillows were really nice and I had no problem quickly falling asleep. Once my work was finished I played a lot in the hotel's poker room. The poker room is well run, and like the hotel generally the managers and employees really seem to let you know how much they appreciate your patronage. This was my second stay at the Monte Carlo and I will be staying here for future visits to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “losing its lustre”
Reviews.Author: visitorToronto
Reviews.Content: Just spent a week at the Monte Carlo. After being regular visitors to Vegas and staying in most of the major hotels, this was the first time we'd been back in three years. We decided we'd go back to a hotel we'd enjoyed 5-6 years ago, booked the rooms thru the hotel website in Feb, the prices changed four times in between booking and our trip. It was easy enough to change the reservations just by calling the hotel but had to keep checking prices weekly on their website. The new off airport car rental is a lot easier to get thru but I don't remember ever having a 20 min wait before. Early check-in at the hotel was easy but the Vegas habit of just line up at one station rather than the next available just baffles me. After reading the reviews we asked for and got a room on the 27th floor strip view, which is the top of the casino, away from most of the construction. If you haven't seen the construction site yet, it is monstrous, will certainly be something to see when it's done. Very dusty and congestive if you're walking toward Bellagio. The room was ok, starting to get a little tired, the walls are paper thin, we didn't hear much construction but did hear the TV from the clown in the next room who had to watch TV at 2:30 in the morning. We had always been big fans of the Brew Pub so were diappointed that it was closed Mon and Tues, but went for dinner on Wed and it was great, have the Steak and Stein!! Had breakfast every morning at the Cafe, just perfect for what we needed. I don't understand Diablo's, doesn't fit with the hotel, they have an outdoor area where you can sit and watch the people going by on the strip which was ok but had the worst Margaritta ever. Make sure you use your players card, they comped a meal that we had at Bellagio. Went into Wynn for the first time, my wife was so awestruck she walked around the entire casino and forgot to play even once. This will be the last time we stay at Monte Carlo would prefer to spend the extra money and stay at Bellagio but we'll continue to come back to the Brew Pub until the close it completely.

Reviews.Title: “Would Definately Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: Supernature
Reviews.Content: This is my third trip to Vegas in 8 months, having previously stayed in Luxor and MGM Grand. I read a few of the reviews and as they seemed to be either really positive or really negative I was concerned to say the least. However it was great. We upgraded to a spa room, and it was amazing, with a huge jet spa, very comfy bed and an amazing view across the strip. The casino was reasonably good with payout, and both staff and security were friendly. My only small gripe would be that on our first night there, we went to the bar in the casino and sat there for 15 minutes with no bartender, before finally giving up and wandered off. Granted it was 3am, but the casino was busy and this is Vegas after all! Went to the pool, really enjoyed it, and I have to say all the moaning about the construction is overstated. Its as big a deal as you want to make it, and it didnt bother me at all. Would love to go again.

Reviews.Title: “Ordinary but affordable”
Reviews.Author: OCruiser
Reviews.Content: For a Vegas hotel, the Monte Carlo lacks a lot of the glitz and glamour of the other well known hotels on the Strip. The lobby and casino are nice enough. The vibe is low key and you don't have to worry about trying to impress anyone. The rooms however, are nothing to write home about. They are very ordinary and like any other decent hotel in a big city. But comparing it to the handful of other Vegas hotels I've stayed at, eh, it's just okay. If it wasn't for the affordable rates, I doubt I'd stay here again. (I like the glitz and glamour!) That being said, it's definitely not a bad choice if you're looking for a decent, reasonably priced hotel on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: blondeegal
Reviews.Content: To my surprise. this is just an average type hotel for Las Vegas. Clean, but nothing fancy. Water pipes were noisy. Not sure why a hotel would be built and skimp on costs in this area. Little things like using double sheets on the bed would add a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Save your money”
Reviews.Author: kajikay
Reviews.Content: I was not impressed with the Monte Carlo. First, it was clean and they were able to get us a non-smoking room. The pool area is cool and the location is good. However, the hotel is located next to a massive construction site for the City Center. It is very loud and you can hear the construction in the rooms. The first night we were in a room with two queen beds and wished to be moved the next day to a room with a king bed. We were woke up at 8:00AM by construction noise. When we were moved, we requested a quiet room away from the construction. The next morning we were again woke up by construction, this time it was construction on the Monte Carlo parking garage. We called the front dest and they said that that was the "quiet side of the hotel." The lady was quite rude and sarcastically offered me ear plugs. Honestly, I would say save some money and stay at the Excalibur!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here (unless you don't like to sleep)”
Reviews.Author: Brian-in-Ohio-07
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo from 4-26 thru 4-29. We were kept awake by loud air horns and banging construction. The rooms were a little worn but pretty clean. I have to say that we loved the casino area, especially the table game area. The pool is crowded and is even more crowded because part of the pool area was closed because of construction. We complained and got some money off of the room. At least the staff was nice about it. Don't stay there until the construction is done!

Reviews.Title: “Only 3 star price but more than 4 star quailty”
Reviews.Author: SunShineyGirl90
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo hotel was fun and has a great location. Although our view from the 9th floor (room 9221) had a view of the pool , mountains and lots of construction we enjoyed the room. It was very clean, totally quiet (we couldn't hear any neighbors , elevators, or construction) and had comfy beds and pillows. The overall impression of the hotel was good the bell service and check in were both slightly above average. The food ranges from a food court with McDonalds and Starbucks to a variety of nicer restaurants (with over priced drinks). We liked being so close to a stop for the Duece bus, being walking distance to the Bellagio, a pharmacy and the southern strip hotels (Excalibur, Luxor and Mandalay Bay). The casino was easy to navigate as was the hotel. In some of the other strip hotels it was part adventure part ordeal to find your way through the casino never mind the hotel. But the Monte Carlo has excellent signs and a simpler layout. We liked this as we planned on visiting a lot of the strip and knew we would be coming and going a lot. We didn't get to use the pool but walked around the area and I will make sure I take time for a swim next time. There are hotels with more impressive features but the Monte Carlo did not disappoint as being a good overall hotel. Considering we got a reasonable price we were very happy and enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but very noisy.”
Reviews.Author: bascott2
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here several times in the past and always enjoyed the hotel and casino. However, there is quite a bit of construction going on next door at the new City Center. Makes for a lot of noise and construction dust. Would recommend requesting a room on the opposite side of the building away from the construction. Also,the parking lot is small since the construction started and they lost a large parking garage. We ate at the new Diablos and the food was great. But again, a lot of noise.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: leftyduck
Reviews.Content: I booked the Monte Carlo because it seemed to be the best value I could find after checking out many other hotels. We had a basic room which was clean, nice, but not fancy. There is noise from the City Center construction next door even though our room was on the south end which is a little further from the site. You will still hear the noise but it's not too bad and I didn't hear during the night. The walls seem thin and you can hear your neighbors and water pipes etc.so bring ear plugs if you are a light sleeper. Check in was quick and the staff were friendly, drink service in the casino was pretty good. The food court was handy for a quick bite, I like the fact that you can get from your room to the strip quite quickly as the casino is easy to navigate. I would not recommend Diablo's, it was over priced and we did not have good service. I paid $11 for a single Margarita. Over all for the price this is a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel on the Strip!”
Reviews.Author: MattJHB
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo is great! It's the perfect balance between smart and casual, not so smart that you can't relax, and not too casual that its tacky. Check in was good, with a friendly staff member doing the necessary quickly and efficiently. The room is comfortable and spacious with nice amenities. The casino was nice and although I wasn't particularly lucky, it was fun. The pool area is okay, although it overlooks construction next door, but wasn't a problem for me. The dining choices in the hotel are a bit limited due to construction, so if fast food or the buffet isn't for you then you may have to venture to another casino to eat, but this is part of the fun of Vegas - you need to explore the other casinos on the strip too. I liked the Monte Carlo, and I cannot complain about anything. I'd stay there again any time.

Reviews.Title: “This Place is Great & Central to Other Hotels”
Reviews.Author: tikisuz
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I've stayed at the Monte Carlo in a few months. Both times were excellent. Rooms are clean and don't feel as "abused" as other hotels I've stayed in on the strip. The pool is a complete blast and you should take the time to ride around the lazy river. The casino was not too empty and not too full, if that makes sense. It seemed to have a nice, mellow crowd for a Saturday. If you are looking for a little less expensive spot on the central strip, this is a great place to stay. Definitely walking distance (girls leave those heels in the room, though!) to MGM, Paris, and such. Beds are super comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “Not Exactly a 4-Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mcuenca
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo is rated as a 4-Star Hotel. I think it does not live up to this standard. Upon check-in, we encountered a front desk employee who was devoid of any personality. I greeted her and she simply asked for my ID. She swiped my card, gave me my room card and told me the room number. I think she said five words and barely made eye contact. Our room had the following: 2 beds, desk, chairs, small tv, safe. However, the bedding was tattered, the pillows were dreadfully lumpy and old. To make matters worse, there were brown stains on the pillow cases (appeared to be make up). We went downstairs and told another front desk employee about our room. She did not apologize. Instead, she said, "Oh yuck!" Again, not much professionalism. At my request, she put us in another room, with a King bed. Again, it was a very standard room. The mattress was old. Bathroom was clean. Pool area was mediocre. Few small pools, few cabanas. The Hotel Steakhouse had closed down. There was not much food choices expect for their "fast food" area. We had to go to other hotels to eat. The casino was average. The Monte Carlo is nothing memorable. We did not spend that much time in our room. You can go elsewhere for the same amount and have a nicer room.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed...”
Reviews.Author: amgbe
Reviews.Content: I took my kids to stay at the Monte Carlo over Spring break and I was terribly disappointed. I read a review that it was the 2nd best "kid" hotel in Vegas with the 2nd best pools which is why I chose it. After booking it I read the reviews on trip advisor about the noise and construction which was very disconcerning so I called the hotel and they assured me that noise was no longer a problem as they were no longer jackhammering. The outside of the hotel is really beautiful/breath taking but the inside is the complete opposite. Our room was very small, tub was plugged so when showering the bottom of the tub was full of water, the ceiling of the bathroom was cracking and splintered as if it would cave in. The housekeepers open the door and knock at the same time, they walked in on us every morning. I also had some of my Chanel makeup stolen. When you go to lounge at the pool you are serenaded with jackhammers and cranes lifting large metal objects over your head and I was awoken every morning between 6 & 7 am to the loud construction sounds. Also the walls in the rooms are so thin that If the construction didn't wake me up the people in the hotel room next to us were waking me with coughing or toilet flushing. If you want a relaxing/restful vacation this is not your place. I will praise them on their buffet food and cafe, that was very good. We also had a view of New York New York's rollercoaster which was cool but I recommend a much higher floor then the 9th which may have solved our outside noise problem. After speaking to management which was nearly impossible, I was told that they are going to be adding a sound proofing to their rooms and she did agree that the housekeepers intrusions have been complained about by others too. It also has a new owner within the last year. It is very sad that such a beautiful hotel on the outside was so deteriorated internally. We stayed at the MGM Grand the last 2 vacations to Vegas and it definitely was a much better hotel experience. I attached a photo of the view at the pool for your amusement...after noticing the terrible pool view while at the check in counter the employee told me (and was serious) that I can watch the building progress while laying at the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: GandT-n-WV
Reviews.Content: Clean, great location.

Reviews.Title: “No noise, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: wtexgirl17
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a two day/night trip to Vegas. The Monte Carlo was great! I had read that the construction noise was very bad but instead heard no noise at all. We did request being put on the opposite side of the hotel from the construction. It was a very good stay and restful night! Loved the buffet for breakfast and the casino for gambling. I found a good rate on Vegas.com. We will definitely stay at the Monte Carlo again!

Reviews.Title: “Great prices, great location, clean, not smokey.....just ignore the construction”
Reviews.Author: tapinsharon
Reviews.Content: Very much enjoyed our stay. It was the best price we could find on the internet. Booked a special we saw on TravelZoo.com for 90, including a 25USD food credit. Casino is not too large - so it is easy to come in off the street and get right to your elevator. The casino was never crowded, and there was very little smoking. Monte Carlo is next to New York, New York, and is in easy walking distance to all center strip casinos. The pools are quite nice, but know there is monstrous construction going on around the hotel. If you are poolside, you will see it all around you and hear it. It is not paradise. However, we did not hear it from inside our rooms at all. Our rooms and the entire hotel were very nicely outfitted, and very comfortable. Would absolutely stay again. Besides, who in Vegas has time to go to the pool?

Reviews.Title: “Not as expected”
Reviews.Author: carshapaules
Reviews.Content: Very clean hotel, while we were there anyway. However, all advertisements I've seen regarding the Brew Pub suggest that the beer is brewed on the premises. Not so any more and, apparently, this pub is to be refurbished or turned into something completely different after this summer according to an employee. Live entertainment nightly from 9p.m. is also advertised but the pub is closed on Mondays and Tuesdays and the Monday when we arrived was St. Patrick's Day too!! There was no entertainment that we saw, not during the week anyway. Also, be wary of drinking in Diablo's! Although "Happy Hour" was posted during the late afternoon, a beer cost $8! An absolute rip off! This hotel doesn't offer as much in the way of entertainment as many of the other hotels along The Strip and the construction noise from the CityCenter complex that is being built next door was evident 24 hours a day so we didn't sleep very well during our stay. Needs major overhaul before we'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo - Brilliant choice for the strip”
Reviews.Author: xJessx
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Monte Carlo from 23rd March to 6th April and had a great stay. The room was big, clean and had a great view over the strip. The casino itself was well laid out and the pool area was clean. The thing I liked best about this hotel is that unlike other hotels on the strip it doesn't get too crowded. It doesn't have a theme as such so people are less likely to visit it which means the restaurants don't get too busy and there wasn't a huge line at Starbucks in the morning (not a bad thing!) There is construction going on by the pool area for the new residential buildings next door. The noise from the construction is minimal and when the cranes are in operation nearest to the pool area (which was in the morning for 2/3 hrs at a time), part of the lazy river and some of the sun loungers at that end were roped off. It didn't bother us to be honest as the music by the pool is at a good level so you don't here the noises and the area which the cranes were working didn't get the best sun anyway. I would definitely recommend the breakfast buffet and the noodle restaurant where I had the most amazing sushi!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: babybunny127087
Reviews.Content: I'm not a picky person. A lot of reviews I don't pay attention to because some people feel like the world should be handed to them on a silver platter. The hotel looks nice on the outside but the inside is like any other one or two star hotel. I didn't even care about the construction that went on day and night because it's like that all down the strip. The staff was rude. Every restaurant we tried there was bad. We didn't get any of the amenities that was promised when we booked our reservations. Our room was very small. There were chips in the furniture. There were kids running around the casino, I thought they weren't allowed in there. I guess I just expected more from a hotel on the strip. I've stayed at Circus Circus before and I can honestly say that it was nicer than the Monte Carlo. Which is not good because I would never stay at Circus Circus again.

Reviews.Title: “Unless you're getting a great deal, consider staying some place else”
Reviews.Author: NJdudette
Reviews.Content: I was in Vegas once again and while my stay at the Monte Carlo was not the worst it most certainly was not my best time either. I was warned about the construction noise by other TA members and made sure I asked for a room away from the noise. I was given a room on the 18th floor with a “mountain” view. There was a tiny bit of construction noise during the day, but nothing major. My first problem with the room was with the strong odor of cigarette smoke – ick!! I’ll be honest, I’ve never been bothered before as I have many friends who smoke, but this was real bad. I toyed with requesting a room change, but it was already midnight and I was exhausted. I figured I’d make the best of it – big mistake. Luckily I discovered the next day I could crack the window open and that went a long way in airing out the room. The room also had one of those adjoining room doors and the people next door weren’t very quiet. I realize Vegas is a lot of fun, but must you laugh and talk loudly every night at 2:00 AM?!?!?! Ugh. If possible, do yourself a favor and try and avoid the rooms with an adjoining door. When I went to take a shower the next morning I discovered mold in the shower, water damage on the ceiling and the water in the tub drained very, very s-l-o-w-l-y. Standing in ankle deep, dirty shower water wasn’t very enjoyable. Now you may be asking me why I continued to stay in the room and that’s a good question to ask and my response would be a touch of laziness and a touch of stubbornness, but quite frankly, why should I have had to ask for a new room? Those rooms are virtually inspected on a daily basis and at the very least the mold should have been dealt with almost immediately. A quick spray of bleach would have done the trick. I’m sure the pool area at one time was very nice, but with all the construction going on, it’s a bit of a downer. I hadn’t expected the noise to be too much, but on Easter Sunday all the construction had stopped and what a difference – clearly the construction noise is a bit loud. In March the sun doesn’t start creeping across the pool area until around 10:45 AM, so depending on your spot, you may be in a shaded area for quite some time. The waitresses came around on a fairly regular basis on Friday, Saturday & Sunday, but they were pretty scarce on Monday. My guess is this will change as the summer crowds increase. As I said, not a horrible time and based on the rate I received it was a relatively cheap trip, but the room fell way short of meeting my expectations. It’s unlikely I’ll be returning to the Monte Carlo anytime soon unless they manage to throw another fabulous deal my way and I can be guaranteed a better room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shstein48
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Monte Carlo March 18-23 to bet The NCAA Basketball Tournament. Check-in was a breeze. This hotel has no major theme to draw tourists. Therefore, the overall experience was terrific. Las Vegas is especially busy the first week of The NCAA tournament and The Monte Carlo lacked the crowds and craziness of other hotels. (The Monte Carlo probably wished they had the crowds and craziness.) Despite other Reviews, my room and bathroom were both very clean. Hoousekeeping is terrific. Are the furnishings older? Yes, but still clean. Buffet was above average, as are all buffets. The food in The Cafe was very good and relatively inexpensive. If you like Las Vegas, but don't need themed hotels, craziness and crowded slots and tables, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “stay here!”
Reviews.Author: TAMember12282011
Reviews.Content: Stay at the Monte Carlo Hotel on the Strip. A little less busier than Caesers, MGM and Belagio and cheaper. Excellent location. Try a dessert view rather than a strip view, its better! Loads of building going on next door at the new city hotel, but it dont affect it. No time for sleep anyway! Leave the kids at home, its adult stuff!

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: MrsO99
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Monte Carlo March 26 - 30th. Room was clean and hotel overall nicely appointed. Lots of construction next door and just down the street which did not make for a pleasant atmosphere. The building next door has taken away valuable pool lounging area so it is extremely tight and uncomfortableand noisy while trying to relax by the pool. I was gouged $34 for a long distance call but overall hotel was good. My problem is the infrastructure of Vegas... sidewalks are horrible to walk anywhere, can't get a bus as out of service and even then its a lousy service, taking a cab costs a fortune as they are stuck in traffic,no grocery stores to grab something other that restaurant food, no garbage cans anywhere so its dirty and littered. What is wrong with the city planners! With all the massive hotels they must have seen this coming. I think the hotels should also bear responsibility to do something with the infrastruture as well. Crazy!

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: Cindy731
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Monaco Suite for our 25th wedding anniversary. The room was wonderful. We did ask for a room on the opposite side the construction was going on. We didn't hear any noise. Construction is going on all over the strip day and night, so it is hard to avoid. I would stay at the Monte Carlo again. It was a memorable experience. If you are wondering about the down side....the toilet paper holder squeaked. Big deal! There are always little things that may not be perfect, but can be overlooked. May be were lucky, but we went to have a good time and we did. Sometimes it is what you make of it.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy construction next door”
Reviews.Author: No_Rest_in_Vegas
Reviews.Content: The hotel is certainly adequate and I am happy to report no trace remains of January's fire, but the _Major_ construction project next door is a terrible discomfort. From the looks of it, they are building one mid-rise building (about 10 floors) out of steel girders and two high-rise buildings (about 40 floors) out of concrete. The construction site is noisy at all hours - it was quiet Easter Sunday, but work began at 2:00 AM Monday morning and did not stop the rest of the time we were at the hotel (we departed Thursday). They appear to be many months from completion. If you are getting a room with a pool view, your room is also facing the construction site and it will be loud. They blast an air horn every time the crane is ready to lift a steel girder. Forklifts that emit that "truck-backing-up" beep in both forward and reverse gears unload flatbed trucks just beyond the pool fence. Jackhammers pounding, men attaching things to buildings, concrete trucks, etc. The Monte Carlo's skin and windows do very little to muffle the fervor. I talked to several guests who told me they felt the work is happening "right outside their window". Some on the "non-pool" side complained of the noise as well. For me, 11 floors above the site was not nearly enough to prevent the suffering. We had our 8 year old son with us, so we spent significant time at the pools. The pool complex is nice and the hotel has done an effective job of using the volume of the outdoor soundtrack to hide most of the construction sounds without drowning out your family's conversations. This is a rather impressive feat as the work site begins at the outside of the pool area's fencing. Unfortunately this fencing is not sufficient to prevent the occasional cloud of wafting dust from the construction site. While noticeable when they happened, it wasn't frequent enough to prevent folks from using the pools (including us). The hotel room windows are quite dirty with what is probably residue from these clouds. If I could do it again, I would choose a different property on the strip. Once the construction ends, I would be comfortable recommending the hotel as a family friendly choice. One final penny-pinching tip: Walk across the street to the Starbucks across Las Vegas Blvd - it's half the price of the one in the Monte Carlo.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and follow through”
Reviews.Author: fredget
Reviews.Content: After reading mixed reviews were not sure what to expect on our first stay there...we were pleasently suprised. From check in to check out the 3 nite stay was very good. We received a large upgraded room, clean and well supplied...some construction noise, but no worse than the street noise in any large city...When we were there they announced that they were moving up the redecorating of all the rooms by about 8 months...we saw no effects from the fire but understand there may be a couple hundred rooms still closed from water damage. The pool and restaurants that we used were good. We felt that the hotel was a good value and would go back,,,All staff was courtious and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: Alberta travel view
Reviews.Content: We are in of fifties and have spent many nights in Las Vegas over the years. We both agree we have never enjoyed staying anywhere in the city as much as we did the Monte Carlo. We came early, just after noon and were allowed to check in. We requested a non smoking room with a King bed. The only one ready that early was on the third floor. We were told if we took 2 Queens we cound be on the 13th floor with a view of the strip. We agreed and the room was great. It wasn't as large as some of the rooms at other hotel we have stayed at but certainly all we needed.The house keepers were pleasent and did a good job keeping the room clean. One thing we found odd, the fresh towels were never folded well and were always wrinkled. When we had questions about our players club points, the front desk went out of their way to find the answers by calling the players club. We were comped the four meals we had charged to our room. When we wanted something lighter, it was nice to have the food court at the hotel. The casino was just the right size and not difficult to find your way around. It always smelled so fresh. There was no smoke odour at all. Drinks were offered regularly while playing. We won and we lost but it was nice to play in a nice bright casino instead of dimly lit others we noticed while exploring the strip. What we liked so much about the casino was that it was all one level. You walked in from the street and never had to climb a stair. The elevators were quick and plentiful. We went to the outlet malls on the north and south ends of the strip. We took our fare share of cabs, just because we wern't sure how to get from the strip to others areas to shop, see hotels and attractions. Be aware cab drivers will turn a six dollar ride into a $16.00 fare if you don't tell them the route you want them to take. While on the strip, the Duce bus serves well. It stops directly in front of the Monte Carlo which was great. It costs $5.00 for a 24 hour pass and we found out you can transfer to other buses to go just about anywhere. My husband and I both highly recomend the Monte Carlo Hotel. We can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel for location, price”
Reviews.Author: badgerKEG
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo March 17-21. For perspective, we are two 22 year-old college students. we didn't see many people our age there (more so at night) - seemed to be many people 45+ and families. We found a promo code at smartervegas.com for $99/night that wasn't on the website, so a good deal! Like the earlier reviewer, when we first got there the lazy river and wavepool were closed. The last two days, they opened up the lazy river, but the wave pool still wasn't open. However, temps were in the low 70's, and when i went in the regular pools I was always COLD, so I think it's reasonable that the wave pool was still closed. THe lazy river isn't very "lazy" in that you can go in without a tube, so there were lots of kids splashing and swimming around - you may get wetter than you'd like! Also, because of the building angle/season, the regular pool was in the shade for most of the day -only the lazy river and the hot tub were in the sun. Unfortunately the construction from the CityCenter is right next to the pool, so it's pretty audible. Speaking of construction.... Our room pretty much faced the construction, and yes, you could hear it during the day. However, we weren't really in our room during the day (who would be?!), and at night it never disturbed our sleep or kept us awake. At night there is work being done, but it seems to be minimal (lifting some beams, and only a couple workers that i could say). During the day, yes, it is pretty loud, but who cares? The room itself seemed nice - when we checked in the person double checked with us as to what kind of room we wanted (smoking/non, king/queen beds) and that is exactly what we got when we went up to the room. No, it wasn't perfect - there were some places where wallpaper was peeling, fixtures were tarnished, etc., but hey, it looks a lot nicer than a college dorm room, and nicer than the 2 star hotels i've stayed at. As for food: we ate at the brew pub (had a $25 comp deal w/ our reservation) and that was decent. It is closed mondays/tuesdays. on Wednesdays they have an all you can eat rib special w/ salad and sides, and my partner said it was AMAZING. We also ate at the Cafe which was so-so, but it was open 24 hrs. so we could eat breakfast at 3 in the morning before leaving for our flight. We enjoyed the casino a lot - it was smaller than many of the other big strip hotels, so easier to navigate, but it was still classy (unlike casino royale- scary!!). It was also pretty easy to find $10 tables to play blackjack at... $5 tables could be found early in the day, but got crowded quickly. The location of the hotel itself is great - 15 min. walk approx. to bellagio and the venetian for sight-seeing, and close to some of the "cheaper" hotels to gamble and eat at (NYNY, Tropicana, Luxor). *Make sure you sign up for the players club! they had some great deals for new members for pts w/in the first week, and you can use the same card at ALL MGM resorts - which is most of the resorts on the strip.
