All in all, a good place to stay if you can get a good deal. If i was spending $150 a night or more, I'd probably stay at Paris or NYNY instead - more fun, but for same amt. of money.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointed”
Reviews.Author: linnybc
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Monte Carlo for our second time in 6 months, but was disappointed to find the lazy river and the wave pool both closed for repairs and the remaining pool was in the shade until about 3:30 and closed at 5:00. The brew pub was closed 2 of the days we were there and they no longer brew their own beer, yet it is written up in all the literature. We took our friends there as they only drink brewed beer and were very anxious to try it. We also found the noise from the nearby construction site went all night long and we weren't even facing it directly. I definitely won't be going back until the new city centre project is finished.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: RoadTripTiger
Reviews.Content: I must say that I was pleasantly suprised with the Monte Carlo. I was a little worried about the recent fire, but you would never know it happened. There is no visable damage, no smell, and no change in access. The staff was friendly and easy to work with. We arrived at 10 am and they let us check in early. Please be aware that the City Center project is under construction right next door. THe noise and traffic are pretty bad durring the day, but pretty much subside at night. The buffet is great quality, but best at breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “What Was I Thinking????”
Reviews.Author: SpeedyGonzalez
Reviews.Content: I was recently in town for a conference and stayed at the Monte Carlo. I requested a king non-smoking room and received a queen smoking room. After returning to the front desk to see if I could change rooms, I was told that my request for a room was just that...a request. It was not a guarantee that I would receive the room type requested and there were no king non-smoking rooms available. I returned to the room and after a few minutes decided that I was not going to subject myself to staying in a smoking room for five days. I called down to the front desk again and after being placed on hold for a few minutes, I was given a king non-smoking room. Here are my recommendations if you insist on staying there....1) bring your own soap or shower gel because the maids are really stingy with the soap. (however they were quite generous with the lotion). 2) consider bringing your own towels because the towels still reek of smoke from the recent fire. 3) use hand sanitizer after being spending time in public areas of the hotel. There was a brown substance smeared on the elevator door for two days.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value......”
Reviews.Author: LexiedogHouston
Reviews.Content: We stayed here March 6-9th. Our room was on the 7th floor with absolutely no view except for the lovely construction site, but we heard no construction-related noises. We arrived very early (like 10 am) and they allowed us to check in, so that was helpful. The rooms are big, but nothing special. It was rather noisy at night when loud talking folks would walk down the hall. We ate at the $12.95 breakfast buffet and it was really good. We ate also at the Italian restaurant (had a $25 comp. and used it there); food was decent and had some good wine. I checked the room prices as our trip approached and the prices changed all the time on the internet. They actually got cheaper as the date approached, so I cancelled and rebooked at the lower rate. We ended up paying about $85 average per night. The location is decent, and with the hotel being smaller, it's easy to navigate. While not as spectacular as the Bellagio or some of the pricier hotels, it served its purpose. I would probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay”
Reviews.Author: Marymary02
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo 3-6 to 3-10. Check-in at 4 pm was a breeze,very helpful staff answered our questions as we had not been to Las Vegas before. We had a room on the 23rd floor, on the south end,faced the mountains. Be aware...there is a huge construction project to the north of the hotel. We heard very little noise, but they are working 24/7.The main pool was open (a little too chilly to swim), the lazy river and wave pool are being worked on currently.Deluxe room was very clean, nice bathroom, drain no problem. Compared to others we saw, this is a smaller hotel, and very easy to navigate which is nice. This was the only casino where I won on the slots.We had a $25 comp for the restaurants, used it on the buffet for dinner and it was really good food.Nice to have Starbucks right there, the food court would be good for younger kids.Cab from/to airport was $12.I would recommend the buffets at the Belagio and the Wynn for brunch on weekends. Le Reve was a fabulous show.Signs to the monorail are confusing, will lead you through the casinos first and then the rail.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fun bar”
Reviews.Author: travelingrules
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, beautiful lobby, nice bright rooms. I took one point away because they tried to charge us more than the internet rate we got on expedia. They insisted on the higher price, which was an $80 difference!!! Even with proof printed out with confirmation numbers, it still took a lot of time and talk to get the lower price. Other than that, the Italian restaurant was decent, though not amazing. We had a $25 credit with our package which made the average food more stomachable, as the prices were higher than average. The pool scene was pretty empty, and there was no outside bar, with horrendous waitress service considering there was barely anyone out there to take care of. Some reviews complained that there is nothing to do here, but Diablo's bar is fun and gets very crowded later at night, but without the attitude of some of the other Vegas cheeseball clubs. The music is decent, there's room to dance, the people are pretty nice and fun and there are no snotty lines or ropes. The plastic spray-tan chicks and the Eurotrash wanna-bes that love them are kept to a minimum here, which in my book equals good nightlife. The upstairs outdoor patio is a nice feature, and with lots of tables put in close proximity together, it encourages and makes it easier to talk to your neighbors. The staff is great. I also liked the toiletries a lot. I would definitely come back, but make sure I saved my receipt from online booking!

Reviews.Title: “Just not worth it.........”
Reviews.Author: Shanan K
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were at this hotel a couple of weeks after the fire. They really need to let people know about the new CityCenter complex next door (north) to the Monte Carlo. It will not be completed until late 2009. We had to switch rooms 3 times during our stay. They first gave us a 2 queen bed room when we requested a king. We went back to the front desk, and they gave us a handicap king room on the 14th floor, next to the construction site. Now, I don’t really care about the view, but I do care that the construction workers work 24/7!! All night long, I could hear banging, crashing, beeping, drilling, sawing, and various other noises. Needless to say, there was no sleep to be had. In the morning I marched down to the info desk and requested to speak to a manager. I explained to him that no one in their right mind would pay upwards of $200 a night to sleep next to a working construction site! I played the travel agent card and explained that I was on a Familiarization trip and would also be reviewing their hotel and sharing it with my agency. The manager promptly placed us on the opposite side of the hotel, away from the construction and also gave us a $50 food credit, although he did not specify WHERE we could use the food credit. That room was fine. I don't think I would have been so upset if we had gotten the last room to begin with. The buffet was actually very good. We ate ther twice.The hotel was rated AAA 4 diamonds but I would consider it a 3 diamond at best. When we went to check out, they tried to charge us for the $50 food credit because we didn’t use it at the right place. I told her that they never specified where we could use the credit. She got a manager on the phone and took the extra $ off after talking to the manager for 5 minutes. I will never stay there or recommend it again.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special about this place...”
Reviews.Author: melargo
Reviews.Content: Lots of 24/7 construction going on next door at the City View Center . This time of year there are many other resort/hotel options to choose from in Vegas that are equal to if not better than the Monte Carlo. I should've opted for the Westin Casuarina off strip or maybe even one of the Marriotts.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: EMA375
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at the Monte Carlo. It is a fairly small hotel in comparison to the others. Fantastic visit! We spent the early afternoons by the pool--get there early though because it fills up quickly--and the evenings on the strip. Our room was very clean and the halls very quiet. Overall, a very enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Lucky Escape”
Reviews.Author: VJJ_07
Reviews.Content: Hopeless! Stayed during the fire - never got to sleep in my bed. Nothing short of incompetant. No fire alarms on floor 24 No signs for fire exists Lifts still working with people in at 11.15am Called from UK to tell us our hotel was on fire! No staff - they all ran away!!! staff argueing with firefighters in the lobby on how to get people out! No guest register - we couldnt find members of our party till after 6! Booked into different hotels. Whilst we're here - people dont pack you suitcases and get in the lift with them Paper thin walls - you really here everything from next door!!! Pure good luck this didnt turn out worse, only as the firefighters sorted out the fire it didnt get chance to take hold. You take your life in your hands staying here!!

Reviews.Title: “nice but!!!!”
Reviews.Author: playitsafe
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Monte Carlo for three years on the run, have always been pleased with the service and staff etc. Food is a bit of a shortfall you really need to eat out. The worst is the group of hookers who hang around near the lifts at weekends, mentioned it to the security but they said there was little you could do, however they are not as obvious at other casinos.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated, but nice”
Reviews.Author: Craps_Shooter18
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo a week before the fire, and we enjoyed our stay. As the hotel may be in need of renovation, it was still above average, and much nicer than some of the rooms at Excalibur or Tropicana. The room was nothing special, just a standard hotel room, that is done up a little bit fancier than most. The bathroom was very nice, except that the drain in the shower was slow. The bedsheets were too small, so they got bunched up in the night, but it was nothing to complain about. I had no problems with noise from the construction site. Upon check- in, we asked the attendant for a room that would not be noisy. He said thath he could give us a quieter room, but it would not have as good a view. We took the noiser room with the better view and had no problems with any noise. It was a great plave to stay for $89/night. No major complaints at all, except for the boring walk when you go past the city center construction site.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: nofate21
Reviews.Content: was i lil scared considering the revies about noise and construction. this was not problem at all. check in was very easy, got to choose for a couple o different rooms choose 11 floor, hadslightly obstuctive view of strip (blocked to the north, clear view of the south). room was great very large, bed & everything was fine. shower was great. buffet was ok, nothing spectacular, but above average for vegas. location was great had MGM, NEW york new york, and planet hollywood was all close. and belligo & caesars are wthin walking distance. the only problem was the parking...self parking ws very limited due to constructio and valet always takes a while plus the tip every time. but would defintely stay again

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: DDBKent
Reviews.Content: Excellant service - 24 hours. Well equipped rooms, small shopping arcade, we enjoyed the casino, bars and restaurants, felt very comforatable. The only issue was that the pool area got very busy as the pool is not partucularly large. Used the spa area a couple of times - again great service and moderate prices for the USA. Loved Vegas and all its sights - so we did'nt spend too much time in the hotel. The hotel is in a great location mid - way along the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Despite chaos during fire, stay was fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: LoveCalgary
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at 9:00 am and after a 5 minute wait in line to check-in (lobby located at back of hotel), we were pleasantly greeted by the check-in girl. She said that unfortunately, they didn’t have a non-smoking, king room ready until 3:00 pm (which is actually their check-in time) but, she did offer some suggestions – upgrade to a suite or 2 queen beds or smoking room, etc. One of the offers sounded good so we accepted a room on the ‘Club’ floor. It was a regular, king non-smoking room but for an extra $35/night, we had access to a 24-hour concierge right on the floor and use of the club room which provided snacks and drinks to club guests from 7:00 am to 10:00 pm (alcoholic drinks were served bet. 4:00-8:00 only). For the extra $140 in total, we thought it was well worth it. If this is something you can afford, I would definitely recommend it (once the club room is available again). My husband and I enjoyed talking to new people in the club room while we had our pre-dinner glass of wine and nibbles, not to mention access to bottled water and snacks at any time (this was a huge plus for me personally). The club floor (32) was only accessible by the guests staying on the floor. To access the floor, you had to use your room key in the elevator. The set of elevators (one and only) are close to the lobby and you don’t walk through the casino to get to them. The room itself was a standard hotel room with a high ceiling and larger than normal bathroom that was all in limestone with black granite counter/sink. The toilet worked great; water pressure in the shower/bath was very good and drainage was also good. It was a clean room and looked a bit worn, but in great shape (no scrapes, chips, burn marks, etc.). Bed was clean and fresh with lots of pillows (6?). We overlooked the back of NY NY and freeways. There was a concrete plant directly below which was a bit noisy at times but we always had the window opened so I’m sure that contributed to the noise (didn’t bother us though). The TV was a large flat screen and worked well. We did notice that most of the channels were either news, hotel or ‘politics’ related. There was a safe in the front closet that worked very well. We had ample drawer space for our clothes. The hotel itself has more of a rich, warm feeling as compared to some of the other ‘theme’ type hotels, which really appealed to us. And it isn’t huge and hard to maneuver around, again like some of the other big resorts. There were plenty of penny slots to play and some actually kept me going for hours with only spending $20-$30. I would say the only negative thing about the hotel is the buffet. In my opinion, it does not match the rest of the hotel both in atmosphere and cleanliness, but also in service and taste. I would rate it 5 out of 10, at best. We feel that the best buffet we’ve tried in Vegas so far is Bellagio which surprisingly, wasn’t even much more money than the MC ($27.95 vs. $25.95?). We also tried MGM buffet, which I would rate as 6-7 out of 10. We did not try any other eatery at MC (other than Starbucks, which seemed pretty consistent in quality as other Starbucks). About the fire – I was in the casino when my husband, who had just returned on a bus from the concrete show and saw flames atop the hotel, came up behind me and quietly said there was a fire and that we should leave. He had first tried going up the elevator upon returning to the hotel because he thought I was up in our room but security stopped him and did not allow anyone to go up. After gratefully finding me, we walked out of the hotel while most people were still unaware of anything happening. As we stood outside looking at the fire, it became apparent that the hotel was being evacuated because hoards of people started lining the streets and parking lots. After approx. 2 minutes, guests were being directed into NY NY for further instruction. In my opinion, the crowds were being moved as swiftly and efficiently as possible, considering the circumstances. We were actually going to be checking out that day and flying home to Calgary, Canada but unfortunately had nothing on us but the clothes on our back and our wallets. No passports, phones, clothes – virtually everything was left in the room. We decided that rather than sticking around, we would go directly to the airport and try to fly home. We knew it was going to take quite some time to sort things out and because our room was located on the very top floor, where the fire was, it would probably take even longer to get anything out. Fortunately, we found an airport shuttle sitting at the MGM hotel (where guests were eventually re-directed to) and managed to make our flight home that afternoon as scheduled (huge thanks to US Airways and Customs for allowing us to fly and get home). Unfortunately, we had to leave behind everything that we took down with us. We are still trying to sort it out with the hotel, but in any case, are very grateful that there wasn’t any tragic loss of life. Hopefully, we’ll get closure soon by either getting our goods back or negotiating a settlement with the hotel. In any case, at this point, I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fire at the Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: nancygv
Reviews.Content: We were recently at the Monte Carlo during the fire on the upper floors. The Monte Carlo along with the staff's at their sister hotels MGM and Mandalay Bay did an exceptional job of handling a very stressful situation. They did their best to accomodate all the needs of the people affected by the fire. I have nothing but respect for all they did that day and how well they kept their cool and remainded pleasant even tho they were dealing with a lot of stressed people and were as exhausted as we were. I would not hesitate to stay at any of their properties.

Reviews.Title: “Yes, I'm giving a good review after the fire!”
Reviews.Author: HomebodyTraveller
Reviews.Content: We were guests at the Monte Carlo on 1/25/2008 when the fire occurred. From another review, I can see that not everyone had a smooth experience. But everyone in my party walked away from the event unharmed AND impressed with the hotel's ability to work out the logistics of reassigning 3000+ guests. Our first night (pre-fire) I was impressed with the hotel. Some reviews here were very critical of the property so I didn't know what to expect before we checked in. However, our room (a Monaco suite) was large, clean, and well-appointed. My friends who were staying in standard rooms were also satisfied. We were looking forward to a very pleasant three-night stay. Obviously that didn't quite work out! It was true that the hotel was not quick about evacuating. We were among those outside of the hotel who called people inside the building to report the smoke pouring off the roof and to tell them to leave. We heard similar tales from others. What we also heard is that false alarms are fairly common. I assume this contributed to the staff's reticence about moving people out promptly. As it happened, when this occurred we were about to embark on a Hoover Dam tour which took us out of the city for several hours. But our friends who stayed behind kept us posted with regular updates. They were promptly taken to the MGM Grand's Garden Arena, and they were assigned new rooms (at the MGM Signature property) well before 1pm. When we spoke to them at 1:15 they were raving about the quality of their new rooms and about to head out for Margaritas. When we returned to go through the process hours later, we had the benefit of time; whatever glitches they may have had earlier (and my friends had not encountered many) were worked out. They had available for us cell phone chargers (free to take), water, sandwiches, fresh fruit, desserts, a few internet stations, and Red Cross workers galore to help with urgent things. We didn't need anything in particular, so we joined a quick-moving line where the Monte Carlo staff took down some info before directing us to shuttles going to another property. On the street there were two different shuttles available going to different hotels, and we picked the one we wanted to be at and hopped on. Check in at the new place was painless. We did not have our luggage or anything but what we had on our backs. However, we were given an update via a note under our door at the new hotel--yes, our new hotel already had tracked what guests were Monte Carlo refugees--and at 9 pm got a voicemail in our new room with explicit directions about how to catch a shuttle back to the hotel for our stuff. Nothing was damaged or missing, and again the hotel had in a place a well-thought-out system for moving people through and back to their new hotels. A colleague who was on a fire-damaged floor had a longer delay, and one was not allowed to go to her room (on floor 29) but hotel staff packed for her. But we had our stuff by 10 pm. Was it disruptive? Yes. Did we lose some time? Yes. Did we regret that our group ended up in three different hotels? Yes. But all in all, we were impressed with the efficient way our transfer was handled. The hotel management had to swing a lot of people into action and commandeer a lot of shuttles and other resources. They had to contact the dispatchers of every cab company and tour company in the city. They had to find out how many guests could go to which other properties. It must have been a logistic nightmare, but they did it well from my viewpoint. We came into contact with a lot of other "refugees" and nearly every one of them was taking it in stride. Many of them had bigger complications than we did (had to delay their departure, had a Monte Carlo wedding planned, etc) but most people seemed to feel well-taken care of, both by Monte Carlo and by the management at other properties. I wouldn't want to go through a hotel fire again, and I wouldn't wish the experience on anyone. But as things stand now I have very few complaints about the way the Monte Carlo handed a difficult situation. I'm so grateful no one was seriously injured, and that this just became a memorable adventure. I would gladly be a guest at the Monte Carlo or any other MGM property again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value!”
Reviews.Author: tallchic1
Reviews.Content: I just returned home from our second stay at the Monte Carlo. I have stayed at many hotels in Las Vegas and none of them have been perfect. Some of the reviews I have read about this hotel might scare you away from staying here. The construction noise is still going on but I am a light sleeper and I was able to sleep just fine, staying on the 17th floor facing the construction. The rooms are very clean. The casino is very well laid out and I never got turned around like I do in most hotels. We were very surprised to learn there are 3000 rooms in this hotel as it does not seem crowded at all and we did not have to wait in any lines at check in. There is no parking garage but it is a very short walk to park across the street and then you can walk in the side door very close to the elevators. We paid a great rate off of their website - only 49 dollars! I have never stayed anywhere in Vegas so cheaply. At this rate, this hotel is a steal and is heads above other hotels you would find for this rate. I only have one complaint and it is about the Wireless Internet access. It is 12.99 to hook up for 24 hours , but at the rate we paid for the room I can understand. If I had paid over a hundred dollars I would have got upset with the management as we were there for a convention and needed internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Short stay due to fire”
Reviews.Author: Bandman614
Reviews.Content: My wife and I checked into the Monte Carlo on Thursday. Friday morning was the fire, so I can't review much of the amenities (and even these may change as the hotel opens), but I needed to add my voice in regards to the hotel's response to the crisis. Yes, we were evacuated, however in short order, every casino's electronic sign on the south end of the strip was modified to tell Monte Carlo guests to report to the MGM Garden Arena to check in. Once there, the guests were fed, and tended to by the Red Cross disaster relief. I know another review here was critical, but I thought the MGM response was adequate. Our needs were taken care of. Efforts were made to assist people who had left medication in their hotel rooms. Most people didn't have the information to answer the questions people had, but it's like that with any disaster scenario. The MGM response was not poor, it was very acceptable. Relocating 5000 individuals is not a "flip the switch" action. Around 5pm, we were relocated to the MGM Signature Suites, which was a beautiful all-suite tower a whopping 15 minute walk (all indoors) to the strip. Around 11pm, we got a voicemail from the Monte Carlo staff that floors 3-26 were able to recover their belongings, and that shuttles would be provided to transport us. This took about an hour from the time we boarded the shuttle. Most of this time was traffic in the parking lot, since it obviously wasn't made to handle that sort of throughput. Inside the hotel, the staff was numerous, and everyone had a dedicated function. Retrieving our things went very smoothly, and we signed a paper stating that there was no damage. In the end, we ended up staying at a Suite for the price of the Monte Carlo, all our expenses which were charged to the room in Monte Carlo were comped, and we have a story to tell our friends and someday our children. Once they refit the hotel, and remove the flammable foam siding from the outside, I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: mumthetourist
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Monte Carlo for 3 nights. It was easy to find driving in on the I-15 from LA. We were lucky to find a car space in the closest carpark to the entrance. The staff were helpful and friendly. We had to wait a while to check in. They couldn't find us interconnecting rooms (we had 2 rooms) but gave us 2 which were down the hall from each other. We had booked our accommodation 8 months beforehand so that was a little annoying. When we got to the room it was on the 7th floor and overlooked the construction site. I wasn't happy so we went back down to the lady we had checked in with and after a bit of humming and arhing she found us interconnecting rooms on the 29th floor overlooking the strip! The rooms were clean and comfortabel but a bar fridge/ tea/coffee machine would have been appreciated. The toilet in our kids room blocked but they did send someone up to fix it fairly quickly and all was good after that. It was in a good position. The Duece bus stop was right out the front, the Tix4tonite was just across the road. We found the breakfast buffet was good value and they had a variety of other places to eat as well. They also had a shop which sold milk etc near the foyer. There is also a Pharmacy just outside the Monte Carlo which sold groceries etc. We are not gamblers so don't know much about the Casino side of it! We loved the Monte Carlo and would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Our experience was great!”
Reviews.Author: copas1
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I just loved the beauty of this place. We never had any issues with the staff or roomservice. Everyone made us feel as comfortably as possible. It's location is great and the we had a strip view room which was excellent! When we go back, It's going to be at the Monte Carlo we stay! We have stayed at the Monte Carlo twice now and will return!

Reviews.Title: “Losing it's appeal...”
Reviews.Author: Sparky176c
Reviews.Content: This was our tenth trip to Las Vegas and fifth time staying at the Monte Carlo. It is in need of a major overhaul. The beauty of years past are all but gone. Worn out carpeting, scratched up walls, poor food quality, and the City Center construction next door really took the "grand" feeling away from the place. The construction noise went on 24/7! Five pounds of stuff crammed into a two pound bag. Even the employees were nowhere as nice as our past visits. I don't know if it changed from MGM buying the Monte Carlo, but we will be staying and playing elsewhere on our next trip. What a shame.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo - Awesome!!”
Reviews.Author: nebraskagirl33
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo Jan 17th - Jan 21st and had a fabulous time (3 gals out on a long weekend break from husbands and kids). Have been to Vegas several times over the past 10 years and have stayed all over the strip and downtown. The Monte Carlo was a very nice place to stay and play. The rooms were fine - comparable to Luxor, MGM and Bally's. The casino at the hotel is a nice change of pace - not as hectic as the other hotel/casino's - so was a nice break to come "home" to after a day of sight-seeing and playing at the other casino's. Staff was very friendly and attenative, check-in was a breeze - we we're able to check in at noon on a Thursday and were giving a room on the 29th floor away from the construction and had a great view of the strip. Too cool to visit the pool area - but it looked nice. Overall - great stay, great hotel, nice casino. Would stay again. One Negative Note ... breakfast buffet is awesome - but the dinner buffet was horrible and not worth the 20 bucks.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Mich8217
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a 2 night stay at the Monte Carlo. I was disappointed on the quality of the room, especially a strip hotel. I found the room a little small and the bathroom to be basic. I've been to Doubletree Hotel rooms to be bigger and more comfortable. I found my bed to be very uncomfortable and blankets to be very worn out. i found the 2 blankets given to be look old and very "used" so we ended up only sleeping with the sheet. I did get a great rate on my hotel ( use the word "escape" for a current room promo.) 2 Free Buffets,2 Drinks 2 Spa admissions & $10 Slot Play. Due to my great rate, I'm able to offset my disappointment of this hotel. We stayed on the 11th floor facing the strip and part of the construction. I did hear faint sounds from construction but nothing too disturbing. The walls are thin and you will hear your neighbor taking a shower but besides that, i had pretty quite neighbors. Parking was no problem but i was here during the week. I would be nervous during the weekend since the parking area really isn't too big. We ate at the buffet with our free coupons and it was okay. Let's just say i'm happy we didn't pay for it. The Spa was nice, i would go again. Overall, i can only give the MC 3 Stars because of the great deal i got, but if i had to pay full price, i would probably give it 2 stars. If you want more bang for the buck, check out the South Point Casino.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, smaller hotel”
Reviews.Author: alias2_u
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Monte Carlo on a Thurs - Sun in January. We requested a high room floor and therefore could not check in until 5pm. Our room was on the 20th floor and had a decent view of MGM, NYNY, Paris & of course the construction. The outside construction noise was not a problem, however the walls are very thin and if you have a neighbor, you will be able to hear their conversation. This was the major downfall. Otherwise, the room was fine, decorated nicely with a very comfortable bed. The bathroom was standard, with a basic tub/shower. The casino is smaller than many, and slightly quieter but that was ok by me. The spa was very nice with a cold plunge pool, jacuzzi, steam room, sauna & nice fitness center. The only restaurant we ate at was the buffet which was fine for breakfast, but not so interesting for dinner. Not quite as much selection as many have. All in all I did enjoy my stay here and would stay again, the only hesitancy is due to the sound quality of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paulgavin
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for three nights with some friends in late 2006. We got the hotel online at an excellent rate! Check in at the hotel was reasonably quick and hassle free. The check in desk is as big as an airport check in desk!!The whole reception area is done in like a marble finish, absoloutely beautiful. The hotel room was very clean and comfortable with an amazing view of the main Vegas strip, although you had to bypass the construction work at the Ballagio. The Monte Carlo has everything you need so you don't have to leave the hotel (like all Vegas hotels, they want you to spend your money there rather than in another hotel). It is equipped with different eateries, shops and a lovely outdoor pool but the main attraction about this hotel is that it has its own micro brewery! For just $19 you can buy a pitcher of 6 pints! This beer is 6.5% alcohol, alot stronger than your average beer. The bar itself is quite big and has a great atmosphere. We drank there every night before heading out. The casino is the same as any other Vegas casino but still great fun once you know your limit! Location wise, its perfectly situated between the Ballagio and the New York New York and directly across the street from the MGM Grand. I would definately recommend this hotel for a great stay in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stroppers
Reviews.Content: This was our second time at the Monte Carlo. We booked it because of the price for the location - next door (ish) to the Bellagio and opposite MGM. You get what you pay for - not one of the plushist hotels on the strip, but certainly better than some others! It isn't the biggest or at all gimmicky, but we quite like this. The rooms are comfortable and clean. We had no problem with noise, although we can see how you would if roomed near the construction site next door! Parking was a problem - we ended up in New York New York's parking lot and had to walk across with all of our luggage. Suppose we could have valet parked though if it had bothered us that much! Check in queues were horrendous, but when we reached the desk, the process was quick and simple - don't know why everyone in front of us seemed to take so long! Would highly recommend Sir Galahad's Steakhouse in Excliber, and the Top of the World Restaurant in the Strastophere for a special occasion!

Reviews.Title: “Not what it use to be”
Reviews.Author: Lovetotravel720
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Monte Carlo 2 nights in Jan. 08. The place is not kept up like it use to be. Paper thin walls, that we had to listen to people and their conversations, and crying babies. By the way, who takes a baby to a Casino?? There use to be beautiful arrangements on every floor when you exited the elevators. Now there is just an empty table. I noticed letters missing off signs telling you where to go in the Casino. Just stuff like that. That if I'm paying that much for a room, I expect more of the hotel. It cant really hold a candle to the Bellagio, Venetian or Caesars Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Got Married Here it was great”
Reviews.Author: Chilly25
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel. A group of 20 of us stayed here a mix of ages from 24 years to 68 years both first timers and return visitors of Vegas. We booked this through expedia and we arranged to get married here directly with the hotel and they were fantastic. Everything was perfect and stress free! Great photos taken within the grounds by resident photographer (Cashman). Flowers wonderful and all staff great. Nice hotel and casino not as themed as some of them but this makes no difference, Really great rooms (especially the beds). Good variety of places to eat cheap and chearful (McDonalds plus others) and some classier places too. Great pub near the hotel loby. Lovely pool area. Would stay here again if there weren't so many other hotels to try! Everyone in the party loved this one.

Reviews.Title: “Better the second time around”
Reviews.Author: The_Mystic
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo back in August. It was our second time at the hotel. Our first time wasn't that great and my wife wrote them a letter to express her disappointment. The hotel actually called us to apologize and offered to comp us to a suite the next time we were in Vegas, so we took them up on it. We like the restaurants and the casino because they never seemed to be too busy, and the hotel isn't that large that you get lost. If you're looking for a busy place or a lot of entertainment, go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Clean”
Reviews.Author: sugerkat
Reviews.Content: Not super-themed like some of the bigger places but we had a nicely appointed room on the 31st floor with a view of New York, New York. It was clean and the staff was nice. Decent location and we didn't have any trouble with noise as they are building another juggernaught right next door. The price was perfect. After all, when you are in Vegas, you really don't spend too much time in the room. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a great value (usually!)”
Reviews.Author: ACG580
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo is a good property. It is not a 5 star hotel, but a good value for the money most of the time. Sometimes the rates are very high and if you are staying in Vegas during a peak time, you will probably get a better value elsewhere. The rooms are clean but beginning to show age. Check-In is pretty fast and organized. Employees are helpful and friendly. Overall, I would recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “OK Rooms, Great Prices”
Reviews.Author: bkimberly
Reviews.Content: Monte Carlo is a great choice if you aren't planning on spending a lot of time in the room and you have a budget. The standard room cost us $79 a night and it was plainly appointed with a comfy bed. Don't expect anything fancy--no minibar or microwave or fridge. The rooms are clean and the staff is friendly. Check-in is a slow process, so just stay calm and don't take it out on the representative---it's management's fault that they don't hire enough people. Overall, we liked the Monte Carlo for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed stay at the MC Vegas”
Reviews.Author: MicheleSW
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice with large rooms and friendly people for hotel and casino staff. We paid exorbitant rates for the convention and expected top notch accomodations. Our tub filled up but I can only count on one hand the number of times a tub has not been clogged in a hotel. The casinos cater to an older crowd but it's less busy than other hotels. The hotel is convenient to most things but for the same price I'd probably pick MGM Grand. I didn't see the rooms there but you don't travel to stay in the room!

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly nice hotel...”
Reviews.Author: zabb333
Reviews.Content: As my trip to the Monte Carlo this January neared, I was worried about the hotel due to all of the negative reviews on Trip Advisor. I decided not to cancel the booking, however, and I am pleased that I did not. The Monte Carlo has about 3000 rooms in it, and is located on the southern end of the strip. The location is basically unbeatable since it offers easy access to the five hotels south of it (Hooters, MGM Grand, Excalibur, Luxor, Mandalay Bay) and also great access to hotels just north of it. After suffering through a 1.5 hour shuttle ride back from the airport by a new driver (I highly recommend you take a cab, not a shuttle), we arrived at the Monte Carlo. We were checked in around 2 PM, an hour before the promised check in time. They had about 10 lines open to check customers in and the wait was only around 15 minutes. We booked with the “CHILL” promotion (good until Feb. 1, use promotion code “CHILL”) which gave us 4 free buffets, 2 spa admissions (the gym + sauna/steam room/Jacuzzi) and some free slot play and drinks. The room was very nice, and for the four of us it offered plenty of room. Contrary to the other reviews on the site, the room we stayed in was very clean. The bathroom is also pretty roomy and the water pressure in the shower is excellent. The maid didn’t give us quite enough pillows, towels, cups or shampoo, but after calling down to the front desk at midnight it was promptly brought up. The one main downside of the room was that the bathroom has no fan. So that you don’t stay in the room all day, the TV in the room has only basic cable. You get the Vegas propaganda channel along with about 20 other stations. There is no HBO or other premium stations in the room. The spa at the hotel was very nice and if you want they will give you a tour of it. The cost is 19 dollars for gym use or 22 for gym + sauna/hot tub + shower use. Because we had 2 spa admissions we decided to try out everything they had to offer. We worked out in their very nice gym (weight machines, cardio, free weights), and then showered and used the steam room, dry heat room, Jacuzzi and cold pool. The friendly staff explained everything to us including how long we should ideally stay in each room or pool. They also brought us towels and bottled waters. Even the bathroom in the spa was nice, and they provide disposable razors and shaving cream so that you can shave when you are there. We used the buffet coupons for dinner one night and were very pleased with the selection. The buffet was probably in the upper echelon of the others we encountered in Vegas. On that note, don’t waste your money on the cheap 12 dollar buffets. You really do get what you pay for. The buffet in the Paris hotel was probably the best in town, and I recommend that you get there at about 10:45 and pay the breakfast rate and then stay around as they switch everything over to lunch. This trick works for any of the buffets. Since there isn’t any seating in all of Vegas except for at the slot machines, it is a nice respite from walking to take in a relaxing meal. The Casino in the Monte Carlo was one of the worst of all of them on the strip. Just because you are staying at the hotel doesn’t mean you should waste any of your time at the casino there. The ambience is boring, and the dealers look like they hate their jobs. I played some craps, roulette, and blackjack at the casino but the experience was nothing compared to playing at places like Excalibur or Mandalay Bay. The casino at Monte Carlo is also very small. It is about a quarter of the size of most of the casinos on the strip, and at any given time about 70% of Monte Carlo’s tables lie abandoned since nobody wants to play there. At one end of the casino is the Monte Carlo’s lackluster nightclub/restaurant. Drinks are 8 dollars each and the place looks far less interesting than many of the other upscale lounges on the strip or even in the other casinos. Overall, the Monte Carlo served as a great jumping off point to the bigger and better things to do on the strip. It was a nice place to sleep, very safe, and the concierge and front desk were very helpful. Out in the front of the hotel the staff also can direct you to lines of waiting taxis and limos. I definitely think that almost any group will be completely content with the Monte Carlo, although my recommendation would be to take a hike along the strip and visit other casinos before spending a single dollar of gambling money. If you are going to win or lose big, the Monte Carlo is just not the place to do it. Feel free to contact me if you have any questions about the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: sailordude_sd
Reviews.Content: Stayed at MC 1/1-1/4. Room was clean our room was on the back side facing NYNY so we didn't experience the construction noise mentioned in other reviews. Ate at the buffet for breakfast and it was very good. Actually had 2 $5 blackjack tables but were usually full. The only negative is the MC no longer has a parking a garage only a lot across from the entrance which was usually full so we had to park at the NYNY garage and walk. Overall very nice stay and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Watch for construction noise!”
Reviews.Author: WindsorTenor
Reviews.Content: This was our third trip to the Monte Carlo. The rooms continue to be large and clean. Front desk and other staff were polite and efficient. NOTE: With the ongoing construction of City Center, the Monte Carlo may not be the best choice if you get a room facing the North or West side of the hotel. Trucks and construction start up very early (7:10 am EVERY day). Loud enough to wake us up each morning. Request a room facing South East!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay at the Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: KH54828
Reviews.Content: We were married in Las Vegas, and spent a couple of our nights at the Monte Carlo. We liked it for many reasons, one being that it is not a mega resort that a lot of people pass through to see different attractions (like the Bellagio or similar or Mirage). Although there were quite a few people, it wasn't overflowing and we didn't encounter many long lines for restaurants, etc. The hotel was clean and th staff was helpful, especially housekeeping. We stayed in a spa suite, which had a fairly large bathroom w/steam shower, hot tub, and wet bar. The room itself was quite large compared to other rooms I have stayed in. I apologize for the clutter in the pictures.....it was right before the wedding and we were digging through our luggage to make sure we had everything for the wedding!!

Reviews.Title: “What I expected for the price”
Reviews.Author: almey1014
Reviews.Content: We went for a package (A & H)- so it was a great deal. That's why we chose it. Great location on the strip. I asked for a room away from the construction and we got it. The room was average, comforters were stained- gross. Our t.v. did not work properly and had to ask 2 days to get it fixed and it was never done. Spend the extra $ and stay somewhere else if you will be spending a lot of time in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Chapel & stay at Monte Carlo - good & bad!”
Reviews.Author: jdisney
Reviews.Content: This is a slightly belated review of our wedding & stay at Monte Carlo, Las Vegas - grab a cup of tea as it's going to be a long one!! We had originally booked our wedding ceremony & stay at Monte Carlo for 2 weeks in total, back in June 2006, having previously stayed here for New Years Eve 2003/2004 and being impressed with everything to do with the hotel. Only after booking did I happen to look at Trip Advisor, just to browse comments.I was shocked at how many people had given negative reviews because of the nearby construction. I contacted the wedding co-ordinator who advised that there was a lot of construction going on, and it did affect the accomodation side of the hotel, but not the wedding chapel. We decided to keep the wedding here, but reduced accomodation to just 2 nights - the night before & the night of the wedding. For the rest of our stay, we booked Paris. We arrived in Vegas on 3rd May, and headed to Paris (see my seperate review - superb!). As we were in the taxi, I could not believe the extent of the construction work next door to Monte Carlo, and we were so pleased we decided to change hotels for the main part of our stay. There were cranes everywhere, and the area of construction is huge. Accomodation: I checked into Monte Carlo on 7th May, leaving my now husband to stay in Paris - we wanted to keep some wedding traditions, even though it was a Vegas wedding! - check in was very quick, I explained to the receptionist that I was staying & getting married at the hotel, and asked for a good room. I was given a room on the 24th floor, overlooking some of NYNY & MGM Grand. The room was a little tired & basic compared to the fantastic room we had in Paris. Overall it was clean, had 2 king beds, a decent bathroom & storage space. It was quite basic though, and felt like it needed a new carpet & lick of paint. It had lost some of the grandeur of my previous stay. I was given a room with an interconnecting door to the room next door, and although it remained closed I could hear some conversations & general noise, but not too much to stop me sleeping. I felt very safe staying in the hotel by myself even though I went out with friends for dinner & didnt arrive back at the hotel until fairly late. The pool area leaves a lot to be desired - they seemed to have reduced the size since my last stay to accomodate construction work, and you literally had to crawl across sunbeds to get to one in the middle as the rows of beds touched eachother at the foot & head end - you had to get on well with the people sitting near you!!! We could hear everyones conversations as we were sitting so close. To be honest, you may as well be sitting on a building site in your bikini as all you could hear was the noise of trucks, cranes & blocks being dropped or stacked. You also had to move several times to chase the sun - we only sat by the pool from around 9am-12pm, and had to move at least 3 times. The hotel sits on top of the pool so areas get shaded very quickly. In all fairnes though, this was 7 months ago so things may have changed by now. After the wedding, check out was quick & easy and we found staff to be friendly. We did check out very early on the morning of the wedding though as we wanted to get back to Paris which seemed like pure luxury compared to the Monte Carlo. The casino is actually very good - people we travelled with usually went to the MC casino from Paris as they found the dealers friendlier, the atmosphere good & they won more often!! It's handy to have the foodcourt, especially 24hr Starbucks. We ate in Dragon Noodle & used the salon, but more on that in the wedding chapel review. I would recommend this hotel if you are on a budget (rooms are v cheap at the moment) and in Vegas to party, gamble or sight see and wont be in the room much. The location of the hotel is good, but be prepared to get dusty as you walk towards Bellagio due to all the construction work - it was going on next to the MC and also on the opposite side of the Strip at Planet Hollywood so there was always a permanentdust cloud around. I would stay here again if my budget was guiding me, as it's worth it to be in Vegas! I would still rather stay here then further down the strip at Circus Circus/Stratosphere which are only a tiny bit cheaper. Wedding Chapel: This is the GOOD part of the MC! From our very first enquiry until our return to the UK, the service we received was outstanding. Our wedding co-ordinator - Michele - was fantastic, and was happy to promptly answer (lots of!) emails in the run up to the big day. She answered every question, no matter how big or small & was always so friendly. We booked the Tiffany package which covered everything we wanted. The type of flowers I wanted were not listed as part of the package so I emailed a photo of the style I wanted and the florist done a fantastic job of putting these together for us - the florist loved them so much, they have now added them to their package as an option!! On our 2nd day in Vegas we went to the MC to meet with Michele & give her our license & run through the day. It was like meeting an old friend and we knew that we had made the right decision in keeping our ceremony here rather then move it due to construction. She was happy for us to provide our own ceremony music & was so flexible in making the day personal to us with our requirements. The actual chapel is very kitsch and very 'Vegas' but we loved it. The minister was great and made us feel very relaxed and comfortable. The wedding was broadcast live on the internet for absent friends and remained on there for 30 days - I thought at approx $55 this was excellent value. The photographer was ok, but I'm glad that we had booked another photographer (De Simone Photography - highly recommend) to take us on a photo tour of Vegas after the ceremony, as it all felt very rushed and she didnt really ask me who I wanted in which photos and even left my Dad out of 1 family picture, despite me saying several times that he needed to be in it! As soon as the ceremony was over we were given a gift bag which included the wedding on DVD (good quality), champagne & other bits & pieces - this was all included in the Tiffany package. I had a manicure & my hair styled at the Salon in the hotel, and although they done an excellent job & it was exactly as I asked them, I thought it was a little pricey at just under $200 - I only had my hair curled, not put up and a basic manicure. However I couldnt have done a job half as good as they did, and I only get married once! We had our wedding breakfast at the Dragon Noodle restaurant after a few drinks in the Brewery pub - the food was good, but completely lacked atmosphere and this was the 1 thing we would change about the day - it didnt feel 'special' enough. The staff made no reference to the wedding, even though I was sitting there in a dress & veil - they treated us like we were on a normal night out. Our wedding photos were ready to be viewed the next morning and we were able to choose a decent amount as part of the package. Additional photos were expensive but we only bought a few more as we had also been on a photo tour after the ceremony so had lots more from the day. To buy the CD of all photos copyright free, it was over $1500 - this is more than double the cost of the entire ceremony!!!! When you consider that our photo tour which lasted 2 hours in a limo, stopping at all of the main hotels, 100 pictures printed in an album & the CD of all pictures copyright free only cost us $600 in total, I think this was a complete rip off!!! Luckily there were only a few more pictures we loved which we had to buy as extra on top of our package so it wasnt too bad, but if we hadnt had the photo tour then it would have ended up very costly as obviously you want all the memories you can get from your special day. I would give the service received from the chapl 9/10 - it would have been 10/10 if the photographer had not been so rushed & pushy with us, and then so blooming expensive!!! The actual day though got a 11/10, and I dont think we could have been any happier at any of the other main strip hotels - it all went smoothly & without any glitches. Thanks to Michele Barker who made the day so perfect. I will try & post some MC pictures when I finally manage to upload them!

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory stay!”
Reviews.Author: paqmkl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night after Christmas. The reception people were courteous and prompt. We got a room on the 31st floor facing the construction, yet it was not a bother. In fact we could see the Bellagio fountains from our room (not a direct view). The room was very comfortable and clean. There was no coffee machine in our room; but they had a food court downstairs with a starbucks. The Cafe was also good. Will consider staying here again despite the construction.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo is Worth a Shot”
Reviews.Author: lettertonoone
Reviews.Content: I was honestly quite disturbed that, after booking my stay at the Monte Carlo, there were so many negative reviews about it on this website. I couldn't change it and went in dreading the possible outcome. Luckily, I was very surprised with the service and the hotel as a whole. Upsides were friendly staff, quick check-in, nice room, comfortable bed, clean bathroom, efficient dealers in the poker room and on tables. The downsides were few: Elevators were malfunctioning during check-out time which caused a decent delay, and because we were closing in on new year's, cheap people like me were nary to find a $5 table of just about any game. But there's plenty of other places to stay, and as far as a quality place to rest your head, this was good!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Excellent Deal”
Reviews.Author: hello17
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying at this hotel. The rooms are very clean, excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “a few flaws”
Reviews.Author: kmm2007
Reviews.Content: Checked in late, December 25th checked out on December 28th. We reserved a room with a view of the strip, for 10.00 extra per night. The view was of the Paris Hotel and the construction sight, which is noisy 24/7. We could not see anything on the other side of the construction sight. We called the front desk. The front desk was very nice and said we could have another room on the 24th floor but with two queen beds not the king we had. We did say that was fine. The view from this room,was of the construction sight and the MGM Grand. We did just decide to stay in the that room. The walls are very thin, one night we listened to a crying baby from 4:00am until 6:00 am. The bathrooms are okay, the bathtub drain was a little slow, but lots of hot water. Upon check out we expressed our disappointment about the lack of view. The hotel did refund our extra $10.00 a night. The hotel also adds a $50.00 a day fee on your VISA "a hold" to cover expenses or damage to the room. After about three to five business days the extra "hold" money comes off your VISA, I am still waiting for the extra money to be credited back to my account. We ate at the Monte Carlo Brew Pub and the meal was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoBuckeye
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on this Hotel. We were a little worried after reading reviews about the construction and the noise. Our room faced the construction - we were on the 27th floor but the noise was not a problem. Yes the construction never stops but it is not disruptive to sleep. The room was very clean. Only complaint was the buffet - we waited a long time in line when there were a ton of empty tables inside. Would definitely recommend this hotel and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “bate and switch”
Reviews.Author: blinders
Reviews.Content: my daughter and i found a pk deal. for this hotel and had read the reviews so we were not excepting a and amazing hotel. we had seen picture of the rooms and i had even talked to them on the phone to make sure it was not an old room.they took my requests that i had made and were very warm on the phone.we checked on dec.24 at 11;oo pm,no wait but the clerks have to call a manger for room to give out. we were told it was a stip view. got to our room and there was a dirty wash cloth on one of the beds ,the view was of walgreens. there was dirt soap in the bathroom and the blankets looked like they had not been cleanedn months and room was small with no place to sit. we left the room and went down to the front desk. they want to charge me for the room !! i ask to speak to the manger he would not come to talk to me but did agree not to charge me. one of the worse things was the lack of caring . we than went to the hyatt off the strip. it was the most amazing hotel i had ever stayed. would never try a srtip hotel again, this was not our first to vegas but it will be our last to hotels on the strip.hyatt is a 5 star hotel with free shuttle to and from the airport, free shuttle to the strip and breakfast for free in the am. good bye strip

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the Price”
Reviews.Author: griffey424
Reviews.Content: This was my third time to stay at the hotel and I had a great time. I have read several bad reviews and can not understand why. I basically went this trip to gamble, but I had a great time. I did have a room facing construction on the eight floor and heard ZERO noise. I ate at the buffet for the first time and was impressed. The price was around $15 for lunch and $18 for dinner and this includes a drink. There was a lot of variety and it was a very good meal. There are several fast food eating places in the hotel and has one of the best locations in the strip. It is right across from the MGM Grand and several shopping and eating places. If you are planning a trip to the Monte Carlo ... relax. I think it is a great hotel and is as nice as most hotels on the strip. The only exception is that it is at a lower price. The only negative about the hotel is the sports book is not as nice as other hotels. Other than that I always enjoy my stay,

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful...if you get a great deal”
Reviews.Author: Mamabear33
Reviews.Content: Not really worth the price the hotel usually is going for. Under 100 a night would be an ideal cost especially since it is in vegas where you can get great deals on far better hotels. The pool area is not what I expected. My kids loved the wave machine but it wasn't a cozy area and although they had 3 sections of pools they were pretty small. I would stay there again if I was offered some extreme discount. Other than that Circus Circus will do...yes I said Circus Circus. Surprisingly, Monte Carlo is not much better.

Reviews.Title: “Expectations drowned”
Reviews.Author: P__SPa
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this casino is its location, in the heart of Las vegas excitement, on the 'strip'. Clean rooms available. The worst part was we were made to wait for 3 hours before we checked into the room because ' room was not ready'. This was the fact even though we had booked the room a month in advance. The receptionists have careless attitude. Rooms dont have coffee maker. There is construction going around the Casino which is a real messy scene. You can hear people speak , squeal and laugh very clearly from your surrounding rooms. No exciting events or restaurants in the casino to keep you engaged.

Reviews.Title: “clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: hugoannie
Reviews.Content: 2 of us spent 3 nights at the monte carlo for a quick weekend getaway. While the room was nothing over the top, it was clean, convenient and the price was great. Check-in was easy at 4 p.m. on a Friday, checkout was even easier. We were on the 31st floor overlooking the construction. The noise didn't bother us at all. We heard a bit of noise on Monday morning. Even though they were working round the clock Friday night and on Saturday, we didn't hear anything. Highlights: people watching at Pour 24 in NYNY, Dinner buffet at Bellagio, Pennyslots at Riviera, Victoria's Secret, Presidential Limousines (great service)

Reviews.Title: “Overall a Great Place to stay, Noise not a problem”
Reviews.Author: eiugirl
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend stay at the Monte Carlo (12/13 thru 12/16) Was very concerned after reading several reviews regarding the construction and noise level next door. Happy to say neither was a problem. Had a room on the 10th floor overlooking the new City Center and with the exception of a beeping noise when the trucks were in reverse, it was pretty quite. Rooms and bathrooms were decent size for two people, any more then that and it might be a little cramped. Only complaint was that the drain on our tub/shower was very slow to drain leaving you in water up to your ankles by the time you were done showering. Overall, would definetly stay at the Monte Carlo again due to the value of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not luxury, but a good value”
Reviews.Author: onedohfan
Reviews.Content: My stay was from Dec. 2 thru 7. Like many others I wasn't sure what to expect after reading some reviews. I almost cancelled before I left as I feared the hotel had really gone down hill. But I booked 3 months in advance and could not find as good a deal on the strip. I decided that if it indeed was bad, I would just stay somewhere else. 2 days before I left I checked availability and rates at other hotels just in case. But it wasn't necessary. I had a very late flight so check in wasn't a problem. Only one person in line in front of me. I was disappointed to find that I was only on the 3rd floor. But it was more important how clean the room was. I didn't even ask for a higher floor. I was impressed when I got off the elevator and saw how spotless the 3rd floor was. I was VERY relieved to find the room clean and in order. Bathroom was a little worn, but the hotel is 10 years old. Still, you would think a hotel with a supposed 4 star rating could afford to put a new faucet in rooms where needed. But it worked so it wasn't a problem. The marble in the bathroom was all shiny and clean. I was pleased with the room. It is funny how people mentioned the sheets are too short for the bed. That was true in my room. But I guess I don't toss and turn much because it didn't bother me. Although the comforter wasn't new, it was not as nasty as some people reported. Since I was on the 3rd floor I didn't have a nice view of anything. Overlooked a roof (parking garage?) and could see the back of the New York New York. But it didn't bother me. Yes there was constuction noise. But I always travel with ear plugs anyway. Sometimes the other people on the floor are more noisy than construction sounds. So earplugs are a staple when I travel. I tried both the Cafe and the Buffet at the Monte Carlo. I had the stuffed French toast one morning in the Cafe and it was excellent. I saw previous reviews that said the buffet was awful. People must be very picky eaters or they shouldn't be eating at buffets. Everything was hot and delicious. I was surprised at the number of options available, American, Mexican, Asian. Salad bar was fresh and desserts plentiful. The casino was larger than I thought it would be. I just play slots and they have a very good selection. I played there almost every day and there was a waitress around the casino all the time, no matter where I played. I never had to wait long for a refill. Their drinks were very generous sizes. I don't smoke but I wasn't bothered by the atmosphere in the casino. I actually won a few, small jackpots there. Not as tight as other casinos. There is an exception to every hotel and I'm sure they have a few rooms that have been neglected. Maybe those maids need to be replaced! Also I think that some people pay $50 a night for a room and expect to get a luxury suite. Overall I was very satisfied with my stay and glad I didn't change it before I left. You can't beat the location. Very close to most major hotels. I enjoy the walk on the strip to the other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: pmichels
Reviews.Content: I booked the trip through Southwest vacations, which I do not have any complaints about. The Stay at the Monte Carlo was not what I expected. The New City Center is under construction between the Monte Carlo and the Bellagio, which means NOISE day and night for at least another 2 years. We asked to be moved to the strip side, but no rooms were available. I do not recommend this hotel if you are expecting to have a good nights sleep. The food at the buffet was not worth the price, for dinner anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: kae2380
Reviews.Content: Check-In was a bit slow with the mad rush from the airport. We were on the 18th floor with a view of the highway and crazy noise from the construction every morning before the sun was even up. I was ready to go over and find the jerk that was making all the noise, but I know they have a job to do. The bathroom was not convenient at all. I traveled with my sister-in-law and the sink, toilet and shower were all in the same room, which made it hard for two ladies to get ready in the morning or evening. I was in Vegas for business and the room and hotel served me well but next time I venture out and it is for pleasure I think I might look elsewhere. It was very conveniently located on the strip! My body and feet appreciated this. The best thing was the water pressure. The shower head massaged my head and body, that's the only thing I thought about stealing... Wow I sure do miss that.

Reviews.Title: “Construction, Noise, Poor Service - Monte is no longer 4 star”
Reviews.Author: RichinMN
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Monte Carlo several times, from the time it first opened, when it was a solid 4-star property. Unfortunately, it has slid to the point where I consider it to be solidly in the 3-star category. At the Monte, we experienced the following: - There is virtually no parking available due to construction - especially on the evenings & weekends (just 2 small lots, no garage access) The front desk told us we could park at NYNY's lot, probably 1/2 mile walk. - For the first time staying at the Monte, I saw room service trash out in the hallways... that wasn't removed within a day - The rooms are showing their age - curling wallpaper, blue crusty hard water buildup on the fixtures, black gunk in the cracks and corners of the bathrooms, cracked grout, threadbare & ripped bedspreads, cracks in the sink, etc. - Hotel tried to put us in a smoking room after we had booked non. After a long wait, we were downgraded from a king to 2 doubles. After another long wait (3 hours after we arrived), they got a king room ready for us. - There is 24/7 "City Center" construction, with the noisy stuff starting at 5 AM sharp. A gravel pit for rocks, sand, and cement trucks has been built behind the hotel. Also, because of the fubar parking situation, if you are on the parking lot side, you will hear taxi & limo horns honking 24/7 (especially if you are in the bottom 10 floors) - Really limited in-room channels. Networks, ESPN, + the Turner channels are about it. Sure, time watching TV in the room is not time spent gambling, but because of our 3-hours worth of room snafus, we missed the entire Ultimate Fighter Finale (which was on Spike) - Someone came into the room while we were out to lunch, and we had the "do not disturb" sign up. They did not service the room, just left some promotional flyers around. Did they know we were gone? Would they have come in had we been there sleeping or getting dressed? We had the DND sign up because we had valuables out in the room. - The buffet has gone downhill in quality - think OCB

Reviews.Title: “Loved the service, rooms, and resturants”
Reviews.Author: Cathy176
Reviews.Content: When I first walked inside the hotel, I knew I was amazed right away. As soon as i entered in my room, i knew for sure that i was going to have a great night of sleep. But best of all, was that my stomach growled and i was starving and walked around and spot the first resturant. I paid and sat down. when the waitress gave me the menu, I opened it right away and saw just what i wanted to eat. a steak with some sauce and rice!! Really delicious!! If i were you, I would go to that hotel, watch the show of Lance Burton AND ENJOY!!! HOPE YOU LIKE YOUR STAY In VEGAS!! BECAUSE WHAT HAPPENS IN VEGAS, STAYS IN VEGAS!! in google earth, look up in vegas and go to ask.com and type monte carlo and hopefully they have pictures. its so beautiful!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Monte Carlo!”
Reviews.Author: marvlis
Reviews.Content: I was early upon arriving at the Monte Carlo thinking that I'd never be able to get into my room. Check-in was quick and I was able to get into my room within 20 minutes. It was clean and spacious - especially for 3 women who had lots of "stuff". We overlooked the pool and also the construction. We weren't in the room enough to be looking out the window during the day. The only complaint was the construction noise on a Friday morning but Sat. and Sun. were fine. The beds were very comfortable and the shower was fantastic. I had stayed at a bigger casino before and I was exhausted by the time I made it out the front door because of the size. The Monte Carlo is a smaller casino and it never felt crowded. It was easy to get to the front door and head out to the strip. The location was also great. Easy to walk or jump on the bus. I would definitely stay at the Monte Carlo again

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, good price”
Reviews.Author: Family-with-four
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Monte Carlo from 11/29/07-12/4/07. 3 of our nights were under $60, weekend nights were a little higher, but not bad. We arrived late and they did not have a king size bed strip side for us, which is what I requested. Based on other reviews, I did not take a pool side room (based on construction noise), so we took 2 queens on strip side, 16th floor. They said they would hold a King size strip side room for us if we wanted to move the following day. Their key machines were broken, so we had to wait for security to let us into our room and come back later for keys. The room was clean and the view was nice, but we did decide to take them up on the king size since we were staying 4 more nights. After multiple attempts to see if the new room was ready, we finally moved into our new room at about 5:00 PM the next day. Now we had a room on the 31st floor! View was even better, room seemed a little cleaner, and we had more space without the extra bed. We definitely did here horns and beeping from the construction starting at least by 6:00 AM in the mornings - even being high up, strip side. I don't think there are any rooms that wouldn't hear it. Otherwise, no complaints on the room. Restaurants we tried - Diablos, the Cafe, and the Buffett were all good. The buffett was free under the football fan promotion, which was a nice perk. We tried the brew pub for drinks and it was decent. Not a ton of action going on, but to get a quick decent drink, it was fine. We also got a free drink under the promotion. No problems with any of the restaurants we tried. We both used the spa for massage and pedicure and both satisfied with their service. Under their promotion, these services were reduced as well, which was also a nice perk. Casino was quiter than others I've been to, so if you want a lot of 'action', you may think about going elsewhere. They usually had $5 craps tables available, which I used often. Employees were always helpful and friendly. Overall, very satisfied with our experience. Nice hotel for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Elsewhere - Construction surrounds the hotel --”
Reviews.Author: SunsetLane
Reviews.Content: There is construction surrounding this hotel -- unless you don't mind being woken up every morning at 5:00 a.m. due to noise. There is no quiet side as the hotel indicates. The hotel rooms are shabby. The casino sells cigars and encourages the smoking of cigars. The smoke in the casino is horrid. The hotel charges for everything -- even to confirm a flight. Frommer's travel guide needs to remove this hotel from its recommendations. The people that have recommended this hotel on this website must be workers.

Reviews.Title: “Would'nt recommend staying at the monte carlo”
Reviews.Author: joseph55
Reviews.Content: Constuction going on all the time right out side the room. Dealers not very friendly. If you play the slot's don't expect to get drinks served. Food was ok but greater selection at the other hotels. Rooms were only average not what you would expect for the price of a 4 star rating. Was not informed of the construction or that there was no shuttle or taxi service sunday to get to the airport from this hotel. Very disapointed for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Semi-good luck at the Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: flygirl75
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went to Vegas for the first time and decided to stay at the Monte Carlo based on the package price found on Expedia. I had read previous reviews on both Tripadvisor and Expedia--so I felt good about my choice. When we arrived at the hotel, there was no system for queing up the customers waiting to check-in. It is a free-for-all, based on whoever has the best luck in picking the shortest and fastest line. We were not one of those lucky people and waited around helplessly whilst other people "jumped" in ahead of us. When we did get served, the gentleman helping us was working his last day at the Monte Carlo and proceeded to rant & rave about his future employer: The Venetian. In all his rantings and ravings, he forgot to give us our coupons that were part of our package and also forgot to upgrade our check-out time as he had so dutifully promised. The room itself was quite large for the standard Deluxe room--which is the base size at the Monte Carlo. The bathtub did not drain properly, so when I took a shower, I had the dirty water pooling around my ankles until I had shut the water off. The toiletries are very basic: shampoo, conditioner, body lotion. No shower cap, no shower gel, no extra "goodies" that we had seen during our stay at the Hilton in Chicago. On our last night at the hotel, and after having spent 17 hours out at the Grand Canyon, we had the pleasure of being faced with what literally one can describe as a DIRTY bed. The comforter had been changed and replaced with a stained, and ripped one. The blanket underneath was also stained, as were the sheets on the matress and the flat sheet. I had to call housekeeping to get this replaced and we waited a solid 40 minutes before they showed up. The housekeeper who changed our sheets was quite shocked at the condition of the bed. She really did not even attempt at trying to cover it up. On the PLUS SIDE: the people at the concierge and information desk were very helpful. I was also quite pleased to see that they do not charge extra for holding your luggage while you wait for your room or are catching a later flight. The buffet was good too: but be warned that the food was of the highest quality when we ate at 6:30pm as opposed to 9:30pm a few nights before. The staff on the gaming floor are very helpful and quite willing to give pointers. I did not find that the people who worked at the Monte Carlo were snobby or unapproachable. The valet was always more than willing to help my boyfriend and I out in the photo-taking dept. On the whole, this hotel is a little smaller in terms of its sheer size when compared to neighbouring hotels (i.e. New York New York and the MGM Grand). If you are looking for the above-average experience, but not something over the top, then the Monte Carlo is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Same here, Monte just OK”
Reviews.Author: TomRoy
Reviews.Content: Stayed 11/27-11/30 and that other reviewer was dead on. The sheets here are terrible. Hard and scratchy as if old and starched. They're even noisy! Enough about the sheets.... Our last stay was at NY/NY and that is much nicer for being in the same price range. Monte Carlo does not have as large a variety of food or entertainment. Other than Wednesdays, no live music here. The casino floor is large, bright, open and just generic. Not really much atmosphere or fun to hang around. The table games are all lumped together in the middle of the floor and also not too exciting. Had a great Blackjack dealer here, but also one of the worst I've ever played with. Totally slow, lethargic and unenthusiastic about being there. The "Brew Pub" discontinued brewing their own beer and doesn't even have a great selection of other beers. Although our room had a good view of the strip, the windows were so filthy, you could barely see through the dirt on the outside.
