The cleaning crew managed to be so loud outside our door they woke us up two mornings in a row. The building and guest rooms are starting to show a lot of wear and need to be cleaned/updated. Overall, I'd try something new, or for around the same $$ go back to NY/NY

Reviews.Title: “Don't go!!!”
Reviews.Author: cardinal
Reviews.Content: Just came back from Vegas and I actually left early. The Monte Carlo should not even be open. Their was construction going on everywhere. For that matter, everywhere along the strip there was work going on. What made the problem worse was there was no place to park, that was if you could find the self parking lot. Inside the hotel it was just as bad. No matter what tower you stayed in, you were awaken (very early) by construction. To make matters worse, the rooms were small and nothing to impressive. I actually tried to leave and stay at the Orleans. They actually have a better buffet. I did check out a day early and couldn't wait to get out of Vegas. Here's two major tips: Wait a few YEARS before going out to Vegas. Also, if you really want to go, stay off the strip.

Reviews.Title: “OK overall stay, sheets were terrible”
Reviews.Author: srauhala
Reviews.Content: My fiancé and I stayed at the Monte Carlo the weekend after Thanksgiving from 11/24 - 11/27. I preface my review by saying we are both in are early 30's, are not picky people, and are pretty easy to please. This was my fourth time to Vegas and I have stayed at the Excalibur, New York/New York, and the Flamingo in previous stays. When I go to Vegas I look for a cheap room with a good location on the Strip. We are not in our room much so we don't feel we need to spend a lot on a room. I decided to go with the Monte Carlo for this trip since it was under $300 total for the stay and it was in a decent location. Since it met my basic criteria and it got decent reviews I decided to go with it. PROS Location: It is in one of, what I consider, the two major areas of the Strip near MGM, NY/NY, Excalibur, Luxor, and Mandalay Bay. It within a short walk to the other major area where the Flamingo, Caesars, Bellagio, etc are located. This hotel probably has the shortest walk to the other major area than the other hotels located nearby. I enjoyed staying at this end since we stayed at the other end last time. It was nice to have the CVS next door as well. Food Options: It has a food court and a variety of restaurants. While we didn't eat at any of restaurants, outside of the new Diablo's, it was nice to have the multiple options if we wanted. We planned on going to the Brew Pub but never made it. We did really like the new Diablo's. They had very good Margaritas, however, they were pricey at $13 for one with decent tequila. The food was good and they have a great location and cool atmosphere. They also have an outside patio and it appears they could open up the large front windows in the warmer weather. View: Our room had the best view of the Strip that I have had and we didn't have to pay extra for it. We were on the 28th floor, facing MGM and New York/New York. With my other stays I never faced the Strip and if you wanted that you had to pay for it. The only thing that would have made it better would be if the casino wasn't located in front of where the rooms are located. So because of that you do see the roof of the casino which is not very nice but overall not a big deal. Construction Noise: There was none. They we not working over the holiday weekend but even when they started again on Mon we never heard anything. CONS Bed: We found the bed to be uncomfortable and we rarely had a good sleep. I thought I could sleep almost anywhere but found it difficult for the first time here. The sheets were like sandpaper and the pillows were terrible. The bottom sheet was not fitted and came un-tucked constantly. I don't think they are ever fitted in a hotel but this is the first time I had ever had it come un-tucked more than once. We woke up to find ourselves sleeping on the bare mattress and the bottom sheet balled up a couple nights. The bedspread on the other bed had a small stain that looked like possible blood or lipstick. This was on the corner where it was not hard to notice so it seemed like they didn't care. Needless to say we did not use that bed and we tore the bedspread off our bed for the entire stay. Bathroom: Not very clean. There was mildew in the corners of the shower and stains around the seal between the tile and the toilet. The shower did have good pressure but the bathroom could use a major overhaul. Hallway noise: Nearby opening doors sounded like it was our room door. A little unerving at first but we learned to lock the door to ease that. So overall, I would say our stay was okay. We enjoyed the location and our view but we would have liked it to be cleaner and to have better beds/sheets. We are not the type to complain so we were able to look past the couple of issues and make the best of it. The room could use a major overhaul but for the money it was about what I expected...although it should have been cleaner. I would consider staying here again only if they remodel their rooms. However, not due to the outdated furniture but due to the cleanliness. Side note: Vegas is getting ridiculous with the timeshare people. Be prepared to be accosted everywhere you go on the Strip and in the hotels. Some of them became quite rude and had snide comments when you said no thank you or ignored them

Reviews.Title: “OK, but wouldn't stay here again...”
Reviews.Author: geminiangel528
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a ladies' weekend. There were four of us and two beds. Check-in is usually at 3pm, but we were able to check in early. The room faced the strip and we were on the 29th floor. There were stains on the comforters and we asked that they be changed. Someone brought us new comforters, but didn't even put them on the bed! They left them in plastic in the corner. We called to ask if someone was going to do it and they insisted they would. No one ever did. To make up for it, they did offer free dinner at the buffet. I went to take a shower and the towel had black rubber melted into it!!! To make it worse, it was folded on the inside like they were trying to hide it!! Again we called the front desk and explained that we were not happy with the cleanliness of the room. They apologized and gave us free dinner at the cafe. It was in a pretty good location and the concierge was very helpful in making dinner reservations and giving advice on the best places to eat and party. Overall, it wasn't terrible. I guess they tried to make things right, but I wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Raise
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent Thanksgiving at the Monte Carlo. The room was very nice, and we were pleasantly surprised by how friendly and helpful the staff was. The casino itself was spacious and well-lit, never overcrowded; we also enjoyed the wide variety of restaurants in the hotel. We rented a car to get out of town and access to the highway was very easy. And, granted, you are at the bottom of the strip, but most other hotels are walkable. On the downside, the self-park is far too small (but, again, the valet staff was great) and if you are looking for an active poker room in the daytime, be prepared to go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: PeachfromGA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Monte Carlo from 11/18 thru the 23rd. My experience was great. Having read prior reviews I requested a quiet room and was accommodated. Was given a 13th floor room with a view of NY NY. I was concerned about staying at such a large place; usually use B&Bs or small family owned and operated hotels. Well, my fears were for naught. The staff was great, very pleasant and helpful; always ready with a smile. The room was spotless. Between the time I left my room and then returned after breakfast, the room was done up; very quick and efficient. They always left lots of towels and new toiletries (loved the hand cream). If I have to give it negative, I'd say that the tub/shower drained slowly. But heck, for and average of $59 per night, with two free buffets, and two for ones at the pub, in a central location, I am not complaining. Will stay there again if the opportunities arises.

Reviews.Title: “Noise problems, otherwise okay”
Reviews.Author: sjmbm330
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was great for the activity we had planned, but we hadn't planned on construction of the City Center right outside our window. So the view - what you could see through the dust covered window was "different" and the noise started very early in the morning. The early trash removal started about 6AM. Pairing that with the thin wall and the noisy next door neighbors, we didn't get much sleep. Definitely bring some ear plugs or ask to be placed on the opposite side of the building. Otherwise, the room was clean and the buffet was reasonable and good food for breakfast or lunch. For a desert city, the shower had amazingly good water pressure. Overall, I would give it a 3-1/2 since all the employees we dealt with were pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo Great location on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: sandyohio
Reviews.Content: I had to attend a convention on the strip in Las Vegas and all the rooms were already booked. I searched on line and found the Monte Carlo had really fair rates. I remembered that this hotel was really in a good location. It isn't close to the convention center(Venetian) but it is right next to New York New York ,Paris, and Belliago. The view from our room wasn't great but the room was average and clean. The latest in Vegas hotels is the lack of amenities such as in room coffee,robes,and no courtesy bar. The restaurants were well run and the food was good at a fair price. We didn't do well in the Casino but that is not unusual. The plumbing in the room was rather loud. When someone flushed a toilet or took a shower either next door or above us,we heard it. The walls were thin too. I woke up in the middle of the night thinking someone was in my room and it was the guy next to us getting up and using the bathroom. The valet service is really slow as well. After staying for a few days we learned that it is better to park in the guest parking then wait for valet. It didn't matter if you tipped well their system doesn't distinguish this. I rate this as average. I would stay again because of the location and cleanliness. Bring ear plugs!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: hawaiitrader
Reviews.Content: It was our first time staying at the Monte Carlo and we will definitely return. The staff was extremely polite and helpful and our room was beautiful. The hotel has great "deals" and they were most accomodating. Unfortunately for the hotel, a lot of construction going on around them, but to the hotels credit, they put us in a room not facing or where one could hear the noise. (all of Vegas seems to be under construction) We highly recommend this fine hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Vickyjo
Reviews.Content: Great location on the strip I personally think this end feels safer due to it being well lit and having less drinking establishments close to the street. Rooms are spacious and we had a great view of the strip though walls can be thin if you have an arguing couple next door as we did. They are well kept, clean and have everything you'ld expect including nice decor and big, comfy beds. With regard to bars and shops there is a lot less to offer at the Monte Carlo than many of the other hotels but what it lacks here it makes up for with the pool area. The pool area is fab! Can get crowded but you don't eactly go to Vegas for solitude. IMO this is a very well located hotel, for the safety aspect but also that is is close to stores and everything without being right in the middle. Just that bit better than the MGM location wise IMO. One tip is i'd say save your money and go next door to the Boardwalk for gambling, better value for money! Also, if you are new to Vegas you must go to 'Old Vegas' on Freemont St. I didn't the first time around and missed put. The second time around I stayed half my trip there, friendlier, cheaper and a nicer atmosphere. Go to the Golden Gate Bay city diner here. Excellent! The famous 99c shrimp cocktail and the most delicious steak dinner ever for about £4 - you will not be dissapointed! (Don't be put off by the stinky casion bit you walk through) Harrah's buffet was not bad nor the surf buffet at the boardwalk, about the right price for what you get really, if you have a very big appetite they will be quite a bargain. The best breakfast buffet is at the MGM grand - you have to see it to believe it!

Reviews.Title: “Is this the Monte Carlo?”
Reviews.Author: ItsMissBrooks
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to say how dissatisfied I was with the service provided at the Monte Carlo hotel this past weekend. I have been to Las Vegas about 9 times over the last three years and have never had the issues that I endured at the Monte Carlo when I've stayed at the MGM Grand, Excalibur, Mirage, Embassy Suites, or Marriot. We were greeted with stained comforters and towels and the housekeeping staff was not interested in remaking the beds or replacing the towel. They dropped off the new comforter in a plastic bag and went on with their day. It was offensive and rude in my opinion. We were then greeted with an unruly toilet and the front desk became annoyed with our calls. We were compensated with 2 free buffet dinners (for four guests mind you) and breakfast at the cafe. It was nice to compensate for our trouble, but I'd rather not have gone through it in the first place and not had to ask. It wasn't offered. needless to say, I'll stick to what I know and that's the MGM Grand.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay...”
Reviews.Author: Albertagal03
Reviews.Content: Mu Husband and I stayed at the Monte Carlo from Nov 8 - 15, 2007 and after reading all the bad reviews, I must admit I was a bit worried but WOW - was I ever glad I did not change our reservation. We checked in @ 9:00 PM at night and had NO problems whatsoever - we were treated very nicely and things went very smoothly. We had a suite which was just renovated 5 weeks ago and was beautiful, clean and quiet. We were facing all the construction and it did not bother us one little bit. We ate at the Cafe almost every day for breakfast and a couple of dinners and had no complaints - good, fast and inexpensive. We also did the buffet one night and it was good. Our last night we ate at the Market City Caffe and it was also very good - if you like real Italian food. The Monte Carlo Brew Pub was also a good place for a quick easy meal and drinks. We have stayed at the upper end of the Vegas resorts - Bellagio, etc and in my opinion, the Monte Carlo matches any of those hoity toity places any day! The rooms are clean, the service was great and everything is relativley close to everything - rooms to the lobby, casino, etc - you are not walking miles to get back to your room. We go to Vegas every year and I can honestly say we won't think twice about staying at the Monte Carlo again.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo - no frills and no thrills”
Reviews.Author: beckymonster
Reviews.Content: It was my first time going to Vegas (I went with my family) and we decided to stay at the Monte Carlo. It is a very clean, elegant hotel but there is absolutley nothing to do. The view was also awkward (it was across the street from a McDonalds and other fast food joints along with broken down souvenir shops with neon lights flashing all night). If you really want a lavish Las Vegas experience, go elsewhere, Monte Carlo was a pleasant stay, but it really doesn't offer much..mid-sized casino, very few dining options, and couple shops. Once you've wandered around the mega hotels on the strip (like Bellagio, Caesar's, Wynn) you'll see what I mean. So if you want a no-frills, no thrills vacation (I don't see why one would go to Vegas if they WEREN'T looking for such things) head to the Monte Carlo.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo Ok”
Reviews.Author: Traci14
Reviews.Content: We stayed here September 6 thru Sept. 9th. We were comped all three nights. Check in around 11:00. We had to wait about 20 minutes. One of our rooms was ready the other one was not ready until 2:00. Ate at the Buffet for breakfast one time. Horrible!!! Food was cold!! Never again! We ate lunch at the Cafe. It was ok. Nothing special. Pool area was very crowded. Very hard to find a lounge chair. Lazy river was really nice but be careful we almost fell a couple of times with the currents moving quickly. Wave pool was nice. Sat at the edge with our cocktails and enjoyed the water. Construction was going on all around the hotel but it did not bother us at all. All in all it was a good stay but the hotel itself is very boring. Not much going on. The casino is very quiet and empty at night.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo Great after past reviews :)”
Reviews.Author: lescas
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last week, after the latest reviews we were a little worried. No Problems at all, rooms nice, above average, casino good, great location on strip. Buffet very good, So overall I would recommend this hotel if the price is right. Construction was going on on the right side, the clerk made sure our rooms were away from the construction.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wpier7
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo is a very nice, CLEAN hotel! Right next to New York, New York and close to the MGM. There wasn't any construction taking place on the hotel, but there's a LOT of it taking place nearby. It didn't bother me one time, however. Don't pay the extra ten bucks for a view of the strip. You can get a pretty good view around the 19th floor, which is free. The breakfast buffet is pretty good and affordable (around $12). I would DEF stay here again, although I would prefer Caesar's Palace for the nightclubs. One more thing: After booking your room, be sure to check the hotel's website daily for price reductions. I noticed a lower rate about a week or so after booking my room. Called them and they changed it immediately.

Reviews.Title: “Halloween in Vegas AGAIN! No better place for it!”
Reviews.Author: tamnrudy
Reviews.Content: Vegas TR 10-24 to 10-30, 2007. Long day of travel on the 24th, flew Spirit from Orlando through Detroit to Vegas. Yes, it was out of the way, but I had been concerned about fares and got a bit too anxious about it. Should have waited til Southwest had their fares online. Got to Vegas around 4:00 PM, one of the bags was damaged; one of the front flaps was almost completely ripped off. I think this was due to overloading the carousel which caused the bag to catch on the chute as it went by at the top of the pile. Be that as it may, at least the bag did not rip open. First tip: stand in the Taxi line. Between a LOOONNNGG wait at the curb, plus the stops at other hotels, we could have been through the taxi line and at the Monte Carlo for a couple drinks! Room at Monte Carlo was 16-316. On the back side toward the NYNY. We were not really bothered by construction noise although it could be faintly heard. It was actually kind of interesting to watch the construction. Amazing the organization that has gone into this massive project. Worse than the construction was the horn honking, etc that regular cars made and the LOUD family next door that TALKED SO LOUD and made sure to SLAM THE DOOR every time they left. Room was a clean, non-smoking room with 2 queen beds. Yes, it could use an update; the coverlets and towels were somewhat worn. BUT…housekeeping was a well-oiled machine; we never waited more than 30 minutes before they were done. First night, Irish Car Bombs at 9 Fine Irishmen at NYNY to celebrate our arrival to Sin City. Went down smmooootthh! This was my biggest night gambling. I put 5 bucks in nickel Tabasco slot machine. Played max bets over and over and got it up to $540 bucks. Cashed out when it was down to $322. Pretty sure that will never happen to me again! Was exciting! Next day was a lot of walking and shopping, all the way down to the Fashion Show Mall and beyond it, the Love Boutique. For those who have asked, the Love Boutique is an adult store that is within view of Dillards parking garage of the Fashion Show Mall. An easy and safe walk discounting the traffic. They were well-stocked with clothes mostly and had Halloween costumes discounted. Got back to the Monte Carlo and Rudy (DH) talked to his best pal from high school, who now lives in Vegas, and who was with his wife at the Palms. They drove down to our hotel and we went for a few drinks at the Big Apple Bar at NYNY. Phoenix was OK, a bar band with standard hard rock mostly. Friday was a blur. We joined some slot clubs at the Planet Hollywood, Harrah’s, and the Wynn. Played in each to get the accounts a tiny bit established. Made enough points at the Wynn to Qualify for free buffet (25 points = 1 free buffet) and decided to save those until Monday before Spamalot. Thanks to TA forum poster clarelw for the heads-up on this. Second Tip: If you do this at the Wynn, be aware that you need to see the players card desk to get the buffet added to your card AND you must use the free buffet within 24 hours of it being put into your players card account….so don’t go do this until the day you want the buffet. Friday evening we went to Rudy’s classmate’s home for hors d’ouvres and some beers. Yakked away til 2 AM, then they drove us back to the Monte. Saturday was spent relaxing before the big event of the Fetish and Fantasy Halloween Ball. Ate at Diablos in front of the Monte; fish tacos were yummy! Got ready and left the hotel at 10PM. The taxi driver was an absolute gem; avoided the Strip traffic which as GRIDLOCK and scooted through the roads around the MGM. Got to the Alexis Park for the Ball in no time at all. Lots of confusion as to standing in line; but we got in a short one. Were inside in about 15 minutes only to find they wanted us to stand in line for drink tickets. Not sure why they changed the procedure from our last time in 2005. The layout was huge and labyrinth-like. There was only one main bathroom area with major long lines…but we did manage to find the “secret” potty that was not marked by signs. No lines there at all. It seemed like folks could not figure out that a big convention center facility had more than one bathroom, drink stand, etc. Anyway, all in all it was a blast. Rudy made the good decision to get us out of there at about 3:45 AM, before the official close. The wait for cab was about 5-7 minutes. We knew from previous experience that at 4:15 AM, it would be an hour or more. Sunday we slept in til noon, then went to the House of Blues in Mandalay Bay for breakfast. YUMMY and the coffee is super good! Decided we were not hung-over (due to eating before the Ball to avoid such a thing; hey it worked! Go figure!) and might even like to see a show that evening. Took the advice of many TA forum folks and visited the Big Coke Bottle by M&Ms World. In keeping with our previous evening, we got tickets ($27.00 pp) to see Fashionistas at Krave (next to the Planet Hollywood complex). Ate at Trader Vic’s in the Miracle Mile shops before the show. Very expensive for such a limited menu, but food was absolutely awesome! Got in line for Fashionistas behind 2 sisters who’d been at the Fetish Ball the night before so we had a lot to talk to them about. Nice girls. We’d bought general admission tix, and ended up in the front row. Cool! The show was very small production, not high budget. But the dancing was excellent and all the performers were obviously highly-trained. Costumes were very, very interesting; we coveted. Though the subject matter might not appeal to some, the dancing was beautiful and artful; with a lot of humor thrown into the mix. Monday was our last hurrah! I had a massage at the Monte Carlo’s spa. Was very nice, but more Swedish than the relaxation type I prefer. The steamroom was lovely and my poor dried out sinuses were in heaven! Next time, I will go back to the Luxor, where I had a wonderful massage a few years ago. And their women’s spa area was really cool. Ah…another trip report that shall be. At MGM, we bought monorail tickets, unlimited one day passes, for the trip to the Wynn and back. Decided to go to the convention center station and take the free Wynn shuttle to the hotel. BAD MISTAKE. The wait for the shuttle was at least 25 minutes, then it took another 20-30 minutes to get to the Wynn due to construction and rush hour traffic. Should have stuck with our original plan of getting off at Harrah’s and walking to the Wynn. Oh well. Can’t change what you can’t change. Next time we will know better; and now you should too! Got our free buffets added to our players cards and went to the restaurant. It was pretty good. The shrimp and sushi were good. Lots of choices and cuisines. Make sure to try the peanut butter cookies on the dessert bar. On to the show! Spamalot was all it has been hyped to be. A total laugh riot and a great production with Vegas glitz, dancing, and fun! We do think it is funnier because we’ve seen all of Monty Python’s movies and shows. If you plan to see it as a play, rent the Holy Grail before you go. Back to the Monte Carlo…Ni Ni Ni… all the way! Checked in with the players club there and got 2 breakfast buffets and 35 bucks in slot play. Not as good as getting comped a room like we’ve gotten in the past, but pretty good considering we didn’t stay as long or play as much. Tuesday, woke up and packed, called maintenance for some duct tape for the mangled suitcase. The stuff they brought was stronger than duct tape if there can be such a thing. Ended up doing the job as the bags all made it safely back to Orlando. We went down for breakfast, returned to the room to finish up there. Did the checkout with the TV and got downstairs. Taxi stand had a long line, but a shuttle service came by and said they’d go directly to the airport for 5 bucks a person. We went, they did, and we decided that was the only kind of shuttle to take. Got through Southwest ticketing, lines through security were long but not major and they kept moving, and hunkered down to wait for the flight. Despite having Zone C seating, we were able to sit together and enjoyed the trip home, if one can enjoy a long plane ride. Pilots got us to Orlando 20 minutes early and Rudy has decided that SW is back in his good graces. Home by 11 PM, the morning came too early. Dreaming of Vegas again next year….

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, clean, and great value”
Reviews.Author: Cleannut
Reviews.Content: If cleanliness matters, you will like this place. We've been to several resorts in Vegas, and even their casino is cleaner and less crowded with smoke!! One of our favorite weekend get-away!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Jayskee
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I were extremely satisfied with our stay at the Monte Carlo. The Monte Carlo is the next best Vegas hotel bargain if you are not staying at one of the luxury hotels. The entire staff was very friendly and helpful. The breakfast and dinner buffets were very good. Having a food court with McDonald's, Subway and Sabarro's was convenient. Our room was very well appointed with a large bathroom. The maid service was very proficient. I really liked the casino's flat floor plan and lighting. We definitely plan on staying at the Monte Carlo on our next Vegas trip.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo - nice trip”
Reviews.Author: sally1115
Reviews.Content: We booked a long weekend to Vegas and picked the Monte Carlo before we knew about the construction going on next door. We called the hotel before to request the room not be facing the construction and had no problems upon arrival with this request. I might have heard a slight beeping noise one morning, but that was it. The City Center going in next door is massive but it didn't really disrupt us at all. The only problem I had was with the pool area. It faces the construction and most of the pool area doesn't get any sun until well after noon. It is a nice pool area, but small. They play music to try and cover the construction noise but you can still kind of hear it. I was able to read a good book and tune most of it out though. After reading reviews I was expecting the rooms to be kind of old and bad. They are not at all. I can be a picky person and I had no problems with them at all. I thought they were pretty nice! Comfortable beds also. We stayed on floor # 20. Prior to this visit I have stayed at The Mirage, Treasure Island and Tropicana. Monte Carlo is just a small step below Treasure Island (Mirage was the nicest) and the Monte Carlo is 1,000 times better than the Tropicana. That place is a total dump. The casino area was quite smoky and didn't bring me much luck but I had great celebrity sightings that weekend - Cameron Diaz and Ashton Kutcher!!

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo is a great hotel to stay at!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: katwalski
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo for our honeymoon Oct 22-26 and it was a wonderful experience! After we booked our hotel I read all the bad reviews and got worried that I booked the wrong hotel but boy am I glad I keep our reservation. As soon as we got there we checked in and told them that we were honeymooners and they gave us a special rate to upgrade to the VIP floor. We stayed on the 32 VIP floor and it was amazing, each morning you could go into the lounge and have complimentry breakfast and every evening there was cocktails. The staff was always very nice and friendly. The Monte Carlo Pub is a great place to go and have drinks make sure you ask for Ozzie and have him make you his special "Nuts and Berries" drink. The Cafe was also a great place to eat, the only food place that I was not impressed with was the Buffet, the food was not that great and it was barely warm! The constuction was not a problem for us and we never even heard it. This hotel is a great place to stay and we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Waste Your Time”
Reviews.Author: akaspr01
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin?? I checked in and they do not honor complimentary upgrades, like EVERY OTHER hotel in Vegas. She tried to add an additional 200.00 to my bill for "security". As soon as I raised an eyebrow she took it off. When I got into my room, it was handicap accessible on the 16th floor, so I called down to be moved to another room. I'm not a fan of the handicapped showers. My 2nd room was on the 5th floor. I wasn't upset at all by being moved down to the 5th floor, I didn't lose anything. My 16th floor view was of construction and the 5th floor was of the roof of the casino, so it was sucky either way. I proceeded to get changed and get out of the room. One of the lamps was broken, wires exposed!! The tub and sink were running brown water and both were stopped up. I called the front desk and was told to run the water for 10 minutes to "clear it up". That helped the water but not the drain. I left the room and they fixed the tub drain. I had to call them AGAIN to fix the sink. Overall, this was within the first 2 hours of being here, so I was not impressed. The hotel is drab and plain and I felt like I was in a retirement home. I've stayed in the Luxor & Planet Hollywood(formerly Aladdin). Both of these were cheaper and I would stay in them any day over the Monte Carlo. All MC has going for it is location. I give it 5 years and it'll be bought out. I included a pic of the sink.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: BirminghamSightseer
Reviews.Content: We loved the Monte Carlo and found it to be one of the more classy hotels in Vegas. Every now and then I like to get away from the flash and glitz and the Monte Carlo is more elegant and low-key than some of the other strip hotels. Friendly staff were very accomodating! Rooms were beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “No reason for the Bad Reviews”
Reviews.Author: JodyPaul
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Monte Carlo from October 25th thru the 28th! I thought this hotel was great for the Value and Location!! I have stayed at many 5 star hotels on the strip so I have an Idea of what quality should be. This was a Boys weekend and this hotel was perfect for that! The Rooms were great and pretty large actually! The bathroom was also good and the water pressure from the showers were the best in vegas period!!! As far as construction at the City Center I honestly didn't hear anything and my room was right by the construction. So I don't know what all the complaining was about. You have to remember when going to the Monte Carlo you are not staying at the Wynn, Venetian or the Bellagio. You are somewhere between Planet Hollywood and the New York, New York and Luxor as far as the quality of the room, casino and other amenities. This is not a huge mega casino type resort with alot of frills!!! It just good solid value!! Clean room, decent restaurants, nice casino and right in the center of the strip close to everything what else do you want for a great price!! All in all it was a great stay no complaints! If I did have any complaints it would be a small one. I thought the check in line could of moved a little faster I felt like I was in line for about 15 minutes too long! Other than that additional 15 minutes it was smooth sailing with alot of fun!!

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo, Nice hotel, great value.”
Reviews.Author: racehrse
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Nice room,very quiet above the casino.

Reviews.Title: “i'll stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: lvfan26
Reviews.Content: I decided to go to Las Vegas My favorite place I used Priceline stupid me and got Monte Carlo I was excited since I had stayed there and knew that the rooms were plush nice bed spreads, bathrooms the whole works. I was excited that the drive up to las vegas was flawless when I got to Monte carlo they were doing construction and ripped out the parking structure for some "city center"??? I went to talk to the security (not very helpful) and asked where to park he told me there was no parking that even valet was full and to go to new york-new york where not only was it hard to find parking there but I had to lug my bags all the way through new york-new york it is hard enough lugging your bags through your own hotel it was embarrassing. finally get in the long line to register where they told me my room was blocked already for me they must have known that this was a disgusting room, due to me going through priceline they couldn't do anything about it like comp my stay or even give me a discount. The room was disgusting and the only reason I didn't ask for a room change was because of the long line!!! the bed spread needs to be thrown out it is so old and dirty i just threw that off I used a kleenex I didn't even want to touch it ewwwww!!! the toilet was broken the flusher was almost pulled out from the toilet and the rug was in need of replacement there is no smeam cleaner on the planet that could get rid of that mess!!! I was looking for relaxation by the time i left i was so stress out I needed a vacation from my vacation

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Dr_Elmo
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed in this hotel and I'm very surprised by some of the good reviews that it has received. Basically, the only important criteria I have for a hotel in Vegas is a good night's sleep and a good shower. I got neither of those at this hotel. The walls were so thin, I could hear the conversation next door and every time someone in our hallway shut their door, our whole room rattled. It kept me up most of the night. Beds and pillows were very uncomfortable, blankets were old and ratty. There was trash on the floor left by the previous occupants. The furniture and carpet were stained and ragged. The shower did not drain at all, resulting in a pool of water up to my shins. The pool area is in a major construction zone, so it wasn't at all relaxing. The casino is okay, but nothing special. We moved to Paris for two more nights, which was significantly nicer for around the same price. With so many choices in Vegas, don't choose the Monte Carlo.

Reviews.Title: “Very dissapointed!”
Reviews.Author: kathiPDX
Reviews.Content: I was expecting a pretty decent hotel room because it had been recommended by two of my friends but ended up quite dissapointed. We got a room on the 11th floor overlooking the strip and like someone previously said, it was basically overlooking the casino roof. The hotel room was nothing fancy but also did not appear clean. The comforter had a big white stain on it and the carpet was a bit stained too. The sheets in one of our beds actually had holes in it. There was mold around the bathtub and the window was filthy. The first night there the safe door was already locked so we had to have security come up to open it...they were quick, I'll give them that. We also weren't given hand soap on the first night and one of our towels had black stains on it. Another annoying thing is that we couldn't find a "Do not disturb" sign to hang on our door anywhere so housekeeping was constantly walking in on us. I don't think I got much sleep both nights with the uncomfortable bed and constant construction noise outside. Also, stores within the hotel don't even compare to the other hotels on the strip. If you have the budget for it, I would suggest staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but ...”
Reviews.Author: Patricks_Dad
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights from 15th October. We had booked a Strip-view room, high up, with the exceptionally helpful bookings staff, and I'd re-confirmed the request a few days before we arrived. On arrival, we had to wait 20mins for check-in (even though we arrived at 5pm) and there were only 3 clerks available. Our desk clerk was less than friendly/welcoming. She gave us a 7th floor room because that was all she "had available" (why do the bother with these bookings lines at all??!) with a Strip view which was right across the casino roof, so not really a view at all. The room was a good size, and had a fridge. Linen was clean, but had seen better days. Housekeping staff were good, and very courteous. We noted the pool was closed a number of times - because there was no lifeguard on duty! Not good. The (proper) dining room restaurant (not Diablos or the buffet) was OK, and the food was good. The shops were a joke - a few empty clothes shops along a "street" that ended in a dead-end with a pile of benches stacked or stored against a wall. Overall, the feeling we had was that this Hotel was run down, and being allowed to run down. We won't be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay again”
Reviews.Author: pathteacher
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the 26th floor facing construction. Woke to noises every morning at 6am. When gambling did not see a cocktail waitress for 4 days that we were there. Buffet not worth the Money.

Reviews.Title: “Construction Noise -Beware!!!”
Reviews.Author: classygrl
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a stay at the Monte Carlo. I would advise people to find a different hotel. There was so much construction noise everyday and early(5:00 am) in the morning was the worst. We were moved to 3 different rooms in our 3 day stay there trying to find a quieter room to no avail. They did move us to a suite our last night for no extra charge. The suite was a very nice room. The buffet was very poor for a Vegas buffet. The desserts were nothing special, in fact I was looking forward to a piece of carrot cake and found only carrot muffins instead! Poor selection. I wouldn't spend the money to eat there again. Go to Wolfgang Puck's at the MGM. It was so outstanding we ate there for lunch twice! We took the Deuce double decker bus to get up and down the strip at $5.00 for 24 hours it is a bargain. Just give yourself plenty of time they get very crowded. Would highly recommend seeing ICE at the Riveria. It was fantastic! Buy tickets at the half off store next to Coca-Cola world.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, very good experience, awesome pools”
Reviews.Author: schmitt1218
Reviews.Content: Very beautiful resort. I was very impressed with everything about the resort, especially the pool areas. I loved that it offered not only the standard pool/hot tubs, but also had an awesome wave pool and lazy river. It was an excellent place to spend the hot days before the nightlife began. The rooms were very luxurious and the beds comfortable. The staff were all very nice and helpful. I would definitely stay here again and suggest it to anyone. The only complaint is the construction next door (out of their control) and also the remodel in the casino area. However, it was not that bad and the overall stay a winner!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: NicolleBC
Reviews.Content: Check in was very quick. The rooms were average in size and decor. I was worried reading about the construction but I did not notice it until 7 am. The pools were nice but the main pool did not get sun until 4 pm. Had to go down as soon as the pool opened to get a sunny spot in the a.m. It was nice there was a food court and a place to get early morning coffee without a lineup. The dinner at Blackstones steakhouse was wonderful and good service. The Monte Carlo brew pub was terrific also. The only small complaint I have is the tub was very slow to drain. The casino was being renovated so many of the slot machines were out of service.

Reviews.Title: “This place needs a remodel - NOW”
Reviews.Author: jrkstl
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at the Monte Carlo, and while the location was great, the rooms and common areas are in bad need of a remodel. The rooms were straight out of the nineties, and the bedding was no better than the last room I had at a Motel 6. I did appreciate the size of the room, but they were nothing special. I purchased this room via Priceline, and according to their site, it is a four star hotel. Not even close, IMHO. If you're going to Vegas for a business trip, the rates during the week would make it worth the stay, but for over $200, it's not worth it. Since our stay was on a Friday evening, we didn't have to contend with the construction noise, but the windows and parking lot, etc. were filthy. Also, self parking was a bit difficult, due to the lack of a garage.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for the price, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Scots_Al
Reviews.Content: We got a decent deal through the hotel's own website which included 2 free buffet coupons, a 2 for one drink and 2 for one entry to the spa. We arrived early Monday evening. No bell staff to meet taxis and take your bags off you - not a disaster, but it would have been nice. There were not too many people arriving at this time, but out of around 20 check-in desks, only four were open, and even when you got to the desk, the process seemed incomprehensibly long and drawn-out. From arriving at the front door to walking into the room took about 40 minutes. On the plus side, you did not have to trail through the casino to get to the elevators. At the time of booking, we requested a room away from the construction with one king bed. Away from the major construction we got, the king bed we didn't. Some noise was audible, but it was not really an issue, and certainly not enough to wake me. The room and bathroom were fine, reasonably spacious, and with most amenities, but notably missing a fridge and coffee making facilities. The Monte Carlo is well situated between mid-strip and the nicer south end of the strip, and most casinos are walkable. The south-bound deuce bus stops right outside the door. On a side note, while the deuce is a good idea, sheer weight of traffic, demand and a very inefficient boarding process makes it an incredibly long means of getting anywhere. We used the free buffet coupons. It was okay, but I would not bother paying for it. Despite it being more empty than full, there was still an inexplicable wait for tables. The food was adequate, no more, no less. Service was on the surly side. The Brew Pub is a great little place - both to sit at the bar and to eat (huge and nice burgers), although it was slightly disappointing to learn that they stopped brewing ten months ago - they should perhaps get round to changing the name and the in-house literature. Houdini's Lounge is a nice place for a relatively quiet drink. The casino was fairly dull and lacking in atmosphere, and there were a fair few pretty miserable dealers. Having said that, the guys involved in the craps lessons were very good. Overall - I would consider staying here again if the price was right, but it would be for the location (it's easily cheaper than its nearest neighbours) rather than for the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure request the right room and don't waste you money on a Buffet.”
Reviews.Author: Tatarochka
Reviews.Content: We just back from Las Vegas, stayed at the Monte Carlo 4 nights. A couple things what future travelers might be interesting to know about this property and up comming Vegas trip: 1. Between Monte Carlo and Bellagio huge MGM City Center construction active. MGM planning to finish this project at the end of 2009. So, if you are planning to travel to Vegas in between this time make sure you book your room away from construction noise. You will face construction all the time. The most annoying was to see all this mass going on right on the other side of the pool. There are no way to avoid it....from one side of the pool hotel and another construction site. If you still ok with that, make a proper request before your arrival. 2. We didn't have any problems with the room, housekeeping service were 24 hours, room were clean all the time. I would not use their hotel shampoo, conditioner or body lotion and will bring my own. By the way in Las Vegas air is a very dry, so make sure to bring good rich moisturizer for your face and body. 3. The most disappointing for me was the Monte Carlo Buffet. I could believe my eyes when I saw the same type of food were served for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Gosh, you will get tired of it. Of course for breakfast they will have some eggs, pancakes also, but that is all. But Lunch and Dinner were the same, only price was different. Don't waste your money and have a Buffets at the Bellagio and Wynn! 4.Spa has a very small and tiny facility. They saying it's newly renovated, well it's not. It was renovated long time ago. Everything standart inside the Spa, but too small and it was very cold inside. I wouldn'tste my money and will try some other Spas in Vegas like MGM, Bellagio or Wynn. With regards Las Vegas shows, we have seen mostly all of them already. This time around we saw Love, Le Reve and David Copperfield. If you will book one of the show at the Wynn Hotel, with your first ticket purchase they will give you a coupon with 25% discount for another show playing at their hotel, if you will buy tickets withing 7 days. So, keep it in mind. They are playing Monty Spamalot and Le Reve at the Wynn only. Highly recommend to see both of them. With reagards, free credits to play at the casino...if you will assign to the MGM Player card they will give you $10 credit to play. And get ready to this at the Wynn they give $25 credit.-). Inside little broshere which you can pick it up at the Airport or taxi they have different kind of coupons also. If you are planning to use Mono rail you will find extra saving too.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: pyschomommy
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself and another couple celebrated our anniversaries and chose the Monte Carlo hotel to stay at while in Vegas. The hotel itself is clean, and the lobby, elevators and casino are very accesible. The hotel layout makes it easy to get around and find others in your group. The room is average, not fancy or themed. Just plain and simple. The bathroom shower didn't drain well. Overall, we chose this hotel because the price was right, the location seemed good, as it is on the strip, and we got exactly what we paid for. Don't expect a typical Vegas over the top themed hotel and casino, and you won't be dissappointed. The plus of this hotel is the pool, however, there is alot of construction surrounding this property and noise will be heard. We weren't too bothered by the construction noise because we were up early anyway for breakfast, and were so tired by the time we went to sleep that we tuned out the beeping noises. There is so much construction going on in Vegas that I wonder if it affects guests staying in other hotels, too. On another note, we dined at Andre's in the Monte carlo and truly enjoyed our dinner! The food was tasty and the service was top notch. The Brew Pub, however, did not meet our expectations at all! The food wasn't great, too greasy, and to top it off mu friend found a nail clipping (YES, a nail clipping) in her cocktail, gross. The manager was very appologetic and sincere. The bill was taken care of, and we left without finishing the rest of our meals. That was by far the worst dining experience not only in vegas, but anywhere! We did dine at Shintaro's in the Bellagio(Awesome), The Wynn champagne brunch buffet(wow factor, high quality food and such an assortment of different cuisines, so fresh), The Paris breakfast buffet(reasonably priced, beautiful ambience, good food, liked it so much ate there twice), The Bellagio dinner buffet(overrated, average at best, decor doesn't match rest of hotel). Definatey, do the ATV Valley of Fire tour (Husbands loved it!). Definately visit the Hoover dam, but don't bother with the Ariel tours which offer both the Dam tour then the Ariel tour of Grand Canyon. After our bus dropped us off at the Boulder city airport we were stuck waiting for others to arrive, and sat there for almost 2 hours, no apologies, no idea that this would happen after enjoying the Hoover dam tour. My advice is unless it;s a helicopter tour of the Grand canyon, it's not worht the money or time, because you get the same view from the plane arriving into and departing Las Vegas. The Celine Dion show was amazing and our husbands even enjoyed it. Overall, we saved money by staying at the Monte Carlo Hotel and we were able to do a variety of other things like tours, shows, and fine dining experiences. I would most likely not choose this hotel again, however, because it is not center strip like the Bellagio or Paris where we spent alot of time walking to Next time we visit Vegas we will stay at the Bellagio or The Paris Hotels because we loved the atmospheres both offered, and the dining options are better, more to choose from within own hotel,plus just can't beat that location!

Reviews.Title: “Clean room & good location; BUT bad service & lacking ambiance”
Reviews.Author: brookl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights recently. Overall we were satisfied with our stay and we'll be okay to return there. But I don't think it's a 4-diamond hotel, and I can understand why it's cheaper than most other higher-end resort/casinos on the Strip. Here's my breakdown... Location -- Monte Carlo is right on the Strip, halfway between Flamingo and Tropicana. I think that is an excellent location. You can easily walk to New York New York and MGM on the south side, Bellagio and Paris on the north. But, if you're planning on using Las Vegas Monorail as a main transport mode, Monte Carlo is really far from the nearest station (allow 20 minutes to walk to either Bally's or MGM station). Hotel Layout -- The hotel building is Y-shaped so that there are 3 sides to the building. One side opens directly out to the Strip, another side faces south, and the third side faces north. As others have noted, there is a construction going on north of the hotel, and the most-affected rooms are on the north-facing side. The Strip-facing side partially faces construction, as well. But we stayed on the Strip side and we weren't affected much at all by the noise. If you're really sensitive to the noise, definitely avoid the north-facing side and maybe also consider avoiding the Strip-facing side. Half of the south-facing side should give you a decent view of the Strip (NYNY, Excalibur, Mandalay Bay, etc). Although I've not stayed on the north-facing side, I think half of the rooms on that side should give you a nice view of the Center Strip (Paris, Belaggio, Caesars, etc) although any view would be beyond the construction and you'd also have to be on a high-enough floor. Room -- The guest room is clean and well-maintained by housekeeping, and sometimes this is all you can ask for in a hotel. The bed sheets were crisp and bath towels felt thick and fresh. The bathroom was clean, with good shower pressure. Nice toiletries, as well. But the room definintely wasn't as luxurious as Mirage or Treasure Island or even MGM Grand. The room's windows were extremely dirty and so it took away from the nice view. Also, they seem to be short on king-size bed guestroom. We checked in fairly early (around 3pm) on a Saturday, and they didn't have a single king-sized bed room left, except on the construction side. Service -- This was the most frustrating part of Monte Carlo. The check-in process was a real pain and took us close to 1.5 hours in total! Saturday 3pm should be the peak check-in time, yet only 5 desks were open and there were at least 5-6 parties lined up for each desk. For a hotel with almost 3000 rooms, this is unacceptable. After about 20 minutes of waiting, our line's check-in desk announced they were closing. So we had to move to the back of another line, and you can imagine our frustration... no staff member cared about how unfair this was. It took almost an hour to check-in. Then we went up to our room and found out our room wasn't ready! Then we were forced to head back down to the lobby and wait once again in a line (this time at a different desk) to get a room change. This took another 20 minutes or so. Also, I felt that some of the staff at the buffet were extremely stand-offish. Food -- We only ate the Food Court and at the Buffet, so can't comment on other restaurants. The Food Court was extremely convenient with decently long hours, and the lineup of Sbarro's, Rubio's, McDonald's, Subway, Manchu-Wok and Starbucks was well-balanced and excellent. The Buffet was disappointing, though. Although they have decent variety, the quality of the food/ingredients was cheap and subpar. I didn't feel too well afterwards. Better off spending a little more and going to Belaggio or Planet Hollywood. And it's also simple things like there only being cheap romaine lettuce (versus mixed fixed greens and arugula at Belaggio) or having only watermelons and melons for fruits (versus pineapples and strawberries at Planet Hollywood). Ambiance/Casino/Kids'Stuff -- This is not a glamorous casino/resort with impressive fountains and gardens and animals. The casino is very sedate and I would even say it's dead after 1am on a weeknight. This place is basically a quiet place to stay in the middle of the Strip. If that's what you're looking for, I think it's a good place. If you want to be in a high-energy, vibrant atmosphere, this place may not cut it for you. All in all, Monte Carlo was good for what we needed and so we won't mind staying there in the future. But there were major issues with the service. If you're looking for a luxurious room, first-rate service, or mind-blowing megaresort experience, you won't find it at Monte Carlo. Also, avoid the north-facing rooms if you're sensitive to the construction noise.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo - Perfect Size”
Reviews.Author: kupaua
Reviews.Content: Flew in from Hawaii and rented a car - knew our room would not be available until the afternoon. Used valet for our car when checking in and throughout stay. Very courteous and provided fast service. Check-in was fast and efficient. We asked for a room with a view of the Strip and near an elevator. Both were provided with an additional 20 minute wait. Room was clean with very comfortable beds and nice linens. Had to call maintenance to get the tub to drain. Once cleaned out - it worked great for all 4 nights. All hotel staff we encountered were great and did their jobs well. Lobby is elegant and slightly away from the casino. Casino is well appointed with friendly dealers and minimal smell from smoke. Buffet and Cafe were adequate and reasonably priced. Other restaurants on and off the Strip are better. Construction around the hotel is a distraction. Sound was not a problem but access is limited to only one entrance off of Las Vegas Blvd. Overall it was a pleasant experience and will be even better once the construction projects are completed! Not too big, easy to get around in and out of the hotel. Will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice,but the did away with the Brewery, no real slots anymore,anywhere”
Reviews.Author: Camie41
Reviews.Content: This use too be our favorite place to stay. All slot machine in LAS VEAGAS do not spit out money anyone, there all a receipt you have to redeem to get your money, boring. That's no fun . What happened to the Marlo Carlo Brewery , they don't brew anymore and got rid of the wonderful BBQ baby back ribs. They have gone down hill. Forget requesting a room with a view of the strip ahead of time , they dont listen,I bet if I was a big movie star they would gave it to me. Sorry Monte, I think we are moving on to a new hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Any other standard 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: docnoc
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 days last week. Stay was average, nothing spectacular and nothing much to complain either. Construction did not bother me at all. will definitely consider staying there again. Located right on strip, next to bellagio. This was my first trip to vagas, my tip would be to buy Fullday bus pass, buses running very frequently and you can easily see the entire city in a day.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: julierickbleu
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo for 4 nights in late September. We are a couple in our late 30s-40s and try to get to Vegas once a year. This was our first time staying at the Monte Carlo. We thorouglh enjoyed our stay and would likely stay there again! We had requested a strip-view room when booking on their website. When checking in, we asked the very-friendly employee if we would be facing the construction. She said that no, the construction on the strip side was over, at least for the time being, and that the most construction was currently goingn on on the pool side. Our room was great, and we barely heard a sound on our floor. The room was nicely appointed, seemed like it was fairly new, and the bathroom was large. The entire 17th floor was non-smoking, which was nice. Never had to wait long for an elevator. We rented a car, and when we parked it around 5-6 pm each night (and then walked or took cabs), we were always lucky enough to find a spot in the surface lot right outside the entrance. The MC casino is smaller than many and we didn't spend a lot of time gambling there, but it was nice to come back to after a day of casino-hopping. While the MC dealers weren't always the most friendly, the drinks were plentiful and the bar staff was very good. Express checkout was nice and saved us from waiting in line. A new Mexican restaurant, "Diablo" ,opened right on the Strip in front of the MC the week before we arrived and is definitely worth checking out. Never got around to spending time at the pool, although we walked around it and it seemed like the noise from the construction right behind it might be annoying. If you want to spend a lot of time by the pool, this might not be the place to stay right now.

Reviews.Title: “I've seen better”
Reviews.Author: thompsonfh
Reviews.Content: We visited the Monte Carlo in early Oct. The hotel is surrounded by construction of the new Las Vegas City Center which consists of several towers being constructed 24/7 (I've never seen an operation like it). If you plan to stay here, get a room facing south above the 25th floor. Much of the noise will be cut out but your view will not be the best. The pool area is no good. It only gets sun from 1 to 5 and is on the ground level next to the casino. Also, there are to many kids running around so if you are looking for an escape from kids, this is the wrong place to relax. Did I mention the constant sounds of machinery on the other side of the fence? Not good. As for the hotel itself, it was very nice. The rooms were clean although the bathrooms were small and not nearly as nice as MGM, or Planet Hollywood where I have stayed in the recent past. Had I done it over again, I would have stayed at Planet Hollywood for $60 more added to the cost of my trip.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect refuge in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: tsalladtsallad
Reviews.Content: This beautiful hotel in a great location made our first trip to Las Vegas very memorable. The Monte Carlo was quieter, less smoky and easier to navigate than any of the other Strip properties that we visited. Our "Monaco Suite" was very large, clean and comfortable. Hotel restaurants including Buffet were reasonable with a great selection and staff. Pool area was well appointed but nearby construction hurt the tropical feel. Not a lot of glitz or big shows made this hotel a welcome refuge from a day of sightseeing and shows. Home of the Lance Burton Theater (magic). We loved the Monte Carlo, will recommend it to our friends and will return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and rooms!”
Reviews.Author: iowatravelgal
Reviews.Content: Husband and I stayed at the Monte Carlo during 9/3 to 9/7. I was a bit skeptical about this hotel after seing some of the reviews on this site, but figured I was getting a great rate, so we stayed anyway. I'm very glad we did, because we had an excellent stay! Check in process was great, asked for a room fridge which was brought up within minutes of our arrival in the room. Received a room on the 31st floor overlooking the pool area and yes, some of the construction. We did hear very faint construction during our stay, but nothing that would wake you up, nor impair your ability to sleep at night. The room was clean and maid service was very prompt in the mornings. We stayed in a king room, non smoking and had no complaints. Sink did appear to drain slowly, but nothing terrible. The pool area was also great; we spent one afternoon out on the lazy river and wave pool. We brought our own floats and the cabana boys were gracious enough to blow them up for us without a problem. I would definitely stay at this hotel again. My H was very impressed with the service we received and liked the fact that he didn't get lost every time he left the room, as has happened in other larger casinos and resorts we've stayed in. Buffet was ok; nothing out of this world. The food court has a decent selection of choices and we picked up our breakfast there almost every day. Can not comment on the other restaurants there, as we didn't eat in them.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel shame about the construction work....”
Reviews.Author: TAG-2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo from 22 to 27th September. We originally had a roomon the 14th floor overlooking the pool area - unfortunately this also overlooked the massive construction site next door. We asked to move the next day and were moved to the 27th floor overlooking the Strip. Unfortunately this still involved overlooking the construction work. The worst was the beeping noise from the lorries backing back in the middle of the night. We broached teh subject on check out that we had lost a lot of sleep, and they offered us a generous discount on teh 5 nights accommodation so that softened the blow a bit. The brewery pub is great and convenient to the central part of the hotel. The location on the strip is great as it seems fairly central to the rest of the strip. We had friend stay in teh Luxor and they spent a lot of time in taxis. We would probably stay there again after construction has finished but that won't be until late 2009!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, Not Terribly Exciting”
Reviews.Author: Hawkwild
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Monte Carlo for a conference this week, my first visit to Vegas ever. The building is lovely and the staff couldn't have been nicer. My room was spacious, although housekeeping had missed a small piece of litter in the room (an unopened moist towlette packet from a local restaurant). No big deal, but some folks would have freaked out I'm sure. Many of the reviews here had talked about the construction next door, so I was sure to ask for a "strip" view, thinking this would solve the problem. It did not--the strip view is from two different sides of the triangular hotel, one of which (towards Paris and Bellagio) is right over the unsightly construction, which features penetrating beeping "back up" warning buzzer noise from the construction equipment 24 hours a day. To be honest, I wasn't bothered by it much, but just know that you need to specifically request "NOT BY THE CONSTRUCTION" in order to avoid it. Other than that, I found the hotel to be comfortable and well located, although somewhat lacking in character. I think I might stay at a more "Vegas-y" property next time. Oh, and I really enjoyed their new Mexican restaurant Diablo's. Very tasty and a nice atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: jewishjim
Reviews.Content: My brother and I stayed at the Monte Carlo September 16-20. What a beautiful hotel! We encountered none of the negatives posted by others. Fast check-in. Fast checkout. The staff went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable. This hotel may very well be the best value in Vegas. Our room was quiet, well appointed, and the view overlooking New York New York was spectacular. The elevators are amazingly fast. The food at the buffet was out of this world! This hotel has it all. I hasten to recommend it. Excellent!

Reviews.Title: “I'd go back”
Reviews.Author: SPopp
Reviews.Content: Well, after reading other reviews on this site, I was definitely concerned with the noise from the construction of the "city centre" next door. We asked for a room on the south end of the hotel, and really, the noise wasn't an issue with us. This was a nice cheap hotel, room was very clean, and housekeeping was done with our room by 10 am usually. Always received fresh towels each day, even though we hung them up to follow the "save water" program. Ate at the buffet once for breakfast, and liked it. Didn't get around to trying any other of the restaurants, but the food court was super convenient: although the Starbucks was super overpriced. We're used to $3 for two coffees in the morning at our local Tim Horton's, not $6!!!!!! My one and only complaint would be the pool area. Others were right, the lazy river is very cold, and a raft will run you $14 to rent for the day. The entire adult pool area pretty much stays in the shade of the hotel until very late in the afternoon, so if you are a sun worshipper, get down there early, and find a deck chair at the far south west corner of the wave pool, or in front of the cabanas. The chairs are sooooo tight together that you have to climb onto them from the bottom of the chair! Good luck getting any space to walk between them. Only went down to the pool area once. Staff wasn't overly diligent at keeping people with small children out of the adult pool either. (there is a kid's pool, wave pool, lazy river, adult pool and hot tub) Really liked that our rooms were accessible right from the lobby of the hotel. No having to trek through the entire casino to get to the elevators. New York, New York is right next door, and you are pretty central to the strip. I suffered a serious back injury while there on vacation, and we were given use of a wheelchair for the rest of our stay at no extra cost to us, which was a pleasant surprise. I was so worried about this hotel after reading other reviews, and to be honest, it wasn't bad at all. I'd stay there again just for the price. Again, the only issue I had was with the pool area being in the shade most of the day. So, if you have booked this hotel and are worried about your stay, please, rest assured, you'll be pleased with the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: tpcruise
Reviews.Content: I found a deal on the hotel's website for $70/nt including free buffet coupons. The check-in line was long, but went fairly quickly. The staff were all friendly and had an excellent attitude, from the front desk check-in person (James), pool side shop and area, to the restaurant and casino staff. There is a CVS pharmacy right in front of the hotel. Across the street is Walgreens, and the Coke Bottle plaza (1/2 price same day tickets opens at 10am I believe). We have stayed all over the strip, and found this area to be easy walking distance to everything. Pool area : clean, lounge chairs available. The lazy river was where we spend our time outside. We brought our own drinks down in plastic cups, and read a review earlier about buying blow up water tubes at CVS for $5.99 each. Take them down to the pool shop beside the lazy river, and they will gladly blow them up for you. They also have a wave pool, which was ok. There is also another lounge pool, which wasn't busy at all. Rooms: Hallways, and elevators are very clean and quiet. The room was clean, quiet (except the first night when a bunch of people in the next room were noisy all night until 5am, we changed rooms the next day), and had a view of NYNY. They were doing construction outside, but we couldn't hear too much noise (except the beeping noise of equipment at times). The buffet dinner was average (Hilton's buffet earlier in the week was much better with a lot more variety and fresher food). Overall, it was good experience for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo Las Vegas Strip, Nice Hotel but Noisy”
Reviews.Author: VIVSpain
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel - with friendly staff and very good Brewery Rooms are Ok.........Casino is good but the problem in the rooms is the noise of the works from nearby the hotel (city Las Vegas) working 24hours/7days. They changed the room but still, you can't get rid off the noise which is everywhere. Will go back to this hotel when the works are done.

Reviews.Title: “Ugh!!”
Reviews.Author: SukiLosAngeles_Ca
Reviews.Content: The hotel was surrounded by buildings under construction. You could hardly hear yourself talk. Luckily the waves were loud enough to drown out the noise at times. The dust was another issue. There was mold in the bathroom and they made a mistake with the reservation and didn't amend it when I pointed it out. The hotel was booked that weekend as it was coming up on fourth of july.. I thought the room was in severe need of updating. The towels had holes!! in them and when I called for new ones they asked my why? They brought new towels that were shabby and worn and you couldn't pay me to go there again. There were huge cracks around the pool and we all stubbed our feet at some point. It just sucked and the management was too busy to deal with it. Never again. Mandalay Bay all the way!!

Reviews.Title: “About Average”
Reviews.Author: duncmelsmom
Reviews.Content: We arrived at midnight on a Friday night. The lobby was gorgeous for my first view of Las Vegas. The only problem I had is that we asked for non-smoking and the room smelled of cigarettes. Luckily the window cracked so we could air it out while we slept. No other complaints. The hotel has a great lazy river pool with (it looked like) a wave pool and a regular pool. Sounds great for kids especially since it was complete with lifeguards, shops, and a bar! Oh, I forgot to brag about the great location. The casino didn't come close to NY, NY or MGM, but it was lovely none-the-less.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: cuteontariocouple
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are in our early 30s. We stayed at the Monte Carlo from September 9-12 2007. Reviews I read prior to going implied that it is a boring place and not fancy or comfortable enough. This was one of the nicest rooms I have stayed in, especially for the price (about $60 per night - cheaper than the airport hotel we stayed in the night before we left!). The hotel/casino itself was lovely and in a convenient location. We booked a special through the hotel’s website, then found an even better special on their website 2 days before leaving and re-booked at a better price, saving about $200 by calling the hotel. We arrived at 11am on a Sunday and there was a pretty big line to check in. We checked in and got our room but they said it would not be ready until between 3-5pm. No problem – we left our bags at the bell desk and used the free buffet coupons that came with our room deal for the Champagne brunch. All you can drink champagne along with the brunch buffet with breakfast, carving station, hot foods, crab legs and shrimp. This is the only buffet we went to in Vegas, but it was definitely good, especially for free! Once we checked into our room it was very nice. King non smoking on the 21st floor at the very end of the hall. We had asked for a view if possible. The only view we had was of the MGM Grand and a little of NYNY but it was ok. The only time I heard construction noise was when I woke up at 4:30am I could hear beeping like a truck reversing. It wouldn’t have woken me up, I just happened to wake up at what would be my normal time back home. A light sleeper might be bothered though. But we were up between 7 and 9am every day and never heard anything else. The pool was really nice. There is an area in full shade which is great for relaxing, but the water stays pretty cold. The wave pool wasn’t working so we didn’t use it until the last day. It is in full sun and much warmer. Too bad there were no waves though. The Lazy River was also fun, even without a tube. We did not hear any construction noise at the pool, which was something I had been worried about, but the view was of construction cranes overhead. Food options at the hotel were very convenient. We ate at the buffet, the brew pub (great service at the bar both times, great sliders!), and used the food court for breakfast at McDonalds and some lunches and late-night snacks. The line-up at Starbucks was crazy in the morning. We liked the Mexican place in the food court. It is nothing special but way better than anything we get in Canada. There is a big new margarita bar and Mexican restaurant opening soon attached to the Monte Carlo, but it was unfortunately not open when we were there. The only problem we had was trying to walk out of the hotel to the North. All the construction has closed off all the North exits so we had to exit on the south side and walk on the street towards Bellagio. The street is not very nice with the construction happening but it wasn’t too bad. It just seemed a lot farther when it was so hot out. We had a great time at this hotel. Maybe people who complain are used to staying in suites at the bigger properties but we liked our room, had great service from everyone we dealt with and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo is all about customer satisfaction”
Reviews.Author: alli_han
Reviews.Content: The check in was smooth, even though it was busy, as Sunday is their busiest day. We went over to the informaton desk after check in and they gave us extra free buffet coupons...so we got four free buffets to use anytime of the day. And what a buffet...smoked salmon and sirloin steak to name a few...for breakfast! We upgraded our room to a Monaco suite. The first room we got 3rd floor with a terrible view of the roof, but we called front desk and they changed us to the 16th floor. They said the room would not be ready until 5 pm but they let us stay in the 3rd floor room until them. The casino was pretty plain compared to the New York New York and MGM, but it was okay. And not too smokey like some of the other casinos. Dragon Noodle was an amazing experience! We called prior to our stay and made arragements with "Gina", as we had our wedding supper there. Gina was super helpful and made everything run smooth. She even faxed us menu options and emailed us quite often before the supper. The waitress "Wing" was awesome and fast. She was always there to serve us and super friendly. The food came out in a timely manner and just kept coming! Food food and more food. And so reasonably priced! We didn't have time to check out the pool or the fitness area, as Vegas has so much to do and see. We meant to get ot the spa but ended up too busy as well. The cafe was excellent and well priced. The servers pay extra attention to detail and accomodate any request (as I could not have certain things in my food). The conceirge "Eddie" was amazing. We had booked our Chapel elsewhere and it ended up to be closed! We went back tot he hotel and spoke with Eddie and he helped us booked another Chapel, which was cheaper, nicer and had limo service for our whole group to and from the Chapel. Eddie also was useful in "where to go" and "the best bang for a buck". Our room was clean, but internet is not free, which is the same in all Vegas hotels. Be aware that internet is $12.95 a day in most hotel rooms. We had six people stay at the Monte Carlo and all of us were more than HAPPY witht he hotel, services and especially the staff. We had 12 others stay in other hotels and the only other hotel that was recommended by our friends was the New York New York, which is an affialiated hotel of Monte Carlo. As a tip, make sure to get a member card from the casino and you can use it to gamble at a number of hotels. And charge your meals and stuff to your room and at the end of the stay they will comp you if yu ask. We broke even at gambling and they still comped us the last night of our stay...which was the pricier night.

Reviews.Title: “ok for the price”
Reviews.Author: Anna358
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Monte Carlo from Sep 5-8. The hotel looks great on the outside, but inside is nothing special. Our room was small and sheets were not the cleanest. The hotel not walking distance to other major hotels like Venetian, TI and Ceasars. Overall the experience was good. The breakfast buffet was pretty good and the price was decent, try Paris buffet much better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for a great price!”
Reviews.Author: lbeesa
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at the Monte Carlo from Sept 3-8th, 2007 and we were very happy with our experience there. When we first arrived we had to wait about 30 mins to check in but that was only because there was a lot of people checking in at the same time. The staff was very friendly and courteous. We were first assigned a room on the 5th floor with 2 double beds...so we went back down to reception and changed rooms because we were supposed to have a King room..they graciously changed the room for us to a King room away from the construction(like we requested) on the 19th floor but told us it would not be ready for a few hours (we were checking in early around 11am) so we said fine. We left our bags and went shopping, came back around 4pm and the room was ready. The Room was nice and big, clean and had a very comfortable bed.
