The only complaint was one morning when I had to get up at 4am for an early trip to the Grand Canyon and my shower had only luke warm water..not hot. But the problem was resolved by the next morning. We never heard any construction noise..only the noise of neighbors slamming doors..the room doors are very heavy and slam if you let them close by themselves..We would be nice and not let the door slam..but others..not so much. Also there are no fridges in the rooms which would be a plus. The location of this hotel is great. RIght next to New York New York and MGM and not far from Paris and Bellagio. We walked everywhere. There is a bit of construction/renovation going on in the Casino but nothing noticable really.(Tip: Play Craps! It's the best game to win on. Just bet the pass line..and you'll win! The MC has lessons every morning at 11am) We also tried the Monte Carlo Buffet for breakfast. It was good. Lots of choice and not expensive. The food court is great if you need to grab something fast and cheap! Only thing that sucked was that it was not mentionned anywhere that Lance Burton the magician who performs at the Monte Carlo was on vacation until Sept 18th. Overall great hotel at a great price for the location and amenities! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to stay...Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: EHKC
Reviews.Content: When I travel to Las Vegas...it's always at the Monte Carlo... location is great (minutes from McCarran Airport)...the Food Court is a plus...even though the construction was going on when I was there with my daughters...we didn't hear a thing...utilized the pool area and didn't encounter any dust... the staff was extremely friendly...I had my daughter's bachelorette part in Vegas and all the invited attendants loved the hotel and what goes on in Vegas...stays in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “What a difference mega corporate ownership makes!”
Reviews.Author: likestoroam
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four night stay at the Monte Carlo.We've stayed here many times in the past but this was our first stay since the change over to MGM ownership. There are still some positives about the place, it is in a convenient location, as long as you dont have a problem with the massive Citi Center construction project next door. This is a 24/7 operation as I was treated to construction equipment at all hours of the day and night. For you who love to lounge in the pool area be aware-The wave pool is literally bounded by boulders---that is what separates the pool area from the construction. Monte Carlo is renovating their casino. I would have really appreciated knowing that 1/3rd of the casino would not be available BEFORE we got there. The rooms are okay but not worth the rate. The casino employees seem more like zombies than live people. The always convenient Food Court staff is even more incompetent than ever and last, but not least, the casino comp system has changed. I would not recommend to anyone, not anymore!

Reviews.Title: “Too smokey”
Reviews.Author: citygirl_29
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Monte Carlo for two nights while in town for business. The lobby and shops are nice but the casino floor is incredibly smokey. If you even pass through it on your way out you will smell like smoke. I walked through other hotels on the Strip and the Monte Carlo is definitely not as well ventilated as the other hotels. I don't know how families with kids could stand to be in the casino with all that smoke. Ate dinner once at the buffet and was disappointed by the attentiveness of waitstaff and quality of the food. Had dinner and breakfast at the 24-hour cafe and greatly preferred the cafe over the buffet - good menu variety and reasonable prices. One irritating thing was on two occasions while eating breakfast in the cafe, a loud alarm went off because they were testing the sprinkler systems. The alarm sounded like a tornado warning and was accompanied by flashing strobe lights. The "test" lasted for almost 15 minutes and was quite distracting when you're trying to enjoy a quiet breakfast. This happened two days in a row. Played the slots a bit and it appeared part of the casino floor was under construction. Room was clean and up-to-date. Nice big bathroom and great shower pressure. Used the taxis daily and sometimes had to wait in the taxi stand for 5-10 minutes. Not because of the amount of people, because of the lack of taxis! You would think they would be lined up waiting to take customers. Bellhop and all hotel staff were very friendly. Might stay here again if I wanted to be in the hustle and bustle of the Strip as the price was very reasonable ($80/night) but am opting for another hotel the next time I'm in town on business and want a quiet place to relax. It is a great location and easy to get to MGM and NYNY.

Reviews.Title: “Not a pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: TopekaDucky
Reviews.Content: I am a little late in typing this, but I want to share my observations of the construction when we stayed at the Monte Carlo in June. I sent a written request to the hotel manager about one week before we traveled asking if consideration for something special be made for us since we were celebrating our 30th Anniversary. Now I know the hotels get many special requests, but this was valid. I also took time to write which is more than most people do when they just show up at check-in with requests. #1. There is no parking due to the construction, and we do not valet our rental car but found a spot near the handicapped parking right outside the check-in lobby. I was told at check-in that we could park in the garage at NYNY (it was over 100 degrees that day so was trying to find a shady spot for the car) #2. I asked the clerk at the desk if there was a note in our reservation since I had written to the hotel manager about our stay, and she wasn't interested in being polite or answering my question. Her reply was to hand the room key (card) to me and ask if I wanted anything else. I again asked if there was a request in our reservation, and she no we don't do upgrades (funny I didn't use the word upgrade which further led me to believe she was aware but not interested in assisting us) #3. When we got to the room, it overlooked the construction on the strip for the new City Centre (and I had asked her to please not put us near the construction), and there were several pieces of heavy equipment running which was noisy since the room and windows were not well insulated. This was around 3:30 PM so figured it would quit around 5 or so, but they were still working until it got dark. OK....we were fine with that until it began at 6AM the next morning! #4. As I mentioned above, the building (at least the area we were in) was not insulated well at all, and we could hear people talking and other noises :( from the rooms on either side. Then at 2AM we woke to hear a woman screaming and begging, no, no from a room maybe a floor above us which was very upsetting but were so shocked we didn't call to report it since we weren't even sure where the room was to tell the staff although I did report it the next morning. I also offered to give a statement if security was contacted but to this day we haven't heard anything from the hotel. I assume responsibility since I should have done several things differently such as ask for the manager at check-in, go back to the desk when we got to the room and ask to be moved, and call security at 2AM but honestly as customer, I expected better service and accomodations from that class of hotel. We have been to Vegas many times and never had this type of experience. Our friends were also in the same hotel but a different area and had a wonderful stay so guess we'll assume our experience was not the norm although we will choose to stay elsewhere when we return to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Nice - but lots of Construction...”
Reviews.Author: IdahoPeoplez
Reviews.Content: Clean, decent, nice room (see the user pictures under this motel -- the newer ones depict the rooms quite correctly). The only miss is the massive structure and construction going on just to the North of this hotel. Good luck sleeping in -- all the beeping, sawing, and construction noise will prevent you from sleeping in after a long night on the strip! I suppose that is Vegas, however -- always building, improving, etc. The Pool was nice - much more scaled down from the Mandalay Bay's river and wave pool. If you have the money and children, I would much more recommend staying at the Mandalay due to the pool facilities! The buffet here was lacking. We spent just a few dollars less than a upscale buffet (Bellagio, Planet Hollywood's Spice Market, Etc) and received below average food. They even charged our credit card twice for the meal! How nice! At any rate, great rooms for the buck. Would like to eliminate the construction. If you stay here, ask for a room that does NOT face the construction! Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy with Construction..Valet limited”
Reviews.Author: Detroitjb
Reviews.Content: We were very excited to be able to get such a good rate for a room at the Monte Carlo on the Strip. We found out why it was such a great rate...CONSTRUCTION. The construction was noisy from the early morning to the early evening. The valet parking was OK if you got to the hotel before say 10 pm. After that the cars were lined up out to the street and the valet couldn't accept any more cars. Definitely a draw back. I would only stay here when the construction of the City Center next door is complete. I recommend to stay somewhere else in the mean time. P.S. I didn't find the Slots to be very loose at all.

Reviews.Title: “Viva Las Vegas !”
Reviews.Author: LolaEngland
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Monte Carlo for 1 week in July. I must say before I went I was a little worried having read previous reports on this hotel.It was my first trip with my husband minus the kids in 7 years !!. Having arrived at the hotel , we checked in with no problems , and even wangled some free passes for the spa. The room was spacious, clean , bed very comfy !. Pools were excellent lazy river was my fave. Food court was ok . Casino is spacious and not to busy, only dissapointment is that it doesnt pay out coins anymore , only tickets !!( I use to love walking about with my money tub). Great location, check out the canyon and skywalk it's a must. lance Burton show was ecellent also. All in all good stay. Dont be put off by the construction, our room was facing New York New York ,and we didnt hear any. Will definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Hated the Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: bri90154
Reviews.Content: What a disappointment! The rooms are old and barely clean and in dire need of some renovations to bring this hotel in the current century. The chairs were so dirty, I was reluctant to sit on them. There was a leak in the bathtub faucet and although we reported this to housekeeping, the problem was not fixed during our 2 night stay. There is no minibar or safe in the room and the internet never worked. There is a fitness room; however, the hotel charges $19 per person, per day to access it. That is a first. I am a tour operator and travel extensively throughout the year, mostly in 4 and 5* properties. Never have I been asked to pay to use the gym equipment. The casino and common areas are bland and unappealing. We couldn't wait to go to the other casinos. Next time, we will stay at the Bellagio. The rate is almost the same and the accommodations are superb.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sander656
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Monte Carlo from 8/25 to 8/28 for our 10 year wedding anniversary- we had a great time. Read alot of reviews making it a horrible hotel but we never encountered any problems.. check in was FAST- took like 5 mins and even though it was only 11 am our room was ready- the room was a standard room and we had king size COMFY bed.. the room was clean and quiet. There is construction going on but they did not work on SAT or SUN - they were working on Monday but we hardly heard any of it. the pools are nice and I always found a place so sit and read.. not too many kids.. ate once at the buffett and it was good. It was a nice visit and sometimes I feel that people feel they have no nitpick EVERYTHING instead of just enjoying themselves.. I would DEF stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “DId the employees just use this room?”
Reviews.Author: alekea
Reviews.Content: March 16th was the single most expensive night in LV and this was the cheapest room on the strip (everything else was booked and cost twice as much). If I could have afforded it, I would have stayed elsewhere. This was my first time staying at this hotel, and it was my cousins' 21st birthday. She's been to LV before, but this was her first time there of legal drinking age. The check-in was quick; we got our keys and went to the room. Low and behold, one bed wasn't made, it smelled like smoke (not the cigarette kind), and we found a used condom and wrapper on the floor next to the unmade bed. It looked and felt as if someone had just used the room and left their evidence behind. I called the front desk immediately and was quickly transferred to a manager who apologized and offered us another room. They sent a bellboy to transfer our luggage and bring us our new keys. He was nice and offered us ladies passes to Tao. Not sure if he was doing that to be nice (they must get these easily) or if it was at the suggestion of management. If it wasn't for the used condom, smoky room, and unmade bed, this would have been a decent stay and my review would have been different. I do have to mention that at that time, the parking situation. We had to park at New York New York, MC didn't have their own parking. An extra star b/c the bed was nice to sleep in and was soft. There should be some sort of cross-checking of the rooms before a guest stays in it. If it was a guest who left that behind, gross, no one cleaned it? If that were the case, you'd expect other things to be in disarray. The bathroom and towels were clean, nothing else was out of order. That leads me to believe that employees had just used it for their pleasure. Literally. I needed to write this b/c I feel the management could have handled this better: a bigger room or comp'd room. As it was, it was almost midnight by the time we got settled and changed to get ready to go out and there was no time to argue. I will definitely stay elsewhere the next time I'm in LV.

Reviews.Title: “Good but too much noise”
Reviews.Author: mrodrig217
Reviews.Content: Lets start by the hotel, liked the hotel in general, staff was very helpfull and the hotel was very elegant inside. Their was one thing that no one told me their is a very big construction beside the hotel even though it does not make a big difference in the day time but in the night time the noise still goes on the construction is a 24/7 noise, even though i was on the 31st floor you can hear the machines going on that was the only thing going on but if the noise was not their everything else is ok, but do not think this will finish soon this construction will finish in 2010 or later so, they should give a little discount for noisy night time construction, the hotel has a food court with all the fast food restaurants you like, and the variety is very good, helpfull if staying in the hotel and having a big family. They gave a 2 for 1 buffet to use in the Monte Carlo, we used it at dinner time and had very good variety of foods and between a scale of 1-10 i give it a 7. If i had to go to las vegas again i will go back but will see if these constructions are still going on to try to avoid noisy nights.

Reviews.Title: “Construction, Construction, Construction”
Reviews.Author: Sunshinetoo
Reviews.Content: A return visitor to the Monte Carlo, I had high expectations of another wonderful stay. The room, as usual was imaculate and the bed, one of the most comfortable I've ever slept on. The problem was the construction blocking off easy access to the food. The food court, unlike the fancy restaurants at the Paris, Bellagio, etc. could onlly offer up Subway, Starbucks and the average chain restaurant found at any mall in America. The Hotel does boast a French restauraunt with a four star chef. The price of the entree at the top of the posted menu was $72.00 a plate. We found the buffet just as good as the Paris Buffet, everyone speaks so highly of. The worst problem is, the hotel is entirely surrounded by major construction. Our beautiful view, over the pool is fast dissappearing behind a 7 building high rise project. We counted 16 cranes, working al night. We learned that if a guest were to complain about all the noise, the Hotel would take the guest to another one of their properties. I can't verify this because we didn't try. The entry on the main Strip was covered with construction dust, and was barren of so much as a plant container to enhance the beauty of the architecture. This hotel is the forgotten child of the dynasty that owns the Bellagio and is building the new high rise project. Next trip I will spend the extra money and stay at the Bellagio or Mirage.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas is Not for Kids”
Reviews.Author: beachbum012
Reviews.Content: THE OKAY: We stayed at the Monte Carlo Aug 19-23nd. The Monte Carlo is right in the middle of the Strip, the rooms are nice, housekeeping was good, and there is a 24 hour CVS next door - cheap snacks. The food court is good, but stay away from the Market Cafe. We had dinner there one evening - service was okay, food was not. The dealers in the Poker Room are great! Aaron is a hoot, Bob is the most patient dealer I've ever had the pleasure of meeting. Every employee I've met in their Poker Room has been friendly and helpful to players. They're nice people. The downside: terrible payout structure for the sit-n-goes, and ring games don't get going there until after the 9:00 am tournament starts breaking up. THE PROBLEMS: We've stayed at this hotel several times over the years, but if I were to ever go back at all, it wouldn't be until after 2009 - the projected date of construction completion. There is construction going on inside of the casino as well as next door. The constant sounds of jackhammers and machinery are overwhelming and will wake you up well before sunrise - bring your earplugs. A large portion of slot machines were unplugged for the renovations that are going on. The slots are really tight here anyway, and I've never had any luck playing them. THE LIGHT IS SEEN: My spouse and I have been to Vegas several times, but I decided on this last trip that I won't be going back. It really is just a filthy, loud, overcrowded city - garbage is everywhere and the stench from the sidewalks is disgusting. I can't believe that so many parents actually bring their children here. We had to walk around drunks who were passed out on the sidewalk - and that was during daylight hours. Pornography flyers are everywhere - they litter the sidewalks. Kids are seeing this stuff - parents - please don't bring your children to Vegas. The amount of filth and waste here is mind-blowing. I'm disappointed with myself for having participated in the excess as I have. Vegas is not for kids and it's not for me.

Reviews.Title: “4th of July week”
Reviews.Author: happytravels2us
Reviews.Content: We have been to Vegas many times, but wanted to try the middle of summer -- 4th of July week. Boy was it hot! Check-in area was beautiful! Check-in staff was courteous and helpful! Requested view of pool upon check-in, but when we got to our room, could not see it. Immediately called front desk and asked if we could be moved. They were full, but offered a room the next day - we took it. Staff was very nice about it. (especially since hearing that some places are not too service oriented if you book through a 3rd party, i.e. Expedia, Orbitz, etc) Our room looked down on the pool :) as well as facing the construction of the new buildings. Noise did not bother us one bit!! Both rooms we had were nice, clean. Various staff were pleasant and helpful. Brewery was NICE!! Bartenders were excellent.... nice people! However, few things... same drinks we ordered at various bars throughout hotel (not including any restaurants) were priced differently! Don't know if it's like that in other hotels. Why?! I would think it'd be the same. Also, never been to Vegas in the 110 plus degree weather! Pretty hot! Pools should have been open later -- at least til midnight (think it was only til 7 or 8pm). Again, don't know if all hotels on the strip are like that. But in that weather, it's still pretty hot at night ... and I really wanted to cool off. And mind you, I'm not a pool person. Perhaps the hotels want you drinking and gambling.......... but overall, pretty nice hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Above Average Hotel with a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: blight
Reviews.Content: The real selling point of this hotel/casino right now is the location. It's right in the middle of the strip, with a very easy walk to MGM or New York New York. There is major construction going on right next door, with the building of MGMs City Center. So try to avoid getting a room on the North side of the hotel. That's where our room was and there was some mild construction noise that we could hear from where we were. Monte Carlo's parking situation wasn't that great either. There were limited spots available and it was all outdoors, so your car gets baked during the day. You also need to walk about 5 minutes in the sweltering heat to get to and from your car. The room was okay with a spacious bathroom. The bed was pretty comfortable. There is no fridge, but you can ask for one at no extra charge. They had a nice food court with alot of the major franchises. I especially liked their casino. They had a lot of blackjack tables available. And I mean real blackjack, not the crappy 6:5 blackjack (they had a few of those too). Overall, for less than $90 per night, it's a good deal, but I wouldn't pay more than that.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Vegas, Unimpressed with Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: Zafiragirl
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 stayed here as part of a group of 14 for 3 nights. PLUS POINTS: Bedrooms are accessed from elevators next to reception, so you don't have to walk all the way through the casino to get the kids to bed. Pool area is fun for kids, and the staff are helpful. Inflatable toys can be filled by a compressor at the poolside desk. Food options are family friendly. Buffet is good, and the staff are friendly. McDonalds and Haagen-Dazs are among the take-away options in the property. Rooms are spacious. NEGATIVES: Pool area is cramped - loungers squeezed onto every available space. Lack of waiting staff for drinks etc. Rooms are needing refurbishment. Furnishings and linens look tired and dated. Carpets dirty and stained. Noise from neighbouring construction site is an issue. Very few towels in the bathroom. Have stayed in worse places, but also in nicer, especially in Las Vegas!! Saving grace was a terrific rate through Expedia - £55 per night. If you can get a good deal on the rate, it's not awful. After all, who goes to Las Vegas to spend time in their room?? PS. I did win $210.10 playing a 5c slot machine in the MC, so it's not all bad!!

Reviews.Title: “What a nightmare”
Reviews.Author: Ayeletb
Reviews.Content: I was in Vegas for business meetings and the hotel was chosen for me. I am so disappointed. It is so old and neglected. The room is dirty. I found bobby pins on my bathroom floor and it is dirty. The room I had requested was not available (non smoking) and the guy was so rude when I checked in. They finally "found" one for me but if I would not have pushed them, they would have told me nothing was available. If you stay here, expect a 6 am wake up with the construction. And I have not had any hot water in the morning. I wish I had something nice to say but this is one of the worst hotels I have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Our home away from home!!”
Reviews.Author: lewisnval
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel. This was our 4th Trip to this hotel this year. We never heared any of the construction going on next door. This Hotel is Big in size yet its very hard to get lost. They just finished replacing the old carpet and should be done in sept. with a new restaraunt called diablo's. My wife enjoys working out here as well. she is pleased with the gym and the spa. She says the spa part is a litte small, but she enjoys it. If you have to pay for it, it is 20.00 for a full day. We have only eaten at the buffet once. We were not impressed. We do eat at the cafe 2-3 times per visit. Its great portions for a reasonable vegas price. the pics are of the diamond spa suite. This room was on the 28th floor right off the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: BettyWolverhampton
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 day trip to the Monte Carlo, Las Vegas. To be fair I had read about the problems with the building works prior to staying at this hotel, but I decided to stay with the booking. What a mistake this was. The noise from the building site was ALL DAY, EVERY DAY, 24/7! Although we were on the 20th floor, facing the strip there was never a time when we could not hear the noise from the construction site (the heavy machinery makes more noise that you can imagine). After the first night I resulted in wearing ear plugs at night but could still hear the noise! The room was OK the decor and carpet is very dated, but clean, we had daily maid service which was efficient. The Casino was busy at all time of the day and night, which surprised me. We were picked up for a trip to the Grand Canyon at 5am and there were still people in the Casino. The pool area although surrounded by the construction site is still very good, and I would say that this was the best part of this hotel. There were plenty of sunloungers (the attendants remove any towels if no one has returned to the sunbed after 1 hour). The pool area was part sun and partially shadey so this seemed to accommodate all tastes. The best part about visiting Las Vegas was the trip to the Grand Canyon. We flew to the Canyon on an organised trip, it took about an hour to fly there. We also went on the the new attraction on the West Rim of the Grand Canyon - Skywalk. I would definately recommend this experience to anyone. Would I visit this hotel again? Not in this lifetime!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay there again”
Reviews.Author: saladyball
Reviews.Content: We made our reservations in early May for a non-smoking room with 2 queen beds for 3 adults. When we arrived in early August we were told they had no rooms left like we requested but they could move us the next morning to a non smoking room. We agreed to that. There is so much construction going on directly beside the Monte Carlo which went on 24 hours a day, we were unable to sleep and we were on the 18th floor. The noise was terrible. They did move us the next morning after some persuasion. Had we been told about the construction, we would never had made reservations there and would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend with the Girls”
Reviews.Author: travelbugz2006
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Monte Carlo Resort and Casino for 5 nights in August 2007. I was there celebrating the last remaining days of singlehood for my friend as we were in Vegas to celebrate her bachelorette weekend. I had stayed at the Luxor on a previous visit to Las Vegas and although I ranked them both as a 4/5 I wish I could have ranked this hotel as a 4.5/5 as it was just a bit better than the Luxor . Pros for this property include: -A very comfortable bed (perhaps I could be biased as I retired to bed each night completely exhausted from a night of clubbing). -Elegant and clean lobby. The Monte Carlo lobby is pretty upscale in appearance with no novelty decor (ie. gold lions or stone statues) -The pool area was equipped with wave pool, lazy river and plenty of sun loungers -Handy food court with McDonalds, Starbucks (coffee that weekend was key!!!) Subway, Hagen Daas, and Sbarro -Relatively less busy casino (although I wasn't very lucky there still a 'pro') Cons for this property: -Check in. Although the front lobby is equipped for atleast 8-10 service people the hotel felt it only necessary to open up 3 windows even though there was a huge line of guests waiting to be checked in. Check in time was about 20 minutes! -Front Entrance. We took a taxi from the airport to the hotel and our cab driver admitted that many drivers believe this property has one of the more poorly designed driveways. After being at a full stop in the driveway for 15 minutes I understood what he meant. -We called down to the front desk for more towels and did not recieve them that morning (when they were needed.) To be fair we did eventually get them but it must have been later in the afternoon. We found it a better strategy to just find the housekeeping staff out in the hall and get extra towels from them Despite some of the negatives mentioned I would gladly return to this hotel if the price was right and would definately recommend it to friends. With regard to Las Vegas type tips I learned on this stay: -Tao Nightclub at Venitian is Overrated!!! Went on a Friday night and it was really busy and crowded. I think I got my foot stepped on 3-4 times just trying to reach the bathroom which by way had a a wait time of about 15-20 minutes. Enjoyed Rain at the Palms much more -Don't take the Trolley to the outlet mall on the north end of the strip (the one closer to Downtown). Spent many wasted minutes waiting for the transfer Trolleys. Just take a cab. -Wynn Buffet is the best buffet I've been to in Vegas. Worth the money as many of the food items are higher end food items (ie. rack of lamb, prime rib, snow crab, creme brulee and gelato) Hope the above review was helpful

Reviews.Title: “Used To Love It, But No More”
Reviews.Author: RetiredTraveler14
Reviews.Content: We used to recommend the Monte Carlo to all our friends as the best value on the Strip. We always had told people that with this hotel's location, prices and quality, it couldn't be beat. No more... We just returned from a 4 day, 3 night mini-vacation there and it will likely be a long time before we choose this property again. We arrived a little early, thinking we could check in and extend our trip by doing a lot our first day. Now, I understand we couldn't check in early, so that was My Bad for thinking we could do so. However, after waiting for an hour in the lobby to be able to check in, we were told it could be as long as another two hours BEYOND THE DESIGNATED CHECK IN TIME before we could get into our room. My husband insisted that this was not acceptable (would they be willingg to allow us to check out 2 hours late without question? I think not) and told them we needed to have our room NOW (we had just driven 8 hours to get there and didn't want to spend more time in the lobby). They were able to get us into a room immediately, but it was after much perseverance on my husband's part. Our room was not particularly clean, although at that point we were just glad to be able to sit down and relax a little rather than sitting in the lobby. There was dirt on the bathroom floor and hair in the ice bucket (UGH!), so we opted to try to deal with this as best we could. We also had problems with the Valet service, which previously was exemplary. Upon our leaving, we waited for over 30 minutes for our vehicle, only to find that they had parked it around the corner (rather than in front of the hotel where people wait for their cars) and supposedly called out our name. We had been waiting in front of the valet area and were both watching for our car, so they couldn't have called very loudly. The whole experience left kind of a bad taste in our mouth, especially after we thought about how many people we had sent their way. We certainly won't make that mistake again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: tpquag
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo from July 2-6, 2007. We booked two rooms from their site and had a wonderful time. Traveling with us were two children (ages 2 and 4) and my parents (6 total-2 rooms). My father within the past year had both knees replaced and hip so we needed a hotel that was easy to get around. This one was perfect! The pool area was perfect for the kids and my parents with the lazy river and wave pool. Yes, it did get crowded at times but it is Vegas in the summer in 116 degree heat! Great pools! They area was much smaller than Mandalay Bay but we were looking for smaller scale. Yes, there were allot of kids but the hotel did a good job of keeping them out of the adult areas. There was a food court right by the hotel elevators, lobby, and pool area. Everything was in one central location which made for minimal walking. The casino was not huge but that was what we were looking for. We have stayed at the MGM, Tropicana, Bally's, Flamingo, and Golden Nugget before...and this one ranked as one of the best trips yet. The MGM is just too big! Construction was found everywhere on the strip from the Monte Carlo to the Wynn. The Duece was a great way to travel but at night it was super crowded and at times would not take people on as it was full (my parents were turned down by 4 busses before they decided to walk back from TI-try that on with new knees). As for the noise, we requested a strip view room away from the construction and go it (we did this with our reservations). No extra fee was added! Awesome room and beds! I rarely sleep the first night in a new hotel and did even without earplugs. The rooms were elegant but not overly done. Yes, a coffee maker would have been nice but to find one in your room is rare on the strip. Some of the wallpaper was peeling off the bathroom walls at the corners and there was no fan in the bathroom but lately I have not been to a hotel where there was a bathroom fan! Go to breakfast at the Paris buffet! Made to order crepes! Oh so good! The food at the Monte Carlo buffet was good, nothing to rave about. When we booked it included 4 free buffet coupons so for free, I will eat there. Go to Paris for breakfast, you will not be disappointed! As for bringing kids, the only hotel that was rude to us about them was Imperial Palace while waiting for the Legends show (my father needed to sit and there was no place to wait where our kids could be...until we found the piano lounge upstairs, great tunes and thank you!). Other then that, my kids loved the shows (also saw the Fab Four, my 2 year old still talks about seeing the Beatles), the lights, the action, and those "video" games they saw everywhere that they wanted to play so bad! The Monte Carlo was the perfect spot for my family! If we ever brought the kids back to Vegas, we would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Got what we paid for”
Reviews.Author: EmpireState39
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Monte Carlo in Las Vegas from June 26th, 2005 till July 3rd. 2005. I had this review posted originally on another side but decided to put it here. Anyway here it goes. My girlfriend booked the hotel and we got $79.00 a night but the weekend nights were higher. We split the bill and it was reasonable. When I walked in I noticed this hotel was elegant and had a nice marble lobby and check in was not much of a hassle compared with shuttling from McCarran Airport. It has a fountain and statues out front. The valet parking is on the side of the building across from New York New York. Once we found our floor (floor 19) we noticed large amounts of young Japanese kids smoking on the elevator and all over the place. We originally booked the hotel way in advance and asked for a non-smoking floor and room. I had to go down to the lobby and request security and told them I wanted another room immediately as I work for the State Smokers Quitline. They put us in another room on the 22nd floor for the first night. This was too small and not laid out very well. They finally put us in another room on the 23rd floor that Monday night and that was fine. The furniture in the room is very nice and has a dark cherry finish on it. There is a table with a chair, lamp and large mirror above it. The window looked out on the monorail below it and the parking lot. There is a big dresser with the normal TV inside the two doors. The wallpaper is a tan color and was very nice. The bathroom was very nice with a lot of marble. The room has your standard amenities but the iron did not work after two days but housekeeping delivered one soon enough. This casino is located near the end of the Las Vegas strip. One thing I noticed was that it seemed to cater to an older crowd and is not overly large compared with many of the newer hotels. Logistically everything is very close and it is easy to get around the hotel and casino. I don’t really gamble and go to visit friends in Las Vegas but I have heard it is an easy casino to navigate through. It is pretty quiet considering you are next to New York New York and Excalibur. The location made it easy to visit Mandalay Bay, MGM, and the other hotels in the nearby vicinity. Monte Carlo's has the standard shops that all the casinos have. They call it "Street of Dreams" It is on the ground floor to the right of the lobby desk. It seems everything is high priced and to me looks like any other street of shops in the hotels in Las Vegas. They have the Monte Carlo Pub and Brewery which reminded me of a place that is here in Rochester. It seemed to have a sports bar theme and really did not look that interesting. It also seemed focused towards a drinking crowd and was very loud. At the time if you kept walking there is a monorail station with electric monorail service to the nearby Bellagio Hotel. I was told this eventually would be connected to the train on the other side of the strip and then to the airport to combat the increased traffic Las Vegas is experiencing. It was a short wait. At the time I was staying at the Monte Carlo the monorail was working but last year it was closed due to construction of the new “city” next door. I really liked this monorail because you could cut over to the Bellagio and walk right to Ceasers and you could knock almost half the time off the trip because of the monorail. As for the food in the hotel my girlfriend and I just ate at the Buffet once. We opted for snacks at the McDonalds at the time. There is also a French restaurant, Andre's and an Asian restaurant, The Dragon Noodle. Most of these required a reservation and we did not bother because we were out and about all the time we were there visiting people. I have read the Monte Carlo has a great pool area but we did not utilize it. Sorry I could not comment on it. They have a business office which was very nice where we got internet access. For a present I called the floral shop to get a dozen roses for my girl and they were great. The vase the flowers came in was so large we had to ship it back separately. The hotel is very nice and does not have all the external stimulation some of the hotels have. It seems a little more conservative which is fine. My only complaint is that the security could have been a little tighter. Stay at the Monte Carlo. It is very nice hotel and is worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “*upgrade* -- and you'll be happy!”
Reviews.Author: krissynita
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at MC for 5 days and had an excellent time! I think the key to enjoying our stay was the great room we had - we always upgrade and took a Spa Suite *Strip Side* at an extra $80 a night. This was money well spent. We spent our last night in a deluxe room looking over the construction and know we would not have been happy if our entire stay had been in a deluxe. Advice: if you are not staying in a suite and don't plan to upgrade, you'll probably be more satisfied with a different resort. The City Center construction *is* obtrusive at the pool and made it hard to relax there even though music was playing loudly to cover it up. Plus the sun isn't really abundant at the pool...but children are...we didn't spend much time there for this reason (too much construction noise and lots of kids...BTW, we don't have children so we personally prefer to not spend our vacation being splashed on by other people's kids -- the resort is very family friendly though, so if you are traveling with the children, you should be happy here and feel very welcomed! Therefore, don't register this as a negative if you are traveling to Vegas with kids -- they'll love it and you'll be comfortable!) The construction noise and lack of sun at the pool however, is our only complaint. Our sincere suggestion is to couples in particular: UPGRADE -- and make sure it is strip side! We never noticed the construction noise from our room - we loved the room. The food court is nice and the location of the MC overall is a *huge* plus. Close to so much! The MC does not have the foot traffic of tourists coming through it like the other resorts nearby on the strip...you can visit great spots on the strip that are nearby and return to MC with a relaxing atmosphere and not get that "overcrowded" feeling. We had a great stay and would stay there again. Played hours upon hours of blackjack there- friendly dealers and $10 tables. Mostly, we loved the location. As for food, the buffet isn't remarkable. It's nice to go to McDonald's or Sbarro's though to grab a quick bite to eat without paying a lot of $. If you are going to Vegas on a budget - stay here! You'll have a great time in a good location! BTW, we played enough blackjack that MC comped our deluxe room on the last night...everyone was friendly, resort was clean...a good stay overall. If you want Vegas luxury, stay elsewhere. If you want fun and good value in a good location that's easy access to plenty of hot spots on the strip, stay at the Monte. You'll spend less on your room (and have more $ to spend on gambling, food, shows, etc.) and you'll still enjoy your stay at the resort!

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo -the good and bad”
Reviews.Author: jodaly
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Monte Carlo in the beginning of July as an end to a 11 day trip through Wyoming and Utah. We were very excited to spend the last few days in Vegas because we were looking forward to relaxing at the pool and having cocktails. ( we were just hiking for 10 days in over 100 degrees weather) I have been to Vegas before and we did book the Monte Carlo because it was in our price range. We had read the reviews about the pool being too small and all the construction going on so we were a little hesitant. We found the actual hotel to be fine. Clean, good location, not too big so it was easy to get to the room. Plus, the pub in the hotel was very cool. Check in was fine and our room was nice. Yes, you can tell a renovation is in order soon but we were fine. As long as it was clean and comfortable, we were happy. It wasn't the Bellagio but like I said we knew what we were getting ourselves into. The most dissapointing part of this hotel is the pool for sure. Not only was it packed but with screaming drunk people who were extremely annoying!! I have been to crowded pools before but this was on the verge of disgusting. You couldnt even get a spot in any of the three poolswithout bumping into someone or havinga kid splash water in your face. The chairs are so close together that once you are laying down good luck getting up without tripping over someone. The wave pool is a joke. SO small and UNRELAXING because you are bumping into everyone and many people dont use tubes so you have kids swimming under you. The pool area also smelled like sewage, possibly due to the nearby construction site, which was an eye sore yes but didnt bother us noise wise or anything. Overall, I would have spent an extra 100 or so had I known and stayed at any other hotel with a better , cleaner and BIGGER pool area. I guess it was our fault for booking this hotel in July when everyone and anyone wants to be swimming(especially during a heatwave, yes it was 120 degrees during the days)! I would stay again if I was not planning on going to the pool but I would def book another hotel in Vegas and pay a little more if I am planning on going to the pool. Overall, my experience there was average.

Reviews.Title: “taken over by rugrats”
Reviews.Author: cadiz001
Reviews.Content: horrible!!!! The rooms are dark, dingy, and fading fast, it looked like everything in that room needed to be replaced. The pool was just horrible, it was so crowded, there was no where to lay down because everything was taken over by screaming ten years old. I felt like I was in the middle of Chuck E Cheese. If you want a relaxing experience without kids tripping over your things every second I highly suggest you stay somewhere else. To make matters worse I had stayed at the Wynn the day before, (which is the most incredible hotel ever, I had the most incredible experience there.) So to go from the Wynn to the Monte Carlo, I felt like I was checking into a motel 6. And P.S it didn't help that they were going thorough some major construction at the time...

Reviews.Title: “Great time! Great price!”
Reviews.Author: stacykwfun
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Monte Carlo! We stayed for 3 nights and the service/staff was excellent. They have some great restaurants and we loved the Lance Burton show. The price was so low that assumed the rooms would be small but they were actually pretty spacious. The best part was the wavepool, which a lot of hotels don't have. For this price, I would stay at Monte Carlo anyday!

Reviews.Title: “OK for the price”
Reviews.Author: Kitten07
Reviews.Content: Stayed here July 4-6, long wait for room to be ready even though arrived at 2:30. Had to walk through the casino to get to the strip. When I booked the trip through the hotel website, the package stated that I would get two for ones, did not materialize. Staff acted like it was a bother when I had a question about which door the shuttle would pick me at to take me to the airport. Would not stay here again. Will pay more at another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average, at best...”
Reviews.Author: Kansas38
Reviews.Content: AAA gave the MC a 4 Star Diamond rating, which is why we booked at the MC. There is NO WAY this resort deserves a 4-star rating. I only stay at 4-5 star resorts and have had good experiences thus far, based on the rating system. However, the rating this resort received is not deserved and reeking of MGM corporate bribery. Carpeting in the casino was duct taped to hide fraying seams. Coffee in the cafe was served in dirty cups. We were given a key to a room that was occupied. Then we were given a key to a room that was dirty. We paid a maid in the hallway to clean our room, so we could get in there. Tub was mildewy and the smell in the room the same. We did tip the maids well, so received amenities and plenty of towels. A far cry from what I expect with a 4-star resort. The pool was littered and reeked of sewage, over-crowded with small children, lounge chairs crammed together, pool bar next to men's restroom and reeked to high heaven, no cocktail servers to be found - not that we wanted to stay. Huge disappointment at the MC. Food was average, room was average, service was average - and at 4-5 star rated resorts, you expect more than average. Obviously, we will not return, nor will we recommend the MC. For those satisfied and pleased with average, even at average (3-star) you can do better than the MC. THEhotel, Bellagio, Mirage, TI, MGM all provide far superior accommodations and service, especially in regard to cleanliness. Take your Lysol wipes!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel for price!”
Reviews.Author: daniellaviolet
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for our wedding day for three nights. Room was spacious and reasonably clean. Good selection in food court to choose from in expensive Las Vegas. Spent a day by the pool, reasonably clean and lots of chairs. Only major issue is they are building a massive complex next to the hotel, so you need to ensure your room doesn't face the construction.....this also makes for a dusty, dirty walk up the strip as well, we wished we had known about the buses/shuttle across the road at the MGM Grand. Also had my hair/makeup done at the spa, great job and stayed put all day!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again...”
Reviews.Author: jcfenberg
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed there with our 3.5 yr old twins for one night (after staying at the wonderful Mirage for 2 nights). The construction at this hotel is unbearable, you have to drive through it just to get to the valet. Our so called "suite" was ugly with filthy carpets, I did not want to walk barefoot. There was an OPEN utility closet in the bathroom that probably had mice walking around in there. We had to call maintenance to seal it shut. We were very excited to see that they had a dvd player for our kids but it was totally unplugged and not hooked up to the tv at all. Another call to maintenance. This room only had an armoire, no proper closet which was annoying. The room itself was very old looking with furniture that looked old and dingy. The electric closing curtain broke halfway down in the middle of the night and luckily we had an adjoining room so we all slept in that room so we were not awakened too early by the sun. The restaurant was totally overpriced and just okay. The players club system was down most of the day and some of the night so I could not get my freeplay which was most of the reason we left the Mirage for this crappy hotel. The staff including the VIP staff were not helpful and I would almost say rude when I called. We took our kids swimming because we heard they had a wave pool. The wave pool was okay but so overcrowded our kids did not want to be in it. The entire pool area was waaaaay too crowded for my taste. The regular pool was too deep and very small. We stayed in for about 2 minutes. Both pools were FREEZING, I cannot believe that they are heated. If they are they keep it at the lowest setting possible. Needless to say I never want to step foot in this hotel again. Amazing to me that anyone would want to stay here. Hopefully you will think twice after you read this.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo is great”
Reviews.Author: ballard99
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo is a great hotel. It is big, yet small enough not to get lost in. It is never crowded. Many places to eat and pretty much close to everything on the strip. Rooms are always clean. This is not the first time for us to stay there and will not be the last.

Reviews.Title: “Love Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: Jade M
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd time staying here and i was hoping that this time was going to be as great as the last and it was. Check in was fast.we had upgraded already to a monaco suite over the phone and at check in we were offered the Spa suite which i had seen pictures of and knew it looked very fancy but too expensive for us.Well Rudy was amazing and he got us the Spa suite for an amazing price and we got lots of coupons for free stuff. When we got in the room i was so excited and happy it was perfect we had a great view could see all of MGM. The jacuzzi tub by the window was nice and we used it twice and just sat in it and looked out the window at all the lights. Bed was huge and comfortable if i wasn't in Vegas i would have slept all day in it. In the evening we got turn down service and they left godiva chocolates on our pillows. The Shower was huge and Had sauna function you could get steam in there while you showered it felt great. Casino area is fun and not too busy like some others. The only problem was the cocktail waitresses we would sit at a machine playing for an hour and at most only had one waitress bring me a drink and other times we did not even see a waitress. We saw Lance Burton and he is unbelievable the things that he does are crazy and leaves you wondering how he did those tricks. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the price”
Reviews.Author: leslierph
Reviews.Content: We booked thru the hotel's website thru an e-mail I recieved from the hotel. We got our rooms for $79 - $89 per night for 4 nights and also 4 free buffet coupons. For the price, this is a really nice hotel. The rooms, as you can see from other peoples pics are tastefully decorated, but plain. We loved the Brew Pub. Great food (especially the nachos), and good live entertainment at night. The only problems we encountered was that our room wasn't always as cold as we would like it (when it was 110 degrees out) and the maids were out of wash cloths for 2 days straight, and the casino was 1/2 blocked off to change carpet in several areas. The hotel and casino was very easy to get around in. Not huge like some of the Vegas hotel/casinos. The breakfast buffett was good, had omlett stations and a nice variety. Casino wise, even with the construction, we could almost always find a $5 or $10 blackjack table (not always easy on the strip anymore). Comps aren't as good as we have had at Mirage, Mandalay Bay, or Aladdin (planet hollywood now). My husband plays alot of blackjack, and we usually get all of our food charged to room comped and sometimes a night or 2 of hotel. This time we only got about $100 of food comped (better than nothing I guess). Just about our favorite day was spent at the pool. We rented a pool cabana ($150 during the week, $200 on weekends). They only have 8 of them, so they are kinda hard to get. You can call up to 30 days ahead to put your name on the list, and they call your room the morning of to let you know if you got one. We did, and it was the best day ever! The pool area has a small lazy river and a wave pool, plus a couple of other little pools. We had cabana #8 by the lazy river. It was sort of secluded. We had a party of 7 and we fit perfectly. There were 4 nice lounge chairs with thick cusions on them. inside was a love seat and a couple of chairs also padded and a coffee table and side table. There was a phone, tv, fridge, and misters. The fridge was stocked with water and various soft drinks. They also brought us a fruit tray. We had plenty of room to pull a couple of regular (non-padded) lounge chairs around. We had a cabana attendent who would bring us drinks and food (which costs extra). We got a couple of frozen drinks ($8.25 each) and a burger and club sandwich for lunch (around $11 or $12 each, came with fries). The rest of the time we drank the included soft drinks and they actually let us bring in our own beer (as long as it isn't in glass bottles). We brought little soft sided coolers and filled with ice from hotel, then there is a liquor store across the street which we stocked up on beer. It would have been very expensiive for our group to drink all day by the pool if we hadn't brought our own. There is also a CVS right next to Monte Carlo which was very convient to stock up on snacks and soda for the room. They don't sell alcohol though. That's about all on the hotel. We did see a show at the Wynn called Spamalot. I thought it looked stupid, but it was so funny! EVeryone in our group loved it! Bought tickets the day of from the hotel concierge. Very convient service!

Reviews.Title: “Won't Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: OklaOnthego
Reviews.Content: Was very noisy, Staff was very rude. Even when there wasn't a line at the desk and nobody was around, you couldn't even get them to ask you if you needed help. I felt as though they tried to ignore you hoping you would go away. The room was almost like a average hotel nothing special. The best thing about the hotel was the smell as you entered the casino from outside, was fresh and great, other than that very poor hotel. Will never ever stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Saggy bed, hot room, Monte Carlo, Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Lizzy3
Reviews.Content: Thought I got a good deal at the Monte Carlo. Lovely room but the bed was saggy and the room did not cool off until the next morning. Was offered a meal comp or late checkout but no room comp since I booked though a wholesaler. Received a $50.00 meal comp which I could not use but will give to family. No excuse for a 3.5 star room to have a bad mattress. Will not stay there again. However, the breakfast at the Cafe was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the inconveniences!”
Reviews.Author: cdrake3460
Reviews.Content: The noise is terrible. If you have to park, your'e driving around in circles trying to find a space. The music at the pool(s) is cranked up so high as to overcome the noise from adjoining construction sites. We stayed here as a substitute for the more expensive Mandalay...wave pool is a joke and the lazy river pool is more like a glorified jacuzzi. The "Mont" was a nice place before all the construction, it will probably be a nice place after the construction, but for now...seek your pleasures elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: musicbaby01
Reviews.Content: Whenever we go to Las Vegas, my parents will always book Monte Carlo because of its great rooms and service. Checking in normally takes less than 10 mins, and the people are always all smiles. As for food, there's a italian restaurant near the casino that has THE best aglio olio! With tons of clams and spaghetti, you can't go wrong. Plus, the hotel itself is very central, you can go walk across, and you'd be at the M&M store/Coca Cola store. You can walk next door to New York New York, and ride the roller coaster(which btw, is extremely exhillerating). As for the TV channels, they have programms for both young and old, so I would definitely recommend everyone to stay here=)

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: International_Baller
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a weekend in Vegas for a bachelor party and stayed at the Monte Carlo. I'm not sure how people are complaining about the construction noise since I didn't hear any, and if I did, all that meant was I was sober and a fool, clearly not enjoying Vegas at all. It's on the strip, although the main entrance is a bit off it. Rooms are cheap ($190 for the weekend, was the cheapest I could find on the strip) and the restaurants are basically just fast food joints, but if you're looking for a cheap place to stay that's centrally located then this is it. Not nearly as nice as Mandalay, Caesar's or even Paris, but it's cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, but pools are chilly”
Reviews.Author: TM-Ohio
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights with husband and two sons, 15 and 11. Initially was put on third floor with view of construction, not the strip like I'd asked. They switched us after 1 night. Hotel is gorgeous and very clean. Massive size (3000-4000 rooms). Room size (deluxe with 2 queen beds) was just adequate, but not generous. Self-parking was easy and close. On-site restaurants (McDonald's, Starbucks, Subway, Sbarro's and nicer, sit-down Cafe) were convenient. Good location near the middle of the strip. CVS next-door is convenient. Nice staff; classy place overall. The worst part, probably, was the temperature of the pools. Even though we were there during the record-breaking 118-degree heat, the pools, which are unheated, were uncomfortably chilly at times, especially in the mornings. The lazy river was very nice, but also was a bit chilly. Seems hard to believe, I know, that anything could feel too cold in 118-degree temperatures. Pools felt better in mid-afternoon and evening. We wished the pools didn't close at 8 p.m. though.

Reviews.Title: “loved the brew bar”
Reviews.Author: SuzieSlots
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Monte Carlo. 8 family members checked in July 10-July 13. We had a little wait when we checked in at 3:00 but got adjoining rooms on 15 and 17 floor. The construction didnt bother us. All the staff were very helpful and we had the breakfast buffet which we liked. $25 for 2. We got a cabana for $150 for one day and it was worth it as it has a sofa-comfortable lounges and chairs- a T.V. a safe.a refrigerator with soft drinks-a cool misting spray- It was 108 degrees in the sun so we loved it. We really liked the Brew Bar and enjoyed the free show "Purple Reign) which I think only is there on Wednesdays. All in all, a fun trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at the Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: jumpinjackjoe
Reviews.Content: Overall a very nice stay at the Monte Carlo. Check in took about 15 minutes, and they were very accomodating when we asked for a high floor room on the quiet side of the hotel away from the construction, which we could not hear, unless we really really listened for it. All of the people working the for hotel were very nice -- valet, bell, check-in, house-keeping, gaming. The pool was smaller than expected, but nice enough. Lots of chairs, but they're so crammed together it can be difficult to find a place to put your drink. While the lazy river and the wave pool are kind of lame, they're actually kind of fun too, at least for a few minutes. No need to rent a tube or raft for the lazy river, just float down it. If it's hot (it was 117 degrees when we were there), try to get a chair close to the pool entry and the building itself, you'll be in the shade most of the day. I only played poker at the Monte Carlo. The poker room was relatively small (maybe 8-10 tables), but personnel and players were nice, very loose game (bad poker players), and they have a couple of small tournaments everyday. Some people have complained about the time it took to get their car from the valet parking, we never had to wait more than 10 minutes. Minor complaints - maid didn't understand that we wanted our room made up on our first day; shower drain was clogged, but we called for service and they fixed it; buffet was kind of weak, nothing special, you can do better (we always like the buffet at the Mirage). For a unique dining experience elsewhere, try the Hash House A Go Go off the strip, I believe it's on Sahara Blvd. Huge, extravagant, over the top portions, comfort farm food with a twist.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo was fine”
Reviews.Author: Traveler_VA
Reviews.Content: We stayed in two rooms at the Monte Carlo - we started in a room with one king, and moved to a higher floor and two queens for the second half of our stay. Both rooms were clean and quiet, with comfortable beds and plenty of room. We had read reviews that complained about the nearby construction, but we had no problems with noise, even though our first room overlooked the construction site. The Monte Carlo's casino is smallish. The blackjack tables mainly had $25 minimums, and there were plenty of slot machines. We had drinks in Houdini's one evening - kind of a wierd atmosphere, because the bar is dark, but overlooks the well-lit casino. Breakfast at the buffet one morning was pretty tasty, with good selection (including an omelette bar) at $12 per person. Andre's (French restaurant) in the hotel was pricey, but delicious, and with good service. We got our room for $150/night, through one of the online discount sites. We were very pleased with the location of the Monte Carlo - close enough to walk where we wanted to go, but without the price tag of some of the more central hotels. The Monte Carlo is not as flashy as some of the other hotels; it's pretty much just a big hotel that happens to have a casino and be in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Sucks”
Reviews.Author: freeingmyself
Reviews.Content: rude employees. room service was horrible. they call it a pool. more like a sesspool. poor rooms for the inflated costs. if your thinking about staying here, i would suggest paying the same price or a little more for something better. will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “monte's not that bad.”
Reviews.Author: BEVERS1
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a few days at Monte. It's not that bad but a few issues need to be sorted. When we arrived we were offered an upgrade to a room with a view for 10 bucks per night, which we paid. Arrived at our room and the view was ok not great. Popped down the corridor to our friends room to find they had the same view at no extra charge, thanks. the pool marea is good apart from the waitress service which is non existent. Anyone who complains about the construction noise isn't partying hard enough, as it was not an issue. The casino aws in a terrible state as they were putting new carpet down so there were black screens up everywhere blocking sections of the casino off. Catch everyone elses drift regarding the slow draining baths. At some times of day the taxi line was outrageous so we asked for a car to take us to the callaway golf centre which is half a mile past mandalay bay and they wqanted 70 bucks each way. ( it's only 10 bucks in a taxi). Overall the trip was good but was not surprised by some elements of the hotel. Don't be put off by the noise or the price. good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “vegas and monte carlo rock”
Reviews.Author: bigface
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the monte carlo,19th june through to the 26th june,was there for my stag do or (bachelor party),thought the hotel had a great location,near to all the huge hotels,bellagio,mgm grand and caesars palace.the ideal thing about the monte carlo was,being with a large gang of fella,s all with different ideas on what they wanted to do during the day ie lounge by the pool and get sozzled,play the tables,or venture round vegas for the day,you could always locate each other,where as if we had been in one of the massive establishments it would have been a nightmare,but the monte carlo was ideal.the reception staff were fantastic,really helpful,they managed to locate us a costume shop which had 7 elvis presley costumes which we needed for a night,they phoned up,reserved the costumes,mind you i think they just wanted to see us all wearing the gear,which inccidently turned out to be one of the the best nights of my life,vegas rocks and the monte carlo made it easier to have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo was okay...”
Reviews.Author: ashlee1233
Reviews.Content: Las Vegas is all about the glitz and glamour so when I got to the Monte Carlo I was surprised, there wasn't really anything to go crazy for. Then I thought about it. For the location and price I got exactly what I paid for. We had one problem with the shower not draining properly, maintaince came within 10 minutes and made it drain better but still not perfect. The good: it was a pretty good location, nice pool with lazy river and wave pool, friendly staff, easy check in/out. The questionable: nothing to attract outsiders to the hotel. ie caesers has the clubs and shopping, no fridge in room, no vent in bathroom The bad: it would take almost an hour to get a cab on the weekend because not too many drivers go there. we spent 50 dollars on a towncar so we didnt have to wait. Overall, I dont think I would go back there but thats just me. I would recommend it because the place wasnt bad and how often are you really in your room when your in Las Vegas?

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: xhollaxxfrontx
Reviews.Content: This is our first time staying at the Monte Carlo. All in all we had a great time!!! Great location too!..When you get there you can either vale your car for free or you can find a parking yourself which is a lot faster. Only thing was there is no parking garage so you have to sit your car on the parking lot of 115 degrees of heat. When you get in the Hotel theres this unique smell (smells like laundry detergent) which is not too bad. Pool was great gets really crowded though so better sure u get there by 8am! Alcohol was decent price and buffet was really good esp the Philly Cheese Steak!! Nice places to walk around and compfortable rooms. When you do check it make sure u request rooms above 23 because view is much better and less contruction noise. We had a better deal on the monte carlo website than expedia, etc. Comes with 2 for 1 SPA, drinks in the Pub, and Buffet and 10$ slot play. Don't vale your car on a Sunday because that's when everone leaves!! and it will take u atleast 30 mins to get your car. Better to self park it. Hope this helps your stay!.Enjoy!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good deal for the $$”
Reviews.Author: chasj2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Monte Carlo for our belated "honeymoon" four years later. Our visit was June 16-21. All the planets and grandparents had to line up to make this work and it finally did. I must say I was terribly concerned with all the comments about the construction going on. The last thing I wanted without kids in tow was excess noise. I was searching the internet the week before the trip with serious concerns about the noise. Finally I decided so many people complain about such petty things here that I would give it a chance and if things weren't acceptable we would change. All other hotels I checked would have been $300-400 more for our stay. We arrived at the hotel at approximately 11 pm on Saturday night and had no problem checking in. I read numerous reviews or people who had nightmare stories about their check in. I think this is simply a roll of the dice. There were numerous times I was in the lobby and there were no lines and other times it was packed. All the employees we came in contact with were very helpful and friendly. Upon arrival in our room I looked out the window and saw a cement yard for the construction site. We were not overlooking the strip so I called the front desk and inquired about a better view. The front desk said the noise from construction would be much worse on the front side. We decided to stay put. Glad we did as I hardly heard any construction noise. We ate breakfast nearly every morning at the buffet. We made it through the line (when there was one) quickly. The food was good. Towards the end of the stay I was getting a little tired of the buffet so we checked the menu at the Cafe. It was going to end up being more $ than the buffet so we stuck with it. Our room was clean and no major problems we couldn't deal with. Some people have complained about any little thing. I do have a stain or two on my carpet at home so I'm not complaining about a little stain on the carpet in our room. I guess I felt right at home ;) We did eat some great meals outside of the Monte Carlo. We ate at Smith and Wolensky across the street from the hotel. Glad we had a $100 gift card because it was rather pricey. With tip we ended up at about $200 total. The food and service were great but not $200 great. We also at at two restaurants in the Venetian. Ate at Wolfgand Puck's restaurant there and had a Asian type salad and a pizza which was an excellent lunch. We split the pizza and the salad and I'm glad we did. There was plenty of food. also ate at Canaletto in the Venetian and it was without a doubt the best meal we had and the price was excellent. Could we hear the construction at the pool? Most of the time no. The music was always on so the construction noise was never irritating. The construction noise was there but it never distracted me from drinking a strawberry daquiri and looking at my hot wife ;) . The pool was a bit small and the kids were out in full force on the lazy river. If you are not a kid friendly person and you will be spending all day at the pool find another hotel. We have two teenagers and a 3 year old and although we were taking a break from the kids the only bother was some kids playing keep away with a ball in the lazy river. A few times I actually thought my wife was going to grab a kid and give them a hug. She was missing the 3 year old. If you are going to use the lazy river you may want to go next door to the CVS and get a tube for 5.99. I think rental of a tube there was over $12. Maybe even $15. We shop CVS at home so it was really convenient to have it right next door. One other non Monte Carlo related comment. The last night we were there we decided to attend the Zumanity show next door at New York New York. Don't waste your money. I am a typical easily excited male and my wife is a fairly open minded female. SAVE your money! Besides the comedy the entertainment value was minimal. If you really want to see a Cirque show I would check out one of the others. If you really want to see some T&A there has to be a better place for the money. I, the male, was seriously dissapointed. Well, I think I have covered everything. If I haven't just drop me an email and I'll give you my opinion. C. Jackson chasj2@bellsouth.net

Reviews.Title: “No Parking Garage”
Reviews.Author: grif
Reviews.Content: Not a bad joint to stay.......but nowhere on their website or when booking by phone do they tell you that their parking garage is not available due to massive and noisey construction on their property. If you want to self-park you have to park across the construction laden street and walk a dirty, dusty maze to the hotel. A bit sneaky not to let folks know I would say!!!

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo Resort & Casino”
Reviews.Author: MistyScot
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 6 nights at the Monte Carlo. This hotel was excellent, well situated and not so busy as some of the others. We tried the breakfast buffet in the hotel and it was really good. Bars in the hotel were very nice. The rooms were nice and had everything you could need. Only slight criticism would be of the pool area. Sunbeds were crammed together and you either had to be in full sunshine or total shade. It was 109 degrees when we were there so you couldn't sit out in full sun for long. Would be worth them providing umbrellas to offer part shade. This was our second visit to Las Vegas, this time to attend a wedding in MGM. It was lovely and the wedding chapel was first class. The whole ceremony was very tasteful. An awful lot of building work going on on the strip. All the cranes tended to spoil the skyline, however we'll have to return again some day to see all the new buildings!! Marion & Brian, Moray, Scotland

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Stay”
Reviews.Author: BlueRTA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo for several nights the week of June 11. As with previous stays, everything was nice, the rooms were clean, and the pool was excellent. The hotel offers a great value for the price; while it is not in the same category as some of the high-end properties the Monte Carlo provides a good vacation experience. The location is very convenient and the food, pool, and lobby are all near the elevators (unlike other casinos where you must travel across the gaming floor to reach various services). There is sometimes a problem getting 1 king bed due to availability. Overall, we plan to stay here again (and have stayed here several times previously).

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo Hotel, what a dissapointment!”
Reviews.Author: AdelaideRobert
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Monte Carlo for 4 nights in May 07. Had the experience of listening to very loud construction work going on all day and night. Prepaid in Australia before we left so getting out earlier would have been difficult. Just prior to checkout we packed, then left our room for a last look at the strip foolishly thinking there was no need to lock our bags. Left a tip for the room staff. Maybe they thought it was not enough! Arrived home to find several expensive small items missing we know were packed. Notified MC Customer relations by e-mail. Not much they could do we knew, but a response would have been nice. Do not stay here. Being robbed and kept awake was not worth the $300 per night we outlaided. Also, don't bother with the slots on the Strip. They are busy paying for the construction work. Best to go Downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Stay was okay”
Reviews.Author: aebooth221
Reviews.Content: The construction going on around the hotel is noisy and annoying. The pool area is horrible. The pool/lazy river was extremely disappointing. The hotel has 3003 rooms and room for 100 in the pool area. The room was okay. It was clean and the staff was helpful, if you complained.

Reviews.Title: “A Waste of Money”
Reviews.Author: Danny F
Reviews.Content: My partner and I recently stayed at the Monte Carlo. We visit Vegas about twice a year and have always wanted to stay at the Monte Carlo, so we were pretty excited about our trip. After this recent trip, we would not stay there again. The biggest problem that the Monte Carlo has that is sits right next to the City Center project so you hear 24 hr construction noise no matter what floor you are on. We stayed on the 17th floor and it sounded like they were right outside the window. Also, there is no parking structure. They demolished it for the City Center project and have a tiny lot that holds about 500 cars. We literally had to wait about 30 minutes each time we wanted to park. Each evening, the hookers were patrolling the casino floor and we were propositioned several times each night. It was like being in a brothel. I will not stay here ever again and would recommend that anyone who is planning on staying there seriously consider their options before booking.

Reviews.Title: “good choice”
Reviews.Author: mmbustillo
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at Excalibur and three at Monte Carlo and what a difference between these two properties! The Monte Carlo is elegant, fairly calm, for Vegas standards and moderately priced. The casino is not as crowded or smile filled as some others and the patrons were pleasant and courteous. Check in and out was quick and painless and our room was ready at arrival. This hotel has several pools: a wave pool; a baby pool; a whirlpool, a lazy river (rental of floats cost $14 or take your own and blow it up) and a regular pool. Go early to reserve a good lounge chair or you will get stuck in the more crowded areas and feel like a sardine! The location is pretty good with the MGM and New York New York next door and a 20 minute walk to the Bellagio, Caesar's, Paris, etc. This hotel is perfect for people who want to come home to a quiet and familial atmosphere and leave the craziness of Vegas outside.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: stacylp
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Monte Carlo while in Vegas for a convention. I had a couple friends tag along for the free room and we were all pleasantly impressed with the MC. We had a room on the 20th floor facing the strip. There was zero construction noise and I couldn't hear the neighbors either. The lazy river at the pool was operational and we didn't have any problems getting a lounger. I thought it was pretty cool that we had a real bathrug instead of the crappy towel they give you to step out of the shower onto. We had to call housekeeping the first 2 days of our stay for more towels, but then they started automatically leaving them for us during their regular servicing. When we did call, they were prompt. The MC has the only microbrews on the Strip too. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Average Room and Location: Above-Average Service”
Reviews.Author: gotarheels
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo June 4-6. Our room was on the 30th floor and was spacious. Bathroom had a full-sized shower/tub combo, two queen beds, writing desk, side chair and entertainment center. The room was showing some wear but was still in good condition. Housekeeping was excellent. My tub had a slow drain so I called the desk and a mechanic was at my door within ten minutes and the problem fixed. Also, I am a late sleeper and am used to not having my room serviced after 2pm. At Monte Carlo, they respect the "Privacy Please" signs but react quickly once it's taken off the doorknob.
