My room was clean and fresh when I arrived back around 6pm each day after attending a business conference. In addition, the beds were very comfortable with nice sheets. My only complaint with the room was that the walls are very thin. I could hear VERBATIM the conversation in the room next door (and it was a honeymoon couple, so you can imagine!...) as well as hallway noise. The casino is large enough to offer many popular games, but it is better laid-out than many in Vegas. No wandering down hallways or off into different "wings." It's all very straight-forward and easy to follow. Drink service is quick and regular. The pool area is nice, but small. They have the usual tightly-packed chairs around the pool and you need to get there either very early or very late to score one right by the water. The chairs closest to the entrance are best as they have comfy cushions...practically a novelty in Vegas unless you're willing to pay a Cabana fee. The spa is very small...just one hot tub, one cold plunge, small steam room and sauna. I wouldn't pay for it as a stand-alone service, but it is free with a treatment. The location is just so-so. It's not quite in the center of the Strip and just out of the "South Strip" bounds. You'll have a fairly long walk to get to the Bellagio area, but NYNY is close. If you walk all the way through NYNY you can use the bridge to Excalibur to access a free tram to Luxor and Mandalay. MGM Grand is also within easy walking distance (across the street from NYNY). Luckily, we had rented a car so this wasn't a problem. If you do so, be prepared...the self-park area at Monte Carlo is hard to find and small. It's in the back of the hotel off the road that leads to NYNY. You'll need to be familiar with Vegas to find it easily. Once there though, we had no trouble securing a space. Overall, it was a nice stay. The staff is particularly attentive and that means a lot to me. I'd stay here again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but some problems”
Reviews.Author: WalnutCreekLouise
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed on the third floor at the Monte Carlo May 29-31, 2007. The atmosphere is beautiful but we had a few problems. Our "clean" bathroom towels had red stains on them as well as the throw rug in the bathroom. I thought when room service came they would replace the throw rug. However, that gross red stained thing kept us company our whole stay. The food prices at the Monte Carlo are really steep for the quality of food you receive. A scoop of ice cream in a cup was $4.65. A cup of coffee from the Monte Carlo Starbucks $3.10, by comparison the same item is $1.80 at another Starbucks in another casino. Two meal deals from the Monte Carlo Subway costs $24.00 compared to half that price at another location. For dinner we ate at the cafe. I ordered the beef tips and noodles. The beef was tough and the dish was tasteless. We ate the remainder of our meals at the Golden Nugget Buffet. The breakfast buffet is $9.00 which includes food and drinks. A great value and wonderful food. The quality and price at the Golden Nugget Buffet are outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “WINNY PEOPLE STAY AWAY!!!!”
Reviews.Author: travis23
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from 06/03 til 06/08 and had a wonderful stay. we asked for a room with a strip view and higher up and got exactly what we asked for with no additional charges. Also got to check out on Friday at 1 since our plane didn't leave until 620. Rooms were very comfortable and enjoyed the bed. We heard no noise and lost no sleep over it. We also had no problem with people running the halls and really enjoyed the 3 elavators that were split up by floor levels. The casino was not over crowded at all like some of the other big hotels where you have to fight your way to the tables or machines. I recommend this hotel to anyone that doesn't go in there looking for somethin to grip about. Remember your on vacation and have fun. P.S. find me a area at least one block long in Las Vegas without construction that you can't grip about because I walked the entire strip 3 times and was unable to do so. LIVE WITH IT !!!!! IT'S VEGAS

Reviews.Title: “It really is the best deal on the strip!”
Reviews.Author: NicoleElaine
Reviews.Content: I have been reading reviews and did extensive research on where to stay on the strip in Vegas. Being a California native, I have been to vegas many times, but never during the summer. I wanted a decent pool. This trip was for my best friend's bachelorette party, 7 girls went. We booked two rooms and requested them to be adjoining. When we arrived,the staff was very courteous and welcoming. They took our bags and car immediately (FREE valet!). Our rooms were not available (it was noon), and they were able to accommodate our requests: non smoking, two queens, adjoining rooms. I had read about the construction, and I didn't think it was much of a concern. I heard a little bit at the pool on Friday, but none from there out. NOT A PROBLEM! This hotel is simple, easy to get around, great food court with starbucks, mc donalds and sbarro. I requested to be on the list for a cabana by the pool (one month before) and we were not able to get it. But we went down to the pool and saved chairs at 9AM, just fine. We still had a great experience. The rooms were clean and nice. They were larger than most rooms on the strip. I would definitely recommend this hotel, it is truly the best deal on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay.”
Reviews.Author: GrandmaSanAntonio
Reviews.Content: Because of all the construction in Vegas at this time, my daughter phoned to request a room far away from the construction noise. We stayed on the 24th floor overlooking the Strip. The room was kept very clean by the housekeeping staff. There were 3 rooms of us and we got rooms close to each other and the elevator. The casino had little smoke and was kept clean. There were plenty of different eating establishments on site. McDonalds, Starbucks and Subway were popular with our teenager. There were no complaints from any of us about the food as we found it all to be excellent. The hotel was a convenient walk to other nearby hotels, the bus stop was 1/2 block away, and there were always taxis available at the door with no waiting. There is also a shuttle to the airport. I am 72 years old and find it hard to walk far and I was pleasantly surprised at how helpful and courteous the staff were. I was offered the service of a wheelchair or an electric scooter if I needed it. The gifts shops were stocked with a nice variety of goods. One shop sells things for $10 so I could get all my grandchildren gifts. I will definitely return. There were no old musty smells at all.

Reviews.Title: “Very Elegant and Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Pam B
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Deluxe Room from May 28th through June 1st. The hotel was lovely and all of the staff were very accomodating. We received excellent service from the checkin/checkout staff, the bell staff, concierge, buffet staff, housekeeping and casino staff. The room was nicely furnished and kept clean, and it was a nice size for the value. The only complaint we had was housekeeping calling and waking us up to ask if we wanted our room cleaned, because we had the Do Not Disturb sign on the door. We had a window facing the construction and were not at all bothered by noise from the site. There was occasional beeping when the trucks were backing up but that was it. The food at the buffet was delicious at breakfast and at dinner, both had lots of choices and the food was fresh and hot.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: rxlady
Reviews.Content: Thought the Monte Carlo was an excellent hotel. Rooms were very clean, staff was very nice, pool area was great. Great value for the money. Felt very comfortable here, would come back anytime. Just a note....there is extensive construction going on around the facility. It did not bother me one bit, but may be an eye sore to some.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo is a winner”
Reviews.Author: MacPooch
Reviews.Content: Monte Carlo was a good value with clean and comfortable accommodations. Casino was very nice. Not the best buffet and the line was very slow.

Reviews.Title: “Still a Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pug13
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo 4 nights in early May. We had stayed here 2 years prior and had a wonderful time so we chose this location again. It is a very reasonably priced hotel on the strip and on our last trip we found it to be an enjoyable stay. This time around we did have some mixed feelings for various reasons that I will explain. We did have a clean and comfortable room and were not unhappy at all with this aspect of our stay. We were able to get a good upgrade for a great price at our last stay, but the options were a bit more expensive this time so we chose to save the money. We still love the casino there. It is clean and a little less smoky than others. The food options are good as well. We enjoyed the Sunday brunch at their buffet – the selection was huge and delicious. The pub had great food, but they no longer brew their own beer. The food court has been expanded and they now have a Starbucks. The first disappointment we had involved the construction which has been mentioned in other reviews. There used to be an empty lot next to the hotel. It is now being developed into a massive condo resort. As a result the free tram that ran from the Monte Carlo to the Bellagio has been removed. This was so convenient at our last stay. We had taken it up to see the fountains numerous times. Now you have to walk along the street to get up to the hotels that are more in the middle of the strip. Unfortunately construction is going on all over the strip so walking is even more crowded and difficult than normal. This, of course, is not the Monte Carlo’s fault, but it does make the location of this hotel less convenient. The first couple of nights we didn’t notice construction noise even though our room was on the side overlooking it. You could occasionally hear the beep of machines in reverse, but it didn’t affect our sleep. However, on our last morning at 7am we heard the repetitive pounding of a drill/hammer type machine. It was awful and kept us awake. We were just glad that particular noise didn’t occur every morning. In summary, we like the Monte Carlo, however, we both agree that we won’t choose to stay there again until the large construction project is completed, supposedly 2009. If you are set to stay there, don’t be too worried just try to request a room on the opposite side of the hotel. The noise will probably be less there. The Monte Carlo is a great hotel and casino for a great value. It is just unfortunate that all the construction is affecting the comfort level at the current time.

Reviews.Title: “24 Hour Construction Next Door”
Reviews.Author: NEWPORTGUY
Reviews.Content: The rate I got for a Friday night seemed too good to be true - and it was. I didn't know that there is MAJOR CONSTRUCTION going on 24 hours a day directly adjacent to the hotel. This made sleeping impossible - even on the higher floors. Dump trucks, bulldozers, jackhammers etc. I guess if you plan to stay out all nite, it might be okay. The construction is directly beside the pool area and made sunbathing during the day a very noisy experience as well. I was also a bit alarmed that the hotel had no security present as people went freely to the elevators and throughout the hotel. Even in the 3 star properties in Vegas it is common to be asked to show your room key before entering the elevators to the guest rooms. This might explain some of the "questionable personalities" roaming the halls at all hours of the night. Management couldn't be bothered with my complaints and refused to move me to another wing of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay would recommend”
Reviews.Author: suzyb1
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the terrible reviews after booking was worried about our stay but glad to say did not need to worry. On arrival check in very fast indeed. We travelled in a party of 7 - 3 rooms. We requested being put together and on a high floor. We were given 3 rooms on the 27th Floor. 2 overlooking the pool/construction area and one over NYNY. We did hear the construction noise but it wasn't enough to keep us awake. The rooms were exceptionally clean, spacious and comfortable and were kept like that throughout our 7 night stay. The beds were really comfortable. The food court was exceptionally clean and comfortable, the Pub a welcome choice for a drink after a hot days sightseeing and the buffet had ample choice and was good value for money. The Casino was very pleasant as not too big or noisy and relatively smoke free. The location was excellent and the deuce bus stopped right outside on the way back to the hotel which was most welcome. My husband won just enough to pay the balance on our trip so we were happy. Would have no hesitation in recommending the place and would definitely stay there again. PS The rest of the part y enjoyed there stay also. Especially our 12 yr old nephew who enjoyed the Pool especially the lazy river.

Reviews.Title: “Not if you want to sleep”
Reviews.Author: My Kinda
Reviews.Content: Just read acw38 San Diego's review about the Monte Carlo. That stay was 24-26 May 2007. Ours was from 24-31 May 2007. We would agree with everything that reviewer has stated about the hotel facilities and location. And would add that the 24 hr Cafe serves excellent food at very reasonable prices. However, acw38's stay at the hotel included some of the Memorial Day holiday period when work on the builiding site, which is at the rear of the hotel and stretches as far as the Bellagio, ceased at 3pm on the 25th. Unfortunately for us, it recommenced at 5am on Tuesday 29th ! And continues unabated all day and all night - 24/7 !! We have had 4 completely sleepless nights. Make no mistake, this is a mammoth development comprising of hotels, retail shopping, parking facilities, office space, etc, etc. It reputely is costing 2.5 times the cost of the Wynn Hotel, and will not be completed for another 18-24 mths. There are pile-drivers, hydraulic drills, cement vehicles, excavators, in operational use continuously. All vehicular movments around the site are accompanied by continuous safety warning bleeps which especially pierce the midnight air whilst you try to sleep. We counted 10 huge cranes moving material round the site. In some areas of the swimming pool the amplified music could not be heard above the noise from the building site and building dust could be seen blowing across the pool area and its guests. acw38 is correct, the Strip is like a building site at the moment, but the development around the Monte Carlo is by far the most extensive. The staff do what they can to move people into different rooms (when/if they complain) but there is a limit to the number of people they can relocate because this development currently impacts on the majority of rooms. Therefore, someone has to be placed in the vast number of rooms worst affected. No apology was offered to us about the disruption caused either before we were given the room or on vacating it. Neither was any prior warning given before we were allocated a room overlooking the building site. Regardless of all the good points the Monte Carlo has, we will not be going back there until this work has been completed. You can't possibly enjoy Las Vegas if you cant sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Awful experience”
Reviews.Author: Kelly1982Ann
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlos for 2 nights. The first night cost $250 the second was $89. I booked over a month in advance for a non-smoking room. I was also traveling with a small tent trailer. I called about a week after I made the reservations. I made sure that the room was non-smoking and that there was a place for us to park. They re-assured me on both issues....Well, when we arrived, we parked what felt like a mile away and had to lug our bags (4 bags only 1 with wheels) all the way to the hotel. We checked in pretty quick and went up to our room and immediately smelled that we were on a smoking floor. My boyfriend is really sensitive to cigarette smoke (bloody noses), so I called and asked if I reserved a non-smoking room. They said I did but that they aren't garanteed, and sent me up and "Ozone Machine" which worked for a few hours. We woke up a few times in the middle of the night to the smell of cigarette. The next day, we had to move the car (it was parked in the City center lot). We had to move it 3 times because the parking attendant guy kept telling us to move it. we also went to get our room change and complain to the manager. She told us that non smoking rooms are given to the first that arrive, so if someone showed up a day before me with no reservations. they were given my non smoking room. Even though I had reservations!!! She said she would make up the inconvenience by putting us in a suite. So we were happy, came back 3 times to see if our new room was available (by now 1/2 of our only day was wasted). When we finally changed rooms, the room was not a suite, it felt smaller than the first but amazingly had a view of the strip. For $350 for 2 nights I expect more than this. I spent all my time trying to deal with the problems that I got no time to do anything. Next time I will dish out the extra $100 and stay at Mandalay Bay or Bellagio. Well no, next time I will take nothing less than the Venetian.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS Hotel”
Reviews.Author: acw38
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 5/24 through 5/26, not a long stay...but a great stay! The Valet parking and bell service were efficient and very friendly. We checked in at exactly 3pm their stated check-in time, and they were unable to accomodate my request for a strip view suite. I had booked this trip 3 months in advance so that I would have a better chance to have my wishes accomodated) The front desk clerk wasn't very friendly, and my husband got a little upset. I calmed him down and went to our room. I came back down stairs asked to speak with a hotel manager, explained all the details, early direct booking, anniversary, view request, arrival at exact check-in time....and he upgraded us to a Spa Suite ib tge 29th floor with a strip view. He was extremely accomodating, not to mention just a nice guy, and he gave us free buffett and drink coupons. Once we moved rooms we were extremely happy. The casino was never crowded, which kind of made us lose that "fast paced Las Vegas" feeling. The brew/pub was great, as was the cafe. The cafe is a bit pricy, but so is everything else in Las Vegas. Room service was prompt and polite, and the room itself was extremely clean, well maintained and the bed was soooo comfortable. Advice...bring your own pillow...theirs are too spongy. We visited Bellagio, Venetian, MGM, and Caesars. All of which were nice hotels, but I felt over whelmed and lost, not to mention the crowds! I love the Monte Carlo and will only stay there from now on. It has a intimate yet grand scale hotel feel. Besides you can't beat their prices. The location was great...walk right out onto the strip and the other hotels. The buffet wasn't anything to brag about but it was decent, and Blackstone Steakhouse was a dream!! Food was fantastic, I had the lobster and my husband had the prime rib. AMAZING!!! The service couldn't have been better. Overall, the best stay at a hotel I have ever had - hands down. If you are looking for the ritz and glitz of Vegas stay somewhere else, but if you want a great time, good price, and still a quality feel....this is your place! Oh, and as for the construction...it's everywhere you turn - get used to it. It will be going on until at least 2010! We didn't notice the noise too much, but early in the morning it could be slightly heard but no big deal. The people at the Bellagio had the same problem, but they paid twice as much for their noise and room.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tikigirl23
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed in early May we didn't have a reservation we just walked in and got a great rate. This was by far the easiest check in process from getting to your room to getting to the pool you don't to trample through the casino. Everything was very convienetly located. The pool was amazing from the lazy river to the wave pool. I had the best strawberry daquari I've ever had in my life at the pool! The rooms were very clean and the staff was very nice I will only stay at the Monte Carlo from now on when I come to Vegas which is at least twice a year.

Reviews.Title: “Pompous People Stay Away !!”
Reviews.Author: Gr81
Reviews.Content: Unless you are some pompous person who expects to be served on hand and foot or wants to sleep in satin sheets or complains at the most ridiculous things then you will love this place. The casino has an open concept and is usually never crowed, the staff were friendly and the tables were reasonably priced. We paid around 600$ each for 4 days/3 nights and could not be more happy. IF you are like myself and don't expect royalty, like some people on this site ( example: I wanted fitted sheets and more pillows and rated the hotel a 2 .... stfu you pompous whiner ), then you will love this resort. For price and location, I give this resort an A+ ... we are going back in July 2007 ... already booked :D

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: wally1017
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and had a great time. Everyone was friendly and courteous. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite a four-star property”
Reviews.Author: SacScott
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a mini-honeymoon at the Monte Carlo hotel in Las Vegas last week. For the roughly $100 room rate we obtained (via Priceline) it was OK. Had I spent the "normal" room rate of closer to $200/night... I would have been disappointed. I'll start with the positives: the location is great (mid-southern portion of the strip, within walking distance to many of the landmark hotel/casinos, such as NY/NY, Bellagio, etc.); the hotel is pleasantly designed to have a semi-European feel; we experienced no problems at check-in; and our room was "nice". Now for the negatives: shower would not drain properly; valet parking is a nightmare (plan on at LEAST 15 minutes in or out); they charge for EVERYTHING ($5 minimum for Internet access in the lobby, $12 EACH to rent flotation tubes for the "lazy river", nearly $3 for a tube of Chapstick that usually costs 70 cents). There is also a fair amount of construction noise from a project being built nearby (however, it's not the hotel's fault). If you are a light sleeper you will have problems. All in all, I don't quite know how the Monte Carlo was able to wrangle a 4-star rating from AAA (as well as most of the online travel websites). It's certainly not "bad"... but there are many better alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo revisited-EXCELLENT!”
Reviews.Author: lovinvegas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the MC for the 14th time May 2nd thru May 7th. I have done reviews on it before but felt it was time for another one as the property is undergoing many changes. Check-in went exceptionally smooth and easy. We arrived about 2:30 pm and went to the "invited guests" line. (I should mention that our stay is always comped as I play enough to qualify). We were given a room on the 32nd floor, which is the concierge level. I asked if it was overlooking the main construction site and since it was they promptly changed our room so that it faced the NYNY rollercoaster. Construction noise was not an issue for us. I was also given free line passes for the restaurants and informed that all of our meals and beverages from certain restaurants and the casino bars would be complimentary as well. Our room was ready-exceptionally clean. I'll note that we are early risers and our room was available to housekeeping well before noon and it was always cleaned promptly. The beds are extremely comfortable, the 32nd floor rooms are spacious and also provided robes, and turn down service complete with Godiva choclates on the pillows. (We tip housekeeping daily.) Club Monaco(the concierge club was closed for another day for remodeling, but when it was reopened it was a huge improvement over the old decor). Beautiful seating arrangements using earth tones, flat plasma tv and a well stocked bar were available from 7am-10pm. Continental breakfast, light lunch fare, a Happy Hour from 4-8 with a variety of appetizers and mini-desserts were served and there was always a waiter on hand to keep things orderly and stocked. We enjoyed going there for mid-morning coffee or a late afternoon drink. The pool area had also undergone some changes- a few more cabanas had been added it seemed, as well as more lounges, The wave pool was open but at least for the first few days the lazy river was closed. I only spent a short time by the pool so it was not an issue for me. Drink service by the pool was good. There was some construction noise but the music helped block it out- The casino was also undergoing remodeling- a new high limit slot area was nearly completed our first day there and opened that Thurs night or Fri afternoon, The new Players Club-under the MGM logo was also uncovered and it was very nice, although it was crowded with all the new members getting cards- not an issue for us since we have them already. At any given time there were areas closed off in the casino- updates, new machines, etc- all seemed in high gear- again it seems that MGM properties is making a big commitment to making the MC even better and more desirable for Vegas visitors. A new Mexican restaurant is also being constructed in the area previously occupied by a "market -type store" it is in the corner near one of the exits to the strip which has been closed off. There are still 2 other exits from the casino to the strip- We ate in the Brew Pub- note that they no longer brew their own beer- it is a fun place for a good meal- service was good as were the martinis. We also ate some dinners and most breakfasts in the Cafe- this was redone when we were there last Oct- again the earth tones, a new menu, but many of the same waitstaff as over the last few years. Our experiences were terrific- friendly waitstaff who remembered us, quick service, and good food. We also enjoy the Italian Market City Cafe- excellent food, generous portions, and excellent service at reasonable prices, The only disappointment we experienced(not this trip) was Dragon Noodle- had given it 3 tries during other trips and were disappointed with food(bland, cold) and service (non-existent) on all three occasions. This trip we weren't trying it again. Blackstone's is also an excellent choice for a delicious meal, although the prices are somewhat expensive for some. We usually have our special Sat night dinner there, but this trip skipped it. Service has always been always outstanding. There is a food-court located off the lobby which has a Starbucks, Sbarro's, Subway, and some other choices. We picked up sandwiches before heading to the airport for our flight home-very convenient. Parking- we rent a car whenever we go to Vegas- the big parking lot is gone because of the City Center Project going on, but we had no problems getting a parking spot in the small lot. There is also valet service and a cab line should you need one. Our stay at the MC was excellent. The staff is courteous, friendly, and professional. The property has a nice location on the strip, and especially with all of the new improvements being done I think the MC will continue to be a great value. We are looking forward to our next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Front Desk Service”
Reviews.Author: Pippyadventure
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo this past week. The hotel is average. The room was clean. As stated by previous reviewer, would have liked a fitted sheet and more pillows. There is also not much security at the hotel, except when you want to use the pool! The pools are small. Also, trying to use the lazy river with out a tube is hard if you are over 5 feet tall. Tube rental is too expensive ($14 ). Service at the Monte Carlo is pretty lacking. Had a simple question and was kept on hold for over 15 mins. I had a question about our bill and was treated rudly by the front desk. The hotel's location is ideal. I recommend using the double decker bus (called the Deuce) for traveling up and down the strip. A tip on using the bus: don't be afraid of using the second level of the bus. People crowed the first level, fearing missing their stop. Rest assured you won't miss your stop if you sit on the top level.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it as usual”
Reviews.Author: csdevo1
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our forth consecutive year staying at Monte Carlo - we love this hotel - the location is perfect, it's not nearly as busy as the others. The hotel is very clean and the staff is super accomodating and pleasant. Our room, on the 30th floor, was great, the maid service is awesome, had no issues with that at all. Must try the Brew Pub, it's great food and great atmosphere. The food court is re-done and looks great, plenty of seating and always kept very clean. The Cafe is excellent for Breakfast or lunch, very good food and friendly quick service. This is also recently renovated and looks great. We have ate at Blackstones two years in a row and it's a wonderful steakhouse. The pool area is much smaller (lounge chair area) and you have to get there early to get a good seat in the sun, that's our only complaint. I was worried about the construction going on behind Monte Carlo and on our first day, the dust was blowing across the back area lounge chairs but we sat up front and were fine - that was the only day we were witness to the dust, but we didn't hear any construction noises inside or outside. Another downfall at the pool is the lines into the patio bar, very long - that could be improved, but the bartenders in the patio bar are great and very nice. We would definately continue to stay at Monte Carlo -

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: diesel929
Reviews.Content: I have visted Vegas about 7 times over the last few years and aside from my first stay (miserable room at Luxor) I have stayed at the Monte Carlo. My last stay was from April 4-7, 2007. This is an exceptional value in a terrific location. I always had an expeditious check in, with friendly check in staff. I always ask for a room with a strip view and they have always been able to accomodate me. I have never been dispaoointed with the Standard Room. The rooms are always exceptionally immaculate with a clean mold/mildew free bathroom. There is an ironing board in the closet and most recently I noticed an in-room safe in there too (I don't recall seeing this on previous trips). The beds are extremely comfortable. The hallways are always clean. I always noticed at least one Housekeeping cart on my floor during business hours. Rest assured, they make sure that room service trays and dishes left in the hallways are cleaned up promptly. Besides the great room for the price, I keep going back to Monte Carlo for the Casino. I usually play blackjack at 10 and 25 dollar tables. I never had a problem finding a seat. The drink service is impeccable. I never heard anyone ask the pit boss to track down the drink server, as I have in other casinos. The dealers are extremely friendly. Many of them remember my name each time I go back (and I am not a high roller). The food in the Cafe is quite good. Not cheap, but not outrageously expensive (I'm from NYC) either. I did not care for the Buffet. Fortunately, the Bellagio is a quick tram ride (didn't ride the tram in April but took it last July) or a 15 minute walk away. They have a great buffet (Hint: To cut the line, register for a free players card and ask for a buffet line pass. They'll give you one for free.). I have also eaten at the Sbarro's and the McDonald's in the food court at MC. No different than anywhere else. The strip location is great. NY/NY is right next door and MGM is across the street. Luxor, Mandalay Bay, Paris, Bally's, Excalibur are all within walking distance. Hard Rock is an $8.00 cab away. There is a 24 CVS next door to the casino which is also very convenient. There was construction when I was there last, but I did not experience any noise whatsoever. This is a great place to stay. I'll be back for the Fourth of July

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ievani
Reviews.Content: I spent my latest trip to Vegas there this past weekend. It was my first time staying at MC. It was a good experience. I found it to be less crowded, moving through the casino, which I liked. My original room, (deluxe) had a problem with the air conditioner, so I was upgraded to a Monaco Suite. It was worth the hassle of packing up and moving. Plus the fact that most of my business was done in the immediate vicinity of the hotel, made my stay there enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Construction Noise”
Reviews.Author: guyinAZ
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the Monte Carlo last week and had several disappointments. A humongous construction project called City Center is right next door to the hotel and clearly visible from the hotel windows. The daytime crew starts at 5AM and if you are a light sleeper, you will notice immediately. There are 4 substantial buildings going up and my guess is that noise will be a problem for some time to come. Another unpleasant surprise was the lack of nighttime elevator security. Nobody there to check for your room key on any of the four nights I stayed--and I wasn't the only one to comment on this. One other disappointment was the fact that after 10PM only the overpriced(about $10 for a hamburger or an order of pancakes) coffee shop and a few fast food restaurants were open. Considering that this is a 3,000 room hotel, I was amazed. The buffet was about average but did have some very good desserts. The rooms themselves were OK but lacked a refrigerator or coffeemaker. The bathroom soaps and shampoos were excellent. The card room, though fairly small, was very nice and had a uniformly excellent staff top to bottom. The players were also very nice and friendly every day I was there. This was a highlight of my otherwise lackluster stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Solid value Choice”
Reviews.Author: Kevin31
Reviews.Content: My brother and I and our wives went to Vegas for the first weekend of the NCAA basketball tournament. We stayed at the Monte Carlo because we found a much better package flight/hotel deal there than in the more upscale Venetian, Bellagion, Mandalay Bay... I was somewhat concerned by the occassional negative reviews here. I would place the Monte Carlo is in the 2nd tier of Vegas Casinos, but we were all generally impressed. For those on a budget, MC offers a very enjoyable experience. Location -- Phenomenal. Middle of the strip. Next door to NY/NY, across the street from MGM, 1/3 mi. walk to Bellagio/Caesars. Can walk to Mandalay Bay in one direction or Venetian/Wynn in the other in about 30 minutes. Check-in went very quickly even on March Madness weekend. We had booked a single room for the 4 of us, but the front desk was able to quickly find us adjoining rooms. Room was spacious - nothing spectacular, but we had no issues with mold, stains, etc. We didn't come to Vegas to stay in the room so I have few criticisms. Would have preferred a fitted sheet on the bed, about the only thing worth mentioning. I don't recall if it had a coffee maker in the room. I was surprised by how much water pressure was in the shower. It was wonderful, but the environmentalist in me wondered how much water was being wasted in the middle of the desert. We were on the 7th floor facing away from the strip and construction and never had any concerns with noise -- nor did anyone we talked to that weekend make any mention of noise being an issue for them. Pool -- Functional but much smaller than the pool areas in the more expensive resorts. It was March, so the pool area that spent most of the time in the shade was still quite cold which meant that the other areas could get crowded. Food -- GREAT sports bar with good food. Solid food court. We ate our major meals in other hotels. Casino/Sports Book/Poker Room. Again, much smaller than comparables at MGM, Bellagio, etc. However, they were all clean, not over-crowded (I had no problem finding a seat at a $10 blackjack table which was not the case elsewhere), well run, and with solid beverage service. Overall, a solid 3 to 4-Star hotel. If you are going to spend $300+ per night, stay elsewhere. If you are looking for a great location and good value and can accept everything being a little smaller than its neighbors, then the MC will be a very attractive place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice for the price”
Reviews.Author: Vi_Smith
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing. The staff was wonderful and the hotel room was immaculate! I mean IMMACULATE. I am a bit of a clean freak and I was truly impressed with how spotless it was. The beds were the most comfortable hotel beds I have ever slept on. The casino restaurants were good and not too expensive. In fact, our friends ate at the Chinese restaurant at the hotel every day! Honestly, I wanted to give this hotel 5 stars, but gave it 4 stars because it was a little loud. Overall though, A+.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all!”
Reviews.Author: cosmicgirl1978
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a few days, as we were looking for something fairly cheap and comfortable - and the Monte Carlo fulfilled this. Check-in was quite slow, but courteous. Our room was huge and had everything we needed. Contrary to other reports, the bed was one of the most comfortable I have ever been in! We were on the 4th floor facing the strip and construction noise wasn't an issue. The casino felt spacious and not as frenetic as some others in Las Vegas. Food was good. The whole pool area was closed, but we were allowed to use the pool at the Bellagio, so no complaints. I would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: AnnPitt
Reviews.Content: Yes, there is the construction nearby, but the noise was minimal during our stay April 20-24, 2007 and was not an issue for us. The hotel is not a theme hotel but is lovely. Staff was always helpful and pleasant. Room on 24th floor was in good condition, very clean and well-supplied. No coffee maker in room, but Starbucks and McDonalds in lobby, so getting coffee was not too inconvenient. Bed linens showing some wear, but we slept well anyway! Had no problems walking, crossing street, etc. $5 for bus day pass a good deal. Did Grand Canyon & Hoover Dam "4 Aces" Rim Expedition van tour (alllasvegastours, not booked at hotel), loved it! One thing, why aren't room service carts with uneaten food removed from hallway promptly? They're quite unattractive, especially when same one seen throughout the day . But might stay at Monte Carlo again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay AWAY from this hotel”
Reviews.Author: brook19652
Reviews.Content: From the outside, the Monte Carlo looks nice if you can ignore all the construction, but inside... They don't have enough staff and don't keep the bed clothes and furniture maintained.Nor do they deep clean the rooms or bathrooms. The rooms are average - certainly no better than a Motel 6. Probably the worst was the black mold (yes black mold) growing in my shower. When I called to ask it to be fixed, I was told it was hard water stains? They did finally after a long wait remove the molded caulk and recaulk, but they threw the old caulk in the toilet and didn't even bother to flush it. When we checked in, despite the fact that we BOTH had our credit cards out and in our hands for incidental expenses since we pre-paid, the attendant wouldn't take it and then said we had declined. This meant that I could not make a local call. The Supervisor REFUSED to let me give them a card over the phone - I had to get dressed and go down to the front desk to give them a card. There was a line of about 10 people waiting because there was not enough staff. The pool wasn't working and there was no notice. So, I got dressed and trudged down to the pool only to find out that a part of it was out of order. They shut down half the casino while we were there and apparently gave time off to all the wait staff because this casino had very few wait staff - one time in order to get a drink I had to push the button on the slot machine and ask the people three times.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: Lucky.7even
Reviews.Content: In comparison to other hotels ( outside Vegas ) , the Monte Carlo is a dead winner. But I supect most of the bigg Las Vegas Strip hotels are very good. The room we stayed in was very nice, bigg enough and very clean. The hotels location is a good one. You're 30 minutes walking distance from the Venetian, so go can visit in between most of the recent hotels in a short period ( Bellagio, Caesar's Palace, Paris, .... ). On the other side of the Monte Carlo you've got the New York, MGM, Excalibur, .... . So you would stay at a central placed hotel. The hotelstaff is very friendly and helpfull. We had breakfast at the hotels Café and the Bar. Breakfast was very good !!!. I think the hotel is a good starting point , but do not expect a wow feeling of it . I think the Bellagio or Venetian could.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: DDDiane
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 days at the Monte Carlo in Las Vegas end of April 2007 - May 2007. Nice place and worth the money. Hallways, elevator and rooms were quiet, considering the major construction going on all around the hotel. Some negatives: Rooms were clean but the staff was not quick to bring extra towels. The pool area was nice, but the lazy river was closed down. If you plan on buying frozen drinks at the pool bar, they are non-alcoholic - get you own bottle of booze. Food at the buffet was not good - eat somewhere else. It was nice to have McDonald's and Starbucks in the lobby to get coffee in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Construction noise throughout the night”
Reviews.Author: Graze
Reviews.Content: Went from the 25th April to 2nd May, staff were courteous enough but the construction work within about 100 yards tends to only stop at peak temperature 3ish in the afternoon and I think overnight Saturday. At all other times especially during the night all we heard were lorries reversing and being on the 21st floor we still could not sleep for it. The reception guy said well at least at the Bellagio they are paying $600 a night for the same noise which wasn't entirely comforting. Definitely not worth the money and not convinced that if the construction wasn't there it would be worth it either.

Reviews.Title: “The Monte Carlo was horrible! Stay away!!!”
Reviews.Author: Broomfield_Nomad
Reviews.Content: I have always wanted to stay at the Monte Carlo. On this, my fourth trip to Las Vegas, I did just that. This hotel operates as a two-star hotel at best! The furniture was chipped and/or broken. The linens were skanky and the bathroom downright ugly. Pool was nice and staff at check-in/out were pleasant. What a terrible, dirty place!

Reviews.Title: “Average, Average, Average”
Reviews.Author: NYSpanky
Reviews.Content: When I go to Vegas I usually stay at the Bellagio. This time, I was attending a wedding and was looking to save a few dollars on the Trip, so I decided to give the Monte Carlo a try. This was a mistake. For the few dollars more, the experience at the Bellagio would have been worth it. Monte Carlo is an ok place. Nothing horrible but nothing great either. Check in was handled quickly and efficiently. I requested a room away from all the construction noise and was given one. However, my request for a King size bed was not. This is the first time that I can remember not being granted a request like this anywhere. The room again was barely ok. It was dimly lit, the furniture banged up a bit, the bed linens somewhat worn and the mattresses not firm, sagging and the pillows small. The bathroom was very basic as well. The sink and bathtub did not drain well at all but the water pressure was good. I decided to relax a bit by the pool in the afternoon. The pool area is completely surrounded by construction, very noisy and a little dusty. The lounges are so close together, that you have to crawl onto them from the foot of the lounge. There were 2 pools, one a wave pool which was a little small and a regular pool as well. The lazy river, which features prominently in their advertising, was empty and totally out of order. No notice or apologies ever made! There was nothing pretty about the pool area at all. It is true that the building does block the sun from some of the pool lounges. However, I found this feature to be a plus in order to escape the extreme heat and sun. I did not eat in any of the Monte Carlo's restaurants. However, I found the food court with MacDonalds, Subway and Sbarro's totally out of place in what I thought was an upscale hotel. Service at the hotel was generally average. They did what was asked but never seemed to go out of their way to do anything extra or to anticipate the guests' needs. All in all, just not a very memorable hotel experience at all. The additional dollars spent on a place like Bellagio, Venetian or Wynn would be well spent.

Reviews.Title: “Steer Clear”
Reviews.Author: bearita
Reviews.Content: I definitely regret wanting to try a different hotel and picking the Monte Carlo. For the same price, I could have stayed in the Aladdin or the Luxor; instead, the MC caught my eye. Unfortunately--they did not have a king bed for us the first night as requested and the rest of the trip was spent in a room that had an adjoining room next door. I have *never* had a problem with hearing the people next door before, but I could follow the quiet-voiced mild mannered men next door clearly. When I asked about the lack of insulation, I was told by the front desk that their walls are just really thin--sorry. Then, the internet access didn't work, the sink stopped up, the maids forgot to come one day, and we gave up on trying to get a cab at the hotel (the bell hops in the cab line would remind us that we could ride in the hotel's sedans for only $100/hour....) I am a frequent traveler who has slept everywhere from the Willard in DC ($500/night) to Motel 6's in Oklahoma and Kansas. The only hotels worse than the Monte Carlo were (1) a Sandals in Jamaica where the air conditioner leaked constantly and (2) a hotel in Reno that smelled like fried chicken everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “This place is TERRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: SophieSarto
Reviews.Content: The single worst hotel in Vegas - Not a four star establishment at all. They offer nothing - crappy pool, heavy construction on all four sides, mediocr food and nothing for nightlife. Basically its a place to sleep and get the hell out of. Vegas should be fun and enteraining, this place is nothing but a 2 star hotel (if that). Terrible bed, linens, towels and toiletries. The bathroom is ugly and cheap looking. All of our guests were forced to change rooms because of broken water pipes and heavy construction starting at 6:00 in the morning........YAHHHH you cant even sleep in this place! Pick another place - TRUST ME! Ps. Staff was accomodating and polite - Felt like they all knew what was up.... Stay at: Mandolay Bay, Paris, TI, MGM, Winn, Belagio or Venetian *All worth the money, if not the same price as the monty carlo!

Reviews.Title: “Wait until the construction is finished”
Reviews.Author: NeedMyCoffeeMtLaurel
Reviews.Content: Wait until the construction is complete...the noise was 24 hours a day. When I complained, the hotel offered to move my room, but I was with a group and all of us experienced the noise. The hotel did comp each room $50 for the hotel Cafe. In addition to the noise from the construction, there was lots of sand in the air due to the wind while we were there. Made it difficult to walk down the strip. There is no coffee pot in the room, which is a big drawback for those of us who definitely need it. The only coffee on the casino floor in McDonalds, where you wait in line for your coffee while people order breakfast. Transportation wise, stay somewhere else. There is no monorail connection, we couldn't cross the street in front our hotel to get to the bus (we found about the bus on our third day). The busses are really nice - clean, easy to access. Double deckers. The actual pedestrian walking was limited due to the construction. We ended up using cabs. The actual casino was very comfortable, not crowded or noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay With Family”
Reviews.Author: quarterdude
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at the Monte Carlo the 1st year it opened, and my family and I had a wonderful experience. During the last several years, my family and I have been staying at properties that are located near the Fashion Mall. We found that the hotels and attractions in this area were better suited to us. However, the kids have grown, and the pool, etc. options are not as important anymore. This last January, we decided to go back to the Monte Carlo for a 4-night stay. With the exception of construction at the property and a few maintenance issues in the guestroom, our stay was wonderful once more. The staff members were efficient and friendly. From the valets taking care of the car, to the check-in at the desk, bellmen and housekeeping services, we were very pleased with our experience. Because of our stay in January, I have booked a room again for this August, and several family members from Minneapolis have also booked rooms at the Monte Carlo to celebrate a family reunion and my nephews 21st birthday. If our future stay goes as well as our stay in January, we will make the Monte Carlo our 1st choice when visiting Las Vegas in the future. Kudos to the hotel and staff! Look forward to my visit with you again!

Reviews.Title: “Liked it”
Reviews.Author: scottsker1
Reviews.Content: Not a bad place. We had the Monaco suite, which is very spacious. However, our view was of the construction site of the multi-billion dollar City Center next door. I do have to say, though, I really didn't hear the construction. Maybe I'm just used to noise since I run a daycare, but I didn't hear any kind of construction in the middle of the night. I was disappointed that the lazy river was closed and drained of water, but the weather was cloudy and rainy from our second day on, so I guess it really didn't matter. The Dragon Noodle Co. had some of the best Chicken Chow Mein I've had. Growing up in the Bay Area, I've found it difficult to find a place that is equal to the food I grew up on, but Dragon Noodle equaled it, although, they are a bit pricey when you don't get a lunch special. Nathan's hot dogs were nothing special and the onion rings gave me the runs. The drain in the shower stopped up the entire time, so you do step out of a little lake, but from past reviews, it looks like that's a common theme here. Had a great time at the blackjack tables (a shout out to Eunice and Peggy who were great in teaching this amature gambler!) and they turned it into a non-smoking table since everyone sitting there were non-smokers, but the other tables held chain smokers, so we still left the table smelling like smoke. The Lance Burton show was great (he talked like Jack Nicholson, which made him all the more creepier in my eyes, but I liked that) and fascinating. Celine Dion's show was within walking distance as were most of the hotels. The check-in was fast and the front staff courteous. We had a 2 for 1 breakfast buffet coupon and my husband really enjoyed it. I don't eat a lot, so I was grateful we didn't pay for me. There isn't a refrigerator or coffee maker in the room, but we didn't mind that. The beds are firm, but comfortable. There isn't free wireless, but we have a wireless broadband card. There was a convention going on in town, so we didn't get a very cheap rate, but it was cheaper than some of the less desireable hotels. Overall, I think we'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: mtntrvlr
Reviews.Content: After my 3-night stay, I could not believe that the Monte Carlo has a 4-star rating. The room was barely nicer than a standard Holiday Inn Express. The bed cover was stained, the pillows small and flat, and the room furnishing were shabby. Overall, the hotel was adequate - but not as nice as other 4-star hotels I have stayed at in Las Vegas and other cities. I've actually stayed at 3-star hotels in Las Vegas that were as nice or nicer. Overall, I was very disappointed in the quality of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: Attkica
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice and the staff was very helpful. A real good location. Not as busy and as ealaborate as some of the others, The room price was good. Not much room amenities. No coffee maker, towels were bad at best, no movie channels. They definitely don't want you to spend time in the room. Which, of course, I can't blame them. Next time I will try to get a deal and one of the nicer hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shanester81
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Monte Carlo hotel from 2-5 April and we had a great time there. We had a fast quick check in and that is a plus whereas alot of other places you stand in line for a long time. Our room was away from the construction which was nice as we travel to Vegas alot and knew of the construction with the city center next door. I had no problems with my room or bed bugs that others have complained about. Our room was well stocked with soap and shampoo and towels and the housekeeper kept the room well stocked and clean the whole time we were there. The Pub was a great place to eat and the Lance Burton magician show was excellent. My only complaints with Monte Carlo was the bedspread was kinda old and ratty looking and the pool area. I was dissapointed on how small the wave pool and lazy river were but other than that we had a great time and definately would be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bargain”
Reviews.Author: Annabelle1116
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay for the Wednesday before Easter and left the Monday after Easter. In comparison to the other Las Vegas strip hotels, I think we received a great bargain. I booked the sweet package and received 2 complimentary buffets among other things. It was well worth it. The buffet was excellent and the price was unbeatable!! The hotel also had a food court which saved on meals. There was a McDonalds (which only took cash, but no problem) and a Starbucks among the choices. We ate one evening at Nathan's which was pretty bad since there was a bug in my salad. They refunded the price of our entire dinner without question, which I thought was extremely generous since only one meal was bugged! The rooms at the Monte Carlo are fine. There are a couple of minor things that require some TLC like grouting in the bathroom, but nothing that was gross. I had requested a king size bed and when we arrived we were given 2 queens and told there was no available king size rooms. The next day they put us in a king size room with no problem. The staff was very helpful and courteous. Enjoyed our stay and the location is great for that end of the strip since a lot is going on down there and the Monte Carlo offered the best rates during that time.

Reviews.Title: “Too big...”
Reviews.Author: madcat19
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights a few years ago just after new year's. The only thing I remember is the mamoth size of the hotel. Long corridors leading to big elevators. Huge lobbies leading to who knows where? Self-service cantine, which left much to be desired. We were out all the time so I can't really comment any more but, we slept OK but maybe I wouldn't go back.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Gladtobethere
Reviews.Content: Check in was slow but courteous. Elevators are easy to find and divided into sections serving different floors. The spacious Monaco suite is well furnished with a sofa, table for four, very comfortable bed and a jacuzzi tub. I never heard a sound from any other part of the hotel. If there was a room safe, I couldn't find it. The slots in the casino are machines you've seen before and elsewhere. Not much new. Everything is so automated you seldom need to request service. Restaurants are abundant and varied, but it would be nice to get coffee without having to endure the Starbucks experience. Try New York, New York next door. Online check in for your airline? Don't use the machine in the lobby. It will cost you $7. Go to the business center on the 2nd floor and do it for one buck. Bellagio does it for free, but this isn't the Bellagio. Nice enough, though.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Andrew73
Reviews.Content: Checked in late on a Sat night and left the next morning at checkout time 11am. Checkout was easy to do on the TV in our room. The shower was very bad, and did not drain so had to take shower in 6 inches of water... The buffet was good and only about $20.... In a good location close to Bellagio and Paris New York New York..

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo is a good hotel with a couple of exceptions.”
Reviews.Author: sresje
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo after looking at the web site and recommendation from a friend. It is a very nice hotel with a couple of exceptions. When I booked the reservation, I asked to be put in a room away from the construction that is progress next door to it. When we got there, I made the same request at the desk. The clerk assured me that we would not hear the noise. We were on the 15th floor and could hear the noise 24/7. Secondly, the only other thing I did not like was that the comforter was frayed and the blanket was old and a hole here and there. Otherwise, the restaurants were excellent and the staff was very helpful and friendly. I would recommend staying there once the construction was finished and the bedding was replaced.

Reviews.Title: “The good and the bad...”
Reviews.Author: runningman5k
Reviews.Content: Stayed from 4/5/07 through 4/9/07: 1) Room was clean and serviceable. Nice tile in the bathroom. Beds are firm which is to my liking. Need a translator for the housekeeping staff and they are lacking in extra supplies, like bathmats and towels. 2) Food was average and not a good value for the price. Buffet was not worth $19 for dinner. Food court was below expectations. Suggest La Salsa across the street for breakfast- an awesome $3.99 breakfast special! 3) Forget about parking- atrocious. Very little self-parking and valet was full the night of my arrival- totally unacceptable. No priority for hotel guests. Suggest parking in the NY/NY lot. 4) Pool area was nice. Lazy river was cool and a nice wave pool. Huge jacuzzi was very relaxing. Plenty of lounge chairs- no problem getting them at any time of the day. 5) Construction noise was the worst part of the stay. Listening to pilings being driven into the ground at 3 AM is not my idea of fun. Construction noise is 24/7. 6) The casino experience was nice. Plenty of machines/tables. Air is always fresh and was a pleasure coming back every night from the smokier places. 7) Front desk staff attentive but not the sharpest tools in the shed. Screwed up room reservations and had my safe number written down incorrectly. That could have been a major disaster.

Reviews.Title: “Expected More”
Reviews.Author: jjjost99
Reviews.Content: I booked two rooms for a family trip. The check-in was slow. I wanted non- smoking rooms. None was available the first night. The rooms we had the first night were on facing a lot with construction. At 5:30 a.m. we woke to the sound of the construction crew driving pilings into the ground. The second night of a four-night stay we moved to a non-smoking room away from the construction noise. No room problems after that. The buffet was disappointing. A lot of seating, but poorly arranged and small food area. Most of the pool area is shaded by the building until after 11:00 a.m. Parking was a problem. Free valet parking, but it is normally full. Two nights I had to park in the adjacent hotel's parking ramp.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo Resort and Casino”
Reviews.Author: Bett19
Reviews.Content: We spent an enjoyable four nights (March 30, 31, April 1,2) at the Monte Carlo. The room was clean and comfortable. The construction noise outside the hotel did not bother us. We especially liked the large pool area with plenty of lounge chairs.

Reviews.Title: “Blood on my pillowcase and NOISE ALL NIGHT LONG”
Reviews.Author: JennyDax
Reviews.Content: I am a travel agent and was there for a convention at the Mandalay Bay. Now I am privy to the knowledge of which hotels are experiencing rennovations, which I always pass on to my clients so they do not have to hear noise have dust and debris as an issue or inconvenient walks to elevators etc... Nowhere did it say rennovations and that is because the Bellagio is expanding right smack next to the Monte Carlo and there is NO noise ordinance in vegas so the work goes on all night long. Our first night after a long flight from Washington DC we ate at the brewery which was pretty cheap and the food and drinks were fairly priced so an overall good experience (we were starving though from a long flight with no meals provided so I cant say it was the best steak I had but it was okay enough and came fast) I immediately hit for $220 not once but twice on the $1 slots so the night was going well until I went to bed around 1am. Jackhammers and trucks making that beeping noise as they back up all night long and no sound barrier whatsoever. I checked out the next morning and checked into the Mandaly Bay where the convention was at. I asked people in the elevator and lobby who were also checking out if the noise was the reason why and YES was the answer I got everytime. Half the hotel checked out, it was a mass exodus! I slept great at the Mandalay Bay but was really disappointed in their hotel as it is supposed to be a 4.5/5 star hotel and really really is not. Had the noise not been a factor I would have been happy with the Monte Carlo as everyone was friendly and the rooms kind of run down with dim lighting so you cant see the stains on the floor and bedspread. Oh I almost forgot! I noticed before I turned in at the MOnte Carlo there was blood on my pillow case! Grosssssssssssss!!!!!! I didnt even mention it to the front desk because I wanted to leave so badly after waking at 6am for convention with no sleep the night before from the construction. The Pro's- Nice people not a long wait at check in, great gambling much more giving on the slots then all the other casinos I went to including MGM,Luxor , Mandalay Bay, Hilton,Excalibur and NY NY where they just ate my money. I did start playing roulette and decided that is the way to go rather then slots but after hitting so fast at the Monte Carlo on the $1 machines I thought it must be that easy to win which was bad for me. The CONS- NOISE all day long and all night long! Dirty sheets and bedding No monorail it is closed because of the rennovations so you cant go to Bellagio from there so wear comfie shoes if you are staying at the Monte Carlo or take the $5 daily double decker bus. In my opinion you would be much better off booking a hotel at the other end of the strip where the Ventian,Wynn,Treasure Island,Harrahs and Mirage are. It is much more the feel of Vegas and there are sidewalks down there that you can walk along the strip and take it all in whereas you cant down where the Monte Carlo,MGM,Luxor etc..are. I am going back in a month and booked The Mirage this time. I am a luxury for less travel agent and our Ritz Carlton packages have been featured on Good Morning America is where I am coming from. Vegas is Vegas so even the 4 and 5 star hotels are showing their wear and tear. For example at the Mandalay Bay they had a beautiful marble bathroom with huge soaking tub but the hot water faucet was stuck shut and decor did not match at all.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value but ...”
Reviews.Author: Jockdoc
Reviews.Content: This is our second time through Monte Carlo, both times on a web special. The Positives: We were able to stay on average for $92/night from Tuesday to Saturday. That is actually pretty good for a major hotel on the strip. Check in was smooth with really friendly front desk staff. We got a 28th floor King size room facing Bellagio overlooking the pool and the new City Center construction site. While you definitely can hear some construction by 630 am, it wasn't horrible from where we stayed. The room itself was very roomy and comfortable. It probably shows a little bit of wear. We used the inroom safe for our valuables and had no problems. The coupons for the website special was nice but not great. We used the spa coupons for our morning exercise and sauna/whirlpool. The free dinner buffet coupon was ok for an average buffet. I stuck to the shrimp and prime rib. My wife played craps and won enough money to cover some of our room expenses (that's a first for us amateur gamblers!) The negatives: The room no longer has a coffee/tea pot which I recalled we did the first time. The bathtub drained slowly so if you shower on average 10-15 minutes, the water will rise to just below the ankle. The worst part of the stay was definitely parking as the Monte Carlo parking structure has been torn down to make way for the new City Center project. This means you can get lucky and park in short term parking lots or end up parking in the New York-New York structure. You can try valet parking but because of the parking structure demolition, the backup is incredible and when you want to pick up your car, be prepared for at least a 15 minute wait in midmorning. In short I love the price but I probably won't go back to Monte Carlo anytime soon until the parking issues improve.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs and bloated prices”
Reviews.Author: maldon41
Reviews.Content: Check-in was a nightmare- a one hour wait in long lines as the incompetent clerks repeatedly had to ask supervisors questions. The room was barebones, but clean (so we thought!). The prices everywhere--restaurants, pub, shops-- were bloated beyond reason, apparently to compensate for the 90.00 room charge. The pool is nice but crowded, there are, after all, 3000 rooms. What killed our stay, costing us a non-refundable one night's room charge, was bedbugs! For the lesions we suffered google any website showing pictures. I'm a physician, so I'm not confusing them with fleabites (not that they would be any better) or mosquito bites.

Reviews.Title: “Too much construction!”
Reviews.Author: datr
Reviews.Content: Check-in is not organized. There is no queue to wait in, thus everyone tries to line up separately in front of different staff personnel. People start to get frustrated when one line moves faster than another. When we checked in the room we requested (king n/s) was not available. They did not bother to tell us this so we went up to the room expecting a king n/s. The room was a smoking room with 2 queen beds. We headed back down to the front desk and reminded them of our reservation. The lady informs us all the king nonsmoking rooms are full. Then she mentions she can call the mgr and see if they will open another block - which obviously means they are not all full. The mgr is unwilling, so we are stuck in the room. She appeases us by telling us we can check into a king n/s room the next afternoon and they will even upgrade us to a strip view. We think they are being considerate only to find out otherwise later. Room was great until 3 am when construction started and all we heard was this loud beeping noise. The next night construction started at 1 am. The noise was so loud - like dropping huge rocks into an aluminum container. The crashing sound happened every other minute. I had a couple of great spa experiences with Mila the massage therapist and Jane the skin technician. I also had the worst facial ever with Flower. The pool was packed every day. All the guests lined up at 9 am and went out and saved all the chairs. If you came out any later, you couldn't find a chair. They should not allow this practice as the people don't come back for hours and some never come back at all. Yet you can not tell which chair is available because they all have towels on them. Oh, and I have never seen so many chairs crammed into every space available. All the chairs were touching the chairs on each side. Pretty gross if you didn't know the person next to you. The rows were so close together you could hardly even make your way down the row. On our last day, I went out at 9 so I could get a good spot. Immediately demolition started about 10 ft from the wall. They were knocking down the bldg next door. Huge amounts of dust and particles were flying everywhere and floating over the entire pool. We have stayed at this hotel many times in the past because it is small and convenient to other hotels, but we will not be back. The only saving grace at this hotel is the gaming staff.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad - could have been better...”
Reviews.Author: briguy73
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel somewhat last minute (2 weeks in advance)... I wanted to stay somewhere else, but I was leaving on a Saturday and I guess many Las Vegas hotels require a Saturday night stay. The Monte Carlo was pretty much my only choice on the budget I had. Check-in was pleasant and was done within five minutes by a friendly employee. I arrived early and my room wouldn't be ready for at least 20 more minutes, which was understandable - my fault for getting there early... The room left a lot to be desired. Unfortunately, I was placed on the 4th floor overlooking the massive construction project that is going on. Understandably, the view left a lot to be desired, but nonetheless, who stays in their room in Vegas, anyways? The bathroom was adequate, but had absolutely no counter space. For me and my wife, this proved to be a challenge in the morning when we were getting ready! The bed was above average in the comfort level - I have a bad back and usually notice right away every morning when I get up in a hotel - not the case here!! I did eat at the "cafe" downstairs and had below average service. My food was barely warm. The next two days, we ate at the Buffet, which was one of the better ones I have ever eaten at. Well worth the money. The brewery/restaurant was good for dinner with average service...

Reviews.Title: “Stay away until construction is completed”
Reviews.Author: Toronto_Travelling
Reviews.Content: There was a reason why this normally $250 a night hotel was priced at $70 per night. From Monday morning at 6:00am until we left at midnight on Thursday, there was construction round the clock. And following the instructions of previous Trip Advisor guests, we requested a strip-view room. But it made no difference at all. We were on the 25th floor and it sounded as if the construction was in the room right beside us. Stay away from this hotel until all the construction has ceased. (Or plan to bring alot of earplugs!!.)

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay at the Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: LabsTimesTwo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo after switching from Circus Circus...what a difference! This is a fabulous hotel. The front desk is helpful and courteous. Our room was clean and comfortable. We had a wonderful view of the Strip and the mountains beyond. We had breakfast the Buffet one morning, which was tasty, plentiful and diverse. The pool area was lovely and gets very crowded -- be sure to arrive early to get a sunny chair (at this time of year, some of the pool area is in shade until 3:00 pm). The only possible negative is the construction noise next door, but our room on the 31st floor was high enough that the bangs, beeps, and clunks didn't really bother us. I don't know if it's worse in a lower room. Also you can always hear loud neighbors arriving in the middle of the night, but that's why I bring earplugs! We loved this hotel and would definitely stay here on our next visit to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: micdenton
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked for me for the NASCAR weekend. I had not stayed at the Monte Carlo before, but had stayed on the strip. The room was clean, the windows are large with nice views up or down the strip. The location was good for getting around - airport, other casinos, freeway access. There was no line at check-in, the bell staff was friendly and quick. The restaurant range - fast food to fancy - was nice. Also had a good range of gambling tables. Overall a great experience and great weekend. I did see the construction and it seems like it could be very disturbing, but we were very 'tired' and slept fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, loved pool area!”
Reviews.Author: IheartPringles
Reviews.Content: We just got back last night from a 4-day stay at the Monte Carlo. We had a fabulous time. There is construction nearby, but we weren't affected by it at all because we were on the 31st floor. I guess the higher you are in the building the less you hear it. The room was clean, maid service was fine, no compaints at all. Everyone was really nice, esp. Eleuterio at the Player's Club Booth. I loved, loved, the pool and hot tub, it was just too bad because it was pretty cold and windy for most of our stay, but got to swim on the last day. It's just amazing, the shallow "lazy river" pool, swimming on my back watching the blue sky above, and then watching the birds it the trees while sitting in the hot tub. Really great break from all the casino action. ;-) I really liked this hotel and would highly recommend it. If you're looking for a quieter hotel to stay and relax, this is it. I couldn't imagine staying at the NYNY where it just seemed so chaotic! The food court was really good, my husband and I had breakfast there a couple of times. You HAVE to see Purple Reign at the Monte Carlo Brew Pub. It is a tribute show to Prince (who's playing at the Rio for $125-300 a pop!), and it was excellent. My friends and I couldn't believe how good the show was, we would have happily paid to see it, it's free for the cost of drinks and appies. Enjoy the Monte Carlo!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: MELGR51
Reviews.Content: Our family of 8 just spent 4 nights at the Monte Carlo. We always believe that we spend so little time in our hotel that it really doesn't matter where we stay. BUT we have changed our mind. The strip location of MC is good. That's the positive comments on our stay. Since the 8 of us met in Vegas as a "reunion" of sorts, we requested months ago that we be on the same floor (or wing!) of the hotel, 4 king non-smoking rooms and that we be on the south wing, strip front because of the construction. When we arrived at 2 PM, we were told that 1) there were no king rooms left, 2) we couldn't be on the same floor or 3) same wing, 4) couldn't promise non-smoking rooms. We were split from the 28th floor to the 13th floor all over the hotel. The room's carpet is worn and thread-bare, the bathrooms have missing grout in the tile in the bathrooms, unwrapped blankets on the bed, towels so thin you can see through them and when my daughter asked for a sewing pack at the front desk, she was directed to the hotel gift shop to buy one! I think even discount hotels now wrap their sheets and give you a complimentary sewing pack if requested! The "food court" is nice if you live on Starbucks, McDonalds, hotdogs and pizza. I thought those foods had been determined to be unhealthy for you in 2007! Luckily, the men in the family booked 3 days of wonderful golf. The women had massages at Bellagio and we had lunch at various wonderful luncheon spots and we dined nightly at the Winn, Mirage, MGM and Venetian. For a few more dollars, I would stay at Paris, Bellagio, Venetian or the Mirage. Having stayed at all of them over the years, we will never go to the Monte Carlo again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place but avoid the noise”
Reviews.Author: ten78cop
Reviews.Content: We normally stay at the Monte Carlo property every time we visit LV. The quality of this hotel for the price is unbeatable in my opinion. There is one flaw to this hotel now a days that is no fault of their own...the construction of a new resort next door. If your room is facing any area of the construction (even on the 25th floor) you will hear construction noise. Request a room facing the NY/NY hotel for some peace and quiet! Check in was smooth and quick. Our room was not ready at check in but we were able to store our bags with the bell service. Our room key worked directly upon check in so if you'd like you can put your bags in your room and for go the bell service. Which by the way was very prompt (within 5 minutes after making the call to bring the bags up). The Brew Pub is a great dining value on the strip for pub fare. Casino still offers $5 tables during the day and some evenings.

Reviews.Title: “over all nice stay”
Reviews.Author: pieguy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the MC for 2 nights in March 2007. Overall we had a nice stay , the Hotel is pretty laid back not real Exciting which is Ok with us . The room was clean and had a great shower ( big sprayer head ) We were on the 13th floor and overlooked the construction the noise was not bad at all . We only ate at the Buffett which i found pretty basic and food Items were not very hot but then it was about 8:15 pm when we got to the Buffett . The walls are pretty thin in the rooms on our last day we had people in the next room and we could here them clearly even though they were not talking loud or yelling . We did have a pretty good rate and I would probably stay there again if I got another good rate .

Reviews.Title: “Too many kids!!!”
Reviews.Author: lladccd
Reviews.Content: TOO MANY KIDS!!! That was the biggest problem with this hotel. Monte Carlo has a nice pool area, but you could not enjoy it for all the kids jumping and splashing. Forget tring to use the hot tub. I actual saw kids on the casino floor standing by there parents who were playing slots. Also, they had no late nite dining, except for a food court. The diner was closed for remodling, so you had to walk to NYNY(that was closest) to eat anything great. They made no attempt to open another restaurat to fix the problem. Great micro brewery, though. We enjoyed that. Good casino floor. Did well at the slots. Rooms were ok. Mine was not clean upon checkin but the staff came within minutes of my call and took care of the room. Checkin and cleaning staff were very nice and helpful. Overall, stay was ok. Would I stay there again ? Probably not. Vegas is no place for kids. But if you feel you have to bring yours, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Risk It”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoHeather
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't risk booking a room here until the construction next door is complete. The contstrcution is just beginning, so it's going to be months before it ends. The hotel is fine. It's clean and comfortable. But the construction noise is unbearable. We were on the 23rd floor and we could clearly hear the jackhammer that ran incessantly. Not only that -- it starts at 3:30 a.m.!
