It woke me up in the middle of the night and kept me up for hours. Definitely not a relaxing trip. With so many other options, don't bother torturing yourself with a stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No Water Fountains in Whole Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: psyclin
Reviews.Content: There are no drinking fountains in this entire many thousand room hotel. You are forced to beg at a bar or buy water and contribute to the waste stream with your plastic bottle.

Reviews.Title: “Best Bang for the Buck!”
Reviews.Author: WannaGoWannaSee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 4 night stay at the Monte Carlo. The location is perfect for walking to the most popular casinos. The service was excellent and we highly recommend this beautiful casino/hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carol Reveiw”
Reviews.Author: Greentinged
Reviews.Content: Our family went to the Monte Carlo for our Dad's 80th birthday. From check in to the day we left, we were well pleased with the service, rooms, Casino, and overall decor of this beautiful Resort Casino. We took lessons from the casino supervisor, Roland, on how to play craps (Free) and had a ball playing and made some money!! The Casino was full all the time with people laughing and having a great time.The pool was beautiful, with plenty of seating. The line to the pool bar was as bit long. We ate breakfast at the buffet, and it was fabulous. We also ate at the Steakhouse, but it was a little pricey, but very good. Rooms were clean and maid service was very quick, with rooms cleaned immediately. We chose this resort based on location, (close to other Casino's), price, and comments from people who had stayed there, through trip advisor. Our stay was enjoyable, and I am happy to recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time at the MC”
Reviews.Author: rod5nz
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a three day stay at the Monte Carlo and had a great time! We received a discount in exchange for touring a Time Share property. (Don't bother, with these...but that's another story) We wondered around in the lobby a little after the taxi dropped us off, not quite sure where to go to use our discount. A front desk employee at a "closed" window flagged us down and was very helpful. He fixed us right up and pretty much gave us our choice of room to stay in, because it was before the influx of weekend travelers. He was very helpful and friendly. We chose a high floor with a strip view. Good thing it was on the 27th floor, otherwise the construction noise would have been a problem. Our stay only got better, as all the staff from housekeepers to bar tenders was very friendly, everywhere we went! My only complaint is the pool closes a little early, but if your going out to dinner anyway, its no big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Still very nice, but needs updating”
Reviews.Author: Luckybeckyblue
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Monte Carlo five times over the past several years, our first stay was shortly after it opened. We've always been pleased. Location, location, location! This hotel has a superb location, especially if you don't have a car. You can walk right outside the front door and go across the street to the MGM or Tropicana, or next door to the New York. A short walk brings you to the Excalibur, where you can take a free monorail to the Luxor and Mandalay Bay. There's a CVS and Walgreens right next door, very convenient for snacks to stock up your room, or picking up toiletries that you forgot. Movie theater and food court for quick eats are also very closeby. The hotel has an elegant atmosphere, hits you from the moment you walk in the door. The scented air is very pleasant. Check-in is usually efficient. On one occasion, we had repeated difficulties with check-in (we were given the key to a room that had not been cleaned, then to a room that was occupied) -- after a long wait and insisting on speaking to a manager, we were upgraded to a jacuzzi suite. It was wonderful, but I'm not sure it's worth the price they charge for it if you are paying full price. Our last visit was the most disappointing of all the times we've stayed there. The carpets seemed dirty and the furniture was showing some wear. The room was clean aside from the carpet, but we were on the back side of the hotel with a view of the interstate and a large construction zone. We almost asked to move to a new room, but after sleeping in the bed for one night, we stayed put -- the bed was wonderful, more comfortable than our bed at home! Maid service was good, our room was cleaned very nicely each day. Room service trays seemed to remain on the hallway floor for a day or two before being picked up. The food court adjacent to the casino was also under construction with most of it blocked off and no place to sit. The parking garage is gone (for now at least) as it has been torn down to make room for new construction, so there is no covered parking (and covered parking is a huge plus in summer!). Ask for a room with a strip view and avoid the construction views/noise. The pool area was nice before; major construction was happening at the pool when we were last there, so hopefully when it re-opens this spring it will be even better. The rooms are very adequate for the price and staff is invariably courteous and helpful. On our last visit, there was a small problem with a large and rowdy group late at night in the next room. We called the front desk, and security appeared instantly and handled the situation with tact. We had a fantastic waitress in the casino, wish I could remember her name, she was a dream. The staff at the sports bar is also very friendly, the bartenders are great if you can get a seat at the bar (it is almost always full). Blackstone's Steakhouse is excellent, not crowded and has very attentive, experienced staff. I love steak, and every steak I've ever had there has been top-rate. Very nice and you can talk to your companions without having to yell over the din that seems to be the norm at so many restaurants, but you have to exit the restaurant to go to the restroom. The Houdini lounge was too loud to allow for conversation. The Chinese restaurant is very good -- we found it to be an excellent value for lunch, less so for dinner. The buffet is a pass, the food was ordinary and the price is rather high. A good value, but be sure to ask for a room with a strip view. Nice rooms, comfortable beds, and friendly staff. We like the elegant atmosphere without the hokey themes that some of the hotels put on. For the price and location, it's a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lucy2001
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Monte Carlo in late February and was very satisfied with the room & casino. We got our requested non-smoking room with 2 double beds (and we booked through Travelocity, so that was nice). We requested a room away from the construction and got one that faced New York New York, so there was absolutely NO construction noise whatsoever...but on our way out one night we could understand how that would be a problem if you were facing the construction (facing North)--it's REALLY loud out there until the wee hours. Casino is nice, nothing special. Room was very clean as was the bathroom, beds comfortable. Buffet for breakfast was disappointing but the service was good. The Cafe was great for a late-night snack (open 24 hrs) and the Starbucks in the lobby was FANTASTIC! :-) Overall, pleasant stay but in the future will likely go back to the casinos located more centrally on the Strip unless the deals at the MC are really good, then I'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo Hotel Lackluster”
Reviews.Author: GottaGoGo
Reviews.Content: Nestled between New York, New York and the Bellagio, the location of this hotel was perfect. The casino was small, but ample, and the staff's level of friendliness was lackluster. Housekeeping did a poor job of cleaning the room when we were out--resorting to the bare minimum of replacing towels and making the bed. The cleaning staff must've dropped a glass on the floor, as we found broken pieces in the entry way that were large enough to see but had been left. The iron that we had taken out in the morning was left untouched and the bag in the ice bucket was not replaced--though we left the lid off to make it noticible. The pool was closed and patrons were shuffled to other hotels for the one warm day we had on our trip. Overall, our Monte Carlo experience was very marginal--we'd try another hotel before returning to this one.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful service...but not all bad”
Reviews.Author: honeymooner31
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I booked the Monte Carlo for our stay in February as we wanted to hold our wedding reception in Andre's restaurant which is inside the hotel. We also booked four other rooms for our guests. No problem with our room (we booked a mini suite which was very spacious - jacuzzi bath, two bathrooms etc) but when our other guests came to check in there were some real problems. One couple who had requested twin beds could only get a king bed on a smoking floor (not acceptable). After a bit of negotiation with the supervisor at check in (who did not once apologise for the inconvenience) I managed to secure them two free buffet passes and the promise of a new room the next day. Whilst the new room did materialise, when they came to check out they were charged for the buffets and were absolutely adamant that it had to be paid despite our best arguments. That was disgusting in my opinion. When my in-laws checked in they were given a room that was already occupied ! The staff did give them a new room immediately and also the buffet passes ( which they were not charged for, thankfully). Another couple in my party had to change their room THREE times - first one hadn't been cleaned, second was a smoking room, luckily the third was ok - but they were not offered anything for their inconvenience. They were the bad points, which, for my wedding, and the fact we were spending over $10,000 at the hotel during our five day stay, left a bitter tast in my mouth, and on that basis I wouldn't give my money to the Monte Carlo again. On the good points, Andre's restaurant, as a venue for a small wedding dinner reception is superb. I had liaised in advance with their planner, Renee, who is fantastic. We had a private dining room and use of the salon next to it for the whole night (we arrived at 6pm). The waiting staff were amazing and the food was fantastic. My party (14 of us in total) could not stop talking about how great it was, and some of them have eaten at some of London's finest restaurants. It really couldn't have been better and nothing was too much trouble. They even baked us a special wedding cheesecake instead of the traditional wedding cake. In the salon they have a humidor with some of the finest cigars and many many vintage cognacs and brandies, which were rather enjoyed by all ! We also used the spa at the hotel, which was nice, and I also used the salon to have my wedding hair and make up done and they were very good. I suspect our experience of the Monte Carlo may have been tarnished by the fact it was the busiest weekend in Vegas (NBA All Star convention) ever and the staff did seem to be rather frazzled. Still, it's the fact that they just didn't seem bothered about our complaints that I am finding hard to forget ...... Overall the Monte Carlo is a very mediocre compared to many other hotels on the strip that offer rooms for the same price and have more going on inside.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andi1979
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel on the Strip. The rooms are clean and room service is OK. It is a good pick for your stay in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “NIce Hotel, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Retirees
Reviews.Content: This was our first time at the Monte Carlo and we found it to be a very nice hotel. We went there to celebrate our 30th anniversary and when we mentioned this on checking in, we were immediately upgraded to a suite! The staff was very courteous and although our suite faced the construction area, the noise was not offensive (we are always up by 7 AM anyway and with the time change it was 10 AM our time). The king bed was very comfortable and the bath included a two person jacuzzi tub. The drawbacks were the parking, which is outside across the street (they do offer free valet parking but we didn't use it) and the carpet was somewhat stained. We would definitely stay there again. We didn't use the restaurants so can't comment on them.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, even better casino!”
Reviews.Author: helbo200
Reviews.Content: Me and my entire family stayed in the Monte Carlo for just under a week last year. We picked this hotel in particular due to its situation on The Strip, it is within walking distance to all other hotels and casinos and a short bus journey away to Old Town. After reading previous reviews I was worried about staying here but I must say our experience was amazing! From the moment we arrived the staff did everything they could to make us feel welcome, I was here with my Grandmother, parents, brother and boyfriend and our ages varied from 21-81! The staff gave us information about shows and places to go that they thought would benifit everyone and they did. The rooms are spectactular and make you feel like royalty, I ordered champagne from room service (the Cheapest!) and explained I wanted to suprise my parents, so they left it outside their room and then came to mine it was brilliant.... The casino itself is alot smaller than many of the others on The Strip but it means you vary rarely lose anyone from your party and there is alot more staff on hand to help. One thing I would reccomend if you've just turned 21 or look young is to get a wristband from your casino onformation point otherwise you will CONSTANTLY get asked for I.D. which is vary annoying! All in all this hotel was brilliant and none of us experienced any problems with noise, but then we were on the 31st floor! Oh and one last thing make sure you go for the buffet breakfast at Mandalay Bay it is out of this world!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “monte carlo was great!”
Reviews.Author: citylady
Reviews.Content: We just got back Friday night from a 6 day stay at the MC. We didn't have a problem checking in, staff very pleasant and quite helpful! The room was very clean and nice. There were no stains on the rug or bed spreads, matter of fact they were in decent condition. I would stay here again. The only down fall was of course the contrustion noise and the walls are thin. We were lucky to have people going and coming when we did, so no problem there. I found the location very good and the CVS right next door very convienent. It is alot cheaper buying a 6 pack of water for $3.19 then paying $2.50 at the hotels. The Walgreens across the street does have a better selection of soda's and pre package food. Back to the MC, they have $5 black jack tables. The staff very friendly and seem to be enjoying their jobs. We ate at the buffet, food was alright, the staff very helpful and friendly. We had a coupon 2 for 1 at the buffet and one for a drink at the Micro Brew, which was a great place to relax and watch a game. We also had breakfast at the Cafe, it was good. Over all a great place to stay and have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: traic73
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel 3 nights in late Feb/early March and had nothing but a great experience. Room was clean and spotless, I asked for and received a non-smoking room (in fact the whole floor was non-smoking which was a bonus after spending all day & night in smoky casinos) and the staff was kind and respectable. Booked at a reasonable rate through Travelocity. The Cafe is a great little restaurant for both breakfast and dinner. No problems in the food court as some other reviews noted. Bonus points for having a Starbucks on-site! To those that complained about the construction noise outside - get over it. Did you really come to Vegas to sleep? I will admit that you can hear some of the construction noise but after about 5 minutes you don't even notice it. It is a fact of life in a city that is constantly changing. Maybe because of where I live in south Florida where there is always construction it didn't bother me as much, but it really was a non-event. Just go, stay at the Monte Carlo, and enjoy yourself. You won't be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Had a very nice time!”
Reviews.Author: Marleigh
Reviews.Content: I just got back from my stay at the Monte Carlo. I was a bit hesitant after reading the reviews, but was pleasantly surprised when we got there. The hotel was clean and was beautiful to walk into. The room was adequate (could use some updating, but clean) and the bathroom was very nice. They have great smelling soaps, gels, etc. The bed had a pillow top which was very comfortable. We arrived on Thursday at midnight so we didn't have to wait in any lines (except the Huge taxi line at the airport!). I asked for a room away from the construction noise and I feel they accommodated us the best they could with a booked hotel. They were very polite to us, too. We stayed on the 16th floor which partially overlooked the strip. I could see a part of the construction site, but only heard a little bit of noise on Thursday night. I don't think they were working the weekend. They are building a huge City Center complex next door and it won't be done until 2009. I've heard complaints about the guest noise, but I barely saw anyone on our floor throughout our 3 day stay. We got a great deal on the hotel and also received drink, dinner and spa coupons. They have a fun brewery in the hotel and the food is pretty good. We had a good breakfast at the Cafe but it was pretty pricey. If you decide to stay at this hotel, ask for a room away from the construction and hopefully they can accommodate you. There is A Lot of construction going on in Vegas right now so your chances of construction noise is pretty good. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Lovetotravel57
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Monte Carlo the first part of February. After reading some of the reviews I really didn't know what to think. But from checking in and all of our stay was great. I found the front desk people to be friendly. Our room was clean and the view was great looking north onto the strip. Yes, there is construction next door but the noise did not bother us as we were not in the room that much. Right now Las Vegas has a lot of construction going on, so I would recommend ear plugs if you can't handle it. We liked the food court when we were in a hurry. I would recommend the buffet or cafe as the food was good and reasonable. I would have no problem staying at Monte Carlo again.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: pack20
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at the Monte Carlo 10 years ago when it was brand new. At that time we thought the rooms, view & prices were great. This time we went with 2 family members (booked 3 rooms total) for 3 nights in February. In our opinion, Las Vegas has changed for the worse as has the Monte Carlo Hotel. Our room was average at best (I believe the rooms were about $140/night). We had requested a king bed and were given two queens so after complaining, they transferred us to a room with a king bed. It was a room for handicapped people; the shower was designed for very short people and was super dark. Like the rest of Las Vegas, everything costs money and feels like a rip off. Internet access is $10/day. To use the gym is $19 per person per day. No coffee maker or newspapers provided. They are working on the north side of the hotel so construction goes on day and night. Very ugly but the noise isn't too bad. Service is weak, check in was slow. The hotel also does not seem to care at all about water conservation. They wash all the towels each day regardless of whether you have the towels hung up or not and in our family members rooms, they said the shower heads put out tons of water with no way to lower the pressure. Being in a desert and sucking water from the Colorado river, one would think hotels could do SOMETHING to conserve this precious resource! I suggest avoiding Las Vegas altogether; every thing costs and lost of hard sells everywhere. The only reason, in my view, to go there is to see a show. We saw mystere, it was absolutely fabulous and somewhat made up for the negatives of Las Vegas in general. We barely made our flight back to the bay area since it took 45 minutes to get through the massive crowds at security. We will never be back.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Experience”
Reviews.Author: MRYLNDTERP
Reviews.Content: There wasn't anything good about our stay here; apparently from other reviews it used to be a nice place to stay, but not any more. The service desk personnel were rude and just didn't seem to be happy to be there. We were given a smoking room when we had requested a non-smoking room and were treated like we were the worst people ever for asking for a non-smoking room. The bathrooms had quite a bit of mold that could easily be cleaned off, but wasn't and the rooms just didn't look clean; the carpeting and the bedding seemed old and ragged. The sheets on the bed felt like canvas. Not that it bothered me because I can sleep through anything, but there was non-stop construction going on, so that may bother some light sleepers. Needless to say, we will never stay at the Monte Carlo again and don't recommend that you do either.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo - "just right"!”
Reviews.Author: UrbanGal
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Monte Carlo February 5-8, 2007. Had a view of the strip and no noise from the construction (huge) site next door. This is absolutely my favorite place to stay in Vegas - have stayed there many times. Love the lobby and the fact that you don't have to go through the casino (or even see the casino if you don't want to) to get to your room. There is now a Starbucks (yeah!). The Market Cafe has been tastefully remodeled and other updates are in the works including the pool area and a new garage. The temporary parking across the side street worked out fine as well as valet parking. The "Prince Tribute" show in the Pub is outstanding...absolutely a "must" (only one day a week). This is not a "mega".."ultra-theme" casino, so if you want a lot of pizazz and excitement it may not be for you...but if you want lovely surroundings with a great casino and a little bit of "peace and quiet"..try it. My only complaint is it seems that some of the slot machines have been taken out to be replaced with ticket-redemption and bill changer machines - but this was evident everywhere in the major casinos.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed!”
Reviews.Author: Prettyinpink86
Reviews.Content: I was very worried before leaving for our trip, it was our first time in Las Vegas and booked at the Monte Carlo, before i left i'd read some pretty discouraging comments on here and started to panic, However once we got there all my worries dissappeared! We had great service from the moment we left the airport, our taxi driver pointed out all the different hotels to us and gave us some great tips on where to eat and what casino's to visit, our check in was very fast and we got to our room and it was ready for us! Very clean. The construction didn't bother us at all, We were on the 23rd floor facing it and it didn't keep us awake. The casino was great, a bit smokey for my likings but we profited quite a bit which surprised both of us! Only downside that i wasn't too happy with was the price on some of the resturants in the hotel for breakfast especially! We did find a really nice restuarnat in the Aladdin that had a great breakfast for $5/US which we took advantage of! Overall a great experiance and a super way to celebrate my 21st Birthday! If you have a chance go see Celine Dion, her CD's don't do her voice justice, what a Phenomenal Concert.

Reviews.Title: “just ok for me”
Reviews.Author: cool26
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the monte carlo from feb. 13 -17 2007. after reading bad reviews about this hotel i was worried about going. the construction noise i read about was not bad at all. my room was on the 20 floor facing the strip and i heard no noise at all. the room was large, but needs some upgrading. and yes the walls are real thin. you can hear everything next door. the food was ok anyware in the hotel. the casino was just ok for me, not real fancy looking and also needs some upgrading. with all the choices in vegas to stay i will stay elsewere on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: mqtorres
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Monte Carlo Rm 217 and never had we had a problem of noise until this stay. There is a major construction right behind the Monte Carlo. The problem is the construction goes on day and night. A machine rattling into what sounded like rock went on thru the night. We stayed two nights. As if this was not enough noise, the room we were given had a connecting door and our luck the people next door were loud and abnoxtious. We had to call for security the first night because at 3 in the morning they came in and started what sounded like an argument. After an hour and half of trying to ignore it we finally called hotel security. What should have been some R/R was sleepless nights and tensions of the noise around us. We understand that the hotel no control over the people next door but I feel room rates should be less during the construction as a courtesy to its customers.

Reviews.Title: “I know it's Vegas, but you do need to sleep some!”
Reviews.Author: gikkiegirl
Reviews.Content: Where to start? Basically the room was mediocre at best. The first room we had looked out onto the construction going on behind the hotel. The room was an adjoining room, and we could here the conversation in the next room CLEARLY. To say the walls were thin is an understatement. We asked to be moved, which was done without issue, but only to be put in a room that was identical (adjoining) except without a closet, not exactly a good switch(I was told this was a better room). This room was with a "strip view",HUH, a view of the top of the casino area, so basically I am now aware of how many A/C units it takes to keep the casino going. You could see a 10 foot area of the strip sidewalk, so I guess that was the qualification. This room was no quieter, as the housekeeping staff thinks shouting from one end of the hall to the other is okay, no matter if it is 8:00 am or 6:00 pm, no naps to be had here. I did ask if we could move even if we had to pay an additional fee. We could have the same type of room, just on a higher floor, but that would have doubled the cost per night of our room, or we could have the spa room but for the remaining three nights it would have ended up costing more than half of what the entire trip, flight and all had cost, so we just stuck it out in our "better" room. And just a note, PLEASE, PLEASE, PLEASE, don't bring young children to Vegas! Our last night we had a very young child next door, screaming from 9:00pm until 2:45 am. We had a 7:15 am flight, so we basically didn't sleep at all that night. Leave the screaming kids at home. I went out of town to have a few days away from my kids, I don't need to hear yours. The water pressure in the shower was great, but you end up standing calf deep in water. We asked that they fix the drain issue, which left us standing ankle deep in water during showers. The room was cleaned daily and no real issues with the service in that respect. We ate at the buffet for breakfast and it was exactly what you would expect, not great, not bad. We also ate at the Cafe and at the Brew Pub. The Brew pub doesn't brew beer anymore, so don't expect a new taste. The food was fine and the service was good and friendly. The Cafe food was good and the service was average. No matter which of these you go to you will stand in line and wait even though many open tables can be seen. The casino is small and easy to navigate and the location of the hotel is nice, it's not right in the middle, more to the side of the MGM and Mandalay Bay, but you can easily walk to where everything is. There is a CVS right next to the hotel, so it's nice to pick up water, snacks, etc without the high price of the casino shop. Overall I don't think we would stay here again. I have stayed at numerous hotels on the strip in Vegas, in standard rooms and not dealt with the noise issues that we found at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place IF you bring the kids...”
Reviews.Author: LisaRz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel to Vegas every year and have stayed here 3 times. This place have some pros and cons, very clean and large casino with loose slots, rooms are adequate and they have a great coffee shop...cons are the fact that there are kids everywhere! With the wave pool it is an ideal place for parents with kids as that's pretty much what takes over the pool each day. Kiddies galore that seem to be unattended...and there are few choices for restaurants so we find ourselves dining at other casinos. We'll be visiting in June 07 and plan on staying at the Bellagio....

Reviews.Title: “Average themed hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Finky099
Reviews.Content: This was my very first trip to Sin City and staying at a themed hotel was a must. My travel plans were booked almost last minute (for work) so my hotel options were somewhat limited, but for $160/night, I found the Monte Carlo to be acceptable. The room was clean and had a good view of the northern half of the strip. Beware construction next door, though. They work on the new project 24 hours a day and even though I was getting up at 6:30am for work, the bangs and clangs of the construction next door were already loud enough to wake me (I was on the 24th floor. too.) The hotel itself is adequate for anyone who wants a fun place to stay, but doesn't plan on spending that much time in the actual hotel- except maybe for gambling, of which I did not do any. It's close to most of the other Big hotels in the center of the Strip and it's right across the street from Showcase Mall, which houses the Everything Coke store and the World of M&M's store. As long as walking is not an obstacle, the Monte Carlo is a long block from The Bellagio and Paris to the north, and one block from New York, New York and the MGM Grand to the south. Harrah's, TI, the Venetian and the Mirage are only another block north of the Bellagio, which is still a close walk. Cab fare from the airport to the Monte Carlo was about $20. And, as a first-timer, I love that valet parking (as well as general parking) at the hotels is free. Makes sense, but I never knew.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: Linred17
Reviews.Content: My husband and I finally decided to go to Las Vegas, but we don't have a lot of extra money to spend so this was the perfect choice. The hotel is reasonably priced, right on the strip, within walking distance to many of the bigger hotels and casinos and close to The Deuce (the bus that rides up and down the strip and into Downtown). At first we were a little bit nervous because of many poor reviews but decided to take our chances. We got really nervous once we checked in and saw the room we were given on the 3rd floor with a view of a concrete roof and two queen beds instead of the king we requested. Once we saw the room we turned right around and requested something different. Thankfully they were nice to us and gave us a room on the 16th floor with a decent view of the mountains and a king bed. From then on there were no problems. There is construction in the pool area, however it was 65 degrees outside and no one in their right mind would want to go swimming now anyway. Also, since Las Vegas is constantly reinventing itself there was a bit of construction going on around the hotel, but that is to be expected and if your room is on the far side away from the construction it's not too distracting at all. We tried the buffet (with a 2 for 1 coupon) and it was okay, but we definately had better while in Vegas - if you go Downtown try the Golden Nugget for a buffet at lunch, only $10/person and really good food! The casino was nice and even better once we won a bit of money. This is a good hotel to stay at for the price but if you're looking for more luxury and a large hotel with lots of up scale restaurants and shops then this isn't the place for you - try Caesars, Bellagio or Venetian. I give this hotel an average to slightly above average rating, but not the best.

Reviews.Title: “better than most reviews”
Reviews.Author: valerina1924
Reviews.Content: We typically stay at Treasure Island, so when we got to our room we were a little disappointed. It was okay, not too fancy, very modest to say the least. The tub didn't look inviting however the room and bathroom were clean, the whole hotel was very clean and orderly. Check in and out was very fast, staff (hotel and casino) was pleasant, food was great. The construction didn't bother us at all, couldn't even tell it was going on till you looked out the window. Construction should be expected anywhere in Vegas. Not a lot of shops in the casino, but nicely located to anything you need, outside. Perhaps we are spoiled from TI, but overall it was a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Grand time at the Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: SonnySandy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo in November 2006. The hotel is lovely and the staff is great! A minor problem with the noise from the construction going on, but nothing to ruin the trip. This was our second time staying at the Monte Carlo, and we have another trip planned for April and booked at the Monte Carlo hotel website directly and got a great rate. Don't let the construction scare you away -- the Monte Carlo is a great value and has great location in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but a 'ho-hum' sort of room.”
Reviews.Author: Sunny_Californians
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the MC during the "World of Concrete" show in Jan.Part of the week was booked through corporate/business hub.Instead of splitting our stay over 2 hotels,we booked the rest of the week also at the MC,although the room rates seemed a bit high in comparison.For the $ the rooms are very average,with need for new linens(ripped towels,very worn bedspreads,etc.) & much better noise insulation between rooms.Several noisy guests were booked into the room next to ours over the week.Truthfully,we've had better rooms at Best Western Inns.At least BW has microwaves,fridge & coffee pot-in room,although we did find the food court handy for morning coffee.We did have a great view of NYNY hotel.The staff seemed fairly friendly.Some housekeeping staff need more training on how to make a bed-very poor.Restaurant $ are average.We found the "Cafe" to have the best food & hours,but it does open onto the casino-allowing plenty of smoke in the area(just about all the restaurants are open onto the casino).We liked NYNY hotel best for meals.The hotel itself is very pretty-outside & will probably be even nicer once all the noise/construction is complete on site.The "City Center"next door has a long time until completion though-lots of noise associated with that.Found the hotel location to be very handy to other attractions-not isolated at all.

Reviews.Title: “building site”
Reviews.Author: Lipsock
Reviews.Content: First time in Vegas and disappointed by the MC. Still we were paying a low rate and in Vegas, you really shouldn't spend much time in your room. Rooms were very average, although spacious. Sleeping was, however difficult due to the massive building project between the MC and the Bellagio. Jackhammers at dawn? NO !! Try 4 am regularly! We changed rooms to the front of the strip - slightly better but could have been because of reduced working at weekend. Food in this hotel average minus. Go elsewhere to eat! Staff attitude was "couldn't give a damn" . Location on the strip was good- next to NYNY, opposite MGM a short walk to the Luxor and Mandalay Bay and a 15 min walk to the Bellagio and Paris Paris the other way. Can't think why some other reviews think the location is poor, cos its not. Also 5 mins from Airport. Just a below average hotel for the Strip which is suffering Building noise until finished. Probably right for the dollar paid though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value !”
Reviews.Author: Laura74
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at Monte Carlo for the last 3 years (always on December) and we will return in few more weeks. Even when construction is taking place all around, it has been no issue for us at all. Great rest on incredible mattress. Fiendly staff always, quick chek-in every time. It also has the express checkout option, take advantage of it, works perfectly for us every time. This past December, their foodcourt area was under remodeling. A little bit of issues there as grabbing coffee and a bite late at night is a great feature for us, but understandable. Hope they're done soon.... Breakfast buffet is great, lots of options, enjoy! Location is awsome and we would keep on staying here. Highly recommendable. Great value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Painfully Average”
Reviews.Author: Loveload
Reviews.Content: My Fiance and I went to Vegas to celebrate our recent engagement with my parents a couple of weeks ago. We got a great deal through a travel website for Monte Carlo and since neither one of us had stayed there before we thought we would give it a try. The room itself was an average best western at best. In Vegas you don't spend all that much time in the room so it wasn't a big deal to us that it wasn't 4 star (or 3 star for that matter). The problems that we had with the hotel were the following: ~The Walls were paper thin. Normally not necessarily a big deal but we could hear our neighbor brushing his teeth. Upon hearing that we figured if we could hear something that clearly that isn't a noisy thing, what might they hear from our room as a newly engaged couple?!?!? So that kind of put a damper on any "activities" in the room. ~Proximity to ANYTHING. From all pictures of Vegas the Monte Carlo looks like it is smack dab in the middle of the strip. This is just not the case. My parents were staying at the Bellagio and it was easily a 15 minute walk (in 30 degree weather) to get to the door of thier hotel. There wasn't much directly acrossed the street nor to the south side. It was very strange being so isolated in Vegas. If you want to be close to the action, this is not your hotel. ~Casino not for table players. Neither my fiance nor myself play slots. I play Pai Gow Poker and he plays Black Jack. This being the case we enjoy casinos with lots of tables. There were two Pai Gow Tables and maybe a dozen black jack tables which the ones with affordable minimums were completely full. If you like slots this seemed like a good place to be. ~Construction. To be honest we didn't hear it as much as others did and because of the weather were weren't going to be using the pool anyway..BUT it did add to the feeling of isolation. It was not pretty to look out the window (we had a strip view) and see all the bull dozers and other construction machinery. Bottom line- we stayed there once and will not be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but....”
Reviews.Author: Diamondwatcher
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights during the second week of January 2007. The room we had was quite large with two double beds, and a reasonable sized bathroom. The room was clean but it was a bit worn and dated. There were scuff marks and stains on the walls and carpets, and the bed covers had pen marks on them. There is a lot of building work going on around the hotel, but from our position on the 16th floor we were not unduly disturbed by the noise. We did'nt use the restaurants or buffet, but we did go to the brew pub. It was ok with a fair selection of well made beer on tap. The staff we had contact with were very good and were helpful in dealing with some missing luggage. The casino is on par with some of the others nearby and the cocktail waitresses very good

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the Construction”
Reviews.Author: ScottyMac66
Reviews.Content: I was at the Monte Carlo for the CES show in early January. We were warned by our cab driver from the airport that we were going to have some challenges sleeping with all of the construction going on by the Monte Carlo. For those familiar with "the Big Dig" in Boston, that is the equivalent but in a real estate format right next door to the Monte Carlo. They are working at all hours six days of the week. I asked to be positioned as far from this as possible, but still managed to be awoken at 5AM one of the days from the construction. If you are planning on staying at the Monte Carlo, I highly recommend bringing some ear plugs along. In all fairness, the hotel property itself is very good for a middle of the road Las Vegas strip hotel. The bars and restaurants are reflective of the class of the hotel, but it is nice to have a fast food court right in the front of the hotel. I also found it nice to be able to go directly from the elevator bank into the lobby - a nice feature if you are on a business trip. One thing we noticed were that cabs were not as available here as we would have expected. The property is further from the convention center than many properties, so that might have been the driver for that. The gambling there was quite pleasant with friendly workers and enough spaces available to play. All in all, because of the construction you can probably save a few $'s and with some ear plugs in hand you will have a nice visit.

Reviews.Title: “The worst Hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Lionesa
Reviews.Content: I can't begin to say how horrible our experience was at the Monte Carlo. I truly believe this hotel hates tourists and caters to the locals. From the moment we approached the front desk to the day we left, all we were told was..No..No..and NO. Not only were the people at the front desk lacking clear english speaking skills, but the looked like they did not want to be bothered with anyone. Every one of them looked like disgruntled employees. There was no smile, no greeting and when we asked if we could have a room overlooking the strip we got a very firm NO. We asked if we could have a room that was a higher floor. We were told that we could, but the room wouldn't be ready until after 3:00. Around 3:30 we went up to our assigned room and found that the room had not been cleaned and the maid had not even been told to clean it. We asked her to clean the room and we'd come back later. We went down to the food court where we thought we'd get a few hot dogs from Nathan's. We had a simple order, a combo #1 and a combo #2. Very simple. It probably would have helped a great deal if the cashier could understand english but nonetheless, when the food came up, it was the wrong order. We told them what we had ordered and they told us that we had ordered something else. They didn't offer to fix the order in fact they got rather snooty about it. Our next incident happened with one of the dealers when we were trying to check our cell phones to see if they worked in the casino. The dealer very angrily told us that cell phones at the table are not allowed. We were not even sitting at a table when this happened. We told him that we were just checking to see if they rang (my husband and I were calling each other..standing right next to each other). He said it didn't matter and that it was not allowed. Next, just a bit of information for the poker players, stay out of the poker room here. The place is packed with locals and they have their own little clique. Tourists are not welcome in *their* poker room. We sat at a few tables playing blackjack and not only were the employess depressing & expressionless (they never smiled), but they really made you feel like you owed them something because they were putting up with you. Pit boss had the same blank face. For the late nighters that would like a snack, they have a McDonalds that is supposed to stay open until 3am. At 1:50 am while standing in a long line, hungry, we were all told that they were closing at 2am..and they were out of most everything. All of us in line were kind of shocked and asked why they were closing at 2am when their posted hours were until 3. We never got a clear answer but they said they were out of food. We were able to obtain the last of the Chicken nuggests. The attitude at this McDonalds fit in with the rest of the hotel and I can't believe that a corporate entity would put such inept and non-english speaking people into this environment that is supposed to cater to its customers. In closing, our final straw was when we went to speak with the manager. We tried sitting down to eat prior to this but we're overran by the cleaning service chattering loudly to each other in spanish while collecting the trash We explained how dissappointed we were with the hotel, the service and the employess. (he didn't smile either). We told him that we had planned to stay an additional night but because of the bad experience so far, we were going to leave. He offered us a late check out as compensation for the lousy time. I guess no one told him that I could have got that by just calling down to the front desk in the morning. We ended up going over to Cesars Palace and had a great time. Monte Carlo needs to learn two things: Hire employees that actually want to be there with a smile and hire people who speak fluent english.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo was very good.”
Reviews.Author: Mark_in_SD
Reviews.Content: The check-in was handled very well, with the woman handling the process very courteous and seemingly concerned with our wishes. The room was in very good condition, and very clean and comfortable. We had a room with a view of the strip on the 25th floor...highly recommended. Our friends had a view out the back of the hotel, and while very nice for the sunset, I would opt for the view of the strip. Other reviews regarding the noise through the walls is accurate, but if you have reasonably quiet neighbors, it's not bad and we had no problems. Obviously, there's not much they can do about the construction at this point. As novice gamblers, we found several dealers at the $5 blackjack tables to be very helpful in the learning process...we came away much wiser! Overall, a very nice "above average" experience and I would consider going back.

Reviews.Title: “Lousy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nwwriter
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights and promptly switched to another hotel. The walls are paper thin and we lost sleep as we could hear the guy next door snoring and his cell phone going off. The bathroom was dirty with hair on the floor (among other stains) and the room decor was cheap. This is a horrible place to stay and we would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: iowacattleman
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, everyone very friendly, check-in and out was very easy. Food was very good & priced as you would expect for Vegas. Very nice that the Cafe with huge selection of food was open 24 hrs/day. Room was very clean, and comfortable. Had worried about the construction noise, however we didn't hear any at all. Stayed on the 13th floor with view of the Stip - excellent location made it very easy to walk to other casinos & attactions. Some awesome shows to see are Mamma Mia & Celine Dion! We would stay at the Monte Carlo again.

Reviews.Title: “Best To Avoid”
Reviews.Author: defanman
Reviews.Content: We have always considered the Monte Carlo to be our home in Las Vegas. This past trip, from Dec 13th to the 19th, changed our minds, at least for a while. As many know there is a great deal of construction around the MC and the noise is terrible. At 4AM the first day we were woke up by someone operating a jackhammer device. They did move us to the 300 wing where the noise was considerably less. The parking garge is gone, and parking is very limited. After 7PM on weeknights, there is little parking left and on the weekends it is just plain impossible to find a parking place. And valet is not the answer as everybody uses it. If you rent a car as we did, it is something for you to consider. The buffet was closed, the small store by the Lance Burton theatre was closed and the food court, while open, was torn up with scattered seating. Though it was winter, the pool area is no more. When it will return, I cannot say. The Brewpub no longer brews their own beer which was the best thing about the MC. The menu is much smaller than in the past, but still a very good place for a light meal. During our time there, I will also say there were quite a few "working girls" in the casino especially on Thursday, Friday and Sat nights. I was approached a couple of time for girls wanting to know if I needed company. If you insist on staying a the MC, you have been warned. As much as we like it there, we will not be back until all the construction is done. At this point in time, I cannot recommend the Monte Carlo. Spend your money elsewhere and enjoy your stay in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Good Time At Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: AlaskaBushpilot
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Monte Carlo the 14th through 17th and had to write this as soon as possible. Before I left for Vegas I read alot of bad reviews about this hotel and was a little taken back and afraid that I had made the wrong choice. Well, glad I stuck with it. I was on the 29th floor facing the so called construction site. Did not here the noise next door until 0900 when it was time to roll out of bed anyway. Even then it was not so loud that if I wanted to I could not have gone back to sleep. Remember, Vegas is a "CITY" that never sleeps?!@#$ I don't know what everyone that wrote such bad things about the hotel wanted for the money but they should have went off the strip for quieter times. Then if you wanted piece and quiet on the STRIP then get a suite at Bellagio. The only problem I had was not enough waitresses at the casino. That was bad, and why I rated 4 out of 5. I had the 2 pounds of crab one night at the Cafe for 19.99 and the food was great...for two pounds of crab for 19.99. Anyway if you have a reservation at Monte Carlo go, have fun and don't worry about the construction...the whole city is under construction. Also...it is a quick walk next door to New York New York which is also a really nice atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “OVER charged on everything (conference charges)”
Reviews.Author: Carlii1964
Reviews.Content: OH my GOSH........WHERE do I begin....We paid over $25,000 for 3-5 days plus conference rooms. They charged us $350 to rent a projector for TWO hours......Yes, you read that right! They charged us $135 to have FED EX deliver 3 boxes to our guests...WHAT THE HECK???? I will be writing them a letter about their "policies". STay at your own risk.....

Reviews.Title: “Last Visit to the Monte Carlo!”
Reviews.Author: BigDoggJimmy
Reviews.Content: Here's the breakdown of our trip: Overpriced and Terrible Service! The casino is OK, with the table limits lower than the more "upscale" hotels on the Strip (Bellagio, Venetian). I must say, the casino was good to me, so I can't complain too much (won over $1,000 on a slot machine)! The Cafe is SO OVERPRICED. Wow. Over $5 for a small glass of orange juice?? The service there was marginal at best. Our hotel had various problems - lamp bulbs burnt out, TV didn't work, and the toilet was difficult to flush. Our TV never got fixed, and in exchange we were given ONE free ticket to the Buffet. (Wooooopdie doo). Needless to say, we're not staying at the Monte Carlo anymore. For a "nice" looking hotel from the outside, it sure is very plain on the inside. I wish that they'd spruce this place up, because it has the potential to be a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful 40th birthday experience”
Reviews.Author: tracycutch
Reviews.Content: I booked a 3 night deal for my husbands 40th birthday in October of 2006. I went round and round and finally chose the Monte Carlo based on it's location. I read the reviews (after I booked) and almost changed my mind but am glad I didn't. When we got there, the check in was easy and when we asked for an upgrade, we were pleasantly shown what was available. We chose a top notch suite (after all, it was a special occasion!!!) and were pleased to find it unbelievably nice. Huge marble bar, jacuzzi tub which overlooked the strip, king bed.. etc. etc. etc. I had heard about the construcion noise but never heard a thing the entire time. We were on the 11th floor, facing the strip and were never bothered with noise. Both my husband and myself gambled a lot (and drank even more!) and never had a problem finding a table or machine open. Waitress/cocktail service was great too. We won quite a bit there over the week and came home with almost as much money as we started with (with the help of a few other casinos also!) The location here is wonderful. You can walk just about anywhere and we did. We went to the Jimmy Buffet concert on Sat. night and walking back met some people that were staying at the MC too. They had nothing but good things to say about it as well. Overall, it was a fantastic trip and we would stay there again. At the end of our fabulous weekend, we found our bill under the door and they only charged us for 2 nights of the upgrade instead of all 3. THat was a nice surprise. Give the MC a chance. They will probably surprise you! If you have any questions, feel free to email me at tracycutch101@yahoo.com

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: gap12
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week, rooms were neat and tidy as youl'd expect. The front desk was constantly busy and you had to line up to get reservations/bookings etc. sorted. The taxi rank behind the hotel made getting to and from easy, but again its busy and lining up is needed. Despite being flat out, the staff were always friendly and seemed keen to impress.

Reviews.Title: “Walls so thin!”
Reviews.Author: hellocanada
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, they gave us 2 beds when we requested 1 king size...this was ok because they changed us the next day. Not a big deal, but when they moved us there was a bug problem....you could hear everything the guests next door were saying. Don't get me wrong, they weren't excessively loud...the walls were extremely thin! I had read this same complaint in other reviews on this website but I really didn't think it would be that bad...IT WAS. If I ever go back to Vegas I would stay at NYNY Park Ave suites, I stayed there before and it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “there is only 1 reason left to stay at MC the location”
Reviews.Author: munichflyguy
Reviews.Content: stayed from 18 - 21 dec at the monte carlo and booked the monte carlo half year in advance to avoid disappointment during the peak season in vegas but apart from the location (iits in the middle of the strip across MGM and beside the faboulus new york- new york there is no reason left to stay here any longer i also made the desicion about theyr advertised house brewery and pub, which i "used" several times during last years and probably theyr only unique offer to compare with all the other hotels along the strip, but to my disappointment the manegement closed the brewery and now they offer the same boring beers in theyr pub-location as you can get anywhere nationwide - what a silly idea in my mind and we got many comments of the staff who work in the pub telling "they loose guests for that reason" we also got off the table after we discovered the change and stepped next door into the famous "nine five irish guys" pub at NYNY at least rooms are spacius and comfortable but just ordinary stuff on the strip - the pool was closed without further notice, there is lots of construction work outside, they switched off the lightshow outside the entrance area is worn and let you feel unwelcome the fountains didnt show off - theyr "self announced best- steakhouse in town" was closed so what else to say about monte carlo - no reason left to stay there in my opinion

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal and Great Views”
Reviews.Author: azmrse
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to the Monte Carlo in Las Vegas. I mostly stay at Excalibur for low rates, but Monte Carlo had a $40 a night deal the week before Christmas. It was very fancy and nice. We arrived on Sunday afternoon and a quick check in (15 minutes or less) we went up to rooms. It is nice that you don't have to go through casino to get to your room. Room was on the farthest end away from construction. I had read the other reviews about the 24 hr construction next door. We did hear the back up beeps but keep the heater on so it wasn't that distrubing. We had a nice view of the Paris and Eiffel Tower and MGM. Room was clean and beds were very soft and comfy. The quality was nicer than Excalibur and the price was amazing. I have learned to check the calendars on the hotels web sites to pick the best time to go for the best rates. The week before Halloween, Thanksgiving and Christmas are the best rates times. Sunday through Thursday are the best days to go. We bought a tv movie and the sound was bad so they refunded it off our bill. The holiday decorations was the best in Vegas. They do Christmas right. We were woke up at 2 am by couple arguing in the next room about him losing their money and her being upset. We listened and laughed then went back to sleep. Glad we were having a girls only vacation. I would go back for the great deal again, I am sure they will have more while the construction is still going on.

Reviews.Title: “Great locations but lacks vegas atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: srbei1
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the monte carlo for a total of 5 nights over the christmas period. the location cannot be beaten, next to new york new york and across the road from the mgm grand. the rooms were large and clean however the whole hotel lacked the vegas, fun atmosphere that is present in most of the other hotels. also the rooms were very dark and the lamp fuses kept blowing. overall, it was not too bad but if you want to experience the true las vegas, stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place, great location”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelingHobo
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo is a great place to stay if they're having one of their great deals that they have from time to time. The location can't be beat, between the Bellagio and the NYNY, and across from Paris and MGM. We got a rate of $99 weekend; $49 weekday, which beat all the surrounding hotels by quite a bit. But the accomocations aren't up to the same standards; everything is pretty average, best-western quality. Dim lighting, not spacious, and poor bathroom amenities. One girl with us electrocuted herself as the hair dryer blew a fuse. Though that may sound humerous.....well, it kind of is. But still, not an attribute that I look for in a hotel. So other than the great location, and a pretty nice casino the hotel doesn't have a whole lot going for it.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away unless you get a cheap rate.”
Reviews.Author: r3
Reviews.Content: Current construction makes this a really hard place to recommend right now. We were on a package last week that essentially made the room free, yet we still wish we had stayed elsewhere. There is one very small lot for parking that proved to be impossible to park in, even during one of the slowest weeks of the year. We ended up parking at NYNY and walking over from there. The free valet averaged about 20-30 minutes, so this was hardly an acceptable solution. We had requested a room as far as possible from the construction. We were given a room on the 27th floor overlooking the Strip, but found that it had not been cleaned. The replacement room was on the 26th floor with a Strip view in the wing furthest from the construction, yet we still awoke to noise at 6am. Not fun when you only went to bed 2 hours earlier. The final day was spend with my brother dealing with horrible food poisoning from one of the onsite restaurants. This led us to the hospital for the day (sadly not a single slot machine in the waiting area :) Management was neither concerned nor apologetic; rather they gave us a number to file a report and offered no remedy for our troubles. What a great sendoff! Bottom line is that if a stay can be this bad when it's free, I certainly wouldn't pay good money to stay there. I think the word is getting out and this property will have a rough go until the CityCenter project is complete.

Reviews.Title: “Old School Vegas Is Back!”
Reviews.Author: CitizenB
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a six day stay in Vegas, three of those days courtesy of a blizzard in Denver that shut down the airport. We were stranded in Vegas. *Sigh* I know, sad isn't it? We had been staying at Treasure Island, a sister property to the Monte Carlo, but TI was sold out for both Friday and Saturday night. We called the Monte Carlo figuring we might get decent rates. We got great rates. We are frequent hotel guests as our travels take us many places. We know hotels good and, unfortunately from time to time, bad. We got some of the best service we have had in years at the Monte Carlo. We checked in less than an hour later coming straight from the airport. The gentleman checking us in, Joel, was fantastic putting us at ease about our travel being interrupted. He had the "If you need anything just let me know" approach that was refreshing. Recently Vegas seems to have developed a rather rude reputation particularly along The Strip but the old Vegas customer service is alive and well at the Monte Carlo. The room we got was clean and roomy. Great view and we were close to just about everything we wanted to see. The staff was incredibly polite. Housekeeping was marvelous as was each and every staff member we encountered. That is hard to say in this day and age. Construction? Yeah there is construction going on but there is construction everywhere in Vegas right now. We bailed on the Paris for our reservations this time because the Paris has had so much construction going on inside the hotel. Joel, the gentleman checking us in at the Monte Carlo, was nice enough to place us on a high, quiet floor and we found it quite peaceful. The restaurants in the Monte Carlo are great. Andre's is one of the top 100 restaurants in the US. They even have a brew pub! A number of the mega-hotels are overrated in my opinion and the customer service is greatly lacking. We got the kind of service Vegas was once known for. The Monte Carlo is far better than middle of the road and rivals the big four (Caesar's, Bellagio, Veneitan, Paris) center-strip cornerstones. It may be one of the best kept secrets in Vegas. We will go back to Vegas and we will not be shopping for a hotel next time. We will be at the Monte Carlo.

Reviews.Title: “I second, never again!”
Reviews.Author: ranchomom
Reviews.Content: Checked in on a Friday afternoon to celbrate 15th wedding anniversary. We waited too long to book Bellagio and boy were we sorry. After trying the$20 trick with the receptionist, she gave us a standard room with a view of the strip and an early check in, whoo hoo! The bed had been made and the room looked clean initially but it did not take long to see that the tub had not been cleaned and there was someones dirty wash cloth behind the bathroom door. We used to enjoy the rates at the Monte Carlo and the free monorail so we could play at Bellagio but this is gone and instead the largest construction pit filled with all sorts of tonka toys! It was a long cold walk to go anywhere so we got a lot of exercise while we were there. We both agreed not to stay again at a property we have always enjoyed in the past. My goodness, the poor bartender in the brewery told us even the microbrewery tanks and equiptment are going as soon as the beer runs out. The new establishments next door will have a big impact on this hotel and it will be years before it is back together again. We had a spectacular weekend but none of it was due to where we stayed. You have been warned; you can do much better with your hard earned money.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Connoisseur-TRIP
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip two months in advance for Dec 10-15th meantime started receiving special offers with a better price. My husband contacted the hotel and they honored each offer so our cost was next to nothing! Upon arrival it was difficult to figure out where to park as we remembered the huge parking garage which is now demolished as part of the renovation. Reception explained the self park across the side street or they would valet our car. It wasn't a problem finding a spot and only a short walk. My husband asked for a room up high, and was given 31st floor. When we opened the door the view was out of this world. We could see the Paris Effiel tower, Belliagio fountains etc... I never shut the blinds the entire stay! The room was spacious for a standard room, bathroom marble everywhere. The construction was some what noisey but with all the shopping & gambling day and night we were able to sleep when we did...besides it's Vegas who worries about sleeping, it's all about action and there was plenty around. The buffet being closed during that week was a downfall but with our $25 food credit we ate at the cafe which was pleasant. I'm anxious to return after all the renovation especially if we get other great offers as we did this time.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: krystelkat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the monte carlo from Dec 10 to Dec 15. We stayed in a Standard room. The hotel room was great. very clean, bathroom was quite large - lots of room for two ppl to move around in. The only complaint is with the bathtub as it was rather small and very shallow. not too good for enjoying soothing bath after a day of gambling! There have been lots of complaints lately regarding the construction noise. We didn't find it too bad. Of coruse, we're both early risers and heavy sleepers. We did hear the

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Stay”
Reviews.Author: TheBig__aaAAaa
Reviews.Content: First off, let me state that I have no problem with the condition of hotel and casino. The property is nice without being garish or cheesy like some other places on the strip. However, it seems like MGM Mirage has taken the worst employees from all its other properties and dumped them at the Monte Carlo. After reading about the construction on TA, I called the Monte Carlo to find out the extent of it before booking - I was assured that the only construction being done was outside (the pool) and that it would not affect my stay. First night - check in to room to find that there isn't any water. A call to the front desk informs me that they shut off the water to purge the pipes. When asked why guests weren't informed of the situation I was told it's not their problem. Can't use the sink, flush the toilet or shower... but plenty of attitude from the staff. Next day - went down to the buffet to find it's closed. There is a sign posted stating "Temporarily Closed" so I asked nearby staff how long temporarily is: nobody knew. With that option out, went over to food court to grab a bite. The restaurants were open but there was no seating - it's a construction area draped off with plastic. After another day - hurray, the maid decided to show up. Along with more attitude from the front desk. Waitresses - they're good at taking orders and money from people who pre-tip and never coming back. One saving grace - the checkout was smooth. I used the express checkout on the TV!

Reviews.Title: “No Parking, Bad Housekeeping, Ladies of Evening Galore”
Reviews.Author: classicLVchris
Reviews.Content: We've been to Vegas maybe 12 or 15 times and usually stay at MGM or Bally's but when we got an offer to stay at Monte Carlo ("MC") for a reduced price this December (2006) so we reserved a standard room. It turned out to be the stay that may keep us from staying on the strip for some time. And that's saying something! There were several problems that the Hotel was made aware of and did little to address and a couple that they couldn't do much about but still made the stay miserable. I'll address these in the order of abrasiveness: First: the 'working girls'. On my last night at MC, I decided to stay up late and play the slots while my mate slept. Starting at about 2AM, I became the target of more than a handful of hookers (prostitutes, etc.) These were aggresive ones, too- they would elbow me gnetly as they brushed by, offering their 'company.' After three of these incidents right in the middle of this casino (and remember everything in the casino is monitored by the 'eye in the sky' security), I marched angrily to the casino security desk and explained what was happening. Instead of following up on the report and sending someone to watch and throw the 'ladies' out, I was more or less ignored. I then returned to the slots and was approached again not more than five minutes later- and with no security responding. I returned to the security desk and made a distinct number 4 gesture to the officer, explaining the 4th 'lady of the evening' had just appeared. Still no help, though some phone call was supposedly made. I returned to gaming again and, sure enough, TWO more hookers did their act. I finally gave up and went to bed. Now, I have visited the much maligned Fremont Street casinos and have never had a single 'proposal,' yet this higher-than-average priced casino/hotel is teeming with hookers and they don't care. The most response I have received so far is a 'comment card' at check out. Hardly a family venue and I'd suggest holding on tightly to your wallet, fellas. At least after midnight. Next, the housekeeping. To begin with, the rug in our 'deluxe' room was heavily soiled and stained and the furniture clearly had been around since the days of the Sands. Next, the maid left a melted bucket of ice and a number of soiled soda glasses around the room. I hope she wasn't expecting a tip. Finally, the parking mess. When we were there in December 2006 (and they say this will be an issue til Fall 2007), the MC had no parking structure. It was torn down for the City Center construction, leaving only a small (maybe 80-space) self-park lot and a horribly overwrought valet service. When we used valet, we had to wait a full 20 minutes in the then 35-degree weather. Plan on the same parking mess if you stay at MC through at least September. Make sure to ask upon booking if the new structure is open- you will HATE your stay if you have a car and it is not. OH, and that construction! We were sort-of facing the construction project (where Boardwalk casino once stood) and all we heard was a loud rat-a-tat, clunk-clunk-clunk all night, every night. Plan on that until City Center is open. It took a lot to make us question staying on the strip, but Monte Carlo did the trick. We also dislike the every-other-block construction that destroys the beauty of the resorts and makes walking very far more like a mine field. If I were on LV's planning commission, I'd limit the number of projects in one area at one time. Next stay for us: Red Rock Hotel/Casino which, on our first visit, looked smashing! It was upscale, modern, friendly and had a great view of the mountains...and no visible hookers.

Reviews.Title: “Beware construction!!!!”
Reviews.Author: homeschoolers4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights while attending a conference. We had a monaco suite. We thought we were lucky facing the strip, not so. There is so much construction going on that there was little sleep, not that your supposed to sleep in vegas right...They are building a city center project next door operated by the same people as the Monte Carlo. They were driving pilings all night, trucks backing up and beeping all night. Then within the building they are also renovating. They started with hammerdrills on my floor at 8:00 am and the next day set off the alarms at 8:05. The pool is closed for redoing as is the convienience store and the seating in the food court. I understand they are trying to make it better but make sure you get a good rate because theres likely to be some inconvieniences. The projct next door isn't complete till 2009. This was also a large conference and many had the same issues. Even a key speaker talked about them in his presentation. It is a very nice property but there are some troubles for right now.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: woolybugger
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took our first trip to Las Vegas and tried to do as much research as possible to pick a nice place to stay. Well, unfortunately our research did not pay off. Our stay at the Monte Carlo was a disappointment. Other than the initial warm greeting the rest was below average. We asked the attendendant for a room with a nice view and when we arrived to our room and opened the blinds our jaws dropped. We were right next to a construction site that was started 6 weeks ago. The casino itself has no life to it at all and the food at the buffet was far below average. This was in comparison to the other casino's and buffets that we visited during our stay. The rooms were small and very unimpressive. To top everything off we were erroneously charged an expense that has to be investigated before the management will take it off our charge...and we are only talking about $50!! (We argued with the hotel manager for over 30 minutes about a $50 charge). Overall....never again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Mrsbeane
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Hotel. I was worried about the noise from the construction but didn't hear any noise from it. I also had the fan running too. Housekeeping is very slow to respond (needed towels, batteries for the remote). For the price - I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Better this time”
Reviews.Author: Bo94114
Reviews.Content: Hi, We stayed here again right after Thanksgiving. Room: 31st floor. Closet had door and safe. Very windy and the window whistled. Bed good. Pillows horrible, barely slept the first night. Was awakened at 3:30a by neighbors conversation. Then a few hours later with another neigbors wake up call that they never answered and then their alarm clock went off and they never shut it off. Don't think they were even in the room. New shower head was good but less pressure. Could hear the beep beep beep of the construction trucks as they backed up even on the 31st floor. Some staining of the wall paper in the bath room but this room was one of the better ones we have had here. Internet still at around $12. Cafe: Ate 3 breakfasts here and all were excellent. As a previous poster mentioned the Filet Benedict is awesome. Casino: Still came back with a lighter wallet but not as bad as the previous stay. Caesars, MGM, and NYNY were not paying off either. They did away with the One Club cash back on the new Players Club and it is now replaced with Free Play. There was construction by the food court. Staff: All were great. There were no hiccups. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Thanksgiving weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Milwguy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo over thanksgiving weekend, and our stay was GREAT! Maybe its because of the holiday weekend, but I did not hear one single noise from construction. I called ahead and requested a room facing the strip and on a higher floor away from the construction. They were gonna put us on the 13th floor but I requested an upgrade to a hot tub room...which was well worth it! We stayed on the 25th floor and had a beautiful room facing the strip..with a bar, refrigerator, nice shower and two sony speakers above a king size bed. The hotel gave us bedside turndown service with lots of chocolate on the pillow each night! Maintenance came and fixed the broken lamp ( light bulb) and gave us a remote for the TV. The DVD player did NOT work. The staff of the Monte Carlo was exceptional / friendly. The only problem was the thin walls...a baby crying could be heard loud and clear next door...and the shower stall leaked onto the floor. The nightclub across the street could be heard late into the night, but we were so tired that we fell fast asleep. The buffet was awesome..the breakfast was well worth it. The pub was less than spectacular / impressive and the prince tribute was cancelled. Overall, a GREAT experience and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The construction is a real problem”
Reviews.Author: JuneMR
Reviews.Content: Don’t assume that the construction will just be 9-5 it was more like 5-9 they seemed to start very early at 5.00 and went on till dark. We stayed there for a week 18 to 25th November and we were lucky that Thanksgiving was in the middle so they had days off but it would have been hard to have had that every day for a week getting very little sleep. There is dust blown every where and the noise seems to affect all the areas of the rooms as it is so spread out. The monorail that should take you down to other hotels is also out of action because if this. A complaint to the reception brought no response from the management and when it was brought up again the staff seemed indifferent, well what can we do about it , its out of our control! A suggetion that they should make people aware of the problems, maybe on the website brought a shrug. There are plenty of other hotels on offer, choose another!

Reviews.Title: “24 hr construction next door”
Reviews.Author: Cx7542a
Reviews.Content: You won't be warned when you book your room, but there is a 24 hour construction project going on right next door. This causes terrible racket in about 2/3 of the rooms, and we had three different rooms in three nights. It wasn't unril the third night that we found someone on the hotel staff that was actually concerned about customer service and made an effort to get us away from the noise. BTW, the 24 hour racket is being contracted by MGM Mirage, the same company that owns Monte Carlo, which tells you something about the level of concern they have for the comfort of their guests. Do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: occasionalgambler
Reviews.Content: The noise from the construction site adjacent to the hotel is a real problem. The hotel staff is indifferent and everyone seems to pretend that it is not happening. The construction seems to be 24hrs and constantly throughout the night you can hear that annoying beep-beep that trucks/equipment make when they are backing up. This mimics an alarm clock! The only way I would stay here is if I intended on never staying in my room/sleeping - but if that is what I was going to do - why even rent the room. The only way I was able to get any sleep was to turn the A/C way down so that the fan drowned out the noise!

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: chadb19
Reviews.Content: Not the nicest casino in Vegas but I had a decent stay. The rooms were ok and the food was pretty good. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Tavoy
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Las Vegas which would include our 40th wedding anniversary. At the check in I mentioned our anniversary and asked if we could have a good room,I was assured it would be.
