The view from the window was a huge building site,we were awake each morning about 6:00am by the noise of the construction machinery. Half the swimming pool area was cordened off,the amount of sunbeds were limited insuch a small area and always full,and most of the pool was in the shade. Towards the end of our stay bulldozers moved in and demolished all the buildings on the off limit area of the pool. Our stay at the Monte Carlo had definitely spoilt what should have been a memorable holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel , would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: brneyznfl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Montel Carlo along with my sister and BIL. Very nice hotel and clean room. Huge bathroom. No complaints at all. We had rooms on the 13th floor with a great view of the construction. I honestly didn't notice any noise from the construction activities but my sister did. Check in was very easy, only had to wait about 15 min. Staff was very accomodating and give us rooms close to each other. We did the express checkout via the t.v. No problems at all. The atmosphere at this hotel is more for the mature traveler. I'm in my late 40's and this hotel was perfect for me. I often travel solo and I wouldn't have any qualms staying here by myself. We ate the hotel's steakhouse restaurant. Very good but be prepared to spend some $$$. The Starbucks onsite was a definite appeal since there are no coffeemakers in the room. There is also a McDonalds and several other fast food services. Didn't eat at the buffet so can't comment. I did order room service one night. Expensive but the food was very good. We saw Lance Burton at the hotel, not sure I could recommend it. Just didn't think it was he was that great. Good magician but didn't care for his stage presence. We also saw Mystere which I thought was fantastic so that probably spoiled me. I've stayed at the Excaliber and I definitely prefer the Monte Carlo. The only negative I can say about this hotel is that the slot machines were not paying out for me!

Reviews.Title: “wait til construction is over !!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: metimenow
Reviews.Content: Overall the inside of the Monte Carlo is great. Check-in is real slooow--and not until 4-5 pm. Had to sit around and spend $$$ ahead of time. . . . Construction of "City Center" is going on right next door. It begins at 6:00 am--shaking the building. From top level floors we could clearly hear the beep, beep of large(VERY) large triple trucks manuvering around the site. It was warm enough to swim/hot tub it but the sunny,warm areas were closed off. And the dust. . . . Make sure you apply codes for $$off nites when you book--no backsies even when it was their mistake.. A cool aspect is the food court (franchises) so you could grab a cheap, quickie b'fast or lunch and be off to wherever. I'll return, but not until maybe 2010 when all is done. No discount for the inconviences, either.

Reviews.Title: “Too noisy by far”
Reviews.Author: tjruk04
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo from the 25th October to the 8th November. This is the first time we had stayed at this property and was looking forward to being more central as we had previously stayed at The Luxor and Excalibur. Upon arrival the check in process was swift and we asked the check in clerk to put us as far away as possible from the construction as we were staying for 14 nights and did not want the noise for all that time. We were put on the 13th floor at the end of a hallway with an adjoining room and the janitors closet the other side. We only stayed in this room for 2 nights as the noise was so bad, there was construction noise early in the mornings, you could hear the television and people talking in the adjoining room and we tried to get some sleep in the afternoon as we were jetlagged after flying all the way from the UK but could not as the maids were taking the carts back to janitor room and the construction was hammering so bad. We went to reception to complain and was moved to the 25th floor but this was worse still. The construction noise was not so bad but again we had an adjoining room and the people next door had the TV on until about 4.30am and then decided to have a row. You could also hear people running showers and flushing the toilets as the walls are far too thin. Would not stay at this hotel again especially for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: wilko99
Reviews.Content: What a joy the Monte Carlo is. Our room on the 29th floor was very big with Queen sized bed. Large TV, comfortable chairs and a desk. The bath room was excellent. Cleaned every day to a high standard. Good rates on internet access. The hotel was also excellent, with good food outlets from Mc Donalds to superiour dining. Didn't care for the so called "World Famous Brew Pub", a bit dark and dingy. Also didn't care for the so called "Quality shops", but I am a cheap skate.....! Checked in within 10 mins of arrival, very simple and easy. Casino was great, really enjoyed it, mind you didn't have a too many good wins. plenty of parking. Near to all the other new casino's in the southern end of the strip. Ait con was good. Only issue I had was that each side of the hotel there is building work, which starts at 5.30 in the morning and goes on well into the evening. Got used to that though. I guess if you had a room lower that the 29th floor, it could be louder, so higher the room less noise. All the hotel was extreamly clean and very fresh, even in the casino. Free drinks to players of slots and tables. Watch the high price in the newsagent and basically all the shops. Bit of a con. Recommend the breakfast buffet, try the ommletts! Maccy D's open 24 hrs. Beware of the hotdogs next door to Maccy D's......Their hard to digest, sickly and exspensive. Lance Burton is the resident show. posters of him everywhere. I hate him personally. Didn't see the show but others that did said he was average, just repeating tricks in different styles. Not a World Famous as the posters surggest! Staff were very good and all punter were friendly. Didn't see any trouble. If ya like ya coffee in your room, go to WALMART and get a coffee maker (cheap) and some coffee and whitener and enjoy. Then just leave it behind. We got one and it cost about £7.00....Paid for itself over and over again. All in all, a great holiday and the hotel was the main part. Thank you Monte Carlo.

Reviews.Title: “Construction next door.”
Reviews.Author: r_ling
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights on route to Orlando from Australia. King bed room. Good view out the window. Construction site next door. Seems to be round the clock. Stayed in the wing away from the site, and hence, noise was no louder than the A/C. Might affect people staying in one of the other wings. Construction also permitted an uninterrupted view to the Bellagio Hotel. Check in was good, with enough staff to reduce the wait to one or two customers. Liked the fact that I can get into the lobby, and then the lift to the rooms without having to go through the casino floor. Pool was supposed to be heated, but given the construction next door, did not venture in due to dust around the area. Weather also too cold for a swim or a dip. Lack of a fridge in the room a nuisance.

Reviews.Title: “6am Jack Hammering”
Reviews.Author: ELCHEAPEE
Reviews.Content: I was a little disappointed, I was on the 24th floor and you can hear the construction noise pretty good. I had reserved a king bed and ended up with 2 queens without any notification of the change by the front desk. For a 4star hotel, I thought the linen and bed spread was worn and freyed. I think the Monte Carlo has fallen and I would ranked this place as 3.5 star at best. This hotel doesnt offer alot compared to the other strip hotels but the location is good. Make sure you bring your ear plugs if you want to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant stay!”
Reviews.Author: lizzyloo85
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 7 night stay at the Monte Carlo hotel in viva Las Vegas!! Contrary to a lot of the reports I read on here before I left, we experienced very little disruption from the ongoing construction around the hotel. However, we were at the furthest end away from it. Check in was very quick and after a 10 hour flight that was very much appreciated by 6 very tired ladies!! The room was very spacious and clean and the beds were comfortable, basically all the amenities were great! We ate at the buffet restaurant in the evening once and found it excellent value for money, there was a large range of food to choose from, chinese, japanese, italian and traditional American food were all available. Breakfast was also very good at the buffet in the hotel. The only other place we ate in the hotel was the pub/brewery, once again the food was excellent and reasonably priced. We had a great view of the strip from our room and were very happy with the service that we recieved considering how busy Las Vegas was when we were there (the world Rodeo Championships and the Welterweight title fight between Mayweather and Baldomir) were all on that week. Check out was very quick and efficient also. Note to British tourists, the hotel hold the price of the room on your credit card as soon as you check in, so if like we were and ur splitting the room cost at check out your credit card maybe at it's limit before you hit the shops. Something we've never encountered at hotels in the UK.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: dsalm
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Monte Carlo. Yes, there is construction going on next door but just bring your ear plugs and its fine. I really liked the smell as you entered the Hotel. Not smokey at all. It is not that big of a casino so you don't have to walk a mile to get to your hotel rooms. You come off the elevator from your room and the pool is right around the corner. Also the Food Court is right there. Nice and handy. It is conveniently located next door to the CVS Pharmacy and across the street from Walgreen's. We bought a small coffee pot for $10 which was much cheaper than buying coffee at the Food Court everyday. We could fix it anytime!! I also liked the location. Not as crowded on the streets as it is closer to Ceasar's Palace, etc. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: avalonsidh
Reviews.Content: I have to say that the Monte Carlo was a good value for the money. I got a good flight/hotel deal on Expedia and basically the hotel cost about $100 for 4 nights. It has a nice location and is within walking distance of several larger hotel/casinos. The rooms were nice and average, nothing to write home about. But nothing horrible either. Water pressure was amazing! It was almost painful to shower, but you never had to double flush! We must have gotten new towels. They were thick and obviously barely used. I have read other reviews and did agree that the walls are thin, but we really had no trouble. I did hear some running water and some doors closing in the hall. But we never heard anyone talking or their televisions. Construction is going on everywhere in Las Vegas and we had no trouble with that either. We were on the 9th floor and had a bird's eye view of the construction behind the hotel. I did hear some trucks driving by but that's about it. But please note that we sleep with a fan going for the white noise. Part of the pool is closed and so is the tram to Bellagio which would have come in handy. We went to the pool one day but it was chilly and we just used the hot tub. It's really too cold to use the pool this time of year anyway! While I thought the hotel was nice, we probably wouldn't stay again. It really didn't have enough for us to do. Limited restaurants, shops etc. We ate at the brewery which was great and the coffee shop which was not. It had decent food but we thought it a bit pricey and it had a very limited menu. The hotel was nice and clean and smelled nice, not smokey at all. The only real complaint was that I booked a king sized bed and got two queens. The girl at the check in desk was very apologetic and told us we could change rooms the next day but we decided not to. Also check in took quite a long time. But other than that we were treated very well by all staff and the hotel was quite a nice value. If you don't plan on staying in one casino for your trip you might try getting a room here and eating, gambling, and spending time somewhere else. Just use this place for sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “construction is to loud”
Reviews.Author: pp
Reviews.Content: Date: October 21, 2006 Reviewer: A TripAdvisor Member, Indiana It doesn't matter what floor you are on construction is all you can hear. The people at Monte Carlo really don't care. They told us it would be going on 3 more years.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nonester
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Monte Carlo from October 22 - 27/06. Having read reviews before I arrived I knew to ask for a room that was away from the construction noise. We were on the 5th floor in the 300 series of rooms which was away. It probably did help to be on this side, but the first morning I did hear jackhammer noise fairly early. Luckily I had brought some ear plugs with me so never had that problem the rest of the trip. The rooms are clean but not overly large. I have stayed at Bally's before and I think their rooms are larger and the bathroom is much bigger. Again though, if you're not spending much time in the room it's not a big deal. At this time of year, only one of the pools is open and it happens to be in the shade the majority of the day so I never spent any time at it. That might be something to consider if you're wanting to be sitting by a pool at this time of year. There was a definite clean smell both in the casino and the hallways which was a nice change from the smokiness everywhere else. The foodcourt was decent as a couple of mornings I would get a coffee from Starbucks and a bagel and cream cheese from the pizza place. We also ate a couple of breakfasts in the cafe and the food was quite good for a reasonable price. All in all, it's not an outstanding hotel but it is a reasonable place to stay while on the strip. The construction noise will be there for quite awhile yet so bring some earplugs. Enjoy your stay

Reviews.Title: “A touch of class”
Reviews.Author: NickPig
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Monte Carlo for 4 nights on October as my sister was getting married in Vegas. We (and when I say we and mean me and my mum, which was nice...for a bit) had been at the Imperial Palace for the first 2 nights as i was cheaper weekend rates but wasnt a patch on the Monte Carlo and I wish we had paid a bit more for the weekend. any wwe had a standard room which was spacious, comforable and clean, nice big TV and bathroom, and asking for a strip view at check in was give one of the 30th floor which had a great view!!! The hotel has a giant casino floor which i measured and it took us 9 minutes to get from the front door to our room.. the Craps lessons are good fun as well but I still didnt have the balls to have a proper go allthough I had a great run on roulette which made up for it. The pool is good but no sun as it didnt get hight enough to shine over the giant 32 floors of hotel rooms. The bars were nice and the pub was lively allthough the prince tibute act (Purple Reign) wasnt much cop... the food court was nice (McD'S, pizza, starbucks etc) and the Cafe which we only ate in on the morning we left was also very nice. We Prefered to eat in other hotels as it was a chance to see more in the short time we were in Vegas, (the back stage deli in the Luxur did the nicest steak and egg baguettes fir only $10) over all the Monte Carlo was superb and relativly cheap, i think we paid $100 a night (around £55) the concirege were friendly and polite and the rooms were great, my sister had a spa suite which had a hot tub, corner bar, sauna and dvd player with Bose surround sound. When I come back to Vegas, cos i will... i will look to stay here again as i loved it!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo has changed”
Reviews.Author: SequoiaBlue
Reviews.Content: This once 4-star hotel has changed for the worst from my two previous stays. I just returned from my stay at Monte Carlo and was disappointed in the changes. Only one pool was open, poolside and bath towels were worn out and smelly and room carpets were worn. Also there is 4-year condo/hotel construction next to the Monte Carlo that spans all the way to the Bellagio. Jack hammer noise woke me up every morning at 8 a.m. and I stayed on the 21st floor! The best thing Monte Carlo has going for them is the location, comfortable beds and its pools if they are open.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, but not very stylish or lavish room”
Reviews.Author: GreatBlueFish
Reviews.Content: Paid about $200 a night. The room was very very basic, no frills. Reminded me of a two star hotel. Really no reason to return to this hotel. After three nights, I decided to move to The Hotel at Mandalay Bay. WOW. For the same rate, this was incredible! Wont return to Monte Carlo, look forward to returning to The Hotel at Mandalay Bay...

Reviews.Title: “Very Decent”
Reviews.Author: lilchrissie
Reviews.Content: Husband and I stayed at the Monte Carlo from Oct 14-17. King Bed. Very decent hotel. Construction noise not a problem but I did ask for a room on a high floor as previous reviews suggested-28th I think. Like the other reviews, room was decent, clean, bed comfortable. My only complaint is they really need to spend some money on a new batch of linens. This is to include sheets and towels. The towels were so thin, rough, and small. I am not a big gal and I could barely wrap the thing around me. The shower head had wonderful pressure and great bath products to use but to step out of a hot shower to use a dingy towel is depressing. Our flat sheet had a rip in it too. Everything else was average to wonderful-room service, casino air (you can actually breathe), food court, the cafe coffee shop, cocktail svc. Would stay again, especially with the kids, cause the pool area is great. I hope the Monte Carlo mngt reads this review and buys new towels!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price - best on the strip”
Reviews.Author: Will1975
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Vegas so we didnt know what too expect at all. Reading some of the reviews about the Monte Carlo I was not expecting it to be anything above average. However.....when we arrive we were amazed by the front of the hotel, the lobby and the general look of the hotel - it looked amazing. We checked into our room which was 'OK'. It looked a bit worn and smelt a bit of smoke but other that that it was very clean and had a big tele and nice bathroom. Hoever we upgraded to a Spa suite for only $80 per couple a night - this room had a spa overlooking the MGM, a surround sound system in it, a sauna in the shower, a kitchen, a bar and a separate lounge - AMAZING FOR $80!!!!!!! The best thing about the Monte Carlo is the poker room and Casino - its not as high profile as the others but I thought it had the best atmosphere out of all of them. They played excellent music everytime we were in there and the staff were very good. The poker room is the best on the strip if you are looking for a good game of limit poker - very welcoming for beginners but also some nice pots to be one if you know what you are doing. Granted there was some construction going on behind the hotel but I think this is effecting most of the hotels in the area. The postion of the hotel was excellent. You are walking distance to the Bellagio, the Paris, New York, MGM, Caesers. For eating in the hotel go to the Buffet diner as it serves excellent breakfasts and burgers. Overall we fell in love with Vegas and ther Monte Carlo did us proud. One tip about Vegas - dont go near the Rio hotel casino -its truly disgusting - the staff are rude and the casino is old and needs updating. Good nights out(bars in the hotels) can be found at the Venetion, Caesers and Mandalan Bay(Blues Club). Have a great stay! Will Houghton(31, London)

Reviews.Title: “Not great – I think there are better strip hotels”
Reviews.Author: RichardLister
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during our coast-to-coast drive across the US. We had stayed here once before about 5 years ago so decided to try it again. During many other visits to Vegas we have always liked the Monte Carlo’s casino, so for this short visit we thought this would be the ideal place to stay. Unfortunately our experience was not that great. The free valet parking was very good and the check in was smooth – except the agent neglected to tell us that the room we’d booked was not available and just checked us straight into a 2 x double room. This always annoys me when the online booking specifically offers a type of room and then the hotel tells you it was only a preference based on availability. I phoned to complain and was eventually put through to a manager who after a little more complaining upgraded us to a “view room” for free, which did have a King bed. The view he was referring to turned out to be of the huge building site between the Monte Carlo and the Bellagio. The room had badly fitting adjoining doors which meant next door’s TV could be heard well into the night. The second night the neighbours where quiet, but the building site never stopped – with pile drivers and demolition diggers running all night! While the room was clean, it was all getting a bit dated and the shower pressure was very poor. We had to pay extra for wired internet access. Overall not a perfect experience and I think there are better hotels on the strip for the money – and without the building site!

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: Fernuch
Reviews.Content: Had 2 rooms booked for the Monte Carlo from the 6th September for 4 nights. Check in at the hotel was fine as it was midnight when we arrived, we got upgrade to a strip view room and we tipped the front desk clerk $20.00 for each room. View from the room was of the Bellagio and the Paris and the construction going on next door, the construction didn't bother us that much at all because by the time we got back to our room of a night time it was very very late. The room didn't have a fridge so we requested one brought up. Housekeeping was great just remember to leave a tip everyday. Casino was good we never lost once. The drink girls were fanastic always coming back, we tipped them $6.00 for every round for 4 drinks, just remember you can order any drink you want even top shelf stuff. Never got to try the pool but there was always lots of people there as we could see from our room. Bed was a king and very comfortable. The remaining 4 nights in Vegas we stayed at Caesars Palace in the Augusto Tower which was unreal. Overall a good stay at the Monte Carlo I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: louise9503
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on here I was skeptical of staying here, but all I have to say is that these people are way too picky. Yes, there is construction, but it is hardly that disrupting. We stayed from Oct 20-24 and it was a very nice time. The beds were SUPER comfy, the staff was very welcoming, and we never had any problems. The only negative was the smoky smell, but you get that anywhere in Vegas. All in all, if you go with an open mind, this place is great, and I would definetly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Could Be Better”
Reviews.Author: Dushan29
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there from Oct. 18-20. The airport shuttle dropped us off at the construction site side of the hotel, hardly a place that should be used as a dropoff point. As they ran out of rooms with queen beds, they provided us with a handicapped room with a king bed on the 21st floor directly facing the Bellagio and all the construction activity of a new city center. Our room had some shortcomings. The door stop on the bathroom door fell off. The heater vent appeared to be coming off the wall. One of the chairs had deep furniture scratches on each arm. The bath towels were cheap and far too rough. The shower head was terrible. It was difficult to adjust. The hotel's ambiance was plain, and it could be any average casino or average Las Vegas hotel. We tried the supper buffet, and to say the least, we could never eat there again. We paid almost $21.00 each, and the food was subpar. We chose not to eat there again. The prices for several other restaurants were on the high side. However, there were some fast food restaurants which worked well for us. A better buffet was had at the MGM Grand which was across the street and a little over a block away. The location was excellent as we were able to walk to many of the other major hotels like the Luxor, Mandalay, Excalibur, and New York New York. Within the same block is a local CVS and Walgreen's is across the street. We would choose to stay there again provided we get the same deal which did not cost us a great deal, but it would not be one of our primary hotels to book the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Did nothing for their guests when stranded”
Reviews.Author: RdHead21
Reviews.Content: A group of us went to Las Vegas to be a part of the USHRA Monster Jam @ Sam Boyd Stadium. Our whole party was told there would be transportation set up through Sam Boyd Stadium, but it ended up falling through. We were calling the Monte Carlo where we were staying to let them know that we were stranded at the Stadium. My father is legally disabled and my friend was a couple of months pregnant at the time. We must have called Monte Carlo 10 times asking for everyone from transportation to the General Manager trying to find someone to help us get home. It was 2:00am on a Sunday morning and we were stuck in the middle of nowhere and the Monte Carlo told us we were out of luck. No one from the Hotel would come to get us, they would not send a limo, a car, a bus, or a taxi. We offered to pay full price for any type of transportation but received no help. When we finally got back to the hotel, we were all obviously angry as heck to know that this hotel where we had multiple rooms booked for our whole group, was not willing to do anything to help us out. We complained and they offered us a free breakfast to use that morning... when we were all flying home. What poor service to guests... even though we were not "high rollers" you would assume they would try to help you out. Too bad... word of mouth can be your best (or in this case) your worst advertisement. None of our family which frequents Las Vegas, will EVER stay at the Monte Carlo again!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: JenniferJennifer
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Monte Carlo from October 16-21. I booked it back in June after a friend who has stayed there twice before recommended it. I wasn't aware of the construction next store until I went on this site a few weeks ago. I'm not a demanding person and am happy with basic amenities, but I have to say that I, along with the 3 other members in my party, was disappointed with the hotel. When we checked in, I requested a room away from the construction and got a room on the 20th Floor facing the Strip going North, which had a partial view of the construction. We heard the beeping of the trucks and the pile driver on and off during our stay, but it didn't bother us too much. The noise that really bothered us was inside the hotel. The running water in the showers on either side of us was very loud. When you flushed the toilet in our room it made a very loud noise (boom!). When the people in the room next to us put their key in their door, it sounded like they were entering our room. All these noises were tolerable during the day, but could definitely wake you up at night or if you took a nap during the day. I would definitely recommend earplugs. I used them and slept soundly. I didn't like the shower because there was no bar in the shower or on top of the soap dish to hold onto or hang your washcloth. I did okay with that, but my 80 year old mother, who stayed in a separate room with my sister, had a hard time showering. She placed a towel on the bottom of the tub for more traction and that help steady her a bit in the absence of a bar or handle to hold on to. The pool area is very small since half of it is closed due to the construction. The shuttle from the Monte Carlo to the Bellagio is also closed due to the construction. When we took a cab back to the airport, it got stuck on the roadway that runs on the side of the hotel because construction vehicles were blocking the road. After about 10 minutes or so, the driver made a u-turn (along with many other vehicles) and went to the road that runs behind the hotel. Again, we were stuck waiting for construction vehicles to go by, this time for about 5 minutes. So a 10-minute cab ride to the airport took 25 minutes and cost $24 instead of $14, which we paid when we arrived. The things we liked about the hotel were the lobby being situated right next to the elevators so we didn't have to walk through the casino with our luggage and the fact that the property isn't as big as some of the other hotels in Las Vegas making it easy to navigate and find slot machines and tables to play. On previous trips I've stayed at the MGM Grand and Treasure Island and was very pleased with both. I was disappointed with the Monte Carlo and will never stay there again, even after the construction is completed.

Reviews.Title: “A definate no no”
Reviews.Author: Horstead
Reviews.Content: This was my third visit to Vegas and will be my last. The Monte Carlo looks great from outside and the Web page but talk about tired inside. We had 4 changes of rooms in our 9 day stay. The noise from the construction work surrounding the hotel was unavoidable. Our last move was to the 29th floor with fantastic views but still we could hear the pile drivers as early as 5 o'clock in the morning. The staff on the information desk were unhelpful almost to the point of rudeness and at one point suggested that we were not telling the truth when we said that we had been told that our new room would be ready at 12 o'clock not 5 o'clock as he was saying The pool was in constant shade and although the temperature outside was in the mid 80's it was too cold to sit. Parts of the pool were closed presumably because of the construction work. Each day we walked the 1/4 hour trek to the MGM where we used their delightful amenities. The buffet was average and the large plates were nearly always cold except by the salad bar where they were sometimes hot! I think that the general staff apathy is because there are so many complaints from guests. Avoid if possible, there are so many other first rate hotels in Vegas, this is not one.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a nice hotel...but not at the price we paid.”
Reviews.Author: optimista
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been to Vegas about 10-12 times in the last 8-9 years. We usually call around in advance to the nicer hotels on the Strip and book the cheapest one. We have stayed at Bally's, the Monte Carlo, MGM Grand, NY NY, and the Luxor. I don't think we have ever paid more than $150 a night, even on a weekend night. A few weeks ago, some friends of ours decided to get married in Vegas and asked us to come along to help them celebrate. Our joining them was kind of a spur-of-the-moment deal (about two weeks from our arrival there), and there was a HUGE convention going on in LV that weekend, so almost everything was completely booked - and hideously expensive. Even the Casino Royale, which definitely does not qualify as a "nice" hotel, was running $150/night. The cheapest rate I could find other than the Casino Royale was at the Monte Carlo, which ran us $550 for two nights. Gack. However, I had read on this site that somebody had been robbed recently at the Casino Royale, so I swallowed hard and booked the Monte Carlo. We were there from Oct 13-15. The hotel is very nice. The lobby is spacious and impressive (although not even close to as impressive as, say, the lobby of the Bellagio). Check-in was a little lame - there was a LONG wait on a Friday afternoon, which I imagine to be a pretty popular time to arrive in Las Vegas. The hotel is pretty centrally located on the Strip, which is a huge plus for us because we never rent a car when we go. Our room was clean and attractive, with marble in the bathroom and a bed that was more comfortable than average. It also had an in-room safe, which I liked. However, the towels - and the WALLS - were painfully thin. The towels were thinner than the old junk towels we keep around to dry off our dog when it's raining. As for the walls, this normally wouldn't be a problem for me, as I am a heavy sleeper, but for an average of $275/night, I expect to be *pampered*. And to be able to hang out in my hotel room without having to hear the people in the next room coughing. Two other things that I thought were plusses which others might not - there is a food court in the hotel that offers crappy (and cheapish) fast food (like McDonald's, Sbarro's, Nathan's, and Starbucks). I would normally not be the least bit excited about McDonald's, but I have to admit that it's a little refreshing now that Vegas has gotten so horribly expensive to be able to buy a cheap meal. I had at least one meal there that cost less than the "service fee" for the ATM in the lobby (which was $4). They also have probably the biggest and best "Everything's $10" store (only it really has some fancy French name - Bijoux something) I have ever seen. So those were good things. Overall, I would definitely stay here again, but I wasn't impressed for the price. So if you're headed that way, be sure to book early! And you may want to bring your own towels, too.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed with the front desk”
Reviews.Author: tiredofbadhotels
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Monte Carlo with my parents from October 8 to 12. Our experience was mixed. First, check-in was very slow. There were too few staff for the number of people and the clerk we had was very slow. First she could not find my parents' reservation. Then, she attempted to bill me room rates even though I had reserved through expedia and prepaid. She then swiped my credit card multiple times because she seemed not to be keeping track of what she was doing. We were placed in unsatisfactory rooms on the fifth floor overlooking a huge ventilation system on top of the casino that produced a constant humming buzz and boasted huge spotlights that glared into our room. We also overlooked the enormous excavation next door. They are putting up a new resort between the Monte Carlo and the Bellagio. We were aware that there would be construction but no one informed us that Las Vegas is permitting 24-hour construction at this site. My wife called the front desk and asked to be moved. The first clerk told her that there was construction on all four sides of the hotel and, in any event, no non-smoking rooms available that night and hung up. She immediately called back and a different clerk told her to come down the next day after check-out time to see if another room was available. She called a third time in 3 minutes and a third clerk enthusiastically agreed that the room was unsatisfactory and he reserved a 31st-floor room for us starting the next day. We then went to tell my parents, who were also very upset with their room. My mother called the front desk but they were not willing to reserve another room for my parents as well. All they said was to come down the next day to try for a new room. In the end, a helpful clerk moved us both to the 31st floor the next day, but we could not understand why we got such conflicting answers from the front desk. All I can say is, if you are unsatisfied, continue pressing until someone makes it right. Even though the first check-in clerk repeatedly swiped my credit card, when they moved us to the new room they did not keep the credit card file so we ended up unable to charge restaurant purchases or make phone calls. When my wife went down to add a credit card to our room, they initially would not accept it because the room was in my name. Most other services were fine. My parents called maintenance to unplug the shower drain and it was done within 20 minutes. The rooms were comfortable, bathrooms were spacious, and the rooms had a free wall safe. The staff was helpful with telling us how to get places and where to find things. The breakfast buffet was very good for $12. We did not eat other meals at the hotel. We went to the brewpub on a Sunday night - it was deserted but they were blaring music and we left because it was too noisy even to talk. We were disappointed that the wave pool, river ride and pool bar were closed. Those were two attractions that we looked forward to when we were picking hotels. All pools at Mandalay Bay and the Bellagio were open and it was 85 degrees. We do not understand why the pools were closed. More importantly, neither Expedia nor the hotel website said anything about when the pools would be closed or about the construction. We would have like to be informed about the construction. The construction noise only woke me when we stayed on the 5th floor, not on the 31st, but it was loud during the daytime even on the 31st floor. The construction produced other inconveniences, too. The window in our first room was caked with construction dust, the pool area for the one pool that was open was noisy and dusty, and the Deuce stop outside the hotel was closed due to construction. The only way to access the hotel by bus was to get off at the Bellagio and walk a long walk next to a dirty, dusty construction site or to ride past the hotel to the Excalibur and walk back. The hotel was decent, but we would stay there again until the construction project next door is finished. For the cost relative to other resorts, there were too many aggravations. Tip: For a cheap, good meal, there is an In 'N Out burger across the I-15 from the backside of New York, New York. It's about a $7 cab ride from Monte Carlo or you can walk through the back of the New York resort and across the overpass in about 10-15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Construction all around”
Reviews.Author: NorthSouth
Reviews.Content: I made my reservation and then read the reviews concerning construction noise. I called ahead and requested a room without construction noise. When I arrived, I again requested a room without construction noise and the very pleasant receptionist told me that I had been taken care of. Wrong! CRASH SMASH starting at 6am. I returned to reception after one bad night and complained. I was upgraded to a jacuzzi room overlooking the strip on the 23rd floor. The room was very nice. The view was great. There was still construction noise, just not quite so load as before. The entire strip seems to be under construction, but nowhere quite as bad as around the monte carlo. This construction is going to continue for a long time as another mega complex has just started to be built next door. Go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Monte Carlo!”
Reviews.Author: khubie1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo October 8-15, and had a FANTASTIC time. We were on our honeymoon and upgraded to a spa suite. We faced the construction but had a great view of the pool. The first morning we awoke to some major construction jack hammering. Which was very loud and noticable. So instead at night we made sure to turn the auto fan on, so we had back ground noise while sleeping and then we slept like babies! The beds are amazing, we had a king with feather pillows and duvet!!!! Also upgrading we got some coupons, like a free desert and deals through out the hotel. We loved the brew pub, and the cafe. Both had amazing quantities of food. Both times we ordered from each we could of split the amount of food in half. Huge meals, so maybe think of sharing. Also, the brew pub has the best vegas lite beer, and the BEST 10 oz burger I've ever had. Its like a steak on a bun. Also at the pub try a giraffe they are definatly the neatest thing I have ever seen. As for the casino every night we toured the strip and always came back to our casino. Ours was usually one of the busiest ones so when other people said that it was dead in their reviews, we were confused! The service was great one night we were there and played and drank for 5 hours. The waitress ALWAYS came back to check on us. Just make sure to start her off with a good tip and she will for sure come back. Although I must say while I was there I didn't really ever see any jackpots go, or bells on the slot machines. The pool was amazing, but hours for the pool in October were kinda a disappointing since it still was high 80's the whole week we were there. They were open 9-5 and most of the main pool was shade until 2-3 in the afternoon. The lazy river and wave pool were also closed. We were definatly looking forward to relaxing in the lazy river, and were quite disappointed about that. Also when you go down to the pool, don't over pay for drinks. Buy them across the street at the convenience store (the plaza where you can rent the cars) and just a 6 pack of corona or smirnoff for 9.95. Rather then 6.50 per drink by the pool. They never once said anything to us, just make sure to pour it in a plastic cup. Overall we had a great vacation, people were always friendly and asking if there was anything they could do to make it better. House keeping cleaned our room everyday, and even changed our sheets without even being asked. The glass shower was amazing, and pressure when the toilet was flushed was awesome, who would want to complain about that! We never had to double flush! :) We will definatly go again.

Reviews.Title: “very noisy...don't choose if you like your sleep”
Reviews.Author: vickyfos
Reviews.Content: Last year we stopped at the MGM and Bellagio in Vegas, both of which were fabulous. Looking at the website for the monte carlo we thought it would be equally as good. Although the room was spacious clean and on a par with the MGM amd Bellagio unfortunatley the sound proofing was not as we could hear noise from the strip as well as our neighbours. This may have not been helped by the fact we had adjoining doors to both neighbours. However there was no such excuse for the noise from the strip as we were on a high floor, this was music and the building work going on next door. If you like your sleep I would not recommend this hotel, the amenities however were very good and we had no complaints about the standard of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away - Construction!”
Reviews.Author: pjstulsa
Reviews.Content: We were at the Monte Carlo Oct 6 - 8. Be forewarned there is major demolition going on behind the hotel. Unless you have a room that faces directly on to Las Vegas Blvd you will hear it. They start at 6am everymorning except Sunday. Not only do you hear construction, but the wall are very thin. The beds back up to the neighboring bathroom, you can hear them flush the toilet, you can hear the shower, and loud voices. Plus the toilets in your own bathroom flush with an explosion. This hotel has a fun brewery pub but that is about it. I do have to say it was nice to have a Starbucks and a McDonalds in the hotel. And the best part is that the prices were normal prices, and not jacked up for the convenience. The casino was always dead, definetly not a true themed hotel, just a normal looking hotel with a casino. Unless you get a really great rate, and a room away from the construction, stay away!

Reviews.Title: “lovely las vegas”
Reviews.Author: rogerrab
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a great 2 week stay at the Monte Carlo (our 5th trip to Vegas), We found the rooms to be very clean spacious & comfy,all the staff to be VERY helpful & polite,quick check in and check out & overall the casino & amenities to be very good and not quite as manic as some of the other strip hotels.we ate at the noodle place,buffet and brewery all of which were good. However..... sadly I have to agree with other reviewers on the noise issue.We had a room overlooking the strip & away from the construction which was great apart from the empire ballroom nightclub across the street.I cannot begin to explain just how loud the music from there is!!! We were kept awake for 2 nights (the 2nd night the music was on from about 3am until 10am) We asked to be moved, which we were with no problem at all - the hotel is well aware of the noise from the club. Our 2nd room (which we moved to at night) was overlooking the pool & construction towards Bellagio - bad move - we were woken at 6am by very loud construction noise and also the sound of someone taking the longest shower in history!! So we asked to be moved & again there was no fuss at all & we basically told them where we felt was the quietest place (at the back of the hotel) & asked to be moved there, which we were and had blissful sleep for the next 10 days ! We heard a little bit of noise from the construction but even the plumbing seems much quieter on that side. I feel really sorry for the monte carlo as the two main sources of noise ie the construction and the nightclub are beyond their control & I can honestly say that the staff bent over backwards to accomodate & help us even giving us a few comps into the bargain. I would definately stay there again, as the position on the strip is great, and apart from the aforementioned noise found the hotel to be great value and very pleasant to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: fletches
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed there for 4 days the end of August and it was wonderful. The service that I received from the time I booked it until we left was exceptional. I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best time ever!!”
Reviews.Author: markymarsh
Reviews.Content: Heard so much about Vegas and didnt know what to expect. We chose to get married at the Monte Carlo as it looked really romantic and wasnt too expensive. I was a little disappointed to see the building work going on but you could never hear it and it didnt effect our stay. The rooms are standard however we upgraded to a spa suite and it really transformed our stay. The staff are absolutely amazing from the concierge to the catering department who made our wedding the most memorable for the 26 of us. They managed to turnaround 26 covers for a wedding breakfast in 48hours and the ballroom they let us have was phenomenal. They bent over backwards to make our day supreme and their service was nothing but excellent. Some of our family were staying in the Luxor an d Caesars but we all met up at the Monte Carlo because it was small enough to always find each other some of these bigger hotels you just get lost. We had a brilliant time in the Houdini Lounge on our last night and we won $1500 so if anything it was lucky for us. The buffet is well worth the money and the pool was lovely. We hired a Cabana for our wedding hangover and boy it was worthe the $200 for the day. So we definitely made the right choice with the monte carlo and most of my family are returning next year !! My dad wans to come for a month he loved it that much.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Construction”
Reviews.Author: fiorentina
Reviews.Content: Although I live in Las Vegas, I am a professional travel director and meeting planner and therefore stay at various hotels when I have groups in town. I am not affiliated with the hotel. I have always enjoyed the Monte Carlo and feel that it is a good value for the money. It is also in an excellent location on the Strip. In a recent post somebody mentions the tram between Monte Carlo and Bellagio. Not sure when they were there but this service has been discontinued. People considering staying that the Monte Carlo should be aware that there is a huge construction project taking place directly surrounding the hotel. It is called City Center and is a massive undertaking consisting of shops, lodging, residences, casinos, etc. Due to the construction the multi deck parking structure at the Monte Carlo has been torn down. They still have valet and very limited outdoor parking. The main problem is the construction noise. After all Las Vegas is a 24 hr city and construction projects such as City Center are operational 24/7. They try to keep the very loud construction to a minimum at night but some of the people in my group said they were awakened by jack hammering, etc. The Brewery @ Monte Carlo has very good food at fair prices. If you like beer and sports this is definately the place to go. I just wanted people considering a stay at The Monte Carlo to be aware of the construction. It's not completely disruptive but if you are a light sleeper bring ear plugs.

Reviews.Title: “A Horrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: jamsmom13
Reviews.Content: My husband and I go to Las Vegas twice a year and have for many, many, years. We usually stay at Treasure Island, but for some reason, we decided to take advantage of a great deal at the Monte Carlo this time and thought we would try something new. We were also celebrating our 30th anniversary & my husband's birthday. From the minute we got into our room, we knew we were in trouble...after reading many reports about the "thin walls" here, we quickly encountered this problem after 5 minutes in our room. We could literally hear ever word of a telephone conversation that the man was having in the next room. We have NEVER had that happen before in any other hotel! It was very annoying but we figured we would just try to overlook that. We went to the dinner buffet which was very sub-standard food. We gave it a 3.5 out of 10. The next morning we awoke at 4:30 am to the sound of the man next door talking on the phone again and using his electric shaver, & water pic etc. You could hear EVERYTHING!!! It was if he was in OUR room!! He left the room approximently 8am, but we could not fall back asleep. Also, I might mention that the construction noise IS very, very, loud, but we found that to be MORE tolerable than the noise in the next door room. We put on our bathing suits and headed done to the breakfast buffet. This was slightly better than the dinner buffet and we rated it a 5 out of 10. We proceeded to go to the pools only to find out that there was ONLY ONE POOL OPEN...the others were closed for the season....and the one pool that was open was IN THE SHADE until 4pm each day. One of the reason's we were looking forward to this hotel was for their pool's....we expressed this at the time we made a reservation and also at check-in. We were NEVER TOLD that the other 2 pools were closed and the other one was in the shade for most of the day. We came there to sit in the sun and relax, after all the temperatures were in the high 80's! We were so annoyed with everything and decided that we could no longer stay at this hotel, so we checked out and went to stay at Treasure Island. We had already missed 2 days out of our 5 day vacation which was very upsetting. Treasure Island is truly a great value for the money and a real step up from the Monte Carlo in every way possible!! We just wished we could have gotten those 2 days back! We just want to warn people about the situation at the Monte Carlo. We are not fussy people by any means, but everything from the customer service, to the holes in the sheets, to all the other problems we described re: the food, pools, thin walls & construction noise, lead us to giving this hotel the lowest possible recommendation possible!

Reviews.Title: “Hit and Miss with Monte Carlo - Mostly Miss”
Reviews.Author: Victoriabound
Reviews.Content: Monte Carlo is Hit and Miss – Mostly Miss Unless you get lucky and get an upgrade. This is a long review and of course based on our experience only. I have noticed in reviews that give 4 or more stars that most of these reviewers seemed to be getting some kind of upgrade that is not available to the majority of guests. This is our second time to Vegas and the 3 other couples we were traveling with have been to Vegas several times each. I have worked with the public for 20 years in the food service industry and know how to treat people courteously and appreciate the same. We booked in May 2006 for our rooms for 4 nights starting on the 27th of September. Bad Points: Check In – Confusing, Tiring and Lengthy - We arrived in the middle of the week too. I could not imagine checking into this place on a weekend. We had called the Monte Carlo reservation line prior to our arrival and requested rooms facing the strip and higher up. The request was on our file when we arrived according to the receptionist. We arrived at the Monte Carlo parking lot at 2:15pm, got out of the airport transport to be greeted with a pile driving machine from the construction operating behind us breaking up cement. The Travel Rep who greeted us at the hotel was yelling and we still could not hear her over the noise. We had to get into the lobby so we could hear her instructions. She told us that the hotel has a strict policy of releasing room keys no earlier than 3:00pm. We had to wait until 3:00 to get our room keys and that the porter would have our luggage in our rooms at 3:00. We had lunch in the Brew Pub and went back at 4:00pm and got the keys. Checked out the rooms and no luggage in any of the rooms and all the rooms overlooked the construction on the backside of the property. Also, one of our rooms was not made up. The previous guests left lots of DNA on the sheets - disgusting and a general mess overall. Not a good impression, especially for the couple who was supposed to occupy that room. We then tried to change rooms. I was greeted by indifference by a complacent person at the front desk. This was my first interaction with a Monte Carlo employee and fortunately, he was the only rude person we encountered. He just told me no room change without the luggage that we had to wait for the luggage to get to our rooms. Not even a smile from him during our entire transaction. I was pleasant the entire time. He is not doing his employers any favor. If you don’t like working with the public get into another line of work. We then went to the area where the luggage is distributed to see if we could retrieve it from there. After a 10 minute wait, we were told it was on its way to the rooms so we sent our husbands up to the rooms to wait for the luggage while we stood in line to try to get the rooms changed out. Finally, someone with the travel company talked to the person at the front desk and then they entertained our request to change rooms even though we did not know where our luggage was. We all ended up on the side of the hotel facing the strip on higher floors. All with 2 queen size beds in each room. We retrieved our luggage shortly after. Noise: This place is noisy. No doubt about it. Walls are thin Hall noise is not buffered Noise from the construction on 3 sides of the block at all hours Water running through the plumbing is loud Nightclub across the strip from the Monte Carlo is LOUD on Friday and Saturday. Note: There is construction in the front and the back of the building so no escaping the pile driving. There is a 9 billion dollar project being built on the same block as the Monte Carlo and we were told it would be completed in a couple of years. The pile drivers started their hammering at 4:11am on the first night and then 3:10am the next night. (at least that is when it woke me up) Earplugs help and if your window can be opened keep it shut. Noise from the night club across the strip – there is a 24 hour night club across the street called Emerald or Empress. It is loud on Friday and Saturday. One person in our party woke up in the middle of the night and the base from the music across the street startled her. It pulled her out of a deep sleep and with the vibrations she thought she was having a heart attack! It was still going at 6:30 am on the Sunday morning we checked out. Comfort of Beds: Beds were comfy. The pillows were not hard at all but they were thick. Just fat pillows so your head is probably more elevated than usual. They gave me a sore neck so if you use the edge of the pillow it alleviates that problem. Food: Brew Pub – Café – Breakfast Buffet and Food Fare are the places we tried. The Brew Pub food is good and reasonably priced. Eight of us had a mid afternoon meal complete with 2 beer each for $10.00 per couple. We bought the tower of beer and a couple of beers on the side. We shared appetizers such as nachos and quesadillas, onion rings. Very good first impression on the food if you like Pub style fare. The servers there were awesome each time we went. Very upbeat. Café Restaurant: Food was great there. Everyone liked their meals. Check out the menu before you go in and if there is something you think you would like, chances are you will enjoy it. The burgers run around $9.00 and do fill you up. One person in our party had the fried chicken and mashed potatoes with steamed broccoli. A healthy portion of well made comfort food, he enjoyed it. I had a chicken Caesar salad and enjoyed that until I found a 4” hair in it and pointed it out to my waitress. I told her that it happens and but I could not finish eating it after finding a hair. I was quite surprised that it was not removed from the bill. I had to ask the person at the till to take it off the bill. I have never charged any customer for food that had a hair in it in my years of serving. It happens on the rare occasion and when it does happen the facility should do their best to accommodate the guest. Breakfast Buffet $10.00 per person. The omlette station was great. Has shrimp, cheddar cheese, ham and standard toppings. I did over hear a guest trying to get toast. Toast was not available according to the staff there. The usual meats, ham, ham hocks, Italian sausage, sausage patties, bacon, fruit, yoghurts etc. It was standard breakfast buffet fare. Food Fare: Standard fast food - no complaints. Pools The pool area is okay but the adult area is in the shade all day. Plus the noise from the construction is LOUD. Maybe in 3 years it would be tolerable. Purple Reign – Monte Brew Pub Show. This is a Wednesday night show not advertised anywhere that we noticed. A Prince tribute. I read about it on the TA Forum and called the front desk when we arrived to get more details and confirm it was on for Wednesday. We went to the 10pm show and it was fantastic. No cover charge, although the drink prices do go up by 10% at 10pm. Well worth the modest charge. Phones in the room 2 phones in our rooms. One on the desk and one on the nightstand. $ 1.00 + tax per local calls Bathrooms The bathroom was a decent size - no complaints here - the usual shampoo, conditioner and soap available. We tipped everyday so near the end of our 4 nights we got some shower gel, sewing kit etc. With all the other options in Vegas we likely won’t be returning to this hotel. Hopefully this was of some help.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Leigh-Harrington
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay here. The Hotel offers excellent value for money with large comfortable rooms in a clean and pleasant environment. The facilities are good witha decent size pool area with three different typs of pool and water slide/river rapids. The hotel staff were very good and helpful, especially the pool staff. Although loosley themed on Monte Carlo it doesnt attract loads of tourists come to have a look like the NY NY or Bellagio etc. so there is a sense of space. Theres a variety of eateries but the best in the microbrewery which does a good range of tasty beers with well priced enjoyable food to go with it. the hotel is well located next to Bellagio with a free tram ride there and located by the NY NY, MGM Grand.M&M World. CVS pharmacy next door for things you dont want to pay hotel prices for. A definite place we would return to.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: lindajoans
Reviews.Content: I had read reviews before going to stay at the Monte Carlo Hotel and one was about the up grade to the Concierge floor of the hotel. When we got to the hotel we asked and sure enough we were able to stay on the 32 floor for $38.00 more per night. This was a real BONUS. Light Breakfast , light lunch, appies in the late afternoon which included all alcohol (no Beer)from 4:00pm until 10:00pm , not to mention a view to die for and a kingsize bed in each room! We went with 2 other couples so it really was a bonus. We booked our flight and hotel thru USAirways.com and I would book another vacation with them any time. Their service was also very very good. We stayed from the 24th of Sept to the 29th/06 and would not hesitate to stay at the Monte Carlo again. Loved it Linda

Reviews.Title: “Really disapointed this time”
Reviews.Author: karenmoc
Reviews.Content: Went back here after having a great stay 2 years ago. As others have mentioned, MC is now surrounded by 24 hour construction which is a bit of nightmare to say the least! According to 1 taxi driver, he dropped a fare off at MC at 3am & the noise from the jackhammers was deafening as the old MC parking garage has just been demolished as well as building work going on either side of the hotel. I also felt that the rooms were pretty shabby this time & the carpet in my room was really dirty. I was fortunate last time that I had no problems with the MC's infamous lack of soundproofing & noisy plumbing but the noises from adjoining rooms this time at all hours was really loud....coupled with the noise from outside, it was impossible to get a decent nights' sleep. I know Las Vegas is the kind of place where sleep can sometimes be optional, but this was beyond a joke! We has scheduled a 2 night stay at Wynn coming back to MC before going home, but we decided not to come back to MC. Desk clerk very nice....I wonder how many times they have had guests complaining recently? Pros: Blackstones restaurant-fantastic steaks,great service Location-Slap bang in the middle of the strip good price for rooms Staff pleasant Cons: the appalling noise Rooms shabby & didn't feel clean I was really looking forward to staying here & took friends on my recommendation. Until the construction stops, seriously consider whether it's worth sacrificing sleep to stay here! The soundproofing issue between rooms won't be addressed.....be careful who you are next door to!

Reviews.Title: “Pity about the pool. Bob,Alicante ,Spain”
Reviews.Content: Have just returned after nine days at the Monte Carlo. We decided on this hotel after reading many reviews of many hotels and picked this one as it seemed to have the fewest bad reports. A friendly girl at reception upgraded us to deluxe rooms when we asked for rooms away from the construction, some noise was heard but there is so much building going on close by, it would be difficult not to hear something. We have one complaint that a large area of the pool area has now been closed until next March. As we only had three days left it didn't affect us too much, but the area remaining open is in the shade and just a small part gets a little sun around 4 pm. However the Tropicana. pool seems to be open to everyone or at least has no security guard at the entrance. All in all we were very pleased with this hotel and would certainly return providing all of the pool area is open.

Reviews.Title: “Not as nice as I remembered”
Reviews.Author: frqntrvlr
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Monte Carlo (9/28-10/1). I had requested a non-smoking room with a king bed when I made the reservation over a month ago directly with the hotel. We checked in late Thurs night (around midnight). Check in was fine until we got to our room (all the way at the end of the hall). As soon as we opened the door you could smell the stink of smoke. We knew before we even walked in that they gave us a smoking room (with 2 queen beds to boot). We were exhausted from traveling (it was 12M in Vegas, 3AM EST), but we walked all the way back down to the lobby only to be told that there were no non-smoking rooms available and we had no choice but to sleep there. While in retrospect we should have fought a little harder for a room change, we were just SO tired. We decided to let it be and just take the room and go to bed. I literally felt like I slept in an ashtray and I really didn't even sleep. At 6AM I went back down to the lobby to get our room changed or we were going to have to find another place to stay. I was given another room no problem. We changed rooms right away and this room was better (and with a King Bed). All in all, the Monte Carlo is just standard. It's fine for just any old vacation but after moving to the Bellagio at the end of the trip, you really can see the difference. AND with our AAA card the Bellagio rate ended up being lower than the MC rate. There is just a difference between standard and luxury. The next time I fly across the country I am going to make sure I get luxury b/c standard just doesn't cut it.

Reviews.Title: “do not book a stay until 2008”
Reviews.Author: BusyBie
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Monte Carlo often and usually find it a very pleasant experience hence our return. We stayed 4 nights from 17th September. During our 4 night stay we had 3 different rooms and 2 nights free of charge. The reason you ask...This hotel is currently surrounded on 3 sides by major construction operating 24/7. We certainly dont go to Vegas to relax, but we do expect to get some sleep. Trucks being loaded with concrete, (they even have their own on site concrete mixing plant!) and peckers hammering away at 2, 3, 4 and 5am onwards. Hotel staff were very apologetic, happily refunded 2 nights and willing to try any number of room changes, sadly no matter how high, or in which tower, the problem remains and will do until the new Casino is completed - many tired and disgruntled customers in the hotel lobby complaining in the early hours and comparing notes by the pool during the day, shoutiing to be heard above the noise!!! Please be warned.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: SASSYBEAN
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo is a nice hotel and casino right on the strip. Very close to the Bellagio, Caesar's, New York New York, etc. Not as big as some of the other mega resorts, but at least you can't get lost on the casino floor! There is construction, and if your room faces it, it will wake you up in the morning. However, I am pretty sure the jackhammers that were running at 6:10 am everymorning (except Sunday) finished their work the morning we left, so it may not be too bad anymore! Overall a nice hotel and casino and worth the price. Rooms were nice and the non-smoking room we requested actually did NOT smell like smoke. Staff were very accomodating and the casino slots pay well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, perfect size, luxury without being crowded!”
Reviews.Author: cmhayes
Reviews.Content: Monte Carlo is a great hotel for the price. What I think will make me stay there again is the size. Some of the newer hotels on the strip are SO huge that you have to walk a mile to get anywhere, which can be really annoying, It was so nice that the Monte Carlo gave you everything you need in a smaller location. The pool area was excellent. Very clean and plenty of chairs. I got out to the pool between 9-10 everyday and had no trouble finding a chair. If you showed up at 11:30-12 of course it was mostly full, but....you snooze you lose!! Pool waitress staff was nice and attentive. Dined @ Dragon Noodle the first night and it was very good and reasonable. When we were looking for some loud nightlife my husband and I just walked next door to NY NY, then got to leave the craziness and go back to our quieter hotel where we could always find a place at the tables! Again, if you are looking for a nice, quieter, clean hotel, you just can't beat the Monte Carlo.

Reviews.Title: “if you are under 6o.. runnnnnnnnn”
Reviews.Author: cushman78
Reviews.Content: we were so pumped to stay here.. we had seen the pool the year before and it is amazing.i travel to vegas every fall with a group of males between 25 and 30. right from when we checked in we were not treated very nice. we were there definetely to party but never get rude or cause problems. we had some big gamblers , me being one, and were never approached for comps or anything. you would think playing a hundred or two a hand for hours and hours and hours would get you noticed. not if your young staying at the monte carlo.i had played for 8 hours one day, and i was drinking vodka red bulls. took a bit for them to comp the red bull but they did. so the next day i went back to the same table orderd a vodka redbull and they wouldnt comp it. i said u were sure serving them when i was 3 sheets to the wind but now that im sober and playing you wont? not happy. i was playing with my one club comp card.. so my play was obviously tracked. the one plus is definetly the pool. not that crowded(cuz the average age there is like 300) so we had good times there.the rooms are clean.. nothing fancy, no balcony and your window only opens an inch whichh is an inconvenience. there no nite club there, the poker room is small and not very big limits. although there is some very easy money sitting there.all in all if your looking to stay at a fun place say nay to the monte carlo. if your older , maybe stay here.... but still not happy with the attitudes of their employees

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Christa612
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because a friend of mine and I were on a budget and we wanted to stay ON the strip. The casino is rather small and there is not a luxurious pool resort...but that is why this place is cheaper. We didnt spend a whole lot of time in the hotel/casino but one thing I LOVED.....our beds were TO DIE FOR comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “Good for Our Needs .... Know Your Needs”
Reviews.Author: Jimmy-13
Reviews.Content: It was what we were looking for. Six guys celebrating a friends 50th birthday party. No one had discerning tastes, as such, it met our needs very well. The pub food was fine - and the pub was a good "hang". Bufffet was fine too as we were looking more for decent food to sustain us - mission accomplished. Food prices were reasonable, and the lines were short. Did not eat in any of their fancier places so no comment there. Check in and check out were fine. Service was fine. Casino was large and clean. Generally no problems finding tables to meet my needs - had many $10 tables and at times, $5 tables. Some dealers were nice, some were jerks (thinking they were doing a stand-up routine). Sports book was small for watching Saturday/Sunday football .... but sufficient for other times. The guests and mood at the casino was behaved, not over the top, but not very lively .... I'd just say fun and pleasant. Construction - yeah, it is all over Las Vegas (and I was told the construction around the Monte Carlo will last another 2 years). A hint - be nice to who is checking you in and drop a tip on "hello" and they will do their best to keep you away from the construction noise. But I was told that they are nearly always 100% full, so someone will need to stay near the construction. Rooms were clean, basic, perhaps underwhelming .... but we spent little time in the rooms. Walls are paper thin. Pool is a good place for an afternoon nap. All in all, we had a good trip that met our needs. Know your needs before you go there. As you can read in the reviews, it is not for everybody. Romantic and discerning .... no it is not. Good clean fun ... yes it is.

Reviews.Title: “even the construction was interesting...”
Reviews.Author: ljers
Reviews.Content: For our first trip to Vegas we read, asked, and listened to recommendations as to where to stay...We decided on Monte Carlo...Good middle price, and supposed to be clean and quiet. Even with construction going on day and night, our room was quiet...we could see for miles from our 28th floor room...ate in every restaurant in the place (except Andres do not like french food) Best burger ever in the brewery...from the moment we stepped in til the moment we checked out everyone there was smileing/service/customer friendly and then some...each employee went the extra step...We were very happy..room and hotel were extremely clean..only downside was the construction, but there is construction everywhere in Vegas...

Reviews.Title: “Not worthy of a return visit...”
Reviews.Author: rossbo1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Monte Carlo over the weekend based on a friend's recommendation. While I got the "casino" rate of $79/night and can't complain about that, there's not much to recommend otherwise, and I won't be going back. The Pros: Nice, spacious check-in with quick lines, The Brewpub (!!!), fairly large casino, and..... That's it. The Negative: Tired, old rooms and bathrooms, HORRIBLE beds, HORRIBLE pillows, paper-thin walls (as many other reviews have mentioned) and though no fault of The Monte Carlo's, 6AM jackhammers running next door at the huge construction site between TMC and The Bellagio. Summary: Nothing to recommend here, and I wouldn't go back.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced, don't expect to much!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bellabacioo
Reviews.Content: We were there for labor day weekend and decide to stay on of our night here the others were at TI. We had stay before at Treasure Island which we loved. The 4th night we stayed at the Monte Carlo. I was expecting something really nice but i was kind of disappointed. We arrived and the check in was smooth everyone was nice. We got to the floor that our room was on and the walk way to the rooms was extremely low. I am 5'7 not to tall and i could almost touch the ceiling with my hand. The room felt almost the same way. The rooms was average nothing special. After paying $130 a night i was expecting something a lot nicer. On the whole it was a nice hotel but dont expect to much.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo-I have stayed twice and will stay again in the future!”
Reviews.Author: har8cin5
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Monte Carlo for 6 nights from August 30-Sept. 5th. This is the second time we stayed here and I must stay the first was mainly for a place to sleep as we were away from the hotel a lot. This vacation the purpose was to relax and enjoy the hotel amenities. Upon arrival we were offered an upgrade to a Spa Suite for an additional $70.00 per night, since this upgrade is usually $220.00 a night we decided to splurge for the first two nights. We were in a cornor room on the 23rd floor and the suite had a full bar and stools all in marble. A fridge, and a 4 person marble jacuzzi tub against the wall facing the Eiffel Tower and MGM. The tolietries are a step up from the standard room and are provided for your jacuzzi and in the spacious bathroom. There is surround sound around the huge bed--(one of the most comfortable beds we have ever slept on-even in a standard room). We received coupons for 2-1 Buffet, Raft rentals Spa Admissions and drinks upon arrival and a free $10.00 item from Bijoux Ternier-since we booked directly with the hotel website.The weather was 100-105 all week so the 5 pools are a great asset to this property. We had no trouble securing two chairs if we went down between 9-10. It was much busier on the weekend but hey it was Labor Day weekend so what do you expect? The waitresses were prompt and friendly around the pool as we enjoyed a couple of poolside cocktails. We did hear a little noise from the construction first thing in the morning but could easily drown it out. Just ask for a room not facing the construction. The location of Monte Carlo is PERFECT. It is central and therefore not a typical killer Vegas walk to go to other properties. There is a Walgreens and CVS just outside and a MIni Mart for liquor and beer. We ate at the foodcourt a few times-nice Italian food and the desserts at the 24 hour cafe were amazing. The only negative I would say was that we were charged for an additional night in the spa suite when were not there and we had a bit of a time getting through to the Front Desk clerk that we had not been in it. Finally a supervisor came and cleared up the mishap and everything was fine. I recommend at ANY hotel to check your bill through the online service on your TV every day just to make sure you have been charged correctly, saves time at checkout. All in all I would return to Monte Carlo in the future. It has to have one of the best refreshing smells when you walk in the door of any hotel I have stayed out...they should bottle it.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, ok rooms”
Reviews.Author: jp7541
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fine. No real complaints as such. However, there was not much different between the standard rooms here and the rooms at 'cheaper' hotels on the strip. In fact circus circus had a fridge in the room, and the MC didn't even have a minibar. The rooms were clean and housekeeping was fine. The hotel location is not as central on the strip so expect a little walk to get to the rest of the action. The plus point is that this makes the cab to/from the airport a little cheaper. Staff were fine, no complaints about them. The pool was great. Around the time we went it was quiet and sun loungers weren't hard to come by. The rental of a tube for the lazy river is a bit expensive. As others have suggested, buy one before you get here, or from CVS/Walgreens next to the hotel before you go to the pool. (There is a pump in the pool shop which you can use to blow them up). Also disappointed about the pool closure time (6pm when we were there). The buffet was reasonably priced and the asian grill in it is a nice touch. Food court was ok too. The construction wasn't too big an issue, as others have said, it depends on how light a sleeper you are and where your room is located. Up on the 14th floor on the strip side it wasn't audible to us. The temporary car park isn't that bad. It is about the same distance from the hotel as in other resorts on the strips. We didn't gamble at this casino so cannot comment on the gaming side of things here. To summarise, this place is fine. Rooms are clean and adequate, but not plush. The swimming pool is great and provided you aren't too sensitive to construction noise it will not affect your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the hotel, but did not love the construction”
Reviews.Author: kgalla74
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel, we were a little turned around. The construction behind and around makes it difficult to find the entrance. We were able to park right in front of the entrance once we figured it out, free, which was rare. Walked right up to the front door, waited in line for 2 minutes, and checked in early. Got a room where we requested as well but had to settle with two queens, which we were fine with. View wasn't amazing, but room was nice. Appreciated that the elevators to the rooms were right near check in, didn't have to parade through the casino with luggage in hand. Plenty of options at the food court and a gift shop right at the front as well. When it was time to hit the pool we were happy to see it also was towards the front and there was no need to walk through the casino to get to it. Pool was crowded as others have stated, but we went down around 1:30 and that's peak pool time.
