Had a great time in the lazy river and wave pool, and second day we also relaxed at the adult pool which was nice. Adult pool is mostly in the shade until about 3:00 though. Appreciated the lack of too cool hipsters, but still a decent crowd. Casino was easy to navigate and as stated by others, lacked the smoky smell. The steak house there is really good, as is the Japanese noodle house that serves excellent sushi. Other than that we hit the food court once and went across the street the other day. The construction was the only downfall really. It's not terribly loud, but it's definitely there. Monday night we got a nice dose of it around midnight, guess in Vegas nobody sleeps. I was smart though and brought earplugs. Seemed to help a little bit, but didn't drown it out completely. I slept fine though. We will definitely visit again, once the construction is complete. Oh and beware of certain ladies behind the sports book counter, check your ticket before you walk away. My boyfriend lost some cash because she entered his picks incorrectly. Not a large amount, but $150 isn't a small amount either. He said she seemed to be lost, and questioned his picks 2 or 3 times, then it appeared she had gotten it together, apparently not. Other than that, checkout was easy, car was still parked nicely right in front free of charge. Easy in, easy out, but beware of construction noise and ditzy ladies at the sports book.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo was just fine.”
Reviews.Author: Ladiedy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in Vegas from Aug. 20th to the 25th at the Monte Carlo. I must say it was quite busy with a lot of kids. I guess parents were trying to squeeze out the last bit of summer. Check in took about a half hour but we received our room right away even though it was two hours til check-in. The pools were wonderful with the 100+ temperatures but getting a lounge chair could be difficult as stated by others. The rooms were clean and the bed comfortable. The window could have used some cleaning on the outside. Dust from the construction on the other side of the hotel probably didn't help. Eat at the Brew Pub-the food was good and reasonably priced with good beer and root beer. Some small things could be improved on but all in all the hotel is nice. I would definately stay again especially in hot weather. We rented a car for two days and side tripped to Red Rock Canyon and the Valley of Fire. They were both awesome. It was our first time in the Valley of Fire and we took at least a hundred photos. I can't wait to go back to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo on First Anniversary was a disappointment.”
Reviews.Author: HastingII
Reviews.Content: We booked the Monte Carlo through Expedia after reviewing TripAdvisor, and found the advice basically sound on cleanliness and appearance. Our complaint with Monte Carlo is with customer service. The casino was like all the others: cigar smoke, sloppy-dressed patrons, and a rude, "get-out-of-my-way" attitude! After having booked two months in advance, wanting this to be a great trip on our First Anniversary, our experience with Monte Carlo was only so-so. We asked for a Deluxe Room with a King-sized bed and left a message that it was our first anniversary. We arrived to find that if we wanted a king bed that first night, we would have to pay an "additional fee" to upgrade to a "Junior Suite" -- "the computers were down" that day and the huge Monte Carlo only had rooms with double beds! So...on our long-planned first anniversary, it was pay extra or get a room for the first night of our first anniversary in a room we could have booked "any time!" There was no courtesy upgrade, no apologies from a supervisor, no special anything, just a "come see us tomorrow," and we'll see about moving you to a room with a king sized bed! Monte Carlo was a fine hotel, but don't expect anything special there!

Reviews.Title: “A cool place to stay”
Reviews.Author: KnowAll
Reviews.Content: How pleased we were that we decided to upgrade for this stage of our trip, especially after visiting the Excalibur which we would have stayed at. Our adjacent rooms were large clean and had efficient air conditioning as well as having comfortable beds and a marble bathroom. We were 20 floors up and faced away from the construction site at the end of a corridor, so were not bothered by any noise With such a large hotel it is not expected that the staff would have time to be very friendly but they were efficient and a fault with a light switch was sorted very quickly when reported The Food Court provided a more economical service than the restaurants, although we enjoyed a buffet lunch after an early morning "breakfast "in the Grand canyon but eating in Las Vegas was more expensive than other cities we visited, even with the exchange rate. Our boys used the pool which was open till 8pm but it was very crowded and rather warm even then The air did seem of better quality than many of the other hotels and it was a peaceful place to retreat from the heat of the Strip Location wise it would have been preferablre if the Bellagio tram had still been running because it was very hot to walk, but we did manage to use the bus and the cable a couple of times We thought it was good value for the quality of the hotel, although our younger son would like to try Caesar's Palace!

Reviews.Title: “Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: tridacol
Reviews.Content: I went to Vegas literally on the spur of the moment. I arrived at the airport less than an hour before a plane departed to Vegas, no ticket in hand and no room reservation made. My accompanying friend had stayed at the Monte Carlo on past occasions and remembered her time there as enjoyable. As such, when we landed, that's where we headed. After incredulous looks from the front desk regarding my non-existant room reservation, check in was a breeze, the room was pleasant, inviting, warm, clean with all the amenities you would expect. I knew I would not be in the room often and it was completely acceptable. Our room was on the 26th floor over looking the wonderful pools. I turn my focus now to the professionalism and hospitality of the staff members at the Monte Carlo. I played it all!!! From the penny slots to the high roller black jack room betting in excess of $5,000 a hand, the staff everywhere were wonderful. I got the same level of service at the penny slots as I did in the high limit room. I make a particular reference and thank you to my casino host David. He met all of my reasonable and even my unreasonable requests. He made my first trip to Vegas an experience I will never forget. Because of his hospitality it will not be my last. For that, I thank you, thank you, thank you David. After 2 days of play, he upgraded me to a complimentary suite, a suite which surpassed my expectations of any hotel room imaginable. The Monte Carlo suites are to die for!!! I had NEVER stayed in that form of luxury. Furthermore, the staff continued their unbelievable hospitality. Vegas will be a permanant fixture in my gambling future although I am closer to Atlantic City. I will not say anywhere else besides the Monte Carlo EVER. Because of David and his professionalism Monte Carlo will forever be my home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Don't give them the business - a/c does not work + bad attitudes”
Reviews.Author: Mulrain
Reviews.Content: Two nights was tolerable. Its 107 outside and about 87 in our room, not comfortable for sleeping, and since the hotel is practically booked, you are not getting another room, we managed and left the ac on high 60. Room was very clean and big, but in need of some updating. We had a nice view of the strip and close to the airport. What made the stay even worse, the gambling. I have been to vegas many times, stayed at many places, I have never however, experienced attitudes or pure miserable people dealing. If they smiled i think their face would crack. Win or lose, the people were just plain miserable! We had to gamble elsewhere just to see if it was us, and it was not. Dealers are much nicer at the dives then they are here. I don't care if the internet rate was 19.99 a night, I will never stay here again. They need to hire people who enjoy their jobs. Oh, and the machines are worthless, there was a time where you can play the slots for a little while, not here, just take you money and you sit there, wondering why it only took 5 min to lose 100 bucks.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: GUrwin
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Monte Carlo for 6 nights between August 26 and September 1st. I was very impressed with the hotel and thought it was excellent value for money and in a great location. The room was a good size, was a non smoking room as requested (As was the whole floor), it was very clean and everything was in good order. I was worried about construction noise after reading previous reviews, however my room overlooked the casino and construction and while I could hear some noise it was not very loud certainly not loud enough to wake me up. The swimming pools were one reason I chose this hotel and they were excellent, it was good having the choice of a normal pool, a wave pool or the rapid river. The swimming pool area was also very well maintained. I took the tip of a previous review and bought an inflatable ring from the Walgreene store opposite the hotel, to rent one for the day was $12, I bought mine for $4. Wednesday night there was a free Prince tribute show in the Hotels Brewery bar, this was very good and lasted for over two hours. I liked the casino and found that unlike a lot of other casinos on the strip it was nice and bright. A good tip is that outside the hotel people were giving out coupon booklets, these allowed you to buy a drink at the hotel bar and receive a free one, they also gave a free upgrade at the Starbucks on site. If you are going for a few days I would recommend hiring a car and driving 150 miles (3 hours) to Zion National Park, it is truly breathtaking. It is similar to the Grand canyon only a lot greener. Another tip, if you are travelling from the airport and there is more than one of you, you are best to get a taxi. The airport is very close to the hotels and a taxi will only cost $10, a shuttle bus costs $5 per person. Also if you have the option try and stay during the week, the hotel cost is a fraction compared to the weekend and Las Vegas is just as busy on a weekday as a weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Construction, don't go”
Reviews.Author: nobadges
Reviews.Content: As much as we have enjoyed the Monte Carlo Hotel, its rooms, service, and best of all pools, over the years, I have to say stay away during construction. The jackhammers and heavy equipment starts around 6AM and the parking structure is closed with temporary parking across the street and very hard to find at certain times during the day or evening. Construction, in Las Vegas, or any popular resort town, comes with the territory, but no hotel should keep it a secret until arrival. I receive numerous offers from this hotel on a regular basis. I booked via the computer, and then had to follow up the booking with several phone calls because they overcharged me. I then received a confirmation of the booking. Yet, no where, in any of these contacts, did they bother to tell me I would not be able to sleep due to construction. I found this inexcusable, and think you should follow my lead and go elsewhere for the next year or two.

Reviews.Title: “If you like noise...”
Reviews.Author: chickeree
Reviews.Content: My friends and I just returned from a four day trip from Las Vegas. We stayed at the Monte Carlo from August 27th to the 31st. The hotel was average. I would have to agree with the other reviews that it is very noisy. The rooms facing the strip also have first hand view of the construction of the new casino resort going up next door. Besides the construction noise, you really can hear the toilet flush from the room next door. We didn't spend much time there. The cafe food is on the pricey side considering you can go across the street to La Salsa Cantina for a $2.95 breakfast. Overall, I would not choose to stay at the Monte Carlo again. Although after a long walk along the strip, it was nice to enter the Monte Carlo because of the rush of clean smelling air. Note that the Venetian and the Wynn have the same air freshener smell. Warning to all travellers, there is a homeless person who wanders the strip between the Monte Carlo and the Aladdin. She is a very large set woman who smells awful. She is really unkept, but my friends and I almost threw up because of the rancid smell. Be warned to hold your breath as you walk by.

Reviews.Title: “Probably Won't Return”
Reviews.Author: justhavefun
Reviews.Content: Stayed August 9-10, 2006. Two straight females, at check-in questioned with a cocked eyebrow whether we wanted "only one room", wink-wink. So, didn't exactly get off to a good start. Being a little flustered, I forgot to ask about the online discounts we were entitled to due to registering on the hotel website. Tried to go back 2-3 times but counter was very crowded. Finally went back and after waiting 10 minutes for the guy to find our coupons, he left one out. Although he initially presented them with a flourish and said, "that's it, ladies", he didn't give us the spa discount coupon and was fully aware that it wasn't in there because he was too inept to find it. Finally got it, though. Room was clean and comfortable, but t's kind of weird to have such a nice large bathroom with no shelves to put things on. Buffets were pretty good here. Didn't like the gambling in this casino at all, much better downtown. Wanted to stay on the strip for this, my first visit, but will probably stay downtown from now on. The pool area was nice but very crowded. There are shady spots tucked in the corner near the towel area if you'll walk around. The pool bar was very unorganized in helping people. A guy working in the bar was very rude to my friend, ignoring her to wait on a man who had just walked in (forever known only as "hairy back man"), although she'd been standing patiently for quite some time. She got really mad, which is unusual for her, so it must've been pretty blatant. Just not a good experience for us at the Monte Carlo.

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect, but enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: SusanTurner
Reviews.Content: Although our stay was not absolute perfect, what hotel really is? When we checked in, our room was immaculately clean. Our problem was a more important factor. The a/c was not working and during a heat wave, that presents problem. They sent up maintenance and the woman was absolutely wonderful. She put in a new filter and found that the unit had actually been shut down, possibly by previous guest even. She did fix it, but when she did a run through of the room, she wasn't quite pleased with a few things, like a burnt out light in the foyer and one bulb out over the vanity mirror. She phoned the front desk and asked them for a possible room change. They not only changed our room, but upgraded us to a suite, which was absolutely beautiful. They also gave us several complimentary coupons and the maintenance woman fixed us up with several "extra" goodie items in our room (i.e. shampoo, conditioner, lotions, etc.,) She helped us to our room and made sure it passed her inspection as well. The staff was very friendly, the breakfast buffet was wonderful, the drinks were great. All in all, had a great time. Highly recommend the Monte Carlo.

Reviews.Title: “Not great, but okay”
Reviews.Author: gutalada
Reviews.Content: After all we had heard about Las Vegas and the Monte Carlo from friends, we were a little disappointed. We were first given a room on the 24th floor, but it soon became clear that someone had used the room after it had been cleaned. The pillows were ruffled, the vanity kit in the bathroom had been opened with dirty ear swabs left on the counter (ugh!), there was no shampoo and I found a used emery board on the table in the bedroom (double ugh!). To be fair, the management was very apologetic and gave us a new room on a higher floor and a discount on the room for the following night. The decor of the room was bland and uninspiring, with a view of the construction site next door. The construction didn't bother us too much as it was the weekend, and there wasn't much activity going on. My two young teenage kids weren't too impressed with what the hotel had to offer (i.e. nothing); they were more fascinated by the other hotels on the strip which had free attractions (MGM, Bellagio, Venetian etc.). We ate breakfast in Nathan's downstairs (it had the shortest line), and it was quite satisfactory for what we wanted - bagels, tea, coffee. We also had a very good dinner in the cafe one night. The service was excellent. Considering the price we paid to stay at this hotel and we only used it for sleeping in (because of the kids, the casino wasn't the main focus of the trip), I'm sure we could have found better places to stay on the Strip. On the other hand, the staff were helpful, our second room was comfortable, and dinner was really good, so that's what saved the ratings score.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, noisy because of all the construction next door.”
Reviews.Author: Peggie2000
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel. Try to stay on the pool side it might be a little quieter in the morning. There are construction sites right between the MC and Bellagio. This also means there is no tram running between the two hotels. We upgraded to a jacuzi suite, and the noise level from outside was better. We had a birthday girl in our group 83 years young so the upgrade was for an extra $30. She couldn't us it as she needed a handicapp room. So we took it, and we loved it. Still at 7am the contruction crews started up. The check in area was slow. Really slow, but everyone we met was very nice and very helpful. The pool area is really happening with people of all ages having a great time. Lots of sun and shade. All of us were lucky at the casino. We all went home with a little extra cash. When in LV be sure to go to Treasure Island's Kahunaville Bar. We had the best fun. Great Grandma even went up for the free shot poured in her mouth. Needles to say she was the Hit of the bar. All and all one of the best Vegas trips ever.. This is our 4th year.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: samroz
Reviews.Content: There is major construction going on between this hotel and The Bellagio 24/7 so there is both a noise factor and dust/dirt factor to contend with. The lunch buffet was only adequate. A lot of the food stations weren't open at the start of lunch. I got the sense that this was done on purpose. Consequently the only open made to order food station (Asian Stir-Fry) was extremely busy and the wait was quite long. Another big dissapointment was the Spa facility. It is woefully understaffed and much to my dismay the services, while expensive, weren't anywhere near the quality expected for the price charged. Also it wasn't until I received the treatment that I was advised for an "additonal fee of $60 dollars" I could receive a facial during the otherwise "down time" during the body wrap. The facial was the only option (i.e. no possibility for a hand, foot or scalp massage). Finally there was a paucity of $5 craps tables (generally only two were available). Overall I was disappointed with my stay and likely will not return to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Stay at Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: beachbumaz
Reviews.Content: BACKGROUND ~ We were 4 adults (2 couples) late 20s and early 30s from Phoenix visiting Vegas for the weekend. We’ve all been to Vegas many times before. ARRIVAL ~ We arrived at the Monte Carlo around 9PM on Friday evening. We did Valet. We tipped VERY well (this came in handy later on…) CHECK-IN ~ A breeze. No problems. Very friendly staff member. We were in our room within 10 minutes of arriving at the hotel. NOTE: I had brought my laptop with me. The bell guys will not take your laptop on the luggage cart. I was OK with bringing it in with me. Once in our room, called for our luggage, and our luggage was there within 10 minutes. Again, very friendly staff member. ROOMS ~ Very nice, basic hotel room. We had a room with two beds (for 4 adults, we were 2 couples). Not a very interesting décor, but nice overall. We were on the 9th floor and had a view facing southeast, with mountains in the background and the rear of Excalibur/New York, New York. Everything in the room was in working order. The only thing I would mention about the room is that our shower did not drain well at all. After just a few minutes in the shower, I was standing in a puddle of water at least 2-3 inches deep. Then the next person would get in, and the water would get deeper, and so on. With 4 adults sharing one room, you do the math! Also, the sink in the bathroom had the same problem. It was a very slow drain. Also, as a female, it was a very small sink…hard to wash your face. It was small and difficult to bend over and splash water on your face…girls…you know what I’m talking about! There was also a hairdryer in the bathroom. The only thing we missed in the room…a coffee pot would have been nice. We would also have liked a small refrigerator. But overall, the room was nice enough. NOISE ~ We had no problems with noise. Of course, we could hear our neighbors showering or flushing, but nothing extraordinary. No complaints. FOOD ~ The first night, we just wanted to grab something to eat quickly before hitting the strip. We first stopped by the Monte Carlo Pub & Brewery. It was PACKED. Instead, we went to the food court. Bad decision. My husband and I got a piece of pizza from Sbarro. It was BAD. And the 2 guys working there were rude and slow and not friendly at all. Our friends got some food from Nathans…their food was BAD as well…and expensive! $12 for some wings and fries. Not worth it. On Saturday morning, I went down to go to Starbucks around 12:30 PM and the line was LOOOOOOOOONG! Decided against that. On Sunday morning, we went to one of the restaurants (I don’t remember the name, but it wasn’t the buffet, it was a sit-down restaurant.) We went for breakfast. It was a-la-carte. It was very good. Very nice service as well. Approximately $20 per person for breakfast. LOCATION ~ GREAT! No complaints here! Right next door to Excalibur. New York, New York, Mandalay Bay, MGM Grand, Paris, Ballys, Bellagio…all of these hotels are within easy walking distance. I was really very happy with the location. AMENITIES ~ I was disappointed. On Saturday morning, we were out of the room by 11AM. The two guys went down to play, us girls decided to hit the pool. We got all ready, walked down to the pool, and were very disappointed. We walked around the entire area and could not find 2 chairs together (we didn’t even see 1 chair available anywhere!) There were lots of open chairs, but they all had towels on them or stuff on them (they were all being used, not just a fresh towel laying on them). We decided not to waste anymore time…we’ll go get massages instead. So, we go back up to our room, call down to the Spa to schedule 2 massages…they are booked up for the entire day! So, needless to say, we were very disappointed, but we understood. VALUE ~ We ended up paying $159 for Friday night and $179 for Saturday night. When I was checking rates, for 4 adults in 1 room, the rate was higher ($219/night). I fibbed and only claimed 2 adults per room to get the lesser rate. We had no problems. No one ever questioned me. I don’t recommend this to anyone, but it worked for us! I definitely think these rates were very fair. CHECK-OUT ~ On Sunday morning, we checked out. Check-Out time is 11AM. We did the Express Check-Out on the TV. We called down to have someone come get our luggage for us. We had a staff member in our room about 15 minutes later. He, also, was very nice. He took our luggage and had it stored for us (since we didn’t plan on leaving town for a few more hours). NOTE: I had brought my laptop with me. Again, the bell guys will not take a laptop on the carts. Instead, he told me I could bring it down to the Bell Desk myself and put it in a locker (with a key) until I was ready to leave. I did. Once there, no one ever touched it…I did everything myself. I walked it into the back room and placed it in the locker and closed and locked the locker, all myself (with a staff member watching me, of course). I liked this, because I KNEW that I was the only one handling the laptop the entire time. When I picked it up, same thing. I unlocked the locker and took it out, all myself. DEPARTURE ~ A few hours later, we were ready to go. Remember I said we tipped VERY well to the Valet when we first arrived? Well, they “have their ways” to remember that. We were told it would be 20-30 minute wait for our car (there were a TON of people outside waiting to depart). However, we got our car within 5 minutes. (What they did for us is on the part of the ticket that we had, they had made a little symbol on it. When we turned it in, they see this symbol and know that we tipped well, so they hurry to get our car. We then tip THEM very well.) We’ve done this everywhere and it ALWAYS works for us! OVERALL ~ A very nice hotel. Not too big, not too small. Clean, basic room. Good food (stay away from the Food Court!) Very nice staff members. Good value. Stay, enjoy! Please feel free to email me at mem2350@yahoo.com with any questions!

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo THE BOMB! A++'s all around”
Reviews.Author: cruiseangel
Reviews.Content: We took our company employees on a appreciation get away just this weekend (Aug 18-20) and LOVED the Monte Carlo. Booked direct with the hotel and they honored lower rate when the price dropped with one call. The POOL (wave & lazy river) was the BEST pool I've enjoyed in Vegas (yes, seriously, over 6 past trips)...why? Relaxing, non-mega, non-stuffy environment, spacious pools and lots of lounge chairs, good bar service with ice buckets to go. The rooms are clean, nicely appointed and not too far from elevators. Beds clean and comfy. The elevator gets stuffy and could use some A/C but has a nice flat screen tv inside so you can see whats going on in the hotel while you ride and not much wait for one. Starbucks and the Pub were both great. If you valet car, be prepared to wait a bit. Unless you are driving a Porche, you may want to self park. Otherwise, MC ROCKED and we will return with no question!

Reviews.Title: “Go Somewhere Else”
Reviews.Author: jacobsda
Reviews.Content: Room was dirty. Hotel staff was rude. Broken desk, missing light bulbs and a TV that didn't work properly. I took a chance and booked the Monte Carlo on Priceline and now I understand why this place was the cheapest. There are plenty of other deals at better hotels in Vegas, so look at those first.

Reviews.Title: “expected it to be bad”
Reviews.Author: pzgirl
Reviews.Content: I had read awful reviews of the Monte Carlo, so I was ready for the worse. It was a very clean hotel, and if it was anywhere else it would be awesome, but by Vegas "over the top" standards it was nice. I agree with the reviewers that the walls were thin and we had to hold the handle down to flush, but.. the pool was great. Very shaddy and we were able to spend alot of time out there. The wave pool and lazy river were fun for adults as well as children. Don't believe all of the negitive hype. It is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: Whifflebat
Reviews.Content: My wife and i just returned from a 5 day stay at the Monte Carlo Aug. 7 -11 and had a wonderful time. We were happy with our choice of the Monte Carlo as it was a good mix of quality and affordibility. I had stayed at the Mandelay Bay last year which was more fancy, but also much more expensive. We stayed on the sixth floor and unfortuantely, we were given a smoking room even though we requested non-smoking, but they were all booked. We could have changed after the first night, but the smell wasn't that bad, so we stayed put. We did have a view of the strip, but we also had a view of all the construction going on. The bed and the room were very comfortable and an excellent value for the price we paid for our package. We booked our trip through Westjet Vacations which included discount coupons received upon check-in. The clerk said that the coupons didn't show up on our booking, but we had brought along a print out of our e-ticket, so she said she would give them to us. They included a 2 for 1 breakfast buffet, a 2 for 1 inner-tube rental for the wave pool/lazy river (they normally rent them for $12/day!!!! You are better off buying a cheap $6 one at the CVS drugstore next store) and a couple others we didn't use. We ate at the breakfast buffet most mornings and it was quite good (the waffles in particular!). We didn't eat at any of the other hotel restaurants. The best part of the hotel was the pool area. There is a pool, a wave pool and a lazy river (which isn't so lazy, it has quite a pull!). We spent 2-3 hours a day poolside. The temperature was 38-43 everyday, so we were glad to see there was a large area to the left shaded by the hotel building. We went everyday at around 9:30am and could always get 2 chairs together. We highly recommend doing this. Another huge plus of the Monte Carlo is the location. It is right next to the New York, New York, MGM Grand and a short walk to the Bellagio. Only having to walk short distance is very important, especially during the day. Things we did outside of the MC: - Ate at Gonzales Y Gonzales at the NY, NY: Excellent. - Ate at Chin Chins at the NY,NY: Good. - Ate at L'Ile St. Louis at the Paris: Very Good. - Had desert crepes at Le Creperie at the Paris: Very Good. - Ate at Quark's at the Hilton: Ok, but overpriced. - Saw the Lion Habitat (free and starts at 4:15pm daily) at the MGM: Recommended - Went to the new Atomic Testing Museam (short cab ride from MC): Recommended if you're into history. - Went to Love, the new Cirque du Soliel show based on the music of the Beatles: Highly recommended (the theatre is small, so any tickets have a good view). We would definitely stay at the MC again if we saw if offered at a good price again. It offers good bang for the buck and is very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good solid accommodation”
Reviews.Author: scottmordue
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Monte Carlo has a lot to compete with e.g. Hotel New York New York, The Bellagio, Hotel Paris, The Venetian etc, but I really liked this hotel. Without the big attraction I think you get better value for money. The room fitted my family of 5 (2 adults, 1 teenager and 2 smaller kids) in OK and was very clean and modern. The swimming Pool is great for everyone and a real plus for the hotel. The location is great for visiting the other hotels on the Strip and the restaurants were good quality. I'd definitely recommend it for the $75 a night that we paid!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, boring room”
Reviews.Author: julesd7
Reviews.Content: We are from England are were doing a tour of California. Our first time in Las Vegas. We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. Very impressive from the outside, and also for shops inside etc. Rooms very drab and brown, obviously as a deterant to not be in them. Would have liked a coffee maker. Our room was on the 29th floor and overlooked a building site. We enjoyed our stay in Vegas however, and the Monte Carlo is at the quieter end of the Strip which is a relief, and the pools are fabulous. We did a helicopter trip by Papillion and were very impressed, we did 'Grand Celebration' which included landing on the floor of the canyon and champagne picnic basket, really fantastic. Highly recommended to do this tour.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: locolomo
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location and great rates! It is not has big as some of the other hotels and no real theme, but I found that to be a plus. Not too crowded. The walk to your room is manageable. Clean rooms. Nice pool area. We did not find it noisey like some of the other reviewers. Comfortable beds. Really enjoyed our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Impressed”
Reviews.Author: stace143
Reviews.Content: After reading all the bad reviews about the construction noise and bad casino, we almost changed our reservation to a more "up scale" casino. Boy am I glad we didn't. Not only is the hotel extremely clean but upon check in I requested a room away from the construction noise and got an amazing room on the top floor with view of the strip for no additional charge. Did not hear noise from the construction or any other room for that matter during my entire stay. Did hear the toilet flush but that is true for most hotels. The pool had a lot of children but that is to be expected with the lazy river and wave pool. The hotel did not have any big clubs like all the rest on the strip did which was good in my opinion. I did go out to a bunch while i was there but liked that I didnt have to come back to a crazy packed out of control casino and the club let out. everyone i was with won money at the monte carlo casino more then at any other we visited. the buffet was great, as we tried it at least once for each meal. the 24hr cafe was closed which would have been nice for late at night when we wanted something though the food court is open pretty late too. nice to have starbucks in the hotel. really do not have any complaints. great service for the amount of money. would definitely stay there when i go back to vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jmrobin
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in Vegas and I loved this hotel. It is in a great location within walking distance of the other Hotels and attractions on the strip. It is closest to the MGM Grand and New York, New York but the other hotels are not too far off. The staff was very friendly and accomadating. Our first room did not have a view of the strip so I called down to the front desk and less than 10 minutes later we were walking into our new room with a fabolus view of the strip. The breakfast buffet is plentiful and costs about $10 a person but there is also a Mcdonalds in the food court if saving money on meals is a concern to you. Also for that early morning cup of joe there is a Star bucks also in the food court. For lunch I recommend the buffet at the MGM Grand (across the street) which is $20 a person but I have never seen so much food before. I think they had just about everything The pool was marvelous and they have a full spa but we didnt make any use of the spa. The room was not bad at all very spacious bathrooms, comfortable beds, maybe the tv's could have been a little bigger but this is vegas who sits in their room watching tv anyway. Also make sure you get a view of the strip and not of the massive parking lot because the parking lot is boring to look at which is why we changed to a room with a view of the strip. If they dont have any rooms with a view of the strip get one with a view of the pool that is also nice. There is a CVS next door and a Walgreens across the street which came in handy for things like pop and snacks which were priced high in the hotel. Some of the other hotels on the strip tend to feel crowded but I really like the fact that this hotel did not feel over crowded. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: Caramel30
Reviews.Content: August 4-8 2006 We Loved the Monte Carlo Just returned from Las Vegas 3 days ago and I would like to say that I was scared after looking at the reviews for different hotels. My husband and I arrived late Friday night and to our surprise we went right up to the desk and checked in very fast, the gentleman at the desk was very nice, because of our late arrival we did not get a king size bed but we were told that the next day to call the front desk and they would give us one. I requested a refrigerator and the request was granted, I also asked for a room that had a strip view, and we recieved that also. My husband just recently returned from Iraq so I asked the gentleman if we could get a room that was not around any construction or loud noise, and to my surprise we got a nice quite room on the 3rd floor good view and no noise at all. After getting to our room and it being so nice and clean, a huge bathroom we decided not to worry the front desk and ask for the king bed we wanted . So anyone that gives this hotel a bad review is crazy cause we really enjoyed our stay the casino had a nice pleasant smell it was not full of smoke and the food court was nice also. The Monte Carlo is located in a great place. The staff was very helpful, I can go on and on about the Monte Carlo but you have to see it for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: grindergal
Reviews.Content: My father and I stayed at this hotel for two nights, August 6th and 7th. I had mixed feelings about the staff, rooms, restaurants, and amenities offered at the hotel. Staff: Overall the staff was nice enough. The check-in/check-out staff was not exactly nice, and rather abrupt, however efficient. The overall process of checking-in/out was painless and brief. My father and I had booked separate rooms and were able to at least get rooms on the same floor and hallway. At the spa I found the service the same(at the front desk): abrupt and snappish, but painless and efficient. The great service we received from the staff was definately from the casino workers and bartenders. The dealers were awesome and the bartenders were truly friendly, nice people. Rooms: Clean and functional. Comfortable beds, but the pillows were weird. I heard no construction noise, but one could easily hear noise from the hallway and your neighbor's bathroom. My shower drain didn't work well, but my dad had no problems and absolutely loved the bed, as he told me several times. I may be spoiled, but I cannot remember the last time I stayed at a hotel that didn't offer free internet access. The monte Carlo wanted ten dollars a day. I chose against giving the hotel this amount of money for using my laptop. Restaurants: Ate at the buffet twice and thought the food was good. Drink service was a little slow the first time, but the waiter was friendly and quickly warmed up to us I should tell you that I have been waiting tables for 8 years and I may be a little more observant of what's going on than others. I notice the little things and yet am always extremely polite and, heck, when you are nice to people they are more likely to go out of their way for you. The Brew Pub was pretty good with service being much friendlier at the bar than at the actual tables. The waitress we had for dinner one night was slow getting to the table and then abrupt, rushing through the order and practically running away from us when she thought that we were done ordering. I had to stop her to ask her to add a salad to the meal. Food came out extremely fast after that and she was efficient, just not friendly at all. The brew pub was also serving breakfast while the Cafe was closed for refurbishment. The Cafe being closed was a real disappointment because it is the 24 hour restaurant that is offered by the hotel, serving a wide range of food for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Amenities: My dad and I didn't use the pool, but did walk around it. Chairs were plentiful. The spa was very nice and offered all the toiletries you could need if showering there. I used the fitness room and found it to be very nice and clean, with windows from which I could see planes taking off from the airport. I did use tha business center to check-in to my departing flight. The charge was $7 for the first fifteen minutes and $1 per copy (I needed to print our boarding passes). Again, I found this to be overpriced. Overall, we had a good time. I don't know if I would stay here again. I certainly didn't win big money at the Monte Carlo, but then, I never do. My dad really liked the hotel, he was happy. I might reserve rooms here again if I could get the same good deal we got which included a bunch of 2-for-1 coupons at the buffet and spa as well as cheap rates. If service had been a little better I would have given a 5-star rating

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo is Great”
Reviews.Author: Pippin2
Reviews.Content: Chose the Monte Carlo after reading all the reviews. We really liked it. Parking and check-in went very smooth. The room was very clean, comfortable and quiet. The location was great and the pools were marvelous considering the 110 degree weather. We would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Tad on the Noisey Side...”
Reviews.Author: Groupies666
Reviews.Content: We ended up staying her out of luck. Our friends were playing in Vegas and we opted for a cheaper hotel across the street. We ended up checking out of that dump and staying here instead with them! I would give it an overall B+ Rating. Very Clean, Helpful desk staff. It was nather noisey, but its vegas! Large rooms, great mini bar, big bathrooms. Of course we had the random Vegas drunks banging into the walls in the hallway. Some one vomited in the hallway, but by the time I told my friensd to come look at it, someone was already there cleaning it up. Very Prompt ;)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, Little noise, comfortable Beds”
Reviews.Author: Pastalvr
Reviews.Content: Being our first trip to Vegas and not knowing what to expect of hotels, we choose this because of the price. It is in a good location and within easy walking distance of many other casino/hotels. The room we had was a standard room, but very nice and comfortable. The shower had great water pressure and we were left with our daily supply of amenities. We had a vew of the pool area and did not experience any outside noise, no slamming doors, no noise from the construction next door. It is right next door to CVS, which came in handy. We ate dinner one night at the buffet, which offered good food for the money. Check in was a little slow, we waited in line about 45 minutes at around 5 pm. Staff was very indifferent...no fuzzy welcome. Long lines of people to check in. Slots are very tight at this casino, but I believe they are all over the strip, but it is a quiet place to play a few coins and pass a few hours. The shops were fun to walk through, and the $20 pot of coffee was good, although not worth $20. It is nicely decorated, although not as fancy as other hotels on the strip, but if you are looking for a quiet hotel to relax at and enjoy your trip, this would be the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Position but some staff problems.”
Reviews.Author: Gold1
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our first visit to Vegas. Our stay at the Monte Carlo was good, our room was clean and as suggested by other reviews we requested a room away from the building site. Didnt bother to put much money in the slots as found the floor was lacking in atmosphere and prefered the hotels further down the strip for that. Must say found some of the staff were a little rude. Had difficulty with the attitude of the staff member on the information desk. Beats me why people want to work in the hospitality industry if they dont like helping people. Front desk is the first and last impression guests get of a hotel and the staff need to go out of their way to be friendly and helpful. Even after complaining to the floor manager about incorrect information we had been given all we came away with in the end was that wonderful? american saying 'have a nice day'. Found the buffet so so, tried breakfast and lunch, but the food hall was good for a quick snack. Would recommend using the Duce great value for $5, and the feet appreciate it after trotting up and down the street taking in the sights and the wonderful shopping. Really loved the dueling pianos at New York New York. Would be happy to stay at the Monte Carlo again as it is good value for money and at the nice end of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, price, and location”
Reviews.Author: maven74
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Monte Carlo July 21-13. It was a girls getaway weekend. We booked 3 rooms for 12 girls. I have stayed at the Monte Carlso since it opened and once again I was satisfied with the accomodations and service. We arrived around 5pm and check in was a breeze. We were given 3 rooms next door to each other. We ordered towels for our room and they were delivered within 10 mins. We had wake up calls and asked for a help with our luggage and it was all taken care of the first time we called. Great customer service. The hotel was clean and comfortable. Housekeeping came around 10 so by the time we returned from shopping and lunch, the rooms had been cleaned. We didn't have any problems with noise. There were a few kids running up and down the hall and being loud but I asked them to stop and they politely obliged. Other than that, we didn't have any problems. We were all happy with our stay and I will definitely stay at the Monte Carlo the next time I visit Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings about the Montel Carlo”
Reviews.Author: facsgirl
Reviews.Content: We spent July 19-20 at the Montel Carlo. The hotel is beautiful and classy. The only negative in the lobby was the skimpy floral arrangements that did not match the decor of the hotel. We do like that it is not overwhelming to get around the hotel. Elevators were always available, never too far of a walk to anything within the hotel The casino has no smokey smell. Not much action seemed to be going on. Never heard the sounds of big wins. It was nearly vacant at 2 and 3 in the morning. I lost on slots-stopped putting money in after 40 dollars. My husband won my loss back on a quarter machine. Nothing to write home about. Check in was fast at 8 pm. The staff were not rude, just indifferent. No warm fuzzies here. We chose to check out by television. Glad we did because when we left, there was a line of at least 15 people. Of the 10 to 12 stations, only 3 were open. I would have been steaming if I were in that line. Our room was very clean with up to date decor. Room size was average. The shower had plenty of pressure, but the tub drained extremely slow. Noise was not an issue for us. We did take 2 small fans to drown out noise after reading other travelers advise. We did not eat at any of the food establishments, so can't offer advise. It's worth the drive over to The Orleans for their buffet. Unbeatable price and selections. My teenage daughter used the lazy river pool the day we were going to check out. She came back 2 hours later frustrated that she supposedly had to pay to use a tube to float in, so she floated without a tube. My son and her said the staff down there were useless. I chose not to investigate the tube situation since we were checking out anyway. We saw the Lance Burton show and it was amazing. I do recommend it to others. The girl at the hotel box office was the only warm and friendly person we encountered at the hotel. The rudest person we encountered was the attendent outside at the taxi pick up. Because of construction, curb side pick up was apparently not available. One side of the hotel grounds was under construction and only allowing valet parking to enter. On the second day that entire entrance was closed off. The other entrances were on Las Vegas Blvd. and of course you can't stop there to pick someone up. The only other option was the drive that taxi's went into to pick up people. It was on the side where construction for a new building next door is going on. Out of desparation to pick up my elderly mother at the curb, my husband pulled into the taxi area to pick up mom. The attendent started yelling and screaming at my husband to get out of the area and he could not stop. He literally threw a fit. My husband had no other choice but to ignore him and load mom anyway. The guy continued his ranting and raging. A more professional way to handle this would be to kindly say, "Sir, you are not allowed in this area, let me give you an alternative way to pick up your family member". Of course that would take some customer relations training and I am not convinced the Monte Carlo cares much about customer relations. Our room rate was originally going to be a bargain at 79.00 a night. Upon making the reservation, our price jumped to 129.00 because they charge for children-25.00 pp. Beware of this policy. Not all Las Vegas hotels follow this policy.

Reviews.Title: “Experience was neither hot nor cold..... lukewarm--”
Reviews.Author: johnniewalker27
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights. Walls are paper thin, can hear everything around you. When surrounding rooms turn on faucet you hear it, loudly, shower same thing, close door.... Rooms are old, outdated, small... But what do you want its priced relatively reasonable considering other places on the strip... Had room changed after 1st night, don't get hanicap rooms, b/c shower head is 4 ft. off the ground and i'm 6'2"... Food court was nice, McDonalds for breakfast... Starbucks and Hagen Dazs Sbarro pizza Resturants were OK.. Dragon noodle across lance burton was good.. Italian place next to that was average, pricey... Lance Burton was Amazing...... Deff. get tickets floor level $72.55 pp REASONABLE>>>> Overall 6.5 out of 10 Gaming was good.. Decent slots, did the best there.. Blackjack was good, good cocktail waitresses....

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Size”
Reviews.Author: jsowens
Reviews.Content: We visited Las Vegas July 22-26 for the first time. We had researched a lot of hotels and things to do prior to our trip. Trip advisor notes helped us prepare for Monte Carlo. Yes, the hotel smells so Downy-fresh in the casino...Yes, it is a perfect size, you do NOT walk yourself silly. Yes, the Micro Brew Pub food is good and well priced, but the service we had was not friendly. It is awesome having some food court cheap choices like McDonalds and Sbarro. Yes, the pool was crowded, but that was mainly the lazy river full of kids, you can get a way to the main pool and have much more room. The pool side was not kept clean and the towels were not picked up. My husband and I stayed on the 21st floor and were very pleased with the room. The bed sheets were dirty with stains and fuzz but the maid quickly replaced them when we arrived and was very apologetic. I asked (when I arrived and noted on expedia) to be away from construction and ice machine and to be on a high floor with a STRIP view...which the front desk graciously obliged. This was a great view and it was very quiet, except for a noisy toliet and neighboring shower sounds every now and then. Again, the hotel is great for the price and the size is perfect. Location is great. Lance Burton's show was also a fun time. He is the Master Magician located in the hotel. Three big tips: 1.Use the $5 a day/or $2 a trip Deuce bus line which stops everywhere along the strip including right in front of the hotel when you are hot and can't walk anymore,2. MUST SEE mystere by Cirque de Soliel, and 3.don't be afraid to travel past the strip to sight see at Hover Dam, Zion National Park and Bryce Canyon in Utah. We will stay there again if we come back. We had friends that stayed at MGM and visited our hotel, and liked it much more. We were overwhelmed when we visited them at MGM...it is in much need of gastric bypass over there.

Reviews.Title: “Not pleased at all!”
Reviews.Author: meeshb
Reviews.Content: We and several friends booked rooms for three nights at the Monte Carlo from July 19-22nd. After reading reviews on Trip Advisor warning us not to get a room poolside due to construction our request was granted. We were however given a room on the 3rd and 4th floors next to the air conditioners. This was the lesser of two evils. Well ,upon arrival I always check my sheets for any signs of bed bugs and did in fact find that there were several holes in the bed sheets. No sign of bedbugs and we called to have the sheets replaced. At 8:30 a.m.the pool area already had debris ex. trash, cigarette butts ect,,, lying around, not very clean. The people staffing the pool very rude. The last night of our stay we heard yelling and screaming people being pushed against the walls and being hit. We called the front desk they said they would inform security. 15 minutes or so went by and nothing had happened. We called again they said they were on their way. Things seemed to quite down a bit for several minutes and the screaming and fighting resumed. We called security directly they said they would send someone back up. The noise level decreased and it sounded as if they had left their room, but this was not so. Several people started banging on our door, then left for a couple of hours. By this time it was approx. 6:30 a.m. and here they came again. I proceeded to get dressed and go downstairs, I spoke to one of the hotel managers she apologized and said that if we had called one more time after they banged on our door they would have asked them to leave. Silly me, three times just wasn't enough. The manager did however comp us 2 buffets and give us an extended checkout seeing as I only got about 2 hours of sleep. On a positive note the Micro Brewry was very good(food and service excellent). We weren't impressed with the Monte Carlo, it was not a cheap get away and we won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo Rocks! Loved it . .”
Reviews.Author: TravelCass
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Monte Carlo and loved it! It was my 3rd visit, so I was a bit biased. It's such a gorgeous, sumptuous resort - the kind of place where you walk in and go - how much did I pay for this? :) The Lance Burton Show is INCREDIBLE! It's worth every penny, esp. if you have kids, because Burton is so sweet and loved to include kids in his show. The other parts of the hotel were incredible, as well - the cafe, buffet, Italian place, food court, etc. are wonderful and easy to to find. They're all bordering the nice casino. The rooms are very nice and I recommend a strip-facing room, although the three I've had faced the back and I had a good view of the NY,NY roller coaster and, another time, the Rio Hotel (cute.) btw -check out Bellagio, NY,NY, Venetian, Paris, Mirage - all like Monte Carlo. Very classy! I stayed alone and came to shop and enjoy the shows and I felt sooo safe here. Vegas is a wonderful, fun city. Watch out shopaholics, tho! Monte Carlo rocks

Reviews.Title: “Okay but nothing superb”
Reviews.Author: ebnyc
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 3 nights at the Monte Carlo. After staying at the old Tropicana on my last Vegas trip, the Monte Carlo was definitely a step up, but it's certainly not as nice as the pricier hotel-casinos. While the pool area was crowded, we always found a few chairs, and the staff was generally friendly. Had some trouble switching rooms after the first night (we had to call or come to the front desk 3 times in one day for the new keys), but it wasn't too big of a hassle. Definitely go for a room on the strip side, as people who stayed on the pool side or back of the hotel side complained of a ton of construction noise. Also, they should note somewhere that there is no longer a tram to the Bellagio, as there used to be. In 115 degree heat, it would have been nicer than a very hot walk through yet another construction site. Overall, a perfectly decent place, but probably not a hotel I would stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo - Good Hotel, GREAT Value”
Reviews.Author: ut_bandelero
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Monte Carlo July 12-15. I have stayed there before so I might be a little biased but our stay this time was as enjoyable as our stays in the past. We arrived at 8:15 on a Wednesday night, there was no line and we were into our room by 8:25. We requested a room away from the construction with a view and were given a strip view on the 13th floor and never heard a peep of construction. Or a peep from anywhere for that matter. I have read other reviews of thin walls but we never heard anything. No conversation, no toilets flushing, no showers running. Nada. I will agree that the pools are on the small side and the chairs are a bit crowded but we never had a problem finding suitable chairs or shade no matter what time of day we visited the pool. We ate at the Brew Pub and the buffet. Both were average but enjoyable. For what you pay to eat at either you basically get what you pay for. Decent food at a decent price. Speaking of the Brew Pub, if Purple Reign (Prince tribute band) is playing, you MUST GO! They are excellent and an absolute riot to see live. All in all, the Monte Carlo is a great value (we payed $115 night on average) and we'll certainly stay there again. PS - As a tip, buy any water you need across the street from the Monte Carlo in the Hawaiian Village. Water was $1.29 at CVS for a single 20oz but they are 2 for $1.00 for 20oz water at the Village.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable experience”
Reviews.Author: RetiredPrincipal
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 night stay at the Monte Carlo. After reading the reviews on Trip Advisor, I was not expecting a lot. Overall, our experience was enjoyable. The rooms, while not luxurious, were clean and fairly large. we did hear some of the surrounding construction noise, starting around 6:00 a.m. but, it was not as loud as my husband's snoring. It was fairly inconsequential. The casino was welcoming and not too terribly smoky. The wave pool was fantastic!! It was 110 degrees when we there. we would spend a couple of hours a day sitting on the edge of the pool, just having the waves break over our legs. It was great. Get out early to get a lounge chair, especially if you want a padded one in the shade. The food at the breakfast buffet was good. Fruit was delicious. We had dinner at the brewery because we had coupons for free drinks. The food was very good, a nice change from some of the heavier meals we had been having. The food court has a Mcdonald's, which was great for getting cold bottle water and diet cokes during the day - cheaper than buying it in the hotel stores. Check their website for specials. I did and was able to save $20 a night just by calling and telling them that their rate on the web was cheaper than what I had originally booked. They also gave us coupons for the drinks and the breakfast buffet. One other great thing, right across the street is a half price ticket outlet. we went there the day of the show and were able to get tickets to see Mama Mia for half price. Seats were great and the show was fabulous. They only sell tickets after noon on the day of the show for whatever is available. All four of us in our group said that we would stay at the Monte Carlo again

Reviews.Title: “Some Good Changes and Some Bad Changes”
Reviews.Author: jdlaw2001
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Monte Carlo. We had also stayed there during the summer of 2005. This year we stayed June 21 - June 26. We actually rented a car this year and arriving at the Monte Carlo from the airport is very easy. You can use the Valet, but the parking garage is very close and we were always able to find a spot close to the hotel entrance. Check in was easy and fast. However, our flight was late so we checked-in at midnight, and I would be very surprised to see a line at that time. You could tell on Thursday and Friday night that there was a line for check in, and I can easily see a 30 minute wait. We purchased our rooms back in February, and the Monte Carlo had some of the best prices for the week. If you book online, be sure to check the prices every so often. The week before we arrived some of the room rates went down and we were able to call and save $120. Customer service is very friendly and they were more than happy to help find a lower rate. Since we saved some money on our rooms we decided to upgrade to the suite. The Suites are similar to the regular rooms, but the extra space, safe in the room, two bathrooms, couch and table with chairs, are nice add-ons if you are going to be there for more than a couple of nights. The walls are still thin, and you can hear your neighbors if they are loud. The pool has changed a bit. They added Cabanas, but while we were there they were mostly empty, except for a few in the back corner that had corporate groups. The already cramped pool area is even smaller with these new Cabanas. They also seem to be getting a bit cheap around the pool. In the past you could bring your own raft and they would happily inflate it for you. This year we were told that they are no longer aloud to inflate outside rafts. It can't be a manpower issue b/c there were 4 life guards sitting in the raft rental station, and they made you feel like you were interupting their conversation. If this is there way of trying to get to you to rent their rafts, then I am truly worried about the financial condition of the hotel if they are tyring to make their money on raft rentals at the pool. Also, I was told I could only have 1 towel. I quickly got back in line and they gave me another? At 6'2", one towel does not cut it on the hot chairs. I saw a lot of people using their shirts under their legs since they were only given 1 towel. Although it seems they are tyring to be more upscale at the pool, cheaping out with towels and rafts really made it less enjoyable. (At least the empty cabanas look nice.) The casino is nice, but small. The slots are tight and we never seem to win. The slots seem looser at New York New York and the Aladdin. We were actually able to find plenty of $5 blackjack this year. We were even able to find an empty $5 table at 11:00 pm on Friday night. We played again on Sunday, and had no problem finding a $5 table. The Brew Pub still has great beer and food, but the service was even slower than I remembered. There are a ton of open tables, but they still make you wait 15 to 20 minutes. At peak time I understand, but there was always a wait. Overall, it's a decent low price option on the strip. If you want top notch service, and are willing to pay more, then you should probably stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Stay”
Reviews.Author: Vegas_Girl
Reviews.Content: Basically, if you’re just looking for a cheap place to crash and you party somewhere else, then this will be just fine for you. I’d say a rate under $90 would be a reasonable price for this hotel. It is in a great Strip location, close to lots of great places but if you’re looking for a clean, quiet place to relax, or even take the kids, then I’d say keep looking. We actually checked out a day early and won't be staying here again. ROOMS: I guess the best way to describe the rooms were small, tired and not very clean. It doesn't look like any updates or remodeling have been done since the place was built. Linens were worn and stained, and were only changed once during our 3-day stay. The carpet, tile, tub and grout was stained and worn. Our room also faced the highway and they were doing construction in the back parking lot so there was noise at all hours (especially at night). POOL: The pool area has too much going on in a very small area, and was VERY crowded. SERVICE: Most of the staff we encountered was friendly and courteous. Our Bell persons were especially helpful. However, we had an incident one night with a group of smoker's who were loitering near our room for several hours. They were very loud, at times screaming at each other, and were smoking enough that we actually had smoke coming into our room. We gave them a couple of hours to clear out before we contacted the Front Desk. It took two calls and nearly 2 hours before Security turned up, and by then the offenders had finally left with only the piles of ashes in the hallway to substantiate our complaint. The staff never told us what, if anything, they were going to do about the complaint and never followed up with us. THE PUB: The menu had changed since we visited last but still had a nice variety of options. The food is okay, definitely edible by Vegas standards, just a bit cold much like the food you would get from room service. Service has always been slow, one night it took nearly 30 minutes for us to get our check. THE CASINO: We actually didn’t gamble here much because for a couple of the days we were there about 50% of the machines were out of service for some sort of upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but not the nicest stay on the strip.”
Reviews.Author: toasttime
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo July 3-7. I had read from previous reviews that check in was a breeze- WRONG!! We waited in line for 45 minutes before we made it to the check in desk. They told us our room would be ready by 5:00 p.m. We went up to the room around 5:30 and the room was not cleaned, went down to the front desk and got the run around that it would be ready in 1 hour. WRONG AGAIN! We went down to the front desk yet again, asked for the manager and was given a suite. The casino was fun to play in, the wheel of fortune in the middle of the casino was a blast! Spent most of our time gambling there. Location was nice, but on previous visits have stayed more central on the strip and will do that our next visit. The buffet was ok for breakfast, nothing fancy. The Brewery was the best! Fun atmosphere and good brews, the nachos were also great. The pool was small and congested with a lot of kids. The lazy river was fun and also had a lot of kids in it. Get down to the pool early in the day to get a good seat.

Reviews.Title: “good value and location”
Reviews.Author: piashi
Reviews.Content: As a resident of Las Vegas, I get emails from hotels with specials all the time. My best friend came into town from NYC and we decided to get a room on the strip in order to avoid traveling back out to where I live. The rate I had reserved on line was to have included numerous coupons. When we checked in, they didn't give us any and we had to ask for them. The pool is nothing special, but will serve the purpose. If you want a really nice pool, check out the Tropicana. It is an older hotel but the pool is nice. The casino at Monte Carlo is decent, the girls came around frequently to get drink orders and you never felt like you had to hunt them down. Traffic on the strip can be atrocious and the Monte Carlo is within easy walking distance to Bellagio and NY-NY. Our room rate was 59 dollars a night - a good value for a room on the strip on a Saturday night.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous for Families”
Reviews.Author: mama_in_vegas
Reviews.Content: Excellent in every way! We stayed at MC for 4 nights this July 2006. The pool complex was supreme and we think better than other hotel pool complexes we saw on our trip. (While other complexes may be larger, they are very very crowded.) About one-third of the guests at MC are families, and we all coexisted nicely with couples and big groups having lots of fun. The wave pool was the best and the lazy river kept us busy for hours. The ammenities and services were wonderful and the employees were nice, friendly and helpful. 2 thumbs way way up. Our views were lovely. I'd recommend our room (23106) for views of the strip and of the hotel pool complex. There is construction going on next door, but we were high enough not to be bothered by noise and it was fascinating to see the process of 25 cement mixers lined up to pour a huge foundation. At check in, just ask for a room with a strip and pool view as high up as possible; the staff was so very helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo - wonderful; Vision Holiday Grand Canyon tour - horrid!”
Reviews.Author: satigrace
Reviews.Content: It was a pleasure to say at the Monte Carlo. The staff – for the most part – was extremely helpful and considerate. The accommodations were spotless. The hotel seemed quieter than others we visited on the strip. And the location was very nice – not at either end of the strip. I highly recommend this hotel. On another note, I would like to warn against using Vision Holidays to see any other attractions in the area – i.e. the Grand Canyon and the Hoover Dam. My husband and I had a horrendous experience with this company. To highlight the faults of this tour: 1.There was no air conditioning on the pick up bus – the outside temperature was 107 degrees. 2.Lunch was not at the Grand Canyon, as it was understood by various members of our tour but at a local buffet in Las Vegas. 3.The tour bus at the Grand Canyon had no working bathroom. 4.We did NOT see the Hoover Dam as advertised due to delays of the company. 5.Three hours advertised at the Grand Canyon was shorted to 1.5 hours, again due to delays through the company. 6.There was no plane available to pick us up after the tour – we were again delayed 1.5 hours as our plane was sent to pick up another tour. 7.Arrived at the hotel at 10:22pm instead of the promised 7:00pm 8.Trip time was 10.5 hours instead of 7 hours – most of which was delayed waiting time due to the company. 9.No customer service representative was available after our tour to discuss the grievances of those on our tour. Enjoy the Monte Carlo. Avoid Vision Holiday Tours.

Reviews.Title: “Second Stay...and would still return”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a six day stay at the Monte Carlo for the last week in June till the 3rd of July. We had been there last year at the same time. I have to admit, even though I have been through the other hotels, I still favor the Monte Carlo for it's layout of the hotel, that everything is close by...you do not have to walk far from the elevators to the Pool, casino, or to the dining. Hotel is extremely clean and find the staff very friendly and excellent customer service. The rooms are a great size and the bathrooms are too! We had a safe in our closet and an ironing board, which I would never need. The lobby is beautiful and the check in and check out was very quick. Valet service is wonderful. Only negatives, is that I didn't think the slots paid out as well there.. and wish that they had more chairs at the pool and a larger pool. All in all, we enjoyed our stay and feel that the hotel provides excellent security and clean, comfortable rooms for our six days stay.

Reviews.Title: “Forget about any other 'strip'hotel...this is the best”
Reviews.Author: aary
Reviews.Content: This is a WONDERFUL place to stay!! My husband and I planned this trip at the last minute and brought along our 2 children. I read trip advisor all the time and was a little concerned about the "thin walls" and the construction noise.. Well upon arrival (which was at a late hour) the man who checked us in was very upfront about our inital room NOT having a view but it was 4th of July weekend and this was not a big surprise for us. BUT he could have stopped there, but continued to suggest that if we wanted we could request a better room around 12 noon the following day. The initial room was GREAT, it was very comfortable, NO "thin walls" or noise and the view wasn't that bad. However we thought what did we have to lose by requesting a better room so the kids could have a view. The next day we did and our request was processed without any delay and we were given a GREAT view of the strip. Everything was great again BUT after about 2 hours in the room we felt like it was "warm" and we knew we would not be confortable. My husband reluctately called and was greeted with warmth and the minor problem was corrected very quick....what a relief. CASINO: We had to walk through to get anywhere and we were simply AMAZED that you could not smell smoke unless you were walking behind someone smoking....The casino always smelled for lack of a better word "downey fresh" lol!!!! I am not joking. FOOD: The buffet was good for the price, but hands down having a 1)McDonald's, 2)Starbucks, 3)Sbarro, and 4)Hagen daz in the hotel food court was wonderful. I was able to bring breakfast to our room several mornings in a row. FITNESS CENTER: Yes you do have to pay, but the equipment was state of the art and having an attendant serving fresh juices and water was nice. The view of the mountains was refreshing. CHECKING OUT: Via the hotel TV, although very common is still a great convenience. POOL: For Adults and Kids alike, It was a wonderful way to end the days. LOVED IT! Only 1 complaint: This was the first time we used expedia to pay for the air/hotel and upon check in we were NOT asked for a card to keep on file and while trying to rent tubes for the lazy river we were not allowed unless I brought a card to the front desk. Had to leave pool (wet) , walk to room, walk to front desk, return card to room, then return to tube rental.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a lovely holiday in Las Vegas. The Monte Carlo hotel was great, although the nearby construction work which goes on 24 hours a day, woke us up early each morning. The desk staff were very helpful about moving us to a quieter room after our first night was disturbed. In fact all the staff were very friendly and polite. The pool area was good, although you had to get there before 9.30am for a good sun bed place. The buffet was good value and one of the best we tried on the Strip. We had read reports before going to the Monte Carlo about noisy plumbing and uncomfortable beds. Our bed was so comfortable I wish I could bring it home. We occasionally heard a shower going but nothing like the noise I was expecting. We would definitely stay at the Monte Carlo again, and would recommend the hotel to others. I would however add that it would be a good idea to take ear plugs if you don't want to be wakened at 5.30am each day. Can't wait to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with average rooms”
Reviews.Author: Amadel
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 4 night stay at Monte Carlo. I loved the hotel itself. Valet parking was convenient both in and out. Check in was pretty quick even at 3:30 in the afternoon. The elevators to the rooms are convenient and plentiful -- though they could add some cool air or ventilation to them. Just off the elevators is the sundries shop that I believe stays open 24 hours. There is a food court very close to the elevators if you just want a quick snack or some coffee first thing in the morning (no coffee maker in the rooms). Food court includes: McDonald's, Hagen Daas Ice Cream, Nathan's Hot Dogs and Cheesesteaks (which has a quick, delicious breakfast, too!), Sbarro Pizza, and Starbuck's. There is a nice shop in the same area called "Indulge" -- all kinds of clothing, shoes and accessories. There is also a pub with a microbrewery in that same area. The pool access is located near the elevators, as well. Having three different pools was a nice feature -- we didn't try the lazy river or wave pool, but enjoyed the regular pool. Chairs can be hard to come by -- especially if you want one that has some shade. The casino was nice and not so large that you couldn't find others in your party if you needed to -- I didn't win, but isn't that how they build all those wonderful hotels in Vegas?!?!? The Cafe was very good! I tried the rib-eye steak and was very impressed with it -- I normally eat steak only in upscale restaurants that serve prime beef, so it was a pleasant surprise to find a nice cut of beef for only about $17-$18. Others I was traveling with said their food was also delicious at The Cafe. If I could rate the hotel/resort on the basis of these things alone, I would gladly give it about 4 1/2 stars -- lots of things to really like from a convenience standpoint. Here's the reason that I only gave it a 3 Star rating -- the rooms were barely a 3 as far as I am concerned. I have stayed in all sorts of hotels from Ritz-Carltons and Four Seasons on down to Comfort Inns and Holiday Inns, so I feel like I know a little about hotel class ratings. The amenities in the room barely qualified it as a 3 Star. There was no in-room safe, no mini-bar/fridge, no robes, no coffee maker. There was a hair dryer and an iron and ironing board. The "closet" didn't have a door -- it was just a nook with a bar and some hangers. The bathroom was average, with a loud flushing toilet and a tub that drained very slowly. The real problem was the thin walls that are the number one complaint from other reviewers here on this site. You could easily hear the conversations in the next room. Our friends had a room down the hall from us and said they heard the person in the next room coughing all night long. And, then there's that dreaded construction that is going on 24/7. We were awakened the first morning at 6:20 AM by jackhammers pounding away and that awful beep-beep-beep-beep sound of heavy equipement backing up. We asked to be moved (along with our friends) and the front desk was very accommodating. We were moved later that day (from the 12th floor to the 17th floor) -- we could still hear the noise, but it was less than before and I was able to sleep with earplugs in. If you are a light sleeper then I wouldn't recommend staying at Monte Carlo. If not, there are lots of things to love about it. It isn't one of those mega-monster places where you walk your legs off and that is a nice change! I would possibly give it another shot, but only if I had a suite where I might not be so close to the people in the next room!

Reviews.Title: “Worth it!”
Reviews.Author: Big_Mick81
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised with the Monte Carlo. I stayed there with my girlfriend in April as part of our world vacation. As usual with my reviews I'll split my summary into the good and bad parts. Good: * The buffet at the Monte Carlo is excellent. We tried it for both lunch and dinner and were impressed on both occasions. During our stay we also tried the buffets at the MGM and the Stratosphere, and both were poor in comparison. * The rooms are quite large and ours was clean and well maintained by the maids. * Sorry to hark back on food, but there is an Italian restaurant inside the Monte Carlo (can't think of the name) which is fantastic. The staff are also very friendly. * The pool area is quite sizable and nice. * The casino itself isn't as big as some of the others, but it had everything you need. * The brew pub is a nice addition. Bad: * Not sure if this is a regular occurrence in Vegas Hotels, but whilst gambling early one morning around 3am, I did receive quite a few invitations from women for...um...company, so to speak. * The casino gaming floor doesn't seem too smokey while walking through it. Yet once you get back to your room your clothes are sometimes putrid. * The drink service at the slots can be a bit slow during peak times, but I guess that's to be expected. * We were there in April and one day it was very hot so we went to the pool. We struggled a bit to find lounge chairs so I can imagine in Summer it would be nigh on impossible to get a chair. * I know they don't want you in your room much, but there was no fridge or kettle in our room. Surely they could at least leave you a kettle? Overall though, we were pleased with our experience and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel except for...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from a 3-night stay (June 21-24) at the Monte Carlo. I found the hotel to be very nice and clean and I would definitely stay there again. We checked in around 1:30 and at that time our room (w/the requested pool view upgrade) was ready and waiting for us. The personnel was very friendly and ready to help accomodate us at all times.
