The Monte Carlo isn't as big and doesn't offer all the attractions (clubs, themes, etc.) that the other hotels may offer but what you get in return is a nice, pleasant, atmosphere w/out the circus. The ventilation in the casino was fabulous (the best if you ask me) and the hotel always smelled very fresh. I found their slots to be cold so I didn't do much gambling their (I had much better luck at New York and The Mermaid (downtown). One thing I especially liked about the Monte Carlo was in addition to the restaurants, there was also an inexpensive food court which housed a McDonalds, Sbarro, an Ice Cream parlor and one other restaurant which was good. I only ate at the buffet for breakfast ($11.50) and the food was good. They had three pools (lazy river, wave pool and reg. pool) that were all operating. Although I didn't get a chance to swim, it looked as if everyone else really enjoyed it. The room was a comfortable size and the bed was extremely comfortable--although they could use bigger pillows. The bathroom was roomy (the toilet flushed extremely loud and the shower water was extremely strong). I did find that the walls where pretty thin (thank goodness only one room next to us was occupied and they were pretty quiet). Our rooms were cleaned every day in a timely manner. The Monte Carlo is in a pretty good location (between NY and Bellagio and right next door to CVS Pharmacy) but definitely a nice walk to the more central hotels. Bally's would be considered central strip area. THE ONLY DOWNSIDE IS they have construction going 24/7 right next to the hotel and if you stay on the pool side (and you are a light sleeper), you will not get any sleep at all!! I called the first night and they offered to change our room but we ended up staying. In the end, they gave us a discount of the upgraded amount ($60) for our inconvenience. I was told the construction will continue until 2010! Other than that, I have nothing negative to say about the hotel and will definitely stay there again. If you are looking for extremely upscale hotel w/a lot of entertainment, ect. then the Monte Carlo is not for you. If you are looking for a nice, low key hotel with good service, the Monte Carlo is your choice. Word to the wise, definitely continue to check their website for reduced prices. I orginally booked for $129, $149 and $179 per night and ended up paying $69, $79, and $119 for our stay. They will gladly change your rate to the discounted amount if they are offering it prior to your arrival.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a stay over the weekend of June 9th at the Monte Carlo and found it to be a great hotel and the staff were friendly and helpful. I upgraded to the consigneor floor and felt it was worth the small fee. Location is good and you don't get lost in the hotel or casino. My girl friend won on the slots but the crap tables didn't work for me. J.B.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful ... but not much action”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Monte Carlo 4/26-5/1/06. I had been to 'Vegas before and had always stayed at the Westward Ho - my father would get comp'd there. Lets just say this was quite an upgrade! Enough said. ;) My first and last impression were wonderful. The hotel is beautiful. Unlike most of the hotel/casinos - when you check in it actually feels like a hotel. You're not checking in - in the middle of the Casino. Much to our delight, our room was ready early. The room was very clean and spacious. We didn't have the best view - but we didn't plan on spending much time in our room. The pool area is very nice - I would recommend getting down there early. By 11:00 am - all prime spots were taken. The pool is a good size - plus there's a wave pool and a lazy river. Of course one word of advice - sunblock! There are several choices for sit down dining. The food court also has several fast food choices. We did the champagne brunch one morning - the variety was incredible. The food was very good and didn't taste like your typical buffet food. If you love pizza - you must try one of the stonebrick oven pizzas from the Pub - they're to die for! As far as entertainment - if you want to dance - you won't really find a place to do that here. However, the great thing about the location - you're right next to NY, NY and you can find all the nite life you want. We did, however, have a great time listening to the sultry voice of Tammie Graham - in the Houdini Lounge - an old fashioned piano bar. She's a lot of fun! If you like Micro-brews - I would highly recommend spending some time at the Pub. The Las Vegas Lites go down pretty easy! We had a late flight - on the day of our departure. When we checked in, I had inquired about a late check-out. I was told I would have to call the front desk on the day of our departure, that it would be based on occupany and the fees could vary. Much to our delight - we were able to stay in our room until 4:00 pm - for an extra $38. I would definitely recommend this hotel/casino! ...a side note - if you love lobster - and money isn't an object - I highly recommend "The Rosewood Grille" - it's located on the other side of the street - just down to the left of Walgreens. ...and if you love a good reuben sandwich - you'll not find a better one - than what they serve at the NY, NY Deli. Happy Travels ... and Good Luck!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was okay, we will not return”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I think that the walls must have been made out of paper. Our neighbors came in at around 1am while we were asleep. We could hear their whole conversation and even worse, we could hear them going through a plastic bag. That is how uninsulated the walls are.--A plastic bag? We were on the 18th floor facing the strip and heard several police cars and helicopters throughout the night. We were tired. The hotel apprears classy enough, however you may want to find somewhere else if you need regular sleep. Oh, and we went at 3:30 to check in,and the king bed that we had paid for already woul not be ready until around 5pm, so we took a room with 2 double beds and even still could not get into our room until around 4:30 because it still had not been cleaned. That part was annoying because we wanted to clean up and go out. The pools were pretty decent but crowded. Next time we are going to stay Downtown. We like it MUCH better!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Value...We Enjoyed this hotel”
Reviews.Author: cancun41
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a very enjoyable four night stay at Monte Carlo. We have stayed at many places in Vegas and this is our new favorite. Are there better hotels in Vegas? Yes I am sure there are if you want to spend 3 or 4 times the $$ per night. We stayed M - Th for an average nightly rate of $69. I challenge you to find a better value on the strip. Our original rate was booked months in advance at $109. The week prior to departure I noticed online that the rate had dropped to the rate above. I called and politely asked if they would honor the new rate. They said of course they would. At that time, I also told the reservations agent that we were celebrating our anniversary and would appreciate a strip view or upgrade if available. They said they would be glad to give us a strip upgrade if available. We arrived at about 1030 pm and found absolutely no line at check in. We were pleasantly surprised to find they had pre-assigned our room to a 25th floor room with a view of the strip from MGM down to the flamingo with just a corner of the Bellagio fountains in the view. The room was nice. Not huge, but adequate with a nice bathroom and very nice toiletries provided. We loved the layout of this hotel. Very easy to get around in and not to large like so many of the Vegas properties. The pool area is not the fanciest in Vegas, but it was very nice and there were always lounge chairs available in either sun or shade at any given point in the day. We ate at Blackstones Steakhouse for our anniversary and had a wonderful meal, and the Brew Pub was a great place to have a beer and catch a game. Never a problem with seating or service here. We also went to Lance Burton and enjoyed the show very much...would especially be good if travelling with children. As for gambling, the dealers in this hotel were as friendly as any I encountered anywhere in Vegas on this trip. I didnt win, but it was a nice place to play. Only one complaint and it was a temporary problem. The first morning the construction noise did start early, but it was not noticable for long and was only that one day. They are destroying the Boardwalk next door. There are not very many places in Vegas where there is not construction going on. If you want the Ritz, you should stay there...or maybe at Bellagio and expect to pay $200 -300 a night. If you want a nice hotel for a great price....stay here, we will again.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo slipping in service!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our annual Las Vegas trip. We have stayed for years at the Monte Carlo resort. In the past, our stay has been wonderful! This year, we noted many negative changes. First, we noticed that the pool hours had been shortened. The pool area has been "reconfigured" to scrunch as many chairs and cabanas in as possible. The towels were being "rationed" out by the pool workers. I was told one per person as they were short towels. We noted the towels were frayed, full of holes and faded. In previous years, fresh, bright towels were readily available! Also, we were not told that the resort has become a "construction" site! We were not told of the vast extent of surrounding construction: Dust, noise and explosions at all times of the day/night. I would not recommend for this reason alone! The tennis court facility was also shut down - with beach chairs filling the courts! In addition, the front desk workers seemed cold and disgruntled. One young lady told us that the Monte Carlo had been sold to MGM properties and many changes were going on. (not all positive!) We noted that during our stay. We plan to look at other resorts for our stay in the future! On a positive note, the food was still top notch at the resort. Hope they can clean up there act!

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo is good value”
Reviews.Author: PamWindsor
Reviews.Content: I just returned from the Monte Carlo and thought that overall, the hotel is good value for the money. The only major complaint I have is that there is a lot of construction going on around the hotel, so you pretty much hear construction early in the morning to very late at night on most nights. This can get tiresome and it doesn't seem to matter what floor or side of the hotel you're on, believe me, I switched rooms a few times and witnesses this first hand. They really should say something about this on their website because it can be a nuisance. The breakfast buffet was delicious and for $10.95, it's another good value here. The casino smells wonderful! They pump out some sort of deodorizer throughout I'm assuming to hide the cigarette smell and it does seem to be effective. Dinner at the Café restaurant inside the hotel was delicious, reasonable and the portions are huge...you must try the full rack of ribs for $14.95. You could easily split these with someone. The shampoo, conditioner and lotions are excellent quality (olive oil, green tea, Vitamin E & aloe). The pool is very crowded and there were many kids around. The hotel is not as upscale as the Bellagio or the Venetian, but then again, with rates as low as $59.95 per night, you can't complain nor compare. Overall, a good time was had and I would return.

Reviews.Title: “June 3-6 trip at hotel”
Reviews.Author: garda44
Reviews.Content: After reading the trip advisor on several hotels, I decided to give the Monte Carlo Hotel a go. Now, bear in mind I am travelling with my sister who just had double knee replacement and we were limited on our walking . We arrived at the hotel and upon checkin, which was fast, was nice especially since we got an upgrade when I explained that my sister had never been to Vegas, had knee surgery, would be in the hotel most of the time, and was her first outsing since hurricane Katrina (we are from New Orleans). They upgraded us to a mini suite which was faboulous on the 28th floor. The room was big with a bar, sofa, jacuzzi in the bedroom, nice view of the mountains. We did have problems with the a/c and they came and changed the filter and fixed it. The bed was comfy. We were able to get a wheelchair for the whole stay and that was included in the amenities. All you have to do is sign for it and not lose it. It was hard pushing the wheelchair in the hotel with the rugs and outside the push was very difficult with the heat and the construction going on. It was a long walk to the other sites. The Coke/M&M store is across the street and worth the walk. The buffet in the hotel is not worth it. I was not impressed at all but the CAFE food was good. Theservice at 2AM is very slow and we had to wait but that was alright. We had breakfast room service and it was great. It was well worth the extra price and a real treat as my sis never had room service before. The play in the casino was good to us. We won at the $5 slot machine and wheel of fortune slots. We were able to survive without losing. The STEAKHOUSE was great. We had filet mignon, baked ptotatos, corn, salade, and soda and it was about $125 with tip. The service was great as was the atmospherre. You can be casual dressed but no tank tops. It is worth it. The shower in the bathroom was large and spacious with average water pressure and it was always the right temp as you needed it. Ice machines are on each floor and the suite had robes for us. We had a mini fridge and a nice area to walk around in. The stores inside werent that great. There was really nobargains. I suggest the Desert Passage at the Aladdin which was good. They are really some nices stores and restaurants there. what is nice about the Monte Carlo is the fact that you dont have too many people crowding the lobby and you can get in and out easy. The tram was not working that connected the hotels and the walk from the back to the front is lengthy. But well worth it. I tried to get the spa services and a haircut but it was booked up both days. Book early....

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel but......”
Reviews.Author: DanandTan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo from the 21st - 26th May. Let me start by saying that our first impressions were excellent. Check in was very smooth and our room was ready for us there and then. The room itself was bigger than we expected and well furnished. Nice bed, Nice bathroom, generally pleasant decor. We didn't have a particularly great view, overlooking the building site on what used to be the Boardwalk. You need to be aware if you are on this side of the hotel that the building work goes on pretty much 24 x 7, but on the 21st Storey it didnt really impact us that much. Also this building work means the monorail link to the Bellagio is gone, which must have been a blow to the hotel. We chose the Monte Carlo for two reasons, we wanted a real strip hotel and we wanted to be somewhere near the centre. That ruled out places like the Stratosphere and the Monte Carlo was the cheapest of the rest. Location wise it did fit the bill, being close to several other hotels. We were pleasantly surprised by the casino in the Monte Carlo, it had a nice feel to it. Not too big , well lit and spacious. The bars were also really nice, especially Houdini's bar which had a great relaxed atmosphere. Also the floor drink service was good, pretty regular and nice drinks. So now to the but side. I've mentioned the poor view above which could be an issue. We were dissapointed with the quality of the housekeeping. The room wasn't dirty but things like glasses were taken and not replaced, rubbish wasnt taken..minor details but not what you really expect in a place like this. The Air Con was not good at all, which in 100 degree heat was a real problem, the room was permanently hot. Finally we had a room with an adjoining door which meant that we could hear every noise from next door. Particularly bad at 6am when a family was getting ready next door. Overall its not a bad hotel, especialy for the strip if you can get it at the right price...just be aware that it isn't perfect.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: albertafamily
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 days in mid may.Hotel rooms were nice and clean but i did tip cleaning staff a few dollars each day which I think made a difference. The casino was fairly quite most of the time, when I did play, the slots the were very cold.The pool area was always very crowded even though we were there at a slow time for tourists. If you like a clean,quite,hotel with not much dazzle this place is good.

Reviews.Title: “return visit”
Reviews.Author: THE ROBERTS
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the monte carlo several times in the last ten years and have always thought it excellent. However for the first time we were disappointed the reception was as classy as ever but the carpets once you got to our floor were in definite need of a clean.Also anyone planning a visit should be aware that the hotel is surrounded with building work and is very dusty at the moment. The cars in the carpark were covered in dust continually and it is obvious that the problem will worsen as the digging and building continues. I have no doubt that the hotel will overcome the present problems and return to its normal status as soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Boring At The Monte Carlo!”
Reviews.Author: JennMcCl
Reviews.Content: I couldn't ask for a more friendly and helpful hotel staff. I was also definitely impressed and pleased with the service! As far as the crowd and the hotel itself (minus the rooms which were more than adequate) it's a little less than desirable. Not a lot going on inside the hotel. The crowd seems to be much more mature (over 60) and not exactly hip or trendy to say the least. My only other complaint would be that the pool area is extremely crowded. If you want a seat anywhere even close to the pool (on a weekend) get there by 9am (when it opens). Next time I'm going to try a hotel a little more upscale...you definitely get what you pay for at Monte Carlo.

Reviews.Title: “Just alright”
Reviews.Author: howboutit
Reviews.Content: Great central location, but not very special inside, definately a class just below Ceasars/Ballys/MGM The good- Check in was great; no lines, fast service. Very clean and uncrowded lobby and casino area, which was great for ease of getting around. The Brewpub was also great- fun room, gigantic big screen for games, friendly, efficient staff and refreshingly lower priced food and drink. Ice machines on the main area of every floor was a convenient touch. The shampoo, conditioner and lotion provided was excellent. The Bad- The pool was just awful. One is greeted by a sea of platic louges w/no rooom between them, wet towels and swirling trash. The staff did zero- I witnessed 4 guys in front of me finish their lunch and smokes, look around for a trash can, then leave their debris where they were. An hour later, the trashed remained (although the lighter stuff had blown away). There were people wandering around looking for free chairs, when obviously long-abandoned lounges w/ piles of wet towels sat vacant. My sandals went "missing" when I returned from the pool. The process of reporting the lost sandals was akin to the Keystone Cops. The mixed: Our first room on the 18th floor smelled awful. I checked it off to you get what you pay for, but then decided to switch to a room with a safe after the aforementioned sandal issue. The second room on the 30th floor was much better- no smell, and a safe. Our rooms had no mini bar, which I think is a plus, but then the vending machine on our floor was empty. This place is very kid friendly, which one may or may not like.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, standard rooms”
Reviews.Author: apaula
Reviews.Content: Nice location, reasonable rates, and pretty standard rooms. Casino is fun. Andre's restaurant is great! Casino was fun. Pool was pretty busy and crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Bittersweet-More Fun Before Food Poisioning!”
Reviews.Author: renoky
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at the MC May 29-June 2. We picked week days as the less busiest time. Check in was smooth and we received a room with a great strip view on the 17th floor. We loved the aroma of the lobby. It smelled like fresh cut flowers piped through the ventilation system. The lagoon pool was a little small for the amount of rooms/people and we were disappointed that the lazy river was down for maintenance the first 2 days there which made the other pools seem even more crowded. There were lots of families with kids by the pools. There are not enough chairs around the pool for everyone needing them and we saw a few selfish people who would come early in the morning to place towels on several chairs taking up several in a row with no intentions of being at the pool for a few hours. This left those who were there ready to swim to stand around even though many seats were unattended for hours. This caused a disturbance one day when seats had been vacant for almost two hours as if abandoned and someone who needed them sat in them. After a while, an English-accented woman claimed someone took her "reserved" seats & created a scene with an man holding a child. With digusting cursing and vulgarness between them, we thought security might come in case of a fight but they finally parted. She continued to rant however for at least an hour afterward like a spoiled child to anyone who was within ears shot of her, stating how "RUDE" other people were to take "HER" chairs that she had come down early that morning to save for later (whenever she decided to come down to the pool). There isn't enough chairs for everyone in the first place. If she had taken the time to read, there is a sign at the pool stating that chairs left unattended for more than an hour would be considered "abandoned" and would have to be given up. Evidently, she didn't care that there were others wanting to use the pool while she was out doing other things. The slots were very tight and I came back deep in the hole. We didn't go many other places to gamble, just to sightsee a day and one night. Don't gamble at MC if you play the slots! My husband broke even at the roulette tables but ended up with enough comps for two tickets to shows, a free room night and a $30 meal at the Cafe. The Buffet's breakfast buffet was fabulous and the lunch buffet there was good too. We had planned on going to Fremont street one night, but my husband wanted to cash in on the $30 Cafe comp meal so we went to the MC Cafe that night instead. Mistake! I had the Salmon with soup which was fresh & very good. He had the ribeye with salad. He said he's grilled out steak at home better. We finished eating around 7 p.m. and by 10 p.m. my husband started feeling ill. From midnight on thoughout the rest of our stay he spent every 5 minutes running to the bathroom with symptoms of food poisioning. He has never been that sick in his life! I had to go to CVS pharmacy next door for Immodium AD & Gatorade. The pharmacist said he should go to the Urgent Clinic with his severe symptoms, but he didn't even feel up to getting dressed and getting a taxi. He had to stay in bed the rest of our trip. Vegas isn't too much fun alone, so my vacation was over also. We never made it to Fremont Street or other places I wanted to visit. I called the food management staff to see if anyone else had reported getting sick and of course they said, " No". They sent someone up from security to fill out an incident report (they made my husband fill it out himself even though he could barely hold his head up). They brought him some bottled water and toast as their only gesture. That was the most they said they could do and didn't even offer provide a ride or cab to the Urgent clinic but suggested he go anyway. That was the last we heard from them. I believe it was improper handling of his salad since I had the soup rather than the salad and I didn't get sick. His steak looked cooked throughout & there was no pink in the middle. The only other thing he had eaten all day was in their food court (a Big Mac and two apple pies around 11:00 that morning). Being sick, the 4 hr. plane ride home wasn't very fun for him either. Overall, except for the food poisioning and tight slots, the hotel itself was very nice for the price we paid. Next time, however, I would like to try New York, New York (for the casino size and variety of food/entertainment) or stay closer to the middle of the strip in order to visit more places with less of walk (it was 103 degrees one day). If it wasn't for the food poisioning, I'd give the Monte Carlo a thumbs up just for the atmosphere. Two days later and my husband still can't eat without getting sick. Bittersweet vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at the Monte Carlo from May 25th to June 1st 2006. (Our first visit to Las Vegas) Check in was a breeze and we received our room immediately. We had a nice view of the mountains and some of the strip. The rooms were very clean and quiet, we had no problems with noise. We had a lot more space then we anticipated and the bed was very comfortable. There is a lot of construction in the area around the hotel but we only heard that a few times. The food at the Cafe was fantastic and we had great service, it was slow one day but the rest of the time we had no problems. We really liked the Pub, great food and beer, try the sliders with a nice ale. Everyone was friendly but housekeeping was a bit pushy at times to get us out so that they could clean the room. The casino was just the right size, with very little smoke. We had good luck at the slots and tables. The only complaint that I can really think of is that there were no safes or coffee in the room, but they have safe deposit boxes available, free of charge and they had pleanty of coffee places (Starbucks, McDonalds and Nathans) where you could get your morning coffee. We had a great time and will return to the MC on our next trip to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: waterski34
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd stay at Monte Carlo in a year on the 32nd floor conceige level. Weather- We arrived Sat. 5/27 to very windy and cool temp's in fact the pool was closed because of this (my wife wasn't happy)! Sunday and Monday of our stay the weather was great and good for hanging out at the pool (except we went out Mon. to find the lazy river drained). Service- Very good, except the Brew Pub is a joke when it comes to service. It doesn't seem to matter what time of day or how crowded it takes for ever to have a server come to your table. Monday night the Brew Pub was half full and it took longer to be waited on than Sat. night. Iwe complained to the manager both times and that's how we finally got service. We're not sure we'll go back to the Brew Pub again even though the food is great. Casino- Tightest I've seen it, we were mainly playing slots to work on points for the One Club player card and didn't hit much (also played a litte black jack, roulette and war) . What's kind of crazy is we hit better jackpots on penny & nickels than dollars and five dollar machines. My wife found the perfect machine ("Take Out" nickel near the One Club desk) and played it over three days, the first day she put $50 in and cashed out three hours later with $800! Since we were loosing mostly at Monte Carlo we visited Slots of Fun, Circus Circus, Excalibur and Mandilay Bay and found the most luck at Manday Bay (go figure). Entertainment- First night Brew Pub, second night Carnaval Court, third night Mama Mia. The highlight was Carnaval Court at Harrah's, got there before 8:00 before they charge cover and got a table near the stage. The drinks, bands, food and people watching were good to great (we'll be back). One thing to note about Mama Mia, we purchased the tickets online through Mandalay Bay and got 2nd row off to the side and when we arrived found they were first row (something about the fire marshall had the first row removed). So, it pays to go directly through Mandalay Bay and it probably helped that we went on a Monday evening. Any questions please ask.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive but you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: amilu
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo over Memorial Day Weekend. It was inexpensive for staying right on the strip and a great location. It is very small as far as casinos go, so it was easily accessible to get in and out. The first day we arrived, the pool was closed due to wind. Apparantly it was very windy in the morning. It wasn't windy in the afternoon but they never reopened it. We did lounge at the pool the next day. They have a kiddie pool, a lazy river, and a small wave pool. On Monday, Memorial Day, the lazy river was closed for maintenance. Who closes their pool on a holiday? We were very disappointed. Another disappointment was housekeeping. Our shampoo/soap wasn't replenished during our 3 night stay, nor did the hairball near the front door ever get swept up. For some reason, 2 empty glasses (not ours) also sat outside of our door the entire weekend. The hotel restaurants were average. The brewery beer and food were both delicious. The Cafe inside the hotel was an excellent value with pleasant servers. The Market Place cafe however was terrible...extrememly slow service and bland. The Starbucks was incompetent, making us wait for 20 minutes for a simple Americano. Stay at the hotel, but just know that the amenities aren't all they appear to be.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: tcaruanj
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Vegas from May 22nd to the 25th and we stayed at Monte Carlo. I'd definately recommend this hotel. It's very reasonably priced, clean and the rooms are nice (nice furniture, good size, good size bathroom). It's right on the strip at the south end. So you have a bit of a walk to some hotels like Mirage or Venice but you're close to NY NY, Luxor, MGM, Mandalay- all great hotels. What I liked about Monte Carlo is that it's not a huge hotel by Vegas standards, that means it's less busy, there was never a long wait at check in, the restaruants aren't too busy, etc. The pool area was busy but I can only imagine what it would be like at a bigger hotel. Also, this hotel isn't themed so if that's what your after then don't go to Monte Carlo. I didn't mind that it wasn't themed. I thought Monte Carlo was elegant and classy and that's why I really think it's good value. It's not the cheapest hotel on the strip (go to Imperial Palace if you want cheap) nor is it the most expensive. There weren't many children when I went which was a plus. I wouldn't expect that there ever would be many either since the hotel doesn't really have anything that caters to them. I would stay here again if I visit Vegas again. I liked the location, I liked the price, and I liked the hotel (clean and elegant). I wasn't crazy about the pool. that's my only negative comment. The lazy river was closed and the regular pool I thought was a little small but it's still nice and clean with palm trees around it and there's a waterfall when you come in (not in the pool). If you need internet access, go across the street. The business center is expensive. $1 per page to print and I can't recall how much for internet for 15 mins. The buffet resturant is good for breakfast. it's $10 per person but we didn't eat lunch after breakfast. They serve freshely made eggs, fruits, yougurt, your regular American style breakfast with sausage, etc. waffels, hashbrowns, pancakes and other goodies.

Reviews.Title: “Viva Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Redjazz68
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo is a beautiful hotel and casino located in the heart of the strip. We checked in very late on our arrival day so received 2 queen beds rather than a king bed. I rang to ask if we could move the next day and that was no problem. Around 2pm the folllowing day I went to get the new keys and asked if there was any possibility of a strip view room with a king bed. We were moved to a lower floor but with a fantastic view of the strip AT NO EXTRA CHARGE. I was rapt. Rooms were huge and the bed was SOOO comfortable. Bathroom was a good size with a bath/shower combo. Had breakfast at the buffet one morning which was very good. Dinner in the buffet one night was okay but we had better buffets at Rio and Paris on other nights. Visited a number of different casinos on the strip. Paris was a particular favorite with a ride to the top of the Eiffel Tower ... great views. Bellagio Fountains are a MUST see. We saw at least 6 different "shows", in the evening they are less than 15 minutes apart. We just did not have enough time to see all the free stuff let alone a paid show and we were there 6 days. It was REALLY hot, 98 most days so that made it tough. The Deuce bus is good during the day to get up and down the strip but it is HORRENDOUS at night. Walk, it is quicker and less frustrating. Shopping outlets centres are great, we spent a lot of time and money but got great value for money. Did a helicopter ride and landing in the Grand Canyon, if you can afford it, do it, I do not have the words to describe standing in the Grand Canyon looking up !!! Overall, loved Las Vegas. Would stay at Monte Carlo again, no hesitation but would like to try Paris next time.

Reviews.Title: “MC pretty OK by Me.”
Reviews.Author: Bubs404
Reviews.Content: The wife & I stayed at the MC May 15-19. Check-in was super-fast and easy (got to the hotel around 11:00 pm). Nice room that was clean & smoke free. Beds are really comfy. Tried to get a strip side room but no luck. The casino was great because of the lack of smoke & the nice fragrance. Slots were pretty tight , but overall won back my money & then some. Drink service was also very good. This place is very easy to navigate to food court, pool, brew pub, etc... The pool complex was better than I expected with the river pool & the fact that the pool bar served the MC brewery brand beer ($3.00 for high roller red, good deal). Never seemed over crowded & could always find a chair. I also noted that they had a liquor store on premises near the casino. Brew pub was great with good food & beer. As I have seen other posts about the noise in the rooms, yes this is a fact, but as long as you don’t have a keg’r going on in the next room it shouldn’t be a problem. All in all great deal & super location.

Reviews.Title: “rich at the micro pub ROCKS!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: vegaschicklet
Reviews.Content: Mico Brew - This was the first time my husband & I stayed at MC and we loved it. Last year when we went to the Micro Brew one bartender in particular.....Richie - allowed me to look in the pool area.....based on what I saw (the lazy river sold me...)we decided to stay there this year cuz of the lazy river and various pools.... Although the water in both the lazy river and pool was COLD and we didn't utilize either of them we still enjoyed our stay. The MC is BY FAR the CLEANEST SMELLING CASINO !!! and Rich at the Micro Brew is BY FAR the NICEST AND FRIENDLIEST SERVER AT THE BREWERY-IF HE ISN'T AT THE "TOP" OF EMPLOYEE'S .....HE SHOULD BE!!! and STEVE needs to "Lighten up" and crack a smile ONCE IN WHILE. Also, the pizza chef needs to wear gloves and stop TOUCHING HIMSELF while cooking! ew! OVERALL........WE LOVED OUR STAY......RICH: If you're reading this........YOU ROCK... Your fans from Milwaukee Wisconsin, Lynn and Bo. See you next year Rich. :)

Reviews.Title: “thumbs up”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights at Monte Carlo and would go back. Our rooms were clean, no problems, with an excellent view of the Strip. This was actually one of my favorite casinos on the Strip, perhaps because I won there and perhaps because the drink service was prompt. No problems at check-in or check-out. Someone else on here complained that they lost their promotions by the end of the stay; didn't happen to us. The Brew Pub is delicious. Also worth noting is the poolside bar. The pool area is a little small but has a great view, and the bar is excellent. The location is great, central enough that only Wynn felt like a real trek. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Right hotel for our needs”
Reviews.Author: impawster007
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the MC May 7th thru 11th. This was our 3rd trip to Vegas but our 1st stay at MC. We were very pleased with our choice. We are in our mid-twenties and it was pretty much everything we want in a hotel. CHECK-IN & ROOM: Check-in was fast with friendly staff. We upgraded our room to a Monaco Suite. I highly recommend this and it was fairly inexpensive to do (about $130 extra for our whole stay). The Monaco Suite allows you plenty of room to spread out, an extra bathroom, and a whirlpool tub. The bed was super comfy. The only complaint we had was that we could hear the couple in the room next to us. At times we could hear them talking and could hear their TV. We were willing to dismiss this minor annoyance but if you expect to not hear anything from the room next to yours- this might not be the right hotel for you. CASINO: The casino is nice and decently sized but it does not pay out that well. Except for one good run on the craps table we were not that lucky. If you are into slots I would definitely go somewhere else like the MGM, New York New York, or the Excalibur. All are within short walking distance and seem to pay out a lot more with their slot machines. The MC does offer free craps lessons which I highly suggest going to if you have the time. POOL: The pool area was nice but smaller than I expected. We were there during the week so the crowd wasn't bad at all but I can see how in the peak of tourist season it would be way over-crowded. RESTAURANTS: The Brewery provided great food, a fun atmosphere, and moderate pricing. The Cafe' was okay. It is nice that it is open 24 hrs and the food is good but the atmosphere is not that great. The Food Court was nice because it gave you the option of getting just a quick snack at low prices. OVERALL: We enjoyed the MC and would probably stay there again. It seems family oriented which is more our style than the party scene. So, if you are looking for the party/night club scene this is probably not the hotel for you. The location was one of the best parts because it's practically in the middle of the strip and close to a monorail entrace (MGM). There is also a CVS right next to the MC so you can go stock up on snacks, pop, bottled water, or anything else that you may need for your trip at a decent price.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Wifey43
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo from 7th May to 12th May. We loved it. We had a great room on the 22nd floor, which faced the Strip. All the staff were really friendly and professional - despite some of the other reviews, we had no problems with anyone. We liked the calm atmosphere, without the madcap gimmicks of some of the other hotels that we visited. Sure, they were fun to visit - but we wouldn't have wanted to stay in any of them! We'd highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: nicki_121
Reviews.Content: monte carlo was a beautiful clean hotel and in the ideal positon to see all the sights it was lovely to check in with a huge lobby area and not in the middle of slot machines and the hotel did not attract the hordes of people like some of the busier hotels enjoyed the wave pool and lazy river the only disappointment was that the rooms were quite small and basic but the ease of being able to see your children ahead of you was brilliant as every other hotel we had to grip their hands as there were so many people

Reviews.Title: “Nice Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: skyset42
Reviews.Content: May 8 - 11 Second trip to Vegas, first time stayed at Bellagio. We weren't sure what to expect because the Monte Carlo was one of the few resorts we did not explore on our first trip. We chose Monte Carlo because of other people’s reviews, I wanted something maybe a little quieter the then Bellagio and he wanted something easier on the wallet. Check In was a little slow; we booked our trip online and prepaid for 3 nights. Upon check-in we were told that they only had us for 2 nights and that we would have to call and straighten the situation out. We asked for an upgrade to a suite with a view of the Bellagio Fountains and the strip. We were told that that could be accommodated and we proceeded to our room. The Check in clerk gave use a number to call and try to fix the reservation problem. Our room was on the 26th floor and when we opened the door I was automatically disappointed. No suite, just a small standard room, and yes, it looked out over the strip to the MGM and NYNY with a lovely view of the roof (ugly). No Bellagio, No fountains. We are not the type to make a fuse so we just dealt with it and proceeded to call the number given to us. We were on hold for 38 minutes, when we finally got through we were told we had the wrong number. I made a long distant call home to get a number of the travel agent and phoned them.......along story short our reservation was correct. It was entered wrong on the Monte Carlo end.....should they not have handled this for us? I also phoned the front desk after this to ask if we could get moved to a suite and was told that we would have to Waite till the next morning. After we got everything settled we were determined to not let our room or a mix up ruin our holidays. So we just forgot about the upgrade and decided to stay in our standard room. THE POOL I found the pool area to be a little small. There are 3 pools 1. Lazy River 2. Wave pool 3. Regular pool. There were always chairs we never had a problem getting on even at 1 in the afternoon. Lots of sun and shade options. FOOD We ate at Andre’s, which was amazing, you should try it. We also enjoyed the Brew Pub and the Cafe. It was nice to have dining options at reasonable prices. We were very happy with the options and the service we received here. GAMBELING Not huge gamblers, but lost a bit, did not win anything and never saw anyone win anything. Maybe kind of tight? We ended up enjoying our stay at Monte Carlo, not sure if we would rush back...lots of other places I would like to try first. We went back to the Bellagio and sat at Fontana’s and watched the fountains one night. Bellagio is just such a beautiful resort. Sometimes spending the extra is well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice - But not amazing”
Reviews.Author: stu.bec
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for one night. It was a Friday and booked at the last minute cost about $250. Cant really complain about it, the view from the room was amazing and the casino and food bars were all there. But this is a Vegas hotel, you have to understand that in Vegas your arent people you are walking dollar bills. The service was really non existent but you have to expect it for $250 PN. Deffinitley worth a stay and one of the better value hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Run of the Mill as far as Vegas Goes”
Reviews.Author: FamOnTheGO-4
Reviews.Content: Fairly plain Jane for Vegas standards. There is nothing really special about this hotel, the casino is average, the rooms very average and clean, the eating areas are the same. It is true the rooms are noisy, you can hear into the hallway when sleeping, the beds were comfy though. If you are looking for action of Vegas this is not the place for you, if you are looking for simple and "Plain Jane" then this is for you........On a positive note, the parking to check in to room elevators are near one another.... If you want hooting and hollering and want to party stay some where else......

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: greenturtle2
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo is a nice hotel on the end of the strip. The rooms are nice, soft beds and a big bathroom. Prices are reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Monte Carlo for three nights in the beginning of May 2006. I have to say that this hotel was great to us--full of nice little details and a friendly efficient staff. When we checked in we mentioned that it was our first anniversary and we were offered an upgrade to a suite for $30 more a night. We took the upgrade and were thrilled--the suite was larger than some of the apartments I have lived in with marble everywhere and beautiful ammenities. Additionally we were given free breakfast buffet and spa coupons, which we also used and were pleased with. We ate one night at the Monte Carlo Caffe--their Italian restuarant. Not the best Italian food I have ever had, but very good and great service. Not too expensive. The breakfast buffet was delicious (I don't know WHAT that other reviewer was talking about--it was great). The pool is very crowded, and there definitely are a large number of kids and a small number of cocktail waitresses, but I wasn't terribly upset about either. It does close at 6pm though and I couldn't figure out why. regardless, even with the upgrade we paid $129/night for what was a great room with exceptional service. I would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo, great value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I took my 2 daughters aged 17 and 20 to Las Vegas in November 2005. The Monte Carlo was our choice despite some reviews being less than wonderful. We found it to be excellent value - the rooms were clean, well appointed, nicely furnished and quiet. The complimentary toiletries were of a much higher standard than usual and the beds were very comfortable. Reception staff were all very friendly and helpful and the hotel is well situated for shopping. It was very nice to be able to get to your rooom without having to walk past all the poker machines etc and the hotel had a pleasant smell and atmosphere. We were very pleased with the service we received and with the hotel itself. If you want somewhere clean and comfortable without paying a fortune, try the Monte Carlo - we are glad we did and would certainly use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Dingy and unpleasant”
Reviews.Author: sunnygirl21
Reviews.Content: After having a great stay at Caesars, we could not afford to stay over the weekend as it reached $600 for a room at Caesars so we booked into the Monte Carlo based on the Tripadvisor reviews. The rooms over the weekend were priced at $300 per night. Based on the price drop we knew it would not be like Caesars but when we got there, the room was dark, dingy, and small. Room service was more expensive that Caesars so we did not order any food. The pool was the worse part; this closed at 6.00pm and was so overcrowded and small. While we stayed here, we visited NYNY and I wish we chose to stay there. The café in the Monte Carlo was terrible the salad dish I ordered was mouldy and the service was not that good. I would not stay here again – you have been warned.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings About Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If the service and accomodations were half as good as the hotel looks from the outside, I would have loved it. First, the good stuff: The beds were very comfortable. The rooms were fine. The lobby and casino look great. Rooms look good we had a nice view on the 26th floor (other than AC units and construction). No complaints with the rooms, except that there was no coffee maker in the room. I have stayed at $49 motels that provide coffee makers. They charge for internet service, which didn't work until they sent an engineer up to reset something. Overall the service was tolerable. Nothing terrible happened, but definitely not high-class service. While at the pool, we were ignored a couple of times by the cocktail waitress and when we flagged another staff member and asked her to send someone over she acted like we asked her to eat a live poisonous snake...finally after treating us like we were peasants, she agreed to send someone. 20 minutes later, when no one showed, we got up and walked over to the outside bar...it was out of everything but beer. Pool closes at 6pm. I guess since they don't make any money from you sitting by the pool, they want you inside buying $10 drinks in the lounge or gambling in the tightest machines ever. My girlfriend and I have played poker slots and Wheel of Fortune at Reno and Tahoe quite a bit. We usually end up almost even...sometimes up a bit, sometimes down a bit. Not so at the Monte Carlo. We were dumb enough to hope for a change of luck over the weekend, and did nothing but lose. I asked several other gamblers how they were doing...all pretty much the same as us. I am sure the table games are about the same at other casinos, but the slots at the Monte Carlo were money pits. The food was very hit and miss. Stay far away from the buffet, we got there just before they were switching from breakfast to lunch fare, so got to try both. We were very disappointed. Nothing but the made to order omelette was better than edible (barely), and I am not a very picky eater. On the other hand, we enjoyed an incredible meal at the Steakhouse (2 ppl $180). The food at the Steakhouse was much better than average. If your looking for a less expensive meal, try the Cafe. The food was much better in the Cafe than the buffet. Overall, it wasn't terrible, but would not recommend it to anyone expecting to be in a 4 star hotel and be pampered. If you're just looking for a comfortable place to stay in a good location and you are not too picky about great service, you'll be satisfied...especially if you get a discounted rate. I would have been steaming had we paid their regular rate.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ladyjane12
Reviews.Content: Unlike some people who have stayed at this hotel, I thought it was quite good. The location of the hotel is brilliant, it is right in the middle of the strip with NewYork NewYork and the Bellagio either side and the MGM Grand opposite. It is a great base for exploring the strip as you are close to the monorail at the MGM which takes you all the way up the strip to the Sahara and stops at all the hotels along the way. The hotel itself is nothing spectacular but definately not bad. Check in is quick (we requested a strip view and got one no problem) The rooms are a good size and they are cleaned daily. Our room was next to the lifts but I didn't once get woken up by any noise. The casino is nice, the staff are friendly and it seems cleaner then most of the strip casinos (it's not smokey at all and thats probably the difference). The pool is packed. You need to be up early to get a seat but the pools themselves are nice.The wave pool and lazy river get sun all day but the tropical pool is shaded almost all day long. All in all I liked the hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful-smelled great!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: OK, I was a little worried after reading other posts before staying at the Monte Carlo...They must be a bunch of fuss pots! Stayed Monday Thru Friday and it was a very pleasent experience! I loved as you enter-the scent was not of smoke or old funk! My room was clean and very comfortable. It wasn't so crowded that it was annoying to manuver thru the casino. The Cafe had great Food and The Steak House was very good too! Overall, I think it was excellent and my point of comparison was staying at the Venitian! So go and save $$!!

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the Monte Carlo (April '06). This is the second time we've stayed there. The hotel itself is very nice, check in went quickly, the staff was very friendly, the rooms are comfortable, the rates were very good, the casino has just about everything you need and there are some very good restaurants there. The food court could use a few more varieties but it is still ok for a quick bite. Overall, I have to rate the Monte Carlo as above average for the price we paid and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Worked for us!”
Reviews.Author: Yanks1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Monte Carlo from April 9 - April 14. We checked in early (around 12 noon) and requested a non-smoking, high floor room. The desk clerk checked for us, offered an upgrade for $20 a night, but with no pressure. We declined the upgrade and our requested room became available almost immediately. I feel badly for the other folks who had dirty rooms, but ours was a pleasure. It was on the 31st floor, was clean when we checked in, and was cleaned every day - done by the time we got back from breakfast. The room and floor was one of the quietest we had ever stayed in. The breakfast buffet was no big deal, for $2.00 more per person we walked over to Paris for breakfast where they make crepes to order - heaven! The pool area was crowded even though the weather was cool - all of Vegas was extremely crowded because it was Holy Week and lots of kids were off from school. We liked the location of the hotel - could walk to Mandalay as well as Bellagio in the other direction. We've been to Vegas many times and this was our first time at the Monte Carlo. One of the store clerks told us that since MGM took them over, they've gotten very cheap with the employees as well as the amenities for the guests. Fortunately, we were not affected by anything negative and as a result, we would definitely stay there again. Also, we had booked back in December and got a great deal for airfare and room.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We took our three kids over Easter break for a last minute getaway. I chose this hotel because of the wave pool and lazy river aspect. From the moment we arrived it was complete disappointment. First of all, I booked two adjoining non smoking room - was told upon check in that the only adjoining rooms available were smoking - yuck - now I had to decide on a non smoking non attached room to stick my 3 kids in. Not a comfortable decision right off the top. There were dirty room service dishes outside our door, which stayed their with rotten food decaying...for 3 days...again yuck..how hard would it be for housekeeping to pick these up???? Leads me to wonder about the cleanliness of my rooms, in which a golf tee was under the desk when we arrived, and stayed there for the entire stay...not too much vacuuming expertise there! The casino sucked....absolutely no play on the slots they just sucked your money in. I will never step foot in that casino again. Way better slots and fun at NYNY, Excalibur, Circus Circus, even slots of fun. Pool was ice cold, so kids didn't spend more than 5 minutes in it. All in all it was my worst experience in a so called middle to more upscale hotel. Oh ya....i booked on a spring special in which i was to receive coupons for two for one offers...they were not given to me on check in -- I had to go down and ask for them -- very cheesy and cheap...I would never recommend this place to anyone and will steer clear of it in the future

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo - Just Average”
Reviews.Author: MissGov
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Monte Carlo for two nights over the Easter weekend. Accommodations were just average. The beds were nothing great and in need of new coverings. Walls were very thin and there was no coffeemaker which was a bummer since we had to go from the 3oth floor down to the main floor just to find coffee. One would think that for the price, there would be in-room coffee. The casino slots were very cold - not many people were winning at all. Most of us love to hear the bells and whistles of winners at least every now and then! Views were not spectacular and this hotel lacks a theme like so many of the others. We ate dinner at the Main Street Cafe - good food - long wait for it to arrive! Champagne brunch was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “loved the place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: just come back from a a trip around america & the monte carlo was by far the nicest hotel we stayed. Check in was a breeze only took 5 mins, we got upgraded. The room was very nice & very clean, no fridge was a bit of a bummer but there is an ice machine & a drink machine on each floor if you want to have a drink in your room.the casino was great not to crowded which is the way i like it, had a free craps lesson one morning, then went on to have a little bit of a win on the craps table, drinks service was excellent & all of the dealers were very helpfull. The monte carlo is in a great location & I would definatley stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas Sold Out!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hit Vegas on the worse week ever I think! There were 2 conventions going on in the week commencing 3rd April. Coudn;t find a room in all of Vegas for the first few days. Ended up staying in Boulder. A couple of days later, we managed to get into the Monte Carlo but they charged the earth - all Vegas hotels had put rates sky high due to to it being a busy week. Ended up being just over 1000USD for 4 nights where as the week after was so much less than this! Standard room was ok but room didn;t get cleaned one day and had to phone up for new towels (which came quite quick). Lazy river was fun but wave pool very small. Pool area was really busy and had to complain on one day as couldn;t get a bed anywhere apart from inside a tennis court area surrounded by rubbish! Upon complaining, the staff put in a couple of beds for us near the pool. All of Vegas too busy on this particular week and I suggest to check if anything is happening in Vegas before yoy go. Its also worth booking a hotel on the net before you go as I think you'll get better rates.

Reviews.Title: “People don't know what they talk about.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have an unusual insight into this hotel because my cousin is the Head Manager over the Hotel aspects. Not only was the service at the Brew Pub, the restaraunt/bar, fast and professional, but it was efficiant. My party of 8 was there during the NCAA tournaments with a full bar and they handled the situation very well. Also the pricing is very reasonable. For instance, a 10oz. steak is only about $12 dallors and most burgers are around $6. Also there were repairs beind done, but not on the pool, just around the pool. The Monte Carlo was installing more gazeboes around the pool for parties. Overall, the Monte Carlo is not as 'flashy' as the Mirage or Ceasar's, and the casino is not as big, but the staff is professional and location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Like the Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: SDSpartan
Reviews.Content: Have stayed numerous times at the Monte Carlo and enjoy it. The hotel is on the smaller side and I find that it is usually less crowded than other resorts. The casino is nice and you can find your way around without too much trouble. The casino had some $5 black jack tables on the Saturday night we were there (nice to find in Vegas). The Blackstone restaurant was great - had some of the best Chilean Seabass I've ever had. The service was good but not great. Reservations are recommended. The service is very good. Check in/out a breeze. Not a long walk from the hotel desk to the elevator lobby to get to your room. Downsides: the standard rooms are ok. The bathroom is on the smallish side with no seperate shower. Pales in comparison to some of the more luxury hotels (i.e. Venetian, Wynn). The bed was comfy and the linens nice. The room seems pretty standard. Nothing to give you a "wow" factor. So if you are looking for that - I'd advise look elsewhere or upgrade to the suites. The food court is undergoing some construction - there should be a Starbucks there soon. Will be a nice addition. The brew pub (forget name) is fun. The pool area is nice and includes a wave pool. The location is great - right on the strip - next to NYNY Casino. Downside - there is construction beginning next door. The former Boardwalk hotel/casino will be torn down (or maybe down now) and they are building next door - so maybe some noise/view issues are some time. Might want to request a room on the opposite side (side towards the NYNY casino and not looking towards the center of the strip). Overall, we'll definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it but hotel has THIN WALLS!!”
Reviews.Author: meow772122
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Monte Carlo for 7 days and 6 nights. We were given the choice of a handicap room that was available right then and there or wait for a room "that is guaranteed from 2-5pm" instead of waiting we decided to take the handicap room, even though neither of us is handicap. The room was on the 16th floor facing the Paris Hotel, parking lot, and construction site. We could see the pool below too. Not a bad view, could've been better though. The room was clean, neat and decent sized. The water pressure in the shower was low but showering was still fine. The handicap rooms have showers that do not have bathtubs (which I liked) and the shower head is detachable (which I like too).The square bar of soap has some exfoliating pieces inside of it and it hurts your skin when you use it!! That sucked, we had to go next door to CVS and buy bath soap! The hotel has thin walls, most days we could clearly hear water running from showers, people talking,and toilets flushing. Sometimes it would sound as if it was coming directly from our room. This is one big complaint but really our only one. The bed was nice and comfy, slept well. We ate at the Market City Caffe, the service was good, and the food typical run of the mill Italian food. Basically like Bertucci's or Olive Garden quality. The Brew Pub was excellent!!! Good beer from their brewery, good atmosphere, and it's located right in the hotel so you don't have to trek out onto the strip for a good time! Would love to go back there. I'd have to say that the slots were pretty cold here, had much better luck at other casinos. Overall, I'd recommend Monte Carlo to others and I'd even go back there. It's in good vicinity to lots of places on the strip, we walked to most places without a problem. And like I said before, CVS is right next door and Walgreens across the street in case you need some snacks or whatever!

Reviews.Title: “OK, not great hotel”
Reviews.Author: aerofl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Monte Carlo with my elderly parents (mid-80's) and brother and sister-in-law for three nights mid-week in March. On previous trips I have stayed at the Mirage, Bally's, Venetian and Bellagio. My brother suggested Monte Carlo for this trip as it might be a little more low key and suited to my parents' needs. Check in was very fast and friendly. My room rate, which changed each night, ranged from $169 to $199 a night. My parents had a vacation package deal through Continental Airlines and payed considerably less. The room was on the modest side for Las Vegas. It had all the usual hotel amentities and furnishings. The decor wasn't special. Two comments from my parents stood out for me - my mother missed the ability to make coffee in the room and they found the bathroom to be very treacherous. As for the coffee, I reminded her that the hotels don't want you relaxing in your room, they want you in their retaurants or in the casino, spending your money. The bathroom was a problem for me as well - no anti-slip mat or appliques in the tub and no bars to grip in the shower. It had never occurred to us to ask for a handicap room, but I know we will in the future when traveling with my parents. I often rode the elevator to my room on the 21st floor alone and seldom saw anyone in the corridors. Almost no noise at all the entire time of our stay. Housekeeping was excellent - I would often leave my room by 7:30 am and return by 9:00 am to find the room refreshed and restocked down to new bars of soap each day. As walking is difficult for my parents, we spent a great deal of time in the hotel and casino. I actually liked how low key the casino was. Granted we were there mid-week, but the casino at times seemed almost empty (two days later and we would have been smack dab in the middle of the NASCAR crowd, so that weekend might have been very different). Also, the entire hotel seemed to be relatively smoke free. We ate breakfast each morning at the food court - OK, not great choices (Nathan's, McDonalds, etc.) My parents ate dinner in the hotel's "cafe" 24 hour restaurant and quite enjoyed it. There are also several upscale restaurants that we didn't have a chance to visit. For extras, such as snacks and bottled water, we walked next door to the CVS (very convenient) or across the street to Walgreens. The employees at the concierge desk were kind of hit or miss. Not much help in getting show tickets - actually no help at all and we acquired them on our own. For other requests, such as monorail schedule and Strip map, they were very accomodating and friendly. There did seem to be some sort of construction going on at the pool and we didn't see anyone in the area using the facilities. I wasn't bowled over by the Monte Carlo and probably wouldn't stay there by my own choice. It was nice enough, but I would probably head to some of the other more glitzy hotels for a true Las Vegas experience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot for our group”
Reviews.Author: dusty910
Reviews.Content: We found the Monte Carlo to be an oasis in the midst of the chaos. The hotel was very clean, the staff very friendly and drink service was excellent in the casino. The beds, as others have stated, were wonderful. We requested a small frig for my husband's medication and it arrived within 5 minutes. Our group included 2 ladies in their 70s who appreciated the relatively small size of the hotel and found it easy to navigate. The only complaint: the marble floors in the bathroom are very slippery when wet, not a good idea for seniors and there are no grab bars in the tub. Perhaps we should have requested a handicapped room. We enjoyed the cafe for breakfast and the brew pub was very good - my husband really loved the stout. We're already planning our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Go Somewhere Else”
Reviews.Author: jplitch
Reviews.Content: We treated four of our relatives to three nights at the Monte Carlo in January. We picked the Monte Carlo because their website advertised a heated pool. I need a pool daily for theraputic purposes and one of my guest does not spend a lot of time in the casino. When we arrived we were told the pool would not be open due to maintenance, but we could walk to the New York or Bellagio and use their pools. A bit chilly for a walk in our bathing suits. We asked to see the manager and he refused to talk to us and sent out a representative who had no customer service savy. (now their website says the pool is seasonal) I would guess they didn't want to spend the money to heat it up since no maintenance was being done the whole time we were there and the pool was crystal clear. Rooms are OK, nothing special. Our view was horrible. Casino slots very cold. Amenities non existent. No coffee pots in rooms. Very long lines at the food court and buffet. Restaurants very pricey. We made reservations at one of their gourmet restaurants and when we confirmed them on arrival they didn't have us listed. I suggest spending a few more dollars and staying at one of the nicer hotels and casino. We left a day early and checked in elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room”
Reviews.Author: freezincold
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 4 days at the Monte Carlo. When we first checked in we upgraded ($50 extra) to the Monaco Suite. Very nice room with 1 1/2 bath. Main bath has a jetted tub. King bed with couch, 2 wing chairs and table with four chairs. View was ok (14th floor), looked out toward the MGM but directly down below was a roof top with air conditioning vents. After 2 days we asked for a room on the conceirege level (32nd floor). Bed was VERY comfortable. Room was smaller but still very nice. View was SPLENDID!! We overlooked the strip toward Paris and could see the fountains at Belligo at night. An added feature to this floor is the pastries and fruit in the AM, sandwiches in the afternoon, water and pop available throughout the day and little finger food and drinks from 4-8pm. The cost to us was only $35 per day for this upgrade. Well worth it to us. We had no issues with noise. We only ate at the Brew Pub at the casino, best nachos ever!! We never won at the casino, but then again we never won anywhere else either. It was unseasonably cool also so we never used the pool but it did look very nice. The temps were only 48-68 the whole time. Workers were all very friendly, check-in and check-out was a breeze. Very nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel & casino are ok, avoid the restaurants!”
Reviews.Author: cheetah600
Reviews.Content: My hotel room was ok, nothing special at all for Vegas. The casino was about like anything else in Vegas. The restaurants had decent food, but took sooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooo long! When I complained (after my third meal that that took too long) their restaurant manager laughed as he told me, "Yes, we know we have a problem, but good help is hard to find!"

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: aimster18
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo for 4 nights during Spring Break. Hotel has a great location on the Strip. Check-in was fast and efficient. The room was clean and the bed comfortable. Our first night there we had an adjoining room and the neighbours were very noisy. Hotel staff quickly moved us to another non-adjoining room when we complained the next morning. No major complaints but no major compliments either. It was an average room.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the monte carlo for 5 days. It was a very clean hotel. It was easy to find your way around and we really ebjoyed the casino. The breakfeast buffet was o.k. value. Well located on the strip. Only dissapointment was having to pay extra for the privellage of using the spa $22 per person. A bit of an exspensive sauna i think!!!!! Rooms were o.k but again no tea/coffee making facilities!!! We never heard about any food credits or 2 for 1 buffets!! Vegas is good but honestly 3 days is enough. Would stay in monte carlo again cos its alot more relaxed than alot of the other hotels on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo is a good value and enjoyable.”
Reviews.Author: SLWilliams
Reviews.Content: We were in LV for a convention and stayed at The Monte Carlo because of the great rates and location on the strip. The rooms were nice, the beds were very comfortable with pillow tops, the shower had little water preasure (I don't come to Vegas for a great shower!), and the hotel was quiet. We could hear some running water from other rooms, but it was still very quiet. The staff was friendly, the casino wasn't too smokey, and the restaurants were good (but slow). They also had a food court with a bagel/coffee shop that we enjoyed very much. The resort is small compared others on the strip and the shopping is minimal. If you are looking for a lot of night life and action, there are other louder and younger locations. Monte Carlo is mello which was what we were looking for since we are middle aged and had our children and my parents with us. We didn't see any big wins in the casino. We all lost our slot money fast! The tram to Bellagio wasn't working but it was easy to get a cab. We saw the Lance Burton Magic Show. The kids liked it but it was over priced and we should have gone to another hotel for a main attraction show. The best thing is the room prices, the location, and that it is very comfortable. We will stay there again next year if we can get the same great deals!

Reviews.Title: “mediocre”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: No coffee pot! When I called the front desk they will not provide one either. For those late nights out this is a deal killer totally. The rooms were average, the mattresses were great and the room was quiet. The bathroom was a one sink, shallow tub economy mode and the buffet was extremely limited. The saving grace was the food court at the elevator base that would allow quick coffee and bagels in the morning. There are so many hotels that have it all together for this price, why stay here?

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to rave about”
Reviews.Author: 3weeks
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Monte Carlo March 10-12. Crammed 5 ladies (average age 30) into a room on the 27th floor. True purpose of trip was to spend time with close girlfriends from college so trip was fun regardless of the mediocre hotel. Weather was horrible, cold and windy, so that put a slight damper on the trip. No fruity drinks by the pool for us. I have traveled to Vegas MANY times. I would compare my stay at this hotel to recent stays at Paris, NY/NY, or the Mirage. If you want luxury, service, upscale shopping, hip clubs/bars and restaurants, and a beautiful atmosphere, stay at Mandaly Bay, Wynn, Bellagio, or the Venetian. If you just want a place to sleep the Monte Carlo is adequate. Ate at the Brew Pub and the Cafe. Food was very good and the service was prompt. On the plus side: The FOOD COURT! Its really nice to just be able to grab pizza or a hamburger and take it back to your room and not wait in huge lines at the restaurants. Its also really easy to get to from the elevators. Also, as others have mentioned, you can walk right out the door to CVS pharmacy and stock up on the Vegas essentials like water, Gatorade, and snacks. Beds were comfortable. Did not notice much noise from the other rooms. On the down side: Rooms are AVERAGE and non-descript. Casino area is showing wear and is so SMOKY. Noticed several areas on the carpet that were repaired with tape. First thing I noticed when I got to my corridor was the distinct odor of POT being smoked in one of the rooms in the hall. This went on for most of the stay. Not the hotel's fault, just an observation. I hope this review was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I stayed at the Monte Carlo in May for our 5 day trip. I would definitely recommend this hotel if you want to stay on the Strip. It's definitely not as elaborate or glamorous as the othe hotels on the strip, but its clean, the rooms are comfortable and a good size. The casino was lots of fun, but definitely not as big as the other hotels. Definitely bypass the food court for your meals, not a very good selection and its very expensive, but the buffet was an excellent choice for dinner. Loads of options and the deserts were absolutely delicious, as was the strifry made to order! You can sit and eat as long as you like (which is what we did when we had to be out of our rooms by 11am and our flight wasnt till midnight, sat in the buffet for 3 hours and no one gave us a hard time!!) Also the restaurant next to the buffet was wonderful. Go there for the best breakfast in the hotel. The french toast was delicious! Right in the middle of the action, it was great to have the train running between the Monte Carlo and the surrounding hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Nice People”
Reviews.Author: hakechrr
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Monte Carlo for 3 nights in early March. The hotel itself is very nice. It does not have a "theme" such as pirates, but it is very well decorated none the less. The staff is pretty friendly and all the dealers were able to ask any questions I had. The one thing I did not like were the size of the shower. I am an average sized man and think it is a little cramped. I also thought the shower head needed a little updating. The beds were very comfortable as many people have stayed before. Over all the value is second to none. I would like to return in the summer when the pool is open as I hear it is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “For the price, very dissappointing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went to a convention and was able to get a room at the Monte Carlo. Superficially looked good. Room was smelly and looked worn out. No coffee maker. I tried to get assistance at the front desk and was on hold for 1/2 hour and gave up. They nickle and dimed me for picking up the phone. $1=$2 for everytime I used the phone. Never gave rates on the services that they offered and did not provide a guide to the weeks events around the strip. It was a very expensive trip for not liking it. If I had a coupon for a $50 a night, I wouldn't have been so critical.

Reviews.Title: “quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: vegasat26
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Monte Carlo for three nights in late January 2006 and found it to be a quiet, clean hotel. The rooms are spacious for big city hotels. The decor (see pics) was understated elegance in the $120/price range. Marble floors in bathrooms and nice lotions, soaps. The floor we were on was pin cushion quiet. I didn't see or hear more than 5 other parties the whole time. Be sure and try the Cafe and buffet. The pancakes were incredible. Isn't it funny how many ways restaurants can kill a simple food like pancakes. Monte Carlo's pancakes were fluffy, lightly browned, and big(2 is plenty). the casino is less smoky than most which is refreshing. Oh, during our stay the pool was closed for the rebuilding of the tram. So we got our choice of either the MGM or Bellagio pool privileges for free!! The Bellagio was breathtakingly bueatiful! The pool was also the longest pool I have ever swam in.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with Potential But Poorly Managed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel has great possibilities but it was dirty inside and out. The outside steps were unkept, there was no flowers in the containers. The pool was not open, the tram wasn't operating, there was no where to sit inside or outside of the hotel. Front desk clerks were rude and gave out wrong information just to make you go away. The price for each night range from $79-$279. Ridiculous!!!! I wouldn't stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo high priced below average food in cafe and buffet”
Reviews.Content: The buffet and cafe at the Monte Carlo was very disappointing. The price for the buffet was a bit high w/ an okay selection but quality and taste low. The cafe for dinner was very high priced and again the quality was low. Big let down for the ticket price.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Service is excellent. It is more a hotel with casino than a casino with a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo = Super 8”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I go to Vegas about 4-5 times a year. I usually stay at the Luxor but I got a good deal to stay at the Monte Carlo and boy was I surprised. This is a four star hotel?
