Check in is complete chaos. You just stand around like cattle as people cut in front of you and the two people they have working the counter walk around between checking people in. They gave me a room that was not even ready. They corrected the problem. The room was ok but if you are the type of person that likes to hear their neighbor shower and use the toilet then I would highly recommend this hotel. I was awoken daily by the sound of pipes hissing and whistling. The kicker was checking out. The deal I had gave me $25 in food credit which I used and they took off my bill. When I got home from my vacation I checked my comp dollars to see what I had earned and somehow $25 was gone. I called them and they told me they have the right to change the deal at any time so they, without my permission, used my comp dollars to pay for my $25 comp dollars. I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service! Good experience. Jan28-31”
Reviews.Author: makua
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo 1/28-1/31 for my 50th birthday: Check-in: We arrived to the hotel at 930am on Saturday and waited less than 5 minutes. I tried to get an upgrade, it was unavailable but they did honor my request for a strip view on a high floor. The room was not ready until 3pm (as advertised) but we were able to check in everything with the bellman and enjoy our first day. Room: The view was good, the room was pretty standard but very clean and acceptable. The bed was a very comfortable "pillow-top" type (similar to the new Marriott mattresses). Yes, we could hear the "whoosh" of the toilets being flushed in other rooms but not a big deal. Restaurants: Pub Brewery: Good beer and pub food Buffet: The breakfast buffet was just okay, doesn't compare well with others such as Paris The 24 hour Cafe- decent late night fare (sandwiches, etc.) Casino: We are wimps at gambling and only used the low-end slot machines. We also did the same at 5 other casinos on the strip this trip. We enjoyed the Mone Carlo because it was quieter, kind of like "coming home", cleaner air- we never felt impacted by smoke. This was one of the biggest reasons we spent the last part of each night at the MC. Service: We had top notch customer service everywhere we went in the Monte Carlo. Even though we were cheapos with the slots we still had timely bar service. It was also very handy to have the CVS and Walgreens right outside. It is very pleasant to come home here every night after going to other places each night. Location: The tram to the Bellagio is now closed. I believe this is due to the Boardwalk next door being closed and the construction/destruction going on, but not really sure. Hope this helps. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: drivr8
Reviews.Content: First time staying at the Monte Carlo. I've stayed about half of the hotels on The Strip at this point, and this would have to be near the bottom. Good points: Easy access to The Strip. Elevators close to Casino. Not so Good points: OK rooms, nothing special. If someone above you or around you uses the water, you'll know about it. Buffet not that great, more expensive than the one at Aladdin, which is far better. Quiet casino. Close to NY/NY / MGM end of strip. However, you have to walk a bit in the other direction (past construction and a shut-down Boardwalk) to get to the next hotel, The Bellagio. Bad points: Moderately to high priced for medium-level rooms and amenities. Dead casino. Very little "nightlife" in hotel. Must go elsewhere to go to the action.

Reviews.Title: “Never disappointed”
Reviews.Author: LasVegasChuck
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the MC on the weekend of 20-23 Jan. I've stayed there many times before and have never been disappointed. The staff is always helpful and friendly. This time I got the best room I've ever had there. Not quite a Mandalay Bay room, but not far from it. The attraction of the MC is the price/what you get ratio. You can always spend more at other hotels and get more lavishness if you want. But before you do that, think about how much time you're planning to hang around the hotel and how much of the day you'll be out doing stuff. The spa is not spectacular, but nice and relaxing. An adequate exercise room. Smallish locker room and hot tub, but I always get my favorite seat in the tub! I rarely eat at the hotel, but when I have it's been a pleasant experience. All in all an affordable place to stay in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Declined in a year”
Reviews.Author: lashley
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo about a year ago, my first time, my husbands second. We loved the hotel, smaller, not crowded, really efficeint staff and friendly, not to mention the great rate. So along with another couple we booked the Monte Carlo for our annual trip with them; I can't say that anything was horriable, just not the same. The rooms are looking alittle tired, staff not as friendly, a bit more crowded. Alittle emabrassing to us because we had spoke highly of the place. We thought we had found our "regular" spot, but I don't think we will stay here again, unless it's the only thing avaiable.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We visited the Monte Carlo December 30th through January 5th. The casino area is very nice, and it is within walking distance to all the strip's other large hotel/casinos. However, the rooms are definetely "used". This is probably due to the fact that the rooms see so many guests. The room was clean and the decor was nice enough but you could tell that it was worn down from many uses. I had visited this same hotel in October of 2002, and had an excellent experience then. The bed was great and the rooms were beautiful. This time I was not as impressed and will probably stay at another hotel when I visit again.

Reviews.Title: “A BIG place”
Reviews.Author: Loving_Holidays
Reviews.Content: This was a nice clean hotel, but get your comfortable walking shoes on, because it is a long walk from the front of the hotel through the casino, up in the lifts and then a long walk down one of the corridors to your room.. at least a 10 minute walk ! But I liked this hotel. The staff are courteous and the rooms are roomy with lots of pillows and cushions on the bed! The Japanese/Chinese restaurant in this hotel is distinctly average! Take a walk to Fatburgers across the road.. they serve a good burger ! The hotel is in a good location, pay $5 a day for unlimited rides on the Deuce bus that goes up and down the strip, it will save your legs. I highly recommend the OPM nightclub in Caesars' Palace on a Saturday night, if your budget stretches to the bottle VIP service you can do it in style.. You can pick up free tickets on the strip for this nightclub

Reviews.Title: “Loved Monte!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: 3 Night stay at the Monte, Jan 19-21. Service was good, hotel was clean, staff was friendly and accomodating. The food court was so very convenient! The restaraunts were a bit pricy, I opted mainly for the food court, very decent prices and good food, nice variety as well. Casino was fun. Later in the evening the casino gets a bit busy, but found it to be a nice experience. Very decent prices at this location compared to the other giants.

Reviews.Title: “Ladies Night”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Decent hotel, especially after midnight when the ladies start coming out and are looking for company. Don't miss it.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to complain about.”
Reviews.Author: wkrik
Reviews.Content: We stayed last weekend. It was a last minute trip on a holiday weekend (MLK) and everything at the hotel went smooth from checkin to checkout. They were the only hotel that provided free drinks, $30 credit on food, 15% off the spa, and 2-for-1 Lunch Buffet. No other offers were available at any other hotel. They were also cheaper than all the other hotels on the strip. The bed also had a pillow top mattress and was comfortable. They do need better pillows though, all 5 in the room were "lumpy". If you just need a clean room to sleep and don't plan on hanging out there, this is the place for you. The hotel is starting to feel a little dated compared to the others.

Reviews.Title: “No problems with Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: Toofaraway
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo from Jan. 10 to 14, 2006. We had requested a king non-smoking room. When we checked in, we were told that the only king non-smoking room available then was a handicap room. We took it. Our room was on the 19th floor with an excellent view north along the strip and up the valley. The room was clean and comfortable. The shower was extra large because it had no tub, which was fine with us. We had no problem with rude employees; in fact the employees in the gift shop were very considerate and accommodating. We ate in the pub, the cafe, the buffet, the Italian restaurant (Market City Cafe?), the Golden Bagel, and had no complaints about food or service. The pub had excellent microbrew beers and good food. We especially enjoyed the convenient location on the south strip. The tram to Bellagio was used several times. The bus stop for the Deuce bus to the north strip and downtown was across the street in front of MGM; a 24 hour pass cost only $5.00. Walgreen and CVS stores are nearby. The layout of the Monte Carlo is good, because the rooms and the restaurants and shops can be reached without going through the casino. We were pleased with our stay and would not hesitate to return to Monte Carlo. It isn't the Bellagio, the Venetian, or the Wynn Las Vegas, but then you aren't paying those prices. Monte Carlo is a very good choice for a pleasant stay at moderate prices.

Reviews.Title: “Decent mid-market choice”
Reviews.Author: GrahamCScotland
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over New Year when the the hotel was packed which, perhaps, isn't the best time to judge the level of service. Even so, it all seemed very efficient except that we didn't get the smoking room we'd asked for, which was a bit of a nuisance. Check-in staff were very friendly and the maids particularly diligent: our room was absolutely spotless and stayed that way for the five days and nights we were there. Apart from notably comfortable beds, the rooms are nothing special and the baths are far too small. The Monte Carlo is one of those hotels where you don't have to brave the casino to get in and out but, if you do use the front door, it leads to one of the busiest and most exciting parts of the Strip. Our favourite spot in the hotel was the Brewery Bar which, when it wasn't full of college kids whooping and hollerin' at the football, was a pleasant spot to sink a few - wheat beer and stout particularly tasty - and the bar food is above average. We also enjoyed a very good buffet brunch on the Saturday. Waiting service in both was very prompt, efficient and friendly. The Monte Carlo probably markets itself at a level above what it really is. If you're looking for something just a little classier than the norm, the Mandalay Bay is still the class leader, but this won't disappoint and the location is exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Three adults spent Dec. 16 - 22 at the Monte Carlo and I am sorry to say we were not that impressed with the rooms or the service. Check-in was easy but mechanical, no warmth or "Have a nice stay!" It wasn't because they were overly busy at that time either! The double room had absolutley no room to store clothing for a week for three adults. All that was available were three small drawers in the TV cabinet and a hall closet with 6 hangers. Room service had to be reminded to leave extra glasses and towels or we would just receive two. The tub in the bathroom was also a source of irritation. By the time you were done with your shower you were standing in ankle deep dirty water. A call for help went either unanswered or they had no remedy. The rooms were clean and the bathroom average. We missed not having a coffee maker in the room. We were also disappointed in trying to get information from someone, anyone, in the lobby. Asking driving directions to a spot elsewhere in town turned into a major production. Evidently the people who work there don't live in Las Vegas? We were very pleased with the food options in their food court; everything from McDonald's to a Steakhouse! The parking ramp was free with easy access to the hotel from the 3rd floor walkway. This was our third trip to Las Vegas in the past year. We have stayed at three different casinos on "The Strip". I'm sorry to say that Monte Carlo ranks in third place.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at the Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our recent stay at the Monte Carlo Hotel & Casino. We requested a King sized bed, and the only one available was in a handicap accessible room. This was fine with us. Our room was very clean and comfortable and nicely decorated. The bathroom was huge, although the shower left more to be desired. Probably because it was handicap accessible, the tub was almost a foot higher off the floor than normal and there was a shower hose instead of a normal shower head. The head of the hose did not seem to want to stay in place. Because the tub bottom was so high, it felt strange as our heads almost touched the ceiling of the shower. Our room view was great. We could see north from the hotel, including hotels such as Bellagio, Aladdin, and Caesars Palace. We could also look straight down into the hotel pool area. I've included some pictures of our room and the views during the day and at night. We never used the pool because it closed early, 7pm, which was dissappointing. We really took advantage of the tram between our hotel and the Bellagio, although once you got off at Bellagio, you really had a hike to get to the front of the hotel and outside. The 24 hour food court came in handy at least once during the trip. Not much shopping wise at the Monte Carlo though. Only a few stores with LV souvenirs, hotel branded items and mainly cheap stuff. Not like the shopping areas of Aladdin or Venetian. We took advantage of the 2 for 1 breakfast buffet coupons we received at check-in. The usual types of breakfast food. Nothing too fancy or special, but it was tasty. And you can't beat 2 people eating for $12! We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Simple and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here numerous times, for conventions or just passing through. The rooms are clean and comfortable, though simple and dependable. Parking is easy, and the garage is not a mile from the hotel lobby as in some other strip hotels. I dont gamble and cant stand smoke, so it's nice to be able to access the hotel lobby and elevators without crossing acres of casino floor. Check in has always been fast and easy for me, as in under 3 minutes from front door to room keys.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad value, but a little disappointing”
Reviews.Author: wilystoat
Reviews.Content: Had been thinking about trying this hotel for a while, and eventually arrived there 22 December. Surly check-in clerk, acceptably nice room for the price, instant hot water, small bath tub, cheerful chambermaids. The oriental restaurant by the Strip-End doors offers truly poor service. I was enticed in by the sight of the flaming woks because I fancied a quick lunch, so was gutted to be served a luke warm plate of beef in black bean, with no chilli despite asking for it extra spicy, and then told they had no chilli oil. Very, very slow service, and when I asked for the bill the waiter didn't know what "bill" meant and had to ask two other waiters before they realised I wanted to pay up and get the hell out of the place.And by the way, not the hotel's fault, but don't go to Vegas at Xmas if you don't like droves of oriental tourists wheeling small children and babies through casinos and bars in strollers(pushchairs)and taking digital photos of just about anything.Pathetic.

Reviews.Title: “Only good thing was the price.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After a long flight from Florida we arrived at the Monte Carlo at 1:00pm and was told we would have to wait for a king bedroom till 5:00pm ,even though I had booked the room months ago. So I payed 25 for an upgrade which was ready. The room was nice but as others have said we could hear people talking through the walls. Went down to take a dip in the heated pool only to find the heaters broken and the water cold. Ate at the buffet for lunch which had meatloaf, fried chicken, processed fried shrimp. Not good at all. I have stayed at TI and Bellagio and buffets there are great. The next day woke up to no power or water. It was not the hotel's fault but added to my bad Monte Carlo stay. Video poker machines were very tight. First time I won nothing in 3 days of play. Drinks were very small and weak. I will not go back to Monte Carlo for sure.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: werwr
Reviews.Content: I had stayed in this hotel in august on my honeymoon and never got round to writing the review. So now came the time. I had read a lot about this hotel and didn't know what to expect. As I travelled from far away (greece) and it was my first time in the states and it was also my honeymoon I wanted everything to be perfect. I found the hotel excellent. I had read about loud plumbing and uncomfortable beds ect. I found the beds extremely comfortable the room was quiet and clean had a wonderful view of the strip and found everybody very friendly. The greatest thing was that the hotel was not too huge! The pool was nice and the coctails there great adn we had a lovely time at the pub and fantastic beer. I would definetely reccomend this hotel and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Just o.k.”
Reviews.Author: PRIMO
Reviews.Content: Just got back 12-18-05, 3 nights. The value I would say is good if your looking to stay at a Holiday Inn type place (Avg room). No safes, no closets (with doors) very basic. The spa rooms looked nice however be sure to get strip view high floor. Food was average but pricey, casino was in fact easy to navigate. But if you are a blackjack player looking for comps DO NOT go to the Monte Carlo. In fact the host even told me that blackjack and craps are the worse compd games. A roulette player would be in heaven. I can honestly say I would not stay there again, i have stayed at many places on the strip before so i know what is out there. I just thought i would try the MC and now i know.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Sunseeker23
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo from Dec. 15 - 18. I thought it was wonderful. The rooms were very clean and the bed was by far the best I have ever had. Check in and check out were super quick. The buffet was just OK, I've had better. The tram to the Bellagio is handy. The casino was very clean and easy to navigate. I'm not a fan of the huge, complicated casino. I feel like I can never find the people I'm with. I played mostly blackjack and won every time but the last. Of course. I really enjoyed playing here and loved the dealers. However there was one dealer who I thought was about the rudest dealer I have ever met. I seriously considered complaining to management about him. Other than that, my experience here was wonderful. I would stay again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo Is The Best For Wanting To Get Away”
Reviews.Author: VegasLover28
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been to Las Vegas several times since January of 2003. Each time we were on a budget and stayed in Hotels such as Stratosphere and Days Inn. However, this year, we took our delayed honeymoon and decided to splurge and stay at the Monte Carlo. The fall package is a stunning deal and to top it off the Hotel has to be the cleanest, classiest and the best hotel on the strip !!! The spa suite is absouletly awesome ! It has a very oversized spa, large shower area with great pressure. The most comfortable bed you can imangine for a hotel and I have been in a lot of hotels. It also has a fridge, safe, radio with elevated speakers near the bed and great views of the strip if you get a room with the strip view. With the fall package, we only payed $163 per night and that includes the taxes. We also enjoyed a $30 room service credit, 15% off any spa package, 2 for 1 lunch buffet and 2 for 1 drinks at their brewery all of this acourse was a one time use. The casino is easy to navigate, clean and virtually smoke free. If you expect to get a drink from the coctail waitress while playing the slots etc good luck because its not going to happen. My wife actually went to our room to get us a coke because the coctail waitresses were virtually non-existent Customer service was awesome at check in and during the reservation process. This hotel is a great hotel and I think everyone should stay here at least once. I wouldn't pay full price but its my personal policy to never pay full price anyway there are too many deals to be had especially here in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Not great, barely good”
Reviews.Author: silverfoxsgal
Reviews.Content: Just got back last night from a 4 day stay at the Monte Carlo. Facilities were passable, staff was horrible. I am sad to say this place has some of the rudest, most disinterested staff in Las Vegas. I actually overheard a cocktail waitress in the casino say to a man who had ordered a drink and didn't tip her " ever heard of gratuity?" How disgusting is that? Especially considering that the man was about 80 years old and probably just thought free is free. Front desk staff didn't go anywhere out of their way to inform or make us feel welcomed. The people at the "shows and tours" desk weren't all that helpful or informative and actually looked at us like we had two heads when we asked for suggestions on shows since we were so undecided on what to see. My biggest complaint about this place was how lousey the staff was. The most pleasant person there was a valet parking attendant. It got to the point were I was making mental notes on how bad their attitudes were. Our room was clean and well appointed. Strange though to not have a fridge in room and no mini bar. The few meals we did eat there were ok (we spent our time eating at other resorts which seemed to have more variety in their buffet menus) Overall just OK. Would save our money next time and visit the Venitian or the Paris. Or even one of the downtown locations which seemed to be more user friendly and a happier place (though not as upscale)

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the Money! A+++”
Reviews.Author: lauraleigh9mm
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night for business on the 12th of December. I had a rate of $49 with AAA. My room was lovely and large although I had a freeway facing view. The hotel is not a huge flashy in your face Vegas casino but rather a subdued elegance. The layout of the hotel is wonderful, very easy to get around. there is no overwhelming smoke everywhere like at some casinos. I played a few slots (I lost)and blackjack (I won). The brew pub is great and I like that you can get the beers they make on site while you are gambling (try the high roller red). the buffet is not really anything to right home about as it very typical. I had a bagel sandwich from the foodcourt which was very yummy. the next time I head out to Vegas I will definetely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Spa Suite”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a convention in Las Vegas in which we stayed at the Monte Carlo. Due to logistic reasons we switched reservations from Aladdin to Monte Carlo and I'm glad we did. We were upgraded from a Monte Carlo Suite to a Spa Suite due to a "slight" problem with our Monte Carlo Suite. The Monte Carlo Suite was nice and huge with two bathrooms, but the Spa Suite was pure heaven! Spacious room with sitting area, bar, huge whirlpool tub overlooking the strip and good size bathroom with huge steam shower. Hotel employees were excellent from the helpful and accomodating front desk to the doorman, bellhops, business center employees, etc. Also, the hotel did not smell of smoke or other odors as did alot of the hotels on the strip that we passed through during our stay. The Monte Carlo always smelled fresh and clean. Only downfall was the room service we had for breakfast. Meal (belgian waffles) arrived rather cold and soggy. Although the Spa Suite is rather pricey, it would be a great room for those on their honeymoon, anniversaries or for those romantic trips away from home. I highly recommend staying at the Monte Carlo in one of their suites.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed from Nov 12th thru the 19th.... and here's a run-down 1) we rented a car at the airport. The 'guest' check-in lot was packed, we had to wait for a while to get a parking spot... When we entered the lobby, no way was there that many people checkin in. However, check-in was a breeze. We wanted a king bed, but none were available at that time (3:00 in the afternoon). The attendant John asked if we wanted a double queen for that night and then move the next day into a single King... we said no problem. 2) The rooms were faboulas. Beds were incredibly soft (Pillow mattress). The bathroom was larger than expected. The Bath Mat was a definite added feature. When we moved to our single King room - Boy-O-Boy what a view - 31st floor, overlooking the strip. Could see the Bellagio fountains right from the window. 3) House keeping was exceptional. Not once were we rushed to vacate and we generally left around noon. When we returned, the room was perfect. 4) The hotel overall did not have the themed pizzazz as some of the others inside, but it was definitely clean and easily navigatable (unlike some of the others). 4) Food - Brew Pub was excellent with a great open atmosphere. There was live entertainment available and the beers were better than expected. - The Brunch Buffet was probably one of the best buffets that we had the entire time that we were there - Highly recommended. 5) Gambling was average.... Win some-lose some - Slots were the same... The Sports Book was smaller than most though and the odds boards were definitely lacking in some aspects. 6) We didn't go to the pool, but it looked really nice 7) I've read issues here in regards to the plumbing - ONLY once did we hear it.... 8) Every staff person was 'EXTREMELY' nice and more than willing to assist us, not to mention a nice smile when walking past..... This was our first time to Vegas and without a doubt, we will go back to the Monte Carlo. The tram to the Belaggio was nice, especially when coming home, it saved walking time and it is faster to Tram it than walk (we tested it).

Reviews.Title: “Much better places for the same price.”
Reviews.Author: mma2003
Reviews.Content: The GF and myself stayed here on one of our trips this year, wanting to try something new. I've been to vegas 20+ times and like to try new hotels to mix it up. We stayed this summer and here is what I thought. Rooms: Similar to many other strip hotels, esp. in the price range, we switched from a room with an adjoining door soon as we got to our first room, we always avoid rooms with adjoining doors as extra noise seeps thru from the next room and we stay up and get up late in vegas. Pool: Standard pools, plus wave pool and lazy river. The facilities were small, not enough swimming space for everyone. Way smaller pools than the mandalay which also has a river and wave pool, and a bit smaller than most other resorts of similar size. The main issue for us was way too many kids, good if you have kids, not so nice if you don't. They could use to get rid of one tennis court and expand the pool area. Casino: Did okay on slots, didn't play too many table games here. Food: Buffet wasn't good, the cafe was a bit better, the brewhouse was fun. Misc: The worst part of this trip was coming up to the room one night to find a rollaway bed that had been placed in our room. We didn't request it, someone at the front desk did. We called and complained for obvious reasons, nothing was missing from the room, just some things moved around, the hotel was pretty good dealing with it after the fact. I wouldn't stay here again, mainly due to the security concerns, the amount of children, and the strip location. I prefer hotels on the block further north, and would take any of those on the strip for around the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Staying after Thanksgiving weekend”
Reviews.Author: gizmochee
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Monte Carlo after Thanksgiving day and got a great deal. The hotel room exceeded my expectations: spacious, and comfortable except the bathroom size is average. The only problem is their buffet restaurant is average, nothing extraordinary. It's better than Sahara buffet. I rather eat at their Microbrewery. Plenty of TV screens to watch sports and wide choices of beer.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here next visit”
Reviews.Author: Chelsee
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I just returned from staying at the Monte Carlo during Thanksgiving week. From the onset, check in was efficient and fast. The room was very comfortable and the beds were terrific. We loved the atmosphere of this hotel. It was beautiful but not as noisy and hectic as some others, such as Paris and Venetian. The casino was great. We felt extremely comfortable. Dealers were extremely friendly and I wish I had played here initially instead of some of the other casinos we visited. I would highly recommend this property and can't wait to stay here on our return.

Reviews.Title: “Forget napping....”
Reviews.Author: hypnoticrichard
Reviews.Content: The noise problem is not good for napping or sleeping in! I ignored these reviews when I made my reservation, but it's true! Every pipe in the building makes noise when any room around you showers, flushes or uses the sink. I loved the room, location, view and price, but I was up at 7am instead of my fanatasy of sleeping till noon, and no way could I nap..... I realy am amazed at how noisy a hotel can be and how far sound can travel through a building..... I stay in hotels every week so I am not being "overpicky".

Reviews.Title: “quite a mixture ....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the M.C. It was our first visit to this particular property. The experience was quite a mixture of good and not so good ..... honestly overall I was reminded of Motel 6 many times. This is because of the building, not because of the staff. Check in was the fastest I have ever experienced anywhere on the planet. Seriously! The staff was very very good!! Like others who have stayed there have mentioned, there is a noise problem in the rooms ..... if your nieghbor is in his room when you are, you will know it. You can hear his children playing early in the morning or late at night ...... and so on .... Strangley, our room had no trash receptical. The windows are not clean outside. The room was clean, however. The bed was as good as some high end places we have stayed at also. My wife loves to play Keno, but she does not like crowds or cigerette smoke, so she really enjoyed the Keno area in the casino ... no real problem with air quality here that we could tell. The casino was not ultra busy as were the other places we visited ..... by the way ... this casino still uses a real keno air bowl to mix and pull the keno balls with ... not a computer as many of the other hotels now use. I thought that was really cool, personaly. When check out time came, the weather had turned bad ... had a truly exellent bellman to help us, but it was at this point that I noticed that there is no protection from the weather provided as you are trying to load your car ... just imagine what this must be like durring the summer???? There is a lot of potential here with this property ... it looks really good and the location is fantastic. I would stay again, but only if the price was right. We booked only because we were staying at another place, but chose at the very last minute to stay in Vegas a day longer ... we started looking for another room "on the strip" Thursday night for Friday the next day and found nothing available .... only the Monte Carlo had room ... our rate was $254 plus taxes. Like I say ... if the price was really good .... it might be ok .... my compliments to the staff once again ... very good group of people.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend the Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned on Nov. 24, 2005 from Las Vegas, NV. It was our second time to stay at the Monte Carlo Hotel and Casino. The employees were more friendly this time than two years ago when we visited. The room was clean, although the only disappointment was the mattress needed to be turned and the pillows were clumpy/lumpy. The Dragon Noodle Restaurant (Asian) inside the casino is a great deal for lunch. They have a lunch special that is a very good value and the food is above average; we ate there twice. The Monte Carlo's buffet was good, but the buffet's in Biloxi, Mississippi (before hurricane Katrina), offer at least twice the food selection. The Monte Carlo is a great overall value, and I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “The Monte Carlo - smaller and more subdued”
Reviews.Author: CaliJoe
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Monte Carlo during the Thanksgiving holiday. made reservation through their online system. Overall, it was a pleasant stay. Nothing to write home about. Although our room was a bit dark, it was clean and adequate. We called the front desk to ask for an extra lamp...they brought one up within 15 minutes. We drove to Vegas this time. We parked in their "short term registration" parking lot. Although this lot is supposed to be for guests who are registering and then moving their car to the "self park" garage, most of the cars parked there were there for over 5 hours. Some cars were even parked their overnight. So, Monte Carlo doesnt monitor this short term lot. A big inconvience if you cant find a spot.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Las Vegas, Costa Rica, Miami, Montreal, Aruba, Bahamas, California
Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Boston131
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just average in my opinion. Two things that would have made my stay better... better bath soap and a concierge... they don't have one! Location is great though with tram service to the Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the monte carlo for my honeymoon for 5 days in Ocotober.It was both my husband and my first trip to las vegas..so we were very excited..so after extensive research about looking for the right place to spend a very special time of our lives.we chose the monte carlo...I must say check in was a breeze.it look less than 10 mins...the attendent upgraded our room to a view of strip..which we absolutely loved.The rooms were very clean and just as they looked on the website.The food court was a life saver and very convenient for those times when you wanted to grap a quick snack..the buffet was good but very little variety..Bally's buffet gets 10 points.I must say though that the hotel smells clean..even in the casino.It is delightful to know that we could stay in the casino and not be engulfed in smoke.Housekeeping was very regular and efficient.I must say we absolutely loved las vegas and a point to note the people are very friendly...We would definately stay at the monte carlo again..

Reviews.Title: “A fridge would have been nice!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Monte Carlo for five nights in October, 2005. Great view from my window of the strip and huge ( king size ), very comfy bed, but the bathroom tub was very small and a refrigerator in the room would have been nice. The hotel's foodcourt, although small, does have Hagen Daz - I recommend the cookie dough. Hotel has great location, very close to Mandalay Bay, Luxor, Excalibar, New York and MGM, with short walk to Bellagio and their wonderful fountain and a bus stop is situated right outside hotel entrance. I wouldn't object to staying here again but there is nothing in particular I would hurry back for and would consider giving another hotel on the strip a try.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: nikkib
Reviews.Content: I agree with your writer from Houston. I think the Monte Carlo is great. We have stayed there 3 - 4 times, the last time in Sept. 2005 and wouldn't stay anywhere else now. The service has always been good, rooms clean and comfortable and I think the staff very pleasant and courteous, and the whole atmosphere is casual and relaxing - not as frantic as some of the other casinos.

Reviews.Title: “loved the monte carlo”
Reviews.Author: ejlindah
Reviews.Content: I have been traveling to Las Vegas each year for the past 14 years. Last week, I stayed at the Monte Carlo for the first time and loved it. Beautiful B+ hotel, very user friendly, nice rooms, tram to the Bellagio, reasonable rates on room and food, numerous 10$ blackjack tables; nice staff. I probably will never stay any where else from now on. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Bring Your Earplugs!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The missus and I came from the UK to celebrate our 25th Wedding Anniversary (without parole) and chose our hotel very carefully. We went for the M.C. .. because it seemed best value for the money .. classy without gimmick ... functionial over fun ... practicality instead of ("Cut it here!"-Ed) On arrival, booking in was smooth and efficient. Bell boys very helpful.The hotel is clean, bright and well .. a tad bland to be honest .. but hey! Its has none of the crassness of say .. New York New York or the pointless opulence of the Bellagio ... it did exactly what it says on the (brochure) label - its not for the younger family ... its not for the 18-30 brigade .. its for those who want decent accomodation, decent gaming areas and `summat to eat' and well presented. Super, smashing, great. So why cant I recommend it then?. Well in one word .. noise. There are other factors ... not many shops (a handful) and some pretty average in house restaurants .. but the noise was the factor that really does detract from one's stay. We'd read about this previously on here(!) and were a tad sceptical about how prolific this problem was - pushing it to the back of our minds til we got there.But there was no denying that it really is a problem. We were awoken the second night about 2 am with next door's television playing loudly ... rang room service who sent up Security to bang on the `offenders' door .. which they did as well!. Each night a similar scenario and by the fourth we'd had enough and complained officially. We were given apologies by the supervisor on duty who admitted that noise IS a problem at the Monte Carlo due to the rooms' design ... great! We were given free breakfast (wow1) as compensation and a room-move to an end-of-corridor placement which solved the problem ... but by then the holiday had only 3 nights remaining and it had put a bit of a damper on things.As I said ... the restaurants are nowt wunnerful. The foodcourt is not the biggest ... the gaming area is fine ... and the rooms themselves are very clean, spacious and appointed ok. The whole hotel is ... Good. Nowt remarkable. Just .. Good. Yes - the Lance Burton theatre (and his show) is very impressive .. yes, the whole building interiorly and exteriorly is `the business' ... nevertheless unless you are deaf, a very heavy sleeper or an insomniac then we simply cannot put hand on heart and recommend the Monte Carlo. Its a nice place. Its a lot smarter, more subtle and classier than most of the other `Strip hotels and shuns away from the gaudy and brash to present a restrained and more `mature' frontage.Great. So if thin walls with negligible sound insulation allowing the tones of a gnat's fart to pass through doesnt bother you then we'd otherwise wholeheartedly and unreservedly say "go for it, Roger". As things are though .. it has to be "No way, Raymond". Pity really. Such a daft oversight and a rectification that will probably be an insurmountable one .. now the place has been built. D'oh!. This is all in our opinion of course. You may visit the place and think alls fine -- and it may well do -- assuming your next door neighbours in all polar directions .. are slipper wearers .. go to bed before midnight and have sworn a vow of silence. If not, then we simply cannot guarantee that your nocturnal nestling-down shall not go uninterrupted. Er.. thats it. And thanks for reading ... ("Ok. Thats enough whingeing for one review!"-Ed)

Reviews.Title: “Definitely recommend the Monte Carlo in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We started and ended a week of vacation with a single night stay at the Monte Carlo. I had booked several months ahead of time only to find two nights before our trip that rates had dropped drastically. I immediately called and requested the lower rate and the reservation operator gladly, without hesitation refunded the difference. The first night we were in a standard room with a great view of the strip. Check in was quick and efficient. Room was very clean and roomy and bed was very comfotable. Our only complaint was being able to hear water running through the pipes a few times to other rooms. Still well worth what we paid. As we returned through Vegas for the last night of our trip we were upgraded to a spa suite at no additional charge. It was the perfect way to end a very active vacation. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go for the pool if you go in winter”
Reviews.Author: toastedbagel
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel for the pools. We went with kids and from what we read, it had an amazing set of pools- a 'lazy river', a kiddy pool, a wave pool, a hottub, and a regular pool. Cool huh? Well, not if you go in November or any winter months! Turns out all but the main pool is closed, and the main pool is in the shade the entire day. It is heated but we quickly got cold after a short while. Nice hotel but if you were going for these features, its a huge disapppointment. All we ask is TELL US BEFORE we arrive to spend $350 a night, okay?

Reviews.Title: “The MC - mostly good.”
Reviews.Author: SLOJen
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Monte Carlo on a Sunday evening. The valet staff were quick and friendly and check-in took no more than about 3 minutes. I was however, more than a little shocked when I walked into my room to find a half empty bottle of red wine, along with an unmade bed and crumpled up room service receipts - oops! I was apparently in someone else's room. (How's that for a scary thought?) I called the front desk and was told that someone would meet me to let me into my new room down the hall. This whole process only took about 10 minutes, but it left me more than a little worried about what the rest of my stay might be like... I was very happy with my new room - #27128 - and was glad that I had paid the extra $20 for a strip view. I could see the pool and tennis courts as well as an unobstructed view of the Eiffel Tower and the Bellagio fountains. And this room was very clean! There is nothing spectacular about the decor, but everything was comfortable and the room was well-appointed. I ordered room service on 2 different occasions and found it to be reasonably priced and pretty tasty. Both times the food came within 20 minutes and the service was friendly. I didn't eat anywhere else in this hotel, but I did have a few drinks at the Brew Pub one evening. I am a 20-something female, and I was alone, as I had a couple of hours to kill before my friends arrived in town. They had a band playing (Onyx) and the atmosphere was fun, but not as lively as I was expecting. The place seemed slightly sleazy and I was ready to leave after I had 2 VERY drunk men trying to pick up on me - the bartender actually offered to call security, which was nice! All the staff I dealt with were friendly, and I liked the fact that the maids smiled at me in the hall and wished me, "a nice day." My only real complaint would be that I found the rooms to be fairly noisy. I was far from the elevators too, so you would think that would cut down on the noise. You will hear everything that goes on outside your room. Honestly, I like a hotel that has a louder A/C - it really blocks out a lot of noise! The Monte Carlo A/C is extremely quiet and doesn't provide any "white noise." Overall, I enjoyed this hotel, especially at the rate that I paid for it. I like the fact that it's "non-themey" and didn't have many kids running around. Enjoy your travels and be safe...

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: tapshoemum
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the monte carlo 10/30-11/04 we found it to be in a great location and clean. The staff was friendly and accommodating. Elevators were quick never waited long. Restaurants...the brew pub was great, we found the selection of the food court area of fair selection. We found the only draw back was no place in the lobby to sit and read the paper or have a drink or meet friends like in other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Monte Carlo following my wedding at the Flamingo. Upon checking into the hotel we were greeted with a fantastic spa suite with a huge jacuzzi, sauna, surround sound system and great view. The woman on the front desk was very polite and professional, and we found all staff to be very friendly. The hotel surpassed all our expectations and we will be booking up again. We have stayed in the Luxor, Flamingo, and Caesars Palace and feel you can't beat the Monte Carlo for value. It may not be the most luxuriant hotel in Las Vegas but you will not get the same standard of room at the same price in any of the other major hotels. Do not hesitate in reserving your room!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Brew Pub, Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: sammyk
Reviews.Content: Fairly good value, it's standard Vegas spec - luxury furnishings, spacious rooms, oppulent reception (although nothing on other hotels!) but in its class and price range it has some tough competition and I felt it lacked the personality of somewhere like Aladdin or Paris. The pool area is great, the lazy river is fun although it seems harsh to charge for the tubes. There are loads of sunbeds and although crowded it was never unbearable. There's a fun brew pub with huge table beer taps, makes drinking even easier and adds to the atmosphere. The main casino is a bit bland - feels like a walk through on the way somewhere else. Overll it's fine if you get a good rate and could offer a welcome escape from crazy Vegas - but for me that kind of misses the point. If I want quiet luxury I'll go to Mandalay Bay next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from Oct. 20 through the 25th. We were able to get checked in as soon as we got to the the Hotel, (which was early in the morning due an early flight), we also were able to upgrade to a spa suite which was very nice. We did here the plumbing noise and the people in the next room but it was not anything we could not/did not get used to. We ate at the cafe most of the time (breakfast) and it was exellent. We found the housekeeping to be average in our room and overall above average in the hotel. We thought that the staff in general were very nice and helpfull with only one exception a waiter in the brewery was very rude, but that did'nt stop us from having a good time. The only thing that we just could not believe was they close the pool area down completly at 5:00 PM. We can't understand why they can't leave at least one pool and the hottub open till at least 9:00 PM!! (this is Vegas) Overall we will stay here again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad of Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo last week because we were cancelled on our trip planned for Punta Cana (thanks Wilma). We had to get a last minute deal. Overall the rooms are very nice with a nice view of the Strip. Location is also pretty good. I personally didn't like the choice of slots at the Casino. I have gone to many of the ones on the Strip and I think that they have a wider varity. Also, their dealers definitely leave something to be desired. I learned Black Jack a year ago and find it can be one of the best experiences if the dealer is friendly and outgoing. The table follows suit. The dealers here are completely uninvolved. They never smile, don't talk even when directly addressed, and are almost rude. Since I spend most of my time in the casino, I am less concerned with the room and amenitits that than the casino. Also, a big complaint I have is with the staff. First let me say that politically I am a liberal. However, when hotels hire staff who are not naturally English speaking, they should make sure that they are somewhat literate in English before they begin work. When we checked in on Thursday we were scheduled to check out on Saturday. I told the girl that was checking us in that I wanted to extend our room through Saturday. I told her that we had a very late flight on Saturday and even though we were not staying overnight, I was willing to pay for the room so we would have a place to crash untill the flight took off. Surprise when we were asked why our bags were not out of the room by 12:00. The hotel was totally booked for Saturday. The manager managed to give us a late check-out until 6:00 which I was very appreciative. But it took us over one hour to straighten this out. This is all because the person who checked us in did not speak enough English to understand what I was saying. Well she could have gotten someone to help her.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here again--still our favorite”
Reviews.Author: ANNIEPG
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our 3rd or 4th stay here. We visit Vegas often and have stayed at many hotels. We are a middle aged, middle class couple who like to travel and like value but would not tolerate a run down hotel or poor service. For another point of reference, my most important criterion is cleanliness followed by all of the usual: service, location, food, fun, etc. For us, the Monte Carlo rates highly in all of these. Our room was sparkling clean, smelled nice, comfortable beds, and quiet. Heat & AC worked fine. The bathtub drained slowly, a common problem. The casino is classy, calmer than most, and has all of the games you would expect. Of course the on strip central location is perfect. For looser slot play and a more casual fun atmosphere, I like to walk over to the Boardwalk once in awhile. We love our buffets and have tried most of them. The Monte Carlo is one of the better ones. Try the made-to-order pasta station for dinner or the made-to-order omelets for breakfast. You won't be disappointed. The food court gives you quick alternatives. We are not pool people so I can't comment on that. Parking was easy. As others have said, its nice not to have to walk through the casino to register and get to your room. We will be back to Vegas and will spend at least a few nights at the Monte Carlo.

Reviews.Title: “What Happens in Vegas, Stays in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have returned home to Chicago from our adventures in Vegas and let me tell you if you have never been and love to party like we girls do then Vegas is the place to be. I cannot say enough about Vegas. My girlfriends and I are in our twenties and we partied til we couldn't party anymore and that was until oh about 5 or 6am as I remember or should I say what I can remember. It was aewsome. Ok so here is the scoop. We needed a nice hotel that allowed us to get some sun, some decent food that would refuel our grumbling tummies after we drank way too much Tequilla, etc, and a nice bed to pass out on at the wee hours of the morning. We got it all and then some. We checked in on Friday early evening and the service was great. We asked for a quiet room away from the elavators, with a view and thats what we got. We were on the 13th floor at the end of the hall-way and the view was great. And for those of you who think it is a bad omen to stay on the 13th floor of a hotel have been saddly misinformed or at least at this hotel, because we couldn't have asked for a better floor to be on. Maybe that is because no one wants to stay on floor 13th, but we were happy. We never heard any pipes or toilets flushing at all. The beds were wonderful. The maid service was great. We just left a little note the first day and asked for lots of extras (towels, soaps, etc) and then left $3.00 a day and we had everything we could ask for. Sure Monte Carlo was a little more quiet than alot of the other big hotels, but it was nice to come back to after being out and partying all night. The cafe was hard to get service at around 5am in the morning, but we weren't upset we just stumbled across the street from the hotel and got fast food at a food court which I wouldn't suggest at 5 or 6am, but we are still alive to talk about it, so why not. You only live once. We really didn't want to spend a ton of money on the hotel we stayed at but we wanted to be right on the strip and in the midst of all the fun. We were very happy to find the tram that took us right to the Belligio where we got VIP access to The Light Nightclub. Oh and by the way the Tram is very nice and free. One of the guys who worked there gave us free passes to walk right to the front of the long line and walk right in to The Light! Yeah! We felt like superstars! From the Bellagio we stumbled to Caesars Palace which has the nightclub Pure and we got bumped up in line and right in as well. Its wonderful being a girl and they must not have thought we were to hard on the eyes either since we got right in and the wait was quite long. The casino was very nice, we did very little gambling but the air was clean and we smelled no smoke at all. The hotel was very clean and the little shop inside (can't remember the name) was fun and had great shoes and accessories. I bought a hot silver pair that no one has been able to match back in Chicago. They were very original. We were even allowed late check-out with no charge at the Monte, so we slept late Monday and then headed for the airport. We found that 3 nights was just enough time to cause enough trouble in the city that never sleeps! So at any rate, Monte Carlo treated us very well all around and I would stay there again. What a time, we'll be back soon, very soon! Love ya Vegas. Maddie, Makena, and Maleeya

Reviews.Title: “you have to find the right hotel for you”
Reviews.Author: w2snowman
Reviews.Content: It still amazes me when I look at hotel reviews sometimes if people stayed at the same hotel I did. SIMPLY put for me this is the best hotel in Vegas, not the biggest or 5 stars or the brightest but it works for the following reasons, location it is a short walk on the south end of the strip for MGM, NYNY, Excaliber, Tropicana, Luxor and tram from Excaliber to MB. Also a close walk to Aladdin and the MONTE Carlo has a tram to Bellagio. Another reason is the MOnte is managable in size the casino is a bit smaller then others but still has all the same games, there is a great food court right at the bottom of the elevators, you dont have to walk to through the casino to get to the pool area and perhaps the last reason is this hotel is not a tourist attraction it is a beautiful 3.5 star hotel and at the end of the day when you have had enough of people its nice to get back to this hotel. We stayed in a Monico suite on the third floor. The room was very spacious about 500 sq feet. We gor there at 10 am on Sat oct.22 and were able to get our room then. By far the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. We did not experience any excesive noise plumbing noise that others have said. I know every one is different I think thats why the reviews of hotels are so different. My wife and I our 30 years old, Middle class, with 2 kids, we enjoy a good time in VEgas but are not hardcore partiers, this is our 6 th Vegas trip in 8 years and have stayed in 7 strip hotels. For us its the Monte Carlo.

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: There are so many great places to choose from in Las Vegas that when one is just average you have to say so. The Monte Carlo pool is set-up for people that have children so if you want peace and quiet at the pool, stay somewhere else. There is a pool that is in a more secluded area, but it tends to smell a bit musty, parents bring their kids there too, and it has complete shade the entire day. The hotel tried to put too many things in the small space they had for the pool (wave pool, lazy river, etc.) and it results in the pool area being very crowded and tight. We did have very good pizza at the italian restaurant and the steakhouse was very good. The pub also had very good food. The room was small and nice (average). We decided to upgrade to a suite which was much nicer for us. The room was kept clean and the staff were all very nice at the hotel. I can't say 'don't go there' because everything is okay. I just preferred the Mirage, Mandalay Bay, The Hotel, and the Luxor to the Monte Carlo.

Reviews.Title: “Unimpressed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Vegas, and after a conference at another hotel, we moved to the Monte Carlo for the last night in Vegas. For frame of reference, as far as hotels go most Hampton Inns provide all of the amenities we prefer in a hotel room. Check-in was fairly straight forward and quick. While there were dozens of people milling around near the checkin, we walked right up to an available employee and were able to check in immediately even though it was a Friday on a 3 day holiday weekend. The room we were given was a handicapped accessible room. The bathroom was very big, but it wasn't a wise use of space. The tub was small and shallow as you'd expect in a HC room, but the hand held shower was abysmal. We called getting washed 'taking a drizzle' it was so bad. The bedroom was nicely decorated though the room smelled of an overpowering deodorizer. We had to crack the window (that's all it did, crack slightly) but it was a windy day so the room aired out quickly. We had a decent view looking up the Strip. Unfortunately the windows were deperately in need of a washing. Given this was our third hotel with filthy windows, I began to wonder if there just werent' any window washers in Vegas. Important note, there is Internet access in the room, but no wireless access. There is also no coffee maker in the room...a definitive -2 stars in our book. The casino looked like we'd expected a european themed casino would look...slightly classier than most of what we had seen on the Strip. But, the gambling was still the same as anywhere else. We only ate at the Cafe while staying here. On the first day we ate dinner, both getting the "Steak Sandwich" dinner for about $10. The steak was a little gristly, and perhaps a bit too tough for a sandwich, but it was tasty, and came with a 1/2 plate of greasy but crunchy shoe-string fries. We ate breakfast there the next morning...the over-easy eggs were a touch undercooked, the biscuits and gravy a bit light on the sausage and on seasoning, but on the whole it was fairly decent breakfast. Oddly, both times were were asked if we were paying cash or charging to the room...as if paying by credit card was something they didn't expect. Of course, they took cards, just odd how they phrased the question. We didn't do the pool, but it certainly looked somewhat more inviting than others we'd seen on the strip. At least there was shade and greenery around the pools so we of the light skin could be outside and not in the sun. Conveniently located next to the hotel is a CVS. This one store was a budget saver for us on the trip since I don't think Vegas has learned what a drinking fountain is and the casino shop water was a bit pricey. The only complaint we have is not about the hotel specifically, but the guests who were near us. As is typical, doors into the rooms tend to be grouped side by side and across the hall from one another. Unfortunately the doors and the frames slam shut very loudly, especially between the hours of 2 and 5 am. They are also very loud when room service shows up at 3:45 and knocks on the door across the hallway. All told, for $200/night, the Monte Carlo is a big waste of money. For $100 and if you get quiet, considerate neighbors, it wouldn't be so bad. But given a choice, we'd not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Pool in the Shade”
Reviews.Author: PapaBlair
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to let people know who have never stayed at the hotel that the pool is in the shade of the hotel for most of the day. If you are hoping for sun, go someplace else, as the sun doesn't come around the building until late in the afternoon. If you are "sun-adverse", this is perfect for you!

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied overall”
Reviews.Author: lucy&ricky
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Monte Carlo w/3 other couples from Oct. 10 to the 14th. Rooms were clean, but noisy when neighbors showered, or made love ( awakened at 4 AM, yikes!). Beds were comfy, but could've had better and more pillows. Pool was nice, but somewhat shady until the afternoon. Plus, it closed at 6 PM. Food court was handy. Discovered food court next door at New York was much better and pretty easy to get to from the Monte Carlo. Member in our group rode a scooter and everything was accessable. Casino was generous in small payouts, easy to navigate and less smokey than others. Do not waste the extra $20 a night for a room w/a view! What a joke! Buffet was pretty good, but go to the Aladdin Spice Market buffet, yummy! And the best so far. The Market Street Cafe had delicious food and generous portions. Overall we were satisfied, but would try somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “In 1 word Unforgetable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo for our 3Oth Wedding Anniversary we stayed for 14 nights and found the hotel to be Exellent the standard of the room was very good(especialy the comfortable bed). The Bar/Brewery was ideal, food and beer selection very good.The pool area was small by comparison to the size of the hotel but was good with plenty of beds and helpfull pool staff.The dining was first class with the food court being very handy for just a snack. The location was very good as the hotel was in the middle of most of the big hotels.We cant wait to go back to the Monte Carlo. Lee and Carol.. England

Reviews.Title: “A few problems . . .”
Reviews.Author: RfamilyLIKES2travel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the MC Oct. 2-6, 2005 to celebrate his 40th birthday. It was our first time in Vegas but we'll definitely go back - probably not to the MC though. Check in was fine but I got the impression that the person wanted a tip. I've never tipped for check in before so I didn't start. Maybe I should have because the room we were given wasn't the best. The view was of the pool area - that was fine with us as we're not that picky about the view. Our complaints consisted of the drain in the tub/shower not draining well (I was standing in about 6 inches of water by the end of my shower!) and the room not being cleaned well. I called the front desk to complain about both. There was a tennis ball on the floor from a previous guest so I know they don't pay attention to detail. The person I spoke with put me on hold then offered me 2 free buffets when she got back on the line. She said that both problems would be taken care of and she did apologize. I thought all would be fine but when we came back in after being out for the day the tennis ball was still on the floor - even though the room had been "cleaned." Seeing that I decided to check on how well the tub drained. It was still extremely slow. I ran the water for about a minute and it took several minutes for it to drain. I called back down and I could tell they were a little more frustrated this time with me. They called maintenance and were told that they had fixed the problem. I told them that it hadn't been fixed to our satisfaction so they offered to "upgrade" our room. We had to pack up everything and move ourselves to a different floor. The only "upgrade" I could see was that we were on a higher floor with a view of the strip (not a great one!) The room actually appeared to be smaller and I didn't like the layout as well. However, we kept it because the drain worked and it appeared to be cleaner than the first one. We did hear the plumbing noise that others have mentioned but we didn't have any hall noise in either room. We couldn't hear our neighbors either. We were in a non-smoking room and didn't smell any smoke on our floor. We did use the free buffets and I will say the food was good. There was a lot of variety and our waiter was very attentive. As far as the casino goes, it was always less crowded than the others we visited. We never won at the MC and were never offered a drink while playing. Actually, the only casinos we were offered a drink at were NYNY and Caesars. Other than the MC buffet we chose to stay away from the rest of them. We ate at Jimmy Buffett's Margaritaville one night - decent food and enjoyed the band. We ate at Toby Keith's I Love This Bar and Grill for lunch - tons of food! And, the wings were tasty. Also, they give out free liquor at the bar whenever his song "I Love this Bar" plays. Another fantastic meal was at Mesa Grill. We ate there for lunch because the we knew the dinner menu would be too pricey for us. The food was delicious but you have to like southwest style and be open to things other than burgers and fries (they do offer an "upscale" version of that though.) Our lunch ran around $70 for 2 of the peach margaritas, an appetizer and two entrees. All in all we had a great time in Vegas - the only downside to the whole trip was our ordeal with our first room at the MC. I think we'll look into staying somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel (minus the pool area)”
Reviews.Author: stephkat
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Monte Carlo with my Mom for my 21st birthday from Oct 5th-11th 2005. Oveall I would say the hotel was pretty nice. I have been to Vegas once before, but I was 15 and on an organized trip, so I stayed in the dorms at UNLV. While I don't have much grounds for comparison within other hotels and rooms in Vegas, we did walk around other hotels, and I've done quite a bit of travelling for someonen my age. I would say that Caesars and Bellagio were nicer, this was probably equivalent if not a little bit less nice than NYNY, but it was nicer than Rio and Palms (and it's in a great location!). Rooms were nice... we had a "strip view" (the first night was room 21313, and the next five were 22305). This meant we could partially see the strip, but we had a very large view of a gravel unfinished area... We had two queen beds which were nice and clean.. nice bathroom.. only thing that sucked was not having a balcony (but I hear that none of the Vegas hotels do!). Room service food was GREAT. I'm a vegan so I had the garden burger with fries, and a pasta with veges and tomato sauce.. both were incredible. The fries are out of this world. My Mom had the chicken quesadillas and she said they were good. The casino was nice... typical of a Vegas hotel. The first day my Mom won (of course she didn't come out on top by the end of the week lol) so she liked the casino. There's a tram that takes you from MC to Bellagio, but most of the time we were there it wasn't running... that sucked. As for the pool... it is very nice, but there is not a lot of POOL itself. It is broken up into different areas (with a small ave pool as well) with lots of trees area. Obviously what that means is that there is mainly shade everywhere. The only section where you can get sun all day long is facing the tennis courts (not near the pool), and this only starts at around 11am. Overall, I had a great trip. The hotel was a good deal (its like half the cost of Bellagio), so if you are looking for a great value, I would say this is it!

Reviews.Title: “Robbed at the Monte Carlo Brewery last weekend....”
Reviews.Author: tv77
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at the Monte Carlo, which we've always enjoyed, but stayed this time at the Flamingo since the rate was a lot less expensive. We went over to the Brewery in the Monte Carlo to watch baseball on Sat night and have dinner. The Brewery started to get crowded around 9:30, and there were wall-to-wall people by the time the band started @ 10pm. I had a purse, bag of purchases and a sweater. One of the waitresses spilled a large drink down my back, and didn't even apologize. We went to speak with a Manager, who was kind enough to comp us a drink. During that fiasco, my bag of purchases and sweater disappeared. Not sure who would want a soaking wet sweater and a bag of bath bombs, but they took them anyway. We went to security to file a report, but they were busy trying to restrain a woman outside of the Brewery who was yelling at her boyfriend that he messed with the wrong family, and she was going to make him pay. When they finished with that, they took down my information and said they would call if it turned up, which it didn't. Very disappointing. If you decide to go to the brewery when it's crowded, watch your stuff, and watch your back!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome value. Well worth the $$”
Reviews.Author: Sir_Topham_hatt
Reviews.Content: We stayed from 10/2/05 to 10/6/05, then moved to The Sahara (BIG MISTAKE to leave the Monte Carlo) to be with friends. We should have just taken the tram to the Sahara daily to visit them. We went from a 5-star hotel to a 1/2-star hotel. We upgraded to a Monaco suite for $30 extra (on top of the $69.95 hotel internet rate) at check-in, with an adjoining room for the other couple traveling with us. It was fabulous. The room was clean, spacious and smelled great. We stayed in 15101 and 15102. Our view was of the roller coaster at NYNY. They provided a room refrigerator for free for the entire stay. Nice touch. Great sushi at the noodle company restaurant. We got coupons for a free California roll with any Sushi item, 2-1 breakfast buffet, 2-1 beers in the brewery and others. Too many to mention. Used about 1/2 of them. You can't go wrong at the Monte Carlo. Would definitely stay there again. We've stayed at Mandalay Bay (they own Monte Carlo) and would stay at MC over MB because the rooms are very similiar and the rates are much less at MC, plus you are already right on the strip at MC versus having to take a tram (albeit, free) to the strip from MB. This place is definitely a winner.

Reviews.Title: “It's OK”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Monte Carlo from October 2-6, 2005. I read many reviews on Trip Advisor and was forewarned about the problem with noise, etc. I was weary about going to the Monte Carlo after reading these reviews but decided not to cancel my reservation. Instead, upon arrival I requested a corner room and this was the best thing I could have done. I did not have neighbors on either side of me (there was an employee locker room next door) and a thick wall between my neighbor's room and mine. I didn't hear a thing. I was at the end of the hall which was fine for me because after all the buffets, I needed the exercise. I didn't hear anything, I slept well and I am a light sleeper. We tried the buffet there. The food was good. We also had buffets at the MGM and Bellagio but our BEST buffet experience which far exceeded MGM, Bellagio AND Monte Carlo was the ALADDIN! The buffet is exquisite and truly worth every dime at the Aladdin. The variety, diversity and quality of the food is stellar. Its the best buffet I have ever had. And I've had many. I will say that our room at the Monte Carlo was not the cleanest. There were holes in the sheets and the comforter did not look clean. But we survived - everyone knows that there are germs in hotel rooms. It just comes with the territory. If I had to go to Las Vegas again and I couldn't afford one of the nicer (and presumably cleaner) hotels, I may stay here again. It served its purpose. By the way, if you can, catch a Cirque du Soleil show while you're there. Its amazing and worth every dollar. Also - check out the Diego Restaurant in MGM Grand. The food and sangria were great!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Keitht
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the concierge floor, the 32nd, from 29th September to 5th October 2005 and loved just about every moment of the stay. The room was spacious and the bed the most comfortable I think I have ever slept in. The shower was powerful, to say the least, and a bit more control over the power would have been nice. We did have a problem over room cleaning when we arrived but that was quickly addressed and we were comped a meal for 2 for the inconvenience. The facilities in the Club Monaco lounge met our expectation on all but one occasion although the lack of beer during the period that free drinks are served, including spirits such as whisky, gin etc, does seem odd for a hotel with its own brewery! The food in the Lounge was generally of good quality and had plenty of variety during our stay. The only problem we experienced was with a particular Maitre D' who was rude to, or at best ignored, pretty much everybody equally - be they American or foreigner. Only when he was on duty was there a problem with the food supply. The whole property is clean and airy with a good selection of eating places to suit all palates and pockets. The location is good, with tram connection to the Bellagio from within the hotel and just a short walk to Excalibur with its own tram link to Luxor and Mandalay Bay. We hope to return to Las Vegas at some time and will look no further than the Monte Carlo for accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo One of the Best”
Reviews.Author: Suncoast8
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at most of the hotels in Vegas. The Monte Carlo is still one of my favorites. Room are very nice, and if you upgrad to a suite, you will not be disappointed. It is very easy to get to your rooms, you do not have to walk through the casino to get to the elevators. The restaurant Blackstones in the hotel is one of the best places to have a wonderful dinner. If you like steak it is the best. They also have a buffett which has so many choices, and the price is reasonable. Their food court has McDonalds, Bagel Place, Ice Cream, and several other choices. I have never been diasppointed in the wonderful service of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What wonderful views”
Reviews.Author: Disneylovers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for a long weekend, Sept. 24-27, and had a memorable stay. The reason for choosing Monte Carlo is the acceptance of Saturday arrivals (many don't), and while our request of a King bed was not met upon our arrival, they did give us 2 Queens with a view of the strip (so we saw the MGM Grand and the M&M store from our window). The Pillow-top beds were fabulous; I never thought I would sleep so much in this city! The bathroom was standard, but the amenities stood out: a curved shower curtain pole to reduce the drafts, a regular bath mat (as opposed to a bath towel) to step out onto, and Mediterranean-style bath products (ex. grape leaves/oatmeal lotions and shampoos) to use during the stay. On the last night we inquired about moving to a King room with a different view. Switching rooms wasn't a problem; we just had to check out/in after 3 p.m. They upgraded us for free to the 25th floor with views of the pools and the Bellagio. Wow! Our day and night views were beautiful. My husband enjoyed the showerhead in this room better (wider spray as opposed to a very narrow but strong one in the previous room). Other reviews and comments indicated water/pipe noise, and I listened for it. Yes, you do hear it, but it was no different than staying at other hotels or even at home. We never heard hall noise from other guests. Our rooms were always on non-smoking floors, so we never smelled smoke. The ventilation in the casino and hotel is so strong that the smoke smell is minimum compared to other casinos. We love to visit Las Vegas and stay in different hotels. You won't be disappointed with this choice.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely nothing wrong with the Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Or so I always say, generally half the price, smack in the middle of the strip, lack of theme = less children running around, clean, quiet(er) than most of the themed hotels like NY NY or Luxor nearby. Anyone who says it doesn't matter where you stay in LV hasn't stayed at Circus Circus.

Reviews.Title: “Not even worth paying a penny.. Go to Circus Circus better. It's cheaper!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here!! The rooms here are run down. Our comforter was so worn out that it had holes and the stitching was coming off. The bathroom was o.k. Now.. the most disgusting thing was the towels they were stain.. I don't know how they could overlook that. All of our neighbors were loud and kids running around. So if you expect to actually sleep there do not stay here. Not only that the buffet has terrible service. People were just rude.. This is something I expect from Circus Circus or Excalibur. I was very disappointed not WORTH what you pay for. And it's not that cheap. Look somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “repeater continues to be satisfied”
Reviews.Author: mantup
Reviews.Content: just returned form our fourth yearly stay at the monte carlo 9/21-9/27. we return here for many reasons. the location is very good for us. hotel check-in/out is very convenient. check in clerks were effeicient and friendly (only 10 minutes..arrival 2pm wednesday). we asked for strip view and were accomodated. the setup of the property is easy to maneuver. it is very convenient to get from lobby to room. you don't have to go through a casino to get to the pool. food court makes it easy for a quick coffee in the a.m..the cafe has great service and we enjoyed and breakfast selections. blackstones steakhouse was above average. our room was always well attended by housekeeping. we had a light out in our room and was replaced promptly. the beds were comfortable..all staff was pleasant and helpful. casino change booth personel always polite with smiles. we have no complaints about noise /plumbing as previously posted.(we stay 5-6 room from elevator). the monorail to bellagio is covenient. we also feel it is a value for our $. already looking forward to next years' stay at the monte carlo.

Reviews.Title: “The Monte Carlo was very nice..”
Reviews.Author: Trinity68
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and I stayed at the Monte Carlo Resort Hotel and Casino September 5th to September 8th.
