We received a very good deal with Orbitz, book 3 nights and receive $50.00 off your 3rd night. The rate was $79.00, which I thought was pretty good to stay on the strip. Checking in was a breeze, only stood in line a few minutes and the front desk personnel were very accommodating. We checked in a few hours early, about noon and were given a room with a view of the strip, non-smoking and two queen beds. The rooms were very nice with very relaxing beds. The bedroom linens were luxurious, thick and soft. The housekeeping was excellent. Each day when we left for breakfast, our room was perfect when we returned and we were furnished with fresh towels everyday. The bathroom was over-average with subtle touches such as a bath rug instead of a towel to step onto out of the shower and stocked with exquisite Gilchrist & Soames bath products. I have read reviews with complaints about the bathroom pipes being loud, but when we closed the bathroom door we couldn’t hear a thing. The first night we did hear the guests that were next door, I believe that they were drunk and they were a little rowdy. The actual swimming pool is smaller than I thought it would be, but fortunately it was not crowded when we went. The Easy River ride was fun and relaxing. The spa hot tub was very nice also. The only complaint that I have about the pool area is that it closes promptly at 7PM. The attendants make sure to inform you that it is time to vacate the area. The parking is convenient. The parking garage has a connecting walkway to the hotel and the valet employees were great. The security was not as visible as in other Las Vegas hotels that I have stayed at, anyone could walk onto the elevators to the rooms without being noticed or being asked for their room key. As far as the casino the gambling minimums were a little high for us, so I would suggest going elsewhere if you want to stretch out your funds. We had a pleasant stay and we would consider returning to the Monte Carlo in the future. The customer service was top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Overshadowed but not outshined”
Reviews.Author: ForwurdMotion
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo is probably the most overshadowed hotel in Vegas, and for no good reason. My brother had spent a weekend there with his wife and upon their return had nothing but good things to say about the hotel. This past August, I vacationed in Vegas with my brother, his wife and my other brother, and I was very impressed with the hotel. We stayed at three different hotels: New York New York, MGM Grand, and the Monte Carlo. However, the Monte Carlo was in many ways my favorite. All amenities were in close proximity to one another (I hated walking through that overly expansive MGM Grand Lobby). The pool was a great place to relax, with a number of different types of pools to choose from such as a lazy river and wave pool. Good restaurants to choose from, including a food court for more casual dining, and pretty good shopping, plus there's a free tram that takes you directly to the Bellagio. It's location is perfect for those who like to walk the strip. The video game arcade is a bit dated, though. Rooms look standard, like ones you'd find at other Vegas hotels. Nothing in this hotel looks overdone or underdone. Which is what makes it a great hotel (just the right size). If ever I planned another Vegas vacation, the Monte Carlo would definitely be listed toward the top, if not at the top, of my list.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: Jackie505
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo from the 4th to 9th Sept. I asked for a complimentary upgrade on check-in (didn't try the $20 trick!) and was offered an upgrade to a suite for an extra $25 per night. It seemed like a good deal so we took it (Room 25-101). A large room with 2 bathrooms and a king bed. We really enjoyed it & thought the extra money well worth it. The view was out the back, looking onto the freeway, but with a very good view of In & Out Burger in Industrial Road! The brewpub very good. Beer excellent, but cheaper if you order it by the pitcher, which is great if there are 2 of you. We're not great gamblers, but hubby entered the Thursday am Texas Holdem competition in the Poker Room. It was good value, for $40. He was quite pleased with himself, as he got through to the final 6. We had no problems with the plumbing & the walls didn't seem paper thin (see previous comments on this hotel). All in all, a very good experience. We had a reasonable deal on price, except for the Sunday night, which was Labor Day & so more expensive, we paid $ 69 & $79 for the other nights. I don't think we'd stay there at a time when we had to pay more than $100 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value...But you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I recently returned from fabulous Las Vegas. We stayed at the Monte Carlo due to its great rates and good location. The rooms were clean and the bed was fairly comfortable. The meal selection was minimal compared to surrounding casinos. Due to being tired of Mcdonald's and the expensive bagel shop, we ended up buying cereal from the nearby CVS(which proved to be extremely convienent). The casino is small and was not paying very well...we actually won money at every MGM related casino and lost at all the others. The pool area is the worst part of the casino. Searching for relief from the 100+ degree weather we were very disappointed with the pool area lay out. The wave pool was closed the entire week we were there. Due to that and the affordability of the casino, the lazy "stream" was packed. The main pool remains in the shade 90% of the day and is a good 50 yards from where you can get constant sun if you wish to tan. The kiddie pool area was nice but it was infested with adults due to the overcrowding. Next time we will spend the extra money and stay at one of the nicer casinos where it is less crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite place!!”
Reviews.Author: VivaVegas
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo went above and beyond our expectations!! Our room was the Morocan Suite on the 32nd floor...very clean and crisp...the bed and pillows were so comfortable and the two bathrooms were great!!! There was no noises heard through any of our walls, and no plumbling problems like other reviews have said. The casino was beautiful and very friendly. This will be our new home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Best value Hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: BigBobJoylove
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Monte Carlo first week in July and we found it hard to fault. We asked for a room with a 'strip view' when we checked in, we had to wait three hours for this but the Concierge looked after our bags and the wait was well worth it. The staff in the hotel are very friendly and cannot do enough for you. The room was excellent, beds very comfy, we didn't hear the plumbing at all and the bathroom was more than adequate. Being a gamblaholic, I was looking for something different from the Casinos in the UK and I found it in Keano (a good tip is to put say ten tickets on and you can watch the numbers being drawn out live on your TV in your room) The Casino itself was very nice, quite spacious and quiet compared to the other Casinos, I thought the Dealers/Croupiers were a bit quiet at times though. We went to see Lance Burton which was very entertaining (if not a little 'cheesey') The Breakfast buffet is superb and very good value and the steak in Blackstones is well worth checking out too. It was as hot as 114 degrees when we were there and the best way of navigating the strip is to get the monorail to the Bellagio, walk across to Flamingo and get the tram from there, this stops at about 6 or 7 hotels en route. A really enjoyable experience. I am working on my wife to take me back to Las Vegas for my birthday next year and the Monte Carlo would be our first choice (although we do like the look of Wynns too)

Reviews.Title: “OK stay”
Reviews.Author: LoveTravel
Reviews.Content: The location is great but the hotel itself is a little worn out. The rooms can definitely use an upgrade- everything just seems a little older. The casino, lobby, and pool area are still nice and the tram to the Bellagio is great.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Here's the deal on MC - not greatest but reasonable & good location. Easy to get to from airport - you will sit in traffic on strip for ones further down. This was our 2nd time there as we were comped from our 1st trip. Yes - walls are thin & you can hear the plumbing BUT hotel's is in a good spot & rates are good so if you are not going to be spending a lot of time in your rm & you have a modest budget stay here. I liked the pools, MC is on the West side of strip so you get sun late in afternoon. It does have some shaded areas but that's to be expected when the resorts are very high - no doubt you will find this problem elsewhere. Yes you need to throw your towel on chaise but I've encountered this in FL, Hawaii & Puerto Rico - it's just what you have to do if you want that primo spot. The wave pool was broke for one day while we were there but they fixed it & let's face it - I could be suffering in New Orleans as a flood victim so if 1 out of 5 pools is broke, I'm not broken up about it. I don't think Vegas is a spot for kids in gen'l - there isn't much for them to do besides pool. We've eaten at Dragon Noodle Co, Blackstones & Market Cafe which were good. For great cuisine I recommend upper class hotels. If it weren't for comp I probably would have stayed elsewhere since I like to see what ALL the hotels have to offer but like I said if you are on a budget but want a decent place to stay - this is it. It's clean, staff is nice, beds are comfy, food is good & location is very good. You can take the tram to the Bellagio and walk to other hotels on strip

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: ozibob1
Reviews.Content: En route from Australia to New York my family stayed 4 nights in Vegas at the Monte Carlo, what a great move! I expected a lot from Vegas and it was truly amazing, but that's another story. Monte Carlo was excellent from the start. At check-in the staff were very helpful, changing our reservation to 2 adjoining rooms and allocating to the cheapest (internet) rate. A Sunday to Thurday stay cost abt $80/n per room. We had a baby and rang for a fridge (Vegas rooms don't have them) -came straight up. The hotel was very clean, modern and service was superb. Casino part was safe and welcoming with a good range of gaming. Food is good (for America) and the McDonalds eaters are satisfied by one in the hotel. Beer drinkers heaven with on-site brewery. This is starting to sound like an ad, but all-true I swear. A free monorail-style tram takes you to the Bellagio in centre-strip, which was very handy as it was always over 100 degrees outside. The pool, for those interested, was very kid-friendly and had a small beach / wave-pool. Tour Info desk has a specialist golf advisor who helped me to buy a set of clubs. Ice machines near the elevator are free. I am definitely going back and will stay at Monte Carlo again. One tip - ask for a room close to the elevator, ours were quite a walk. Also ask for a room with views down the strip toward Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: Mid40sTravellers
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Monte Carlo over Labour Day weekend. It is a lovely hotel. Rooms were clean and the marble bathroom very nice. Very nice toiletries are also supplied. I was surprised though that a good sized bar of soap, barely used once, is removed and replaced with a new one each night. Seems such a waste! One bath bar would have lasted our three nights no problem. As for the plumbing noises - we did hear it occasionally but did not find it bothersome. Also our room area, at the end of the hall on the 29th floor, was very quiet and we never once heard any guests talking or coughing in rooms around us. As for the pool area. We went down about 9:15am on our first morning and a helpful attendant got us two chairs in a semi-shaded area of our choosing. It was away from the pool area, which was just a short walk to get to. However, as the previous reviewer said, forget about getting one of the "comfy" loungers. Not a big deal for us but worth noting - I would say make them all the same to satisfy all guests! If you decide to go to the pool later in the afternoon, expect huge crowds. I do not know if it is always this way or only because it was a holiday weekend but we did not enjoy it as much at that time of day. We were given a 2for1 coupon for the buffet but opted not to go when we saw the lineups at breakfast time. Also the 24-hour cafe had the same problem. Again maybe due to it being a holiday weekend? Cafe food was quite good as we went for a late night meal one night. We would stay at the Monte Carlo again but in hindsight would not choose a holiday period or even a weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with pool situation”
Reviews.Author: JLJRN
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 5 days at the Monte Carlo. We chose this particular hotel because of the reasonable rates, location on the strip, and the fact that you didn't need to walk through the casinos in order to take the elevators to your room (we traveled with 2 teens). Another selling feature were the "incredible 5 pools" which were raved about from the operator who took our inital reservation. The pool area turned out to be a major disappointment. The "wave pool" which my boys were most looking forward to was "broken" so the water had to be completely drained. There was no sign of fixing it in sight. This resulted in an already crowded "lazy River" to be packed like sardines. The "main pool" was on the small side as well and was situated in such a spot that the hotel shielded it from sun until late in the day. This was fine for the folks who enjoy shade, but for those who like the sun, it was a major disappointment. The only water area in a sunny location was the "baby pool". Prime lounges next to the pool also had to be "reserved" by tossing a towel on them by forming a line at 7:45 in the morning. I do give the Monte Carlo managment credit for upgrading our room to a suite for the unexpected inconvenience (after much complaining), but I still would have opted for functioning pools over the larger accomodations. The rooms themselves were clean and housekeeping prompt with any requests. The food court was convenient but not nearly as varied as the surrounding hotels. Breakfast at McDs everyday got tiresome and the bagel place was horrible. The Brew Pub however was a really nice spot for lunch which the kids enjoyed. We ate at the Market place one evening for Italian which was average. The Lance Burton magic show was cheesy but the boys really liked it and got to be assistants to the magician. I'm not a gambler so I really had no opinion as far as their casino went. It did seem alot less stuffy, less crowded and more sedate than the others which could be either a good or bad thing depending on your personal preferences. One last thing.....make sure you search the room completely before checking out because retrieving a left behind item is next to impossible. I left a favorite pair of sandals in the room which I believe were obscured under the beds dust ruffle. I called the "lost & Found" dept several times and never got an actual person-just a recording. I left a detailed message but no word back. Pretty sad how an employee could possibly want someone elses used sandals. In closing, if you're looking for a clean, good priced hotel in a convenient location, don't care about sunning by the pools, and plan on doing most of your dining at nearby hotels, then consider the Monte Carlo. You get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel...Great time...Great everything”
Reviews.Author: dmbsocal
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo is a great location for it's spot on the strip, price of rooms & restaurants. We moved to the Monte Carlo after a not so pleasant evening in another strip hotel. They have great rates with some pretty nice packages. The service at the front desk, ticket counter and every restaturant was excellent. Blackstones is a must for a great steak dinner. The best part for us was the brewery...make sure you go see Ozzie the bartender (Mon - Fri0 6pm to 2am. Great guythat really made the nights we were there fun. Only issue we saw was the pool could expand a bt more...but nice size the size of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Watch those Life Guards”
Reviews.Author: spanky11
Reviews.Content: My Family and I stayed at the Monty Carlo for five days. We had a wonderful time the food was excellent the staff you could tell all worked very hard. Are room was always clean. But I must tell you the Lifeguards are not professional at all. There was a woman whos child went missing in the pool and not one lifeguard came to help. It took vactioners to help look for her child and yes she was o.k. My friend and I watched these lifeguards for 3 days straight and could not beleive what we were seeing. They would gather together 4or 5 at a time and talk about what there weekend was like. Instead of watching the pool. We noticed and heard some of the male lifeguards talking about the women sunbathing. It was very Rude. So if you are bring young children watch them very closely. Because these Lifeguards are not professional, they shouldn't be aloud to were there t-shirts that say "Lifeguard". I hope the Monty Carlo Hotel address the issue as it is very important safty issue.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Monte Carlo for the first time after getting a great weekday rate there. Everything was very nice and a bit above average. I would recommend staying here as long as the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “The best so far”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughter and I stayed at the Monte Carlo 7 - 10 Aug for a quick little get away vacation and I must say that this is the best place I have stayed at yet. I have stayed at 6 other hotel/casino on the strip, but this one beats them all. The Casino was great, no smell of smoke and was very clean and roomy. Might have to go back there and try and get my money back soon. Me and the family spent a day at pool side, lots of shade to get out of the hot sun, a little small, but the hotel is known for it's money making casino, but still the pool was a nice escape from the hustle and bustle of the gambling. Ate at the Cafe for breakfast and was not upset with the quality of the food. Ate at the buffet on night for dinner and wasn't impressed, but then again, it's a buffet and all the other buffet's that I have eaten at were pretty much of the same quality. I liked the pub, my daughter and I went in when "Momma" was trying her luck at the slots, big pub, I highly reccommend the hot wings, not very hot, but really taste. No noise from other rooms and our room was on a smoke free floor so no smell of smoke. As for the noise from the plumbing, come on people, you are in a hotel, you will here little things like that. All in all, we had a great time and I would difinitely stay here again. We originally had reservations at the Imperial Palace and after reading reviews, was so happy I decided to change to the Monte Carlo. We visited the Imperial Palace to go to the Luau. The Casino is a "PIT", everything you read about the SMOKE, CROWD and NOISE is true...DO NOT STAY THERE. The Luau on the other hand was pretty good, good show and the food, well, once again, it was a buffet. I highly reccommend the Monte Carlo Hotel/Casino, will check in to this place again on my next trip. Good luck, and if you happen to find any of my money out there, let me know. :-) :-)...

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but could have been better”
Reviews.Author: legiswriter
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Monte Carlo from August 9-13 and overall had a good stay. Its not the best place Ive stayed at in Las Vegas, but it was ok for the money. The rooms are pretty nice, and the beds are really comfortable. Had a nice view of the Bellagio and the strip. The thin walls can be a problem. Athough we didnt hear too much of anyone else, its hard to feel romantic if youre worrying about people being able to hear everything going on in your room! Also even though we lucked out with quiet neighbors, I can see where it could be a big issue...one night I was up for an hour listening to a lady cough so loud it sounded like she was in bed with us!! I guess it depends on your location in the hotel because it seems like people either hear everything, or nothing. The breakfast buffet is just ok, but if you get one of those little packets of coupons with the two-for-one deal its worth it. The Brew Pub is awesome. Ate there twice and drank more beer than I can remember. The beers are brewed on site, and are super cheap compared to most places in Vegas. I really recommend the IPA and make sure you get a Giraffe! The tram to the Bellagio is one of the best features of the hotel. Its a godsend not to have to walk that huge space between the two hotels if you're trying to get down the other end of the strip. The pool situation is really as annoying as everyone says. You have to stand in line at 7:45 to get a chair anywhere near the three pools. And once you're out there its pretty irritating to watch one person lay 5 or 6 towels across a bunch of good chairs and then not come back out to the pool till 11. The hotel has a sign about considering a chair vacant after an hour, but thats not enforced as far as I could tell. The major complaint I have about the casino, and this might be a bonus for some people, is its not very crowded or fun. Its pretty and clean, but so vacant and quiet it doesnt have much atmosphere or a good vibe. I like the scene better at the Bellagio or the NY NY. Overall the Monte Carlo is just ok. I dont think Ill be staying there again because it was a little sedate for my taste, but like I said, for some people that might be a reason to stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Liked it (didn't LOVE it)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Visited August 2nd-8th 2005. Want to preface this by saying my wife and I got a good deal through Travelocity for airfare & six nights ($1,500 total) to stay at the Monte Carlo. So, wasn't expecting a Four Seasons-type experience, but we generally liked the hotel and its location. There were some things you should know before jumping in, however. Just wanted to give everyone a clear picture of what to expect. So here we go... -- Check-in/check-out, bell desk, valet, etc. were EXCELLENT. Service in general at the hotel was top-notch. These folks do work on tips, so have plenty of $1's available. Word to the wise on checking-in. We arrived at the hotel at 11am and got early check-in, but "rooms with a view" were not available until 3pm-5pm. Let them know early the day of if you want to wait for a room with a view, and stick around the casino until it becomes available. The bell desk will gladly hold your bags. -- Walls are PAPER THIN between rooms, so pray you don't have a loud couple of a family with kids (like we did) nextdoor while you're there. Plumbing is also loud. But, if you have earplugs from the plane ride there, throw 'em in your ears and it won't bother you. We figured that out the second night and it served us well from there on. -- Ate at the Brew Pub & the Buffet "Sunday Champagne Brunch". Was impressed with the Brew Pub (great food, ok prices, good beer and good atmosphere). The "Sunday Champagne Brunch" isn't even worth the $17 we paid per person. Selection is uninspiring, Omelettes stop after 11am, and when we asked the waitress for mimosa, she brought out a glass of champagne and a glass of O.J. and told us to mix it ourselves!!! -- Pool was busy, and we could only find a seat far away on the concrete. With 100+ degree temps, this was not comfortable. Guessing this is always the case, since we were in Vegas during "down season". Lazy river was overhyped. -- Casino isn't the best or most happening on the strip, and I found most of the dealers (minus the craps table) kind of snotty. If you get a snotty dealer, life's too short--find a different table. Craps lessons available at 11am except on Tues/Wed, take advantage of these. Another note on the casino--MGM Mirage recently (April) bought out the Monte Carlo and several other properties on the strip. However, the Players Club card from MGM Mirage hasn't carried over to these properties yet. Monte Carlo currently works on the One Club card. So, Im guessing these points will not transfer over when the switch happens? Airlines stick it to customers, why not casinos? If you want to START accumulating points for MGM Mirage, recommend you sign up for the card at the MGM Grand across the street of NYNY nextdoor. $25 minimum for any table games to count on your card, though...for some, that will be a bit steep. -- Location on the South Strip was great. Tram from Monte Carlo takes you to the Bellagio (center strip). From there, it's just a short walk to Aladdin, Paris, Caesars, Flamingo, Mirage, Venetian, etc. Monte Carlo is also just a short walk to MGM Grand and NYNY (nextdoor--the Times Sq Bar is a must-do) and Excalibur. From Excalibur, tram takes you to Mandalay Bay and Luxor. We casino-hopped our second day there, and found the location very central. You'll be walking a lot either way, so make sure to wear comfy shoes. Overall, it's a nice place to stay. However, wife & I will probably stay somewhere else next time we go just to change it up. We're in our mid-upper 20s and it was just not suited for our age group. More suited for families, I think.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheUnit
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed a week at the Monte Carlo. It was a great visit. The room was a nice size and the bed was very comfortable. I had read complaints about the walls being too thin and hearing noise from the neighbors. I experienced NONE of that. There was plumbing noise coming from the bathroom; however, by closing the bathroom door we didn't hear the noise. Ate at the Cafe for breakfast and one dinner. The breakfast was very good and the prices were in line for most hotel restaurants. For two of us it cost ~$30.00 with tax and tip. If you want cheaper you can go to Denny's. The dinner at the Cafe was not that good and would not recommend it. Ate at the Italian restaurant and Brew Pub for Dinner. Both of these places were excellent and not too pricey; ~$45-50 for two people. The staff was very friendly. All in all we had a wonderful time and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: hcs81m
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Monte Carlo August 4-7. The hotel far exceeded my expectations. There is a tram that connects the Monte Carlo to the Bellagio. The check in process was quick and easy. We had a room facing the MGM and NY NY. The casino was clean and not very smoky, and we could not hear noise from the other rooms as others have complained. The only complaint was the the hallway had a faint smell of mildew, but it was not in the rooms. You can't beat the location, service and ammenities for the price

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mbr1701
Reviews.Content: My family and I enjoyed the Monte Carlo. It is close to everything...I had read several reviews on this site concerning the Monte Carlo a fews weeks before we left for LAS. I read a few complaints about loud water pipes and noisy rooms. I don't know if these complainers stayed in the basement or what, but I heard none of this. To be very brief, check-in was fine, took us about 15 minutes. Hotel clerk, at our request, provided us with connecting rooms. Rooms were very clean and were kept clean during our stay. No complaints on room. Casino was clean and did not have the odor of cigarette smokers everywhere. Monte Carlo does a great job on ventilation. Breakfast buffet was average. Overall our positives sure did outweigh any negatives we had. Only negative I have, POOL!! It opens at 8:00 a.m. If you want a chair, get to pool before it opens and be prepared to stand in line!! We went to pool in morning just so we could get chairs for four people....I'm tellin ya, if you plan to spend time at pool in morning, take your room key and get to pool entrance no later then 7:45 a.m.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our honeymoon in Vegas and stayed at the Monte Carlo July 31-Agusut 4, 2005. We were very happy with our stay at the Monte Carlo. The location of the hotel is excellent. We had very easy access North to the Bellagio via a free tram. Just cross the street and we could go to the Aladdin and Paris. Head south and there was New York New York, Excalibur, Luxor, Mandalay Bay and across the street the MGM grand and Tropicana. All are within easy walking distance or use of a tram (free). We spent most of our time at these locations. We did walk to Caesars, Mirage and the Venetian but only spent a little time there. Our favorites were right across the street or next door. The hotel itself is very nice. The lobby is clean and open. Very easy access to everything in the hotel without having to walk through the casino much (expect to get to the buffet and a few restaurants). The staff is very friendly and helpful. Our room was a standard room but very nice. The bed is the BEST! It has a wonderful pillow top mattress and great pillows. We didn't go to Vegas to sleep, but when you do, you will enjoy it! The plumbing issue that all the other reviewers discuss is definitely there. I heard it mostly around 6 in the morning and was always able to fall right back asleep. Other noises occurred a few times, like a baby crying at midnight and a drunk couple fighting in the hall but I was always able to fall right back asleep because of the awesome bed! My husband slept though it all! We were a little disappointed by the pool. We had planned our honeymoon for Mexico but had to change plans at the last minute because of the hurricane. The pools in Vegas are nothing like Mexico so it's really not a big deal. We knew it wouldn't be the same and we know we probably wouldn't spend much time at the pool. However, that being said, we did want to spend a little time there and enjoy. The pool area is GREAT for families with kids and teens. Not so good for couples who just want to lay out for an hour or two. I went out one morning at 8:00 (when the pool opens), had to stand in a 10 minute line to get a towel (not a big deal), then found a chair way out in the sun and not by any of the pools. It was fine for a while but then I got way too hot and there is nothing every available in the shade. Unless you get up early, wait in line before it's even open. If you are looking for a hotel where you will swim all day this might not be the place for you, unless you are getting up early and staying there to "guard" your chairs. The pools are okay. Like I said, great for kids. There is a small wave pool and lazy river. The more adult pool is nice by also small. Overall, I really enjoyed our stay at the Monte Carlo. It's not crowded or busy and the location was key for us. We ate at the brewpub one evening and it was very good. Also shopped in a few of the shops located on the way to the tram, however, shopping is much better in Paris, Bellagio or Desert Passages in Aladdin. Since we were connected to the Bellagio via a short tram ride, I felt that we got to know that hotel as well. We ate, shopped and watched the fountain show with ease. Other sites we saw/went too: Star Trek Experience, Top of Eiffel Tower, Variety show "V" in the Aladdin, Buffet at the Aladdin, Todai restaurant (seafood and sushi buffet) in Desert Passages, shopping at the Fashion Show Mall, and played casinos at all hotels listed above. Please e-mail me with any questions! Would we stay at the Monte Carlos again.....? It's tough to say, for the price and location it was perfect but it would be fun to try something new. So, I would have to say it depends on our budget and length of stay.

Reviews.Title: “4 nights at the Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back form a four night stay at the Monte Carlo form July 29 - August 02, 2005. All total there were seven of us. Myself and my wife and two of our friends in one room and my Mom and Dad and sister in another. We stayed in room # 22204 and had a decent view of New York New York and MGM. My Mom and Dad's room had a view of everything north of the Monte Carlo, room # 29106. We absolutely loved the location, one of the best features of the hotel. We could walk almost anywhere, and we did. We walked all of the way to Wynn Las Vegas sunday, stopping at every hotel in between. Checkin was fairly easy for a Friday afternoon around 3 - 4 pm. I waited about 10 minutes only. Our room was clean and ready to go when we arrived. I have heard a lot of people knocking this hotel because they could hear everything form the plumbing to people in adjacent rooms. You could hear some stuff when you laid down to go to sleep, but if you were in the room talking or watching TV, it wasn't even noticeable. The tram to Bellagio is an awesome bonus feature. We ate one noght at the microbrewery, the food was decent, but the beer was not the best. Pool was very nice, especially the lazy river. My wife and sister said the wave pool was very crowded with kids. The casino is smaller thean most but very easy to get around in. The layout is pretty straight with table games in the middle and machies around the perimeter. Most of the dealers were pretty friendly and the craps lesson was pretty cool. I didn't go to the lesson, but afterward they made the craps table $2 for an hour. One thing i noticed was there were only two bars that i found that you could sit at and play video poker, i think they should add one more. my only other complaint was that we didn't win enough.

Reviews.Title: “Cool, would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Vegas and a stay at the Monte Carlo July 29 thru August 2. I was a little nervous once I read some of the reviews, and I have to say, I don't know what so may people were complaining about. Sure you could hear the neighbor's shower but it was not that big a deal and sure I could hear the neighbors talking but it certainly did not keep me awake at night. The room was not especially fancy but who spends a lot of time in the room in Vegas anyway? Because the Monte Carlo doesn't have as many gimmicks like so many of the other strip properties it's not as crowded which was really nice. We never waited more than 15 minutes to get in the buffet and the steakhouse was really pleasant, romantic experience. The location is central to lots of hotels on the strip. I really enjoyed the pool with the wave pool and lazy river. There were plenty of spots with shade and when it got pretty hot the wave pool and lazy river were perfect. The inner tubes were a little pricey at $12 per day but you could buy them at nearby CVS or Walgreens for half the price. Careful of the Mai-Tais served in a football- they were mixed pretty strong. Tasty though. We booked online and got some kind of summer escape special which came with coupons for but one get one free at the buffet, raft rentals spa admission, and discounts at some of the shops. It saved us a lot of money and the reservation agent disocunted the room a little more than was advertised. The staff was pretty friendly, check in and out was smooth, housekeeping never interfered when the "Privacy" sign was out which is REALLY important for a getaway with your significant other. I've heard horror stories of overzealous housekeeping staff interrupting intimate activity. That is where the thin walls were a bit of a problem-we could tell the neighbors in the next room were listening. The food prices were a bit steep, except the buffet. All in all, I enjoyed my stay and would stay there again. My biggest complaint is that we requested a non-smoking room and even though we were on a "non-smoking" floor, I smelled my neighbor's cigarrette smoke the ENTIRE time. And there is an ashtray directly beneath the sign outside the elevator that says "NON-SMOKING FLOOR." I should have complained but I didn't. Also no safes in the room, that's a bit odd. I've stayed in much less quality hotels and more quality rooms worldwide and have always had a safe of some sort. The front desk was really cooperative in printing out my room charges the night before and providing a late check out. I would recommend this hotel to stay and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fun time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just went on all expense paid trip last week of July '05 to Monte Carlo, 1st time going. We had a blast, great fun, great buffet, love the asian grill and the kids loved the pasta grill, great prices, not too busy, not too smokey. Lots of fun the pool is fabulous, lazy river is great! The pool not too crowded perfectly shaded so you can sit in the water all day, and the cocktail girl does her rounds. Decent room, very clean and comfortable, maid service great, front desk people great. Awesome views of the strip from our room, took great pictures! We really recommend the Monte Carlo, it's in the middle of everything, loved that the Casino actually smelled fresh and clean and not smokey!

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo gets a ration of "5" on a scale of "10"”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Sayed at the Monte Carlo 23-27 July 05. Fast check in and out. Casino is especially clean and they do a great job with smoke control. However, drinks are expensive if not gambling. OK food court and the food at the Caffe is good, but service was very slow. It took almost an hour to get our food. The breafast buffet needs improvement. Service was also poor there! Had to stop eating and wait on something to drink. Rooms are clean but just a little small. A/C has a hard time keeping it cool! Did hear pipes banging sometimes. Housekeeping does a very good job. Great pool area and loved the "Lazy River". OK deal for your money. I plan on checking out other hotels for my March trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing wrong with the Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: Eamosbabe
Reviews.Content: I have just got back from spending 8 nights at the Monte Carlo and enjoyed every second of the experience. After reading the previous reviews I was really concerned about the banging noises some guests had experienced from the plumbing, but the noises really did not bother or wake me at any time. The pool was nice, not huge by any means, and you did have to be there early to get a decent seat. The only issue there was that there was a queue every morning to get the good seating, and what was happening was that some guests were leaving their towels at 8am and then not coming back for hours on end - really annoying! Food was grand, we tried loads of different restaurants in various hotels for a bit of variety. The Casino was well laid out - lost a fortune as to be expected. The rooms were basic, but very clean and the cleaning staff were A1 with replenishing towels and keeping the room tidy. Overall I did enjoy the Monte Carlo, but would like to try somewhere else next time as you have such a variety of hotels to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Great Anniversary at the Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: Daybreak57
Reviews.Content: We booked a trip to Las Vegas to celebrate my parents 50th Wedding Anniversary and stayed at the Monte Carlo from July 11th - July 14th. This was our first time staying at the Monte Carlo and we were not disappointed. The hotel was wonderful! We arrived around 11:00 a.m. and were suprised that we were able to immediately check in! Our rooms were really nice too. When we contacted room service to purchase a "special gift" for the anniversary couple; they were wonderful in that regard too. Everyone from the bell desk employees to the maid staff were super! The Monte Carlo is in a great location too. I would highly recommend this hotel and plan on staying there on our future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Casino”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had absolutely no complaints about this hotel, though we were a little nervous after reading some of the reviews. It is in a central location and fairly easy to walk to just about anywhere. We liked the fact that it isn't a big tourist attraction because the hotel and casino were both quieter and less crowded than any other we visited. We were always glad to get back to the Monte Carlo after visiting other places. The Spa was wonderful and so were the pools. The room was very nice, though not something that would take your breath away. The view from the room was extrordinary. Service was all you could expect and employees were friendly and cooperative. When we go to Las Vegas again, we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Little Known Gem!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We decided to get married in las Vegas and chose the Monte Carlo and were not disappointed, in fact we were highly impressed. We stayed in the Monaco Suite which was very clean and we heard toilets flushing but that is because we were high up and well it needs force to get where it needs to go! I am a very light sleeper and I did not have a hard time, who goes to Vegas to sleep anyways? There are a lot of kids by the pool but that is because it is a GREAT pool and well, kids gravitate towards pools. We had a blast, you can only gamble so much so during the day we hung out in the lazy river which was our favorite. Blame the parents for bringing their kids to Vegas, not the hotels for accomodating them. The beauty salon did a fabulous job on my hair and the chapel was great and for a great price! We are going again in September and cannot wait!

Reviews.Title: “Super Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We go to Vegas four or five times a year and stay at different locations. The Monte Carlo was grest. Check in was less then 10 minutes all the services were conducted in a very professional manor. Whats not to like, location, great food, fun atmosphere. If your going to Vegas consider Monte Carlo you won't be disappointed. For the money best on the strip

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: dmills1956
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a friend from Macau (near Hong Kong) July 12-14th. A/C unit had a diffiicult time keeping the room cool. It never did shut off, the thermostat was set for 70, but when it's 115 outside... I'm not complaining. Had a room on the 29th floor faciing the across the strip - could see from the MGM down to Paris and a bit beyond. Had looked at other properties around town, but got this for a great rate of $75. Check in went smooth, check out was handled via TV and they emailed me a bill. Upon checkout Friday morning the escalator to the parking level was under repairs and you had to hoof it across the roadway and up the elevator. It seemed strange that there were no signs in the parking garage or the elevator telling you what floor the skybridge was on. Lost all my money... but I had a great time :)

Reviews.Title: “Stay Somewhere Else”
Reviews.Author: travelqueen4
Reviews.Content: Stay somewhere else, this is no place to rave about at all. I only stayed here because my flight was cancelled and I was "referred" by the place we stayed at all week (they were full and we couldn't get back our room). Well needless to say the man who checked us in was strange acting, he gave us a smoking room (requested non) and the noisy pipes and hollow walls in this place are terrible ! And not to mention the non working magazine size a/c unit that runs 24/7 just to maintain a breathable temperature in the room. And their are no fans either folks. So many people were complaining of the same problem with the air units being so tiny and not much air coming out of them. The 3 days spent here were not good, I couldn't wait to get out of the room it was so miserable trying to sleep with all the pipes banging and all you could hear! They do have a nice casino, nice shops and restaurants. But they didn't put enough into their rooms that's for sure ! It seems they went all out ritz on their hotel part and forgot about the rooms. I would not stay here again. Not for any price, it's just not worth it. We stayed at the Excalibur for a week and loved it, that place was just super all the way around.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - recommended to anyone”
Reviews.Author: MN_Bill
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo for 2 days in Mid July. The check in was very smooth and at 11:00am we were able to get into our room - a rarity for most hotels in vegas. The room was well appointed with great furnishings, quality bed, nice large bathroom with a vanity. No tub in these rooms for those of you who like to lay in a tub. The AC system worked fine but seemed to keep the room warmer than the thermostat would indicate. The Casino is especially clean and appeared smoke free or there weren't very many smokers. The food court was nice for a quick snack if you don't want to spend a huge amount of money or time on food. We also went to the little Italian place on the main floor....Caffe ???. It was fantastic food. I had the wood oven fired Pizza and my wife had the lasagna - both were top notch in our opinion. Drinks were expensive in my opinion. Its been a few years (14) since I was in vegas and I recall the good old days of cheap everything. Its really changed, but the Monte was a great value for the price. My only real complaint other than drink prices is the sound of the water and the water pipes while we were in the room. They were very loud and if you are a light sleeper I'd suggest getting ear plugs. I showered early - 4-5 in the morning and its loud. The toilet is even loud. We had some minor problems with our sink that wouldn't drain at times, but then all of a sudden the water would dissapear in seconds, so I don't know what was going on.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitly be back!”
Reviews.Author: california_girl1972
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for our 10th wedding ann and had a wonderful time. We were a bit nervous because we had already booked our room prior to reading the reviews and were worried from all the negative feedback we read. We are gald to say that for us none of it was true. We did not encounter any of the noise problems so many posted on and we found the staff very friendly. Check in was a breeze also. No problems with any of the pools either. All in all we had a great time. Living in Cali, we do tend to visit Vegas quite often and have stayed at different hotels and this one is a keeper

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in late June and thought it was great. The location is perfect, the price great and loved our room and the pool area. I cant understand why some people are finding fault with this place. It's no more noisy than any other hotel i've stayed at, the room was large (by European standards) the pool area was great with a good mix of sunny areas and shady areas for those of us who burn in the Nevada sun (looking into the New York New York pool area from their rollercoaster it was completely in shade from the surrounding buildings!), all the pools were working, and the best thing was the lack of crowds in the hotel. Because it has no big gimmick - New York, snow leopards, lions, volcanos etc - the place isn't overrun with tourists just visiting. We went to the Mirage to meet up with a friend and couldnt believe the crowds of people in the foyer and all over the place. I'd deffinately book here again

Reviews.Title: “Great for a family of four”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When you travel with kids, the pool is important! The lazy river and the wave pool were big hits!!! The swimming pool and child pool were good, too. They had a food court designed for kids and restaurants for the rest of us. A Tram connected the hotel to the Bellagio and NY NY was right next door. Several times we could hear noise from the adjoining rooms (they probably heard us, too). I've stayed in Vegas many times, I'd put this hotel slightly above Treasure Island and well above MGM for a family vacation. No problems with the Casino at all. $69 for our weeknights and $119 for the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo: Value for the Money”
Reviews.Author: Numbers_Guy70
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Monte Carlo at the end of April/beginning of May 2005 for three nights. We had picked the Monte Carlo based on price (less than a lot of the other strip hotels) and location (it was our first time in Vegas and we wanted to stay on the strip). My thoughts: Location: Perfect. Central to everything. Walked from Mandalay Bay to the Wynn. MGM, NYNY, Paris, Bellagio, Venetian are all very close. Accommodation: We had spent the three previous nights at the JW Marriott, so just about any room was going to feel small. The rooms are basic, but comfortable and clean. No great frills, but no bad surprises either. Service: Very good. We checked in early (about 1 p.m.) and were given a room with a Mountain View. Our attempts to nap (mid-afternoon) were thwarted by very noisy neighbours so we asked for another (preferably strip-view) room. The front desk sent someone up to meet us with a key for a 16th floor strip-view room. Check out was also very convenient. Amenities: The pool is a zoo. While the wave pool and lazy river are nice in theory, neither is all that exciting (air mattresses cost extra). The day we lay out by the pool, there were a million people around. The redeeming feature was the big Rum Runner (served in a plastic football-shaped vessel). Didn't eat at any of the MC restaurants (save for breakfast at McDonalds and at the bagel place - where they have awesome bagel sandwiches - highly recommended). Otherwise, ate at the Wolfgang Puck restaurant in Venetian, the Chinese place in MGM, and RumJungle at Mandalay Bay (all three of which I would recommend highly). Casino: Casino is ok. I preferred the casinos at the MGM, NYNY, and Luxor. The casino felt a bit clasutrophobic to me. DO order the beers from the MC brewery though - one advantage this casino has over all others on the strip. Overall, if you're looking for a decent, reasonably-priced strip hotel in a great location, I would recommend the Monte Carlo. It is by no means top of the line. But it is what it is.

Reviews.Title: “Classy Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a great place for adults. It's a lot less crowded in the casino and buffet and you don't have drunken partyers running amok. The location is great and you have the free monorail to Bellagio. The pool area is beautiful. If you have to get crazy, go to the brewery.

Reviews.Title: “Would never stay here again; rooms dirty & need updating”
Reviews.Author: Slinky1
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in early April 2005 at the Monte Carlo hotel. The old adage "you get what you pay for" would certainly apply here. Our room had a burned-out light and I saw a used band-aid on the floor under the desk. (Gross!) (I wouldn't have seen it if I didn't put my shoes there!) Four days later, band aid was still in place....so I'm guessing that housekeeping doesn't do a great job vacuuming. We traveled with my husband's sister, who had a room in which the curtain near the windows was slightly ripped and hanging off of two of the hooks. We originally booked a room with a king-sized bed and got one with a queen-sized one instead. (We're not fussy about stuff like that) so we didn't bother to say anything. The pool's lazy river ride was also closed. The pool was not really in the sun and very small; you had to get there early to get a spot in the sun. On our next trip, we will DEFINITELY stay elsewhere. On a positive note, the brew pub was good for a burger and beer, and had live entertainment. The breakfast buffet was decent, and the casino wasn't too smokey.

Reviews.Title: “beware the noise”
Reviews.Author: freed0m5
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our trip and stayed at the Monte Carlo. Previously before booking at the hotel I carefully read each of the posts regarding the Monte Carlo and the biggest concern I had prior to leaving was the noise factor. But having stayed in Vegas in various hotels over the last five years and having experineced no problems in this area we thought we would take the chance. Unfortunately at the Monte Carlo there was a great deal of noise. The plumbing was terrible, From about 6 am every morning until we left our room for breakfast, we heard nothing but toilets flushing and showers running. We also shared a connecting door to the next room. The first couple of days was fine, but then a younger couple checked in. I have to say this, late at night to three am or so, we heard It all, including the profanity used during It. It was so loud that it woke both my husband and myself out of a sound sleep. This was bad enough every night but would be a real concern if we had small children in the room. The hotel room itself was small and the wardrobe was off its hinge on one side making it impossible to hang our clothes up.The bathroom needing caulking around the tub, and some days we received soap, shampoo, lotions etc. But only one day of the five did we get the mineral bath, or the mouth rinse. But having said all that, the hotel staff were great, very pleasant and efficient. The layout at the hotel makes it easy to enter and exit without feeling you have walked miles to do so. The tram to the Belligio was the best. It put you at the centre of the strip within minutes. All in all my review is beware of the noise, but if the price is right go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, might stay here again but...”
Reviews.Author: hawaiisun
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for a couple of nights and decided on this location because it seemed central and accessible to other good hotels. We arrived late (around 11:00 p.m.) and had booked online with their web site three weeks ago requesting a king room with non-smoking floor and when we arrived at the checkin counter we were told there no king rooms available that were non-smoking but did we want to see the smoking room anyway--I said yes, but as soon as I entered the room I couldn't stand the stale smell of smoke so we went down to request another room--were told there was only a handicapped room available that was non-smoking but with a king bed. They said the only difference was the bathroom so I said yes. It was on the 25th floor with a good view of Bellagio and part of strip--the room seemed small--no coffeemaker in room just a tv two chairs and bed. There was no safe in the room either which I found surprising. The decor seemed nice though, I thought it would be fine for two nights. If it was any longer I would want a larger room with more amenities in my room. I have four complaints about the hotel and room though--the pillows are tiny and very cheap quality and lumpy. We only got three very small pillows so I asked for a few more hoping they would be in better shape but no luck they were in same condition. Also, the towels in bathroom were extremely worn out, very thin and rough like very old towels. I would say the towels by the pool were in much better shape! I noticed when we arrived there was no bellman available that I could see, it would have been nice to have ice brought into our room and told about amenities about the hotel, etc. The ice machine on our floor (only ONE) was broken one day and working so poorly the next day I had to go down one floor to get ice! After looking in a couple of other fancy hotels in the strip, I would probably book a different hotel if it is only a bit more to pay. This hotel is probably good for people with kids, because of the wave pool and lazy river style pool. There were definitely kids everywhere also because of the long weekend holiday. The really good restaurant I liked in the hotel was the Market Caffe--the thin crust pizzas are excellent, as are the salads! The portions are very good value for the price. Service was good as well.

Reviews.Title: “A nice stay (but I do understand some of the complaints I've seen)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently spent five days at the Monte Carlo and were pleased overall with the stay. First, the staff did a great job of making sure we had the adjoining rooms we requested (eventhough we weren't there early for check-in). The rooms are large and they were very clean. The bathrooms were a good size. We did notice that the plumbing did make a fairly loud sound whenever our toilet was flushed. My sister and her family had a room on our floor (12th) and said they could hear water running in the pipes all night their first night there. They changed rooms the next day and didn't experience the problem any longer. Our kids enjoyed the wave pool and the lazy river. They also enjoyed playing video games in the room, which was made possible by a very helpful engineer at the hotel "fixing" our TV to make the hookup possible. We called on the staff for things like that (getting extra towels, for example) and were helped pretty much immediately in each instance. The ambiance of the hotel isn't what you find in some of the others on the strip, but the prices are cheaper for the rooms, so perhaps you are getting what you pay for. It was awesome to have a CVS and Walgreens within an easy 5-minute walk. The ESPN zone was right next door, too, and if you have children you have to give it a try. The duckpin bowling was a huge hit with our family. We then walked about 20 yards and ate at a New York style Pizzeria inside New York-New York (which is where the entrance to the ESPN zone is located). A whole pie was only $15, which is quite a bargain in today's Las Vegas. The food isn't cheap like it was 20 years ago when the wife and I were there. I've seen some talk about the $5 tables at the Monte Carlo. To be honest, we didn't see many of those. Sometimes in the early afternoon, it seemed as though a few tables would be set for $5, but by 5 p.m., the minimum was typically $10. But that seemed to be pretty typical for that end of the strip (and perhaps the strip as a whole.) We went to New York, New York, Excalibur and a few others one evening and found only a couple of $5 blackjack tables (all of which were packed). The real nice thing about the Monte Carlo casino was it didn't smell smoky at all. Those who are saying that it's centrally located, however, must have a different version of cental than I do. In my opinion it is almost located at the very end of one portion of the strip. We walked for at least an hour (and probably more) to get to Treasure Island so our kids could see the pirates battle (DO NOT DO THIS if you want to see pirates battle!!!!), and Treasure Island still wasn't even halfway down the strip. If you are looking for centrally located then the Venetian, Flamingo, Wynn or Treasure Island would probably be closer. One thing to know (that I wish we had known earlier) is you can drive your car to virtually any casino and park in the free guest parking. We were under the impression that it applied only to the parking garage at the Monte Carlo (since that was where we were staying) until the last day of our trip. Give the wax museum a try. The interactive stuff is a lot of fun. My daughter "married" George Clooney; my wife got next to Hugh Hefner in his Playboy bed; my sons scored on a layup against Shaq (and the crowd roared) and the gallery voiced its approval when I sank a putt with Tiger and Arnold Palmer watching. The hotel was nice and we have no huge complaints, but we will probably give another one a try the next time we go.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Love_Florida_Sun
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I have just returned home today from a very special Monte Carlo experience. When you first arrive from the airport, your shuttle, limo,or taxi will drop you off at the back entrance of the hotel. As soon as you walk in, you will see a long counter of stations for check in and check out. We were greeted courteously, the service was fairly expedient and we were not rushed during either check in or check out. As you walk past the counter, you will see elevators for each part of the towers of the hotel. Our room was 26313 with a perfect view of the strip and the mountains in the background. Rooms are large with either interactive Internet on the TV, or a special connection for those with laptops. The fee for interactive Internet service (viewed through the television screen with a special keyboard provided by the hotel) is $5.99 for about 2 hours. Using this equipment makes it easy to surf the net, learn more about the shows, and correspond using E-mail all in the comfort of your room. The room is temperature controlled. We kept our thermostat at a comfortable 76 degrees and it was great--it also offers the centigrade conversion factor, so you will never be too hot or too cold in the rooms. Speaking of room, I was told by a seasoned Las Vagas girlfriend that the Monte Carlo offers the most comfortable beds on the strip. We all agreed. As far as noises, not one of us heard them. Yes, the commode will flush with a rather startling sound of rushing water, but only for less than 5 seconds. On the ground floor, the casino area is about 1/2 mile long and there are some nice places to eat along the right side. We found the Cafe the most reasonable with a versitle menu. The night life is just beyond that and there is live entertainment and dancing. This hotel is not as confusing as the others we visited during our stay, but every night we were glad to soak up the comfort of our rooms and get a good night's sleep. The bathroom is spacious with a tub/shower combination and elongated counter space around the sink. Let's leave the room and visit the pools. The decor is tropical with fountain features and a tunnel leading to one of the areas. The lazy river is relaxing. You will see tubes of all colors and sizes as you float along. Cost for renting a raft from the hotel is $12.50/day (24 hours) There is a delightful wave pool just to the left of the lazy river and further left is a free-form heated pool less crowded and better for adult swims. If hot tubs are your thing, try the one within the complex of the pool area. It's hot and bubbly for easing muscle pain from all the activities on the strip. All in all, the Monte Carlo offers exceptional guest relations service, a wide variety of dining choices ranging from McDonalds to the more elete, and a little Hudson News store for daily papers, munchies, water, and several souvenier items. Drink lots of water in Las Vegas! The temperatures soar into the hundreds and rose all the way to 112 on Saturday, July 2. This hotel is located on the strip and after taking a stroll through the casino area, you will be on South Las Vegas Boulevard. The managable walk through the casino is long, but not nearly as spacious as the Bellagio, or MGM, or Paris. If you turn left you will see a CVS Pharmacy on the corner, if you turn right you can walk to New York. Crossing the streets in Vegas is tricky. There are only a few spots that permit crossing. Look for the light once you enter the Las Vegas Strip. Those lights are the only permitted spots to cross. After a long day on the strip, you might want to consider the spa offered at the Monte Carlo. Everything you need to have a wonderful time is available through this lovely hotel. A tram to the Bellagio is worth taking from the Monte Carlo--just for the experience of seeing the lovely water show. The sound of rushing water dancing in the pool at the Bellagio captivates the immagination and is magnificant to see, the best part, it's only a 3 minute tram away from the Monte Carlo. Easy access to everything in the hotel, good food, great service and 3 lovely pools makes this a 4 on my review. Now that they have been bought by MGM. the hotel has even better things on their horizon. Thank you for you patience as you read my rather extensive review of the best kept secrete on the stripl

Reviews.Title: “Had stayed previously, but never again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Monte Carlo with my girlfriend and was actually quite disappointed. I've stayed at the Monte Carlo before, and actually liked the hotel previously, but my last stay pretty much has convinced me that I will not stay there again. Particular problems: 1) I had made my reservation > 1 month in advance, and had requested a room with a king size bed. I realize that the requests will "attempt to be honored, but are not guaranteed". However, I arrived at the hotel around 9PM and all such rooms were gone. In order to get what I wanted, I was effectively forced to upgrade the room at the cost of $35, $50 and $50 dollars for the 3 nights of my stay. Of course, I suppose this is to be expected, but it has not happened to me before at any other hotel (and I've stayed in a lot of them!). Further, at the final price per night, I likely could have stayed at another more expensive hotel to begin with (and the room was fairly pricey to begin with, given the trip was on a weekend). 2) Given the upgrade mentioned above, we ended up on the 32nd floor which is where the suites are located (and you need to use your room card in the elevator to even get to this floor). So, I expected a pretty nice room with good amenities. The room was good (the bed was great), but the toilet did not flush all that well. Further, the shower head was particularily bad. It was designed for someone about 5'6" (I am 5'10" and had to crouch in order to get my head underneath...). It was not "detachable/handheld" which is something I like, although other rooms in the hotel do have "detachable/handheld" shower heads (I know, because I had previously been in such a room). 3) I got charged room service (only $8. but still...) for water that apparently got drank. However, there was no water left in the room by room service the first two nights of the stay (i.e., there was no water in the room when I arrived, and there was none left the second night). For the third night, there was water, but I did not use it as I had walked across the strip to CVS and bought my own water. Fine, I had to pay for an upgrade, but the room was nicer than the normal ones. However, being charged for something I did not use is pretty unacceptable. 4) Upon checkout, I would not say that the person helping me was very friendly at all. (The person helping to check me in was, however, helpful). I really got the impression that since my stay was over, they no longer cared. Bad for repeat business... As I mentioned at the beginning, I have stayed at the Monte Carlo before. I liked the hotel, and that is why I chose to stay there this time (I consider it to be a pretty good hotel in a good location). However, I was not impressed at all with this last visit. For what the stay ended up costing, I am sure I could have stayed in another hotel (e.g., I've stayed at Paris which has much nicer rooms and is in a really good location too - I had checked prices at Paris before booking my trip and a standard room was about $20. more per night that the Monte Carlo. However, given I paided > $35. more/night for the upgrade at the Monte Carlo... I would also comment that the standard room at Paris was as nice as the upgraded Monte Carlo room and has a much nicer bathroom compared to the Monte Carlo upgrade with a great shower). Given the number of very good hotels in Las Vegas located on the strip, I really don't think I will ever stay at the Monte Carlo again. I'd recommend that if there is another hotel within a few dollars of your budget such as Paris, Treasure Island, etc. that I would pick one of them first any day.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot for convenience (esp. w/children)”
Reviews.Author: hogandi
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Monte Carlo. -But our reasons why may be different from most: we loved it's simplicity and convenience. We toured many of the larger hotels w/themes during our stay and were thrilled that we were at the MC. We had 2 adjoining rooms (3 children). Plenty of room--rooms were spacious and clean. No noise issues as previously reviewed (in fact we had much worse noise problems at the Flamingo). What we especially loved was the ease of getting around. No 10-20 minute walks through casinos to get to shops, pool and eating. Our kids-15,12, and 7 loved the lazy river and wave pool. The pool area is a bit cramped, but this also makes it easy to navigate. We're not fancy food eaters, so we loved the convenience of a reasonably priced food court (McD, Nathans, etc). We also thought the Brew Pub was great (live music). Also loved the convenience of walk to CVS or Walgreens to stock a small cooler in room. Tram to Bellaggio was great. Staff was friendly and efficient. Great location, Great Price.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: sune
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Monte Carlo, June 7-16, in a non-smoking room with a king bed, on the fifth floor facing the Bellagio and the pool area. Monte Carlo was very nice, the room was big enough for me, it was clean and smelled very nice, the water pressure in the shower was very good, and the elevators were fast and many. I could of course hear the water pipes and hear people in the hallway when they past my door but it were nothing that kept me awake or disturbed me. I hardly heard anything from my neighbors as well. However, one evening when I came back to the hotel room it was no water at all during the night. It would have been nice to have taken a shower after been gambling all day but it was not such a big deal. With the tram to Bellagio Monte Carlo has a good location, the casino was easy to navigate and had one of the best shoe blackjack games in Las Vegas. I am pleased with my stay at the Monte Carlo and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “we'll go back!”
Reviews.Author: trailmix
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights and it was a very enjoyable visit. We would gladly stay there again. The rooms are large and clean, with the best mattresses and pillows. The pool area is very nice with a mix of shade and sun. The lazy river is a nice addition but the wave pool is more for the kids. We ate in the Brew Pub - very nice and reasonable and the cafe (for a free breakfast - okay). Casino was nice, not overwhelming, dealers were friendly and drinks were easy to get (more so in the evening) and it was nice to get the brew pub beers in the casino. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Generally good, but a few problems”
Reviews.Author: mikepowie
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Vegas (second trip out there) and stayed part of my trip at the Monte Carlo. All in all, it was an enjoyable experience, but I did have some qualms. First, the positives: check in was both fast and pleasant. The woman who checked us in (a few hours early) found rooms on the same floor as friends we were traveling with. No kings were available, so rather than wait, we took two queens, which was fine. As with most staff in Vegas, very professional and friendly. The casino is superb. As others have commented, it’s not smoky at all; indeed, it has a pleasant smell. Friendly dealers, great blackjack rules, especially for a strip casino. We were able to find a $5 table with no problem during the middle of the week. Though I am not a roulette player, my friends insist the action there is good, though they were a little disappointed that the only single-zero table was in the high-roller section. The pool was of course a little crowded, with a few too many badly behaved children, but it was nice. Lots of shade from the trees (not a bad thing in Vegas), and different pools to from which to chose. Again, great service. My main complaint with the Carlo was the room itself. The exteriors of the hotel are nice: elevators, hallways, etc. But the room was a bit of a letdown. The rooms look older than they are. And as others have mentioned, it is noisy. I had read the reviews on Trip Advisor before arriving and thought that since I live in a townhouse with noisy neighbors, I would be fine. Well, the voices from other rooms aren't terrible (mainly loud people in hall in my experience), but the plumbing was very loud. If someone showers in the middle of the night, you will hear it. The bathroom wasn't as clean as I would have hoped for; and after showering, there was 5 inches of water in the tub. My friends' room smelled of smoke, though ours did not. They also had problems with the slow drain. True, I did not complain about this, as we were only there two days, but given the complaints about this (from reading reviews alone), it's hard to imagine they are unaware of these problems. As a point of comparison, we stayed at the Stratosphere during the second part of the trip (to save money during the weekend), and were extremely happy with their rooms, which had none of these problems mentioned above. Of course, location matters too, and the Carlo has them beat hands down. All in all, I was not upset about the rooms, and we paid around $89/night, which is great for its location. I wouldn't advise against the Carlo, as there are some real benefits to it, but I will likely try a few other places before returning.

Reviews.Title: “Just Right”
Reviews.Author: smileyleonard
Reviews.Content: We stayed @ the Monte Carlo on 6/15/05-6/18/05 ( 4 days ) and everything about the Monte Carlo is " Just Right"! Hotel and rooms ( we accupied 4 rooms) are clean. Pool area very nice. Location is perfect. We enjoyed our stay. One last thing, I notice hardly anybody winning on slot machines. So play smart and know your limits.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After staying at MGM, Ballys, Mirage, Alladin and Excaliber I must say Monte Carlo is now my favorite. The others were great all around but the Monte Carlo was the best. The beds are so comfy, bathrooms clean and bright, lots of water pressure. Very little outside noise The staff are very quick to respond and seemed happy to help with whatever you need. The valet was organized and car arrived within 5 - 7 min. Food in all the restaraunts was of good value and freshly prepared. Smell of smoke very minimal and kids running around hardly any. Pool was a little crowded, but so much fun in the wave pool and drinks were flowing. Not been to a hotel yet that didnt have some crowding. Slots were pretty loose on 2 of our trips and tight on one visit. They seem to be getting tighter all over Vegas. I would say that any place you stay in Vegas if you go enough times you will eventually have a few things go wrong at any hotel you stay at even the most expensive ones. I just know as many times as Ive stayed at all of these hotels, Ive never had a really bad experience at any of them. Just minor annoyances that I would complain about if annoying enough and allways get compensation in some form according to how big the problem was. Monte Carlo is just my favorite. Cheers.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: MAS007
Reviews.Content: Just to set the scene we are a couple in our forties and stayed at the MC from 30th May for 4 nights. We were dropped off by the airport shuttle bus ($5 each) at the reception entrance at the rear of the hotel. The reception area is spacious and very grand and unlike several other strip hotels, you do not have to travel through the casino to reach it. We arrived around 5pm, there was no waiting at all and we were greeted by a friendly member of staff. When I asked about a strip view room we were offered one with 2 queen size beds. We had already decided that we wanted the luxury of the king size bed so went with the pool and mountain view which was fine. The elevators are close to reception and are arranged in three groups of six for every 10 floors making a total of 18, hence again no waiting. Our room on the 20th floor was a good size with nice furniture, good size bathroom and a bed to die for, it was sooo comfortable! We left a tip of $2-3 per day and our room was kept spotless by the housemaid with a plentiful supply of toiletries. In terms of the dreaded noise issue mentioned in other reviews; yes the plumbing from adjacent rooms can be heard at times and if you had a noisy neighbour I imagine the noise could transmit through the connecting door. However we didn’t experience any problems at all. We ate at the MC micro brewery first night where the food was good at reasonable prices although we did have to wait 30 minutes for a table only to find the pub was only half full! (our only real complaint). Another night we ate Italian at the Market city café where the food was very good with excellent service. We used the food court on occasions when we were pushed for time and it was fine. We also ate one morning at the buffet breakfast, which was more than adequate for the price of $10.95 (+ tax and tip). However if you want a real treat try Bellagio or Paris. The choice of buffet breakfast at both of these hotels is tremendous for around $13-$15 per person, Paris having the edge. The MC pool area has a good mix of sun and shade in the afternoon (more shade in the morning). The wave pool is good fun as is the lazy river. You can hire the rubber rings for the lazy river for $12 or buy your own for $6 at the CVS store next door. Towels are obviously provided free to residents at the poolside. The “bed hoggers” are kept in check by the pool attendants who return the sunbeds to the pile if they have not been used for an hour. A few other general points, the hotel is in a very good location on the strip in terms of visiting other hotels. However if you want to avoid the heat and hustle and bustle of the strip (it does get very busy in the evening) then take the automated tram to Bellagio which then connects through to Ceasars Palace. The tram is located behind the microbrewery and runs every few minutes. The casino is however easy to navigate through and it only takes about 5 minutes to walk from the strip to the elevator and upto your room. The hotel also has a Dollar car rental office where we picked up our convertible for an unforgettable trip around California – but that’s another story. Overall we were very pleased with the Monte Carlo and would highly recommend it. Whilst not in the same bracket as the Bellagio etc it remains a classy hotel and for the price we paid of $69/79 a night it is excellent value for money. Also those pillow top beds have to be experienced, enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Don't judge a hotel or book by its cover!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Granted the Monte Carlo is a clean, upscale and conveniently located hotel, all that is forgotten when you only get one hour of sleep a night. We paid for an upgrade upon check-in and walked into what we thought was a beautiful suite. Lots of room, 1.5 bathrooms and a great view, unfortunatley we didn't realize how poor the room was until we tried to get to sleep the first night.
