I heard every single word coming out of our neighbours suite, I heard him cough, I knew what TV show he was watching and he wasn't being unusually loud at all! On top of all this the plumbing situation is a nightmare, you hear every shower go off and every toilet get flushed. My wife will tell you that I'm a sound, deep sleeper, heck my alarm clock barely wakes me up, but this was unbareable. We called down to complain and we're told by the night manager Mr. Micheal Dellaney that he was shocked to hear of such a problem and hasn't come across this in his 9 years of working there (Can you spell B*S*?). He said all the suites are identical so that would be the deal wherever we would be moved. He only offered to remove $35/night from our bill for the first of 4 nights or down grade us to a standard room and hope for something better. Neither solution was acceptable and I filed a complaint with the MGM-Mirage group of hotels. It's our 1 year annivesary, we're in Las Vegas and I've received better service from Comfort and Holiday Inn's. I could barely sleep at all that night and my second day was a write off b/c I had to sleep during the day. Fortunately the official hotel manager Brian Cotto stepped up to the plate and upgraded us to an even nicer suite that had no neighbours on either side and even had a whirlpool tub. Thanks to Brian I'm giving this trip a 2 star otherwise it would have barely received a 1 star. I would not stay here again and I would advise you to go to a hotel where you'll be able to get some rest, in Las Vegas you'll do more walking than in Europe and you'll need that rest to enjoy the trip. VIVA LAS VEGAS!!

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: Ash2005
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Monte Carlo for two nights this past week. The hotel is opulent without being overpowering. The lobby is beautiful with marble floors and huge chandeliers. The large sculptures at the entrance have an Italian/French flair to them. However, this was the only hotel that had fountains on the outside that weren't running. We managed to get a great deal and then upgraded to one of the upper floors, we were on the 21st floor. The room was a nice size and the bed comfortable. The sound proofing wasn't as bad as others mentioned and it didn't bother us too much. We did however feel the absence of a coffee maker in the room. There was also a $10.95 high speed internet surcharge per 24 hour period. Self parking was free. We didn't use the pool so were not aware of any problems there. We were given a two for one breakfast buffet coupon. The buffet was one of the best I've ever had and a good deal. If you're looking for a quick bite the food court downstairs has some cheap eats. There is a good variety of restaurants to choose from for dinner. The Casino is big but not overcrowded. I would definitely recommend the Monte Carlo. Our trip was comfortable and good value for money, specially compared to other hotels in this league.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: pamypete
Reviews.Content: Again the TripAdvisor website came up trumps whilst I was searching the intricacies of all the hotels on offer in Las Vegas. Stayed there for 4 nights and so glad we did. Our room was superb and certainly value for money. We asked for a quiet room and certainly got that; the view was not good but who cares about a view when you are in Las Vegas? The hotel was well laid out and having the micro-brewery in-house certainly suited our UK taste buds! The pool area is a bit "concretey" but, if you just want a couple of hours in the sun, then perfectly OK. The pool is small but has a wave machine which is great if you like that sort of thing! Our room was clean and the king-size bed was extremely comfortable. However, beware of using the telephone! We had to make a call to the UK - thought it would be about 20-25$ - but were horrified when we found that they had charged us $51.00 for a 6 min. call! We had looked through the "guest services brochure" and knew it would be slightly more expensive - but not as expensive as that! We saw one of the Reception Assistants, he spoke to someone, and the charge was immediately halved - so it is important to get these things checked. We certainly learnt a lesson there! Get a phone card - there is a Walgreens almost opposite the hotel. The location of the hotel is good - there is a monorail linked to the Bellagio - the MGM Grand is almost opposite and you can pick up the new monorail to some of the other hotels. If we visited Las Vegas again, I would certainly stay at the Monte Carlo again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything about it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Monte Carlo. We loved it the first time and decided to go back and stay there the second time we've visited Vegas. The hotel's elevators are centrally located in close vicinity to everything, the loby, the food, the casino and the rooms, so you don't waste time walking. There is a tram that goes between MC and Bellagio and once at Bellagio's we could "hit the strip", which was a lot of fun. We did dine at other casinos, but decided that the Monte Carlo buffet was the best - breakfast and dinner! Not even Bellagio's could compare, all thought we do like Bellagio's casino and atmosphere, the Monte Carlo casino is as just as good (especially late at night). The room service is excellent, the girls are very pleasant and polite and keep the rooms nice and clean. The std rooms are nice size and the beds are comfortable. We never had a taxi problem, no lines like at some other hotels and we were there over the Memorial Day weekend. Easy access to and from the airport, no more than 10-15 minutes. We are planning on going again in September and we will be staying there again. Oh! I forgot to mention the pool area which has this tropical setting, lots of privacy for adults, water falls, lazy river for the kids, but if you are not into kids you can find a spot that's quieter and more private too. Monte Carlo doesn't have that many kids anyway, so no worry. The people at MC are very friendly. One more thing, no matter which tower your room is in you will have a beautiful view from your hotel room. Last time we were facing the Rio and we could see the whole city lights at night, which was beautiful. This time we had a view of the Bellagio's, the Paris, the Eiffel tower, and more - it was magnificent, especially at night. If you are looking for absolute luxury and big rooms then MC isn't for you. We liked it and we are going back, after all how much time do you spend in the room? With all the stuff to see and do in Vegas you'd be lucky to get 5 hours of sleep... Go ahead, make your day!

Reviews.Title: “Good location - would definitely go back”
Reviews.Author: MegW
Reviews.Content: had a great time here at Monte Carlo. King bed, non smoking room 14-214 (I think). two small issues - no full length mirror and bathroom could do with a bit of regrouting, apart from that really liked it. Good sized room, nice decor etc, very comfy bed. Housekeeping good. Ate in cafe three times, buffet once and pub once. Also did the slot tournament four times. Good location, got the train to Bellagio a few times although it was not working part of our time there. CVS next door for snacks/drinks.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best”
Reviews.Author: mahalonuiloa8
Reviews.Content: Just came back from Las Vegas (May 30 - June 3) and stayed at the Monte Carlo. This truly is a wonderful place to stay. Can't beat the price nor the location on the strip. The buffet is reasonable in price with the food absolutely fantastic. The staff is friendly and willing to help you if needed. Loved the food court for a quick "bite". The casino is spacious but not as large as some of the others on the strip. I went to Caesar's casino one night and got lost. This is not a mega structure as some of the others and not as crowded. The room was plain , nothing fancy. Housekeeping had the beds made every day by 2pm. I had a good view of New York New York, Luxor and Excalibur with some mountains thrown in. This is not my first visit to Vegas. I stayed at the Bellagio the last time. The Bellagio is in a class by itself with the price of a room to match. There is a tram that will take you from the Monte Carlo to the Bellagio and reverse. So if you have this incredible desire to see the Bellagio and all its opulence, you don't have to walk in the brutal sun (90's). Simpy put, the Monte Carlo is simple,cheap, and just a great place to gamble (if that's what you like) and eat. I'll say it again, the buffet is EXCELLENT and not that expensive. Breakfast about $11.29 and dinner about $17.25 with tax. I would definitely go back there again. I have read others mention about the noise. It is really not that bad. I could only hear other doors slam but could not hear talking in the corridors or my next door neighbor's TV. Give Monte Carlo a chance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Serivce”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My sister and I just got back from our vacation in Vegas. Neither of us had stayed at the Monte Carlo before so we were pleasantly surprised! Our room and some meals were comped because she was playing so well at the blackjack tables! The pillow-top matress was VERY COMFORTABLE and the food at Blackstone's was scrumptious. Our lunch at the Pub & Brewery and breakfast at the Cafe was good too. The casino was enormous and relatively smoke-free. The staff was great and we really had a wonderful time. We will definitely visit again.

Reviews.Title: “The Calm After The Storm”
Reviews.Author: slotqueen250
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Monte Carlo was wonderful. We had a room high up with a view of The Bellagio. The hotel itself was peaceful, quiet and airy and after all the running around I did trying to see everything I could on the Strip, it was nice to come home to a quiet place to unwind. In the hotel, we could either walk around and shop or stop by the Brewery and have a huge (or small) beer or hit one of the small eaterys that stay open late right near the Casino. We ate at a Chinese restaurant one night which was very nice, played slot machines all night when we wanted to and could get anywhere from the location by either walking, cabbing or taking the tram at the MGM. The hotel is very nice to look at outside with all the statues and the lobby is tremendous! The hallways upstairs were always clean and airy and so was my room. If I had any complaints it would be to upgrade their bathrooms which were a bit old fashioned. I also did not like the soaps and creams and stuff in the bathroom, they did not smell nice. I think they should change to something with an herbal scent to it. They have such nice scents out there now. All in all I cannot wait to go back and I would certainly go right back to the Monte Carlo to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked our reservations ahead of time, however our room wasn't ready until 5pm that night. We arrived in Las Vegas around 11 am, so we were lucky we travelled with another couple, whose room was ready a couple of hours before ours. For the most part, the place was exceptional, however; we ran into a few staff members who did not seem to care in regard to their service, or job for that matter. We ran into a few rude, and unhelpful staff memeber. Due to this experience, I will not return again.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed, but only during the week!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tubro
Reviews.Content: Went to the MC from the 24th-28th of May. Asked politely at the front desk for an upgrade (to celerbrate our anniversary) and the lady said "we don't give free upgrades at the Monte Carlo", but for $50 more a night you can have a better room, I said no thank you. The hotel did have a nice smell to it and the elevators were easy to access from the registration desk. (no need to cut through the casino) The safety deposit boxes came in handy and used them everyday.(free) The buffet was good (breakfast and lunch, didn't try dinner) and would recommend it for the price, $10.50 and $10.95. The rooms were clean and size wise OK, but YES when you used the sink it made a squeaking sound, and the noise of the toilets are EXACTLY the same as the ones on an airplane. If you know what that sounds like then you know what you're in for. Thin walls.....NOT REALLY, we heard a couple talking one night in the hallway. The pools......wave pool, was pretty lame. The Lazy River was a Blast!!!! BRING YOUR OWN RAFT!!!! IT WILL SAVE YOU $12 A DAY. They will inflate it for you for free. Weekends are hell though. The lazy river is packed.... I MEAN PACKED!!!! The pool area fills up fast, we made sure we weren't there too much after 9 when it opened. If you are an avid Blackjack player you will get a kick out of this. The tables closest to the strip hit on soft 17, and the tables further into the casino stand on all 17's. For those of you who know the difference in odds, this made me laugh. I would go again... it was worth the money and the lazy river made the trip. Enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - comfy bed but loud pipes”
Reviews.Author: travellingteachers
Reviews.Content: Since our flight was delayed by two hours, I was very concerned that my husband and I would be stuck in a horrible room. But we were very fortunate to get a great room on the west side with a view of the pool and the Strip. We ended up with a double room instead of a king - that's okay, more room. The room was quite clean. My husband is a neat freak and for once, he didn't feel disgusted sleeping in a hotel bed - a rarity for him. Check-in and out was very quick. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly. My only complaint is that the pipes were quite loud. I'm a light sleeper and woke up each morning to the sound of showers and pipes whining. It wasn't just a quiet annoyance, it was actually obnoxiously loud. At one point we thought it was a hotel alarm or something. On the other hand, I couldn't hear my neighbours at all. We were at the end of the hall so that probably buffered some of the noise. The casino was quiet and not as smoky as some of the others we visited. We thought the location was perfect for us. To get to the Bellagio, the tram is convenient. Jumping on the monorail, rather expensive at 3$ per trip, is simple from the MGM. Despite the pipes, I would definitely stay at the Monte Carlo again.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo was a pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: onefancynancy
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nites at the Monte Carlo and must say I was pleasantly surprised. As soon as you walk in you are greeted by a wonderfully fresh scent, not stale casino. Check in was a breeze, there was plenty of staff waiting to greet you. The halls with shops and pub were a nice surprise as well. The pub had terrific beer (made on site) where you could grab a reasonably priced bite of food. Or you can visit their food court which houses some fast food like McD's and Sbarro. In the same location as the pub there is a monorail which goes directly to the Bellagio. This is a wonderful feature, especially if grabbing a show like Cirque du Soleil "O" which is currently playing at the Bellagio. As an aside, if you have heard wonderful things about the buffet at the Bellagio, as we did, you may be disappointed, as we were. It was alot of $$ for lackluster food. But that is another review! The location of the Monte Carlo is simply perfect. You can monorail as I stated to the Bellagio to the left (which is across the street from the beautiful Paris) or just to the right is New York New York which is where we went for our Starbucks fix and for a wonderful meal at their Italian restaurant. Once past the NY NY, you can grab a monorail at the Excalibur (which is connected by pedestrian bridge) to the Luxor and the Mandalay Bay. Directly across the street from the Monte Carlo is a fun little shopping center with M & M's world (which is where I bought fun souveniers for the kids) and the Coca Cola store. There is also an arcade there and a pretty good sized food court for a cheap bite. There are also a Walgreen's and CVS just outside the front door of the Monte Carlo for bandaids and sunscreen! My only disappointment with the Monte Carlo was in the rooms. The plumbing coming from the rooms next door is quite loud. AND you can hear the conversations of the guests. The shower is also quite low on the wall and if you are taller than 5'6 or so you will have to scrunch yourself down to rinse your hair! In addition, the shower only sprays hard and harder with no inbetween. I know this is being picky but when you are hot and tired and just want a relaxing shower, it won't happen. The pool area was large enough with a fun lazy river to float in and a regular sized pool too. It was 105 when we were there and there was plenty of shade and sun to relax in. Let me just conclude by saying, you don't need to rent a car in Vegas but you must allow yourself plenty of time to walk to the neighboring resorts for shows or reservations. Based on the location of your room it can take a good 5 to 10 minutes to get from home base to the front door of the casino. Whatever you do, make sure your walking shoes are broken in before you get there. Cute shoes do make the outfit but you will want to consider comfort first!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dnord35
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Monte Carlo one night and I must say that we had a great time there! The standard rooms are very nice (great beds, marble-floored bathroom, etc), plus the casino isn't as smoky as some of the casinos on the strip. The pool area is awesome, they have a lazy river, wave pool, and tons of beach chairs to catch a tan. I have nothing negative to say about the Monte Carlo, I'll definitely be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Trip of a Lifetime”
Reviews.Author: janelle12
Reviews.Content: My family and I travelled allthe way from Australia When we arrive at Las Vegas we stayed at the Monte Carlo . From the mintue we walked in to the moment we booked out the service was amazing . The rooms where fantastic and I asked for a room with a view of the strip . That was no problem . The room was large and had enough room four all four of us to move around in .

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel good location”
Reviews.Author: AAS
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a three night stay at the Monte Carlo. We booked the trip last minute and were pleased to get a good rate at the Monte Carlo. The hotel is not as fabulous as some of the others on the strip (it is also without the accompanying price tag) but it is clean and the rooms are nice. Nothing to write home about but everything you need. Check in was very quick and we never saw a long line like we had observed at some other hotels on the strip. The only room noise we noticed was when people were yelling in the halls. Luckily this only happened a couple of times. The pool area was nice plenty of shade and sun space and several different pools to choose from. The pool Saturduy morning was packed, wall to wall people, but the drink service was regular. We sat in the back area away from the main pool and were pretty well insulated from the pool noise. We had massage appointments Sunday afternoon. We made the appointment first thing Saturday morning and there were only two times left on both the ladies and the mens sides. You can book up to 72 hours in advance - next time we would make appointments before we leave. The spa area was nice and the cardio equipment new. I don't think it would be worth paying the $25 use the spa - but definite take advantange if you book an appointment. We enjoyed several of the restaurant. We ate at Adre's the French restaurant and were able to get same day reservations on Saturday night. It was verygood and very intimate. A nice place to spend a romantic evening. We also enjoyed the micro brewery and a"giraffe" of beer for a more casual lunch.

Reviews.Title: “Homebase everytime I go to Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: annabelle32
Reviews.Content: Look no further for a hotel in Vegas. For the money and the location - you can't go wrong. My husband and I stay at this hotel everytime we are in Vegas - although a few times we have tried other locations and have not been as happy as we are with the Monte Carlo. The pool is great - spacious with a perfect amount of sun and shade. For those people with kids - it has a wave pool! The rooms are large and clean with the perfect amount of amenities. We have never had a bad stay with this hotel. If your looking for a reasonably priced hotel on the strip - pick this one.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel. We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Monte Carlo from May 1st - 7th. It was our very first trip to Las Vegas and we are so glad we picked this hotel. We had the 13th floor. It was nice and quiet. The room had everything we needed, and the view was beautiful. The only thing my wife didn't like was shower curtains in the bathtub, a bit tacky. She likes proper shower stalls or showers with sliding glass doors. Myself, I don't care one way or the other. Other than that, everything was great. After hotel hopping all day you see a lot of casinos, and I can tell you that the Monte Carlo has the cleanest and freshest air of all the casinos on the strip. The location of the hotel is also ideal. It's close to several other major hotels within walking distance. The food at the buffet was also excellent whether for breakfast, lunch or dinner. But if you're looking for a change of pace check out Coco's across the street for their power breakfast or perhaps Denny's. All-in-all we had a great stay at the Monte Carlo. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “worthy of the name”
Reviews.Author: DanielRonfeld
Reviews.Content: waking up in a room at the monte carlo gives you the impression that you could take your book, let your roommates sleep while you go down to the lobby and read, and relax. The quiet decor and general feeling of calm, decorum of course begins and ends at the elevator. Once you are in the gorgeous lobby or the clinking clanging casino, forget it-- the place is a hussle bussle with crowds of tourists and insanity- which is exactly why you go to Vegas. Wholeheartedly I would recommend the Monte Carlo, the rates were comparable, but the service and the atmosphere were well above and beyond the average!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice - Better than Expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from 3 nights at the Monte Carlo. We won a trip and went with another couple, and had no choice of hotel. After reading very mixed reviews on TripAdvisor, I was a little worried about the noise issue and being kept awake. Fortunately, we were never disturbed by noise during our stay -- I requested a room away from the elevator and ice machine, but think we just lucked out -- either there was no one staying in the next rooms or they were very quiet. The Monte Carlo is a very pretty hotel. Our room and bathroom were large and very clean. The bed was comfortable -- I always worry about the bed since I have a bad back and need a very firm mattress. Other reviewers had described the beds as "soft" as a positive, but I don't like soft. The bed was a pillow top and while the top layer was soft the bed provided excellent support, so I was very happy and comfortable. There were some amenities lacking and other issues that keep the Monte Carlo from being a 4-star hotel. First of all, there are no full length mirrors! There is a mirror in the room but you can only see yourself down to the knees. I like to see my shoes with my outfits and actually have never stayed anywhere that didn't have a full length mirror. They do have irons/boards in the room which is handy. The lighting is only so-so. We had a view of the strip, but the windows outside looked like they hadn't been cleaned in years -- so dirty they were hard to see out of. The water pressure in the shower was extremely strong, but there was no way of controling it -- just on/off. The hairdryer in our room hardly worked, but another was brought as soon as I called to complain and it was fine. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. Dinner at Blackstone's in the hotel was not worth the price -- nothing special. Friends that we traveled with went to Andre's at the Monte Carlo and deemed it "magnificent." The breakfast buffet was mediocre. The pool area is lovely although we did not use it. One of the pools has a wave in it and another one had a slide. A group tennis lesson we took was fun. Overall, we like the Monte Carlo much more than we had expected to. If you get a good price, it is definitely worthy of a stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Monte Carlo and loved the price!”
Reviews.Author: mxgurugirl
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 night stay at the Monte Carlo. There were 4 in our party and every one of us agreed it was worth staying there again. We arrived at 9pm on a Friday night and had no wait at check-in. The front desk clerk was very nice, but could have explained how to get to our room a little better. There are 3 sections to the resort with 18 different elevators in sections of 3, so you have to know what you are doing. Our room was very clean and was on a smoke free floor. We choose not to take a view of the strip but instead the back of the resort, which had a good view of the NY NY rollercoaster. Beds were very comfortable, but who really cares...you don't tend to be in the them very long. No coffee maker but they do provide a iron and hair dryer. About everyone else complaining about the noise from the hallway or the water pipes. I'm sure people could hear us coming in at night, but I never heard anyone else. The water pipes did make some noise but it was no big deal and definitely didn't wake you up or irritate you. The casino was very nice and smelled very fresh. No smokey smell. Played craps and some slots. A dealer named Rick made our experience pretty fun for a first timer! The breakfast buffet was fabulous! $11.95 was definitely a deal! My husband and his 2 friends ate there every morning and weren't hungry until early evening! My husband and I enjoyed an afternoon at the pool. We had no trouble finding lounge chairs and there was plenty of spots with either sun or shade. Their micro brewery served great beer! We bought a tall glass mug to keep for $8.95 and you got refills for $3.00. We checked out at 11:00am on Monday which went very fast. No waiting lines. We got a taxi within 10 minutes. Overall our experience was wonderful. Definitely worth staying there.

Reviews.Title: “1st time stay @ Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 4 night stay at the Monte Carlo. I had spent a good deal of time on this site and others reviewing hotels and casinos. We are not big gamblers, so the accomodations took top priority, (although I do play video poker and went to other establishments to play that have better payoffs). We were looking for good location, good price and good reviews from other travelers. The Monte Carlo overall met our expectations. Check in on Monday around 5:00 pm was slow and they could have opened up more lines. Bellhop had our luggage up to us pronto. The standard room is on the smaller side, but the bathroom made up for that. It was large(very slow drain in sink) and the bellman asked if we wanted additional towels and housekeeping had them up to us in about 2 minutes. The room was clean and our view was facing the back of the Strip, but that was ok. Stayed on 21st floor. One complaint was no coffeemaker, which I knew, so I brought my own. I did not want to have to my husband go down each morning to the McDonald's to get me my java. Now, about the noise - Yes...you can hear everything in the halls and in the rooms next door - and I mean everything! I complained to the management about a group of people yelling in the halls and disrupting my sleep on night. I was unable to get through to the front desk, as they put me on hold, but I went down the next morning and a manager gave us a free meal at the buffet in the hotel. I would rather have had them answer the phone and stop the noisy folks, which I told him. The buffet was good. We ate at the Market Cafe and the Pub, both were good. The main floor and casino is very clean, upscale, bright, open and has a very nice smell, and no smell of cigarettes. Thank the Lord <:. We enjoyed the beautiful flower arrangements near check-in. Liked the express check-out done on the TV. Getting around was very easy. Parking was attached to the hotel. We did not use the monorail, but will next time. We walked a lot and needed more time to see everything we wanted to. Overall, for a price of $69.00 per night, it was a bargain and we would stay again. Hope this helps those of you who are on the fence, as to where to stay, as I was. And I am a bit on the picky side.

Reviews.Title: “loved the Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: greenberry
Reviews.Content: We just spent three nights at the Monte Carlo and we had a great experience. Check in was quick and we got to choose our room since they had different King rooms with different views. We ended up on the 27th floor with a great view of the Strip. The room was very nice, clean and quiet and we never had to wait for an elevator, which was a welcome change from a previous stay at the Imperial Palace several years ago. The casino is beautiful, the Lance Burton show was amazing, and we loved the brewpub. Location is excellent - free tram to the Bellagio came in very handy, and we could easily walk anywhere on the South end of the Strip. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “beware !!”
Reviews.Author: disneydollar
Reviews.Content: Beware if staying at the Monte Carlo Resort & Hotel. Here's what happened to me in February when I booked a weeks romantic break at the Monte Carlo Resort, concierge level. It turned out to be 7 nights of hell and not a resort I would recommend. 3rd day, while my husband was in the lounge having breakfast I was in the bedroom when, walking past the bottom of the bed I tripped. I had a glass of water in my hand which flew out onto the TV. I hurt my wrist trying to stop myself falling and also bit inside my lip. I got my husband and we rang maintenance. A girl came to the room and stated that the TVs were new and so big they could not be lifted out of the armoir, and also they did not keep spares. She turned the TV on and the screen was yellow. At this stage she rang the chief engineer who told her to inform us that we would have to pay for a new TV, apporximately $2,500 as the hotel had no insurance for breakages!! I was very upset and in pain so he asked that both myself and husband went to the front desk to speak to him. I refused and my husband went. Again he was told we would have to pay and that an engineer would inform us of the bill later in the day. Later in the day there was a message on our telephone to say the TV was ok. I spoke to the concierge and asked to speak to a manager to clarify we would not be charged anything. He was very rude and stated that all breakages were charged for and that they management had ways and means of finding out these things. He also reiterated the hotel did not have insurance for damages caused by occupants. Something I find very hard to believe. The rest of my holiday was totally ruined, as I was in pain and thinking I was being watched all the time. This is a resort I will definetely NOT be returning to.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: AsTheCrowsFly
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Monte Carlo from April 24 thru the 28th. We would definitely stay there again. Check in was very easy and we upgraded to a "view room" with a king bed on the 24th floor for an additional $10 a night. The upgrade was well worth it for the wonderful view. To the right we could see the entire north end of the Strip and to the left we could see the Rio, the Palms, Red Rock Canyon and Mt Charleston. All the lights at night were beautiful. The bed was very comfortable and soft and we didn't have any problem with noise. Housekeeping was excellent. We ate at the buffet breakfast one day. It was good but not as good as the MGM Grand buffet (but MGM cost about $1.50 more a person). If you buy anything at Nathan's in the food court, they will give you a coupon for "buy one, get one free" Express Breakfast. We did that twice and it was an excellent deal. For 8 bucks, we got 2 big breakfasts - choice of waffle, pancakes, cheese omelet or biscuits and gravy, plus bacon or sausage, toast, hash browns and coffee or tea. We spent some time in the casino, playing Black Jack and Craps. There were a couple of $5 tables. You can get a comp card but you have to bet $25 a hand to use it. That's ok for Craps but pretty steep for Black Jack. The card can also be used at Excalibur, Luxor and Mandalay Bay. All the dealers were friendly except for one. We were playing Craps and the table was really hot. We were up several hundred dollars when the dealer got grumpy at my husband for taking too long to shoot the dice. So we left, which was just as well because if we'd stayed we probably would have ended up giving the money back to the casino. The location of the Monte Carlo is a big plus. It's an easy walk to New York New York, Excalibur and MGM Grand. There is a tram that goes from Excalibur to the Luxor and Mandalay Bay and another tram that goes from the Monte Carlo to Bellagio. You can see a good part of the Strip by taking advantage of the trams. We would recommend renting a car, too. We paid $130 for the whole week (including gas) and were able to get to Hoover Dam, Red Rock Canyon, Downtown and hotels on and off the Strip. It was much cheaper than renting taxis and paying for tours. All the hotels have free parking, which is really convenient. Just don't drive on the Strip after noon - it gets very crazy. Take Paradise Road, Industrial Road or I15 instead. We had a great time and would go back to Monte Carlo again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice overall.”
Reviews.Author: SkyTravel
Reviews.Content: We just stayed here this month for 3 nights. The "theme" is a Mediteranean feel, which includes murals of flower gardens, statues of angels, and warm golden shades of coloring. The room was nice, very clean, and all the little extras offered such as iron, tiny sewing kit, bottled water (for a fee). The restaurants are somewhat pricey, but it seems that's the direction Vegas has headed in. The large hotels no longer offer cheap buffets as much. They have a food court where you can get bagels, coffee, pizza. We ate breakfast there each morning. The casino floor is nice, not too noisy. There is a tram to Bellagio, and NY NY is a short walk away, so location is good. This isn't the nicest hotel I've stayed at, but the price was decent and it was clean. It's more relaxed than some of noisier hotels like Excalibur or NY NY.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Fun”
Reviews.Author: Kathi06
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a 4 night stay at the Monte Carlo. We were very impressed with the staff and the easy check-in. The room was very quiet and comfortable...the bed was one of the better ones we've had in a hotel...and the room was clean and attractive. The casino is fun and quieter then most...we did better there on the slots then in other places. I actually liked the feel of the place better then our stay at the Venetian, which has lovely large rooms, but wasn't as clean, and the staff was friendlier!...we wouldn't hesitate to return...

Reviews.Title: “Love the Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: cattom
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best deals in Las Vegas, with a great central location on the Strip. I paid $69 for a Sunday night, and $79 for mid-week. Check in was a breeze; we arrived from NY at 10:00 a.m. Las Vegas time, and they quickly checked us in that early as rooms were available. Rooms are a little small, but they are relatively clean and contrary to what others have written, quiet. There are a few restaurants, which are decent, and the steakhouse is excellent. The casino is also great, and if you use their card, they are liberal with comps from play at the machines. There are plenty of $5 tables, and it is rare that it is too crowded; if it is, they seem to have enough dealers so as to avoid "packing" people at tables as they do in Atlantic City and other gambling venues. The machines are somewhat loose; I won decent amounts a few times on $1 and quarter machines. The $5 and $10 machines were tight. I have also stayed at Luxor, which is also great, and Harrahs, which is too noisy and "carnival" like. The Monte Carlo is relatively quiet and seems to have a little class, while not charging the prices of first class hotels such as Bellagio and Venice. All in all, I have stayed at the MC 3 times, and it is a joy.

Reviews.Title: “Moldy Bath - Yuck”
Reviews.Author: palm2rees
Reviews.Content: My husband just got back from a stay at the Monte Carlo while at a convention and reported that the bath was terribly moldy. That is not something that is hard for houskeeping to take care of. We've stayed at the Luxor for less many times and it has always been immaculate. Just my two cents.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite so far!”
Reviews.Author: Travelbug325
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Monte Carlo many times in past years since it was built. The staff there were wonderful, housekeeping was wonderful and the casino was great, not oversized that you get exhausted just trying to find someone, it was perfect. Also, they were so great when my young son left his stuffed animals on the bed and the housekeeper didn't see it and accidentally wrapped them in the sheets when she took them off the bed. They apologized and took it so seriously (which it was to my little son), they searched and actually found one of them! There are thousands of sheets that they send out and they went to all that trouble! You can walk to the New York New York, Excalibur, Luxor, etc. MGM is directily across from Excalibur and so is the Tropicana. You will not be disappointed with this hotel. If you need any last minute items there is a Walgreens across the street opened 24 hrs. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “I have stayed here 4 times- good value”
Reviews.Author: Grant_grant
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the MC four times over the years, and the most recent is in December of '04. My experience has always been positive. This hotel is near the top of my list for the following reasons: 1. The hotel is one I consider to be near the top of the "middle tier" of good location strip hotels. It has a lot of the features of the big boys, but the price is usually reasonable compared to the swanky big name joints. 2. Always clean rooms, the casino is bright and happy-feeling, and you dont have to hike 10-miles thru a maze to get to the elevators. 3. Very nice pool area. 4. Attentive staff. Unlike even the top hotels, it doesn't take an hour and a half to get a request taken care or. 5. Nothing feels out of date or dingy, despite reasonable prices. Quick story about their great service- I wear a mouth guard to keep me from grinding my teeth at night. It stays in a little case on the vanity during the day. The maid service accidently threw it away! I called housekeeping to ask for help, and they sent a manager up within 15 minutes. He promised to help, disappeared for about 45 minutes, found it in the trash, and returned it to me! I can't imagine how much rooting around in the trash it must have taken with a whole hotel floor's worth of garbage. He also had taken it to a kitchen and run it thru a dishwasher so it would come back to me clean. I expected the maids to only say "sorry" and shrug their shoulders, but I got a response from the staff fast, and an ideal solution to my problem. I will return to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Value”
Reviews.Author: myownself
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night stay at the Monte Carlo April 10-14 and would definetly make it a hotel of choice. Check-in was fast, asked what upgrades were available and they offered a couple, $20 for a larger room and $50 for a room with jaccuzi, I declined both as was staying by myself and did not really require anything special. Got a standard room on the 9th floor with a view of the back of NYNY. The room was clean, nicely decoraterd, with alot less wear than you would expect from a hotel that has had 100's of 1000's of people pass through it. For $79 a definet bargian. Yes, there were all the little bottles of shampoo ect. in the bathroom as well as a couple other surprises that all you ladies will enjoy immensly. Yes the toilets are loud when they flush, new technology in the toilet industry, but believe me, after you flush one of these babies, there will be no chance of you seeing any trace of a log jam and the noise lasts for about 3-5 seconds. Beds are very comfortable, I slept like a baby. I read some reviews about noise from adjacent rooms, well, there is a door joining the next room, but unless you have it open with your ear up against it, you won't hear anything and if you do..well, your just a pervert. Maid service was good, I ussually left the room in some sort of dissaray and returned to find it magically returned to a state of clean and tidy...I loved that. I ussually left a $2 tip for the magician who did this work, however one day they left it on the counter exactly where I had placed it..maybe they thought I needed it more than they did. The food services in the hotel were definetly adiquate, if you didn't gain a couple lbs while you were here, you must be anorexic. Do taste the horseradish in the buffet..it will litterally bring tears to your eyes, I was bawling like a baby as I ate my roast beef. There is also a food court, pizza, burgers, baggles, hotdogs, the american staples. The pool area was very nice, they have a lazy river thats not that lazy, it moves quite swiftly, the wave pool is a nice touch, there is a childrens pool which I think parents with small children will enjoy, a larger pool for swimming which early in the day is a bit shaded and a hot tub. If you want to get wet, you can find a place here to do it. There is also an area the size of a small parking lot where you can get the full blown effects of the sun and critique the new styles of bathing / sunning attire of the ladies, anouther nice touch. The location of the hotel on the strip is perfect as anyone who has been to vegas can attest to, walking the strip can be a somewhat painfull experiance after you have done it the 3rd time, nothing worse than a case of vegas feet and if you never had it you will definetly know when you get it. The gambling is like any other casino in vegas, they will get your money..eventually...however some dealers do it with more class than others. I prefer to have mine taken in the classiest of ways. Drinks at the tables were always plentiful, I was never without one for lack of service. There are a few boutiques for shopping, nothing to extravigant (aka ceasers forum shops). One other suggestion....when you are shopping and come to a store with a massaging lounge chair for sale.....DO TAKE THE TEST DRIVE......its the best 15 min massage you will get in vegas for the price. Have a wonderful time and if you take vegas to seriously...you have way to much money...it's like a cartoon.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: travelerer
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 5 night stay at the Monte Carlo Hotel and would definitely go back. We have paid 3 times the price at other hotels but this was a great value for a change. The Market City Cafe had the best food of the entire trip and we ate at all the outrageously priced restaurants. We found ourselves drawn back to the hotel because of the size, elegance and charm. Don't listen to the snobs that complain about thin walls, it is true but if you are that cranky, stay home. The bed was great!

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at Monte Carlo.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo is a beautiful place. We had the best time we ever had in Vegas. We have stayed at many places but none compare to the MC.The staff was great and helpful from the checkin service to the life guards to housekeeping.We will stay there again.The location is great.We asked for an upgrade at checkin and for $50.00 we could get a spa suite. We said ok, than he said that he was sorry he was wrong and there was no spa suites left but we could have the Executive suite for the same price. WOW what a great room.We were very satisfied overall with the MC.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: mederic24
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the MC this past weekend and were very happy with the facility. Although it was a busy weekend the service was excellent and we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. All of the employees from the front desk people to the housekeeping folks were extremely courteous and helpful. We visited the Brew Pub at the MC and it is a great place for one of their in-house brews and a burger or ribs. The entire facility was top-of-the-line. We would not hesitate to recommend the MC and give it our highest rating.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: JCooper-Ontario
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo on our trip to Vegas and it was just fantastic! The service you receive is superb! We had made reservations at the hotel before going, however, once we got there, we were upgraded into a suite on the 26th floor. The view was amazing - the lights of Vegas are just breath-taking! I found that everyone at the hotel and casino were very friendly. Of course, there are free drinks while in the casino. Apparently I looked young to a lot of the hotel staff (which is a nice compliment), so I had to keep my ID close at all times :-) The lazy river was under renovations when we were there, however, it was set to open on the day we left. The wave pool was very nice and the pool area in general was very clean and the staff were extrememly helpful. Drinks can be charged to your room while you're out there too, which is nice in the warm weather! A great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Sincere service, great place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our first time at the Monte Carlo will definitely NOT be our last. We went for the good rates but will go back for the excellent service and wonderful facility. It was not the typical fake, insincere service that we usually experience in Las Vegas. These people actually like their jobs! Everyone, from the bellhop to the bartenders to the housekeepers were warm, welcoming and friendly. Our room was clean and spacious. There were numerous options for eating and their Microbrewery was the best. The food in the Pub was great and so was their beer. They had live music and dancing every night. Even the other people staying at the hotel were polite and friendly. I can't say enough about what a pleasant experience we had at the Monte Carlo.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our first trip to Vegas. In preparation for our trip, we did lots of research on the internet, including reading reviews on this website, in deciding where would be the best place for us to stay. We actually had not considered the Monte Carlo until I read favorable reviews here on Trip Advisor. Considering all the choices of hotels in Las Vegas, we ultimately did decide on the Monte Carlo. We were very happy with our decision. It is a beautiful hotel, but also very comfortable, not too swanky like some of the others. We paid about $400 for 4 nights (including tax) for their basic room, which we thought was very reasonable. The rooms were actually bigger in person than they appeared on the Monte Carlo website; they were nice and clean, we always had plenty of towels, and the staff was very nice. The casino was comfortalbe; my husband played Texas Hold 'em for the first time at a table and the dealers were cool. I liked that there was a McDonalds in their food court for a few quick, cheap meals (and I believe open 24 hours). One negative thing that we had seen posted in reviews about the Monte Carlo was that the walls were thin, but we did not have a problem with that. In the mornings while I got ready in the bathroom, I did hear water running from other bathrooms, but that was not an issue for me at all. It's a great location for visiting the hotels and sights at that end of the strip (NY NY, Excalibur, Luxor, Mandalay Bay, MGM Grand). We would not hesitate to stay at the Monte Carlo in the future. However, next time we go, we will probably stay at the other end of the strip, since there is alot at that end we didn't get to this time (Treasure Island, etc.). That's the thing about Vegas ... too much to see in just one trip!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy rooms - poor soundproofing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Not sure how Monte Carlo gets 4 stars from some rating services. It is a 3-star facility with some caveats. My room (a Monaco suite) on 11th floor near elevator lobby was dreadfully noisy. I can accept some guest noise outside in the elevator lobby - that wasn't the problem. Noises from adjoining rooms, the floor above, and the plumbing were all clearly audible. The only thing that made it somewhat tolerable was that the clock radio had some nature sounds selections, and it made a pretty good white noise machine to help mask the offending sounds. Amenities are fine - on a par with Crowne Plaza. Casino is large, but the gaming is not particularly player-friendly. You would think the location is good near Tropicana Blvd, but the Strip between Flamingo and Tropicana is pedestrian-choked and not very easy to walk. You'd be better off at Luxor or Excalibur, or farther up the strip (TI, Mirage, Flamingo).

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, but wave pool not working and other pool cold”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at Monte Carlo over Spring Break. I picked hotel for good location and for the wave and river pools for my kids. Room was very comfortable and had a great view of the strip. But we went down to the pool the first day to find that the river pool has been broken for awhile and won't be fixed anytime soon (wish I'd read that on this site before I came)! The wave pool isn't heated enough so my kids didn't want to use it. This left one very crowded pool and jacuzzi for the whole hotel. Ate at the sports bar there one night, it was ok. Went to the Lance Burton show and really enjoyed the act and theater. Might stay there again for the location, but really nothing too memorable. For kids: Shark Exhibit (Mandalay Bay), Stratosphere view, Lions and Rainforest Cafe (MGM), Car museum, Mirage volcano, Tropicana garden, Fremont St at night, Mirage breakfast buffet, and MGM pool (Monte Carlo was disappointing).

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time at the Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: Jersey-Girl5
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Monte Carlo 03/25-03/29. I had read almost every review on this hotel since I booked my trip, so I knew exactly what I was getting into. I read some good and not so good reviews. And I would have to say that I don't regret my decision to stay at all. I booked through America West Vacations and got a great deal with airfare included. 1. I had a connecting flight from JFK to LA to LV. Both flights were on-time and quick. 2. Check-in at the hotel was quick(1:30pm) and I asked if there were any available Spa Suites and how much. The front desk person was very nice and helpful. She told us nothing was available that night and told us to call the next day and check(we never did). She gave us a room and a key with a semi-view of the strip but told us we had to wait till 3 for our room to be ready. This wasn't a big deal since we were going to get some lunch at their buffet anyway. So we gave our luggage to the bell hop and headed towards the MC buffet. The price was pretty good but I wasn't too impressed with the selection or quality. After lunch we walked the strip for a bit, signed up for the One Club Card and played the slots. So, 4:00pm came around and we figured our room would have been ready by then, we were wrong. We waited till 5:00pm till we decided to head back to the front desk and complain. The front desk associate told us the room was still not ready and decided to get us a different room that was. By this time, we were so upset and so tired, but MC did make up for it by upgrading our room to a full view of the strip on a higher floor. We overlooked the pool and the view was absolutely beautiful. 3. Our room was a good size with a king bed, which was very comfortable. I didn't notice any wear and tear. The bathroom was pretty big as well, loved all the amenities the hotel provided. The toilet was loud but I didn't care. I would rather have a strong flushing toilet than a weak one. I would occasionally hear some noises coming from the other rooms(which were usually just the shower) but it wasn't too excessive. I hear the same noises in my apt. building, you get used to it :o) Side Note: Housekeeping didn't come up to clean our room one day. I think it was because we slept in one morning and had the "Do not disturb" sign up. But we figured they would come up sometime throughout the day. That was the only setback. 4. I usually only play the slots, so I can't really say much about the tables or the dealers. I also loved how the casino wasn't overly huge. I really appreciated it after those long walks on the strip(you have to walk through the casino to get to the elevators from the Strip). 5. LOVED the Brewpub. My boyfriend(now fiance as of 03/26) really like the Pale Ale and I usually had the Winners Wheat. We visit alot of breweries thoughout the country and we really liked the quality of their beer. We drank at the brewpub a few nights while we were there. 6. We ate at a bunch of buffets, but my fav. was the Paris Buffet(easter dinner) and Luxor(breakfast). 7. Lastly, I do believe this will be the Vegas trip I will remember forever. My boyfriend proposed to me on the gondola ride at the Venetian the Sat. after we arrived!! We plan on revisiting LV for our combined but separate bachelor/bachellorete party. This time we'll dare to get the huge giraffe beer containers for our parties. All in all, I really enjoyed the Monte Carlo and would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we expected...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the MC March 26-29. Overall, it was what we expected for the cost, which is a good value for the quality of the hotel. The rooms were plenty big as was the bathroom. Yes, you could hear the room next door, but maybe we were fortunate that they were not in the room the same time we were. The water pressure was ridiculous. Now I like a lot of pressure, but the shower was so strong that it would blow the curtain back and the entire tub would fill up in under three minutes- have never experienced anything like it. The casino was small (which is fine), but most of the dealers were not very nice which made us gamble at other places. The food court was very convienent for a quick snack, but can't rave about the other restaurants except for the brew pub which was a great place to eat and watch the basketball games. The pool was disappointing but this might just be the time of year- half of it was closed for repairs and the majority of the rest was in the shade so the result was a cluster of people here and there basically lying on top of each other to get some sun. Would stay here again based on price and location. Check in/out was without hassle. Have FUN!

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo an excellent choice in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: stix123123
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo is a great hotel to stay at. Just got back from my trip from March 23 2005 - March 28 2005. Check in was a breeze and for once the airport shuttle actually drops you off near the front desk. The room was nice with a tile entrance and bathroom. The bathroom was a good size only problem was it was alittle dark in the shower. If you do go try to get the king bed as it frees up some space in the room. For the people that complain about pipe noise... there is some noise of water once in awhile considering there are other people staying all around you. If water noise is your biggest concern I would suggest not leaving the cushy confines of your home. The pool is pretty nice but mostly in the shade. The lazy river ride was closed at the time. If you can eat at Andre's while you are there you wont be disappointed. It is expensive but has great food and it is an excellent experience. The tram between monte carlo and bellagio was not working when we were there. If it was you would be able to cover all parts of the strip with ease. The monte carlo brewery pub is also a decent place to get some good beer during the day. It turns into a some kind of club at night but I wouldnt say it is a popular choice. Basically if you are looking for a reasonably priced place to stay I would recommend the Monte Carlo, its location and offerings are worth the money. (I have stayed at Paris and Mirage if that helps you decide where to stay... as I still recommend the Monte Carlo after staying at the other places if you dont want to spend as much money)

Reviews.Title: “Decent value, and If you are driving....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the MC perhaps 10 times since it's opening in the late 1990's, in addition to many other strip Hotels..... I usually return to the MC for the following reasons: 1) Room rates seem to be slightly lower than comparable hotels on the strip, after looking for internet rates, etc.... 2) Location...you cannot beat it, and if you are driving (as I usually do), the access from the parking lot (or the open lot across the street from the lobby) is easy and allows for a pretty quick walk through the lobby and directly to the elevators, WITHOUT having to walk through the casino gaming area.... Also great walking and/or monorail proximity to NY-NY, Bellagio, MGM (and it's movie theater); Excalibur; Mandalay; and Luxor; along with other south strip locales. 3) Not an overwhelming number of young children. 4) The gym/spa is well furnished, but relatively small, and you will pay to use it. The pool is pretty nice. 5) The gaming area is small by strip standards (which I like), and seems to be professionally managed with a courteous but slightly indifferent staff. As far as hot/cold tables...? Hey, win some/lose some.....universal rule, I think. 6) Drink and foods service/restaurants are average, but options are obviously available away from the property if you wish....the food court serves it's purpose, but beware of lines durning mid a.m. hours... 7) Housekeeping has always seemed pretty responsive and thorough... 8) The rooms are neither overly impressive nor terrible...about what you would expect for the usual rate. And yeah, the plumbing can be loud on occasion. The location, room rates, and the parking/lobby/elevator layout, though, is what brings me back every time. I cannot recall being disappointed enough with this hotel/casino to not want to come back.

Reviews.Title: “loved the Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Visited Las Vegas in August 2004 we stayed at the Monte Carlo and really enjoyed ourselves in the Casino itself and in the restaurants and eateries located within the resort lost some cash on the tables but picked up some on the slot machines, it was my first visit to Vegas and i have raved about the place to my friends since my return to Australia.the staff at Monte Carlo were friendly and courteous but be aware of the long distance call rate wow I will visit again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Fun place!”
Reviews.Author: gurltraveler
Reviews.Content: Not a family type environment, but then again it is Vegas. But the pool was a lot of fun for the kids. The rooms are nice, they charge for every little thing like the bottle waters they leave out for you! The toilets are EXTREMELY loud! You can hear it when your neighbors flush! Yuck! We got a great deal on the room so I won't complain about the value. Still very nicely decorated, would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Won't Go Back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My sister and I just got back from Vegas. We stayed there from March 7-11th. The weather was beautiful. Sunny 85. Too bad there was no room around the pool to layout. It was crazy. The pool was not completely opened and there was so much shade around the other areas of the pool. What was left was a very small section and of course everyone wanted to layout, we were practically laying on top of each other and you had to be directed where you could lay. Being from the midwest with our harsh winters, I was so looking forward to laying in the sun and returning with a great tan but was totally frustrated by the limited amount of space around the pool. That meant spending 7 hours a day in the casinos. Thank God we were winning. Maybe it gets better later in the season. Our room was average, I guess we should have read the reviews about having a room close to the elevators, not a good move. Everything was pretty pricey there but you expect that from the casinos on the strip. I loved the Monte Carlo the first time we stayed there but I definitely will be looking around for some place new next year. A place with a great pool will be a must.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just got back from six nights at the MC and I have to say that I had mixed feelings. Check in was disorganized and our clerk was completely disinterested. She just gave us a room (she did accomodate our request for a high floor--28) quickly. In her defense, the people ahead of us seemed to be giving her major problems. Our room was much smaller than we are used to at other casinos, both in Vegas and Atlantic City and the lack of a safe in the room (which is standard in AC) was distressing. I have stayed in Vegas three previous times at three other hotels and none had a safe. Odd, I think. We, of course, were lucky enough to have the loudest neighbors in the world, but thankfully they checked out after three nights. The walls are VERY thin so you do hear your neighbors shower, talk and whatever. I knew this going in but hoped that we would have quiet neighbors. The room was kept clean and the beds were very comfortable. Enjoyed our view of I-15 and the Palms but at night with all the lights, it was beautiful. We could see the mountains which was very nice. Room service was quick and tasty. Found it amusing that during the week, chaise lounges were already set out at the pool, but come Friday, the chairs were stacked and an attendant had to put them out for you. On the positive side, the location cannot be beat. Can easily walk to all the casinos so if you aren't planning n taking any side trips to Red Rock or Hoover Dam, a car is really unnecessary. Also, I really liked the fact that we didn't have to walk through the casino to get to our room. Overall, I think that I would stay there again, if the price was right, but it wouldn't be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I dont know why people are saying this hotel is so horible. They are probably used to staying at the Ritz or somthing, well anyways. We checked into the hotel on Mar10 at about noon. We got into our room right away with no problems. The first thing that hit me though was a strong lemon cleaner smell that triggered a migraine, but after a few hours the smell disapated. The room was clean, bathroom was fairly large. There were two girls in the room so it was hard to share counter space in the bathroom, Another vanity space would have been nice. After reading reviews I requested to be away from the elevators, never heard them though, even when we were waiting to go downstairs. Plumbing noise was only obvious when we were in the bathroom, and even then it was not overly noisy. The maid service was excelent, and all of the staff was curtious, especialy the dealers. They were willing to coach along new gamblers, and even showed me how to play Roulette in the middle of a busy table. The casino was smaller than most, which made it easier to get around and find your friends when you were ready to leave. The pool was heated, I was a bit disapointed that the lazy river was closed for repairs, and the pool is in the shade most of the day. This does have an upside though, no sunburn and it's easy to find a chair. The only complaints that I have is there was a little mildew in the shower, someone came in to clean our room at 9:00 sunday morning while we were all sleeping, and the sit down restaurants are kinda icky looking. By the way, the food court is great....Coffee, McDonalds, Sabaro, and a great lunch Buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo was great!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo for two nights in March. Reserved through their website for a great price, then it went down and they adjusted the price for me twice! Check-in was very fast, if a bit impersonal. They said our rooms would be ready in about 10 minutes, but it took until five o'clock before they were done, over two hours after we checked in. That part was not cool, because we were very tired. (If we had known, we would have checked our bags instead of hauling them around for two hours!) But, on to the rooms--finally. The rooms were nice, good size. I loved the bathrooms, especially. Yes, the plumbing is loud, made me jump! We only heard a little noise from the connecting room next door, because there were little children there. Not too noisy at all. Very comfortable beds. The king-size room seemed a lot more spacious than the two queens. I really liked the decor of the rooms. Good sized TV and plenty of storage space. Although we mostly used valet, the parking was very convenient. We will come back to the Monte Carlo. Great price, great location. We enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “las vegas nana”
Reviews.Author: lasvegasnana
Reviews.Content: I am a mother and grandmother who gets together with friends of mine every year and we all go to las vegas. Every year we stay at the monte carlo and we will not stay anywhere else. We love it. The rooms are not small, they are big enough for us to sleep in and shower in, that is all you need them for. The rest of the time your enjoying vegas and the weather. We are from wisconsin and it is cold where we come from, so the sun is very enjoyable to us. Also the hotel has always been very polite to us, we never had to wait a long period of time for a drink and not that noisy for a big casino. The rates are very reasonable for our pocketbook. I would also recommend to go se the casino host. They will help you out a whole lot and maybe save some money for you on your next trip. They do us. I hear a lot of complaints about the noise in halls and the rooms. Vegas is open 24 hours a day. It never closes and I don't think you can get away from that at any of the other hotels. It is vegas. It is sunny, noisy, relaxing, away from the stress and most of all- a lot of fun.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: Antar
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at several hotels in Vegas, and wanted to give the Monte Carlo a try because the price was right (between 59 and 79 USD Mon-Thurs). Pros: Smaller and quieter than the other hotels in the area. If you're not into having kids around, this is a good place to be. I've stayed at the Luxor in the past, and found it to be overrun with children (probably due to the Excalibur being next door). Check-in was fairly quick; our room wasn't ready and we had asked for a king-sized bed. They put us into another room with 2 queens (which we were fine with) and said we could switch the next night if we wished. We did end up switching, but for a different reason -- there was a strong odour of cooking that we found obnoxious. The front desk moved us up a floor (25th) and gave us a king-sized bed and a strip view for no extra charge. It was nice, but I can't imagine paying an additional $20 per night for it. The room was nothing special, but it was clean and in good condition. Considering that I'd probably get the same layout at a Doubletree and pay $100+, I was content. Cons: *IMPORTANT TO KNOW BEFORE YOU CHECK IN* The hotel put a 100 USD per day hold on my credit card for amenities (ie. room service, charging restaurant visits to your room), and didn't inform me they were doing so. On the third day of my visit, I had my card declined while dining out and was bewildered because I knew I had enough cash -- this was due to the Monte Carlo. The front desk eventually cleared it up, and informed me that this was standard procedure at all Vegas hotels. This isn't true. I've never encountered this at Luxor, and when I stayed at the Aladdin, they gave me the option of allowing a per diem for amenities to be taken from my card. The Monte Carlo never gave us the option of declining -- they just charged my card. I was upset because it was going to take 5-7 days for the bank to credit the cash back to my account. The hotel was apologetic, but didn't offer anything to smooth over the situation. If you don't want the 100 USD per diem amenities, BE SURE TO TELL THEM UPON ARRIVAL.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service,friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: gamblinggal
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Monte Carlo March 3 to 6th. Had read lots of reviews before deciding on this hotel. We had no surprises and were not dissapointed. Booked directly with the hotel and got a great deal for a standard room. Upon check in the registration clerk asked if it was a special occasion for us. It was our wedding anniversary so right away she upgraded no charge us to a strip view room on the 31st floor! Tried to convince us to upgrade again to a suite but we decided to stay with what we had. We knew we were not going to be in the room much anyways. The price was excellent though to upgrade to a suite- much cheaper than booking a suite on line- a suite would have cost us over $350 more to book it on line but they offered to upgrade for only $149 more. Everyone was really helpful- always friendly no matter who you asked. Very easy to get to the rooms. Always left a tip for housekeeping and the room was very clean. All meals were great. Yes the walls are a little thin but did not bother us to the point of complaining. Would recommend this hotel to anyone. Had a wonderful 1st time visit to Vegas. We will be back!! Thankyou Monte Carlo.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel......Great Price”
Reviews.Author: pikapptcu
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Mar 3 & 4. Not the greatest hotel on the strip. Rooms were small. Plumbling was very loud plus walls were very thin. You get what you pay for. We had a rate of $59 on Thurs and $99 on Fri. Good rates! Casino feels very cramped (low ceilings). The brewery is a decent place to grab a bite and a drink. The bellmen were fast and nice. Nothing else great about the hotel. We visited every major hotel on the strip (from Mandalay Bay to Treasure Island) and would rank Monte Carlo on the bottom. My only problem is that I stayed 3 nights at the Four Seasons in Mandalay Bay and then went to Monte Carlo. Huge downgrade! I would recommend staying at Mandalay Bay, Venetian, or NY NY. Some good places to go: N9ne Steakhouse (Palms) and Cenalleto (Venitian), Nine Fine Irishmen (NYNY), O (Bellagio), golf at Bali Hai

Reviews.Title: “not bad, not great”
Reviews.Author: aaronr
Reviews.Content: I just got back last night from The MonteCarlo (stayed 3/3 to 3-6) paid 185.00 per night. The room was clean. I never heard the elavator, and the bathroom in our room was large. The bad part is the staff, they were not rude, but not friendly at all. The overall vibe at the MC is very unwelcoming. My least favorite part is the fact that it takes 15 minutes to get from the front door to the rooms which gets old quickly and keeps you from going to the room too often. For the same money I'll stay at Paris again next time.

Reviews.Title: “A tight space”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at the Monte Carlo and my review for this hotel would be neutral. First, I agree that the walls are VERY thin. We could hear our neighbors' conversations and even the TV noise from next door! But since it is Vegas, who stays in their hotel room all day? If you like to sleep early or wake up late, you will not be too pleased with the noise, since in Vegas, people like to turn in very late in the night and make a lot of noise, and early check-outs make to hard to sleep through other people's noise. Second, the room is a so tiny it's a little bigger than a walk-in closet. But wait, the bathroom is worse. The shower head is the size of a quarter, it will take forever to get all the soap off your body. Also, you need muscles to flush the toilet! And yes, the plumbing is bad also. The good thing about this hotel is the location, the price, and the nice room decor. It feels like a 4 star hotel but a little less. The room is very clean and new, the housekeeping is good, re-stocking our towels and amenities. Overall, if you don't want to pay so much for a nice hotel but want to stay on the strip, this hotel is great. But consider the consequences.

Reviews.Title: “Check Your Valuables!”
Reviews.Author: BEEBEE
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Monte Carlo some time back. My wife won $300.00 at the slots which I secreted in my overnight bag. The next morning we went out to breakfast, and returned not only to find our room clean, but that three hundred dollars gone as well. Reported it to the hotel manager who accused me of either making the story up, or taking the money myself (he mentioned some people have a gambling problem or spend it on "hookers"). I am aware they are not legally liable for"lost" money, but figure they should be aware of a thief in their staff, so I spent a good part of the day downtown filing a police report (to no avail) I informed the Hotel Manager of this fact and suggest he sue me for slander/libel if I did indeed make the story up! No lawsuit ever materialized. Hotel security was sarcastic enough to send me a letter stating if any employee should happen to "find" my "misplaced money" they would happily send it back to me---I'm still waiting!!! I would not spend another night at this property even if the Hotel put me up for free! p.s.--gave it one star because I actually enjoyed the heated pool!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, but noisy plumbing!”
Reviews.Author: iluvvegas
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on 1/31 and 2/1. Checked out 2 days early because of loud plumbing. I had read this in other posts, but thought 'how bad can it be?' Well, we upgraded to a Monaco Suite (regular room rate was $59 + $30 upgrade) and they are located immediately off the elevators. We could hear the elevator 'bing' every time it opened on our floor. We could also hear water running next to us and above us. Every suite has an adjoining door, which helps you hear your neighbors very well. I will say, however, that the suite was very nice, the pillow-top bed was so comfortable, and the 1.5 bathrooms were nice and large. Ate in the brewpub and the food/service was excellent! Would not stay here again because there are so many other nice hotels to choose from in the area.

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Monte Carlo every year for the past 5 years. Love the location, and the aroma when you walk into the casino is the best in Vegas! The rooms are average, we have no complaints there. Don't expect them to be like upper priced hotels. We do miss having in room safes though. Saftey boxes are a bit of nuisence. Last year though, we did not appreciate one cocktail waitress that took forever to come around and when she did finally bring us a drink, stood there and waited until we tipped her. Yes you should, but I don't think she should have just waited minutes until we did. The staff was not as friendly as in years past either. The comps are not as easy to get as before. We are deffinately thinking about staying elsewhere this year. When I did call to check rates, the girl was very rude and didn't offer any help and sounded like she was doing me such a favor talking with me.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: traveler05
Reviews.Content: I just returned from the MC and we loved it. We payed 49 a night for a regular room and upgraded for $80 to a spa suite on the 29th floor with an amazing view of the strip. We liked the casino ( did not win), liked the food court for a quick snack, loved the location, and had no complaints at all with the hotel. For the price this place can not be beat!!! We have spent more to stay other places but won't make that mistake again!!! Would be great in the summer too!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good.....but”
Reviews.Author: BoboU2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 1/21-1/25. Regular room was nice, beds were good. Wasn't as noisy as I was led to believe here. The staff was helpful and nice. I thought the Cafe and the dinner buffet were good and priced nice. I'm not a "gambler" but I thought the Casino was good and well spaced out. The only 2 problems I had at the MC was the bathroom was below par... crappy water pressure, the handle on the sink kept falling off and the toilet was very low. And the other was the TV/Internet access. But for the price not bad...I would stay again if I got a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The room was nice, however no coffee makers or room safes, which was a drag. Plus when we were there, the coffee/bagel shop was closed in the morning, leaving just McDonald's coffee, which is less than desirable. Also, I had a problem with my room key and couldn't get anyone to let me in. I was told secuirty would have to do that and I had to wait over 30 minutes for someone to finally come up there. Also, check-in was disorganized and nobody knew if it was one line or several. I liked the hotel overall, especailly for the money, however, the service was bad. I was betting a lot on the Black Jack tables and $1 slots and had a hard time finding drinks...

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: vtgambler
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three night stay at the Monte Carlo. I have stayed at most of the big hotels on the strip and I think the MC offers the best value for your dollar. The room was nowhere near as nice as Bellagio, Mandalay or Venetian, but it was clean and the maid service was good. We had no problems with noise. The location of the MC is good. It's a short walk (by Vegas standards) to Bellagio, NYNY, Aladdin and MGM. The layout of the gaming area is pretty much a big rectangle which makes it easier to navigate then many of the others. No problem finding low limit blackjack and craps. They also have a small poker room and an average sportsbook. The buffett was average. You can probably do better for your money elsewhere.
