The Italian restaurant was good and I've eaten at the steakhouse (Blackstone's) in the past and thought it was excellent. Having a food court in the hotel also offers some quick, convenient options. Feel free to email me if you have any questions! Also, FYI - the monorail was open and we used it once. Our conclusion was that unless you are going all the way out to the LVCC or the Sahara it is waste of time and money. You have to walk all the way through the MGM to get on and then back through another casino to get off and it cost $3 one way.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from three nights at the Monte Carlo and everything was outstanding. Check-in staff was pleasant and assited us with our request for an upgrade. Casino is nice - not so large that you lose your friends among all the gambling but still has all the most popular games. Buffet was very good - go before 3:30 and get the lunch price. Great location and good comps! We'll definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A great time had!”
Reviews.Author: WickedWahine
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night on 1/16. Upgraded two deluxe rooms booked online thru MC at $69 a night to a spa suite and attached deluxe room at the front desk for only a bit more money. A front desk employee was being trained during our check-in and it did take a significant amount of time to process us. After a long drive from Arizona, it left us both wondering what we were in for. We were pleased to be given a 22nd floor suite with attached deluxe room for our daughter. Unfortunately, the deluxe room attached to the suite was still not ready, even 45 minutes after checking in. Then a maintenance crew showed up with a carpet cleaner. We were told the room was not ready due to vomit on the carpets. We were only informed of this after using the key for the third time to check if the room was done and walked in on them furiously scrubbing. After a call to the hotel manager, a deluxe room only two doors down from our suite was given to us at no cost for the night with apology for the inconvenience. The spa suite was luxurious, had an excellent view from the 22nd floor, and the amenities and toiletries were a great treat. Love the Gilchrist & Soames products! Furniture, wallpaper, and carpeting showed signs of wear & tear and one of the bed sheets had a burn hole in it, but the room was very clean and nice and the bed soooo comfortable. Around 2:00 a.m. in the morning a large group of drunken partiers decided to camp out in the elevator area just outside our door and made an unbelievable amount of noise. It did seem to echo right into our room. A call to the front desk had the problem solved within a few minutes, however. Room service the next morning was fast, efficient, and very tasty. We will definitely stay at the MC again. Despite the few problems we had, the response to them was exemplary enough to satisfy us and the Monte Carlo is a luxurious, clean, fun place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: Chi-native
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the Monte Carlo and loved it. Since you're in Vegas, it's pretty pointless to stay in your room so we didn't. The hotel is right in the middle of everything, especially shopping. Check in was easy, expecially after booking through the now defunct Spirit Airlines. We had the redeye back to Chicago, but were able to store our bags while we continued to shop and party. The only problem was that one of the housekeepers threw away our souveneirs. The hotel staff took care of it immediately. They looked for our belongings in the trash, and before we arrived home, they had left messages of apology on our voice mails and before the week was over, we both received checks for the value of the missing items. I would definitely do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Best rates and very clean”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We've been to Vegas several times, business and pleasure, and for the amount that we stay in our room...it is the best. Very clean and nicely decorated. Actually saw Mike Tyson and "girls" in elevator. Casino employees are not snooty and atmosphere very comfortable, no matter what you are wearing or the amount of money you are gambling. We stayed in the Deluxe and the Suite, and besides a couch and extra bathroom, quality the same in both. Not really a place for kids, pool is nice, however nothing else for them to do...I would suggest New York NY with game room, or Circus Circus with huge amuzement park inside. Have fun and be safe.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property and staff”
Reviews.Author: Winecountryguy
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Vegas 3 times, always before in a time share my parents bought. This time we wanted something nicer. There were lots of bargains for the time we were going to be there, but none as nice for the price we got ($49/nite). I had read many reviews, some glowing and others negative. My sister stayed there in October and was pleased so we booked our room (over the internet). First, let me say that everyone we had contact with was wonderful. The valet that parked our car was very considerate to my wife. She had left a bag in the car after it was parked and he went with her to retrieve it. Check in was a little slow, not bad, but the clerk was very helpful in getting us an upper floor (29th) with the view we wanted. The bell hops were "Johnnie on the spot" delivering our luggage. As to the room itself, I was very impressed. Nice carpets, attractive furniture, quiet adjustable heat, spacious bathroom and comfortable beds. I think the shower has plenty of power. As to noise, we had no problems at all. Maybe if someone is shouting, you might hear, but otherwise nothing to complain about. The hotel itself was layed out nicely so you can bypass the casino to get to the pool area and some restuarants. I didn't get a chance to use the pool as there was a bad storm and cold weather the days we were there (Jan 2-5). Other staff we met were very helpful as well, the concierge that got us tickets to Mama Mia and the Spa staff my wife met. She was very pleased with the AromaTherapy message she got. We are not big gamblers, just do some slots, so I can't comment on the dealers. One thing I noticed was the air was fresher in the casino than others we went into. One of the big pluses of this hotel is it's location. You have 2 monorail systems to use close by. One goes south to the Mandalay Bay. The other goes north to the Riveria. Of course there is lots to do within walking distance. We didn't eat in any of the nicer restuarants on site as we have our favorites in other locations. The bagel shop and pizza were good. We used express checkout with the TV in the room. Very convienent and saved standing in line. All in all, this was a great stay for one heck of a price. I would definitely return (hopefully with better weather).

Reviews.Title: “Great Time at the Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: Venderhack
Reviews.Content: Just so you know where I am coming from, I am a 35 year old married man that doesn't need to be pampered or desire to much. I stayed at Monte Carlo for New Years and I must say the hotel was awesome. The staff was VERY friendly except for one BJ dealer who must not have gotten her new attitude for Christmas. The location is perfect being right next to NYNY and across from MGM which might explain why the hotel was never crowded. The check in was a breeze but I also arrived there at 12:30a and check out was also a breeze. Beware of the cost of long distance phone calls. YIKES!! Use a cell phone if you have one. The hotel room was nothing that took my breath away. Kind of like a room at the Holiday Inn. The bed was very comfy and the shower bowed out giving plenty of room. They did provide shampoo, conditioner, body lotion, oatmeal soap, another bar of soap and a shower cap with lots of towels! I was disappointed that the room did not have a safe but did have a hair dryer, iron and board. I was on the 28th floor with a pretty decent veiw. Half the window looked at NYNY, Excalibur, Luxor and Mandalay Bay while the other half looked at the mountains. Sunrise was beautiful with the clouds hanging over the mountains. But I digress. There were seperate elevators for the top floors and I NEVER waited long for an elevator. The carpet and walls were clean with no graffiti anywhere. Now about the noise. I have read many things about the noise and yes, you can hear people in the hall and when you are in the bathroom you can hear the plumbing from the other room but it is FAR from distracting. If you are THAT bothered by some noise than may I suggest Bellagio. The casino was standard but I liked the lay-out with two big sections of table games and a beautiful poker room. MC also did a great job of filtering the air. Trust me, you'll notice if you're a non smoker! One thing I did notice is the lobby and elevators were seperate from the casino. I went to the Excalibur, what a mess. People, luggage and KIDS were EVERYWHERE!!! I couldn't wait to get out of there. My in-laws stayed at the Flamingo. What a dump. They hated it. The curtains were yellowed and the carpet stained. The vent in the bathroom looked like the inside of a vacuum cleaner bag. No wonder people are getting sick!! I would recommend the Monte Carlo if you want to stay somewhere inexpensive on the strip that is close to other sites and not spend a fortune in transportation. I would absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: MeercatMD
Reviews.Content: Great Location! We just returned from the Monte Carlo. Check in was fast and easy. Our room was very neat and clean, and we had a nice view of the strip from the 14th floor. There were only two problems with our room. One was that the plumbing is in need of some up-dating. It took awhile for the hot water to come on in the shower, and sometimes our toilet would burble up after taking a shower (water pressure problem?). The walls are “thin” if the television is up very loud (blaring), or people are shouting to each other at 1:30 in the morning (we experienced this one night). We heard security knock on their door, and it got quiet after that. There is no coffee maker in the room, but there is a Golden Bagel Coffee shop downstairs and also a McDonalds. We ate at the buffet on Christmas day and the food was very good. We also ate at the buffet for breakfast the day that we left and the breakfast buffet was good, but we would have liked a larger selection of fruit. We also ate at the micro-brewery and Dragon Noodle – both were excellent. We also had the pizza at Sbbaros which serves large slices of pizza (fast food). There is also a French restaurant called Andres that looked very nice, but we did not eat there. The casino is actually nice and we saw quite a few people winning at the slot machines. The casino is easy to maneuver through, brightly lit, and was not as noisy as some of the other casinos. The arcade was okay, not as large as MGM or NYNY’s arcades. The shops were nice, and I especially liked Bubbles which has different soaps and bath salts for sale. The hotel staff was very nice and friendly, including the maintenance workers. We always left a tip for the maid, and our room was always clean. If you are looking for a good clean up-scale hotel in a good location for a decent price then this is the place. If you are looking for luxury then you should stay at the Venetian or the Bellagio. We really enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed a week at the Monte. The hotel was super nice and clean. The decor was elegant and upscale. I was most impressed with the non-smokey atmosphere in the gaming section. The hotel offered a Texas Holdem lesson for one hour each morning. This was really helpful for a first time Vegas visitor. The buffets were awesome. I liked the location on the strip, convenient to everything. The room rate was low compared to other hotels in this level. We rented a car at the hotel and went to the Grand Canyon for two days. The only negative thing I can think of is the rooms were not very sound proof, especially noise from the hallways. We will definately stay here again when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Good prices in return for not much else”
Reviews.Author: swimmom1960
Reviews.Content: Stayed the week before Christmas and the rates were fabulous however we had requested adjoining rooms to our children weeks in advance when we booked the hotel. They had none except on the vip floor which was $39.00 more a night per room and they promised the next day we would have adjoining rooms to move to on the lower floors.Our key to the vip floor was very difficult to access, rarely working on the first few tries. We waited all day for this and at first they said we had to be out of our room at 11:oo am and our new room wouldn't be ready until 5-6pm. They ended up letting us stay in the old room but refused to call our cell to tell us when it was ready and we had to keep checking back to see if it was ready so we wasted a day. In both rooms the water pressure for the shower was so weak I thought it would take all day to get the shampoo out. They had a bad selection of slot machines and they were so tight they squealed. The buffet was good. the selection of fast food was good. The crap tables were cold and the blackjack too. The people at the hotel were for the most part unfriendly with the exception of a couple. If you go on a cheap rate don't expect much!!

Reviews.Title: “Great time, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Monte Carlo from Dec 19-22. Had a great time. The hotel was in a prime location on the strip with Bellagio, Caesars, MGM Grand, and other hotels very close by. The rooms were very clean and comfortable, and unmatched for $49 per night. What a deal!! The property was a good size: not too big, but not too small. Lots of low limit blackjack tables available. Good food court and helpful and friendly staff. Only negatives were a few rude dealers and tight slots. Would stay at the Monte Carlo again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the $$$”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just spent 5 nights at the Monte Carlo from 12/11 - 12/16. Beautiful hotel at an excellent location on the South Strip. We found staff to be pleasant and acommodating. Got an excellent deal for a Saturday thru Wed stay on their website. Forget about using the travel websites like Expedia or Hotels ... you will get a better deal calling the Monte Carlo or going directly to their website. The room was clean and reasonably sized, and housekeeping cleaned it every day ... never had a problem here. Leave a good tip for the housekeeper your first day. This was our first trip to Vegas. We requested a high floor and when we checked in they gave us a strip view on the 26th floor... no extra charge! The hotel lobby is beautiful, the casino large enough for us, food court very convenient for the quick munchies, and for breakfast, the Cafe was an excellent choice. Minuses: the buffet was just not good and not worth the $$. Dragon Noodle Asian restaurant was mediocre at best. The walls are thin and we were awakened one AM by our next door neighbor (that was the only time). The plusses: price, location, friendly service, fast valet service, drink service in the Casino fast, clean and well maintained rooms, comfy beds. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay on the strip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from 12/12/2004 to 12/13/2004. Very impressed! Excellent value for the money. Great location. Room was very clean and well layed out. Bathroom was clean and well stocked. Great food selection and nice on-site brewery. Staff was friendly and helpful. Hard to believe that this place was the same price as Luxor (rude staff... See my 8/2004 Luxor review) and Excalibur (which is not as nice).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: SubaruDriver
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in October and had booked a Spa Suite, but were upgraded to a Diamond Suite which was absolutely fabulous. Have stayed here before in March and found that the rooms had been updated since we last travelled here to a great standard. The bathroom is superb. Two people can lay flat side by side in the spa, and the views gave us a look down the strip and let us watch the Bellagio Fountains do their thing every 15 minutes. House keeping was acceptable, and the location of the hotel is fantastic - next to New York New York and opposite MGM Grand with Alladin and Bellagio a short walk away. I found the casino to be a lot more airy compared to others on the strip and a lot less smoky. The hostesses are very quick at getting drinks and deserve their tip! Wouldn't hesitate to go back

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: miranda
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Monte Carlo on the 21st November 04, and had booked a standard room. I asked about upgrading and they offered us an upgrade to a Whirlpool Suite for an extra $40 dollors per night which we accepted. The first suite we checked into we asked to move out of straight away because the window would not close but the second suite was brilliant. The room was extremely large, with a Jacuzzi in the corner(view of the strip as you sat in the Jacuzzi). We had a bar area with sink and fridge. The Bathroom was lovely, seperate toilet and large walk in marble shower. It was definately worth the upgrade. The maid always made an effort e.g chocolates on pillow in the evening and bed folded down. I found the staff helpful and the hotel seemed very upmarket and good for couples. We stayed over Thanksgiving and did not see many Families although I am sure they do cater for families. The only negative is that the walls were thin and if you had noisy neighbours I could see that this would be a problem!!!! We only had neighbours on one side which I think helped. I would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the pool”
Reviews.Author: Laurence Zing
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in September 04, we were advised by friends and they were not wrong! The pool area was fantastic if not a little too busy at times. The room gave a brilliant view of the Strip but was not very spacious, the bathroom was larger than it needed to be but was clean and hygenic. The bed was ok but ask for extra pillows! The hotel gives excellent access to all the major attractions. Very reasonable price, as with all Vegas hotels, it gets pricey at the weekends but on average this offered good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, clean, great value”
Reviews.Author: WKWH
Reviews.Content: Our party of 7 stayed at The Monte Carlo for 5 nights. GREAT LOCATION and easy to get to other casinos (walking to most, $2.00 bus for 1 way, or purchase $5.00 ticket for 24 hour period - with as many on and offs as you desire). MC had tram to Belliago, but was temporiarly down. Easy, friendly, and quick check-in. Even on Thanksgiving Day we were able to get our rooms an hour early. The above average rooms were large, clean, had dark curtains, no smoke smell, easy to get to, located at the end of a hall, therefore almost no noise and we could go on balcony and take pictures and get fresh air. GREAT VIEW. No problem with elevators. Best price we could find for similar hotel (direct thru MC website). Beautiful, above average casino, good ventilation, high ceilings, all the games most people want. Large casino, but we were able to find the rest of our party (most of the time). Friendly and efficent staff. Had breakfast and dinner buffets, also dinner at Cafe, all very good and reasonable priced. Food court convenient. Breakfast at Nathans was very good, cheap, and large. Belliago, Ceasars (a must see), Venitian and other grander (and more expensive) hotels had grander shopping, but we weren't interested in that anyway. All 7 of us say we really like Monte Carlo and will recommend it. We plan on staying at MC again. Our first trip to Vegas and we had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Way Cool Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 5 days for our 5th wedding anniversary starting the weekend before Thanksgiving. We couldn't ask for a better visit. Our room was clean and fresh and the hotel and casino staff were all very pleasant. I read many reviews and was quite worried about the noise we might have to deal with through the walls in our room, but it was not bad at all. I didn't hear our neighbors in their rooms, just an occasional noisy guest walking down the hallway. I also read some reviews about the buffet not being good and that was totally not the case. We ate dinner there one night and the food was really good. I was totaly impressed with the casino too. The air was fresh and clean smelling and the gaming areas neat and clean. I've never played table games before this trip but now I can add that to my lists of things accomplished. Thanks to a very friendly and helpful casino dealer, I was taught to play BlackJack like a pro. My thanks to the Monte Carlo for a wonderful 5th Anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, not that glamourous.”
Reviews.Author: victoriabcguy
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 evenings at the hotel. Booked directly through their website, which had the best price I could find. The hotel is part of the mandalay group and as such is affiliated with a few other hotels. The room was pretty decent and the housekeeping is 24hrs. which comes in handy when your sleep schedule gets screwed up in this town! I didn't find the place to be as noisy as some ppl had mentioned. My room had great curtains that provided good dark cover for sleep during the daytime. No problem with the elevators being difficult like in some places, and the rooms aren't a marathon walk to get to like in some hotels. Each floor has three "wings" 35 rooms each wing, with a bank of six elevators to service about 9 floors. The casino itself isn't as nice as caesars, bellagio or other places- kind of middle of the road. I did most of my gambling elsewhere. Appreciated the food court to get take out coffee and the mcdonalds to grab a couple egg mcmuffins when I returned back to the hotel room. A short walk to the middle strip area of bellagio/ballys, etc. Hotel staff were efficient -- neither friendly nor rude. For the price, I'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: wsjohnson.phd
Reviews.Content: As the title implies, we spent our honeymoon in Vegas at the Monte Carlo and absolutely loved it!! The staff at the Monte Carlo were first rate! They treated us as if we were special and catered to our every whim, with no complaints or hesitation. I know it's considered a world-class hotel and should offer the sort of attentiveness we received, but we were your basic run-of-the-mill guest; no one special and yet, they made us feel like we were the only guests in the hotel. Our 15th floor room was large, lovely and the king-sized bed was the most comfortable bed we had encountered in years of hotel visits: with night views of the strip and skyline from an oversized window that we shall always treasure. The pool, spa and health club were first rate with attentive, helpful and very competent staff. Altho we did not have our wedding in the hotel's chapel, we did happen upon a wedding there and witnessed the warm and caring attention to detail provided by the staff,as well as the appreciative bride and groom. The hotels shopping strip, restuarants, bars and lounges were all top of the class with experienced and extremely helpful staff. The concierge staff were extremely knowledgable, courteous and helpful without a hint of bother. While in town, we visited all the other hotels along the strip, from the Bellagio to Treasure Island and felt like the Monte Carlo was the right choice for us. Bar none, the five days we spent at the Monte Carlo were the best experience I have ever had in Vegas. I would highly (and have) recommend the Monte Carlo to anyone who wants an 'experience to remember' in Vegas. Oh yes, the casino and sports book was top class as well; unfortunately we don't gamble, but that doesn't mean you shouldn't.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo very classy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were 9 people booked into the Monte Carlo for the first time in September and were very impressed with the property. We had all been to Las Vegas several times and had stayed at other hotels. Elegant, not flashy design in the hotel and casino. The pool area was compact but designed well w/a lazy river that was great for a inner tube. The casino was not so large that you couldn't find people and had all the games you could want. The breakfast buffet was reasonably priced and had anything you would want. The other restaurants were overpriced. My husband had us upgraded to a suite. More room but no real amenities except the safe & jacuzzi tub. The standard rooms did not have either. Right on the Strip and very easy to traverse to get to where you want to go. We were able to sight-see the new hotels very easily from our location. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: ramonaone
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went for are anniversary Nov 12 through the 14th, and as usual we had a great time. This is are 3rd time staying at the Monte Carlo and it was really nice. The hotel staff cound not be more polite or helpful. We asked for early check in as we arrived at 10:00 in the morning and we were accomadated right away. The place is always clean and neat, the rooms are very nice. Nothing fancy but always nice. The Monte Carlo may not be as fancy or have the shopping of some resorts, but those other places are only a short walk or cab ride away. And you don't have to put up with the rude staff at so many other places. I have stayed in $1500.00 a night rooms and in $150.00 a night rooms this is a nice compromise. We will go back

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly acceptable hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a girls trip in Vegas November 9-12. Our priorities included a good location on the strip and a reasonable price. These attributes were definately met at the Monte Carlo. Also enjoyed the casino and the food court--although the food court seemed to close early. I heeded the advice of some other reviewers and booked online from the Monte Carlo Website--much better price than the online travel sites (expedia, orbitz, etc). Check in was ok but for the fact that we did not get the connecting rooms we had requested, other than that no issues with the room (we did not have issues with noise). We also went to the Rita Rudner comdey show--enjoyed that!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic as always”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I always stay at the Monte Carlo when in Vegas. I have stayed at many of the hotels on the strip and always return here. The hotel is as you'd expect- the rooms are nicely furnished and are always clean and spacious. The staff are really helpful and friendly. The pool area is lovely and there are a wide variety of places to eat and drink from 3am coffee to 5 course banquets. The value for money is great. The gaming floor is bright and airy rather than being dark and smoky. I have also noticed that there are rarely children staying at the hotel, the most I have ever seen are about 4 or 5 by the pool. The only bad thing I have ever encountered at the MC is check in and check out, this seems to take anywhere from 1 minute to quarter of an hour it just depends if your lucky!

Reviews.Title: “The Monte Carlo is perfectly fine.”
Reviews.Author: wmvesneski
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Monte Carlo with friends from 10/29 to 11/1 and it's a perfectly fine place. We've stayed at Bellagio, Circus Circus (ick), Flamingo and the MGM Grand in Vegas and I'd rate this equivalent to the MGM Grand -- clearly not as nice as Bellagio, but better than the Flamingo. Yes, the walls are thin, but, the room was clean and large, the lobby is very nice, check-in was a breeze, and the staff are very friendly. I had a massage at the "spa" which was adequate, but if you've been to high-end spas and resorts, you'll be disappointed. Lance Burton was also fun. Finally, avoid room service, the food arrives cold -- for breakfast just head to the food court where there is a bagel/coffee shop that makes decent lattes. Finally, the casino is pretty decent and it's one of the best in town in controlling the inevitable cloud of cigarette smoke. Finally, the Market City Cafe is fabulous (Zagat rated). All in all, I would stay here again and would recommend it if you're trying to avoid the low-end hotels while also save some money.

Reviews.Title: “Small towels, thin walls, fun casino”
Reviews.Author: careytony
Reviews.Content: Just finished a weeks stay at the Monte Carlo and although it has it's good points was it is not one of my favorite hotels. This was the second time I've stayed there because of business obligations and both visits were similar. Rooms are clean and bright but walls are paper thin. You could hear when neighbors next door showered and ran the sink. You could also smell food odors coming up through the vents. And oh yes the fire alarm went off just an hour after we got there. After a few minutes the sirens went off but the flashing lights stayed on at least another hour. While there were announcements that the situation was being investigated no one ever announced whethter there was really a problem. It was only by asking a security guard that I found out that the situation, whatever it was was resolved. My complaints includethe fact that there is no full length mirror in room, no vanity mitrror and tiny towels that no one over a size 6 could wrap around themselves. There is also no place to sit down in the huge lobby or by the elevators. And since I 'd rather shop then gamble I also wish there was a greater selection and variety of stores. On the positive side the Gilchrist and Soames bath products are terrific, the staff is generally helpful and the atmosphere is friendly enough that I felt quite comfortable sitting in the coffee shop alone for a meal. The casino offered lots to do for the small time gambler with plenty of penny and nickel slots. I especially enjoyed the group craps lesson and $2 minimum bet game that followed. All and all it was a relaxing stay buy the hotel room was nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: toddykay
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 2 week vacation staying at the Monte Carlo Hotel, 7th-21st October 2004. What a fantastic stay we had. We have been to Vegas many times before and always stayed at Harra's, this time we decided to change. I searched the internet for weeks and decided on trying the Monte Carlo. We were certainly not disappointed, in fact we were overjoyed. We found our first room had very noisey plumbing, after speaking with the Manager we were changed to a suite at no extra charge, it was huge. We found if you leave a good tip every day for your maid you get your room done nice and early, our maid was really lovely. We can highly recommend Blackstones to eat at, but for a pure dining experience go to Andre's exceptional service and food. The Buffet was o.k. but make sure you ask for non smoking and to be seated at the front. The first time we ate there we were seated at the casino end, we found by the time we had trekked back to our tables with the food it was lukewarm. The variety is very good though. The Cafe was excellent for breakfast and lunch, probably for dinner too but we did not try this. They have a food court if you just want a bagel & Coffee or a Macdonalds. You must try the various Ice Cream Milkshakes, they were delicous. The pool was superb, the lazy river and wave pool were great fun. There was never a problem in getting chairs and we always opted for our favoutite spot and got it every day. In our opinion the Casino was the best in Vegas, it had a lovely smell to it, it was clean, well laid out and the staff were excellent, give the cocktail hostess a good tip and she will certainly look after you. The Casino Hosts were amazing, thank you to Julie and Alan, they really took care of us throughout our stay. We were so impressed we are already planning our return trip for Christmas and New Year. Thank you Monte Carlo....be seeing you again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Very solid Vegas hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at the MC and am a very picky traveler. Very pleasant stay. First time in Vegas. Was traveling with family including chlidren. Utilized Trip Advisor extensively in planning my stay, so want to offer feedback. Had a clean, elegantly decorated room on the 24th floor overlooking the Strip; slightly worn but acceptable. NO smoke smell in room. Comfortable bed. New towels were delivered each day. Separate banks of elevators to rooms very well-designed so that there was very minimal wait for an elevator at any given time. Hotel layout good- not necessary to trudge through the casino on way to pool or parking lot. Pool area excellent and a TOP DRAW for families, as previously noted. They are closing for the season at the end of the month. Good location on the strip. This is not the Bellagio nor is it Bellagio pricing, but the MC is a very elegant, clean, solid place to stay on the strip if you don't want to pay Bellagio prices.

Reviews.Title: “Review way past overdue!”
Reviews.Author: mmt
Reviews.Content: I have been meaning to write a review of our stay at the Monte Carlo since we returned in June 2004. My boyfriend and I had a wonderful experience, and we chose the Monte Carlo based on extensive research on sites such as Trip Advisor. I booked a room on the Monte Carlo website for a standard room, it was a great rate at $79 with the web special they were running. When we arrived, we were immediately and easily upgraded (we did not even begin to ask) to a jacuzzi suite at no additional charge. (We do travel weekdays, because we are both in the service industry and must work on the weekends - maybe that had something to do with it) Anyway, the jacuzzi suite was pristine clean and wonderful! The room was spacious and very quiet except for one night when a bachelor party was next to us and the guys got in pretty late and were rowdy. We knocked on the wall and it quieted down. We left a tip every day for our room attendant, with a note asking for extra towels the first day, and so of course our room was very well taken care of. Our bathroom was great with a marble shower/steamroom, and the king sized bed was very comfortable . The view was not of the strip, it was of the highway and a little of the parking lot and resort across the street, but we didn't care about the view, when we were literally in the jacuzzi right up against the window enjoying the glow of the city lights. The pool was amazing, we loved the lazy river and there were of course kids, but they were not unruly or obtrusive at all, everyone was just having a great time together. It was not a hassle for us to get pool chairs, it was crowded but there were staff members ready to help you find a spot. The buffet was okay, but we all know that the buffets are going to be just okay in Vegas (or anywhere). We only ate there once, and actually enjoyed going to the little coffee shop in the food court for lattes, salad and breakfast sandwiches, and took pizza from the food court back up our room-perfect!. The casino is nice, and neither of us is a smoker, so it was bearable to us, and we could actually stay for longer periods of time at the tables. We visited several other casinos on the strip, and we agreed that we will definitely book again at the Monte Carlo - and for sure we will book the jacuzzi suite!!

Reviews.Title: “Great as always”
Reviews.Author: Love2Travel
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Monte Carlo in September 2004. Check in was a breeze, I've never seen a line more than 2 deep there. Staff was friendly. Room was clean and provided everything you need. Nicely decorated. Pool is amazing. Love the lazy river. Always lots of chairs and staff to get you one of there are none avialable. Ate at the buffet - it was good, with steaks cooked to order. Decent prices too. Casino is usually pretty quiet with lower limits. Most dealers were friendly. Wait staff and bartenders are friendly and very quick. All in all, a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Would have rather stayed in an Animal Shelter”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in 80% of all of the Las Vegas hotels, we thought that we would give the Monte Carlo a try. What a mistake. The guest room walls were so thin it was like we were sharing a room with the families on both sides of us. We called the Front Desk about this matter and the clerk reluctantly admitted that there were quieter rooms. We asked to be switched to a quieter room and within 10 minutes, we had a new room. We went downstairs to get a new key (because they couldn’t have anyone deliver a key to our room within the next hour.) We then realized that we would have to take a separate bank of elevators to our new room. Floors 1-12 in one elevator, 13-26 in another, etc. A Bellman was unavailable for the next 45 minutes, so we so schelped our luggage to our new room. This process took a good 20 minutes because of (and I’m not exaggerating) a 15 minute line for the elevator. There were so many kids with pool toys flooding the lobby and elevators that I thought the Monte Carlo was giving away cash for free and tickets to Disneyland. Our second room smelled like a toilet, so we decided to check out. We certainly couldn’t leave in a huff since it took another 10 minutes to get an elevator. I called the Front Desk and they said, “We certainly do not want you to leave the Monte Carlo with bad feelings, so we can offer a complimentary buffet for your troubles.” Nice offer, but I can only imagine the line for the buffet. When we asked why all of the kids were at the hotel, the clerk said, “We had some families decide to stay another day.” How many families would that be, 1000? We stood in the lobby calling other hotels for about an hour. We also made use of their business center where the Internet was available for the low, low price of $1.00 a minute. Once we found a room at the Hilton, we grabbed our luggage and waited another 20 minutes for our car at the Valet. As we were waiting, several buses were dispensing more kids into the hotel’s parking lot. A $79 rate provided us with bad feelings, a migraine and a need for some anxiety medicine.

Reviews.Title: “Magic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hi All, Just returned from the our stay at the Monte Carlo and I can only say how wonderful our trip was. From the time we walked in the door, the team were superb. Check-in was a doddle, really friendly staff who were effecient but in an un-hurried style. Our room had panoramic views of the strip. I would say the rooms are getting alittle old, but please don't take from this. Everything was spotless, fresh towels as many as were required. A very comfortable bed and well a jacuzzi bath overlooking the strip, magic. I have stayed in many many hotels in Vegas, but for a real genuine good hotel at a wonderful price I think you'll be hard pressed to beat the Monte Carlo.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms aren't the best for the rates you'll pay”
Reviews.Author: CheBird
Reviews.Content: Just spent 2 nights at Monte Carlo. The rooms were nothing special. The walls are very thin - I could hear our neighbor's entire phone conversation and when he came in and out of his room, it sounded like he was opening and closing our door. In the middle of the night, it kind of freaks you out thinking someone is coming into your room. The casino was great. The poker room staff was so nice. The big thing in Vegas now is the shops in the hotels, and I thought the Monte Carlo was still lacking in that area. Pool area just all right. There seemed to be a lot of young kids at the pool. Kind of a buzz kill.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at the Monte Carlo!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from the Monte Carlo and we had a great time. We have stayed at numerous other resorts (Bellagio, Mandalay Bay, Luxor, Excalibur, Bally's, Harrahs,) and besides Bellagio and Mandalay Bay that are of course luxury resorts and cost quite a bit more, we liked this one the best. We did not eat at the buffet, only the Cafe and at the Pub. Also went to the Lance Burton magic show and thought that was a lot of fun and very entertaining. The best part was that we had a very very early flight to Vegas and didn't know if we would be able to check in when we arrived but when we got to the check in at 9:40 am, they gave us a room on the 5th floor, no problem. The gentleman did say that if we wanted to wait and check in later (after 3pm) we could get a room on a higher floor with a better view. Our room was just fine and we were happy to be able to check in. All of the employees we encountered were helpful and friendly with the exception of one of the bartenders out on the casino floor that was kinda crabby and made a lousy long island ice tea :o(~ But overall we loved our stay and would stay at this hotel again unless we were able to get a better deal at one of the other resorts of our choice (Bellagio, Mandalay Bay, Casears, Venetian or Paris) or if it is a special occassion and don't mind paying more $. The price and location here were great and we LOVED the atmosphere. Quiet and not all crowed and noisy or kids running around like at some of the other resorts we visited.

Reviews.Title: “Well Impressed with the Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: rosiegirl18
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from West Coast tour & stayed at the Monte Carlo for 4 nights. Beautiful lobby with plenty of space - some of the lobby areas in other hotels are cramped within the casino area. Check in & out very efficient. Our room on the 17th floor had good view of The Strip & was very clean, lovely comfy beds. Not keen on the fast food court but was quite handy on a couple of occasions. Position of Hotel is very good, near enough to walk to the Bellagio, Paris etc but felt like it was in a quieter part of The Strip, it was nice to return to relative peacefulness after visiting some of the more "lively" hotels & casinos. Would definitely stay at the Monte Carlo again - saving our pennies as we speak for a return visit !

Reviews.Title: “Not worth for 194$ a night”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I won't make generic comment - here is my experience. I stayed at a room of 194$ per night. It did not even have a coffee maker to make a couple of cups of coffeee. Forget about any sort of free breakfast. The bathroom is very ordinary. A very bad toilet freshner used. We booked for three persons, but we were provided with ONLY two bath towels. The sleeping pillows were so small that we could not sleep well. The hotel loby looks royal, maintenance is perfect - however not pleasant to stay in the room. Not worth for 194$ per night.

Reviews.Title: “Love Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: Nic-o-lous
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Monte Carlo made my trip to Vegas extra special. We were three people in the same room so we decided to upgrage to a larger room. Originally we were given a room with two queen beds. which we found small for three people. After paying a little extra per night we got a fabulous suite on the 17th floor overlooking the strip. They were nice enough to give us a cot (which was like a regular twin bed) for the third person. The maidservice was great, the room was so clean. The bed was so comfortable. If you need a late night snack go to the Cafe Restaurant, the food is great and it is open for 24 hours. If I go back I will try to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our family reunion”
Reviews.Author: sunloving-mama
Reviews.Content: We had planned a family reunion for our group of 22. I made the arrangements and everyone was coming from all across the states, from North Carolina to California and places in between. I was nervous about it, because I'd only been to Vegas once myself and that was over 10 yrs. ago, and trying to accomodate the grandparents of 80 to the grandkids as young as 3 was a daunting task. I went with the Monte Carlo because it was on the Strip, the price was within everyone's budget, and the theme would easily suit them all. It turned out perfect. They were all tickled with the hotel, price, and location. Definitely overlooked, because it doesn't have a screaming gimmick, like some of the others, so we weren't crowded with tourists walking the Strip wanting to check it out. We could easily find each other in the casino or at the food court or in the awesome pool area. My only change would be to stay longer!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location on the strip. Did not hear the running of water that most people have complained about. The room was nice for the most part. We went in July when it was very hot and couldn't get the thermostat to turn down. We had a great view of the strip. People were very curtious. The casino was nice but the slots were tight. Ate at Paris it was very good. The buffet at the MC was horrible would never go back there again. Would go back to vegas again but would probably not stay at the monte not because of the hotel just to get to see other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good for the Money”
Reviews.Author: pabutah
Reviews.Content: Check-In - Fast no problems Room - Pretty Good - Non smoking room (Slight smoke odor in bathroom). Staff - Responsive Resturant - Pretty Good Go in the middle of the week less crowds better service.

Reviews.Title: “Very, Very Nice...........”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo is the perfect blend of sophistication and fun. I know many people frown upon bringing thier kids to Vegas, but the Monte Carlo provided our little "fishys" with unending amusement during the day. The hotel has a "lazy river" as well as a first class wave pool. Of course, this meant the kids were pretty tuckered out come nightfall. This is when the Mrs. and I took full advantage of the location. The Monte Carlo is perectly situated on the strip. No high profile destination is outside of walking distance. The service was great. The location was great. The amenities were great. We would highly recommend the Monte Carlo to any couple and/or (especially) family who may be planning a trip to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend the Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: kris2004
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo during our recent trip to Las Vegas. Rooms were well appointed and very spacious. We were on the 30th floor and had a wonderful view of the strip. Whilst in Las Vegas highly recommend catching Celine Dion, its an extrodinary show.

Reviews.Title: “Hmmm....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For our second trip to Vegas, we though we would try somewhere different from the previous trip. The last time we stayed at the Luxor and loved it, but it was right out at the south end of the strip. The Monte Carlo is a similar price but better located. The reviews I read on here are correct: THE WALLS ARE THIN!!! We were in a room next to a suite, who held parties every night at 1am to 4am. The screeching was unbearable, they might as well have been in the same room as us. To give the Monte Carlo it's due, when we rang security they did what they could, short of throwing them out. I requested a strip view, which is a bit of a waste of time here, as the accommodation is so far back from the strip, that all you get is an unobstructed view of the casino roof. The buffet breakfast was enormous, of course, but always seemed to us slightly inferior to that at Luxor. It's a nice hotel, don't get me wrong, but with the choices available in Vegas for about the same price, I doubt whether we'll stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Expected good! Received GREAT at Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: JZN
Reviews.Content: We went to Vegas in September, 2005. The trip was exactly what we wanted it to be. This was my first time in Vegas. Our reception at the Fronk Desk of the Monte Carlo was excellent...professional as well as interested. At our request, we were given a room on the 29th floor overlooking the pool area, The Strip, and from which we could see the Bellagio Fountains. The atmosphere was great and we were amazed by what the resort had to offer. One could come to the Monte Carlo and never go on the streets to have a good time. On our first day, we walked "the strip" starting with New York, New York to our right and continuing down and across the street and back up again. We went into all the "major" restorts/casinos just to see what "Vegas" was about. It was fascinating. We found the Monte Carlo Casino to be the BEST. It was huge, lots of room to play and plenty of open tables. Other casinos were overcrowded. The Monte Carlo Casino air was clean with lots of laughter and applause around the room. The pools were GREAT, especially the "lazy river." Watched Saturday night football while eating at the Monte Carlo brewery...food was great and atmosphere superb...brew was good also!! The Sunday "Champagne Brunch" was also excellent. All in all, it was an especially pleasant experience. We look forward to a return visit, soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the location and price”
Reviews.Author: jmt9459
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 3 day trip with wife. She chose the hotel because of the pool. The price was right. Check in/out was a breeze. We went to the pool once and had the usual chair findng issues. As described in previous reviews, there were many place holding towels on lounge chairs. We eventually moved some towels and plunked down. We had 1 noise problem, a party in the suite next door. It was unavoidable and excusable. Concrete couldn't have muffled their racket. Ate at the breakfast buffet once, was not impressed. It wasn't bad, but not too great; no service complaints. We ate sushi at Dragon Noodle. It was pretty darn good. Didn't eat anywhere else in the hotel, too many other choices in Vegas. Loved the location. The monorail and tram to Bellagio were broken. Gambling was hit or miss, as to be expected. We are not slot players and cannot comment on their "looseness." We had a great BJ dealer named Simon. Recomment eating at the Paris Buffet for breakfast. Also enjoyed Mandalay Bay's b-fast buffet, great service. VERY friendly!! Would stay again for same price.

Reviews.Title: “Rough Start - Great Finish!”
Reviews.Author: LoveUSA
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Monte Carlo this past Spring. Had a rough start by using an on-line travel discounter to make our reservations. Subsequently found out from Monte Carlo Reservation Group that there is every possiblity that they may not be able to honor your room request if it is not made directly with the hotel (i.e. low floor, non-smoking). You will get a room, but it is somewhat of a "grab-bag". Upon arrival at the hotel, the front desk staff was polite and professional. The room was clean and fresh and the housekeeping staff quite efficient. Food is great here! Have a "mall-type" fast food court and the hotel buffet is a good value for the money. Casino is not a big "theme".....classy, but more traditional (perhaps for the 30's and up crowd). The hotel box office was able to supply "stand-in-line" tickets for the Lance Burton show. This is a show not to be missed. Nothing fancy, just leaves you pleasantly mystified! The high point of this hotel is the pool. No matter what you have heard about it's size....it is gorgeous...clean and the staff and the quick food service is great. The lazy river is just enough for all ages, but don't be surprised that it costs $10 or so to rent to tube to float in. Get it anyway, you'll need it to enjoy this ride throughout the day. Subtle classiness and style are always present at this hotel. We never felt that we needed to go elsewhere to enjoy Vegas! One more thing...gift shop sells their soap and shampoo. Don't leave without it!!!!! Good Luck!

Reviews.Title: “The best of Vegas”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went to Vegas in August 03. The trip was wonderful. We went through Liberty Travel and everything went very smooth. Upon arrival at the Monte Carlo we were greeted by the wonderful workers. The atmosphere was great and I could not wait to see the entire hotel and what it had to offer. Compared to other casinos in Vegas, we loved the Monte Carlo Casino the BEST. It was huge, lots of room to play and plenty of open tables. Other casinos were packed and overcrowded, but Monte was great. During our stay we enjoyed a magic show that is offered right at the Hotel. It was GREAT! SO MUCH FUN! Lance Burton is a MUST SEE! During the day you can relax by the numerous pools and there are plenty of drinks and waitresses. They had the best Pino Coladas EVER! It was so relaxing and they had really good food as well. I would definately go back to Vegas and stay at the Monte Carlo any day of the year!

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just came back from our holiday to USA... Would like to recommend Monte Carlo... Although not much is written about MC in books or magazines, I can say that this hotel is an ideal place to stay in Las Vegas... It was located at the centre of the strip, easy assessible and they have polite and friendly staff... I would say that Monte Carlo is an excellent hotel to stay and We will definitely return to the same hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend the Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you are planning a trip to Vegas I would not recommend the Monte Carlo. We recently stayed there for a three night trip and was very disappointed. It started out with a clueless person working check in. We then made our way to our dirty rooms. There was hair all over the bathroom including the tubs and floor. Housekeeping was terrible. They did not get to our room until 3-4 in the afternoon. This was the time we were in the room getting ready to go out for the night. And they did not seem to care. They continued to come in the room, even with my husband still putting his clothes on, and start cleaning the tubs and so on. The outside of the hotel has a nice look to it, but the inside reminds me of an older hotel. Low ceilings, not much going on, etc. The casino is of average size and I have to say some of our party had good luck there. The buffet was awful. The pub was not bad, good food, friendly staff. They have a food court which I was not too crazy about. We didn't try the other restaurants so I can't say anything about them. All in all I was not too crazy about the hotel, would not recommend it to anyone, and had much better stays at other hotels in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a busy weekend at the Monte Carlo Resort & Casino. Overall, this is a great hotel. Location: The resort is located on the Strip located in between the New York, NY Casino and the Boardwalk Hotel and is within easy walking distance to many of the Strip's attractions. Walgreens and CVS are located right next door for any presciptions or last minute items you may need. The hotel: The hotel is very clean. The rooms are great with extreemly cofortable beds. They'll ask you if you want to upgrade to a "strip view room" for an extra $10/day if you plan on being in your room a lot, it is worth it. Otherwise you'll face the roof or a wall. Ammenities: The pool area is in a very shady area of the hotel and fills up fast. Better to go before 9:30 for a better seat selection. Flag down a pool attendant and they will grab the chairs and put them where you'd like. The lazy river is great and is the sunny portion of the pool area, and a great spot to people watch. Drinks are fairly expensive (around 7:50 for mixed drink)--- you can save money by ordering a souvineer glass (yard or football) which holds about 4 drinks (costs $10 for the first drink/glass then $9 for refills). The downfall to this hotel in my opinion is restaraunts. They have a few, but nothing fancy. The food court is good for breakfast & lunch if you are a penny pincher. It houses Sbarros, McDonalds, and a couple breakfast places. I perferred to dinner out at the other resorts. Overall, the hotel was great for the price and location. It may not have any attractions like most of the other Vegas hotels, but this keeps foot traffic down and is much more relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas at its Best!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently visited Las Vegas for our Honeymoon. This was our second trip to Vegas in the last 6 months. I must say, that I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Monte Carlo Hotel & Casino. The room was very nice, and we had an excellent view (15th floor), the staff was very helpful and pleasent. The first time we traveled to Vegas, we stayed at the MGM Grand. It was nice, but honestly, its too much, its just to big. Everything in Monte Carlo was conviently located. I loved the fact that when you valet the car, and walk inside, the elevator to the rooms is right there, no longs walks across the hotel. The food is some of the best i've had. The Cafe restaurant was very nice, and the Blackstone Steakhouse, while expenseive, was great also. Both were fairly priced. To wrap things up, I would not hesitate to stay at the Monte Carlo.

Reviews.Title: “Good family place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We researched a bunch of the Las Vegas hotels using TripAdvisor and decided on the Monte Carlo for our stay as it appeared to be among the few family friendly hotels. To that end, the MC was great. Convenient location, good pools, excellent breakfast buffet, nice decor, and clean rooms were the pros. The main con were the paper thin walls mentioned by other reviewers. We've stayed at many hotels and I don't think we've ever encountered walls that transmitted sound so easily. Pray for quiet neighbors during your stay here. My teenage daughter's review of the MC is as follows: "The hotel was not as elaborate as the others, however, everyone is very friendly and the service is great. It is very family friendly and doesn't attract a lot of people who aren't staying at the hotel. This way the place is not all the hustle and bustle. For a great room ask for a window facing the strip, at night it is cool!" Also check out the Lance Burton magic show at the MC, it was a thrill. We were able to upgrade our tickets to the third row by checking with the box office an hour before the show started. Evidently comp tickets given to the casino are returned to the box office shortly before the show. The kids really enjoyed being close as they tried to figure out the tricks behind Lance's magic act.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location, good pool”
Reviews.Author: PJPringle
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Monte Carlo after having spent a few nights at the Sahara hotel. This was because I wanted to be closer to the central strip and the rates at the Monte Carlo were quite reasonable. Check in at the hotel was fast and the room was quite large with nice furnishings and bathroom. However, like other reviews have said, the walls are very thin and so you can hear a lot of noise coming from the other rooms. The hotel has several restaurants to eat in including an Italian that was good, a 24-hour Café that was reasonable and the Monte Carlo Pub and Brewery, which was quite nice and had live music on most nights. There were also some shops and a fast food court, offering more choice than the Sahara. The hotel pool was one of the nicest I’ve seen in Vegas since it has a normal pool, a wave pool, some rapids and a hot spa (which was a bit too hot), together with plenty of sun beds and a drinks service and a place to get food. In terms of gaming, the Monte Carlo was not that busy and there were no cheap tables, however the hotel is close to most of the other casinos. Overall, the hotel had a nice feel about it and I would recommend staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here late March (2004) with 22 friends on a stag party. No problems, great place, and I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great las vegas hotel”
Reviews.Author: sacarmic
Reviews.Content: I really like this casino. It has a great location right in the middle of the strip. Very classy, traditionaly style casino. Great pool area and ususally is not very crowded. The rates are usually very good as well. Thats why I like it, class and very good rates. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “monte carlo great”
Reviews.Author: tamo1962
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel! My kids loved the lazy river, the staff was great, and I did not feel as though I was taking my kids to some dirty, seedy casino and had to cover their eyes the whole time. Very elegant and classy.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Satisfied!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: August 2004 first time at the Monte Carlo in Vegas and loved it. The pool area which was the deciding factor on where we chose to stay was more than we could've hoped for. Our kids had the greatest time as did my husband and I. The wave pool can't be beat and the easy river sure does keep you moving. The waterfalls are so refreshing. The lifeguards are very alert there which was very reassuring. The hotel is beautiful especially the outside entrance at night, all lit up with the angel statues. It's breath taking. Although the price is very reasonable the delux room seemed a little basic considering all the other lavish treats this hotel offers. The buffet for both breakfast and dinner (had lunch in their food court) was absolutely superb. Price is right for adults and kids under 10 was $7.25. A few other buffets we noticed during our trip to Vegas were charging full price for kids or just a few dollars less than adults. Our overall feeling about our visit to the Monte Carlo is Awesome! We will most definately return.

Reviews.Title: “We have found our hotel/casino”
Reviews.Author: leo8lion
Reviews.Content: We visit Las Vegas 2-3 times a year-I have stayed everywhere from The Excaliber to The Mirage. A last minute trip to Las Vegas in July we were able to get a room at the Monte Carlo. We have found our hotel/casino, we love it there. The staff was overly friendly and helpful. We ate at The Market Caffe late one evening, spilt the drink I brought in, the waiter rushed and got me another without even asking! Renee at Blackstones-what a waiter, and very knowledgable (love the accent). We also ate at the 24 hr Cafe and were very pleased. The casino's not crowed at all and you can find $5 Black Jack tables. Loved the Houdini Lounge too! I recommend it to all my friends now. Not too stuffy or fancy, just right!

Reviews.Title: “Best Casual but Elegant place on the Strip!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo is a very classy and clean place. Service was excellent and the rooms are nice for the price. Most of the time it is around $79 which is a steal for a nice place in vegas. Very easy to park and get your luggage in. Nice but small pool area. Beautiful lobby and other public areas!! I would recommend this place for families that want to see other hotels also. It is very easy to see others from it's great location. Take the monorail and save time!

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Monte Carlo does it again. Just got back (Aug 8-13, 2004). This is the third straight year we have chosen to stay at the Monte Carlo, and as usual have not been disappointed! Whether it was the room, the food, the spa, the pool, whatever, we enjoyed it all. This is truly a top notch hotel. Sixth time in Las Vegas and have stayed at three other hotels, MGM, Excalibur, and Treasure Island (TI now). All the other had some good points, but Monte Carlo has it all. Stay there and don't be disappointed. TIP: Keep checking the rates. We booked in early June at $79.00 a night and re-booked the beginning of August at $59.00 night. The room was on a high floor with a great view of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Service & Good Food”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Monte Carlo. We have stayed here in the past and have always been impressed by the helpful staff from front desk, to dealers, to housekeeping. The casino is just the right size to have plenty to do but it is not so big that you get lost! The food was good, especially at the Dragon Noodle. I had a great massage at the spa and enjoyed the pool as well. Join the One Club and enjoy the comps and cash back on points earned. The daily slot tournament was lots of fun and so was 3-Card Poker. I suggest the Monte Carlo if you want a nice, clean hotel on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service spoils trip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Monte Carlo at the end of our trip (Had comped rooms at the Rio the previous 2 nights and had a wonderful time.) We were really looking forward to returning to the Monte Carlo since this was our third time at this hotel and had loved it previously. Rooms were clean. Drain in shower very slow. Most of the staff was pleasant but, unfortunately, we had some incidents that disappointed us on this trip. First, my husband encountered a rude employee while trying to sign up for the One club which ruined his desire to gamble at this casino. I was not there so I can't say what happened but they did lose out on our gambling money. Second, our waiter at breakfast was very rude. We received a 2 for 1 breakfast coupon at check in and used them. Waiter implyed that we were lying as if to say I snuck in while my husband just paid for one meal - it said comp on the ticket which my husband pointed out. He must've not liked that because he was the worst waiter we ever had. I asked for a couple of straws and he threw one on the table and walked away. On his way past me I asked for another straw and he gruffly said he didn't have any. I pointed to the straws in his apron pocket and he took one out and threw it on the table again. He avoided checking on our table so as he walked by my husband politely asked for a cup of coffee which he replied- "yeah, yeah". He refilled other tables next to us but never ours. We complained to the seating hostess, Ida B., who was very accomodating and apologetic. She was wonderful and saved our overall impression of the Monte Carlo. She had another waiter take over our table so we wouldn't have to deal with the very unpleasant waiter we originally had. If not for that bad waiter we probably would not have such a bad overall impression of this stay. The dinner wait staff were very nice and the food was good. Also the pool area was o.k. Seemed to be interrupting the guys at the pool desk when asking about towels. No one watching the kiddie pool area - kids and their parents putting the chairs in the water to sit/play on and not taking them out when they left. Even eating in the pool - both on the NO list posted on the wall. The arcade was small but still fun - mostly driving games.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bobcoll71
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel in April as my partner and I were gettimg married in Las Vegas. We found the hotel welcoming, the staff made you feel at home. Room service was excellent and the VIP Club an added bonus! Andre's Restaurant and Blackstones Steak House are both 5 star. I intend to stay there agian in the not too distant future. A great Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable!!! Perfect Choice:)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Monte Carlo July 4-6 2004. This was our first time in Vegas and we had the best time imaginable. Our flight to Vegas arrived at 1:00 am on July 4. We picked up our rental car and decided to drive to our hotel to park the car and head out on foot to see Vegas on a Sat. night. We knew we didn't want to book the hotel for that Sat. night because we would be arriving so late that we would just stay up all night and check in as early as they would let us. And that is exactly what we did. We took our own tour of Vegas from 2:30 am till 10:30 am. We parked our car at the Monte, then walked through all the casinos down to Mandalay Bay. Then we crossed the street to the other side of the strip and walked and went in most all the casinos till we found Casino Royal (across from the Mirage). This is where we spent most of our time in Vegas. When I came to Vegas I was not a gambler, but I had never played roulette before, after leaving Vegas, I see how much I have changed. I am a different person after being in Vegas; it changed me. My husband and I spent numerous hours playing roulette with the $0.25 chips at Casino Royal. Playing with quarter chips allowed us to play for hours at a time and win a little and/or loose at a time. We had a budget set for each day and when it was gone, then we were done, but O' how fun it was just to play roulette, it didn't matter if we won or lost, just playing was fun. We did come home with cash in our pockets, so we didn't do to bad. Anyways, let me get to the hotel. We showed up at 10:30am after being out all night and went to check in. The lady at the front desk was incredibly helpful, friendly, and curteous. Check-in isn't till 3 or 4, but she got us in right when we arrived. The deal we got on the Internet was for $69 a night with a view of the pool or strip and a book full of good coupons. At check-in, we asked nicely to see if we could get the strip view, instead of the pool view and she said "no problem." She gave us our key and coupons and we headed to our room. We were so tired from being up all night that we couldn't wait to sleep. Our room was on the 17th floor and had an amazing view. I think we were in room 406, but I'm not positive. The room was spotless, the bed was comfortable, the ice machine and elevators were just down the hall, we never needed maid service because we had enough towels to last us all of the nights we would be there. The room was so cozy and comfortable that I felt like I was at home. I could not have asked for anything more. This hotel has some of the best rates in town, it is in a great location, the staff is helpful and friendly. With one of our coupons we had buy a breakfast buffet from the hotel and get one free. This was the one of the best meals we had our entire trip. The buffet is outstanding!! You get to make your own omelets, then you have every breakfast food imaginable from eggs, bacon, sausage, biscuits & gravy, waffles, pancakes, bagels, fresh fruit, then come the pastries. These pastries were outstanding!! The best pastries I have ever had. They different fruit filling with a glaze and they melt in your mouth. I was so impressed with everything about the Monte Carlo. I did my research and it payed off!! I would recommend this place to all of you who have questions about where to stay and have never been here to see how Vegas is set up. I knew that I would probably only go to Vegas once in my life and I wanted the best, affordable time possible, and that is what we got. There was only one bad thing to say about the Monte Carlo, which this doesn't even bother me with all the other great things we have experienced here, but it was the thin walls. You can hear the people next to you even when they are talking in their normal voices. You can hear everything. About the pool, we never made it there because we could not keep away from the Casino Royal long enough to see it. We gambled once at the Monte Casino, but it just wasn't as inviting as our favorite place. Things I would recommend doing in Vegas: see a show (we saw The Blue Man Group-good music and involves the audience and Zumanity-a one of a kind Vegas show, good comedy & interesting body movements), eat good (we ate at Wolf Gang Pucks-fabulous and I would recommend the slice prime rib sandwich-WOW! and at Emrils-good, but very expensive $30 meals, ESNP Zone-good cheese fries), gamble (we like Casino Royal, MGM Grand & Binions Downtown), see the strip and downtown (they are two different worlds) and rent a car and drive to the Hoover Dam (it is a short 20 minute drive from the strip and a beautiful place to see). Have fun, we sure did:)

Reviews.Title: “Monter Carlo gets 5*S*T*A*R*S*”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Monte Carlo over 10 times and each time well.... it just keeps getting better and better, great service great food and very friendly dealers (the Elvis look alike black jack dealer made me laugh so hard it was incredible!) all an all said what a great place and in my opinion best VALUE for the MONEY! WE WILL BE BACK

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite place on the strip!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've been to many hotels on the strip. This is my father and I's favorite place. It is a great value! It has nice rooms, good facilities including pool and tennis, and it has a good location. Try the italian restuarant in the casino near the entrance, it has wonderful food and is cheap. For reference, I've stayed at the Flamingo, Mirage, Luxor, Mandalay Bay, and the Aladdin, but this is the only resort I have stayed at twice!

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: blackalls
Reviews.Content: hotel in good position, walking distance to most places...rooms okay if you like looking at car park and highway 15...they are clean and tidy...desk staff could be friendlier, after asking for coupon book we read about was told we didnt qualify with our room... would probably stay again

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Monte Carlo!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had our first family trip to Vegas from June 21st to the 25th. The Monte Carlo was more than we expected for the price. We stayed on the 25th floor with a great view of the strip. The room was clean and the staff was very curteous. The pool was nice and shaded. After seeing all of the ornate hotels my family and I were glad we had a quieter hotel and smaller casino. Although I did not fair well in this casino...my son did. The location couldn't have been better, we walked to everything! All of the restaurants were good. I had read bad reviews regarding the buffet being cold, this did not happen during our visit. We ate breakfast and dinner there and the food was hot, the choices plentyful and delicious. I suggest that you go on line and register with the hotel to get email specials, that's where we got our package deal with coupons for food, clothing and spa deals.

Reviews.Title: “A Terrific Place!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 5 night stay at the Monte Carlo. I must say I was a little worried after reading some of the reviews, but can honestly say that we only had a positive experience. When the young lady checking us in found out that we were there celebrating our 22nd anniversary, she excused herself for a moment and when she returned said that she was upgrading our room to a suite (which was very, very nice)....and at no cost to us!!! When in Las Vegas in the past, we've stayed at some of the "larger" hotels (and they were also nice) but we didn't get that "personal" touch that we received at the Monte Carlo. Everyone that we came in contact with was extremely nice/helpful. We would highly recommend the Monte Carlo, and we can't wait to go back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Nice AND a great value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we checked out of excalibur early and went here. Although i'm sure it is not the nicest or best (that would be the bellagio), it is the best value (we paid 59 night on internet). It is a bit dated (only by las vegas standards), but well kept up. The pool is smaller than most, but comfortable and nice with the lazy river (except for the sunburn). The on site brewery is too good -- remember to hide your money before partaking :) The rooms were good, nice views and altogether a good experience. The people throughout were nice - even when I wanted to sleep in until 3pm - they came to clean to room late.... GREAT VALUE on a GOOD place..

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: DK223
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location. The rooms were nicely furnished and of a good size. Ate at the buffet for dinner twice, it was really good value and nice, fresh food. Try and see the Lance Burton Show - he was wonderful! My only gripe was that in order to get a sunbed by the pool, expect to have to queue up before the gates open at 8:00 am!! The pool area is rather crowded and the beds a bit too close together. Also, any hint that you might be leaving and people rush over for your bed, throwing their towels on before you can even get off the thing, which was annoying. The management really need to sort the pool area out! There wasn't this problem at the Luxor. That aside though I loved this hotel, It's in a great location and is clean and comfortable and has a touch of class. Friendly, professional staff as well!

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful by comparison”
Reviews.Author: Stella
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Monte Carlo twice, although not recently. This hotel is less 'themed' than most hotel on the strip (think Excalibur, Luxor, Circus Circus, etc.), but not as posh as others (Bellagio, Mirage, etc.). Its decor was sedated, and its location is good. Not too far south on the strip, and within walking distance to other interesting casinos. There was also a tram/train that takes you to the Bellagio. The brew pub was good, and the food court was convenient. The pool was OK; the lazy river was closed during the non summer seasons. It's worth staying if you can get a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo from June 24th-June 29th. Everything was great. We got an excellent room. At first I thought the room was a little far from the elevator, but the view was worth it. We had a wonderful view of the strip and MGM. The room was a normal size hotel room, but the bath was larger than normal. The buffet was excellent, well the 1st time for dinner. The next time we went back for lunch, it wasn't as good. The price was decent compared to many others we saw. I loved the casino. We had really great attendants at Roulette. I didn't really have much luck on the slots. When we got there, we enrolled in The One Club. I will definitely be going back, so hopefully I will win some free stays. Service everywhere was great. Check out was quick and simple.. Housekeeping, the business center, gift shop attendants, etc. were on point. We didn't even get a chance to go to the pool or pools rather. I was kind of disappointed upon arrival.
