I thought they would be a lot bigger and better. We stayed so busy we didn't even have a chance to use it. We were able to do self-check out. We had a late flight, so we were able to leave our bags at the bellhop station. Eventhough I lost my ticket, they didn't have a hard time finding our luggage. Overall, it was an excellent stay. My first time in Vegas went great. After visiting other hotels, I really only want to stay at the Monte Carlo.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful!! Our new home!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have read a lot of reviews on the Monte Carlo. Many of these reviews stated how much people did not like the Monte Carlo, or how average they found the hotel. We absolutely loved it, so I am sharing this report to inform people of this. If you are looking for a nice hotel without breaking your bank, this is the place!! We were staying at the Monte Carlo because the main reason for the trip was my sisters wedding. She and her fiance were staying there, and the wedding was at the Monte Carlo chapel. Since price was nice we decided that would be our home for the whole week. Played Poker, Slots, Blackjack, VP and Craps. Managed to get a $1000 bankroll to last a whole week. Daily Slot Tournament is free and tons of fun. Hourly tournaments from 10 am - 6 pm. Top two in each hour play in finals at 7 pm. I was second at 2 pm and went on to win the 7 pm finals. Everyone who entered throughout the day got a key chain. All finalists got a T-shirt. First place got $500 Cash, second place got $100 in Comp Dollars, Third place got $40 in Comp Dollars. It was tons of fun and FREE!!! (And the $500 came home with me!) This hotel smells amazing, has beautiful rooms, not huge, but plenty of room. The hotel and casino are both bright, and with high ceilings they rarely smelled like smoke. Never met a rude employee, and had 2 wonderful blackjack dealers one night. We ate at Dragon Noodle, Market City Cafe, Nathan's Famous, and the Sunday Champaign Breakfast. All were good to excellent. We also visited the Brew Pub and Houdini's Lounge. Johnny Ray was singing at the lounge and he is AMAZING!! The Brew Pub was fun as an evening hangout. They had a band during the week, and played videos and dance music on the weekends. Hotel rooms do not have safety deposit boxes, but you can get one near the front desk area. I did not think I would like this arrangement before arriving, but it worked great. We were able to get to travelers checks and money without going all the way up to our room, and there was never any other guests at the desk when we got into our box. We got into the box multiple times a day, and the staff was always very nice. Hubby enjoyed the poker room here, and at Mandalay Bay. After arriving 1 hr and 45 minutes late hubby was anxious to hit casino. He played Craps and won $117 in fifteen minutes. I played VP and lost $60 in 15 minutes. He kept playing, and I went to bed. Casino was much less busy during the week. We liked that a lot. Weekends were busier, but you could still find what you wanted in a few minutes. Cocktail waitresses were always around and nice. (That could be because I always tipped!) We only spent one afternoon in the pool. The lazy river is more like rapids, and the wave pool has very easy waves. They also have a regular pool, kiddie pool, and hot tub. We found all to be nice. Chairs can fill up by the pools if you wait till later in the day. But there are tons of chairs toward the back all stacked up. Just go back there and drop your stuff and hit whichever pool you like. The wedding chapel and staff were very nice. They were extremely helpful and the wedding was beautiful. The best lady minister in my book. She was wonderful and made the wedding very special. WONDERFUL!!!! We can not say enough about our wonderful time at Monte Carlo. It was one good experience to another. We loved checking out all the other stuff going on in Vegas, but always found it so nice to come "Home" to the Monte Carlo. We will absolutely be coming back again, and again!!!

Reviews.Title: “It was fine, had a great time”
Reviews.Author: keninCT
Reviews.Content: Stayed 7/1-7/5 2004 I was going to stay at the Flamingo - a 3 star, but found the Monte Carlo had a better rate and is considered a 4 star. I read everyone's reviews, especially the negatives ones, and encountered only one problem - the walls are REALLY thin. All the other negative experiences that I read about here did not come to pass. The staff worked harder to make me happy than any hotel I ever stayed in. I dealt with people at the pool, valet parking, a manager, a front desk information person, a show booking person and others. Of course, asking pleasantly and staying positive doesn't hurt. We ended up on a top floor with a view of the desert, mountains and the resorts down the strip (NY, NY, Mandaly Bay, Luxor), at a price, for a holiday weekend that was great (less than $100 per night including taxes). Call them for the best price, it was even lower than their internet price which was even lower than the travel website prices. The pool areas were small, but fun - especially the small river type pool. The casino was fine, as was the food court. The location is also pretty good. Once the new monorail opens - direct to Belaggio, it will be one of the best locations on the strip. If you can handle a little noise at night (we use a sound machine and ear plugs anyway) AND the price is right, you should stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time at the Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: lcdckc
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervous reading all the negative reviews, but we just returned today and it was absolutly beautiful. It was our first trip to Vegas and we would stay here again. Even though I lost all my MONEY!! It was still a nice trip. The only complaint I have is there is no exhaust fan in the bathroom. We had a great view 21st floor room 311. The best thing we did outside the motel is take a free shuttle from Harrahs over to Rio! It was incredible. Free shows and lots of slots and restaurants. A must see is the flower and water show at the Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort and just the right size!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Every year we plan a family vacation and Monte Carlo is the place we stay, has a lot of class and we love the pub to eat at and the great pool for the kids, have stayed many other places but this is our favorite!!

Reviews.Title: “No complaints...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: All things considered, the Monte Carlo is a very good value among strip hotels. I found the casino to be sort of boring, and spent more time at NY, NY and MGM. But I thought my room was pretty nice, and available dining options were good. Housekeeping took until mid afternoon to make up my room every day, but I suppose that's probably normal for a vegas hotel. Location on the strip is excellent!! The only thing which bothered me is that the bed in my room was made up without a fitted sheet covering the mattress. (they used a regular sheet instead) If you tend to toss and turn at night, it can be pretty easy to wake up staring down at a bare mattress....yechh!!

Reviews.Title: “Average room - everage hotel”
Reviews.Author: lomlom
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6/11 - 6/15. First room had funny odor, was moved to much nicer room with view of strip. Last night could hear guests in next room clearly. Pool area not appealing and crowded. BJ tables will not consider rating you unless playing $ 25 or more, I found this out of line for an average hotel. Dragon Noodle resturant food was exellent, service poor. Hotel has exellent location but would stay there again only if priced right.

Reviews.Title: “great time at monte carlo!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Monte Carlo from June 8 thru June 12. I was a little nervous reading some of the unhappy reviews but we found them completely unfounded. Check in was quick and painless and we were even upgraded to a suite since we were "first timers". The pool area was great and even tho it did get a little crowded there were plenty of chaises to be had. I recommend the Pub and Brewery for a drink and snack it was very nice with great service. The room was nice and the bathroom was quite large. I would def stay there again. Hope this helps!!

Reviews.Title: “Elegance, great location, and good value”
Reviews.Author: buddmar
Reviews.Content: I can recommend the Monte Carlo enthusiastically! When planning my trip this past year to Las Vegas I wanted more than just a clean and satisfactory room ... I wanted to stay in a place that had glamour and elegance on the "Strip" but not too expensive. The lobby and casino is decorated in an opulent "fin de siecle" European style with all the gold framed mirrors, crystal chandeliers, columns, etc. My room was only about 50 bucks but I splurged and upgraded to a junior suite for about $95. My suite was lovely, very modern, with all the touches of a five star resort: jacuzzi whirlpool tub, marble counter tops, huge color TV hidden behind a stylish etegere (excuse my spelling, if it is not correct!), really nice complementary lotions, shampoos, soaps, mouthwash, etc. The room was decorated in a very posh and attractive way. The steak restaurant was wonderful, and considered one of the best in Vegas. The pools and "lazy river" was great during the hot days. The on site Brewery was fantastic. I consider the MC one of the 10 most sumptuous, opulent hotels on the Strip - along with the Belagio, the Paris, the Venetion, etc. - but lower rates and a fabulous value!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Respite”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Given some of the recent reviews, I was concerned that the Monte Carlo had gone downhill since the last time we stayed there. I was happy to find that that was not the case. Our check-in and out was fast and easy. I particularly like that you can access the hotel lobby, rooms, and parking without going through the casino. We found that although we had reserved a King, we were given two doubles. I called down and they moved us to a King, with a view of the pool and Strip at no extra charge. The room was clean and quiet and the hotel and casino staff were pleasant. Good location and, not seeming as crowded as other properties, was a nice respite.

Reviews.Title: “not again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we stayed at monte carlo about 3 years ago and it was nice. Took my daughter out on 21st b-day May 10-13th there was 7 that went had 3 room was to have 2 with king bed 1 with 2 bed all ended with 2 beds each room. not good start. my room one bed was not made. and a dirty washcloth haing in shower... called and talked to surpervisor sent maid up to redo room came back to find beds turned down and chocolates on pillow and rose on night stand. next day came back to find pack of cigerates on table in one of the rooms This was a non smooking floor and rooms called surpervisor again he came up to get them and telling us the story that he didn"t know how they could have got there the maid that was down for that room didn;t smoke so offered turn down service . the beds were turned down and the chocolates were just thrown on the bed . A YES THE WALL ARE VERY THIN COULD HERE THE PEOPLE NEXT TO TALKING.

Reviews.Title: “Still a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the M.C. several times over the past few years. This time it was for five nights. As in the past, everything was above average. Service, food, self parking, accomodations and personnel. Excellent location for walking to other hotels/casinos on the strip. Great rate and good comps for slot players. Look forward to our next visit....

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from another stay at the Monte Carlo...I would not hesitate to recommend the MC to anyone searching for Vegas accomodations. The MC offers a hard to beat combination of very reasonable room prices, excellent location on the South Strip, comfortable beds, a pleasant environment and solid on-site restaurants. Rates are probably among the best of the higher-end resorts. Book directly through the MC website...you'll find the best rates there. If you are booking well in advance, review the rates from time to time as they tend to change frequently. The location is excellent...You're in reasonable walking distance of all the major destination resorts on the southern and middle parts of the Strip. There's an awesome CVS next door (a few tips...go there to buy $5.99 floats for the lazy river to avoid the $12 daily rental charge; pick up a styrofoam cooler to keep ice and cold drinks in your room; shop here for any of your basic necessities that you need or may have forgotten). Kind of sounds like an ad for CVS, but it definately enhances the appeal of the MC. The rooms are nice and beds are very comfortable. If you do Vegas correctly, you should not be spending a ton of time in your room and when you do, you should be exhausted. The walls do seem a bit thin, but it's not really a big deal. The on-site dining does not offer a ton of options, but the MC Pub & Brewery and Dragon Noodle are stand-outs. The pool is probably average by Vegas standards, but it certainly does the job if you want to soak up some rays or take a dip (if you want eye candy, go straight to the Hard Rock). The casino is fine...Same slots as everywhere else, plenty of table games. If anything, the MC serves as a great "basecamp" for your Vegas expedition. As mentioned above, there are many features that make the MC an attractive place to stay, however it's not the flashiest place and it doesn't have the wide range of entertainment/dining/shopping options that other Vegas resorts offer. But you can seek all that stuff out by walking or taking a quick taxi ride to wherever you want to go. Taking all factors into account, I see no reason to stay anywhere in Vegas other than the MC.

Reviews.Title: “It was fine - what is all the fuss?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've been to Las Vegas hundreds of times, and this time went with a group of people from where I'm living now. Someone found the great 5 night deal with the Monte Carlo, so we booked it. The reviews here made me really worried, because I've had bad experiences in Vegas before... well, we got there at 10am (this was pretty early for check in), and walked up to the counter with no wait. The girl at the counter didn't even blink an eye that we were so early, and I asked her for the best room at the moment. She gave us an awesome room on the 14th floor with great views of the strip. When our friends arrived 5 hours later and told the person at the counter the room number that we were in, they got rooms all around us, with no problems whatsoever. No tipping necessary, either, and the people at the counter had personalities - no robots!! Overall, everyone loved their stay - all of us had different interests - some stayed at the pool 6 hours a day, others gambled, others ate... the pool area is okay - drinks are very expensive, of course. The restaurant is good when you're coming back from the clubs at 6am (note: the Quizno's just north of the hotel is also open 24 hours). The food court is good, if you want fast food (note: the big Coca-Cola food court is pretty much across the street), and it's close to everything. I've heard that the Lance Burton show at the hotel is AWESOME, but, I wasn't able to go. It's very easy to walk up and down the strip from the Monte Carlo, also making it a good place to stay. The only complaint that I would have was that the housekeeping services were totally average. We left a very good tip the first night, and only the bare minimum was done. We didn't tip after that, and the service didn't get any better or any worse. Don't expect them to do any more than they have to... Overall, I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a quiet place (it's nice to come back to after spending all day and night surrounded by loud noise and music) that is really nice (definitely not motel quality like some people made it out to be) and accessible. If you want ritzy, go somewhere else - the Palms, Bellagio, and Venetian will give you that, but, you won't get the awesome pricing of Monte Carlo!! And, you probably won't be treated as nicely by the customer service staff...

Reviews.Title: “We had a Great Time!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were in Vegas May 16-20. We had a wonderful time at the Monte Carlo. There hotel staff was courteous, prompt and very helpful. The rooms were beautiful and clean. We stayed for the price of 79.00 a night. I booked directly from the hotel's website and got an inital price of 99.00, but I kept checking prior to our arrival and it had went down to the price of 79.00. Definitely worth the price. We did not eat at the hotel, there was so much to do, we were hardly in our rooms. The only thing negative I could say was that we could hear our neighbors early in the morning, but they were not obnoxious or anything just getting ready for their day. I will defintely stay at this hotel again. If you are looking for a good price and nice surroundings this is the hotel. The swimming pool, wave pool and the lazy river were fun. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably Priced, Excellent Location, Great Selection”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent our first visit to Las Vegas at Monte Carlo and had a wonderful time. Our visit was May 14 through 18. I found the hotel to be quite nice indeed. We stayed on the newly renovated 14th floor and it was great. We very much enjoyed the Monte Carlo Brewpub and the pool area. The location is great. Bring a good pair of walking shoes and you can walk to nearly every resort south of the Venetian. Although we're not big on gambling, we found the casino to be very friendly and the air handling system seemed to keep the smoke to a minimum. As a non-smoker, I found the second hand smoke to stagnate in some of the larger casinos. The Monte Carlo rates as a reasonably priced upper-middle class accomodations. It doesn't have the flash of NY NY, Paris or Caesars Palace, but then you're not paying for it either. I'd recommend the Monte Carlo to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “worst stay ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: worst experience in vegas ever!! rooms reservations were not ready until late eveninghad to wait around all day for our 2 rooms...then they resold our room before we checked out. new guests moved in while we were out eating breakfast. they didn't even apologize. employees were lazy, and not helpful at all. made me very depressed.

Reviews.Title: “A great Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights and thoroughly enjoyed the hotel. The rooms on the 14 floor have recently been renovated and were beautifully decorated, spacious and clean. We had a great view of NY Ny, MGM etc. The service was prompt and helpful. The noise from neighbours was a problem at 3.40am one morning and on another morning the shower in another room woke us pretty early. A very elegant hotel and the pool area was pleasnt and not too crowded even when the weather got quite warm. Have only twice stayed anywhere in a hotel that we have liked better than this and both times the cost was $300-$400 a night. Would definately recommend the Monte Carlo. Also enjoyed its central position on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Rooms, Poor Management”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hair was found in the bath tub the first night. We were told housekeeping would come right away and clean it so we could shower...an hour later they had still not arrived. Next Morning: Housekeeping knocked on every door-tried to open our door before 8 AM and woke us up. Hotel attempted to compensate by offering a late checkout. Upon arriving back to the room our key did not work. If you don't mind lack of cleaning, housekeeping and sleep...a great place to stay! By the way, great pool and sunbathing area.

Reviews.Title: “Eh..never again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights (Thu-Sat) and was very upset with the room we were given. Upon late check-in we were given a room at the end of the hall that appeared to be just the living room area of a bigger suite. It was tiny, had a murphy bed, a coffee table and couches pushed against the wall, and a television perpendicular to the bed (impossible to watch unless you sit at the foot of the bed). Upon complaining I was told that they had no King beds available in the hotel and my only option was a smoking room with two full beds. We opted for the smoking room and luckily it wasn't horrible. Other then that, the hotel was average. I'd recommend the Aladdin, Caesars, or MGM instead of this place.

Reviews.Title: “Not too tacky on the strip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Overall a good quality hotel for the money, not as enormous or tacky as some of the hotels on the strip. The Self Parking was really easy and close to reception and avoided the queue for the valet retun. I would not even bother with parking for check in, it's not much closer. Room was excellent although I always have a quibble with these smart hotels which don't find it necessary to have a coffee/tea maker or a fridge in the room. Main complaint - the queue for the buffet breakfast in the morning was enormous.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: gpmatthew
Reviews.Content: We've been to Vegas a few times, but this was our first stay at the Monte Carlo. It was wonderful. The rooms were very nice and very clean. The service was helpful and pleasent and check-in and check-out was a breeze. If you're looking for roller coasters and a lot of loud craziness this is not the place for you. But if you want style, class and a great location at a reasonable price, this is the perfect place in Vegas. From here you can easily go anywhere on the strip, go nuts on the town and then retire to the more relaxed atmosphere of the Monte Carlo. Don't get me wrong, there's plenty to do, but if you're in your forties or older I think you'll appreciate this hotel more than say someone in their twenties. I'll definitely go back my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: 14NASCAR
Reviews.Content: This was my first time here at the Monte, and for that matter, my 1st time in Vegas. I was not surprised at all about this hotel as the reviews from family and friends that stayed here before said it was excellent. I have to agree. I was here for five days & I stayed on the 30th floor facing the Belligio, Paris, Rio and the swimming area at the Monte. I think this is the best view. I was able to see the fountains at Belligio without much of an unobstructed view. The staff was excellent, from the check in all the way to the maintenance which had to come to our room to retrieve an earring which fell into the sink drain. They seemed eager to help me with this little problem. For that, I thank them. I will be coming back to Vegas for sure and I will be choosing the Monte Carlo for the service, price and elegance of a 4 star hotel. They made my trip a 4 star trip.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, recommended”
Reviews.Author: Mgz
Reviews.Content: We had a group trip recently, all staying at the Monte Carlo. Overall, it's a good value, with no serious drawbacks. The hotel was very clean, well cared for, with a large marble lobby. The casino is after the elevators, which was preferable to walking through a casino to get to the rooms. Rooms were standard size, large enough, with two queens (kings also available). Bell service and front desk service was friendly and fast. I was able to check into my room at noon, 3 hours early, with no hassles. They switched me to an upper floor upon request, also with no hassles. The buffet was fast, affordable ($10, $17 on Sunday), with a good but standard selection (your basic selections, pastries, and such). Very good, but nothing gourmet or exceptional. The brew pub, cavernous, was fun. Several good beers, and some fun containers, including an oversized, five or six foot "glass" and a vodka ice flow ("the luge"). Didn't try other restaurants there. The pool area was smaller than we expected. It was nice enough, and had cocktail service, but it was smallish and somewhat crowded by Vegas standards. The pools were also cold, which I understand is common among most hotels except for summer months. The casino was fine. Nothing showy like the Rio or particularly themed like NY NY), but perfectly fine, with friendly dealers and waitresses overall. One felt comfortable there, at least when winning :-). The bar inside the casino is pretty mellow - smallish and not terribly exciting, perhaps by design. Overall, this was a good hotel with good value (we paid from $89 to $199/night, late April. There are more luxurious options, but they cost more. I'd recommend this to people looking for a well located place on the strip, a "Vegas-sized" hotel/casino at more affordable prices than other options like Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo looking a bit worn?”
Reviews.Author: nroskilly
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in many of Vegas' resorts and hotel/casinos, I was looking forward to a two day April stay this year at the Monte Carlo, due to its reputation for refinement on the Strip. I think that we were a little disappointed; the Monte Carlo is losing some of its appeal, and may well be in need of refurbishment. Our room was fine, but there were signs of wear, and the facilities aren't any better than elsewhere. The pool closes quite early, though this seems to be a Vegas thing these days. We paid around $89 for the room, which was okay, but paid less at the Hilton a few days later and enjoyed it more.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Resort”
Reviews.Author: One-tonner
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Monte Carlo from Saturday through Wednesday. Our check in was no problem, the staff was very accomadating as it was 9 am and we were able to check into our room immediately. The location of this hotel is perfect for all south strip activities. The Pub & Brewery serves excellent large portions. The Sunday Brunch Buffet was overpriced, but good. Lots of $5 tables all week. Pool area is fantastic with good drink service. Was able to use the hotel Limo to go downtown (was only $50 with tip). This is a deal especially if you are in a group that requires two cabs. The spa at Monte Carlo is fabulous. The men's spa attendant Juan was very informative and made using the spa a breeze. Overall a very enjoyable stay and at least $300 less than MGM.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Monte Carlo was very nice. Check in and check out was fabalous for a "sold-out" weekend. It took no longer than 5 minutes each time. Nice beds, clean rooms, and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel on the Strip!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo is the best hotel on the Strip! We checked in fast/ checked out even faster with video check out. The beds were excellent! Best hotel bed I've ever ever slept in and I have a bad back. The food at Blackstone's is fabulous! Had the prime rib and it melted in my mouth. Way better than CC's or S&W. The Cafe and Pub food were great too. I would recommend this hotel with 5 stars plus!

Reviews.Title: “Not so great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well, I guess if I had to do it over again I would not stay at the Monte Carlo, was it really that bad, NO, but it wasn't that great either, we paid 169.00 a night for the room, and I have stayed in better rooms at vegas for 59.99, and that was on the strip, bally's mgm, and others as well, it is diffently not kid friendly, so I suggest if you ahve kids, stay else where, the buffet, well I have had better, the pool way over rated if you wanted the good wave pool, stay at Mandalay Bay, we did not even get one spiff, when we have stayed at other hotels we have ALWAYS gotten a coupon book for deals on the buffet, shows, ect... nothing this time, so I guess I don't have a complaints on the rooms they were clean and ok, when we checked in I asked for a room with the view of the strip and he told me that if I wanted that it would be a extra 20.00 ( I have allready paid an extra 30.00 for my kid a night) so I told him to forget it, could I have aview of the pool or something, and he made so a to do about the great view he was going to give me of the pool and how lucky I was to get it, when we got up to my room I noticed that the whole side of our hotel had the pool view, I mean either you got the strip view or the pool view there is no other view to be had, what a deal, so my advice to you STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: galileocan
Reviews.Content: If you want a good resort on the strip, but do not want to pay out the $$$ that you have to at the deluxe resorts, then this is the place for you. I have stayed here the last few times I've come to Las Vegas and its just fine. Rates are usually quite a bit cheaper than the hotels nearby such as Bellagio, Aladdin, MGM and Paris. Great pool at the hotel with a wave pool and a lazy river. Excellent for kids. Rooms are okay.....missing little things that are noticeable such as a waste basket in the room rather than only the bathroom, a full length mirror in the room rather than the bathroom, safe, iron, etc. These missing items are probably why you get a better rate. Food here is fine, top marks to the Dragon Noodle Co. for Chinese and Japanese food - excellent and great value! The breakfast here is excellent and is only a bit more expensive than Denny's across the street and is MUCH better! Stay here - enjoy, and save a few bucks for gambling.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i always stay at all the hotels & casinos just for fun. I found this one to be great, check in was fast & easy, room was nicely decorated, no problems anywhere, never wait for elevators......i thought it was really nice i didnt want to leave...buffet was good too!

Reviews.Title: “loved the trip except people with hand outs”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: stayed at the monte carlo excellent loved the pool area, missed the coffee pot in the room. meals were excellent. celine dion show was excellent all seats in the house are good seats. so you do not have to pay top price. the one thing that got to us on the strip was people pushing leaflets at you about timeshare and some of the not so cool topless shows. also we would have liked more benches to sit on. example, ceasars palace, fountians of belliago freemont street. now best yet was the shopping. at the outlet centers, can"t wait to go back. bye for now h.w.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Service at the Monte Carlo”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monte Carlo June 2003, this was our 5th visit to Las Vegas 1st to the Monte Carlo. We were traveling with 9 others which had also been previous Vegas visitors. To start our rooms were not ready for us, we had requested a cot when we booked this trip, also when we checked in, then several times that evening, it finally arrived at 2am! We had to call house keeping on a daily basis to get our rooms made up. The pool area was like sitting in a parking lot to tan, the pools were so small you couldn't sit around them unless you were down there at 8am, so you had to settle for a chair in the back forty. The restaurants at the hotel, the brewery's food was alright but the service there and the oriental restaurant was just horrible. We did contact management, but was not even given the courtesy of a return call

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: canadarose
Reviews.Content: my husband and i stayed here 5 nights, starting mar 14. Nice room on 31 floor, clean and roomy. Maid service was prompt. information desk helped with several things, including safe. they couldn't have been nicer. Especially liked the pool area. Not too crowded, and considering lazy river and weather in mid- 80s, not too many kids. Ate at brew-pub (great food and service) buffet (no wait, ok selection for price, but COLD) and Dragon Noodle (Loved it). Casino not too large or smoky, cocktail service slow. machines average to poor. got 3 meals comped, shich consiedering we didn't do much gambling there pleased us. Would certainly reccommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy staying here!”
Reviews.Author: Seektravel
Reviews.Content: My only disappointment was the rooms were boring looking compared to other places I have stayed, but much made up for that. First off the pool is really nice. There is the river pool, wave pool and regular pool. I love the Brew restaurant and even when I do not stay here I try to make a stop here for the beer and shrimp bucket. The food court is a good thing to have, and the location of this hotel is very good too. All in all worth my stay. If you have kids this is a good choice, since the arcade is smaller with a guard so you feel comfortable leaving your teen in there for an hour.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad...But few issues”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I and another couple stayed in a suite from march 6 thru the 11th 2004. The hotel itself was very nice and well kept...the walls are alittle thin and i could hear the guy next to me snoring..the casino was fun to play in had the most available tables during the day and didnt have to fight with crowds from the other hotels..dealers were hit or miss either very friendly or miserable not really any inbetween....Upon checkout we were overcharged for a room upgrade when all along we had a suite so we hadnt upgraded on anything and they charge you 4.00 for a bottle of water even if you dont drink it..We called and they acted like we were bothering them when we asked them to fix our bill they did but seemed to be a hassle....Overall wasnt to bad of an experience if i had to do it over again id stay somehwere else and gamble there..

Reviews.Title: “Has both positive and negatives”
Reviews.Author: Travlin
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 night stay over the Nascar weekend. Positives-you don't have to walk through their casino to reach room elevators (NICE), and parking is very easy to access...without having to walk forever like at many LV hotels. Don't get me wrong, I'm not against the exercise (I walk for exercise here at home), but I don't need to waste valuable time going from parking garages to the inside on my trips. The food court is a nice option for a quick pick me up, and not crowded. Our room on the 24th floor with a strip view (which I requested upon check-in) was average, nothing remarkable though. We didn't have an issue with any noise, other than the occasional loud voice in the hallway. The Brew Pub on premises is great. Walked right in on a Saturday night around 6:30PM! Good food and beer. Negatives: Arrived at the hotel around 12:45PM, and was told that the room had been vacated, but the maid would have to clean it first prior to our checking in. Okay, fine I guess we can find something to do for awhile....afterall it is LV!! I left our luggage with the bell desk, and was told to check back about 3:00PM when check in begins. We came back shortly after 3, room still hadn't been cleaned. So we went to the food court to get a bite to eat. Finally at 3:45 we could "officially check in". I guess if check in is after 3PM, I shouldn't expect anything different, however after spending way too much money for these 2 nights, it would have been a bonus to have the room earlier and therefore maybe would have checked out the pool. (Never saw it) The second negative would be their steakhouse. Our family wanted to go out for a nice meal on our last night in LV, and walked into the steakhouse around 7:00 PM. There were not too many diners at this point. The hostess said she could seat us (3 people) at 8:30!!! Were they expecting a crowd? We declined and walked over to the Bellagio for their dinner buffet which is outstanding! All in all, I still enjoyed my stay at the Monte Carlo, rates above the Paris in my book!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: swatts1
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 night stay at the Monte Carlo. The location would have been excellent IF the tram to the Bellagio was still in service. Instead we spent lots of money in cab fare since most of the shopping (main reason for trip) was north of our hotel. The hotel was very nice. It was quiet and I didn't notice the noise problems that others have mentioned. The rooms were spacious, especially the bathrooms. For the price it was a very good value. The design of the hotel is good and no room is very far from the main bank of elevators. Other hotels in Vegas require LONG walks to get to and from one's room. The taxi stand was well placed and cabs were plentiful. Our only complaint came when we were out of the room from 10:00AM until 4:30PM. Upon our return we were dismayed to find our room had not been cleaned. I took dirty towels to the maid and she gave me clean ones. I called housekeeping and requested that this not happen again during our stay. It was a minor problem but I did not feel that housekeeping on our floor (25) was anything to write home about. I tipped each day, but never really felt that housekeeping was doing anything more than average. I would stay at the Monte Carlo again, but would really like to see the tram operational before I return!

Reviews.Title: “Great Casino....Average Rooms....”
Reviews.Author: Katieorange
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo is a great place to stay when you don?t want the hustle and bustle of lots of tourists. The rooms are clean and satisfactory, but nothing special. The location is a plus since you don?t have to pay 5 dollars in cab fare just to get off the property. Check in was fine for me, but beware, it does seem that in the later hours of the afternoon Check in gets very full. Out of the 15 check in desks only about 5 are open. The Casino is hardly ever packed so it great for gamers who want a low-key night. Also they have about 5 fast food restaurants to choose from, which is nice when you don?t want a sit down meal. I had a great stay at the Monte Carlo, but next time I think I will try a place with a little more charm.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice pool, all around good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Monte Carlo last September for 3 nights, we were in town for a trade show. I really liked the location of the Monte Carlo - not having to walk through the casino to leave the hotel was great, and access to the pool area from the elevators was also great. the parking lot was also fairly close. Pool area was nice, really enjoyed the lazy river every morning. our rooms were fine - we had a decent strip view, it was clean, etc. so, for a good rate we thought it was a good place, in a convenient spot on the strip (we walked almost everywhere). we stayed in the treasure island the year before, where the rooms maybe were a tad fancier, but the pool area and location of the monte carlo are better in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory but not memorable”
Reviews.Author: Anrmd
Reviews.Content: Hotel seemed to lack the charisma of many of the megaresorts of similar age. Check-in, room, shopping, and restaraunts were satisfactory but no particular reason to bring us back. Will say that location on the strip and easy in-out access were a plus. A decent value but not quite what we were used to.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about the Monte Carlo. When they had the poll heated now in February thats for me. Everything was great from our room to the people. We loved the Monte Carlo.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were their in June of 2003. The rooms were okay, and the pool was nice, though overly crowded. The casino is probably the tightest in the state. DO NOT GAMBLE THERE!!

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo- Had a Great Time”
Reviews.Author: youngerbrother
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a week in late Aug. 03. The pool complex is fantastic, but tended to get a little crowded. There are lots of shady areas to keep cool. Many different areas at the pool, something for everybody. Rooms were about average, not very sound proof. We had 3 rooms for extended family and all had nice and different views of the strip. This resort is easier to get around in than some, hotel elevators are close to the pool, casino and food court. We thought all the staff was really great and helpful. The Pub and Chinese restaurant food were both very good and reasonable. The Lance Burton show is not to be missed. Location is central and can walk to lots of other casinos and theme shopping. Beautiful hotel, if not a little contrived, but what isn't in LV? Price was great compared to others. Viva Las Vegas!! Check out Red Rock Canyon - awesome and only 40 mins. away.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: caralfa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 5 days in June 2003. The check-in was fast, and the staff friendly and helpful. The room was clean and comfortable, if a little noisy on the Saturday night because of our neighbours. We enjoyed the buffet, both breakfast and lunch. The location is good and we enjoyed walking to the other hotels. Unfortunately the tram link with the Bellagio was not operating when we were there. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We won't go back........ever!!”
Reviews.Author: Mfan
Reviews.Content: What happened to the Monte Carlo??!! Stayed here in 2001 right after 9/11 and it was a wonderful place to stay. So wonderful that we decided to return in January of this year. BIG MISTAKE! We spent three wonderful nights at the Golden Nugget and planned the last two nights so we could enjoy the strip. Since we had such a great stay previously at the Monte Carlo, we booked a room for two nights and checked in on Jan. 4th. Check-in was fine, room was fine. The problems occurred when we hit the casino floor. Tried to cash a check and couldn't. Since I don't write checks for anything that runs through the "merchant system", our credit information was not in their files. Casino suggested we open a line of credit and we'd be fine. So, we did that. They acted like it would be no time at all to handle that and it turned out that the next morning they still hadn't been able to do anything with our application. When we were finally approved, we find out that we couldn't access the line of credit as we were promised...........you had to take $500 increments as they decided on your rating of play and they would dole the money out as they saw fit. Even though it was MY money!! Their explaination was that we didn't have much play in the casino from the night before. Go figure.........we COULDN'T get a check cashed because of the system they used to verify checks and we didn't play enough in the casino. After becoming frustrated with it all, decided to talk to Casino host and got the runaround there too. I told them if they had been honest with me about how the line of credit worked, I would have just used my credit card or ATM card and gotten money and we COULD Have played the night before. Nobody cared and quite frankly, they weren't very accommodating - just let me know that we hadn't played enough for them to do anything for us. We spent all morning trying to get the line of credit thing taken care of and finally decided this was crazy. We came for relaxation and a vacation, NOT to be stressed out. So, we checked out and went to Bally's where we had a good stay previously too. What a difference!! Bally's cashed a $500 check, no problem. They cashed another one later on that day for my husband, and there was no problem at all. The room was larger, cleaner (no mold on the shower curtain and the furnishings were newer too). It was $10 more, but I'd have paid 10x that for the level of service we received at Bally's compared to Monte Carlo. Instead of hearing why they COULDN'T help us out, we were asked what they could do to help us out. I talked to many people who have told me they experienced the same thing at the Monte Carlo and will never go there again - not even to gamble. I wonder what has happened to turn this hotel so completely different from our first trip there in 2001. All I know is I'll never go back - not to stay - and not to gamble.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Monte Carlo between Christmas and New Year . We visit Las Vegas each year and always enjoy our visit . This was our first , and last , visit to the Monte Carlo . From the time we arrived the service was non-existent . There were no bellmen to help with the bags and no room to store them inside . Check-in was a nightmare . The rooms were sparce and noisy and each day a bottle of water was left in the room at a cost of $4.00 if you wanted to drink it . (we didn't , but they wanted to charge us anyway ) In the casino , pray you do not need a floor attendent unless you are an expert tracker . (Hint : they are found in herds as far from the guest as possibile) The buffet was plain . Dealers were rude and seemed bothered to open their table for play . I could go on , but I'll never go back .

Reviews.Title: “Best Stay so far”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay at Monte Carlo from 12/10/03-12/13/03 Staff was very helpful, and everything was very clean. Will stay there again next visit!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Wookie1070
Reviews.Content: Spent two days here on a five day trip to Vegas. We wished we had stay the whole five days. Very nice hotel (great rooms, pool, service, atmosphere, etc).

Reviews.Title: “Good, Solid, but not Distinctive”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo is a perfectly adequate place to stay and play in Las Vegas, but it lacks any real personality to make it a standout destination. The service is very nice, and the facilities are excellent. Unlike some other reviewers, I found the pool area here to be among the best in Vegas, right up there with the MGM and Mandalay Bay. My one problem with the facilities was that my room had an APPALLING smell of smoke. I'm a smoker, and I asked for a smoking room, but I'll never do that again. Seriously, I opened the door and was just HIT with the smell. I bring scented candles with me when I travel, but they couldn't tackle this disgusting smell, either -- I just wound up with vanilla cigarette smoke. From now on, I'll get non-smoking rooms and just smoke in the casino... I love the food court. I particularly love the bagel shop in the food court. It's one of the few places in Vegas where you can get fresh, semi-healthy food quickly and at a reasonable price. I stop by there even when I'm staying at another hotel. I also love the fact that the table games in the casino are somewhat separated from the slot machines. When you're at a table, particularly in the center aisle, the slot crowds and noises barely infringe upon you. However, getting to the oasis of table games can be an adventure, as the narrow pathways between slot machines get jammed up with glassy-eyed slot zombies. I suggest you bring a cattle prod to nudge them out of the way. However, this is the case in most casinos. All in all, I would be happy to stay at the Monte Carlo all the time except for one little problem. I can't seem to win in this casino. For the last 3-4 years, I've lost every single time I've played here (at most places, I win sometimes and lose other times). It doesn't matter how good the place is or how cheap the rates are. If you lose consistently at the tables, you have to try someplace else.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel, Could do better”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went during the second week of December. Check in and check out were very quick, the room was larger than a typical basic hotel room, and we had a great view of the Strip, the MGM Hotel across the street, and New York New York to the right of us. It's a good location, near the newer hotels including the Bellagio. I would stay here again if I had to (didn't have any major problems with it), but we could have spent less money for a better overall resort hotel. There are alot of deals out there, so price them before you book. IMPORTANT NOTE: Many plays and attractions weren't open when we were there such as the New York New York rollercoaster, Lance Burton's magic show (at the Monte Carlo), Mystere and O. Call ahead to find out the dates they are open. And definitely spin the big slot machine outside of the Tropicana for your free deck of playing cards, free admision to the Legends Hall of Fame museum, and other goodies.

Reviews.Title: “Top Rate Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Popz4120
Reviews.Content: Great resort!! We had an absolutely outstanding time here in early December 2003. The front desk clerk who helped us was SO helpful and friendly that it gave a favorable impression right from the lobby. The room had a Strip view without any added upcharge. There was a Ben Stiller movie being filmed in the Casino that took up a bit of space, but they allowed us to walk thru the background during the filming of a scene so we didn't mind too much. The Buffet did not offer much, but the Food Court was outstanding and we ate there for the duration of our stay. We definately plan to stay here again...and we have stayed in several other Strip Casinos (Bally's and Excalibur).

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant hotel with a fantastic pool facility”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having enjoyed my two-night stay at the Monte Carlo in late October, I must say that the pool facilities were the real highlight of my visit. The wave pool and easy river ride are especially fun and can be enjoyed by young and old. The staff were attentive and, in several instances, quite charming. One of the pool boys, Jorge, could be a supermodel. Room rates vary, of course, but the $75 per night I paid represented good value-for-money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Myself along with three co-workers spent the weekend of Nov.13/03 at your Hotel. We had a wonderful time. While we were there we visited 15 of the Hotels along the Strip and all agreed that when we return to Vegas we would deffinitly stay at the Monte Carlo Hotel again. Thanks for the great weekend we will all remember, Michelle Hansen

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Monte Carlo for three nights from Nov. 12th to15th. This was our first time at this hotel and we were pleasantly surprised. The staff were friendly, very helpful and we had a great room. The casino was not too busy and the crowd at the hotel was great. We ate at the brew pub and had an evening buffet - both were fine. I especially liked the close proximity of the parkade to the hotel. We had no difficulty checking in or out and the slots were very rewarding!!! We have stayed at several other hotels in Las Vegas, but will definitely book into the Monte Carlo again on our next trip. J & P

Reviews.Title: “Monte Carlo and the Strip porno peddlers”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Monte Carlo was excellent but adjacent rooms noise insulation poor. Plenty of hot water!I know 'Sin City' is gradually shifting their focus away from family-oriented, but our worst experience was when walking around the strip these people (illegal aliens) line up 5-6 in a row and keep pushing porno-related pamphlets in your face. On one occasion I heard a nasty comment directed to my wife.I asked a casino security officer if there is anything that can be done about them and he said they have been trying but have been unsucessful in removing them from the streets.I done really know if anything can be done and don't expect much action from the mayor who recently came out in favor of making a couple of blocks on East Charlestor a legalized prosititution zone.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Monte Carlo for 2 nights and had a great time! Staff was very attentive and very helpful, the pool personnel was excellent! The room was very clean and beautiful. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone. I will definitely stay there again when I visit Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I thought Monte Carlo was a great Hotel. My boyfriend and I had the monte carlo suite which was really nice. We went toward the end of June 2003. The restaurants were excellent and it is in a great location on the strip. I would defintely stay at this hotel again if I ever was to venture back to Las Vegas. I had a great time!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Watchout!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Worst experience ever! Was charged 8.00 after I got home for what looked like a courtesy bottled water...Charged 59.00 for two phone calls less than 5 minutes to my friend in a neighboring hotel, minutes away. Didn't know this until I got home!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our son was married in Oct. @ the Monte Carlo Chapel.. a reception was held in hotel as well.. Arrangements were made by our daughter-in-law and all was coordinated beautifully by the hotel, without a single problem. It was truly a memorable beautiful wedding.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for the Good Price”
Reviews.Author: murphds
Reviews.Content: Stayed Oct. 12th - 17th, 2003. Had no problem checking in early 12:30pm. Only complaint is about noisy plumbing. We were on the 19th floor. Our friends were on the 9th floor and they didn't hear plumbing from their neighbours the way we did. Nice pool area. Suggest you bring your own inflatable bed, ring, raft etc. Rentals are 12.00 per day. For those who complained about the high prices; you're in Vegas you have to expect to drop some cash!!!! Highly suggest Emeril's restaurant at MGM. Make reservations well in advance. The gym at Monte Carlo is 1/2 price after 7pm. Best spa in town is definately at Caesar's Palace, have been 5 times.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money spent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husand and I stayed at Monte Carlo from October 1st through October 7th and we had a GREAT time. I enjoyed the resort for several reasons: 1. it was definitely less crowded than the other casinos on the strip. 2. The resort is located in the middle of everything. 3. The wave pool was a plus (be sure to get there no later than 10am for the best seats). 4. Check in and out was a breeze. 5. VERY AFFORDABLE. We did not experience any plumbing problems or noisy neighbors during my stay. The rooms are simple and well maintained. I stayed on the 11th floor (non-smoking floor-just one of many offered) and I had a fantastic view of the pool below and the mountains off in the distance. I must admit that as the night gets jumping in Vegas, I wished on a couple nights, that there was a night club inside the Monte Carlo, but with so many options within walking distance, it wasn't a big deal. The huge sports bar inside the Monte Carlo offered wonderful give aways during the Monday night football game, compliments of ESPN. I recommend this resort for travelers that are in need of an escape minus the madness that can sometimes happen at some of the more "20-something" resorts. I would definitely stay at the Monte Carlo again, especially if the price is right!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful first time!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with our 2 sons and (wife & fiance') in their mid-20's joined us 9/17-9/22 in Vegas. This was the 1st time my husband and I had been in Vegas). We stayed at the Monte Carlo. Upon arriving at McCarren Aiport we shuttled to the Dollar Car Rental and our sons rented a mini-van. Son #1 did all the driving and did a super (altho speed demon) job. Alot of reviews say don't rent a car & don't drive down the strip. Well, if you go with the flow it moves right along. Pretty at nite and interesting to see all the walkers from a vehicle. We never rented a cab once altho during the week we walked and walked. We only used the van when we went to Fremont Street, Hoover Dam and Red Rock Canyon. The Monte Carlo was a nice hotel. Not quite so overwhelming. Had a bit of a delay checking in as it was difficult (so the gal said) finding 3 rooms on the same floor. Our son's rooms had a nice view. Our view sucked. We checked our luggage at 1:00 in the aft with the belle hop and were told our rooms would be ready at 3:00. NOT! Also not ready at 4:00. By 4:30 we found some employees roaming the halls and finally a woman in charge said she would see that our rooms were ready by 4:30. From then on, we had no problems. The Monte Carlo had some nice little eatery shops including McDonald's for a quick fix and the Microbrewery was very, very nice. $3.00 tap beer. Heh, we're from Wisconsin! We saw the Blue Man Group one nite but for $100 a ticket, I would have prefered some other show. We walked constantly and we all were really pooped. Had to change shoes alot. Lots of sites to see. Can't believe the expense of construction at these hotels & casinos. The weather was really hot for Sept. but gorgeous! Great in the early a.m. and later at nite. Hated the porn pushers. (We called them card flippers). Especially such young kids. We debated about taking a helicpter tour one day but found out the next a.m. that one crashed and all 7 people were killed. Yikes! We were more sight seers than gamblers. Alot of the tables looked too intimidating for us anyway. And very busy. One evening we ate at Lary's Steak House. (the waitress was very unimpressive and when we complained the manager took offense.) I guess they don't appreciate constructive criticism. Oh well. We had much more fun at the Harley Davidson Cafe! Needless to say, we packed alot in to 5 days. But, my husband and I are talking about going back again next Sept.

Reviews.Title: “Probably Most Accessible Hotel in LV!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friend and I went to Vegas in the early summer....hot!!! We had stayed at other large chain, more expensive hotels before, but wanted to try the Monte Carlo due to the great price...like $60 midweek or something crazy! We arrived, and check in was not too slow, as we arrived at night. The room had an awesome veiw of the pool and the lovely twinkling Vegas strip hotels. The bed was decently comfy, but the shower was a little awkward (low shower spout...I think we had a handicapped room?), but nicely decorated. The room service food, well, just dont waste your time waiting for it, and dont subject your tastebuds to it unless you want dirt to sound yummy! Ha ha! You're better off eating at the food court. Their Beer garden cafe or whatever its called, had great food, and delicious beers! Try the sampler if u want to taste them all but not get wasted! The good part about the Monte Carlo is that you do not have to walk far to get anywhere in the hotel. And you dont have to walk through the casino or shops to get to your room! Very friendly casino staff! The pool area was nice, especially to cool off from the heat. Not very spectacular, but I didnt go to Vegas to swim. I would stay here again, but maybe spend a little more to get a more private, larger room, and just eat somewhere else. I would recommend it! And ask for a coupon book when you check in, just tell them you saw it on the internet!)

Reviews.Title: “Are you handicapped?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were at the Monte Carlo last May.We loved everything about it. For instance:the price, decor, rooms, buffets, slots, pool area, the staff and especially the handicap parking.I recommend the Monte Carlor for anyone wondering where to stay.

Reviews.Title: “a dream vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: everything and everyone was really great, staying at the monte carlo is what a dream vacation is all about. I hope I can enjoy this againg.

Reviews.Title: “Going back again!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've been to Vegas 3 times in the past year and just booked trip #4. I had never been there before last October 2002 when we stayed at the Paris for a convention...eh, it was ok. March 2003, I stayed at Monte Carlo - awesome. July 2003, I stayed at Bally's...they need to clean that up a bit. Well, in December 2003 I'm going back again - and staying at the Monte Carlo. The location is great, the rooms a good sizes and the food court/casino is very convenient. I'm only paying $49/night this time and I would pay double that to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you want in one place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel had everything. Check-in was a breeze. The staff friendly and attentive. Food and restaurants could satisfy all tastes, from the buffet to one of the best steak houses I have eaten at. The spa was nice and the outdoor lazy river was enjoyable. The rooms were some of the nicest I have stayed in on the strip

Reviews.Title: “Stayed twice-great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Monte Carlo twice. I love this hotel. When you walk in it has a very distinct smell (a good smell). The room was very pretty. I didn't like that there was no room safe though. The pool is great. The wave pool is fun. This hotel is in a great location and usually a great price. Very clean, great food court. Try them you'll be happy.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Monte Carlo in June. Were not quite sure of what to expect after reading the reviews, but it was a pleasant experience. We arrived there at about 11 AM on a Thurs. Check-in was quick and smooth. Staff seemed very nice. We stayed in their standard room on the 19th floor. The room was average but had some of the softest pillows and bed we had ever slept on. The bathroom, on the other hand, was below average. Water leaking from the wall was an issue. Also the bath tub/shower combo is always dissapointing. The room was rarely cleaned during our 3 night stay. We had to call cleaning services 3 times, but the room was still not cleaned until late evening on our 2nd night. The pool was nice, especially the wave pool, but very small so it was hard to find a spot if you arrived after 11 AM. The microbrewery was a nice place to hang out but make sure you specify to the hostess if you're only there to hang out and have a beer,or else you might get a scolding from some of the servers. Casino was average, there are better places to spend your gambling money. It was nice to have a Mcdonalds and Sbarros right in the hotel. As mentioned before, rooms can be reached without going through the casino, which is a plus. Overall, it has a wonderful location and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Strait is Best”
Reviews.Author: Jimbo05_11
Reviews.Content: Theme hotels are great to visit and enjoy but it is a relief to return to the peaceful and uncrowded environment of a "straight" hotel like the Monte Carlo. Liked the checkin/out arrangement, free from the clutter of non-hotel guests. Liked the transport drop off and pickup arrangements. Separate locations meant no congestion. Liked the big picture windows and the spacious bedrooms. Very relaxing after a hectic day among the overcrowed theme hotels. Would like to see an inprovement in eating facilities - were "okay" but not tempting. Ate elsewhere!

HotelInfo.Name: Monte Carlo Resort & Casino
HotelInfo.Address: 3770 Las Vegas Blvd S, Las Vegas, NV 89109
